reviews.review: Wonderful! Tres bien!. Unsure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Be prepared not to wear any swimming costume. I was nervous about this but you really do have a much more authentic experience. Me and my husband went and for around £23 each had a wash with Moroccan spiced soap a scrub hair wash and shower (oriental hammam =250 dirham). Felt so so clean and was doused in rose oil which smelled amazing! We were taken to a quiet relaxation room and was served water mint tea and pastries. A fantastic place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the souks! It did take us an hour to find it but we did get lost! Take a map and persevere! A wonderful haven! Thank you Nadia and the team especially the lady on reception who gave us directions to get back - we made it!

Enjoyable, but could be better. We had a reservation at this hammam at 10AM. We booked couples hammam and a massage. The place is beautifully designed and people seemed to be pleasant enough, but the hammam itself was quite cold. We've been to many hammams before, and it was definitely not the right temperature. It wasn't freezing, but it was barely warm enough. We blamed it on our early reservation and figured maybe we should have came in later. The scrub was nice, but the glove was really rough, my husband felt like the hammam lady was going to rip his skin off. But the massage was really enjoyable. Don't expect a deep tissue, in our experience most of Moroccan hammams do a nice, relaxing oil massage. We didn't feel rushed, like other reviewers pointed out, but the place was empty that early in the day, so we could relax and enjoy.

Rushed & not relaxing. Save yourself the time and go elsewhere. I booked the most expensive hammam package and was HIGHLY dissatisfied. The actual scrub was rushed and not thorough. The clay was lathered on sparingly and I spent most of my 50 minutes waiting.
Nice place for quick hammam. This one of the easiest to access hammams in the old city. We liked their services compared to others in Marrakesh but below other cities.

Welcome to the fast-food of hammam. Normally I only like to write good reviews, but I need to inform you that this establishment is unworthy of praise. The reason I give two stars is because the place was clean and had nice ambiance.My group of four made a reservation for a traditional hammam and 30 minute massage for each of us ($500 drhm each). Bottom line, the whole thing was extremely rushed and the massage was poor. The water poured over us (typically hot) was just slightly warm and in the room there was no steam. After washing they had us sit in a room (while we were still wet) and drink tea. This would have been more appropriate at the end of the whole experience (how it is typically done elsewhere). The "massage" was a rushed slathering of oils. When we asked for more pressure the massage was done more quickly. We all were left still oiled up after the whole experience. They offered to let us shower at the end, but in a small smelly shower at the end of the hall. When I politely tried to suggest how the experience might have been improved the desk staff interrupted me and became defensive.As I said, at least the building was nice and was seemingly clean.

Classy and fabulous hammam. I visited many hammam centers in Marrakech in the past and definately this one is the best .It's location is great ,very accessible.Cleanliness is perfect ,professionalism of the staff especially Nadia who did the hammam for me is more than excellent .Massage therapists are so professional and they know very well the art of massage .Materials used in hammam and massage are the best .the center is so elegant and relaxing especially when you take a moroccan tea after finishing your hammam and massage .Thanks for all the staff and i really would visit it again

Very relaxing and professional. Zero complaints. 1st time I've done this and I was very pleased. They supply everything you need. It is private. Staff is helpful and professional. I really enjoyed. ***Must do***Don't wear makeup...just going to take it off in the process.Hoping I can find a place back home to do this again. I did the Royal Hammam. $450 dirham.

The best place to relax and unwind in Marrakech!. I am a regular visitor to Marrakech (once or twice every year) and always make it a priority to treat myself to a visit to Hammam de la Rose for a hammam and massage treatment during my stay. The staff make you feel welcome from the moment you walk through the door and always look professional in their immaculate green tunic uniforms. I can highly recommend one of their special packages which include a hammam session followed by a full body massage - 'Ceremony of the Rose' and the new package, 'Tour of Morocco' are both excellent. Between the hammam and massage there is a short break when water, mint tea and a small sweet treat are provided in a quiet lounge area. For me personally, Jamila provides the best hammam session so I always make sure to book an appointment when she is available. Jamila gives a very thorough body wash and scrub with a special mitt which makes my skin feel wonderful and refreshed afterwards. I will be back to see you again in 2017. Thank you from Carole

"Western" style hamman.. I found the service and the time spent at the hamman a rather expensive not so caring visit. We paid 700 dhms for 2 of us.. I think one would be better off doing a local hamman for 50 dhms. Even if they charge you double, it might still be a better option. The local price is 30 dims for the hamman and 20 for the scrub.

Absolutely Amazing!! . Me and my husband decided to go to this spa after reading the reviews on trip advisor and it was totally worth it!!We paid around £100 which is 1000dirums for a Hammam and massage and they also in included the facial for free when I requested it! They served is water and mint tea after Hammam before going for the massage. The whole experience was relaxing and what we totally needed! Before leaving they gifted me a rose pendant necklace which was very sweet! Definitely coming back soon! XxX

Absolutely lovely!. I was in Marrakech for a long weekend by myself and decided to try Hammam de la Rose based on Tripadvisor reviews. I booked the Tour of Morocco and it was delightful! The ladies who work here are wonderful and the entire experience amazing. I ended up going back the next day for another massage. I will definitely be back the next time I am in Marrakech

A definite must do. This was my third visit to hammam de la rose and I can't say I was dissappointed. I booked a the rose ceremony for sister and I and back massages for the two boys (17 & 15) and they both loved it. We had just arrived in Marrakech so it is the best way to unwind and really get into the mood of rest and relaxation. The boys were fast asleep when we had completed our hammam and they just wanted to come back before we left unfortunately we didn't have the time. But I would highly recommend hammam de la rose.

Good For All The Family. We wanted a Hammam experience for the whole family (2 teenage daughters) and this was recommended by the Riad we were staying in. We were worried about what to wear but swimming costumes were fine!The body scrub is very invigorating but beware if you have even a touch of sunburn. It will be very sore! We took one of the packages that finished with a 30 minute massage.A really nice, tranquil experience and I would recommend Hammam de la Rose.

Wow. I have paid nearly £100 for a massage in London but the surroundings and atmosphere has never been as splendid (and that really is the word for it) as this spa. After the massage you can have am amazing waterfall shower and drink the mint tea in a white / blue room which utterly relaxes you beyond belief. We enjoyed our time immensely and may try and squeeze in another visit :)
Not really my thing, but they did it well. Excellent service and atmosphere. We bought the full monty for a couple and it was a good experience, even though I would not have gone alone!

Very lovely. I had a hammam and the room was beautiful and the staff really fun. My husband had a massage and also rated it. We didn't spend much time there after as it was closing early due to Ramadan which was a shame as it was a beautiful spa. Would recommend and would go back.

Great recovery from the medina. My wife and I went to this Hammam after a long day in the medina. I had the anti stress treatment and she had the royal Hammam. We received the attention and service we expected. The Hammam was a block from the taxi stop but had a clear sign so easy to find in the craziness of the medina.We were greeted in English where they explained everything. We were taken to our change rooms and changed into the disposable underwear provided and a robe with slippers. Then we were off to the Hammam. It was a very relaxing experience in the warm water with a 15 min or so pause to relax in the steam. The Hammam seemed pretty basic as far as application of oils and such which was fine for me.Once done I was taken to a waiting area and served cookies, water and their mint tea which had some extra herbs. After a brief wait I was off to a massage which was also relaxing- they hit the main pressure and sore points. Then it was back to the waiting area for more cookies and team while I waited for my better half to complete her treatment. When we were ready we were taken back to change and head back to the medina. I found the overall experience very peaceful compared to everything outside. If anything, they left us alone longer than I would expect but it seemed geared to our speed. I recommend this Hammam as a great way to unwind while in Marrakech.

Good hammam in clean pleasant roomy spa. First time trying & hammam (body scrub Moroccan style) was so good! Must do when in Morocco and this is definitely the place. Attentive and pleasant staff in a well kept and clean spa made it 5* for me. The only reason for a 4* is the massage that followed was more a rub than a true massage. (Having been to many Asian standard massages we've perhaps come to expect too much of this place. I understand massage is not really culturally native to Moroccans so I guess it may be unfair to expect too much.) Overall, very very good experience and glad my guide had recommended it.

Beautiful place but mediocre massage. I came to hammam de larose on the recommendation of other travellers. I had the sublime massage and was going to pay also for a foot massage but they said there was no need as the massage also incorporated a foot massage (which was only about 1 minute a foot).The massage was a little light so I asked for it to be harder and they said it would be 50dh extra as it was an Ayurvedic massage! What a rip off. The therapist was a little blunt too. The receptionist was nice. The massage was relaxing but not sure if it really went for my tense points. I had a manicure and pedicure which was very nice but it would have been nice to have a hand/foot massage incorporated. The experience was okay overall but it may have been just as good somewhere cheaper.

Poor treatment in beautiful setting. The spa itself is beautiful, but the treatment very disappointing indeed. I had read a couple of negative comments on Trip Advisor, but the majority were very positive, so we decided to give it a go. My girlfriend and I have both had many Hammams in Morocco, and I am sad to say that this was one of the very worst. The therapists were disinterested, and very unengaged, they slapped on the soap, mud, or whatever as quickly as possible, with no focus or care, and then left us to “relax” seemingly as quickly as they possibly could. We both speak English and French (I note the response from the Hammam below about the therapists not speaking English) and I can tell you that they are just as curt and unfriendly in French.It was the lack of attention that was the worst aspect though, both if us had therapist who just didn’t seem to care about what they were doing, or about us, they just slapped on the treatments as quickly as possible, not covering all the flesh by any means, then walked out. We are both used to hammams in which the treatment is given by someone who appears at least to care - the lotions are applied with care and focus, all the skin is covered.We had the top of the range hammam, supposedly 50 mins. The therapists were with us for about 15 mins at most. The treatment was supposed to end with a foot massage, that lasted about 90 seconds, and was little more than a quick rub of the knuckles along the sole.When we complained afterwards, the front desk explained that the long gaps (15 or 20 mins just lying in the Hammam) were so that the treatments could take effect - this is just about acceptable for the mud, but hardly for the initial soap application, which just gets sticky and itchy. Then we were instructed to wash ourselves under the shower (twice) whereas in every other hammam either of us has experienced the therapist does the rinsing, that’s part of the ritual! At the end, when asked what we thought, we were honest. The front desk staff were very defensive (as I see “the management” is on the negative comments below) they made excuses, but offered us a 10% discount, which took the price down from 900DIR to 810DIR, a lot more than the treatment was worth in my opinion.There is also a strange comment from “management” below that Trip Advisor is a place to share recommendations of good experiences only - no, Trip Advisor is about sharing all experiences, positive or negative. My own feedback is usually very positive, as I am careful to go to hotels, restaurants, etc. endorsed by others on Trip Advisor. On this occasion I saw some negative feedback, but hoped our experience would be in line with the vast majority of positive feedback. Sadly it was not, and I cannot recommend this spa. I hope that given the significant numbers of negative comments, the management will try to improve the attitude and quality of its therapists, rather than just being defensive. You have excellent promises, now make sure you therapists and treatments live up to that standard.

Anti Stress :) . We booked the Anti Stress package to get the best of both. A Hammam and a massage. I couldn't recommend this package and place more.The staff were super friendly and asked how you prefer everything they were doing to ensure it was just right for you. Great price too! :)Wait for the caramel shampoo! Thank you!

What a start to Marrakech. I would like to thank all the staff at Hammam de la Rose for the most wonderful experience today especially Nadia who gave my husband and I a wonderful Hammam and to Narinia and Khahja for the most enjoyable body massages. The Hammam is a pure retreat, clean, attention to detail serving us mint tea and pastries, truly a amazing experience .If you are ever in Marrakech make sure you book a visit here, you will not be disappointed.Thank you everyone.

Not hammummmm. Staff was wonderful at entrance but treatment did not live up to expectations. Having been in a fair amount of hammams, Hammam de la Rose special 45 minute treatment did not feel like a treat. We were left to sweat most of the time and treatment was down to a bare minimum. If you like military style comments ('turn, sit, shower, come') and little attention this is the place to be.

Lovely spa , great escape !. If you feel exhausted from the craziness of the souks, this hammam is the best escape. I have enjoyed a great oriental Morrocan massage by a superb lady , Madam Ghezzlan. She was very professional and provided a great massage. The place is clean and the atmosphere is very relaxing. Highly recommend.

A complete stunning moment of wellbeing !!!. I walked in without reservation and they was helpful to arrange me an appointment easely, how wonderful !! A perfect relaxation from your first step in to the end of the package, i was provided with nice clean robe, sleepers and disposable underwear, the hammam was as wonderful as i could of remember my mom doing it to me during my childerhood.. mint tea.. relaxation time and than one of the best massage i ever had ( as i'am a beautician ),every tiny details is concidered, they took care of every need.Many thanks for the the kind lady's team from the reception to my therapist.I will definitively be back ..☺

Ripdeal. Don't go there.. After reading many positive reviews about Hammam la Rose, I booked a treatment today. And this was the worst Hamman experience I ever had. Friendly when I made a reservation with 'a kind request to cone 10 minutes before the appointment.' Since the hammam is located in the labyrinth of the Medina, and I am just a tourist, I decided not to take any risk in getting lost and by accident I arrived 15 min earlier.No problem. At the counter I decided to book an extra massage, which resulted in a total amount of 700 dh.for 90 minutes.It was a bad mistake. An uncaring 6 minute scrub, a 1 minute shampoo including conditior filled with 50 minutes left alone 'for relaxation purposes'. I questioned this 3 times, without an adequate answer. After they told me to relax on a huge white sofa with a glas of mint tea, 1 biscuit and 250 ml water whilst waiting for the massage, I decided to step out of this shameful and ridiculous priced experience. I had to pay 400 dh for just 20 minutes actual hammam attention. They did not care at all about my complaints and discomfort. 'This is Moroccan style hamman. Sorry that you do not appreciate the relaxation time. Not That will be 400 dh please.'Don't go there! They just want to make a lot of money for a lousy service. They can, because they are only getting 1 time customers: tourists who believe the positive reviews.

Rosie & Dan. A great hammam experience - we opted for the couples anti stress package. Beautiful spa surroundings, lovely Moroccan products, wonderful massage, nice mint tea and pastries, and very thorough scrubbing! We left with glowing skin, feeling completely relaxed. Thank you.

A real treat away from the craziness of the souks!. As soon as you walk in the place feels right. I was with a group of 6 and 4 had the feet/legs massage, with 2 opting for the back massage. It is an enveloping experience, with different chill out spaces, wonderful lighting and ambience, friendly staff, and it is spotlessly clean. My masseur was Rhizlane, and she managed to energise my tired legs in minutes - thank you so much!!

Such a sanctuary within the souks. Booked the Ceremony of the Rose package on my last day in the city, which was the perfect way to spend a late afternoon being pampered after two days on an excursion to the desert and wandering around the souks. I had the hammam first followed by a relaxing massage which involved the best foot massage ever! My massage therapist spent at least 10 minutes on each foot and it was a real treat. The oils were beautifully scented and relaxing. This spa is just so beautiful, as soon as you enter you feel like you’ve been transported somewhere else, such a sanctuary within the busy souks – is a bit difficult to locate but as soon as you enter you forget all about that! You are provided robes and slippers, all your belongings can be stored and locked away safely in their lockers. The hammam was an experience but the team is so friendly and professional that you feel instantly comfortable and relaxed. After the hammam I was taken to a relaxing lounge area and served snacks before I was taken to have my massage. A great experience and I would definitely recommend this place, the setting is so beautiful, creating a tranquil sanctuary as soon as you step inside. A modern set up but a traditional and mystical hammam setting and one of the best massages I’ve ever experienced.

Waste of time and money! . I booked this after researching and reading all the hype on TripAdvisor! However, this was not enjoyable at all and a waste of time and money.When we arrived there, we were greeted by friendly staff and showed where to change. We were given some black paper underwear and and a robe which was clean and fresh.It all started good, until the Hammam (1hour). When taken to the room, the lady spoke very little english and did not explain the procedure. I was rubbed in some soap and pointed to sit down in the sauna. With no explanation, I wasn't sure how long I would be left alone. About fifteen minutes later, she came back and came a lazy scrub/head wash - so little, that I actually decided to scrub the product in more myself.In addition to the hammam, I also had a Orange Blossom facial (30 minutes) which was mediocre. Again, same thing - i was given a scrub and left for five minutes and then same with mask - the massage must have lasted about 3 minutes. Out of the 1hour 30 minutes, most of the time was spent alone and not with my therapist and having paid around £55 for this, I was left feeling ripped off.I think next time, I'd rather go to a cheaper, local 'authentic' one.

Hidden hammam jewel. It's actually really hard to locate. No signs, and located in a pretty anonymous building. Once you find it though, you enter into a world of SPA - bare in mind, it's intimate and traditional, but it definitely delivers. If you go in the afternoon, be sure to spend some time on the roof to enjoy the sunset with a cup of mint tea.

Most relaxing experience in Marrakech. So calm, so welcoming and so relaxing. The salt scrub was a new experience for me but it was lovely! Massage incredibly relaxing. We had booked in advance from the UK at this ladies only spa. Well worth the money.

Massage is excellent, don't bother with the hammam though. We booked a hammam plus massage package. The hammam women were a bit rude --- they behaved as if we were doing them a big inconvenience. They don't speak English either, which doesn't help. The massage was great though, highly recommend the massage here! Five star massage, one star hammam.

BEST HAMMAM ever!. Let's start by saying that this place is hard to find! So we pay 10 dirham for a guy to bring us there from the sqaure. But by jolly, is it worth it.We got the 2hr 15 min package and it was pure heaven every single minute. The place is clean and airy, even the toilet and the shower room are very modern and clean.None of us spoke french/ arabic but the staff spoke enough english to be understood. They are very nice and very accomodating of our need.They even throw us a free massage and small gift of argan oil at the end. They make sure we are hydrated enough during the hammam and fresh mint tea waits for us at the end of the massage.I have a lot of spa deals before but this definitely is on top of the list.Definitely recommending this to everyone as a to do in Marakkech.

Wonderful. So glad we picked this Hammam - it was truly wonderful. We booked a couples Hammam followed by a 50 minute massage and have to say it was first class. The staff were really lovely and it was honestly the best massage ever. Nice touches with lockers, all very clean, robes and slippers provided, tea and refreshments provided between treatments and all very professional but also very friendly at the same time. Would definitely recommend coming here, but maybe worth booking in advance as they are very popular.

A-mazing. Book into Hamman de la Rose to recover from your flight, it's a must. The packages are a great deal. The massage therapists are some of the best I've encountered, anywhere, and the atmosphere is relaxing and serene. I'd never considered this but given a fellow visitor raised it, and seemed rather perturbed, it may be worth stating ( the obvious) A traditional Hamman treatment involves stripping off your kit ( bar a tiny pair of disposable underwear)and being scrubbed down and oiled up. Fine by me but my fellow client had not expected this stating: that's not how they do it at my spa in Cheshire. Well it's not a spa and it's not Cheshire. But yes for those not comfortable with a full on all over body scrub, avoid. You'd be missing out but each to their own.

Relaxing treat to end the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Booked this as a treat for us at the end of our busy week in and around Marrakech. The staff are so lovely, and the experience fantastic. My partner, who is not a spa kind of man really enjoyed it too (of course! :)) Recommended great way to relax at the end of your Marrakech experience -just enjoy!

Traditional Hammam. Very positive first experience with traditional Hammam. We went for a package - traditional Hammam de la Rose plus a relaxation massage (1h 40min). The stuff was very kind from the moment we step into the spa.The place itself is peaceful and beautiful, helps you to relax. Hammam experience was very interesting, but very private, the stuff is highly professional and would let you know what is the procedure. The massage was pleasant as well. I was expecting a bit more focusing on my back but rather than that it was an amazing experience and I highly recommend it! :)

Luxury Hammam . We visited this Hammam today - the reception responded to email enquiry for appointment almost immediately. The spa itself is absolutely beautiful inside. The changing area is good and you are provided with everything you need. We had chosen the anti stress treatment. The steam room is stunning. Everywhere is clean and it really feels like a high quality sort of place. I did feel like the Hammam side of things was rather rushed - the soaps and oils were quickly slapped on and one of the ladies seemed a bit miserable and didn't smile at all. We were taken to a very comfortable waiting area afterwards and given mint tea, a cookie and water which was a nice touch. The massage received was very good, I enjoyed mine - the only criticism my daughter had was that her masseuse had very smelly feet! Afterwards we had a shower which isn't always offered so we didn't have to go home with oily hair. Overall I think this is a lovely place to visit and I recommend it however I wouldn't visit again as there are many many Hammams all over Marrakech and I have had better hammams at cheaper places but not with the high end luxury of Hammam de la Rose.

Lovely modern Hammam. After a local recommendation I spent an afternoon at Hammam de la Rose. From the moment you step through the doors it's like you've escaped to another city, the craziness of the medina and souks are quickly forgotten. I had booked for a 30min hammam followed by a 30min massage, both of which were lovely. All of the therapists I came across were extremely professional and went out of their way to ensure you were comfortable and enjoying the treatment. The small touches of having someone to walk you between rooms and giving you the hammam glove to keep didn't go unnoticed. Care was also taken to create a clean, relaxing environment, everything was brand new (no reused robes) and the products high quality, all of which smelt amazing. I would definitely recommend a visit when in Marrakech.

Wonderful place and wonderful staff. This was an unforgettable spa experience. My friend and me, had a hammam, a face treatment followed by pedicure only for 950 dirham. The experience was definitely worth the price. There were especially to girls, I think it was Fatima and Ghizlan, tho I'm not quite sure that was the right spelling of the name. They were lovely, talking even one of them did not speak English. Surprisingly that was no problem. The cared for us, and we had a great time with them. We are definitely coming back to wonderful Hammam de la rose next time!I recommend this place!

A Luxury Hammam. After looking at the reviews on Tripadvisor, we decided to come here for a relaxing couple of hours and we weren't disappointed. We booked a hammam followed by a 1 hour massage in a bid to remove some of the stress the hustle and bustle that Marrakech will inevitably place on you, and it definitely worked!This was our first Hammam so we don't have anything to compare it to, but it was definitely very good. Inside was spacious, clean and smelled great. The girls were professional, talkative and knew what they were doing. They washed you from tip to toe, scrubbed you down with a black scrubby sponge thing and lathered you up with all kinds of potions, which smelled superb. The massage was also very good, probably the best I've had. I was more than ready to go to sleep afterwards but we had a flight to catch later that evening so it wasn't possible. There are so many spas/hammams in Marrakech and you're probably thinking I have no clue which one to choose. There may be ones better than this, but if you spend the next hour trying to find one, you'll just stress yourself out more. This one is honestly very good so just book it. They also have a roof terrace for relaxing which was a nice touch.
Cool hammam. Feel of a brand new hammam! Clean, cool and relaxing. Hammam, massage etc Quiet haven on the edge of the Medina.

Heavenly Hammam, Fantastic customer service!! Hammam De La Rose, highly recommended.. I went to this Hammam, last week, when we were in Marrakech for only 2 days.Mariyam, and her colleagues at reception are well dressed, very smartly dressed actually. They are professional and welcomed us upon arrival with lovely smiles. I booked by email in advance but the night before, I realised I had booked the incorrect time for us, I emailed to change it to the evening and they were most accommodating, another sign of great customer service here!Hammam De La Rose is the 3rd Hammam, I have been to in Marrakech and by far the best. This is the very best Hammam, as yet and I highly recommend it. There are a few reasons for this:It is clean (I'm a germaphobe and found it clean!) from the changing rooms to the actual bathing area, the actual Hammam, to the massage rooms to the lovely neutral relaxation room at the end.I liked everything about this Hammam, granted it costs more than say, Hammam Ziani ( never again, that place is filthy, dirty, gross and having gone there when I was in Marrakech last, I will never go there again!) but there is a simple reason for this - quality of service and overall better experience.The staff are super friendly, in all departments, they are lovely and walk you around from Dept to dept respectfully. This is a nice personal touch.We both went for their 500mad = £37, Package, a 50minute long package, which included, Hammam, scrubbing and a 20 or 30 minute massage. no payment was taken until minutes before we left, Unlike Hammam Ziani and Hammam Hilton, they both charged upfront, last time I was in Morocco and provided awful service. Please avoid those Hammam's. This very fact that they do not charge you until the end, shows they are a qualityThe scrubbing is awesome, the lady who did so for me, was very thorough and left me with Glowing, simply gorgeous baby soft skin all over. If you are a Brit like me, And a tad fragile, who may not be used to the pressure, you can ask them to be gentle and they will happily oblige. I however chose to close my eyes, clenched my fists and bear it. My skin has never felt so good before.After you have been bathed, you are given the glove they scrub you with as a souvenir, wrapped in plastic. How lovely, I brought mine back to Britain and in my bathroom, only my John Lewis natural bristle body brush which cost over £10 is of better quality than this. It is branded Hammam De La Rose too, this shows they are proud of their brand. I was then given my gown and waved goodbye, the door opened and another woman was stood there in uniform with a cute little bottle of water for me, it was ice cold mineral water. Again another nice touch.Then I was taken to the massage area, the massage was ok. After this, the masseuse asked me if I wished to shower and I said yes. The shower area was lovely, the shower itself, rain water style big head was amazing, the water pressure was fabulous. Like a jet spray. On a shelf nearby were 3 big bottles, gorgeous argan oil shampoo, conditioner and body lotion for customers to use. The aroma of these inspired me to buy some to take home to Britain.After my shower, I was then shown where the relaxation room was, where they brought us mint tea and little biscuits. We sat there chatting for 10minutes or so and then changed and left, feeling super relaxed and completely reenergised!I forgot to add, right at the start, they give you clean robes (I stressed clean here, as at both Hammam Hilton and Ziani, I was clearly given someone's / multiple persons used robe / gown to use!! I could actually see different coloured hair on the robe at Ziani, some long some very short, I dread to imagine which part of the body that hair was from.....euwwwww, gross) they were freshly laundered with no marks, you are also given clean cloth slippers and disposable underwear. Upon finishing your treatment, a hair brush and hairdryer is there and ready to use in he changing room and bins to dispose of your gown, disposable underwear and slippers.I really wish them success and hope there are many Hammam De La Rose's, a chain of them soon. I so look forward to returning to Marrakech, This is the only Hammam I'll be going to. Thank you all at Hammam De La Rose.

Stress relieving and mind blowing!. Me and my partner opted for a two hour treatment called the 'Tour of Morocco' (1600 Moroccan Dirhams altogether). It was amazing being pampered for so long and it was so relaxing, you could feel all the tension just melting away. You are provided with everything you need - disposable briefs, slippers and a gown. As a side note - all staff are females in this establishment so regardless of whether you are male or female, a female member of staff will carry out your treatment.To give a brief overview of the 'Tour of Morocco' - we were shown to a private locker where you get changed into your disposable briefs and a gown and we were then shown to a relaxation area where we had pastries and mint tea (a perfect bonus!). We then proceeded with the hammam which is basically like a sauna. After a short time we were exfoliated with a number of different and beautifully smelling creams and scrubs. We also got to keep the exfoliating mitt as a present. A quick but thorough foot rub was given and we were then shown to another room with some more mint tea and pastries and soon after we were shown to a room where we were massaged (the whole body, back and front) with argan oil which was so beautiful. I can remember feeling totally reborn after leaving. I would definitely recommend! I was so soft for so long!

Hammam and massage. Me and my partner decided to book the "Tour of Morrocco" treatment (a two-hour session with a hammam and massage) after reading such good reviews of this spa and we weren't disappointed. To give you a brief run-down of events, firstly you are shown into a private changing area where you strip down and place your clothes and belongings in a locker. Paper underwear is provided, but I chose to wear my bikini bottoms for the treatment...no top half, but the spa session is private so you don't need to feel self-conscious!All necessities such as robes, slippers, towels are provided.After putting on your robe (you carry the locker key with you in the pocket) you are led to a waiting area before being called up to the treatment rooms. The ladies did not speak fluent English, but give you clear instructions on what to do. A hammam involves sweating it out in a steam room before being covered in soap and vigorously scrubbed down with a mitt. My skin still feels baby soft four days after! You're then led to to waiting area and given mint tea and water before being called in for the massage. It was mine and my partner's first time getting a massage, and it was great to feel all the stress getting worked out of your back and shoulders. One you've finished you're given the opportunity to shower and dry your hair before changing and settling the bill.We left feeling amazing and would recommend this spa to anyone.

Spa Luxury at it's Finest!. A friend who lives in Marrakech with amazing taste recommended HdlR + it lived up to it's reputation. From the moment we walked in it's doors, we were greeted with exceptional care, kindess + professionalism. My boyfriend + I had the Imperial Hammam for two (400 dirhams each=$40 USD) + were treated to a thorough dousing of warm water while we sat on relaxing hot slabs of marble (so great for your back), followed by an intense scrubbing (gommage) that removed layers of skin that you'll not believe. Then after we were treated to the luxurious black eucalyptus soap which opened up the pores + lungs, further aiding in the detox of all the food + wine we'd indulged in. The final steps were rhassoul, the nourishing black mud along with a fragrant shampoo + shower in orange blossom scented bath gel. Our muscles were on the verge of jello by that point + we were treated to a quick massage of traditional rose oil before donning our robes once again. We somehow managed to crawl up the stairs to the luxurious lounge where tea + cookies + bottled water awaited + we snoozed + breathed in the relaxation until someone told us we could do the same on the sun lounges up on the rootop terrace. We climbed one more flight + found ourselves asleep on the roof, without ever feeling rushed to leave or move on. Jamila was the technician who took care of us + she was funny, despite our limited French + Arabic. She knew exactly what we needed as we were both first timers in the Hammam + she could NOT have been nicer. I look forward to going back for a good scrubbing once I'm in Marrakech again.

Professional friendly service with European prices. I would imagine there are cheaper places in Marrakech but, as this was the first time I had had a Hamman, I wanted to go somewhere I felt safe. They give you disposable undies and the room was dark so you get to keep your dignity. The lady who washes you has a no nonsense attitude which I liked. To be honest, I am not used to going to spa so for me, the treatment felt quite indulgent, but I guess that is the point. I had an Imperial Hammam which not only left me feeling indulged but also very tranquil, squeaky clean and with incredibly soft hair that smelt great.I have nothing else to compare this to, so based purely on friendliness of the staff, enjoyment and squeaky cleanness, I would recommend Hammam de la Rose.

Amazing place - a definite must do!. Great place to go and just chill out. Feel like a million dollars after treatment. I went with my sis and we had the treatment of being washed, scrubbed and exfoliated then you are treated to a wonderful full body massage. Very tranquil and just bliss x

great welcoming. I went to the spa after a friend's recomendation, once one gets there you feel very welcomed by the front desk girls who were professonnal and helpful. They gave me some moroccan tea and showed me to the changing rooms to get prepared for one of the luxurious hammams. Special thx to Fatimazahra and Laila the twin looking firends !

Amazing Hammam experience.....not to be missed!. Whilst in Marrakech we visited 2 Hammams and despite being lower down the Trip Advisor rating this one FAR OUTSHONE the other place. It is beautiful, the service was amazing, the hammam was very relaxing and the massage was perfect. Good value for money and worth every penny. Enjoyed this experience with my partner and he loved it too!

Relaxing, clean and overall nice place. I gave my girlfriend an 'orange blossom face treatment' and afterwards we had a couples massage.Place looked clean and modern. Personnel was helpful and friendly.During the wait I got tea and sweet moroccan biscuits. The massage was very good and relaxing. Afterwards we got some more tea and biscuits.Overall: a recommended place but it was the first time ever that I went to a hammam/massage salon.

Average experience. Nice and clean place. The hammam was good and the result is felt afterwards. However, the following massage was hardly so you could feel it. Furthermore, when it was over we were rushed out.

A beautiful hamam experience. We were looking for a hamam because we wanted to exeprience something authentically Moroccan - and this is just that.Our riad reccomended this Hamam to us - as she said she goes there regularly. After a day walking around the city we went to Hamam de la Rose in the afternoon. It was everything we hoped for - luxurious, relaxing and really authentic.On our arrival, the helpful and friendly staff we there to explain the different services and talk us through what happens. I chose a hamam and a massage. I loved all the different products that were used - black soap, exfoliating scrub, caramel shampoo and argan oil. The ladies who work in the spa and all very helpful, friendly, polite and professional. Each room we were taken into was relaxing, clean and very beautiful.Once the hamam was over I had a massage and I have to say it was one of the best in my life. Afterwards, I felt much more relaxed and healthier. I would definitely go again - as there are so many different treatments that you could go mutliple times.The staff were brilliant - really lovely and they made sure we were satisifed when we left. I loved my exeperience at Hamam de la Rose and will go again when I return to Marrakech.

total confidence highly professional. we had a hammam , the black soap scrub, a bit like a turkish bath, followed by a massage on the recommendation of the Riad where we were staying, first class service throughout, not too hot or rough and the massage was really good, thorough in fact I would recommend de la Rose completely

Just perfect. We did the 'hammam de stress option, with hammam and a full body massage. about 1000 dirhams (£70) for the two of us. Very good value for money.Sauna room is lovely an warm, with heated back panel, the room is large enough for 6 or so people sitting, and 6 standing, the roof is domed and the colour is green wash. there is a water cistern in the centre with a light in it that reflect on the roof, like in a grotto. its a world away from marrakech medina separated by a thick wall...In the sauna room we had a lady pour water over us from a gold or brass looking bowl, whihc was sensational, like being in a waterfall, only a lovely warm/hot temperature! Then we got rubbed down with the black soap and left to relax.One after the other we had the scrub experience:-bowl pour water like the waterfall amazing feeling-vigorous/a little bit too hard, full body exfoliating with the glove (you get to keep it)-waterfall feeling again with the rinse-on with the orange scents on the face.. mmmmm-relax in the sauna again for a bit-waterfall rinse again-soap up body and shampoo smells like yummy caramel! mmmmmm so good!-rinse under a rain water type shower (not the greatest - i prefer the waterfall feeling!-condition hair and rinse againAfter this, relax in a beautiful room, with morrocan tea, bottled water, blue room, peaceful, tranquil, towel sofas sitting in our heavy robes smelling of caramel!! You got to choose your massage oil out of rose, verbena, orange, and one other.. we chose verbena and rose. very good massage, we had it together in the same room (like american movies) it was super relaxing. Best spa experience of my life so far! I would like to find something like it in london. I would go back to this place if i ever went to marrakech again, but i cant say i want to return as it was a stressful place, hamman de la rose eases that stress, and there is a beautiful riad/hotel very nearby on the opposite side. if i went to marrakech, i go for a weekend, stay in the hotel opposite, and go to the spa again!

Excellent Spa Experience. This was the first of two hammam experiences we had in Marrakech - and definitely the more spa-like. We did the 'hammam de la rose' package, with hammam and a full body massage. It started with us being brought into a changing room where we put on some disposable underwear (which were odd) and soft, heavy robes and flip flops. Then we were lead into a beautiful room, dark blue walls with mosaic and a gorgeous sculpture and low, comfy chairs for us to relax on while they prepped our spa. We had just arrived in Marrakech about 12 hours prior, so just this lovely, warm and relaxing room was already a delight.They led us up to the hammam room - which was breathtaking! Lit primarily by candles - the walls and floor were decorated with green and blue iridescent tiles - and it smelled heavenly. We were brought into the sauna room where we were doused with warm, scented water and then rubbed down with the black soap and left to relax for a while. My partner went first for the scrub, before I went they made sure to change the dressing of the platform where the scrub happened and thoroughly rinse the whole area. The order was approximately as follows:-douse again with warm water-vigorous, full body scrub with an exfoliating glove-rinse with warm water-rub with orange scented scrub-relax in the sauna again for a bit-rinse with warm water-soap up body and shampoo (amazing caramel scented argan shampoo that we actually bought a bottle of)-rinse under a rain water type shower-condition hair and rinse againAfter this, we felt marvelous and couldn't believe we still had a massage after! While they were preparing our massages we were led into another beautiful room with deep couches and sunlight filtering in. We were brought hot mint tea, small almond cookies, and cool bottles of water - which was perfect.The massages after were very good as well! They offered us a shower after to remove the massage oil - but we declined it and went on our way smelling like orange blossoms and caramel =)

a discreet Paradise: Best Hammam in Marrakech. Hammam de la Rose is discreet and elegant. Beyond its discretion, the most important thing is the level of service. The hammam treatment is absolutely perfect - the steam rooms are clean and soothing, the staff are ultra-professional and know how to ease all pains and stress out of the body. The massages meanwhile are some of the best in the city. I have traveled extensively, lived in New York for 15 years, with a very demanding and stressful job, and have searched for the perfect massage treatment. I've found it at Hammam de la Rose. What is also key are the products that are used. Organic and healthy, all soaps and oils and masks smell absolutely divine. One comes out reborn. I cannot recommend Hammam de la Rose highly enough.

Beautiful and strongly recommended . I would like to give a massive thanks to Fawzya , Jameela السمراء , khadeeja , and to Na'ama " with the magic smile " they made it a very nice experience. Of course I don't want to forget the manager there she was very nice and helpful. Beautiful place with amazing colours and decorations and I would go again.

Best Hammam in Marrakech . One of the best places to visit when in Marrakech. Excellent customer service, excellent hosts. When entering the Spa you instantly feel welcome and in a stress free zone away from the hustle and bustle of the main city located in the Old city opposite one of the Kings Palaces. The Spa is very clean and a very soothing place to have a massage all treatments are reasonably priced. So special thanks to the Manager who also owns a chic restaurant just down the road from the Spa which offers delicious food worth a visit after a massage :-) and the all the Spa Hosts that gave us an awesome Moroccan Hammam and massage. Would definitely visit again when in Morocco. Keep up the good work guys. Oh yeah I also had a manicure and my mate had a predicure ( don't judge guys ) See you guys soon UK

Great experience. Was recommended this hammam and it is definitely worth a visit! The staff were really friendly and great at what they do. Very luxurious and well kept. Good value for a private hammam and worth it if you don't want to brave the public ones. P.s. Very up close and personal - if going with a group make sure you are comfortable around each other.

Nice place but avarage service . I choose this Hammam because of the many positive reviews on TripAdvisor. In my opinion previous customers overestimated this place. The ambient is certainly very nice, clean and new. The service is nothing special. The prices are high so I was expecting much more. I opted for hammam plus relaxing massage. The first one was too quick, I didn't even realised what was going on. The beauty therapists didn't speak any English so fairly impossible to communicate. She was such in a rush to put one finger in my nose (by accidental mistake obviously ) which started bleeding immediately. I didn't complaint because I know it can happen. However this was the cherry on the top at the end of a disappointing hammam. The massage after that was performed by another person. Nothing to declare about it. It was very basic and in the meantime I was thinking about an alternative spa to visit.Finally the place is fine but doesn't worth the price at all.

A Wonderful Treat not to be missed. When in Marrakesh you MUST take a Hamman. There are loads. This one is so wonderful. It is on the edge of the Medina and easy to find. It is shown on many tourist maps. It is a place for visitors as it is not the usual locals hamman. The place is spotless and so relaxing from the moment you enter. I paid 500 MDR ( about £35) for a wonderful experience. ( 30 mins hamman and 30 mins massage) although there is no clock watching and I think the massage was certainly longer. The staff ( all female) were excellent.

Simply Must try!. Get yourself ready to the best part of your journey.Hammam De La Rose is a must try if you are in Marrakesh.You're gonna have part of an unforgettable experience.The staff is very welcoming, the place is stunning, clean with relaxing music and has a beautiful perfume.I tried it with my partner and both of us was very pleased with the treatment what we had chosen.After that, they escorted us in a relaxation room and the Manager came to see us and ask if we vere happy, offered us a nice cup of mint tea what we served on the rooftop's sunbeds. You can't wish for more in a sunny November morning.

Bliss!. This is something not to be missed. I had a body scrub followed by an oil treatment followed by a henna treatment and felt fabulous afterwards all for approx £21! Hammams have heated walls and are usually next to a bakery - do some research and it will help understanding the whole ethos of a Hamman. This place is at the top of the Medina and easy to find. Jemillia was the lady who so expertly exfoliated and treated me. It is a great place to relax in the fun chaos of Marrakech. You only need yourself as everything else is provided for you in a calm and relaxing atmosphere - everyone should treat themselves to a Hammam here.

Hammam de la Rose. Had the most beautiful hammam spa and massage here. Best money I've ever spent! The experience was so luxurious and the staff were amazing. Would recommend to anyone visiting Marrakech!

Delightful. My wife had a Hamman scrub followed by body massage and said it was wonderful. Meant to be an hour session but in reality was more like and hour and twenty five minutes. Total cost of £35 so great value for money.

Excellent and tranquil. This was my first Hammam, and it was exceptional. All of the wonderful reviews do not do this place justice. I have to say that this spa is the best place I have ever had a treatment at. The staff were friendly, service was life changing especially as I felt relaxed at happy. I highly recommend this place. Thank you for this great experience. When I am back in Marrakesh I will definitely return. Love from the British Girls x

Excellent and unusual experience. excellent value for money! a great experience although we were never quite sure what was happening next because of the language barrier but that was all part of the adventure. fabulous scrubbing and exfoliating followed by gorgeous massage, perfect after a day of biking and walking. I must admit I felt a bit self conscious in my paper pants but I soon got over it!!!
Pedicure. Went for a simple pedicure - but liked the place and the job was well done. Not much conversation, due to lack of common language.

Hammam - Must Visit!. We looked at a few hammam places but this one stood out from the rest:Very centrally located in the cityLoads of different options to choose from the menuVery clean and smelt beautiful as soon as you walk inMassive place with different floors and total privacy...even gave us a tour before booking!Very accommodating and customer caring (Manageress was wonderful!)Well worth it! Took good care of us and even offered a drinkHighly recommended and would definately visit againMakes you feel a new person!

First time.. We never have been to a hammam and/or massage before. This time we tried. Went in the day before to make an appointment for the next day and some info about how this works. This hammam does nice deals for couples. No other guests involved. Everything was very good explained by the receptionist and even gave us a small tour in the building. Next day we went back. We were taken to seperate dressing rooms to get changed. Here you had your own locker to put your clothes and stuff in. In the locker was underwear to wear, a bathrobe and slippers. Then we were taken to the hammam. This was an hour. after the hammam we had tea and cookies, before we had an hours massage. This was really an hour, not 50 or 55 minutes. After the massage there is the possibility to relax on the rooftop, have a shower or get changed. We really enjoyed it. It was continiously just the two of us. Very professional.

Pamper yourself, you deserve it!. Amazing experience during our honeymoon in Marrakech. We visited two Hammam spas and this was by far the best. The treatment was thorough and by the end of the treatment we felt totally relaxed. The staff were professional and polite. I highly recommend this spa in the midst of your holiday/break in Marakech. Escape into utter Hammam bliss.

Best Spa Ever!!!. I visited with my friend they treated us soo well! The ladies there are amazing and make you feel so relaxed. We had full scrubs done and massages. Our skin was rejuvenated and the massages had us sleeping like babies!This place is amazing the ambience was exactly what you expect with a spa. We were given everything in terms of dressing gown, slippers, etc and the decor of the rooms were lovely.Thank you for a phenomenal experience that we will never forget.

Tranquility, luxury and sumptuous service. I visited twice during my last stay in Marrakech and will definitely return. I had a massage, waxing and pedicure and and a package that included a massage and traditional hammam.As soon as you enter the place the quality and tranquility is evident. Once through reception the lights are dimmed and the decor beautiful with cool, relaxing but colourful smooth tadelakt and drapes everywhere.Hygiene and cleanliness are paramount. All towels, gowns and slippers are provided and you can leave your belongings securely. You are given your body scrub glove to take home after the hammam. Mint tea, water and traditional biscuits are offered between treatments in a lovely chamber bathed in coloured light.The hammam is thorough and a pleasant experience (though I also enjoy the more rough and ready public hammams!). The two full-body massages I had were professionally-done with a selection of oils, good facilities and unhurried service, checking for feedback throughout. I can certainly recommend Fatima-Zara and (not sure of the spelling) Naima.I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting a luxury spa treatment at a really quite reasonable price for the care and attention you receive. Booknig is easy, with staff who speak several languages. Emails receive swift, prompt and warm attention. Gratuities are shared evenly among all the staff, which I thought was a nice touch since the cleaner is just as deserving of your appreciation as the masseur.

Interesting experience. It was only our second day and we thought of trying the hammam spa. We did the couple hammam with massage. It cost 700dhr for about 2hours. Overall, it was okay. The hammam was a good first time experience with my partner. The scrub was something anyone else could do. Massage was more of rubbing and touch rather than pressure points which I like with Asian spas.

Beautiful Hammam Spa with very helpful and friendly staff. Lovely little treat - Husband had a Balinese Massage and I think I had the Hammam Imperial Morocco. Thorough scrubbing and cleansing on my part and my husband enjoyed his massage. They provide everything you need: towels, slippers, towel etc (including disposalble pants!) Good location not far from the souks Only thing - wish I had had a massage as well ;-)

Curious. After 10 days living in the desert I was looking forward to a Hammam and Massage. The Massage was fine and thoughtful but I was disappointed with the Hammam. I was the only one in, so little atmosphere and warmth and I felt the Hammam was light weight and under committed

There are better places. After having some amazing massages at the Heritage Spa we thought we should try somewhere else - we love the Heritage Spa but there is always that feeling that you should try elsewhere just in case you are missing out!Basically we should have stayed as creatures of habit and not wasted our money!We had a couples massage....the first 10 minutes or so were spent with them trying to get the temperature in the room right.......then throughout the massage they were pretty noisy....their shoes squelched etc.....they bumped into the tables......it wasn't very professional or relaxing! Plus it was more expensive! We left feeling pretty annoyed at ourselves for wasting our money!

Incredible . Absolutely loved my time here! They really take care of you and I came out in a daze of luxury and relaxation. My masseuse, Ghizlane, was amaaaazing! Wish I could have spent the entire time here.

5 star oasis!. Situated just on the outskirts of the medina, this was a fabulous recommendation from friends that didn't disappoint! Staff are very friendly without being pushy, and you feel properly pampered. The whole place is really clean, beautifully decorated and the treatments out of this world.I had the 30 minute hammam beldi followed by 30 min back massage and floated away at the end feeling like I was on cloud 9... Definitely recommended for the quality of the treatments, the ambience of the hammam and that you'll struggle to find better anywhere else in town as a result. 10/10

Super relaxing. The moroccan twist of a spa experience, complete with black soap wash and clay. The massage therapist, Ghizlane, can be recommended. She applied the right pressure and listened carefully to my requests.
Amazing experiences. Ceremony of the Rose is the best thing that ever happened to me. Ghizlane was just great. In my opinion is to cheap what you get... Great job guys

Hammam and massage. Great experience! Fizia and Ghizlane have really made us experience a real maroccan Hammam visit! Can only reccomend it! You enter the house and Marrakesh disappears completely: it's a unique world.

Poor Experience. My friend and I visited the rose hammam on recommendation of a friend and after reading the positive reviews on Tripadvisor we were looking forward to our visit, however we were extremely disappointed.While the receptionist was polite, the lady in the hammam was not at all friendly and after leaving us alone in the hammam without knowing how long we were waiting, proceeded to talk to her friend in quite a loud voice in the hallway and so the experience was not at all relaxing. After being washed and laying down to relax on the beds the lady then continued to sit on the floor in view of us and talk to her friend. My friend and I were extremely shocked by this unprofessional behaviour and thus the experience was not relaxing.We had booked for a 50 minute massage after the hammam and having been 40 minutes in the hammam (there was a clock outside) I was aware they may reduce our massage time as the full package was 90 minutes and we were to then have mint tea. We relaxed with tea and biscuits which was pleasant before going through for a massage. I asked the masseuse what the time was and she said she did not know with a smile, I saw a timer set to 51 minutes but she did not set it despite reassuring me my session was 50 minutes. I cannot fault the massage as it was fantastic however I was sure it was not 50 minutes and when I asked the lady she said it was. We were shown to the terrace where I again asked the time, the lady disappeared to look and returned to inform us it was 5pm. My friend and I felt it was quite late and she too agreed her massage did not seem to be 50 minutes.After relaxing for 20 minutes we returned to the changing room and checked out phone to see the time was 5.02, meaning the lady lied to us deliberately about the time, being only too aware that our massage could not have been longer than 30 minutes.When paying I informed the lady on the front desk and she did not seem at all surprised, she merely reduced our payment by 10%, however for £45 in Marrakech I would expect a much higher service with a full 50 minute massage.Needless to say we will not be recommening this hammam.

Great hammam experience. My friend and I read about this spa in the TimeOut Marrakech guide book and decided it seemed a good middle ground between the public hammams and the up market spas in Marrakech. Hammam de la rose did not disappoint. The staff are lovely and speak great English. You are provided with robes, slippers and disposable underwear so you don't really need to bring anything with you which is ideal as we had spent the morning sight seeing. They also have lockers for your valuables. We had a hammam to ourselves and the whole spa environment at de la rose is immediately relaxing. They even wash your hair for you! Afterwards we could spend as long as we wanted in the relaxation room where we were given mint tea, water and biscuits. We would definitely recommend and probably would have revisited in this trip if we had had more time.

You will feel like a Princess. This is the best hammam I have ever been to-the ladies treat you like a princess. You enter from the noise and commotion on Dar El Bacha and enter an oasis of quiet and luxury. The ladies are lovely and well-versed in english. Get the Imperial Hammam! The rose-scented clay mask they put on your body is heavenly. You will leave feeling relaxed and rejuvenated-and ready to go back to the beautiful madness of Marrakech. I shall be daydreaming about the experience for a long time.

Great place for first hammam experience. The place is very nice. It was my first hammam and was quite an experience. I wish I've gotten a little intro to what will be happening though. In any case, it ended up being great. The only thin that bothered me was that they use the same towels, i.e. I was there with a friend and when they were drying us out (face and hair) they dried my friends face first and then used the same towel on me and left it on my hair. I would expect a place like this at the price they are charging to be more conscious about simple things like this. The massage afterwards (Morocan one) was fantastic. Would recommend a place.

What an intriguing concept!. 37 degrees outside, and we went into this haven of tranquility. Bit hot to start, we were early, so we had to wait a little while. We were given really cold water to drink though, to try and cool us down. If you have never had a hammam, it's an odd idea for us Western Europeans. You change into disposable underwear, both men and women, and get washed and scrubbed. I'm a big boy, and my disposable pants barely covered my bottom. Tbh this sort of thing doesn't really bother me, I'd have gone in naked, but I think I would have scared them for life. My wife was shocked that she had to go topless. But it was only the three of us (staff member, me and my wife) so it didn't bother me. The rub down and was was fab. The lady washing was great fun, she took the Micky out of my bottom purtruding out of my pants, by pulling them down and washing my bum. Very funny. But that aside, it was very relaxing. We went into the chill out room after, and I went fast asleep, and snored. Great. You have to go here. Don't be tempted to try the others, there not as good.Thank you

They'er asking for tips. I had an appointment for their package Ceremony of the Rose (90min) 700DHS On arrival I was shown the locker and got slippers, bathrobe and a pair of panties. Then in the bath / scrub room where a woman washed me while asking me 50 times if I was ok - Yes I am ok! When she gave me the bathrobe she said, "now you pay at the reception" I said well, I must also have massage! she repeated a little embarrassed "you pay money me - tips me" SIGH it was a strange feeling to take into massage and stayed in me throughout my otherwise lovely massage. After finishing massage the masseur followed me down and waited until I came out of the locker room. She continued to swarm around me until I started to explain their annoying problem then she slipped away. The woman at the front desk tried to act shocked but this problem is discussed in many review here, so I wonder how surprised she could be. I put 70 DHS and hope the girls got them ....? This problem is a management responsibility as they should do something about it - I'm not the only one with this tedious experience

Good value Scrub.. My husband and I had a scrub and shared the same time slot. It was amusing watching the process on someone as well as experiencing it yourself. It was basically a 40 minute process of sitting in the heated hammam for 8 or so minutes. Followed by having bowls of water thrown over your head and body then being scrubbed with an exfoliating glove and black soap, rinsed, and then showered. Then your hair was washed with delicious caramel smelling shampoo, rinsed, towel dried and then your skin moisturised with Caramel scented moisturiser. Finished off by a mint tea and almond biscuits. The front of desk girl spoke very good English and was friendly. The girl administrating the scrub was courteous but gave basic instructions...sit, lay, shower.We found the experience enriched our Marrakech stay and we are still having a laugh about the disposable undies.The exfoliating mitt was then included for you to take home.We went here rather than our hotel as it was better priced and conveniently located near our hotel. Unlike other reviews stating that a tip was expected, we did not have this pressure.We booked on the day for an early evening appointment.

The worst massage i've ever had. Booked in for a 30 minute back massage on our last day in Marrakesh. Booking process was easy, friendly english-speaking receptionist booked an appointment for the following day. Arrived 5 minutes early as instructed. Was taken into a treatment room and received the most lack-lustre back massage which lasted AT MOST 15 minutes. This consisted of the 'therapist' rubbing my back, hands and hair for about 10 minutes, leaving the room with no explanation, and then returning and telling me to get dressed again.She then seated me in an empty room, gave me some cold mint tea and and once my 30 minute appointment was up, i was told to get dressed. I appreciate that this Hammam is trying to create a relaxing environment, and the decor was characteristically Maroccan, but that doesn't make up for paying 300Dh for an inexcusably bad massage. If you pay for a 30 minute massage, at the very least you expect it to last that long!Maybe their full Hammam package is better, but surely if they offer a back massage, they should be able to provide it.

First time Hammam - what you need to know. We booked a couples Celebration of the Rose Hammam and were very excited but had no idea what to expect.I had lots of questions I couldn't find the answer to on here or on their website so I hope this helps:We were able to get a taxi to 300m away from the Door and it was a straight walk so impossible to get lost.Upon entering we were greeted by and English speaking receptionist who checked our booking and welcomed is. They recommend you arrive 10mins early but we were 20mins early and this wasn't a problem.We were each shown into a male and female changing area and given a locker key. Inside the locker there was a bath robe, slippers and a thong paper underwear. This is a piece of material approx 3" wide and barely covers you front to back, it comes up very high and had a string waistband. I did try it but it was incredibly unflattering and a little uncomfortable therefore I opted to keep my own underwear (pants) on. My boyfriend was given black loose fit shorts to wear.I exited the changing area and was not sure where to wait therefore asked reception and we were shown to a relaxation area where we were given a small bottle of water. After a couple of minutes we were taken for the Hammam. We entered a sauna/steam-room type room, it was very warm and wet but not steamy. Our gowns and slippers were removed and we were given sandals to wear and were shown to padded seats in a round room. The therapist then doused us in warm water covering our whole bodies, rubbed black soap all over us (they will cover every area not covered by underwear, wear a bikini top of you prefer). We were left for 5 mins to relax then it was washed off.One by one we were taken to the next room (I could still see my boyfriend in the next room as it is a seperate section of the room but adjoined). I was asked to lie face down on a padded bed while I my skin was brushed by an exfoliating mitt and my feet with a pumice stone - you get to keep the mitt. I was asked to turn and then sit until my body was fully brushed. Next my hair was washed with a beautiful caramel shampoo and conditioner. The conditioner was left in and my hair tied up. I was given an all over rose mud mask as I stood. It was put on my face which I was worried about as I have extremely sensitive skin but I did not react - a first for me!I was then asked to lie on another padded bed and relax while my boyfriend was called through and given the same treatment.We were then asked to shower it all off, together. Our gowns were put back on and a towel provided for my hair. We were then shown to a relaxing area and given sweetened Mint tea and water. This was lovely. I could feel my body cooling down and relaxing.After 5-10mins we were shown to the room where we would have a massage. We choose an oil and were given the most relaxing and soothing massage I've had. We both absolutely loved it. Ladies - your chest will be massaged, men - your groin is not touched (apparently common in Turkish massages).Afterwards we were asked if we wanted to shower. I wanted to just wash my hair as leaving the oil on my skin would do me good. We were taken into a shower room with a shower, sink and mirror. There was only shower gel here however therefore I used this to wash my hair in the sink.When we finished we were taken downstairs and back to the changing areas.In the changing area there is a sink with brushes and a hairdryer. I had read on here there was a charge to use the hairdryer therefore I didn't bother. There was a rose moisturiser available to use. There was a well lit mirror where I could reapply my make up.After leaving and letting my hair dry in the sun I noticed it was very very oily even although I had washed it (with shower gel). I had to put it up in a ponytail as it was too greasy to leave down.I'd recommend you take pants or a bikini to wear as comfort. If you want to wash your hair afterwards you'll need to take your shampoo/conditioner in your robe pocket with you. It would also be a good idea to remove all make up before the Hammam and wear your hair down so it can be washed and you can get the most out of the head massage. Card is accepted as payment and a few of the therapists ask for a tip which can be slightly awkward.Take a plastic bag to carry home wet underwear/bikini and wet mitt.The staff are all femaleThis was a delightful experience for us both and I'd recommend!The cost was 700dhm per person (approx £50) well worth it.

Relaxing. My husband and I visited the hammam on the last day of our holiday. We pre-booked via email the day before to ensure we got the time/treatment we wanted as we knew the spa was very popular.We arrived around 15minutes before our treatment and were shown straight through to the changing rooms where we were given robes, slippers and disposable underwear. The staff were very polite and friendly, the atmosphere instantly relaxing. We booked in for the hammam and massage package which was 90minutes of pure bliss -refreshing and relaxing. It was an ideal way to relax after the heat and noise of the souks. Our treatment was booked for a late afternoon/early evening meaning the spa was very quiet and we got the relaxation rooms pretty much to ourselves. I would highly recommend a visit...it's well worth the money.

An Oasis. Mum and I made our way here for a mother/daughter afternoon. We ordered the 90 minute Ceremony of the Rose for 70 USD each, which included a 45 minute hammam followed by a brief break for tea and biscuits and then a 50 minute Swedish massage. I had my son with me who was asleep in his stroller. The ladies were so gracious as to put him in a quiet room while we had our treatment. Moroccans adore children and while I asked them to retrieve me if he awoke, they did not and instead played with and entertained him which was really above and beyond the call of duty. The hamman was delightful. Very relaxing and thorough. The massage was relaxing as well but I wouldn't say it was the best massage I've ever received. It was pretty light, not the best technique but still good. The only thing that bothered me about Hammam De La Rose is that they blatantly asked for tips and then they all stood outside the changing room as we dressed. It made me feel awkward knowing they were all there waiting for a handout. While I understand Moroccans make a very low wage and everyone is trying to survive, I paid $140 USD for the treatments and didn't appreciate feeling hawked after. It just left a bad taste at the end of what was a rather enjoyable 90 minutes. I tipped an additional $10 because they essentially baby sat for me and were very kind but they need to tone down the aggressive tip antics. I left the souqs and Jemaa El Fna to get a break from all that!

Wonderful first ever hammam. We were feeling a little under the weather and visited here for a bit of relaxation. Wow, it was wonderful. We had the hammam beldi - effectively a sauna followed by an all over scrub and wash. The staff were very friendly and professional with a relaxing lounge to chill in afterwards. A little pricey, but a wonderful holiday indulgence.

Perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the Medina!. I am a regular visitor to Marrakech and since discovering the Hammam de la Rose about 3 years ago, I try to go there at least once on each of my stays in the city. My favourite treatment is the Ceremony of the Rose, which includes the full hammam ritual (body & hair wash and body scrub) then a rose face & body mask, followed by a full body massage. Between the hammam ritual & massage you are taken to a relaxing lounge area and provided with mint tea, biscuits and water. The therapists dress in smart salon uniforms and provide a thoroughly professional service. I always return to the riad feeling nicely scrubbed, massaged and relaxed. I can highly recommend Hammam de la Rose and will look forward to my next visit. Thank you to all the staff there. Carole

Very professional. Having visited many different hammams including 2 in Marrakech, this was by far the best. From the moment we stepped through the door, they made us feel comfortable and relaxed. My husband and I appreciated being able to have a hammam together and loved the gorgeous products that they used. They also have argan products and hairdryers etc in the female changing room. After our hammam we were taken to a relaxing lounge where we were given our scrubbing mitts, a bottle of water, mint tea and biscuits.A real bargain at £16 for a relaxing break away from the hustle and bustle of the city - well recommended.

Fantastic Experience . All staff succeed in making the visit an excellent experience for myself and my wife. The initial "scrubbing" was thrilling before the main massage experience which was relaxing and allowed one's body to relax while the mind just switched off. I would recommend experiencing the hammam after the sight seeing tour: a retreat from the hustle and bustle.

Amazing experience. Luxurious spa offering great service, we looked around and found this was the cheapest by far in comparison to the top 5 hammams. Opted for a hammam with massage, 2 hours of relaxation for only £50! Very professional service, highly recommended

Lovely up market hammam in Marrakesh. We did a couple's hammam and spa package- 90 minutes - steam room, soaping, aromatic oils and massage. Tea and Moroccan biscuits in the middle. All wonderfully relaxing- felt very chilled and skin renewed. Previous experience of this was up market hammams in Andalucia ( gorgeous Turkish bath affair) and local single sex bath in Turkey. This wasn't much like either of these- not cheap but lovely.

Massages not amazing. I had a full body oil massage. I am guessing they use good oil but the masseuse was not impressive. I hope they have better masseuse...I think I will try another place next time.
Relaxing and a worthwhile experience. Worthwhile and unique experience. Being naked was a bit awkward at first but was fine after a while and actually very relaxing!

Relaxation at it's best. Wento to Marrakech as a group and decided that we all wanted to try a hammam scrub whilst we were there. What an experience!!! It's tranquil and relaxing. A couple of the group had hangovers and felt loads better afterwards. Really worth a visit if you are around the area. It worked out around £16 and was worth every penny. The treatment time was about an hour and a half (this may have been due to the size of the group as we all went in together).

A great way to unwind . Marrakech is a vibrant and busy place to be and this hidden gem allows you a few hours of peace and tranquility.Staff were polite and made you feel at ease and the facilities were fantastic.Would recommend and would revisit

Blissful!!!. What a fantastic luxurious experience! I had been to both public and spa type hammam whilst in Turkey and this exceeded all my expectations based on these experiences! If you want a true "authentic" hammam maybe this is not for you, save yourself some money and go "public" but my daughter and I both felt as we d been whisked away to paradise. From the moment we entered to the mint tea and Moroccan cakes whilst winding down the experience was exquisite! Am still using the glove, four months later, that was used during the exfoliation and my 48 year old skin still soft as a peach!! Thanks to all the staff.

Amazing hammam in the heart of the Old Medina.. This place was amazing. From the body scrub and wash, to the amazing massage with argan oils, to the incredible staff, and even the super fluffy robes. I would highly recommend this hammam if you want to treat yourself in a little personal oasis in the middle of exotic Marrakesh. The staff was so friendly and accommodating, the rooms were all beautiful and relaxing and the overall experience was just truly amazing. Do yourself a favor and just go here.
