On top of the amazing services, the prices compared to the overcharging non-authentic stuff you get in the USA, are just incredible.

Perfect way to spend a few hours in Marrakesh. My friends and I booked different treatments: massage, basic hammam and the imperial morocco. All men and women in the same group are together and they provide only disposable bottoms for both. After the hammam, there's a small lounge with tea and water to relax after any treatment. We all loved it and it seems the massage is the best thing in the menu, according to my friends. The staff is very friendly and nice.

What an experience!. As our first hammam we had no idea what to expect. We had been recommended la Rose and we were not dissappointed. The traditional hammam was great, after getting over the initial giggles of the whole situation, sat there in our paper knickers and having buckets of water chucked over us! The scrubs and exfoliators were great, and the massage after was fab. They even shampooed and conditioned our hair. Definitely highly recommended.
Lovely & accomodating staff.. One of my first business interactions and they ensured that I did not overpay. My regret that I did not get a massage. Next time for sure!

Fabulous end to our trip. 3 of us Visited the spa on our last morning - 2 for the Hammam and one for massage. Wonderful experience and attention to detail. Thank you to the ladies who did our Hammam (Berbere and imperial Morocco) we now feel ready for our flight and loved having our faces exfoliated too. Enjoyed relaxing afterwards with tea and water and wish we had gone earlier in our trip as we would have come again for another treatment. Fabulous service, value and well worth the visit. THANK YOU :-)

Birthday hammam. Absolutely wonderful. I booked a last minute treatment for my birthday and was delighted with my choice of establishment.The location a 5 minute walk from my Riad, the staff were welcoming the smell on entry was simple sublime.I was escorted to a room where I changed into a robe, lockers are provided for personal belongings. Hammam de la Rose have thought about every single detail that would suit all clients. A relaxing environment that offers the offer the upmost professional services.A special thanks to Jamila the lady who did my Hammam, thank you for a wonderful treatment and look forward to my return later in the year. With kindest thanksKaren 19/6/2015 at 10am

Excellent Hammam!. Visited here to fill an afternoon before travelling back home in the evening, luckily we were staying in a riad only a quick 5 minute walk around the corner! Really isn't anything I can fault them with - greeted with a smile and an English speaking receptionist, quickly served (unfortunately because we didn't book there were no massages available, so I would recommend booking in advance if you wish for one!) and taken to get changed before being taken upstairs into the Hammam. Again, the lady looking after us spoke English to a reasonable standard, made sure we were comfortable at all times. We opted for the full body clay Hammam which we left feeling very relaxed, clean and soft!Upon finishing the Hammam we were taken to a lovely relaxation room and provided with a cold bottle of water and a glass of mint tea - excellent! We were allowed to stay here for as long as we wanted, and so stayed for a good hour!Very clean, very well run Hammam! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for something to fill an afternoon or even a day! Only a 10 minute walk from Jeema El Fma (Main Square) is a bonus!

Lovely, relaxing, calming... two thumbs up. After a particularly bad hammam in Agadir, my friend and I were hoping to have one to restore our faith... Our experience at Hammam de la Rose was amazing. We were treated so well by every staff member. Our hammam was good, our massages were the perfect pressure and our facial was good too. I would definitely recommend and would visit again, if in Marrakech again.

Clean Hammam Great Experience for a Hen Party. Nice hammam located in the medina short walk from most riads within the medinaClean, chilled out spa/hammam where the ladies really take their time to pamper you.The black clay scrub is a definate must do!Tea and biscuits served before and afterThe spa is amazing, from the scrubs to the shampoos they useThe massage was good - but make sure you book high pressure and tell the ladies at the front desk exactly what you would like beforeBook well in advance as it is very popular especially if its for a big group:)

Disappointing. We were personally recommended this Hammam and chose the Ceremony of the Rose, Both of us were really looking forward to this experience. However, in common with others I felt that the staff didn't really give us a personalised experience - most likely it was a language barrier as we speak English and our ladies did not. I had to ask for water as even though we were asked to wait before our treatment, nobody had thought we might like some water. Hydration is very important when using steam rooms - mind you we weren't in it for very long! I felt like we were on a conveyor belt with perfunctory scrubs and massages. I was expecting to feel 'scrubbed' clean. The order of the treatments was not explained and we didn't really know what was going on. After our scrub, shampoo and rose mask, we were asked to wait in a room for a while and brought mint tea and a pastry. Then we were called into the massage room. I've had a relaxing massage many times, this was the sort of massage my husband might give - as one other reviewer has said it was more like stroking the skin. Not very relaxing either to have a massage, almost naked at the front of the salon behind a plate glass frosted window and a voile curtain but listening to the sounds of the street the other side of the window. We wanted to relax on the roof terrace after our massage but were directed to get changed and off we went. The owner (?) did ask us how we enjoyed our treatment, my daughter really enjoyed her experience, possibly because she doesn't have massages very often? Anyway, I did not want to complain and spoil my daughter's experience - very few people have the courage to complain in person I think you'll find. I did mention to the manageress before I came in I had a tension knot in my shoulder (the result of getting lost in the souks) which I had asked the masseuse to sort for me. I have had tension knots worked on before and although it is a bit stiff after the massage it usually clears up after a couple of hours and is much better. This didn't. Don't know what she did, but my shoulder was agony for a couple of days. I couldn't even touch it or have the strap of my handbag over that shoulder. I thought the Hammam was expensive for what it was, I didn't feel it was personalised or feel pampered. I've had spa treatments in the UK and the staff here was amateurish in comparison. However, my daughter did enjoy her time here so I've given this an average rating.

Wonderfully Enjoyable Pampering. We've been to a few, but this has to rate as one of the best Hammams we have had. My wife and I visited this very classy, yet excellent value establishment down a classically 'difficult to find' Marrakech alley!! It was great to enjoy the experience together and feel so relaxed by the end of our treatment. We would highly recommend this place and having spoken to others who had a hammam while visiting this great city, we definitely believe we made a good choice. We will certainly re-book on our next visit.

Luxurious relaxation. When we entered the Hammam it really was like entering an oasis of calm. My friends and I all had the Celebration of the rose treatment. We were given robes, slippers and paper pants, omce we had changed into them we were led through to a relaxing spa area where we were doused in warm water, and then left to "steam" each of us was then taken into another room and exfoliated, our hair was washed and then conditioned with a lovely caramel fragranced conditioner, and we were covered in an all over body mud mask. After 15 mins we were led to a shower to remove and we were given our robes back and led to a beautiful room where we were given mint tea, water and a Morrocan pastry. When we sat back on the sofa the skylight was an ornate blue stained glass window, so we relaxed and chatted looking up at the window. This was then followed by an amazing all over body massage where we could choose our scented oil and I almost fell asleep. This was a much needed luxurious experience, away from the hustle and bustle of the town. I highly recommend, excellent service.

Relaxing Rosa. Marrakech is for couple or for fun or for exploring and you always need to relax. From moment you arrive it sends out chill out vibes. The black man cloth aka Tarzan is a surprise. Initial hammam is big and plenty of warm water and black soap. Followed by a healthy body scrub, and the glove they give you after. Then a 10 minute relax with tea followed by pretty good head to toe massage. We went as couple and as couple you are treated well. Head massage could be longer according to my partner and I wanted a more intense deport massage. This is where the can gain the five stars, be more attentive to the individual even when you are a couple.

A session in serenity. In a building that is predominantly French speaking, my schooling taught me enough to understand,"you are not to wear trunks for your massage", but not enough to get, "you are to wear the modesty pouches provided though" (take note!!). Once the masseuse got over the initial laughter of me naked and gave me my pouch, the experience of being washed, massaged and dried was immensely satisfying and I thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience. The staff were very friendly and attentive, despite the language barrier, and I would love to visit the hammam again.

Nice place to go after a day on your feet!. Clean and private. Massage was great as well as the scrub down. Service was attentive but the only disappointment was at the very end, my friend and I had planned to get our hair washed and blew dry but had to wait so long, we finally left with oily hair from the massage. Overall good experience but with an unnecessary flaw at the end.

Had better. We chose this Hammam for 2 reasons:1, The good reviews2. They offered couples massageWe went for the scrub and massage package. When we arrived at the Hammam there was a short wait before we were shown where to get changed. No real issues except if you're a male, you might find the "thong" a little uncomfortable!We first had the scrub/hammam experience. The lady who did the scrub was good, she scrubbed with good pressure but we were left in room without any instructions about what was going on. We didnt know if we should relax, or if she would be coming back in 5 minutes...it turned out that we were sitting there for 20ish minutes. The whole experience lasted about an hour.Following this we had the couples massage. The massage was ok - but doesnt compare to those that you have in Asia. There was a lack of pressure, there wasnt a relaxed feeling in the room and on a couple of situations we heard the masseuse talking to each other....hardly professional! You pay over the odds for this place because of the reviews! I wouldnt go back here in a rush!

Go for the hammam but not the massage. I'd booked this place after looking on trip advisor.They welcomed us very warmly. We were a hen party of 5 and wanted to experience the hammam and massage. We were told to do the signature package and we mentioned to them that the massage we would prefer to have a strong one and we were assured we would have strong massage but when we were greeted by the masseuses we had said we wanted and they said its only relaxation so would be a softer massage. Therefore the massage wasn't great.However the hammam was really good. They were very good and listened to what we wanted. Good experience. I would recommend doing both treatments separately instead of package deal.

A good cleanse. The small reception hides a huge hammam, it's private and slightly expensive, but quite amazing. You hae to prebook, but they were very flexible. We did a hammam scrub, and a lady washed, scrubbed and pampered us with olive soap, caramel shampoo and rose oil. after the hammam you're sat in a room and given water and sweet mint tea for relaxing. After some hot days in the souks, it's just the thing.

A Sanctuary in Marrakech. The place is beautiful, clean, Lady at reception spekas english which is GREAT! the ladies in the spa treat you with respect. We couldn't speak to each other, but it was understood what was coming next, and they were very nice and friendly.Really enjoyed the Hamman at this place. And is not expensive.

Excellent experience ++++. Visited this morning, and although I had no appointment and they were busy they managed to fit me in. 700 MAD (£47) for a traditional hammam and massage left me feeling relaxed, chilled and very happy. Great treat half way through my holiday. Highly recommend!!

Lovey Experience (Don't Forget If You've Paid A Deposit). As the title suggests, my girlfriend and I had a lovely experience, which I will come back to later, but unfortunately this was tainted when we realised later that evening that'd we'd paid a 200 MAD excess on the flagship 'Ceremony of the Rose' treatment (700 MAD per person - quite a lot for us) because we had not remembered and were not reminded by management that we had already paid a 200 MAD deposit when we booked in person a couple of hours previous. We hope this was human error on part of management (as well as ourselves) and not attributed to something more beguiling as we really do feel this is something they should have been on top of especially when their clients are in a post-hedonistic stupor! That being said, the de la Rose is a well presented, modern hammam - front of house were friendly and the attendants congenial and accommodating. The scrub was thorough and the massage relaxing though we would have liked it a little stronger and deeper. All in all, a worthwhile experience if you have a few MAD to spare but slightly over priced by our estimation and would perhaps recommend one finding a more authentic and traditional alternative. Thank you.

Very unpleasant experience. We picked this hammam because it looked a little more "posh" than the other ones: it seems to be more in line with what we expect a "spa" to be. Well, that was a mistake. Yes, you will pay more that what you would pay in a more traditional hammam, but don't expect to feel spoilt or anything like that. Me and my boyfriend booked a Hammam beldi (30 mins hammam + scrub and cleansing). We were welcomed by a lazy member of the team, that took us to the changing room without a single smile. When we got to the hammam we were quickly asked to take off our robes and then led to the steam room. Once we got there the two girls rudely started to throw bowls of hot water at us. After that, without saying a word, the left the room and we were left, clueless, for something like 30 mins in that crazy-hot steam room. They came back and took us to the other room, where, we were rudely scrubbed and cleansed. It felt like being in a hospital. I had NO CLUE about what was going on, they didn't speak English and they didn't even try to tell us what was going on. There was NOTHING i liked about this experience. Would NOT recommend.

Expensive tourist trap!. I visited many hammams & SPAs in Europe, Asia, Africa. This was definitely mostly overpriced & dull hammam. Massage was o.k but the whole experience felt like tourist "waiting in a line" for your turn, employees behaved like in a hospital. An awful plastic cloths were used in hammam for sitting, these usually collect dirt and germs especially in heated environment. Pedicure was expensive and not worth at all - you can do it much better yourself. All in all - please search for better hammam in Marrakech and try to avoid this place.

Best Massage Ever!. This was the first time I have visited a hammam--and while a bit unnerving at first, the staff was professional and very discreet, so it made the experience very relaxing. Following the hammam, I had the BEST massage of my life. Again, very discreet and very professional, and got rid of the all the tension that built up after two days in the Medina. The smells of the oils were amazing, the massage therapist instinctively knew how much pressure to apply, and I left feeling renewed and relaxed. I would highly recommend the Hammam de la Rose for anyone who wants a combination of luxury and a traditional hammam experience. Worth every single penny/pence/durham. They also sell the same products that they use in the hammam--and while a little pricey---bought some to bring home and have not regretted it once. Overall an amazing, luxurious and relaxing experience well worth the visit.

Fantastic Massage - great atmosphere. If you want to relax and have a great time, go here. The massage was just amazing. You feel newly born. The treatment is very friendly and professional. Absolute recommendation
Sublime. Went with 2 friends and shared experience together. Beautiful from start to finish. Sensual experience. Recommend whole package (inc massage).

Best massage in Marrakech . Me and my Sister have visited 3 different spas during our vacation in Marrakech. This one was by far the best one. The massage therapist was stong and have a good deep pressure massage which is very hard to find! We are going back again a 3rd time tonight. Really recommend it!

Bliss!. I had a very relaxing morning here. The spa is very clean and there is a tranquil atmosphere. All the staff were friendly and very professional. I had a 45 min hammam which was lovely (I particularly liked the scrub). Afterwards I was given mint tea and water while I relaxed for about ten mins. Then I had an amazing 45 minute massage which was just perfect. It wasn't cheap at 700 dirrahms but definitely worth it!

A blissful retreat .... Thoroughly lovely spa,my mother and I had the private hammam and massage, the hamma was lovely and the massage really, really good (as someone who is a professional bodyworker it's often hard to find good masseurs with decent thumb strength!)
Fabulous couples massage. We booked in for a couples massage and had a wonderful experience. They were very professional and the spa was very clean.

Felt rejuvenated afterwards. Recommend the ceremony of the rose. We had the full Hammam ritual followed by massages and it was amazing. Really nice way to spend a relaxing afternoon of our holiday in Marrakech. Skin felt amazing afterwards. Although expensive in morroccan terms the skills, setting and overall experience made it great value for money.

A lovely relaxing retreat. My partner and I visted the hammam durung our stay n Marrakech. We had the 'Celebration of the Roses' which included a double hammam experience followed by a full body massage and it was absolutely wonderful! The spa is gorgeous inside with traditional Moroccan features and decor and the staff were lovely. The whole experience is very intimate (in other words they will scrub and massage ANYTHING that isn't covered up!) so if you're a bit coy then go in a bikini and keep your top on. We came out feeling relaxed and refreshed and it was a very welcome few hours retreat from the hussle and bustle of Medina.

Lovely little Hammam in the centre of Marrakech. My friends and I visited this Hamman a couple of days ago and we where not disappointed. We turned up without an appointment and they where able to fit us in. The change rooms were nice enough and the robes comfy. One of my friends partners was not getting a treatment and he was taken up to sit on the lovely terrace upstairs and given tea, water and biscuits while he waited for us, which was very much appreciated. The treatments themselves where amazing, all the soaps and oils used smelt delicious and left our skin feeling great. The Hammam room itself was beautiful and the three of us very much enjoyed our time in there. We thank the staff for a great experience and hope to come back to get even more treatments done next time.

A great experience. This was my first visit to a hamman and I wasn't disappointed. It is very clean and professionally run. You are looked after every step of the way. I had the. 250D basic hamman which was very good value and lasted about 45 mins altogether. You get a nice white fluffy robe , paper pants and slippers and then are led upstairs. The hamman is very warm which is good as the attendant starts by pouring water over you and then soaping you with the famous black soap. Then you are left in the sauna to sweat out the toxins before being rinsed off and then lying down and beingscrubbed with a mitt . All over. More rinsing, hair washing, soaping follow and then a rain shower. It all smells gorgeous. At the end, in your robe,you go to a quiet room with white sofas and have water and mint tea before getting changed. Great experience, can't wait to do it again.

Fabulous Hammam. This was definately one of the highlights of our trip. After spending days exploring in the heat and getting lost in the souks and tunnels this is the perfect way to feel revitalised in peace and tranquillity. The staff are friendly and professional; all the soaps and scrubs which they use smell incredible and make your skin feel silky soft. Even better unlike a lot of hammams you can do this as a couple.

Revitalising!. A thoroughly enjoyable experience, I will have to return to Marrakech if only to visit Hamman de la Rose for an Ayurvedic massage with Atika. I was a little hesitant having tried massages at home which usually have the effect of making me feel drained and exhausted, but this one was fab, I felt re energised and bouncier!! Atika was great, very professional. The spa was beautifully decorated with a nice rooftop terrace to relax with a mint tea after your treatment. I would definitely recommend a visit.

high relaxation. as soon as you walk in to the reception gorgeous smiles greet you and make you feel comfortable and relaxed straight away.. A safe quiet location in marrakech with beautiful staff and high quality clean steam rooms and totally amazing massage and oils ..

Bliss in Marrakech. Stepping into the Hammam de la Rose from the busy street in Marrakech's Medina, one knows that an exceptional experience awaits - the personnel are all professional, well groomed and lovely, the beautiful decor and low music add to the atmosphere of blissful relaxation, and each step of the treatment is expertly administered. I felt relaxed, renewed, and grateful that my son-in-law offered such a lovely gift during our family trip to Marrakech.

Bliss in Marrakech. The best way to get away from the madness of Marrakech. The hammam is top notch quality. From the moment you step in you are in a peaceful place. The hammam was out of this world. So relaxing. You feel like a new person at the end of it all. the facility is very clean and everybody has a professional attitude. The one thing I would not recommend is their manicure and pedicure services as it is clear that's not their speciality. I just got a polish change and the choices were limited and I do a better job applying color on my nails at home. Thumbs up to the hammam and massage though. DO IT! Preferably on your last day or night in Marrakech :)
Tranquility Base. After a combination of a Hammam and a full body massage - you are in blissful peace! Was truly relaxing and brilliant service to boot!

It was a very bad experience. My wife booked a full massage and hammam for 700 Dhiram. When she came back she said it was her verse experience she had a hammam for about 20 mins which was fine and then she was just sitting in the steam room for nearly one hour and at the end she was given a massage for only 7 min and was told to relax on the massage table for nearly 20 min then massager came back and said your massage is complete.Secondly the 7 min message was only done at the back. My wife complained to the massager saying are you not going to give me full massage she said no it's only for back. This was very disappointing we were told that the massage will be for 30 min and will be for full body. When we complained to the manager she just said "sorry I think the massager did not understand well." She gave us a 100 Dhiram refund which was nothing to what we paid. It was a very bad experience to the money we paid for sitting in the steam room.

Excellent experience. I visited the hammam on 2 occasions. Both visits were an excellent experience. From check-in right through the whole experience of having a wonderful hammam treatment and then a relaxing massage. The facilities are of high quality comparing favorably to any similar Spa experience in the US. The staff are caring and very helpful, appropriate to the surroundings. The staff in the hammam and massage areas are well qualified again comparable to any US Spa that I have visited. The ambiance is well in keeping with the Morocco's sense of style and design and of high quality. My wife joined me on both occasions and we both highly recommend the Spa and Hammam and look forward to visiting there again whenever we are visiting Marrakech. Shukran !

My favourite part of Marrakech!. I did a birthday weekend in Marrakech with 3 other girls and found this to be the perfect day. Extremely easy to find, we arrived at 11.30 just to see if we could get an appointment and at 12 they had us all in for a 45 minute tradition Hammam with Black Soap and Henna. We were the only ones there that I could see so we had the entire place to ourselves. The staff were extremely friendly and 100% professional and the facilities were beautiful. The entire experience was completely incredible and relaxing from start to finish. I would go back to Marrakech just fro this treatment alone! Two of the other girls had previously had Hammam and had mixed feelings about having another, but after a day at Hammam de la Rose all our opinions were definitely positive. Thank you so much to the wonderful staff. A must do in Marrakech!!!!

worth a visit!. I'm not very often in Hammas, but at least I had some experience in the past. This were two very relaxing hours, especially the Ayurveda massage was extremely professional. I can definitely recommend that place!!
Excellent. Friendly stuff, very well organized, very clean, very well equipped. Treatment (Hamman for couple and massage) was very nice. Came out very relaxed.

Amazing Hammam. My husband booked a Ceremony of the Rose (90min) for two persons by email before arriving in Marrakech and got a prompt confirmation email. I must say that after reading some negative remarks from previous clients here on tripadvisor my expectations were average. Well, it was amazing from the moment we stepped in. All the areas were spotlessly clean, the staff was friendly and my massage was just great. Between the Hammam and the Massage we had a quick rest time for tea and cookies. None of the staff who took care of us was pushy for tips.In the changing room there's a hairdryer available but for 100Dirhams you can get a brushing in their hair saloon.Small advice: if you are not happy with the pressure in your massage let the masseur know, otherwise she will not guess, right?

Very average. I was very excited to be going for a traditional hamman and massage and purposely booked something outside of the hotel as we wanted to experience the authentic hamman. I booked for myself and my 2 adult children for the 'Ceremony de la rose' Hamman plus massage. The changing facilities upon entry are very substandard, there is only a flimsy curtain separating customers and passers by and my son by mistake came into the ladies area as he had no idea where he was going. The privacy aspect really needs addressing. We went downstairs together as a family and waited 10 minutes before being taken to the hamman. We were in there far too long without water, I ventured outside and found a member of staff and asked if we could have some water and move on to the next step as we had been sitting in the steam room for 15 minutes.I felt that at each stage of the process we were on a conveyor belt, there was nothing personal about the experience and we were left far too long in between each step to the point where we just wanted to get out. The two ladies who were carrying out the treatment chatted constantly in the area next to the hamman, therefore there was no relaxing atmosphere as one would have hoped for. The massage was very average, it was more like stroking of the skin, not what I would call a proper massage. It was relaxing, how can it not be lying on a hot bed but the therapist appeared very tired and I felt sorry for her. I started wondering how many massages she had carried out during the day and wondered whether she was just worn out. In my opinion this establishment may appeal to those who are not familiar or experienced with hammans and massages in general. For anyone who is used to regular treatments, I think they will be disappointed as we were. There are many more superior spas to visit and we would do further research on our next visit

Good but could be even better. The spa smelt lovely, was lovely and clean with good facilities to change (they have lockers for your things). We had the Hammam de la rose package and so were washed down by one friendly lady although we did feel like we were the last of the day (even though it was lunchtime), she felt like she was a bit bored. The scrub was lovely but very short, and we had a nice rose body lotion put on, only issue is that she put some of my face which started burning immediately, i should have showered it off but didn't want to make a fuss (it later gave me a rash and a red face for a couple of days) so when she asks if you want on your face i would suggest no!We then went on to the massage which only lasted about 30 minutes, again, the motivation for the massage was minimal as in minimal effort put in. With the package we had bought for 1 hour and a half the actual treatment time was about 45 minutes so just know that when you go. Very friendly though and a nice retreat from the souks.

AMAZING! RELAXING! PERFECTION!. Truly was an amazing experience. The facility is beautiful and modern. It was all very elegant. The staff there were very polite and professional. The manager was great. She spent time telling us about the best restaurants and clubs and was truly helpful and kind. We had actually met her on our first day at a cafe. She was super kind and informative and told us about the local delicacies etc. So it was really cool to walk into the facility and see her again.Back to the spa. It was truly great! The Hammam or the scrub was a completely new experience for me and it was great. The massage was relaxing as all good massages should be. I completely and utterly recommend these spa to anyone looking for a relaxing break whilst on holiday in Marrakesh.

Nice and professional. After a few days in the city we felt like getting cleaned and relaxed. Visited in the late morning and the place is buzzy and full. Need to book in advance. We would have liked to add a massage, but that was not possible.Clean, efficient and very nice. Maybe add a little aucentication and it would have been 5 stars.

Very relaxing. During our stay in Marrakech we decided we wanted a Hamman. Before booking we were shown around the spa and then decided to book for the couples Hamman and massage. The staff were very professional and the spa is very clean. We loved the experience and felt very relaxed and pampered for the rest of the evening.

Nice experience but not the greatest treatment. After negotiating the labyrinthine souks of the medina Hammam de la Rose is definitely a very pleasant Oasis of calm. The staff are polite and very welcoming when you arrive, and It is advisable to book ahead as this is a very popular and busy spa.Overall? The treatment we had (ceremony of the rose) was relaxing and we certainly felt cleansed afterwards.The downside for me was the actual treatment time. The easiest way to explain this is to walk you through our experience.1) arrive and get changed into the paper g-string (standard for this type of treatment - ladies you will be expected to wear nothing but your paper g-string pouring treatment, again this is standard)2) wait for 10 minutes to be taken to steam room3) into steam room - the wash down and soap application took about five minutes (for two of us)4) left in steam room for around 15-20minutes5) lady returned and then we were scrubbed ( about 5 minutes each) and the rose mask was applied (took less than a minute each)6) left lying down for another 15 mins7) lady returned - we both showered8) taken to a room where we had tea - another 20 minute wait.9) collected by two masseuse and had a massage (30 minutes)10) treatment ends get dressed.The whole experience lasted exactly two hours from arrival to getting dressed at the end. The actual treatment time (ie when the body was being rubbed down or massaged) was less than 45 minutes each, this is despite the treatment being advertised as 90 minutes.So whilst this was a very pleasant experience the time spent on treatment left us feeling a little short-changed. The Hammam was clearly very busy and did have a bit of a "production line" feel to it, and the standard of massage was only average compared to other treatments we have had in different countries.If you are looking at this through western eyes the cost is pretty good value compared to European spas..... But when you look at the actual time spent on the treatment (as opposed to lying or sitting around) the pricing is what you would expect in any UK or other European city.Worth a visit.... But keep your expectations in check.

Girly massage. Great luxury spa. Clean, great staff, and a decor that is impressive.If you're a muscly-fat dude with tense nerves and in dire need of a real deep tissue massage (I opted for the ayurvedic), this place might not be for you. My masseuse did her sincere best, but was unable to dig in and get rid of those knots. It was a bit soft and girly for my taste.However, i do recognize that I'm a brute of a man, and there is no fault with Rose Hammam. The rest of the general public will be fine here.
Great Hammam. Lovely hammam conveniently located in the souk - the staff is incredibly friendly and professional, everything is spotless clean and the services great - highly recommend

Really great hammam!. My mother, my sister in law and I went looking for a hammam on our last day in Marrakech, and I'm so glad we found this place! Even with short notice, the very nice receptionist found time for all 3 of us. We chose both a hammam and a massage. We had the massage first, because of the late booking, but it was no problem for us. The massage was terrific! I felt so good and relaxed afterwards. The hammam was my first, and it was a great experience! I have no idea how long the whole thing took, cause you just lost track of time, but we came out feeling so great and relaxed as if we had been there for hours!

Waste of money. This place looks nice enough from the outside and good in the entry but does not look like a traditional hammam place when inside. However, the main reasons for the poor rating of this place:1. A Riad was being built/refurbished behind the hammam room so while I was trying to relax there was this constant banging - horrible. When I told staff about the problem and that they should have mentioned this to me before starting the massage / subsidised the price - their response was that it's not their fault. I would have been fine if they had notified me of the banging before so I knew what I was paying for. 2. Large parts of the 1.5 hours was just sitting around in the spa with 1 min of scrubbing - no real value add on their part. 3. Prices are more than average for this type of place - I'm 100% sure you can get better value for money than this place. The good thing was probably the massage. I wouldn't visit this place again and don't recommend it to others. Go to the Hilton instead if I were you!

Really good. My partner and I went for the couple package the Haman and massage. They said it was 90min treatment but was over 2 hours of bliss. Excellent massage. A lovely experience to do as a couple. Beautiful place generally and staff very helpful and friendly.

What a wonderful experience!. Having never been to a hammam before and being a lone traveller, I wasn't quite brave enough to try one of the public hammams, In addition, the hammam was a treat to myself for having completed my dissertation so I decided to splash out a bit. What a treat it was. Like nothing I have ever done ever before (not the most English of experiences!) but so relaxing. I had the Ceremony of the Rose, which started with the hammam and finished with a 50 minute massage. The whole process is advertised as 90 minutes, but actually takes 2 hours.The hammam itself is beautifully decorated and the staff are lovely and kind. It was wonderful and I can't recommend it more. I would imagine it would a be really cool thing for couples too.

Great traditional experience and relaxing escape from the crowds.. We found this place through Tripadvisor and what a find! Having turned up without booking we managed to arrange a time the following day for or party of 6. The spa provide dressing gowns and slippers and hair products so no need to take your own. We did however all turn up in bikinis thinking this was the norm but soon found out paper pants and a dressing gown was all we needed! We booked the Ceremony of the Rose which was 700 dirham (around £50) and being a group of 6 girls we had the Hammam to ourselves. If you went as a couple I'm not sure if they'd book time slots for you or not. The traditional Hammam experience was invigorating and this was followed by a massage upstairs. If you were in one of the inside rooms it was a great but one of our group was in a room on the roof and was quite cold. As a group this experience was great and a lovey escape from the madness of the souks and the market.

Great experience away from the madding crowds. We booked the 'Ceremony of the rose' package (Hammam and relaxing massage). The Hammam was great for the skin and was a perfect combination with the massage. We scored this as a 4 on a value for money basis and it wasn't the easiest to find, but we'd recommend it as something to try in a calm and professional environment.

Do not miss when in Marrakech!. We decided to go to hammam on a rainy day but it is now clear that no matter the weather, you need to visit a hammam when in Morocco. The location of this Hammam is great - not so noisy with lots of boutiques of art, handicraft and perfumerie.The service was great - some cookies and traditional tea is included. Great value for the price. We took the Rose treatment, which includes the steam room with scrub, eucalyptus lotion, hair wash with caramel shampoo and balsam and body wash with rose gel. Then some tea and 45 minutes of massage with Argan oil of your choice.If you are very conservative, hammam is not for you - you need to be basically naked (only wear undies) at all times and you will be thoroughly scrubbed, washed, creamed and massaged ALL over.
Good location and service. This is a very modern, claen and well managed hammam - something of a 'no-brainer' if you have not researched something else.
Lovely luxury hammam experience. Gorgeous hammam in nice part of the medina. Had a hammam and massage for couple. Was really expert and totally relaxing. Good value and highly recommend.

Jackanackanory!. What a SUPERB experience. We had a wonderful and frankly quite romantic couples scrub and massage (ceremony of the rose) which lasted around 2 hours all together. Very friendly and attentive staff, spotlessly clean, would give the swankiest spa's in the UK a run for their money. Conveniently located near the medina. Recommend

Incredible!. We have booked the "Ceremony of the Rose" Program at Hammam de la rose which is a 2,5 hours treatment together as a couple. As we have never done anything like this before, we were very excited as to what we should expect. Well...we din not expect THIS! It was the most incredible experience, spa-wise. Even my husband, who was sceptical at first, still talks about that day at that splendid, clean, professional spa. It was worth every dirham, and we will definetely be back!

Different experience in Marrakech! !. Lovely spa which we happened across while wandering. We opted for a couples experience which was grat fun. I've never done it before and it's a box ticked, but was ever so impressed with Fatima the owners communication and advice. A little oasis in what can be a noisy intense place. Leave the souk hassle noise and nonsense behind and take a break. Totally recommended

Fantastic place . We went as a group of 8 (men) as part of a weekend in Marrakech celebrating one of our group's 50th birthday. We all had the ceremony of the rose treatment and it was totally brilliant. The hammam is stylish and classy, the treatment was quite full on (hot, of course, lots of mud clay plastered all over us...while wearing comedy massage paper pants). The women working there were friendly and funny. The massage was one of the best I've ever had and several of our group said the same. Not for shy or bashful people maybe - but if you're looking for a tourist-focused but still partly authentic experience this is a great option.

A moment out of time. My wife and I had our first (and yet only) hammam experience at Hammam de la Rose and we were absolutely enchanted. The staff was very gentle and full of attention. They all speak french and english. We had booked a full hammam+massage (Ceremony of the Rose) and spent a very calm and relaxing moment there. Hygene was excellent and the atmosphere (dim lights, soft music...) was amazing. Definitely one of our best experiences - we're bound to get back there next time we are in Marrakech.

Brussels prices for unpleasant, low quality service. Just as for our Riad - way over generous marking for this hammam. ( wonder why that is). Even selected as Trip Advisor selection of the year !!!Anyway, I sent my daughter and wife to what was supposed to become a luxurious well-being "pampering" afternoon. They came back furious and sad after two hours.The place had no particular character or local colour, and moreover:- skillfully taken photos published on the web were hiding what was in fact a narrow, smallish space;- " packages" turned out to be straight-jackets from which you could not deviate;- as to the prices for services themselves, they exceeded those of equivalent establishments in Brussels, whithout providing the professionalism and attention to client needs you would take for granted there.My wife was particularly upset about an amateurishly done eyebrow epilation which she will carry as a memento for the next 7 weeks, each time she is looking into the mirror!Our advice - keep away from this place. There are more typical and cheaper establishments in Marrakech. Alternatively, with the same money you will be getting largely more satisfying services on your high street back home

birthday. we visited on the 2nd of november for my birthday and had a great time. The spa is clean and the staff are proffessional and friendly. I was also grateful for the ease of booking via email. thankyou for a lovely afternoon. best wishes sarah and ben

Amazing. We really loved this spa. We visited other exclusive spas as well but this was the best!!!! We made to facial- and they were so professional. The interior was amazing, so beautiful, service so excellent and personalised! Thank you!!!!!!

Wow. I have never visited a spa before so did not know what to expect. This was amazing. It worked out to be around £25 and it was the best £25 I have ever spent. I had the hammam which involved having warm water poured over me and to then sit a sauna like room while they cover you in black soap. After sweating it out in there for a while they wash off the soap and then the he exfoliating began. I was then massaged with various lotions and potions while I had an oil massaged into my hair and then that was shampooed and did conditioned. I felt completely relaxed and clean once it was finished. I was then taken to a nice quiet tranquil room and given water and mint tea which was delicious. I will definitely go again if I return to Morocco as this was amazing. Would definitely recommend.

Relaxing and calming. Ths was first experience of a hammam so hadn't been too sure what to expect. The staff were lovely and although the lady doing the hammam didn't speak English it was easy enough to understand what to do. If you are very shy then it is probably not an experience you would enjoy, as you are quite exposed in just knickers!! But the treatment rooms were private, clean and relaxing and obviously you have a robe to wear between treatments. The whole experience was very enjoyable after getting over my nerves!! I left feeling floaty and sqeaky clean from head to toe which after the heat and dust was great way to end the holiday! For the price compared to similar spa treatments here in UK it was very good value for money, just 700dhs for the 90 minute hammam and a massage

Disappointed. I'm afraid my review isn't going to be based on any treatments as I didn't get as far as having one as they could not accommodate me. I went in yesterday to book the ceremony of the rose treatment (the full package of hammam, scrub and massage) and based on previous reviews asked if I could have a private hammam or even women's only as didn't feel comfortable wearing skimpy net underwear with strange men in the hammam with me. The lady at the desk didn't even try to accommodate my request and stated if they had a male customer arrive whilst I was in the hammam they would let him in. Very disappointing as I'm from London and have always had my request accommodated back home yet in Morocco where I'd heard women only hammams were the norm I was turned down. Very poor customer service. I shall be having my hammam and massage at my riad today and am very much looking forward to it.

Amazing. What a luxurious start to our holiday! We went for the ceremony of the rose. From the hammam to the massage, everything was 5stars. Thank you hammam de la rose for giving us such a relaxing day in the middle of hectic Marrakech. Try to go at the start of your trip as exfoliation will remove any tan :)

Very Good! Come here instead of Les Bains!. Please ensure that you have your hammam and massage experience at Hammam de la Rose and NOT at Les Bains de Marrakech. Hammam de la Rose is excellent and will suit the luxe traveller that expects and demands a higher standard of massage and general customer experience. Les Bains is awful, and my wife and I had the worst massage we have ever had (and we regularly have massages in London and whenever we go abroad). Hammam de la Rose is the clear winner in all aspects and should be your first choice Hammam/Massage experience in Marrakech. It is very modern and chic, and the hammam experience and full body scrub is very good (although a lot of waiting time in my opinion). The massage was very firm and rejuvenating, unlike Les Bains which was more like a very gentle stroke with the occasional penetration of fingernails into the skin of my back! Very attentive, friendly and smiley staff. Highly recommend.

What a lovely way to end the day. We had a lovely hammam here tonight. We had promised ourselves something special and weren't dissapointed. The staff were kind and helpful and we started with a wash, exfoliate , moisturise in the lovely hammam. After being rubbed with argon oil we relaxed with mint tea until our full body massage. This was gentle but thorough and we left feeling like new women! A definite must for anybody wanting to end down on the traditional way.

A Spa Virgin!. Yes. I confess. I was a Spa Virgin. In my crowded (masculine) life I had never imagined me for one moment in a decadent spa experience. Boy! Have I missed out! My lovely Janice insisted that if we were going to be in Marrakech we had to 'do' a Hammam. The all-female staff at Hammam a la Rose guided me through to a changing room and a locker. We did not have to bring anything at all - so there I discovered my bath robe, slippers, and the world's smallest black net bikini. Led from there and un-robed I was attacked - splashed - soaked - in warm water, the first of ten steps to a most wonderful feeling of privileged pampering. Janice treated me to the 700dh program (the cheapest!) I don't think my Spa no-longer virgin body could take any more advanced pleasuring.

Great place to relax and be pampered. The Hammam de la Rose is a classy place among the many hammams in Marrakech. It offers high quality treatments in a beautifully decorated environment. The spa is classy, decorated in blues, greens with white touches. For me it was the second time round to this Hammam, for my sister the first time. As an avid spa goer, she could compare on the environment as well the quality of treatments and she was also impressed. We chose a hammam with hair treatment and a relaxing massage. Expert hands and friendly staff. We might have appreciated a slightly longer relaxation time between hammam and massage and maybe a couple of those lovely oriental sweets with the tea, but still it was close to perfection. Will return again, even though it is a bit a pricier hammam. To be recommended

No words for it! So relax 😊. Friendly staffs, super great bath & so relax! They will scrub you till your skin glow ;) my fav part would be the caramel shampoo. Yummy! Smell so good & can't resist, bought 2 bottle of the shampoo from this shop :) We took the 700 dirham package. It includes hammam bath & massage. Oh lala the massage was so relaxing! Until I fall asleep snoring lol. I would recommend this place. A must to try

Wow!. After a delayed flight this was the perfect treatment/spa to have a relaxing and authentic hamman and massage. The products were amazing, the staff friendly and of course the massage was a great start to our holiday! Lovely to have treatments just me and my husband. A great spa retreat in the centre of the busy hustle and bustle of Marrakech!

A must visit. One of the great delights about visiting marrakech has been taking a visit to Hammam de la rose. The moment you walk through the door you know that the next hour of your life will be one of the best. The surroundings are stunning and sumptuous. The staff are wonderful and the treatments fabulous.If you visit as a couple you will be treated in the same treatment rooms. The briefs that are handed out leave very little for the imagination so be warned if you have a shy disposition. If you are on a first date then you might get to know each other a little faster than you had anticipated.

Amazing experience. What a way to end a holiday... A truly amazing experience... All the staff were really lovely, welcoming and genuine. Had an amazing treatment and if I ever went back to Marrakech then I would definately go back there. It's hard to believe when you're inside that you've just stepped off out of the souk, it is so tranquil and quiet. Would recommend this to anyone wanting a bit of pampering at the end of a stay in Marrakech, especially after finding your way through the souks!

Best experiences in Marrakech. This place is amazing and so relaxing. Me and my girlfriend went here on the 25th which was out last full day in Marrakech and what a way to go. They treat you so well and the experience as a couple is lovely. The quality of the service is out of this world which suits alongside the quality of this spa. You are transported away from all the hussle and bussle of Marrakech. Left felling a million bucks. Will be going back to this place when I am in Marrakech again. 5* rating all the way. We had the Imperial Moroccan Hammam. All I can say that's left to do is go!!!! You will not regret it.

What a relaxing day, we left floating!. Me and my girlfriend just recently visited Marrakech, and we had a fantastic holiday! Partly due to Hammam De La Rose. We went towards the end of the holiday as the heat is quite intense and we were feeling the need for an exfoliating scrub and massage so we went for the, 'Ceremonie De La Rose' to get the full experience. Initially we were taken to seperate changing rooms where a robe, paper undies, and slippers were provided. After a brief waiting period we were taken into a sauna where we were bathed in water and left to relax. We were then covered in black soap from the Atlas mountains and scrubbed from head to toe using exfoliating gloves, they applied a different soap and we went back to the sauna for more relaxation. After this we showered and were taken to another waiting room where we had tea and petit fours.We were then taken into another room where we had a massage from head to toe, it was the most relaxing experience I had ever had! We left absolutely floating and completely de-stressed, only wishing we could stay for longer and kicking ourselves that we didn't get more of these done! This hammam gets mine and my girlfriends 100% approval and when we go back to Marrakech we will be visiting again!

Hammom and massage . Amazing experience, all the staff had smiles on their faces and really gave the best customer service. The Hammom was incredibly clean and fantastic. The minute you walk in you immediately feel relaxed and at ease, they pamper you almost to the point you just don't want to leave. If your in marakech this experience is a must and the team at hammom de la rose really give a first class experience.. Thank you

Oasis Hamman de la Rose.. Ah total relaxation, in the midst of chaos, dust, stiffling heat my wife, sister and mother decided to relax in Hammam de la Rose. What a great decision, I went for walkabout and we all met up about two hours later. The girls looked so relaxed and talked of nothing except the beautiful surroundings, the polite, quiet professional service. The treatments were out of this world, the prices were exceptional good for what was on offer. Recommend without reserve,

don't bother going here for a pedicure or manicure. The surroundings are plush and the place smells great but, we were thoroughly disappointed with the quality of pedicure or manicured we received a few days ago. At 250dh for each (about £20, normally £20 at home for a pedi, £12 for a mani in London), our expectations were for a similar standard or more than what we would get in London.I had the pedicure - quick file of nails, no trimming, feet soaked, quick rub of hard skin (nowhere near as thorough as at home) and then some uncomfortable stabbing of a cuticle cutter around my toes and a paint.The mani - similar experience, no buffing of nails, but poor quality painting, rough round the edges, honestly could have done better ourselves.The painting of nails - undercoat, two coats of maybelline nail paint, no top coat.For this money, in Morocco, where everything is cheaper than London, we expected more for this price, we paid, but left no tip.shame, I hope the Hammam is better, as the pirces were far above what we paid for ours in Essaouira and that was a great experience.

Great hammam and massage. This is a tourist hammam rather than a local hammam - but it was a lovely calm place. Staff were female but hammam is open to both men/women/couples. Hammam and massage done in private if requested. A little pricey but well worth it!

Great first experience. My wife and I tried this Hammam with no idea what to expect, it was essentially a steam room, with a exfoliating rub. My wife didn't fully enjoy as she had a touch of sunburn, but overall the experience was good, the staff friendly. Few things though, a clear explanation for first timer would have been good, fortunately my wife and I were in there alone, which was good as my wife was topless!All in - good experience and we may go back for a massage!

Heaven on Earth . Me and my friend found the Hammam de la Rose through tripadvisor. We went the day before to make our reservation. There is not much for me to write that has not already been written. We were just very pleased with our visit; - we were well taken care of all the time during both our Hammam and massage. The service is just fantastic as is the atmosphere. Go spoil yourself to this far from over-priced experience.

TERRIBLE. This is a terrible place, my experience was awful. The robes they give you are so short when you sit down you have to try to hide your modesty. They are also dirty. Never been to a spa where they didn't give you big fluffy ones.We booked massages and hammams and normally the hammam comes first, not in this place. Such a stupid idea, all relaxed and then your scrubbed to death.Finally they thought it was acceptable to bring my DAD in for a hammam where you are hardly wearing with a group of 5 women. When i explained the situation, they looked at me like i was making a fuss.horrible people, tacky horrible place.

nice experience. I walked in and scheduled a same-day hammam and massage for the afternoon. This is a good place for a first-timer. The hammam was delightful. Very relaxing. I prefer a deeper-tissue massage than I got. This was more of a rubdown with good-smelling oils. I would go back for the hammam only.

The best hamman experience we had in morrocco !. My husband and I shared a hamman/ massage experience and we found it to be very prioffessioal with the aim of relaxation and therapy rolled into one. The staff were gentle respectful and pleasant. The environment was lovely. They did not scrub too hard or make you feel embarrassed . They supplied small disposable briefs. We also tried a hamman in fez and this was the superior. I also sent an email enquiry to les bains which they didn't even reply to. As a westerner I would recommend this hamman.

Relaxing Experience. This was my first Hammam visit, and I must confess to slight trepidation. However all the things I thought I might worry about just did not apply. At no point did I feel at all uncomfortable, in fact the exact opposite. All of the staff (front of house, hammam, masseuse) were superbly professional, calming, and spoke lovely English or were patient to my language deficiencies. I did the Ceremony of the Rose and this was a great combination. The facilities inside were great. Had it not been my last day, I might have gone back.

Great first time hammam experience. My boyfriend and I had never tried a hammam and were a bit afraid to go first time to a public one.We happened to be staying near this one and thought the prices were reasonable enough, knowing it was a bit of a fancy one. It was about 350 drihams each for a hammam experience. The place was really nice and the staff were friendly and guided us through all the steps without any issues. The sauna and scrub were very westerner friendly and the girls kept checking we were ok with the products, water temperature and the level of scrubbing.We did the hammam as a couple, which was probably a bit nicer than doing it alone because there were less awkward moments. Make sure you don't do this with work colleagues or immediate family because it involves essentially complete nudity. We were escorted to a chill-out room after and served mint tea and water, which was lovely. Overall a very nice experience, and you get to take your scrubbing glove home as a nice gesture.
Spa Day. Fantastic experience, enjoyed the Hammam and Massage. True value for money. Staff very friendly as I had booked this via email before departing UK.

A wonderful relaxing experience. My wife and I booked to go with another couple, we had a wonderful 3 hours relaxing and being totally spoilt.Next time we are in Marrakesh we will most certainly book to go again.

Excellent hammam and facilities but staff could have been friendlier. The facilities here are lovely and well kept, we particularly loved the sauna area where we had our private hammam. The massage was also very good and the place is well worth the visit, just for the hammam experience if nothing else! We found the staff who did our hammam to not be very friendly however, I felt they were laughing at me at one point and often muttered amongst themselves. The girl on reception also couldn't find our booking at first and was a bit sharp. The manager however was lovely and kept track of everything so it all ran on time. All in all I would go again.

Perfect!. It's a bit more expensive than others, but this hammam worth it! Beautiful design, friendly and well-qualified stuff, only natural cosmetics. Several hammams don't let men and women inside together, but my husband and i, we were both in the beautiful private area and we both had all the procedures.

Beautiful Hammam experience. Warm welcome, good advice from the ladies that work there, and beautiful place. We all went in as a family, had lovely private hammam followed by wonderful massage. More pricey than some, but with a definite exclusive feel - well worth it.

Fabulous tranquil pampering right in the Medina. I took my wife here on her 40th birthday and we both enjoyed the Ceremony of the Rose. From the moment we walked in we were treated to a wonderful experience. Most Hammams in Marrakech won't even let men and women into the same areas, but we were able to share the whole experience together, from the full Hammam through to the lengthy deep massage to finish.Highly recommended, though don't try to book online - they don't seem to receive the bookings. Not a problem though as they fitted us in when we walked in off the street.

maybe my expectations were high after reading all the great reviews??. i have to stay to start off with i have quite abit of experience with hammams so maybe my expectations are a littele high, but after reading all the great reviews i was expecting to be blown away however left very underwhelmed.the receptionist was friendly but found jamila the hammam therapist to be very rude cosidering i knew she could communicate with me from reading the review but decided to just drag my round by the arm or just leave me and not tell me she was going anywhere. she then decided to tell me her name at the end and was a little shocked when she realised i could speak arabic.after that i had a massage and booked in for a balinese however i recieved a very basic moroccan massage, to then realise my 60min massage only took 45mins was not the best.it is a beautiful spa quite difficult to get to if driving as parking is a no go round there, so it is quite a shame. unfortunatly i won't be returning.

Wonderful!. Did the ceremony of the rose and loved it! Don't be turned away by the basic locker rooms when you get started, the rest of the facilities including hammam rooms are really nice. Jamila did my hammam, which was lovely. She does not speak much english but did a good job of communicating anyway. Khadija was an amazing masseuse. Only thing I would change is if the front door staff were more warm, and explained ahead of time what to expect for a newcomer - for example I was washed but then told that staff would be back. About 20 minutes later I was still sitting in the hot room wondering what was next. Had I known it would be such a long wait I could have relaxed into it more.Also they say it is 90 minutes but we were there for 2.5. Not that I am complaining - I loved the extra time!

Anxiety washed away for first timer!. 'You must do a Hammam and I know just the place' was the simple instruction given to my wife and I when we borrowed a friends apartment in Marrakech.The location took a bit of finding, but once inside we were welcomed and invited to the changing rooms. As a very large gentleman, I had never tried such an experience and was apprehensive to say the least. My anxieties were not assisted when asked to change and provided with a paper thong and a bath robe that I would have struggled to get on one arm. A larger one was found and a towel to cover the gaping robe. I decided that keeping my boxer shorts on was the best option! We were then invited upstairs to the treatment room where we were greeted by our host. Robes removed and my wife and I were invited to sit in the steam room. After a short while, anxiety rising, the female host entered and instructed me to stand, where she then poured water from a central basin all over me. I was then asked to sit where she started to lather the black soap all over my body - anxiety overload! I then watched as the same was done to my wife, who also was out of her comfort zone.In for a penny; in for the pound! I'm here now and took the view that I might as well enjoy it and found as the next treatment started I relaxed. My body was scrubbed (exfoliated) washed and oiled so many times I could not now remember the exact sequence of events. I was so relaxed that at one point I almost fell asleep! Treatment complete and I was escorted upstairs in my robe to a calming waiting room with big sofas where mint tea and water was served whilst I relaxed and waited for my wife to join. I felt amazing! Relaxed, de-stressed and carefree! All anxiety washed away!!For those who have never done this before, take a spare pair of underwear if you don't want to wear the paper alternative, or go commando on the way home! This is a must do experience in a beautiful location with respectful staff. I will return on my next visit to the town. I would have given it full marks if they had the oversized robe for us big chaps!
Lovely sanctuary. Husband and I went in for a couples relaxing massage, was delightful and would love to go back one day!

Perfunctory. There are so many good options why go for this one which is over-priced, and treats its customers with mild disinterest. The staff are sullen, disorganised and treat the customers like a tiresome production line. A great shame because the building is lovely and in a good location

Great experience and one of the best in the world. My wife and I visited the Hammam looking for an authentic and relaxing experience. Marrakech is a hot and demanding place and to be immersed in the relaxing atmosphere was bliss. I would highly recommend this place and the staff and welcome gets five stars. My only reservation is the pan pipe music which is off putting. I was just about to get a massage when Hotel California came on which wasn't very relaxing. Otherwise worth every penny and I would return.

Hammam experience. The wonderful Hammam de la Rose in the medina of Marrakech is the first place I go every time after arriving in this enchanted city. At the reception, Bouchra gives a warm welcome back. Starting with a very relaxing steam bath, followed by an efficient scrub and a whole body mask ( rhassoul), you find yourself immersed in a blue lounge, wrapped in a thick and cosy bathrobe, sipping a nice herbal tea. The massage is divine and all the ladies are experts following a perfect protocoll. The perfumed oils used are of high quality, everything is perfectly clean . A wonderful way to enjoy the moroccan tradition of hammam! Claudine, Switzerland

Relaxation & the Rose. The Hammam de la Rose is pure bliss. I had the ceremony of the rose, ninety minutes of relaxation in a Hammam followed by a massage. The ladies in the Hammam are lovely and guide you gently through all the rituals explaining as they go along. The building itself is modern and spotlessly clean. I really loved the art work in the changing area, the mint tea and water served after the Hammam and before the massage. For 700 DH (approximately £50) I thought it was good value and would recommend the experience.

Very relaxing and enjoyable experience. After arriving in Marrakech we booked a Hammam ritual "Ceremony of the Rose" to get over a tiring day flying. It was a beautiful and very relaxing experience and we emerged like newborn. Now three days later we went back again to repeat the experience. The people in Hammam de la Rose are very friendly, the atmosphere is very relaxed and the premises are clean and beautifully appointed. I can thoroughly recommend this place for a Hammam experience, a must do in Marrakech!

An amazing experience!. We had the "Ceremony of the Rose" - a complete Hammam Ritual - and it was fabulous. I thoroughly recommend it!Hammam Spas / massages is something that is recommended when you visit Marrakech, and I truly think we found the best place for it here.An hour and a half of being washed, scrubbed and massaged, and you end up feeling thoroughly relaxed with the smoothest skin ever!I also had a pedicure, which was mediocre at best I'm afraid to say.For the Hammam Ritual there is no where else to beat it though :)
Cleansing and Lovely relaxing experience. Found this on a wander around the Medina. We booked for the following day and had a wonderful relaxing afternoon

Nice find. Just walked by this spa and popped in for a pedicure. No issue with availability and great service. Clean, well decorated, relaxing experience. Reasonably priced and very friendly staff. I would stop in again and I highly recommend!

Sublimely sensual. A beautiful spa with excellent staff. We had the couples package so were not surprised to be almost naked and treated together. Worth every dirham. This was an erotic and exotic experience I would recommend to any couple. I was in Marrakesh as a Valentines gift and this was one of our stand out events. We left feeling totally cleansed,silky skinned and relaxed. The building and atmosphere is calm and perfumed and so is a relief from the hustle of Marrakesh. I have been to several spas. Nothing beats this. Anna and Denis from Wales

Perfect end to a busy five day stay. After a busy five days site seeing break and with very achey limbs, this was the perfect way to end a wonderful time in Marrakech. The staff made me and my husband feel so relaxed with the most wonderful morrocan oil massage. Definately a must do after walking around the souks and seeing the wonderful sites. Only been home a couple of hours and could already do with another massage!

Gorgeous Place. I would thoroughly recommend visiting this Hammam. I had never had a spa experience before so I didn't really know what to expect. I chose the 'ceremonie de la rose' treatment which involved a traditional Hammam bath/scrub followed by a full body massage. The staff were lovely and even though there was limited talking (language barriers) I was made to feel welcome and comfortable. Ladies - don't be shy; you will be expected to undress and they provide you with a robe, slippers and paper knickers but I wore my bikini bottoms and that was fine - but really do not worry it does not feel awkward at all and the staff are very respectful and considerate. It definitely is a lovely and reasonably priced experience that is a relaxing break from the madness of Marrakech! I did not book, I just walked in and they were able to accommodate me straight away - and you even get a complementary glass of the a la menthe!

Fit for royalty. This must be experienced. If you want to sit in the lap of luxury and be pampered by the best, then look no further. I had the privilege to unwind today at this special place with my girlfriend. We are in town from Miami. I am a doctor and she is a Thai massage and private yoga instructor. Not only were the facilities polished, clean and incredibly decorated, but the staff of beautiful women are well learned in the art of customer service. Five big stars to this perfect establishment.

WOW! DO IT! Best thing I did in Marrakech :). I booked online before my holiday and had some email contact (in poor french) before I arrived, but I popped in on the day to check if I needed a swim suit (You don't. Paper thong provided). The lady on the desk seemed to have no idea about my booking until I showed her my phone. But to her credit she obviously moved a couple of bits around and booked me in again straight away. I think I was lucky it was low season. Don't rely on this. I would imagine this place is VERY popular at peak times.The spa is every bit what you would expect by English standards and has a very lovely feel to it. Although I made a botch job of trying to communicate in basic French, the ladies spoke more English than I was expecting from past reviews but I could tell they appreciated me trying! Despite what I had read, they WILL look after you at each stage and you won't be left wondering what is going on.I went for the Hammam de la Rose treatment which is 90 mins and includes hammam then massage (you will select which scented oil you'd like). A lady will take you to change and give you a locker key and robe, slippers, and thong. Once you're ready she will collect you and take you up to the hammam area (dimly lit which is nice, although I was the only one there), swap your slippers for plastic sandals and you will be washed and left to steam for probably 10 minutes. You'll then be washed again and taken to the adjoining room where you have your scrub down on the concrete bench. Even if you have no French they'll lead/turn you around etc in a kind and gentle way, so you feel looked after and know what is going on. You steam again I think and have various washes (hair) and are moisturised etc before eventually being taken in your robe to an area where they'll bring you tea and water. At this point you really will never have felt as clean or soft in your life. As a nice touch you are given the exfoliating mitten to keep. Also, the lady did check that the pressure was OK with me. Then you are collected for your massage (including the most amazing scalp massage) and oh my goodness I came away from that place floating on a wafty cloud of heavenliness that I can't imagine could ever be replicated. I was glad my riad was close by, so I could flop (and then have a thorough wash off of all the oils in my hair before bed. You will def want to do this). My boyfriend laughed when I sent home a selfie of my woozy self as he said I looked "stoned". I almost wish I had gone for a 4 handed massage as Marrakech is so cheap I probably could have afforded to do that, but honestly, I have had a number of spa treatments over the years and for me, this stands out as the most heavenly. Most needed after foot-pounding and sightseeing for a couple of days. The hammam is easy to spot in Rue Dar el Bacha so no worries there.Now I just wish someone would set up the real hammam experience here in England. I'd pay good money for that over and over and over again...mmmmm :)

A virgin Moroccan spa experience.. A bit of an unknown but we went on a recommendation. Very good service and an excellent price. Very relaxing experience but the massage could have been more thorough. Would have no problem recommending.

First time at a Hammam. This is my only experience of visiting a traditional Moroccan Hammam. I have been to Turkish Baths in Istanbul, but I must say that I enjoyed the experience of the Hammam better. The greeting at reception could have been friendlier, as could the girls who bathed us. I think the language barrier doesn't help as I speak limited French. The overall experience was good, and the interior of the Hammam itself is very relaxing. It was nice to be left for half an hour or so in between the bathing and massage on a huge comfy sofa drinking tea and water. The full body massage was certainly relaxing and unhurried. The girls that did the massage seemed friendlier than the ones that did the bathing. I'm not sure I'd necessarily return to this one as there are so many other Hammams in Marrakech to experience.

Perfect. So good, we went twice. My partner and I stumbled across this hammam whilst looking for a riad to eat lunch. Feeling in need of a good pamper, we ventured in to find a very western and luxurious interior. Helpful, friendly and genuine staff were bettered only by a wonderful treatment for us both. Treated privately, as a pair, we had a good hour in the hammam being scrubbed and cleansed by lovely staff and an authentic beautiful building. If you planning a trip to Marrakech, this needs to be in your list. Fact. We will return!

Mmmmm. Have to say I was a little disappointed, from the greeting to paying up. Not what I was expecting for a apa so highly rated. Shown to a room to change no smiles at reception, no confirmation of what i had booked and paid for. Summond to Hammam area not by name but beckoned. Cant fault the Hammam itself but after i was left in a room, having to findmy own way downstairs and looking for the changing room, i wandered to reception and found the girls downstairs chatting, perhaps I expected too much? But for similar prices to the uk i expect the same service.

A Bit Disappointing. I'd read all the great reviews, so decided to book a treatment. I was looking forward to it.I got there and was welcomed, by the manager. Everything went according to everyone else's description, I got changed, robe and slippers, and got into the first treatment. The lady was, not rude exactly, but not welcoming either. For the first treatment she took the cactus salve and shoved it under my nose for a nano second, then proceeded to apply it quickly, pushing me to turn me around. Each of the treatments was similar, sit, lie front, turn, followed by a shove. The scrub was rough and too hard, despite me saying "doucement'. Each of the treatments was done with the same amount of care, or lack thereof...Then after my treatment, they sit you in a room full of pillows with tea and water to relax, they forgot about me here and I had to get myself back to the change room...I realize there are cultural differences, these are to be expected, but when I am paying european prices for a spa session, it is not really acceptable to be made to feel like I am not welcome there. Maybe it depends on the person giving the treatment?Would think twice about booking again...

Absolutely fantastic massage experience. We visited here for a couples massage and we both agreed it was the best massage we had ever had. Fantastic experience, from walking in to walking out, everything is considered, it's a beautiful, relaxing environment inside; such a calm oasis just metres away from the busy souqs. Well priced and much better inside than the facility at our 5* hotel.Make sure you book; it's quite close to the centre of town so you could easily walk past when visiting the souqs.

Depends on what you want !. I am a fan of Moroccan and Turkish Hammam and I think that their hammam was good but not good enough comparing to the ones I tried before Hammam ⭐️⭐️⭐️: To be fair, their atmosphere and the decorations were BEAUTIFUL but scrubbing wasn't done properly, shampooing was very random and my hair didn't feel fresh and clean after (ask her to massage the roots). You can choose the package you like but make sure you get scrubbed and shampooed really well cause after a hammam you are supposed to feel extra extra extra clean and your skin should be blinging !Nails ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ : worth it ! I was 100% satisfied with their manicure and pedicure .. 500 DHS and a perfect job done by Khadeeja ❤️Hair ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ : Excellent blow-drying by Sana ! My hair had volume and shine

The bees knees. This is my first review on trip advisor. I went there to book a joint hammam for my girlfriend and I. On my way i received some unwanted attention from a not so nice guy in the souk outside, the lady working reception that day and the other time I visited was splendid and very helpful an friendly.
