Each phase was conducted quietly and efficiently, the atmosphere pleasant and soothing. I know that when I come back to Marrakech I will be beating a path to their door!

"Terrific moments in the spa". I had visited this lovely spa with my wife and my little sheldren. First they picked us up near cafe france at the big square and there a nice lady was waiting for us and she walked us to the spa we walked between the narrow streets of the medina and we were like searching for a lost jewl just the door was opened we were amazed by the stunning decoration which was like a meeting for arts later on jawad the manager received us and explained everything about the cares in the menu and gave us ment tea with moroccan cookies which was in a family atmosphere also just before we started they took an emense care for our child and treat it like if we were in our home.Then we started with the hammam which was our first hammam the girls in the hammam was friendly and they showed a lot of care for us after we finished the scrub down and the mask we felt very clean like never before.Later we moved to the massage which was done by professional masseuses which took part in every part of our bodies after that we felt totally relaxed and cleared our mind on the top terrace which is overlooking to the big square. Thanks for this experience I recommend.

"VIP Experience". all in all was good. this lovely place that gives so many care to its clients i came by my self to the spa without any reservation and i was extreemly amazed by the kindness of the staff they explained to me the menu in a family atmoshere while we had tea an moroccan cookies then i choosed a 4 hands massage which was done by khadija and nezha who were highly professional and balanced in the movements while the massage.after that i felt totally relaxed and they gave me also some lovely gifts at the end which was unexpected. i recommend

Great service. Very professional and excellent service, beautiful spa location, the staff is incredibly helpful. The massage was unbelievably good. Men: bring two extra underwear.Women: you might feel more comfortable with your own bikini bottoms. Bring two extra as well.

Great service and great price . My friend and I did the package with 45 min hammam, 1 hr massage, facial and 3 course traditional lunch. The price was less than 1100dh and great value. Everyone was friendly and professional. They met us in the square to show us to the spa as it's tricky to find. We even got a little bottle of argan oil to take home. We did a lot of research and stopped in several other hammans before choosing this one - very happy with our choice!

Very nice . We were met by Fatima in the square and walked a little way to the spa otherwise we would never have found it ! A little gem tucked away. We started with being greeted with mint tea and cookies,then off to the haman which maybe a little small as my partner is tall but he managed . Where we were scrub and left to soak up all the goodies in our skin which last for around 45 mins after it was up stairs for a massage , we both opted for strong which I normally have but soon had to take it down to medium on my legs she was strong. !! Finished with foot massage and then offered a shower which was good to take off some of the lovely oil. Over all good experience at a fair price. ;)

Very relaxing afternoon. Went for the hammam + 1 hour massage combo, it was great and very relaxing.Staff was kind and attentionate, massage was top notch.As usual with places in the medina it's not the easiest to find, so get them to pick you up at cafe de France when you book (or ask one of the kids around).

5 Star Experience, A Must do. We went for the 95 euro full package, and went in with no expectations. From start to finish the level of service was incredible, with mint tea and snacks, waters etc. The Hammam was the strangest part which was the first on the list. Its purpose fitted perfectly before the massage which was to clean us, scrub the skin and then sweat out all the bad stuff. It was very professionally done and started off the relaxation process.After we had the massage which was incredible. They do it however you want and you can change mid session. My Wife had medium and changed to hard during the session. Out of the corner of my eye I saw the women mount her putting all her energy into what my wife describes as 'the best massage she has ever had'. Mine was perfect, I opted for Medium and it was the most relaxed I have been for a long time.They gave us a free foot massage in addition to the facial, and after the process we had a meal on the roof which was the best Tagine we tasted since arriving a week ago.After the whole thing, they gave us two bottles of complimentary Argon oil which we had previously bought from a Argan Plantation place for 30 euros a bottle, so incredibly generous. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting an unforgettable evening and a true taste of Marrakech.

Amazing experience. I have been in this amazing place last week with a friend and we tried for the first time the hammam and it has been such an amazing experience that we had to come back the next day for a massage because we could not feel more cuddled than we had been there! Recommended :)

I've had better. We booked the ~60 euro couples massage, incl. dinner. The massage was very rough (though we asked for medium), and not relaxing. It did not help that the ladies did not speak any English. The dinner afterwards was served on the roof top terrace (which was a bit chilly) and was very simple. Overall both of us never felt very comfortable, hence based on our experience I would not advice this hamman for couples.

Absolutely fabulous!. I booked this hammam seeing the recommendations on TA. I wanted this to be a gift for my wife at the tale end of our stay in Marrakech, so I arranged a hammam for myself and a massage treatment for my wife.The experience started with the e-mail exchange between myself and the spa with the discussion of various treatment options. The response was detailed and courteous. The day of our appointment, the manager, Jawad, met us at our riad and walked to the hammam. He then sat with us, treated us some tea, and made sure that we understood what hammam entailed and the price that we would have to pay for the treatment.The hammam sauna was wonderful, and my wife really enjoyed her massage, which went above and beyond what was expected, both in time and in quality. I ordered a traditional Moroccan meal and ate on the terrace waiting for my wife to finish her treatment.At the end of our session we sat together again, had some more tea and chatted about our experience. I have to say that I was really impressed by the level of customer service of the entire staff and by Jawad.

4 of us enjoyed it to the max. We booked the Ritual Royal Samira Riads package for the four of us and it was fantastic. The Hammam scrub, an amazing never ending massage followed by a great dinner on the rooftop. You will get picked up at a central meeting place (very convenient) and at the Hammam all questions are answered in perfect English. Go there and indulge!

Hammam plus 90 mm massage. The best massage experience ever. Very difficult to find with Google maps. Ask to be guided from the main square ( Jemma Elfna) at Cafe Frances Ask for Xhuxa - most experienced masseuse there. Confirm they can accept credit card that day before you go there. !!!

Our favourite part of marrakech. This was our favourite bit if marrakech. I seen it on tripadvisir so after a lovely meal in a 17th century palace we set off to find it. We were constantly lost in the medina so after alot of circling finally one kind soul showed us the way! They almost couldnt fit us in but luckily as we were walking out they had a cancellation! Phew! We thoroughlu enjoyed the whole thing. The friendliness the feeling of being looked after and the laugh.Being our first hammam we didnt know what to expect so after changing into our lil disposable gstrings they gave us (my partner and i had great giggles at this) the sauna scrubs and rinses were soooo relaxing and the massages to die for. We were like pure jelly leaving and id give anything yo be back in morocco to get it done again. The staff are soo incredibly nice and we were welcomed back yo just come in and sit to drink tea any other time we felt like having a break from the medina being told this is our other home. It really felt that way ☺ the only bad thing was not having card facilities. I personally dont like using atm machines in busy touristy areas so widh i had of had enough cash on me or that they had card facilities. This place id great tho. Well worth walking in circles trying to find it! P.s it really is down these quiet lil laneways that can feel a little intimidating but its worth it for this lil gem ☺

Value for money!. This isn't your fancy 5* spa (for those you are best staying in your hotel) however it was very good! Few things to know:1) It is in a very remote place so a bit difficult to find, we had to ask a few locals for directions2) Don't be put off by the outside of the building, its much much nicer inside!3) If you are in a large group call and book the treatments in advance. I spoke to a guy called Joel at the spa and as we were a group of 12 he gave us a good discount4) If opting for the argan oil massage, they will get this all over you including your face and hair so tell them in advance if you don't want that or if you do then be prepared5) they have showers on site which are cleanWe had a large group so some people got individual rooms and others were sharing. I shared with a friend and the two masseuses were great however from time to time they would speak to each other in French which was quite unprofessional. All in all I would definitely go back as its great value for money and the staff are friendly. There are no extras or hidden fees. You pay downstairs for your treatment after its over and we also got a free gift (Argan oil for each person). You can also tip the person who did your treatment if you feel you want to.

Amazing Hammam!. I visited Hammam Rosa with my boyfriend for my birthday and it's was an amazing experience!We went for the €95 package which included dinner and I would recommend that to everyone! Wow what a birthday treat! The staff and service were excellent. Watch out for the 'gift' of Argan oil (which is not free)

Great hammam experience!. We had a traditional hammam and massage with argan oil and we loved it! For marroccan standards a bit expensive I think, but totally worth it. We had a massage from Samira and Gosha and we can recommend both. We would love to come back here in the future!

Awesome, professional and 5 star pampering royal arab style. My advice dont think about it, just book it, its worth every penny. I recommend a hammam and a massage total of approx £45 for 2hrs treatment is a bargainHost javad is very friendly and informative no pushy sales people and no trying to rob you like alot of places in marrakech. The host javad speaks english very well so communication is no issue2 hrs off blissful pampering with regular arab mint tea to refresh u I have tried many spa places in marrakech and this is a gem, one of the few establishments which is professional and has proper masseuse

Blissful!. My friend and I went here after extensive communication with Samira via email & I was satisfied that my service would be valued. We were told that we would be met in the square by members of staff who would guide us to the Hammam. I was pleasantly pleased with this, however we were running late and it so happens the owner of the Riad I was staying at knew Samira and Abdul and called for them to arrange a pickup from the Riad for me. They kindly sent Rachid to pick us up and he was extremely friendly and great. We were then taken to the hammam and greeted by a beautiful lady (I forgot her name :-( ) who was great in explaining the services and gave us mint tea and biscuits on arrival. I got the Oriental Ritual package which included the hammam which was done by Leilo who was great. The hammam consisted of me going into a steam room type set up and received a full body treatment which included a black soap scrub , ghassoul and henna. The scrub down of my skin was shocking, as I saw the amount of dead skin being removed(considering I had a body scrub done 2 days before!). It was all in all a great treat!The highlight HAD to be my massage however! I have had massages done in many major cities and this one was TOP NOTCH! I cannot recommend Noima enough! I wanted to take her in my suitcase back home! She was EXCELLENT in her technique and believe me when I tell you I felt so refreshed it was unbelievable. I also had my facial done by her which was simple yet effective and had my skin glowing for days. We also had the meal which was ok, something we could have lived without. We had the lemon chicken meal, which was served with soup, olives,bread and steamed vegetables as a starter. The dessert was then pieces of orange with flaked almonds.We had henna designs done seperately by a lady which they call in-which cost 10euros each (which was NOT the price quoted by Jomod[the manager]) but nonethless we had the henna done. It was burning throughout and we were told this was normal. The henna did not last even a day before it started fading and it was when I got back to London I was told it was loaded with chemicals which is why it was burning and did not last. My friend had a pedicure done by Loufna and she said it was great-didn't get too much details there.All in all a great experience and definetely get the hammam and massage by Noima! The meal and henna designs can be skipped.

Spa day in Marrakech. Amazing spa. This Hammam experience including a three part scrub, massage, and sand foot massage. All for 80dh! The facility was clean, well maintained, and amazing. Additionally, a young man from the Spa picked me up from my Riad and walked me to the spa so I would not get lost. The sisters who own the spa are amazing and gave me a bottle of argan oil upon my departure. Also, I had Moroccan tea and cookies while I was there.

"a world of utopia". we came to this spa with some friends and we were surprised with the interior decoration of the spa it is like a jewl it has a great combination of many cultures in it. Also the stuff of the spa are so kind since we enter the spa until we left they made our experience of hammam and so great it was my first time to have moroccan traditional hammam and it as great i felt and my friends like newly born.
Great experience and service!. We booked a relaxing massage and dinner. The massage was great and the dinner fantastic. The service was excellent. We very much recommend this spa!

Amazing Moroccan Hammam & Spa. During my stay in Marrakesh, I visited Hammam Rosa Bonheur many times. The staff is super friendly and welcoming, but also very professional. The services are well structured and the location is very convenient. I had amazing moments at Hammam Rosa Bonheur and I highly recommend it. Thank you Samira and Team for everything!!

Lovely Hammam experience. This is my first hammam experience. I visited the Hammam with my sister in March 2016. We didnt have any booking done, we just turned up and ask whether there are any availabilities and luckily they can accommodate both of us later on the same day. The location is a bit hidden, its a bit tricky to find it first time to the point we have to ask a local man to guide us there but when you know the location is easy to get back to. The service is amazing. Very polite, very helpful. We are served mint tea and cookies when we arrive. The hammam is very clean and smells amazing. There is a locker to store your clothes and valuables when you are in the Hammam.The ladies that do the hammam are excellent especially one lady called Nesreen. She scrubbed and scrubbed you until you can feel there is not a single dirt / dry skin left in your body and it does not hurt at all. Unfortunately they didn't speak much english and we did not speak French or arabic so most conversation is sign language and a smile. Chilled water is provided plenty during the hammam which is important for hydration. The message is lovely. Good pressure. Again the rooms are very clean, tidy and smells nice and relaxing. When we are about to leave they send us off with a bottle of argan oil each which is gratefully accepted. Not the cheapest hammam but for me is one of the most worthwhile spa / treatment ever. Definitely worth a visit.

Relaxing!. My partner and I had the Argan oil massage which lasts for 1 hour. As soon as we arrived, we were given tea and guided to our room to change. The staff were really friendly and made us feel comfortable. The massage itself was wonderful. The ladies were great and we felt incredibly relaxed afterwards. We were given a drink and some oil to take away. All in all, a great experience and well worth the money!

Thought it would be better and THEY DONT ACCEPT CREDIT CARDS!. I went to this place because of the great reviews but it was kind of dissapointing. They miss a lot of the pampering details that make you feel special at any spa. I had the four hand massage and it was not the best just ok. The two ladies were very smiling and nice however they whispered and giggled softly during my service! I thought it was un professional. There was also a lot of outside noise in the massage cabin. AND NO CREDIT CARDS ACCEPTED! I do have to say the staff was friendly all the time.

Great introduction to the Moroocan Hammam experience. My wife, daughter and I visited the Hammam in March 2016 and I signed up for the 2h15min Hammam and massage package.The hammam was not quite what I was expecting as I was anticipating that the 'argile' (clay) that they put on you was almost layerered on with a thick coat but in fact it is much more of an exfoliating type of soap that is rather briskly applied all over the body and then left on for a few minutes. In any event the very loud / raucous shouts, laughter and babble from a group of 4/5 young frenchman in the next door hammam ensured this was anything but a peaceful experience!Having been scrubbed and washed down by a friendly lady who spoke neither french or english I was then led to my massage room and given a full body massage by a super friendly lady.Whilst the whole experience was not as peaceful as it should have been; I left the place more than satisfied - my skin feeling soft and re-awakened!The manager and his super friendly wife/business partner had the grace to apologise for the noise and gave me a little gift of massage oil for which many thanks!
Excellent . We got the hammam massage and meal package. We were very impressed excellent service throughout and an awesome meal to finish. Would recommend to all.

A treat!. I went to this hammam because it was rated #1. Totally worth it. I had a private hammam and a massage. It was so relaxing. The staff was very nice and helpful. You are served mint tea before and afterwards, and are given a bottle of water after the steam room which I totally needed. It was a little hard to find the place, I'm surprised they don't have better signage. But find it! There is a hostel nearby, and I just went in there and asked for help finding it, I knew I was close but it would take me awhile. Someone from the hostel walked me over there. I wish I knew the name of that place so I could write them a good review just for that!

Best massage of our lives. We booked a hammam, 1.5h massage and a dinner through a riad that belongs to the same company (riad zehar / samira riads). It was an investment but in the end we found it well worth the money.

Relaxing and welcoming. We booked based on trip advisor review - darned hard to find but if you are near they will come and get you, and guide you in!We had full massage, and a meal. A little unsure with the massage what was happening at times, but very good. Maybe a bit rough but good all the same.Meal was traditional, and served in the little welcoming room. We were treated to the staff singing happy birthday to another client, they had been to get her cake when she had said it was her birthday - then the girls came in and treated us to impromptu Moroccan belly/ dancing - inclluding having us two ladies up to join in. Fantastic night!

Birthday Treat. We were met in square by a lovely friendly chap called Samira. The place is difficult to find on your own. We were served with tea and biscuits on arrival and met some of the other staff. The hamman ritual was a wonderful experience, undertaken by a couple of lovely young ladies. Afterwards we had a massage and facial which was super. This was then followed by an exquisite meal and wine served on the roof terrace. A beautiful birthday treat.

Relaxing spa..... Would be a little bit hard to find it alone, but you can arrange to be picked up at a certain point in Marrakech. Hammam, a long relaxing massage&facial....it doesnt get much better then that. Enjoyed every minute of it. Afterwards we had a delicious dinner next to a fireplace and a surprise "last Minute" cake for my birthday as the sweet team of Riad expressed themselves. Unexpected homemade bellydancing turned our evening to unexpected mini party. Thank you guys, you have definetely made us enjoy our evening at your house!:D
Miss Victoria pollitt. Really enjoyed my staff was great and food was lovely would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the city

Amazing spa, definitely go 😊. What an amazing time we had here. We were so welcomed with tea and biscuits, followed by a soap scrub and exfoliation, then a wonderful professional massage. Then followed by a delicious and very filling 3 course lunch. We absolutely loved our experience here and all the staff were so friendly and treated us so well.

Really nice. Isn't easy to find but the place is worth to go. You can meet a group of marocian boys on your way to this place and they will show you a way to get there,but of course they want a money for that on the end. But inside,you can expect really nice people and beautiful place for relax.

This place takes the stress away. Fantastic place. Very friendly staff. Slightly higher prices but definitely worth it. Call before you go get one of their staff to meet you close by. it's a nightmare to find.

Nice People, nice service. This is a nice Hammam in the Medina. We searched it ourselves (its not so easy to find ;) and then we meet Abdullah from the Hammam Rosa Binheur and he showed us the way. He invitet us for a tea and was very nice and friendly. He told us much things about Marrakech and the people. Then he explained us the different possible massages. We made a reservation for later the same day. We were first in the Hammam and enjoyed an nice "Rubbing-Massage". It is a bit hard but the better you will feel afterwards =). Then we had a long massage (about a hour). Fatima and Aicha made it very good and we enjoyed it very well. We made the whole thing as a couple. Itwas a nice experience and a good service. Thank you!!!

Started off rocky but happy overall. I am staying at the Sofitel Spa and decided to come to this one last minute with my wife based on the ranking. Not sure how this is number one. It's kind of an odd setup that you need to come back in your robe at the front desk which other guests of the riad are just relaxing to get to the Hammam. The ladies who did the Hammam and massage were great. I could not give them a direct tip and had to put it in a box. They said open past 830 pm and left at 10pm.Thank you

Great experience for fantastic price. Wonderful ladies giving superb massages and facials. A step outside my comfort zone but they made it a comfortable relaxing experience. Samir and Aissam were very helpful and 3 course lunch with wine was very tasty. Recommend this hammam.

Lovely relaxing evening for 5 hard to please women. 5 of us was in Morocco celebrating my 30th and decided on an evening spa to avoid missing out on the sun. We were met outside the palace Bahia, which was easy to get to by taxi. Then escorted to the Riad. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The Hamman was great and the massage was even better. I've visited Morocco twice now and have tried two spa establishments that have been rated 5 star by trip advisor. On the first trip I thought nothing could top the experience we had at a different spa, but this did by miles. The meal was also gorgeous. All in all a great experience was had by all. We was even escorted back to the taxi, which was really appreciate dad it was late and dark. I would love to return back to Morocco and to the spa. I would recommend the all in massage at 95 euro to get the most out of the experience

Wonderful Hammam!. I had a very wonderful experience at Rosa Bonheur, and the price of their special treatment takes at least 2 1/2 - 3 hours, and is well worth the price. I had contacted Samira the owner long before I arrived in Marrakech, they made sure someone was at my riad to meet me to take me to the Hammam, and thankfully, out of pure kindness, they had a lovely woman walk me back to my riad, she was very sweet, and we laughed while trying to find my riad. The Hammam is very clean, and the decor is very lovely, I enjoyed sitting on the roof with tea, relaxing before my treatments. I hope to be back in Marrakech this year, I will definitely be going back to Rosa Bonheur. All around this is a wonderful Hammam, wonderful kind service people, wonderful treatments, wonderful food, wonderful atmosphere.

Amazing experience - hammam and massage. I can highly recommend Hammam Rosa Bonheur. I had a great hammam exfoliation treatment and massage. The place was very clean, tidy and professional. I frequently get massages and this was one of the best massages I have ever had! A bit expensive compared to other places nearby but I felt it was worth it. They provided private shower and toilet facilities, fresh towels and a hairdryer for use after my treatment which was nice.The only downside was that the place was hard to find and I tried to go there myself to make a booking but I couldn't find it. On returning to my accommodation and calling them they were friendly, scheduled me an appointment and offered to send someone to meet me at the main square in the medina who then walked with me to the treatment rooms (I would never have found it without this!).

Fantastic Hospitality. Thank you Najat, Hanan and Fatiha for an amazing spa experience. We felt totally relaxed afterwards and very ready for the wonderful meal on the roof terrace.Also a very big thank you to Aissam for showing us the beautiful Riad. Next time in Marrakech we will definitely stay there.

Excellent experience. Very good hammam. The price is reasonable. We were offered a hammam in a hotel at the same price for half as long. We ended up having a couples hammam and massage.Everything was taken care of. We booked a hammam over the phone the day prior. We met Samir at the Bahia palace and he walked us to the building. He explained the whole process to us as it is our first time. We kept our close in a massage room which was locked while we went for the hammam. They also provided us slippers, a disposable bottom and a robe.Would definitely do this again.

Great experience!!!. Our experience in Marrakech was 100% touristic...we followed trip advisor advice in almost everything and were not disappointed. We found the Hammam and decided to try and find it for ourselves. It went great! Even though its NOT SIGNED ANYWHERE you just have to take the risk and explore a bit. We went to have a look and decide for ourselves what we wanted. We were received at the entrance by Samir who offered the classic mint tea and marrocain patisserie....it was a very nice and quiet place...low light and soft talk. We talked a bit with him about the city before he got into the Hammam offers and suggestions. Then he took the time to explain each one in details. We already had an idea of what we wanted and had done a bit of research before..this seemed like the best option, even though it is not especially cheap is GREAT value for money. We went for a Hammam with the black soap and scrub, a relaxing and long massage, a facial (scrub, massage), and the dinner. We decided to have it around 4:30pm to have dinner there and not be wondering around finding a place to eat!!! It was a great idea 100% recommended. The food was very nice and we enjoyed it but if you are looking for more options and a gastronomic feast you might prefer to look for a restaurant after the treatment. Everything was great! The Hammam is a great experiences...completely different at what we were used to but very nice in holidays! Nice relaxing massage and facial! The staff were great too!!! all perfect!!

Un masaje exelente y trato esquisito. Exellent masage and personal treatment!. Myy experience in Hammam Rosa Bonheur has been the best in Marrakech so far, I was looking for a long time for a professional masage that suits also for deportists and dancers. The treatment was very good , all the details in hammam and in masage. Moreover, Samira and all her employees are very sweet and dedicated to their work, to give the best experience for any person that visits Marrakech and her Hammam. Highly recommendable!

Quinn. I came here as part of my friends 30th birthday trip away we was greeted by lovely friendly staff and a cup of Morocco finest tea we then went on to enjoy a hammam which was lovely we all had a good old scrub felt very clean and fresh afterwards we than went on to have our full body massage which was no other than amazing I could of lay there all day and enjoyed it then I was left to relax and have a nice shower before going down to have a beautiful well present beautiful meal I had a lovely day and will definitely be returning ❤️

Thoughtful staffs and fantastic experience!. I must say this has to be one of the most wonderful spa experience I have ever had in my life! Hammam was fascinating, me and my boyfriend were very clean afterwards! the massage was really nice too, my boyfriend was literally snoring as it was so comfortable! the dinner we had after the hammam and massage was great too. Applause to the staffs for being extremely professional and caring, and they all made sure we felt like home in that few hours.

Great experience and amazing customer service. I booked in at the last minute and Samira was really nice and informative when I contacted her by email. The argan oil massage was extremely nice. I have back problems and after an hour massage it didn't hurt me for four or five weeks! Amazing!!When I arrived Samira was very attentive and offered me some watermelon and tea on the house. She even gave me a little present: a small bottle of argan oil.Such a pity I discovered this place just the day before going back to London, but I do highly recommend the experience to anyone, either for healthy reasons or just for having a relaxing moment. The hammam is small and although very close to Jemaa el Fna, not easy to find for the first time, but Samira will send someone to pick you up if needed.

Wonderful experience!. We booked a pampering package for two with hammam, scrub and massage. The hammam itself was very interesting experience, and they definitely scrubbed us within an inch of our lives! They were also very considerate taking into account that i am a big plus size woman.The massage was also very interesting, nothing quite like I've ever had before with a lot of stretching and small movements. It was all in all a really amazing experience!

Most relaxing and best Massage & Spa ever!! <3. We booked the big package including a great dinner and were overwelmed by the service, the atmosphere, the kindness and the great food.The massage was just amazing and we felt absolutely relaxed. We didnt want to leave anymore as we felt so comfortable and welcome in this place. The freshly cooked 3 course dinner was the perfect end of this perfect day!Thank you very much, we will definitely come back every single time we will be in Marrakech (once a year) and cant wait for the next visit.
Bath and spa. Very nice experience, professional and very friendly. Highly recommended Very clean place will be repeated again.value for money

Heaven on earth. From start to finish, this place was absolutely divine. From the highest level of service and genuine welcome from the entire staff, to the top notch massage unlike anything I've ever experienced. My trip was made extra special by the professionalism and vast knowledge of team member Samir Nomad. He is simply incredible with ideas, with innovative ways to make sure that you get the full experience of the land. He is Ultra Polite, professional, quite charming, and willing to go the extra mile to accommodate everyone. His english speaking skills are excellent, and he adapts to his clients as needed. Incredibly hard working young man. I was delighted to have met him, and I look forward to returning again to this fabulous place! A must do!

Saved our Day in Marrakesh, incredible experience. Simply put, the best massage i've had in my life. A full body experience. You will be worked from head to toe. The girls used techniques i've never seen before. The argan oil makes it all the better for your skin. We also did the hammam and facials, which I would recommend. especially the hammam, as this loosens you up before the massage. It was amazing to see how much dead skin comes off. Your skin feels new and refreshed like never before after the hammam. I wish we had something like this tradition of hammam in the west, as it's so therapeutic. they were very generous with their time for us too.

The best spa experience in Marrakech, period!. Booked a hammam and massage for me and my friend (both guys).A rep from the spa was kind enough to meet us in the square, as the spa was hidden away. We were led to the spa and we took a seat in front of a log fire. We were offered mint tea, other beverages and some biscuits. After relaxing for a little we were led down to the hammam. We changed into robes (lockers provided for our clothes) and entered. Temperature was just right and smelt of eucalyptus everywhere. We were shampooed, rubbed and scrubbed thoroughly by two moroccan girls. Feeling thoroughly clean we were led back upstairs for some more mint tea! After a little we went upstairs for our massage (choice of either same room or different rooms). We chose whether we wanted a light, medium or hard massage. I chose hard and my friend chose light. 1 and a half hours later I felt like every knot had been taken out of my back and there hadn't been a single muscle untouched. My friend was asleep, apparently it was that relaxing. After that we had yet more mint tea, and the rep led us back out and even hailed a cab for us. Every single staff member was kind, accommodating and paid attention to detail. We didn't feel rushed whatsoever (spent a good 4 hours there in total). The prices were very reasonable and was even given some argan oil as a keepsake. I have been to a few spas and I cannot recommend this one enough. 10/10

Magical Spa. I had a magical experience inside this beautiful SPA , I really appreciate the service and the feeling of what are doing !!Any one who will visit Marrakech have to visit this amazing place !!!
fantastic. wonderful place to have hammam and massage lovely and smily staff Bravoooo.I'll be there again on february iam inpatient...

Made me feel so clean, relaxed and happy!. I could tell we were likely to have a good experience here when we received such a genuinely warm welcome. While drinking our welcome tea, we chose the body scrub / hammam and one-hour massage. I felt a little nervous not knowing what to expect, but everyone made us feel extremely welcome and comfortable. One thing to note is that the small package they give with the robes is disposable underwear that you are meant to put on before the hammam - we thought it was a hair net! So we certainly surprised the staff when we showed up to the bath without the underwear! They had a great sense of humor about it and quickly brought us a pair to wear. The bath and scrub were amazing - I couldn't believe how much dirt it cleaned off! The scrub might be too hard for some, but it was the perfect strength for me. I'm sure the wonderful ladies would accommodate if you wanted a lighter scrub. The massage was heavenly. My usual complaint with massages is that they are too light - but my Rosa Bonheur massage was the perfect pressure! And the masseuse had some really lovely techniques that I'd never experienced before. Afterwards, I felt so wonderful and really appreciated the impeccable service of all of the staff. We will definitely visit again when we return to Marrakech!

Hammam rosa. The place is so nice and the environment is amazing, we had me and my friends the best bath and massage. I advise everyone to have a try.The people there are so friendly and kind with the best experience.

Amazing spa, brilliant ambience. Visited with 3 friends, had a hammam beldi and a 1hr 30mins massage each. Hammam was fantastic - scrubbed with black soap and shampoo, the heat was just right. Massage was fantastic, so relaxing I fell asleep! Had a choice of either soft, medium or hard massage. The staff were the friendliest around, very accommodating, from meeting us in the square to take us to the location to offering complimentary mint tea at every opportunity. Free WiFi at the spa too. Would definitely recommend - will definitely be back!

Exceptional experience♡. I have visited Marrakech many times during the last 4 years and experienced the traditional hammam and massage but not to compare with Hammam Rosa Bonheur. It is really a must to visit Riad Al Ralia and its amazing spa and tasty traditional meals, specially the wonderful staff with their friendly welcoming. I highly recommand the hammam and the massage specially with the valuebal product they are using as pure argan oil and with the magical atmosphere and the experienced masseuse u will be more than relaxed, u will be pampered top to toe."Hammam Rosa Bonheur" is an exceptional experience not to be missed if u are visiting Marrakech.I adore this place it has a special magical unique spirit... ❤️❤️❤️

Highly recommended. 4 of us visited the Hammam, and we all chose the option of the Hammam, body massage and facial without a meal for €90. You do strip down to just paper knickers, so be warned about who you bring! The spa attendants are good at making you relax, so you will forget about it. The scrub part was the highlight- we were amazed at the skin that was scrubbed away. We all enjoyed the massage afterwards, and would highly recommend it to others. Samir met us outside a cafe on the Place, I'm not sure if we'd have found it otherwise!

Amazing hammambiance.. Such a relaxing day - we chose a package including hammam, 1 hour massage, 30 min facial and a meal for €95. Really good value. We didn't expect the meal to be so good - a proper banquet and some of the nicest food we've had out here. Staff were amazing! Highly recommended. Bit tucked away, and the map isn't accurate. Get to the derb with the sign for Riad Rouge, there's a vegetable stall directly at the end. Turn right at the stall and carry on round keeping an eye out for signs above the doors. Happy hammaming.

Nice hammam and one of the best massages I've ever had.. It was our first hammam, and the staff was very welcoming and made us feel comfortable. The scrub was vigorous, and the massage afterwards was just wonderful. Just as strong as we asked for, and wonderfully relaxing. Overall a great experience; it was so nice, we might return for another massage tomorrow.

Amazing experience! A Must! . We were a group of five and we all had the classic gommage massage. When I say everyone had a good time I really mean everyone. The staff, us five and even Samir (easily the most kind and welcoming person in all of Marrakech). This is a must visit place if you're in Morocco. WELL DONE HAMMAM ROSA BONHEUR.

Review from a reluctant visitor!. While my partner is a massage lover, I certainly am not, but I wanted to go for his sake. For others who are reluctant I'll describe the process! We called in in the afternoon and were given an appointment a couple of hours later. On arrival you are given tea and then taken upstairs where you change into the paper pants and a bathrobe. Your clothes get put in a basket and locked, you have the key.We went into the hammam room together and were given the black soap scrub. The ladies who did it just get on with it, so you don't feel too self conscious. They leave you covered in soap for a bit and then scrub you. After they had rinsed us, we were dressed in the bathrobes again and taken for our treatments. My partner had his massage and I opted for the less personal manicure. I was sat in the lounge area while the girl did it in my bathrobe, but everyone is in the state at some point or another!The girl who did my manicure was very sweet and did an excellent job. I said I was a little reluctant but she totally put me at my ease. She is a credit to that hammam!My partner joined me downstairs and then I got changed again. I had lots of tea throughout, sat next to a lovely fire which was very welcome for December. A nice chat with the owner on the way out and we were back into the hubbub of the medina.

Upscale, luxurious bathhouse . Great way to experience a Moroccan bathhouse. Like many places in the medina, it has an unassuming front door (and the Google maps location isn't quite right, so we had to ask around to find it the first time; the second time, they sent someone to pick us up from our riad). But it's quite lovely inside! And they are good with amenities: biscuits and mint tea to welcome you, a robe and disposable bikini for the bath, shower facilities afterwards. We did the bath and mud mask + massage + foot massage package. The bath takes places downstairs in a room that feels like a mix between a sauna and a steam room. Someone pours water on you, soaps you up, scrubs you down with a black glove -- you'll be impressed at how much dead skin comes off -- then you get the all-body mud mask, and another rinse off. Then it's upstairs for the massage. Fairly standard massage as they go, with plenty of Moroccan oils to go around. Depending on how you like the pressure of your massages, make sure to let your masseuse know to adjust. My friend and I both asked for hard pressure but felt it a bit soft to the touch.

BEST MASSAGE EVER- HANDS DOWN . My friend and I came here together and it was basically the best experience of our lives. The staff was AMAZING. Everyone was so friendly. The massages were unbelievable. If you are in Marrakech and don't come here, you are missing out!!! Just a warning- whoever you come with, you should be comfortable being naked around them. You are most of the time, but the staff makes you feel comfortable and it's not awkward. The package we got, that I suggest, includes a Hammam scrubbing, body mask/ sauna, hour massage, facial, and nice rooftop dinner for 95€. They also gave us free Argan oil afterwards. It is nice to see the sunset at dinner, so you should schedule your appointment for 4 hours before sunset. I cannot say enough good things about this spa!
good place . I have visited hammam Rosa with my friends its best place if you search for hammam and massage special thanks for noor

An amazing experience each and every time!. I have visited this hammam and spa several times over the years. They provide a consistently amazing experience. With the recent expansion to the hammam, massage and patio area, it is easy to spend a full half day enjoying the amenities, including a very well prepared and delicious meal. I brought my friend with me for her first ever hammam and massage. It can be a bit intimidating at first, but the ladies made her relaxed and secure, and she very much enjoyed the experience. Now, if only there was a service for someone to carry me from the very relaxing and soothing afternoon directly to my room!

Just what we needed after a long 2 days of traveling!. My Husband and I booked a traditional Hammam, massage, and dinner and we were not disappointed! After 2 days of delayed/missed flights and lost baggage our trip to Morocco had started on the rough side, but the incredibly friendly staff and excellent service renewed our excitement and calmed our frazzled nerves. Highly recommended for a very relaxing experience!

Great Spa Package+Meals, Friendly Staff, But Average Facilities. We are family of 4 with teenagers, booked Hammam + massage + evening meals all in one package. The entire email communication and booking process is very straight forward, we ask them to be pick-up (outside the Cafe France), it was on time and friendly greeting. Arrived at the spa premises, warm welcome greet and friendly staff - But about the place, to be honest nothing luxury about it, just average room, and yes at arrival they served you tea and biscuit...but again nothing special about it. Then not long after waiting in the reception room we are ready for Hammam & massage time. The Hammam was kind of fun, we have plenty laugh and the lady staff who did our Hammam very much keen doing the scrubbing. We enjoying this part. Please note: you can ask for separate room if you prefer mum+daughter and father+son. And after that, we have 1 hour and 15 mins massage, it feels so long laying down in the dark room and almost forget we've been at this spa place for nearly 3 hours. Next, is the second best part: our evening meals at the top terrace. The traditional food that we had is very tasty : chicken tajin, lentil soup, local bread, couscous, mini pastry roll, aubergine stew/tajin and traditional fruit dessert. We are very full as it is big portion of dishes. After finish our meal, we spent the rest of the evening enjoying the sunset at the very terrace top. with aromatic minty tea. We booked this spa package with price attached (see below) and hopefully will help if any readers are looking for accurate info: Rituel Royal Samira Riads 2h30 Care + Moroccan meal 95€ / per person. What's included on the price : - Traditional Hammam (45 min) (black soap scrub, ghassoul and henna )- Relaxing massage verbena or invigorating jasmine and Argan ( 1:15 )- Facials organic products (30 min)- Traditional Meals : Starter, main course mint tea and coffee (served on the terrace )​Enjoy your holiday in Marrakech!

Beautiful spa with fantastic service. I walked into this spa looking simply for a body massage, but left with so much more. Khamissa greeted me at the door (I accidentally knocked at the riad next door), and took me to Samir and Mariyam, who helped me choose what services I wanted that day. Granted my experience differs from the experiences of other guests because I speak Moroccan Arabic, but nevertheless I could still see how friendly and warm these people were right away. I decided to get a hammam and then full body massage, which were great choices. I am someone who likes a hard massage -- it can really never be too hard for me. Khadija did an excellent job and really worked out some sore muscles and put me in a deep relaxing state. I stayed a little while longer and drank tea with them until I had to leave. The beautiful finishings of this spa and relaxing aura made it so I didn't want to leave! I will definitely be back here.

Super friendly people and great hammam. Just went to this beautiful riad for a hammam and massage. Salim met me at the square and took me to the place, where I was treated to tea and biscuits, before being led down to the hammam for a very relaxing 2 hours! I can't recommend this enough. Tanmirt Salim!

Thanks, great as always.. After 2 weeks in the Sahara I went directly to have a hammam!! I was delighted to see some modifications to the location which made the experience even better than before, now there's more hammam places and lots of massage beds to cope with the demand. these guys really do deserve the ratings and reviews they get!! thanks and see you again soon.

Amazing experience . We visited this Hammam after reading reviews and a recommendation. I have to be honest this was my first Hammam and I was needless to say apprehensive. I have visited many massage places over the years in big hotels / small hotels / beaches and they have never really cut the mustard until today.The host was welcoming especially after we were met in the square by a lovely young lady who spoke no English ( she was lovely ) but the tension level was now at its peak. After a quick mint tea we went for our Hammam- two great ladies worked their magic and I was surprised that my insecurities left me and I was able to relax. Then followed the massage - Amazing- couldn't have asked for more. The room was spotlessly clean and warm and relaxing - the ritz it was not but the facilities were better than expected. If you are looking to try your first Hammam followed by a great massage in an environment that is welcoming then go. You won't regret it .

Photos different to reality. Booked hammam and massage for 2 - via email - after reading reviews. We were collected from our Riad. The Hammam was good but the room was not. Very narrow benches covered in old plastic matting. No lockers. No proper change rooms. Then walked through hotel in our towelling gowns to old and tired massage room - no ambience at all. Massage was excellent. I believe that they own more than one spa and the photos on-line are of their other one. If this is the case then this should be explained at time of booking. We were asked to pay in cash - which we did. I have an email quoted price of 1210 but was charged 1320. I was not going to argue the point at the time as we needed to be led out from the spa to the main area as was in a very unfamiliar and unlit back area of the medina.

SOO GOOOD!!! WENT BACK FOR SECONDS!!!. After reading the reviews i just had to go to this hammam. Was on holiday with sisters and our adult children so wanted to take them to a nice hammam as its my second time in Marrakech and last time went to diffrent ones.The whole day asked a number of taxi drivers to take us to Rosa bonheur but they refused and wanted to take us to 1 they thought we should go to.Went back to hotel at 5pm and luckily i had the phone number and address so i rang the hammam and was so glad the lady spoke perfect english (later found out it was samira who owned the place) and i asked if she could fit the eight of us in that evening and she yes she wil do her best. She also sent us a minibus to pick us up from the hotel and then Lovely Samir met us at the square where we got dropped off. He was so lovely he actualy looked like he could have been my younger sons brother.(lol.),he looked after us so well. We all had a hammam and full body massage which was amazing especially my lady Sayeda. All i can say it was so good we all went back for another hammam andg massage the day b4 we wer due back to uk. Highly reccommend this place. Will definatly go back.

Wonderful - would go back. My friend and I visited for a hammam and massage after reading the reviews on TA. It was incredible. We were met at the main square which was really helpful as there is no way we would have found it by ourselves. We were given tea and biscuits to welcome us before being shown into the hammam. We both wore a bikini as we weren't too keen on only wearing the tiny pants they give you, but the staff were fine with this. The hammam was great, and something I would recommend as a must do in Marrakech. We then both had the argan oil massage which was wonderfully relaxing and seemed to last forever. Would 100% recommend.

Relaxing massage and friendly staff. Samira met me at my Riad which was much appreciated as I kept getting lost in the Medina. He was very friendly and I was offered tea and biscuits on arrival. I had a 1.5h massage which was very relaxing. This was followed by tea and biscuits and then I was taken back to my Riad. Great experience!

Incredible, Relaxing, Just Lovely.. My partner and I scheduled a traditional black soap hammam and argan oil massage together and it was amazing. We met someone from the spa at an agreed upon location and they took us through winding alley ways to a wonderfully out of the way paradise. Though the outside doesn't look like much, the inside of the spa is beautiful. We were greeted by a gracious host and had mint tea before our hammam. The hammam experience was lovely. The ladies knew exactly what they were doing and made it an enjoyable experience for us both. Definitely worth trying! My skin has never felt better. The woman that helped me even washed my hair and braided it back. I felt wonderful. After the Hammam, my partner and I padded downstairs in our fluffy robes that we had been given. We then had wonderful massages. I highly suggest the argan oil massage! After they finished our massages we were left in a private room with an adjacent bathroom to change and shower. Once we had cleaned up, we exited the room and were offered mint tea again. It was a truly lovely experience and we felt most welcomed. I highly recommend this spa.

Wonderful Experience and Service. My fiance and I visited the Hammam for the Romance Package having read the amazing reviews (no1 on trip advisor!). Booking was easy, just drop them an email from their web page and they will reply almost immediately.Samira collected us from the main square, as the Riad where the Hammam is located is hard to find (via the souk, don't try it alone!). We were welcomed in the traditional way with a serving of green mint tea (wish we could get that over here as it was delicious).The hammam part of the treatment was a bit awkward at first, mainly due to English bashfulness in being naked and washed by strangers (both female), but once you get over that fact it is a lovely experience. The amount of dead skin removed is incredible!! Be aware if you have sunburn, but letting Samira know this will be translated to the ladies.The massage was the best I have ever had. Slightly too rough, but afterwards you feel amazing. Very talented.My fiance doesn't like people touching his face, so instead of the facial he was given a foot treatment. I really enjoyed the facial, pretty much the same as those offered over here in English spas.The meal afterwards on the roof terrace/retreat was lovely and very filling. The service was the main thing here, felt completely welcome from the moment we arrived. Didn't see any other guests at the same time, so felt like VIP's. Samira even assisted in suggesting some bars to visit in Marrakech, going as far as to Whatsapp me the information the next evening.We will be back if ever we visit Marrkech again!Thanks to the whole team :) x

Wonderful Experience. Greeted from the main square which was most needed as it would be a nightmare to find on your own. Given tea and biscuits on arrival, with a wonderful host who chatted to us. The hammam was amazing - who knew you could rub that much skin off! I felt brand new. The massage was really lovely and relaxing. The experience was really long, you really got your moneys worth. We then had lunch on the terrace which was lovely. They gave us far too much food but the pastrys that were served as a starter were wonderful, I would go back again just for those! Will definitely return when I go back to Marrakech

Best massage ever!. Arrived on an early flight to Marrakesh so thought spending the afternoon in a Hammam was a good idea. I wasn't wrong - a very thorough scrubbing led to 90 mins of the best, most relaxing massage I've had. Welcoming and authentic feeling, the staff at this Hammam know how to make you feel welcome and pampered. I thoroughly recommend a visit.

Nearly ruined our holiday - awful experience. We booked this purely based on the reviews on here, I don't know if most people who have reviewed it just had a hamman bath or if the reviews are wrong because it was quite awful.We booked a 2.5 hour package for €90 - hamman, massage, facial and lunch. Plus we added extra a manicure and pedicure. This was done via email in the UK.The person met us as planned and took us there.First impressions were a little tatty but we were reassured by the good reviews on here.The hamman bath part was ok, in fact quite good, then it went down hill!The massage was dreadful - not really a massage more of a rubbing in of oil! I am a trained sports massage therapist and I would say the lady who massaged me had no training at all - which is quite dangerous. I had to stop her doing very incorrect moves from time to time.The facial was a quick application of a scrub (no cleanse first) then an application of oil - no mask or eye cream etc.The worst part was the manicure and pedicure - these girls obviously have no training at all. The hygiene factor was zero and the choice of colours - 2 shades of red! They massacred the cuticles and did the worst paint job. Since returning my friend has contracted a nail fungus on her toes - which doesn't surprise me at all.We finally got lunch at 3.45 having arrived at 11. We were starving. Starters were bland and tasteless, the tagine was good.The whole experience was ruined as was our trip when after we paid one of the staff (a man) chased us into the souk saying he had undercharged us and wanted an extra €40 each! He was quite rude. Thank god I had printed off the email with the agreed price. He then tried to say thy had misunderstood and quoted the wrong price, he then said the prices on the website were wrong etc. He was quite pushy, only for the fact I am more pushy and told him to get lost, they would have fleeced us for an extra €80!The whole day was unprofessional and we were left feeling quite shaken by the altercation in the souk.I would URGE you avoid this place, they don't deserve the high rating at all - there are better and much cheaper places.I always write fair reviews and would have given this no "dots" if I could have I feel that strongly as to how bad it was....

Brilliant. Having just got back from a 3 day 4WD tour/camel ride we were really looking forward to our hammam massage, and it didn't disappoint! I went with my sister, who had had a hammam before (so she knew what to expect!), but this was my first time. Ahhhh the luxury of feeling pampered and attended to - absolute bliss. My skin probably hasn't felt this good since I was a baby ;)

Great and relaxing hammam experience!. Went to this spa as a couple and we had a great time. My first hammam experience ever and i have got to say it was truly relaxing. Sleepers, bathrobes and of course the traditional welcome tea made this visit memorable.Therapists and Samir were very professional during the whole visit. Definetely recommend!

Still the best in Marrakech!. I visited this Hammam last year and visited again a couple of weeks ago, I must say that this is still the best Hammam in Marrakech. They have really kept up the standard. Both the gommage and the massage is the very best. The service is excellent and I highy recommend this Hammam if you want an authentic experience! Since the last time, they have expamded and can now accomodate more people at the same time.

Amazing. I have no idea what the review below is about- this hammam and spa is amazing. I visited this morning with my (reluctant!) boyfriend and we both had a fantastic time. We were met at the main square and taken to the riad where we were given mint tea and biscuits and left to relax. We then had a hammam and an Argan oil massage. Both were amazing but the massage was by far the best massage I have ever had- even my other half had a great time! All in all, a great experience, thank you!
Terrible Hammam massage. We went here and the massage was terrible! The other reviews here are misleading. Don't go here you are better off going to a different establishment.

No wonder they're ranked #1. I'm glad myself and friends chose Rosa Bonheur for our first hammam experience. I cannot imagine having it anywhere else. Arrive for the tea and biscuits while we cool off a bit. It happened to be warm this day. Now time for the hammam experience. It was myself and two other female friends. We go into a room to undress and put on disposable thong panties, robe and slippers. Led upstairs and then the experience begin. I don't want to give it away. I want you to be as shocked and pleasantly surprised as we were. Just know that you will leave glowing and smiling ear to ear. Without giving it away I will say that it was the best spa experience of my life. The girls are really cute and fun. They just giggled at us while we were taking it all in. Just lay back and enjoy it and know that your money spent is well worth it.

A true number one!. This place really lives up to high expectations! After a full day of walking in the heat and traffic of Marrakech we really needed some relaxation and spontaneously gave this number one hammam on Tripadvisor a call. They instantly picked us up at the main square (Jamma El Fna) and led us to their riad, a few windy alleys off the square. It was no problem to get a 2h SPA treatment (hammam and massages) for both of us at once, without any reservation. We have both had many massage treatments around the world and can assure that the quality certainly matches if not exceeds significantly higher priced options elsewhere. Moreover, the young team was exceptionally motivated and charming, we laughed a lot with the girls in the hammam and later had endless cups of tea with one of the organizing guys. We wandered home very happy and relaxed. Thank you, Samira and team!P.S. If you want to find the place, better give them a call! They are moving around due to renovation, so the adress we found here on Tripadvisor was not correct and we would nearly have missed this great experience.

Great service. I had a couples hammam done with my boyfriend here and I must say it was excellent especially as it was something we could do together . The service was great with someone meeting us midway in the square as the location can be bit fiddly to get to and dropping us back off to the square . We had the hammam and Argan oil massage . The place itself is stunning and although slightly expensive , I definitely felt relaxed afterwards . The hammam was a bit rough on the skin but my skin looked and felt great afterwards . I would highly recommend to others .

Amazing Spa!. We recently visited this spa after reading several positive reviews here on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. I was able to schedule our appointments via email with Samira the day before. We arranged to be picked up at the Cafe Argan, which was not difficult to find, in the main plaza. Samir picked us up, right on time, and walked us to the spa, which was not too far. He even gave us a chance to look at the shops on our way. Upon arrival, we were greeted and offered delicious tea and biscuits. Overall, the customer service was incredible and the massages were amazing. I would highly recommend this place!

No. 1 Hammam!. Fantastic Hammam. Quite difficult to get to but i'm sure a local will help you out. Although just be careful as they can lead you off in the wrong direction, we got lucky with our guy. We chose the hammam eucalyptus and trilogy of masks and a full body argan oil massage to start our holiday off. It was perfect from the start. From being welcomed with a mint tea and biscuits to the gifts of argan oil. Staff are superb and very welcoming. Skin was AMAZING throughout my holiday :)Would highly recommend this Hammam.

Fantastic spa in Marrakech. Rosa Bonheur was chosen as it was ranked #1 on TA, this credit is certainly well deserved. Arranged to meet Samir at Cafe Argana (easily spotted when you enter the main square at the drop off point), otherwise it would be impossible to find. Samir takes you back also! Facilities at the spa are excellent, and beautiful.

Moroccan hospitality at its best. I had a fantastic experience at Hammam Rosa Bonheur. They met me in front of Cafe Arabe and I'm grateful because it might have been a bit difficult to find on my own. I was welcomed with tea and nice conversation at the riad. Though it's my third time to Morocco, it was my first hammam experience. I don't know what I was waiting for! I had the "royal treatment" package and it was well worth it. It included a sauna steam, total body skin treatment of black soap followed by "terre" or mud, massage, facial and dinner on the rooftop terrace. Everything was fantastic. If you have never had a hammam and hesitate because you might feel shy, just go for it! The young women at Hammam Rosa Bonheur who provided the treatments were extremely professional, sweet and very helpful in guiding me through the process. Not to mention that my skin feels amazing and it was incredibly relaxing.Dinner on the rooftop terrace was such a lovely bonus! Not only was it absolutely tasty and abundant, the proprietors offered such wonderful service. Once the meal was underway, they ended up joining me and the other dinner guests. They are so kind, generous, interesting, and easy going. I would have happily stayed and visited all evening if I hadn't been staying on the other side of the medina. My only regret is that I didn't stay in one of their riads! Really, they are a super hospitable, professional and friendly bunch. It was a wonderful and genuine expression of Moroccan hospitality. A big thanks to Samir and his lovely team! Merci et à la prochaine!

Marrakech Hammam Rosa . Very nice place to go after having a very tired busy day, once arrived we was met by a fellow moroccon called Samir he was a nice guy always pleasant to talk to. He negotiated everything and before we know it we was treated to the best massage you could possible get, which made us come back again and try something new on the Menu. They are plenty of options for you to choose from with reasonable prices ..Thanks to the staff of Hammam Rosa and Samir ...Great people...

Great hammam with kind and refreshingly honest staff. The spa was hard to find, had to pay a local 5 dihram to get us there but well worth the effort. Refreshingly honest establishment in Marrakech.. Would highly recommend for first time users as the girls were kind and patient and put you at your ease from the start.. Good quality, very relaxing.. Were even given 2 little bottles of Argan oil to take with us

Like a Princess.... I learned about this spa because I had booked my stay at one of Samira's Riads. One cannot go to Morocco with experiencing a hammam and I saved this occasion for an extra special day during my trip in celebration of my 40th birthday. On the day of my appointment, Samira arranged for Saida to come and meet me at Jemaa El Fna so that I could find my way to the spa. I walked in to the immediately soothing smell of orange essence oils surrounding me...this sent me into an instant state of relaxation. I had never experienced a hammam and did not know what to expect...within a few minutes of the washing/steaming/scrubbing process, I felt like I was in another world and my entire being and skin were completely rejuvenated and like new. Following the traditional washing and scrubbing from the hammam, I went for my hour long massage, which after pretty intense traveling through Morocco via trains and non-stop walking, was desperately needed and surpassed my expectations. I truly did not want any of my treatments to end at the spa and could have happily spent several more hours there (perhaps even days)...the 3 1/2 hours there was pure bliss. But, it did not stop there...once I showered and got dressed at the end of my appointment, I went downstairs only to be absolutely stunned and speechless when Samira and her staff surprised me with a gorgeous birthday cake and sang "happy birthday" to me in Arabic...I was traveling alone in Morocco on my 40th birthday without any family, my kids or friends...I had no words except tears and gratitude for this gesture on their part and the joy in my heart in being able to celebrate this momentous event surrounded by new friends....

Relaxing and fun experience. It was my first Hammam experience. I would definitely recommend the Hammam Rosa Bonheur to any one seeking a quality Hammam experience. It is a five star customer service experience. I booked the appointment on phone and was picked up from France Cafe by Samir and was provided the tour of the facility before start of the experience. Greeted with Moroccan tea and Biscoti by Samira who is an amazing host and clarified all my queries as it was my first experience. The staff provides an excellent service with a great smile on the face. The full body massage was an hour long without any interruption or break by a very experienced therapist. Good shower facilities and a tea is provided after the massage. I had a great fun afterwards by having a good chat and pics with the staff in traditional dress. It was followed by a gift of Argan oil including for my wife even though she missed her appointment and did not have treatment. All in all a great experience, highly recommended! Thanks Samir, Samira, Rashida and rest of staff!

Amazing, very accommodating. Although hidden away from the square, arranged to meet someone from the spa at cafe de France in the square. We arrived 15 or 20 minutes late! But he greeted us as if we had just arrived on time, any apologies of being late were brushed under the carpet. Although we were late and they were fully booked the service was not rushed one bit. Was seated and offered mint tea or mineral water. Was bought a menu of experiences. Chose the hammam beldi and a full body massage. The hammam beldi lasted a good hour! We were scrubbed with black soap and other ointments. After this we had more mint tea. The massage was excellent value for money, as it was one and a half hours long. Can pick between relaxed, moderate and vigorous strength for your massage. Was so relaxing I fell asleep. After the massage we were given (more) mint tea and a gift of some pure argan oil in a bottle. Visited here 3 times in 3 days, it was simply fantastic. Cannot recommend enough.
Very Posh. We we were treated like a prince and a princess in Hammam Rosa Bonheur. It is a an excellent experience.

First Hammam. Went with my boyfriend for our first ever hammam. We rang up the day before to book and the next day we were met by Cafe France and guided to the place, definitely for the best as think we would have struggled to find it ourselves! We were then given tea and a little while to decide what treatments we wanted. I chose a hammam and full body massage and my boyfriend had a hammam and a back, neck and shoulder massage. Before both treatments we were asked whether we would prefer soft or hard, we both chose hard. The hammam was so relaxing and my skin felt so soft afterwards, would say the hammam treatment is a must if you visit. Then we were guided upstairs for our massages. Both of us fully enjoyed the massages, and after were given time to shower thank sit on the balcony until we were ready to go. Had a great time, would definitely go back if I visit marrakech again.

Hugely disappointed. The one star I have given the Bon Honeur is not given lightly (see my other TA reports) and is as a result of my discussing this with my daughters, to come up with a fair review of our (4 females - mum, two daughters and daughter in law) experience. We did not have a problem with the treatments per se we had but rather with the poor communication, overcharging and lying.Let me begin. After much research, I kept coming back to the Bon Honeur because of the fab reviews on trip advisor. I emailed them on the morning on our last day in Marrakesh to ask them for an appointment and detailed that we all wanted different treatments. They emailed back with lots of offers, asked us to confirm (which we did) and sent someone to meet us at the main square in the medina.On arrival, and because we wanted to use up the last of our dirhams, we were discussing how we would pay - the guide who had met us was presumably the manager and he said there wouldn't be a problem if we didn't have enough dirhams because they had a card machine. My eldest daughter specifically confirmed this with him. Then he told us to hurry up because they had other clients! (We had just been poured tea at this point). Not a good start and it set the tone for the rest of the experience. On perusing the 'menu' it was clear that there were not as many treatments available as on the website. The only facial available on the menu was 'anti ageing' (at 30€) not really suitable for my 26 year old daughter in law (she had picked out a 'facial with organic products' at 20€ on the website (in the event the facial she was given cost 35€!). Secondly, we were told there was no one to do my daughter's pedicure as they said the person was off sick. When challenged as to why they didn't let us know this in the email, we were fobbed off with them pretending to not understand. My youngest daughter wanted a back massage but she to her surprise she had a whole body massage (which of course cost more money). I had a hamman and massage but there were different options on the website and at no time was I asked what sort of hamman or massage (relaxing or with oils etc) did I want (other than hard, medium or soft).The upshot of this was that we were short of 300 dhs. We were then told that we couldn't pay by machine so we were unceremoniously marched to the square where we had to draw money out on a bank card to pay for this. (I am guessing he wanted to avoid the charge).The whole experience left a bad taste in our mouths and what was to be a treat at the end of our break together was really stressful. We felt they pulled the 'don't understand' card out because we weren't going to spend lots of money. I don't give one star reviews lightly and I do understand how poor reviews affects businesses but I have tried to recount as honestly as I can, our experience at this spa. Service is very important and is rewarded if earned but the service (excluding treatments) from the Bon Honeur was shockingly bad. We all left hugely disappointed.

First hammam massage. My boyfriend and I visited the spa on our recent holiday to Marrakech. We were met at the Cafe France in the square ( recommend emailing ahead to ask if you could be met as the spa is down a series of alleys). We both were greeted by the staff, all of which had good English, and invited to have some tea and biscuits while we decided what we wanted. We went for the full massage package but without the food which cost 80 euros (sooooo much cheaper compared to UK prices). We were the only people in the spa but when we finished two other couples were waiting to have their treatments. The black scrub was amazing! The dead skin that came off me was unreal! I felt so smooth after it. This was followed by a 2 hour couple massage with argan oil. There was a big shower + shampoo provided to wash your hair + body after the treatment. Following this we were told we could go up to the roof terrace to take some photos + was told to take our time. Brilliant treatment + well worth the money!

A little piece of heaven. Though nothing grand in its structure or decoration but the service was excellent and enjoyed a black soap hamamm scrub which took all dead skin....followed by one of the best massages I have experienced.They sent a man to pick us up at our hotel and show us the way to and from through the twists and turns of an area of the souk....you found yourself wondering if it was on the up and up......most definitely. I think it may be a little pricey but well worth it.

Wow! One of the best massages I've ever had. We got the 1 hour oil massage for 330 dirhams - and it was totally worth the cost! I asked for a "hard" massage and it was really hard and fantastic. One note: We just showed up without reservations. It was slightly hard to find on our own. The trip advisor pin is correct. Go down the main road. Coming from the main square, it's a small alley way to the right, just before the small alleyway to the left that is pointing to "Dar Si Said museum." Go down the alley and turn RIGHT. Follow the curve and it's just down on the left. We had trouble and a local kid helped us - I gave him 10 - but these directions will get you there.

Amazing!!!. Went there today with a friend and asked for the whole package. We was not dissappointed. Lovely friendly environment and the attention to detail was on another level. I had the massage that lasted 1 hour and 30 mins. The lady that performed the massage touched muscles i never knew i even had. Thanks to her i am now 6 layers of dead skin lighter and i have skin as soft as an infants bum. The man at the hamman met us in the town square and walked us to the building. Truely fantastic customer service and i couldnt have asked for more.

Best Hammam in Marrakech!. I visited Hammam Rosa Bonheur with 4 friends (all males) whilst on a stag do during Ramadan! We were collected by the manager Samira from our taxi nearby. We had an awesome time. Samira and her colleague Samir are the nicest and most helpful people you will meet. The service was excellent and the Hammam experience was out of this world! I would recommend Hammam Rosa without hesitation. THE BEST HAMMAM IN MARRAKECH!

An absolute must for Marrakech. I can't recommend this hammam experience highly enough. We went for the special offer which is euros95 or 1090 dirhams. We met Samir at Café de France in Rue des Banques and it was just a few minutes walk from their to the hammam. We had a delicious mint tea known as "Moroccan Whiskey" and then off up to get dressed in our paper knickers. I think the whole experience lasted four hours. There was scrubbing and washing and oiling and massaging and eating and drinking. I actually fell asleep during the massage I was so relaxed. Samir and his team are the nicest people you could ever want to meet and he helped us find some good bargains in the markets nearby. I wish I could travel to their hammam once a week to get recharged more often. Hope to see you soon Samir x

Best Hammam Massage!!!. We were collected from our taxi from the Manager who was fluent in English and very helpful. The location of the place is difficult to find so I would recommend you pre-organise your massage and request the Manager to meet you at a specific location. When arriving at Hammam Rosa Bonheur, it was very clean and we were offered mint tea, biscuits and water which was nice! The Hammam scrub and massage was very relaxing and probably one if not the best massage I have had to date. It is great value for money compared to UK prices and you get much more time. We paid for 1 and half hours but we must have easily had 2 hours of treatment. The staff are all very friendly and make you feel comfortable. I definitely recommend this place! 5 STARS and nothing less!

Wonderful experience, wonderful price, wonderful people. I visited Rosa Bonheur with my fiancé, my best friend and her boyfriend and we had an amazing time! After a long day in the Atlas Mountains, we wanted to unwind. We were greeted by the gracious people of Rosa Bonheur with open arms and enjoyed hamman and massages! They use the best Argan oil and were such professionals! The best part of the experience was how overwhelmingly kind they were to us! Come for the spa treatment and stay for the genuine kindness of Rosa Bonheur!!
