Wonderful hammam experience! . We went to this hammam during Ramadan and had almost three hours of pampering (100 euros), from 8:30pm.What an amazing experience! It's incredible value, but more importantly every part of it is wonderful. The staff, the facilities, and the service itself (massage and bathing).Someone from the hammam also escorted us to and from the venue. Please don't be alarmed by the red lights in the entranceway, it's definitely not a brothel! This would be an absolute must do for me on a future visit to Marrakech.

Well Spent afternoon to chill out during a hectic holiday!. On entry we were served mint tea by the pleasant staff before we began our hammam scrub and massage. The hammam scrub was very thorough and the massage was excellent. Soft music was played in a darkened room during the hour long massage it was so relaxing I even fell asleep for a short time! Would recommend to anyone!

First hammam & loved it!. My daughter & I visited Hammam Rosa Bonheur and both experienced our first hammam and followed with a massage. The services were excellent & the personnel were very friendly. Who would think that being scrubbed down would be such a relaxing & wonderful experience? Wish I could do this at home!

Best hamman in Marrakech!. I spent 4 days in Marrakech with my boyfriend, and 2 of those days were spent in Hammam Rosa Bonheur. This place was one of the best experiences in Marrakech. The hamman and argan oil massages were beyond amazing. Quite authentic, and highly recommended. They offered us mint tea, biscuits, and even helped me arranging someone to come to the location to do henna on my hands while I waited for my boyfriend finish with his massage. I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

Must do when visiting Marrakech.. I cannot recommend this hamman highly enough. They were brilliantly efficient from making enquiries over the Internet to meeting up in the agreed place. The hamman and massage were both a very relaxing experience. My husband chose not to have ant treatment but was made to feel very welcome and provided with mint tea and biscuits. We also had the meal after the treatment which was wonderful. Thank you so much for a fantastic experience.

Relaxing experience. I booked this for my family as it was so highly rated on TA and i'm very glad I did! We went for the package of Hammam, massage, facial and 3 course dinner on roof terrace, for 95 euros each (expensive for Marrakech but such good value compared to prices at home).We were met outside Cafe de France in the main square and were led to the Riad (just as well as it is difficult to find). Excellent tea and biscuits to start, followed by the Hammam. We were asked to put on funny little paper pants but as we were a family group we chose to keep full swimming costumes on which was fine. 45 mins in the steam room - black soap, then scrub. It was vigorous but felt wonderful and my skin has been so smooth since. Full body massage was wonderful - we had medium pressure which was quite firm enough. Facial was nice but I felt we were left alone too long - I would have preferred a head massage whilst the face mask was setting. Having said that, the therapists had just given us a massage and it was Ramadan so they'd probably had enough by 7pm.Dinner on roof terrace was lovely. We were all so relaxed and in a trance by the end of the evening. Overall a lovely experience, much more suited to us than the traditional Hammams sound like!

An authentic experience in the beautiful spa!. We booked a treatment at the spa, recommended by the Riad. They organised a member of staff to take us as its a bit tricky to find like most places! It was a real treat from start to finish. The staff were friendly, welcoming and talented in their work. The Hammam in the basement was a hour long scrub from top to toe. The products used were lovely. The hour long massage to follow was on the top floor, in a lovely treatment room, my husband and I had the whole spa treatment together. We then had the facial 30 mins, and organised also for later on was the traditional dinner. During our treatment we were offered lovely mint and lemon tea, and the morrocan biscuits. This is a must do experience, and I would recommend this spa to everyone going to marrakech. Thank you for the amazing day, my skin felt fabulous after and the body and mind completely refreshed and relaxed. See you again.

Invigorating and very enjoyable. This has got to be one of the nicest experiences that we had whilst staying in Marrakech. Having never had a hammam before we thought we would try it, the reviews were good and we were not disappointed. The Rosa Bonheur is a short 10 minute walk from the Riad Reves 'D Orient where we stayed. Inside is beautiful, the staff are friendly, helpful and from the outset made us feel at ease. We were offered mint tea (Berber Whiskey) and cookies and had the chance to relax and talk before being led away to get changed. The hammam included relaxing in the steam room, body scrub and being washed with warm water, it lasts for about 40 mins. We were left feeling really clean and invigorated and were even given a bottle of Argan oil to take home with us. This hammam was really reasonably priced and great way to relax after a day at the souks, I highly recommend it!!

Relaxing massage. Our riad booked and recommended this spa for a treatment and as it was top on TA we had high expectations! It was very good however the staff were a bit put off by the fact we wanted the Argan oil massage instead of Hammam which is guess they specialise in. The riad was beautiful and traditionally decorated we were given mint tea to drink while we chose our treatment. My friend and I both had the massage and we were massaged at the same time in one room. The massage was really good one of the best full body massages I've had. However the ladies kept yawning and sighing... Not a major problem but don't usually experience that with a massage. I felt like maybe they put more effort in to people who spend a little more and have a Hammam as well. Despite this it was a good massage for a good price with friendly staff

Very friendly yet professional and invigorating!. I'd never been to anything like this before but my wife talked me into it. She had read good reviews of this Hammam and I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised.We were met at the Cafe de France and led back to the Hammam where we were served some mint tea and water prior to our treatments. We had some kind of steam room, wash, scrub etc followed by a relaxing massage. We were together for the whole thing and the staff were very friendly and professional - they clearly know what they're doing.Overall, really pleasantly surprised as this isn't something I would normally choose. Keep an open mind chaps!

Legit!. Fun, and very relaxing! Hidden space down a narrow set of alleys in the medina. Very charming - 4 stories with reception on the ground floor, hamam in the basement, and two floors of treatment rooms. Tea + 40 min hamam grommage + 75 min massage + 15 min foot scrub + more tea. 80 euros well spent, and included argan oil as a parting gift. Loved the entire experience, especially the massage which was FANTASTIC and up there with any I've received in a foreign country. Will return if ever in Marrakesh again.

Great experience. This place was rated No. 1 on TA and had excellent reviews and we happened to be staying just around the corner. It is difficult to find and the exterior is entirely non descript and can be easily missed. The interior is traditional and immaculate. The owners are young, hospitable and offered us endless tea and biscuits throughout. We were accommodated last minute and had a couples hammam and my boyfriend also had the Argan oil massage. My boyfriend thought the massage was excellent and one of the best he has had. There's no need to bring anything with you, we were given these funny looking paper pants and we had a good giggle because we put them on back to front lol. This place deserves its premiere position. We are going to try out heritage spa, no.2 on TA before we depart hoping for another great experience

Great way to end our Morocco adventure!. We spent our last day in Marrakech and it was the best way to end our wonderful trip. First of all, Samir was very responsive to my inquiry from the States. Then, Samir was nice enough to meet us and walk us to the spa since it is not easy to get around on your own. They were extremely accommodating to what we wanted. My daughter and I had scrubs, massages, and facials. My husband and son had scrubs, massages, and foot massages. They served us a delicious "snack" and it was really a lovely afternoon!

A must if visiting Marrakech. We had a scrub and a Argan oil massage which was fantastic and very professional. I could not speak more highly of the people who work here Anwar and Samir two of the nicest people you'll ever meet helped us and invited us for dinner for iftar. We even ended up going out for a meal later in the evening/morning with them. I could not recommend this place more! Extremely friendly, and made a big difference to our trip. Thanks for everything guys, keep up the good work!

Wow, what a fantastic experience!. After a very stressful morning in Marrakech we were so ready for our experience in the hamman. We were met in the main square and escorted to the riad. The staff here are SO incredibly friendly, welcoming and provide a 5* experience. We had a scrub, massage and facial, followed by dinner. The treatments were excellent, the food was best we have had in Marrakech, but the best thing about our experience was being made to feel part of the family. All the staff were so happy and welcoming, even offering us to eat with them on first day of Ramadan. GO HERE whilst in Marrakesh, you wont regret it! From Jane, Jacquie, Gemma and Joseph- keep up the good work, we will return one day!

Very good. I wouldn't quite say excellent as they appeared a little busy, however the massage and cleansing was quite an experience for a first time spa visitor like myself. All very relaxing and then a very pleasant dinner on the roof top balcony. Not one of the cheaper experiences in Marrakesh but still very good and compared to prices back home very good.

Simply a must!. We were met in Jemaa El Fna Square, which is necessary, as we wouldn't have found it otherwise! We had the special hammam, massage and lunch package... It was fantastic! It's relaxed, well paced and a true indulgence. Every treatment is comfortable and professional, and the girls are friendly. The oil they use for the massage leaves your skin feeling and looking great!Lunch on the terrace was plentiful and tasty. While not necessary, it was a good idea to let us relax after the treatments before heading back out in to the madness!And Anwar who guided us there and back, served lunch and tea was very friendly and provided good chat!Would highly recommend it!

Soul-nourishing experience. I have had hammam all over the world...none better than Rosa Bonheur. The ladies here work with their hearts and provide a soul-nourishing hammam. From the vigorous hammam scrub to the roasted argan oil used for the massage, this is a five-star experience.

Total Bliss ~ Back for more :). This was my second time at the 'Hammam Rosa Bonheur' and I probably should have done this review sooner, as it is definitely worthy of one. However, my first experience of this Hammam Spa was only about three months ago and I came back for more. That's how good this Spa is. It was booked for us by our lovely Tour Guide, Yassine, as part of a recent tour we did through 'Morocco-Traveldreams'.The Spa is located in quite a hard to find area, so you can arrange to be met at a suitable place by one of the staff. Myself and three friends chose the 'Special Offer Package' for €95, which consisted of a 'Traditional Hammam', black soap scrub for 45 minutes, followed by a very relaxing all over body massage for an hour and a half, then a thirty minute facial, followed by a traditional Moroccan meal......Total Bliss!! The staff are very welcoming and mint tea was awaiting us on our arrival. We were then ushered downstairs to the Hammam where we were given a robe, a pair of slippers and a teeny pair of paper knickers to change into. There's no need to bring anything with you, that's all you need. Just a word of warning though, this is not a spa for those who are shy. The four of us, all ladies, were treated to the black soap scrub, in the same room, with just the paper knickers on but hey, if you're all friends together, who cares. The ladies doing the scrub were professional and courteous at all times and made us feel relaxed. After the Hammam, we were taken upstairs for our massage in the same room and the ladies worked in sync with each other, making sure we all started and finished our treatments together. The massage was so relaxing, that I fell asleep. It was just wonderful. So much so that I did not want to get off the massage bed. I felt all the tension drain from my body and didn't want to do anything else that day but being near to the medina, shopping was a must before our departure back to the UK. After the spa we had a lovely Moroccan lunch and of course the famous Moroccan mint tea on the terrace upstairs, in a private area. I can honestly say that this was one of the best spas I have been to and will definitely return again in the near future. This spa was recommended to me by a friend and I have since recommended 'Hammam Rosa Bonheur' to many others.Definitely one not to be missed :)

A must while in Marrakech!. My husband and I made an appointment here for a couples massage and black sand scrub with dinner for our honeymoon. Though I have visited a variety of spas/ baths / and massages this was my first time at a hammam so I can't really compare the experience. What I can say is that the staff was very helpful and friendly. Samir, one of the staff members, met us at a local landmark and walked us about 5 min or so through the streets and alleyways to the hammam entrance as it is difficult to find. Samir was a great host and so much fun. He was friendly and helped us feel welcomed over mint tea and cookies while we waited to begin our hammam experience. We were happy to see him reappear at dinner as he attended to us during our meal. Oh and bring a swimsuit. I made the assumption that we would be nude as that was my experience at other saunas and in fact, if you don't bring a swimsuit they ask that you were a little paper thong. This was not a big deal but my husband and I spent a good ten min laughing at each others "new undergarments". We were feeling pretty ridiculous. We were able to schedule a couples experience which was nice and went through the whole process together. The scrub is good and not too abrasive,...(not like a salt scrub at the Korean spa) . The best part was the massage. It was really thorough and lasted about 90 min. At the end of our massage we were offered our dinner on the terrace which was a great end to the day. We scheduled our services for the evening which was great after a long day of walking the souks. Dinner was great and was several courses of traditional Moroccan flare. Overall our experience lasted about 4 hours and we left feeling rejuvenated and refreshed. Thank you again!

Couldn't have asked for more!. Just came back to our hotel from probably the most relaxing afternoon of my life! My boyfriend and I got the €80 hammam and massage package and we were not disappointed. The welcome is friendly and (after mint tea) we were whisked downstairs to the hammam. The black soap, scrub and mud treatment were amazing and the staff were friendly and professional. After we were lead upstairs for a massage (the hard one is excellent!). Also, you don't have to bring anything with you (they even give you little paper pants, but be aware your top half will be naked!).The treatments were wonderful but the staff were second to none. We had only booked about two hours before and yet they were very flexible and let us change our package. The welcome couldn't have been warmer and the icing on the cake was we got a literal free lunch. As we left the massage they just kindly offered to feed us anyway, and what a lunch! It was delicious, up on the terrace, and we felt so spoiled!Finally the young man who works there sat drinking mint tea with us for almost an hour and we had a great chat about all sorts. We felt at home and didn't want to leave! Nobody rushed us and we ended up staying from 12pm-5pm, only leaving to explore the city.What a perfect treat, I would recommend to everyone and will be back!

An experience not to be missed!. My fiancé and I visited today after having booked yesterday by email. We booked the special deal of hammam and massage. We were met outside Cafe de France in Jamal al Fna and accompanied to the Rosa Bonheur (don't try to find it alone). We were greeted by Miriam, who explained everything over mint tea. We had never had a hammam before but it was a great experience not to be missed, followed by a fantastic massage using argan oil and facial.The girls who attempted to us were lovely and very professional as were Miriam and Samir. We wouldn't hesitate to go back again and thoroughly recommend. Thank you Miriam and Samir for making us feel thoroughly rejuvenated.

Absolute bliss. My 21 year old daughter and I both had FOUR-HANDS massages... The whole team were so welcoming... They met us from our taxi, gave us delicious refreshments... And as for the massages - absolute bliss!! They even rang me the next day to say they had overcharged us by mistake and they sent someone to our riad with the money! We hope to return one day...

Perfect relaxing afternoon. I went with my aunt to the Hammam Rosa Bonheur. We got the €80 hammam and massage package which was positively divine. The staff were kind and professional. I think this hammam is a good intermediary between the traditional and spa -style hammam. It's a little tricky to find but worth it!
Friendly and unique. A great experience and a must when visiting Marrakesh . I had the package and the staff were friendly and professional. Ask for directions as impossible to find...

Amazing introduction to a Hammam. I visited the Hammam on May 27th with my Mum and sister. We were met outside Café France and walked to the Hammam (as others have said, attempting it on your own is difficult...we had attempted it the day before). After some mint tea and amazing homemade biscuits we had the Hammam, massage and foot scrub package. The ladies were lovely and very considerate as I wasn't totally comfortable with the naked aspect of the Hammam! The massage was really long and very relaxing as was the foot scrub. After a quick shower to remove some of the oil we went downstairs for some more tea before being walked back towards our Riad. All of the staff were lovely and welcoming and made it an amazing and relaxing experience at the end of our stay in Morocco!

Fantastic spa . First and foremost this spa is excellent do not hesitate to go. I went today with my partner and we enjoyed the 1hr30 special offer massage with a meal. The massage was lovely and you can choose how hard this is. The meal was lovely and u can easily treat this as a dinner and go the rest of the day without anything. The soup was fabulous, the best I have had for a while. The service was exceptional. We were treated not like customers but guests and when we left we were invited to go back for tea at any point, such a lovely touch. Please note the spa is hard to locate, but they will arrange to meet u in the main square and take you there to put your mind at ease. In tempted to go back again before my holiday is over, the service was that good.

Fantastic!! . My boyfriend and I visited it today and had the massage,facial and meal for 720Dh each. Worth every penny!! we got picked up outside café France (don't try to find the place yourself you will get lost) were welcomed by very friendly people who we chatted with and had tea. Had an amazing massage in a joint room with a really good facial /leg scrub. Very relaxing and no rushing. Took a quick shower to wash off some of the oil and then sat out on the terrace in the shade to have a fabulous three course meal.They did all they could to make your stay the most enjoyable, we ended up being there for a total of 4h45.Would recommend highly

Fab hammam. We were staying at samira riads and took the 80 Euro hammam, foot and massage package.Personally met and walked from the main square to the spa so as not to get lost. Greeted with mint tea (as is standard), picked our treatments and then fell into 2 hrs 10 mins of relaxation. It was pretty much an all over massage, and I was in the room with my friend who was getting the same treatments. Very relaxing, very good, and worth every penny

Awesome experience. My husband and I went and were welcomed by the friendly staff and the owner was a delight , we had a great time and would recommend the place for a great experience of relaxation Hope to go back soon Sarah

Sarah. this was a fabulous experience for my birthday the staff were attentive excellent Hammam and massage although we only paid for 2 hours we were given 3 if you visit Marrakech this is a must on your to do list. Staff are attentive and fabulous next time I am in Marrakech will definitely be going back

Sustained excellence. I have been to this hammam several times to try the various services offered. To my delight, the experience was once again professional and pleasurable. Each staff member is friendly, and works to ensure you receive a quality service. Definitely, a well run business, ensuring the client receives an excellent experience and value. Thanks!

Best Hammam ever!. We went to Rosa Bonnheur in our first day in Marrakech and we enjoyed it so much that we had to go back again before our trip ended. Hammam and massage 2h package is worth every penny. Hammam is managed by the charming Samira who, with her dedicated and very friendly staff really made us feel at home and paradise at the same time. Will defenitely come back next time in Morocco (Insha'Allah)Big hug to Samira, Achbarou and rest of the crew.

Excellent hammam. I visited this hammam with friends and highly recommend it for its friendly staff the excellent service. We had a back and neck massage which was amazing; very relaxing. We had the hammam black soap scrub again a very rejuvenating and relaxing experience. I would highly recommend this hammam. One of the really friendly workers met us at cafe France and showed us how to get there.

Perfect hamman and meal. We really loved the hamman experience and if we'd had longer in Marrakech we would have been back for more. We had the special with the 2h 30 treatments and the meal. The food was beautiful and traditional.The therapists doing the treatments are amongst the best I have ever had and special mention for Samir who really looked after us with the dinner and was very interesting about his heritage. Samira, the owner, has a really hands on approach and as a result she has a fabulous, well run hamman that really hits the spot. We were a bit dubious about meeting their staff at a set location but that was unfounded. They met us on time and had a leaflet so we knew it was them. I would highly recommend.

Must Do in Marrakech. Make some time to visit this wonderful spa. The staff there are wonderful and have an infectious attitude. There is absolutely no clock watching here. The quality of the treatments are also superb. My only little tidbit is to make sure you ask questions about the flow, the girls only speak French and understanding what they need you to do can be tricky sometimes (this matters only if you don't speak French obviously).

Beautiful relaxing time. Fantastic massage. Not the cheapest in Marrakech but worth every penny. We had a body scrub in the sauna and gorgeous relaxing massage using argon oil. Was approx 2 1/2 hours from start to finish, the most relaxing time ever. Greeted with mint tea and biscuits we chose our treatments and were surprised when we were told we could be massaged together as this isn't traditional in Morocco. Staff were very friendly. Would return if ever in Marrakech again.

Wonderful experience, professional staff. My wife, her cousin, and I all appreciated the wonderful treatment by the staff at Hammam Rosa Bonheur. Yassine met us at the Palais Bahia and took us into the hammam, and from there we experienced a wonderful massage, an incredible feast of food, and a much-needed spa day. None of us had ever been to a hammam before, and the staff was accommodating and welcoming to us. We couldn't believe how relaxing the massage and hammam were! We did the 95 euro package, and it is well worth the cost and the time (around 4-5 hours). We spent a great day at Rosa Bonheur and we hope to return if we are ever in Marrakech again!

Felt personally welcomed into my first hammam experience. Wow - was very impressed by the welcoming and calming environment of this hammam! It was my last day in Marrakech and I had not reserved in advance - I ended up finding this one and trying it out, not having any idea what to expect. Samir, one of the Riad's managers, met me and my fiance in the main square to help escort us into the quiet and cool Riad. Samir welcomed us in and offers of mint tea and cookies, and Samira the hostess helped explain what the hammam would be like since this was my first time. I was escorted down to the warm stone hammam area and offered a changing area. I had the place to myself. A woman started off with a black soap massage, left me a couple minutes to steam, massaged off all my dead skin (so cool!), then put on a masque. Afterwards when I went back upstairs to join my fiance I was offered a complementary foot bath/massage of rose and mint while drinking mint tea. I was so pleased with the whole show that I said "I need to get myself one of those scrubbing mitts!" and they gave me one for free! (Plus a complementary bottle of argan oil!) All in all I was super impressed and would recommend this experience in particular to first-timers. Thanks again Samir, Samira, and all of the hammam staff.

Very personal and fantastic. I searched all over for a good Hammam. So many reviews reported poor service or being herded like cattle inside of them. All reviews pointed to this place and I am so happy I listened. Pros: 1. My hammam was by myself. There were two rock slabs in the room so I imagine people could go together but I am happy I didn't have to.2. The attendants are attentive and respectful. They aren't just throwing water on you and scrubbing your skin off.3. The room was warm but there is a barrier between your skin and the rock.4. You're given a robe and plush slippers during transition from the hammam to the massage. 5. Massage is great but not for the modest. I'm sure you can be specific on areas to avoid, though. 6. There is a clean, modern shower to use after you're done. 7. Prices are very reasonable compared to other places and when you take personalization into count.8. You can pay in Euros or Moroccan dirham.9. My skin felt amazing after. I didn't even want to wash off the massage oil because I felt so rejuvenated. Con:1. This place is hard to find BUT if you email them they will meet you at Cafe France or somewhere in the main square to walk you over which is great.Overall, I left here feeling like a princess and will most definitely return if I am anywhere near Morocco.

Overall amazing experience at this hammam. Very freindly staff, excellent service and massages were superb. I went there twice in two days. Goes to show I was completely satisfied from the warm welcome to the complete Morrocan spa experience.

Fantastic place. Hidden in the back streets of Marrakech, I was very fortunate to have found this great hammam. Went there twice having the massage and hammam with scrub. Brilliant prices as were the people. They were incredibly friendly, made you feel right at home without the false pretensions of grand spas. Definitely would recommend to all and would go again

Peaceful, tranquil setting with fantastic treatments!. We spent a lovely relaxing afternoon at the Hammam Rosa Bonheur on 16th April for my husband’s 40th birthday. We both had the traditional hammam beldi black soap scrub followed by the argan oil massage, which were amazing and left us totally relaxed and with baby smooth skin. The place was beautiful, peaceful and very welcoming – you can never tell what you are going to find behind a door in Marrakech!!! As a couple we were able to be in the same rooms receiving the same treatments at the same time which is not standard for many hammam’s but is available at this one. We were able to prearrange a meeting place with someone from the hammam and he was very helpful and chatty and offered us mint tea and biscuits on arrival and afterwards. There is certainly no clock watching here as both our treatments went on for longer than the advertised times. I would highly recommend this hammam and would love to return there some day.

Highly recommended - a wonderful experience!. After reading some great reviews about this Hammam, myself & my partner booked in for a treatment for our last day in Marrakech. It was also our first time doing a traditional Hammam. We combined our treatment with the hour long body massage afterwards & it was all amazing! We both said it was the best massage we've ever had. Everyone was lovely and friendly & we were treated to yummy tea & biscuits before & after the treatments. We left feeling totally relaxed & wishing we didn't have to leave that day.Thank you Samira & your team (i'm coming back next time i'm in Morroco!) :-)

Pleasure and relaxation at its best!. WOW! All I can say is WOW! I just experienced the most amazing half day of pampering at Hammam Rosa Bonheur, in Marrakesh medina. Just a short walk from Cafe France, this hammam and spa rivals any I've visited in Marrakesh or the U.S. It is a beautiful, clean facility, where you are made to feel at home upon arrival. The quiet, intimate surroundings immediately put you at ease. The spa offers a variety of services and special packages. I decided to splurge and went for the deluxe hammam and spa package, with a traditional Moroccan meal. It was an excellent value for the price. I would recommend visiting Samira, Myriam and Salah, and experience a couple of hours of pure relaxation and pleasure at Hammam Rosa Bonheur, Ana bezzaf farhana!

A definite must. Sometimes when a place comes highly recommended on trip advisor your expectations can be incredibly high, fortunately neither my husband nor i were disappointed when we visited the hammam on th 7th April and had the special treatment for couples which included the black soap scrub, the best massage ever and finally a delightful meal. It is such a shame that this hammam isn't nearer to where I live as I would go frequently.

Fantastic morning!. Was here with my fiancé and another couple. We all had the special package deal and it was more than value for money! We were there for almost four hours after Salah met us in the main square. Tea and biscotti on arrival, lovely relaxing massage and facial, great scrub in the hammam, followed by fantastic 3-course lunch with wine on the roof terrace. All the staff were friendly and professional. Full marks!

A hammam experience not to be missed.... It was fantastic, my husband & I visited and had the most wonderful hammam experience. We were collected at the main square by the manager who spoke fluent English. We were made to feel at home from the minute we arrived, the attention and service we received was superb. I couldn't recommend it highly enough and we felt we got excellent value for money.

Ahmazing experience. I visited Hammam Rosa Bonheur on 26th March after a day sightseeing they were able to fit me in the evening at late notice (Riad initially contacted my first choice Heritage spa fortunately there was no availability). On arrival I was given minted tea, I was then taken downstairs to the steam room firstly water was poured over my body which felt like heaven. I cant remember the exact order but I was scrubbed with black soap and then separately a mask was applied to my body both products were left on my body for a set time before being washed off. After the second application the steam room heated up and got quite hot. Following this I was taken upstairs for a full body Argain oil massage with relaxing music playing in the background, this lasted for roughly one hour. The only minor complaints that I have was the background noise which was partly due to a 60th birthday celebration that was being held at venue. Following my treatments the group that were celebrating invited me to join them we ate cake, we danced and were entertained by the staff and a belly dancer. This was the perfect ending to an amazing first day.I left with a free bottle of Argan oil i'm unsure if this is standard or due to the party that was taking place. Yassine was lovely and after the party he walked me back to my Riad. Following this treatment my skin felt baby soft, I would definitely recommend Hammam Rosa Bonheur.

Magic experience . This experience is why we love TripAdvisor. After reading all the reviews we could not expect anything but a 5 star treatment and that is what we got. We booked the full 95euro treatment with massage facial Hammam and dinner and this was truly wonderful. We were first greeted by tea and homemade biscuits which allowed us to get comfortable before the Hammam (first time!), and we're made to feel extremely welcome by Samira and her team. Next we started our range of treatments which were set in the authentic Riad in all privacy. The massage in particular was excellent and felt like it lasted forever! Even our less adventurous Italian parents for who we had organised this as a surprise loved all the treatments. After almost 3 hours of relaxation we ate a beautiful dinner on the rooftop terrace under moonlight-again in all privacy, accompanied by a beautiful maroccan wine. The whole experience left us so happy we joined Samira and the team for a dinner and drinks the next evening in one of their other Riads, which again did not disappoint. Next time we are in marrakech we are planning to rent a room with her and her team to again relive this true maroccan hospitality. Thank you Samira, and especially the team, for making our days in marrakech so wonderful!

so fresh and so clean. Clean and nice Hammam. It's a bit tricky to find since it is in the medina hidden in a small way. Who doesn't like to have the adventure of finding the way, may either contact the hammanm and get picked up by the staff or just ask one of the youngsters hanging around in the suks to guide you.The staff is very friendly, the prices are reasonable and we enjoyed the treatment a lot. We took the hammam and gommage for 25€/45min. The whole complex is very clean, the staff left a professional impression on us. All in all, we can recommend to go there and would visit again.
perfect. Me and my friend really enjoyed of hammam and massage! Special thanks to amazing Yassine who was very friendly and made us feel welcomed and wanted.

Great hammam experience. Myself and my friend had an excellent time at this spa. We were met by the wonderful Yassine who took us to the spa, gave us tea and talked us through everything.We both had the 1.30 hour relaxing massage which really was just that! The girls that performed the massage were kind and professional and clearly experienced.I also had the full hammam experience which was just wonderful. The hammam is completely private and the girl that did mine was very respectful and sweet, My skin was left beautifully soft for over a week.I also had a hammam and massage at a 4 star hotel in Casablanca and it was disappointing in comparison. This spa is clean, professional and very friendly.Thanks you to all of the staff at this spa.Ayesha

Best place for a massage in Marrakech!. We were a bit nervous about meeting a person we had never met before in front of Palais Bahia and then being taken to the spa for our massages, but after our experience I am so glad we did. In a city that can sometimes be difficult and intimidating to tourists Salah and his team at the Hammam Rosa made us feel welcome and comfortable. The masseurs new what they were doing and did it with skill. The Riad that the spa is in is a bit difficult to fine (hence the need for Salah to retrieve us from a more obvious location) but beautiful and welcoming. The room was staged neatly and was very warm. We were welcomed with tea and biscuits and felt so relaxed after our couples aragan oil massages. A must do in Morocco.

Amazing Hamman and Evening!!. This was booked through previous trip advisor reviews and we honestly couldn't fault it, it was a wonderful relaxing evening compared to the busy bustling streets of Marrakech. The staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English and the riad was beautifully decorated and presented which made the experience feel all the more authentic. The Hamman was excellent and extremely good value for money considering the time spent, we had a 2.5 hour treatment and felt very clean and relaxed afterwards! We then were presented with a 3 course delicious traditional Moroccan dinner Which also happened to coincide with one of the staff members birthdays. They included us in their celebration and we had delecioys birthday cake to follow! Thank you for making us feel so welcome and walking us back to the main square it was much appreciated and we had a fantastic evening!! I would highly recommend this experience!!

Absolutely amazing! True Bliss. Me and a friend went for a hammam and then a full body massage which was a decently priced deal, it was worth every penny! If you go for a hammam it's better to spend a little more and get a really good experience than save a couple pennies and get a sub-par hammam and massage. The hammam here was a private 2 person hammam, I do have to say they reallllllly scrub you down, I had so much dead skin! But you feel as smooth as a baby's bottom after! Everyone was very accommodating, always asking if the temperature was ok and were very polite. Be warned though they do scrub just about everywhere and you wear a cloth mesh underwear thing! The massage was beautiful! The argan oil mix they used was absolutely luscious! The massage tables are 2 metres away from the hammam room so it's all nice and private still.The only trouble might've been going to a different riad as these owners have several riads on opposite ends of the medina, I was using the Tripadvisor App and it thought it was in the other riad. But if you call ahead they can arrange to meet you in the square and from there it's only a 10min walk, no charge either! We did have to put all our belonging and clothes in a basket and leave them in a room but everything was the same when we went back to change :)Truly an amazing experience, I never wanted to leave! thanks!

Love the Riad! Love the Hammam!. This experience is worth a trip to Marrakech. The Hamman is located in one of the Samira Riads. So I book a few days in the riad and enjoy the Hamman at least once (or twice) while visiting Marrakech. The very competent staff is genuinely friendly and dedicated to the guests relaxation and pleasure. Prices are very reasonable. I have visited twice and will return often.

Wonderful Moroccan Bath Experience. I really thank Yassin and Meriem for this warm wonderful experience. The staff puts all their efforts to have genuine moroccan bath experience. Reasonable price for couples. My wife and I enjoyed it. The massage is the best I ever had. Don't hesitate to go and try it.

Great Hammam and lovely staff!. A special mention to Yassine and Rim, Naima and Aicha for a welcoming and enjoyable experience in this very homely Hammam.The hospitality was first class as was the treatment, it was our first experience of a Hammam and one we are not likely to forget for some time! We still feel clean and scrubbed some weeks later!They were especially lovely to my girlfriend and she enjoyed the experience immensely! We can whole-heartedly recommend Rosa Bonheur for a Hamman experience in Marrakech.

A must try!. Warm and friendly people. We tried the traditional massage and hammam. Obviously the hammam is a must try if you are visiting Morocco. They were very accomodating and sincere and were in no hurry to finish the therapy which is very important when you are going to have a relaxing time. Got a gift from them at the end which was really sweet of them.

Wonderful. Came here this afternoon for the 95 euro deal including lunch. Everything was perfect, the ham am, massage, facial, lunch & wine. Met one of the lady owners who was lovely. If we came back to Marrakech we would look at staying at one of her four roads. Booking was easy & a member of staff met us at a central location as although not far from the square, it is difficult to find. Definitely recommended

Good hammam experience: small, professional and with privacy. If you want a basic experience (e.g. peeling, washing, thorough massage 550 MDH, count some 3 hours) without much of a fancy environment but plenty of privacy this place is perfect – ideal also as a "first" hammam experience. It's clean, the young staff extremely charming and hospitable and the gommage and Moroccan massage thorough and generous! They can also organize a meal in addition, or a person for a natural hennah (some 50 MDH). Yassim came to pick us up at our Riad and he even organized a transport back to the airport one early morning (150 MDH), very reliable and pleasant. Thank you for the overall lovely experience!

Tremendous experience.. I had almost exactly the same experience as the recent reviewer sdenttasker and I do not propose to rehearse it save to say that it was worth all we paid and although there were cheaper packages I do not regret any componant. I had not been to the city since I was a teenager and was intent on having a go at so much of what I discovered later I had missed. This is not a super flash spa but the service and staff are as good as anything I have ever tried anywhere else. Highly recommended.

Wow what an amazing experience!. First time in a hammam -- wow! I felt like a baby but got sooooooo clean....The massage was perfect -- one of the best I've had.I got the package with Hammam, Massage, Facial, and Dinner. I highly recommend it!!It is a little tricky to find. Off of the "main road" just past the little square with the italian restaurant (towards the palaces), take a little right onto a side road that has a sign for another riad. Go forward 10 feet and turn right until you get to the end of the little road and turn left and the hammam is about 3/4 of the way down the street on the left. You will have to be right to the door to see it. It was a quiet but safe area.

Great couples hammam. We visited in late January and had an amazing time, from being met and walked to the riad through to a delicious late lunch on the roof terrace. The hammam experience was wonderful (but I do recommend taking your own swimwear if you don't fancy the tiny paper pants) and the massage was as good as anything I've had anywhere in the world. A really indulgent, relaxing and delicious experience. Can't recommend it too highly.

Extremely wonderful. I have visited Marrakech many times during the last 4 years and experienced the traditional hammam and massage but not to compare with Hammam Rosa Bonheur. It is really a must to visit riad al ralia and its amazing spa and tasty traditional meals, specially the wonderful staff with their friendly welcoming. I highly recommand the hammam and the massage specially with the nice product they are using as pure argan oil and with the magical atmosphere and the experienced masseuse u will be more than relaxed, u will be pampered top to toe."Hammam Rosa Bonheur" is a wonderful experience not to be missed if u are visiting Marrakech.I adore this place it has a special magical unique spirit... ❤️❤️❤️

Worth a visit... Very nice traditional experience.They set up a spa within their Riad and the technic is really good. Do not expect luxury but clean, friendly traditional service. Good luck finding this place without the help of Yassine!

Lovely, lovely evening.. I had booked via email for my partner and I to have the Hammam and massage followed by a meal at the Riad.With so many establishments offering treatments it's difficult to know which to choose but from the moment we met Yassine outside the Palace Bahia, we were confident in our choice.The Riad is down some very narrow alleys off a Souk in the South of the Medina.On entering you are in a charming lounging are with an open log fire... Evenings in February are cold!We were taken downstairs to change and into the Hammam . Sluiced and soaped and left to simmer on a low heat. The warmth and steamy heat are very relaxing ... But next ... A very vigorous rubbing down with rough mitten, imagine a Brillo pad, leaving every inch of your skin exfoliated. Followed my more sluicing down. If that doesn't get your blood circulating, nothing will!We then went up stairs for a massage. Unlike any massage I've ever had. Over one and a half hours of total relaxation . No more £75 for a back massage at the spa for me. Every muscle and every bone was tweaked and attended to. When the masseuse eventually whispered that she had finished , I looked at my watch. We had arrived at 5pm , it was now 8pm. Where had the time gone? We had been advised to leave most of the oil on, if possible,as it would continue to benefit our skin. There was a nice bathroom if you wanted to shower.It was then back downstairs where a table had been laid for us by the fire.We ate salads and olives, a wonderful Morrocan soup and then tagines. Followed by oranges and cinnamon. Wine is available to purchase. We paid just over 2000 drhms for a wonderfully relaxing experience.Lovely, small establishment with wonderful staff.Very highly recommended.

Wonderful experience, not to be missed if you are in Marrakech. My wife and I had never visited a hamman and I can certainly say it was an experience not to be missed. We went for the whole package of 95 euros and it was worth every penny. Top to toe pampering and a very tasty meal at the end. Very friendly and welcoming people and I would highly recommend a visit.

Extremely pampered afternoon. Having researched several hamams in our immediate area, we found this gem. More expensive that your usual, but if you are a couple and don't relish spending time in separate areas, then go for this. Spent over 3 hours being pampered by extremely courteous ladies, nothing was too much trouble. Took combined meal package-excellent soup/salad/beef tagine - only wish we could have stayed longer but our flight called. Big thank you to all and especially Yacine for his gentle hospitality.

Great value for money. My girlfriend, her brother, her parents and I booked the 95 euro special offer package. This included facial, full body massage and hammam.The whole experience was different but amazing. Her dad didn't want to go but absolutely loved it! I would suggest everyone to try a hammam whilst in Morocco and if you do you cant go wrong here. They are very friendly, welcoming and professional.

Best incredible hammam. We chose to get an hour and a half fleur d'oranger massage. It was absolutely incredible. I don't use to really like massage but this time was fantastic and so relaxing. Unfortunately I lost a bracelet that was very dear to me. Samira (who I think is in charge of the hamman) was caring so much about this whole lost story. When I got back to England, I got a text from Samira telling me she found the bracelet. Two days after I received it by mail. I got really moved by everyone's kindness and generosity. I would recommend this place to anyone in Marrakech. It is very clean and you feel at home. Next time I go back to Marrakesh I will run back to this place to get another massage and hug Samira!

Lives up to its reputation!. I too booked this place based on past reviews, and I am sure glad I did. I opted for the 2+ hour special with the meal. Yassine is a friendly, easy going guy, and met me enthusiastically in front of our meeting point at the Palais Bahia. He then escorted me, while hauling my luggage to the hammam about 5 minutes away.The facilities are very clean, but be warned that its hard to expect complete silence in the medina. Anyway, I was greeted by a couple staff members, and they welcomed me with some mint tea while setting my bags aside.I was taken upstairs to the massage room, where I was instructed to change into this skimpy looking thong and bathrobe. Then I made my way back downstairs into what was a narrow sauna room for the hammam. After being splashed with some water, I was told to lie on my stomach on one of the counters, and man those things are extra warm, almost burning. The masseuse proceeded to splash more water, as well as some oils on me. Then came the gritty part where she scrubbed off dead skin. A whole lot of it. Geez I didn't realize I had that much. The next phase was going back up to the first massage room, where the actual massage started. It was very soothing, and had me almost falling asleep multiple times. Next thing I knew, she was working on my facial, massaging my body with more creams and oils, and just like that the experience was over. Time flew by so quickly!The meal was also amazing. Soup, eggplant salad, chicken tajine, and oranges with cinnamon made for a great last meal before leaving Marrakech. I was allowed to hang out for awhile after, and also drink more tea. Yassine then helped me take my bags to my taxi, and that was that.Great experience, great staff, and great food. Hammams are a must when visiting Maarakech, and I recommend Rosa Bonheur!

Highly recommend. Went to this hamman based on the reviews on here, didn't disappoint, echo all the 5 star reviews. We went for the 95 euro package, lots of pampering and scrubbing, got to stay together at all times (good as couple) food was some of the best we ate in Marrakech.
Excellent service. I went this January with my girlfriend it was a really good experience, I love the service and the price is really accessible. I will do it again

Amazing experience!. I was looking for a hammam that could accommodate 6 people in the evening and sent them an email the night before I wanted to book. They were so responsive and even called me at my hotel to explain in more detail the different package options. We ended up booking for the following night and they offered to meet us at a central location in the main square so we wouldn't get lost. The whole experience there was amazing. Everyone was so warm and welcoming. The services and food were great- we did a package deal. It was by far the best meal we had on our journey and definitely best massages ever. This night truly made our whole trip! My only regret is that I didn't stay in their riad and spend more time there.

Very nice and warm welcome . First of all I want to thank Yannis the guy who took us from the cafe France. Very nice and polite guy for somebody who comes from the desert, you have a nice good person working there for you.Thanks for the tea and delicious sweets if I didn't stop I could eat more and more..Thanks to the lovely ladies who scrubbed us and then to the ladies who give us a proper good massage, it was a long time since had a good massage. Especially thanks to my lady who had asthma.It was a very good day to celebrate our anniversary, everybody and everything was perfect.Thanks a lot again, we will be back. Joe and Mike
Lovely . I have the best hammam and massage. All staff is very friendly and lovely. I am so happy. Everything was perfect. Thank you very much.

Absolute bliss! . Amazing! What an experience. Husband and I had joint treatment 2.30hr special. Thoroughly recommend. 45 min soap and scrub in hammam, then 1.30hr massage and facial. Never felt so pampered in my whole life and as a 44 year old woman I've had a few spa treatments in my life but this beats them all! Lovely friendly staff and great food.

Exquisite. We have just returned from this beautiful hammam, well oiled, clean and totally relaxed. A great experience in a grimy city. As others have said, this is an oasis of tranquility, wonderful warmth of welcome and delightful service from beginning to end. It is impossible to find on your own but that is part of the discrete privacy this establishment offers. My only regret is that we are not staying in one of Samira's Riads as there is an exclusive New Year party tonight for all her guests. I am sure the Riads are as tasteful and comfortable as the Hammam and would definately stay in one if I came back to Marrakech. Happy New Year and thank you.

Best ever!!!. I don't know where to start! Came across the great reviews so called up and was met by Maryam (Reem) at cafe France and taken to the hammam. Beautiful riad with a great welcoming. Had picked the hour and a half package and this did not disappoint! Scrubbed down so well and massage was just on point!! Absolutely perfect! Asked if wanted relaxing massage or deep tissue and went for a nice deep tissue massage.After the amazing hammam and massage, we could not stop having a laugh with Samirah, Simo (Fish) and Mariyam! Mint tea after mint tea and even ended up staying for food, which by the way was the best food I had while in Morocco, and hosted by the best people I have met in Morocco! Can not say enough positive things about the family and the service and can only say you have to visit Rosa Bonheur and this will make your trip! Can't wait to go back and just want to say a huge thank you to everyone for the most amazing comforting time! A special shout out to Aisha who was excellent!I don't normally do reviews but on this occasion it is the least I can do and I had to let everyone know the reviews are so true!! :) x

A romantic half day experience!. My wife and I booked the 95 euro package, having seen the wonderful reviews, particularly recently. We've just got back to our riad and I must say, this has been the highlight of our tour so far, and well worth the money. What you get here is far more than a massage - it is half a days relaxation and dining experience. It starts with Yassine picking you up at palais balia and taking you to the riad. Then after some snacks you have the hammam. My wife was pregnant but Riam and the staff fully catered to making her as comfortable as possible throughout our stay - they even gave us a private room for the hammam so I could make sure she was ok. The massage was then also excellent, as was the facial (so my wife tells me - it was my first!). Then came the extraordinary part - just as you think you'll be hurried along, Yassine serves you a wonderful without a shadow of a doubt the best tagine we have ever had - we had the beef and the vegetable. Felt a little guilty that we stayed so long but Yassine was having none of it and even carried our entire meal downstairs after it got a little chilly outside, and put extra wood on the fire, to truly make us feel at home. Compliments to Yassine, our 2 masseuses, the cook and Riam - we both thoroughly recommend this package. Well done! And to husbands/boyfriends whose partners need a little love, this is an excellent find!

Our very first experience of Hammam. It was suggested by our Sahara's tour guide. It didn't disappoint us (Since it was our first time, we couldn't really compare with others and also don't know what to expect). The location was quite difficult to find but at the end with the help with the local and google map, we were able to manage to find it out. Otherwise, you could always call, they would always get someone to pick you up. It was in a small but cozy riad. The Masseurs were very professional. I feel very clean and all the dirts on my body gone after the heavy scrub! Although I think the waiting time in the sauna room was a bit too long after the black soap (before the scrub). So be aware that some are waiting time in the 45 min that is listed on the price list. The body massage and facial message were both very good. I enjoyed it a lot! It is highly recommended to have a short escape after walking & shopping in the busy and packed Marrakech!

Excellent service!. We would like to thank spa rosa bonheur for the unforgettable experience.We have booked hammam and 1h massage for a couple and it was romantic, professional and an experience to be repeated any time again.The staff was very friendly and welcoming and the service provided was of a very high standard!Even though we were almost 30 min, spa representative waited for us in the previously agreed meeting spot and we got the full service at the set price anyway without any complaints.Thank you
Amazing experience. Warm and welcoming place. Treated us like royalty. If you're visiting Marrakech then please make sure you go to this place. Such a friendly place with amazing services

Amazing!. This place is absolutely amazing and was definitely the highlight of our trip. We went for the hammam experience package (2.5 hrs plus lunch) which in its own right was mind blowing. It was nice to be looked after by the two wonderful 'hammam ladies' and then to have lunch prepared and served to us afterwards. Samira and Yassine in particular were extremely hospitable. When they learned I was there for a birthday trip, they literally couldn't do enough for us! After a fabulous day, they invited us back later on that evening where they surprised me with a birthday cake, tea, biscuits and the works to celebrate my birthday with their son and family. They made us feel very welcome and part of the family. Unfortunately we hadn't booked to stay at their riad (hotel / guesthouse), but we will definitely be returning to stay with our new friends.

Amazing escape!. Amazing escape from the media, very warm welcome, headed down to the hammam rubbed and scrubbed, and then massaged. Thanks for the baby soft skin. Had an amazing time given tea and biscuits and a gift. Want to take them them all home. Thanks all will be back soon. :)

200%!! The perfect experience!. Similarly to the other clients before me, I chose Rosa Bonheur for its exceptional reviews & was also extremely impressed. Having already had a very traditional hammam with the local ladies in Chefchoen (North Morocco) and a massage in Essouaria, I already knew what to expect from my experience. I actually visited the hammam the day before my visit to check it out given the feedback about it being hard to find! It is definitely hard to find, however if you call them, the very friendly Yassine (gentleman) will come and collect you. Even on the day BEFORE my hammam I was treated to exceptional hospitality by the family who run the hammam and other riads close by. I got to meet the boss, Samira and her sister Myriam, Yassine, Fatima & Aicha. They were all incredibly warm, friendly, genuine and welcoming. An absolute delight!I then returned for my appointment the next day and it's safe to say that all my expectations were well exceeded. I booked the full 95€ package for 2.5 hours commencing at 11am and didn't leave until 4:30pm! I was the only client there so felt extremely special. I received the traditional hammam for 45 mins, a full body massage for 1hr 15mins & a facial for 30 mins. It was divine! I was given a robe and artificial underpants to wear during the entire treatment so you don't need to bring anything with you. The hammam warm room, massage room and the entire surroundings are very clean, sensual & inviting - perfect for relaxing. Included in the package is mint tea & biscuits on arrival, fresh orange juice after your hammam, a luxurious shower after all the treatments and a 3 course traditional Moroocan meal on the terrace to end. I could not have asked for a more perfect way to end my 3 weeks in Morrocco! Huge thanks and gratitude for everything. Fantastic value, don't think about it, just book it!

Incredible!!. Whilst this was extremely difficult to find (had to pay some Moroccan children a couple of Dirham to take us here) it was an absolute gem. Samira was absolutely lovely and offered a great package for us as it was my mother's birthday. We had a 1/2hour massage and 45 minute hammam. I was very nervous about the cleanliness of hammams but Rosa Bonheur was so clean and the aroma was amazing. We were offered some delicious mint tea and biscuits before going into the hammam. We had some scrubs massaged into us in the hammam which was lovely. The ladies were really nice and kept checking that the temperature was okay. We then had a glass of fresh orange juice before having the best massage I have ever had!! My mother and I have traveled all around the world for massage treatments and this was by the far the best ever. I wish we had more time to have more treatments! Samira, her sister Maryam and a gentleman who I presume is her brother were all absolutely lovely. They were extremely caring and quite honestly the nicest people we had come across in the city! HIGHLY recommend a visit!!

First Hamam Experience. I ventured into this experience as a single male. I was given something resembling a thong to "cover" up, but the therapist is so liberal with adjusting it that it would have been better not to have to wear it at all. I did a standard black-soap scrub, which was amazing. At one point, the attendant took my hand to make me feel my own body and all the dirt and dead skin that had peeled off.The place is hard to find so I called and had someone meet me in front of Cafe de France in Jamaa el Fna.I enjoyed talking to the two young men in the waiting area as well. I drank plenty of tea and ate little biscuits.
What a treat!. Lovely hammam with great services and an absolute top massage from Fatima. The scrub was very thorough taking all the dead skin off and leaving us soft as a baby. Thank you!!!

amazing experience!. We booked this hammam for their good reviews in this site and it didn't dissapointed! It was a wonderful experience, the staff was very kind, polite and extra professional, let yourself in their hands for as long as you can, you'll never regret!

Wonderful experience. We opted for the one and a half hour couples package with hammam, massage and 3 course lunch. It was perfect way to relax and take a break from the madness of the medina. Exceptional value for money too!

Blissful retreat. As part of our visit to Marrakech, my friend and I wanted to try a hammam and it turned out to be the perfect escape from the business of the medina. We were met at a landmark and taken to the hammam, where we were offered mint tea before getting changed in a room which supplied dressing gowns. They do offer you the smallest paper pants imaginable but luckily we brought bikinis! It was fine to wear them, just be aware that they will want you to take the top off. They let you sweat in the steam room before washing you, applying the soap, sweating some more, the most vigorous scrub ever, a whole body mask, more sweating and more washing! You come out feeling cleaner than ever before, and completely renewed. We followed this with an argan oil massage - ask for a relaxing one if you don't like it too hard! Great service and a really relaxing few hours.

Amazing!. We went this week for my husband's birthday. We had the couples package for an hour and a half with dinner on the terrace after.Yassine met us at Bahia Palace and took us up there.They had a room for us to get changed and gowns and slippers. I had taked a spare pair of pants but my husband only had giant boxers so had to wear the disposable pants they gave him. Paper banana hammock held together with string!!!! I just felt sorry for the ladies!The treatment started in the steam room with a rub down, a very vigorous scrub and then a mud mask. Then we moved on to the massage. We had a choice of relaxation or invigorating and chose relaxing. I have had a couple of massages before and this was heaven. My husband thought it was the best ever.After a bit of a relax we got dressed and went up to the terrace and had aubergine salad, harisa soup, bread, chicken tagine and some lovely moroccan wine.Overall a fantastic visit and we would highly recommend it.

Just perfect.. We recently visited and had the special 2.5 hr hammam/massage/facial package with lunch included. It was a wonderful afternoon and I highly recommend it. We ended up being at the Spa for around 4.5hrs total - such a good way to spend a day in frenetic Marrakech! The hammam itself was wonderful - the scrub was amazing and I felt so clean afterwards! Definitely worthwhile to get the 95 euro package - the value for money was excellent. The meal was delicious too and a perfect way to finish off a great afternoon.

An excellent little Hammam. I chose this Hammam from the good reviews they had and I was not disappointed. It is tucked away in a small Riad in the Medina, so it was good to be guided there by Yassin. The gommage, rhassoul and massage were excellent - absolutely the best! Highly recommed it!

Relax!. Arrived in Marrakech on the overnight train and I knew that my first day here would be a bit overwhelming. My afternoon at Rosa was a perfect getaway from the noise and chaos of the streets. Talked hubby into going with me and he really enjoyed it. We had the 95 euro per person special--warm spa, wash, pumice scrub, more basking in the heat, massage and facial with lunch too. It's a bit pricey compared to some but so worth it. We were there for 3+ hours and left with soft and scented skin ready to face Marrakech. Btw, hubby says he only visits spas in Marrakech so I guess he's up for this on our next trip here!

If Carlsberg did Morrocan hammams........ Very difficult to find. Book before you go and they will meet you in the square. We had full body hammam and 1 hour massage it was 1300mad. We had the treatment together by two women who were lovely. Very relaxing in the heart of the Medina. Cant really fault it, ignore the touted spas and book this one.

Heavenly treatment, delicious food, friendly staff. My friend and I visited the Hammam to get 2.5 hours of treatment and Moroccan lunch. Firstly, we accidentally went to the wrong Hammam (it was our fault) but it was no trouble - we were personally escorted to the right Hammam where tea and biscuits were waiting. The treatment was heavenly, and really very reasonably priced. Afterwards, the delicious food just kept on coming, and we spent an hour or so chatting with the very friendly staff. I would highly recommend this Hammam.

A very relaxing experience!. My niece and I opted for a Beldi soap scrub/hammam, followed by a back/neck massage. What a super choice! We were met in the main square and guided to the hammam and greeted there by the very friendly Yassin (apologies if I spelt your name incorrectly!) who gave us tea and biscuits and chatted to us until we were ready. The whole experience lasted over a good hour and you really get your monies worth. The massage was fantastic and my skin was left feeling smooth and fresh after the Beldi scrub. I am so glad we chose Rosa Bonheur and I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone!Thank you!

Amazing experience!. This was my first hammam and massage experience so I can't compare it to others, but I couldn't complain about a single thing. Everything was great! The host Yassine and my masseuse Fatima were really good and friendly. I went of all the previous reviews and wasn't disappointed. If your in marrakech, I highly recommend this place!

A relaxing haven. I got a head massage with my friend and it was amazing! There were two beds (so if you are a party of three, the third will have to wait), one shower, and a nice cozy little pool. Our friend who waited was served tea, cookies, and a plate of watermelon. They have wifi. They used argon oil for our backs, it smelled really good. I would highly recommend this place!

Super expérience. Great hammam, staff very friendly and welcoming. Pick up is arranged from the main square so no need to negotiate the winding street of Marrakech. A very relaxing way to while away the day!

Excellent Hammam with a Personal Touch. Was met at the Cafe de France by a lovely young man, as the actual place is very difficult to find. Upon arrival we were offered tea and morrocan biscuits. As a couple we were able to enjoy the experience together at the same time. The massage was one of the best I have ever had and I have had many. Everything is provided for you from slippers to robes etc. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Felt totally relaxed afterwards. Reasonably priced as well.

Great Hammam! True Relaxation!. So I decided to do the hammam experience and I enjoyed it very much. The hammam was private and luxurious unlike many other hammams. Everthing was immaculately clean which is a major plus! I highly recommend it for anyone who wants to truly experience Moroccan style relaxation while bathing. It is a very interesting experience that you will enjoy because I know I enjoyed it very much!!!! The quality is what makes it PERFECT!

Like being reborn. This is the only hammam experience we've ever had so I don't have much to compare it to, but we loved everything about this. We actually tried to find it ourselves, which unless you're extremely intrepid and not shy about knocking on doors (the place is totally unmarked from the outside, and you have to deduce its address), I'd definitely recommend arranging to have Yassine come get you and escort you to them.Yessine is a wonderful host. We went for the whole package which took about 2.5 hrs I think. The hammam was definitely an experience and feels like you're shedding so many layers of skin...my skin was softer for weeks afterwards! And then after, getting massaged expertly...when we emerged from the lower level where the experience takes place...you feel like you're coming out of the earth and being reborn! Then we had an incredible meal that was the best we had in Marrakech. Home cooking, authentic, and delicious! I was like a noodle by the time we left. A happy, well-rubbed and well-fed noodle. Recommend.

Very good indeed. Visited this hammam with my son on out last day at Marrakech and Marocco. It was indeed as good as promissed, but quite expensive if I compare it with my fellow travellers experiences. But if that is not an issue, send them an e-mail and let yourself be enchanted in this Marocc dream!

Best Massage I've ever had!. We were met in the square and taken to the Riad which is about 5 mins walk from cafe de France. The staff are very welcoming and ladies who do the hammam and massage are obviously dedicated to their work as the quality is worth every penny! We had dinner on the terrace to finish of a wonderful few hours and Yessin was a great host, very polite and keen to ensure you have a memorable visit. I have no hesitation in recommending Hammam Rosa Bonheur.
Excellent Hammam!. Very friendly, top-quality hammam! They came and picked us up at the Jeema El Fna, otherwise we would never have found it :)

Best massage ever. I had an amazingly relaxing few hours on my last day. Yassine met me in the square which is advisable as I'd never have found it otherwise. I was extremely well looked after by Yassine and had the treatments explained to me - which was a good job as I nearly ended up getting my nails done! Can't fault it, was well fed and the massage was the best I've had.

Nice hammam. This is a cracking little hammam right in the middle of the medina, 3 minute walk from the square, my wife emailed them booked a time and they met us at the cafe France in the square, it would be difficult to find on your own, we were offered tea when we arrived then taken down stairs to the hammam, this is not a 5 star resort spa where you get pampered and stroked !! This is a hammam where the girls remove dirt and skin alike ! We had the 1 hour massage after and emerged brand new and ready to do battle in the souks again, One bit of advise is they tell you that you do not need to bring anything, either bring swimming trunks or spare underwear,

Awesome. After researching thoroughly on tripadvisor- my mum and I went to hammam rosa bonheur.Samira- the owner welcomed us with tea/biscuits before we even decided to book. We never felt short changed with time or attention. The staff exceeded our expectations. Great value for money. We were pampered within an inch of our lives and had to go home for a sleep!

An Authentic Hammam. I enjoyed my hammam and massage here. The ambiance isn't as polished as other spas in Marrakech, but the attitude of the staff makes up for it. The staff is very enthusiastic and tries hard to make your experience enjoyable. This falls somewhere in the middle of the hammam spectrum - not exactly a community hammam, but not exactly a spa hammam either. They are tucked away so I would definitely recommend accepting their offer to meet you and walk you to the riad.

Amazing relaxation!. From the moment the beautiful hostess opens their almost secret door (no sign outside) till you leave at the end, clean & relaxed, this place is heaven on earth. It's small, we where with two guys, and no other guest could fit in. The hostess offered us tea, but also a meal afterwards is possible. "Are you angry?" she asked, when she meant hungry. You immediately fall in love with this place and the people. About the treatment: It's not expensive at all, and the staff is very skilled. I would recommend the whole package. Get soaped, scrubbed, put on mud and be washed. And end with a long lasting massage. Reborn.

An Authentic Traditional Spa Experience. This is definitely the place to be if you are looking for a real authentic Moroccan hammam experience in a safe and private environment aside from the community hammams. I went to the spa for a hammam and a massage. The staff was able to accommodate me in the evening. The entire experience was a wonderfully relaxing one. It was like nothing I had ever experienced before.I left the spa feeling rejuvenated and relaxed. This intimate little place should not be missed if you are visiting Marrakech.

The real thing. Hammam Rosa Bonheur isn't a large spa designed for mass tourism. It's small and intimate, with a focus on traditional treatments. The ever-helpful and kind Yassine fetched me from the main square, applied the hammam treatments, after which Fatima gave me a massage. It's about the best traditional massage I've had, it has really improved my sleep, and I couldn't recommend it more highly. As Marrakech becomes ever more popular, it's fantastic that authentic places like this still exist.

Excellent hamman and massage experience!!!. If you are looking to experience a real hamman and massage. This is the place to come. The hamman lasts around 35 minutes which removes all your dead skin and massage is a full toe to head massage lasting for around hour and can be as gentle or firm as you like. Afterwards our skin felt fresh and muscles loosened. All for a great value price too. Don't risk the street vendors trying to pull you in and be disappointed with the hamman experience.

super massage the best place :)) . yassine super accueille aisha très class ... very clean this place and is perfect after your relax time you can go directly to the Souc juste near to this place you can find the best oil argan and the really one because some of them the sale oil for salad hahahahaha then be careful ask Yassine him tell you about this place .... enjoy marroc enjoy hammam rosa bonheur ... a bientôt Symona and Mike from France

Brilliant, Relaxing, Pure Bliss. My girlfriend and I decided to experience a local hammam and massage. Given the location of our hotel and Rosa Bonheur, we decided to try this place based on previous tripadvisor feedback. We weren't disappointed! The whole experience was amazing, from the hammam right through to the 1hr body massage. It was fantastic and highly recommend it to anyone.A big thank you to Fatima and Isha (the wonderful ladies who provided the treatments) and Yassin who met us in the square and brought us to the spa and explained everything. His english was better than our French and Arabic!

Pure relaxation. We just had a private hammam experience at Rosa Bonheur, which was excellent.We were completely surprised by the intense treatment (scrub and massage) and felt wonderful afterwards. After a hot day in the souks this is a perfect way to relax. We totally recommend this place.

Amazing experience . I have never been to a hammam before but thoroughly enjoyed my experience here. My partner and I made use of the traditional hammam special offer both getting Moroccan massages. Moroccan massages aren't for the feint of heart but there are other options if you prefer a softer touch. I felt totally relaxed and now have lovely soft skin. If you come to mocorro don't just have a massage I highly recommend a traditional hammam it makes the experience something to remember. I haven't been to any other hammams so I can't compare but this is very beautiful, clean and professional with great service for a good price.

Beautiful spa and experience. We were greeted by friendly front staff which is a breath of fresh air for Marrakech. The spa is nothing short of beautiful. The decor had a rustic traditional feel. We went for the 1hr 45min hammam + massage. The hammam was really good. My first one. We had to wear what was like a thong. Which, for a guy was a little bit awkward as I kept having to... Readjust my 'thong' as I kept slipping out. And on one occasion the lady had to turn around and tell me in arabic to put my mouse back in the house. Which was a tad embarrassing. My Mrs found it hilarious!. The massage was very good. And the head massage was nice and relaxing. My Mrs found her massage a little hard, but they did a really good job overall and it was just what was needed. I would certainly recommend this to anyone going Morocco as it was one of my highest points of the holiday!

Wonderful place. We booked a spa and hammam package for 2. We were greeted by a wonderful lady upon arrival who explained everything to us. The hammam was wonderful and very effective. This was followed by a deep relaxing massage and was just what we needed after a couple days of walking around the souks.The place is very clean and we were supplied with brand new sealed loofahs for the hammam. The bathrobes were clean and smelled good as well. They also provided us with lockers to keep our stuff in.

Amazing!. I went with my mother and 2 sisters. It was a small and cute building that was decorated and smelt beautiful! All the women were professional and gave us exactly what we paid for. Thank you!!

Relaxing Hammam. This was our first experience in an Arab Hammam. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Everyone was very professional skilled & hospitable. The receptionist spoke excellent English & communicated with her colleagues so there would be no misunderstanding. We received everything we asked for in the package, charged the correct price, and were not shorted any time. The facility was clean and beautifully/traditionally decorated. I highly recommend this Hammam.

Terrible. My husband and I booked a massage and hammam package for 2.
