After the 2 girls started to massage our feet for 2 minutes, chatting the whole time to each other and doing a terrible job we looked at each other and cancelled the remaining session. There is way better places to try and cheaper is not better. Yes the price is cheap but you get what you pay for. I also do not understand any of the good reviews here. Hammam was also highly disappointing.

Just the thing to recover. Exceptional experience here. We booked their special (400'dirham for a hamman, scrub and foot/body massage) and were treated like royalty the whole time. It was a blissful one and a half hours. We booked online and the staff spoke excellent English. Going back tomorrow.

Wonderful start to the day!. My partner and I had a great time here taking advantage of the special package offer. The women on the desk were very welcoming and so were the people giving the treatments. It was my partner's first massage and my first hammam and the experience was great. I chose a Moroccan and the woman was very good. Very good value for money!! Thank you !

Best ever! We will be back! . 5 star all the way! Luxury, elegance, professional staff really make this a wonderful experience. We had the special package of hamman, foot massage and 1hr massage. You get to choose exactly what type of massage you prefer. Ambience in this beautiful building is a peaceful and tranquil oasis. My best ever massage! Definitely go...

Absolutely amazing spa with friendly polite therapists. Just got back from Les Bains de Azahara and it was one of the best experiences of my life. The staff were so friendly and polite and spoke a little English as well as French. My friend and I went for the traditional Hammam and Moroccan massage. The massage was perfect and the ambience was wonderful with orchestral Disney music playing during the massages. The therapists were professional and so kind and the Moroccan tea was the best we've had so far in Marrakech.Truly couldn't fault this place and would highly recommend it. I plan on going back for a manicure and pedicure tomorrow!

Thoroughly lovely - highly recommended. My girlfriend and I visited this morning for a "relaxing package" - a hammam including a full-body 'mask' and an hour's massage for 500 MAD. The hammam was excellent - clean and hot, and the amount of dead skin the lady with the glove (one each, given to us when we left so you know they're clean when they start) managed to remove was frankly quite shocking. I left feeling I'd won a strangely enjoyable fight with an orbital sander. The massage was powerful - we'd picked "Moroccan" (other alternatives were relaxing or draining) and the young lady doing it managed to dig her knuckles and elbows into more knots than I thought possible. If you like a gentle, sweeping massage then Moroccan is not for you - I like a deep tissue massage given with gusto and this didn't disappoint. We'll go back again before we leave - and I'll probably take my own swimwear again, because the disposable pair you're given seem more like a small thong and don't cover much. Maybe I'm just too British!

Romantic and great spa experience. After reading the reviews from TripAdvisor, we made a reservation during a stay in Marrakesh. The spa is a short 15 mins walk from Jemma El Fna and is fairly easy to fine. We had a traditional hamman, one hour massage and romantic baths. The scrubs we received during the hamman was very thorough. The massage was great and the Romantic bath is true to its name. Candle lights everywhere with a side by side bath tub next to my hubby. This is the most romantic settings I could've imagine for a bath. I highly recommend for couples to try it out.

This is the place to go!. It was my last day in Marrakesh, and I had planned a hammem visit. My driver suggested Les Bains de Azahara, and we came by the afternoon before to see what I thought, look at prices (very good) and book. After reading the reviews I had high expectations, and I was more than amazed at the wonderful treatments, service and personal attention I received throughout my three hours there. Overall an incredible experience and truly a luxuriating assault on the senses. I highly recommend.

Great spa les bains de azahara. Great friendly staff, great spa lady. really relaxing especially at the end of your journey. Just be careful with the taxi getting here (some drivers do not know the location) and you will struggle a bit but dont be fooled it is in central, just hidden but a gem.

You have to go here. My sister and I spent so many hours looking for a great hammam and massage spa for the right price. We then came to this one and I am so glad we did, it was absolutely amazing, on point 100% with price and the experience was also peaceful and relaxing in an intimate building.

Amazing massage!. I booked a hammam and massage for myself and two friends after reading great reviews and I was not dissapointed! The lady at the spa was really welcoming and explained exactly what was involved with the hammam as it was our first time. You are given a bath robe and slippers to change into before, I would recommend wearing bikini bottoms, but you are given disposable underwear. The hammam was great and left my skin so soft, it was then off for a foot massage and some tea. After this an hour's massage which was so relaxing I didn't want it to end! Although we snuggled to find the location if the spa it was well worth it!

Please Read Before Booking!. I have just left Les Bains da Azahara and I will find it hard to describe how incredible my experience was.  For £36 in English money I was absolutely stunned! I had the traditional package where I was washed and scrubbed, followed by a foot massage then my one hour full body massage. I decided to have the Moroccan massage (when in Morocco hey?) and it was indescribable.  My body has never felt so good, my skin is so soft and I feel as though I'm floating. The staff couldn't do more for you they were exceptional. If I ever return to Marrakech I will be sure to spend my whole stay there. It was addictive!   Thank you very much to all the staff and I hope anyone who visits Marrakech goes here!

Enjoyable hammam and massage. The lady was very good at explaining the types of hammams and massages in English. Hammam - scrub in a hot sauna Before getting in the hammam, we got changed in a tiny changing locker room. Slippers were a little bit old and oily. We both got scrubbed by only 1 lady instead of 2. We were lying down on anti slip mats on top of the marble, the scrub was great. We then got rinsed and she also washed my hair which I had no problem with since I had short hair. Before asking my gf she poured water all over her hair and then shampoo, there was no conditioner after that. I would suggest to train your staff to ask your clients before pouring shampoo all over their hair. What bugged me most was her soaking the mats and rinsing the platform while we were rinsing ourself. 1. She should do it after we leave the hammam 2. The way she rinsed it seemed really unhygienic. We weren't offered a towel to dry ourselves but a bath robe. My gf's hair was dripping, it was slippery walking to the foot massage area where we had a 3 min foot massage. Went upstairs afterwards and the massage was fantastic no complains at all. Highly recommend the massage, and I hope to see some improvements with the hammam in the near future.

Lovely authentic Moroccan hammam experience. Absolutely loved this place! My partner and I went on the final afternoon of our trip to Marrakech over the Easter weekend for the couples package (580 MAD). This included a hammam bath, a short foot massage while served Moroccan mint tea followed by a choice of three massages: traditional Moroccan, relaxing or draining for one hour. Most westerners will be unfamiliar with the concept of 'hammam' and what the procedure actually involves so I will try to clarify. The hammam is more commonly known in the West as a Turkish bath as its initial conception dates back to the Ottoman Empire where it served as place for social gathering, ritual cleansing connected to the Islamic faith (which necessitates spiritual and physical cleanliness) and an architectural witness to the sultan's greatness, power and wealth. However, as the nice lady who greeted us on reception pointed out, several Arabic countries have adopted their own variants of it and thus the Moroccan variant differs to that of the Turkish (i.e. the addition of a black soap scrub with a hessa glove). Upon arrival we were seated on a comfortable sofa and offered a menu of treatments. Although we had already made a booking and thus this could be considered as pushy by some, I thought it was innocent and actually quite thoughtful. We were then shown to a changing room with a bench, shower and lockers containing fresh dressing robes, sandals, sterile disposable hessa gloves and a pair of paper underwear which didn't leave much to the imagination (I'm not sure it would even sufficiently cover more well-endowed gentlemen!) but my suggestion would be if you are not comfortable with this you could always bring bathing trunks (or bikini bottoms for the girls) but other guests will not see anything anyway. On leaving the changing room we were directed through a low-lit, curtained corridor to the hammam. This was a single room tiled with beautiful marble, a large inset basin full of hot water fed by ornate taps, a dousing bowl and a pot of black soap plus candles. The best way I can describe it is like a milder version of a Finnish sauna - dry heat but nowhere near as hot and it wasn't at all like a steam room (i.e. misty and humid with wet heat). The attendant was a lovely motherly lady who couldn't speak much English but understood my rubbish French and always had a big smile. She pasted us with a surprisingly sparse amount of black soap and instructed us to lay face down on the benches and relax in the warmth before leaving. We stayed like this for half an hour or so before she returned and scrubbed us down with our own gloves (the amount of dead skin that comes off will surprise you!). She then covered us in some sort of moisturising balm which smelled of orange blossom and shampooed/head massaged our hair all throughout dousing us at regular intervals using the bowl and hot water from the basin. She then left us again to soak our feet in a wooden foot bath containing cold water with rose petals for another 20 minutes. Finally, she returned (she was going between the different hammam rooms along the corridor with other guests) and told us to stand under a cool shower in the centre of the room. We then robed-up and left the room to sit on cushioned recliners in the lounge to be served mint tea along with another couple. Shortly, another four ladies appeared to sit on stools at the foot of each recliner and give a short (less than five minutes) foot massage. After this we were led upstairs to a massage suite and asked which of the aforementioned massages we would like (we both chose the relaxing). Note: the Moroccan massage may seem like the authentic option (and is exactly and only what you would be offered if you went to one of the public hammams) but it is not for the faint of heat and typically involves a bit of contortionism and rough handling. The massage itself was great (full-body back and front) and the therapist was friendly. After it had finished we were again left to relax for a few minutes before returning to the dressing room. A shower at this stage before getting dressed is definitely recommended as you are covered in oil but the only complaint I have is that this was barely possible for us as the shower pressure on the hot water was practically non-existent (a trickle at best). Although the couple in the changing room next door didn't seem to have this problem. On exiting the two masseuses who had been chatting with their colleagues in the lounge area hurried over. Initially I just thought they were being friendly/attentive but it was only after I left did it dawn on me they were expecting tips and I felt bad I hadn't obliged. Nonetheless, a separate lady now on reception who was just as friendly as the first asked us if we had enjoyed the experience and seemed genuinely concerned that our expectations had been met. We exited into the bright daylight feeling super relaxed and contented. Overall, I absolutely recommend this experience to couples and groups. While you could go solo (especially for the hammam) the massage may feel a little awkward for a young man. One final thing I will point out is the experience you get at an establishment like this (i.e. a hammam/spa geared towards tourists) is totally different to what you would get at one of the local/public hammams. These are most certainly only for the very bravest and are not as well-kept (they get much more traffic though). Segregation is obviously enforced and as a tourist you will stand out a lot (particularly if you don't go in completely naked) you would also be expected to bring your own black soap and glove (available cheaply from the souks - 5 MAD for 100g soap) or the option to purchase on-site is available at some public hammams. You would also be expected to pay the attendants for scrubbing you down and twisting/pulling you around. There are many private hammam-spas available in Marrakech so it can be difficult to make the right choice, every single one will offer a subtly different experience but one thing is for sure, if you choose Les Bains de Azahara you will not be disappointed!

great experience. A nice treat while in Marrakech, we booked the special package for 400 dirham per person which is excellent value compared to other spas in the city. This was our first experience in a hammam and it was so relaxing and a perfect way to end our holiday. The decoration inside is great and the staff very friendly. Would recommend!
Awesome Experience. We did the 400 dirham special, and it was fantastic! The service was great, and we enjoyed every moment. I WILL be back one day!

The friendliest Receptionist, the Best Hammam woman, the Most Chic Spa i have ever seen- Pure Bliss. Beuatiful surroundings, easy to find (and when i say easy it means you don't have to walk through the narrow streets to find it or at least not too much), a real celebration of the senses from the moment you enter- dimmed lights, tender curtains, smell and taste of mint tea...... clean and spacious changing room with your private sink and shower.... as usual, i felt a bit shy at the beginning with my breasts naked but the woman made me feel like laughing more than anything else, she was so nice, so relaxed and so professional .... after only 5 min i was in another world..... the treatment is beautiful- pouring warm water and taking off all toxins from your skin.... felt so light and clean after....the massage girls were very professional- not even 1 word to distract us during the massage in the dark room (no idea how they do it but it's so much better!), they customized it according to our specific preferences which i've never seen and didnt know is even possible- gentle relaxing on our legs and strong Moroccan on our bags..... my hair and skin were so shiny for the next couple of days because of the oil ! amazing !if you love yourself you must try..... if you love the people, leave them a good tip or at least a good review :)

Good choice (for a discerning spa-goer!). I was mpressed by this spa. I chose it as it was close enough to the hotel, and the taxi could get quite close to drop me off - I didnt have to walk through windy roads within the MedinahThe lights and ambiance were soft and set the mood for relaxation. I was able to book easily over the phone and at reception there was a warm welcome.The experience itself was as expecte d- generous use of mask/scrub, vigorous scrub, but you feel so pampered and cleansed after! I had to keep telling them to go more firm on the massage - it was good but I didn't feel they got into some of my knots so the massage part for me was a bit lacking.Be prepared- one of the girls will whisper to you that you can offer the famous tip -so keep some change with you as they will "expect" something. Easy to find- just by Doukkala mosque. Taxis on the return can be caught just a short walk down the street.Good value for money - I paid a bit more and it was worth it.

Good value Hammam. Our Riad owner recommended this place, I called in the morning and I was booked in that afternoon. The receptionist explained the different options to me and I chose to have the basic Hammam which was 150 dirham. (this seemed a lot less than other places I had looked at) Communication was a little difficult with the lady but I was scrubbed and washed in a lovely small clean room and then had a relaxing foot massage. My friend didn't want a hammam and the staff kindly let her sit in the relaxation room and gave her some mint tea whilst she waited for me.

Lovely hammam and massage. Emailed in the morning and they were able to fit me and my partner in that day, which was great as it was our last day in Marrakech. We had booked the hammam and massage package. They give you disposable underwear (be prepared to laugh), towels and shoes to wear throughout your experience, you get to lock away your items in the cupboards provided. We had the hammam to begin with, we were washed with warm water and then covered in a soap scrub, this was left on our skin for a little while and we were left to relax in the steam room. We were then scrubbed, this was a nice experience and not rough. We were then washed off and had our faces and hair washed before sitting with our feet in a warm bowl of water with rose petals. We sat in the "waiting area" and had a quick foot massage before being taken upstairs for a 1 hour whole body massage, when they say while they mean whole so be prepared. We both opted for the Moroccan massage. This was lovely and they kept asking if we were OK throughout. Overall this was a very relaxing experience and would recommend, could not fault the price at about £60 for the both of us!! Great service from all staff throughout

Very nice experience!. I emailed them in the morning and immediately got a response that they have a spot available. We went a couple and used a mixed hammam available for couples. The environment is very traditional and cozy. The woman at hammam did great her job. Relaxing foot massage which was included was very nice. All the personal very attentive, especially the girl at reception. We really had great experience for very reasonable price.

Delightful Visit. I booked in a Hammam and Massage for my wife while I roamed around the city with my 1 year old.My wife loved the whole experience and staff were very professional and accommodating and staff actually spent more time with her than we paid for. My wife said that she felt relaxed afterwards and that she would definitely visit again.I spent some time looking into a good hammam and found this one every much to what I expected. Prices are very reasonable and are cheaper than some other ones I looked at. Price is not an issue as long as the service being provided is spot on and I feel that next time, I would pay more or maybe I would go for a relaxing massage myself.The Hammam is not difficult to find and if getting a taxi, you need to ask to be dropped outside Mosquee Bab Doukkala. Once outside the Mosque, you need to go straight down so the mosque is on your right hand side and the Hammam is just a few seconds walk to the left hand side in one of the side streets.
Hammam delights. We had a blissful morning at the hammam. We had no idea what to expect and a certain amount of apprehension! We felt pampered and hugely relaxed after the bath and the hours massage.

An experience. My girlfriend and I booked a hamman and massage during our stay in marrakech. There are a lot of choices of different hammans and massages. The hamman was a bit of an experience for us both, having someone wash you is not something we are used to in everyday life but it was an enjoyable experience. We both had a Moroccan massage, I enjoyed mine. My girlfriend didn't enjoy hers as much. But we would both recommend it!

Highly recommended. As a first experience, this was great. It sounds obvious, but be ready to bare (virtually) all as you are scrubbed down by an attendant. Luckily you have your own room for this, and have a big robe for the rest of the time. It is an impressively beautiful place with good staff and you do feel soft afterwards. No hidden charges and the basic Dh 150 deal was great.

Nice and Charming experience. This Hammam is perfect for a relaxing moment in the chaotic city of Marrakech. The package we took included a Hammam and Massage and both the price and the quality were awesome.

So relaxing!. This was our first time in a hammam, it was incredible! The price is very good for the quality of the service, we had a Relaxing Package which included a hammam, mini foot massage with mint tea and about an hour full body massage at the end. Super clean and professional. We are very happy we found this through here, thanks to all the people that had nice experiences before us. It was a great ending to our holidays, it was so relaxing... we didn't want it to end!

What a splendid afternoon.... After visiting this hammam with a friend this morning, I feel it necessary to write this glowing review. We weren't 100% sure what to expect, so I hope this review will help anyone else visiting. We got a cab to drop us outside, (50 dirham from Jemaa El Fna) but walked back afterwards and it's a short walk (10 minutes max) from the main square and just around the corner from Koutoubia Mosque. We opted for the 400 dirham spa package that includes use of the hammam, a black eucalyptus scrub, short foot massage and then an hour long full body massage. This is without a doubt an excellent deal at around £27. Robes, and flip flops are provided, along with some very skimpy paper pants, so I would recommend bringing your own bikini bottoms or a change of underwear. We were greeted by a member of staff who sat us down and talked us through the whole experience as I had never visited a hammam before. She answered all of our questions and was very welcoming. We were advised of a 15 minute wait and she then took us into the changing room where we were each provided with a locker.We then went and sat in a relaxation area, were offered mint tea and waited for the treatment. We were then taken into the hammam together, and the first part of the treatment started. Be aware that it is all topless. It was lovely and warm, the treatment was bliss and my friend and I left feeling pampered already. Be prepared to be amazed (and kind of disgusted) at how much dead skin will be exfoliated off of you. This part was concluded with shampooing your hair and a quick rinse off before being taken back to the relaxation area. We were given more mint tea and a short foot massage. We then went upstairs where we were given incredible hour long massages which included the face and head. I asked for a bit more pressure and the masseuse happily obliged. They checked throughout that we were comfortable, which we definitely were. We were then left to chill in the room for 10 minutes before being led back to the changing room where there was the option of having a shower, we chose to soak up the oil and left feeling wonderful!The whole experience was incredible, the staff were so friendly and helpful, the spa itself is clean and beautifully decorated, and the massage and hammam experience were expertly carried out with high quality products. This will be a memorable highlight of our trip to Marrakech, and we cannot recommend it enough.

Beauty treatment, Hammam and Massage. My partner was disappointed with her beauty treatment. The poor lighting may have been responsible for this. I had a a combined Hammam and a Morroccan massage. The massage was very good. The water was luke warm at best.

" A must do in marracekh ". well booked from reading reviews on here, I emailed the spa and booked for 4 ladies 10am ,a email was returned also with a maP ,to show taxi driver and phone no .he rang from his cab to confirm directions .I would not have found on my own down little street ,just a sign above door .we booked the 350 dirham morning deal must go morning 10am lasts about 2 hours aprox in English £24 well on arrival once enter spa like going into different world was given locker with key ,gown slippers and pants!well don't be shy they were so small like a thong but we had a laugh as none of us slim !you could take a pair of your own well 1stin steam room black soap rubbed in left the scrubbed of washed down .then another soap put on .we rubbed in then lady washed our hair then rinsed of ,our skin was so soft then in lovely room all given cup tea then foot massage then all taken to rooms upstairs and had 1 hour massage inc the head .all I can say was such good value if you go in the after noon its the same price just for massage do look on the website they will call you a taxi if you want to return to hotel if was stopping longer would have gone a second time and if return to Marrakech will return ,go you will not be disappointed . ps we did give tips to staff as deserved it ,but did not feel they was waiting thanks again for a great relaxing morning

Flawless, Must-Do in Marrakech. Three of us booked Hammam and massage together, the front desk staff (I think her name was Anita) could not do enough to help! Firstly paying our taxi driver when he didn't have change, to helping us select a treatment. The hamaam experience was incredible, felt very authentic and the Ghassoul mask left our skin super soft! We had a foot massage afterwards with tea, and then a full body massage which was relaxing enough to send all three of us to sleep! The venue itself is very beautiful, the staff are just fantastic, and the overall experience is brilliant. I've been to Hamaams in Turkey and a few here in London, but this is by far my best Hammam experience, definitely worth a visit when in Marrakech.
Amazing the best. Fab time at what I will call the best spa in marrakech.If you are considering do it you will not be disapointed!

Perfect hammam intro. After a lot of research and recommendations from Moroccans, I chose to try this hammam during the last few days of my 2 week adventure in Morocco. I'm pretty fussy when it comes to massages, and this place delivered. The receptionist was friendly, professional, and even remembered my hammam preferences when I came back the next day (yes, it was that good). The hammam ladies were energetic and I'm sure I'm back to my 20-something year old skin after their exfoliation! And both massages were great. I chose the Moroccan option both times and loved the orange blossom infused argan oil they used. Heavenly....Although it seemed pretty busy, the staff professionally moved clients through the curtained passages with the discretion required to give you a bit of privacy.

Special Pack from 10am to 2pm. My new fiance and I treated ourselves to this package which included; a Hammam exfoliation with traditional black eucalyptus soap + foot bath with rose petals and short foot massage + 1 hour massage. Despite visiting numerous establishments to have a professional massage, I can confidently say that this was the best overall experience as well as the best value for money which I have ever had. The staff were extremely attentive and professional at all times with the private and suitably seductive atmosphere making for the perfect oasis from the hustle and bustle outside. Would recommend to anyone who has a few hours to spare whilst visiting Marrakech.

get that fab friday feeling. Girlfriend and I had the 350DH (now 400 DH) package at 10am on a Friday morning. We both loved every minute of the experience. Went for Moroccan and strenuous massages respectively. Felt like shiny pebbles after our 2-hour visit. Cannot recommend relaxed and friendly team enough. Until next time!
Good value, high quality. Great service.. Had a wonderful experience with the 200 Dirhum package. Full body wash, mud soap, rinse, foot massage and a cup of Moroccan tea.

Relaxing time. We went for the special treatment pack, a hammam and massage for 400MAD.Even though we were a bit early, it was no problem to change clothes and start with the hammam. You will be dressed in their underwear.. it does look a bit funny.. a man in a paper 'thong'.The hammam was relaxing and the massage was good.It would be nice if the employees knew a bit English. Even if they are just commands like: please sit down, or please lie down.We had a good time there, was worth the money.

Great service. My friend and I went to this spa twice during our stay, and we would have visited more if we were staying longer. We had a great experience with the Hammams and massages. We were offered deals to make it cheaper and the ladies made sure we had the real traditional experience. Not to mention, the inside of the spa was stunning. Would definitely go back, next time we visit.

Nice, but the hammam was not hot at all!. They lost our reservation so we had to do the massage before and the hammam after.It was unpleasant, but it could happen. We had a little discount on the massage btw.The massage and the service in general were very good. The hammam instead was not hot at all! They said that europeans are not used to take hammam like the moroccans, so the temperature was colder than usual.

Fairly priced hammam experience. Me and two of my friends went here (twice!) during our week in Marrakesh. We enjoyed the hammam with massage afterwards. The first time we tried the moroccan massage and the second time the relaxive sportive. The relaxing sportive was a lot more pleasant than the moroccan but the woman doing the hammam (during the second visit) was a bit grumpy and we had to do most of the scrubbing ourselves. Otherwise it was two perfect evenings on an unforgetable vacation!

Just right.. After a gruelling mountain hike, our hammam experience here was just the ticket. The online deal is a bargain (also confirmed by our riad owner who really discouraged the public hammams due to cleanliness issues). The space is welcoming, clean, well-decorated, and has great Moroccan flair. Only suggestions would be that the hammam could be hotter for me – though my boyfriend felt it was just right, and that during the massage, they opened the window to let in some air. Unfortunately, it was quite noisy so that was a bit distracting.Otherwise, great service, and relieved that the massage was just firm enough! Nothing worse than soft pressure. ;)

Good to OK experience. Good experience with this hammam. You get a private room for the hammam and then proceed to foot massage and body massage. Both massages were just OK, with the foot massage being very softly done, not really a proper massage. The overall experience is good, with clean facilities. Massage could be improved! Overall good.
Amazing. Very relaxing experience, extremely friendly staff, good value for money, I would highly recommend!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Absolutely amazing! . Was recommended this hamam by riad asna, were I stayed. Relaxing place and personal and caring staff! I highly recommend a visit!

Excellent first time hammam experience. My cousin and I were travelling in Morocco and wanted to try a hammam. Our innkeeper at Riad Tizwa made all the arrangements for us to come to this hammam, and walked us there. To save time I will echo the review recently written by Carla C - exact same experience. We both loved it and found it very relaxing; in addition, the price/value was quite good. If I were to return I would ask for a second mat to lay on, as the bed was quite hot and it took me a while to acclimate. Two layers may have helped me. My only complaint - and it's minor - is that when we were taken to the room for our foot treatment, the two girls were just hanging out listening to their ipods - did not welcome us or even smile. Eventually one got up and served us hot tea, then they began the foot massage. I just think the ipod-listening should be done outside of view of clients. All that said, I would definitely return to this spa. We had no other treatments there - just the hammam.

Wonderful experience . This was my first SPA treatment and it was absolutly amazing. I was a bit anxious massage might be a bit painful but I was definitely wrong. I and my wife had the hammam first and after we've been well scrubed and washed we had the foot massage. Right after this we've been guided to the second floor for the full body massage. It took around 1 hour and it was heavenly. If I wasn't married already I would have preposed to the girl to marry me . The whole thing was called traditional hammam and massage package. Word of advice, if you book online call again to confirm or even better just call them and make an arrangment over the phone.

Don't look anywhere else. Ben there with the GF. Very friendly and caring staff. Fair prices (special offer 400MDR before 2pm for hammam + 1hr massage)The place is beautiful, clean and kept in the dark. You will forget about everything for 2hours. Spend 30 mins in a private hot room with your other half.Don't think twice, it's a great experience altogether.

Amazingly relaxing. Me and my friend went here on our last full day in Marrakech and it was great. First we had a hammam, after that a foot massage and after that a full body massage. And it was all amazing, so relaxing! Specially in a city as crazy as Marrakech and after a 3 day desert trip, it was such a good way to end our stay in Marocco. The women who work there are really nice and sweet, although their English isn't great, but just pointing and some French was enough. I would really recommend this. O and some advise, just wear the weird white underpants-thingy they give you, it's awkward at first, but swimwear would just be in the way with the hammam and the massage.

Beautifully ornate Hammam - highly recommended!. Despite the plain appearance from the outside, I was very impressed by how ornate the Bains de Azahara was in the inside. I booked a traditional morrocan massage and hamman special package and it was perfect for my final day in Marrakech! I would recommend the experience to anyone who wishes to unwind after the hustle and bustle of visiting the old town and nearby main square.

The feel of Morocco:. Having been advised by a colleague, who's previously been to this amazing country, that a "hammam" is a must do experience, we booked a two hour session. I don't have a means of contrasting this place to any of the others within the city, so all I can contribute here is how the whole experience felt. You are greeted by a very courteous staff, who take you to change into your robe. The next stage is where you enter a room with three matts protruding from the stone walls for you to stretch out upon. The lady rinses you down with water, then scrubs you down with an exfoliating glove, which you get to keep, then applies an aromatic oil to your skin. You lie down, and they leave the room, and steam begins to fill the chamber. After ten or so minutes, the lady returns to have you rinse at the shower in the front corner of the chamber. Next, she applies the "black soap" which is the medium for extracting the toxins from your pores. You lie back down, and steam returns. I could literally feel the toxins leaving my skin. One of the ladies we visited with, said she could see them on the surface of her body during the process. I'm not sure exactly how long you are in this state, but long enough where I was sweating profusely. Repeat the rinsing at the shower, towel off, then leave that chamber to relax in a cool chase with some water and mint tea...upstairs for a massage, then your session is complete. Even a day later, my skin feels like butter. The locals visit the public hammam's once a week, and I believe it is a big reason their beauty is preserved for such a long period of their life...

Lush Hamman. Visited Les Bains de Azahara for Valentine's Day. Beautifully decorated rooms and good prices. We booked the 400dh pp special online which included Hamman, body scrub, foot massage and 1hr massage. English was very limited, however this did not cause any issues as we hadn't gone there for a chat. Earlier in the week we had been to a Hamman in Essouira recommended to us by staff at our Riad, that was nowhere near to the standard of Les Bains de Azahara and it cost us 350 just for the Hamman and massage. Highly recommend.

Fabulous!!!!. Not long out of this fabulous place and felt the urgent need to write a review to highlight how wonderful our experience was in Led Bains d'Azahara. This was our first Hammmam experience and it will definitely not be our last. We opted for the traditional Hammam followed by a Morrocan massage which was 450dh. The experience was just wonderful. The staff in here are so gentle and nice. It was beyond a doubt the best massage I have ever had in my entire life. The hammam experience was so relaxing and we felt a million dollars leaving this place. It is by far the best thing we have done in Marrakech and I cannot recommend this place highly enough- it was so luxiourios, so professional and staff were wonderful! We will be back!

A great introduction to the Hammam experience. Really enjoyed my Hammam and massage. The staff are lovely and the atmosphere is welcoming and relaxing. I had a Moroccan massage which is not for the faint hearted but you can have a relaxing massage if you want and it hey will change it to whatever level you like. This is definitely a tourist Hammam rather than a local so the prices match this but saying that I was there for 2hrs and it was 400dh (special morning rate) which is about the cost of a massage only in the uk. I would certainly recommend the aromatic rub with the Hammam this was lovely. Great think to do if you want to get away from the bustling streets of Marrakech and treat yourself

Great experience..... It appears you shouldn't go to Morocco without trying a Hammam and around Marrakesh there are many municipal Hammams to choose from, but this one is private and just around the corner from our Riad (Altair) and as we were 'first timers' we felt we wanted a more luxurious/private experience than that which we may have got in a municipal Hammam. We also met a couple who recommended the hammam to us which also gave us the confidence to give it a go!For me I went for a Hammam and foot massage for 300dh and it was the most bizarre experience I have ever had! I just couldn't believe that at the age of 44 years I was being given a bath by someone - as this is basically what a hammam is. You strip to nothing apart from a pair of paper pants, plastic slippers and a robe and then they take you into a room with heated ceramic beds and you are splashed with bowls of water and then have various lotions and potions quickly massaged onto your skin and they are either left a while to do their magic or washed off immediately. At one stage your skin is roughly sloughed by the person performing this and it is quite surprising to see how much dead grey skin is produced and then washed off. It was lovely and warm in the room (a little like a sauna), with dim lighting and soft music and this treatment also included bathing my feet in cold water with rose petals and afterwards it followed with mint tea and a wonderful foot massage. Had I known more of what to expect I may have relaxed more, but all in all it was an amazing experience that I would definitely repeat both generally and at this Hammam. The receptionist spoke good English and the other staff mainly French. My husband opted for a relaxing full body massage which didn't involve any water and was simply a massage using massage oils, but he thoroughly enjoyed the experience and said the masseuse was very professional, put him at ease and he felt very relaxed afterwards.

Value Family Experience. I went along with my three kids aged 13,12 and 10. We just took the hammam and foot massage at 150, but it was a fun and relaxing experience. Part of it was for the kids to see what a hammam is all about , and we were treated very well by reception ( excellent English and communication in general) and by the ladies who attended to us.All in all good value and worth the trip....oh yes we felt cleansed and relaxed after!

One of the best so far. We came in Marrakech 2 times in a two year timeframe. We discovered this spa long ago because it was very close to our riad. A chance!Even though the service can be slightly adjusted depending on the person working and the workload, hammam, massage and bath have always been delightful!We came again today, after two years, and because the owner was thankful for that, she upgraded our treatment. Awesome!Room temperature was perfect, even in the changing room. Towels etc, straight from the plastic emballage as they were new (were not but means at least were cleaned and checked).We will go again, thanks for all!

Sloppy service and bad hygiene - customers first?. I visited in November 2014 because of the good reviews. However I left with below average impression of the spa. There was a misunderstanding of my booking and although I sent an email to confirm early the morning, we were asked to come back in 2 hours. The lady who received us was probably the one that has confirmed the mail and she was not at all sorry and very rude. Btw the staff speaks French and only a few words of English.Product: We ordered the ‘today’s special’ which included 45 min hammam, foot massage and 1 hour massage for 350MAD. Of the 45 mins of hammam, I counted 10 mins pp of the staff providing service. Then we were moved to get the foot massage, this was actually a 3 mins sloppy massage with the girls being occupied with some staff intrigues happening that day. We picked the Moroccan massage that was very good and the girls stepped up. Other: There were a couple of things I discovered with this place. There are mixed changing rooms also vey small and cold (we did not eager for a shower after treatment to say the least), slippers given were dirty, candels were not lit in hammam room, shared bucket used for foot bath and wet towel at the massage bench (from other guests?!).Think you can find something better ☺

Great Spa. We made a booking for four girls at this spa and were treated and attended to very well. The haman was great fun as all four of us went in together as requested. The massages were some of the best we'd ever had and the baths were lovely, although more fun with a friend as you are left bathing/to relax for half an hour. We went for what was 3 hours worth of treatments and came out after 5 hours so definitely got our monies worth. I wouldn't recommend the manicures as they aren't of a very high standard compared to English standards. They chipped quickly and the colours on offer are limited. I definitely recommend all other treatments. We had a fantastic afternoon here!

Go for the massage not the mani/pedi!. The hammam and massage were amazing and totally worth every penny! They were attentive, in very relaxing surroundings and you were able to ask for the massage you preferred.However, I also booked for the luxury pedi with wrap and the experience was awful. The girls working seem to argue over who was going to be responsible for it and once decided the person given the job was not best pleased and didn’t hide the fact! She stomped around to find the bits she needed and then kept a foul face on throughout. The wrap consisted of her slapping some mud like cream on the tops of my feet only and there was no exfoliation and little massage. The nail painting was ok but could have quite easily be done by a friend. Lovely place just not what they are good for.

Perfect Hammam!. This was single handed the best hammam and massage I have ever received. We got a deal that between 10 and 2 for the equivalent of €30 each, we got a Hammam bath, a short foot massage and an hour long massage too - for the price was an absolute bargain. I didn't know what to expect with the Hammam and I did it with my boyfriend so it was a strange experience but genuinely my skin and hair have never been so clean in my entire life. The massage was so relaxing that both of us fell asleep too! I really wish they had them in Ireland.

simply divine. the stuff, the owner and the ambient were simply fantastic. the treatment were nice and long, relaxing and rejuvenating. i recommend the Moroccan massage and definitely the hamam treatment.

five star hammam!. This has to be the mot luxurious and relaxing spa I have been to. We have arrived not knowing quite what to expect, but felt very well looked after and at ease. We have opted for three treatments and whole process was smooth and relaxing. This hammam is uber clean and has gorgeous interiors.Me and my friend started our pampering session off with a facial. This was an extremely sensual experience, all products felt and smelled great and my beautician had the softest touch! Afterwards we relaxed on the loungers with mint tea. We proceeded to have a romantic bath. Baths were covered in rose petals and smelled amazing. We were left on our own to relax. 15 minutes later two ladies came in with cold bottled water (which was very much appreciated) and proceeded to give us the best head and shoulder massage I’ve ever had! These ladies then helped us get dressed and finish off the session by a gentle foot rub as we were having yet another cup of mint tea.If we weren’t in heaven already, we were then taken upstairs for a whole body drainage massage. My masseuse had very knowledgeable hands and was working her way through all my lymph nodes. It was invigorating and yet relaxing.At the check out we picked up a few beauty products at a very reasonable price, something to take home to remind us of this wonderful experience!
Wonderfull experience. All the people working at Les Bains de Azahara where very nice to us. The massage was also very relaxing and we will definetley go back!

Will come back!. 1hour of good moroccan massage while listening the mosquee calls for Praying, then the exfoliating rubbing with black soap at the hot hamman, the strange but pleasant feeling of being bathed, as it was done more than 2000 years ago, then the relaxing glass of tea and the foot massage... A truly pleasure. Maite, the owner, was there and was very kind and nice. The place is very safe, and the way back walking to Jemaa el Fna was another good experience. Will come back! Many thanks Maite!

Amazingly tranquil. We are a group of volunteers that desperately needed pamper time . Omg this place far exceeded any expectations we had . The staff were fab and the treatments were first class. The prices were phenomenal . Defo recommend . . We will be going again before we leave . You must try x

Disappointing, not as expected. Had read all the fantastic reviews but my experience was nothing like that! Was the only client there, they didn't speak and English and only a little French so communication was difficult. However that shouldn't have mattered, I thought I knew what to expect but it never materialised. No steam, just buckets of warm water thrown over me then quick douse with what looked like washing up liquid. Then left for "5" minutes in lukewarm room, no steam - after 10, I had to go to look for someone to rescue me! In middle of scrubbing she had to go answere her mobile phone - really! in all, 20 minutes max of washing.scrubbing. The 2 minute of feet in rose petal water. Then moved to a lounger where I got mint tea and a mini foot rub.Then upstairs for "1 hour" massage - not so much a massage, mostly a rather soft rub all over, mainly on my legs. Had to ask for a bit more pressure to make it feel like something was actually happening!No water offered, I had to ask to some afterwards.Maybe the fact that it was Ramadan made a difference but nevertheless a very disappointing experience all round. Wast of money.

Best hammam ever. I am so glad we found this Hammam...it was the best spa treatment I have ever had.The experience started with getting changed in our private cabins into these disposable underwear (very funny look).Then we were led to the hammam room where we have received a 45 minutes Hammam treatment.We got washed with black soap, exfoliated, washed again, oiled, shampooed, steamed and received a foot bath as well.Then we were led outside to the resting area, received some mint tea and a 5-10minutes foot massage. Then rested for 5 minutes more and led upstairs to the treatment room where we were massaged for an hour side by side.You can choose between relaxation or a stronger moroccan massage. We selected the Moroccan massage and it was amazing with proper pressure and very skilled hand techniques.If you go between 10-14 they even have a special deal for 700 DH for 2 people.We very very satisfied and also gave 20DH for each of the massage therapist.

Pure heaven. We came here on the last day of a seven day trip to Marrakech and we had the couples experience which included an exfoliating scrub, foot massage and full body massage.This was the best part of the whole trip. The hammam was warm and (very importantly) clean! The staff were friendly and attentive and the building was beautiful with atmospheric, calming music playing. We were given bottles of water and tea and allowed to take our time and relax. It was a wonderful experience and I would absolutely recommend this to anyone travelling to Marrakech. The only slight difficultly is that it's tricky to find and none of the locals appeared to have heard of it. Well worth it once we'd found it though!

The one to try. There are many who use self–made TripAdviser signs in the jungle of massage studios and saunas in Marrakech. Therefore, it has been challenging to find the right one.Most are pretty good , but to find the absolute best requires a little more of you.I've checked 5-6 places and there is one that stands out on all parameters. I mean location, cleanliness , price vs. quality should be emphasized, and here wins Les Bains D ` Azahara. This is the real deal!You will meet with a quiet professional lady who gives the peace you want. RELAX!You are then ushered into a dressing room where you leave your clothes in a locked cabinet. We have been here six times and this is one hundred percent safe. Then it's into a small sauna. Here you lie down and feel the heat rising in the body. You are then washed and scrubbed by a strong girl in the 20s. You feel the old junk disappear from your skin .After extensive rinsing carries for 15 minute foot massage cup classic Moroccan tea. Soothing tones fills your ears and your employees whispers so you will go best possible rest. The venue is an old almost country-house style with a sleek dark wood interiors, and the smell is nice. Then you get one hour massage that you not will forget. FANTASTIC!Don't forget to tip the girls! Good luck.

Average spa outside the city centre. . The hammam was disappointingly perfunctory. Water was thrown at me like a waterboarding session. The room was not hot enough to produce adequate steam. The kessa and algae body treatment were ungenerous and had no detectable effect. I had to beg for some water as no refreshments were offered even after hammam.Next time I would try another of the luxury spas. I reckon our riad got commission for sending us there. Despite these reservations I still feel it was reasonably priced, though did not deserve the 'luxury' tah
Relaxing Morning. We had a couples package including a hammam, massage and foot massage. It was really good value and an enjoyable experience on a cloudy Marrakech day.
Fantastic hammam and massage. Lovely Moroccan experience. Decor, hammam and massage all great. Staff very nice. Would definitely recommend.

Excellent spa and hammam. My boyfriend and I have just returned from a weekend in Marrakesh. We were staying in Riad Barroko which is the sister riad to this spa and only a two minute walk.The staff were all very helpful. The lady on reception took the time to answer our questions and recommend treatments. In the end we both had a 1 hour draining massage followed by the 45 minute hammam experience.Both treatments were excellent. The staff carrying out the treatments were friendly and experienced. We were provided with robes, disposable flip flops and disposable underwear. There is a changing area and a locker to leave any valuables.After the treatments we were given tea and allowed to take our time before leaving. The spa is clean, beautiful and a truly relaxing place. I would definitely come back here and I would highly recommend this spa/hammam.Thank you all so much!

Excellent Hamman experience. We found this hamman by chance walking back from Jardin Majorelle and I'm glad we did. We had the traditional hamman and body massage - a great first time experience. Everything you need is supplied and all the ladies looked after us really well and were very friendly.

Great and above all very cheap for what you get!. We went twice. That's how much we loved it. Everything is great here and when you consider the price you pay for it all, you relax even more. The hammam is very nice and the massage excellent (we went for the Moroccan massage). The only drawback is that you can't really take a shower after the massage. There is a shower yes, but no pressure and no towels. If you go out afterwards you have to get back home first to shower...

Excellent from beginning to end. We found this Hamman on tripadvisor and made the reservation for the body scrub, rose petal foot soak and body massage online. It was easy and the prices are so inexpensive (we are from NY). It was a true adventure to find this place and from the simply front door, I told myself to lower myexpectations but OMG they made me raise them and still surpassed. I don't remember everyone's names, and for that I apologize but I do remember Elham. She gave me my foot and then body massage - she was so good - firm yet gentle.My partner and I started with a black soap scrub, it was so relaxing yet cleansing. I felt my skin breathe. The intimacy of the room was perfect for the two of us. Afterwards, the foot massage and tea were the perfect segue to the body massage. It gave us the opportunity to chat with the staff and talk to each other.As I mentioned Elham was gentle yet firm. I am often ticklish and don't relax during massages but this time I almost fell asleep. Yet the kinks in my shoulders didn't leave with me.We were so disappointed that we didn't have time at the end of our trip to return for a second massage. I would suggest that people run to this Hamman. It is wonderful

Ok. The spa is was ok., nothing spectacular but ok. You can not shower after a massage because the hot water pressure was too low (not enogh even to wash your hands). My wife had 2 services, and while she was taking the first one there was a kind of discusion (in arabic, so we couldn't understand) between two ladies about who will do the massage which was anoying.The hamman+massage was good, relaxing and great value for the money.

amazing experience. you have got to go to this spa. There are others nearer to Jama El Fana also but we opted to go to this one as the prices were reasonable.2 of us had the second hammam on the list which equated to £20 for 45minutes. The lady washed and scrubbed our whole bodies with black soap, applied a mud mask and also Shampooed our hair.the interior is beautiful too. the lady on the front desk speaks very good english too.fabulous experience,

Beautiful experience!. Easy to book online, in January I was able to book the day before for the next day. It's down a little side street off the north end of Rue Fatima Zohra and there was a sign on the street pointing the way, very helpful as finding anything in Marrakech can be challenging! :) I had the Relaxing package for 500dh which was great, really good massage! Very tranquil and peaceful. Bathrobes, paper underwear , slippers, everything is provided. Definitely a good value option compared to some of the more well publicized hammans.

Perfect Hammam Experience. Les Bain de Azahara was not my first hammam experience in Morocco, but it is definitely the best. My partner and I were able to book online, which was very convenient, and from the moment we arrived everything was organised down to the last detail. The staff were highly trained, extremely friendly and very professional. Other massages I have had in Morocco have been a bit disappointing, more like an oil rub, but not at Les Bains de Azahara. My massage therapist was fantastic and very thorough. At time it almost felt as though I was getting a four hand massage. The steam room was warm, the robes and towels were dry, the tea was delicious, and the spa package was very well priced. I highly recommend Les Bain de Azahara.

Lovely place, relaxing experience, good value deal. This hamman was round the corner from our Riad which was great. Very easy to make a reservation and a good deal of 350 dirhams for body scrub, foot massage & tea, and 1 hour full body massage. Fine to go in as a couple. They give you everything you need so no need for bikini, etc. Lovely surroundings & very sweet women working there.

Wonderful treat for body and soul. Me and my husband went to this Hammam for a nice relaxing morning treat during our 3 days stay in Marrakech.We have decided to take a Spa package for 350 MAD per person.The experience was truly amazing. The place itself its clean, smell lovely and ladies are all very nice and welcoming. You don't feel embarrassed or intimated.We have brought our own swimming shorts and slippers but everything was provided.We had skin exfoliation with olive black soap - all dead skin went off, then we got a warm cup of mint tea and a feet message. The best part was 1 hour relaxing body message.After all this you can feel like a new born person and skin is so soft and shiny.Thank you very much for a lovely experience we will be back and highly recommend to everyone visiting the city.

perfect hammam experience!. Honestly, you can’t have a nicer closing experience of a 4 day trip to Marrakesh than a perfect hammam bath with a relaxing foot massage! The treat at Les Bains de Azahara was perfect, the personal was professional and kind, the decoration invitingly beautiful! At this cozy place you get luxury treatment for a VERY reasonable price. The owner attended us herself and gave us insight of the day-to-day life in Marrakesh which was worth itself the visit! My husband and I will be eternally grateful for having found this place in the maze of Moroccan streets.

Relaxing Hammam; Great Experience. My wife, 6 year old son, 2 year old daughter and I went to the Les Bains Hammam earlier today and we had a wonderful experience. We decided to go between the hours of 10-2pm as Les Bains offers a special during those hours for a package hammam and one hour massage for 350 dirhams (which is considerably less than other spas that we looked into before we decided to go to Les Bains).The Hammam was very relaxing and all four of us had a fun time getting scrubbed, etc. My wife and I then went upstairs for an hour massage while some of the ladies who worked at the hammam watched our two young children. We ordered the Moroccan massage and it was terrific.All in all, we had a great time at Les Bains and we would highly recommend it for families as children are welcome and are well taken care of. We believe it was a great value for the money (we spent two hours there) and the staff was very friendly and professional and the hammam was extremely relaxing and serene.

Good massage. We booked for a massage in the early evening. It could have been lovely place but seemed uncared for. We were sent to change in our robes then left in the waiting area which was cold and soulless. Nobody had bothered to even light the candles. We could see all the girls talking in the room opposite while we sat and froze. The massage we had was good however and the girls were charming. Needs someone who cares in charge.

Great hammam. This was my first visit to Marrakech and a hammam, and I'm very happy I chose Les Bains de Azahara. From the moment I got in they were really kind and helpful, explaining all the different choices they had. Because of my time constraints I chose a traditional Hammam which included a foot massage. It was great. The therapist was really nice and made feel really comfortable, even though I was wearing only a paper thong!They were calm and not rushing me around and I really enjoyed the experience. I will make sure to have more time on my next visit!!

oh dear -what to say?. If my review was based on my first experience it would be amazing. My partner and I both had the Morrocan massage and both said it was amazing. My therapist (Magga) was brilliant, her pressure was very firm and I really felt the benefit. On the basis of this i booked in for another massage later in my holiday and requested the same therapist.That is where my experience differs.I had never seen the therapist before and when I mentioned this there seemed to be a lack of understanding of what I was talking about. The massage was mediocre, the pressure wishy washy and my time was cut short. I was in and out of the hamman - changed massaged within 50 minutes instead of the hour I had paid for.Complain - I did but again there seemed to be a communication problem ie. no understand much english

Best experience....Ever!. This was the highlight of my holiday, easily the best massage/ spa experience I've had anywhere. 2 hours of sheer bliss, bathed, soaped, scrubbed, foot massage, AMAZING massage to follow, lasted almost 2 hours!!! For 35 euro! What are you looking!??!My friend opted for the hotel Hammam massage at twice the price for half the time. Nothing else to say. Just book it.

A wonderful experience. We had a 45 minute hammam with eucalyptus soap, scrub, mask and rose petal foot bath. It was in a very warm and relaxing environment. Following a foot massage and mint tea, we had a one hour Moroccan massage which was heavenly. I'm not sure how hygienic the facilities were - they seemed to reuse the same exfoliating glove on me and my friend (and who knows how many others) without rinsing it, they exfoliated me on the same surface as her without washing away her dead skin first and everyone seemed to lie on the same massage table without a change of towels. But it was a very relaxing experience and a bargain at 550DH for over 2 hours of pampering.

Amazing Experience. Set in the heart of the city centre this spa place was really amazing with beautiful interiors . The whole family went and were catered for. The were numerous choices of Hammam and massage treatments. Definitely recommend this place with very reasonable prices for the treatments . The staff were very friendly and a welcome drink is offered upon arrival.
ido-edu Basque Countrytik. We enjoyed the hammam+gommage & massage relaxant for almost 2 hours. The attention was great. A great experience.

Perfect experience - lovely host.. My boyfriend and I went for a one hour massage. It was extremely relaxing in a lush environment. 1 hour massage costs 350Dh which in the other places would have given us only 30 to 34min session. The owner is a very friendly Spanish lady who has lived in Marrakech for 20 years and can always suggest some nice places to go to. Experience succeeded my expectations. This place is easiest to find if you go to bab doukkala mosque (find the car park by the mosque) and look for the first alley opposite the car park.

Beautiful hammam. We got the cheapest priced hammam which was 150 dirham and we very much enjoyed it! It was an experience we had never had before but we found it intriguing and relaxing. The first Lady who scrubbed and washed us was very efficient and it was very relaxing, interesting and different from what wev experienced before. there is a beautiful interior inside the hammam room and throughout the building. The only thing that would have improved it was a longer foot massage at the end as it was very short. Be prepared for men and women to wear only a tiny paper thong! Overall loved it!

Really Good Hammam. We found this spa at the end of the road near our riad. It was a trully wondeful place. The traditional hammam with the foot massage at the end was a great experience. The water poured over your body was the perfect temperature, the beautiful smell that permeated the establishement relaxing. The perfect end to our climb up the Atlas mountain. A perfect find.

Fantastic experience all round.. Could not praise the accommodation and staff more. We were a group of 10 girls and we all hope to return with our husbands!! Only point would be.....not enough hot but it wouldn't stop us returning - especially for the home cooked food.

Hidden Gem. My friends and I stumbled across the Spa whilst wondering through the Medina and knew we'd found a perfect retreat from the moment we stepped inside. The interior was beautiful and the delicate mixture of soft lighting and enticing smells added to the ambiance.The price of a Hammam was less than £12 which was incredibly reasonable considering how much we got out of it (the foot massage at the end was divine!).The staff were all polite and attentive, and we all felt so peaceful afterwards that we could have stayed there for more than the one and a half hours.

fantastic flushing massage. Stumbled upon this Hammam just walking by it. Very nice and relaxing decor, nice front desk lady speaks English but no touristy feeling inside at all. On our first visit, the treatments were as expected only to have a screaming baby in the Hammam disrupt the wanted peace and quiet. The owner was apologetic and did not charge us, other than the initial deposit fee of 200 Dhs. We went back a week later hoping to have our relaxing treatments and were not disappointed. The draining massage was very good and my legs felt revived after a week of lots of walking around Marrakech. My friend fell asleep during her relaxing massage, so it worked. I would highly recommend this Hammam for a few hours break and relaxation.

Recomended place to visit in Marrakech. I am from Kiev, Ukraine. I am a huge fan of hammam and I have visited a lot such places in the world. So, I can admit that Les Bains de Azahara is one of the best hamman which I have ever visited. All there is created with understanding of needs and desires of the clients. The personnel is very professional and very client-oriented. When you are going to choose high class hotel, you are looking for five stars hotel, so Les Bains de Azahara is five stars hammam place!

Absolutely enjoyed it - especially for that price!. We had the cheapest treatment but it was absolutely relaxing! The Les Bains de Azahara were the second spa that we went to and we had the same treatment as before but it was half price of what we had payed at the other spa. Comparison and description:We didn't get free slippers and underwear. (So, bring a second slip! Shoes are optional. You don't need them.)My boyfriend and I had a private hammam and the lady who did the treatment was amazing! Instead of using a water jet she scooped water on us. That was so much more relaxing! The room was very nice and traditionally decorated. The srubbing was really intense. In the more expensive spa it was more relaxing - but only because she did hardly scrub half of my body. In this spa the lady scrubbed every bit and was very accurat. I loved it, although it makes your skin burn. :-)Before standing up we got a bucket with cool water and rose peddals to put our feet into. That way my blood circulation was stimulated and I didn't have any problems when I left the room. (I nearly fainted in the other spa.)We were brought to a relaxation area. and got some tea. After a couple of minutes two younger woman came to give us a foot massage which is included. It was really relaxing and I liked the fact that they treated my boyfriend and me at the same time. Although the girls were chatting while doing the massage, I didn't feel disturbed. I think it was more authentic that way. The only negative things: - There was no hair dryer, although they had a shower in the private changing rooms. I was glad, our hotel was only about 100 m from the spa.- You could here the people and cars on the street while being in the spa. It wasn't very loud, but I which, they had a door to seperate the reception an dhallway from the other parts of the spa to keep the noise out.

Good choice. This was a lovely experience. It's quite a small boutique place which made for a friendly atmosphere. I had a hammam and the traditional Marrocan massage and I really enjoyed them and felt very relaxed. My skin felt wonderful for two days!

Hamman was fantastic. We were unsure what to expect but salima the lady that washed and scrubbed us within an inch of our lives . Have the hamman relax and enjoy really great after treking round the souks. Prob best to book if you want late afternoon evening.

Go!. After a long day in the souk with busy venders and pollution, comming to this hammam was paradise.We had a 45 min hammam with clay mask and a one hour massage....need I say more? The hammam is nice ,clean and cozy.Very friendly staff in a lovely atmosphere. Just what we longed for. 6 mature ladies left renewed, relaxed and very clean.Highly recommended.

Not an oasis of calm.. I decided to try this spa because I couldn't get booked into Lea Bains de Marrakech and because the ratings on Trip Advisor were high.If you are looking for a relaxing Hamman experience in Marrakech then this is not the place to go. The spa itself was slightly shabby, the changing area cramped, but for me the biggest negative was the noise. After having the Hamman treatment, which was just ok (the room was too bright), I was then shown into the quiet room for a foot massage and some mint tea. In theory this sounds wonderful, but it was impossible to relax because the room was anything but quiet, I could hear everything that was happening at the reception, including a large group of Dutch tourists trying to make appointments. I then had a Moroccan massage which would have been relaxing if it hadn't been for the street noise, the motor bikes were very loud and I could even hear conversations from the passersby, so I found it impossible to switch off and enjoy.If you want to have a luxurious, total chill out experience then try Les Bains.

Underwhelming.... We visited this spa for a group (7 people) hamam in November 2012, and were split into two groups of 4 and 3. After the glowing reviews, I was really looking forward to the experience, especially having enjoyed excellent hamams at other spas on previous visits.Unfortunately, the whole experience was very underwhelming. The lady who did the 'scrubbing' in our wet-room didn't use any olive soap (so it was a bit 'dry' and ineffective) and she rushed through the 4 of us about 10 minutes quicker than the other group of 3 people (who did have olive soap, bizarrely).After the hamam, I was looking forward to the relaxing mint tea and foot-rub on the lounge-beds. Instead, all the masseuse girls were talking loudly to each other during the massage, and two of them were sending and receiving text messages while actually giving the massage. The whole impression was of employees who didn't really care - completely at odds with previous hamams that I've experienced.A real shame, especially as it was the first hamam for most of the group, and the experience was, at best, mediocre. Maybe it was a one-off (the other reviews suggest it was), but I doubt that I'd return to give them the benefit of the doubt.

The Best Hamman Experience. During our visit to Marrakech we tried few hamman and this one was by far the best. The place is not easy to find as it's tucked a way in a little alley.We had a traditional hamman and the lady scrubbed every inch of our body, it's a wonder how she finds the energy to do that all day long.After the hamman we had a massage, we were so relaxed that it took us a good 10 minutes to go back to real life and the hustle and bustle of the Medina. I would definitely recommend it to anyone in search of the perfect hamman experience

An emergence in indulgence. Immpossible to describe how completely one can be transported away from the mundane by this experience. It is difficult to find, even for the cabbies, so use the tip that it is proximate to the Mosque. We had a bit of difficulty at the end paying with USA credit card not being accepted, and instead of making us feel that we were scamming them, they told us to come back later and pay! I love the lovely people of Morroco. I demurred, and asked the nearest ATM, and they got the coolest young boy to guide me there. That was another experience in traversing the warrens of out of the normal streets of Marrakech, dodging scooters and pedrestrians and going out of place and time.

Fantastic Hammam. My partner and I both attempted to go to Les Bains de Marrakech hammam but it was full for the day and the following day also... Everything happens for a reason they say, as it pushed us to go to Les Bains de Azahara instead which we were both very happy about in hindsight! After a bit of a trek from our riad (in the south of the medina), we found it tucked away down a back street. We both had a traditional hammam which was amazing; the lady that bathed and scrubbed us was like a small machine! She got into every nook and cranny and didnt hold back. We then had a massage and a pedicure... They where ok but nothing compared to the actual hammam and on reflection if we were to go again we would just have the hammam and not bother with the massage or the pedicure... All in all it was a fantastic day and well needed for some serious relaxation. Would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Marrakech and in need of time down-time!

Relief from Marekesh Madness. This was an excellent and refreshing way to spend the afternoon after a long, hot, crowded day in Marekesh. The spa was clean and cool, the ladies working there professional and courteous. Overall a fantastic experience. I plan to go back once more before my departure from Marekesh to restore my sanity.

An excellent and relaxing spa trip. We went here on our second day and it was amazing. We were worried about finding it after reading a few reviews on here but it took us about 2 seconds. A tip is get your taxi to drop you of outside the mosque de bab doukkala it's very easy to find it. We went inside this little door and it takes you into a traditional moroccan palace. The staff were welcoming and friendly, and some even spoke some English which was helpful even though we could speak some French. It smells divine and is relaxing and cool (air conditioned) as soon as you enter. You do get changed into a paper thong and nothing else (as with all/most hammams) and as I went with a friend we did get to know each other a whole lot better. The girl doing our hammam was great and although we got a touch of the giggles over our state it was a very relaxing and amazing experience - I want to go again! You get to relax with some mint tea after too. Head upstairs on these tiny stairs to the massage rooms which again was fantastic and so relaxing. Still in the paper thong so really just be prepared to not really think about your bits all exposed all the time! Afterward they called our hotel for us and made us feel welcome, I would definitely go again! I highly recommend it.
Awesome place. Totally relaxing. Great pampering. Felt completely looked after good quality treatments and not rushed at all. Nice pool area.

Utterly spellbinding. We went to the spa after speaking to some other brits we met in the souk ( they were as lost as we were) and found it every bit as amazing as they'd described. It was difficult to get to, even in a taxi, as it's down a dark alley which has the same name as others in that area, but, that aside, the staff were amazing, the ambiance of the whole place was serene and they treated us like royalty; utter bliss after the madness

A great and experience. We had intended to visit another popular Hammam in Marrakech, that is very well advertized. But we came across this one walking around near our Riad. We stepped in, looked around, and decided to book. Glad we did. It was a different exprience, because we'd not been to a 'public' hammam before but it wasn't so public. We had a private bath but it was three of us, so to us it was a bit public, especially when someone is scrubbing you down. We did the hammam and massage combo. It was very nice, clean, relaxing. The staff of ladies were really kind and we never felt uncomfortable. We felt so clean and refreshed afterwards. I highly recommend this place.

Excellent!. We were recommended this by two people who were staying in the same hotel as us and we are so glad that we were! We had a hammam and massage and enjoyed every moment and left feeling relaxed and my skin felt amazing afterwards!!Felt comfortable the entire time and it was decorated beautifully and all the finer details made at a great experience.

amazing perfect spa and massage!!!. I would recommend everybody to do the spa and hammam. it was perfect! !!!
We enjoyed every single second of it, also the fresh fruit, very friendly ladies...

SPA Day. Booked the East meets West package with my wife. Massage was excellent while my wife complained regarding the hammam so the therapist was careful when I had my hammam. However, the hammam experience was just average and not up to the expected standards.

Best hammam in Marrakech. I had three spa experiences in Marrakech (in the same trip) and the hammam here beats the others by a mile! The mama who gives you the hammam is sweet and makes you feel comfortable. The spa is itself very tiny (just a hammam room and one massage room) but the experience is good! I would re do the hammam when I visit Marrakech again!

Wonderfull-Clean-fantastic. We never had an Hammam treatment until we arrived at the Maison MK. The first Day we booket one- and we was very greatful for this experience!A beautiful Way to clean up the Body and Mind. The different Scrubs and the Oil they Use in the MK are great. It smells fantastic and you really can let you go. We had the Treatment as couple- first i had the Hammam and my Husband the Massage and after we change! during the break we meet us in the smal entrance Room, there we recived a small plate with fruit and a little Drink- amazing!The Massage was with oil, you can decide with smell, a realy soft and relaxing massage! We was happy to have done this treatment and can only tell you to do it, it's an amazing way to clean up- and you will habe a skin like a baby after =0)

Unwinding on arrival in Marrakesh!. Just returned from a brief stay at maison mk. No better way to clear away the accumulated stresses of work than a good pummelling in the hamam and a soothing massage - the full "East - West" treatment - highly recommended!

Blissful. I had the East West package with my adult daughter today and it was the best Hammam & massage experience ever. The massage was exceptional - not rushed, perfect pressure, choice of oils and the lovely lady giving the massage was professional and smiley and therefore I was able to properly relax and enjoy the fabulous massage in the wonderful dark room.
