After the massage I met my daughter in the spa waiting area where we enjoyed a shot of fruit juice and some beautifully presented fruit before swapping over treatments. My daughter said her skin felt like a new born baby and her face was radiant also. Before the Hammam say goodbye to your old skin because you will never see it again! It is a wonderful Hammam experience and again the lady (so sorry I can't remember your names) was lovely, smiley, professional and super strong at scrubbing your body until you almost feel reborn. We both absolutely loved it at Spa MK and I think you really do get what you pay for here. We felt really pampered and special. Yes, you could get a couple of mediocre Hammam packages elsewhere for the price of this one - but I choose quality over quantity every time. After this place I would be disappointed anywhere else. Thank you to the Spa MK team. You're the best.

Whoa!. Samia was my spa girl (is that a thing?) any way, she was fantastic. I went for broke and did the full day of beauty. Hammam. Massage. Facial. Mani. Pedi. It was fantastic. I wish I had the money to actually stay at this riad. It was so lovely! There would have been nothing they could have done to make my time here more enjoyable. I wish I could smell that way all of the time. It's more a blend of east and west so if you're looking for some girthy Berber woman to scrub you with a hedgehog, this is not your place. The hammam is fairly traditional minus the rose petals on everything. I was in heaven.

The Best Hammam Ever. For us it was the best hammam ever. We chose the Ease West experience, which is very good for a couple. It consists of two parts (45' each one), one is a relaxing massage and the other one is a real hammam bath, so everyone starts with one of the two activities. For the massage you can choose several kind of aroma oils including the Argan Moroccan famous oil. They give you the massage in a dark and relaxing environment and you feel so well after. On the other side, for us that used to call to the Arabic baths as Hamman, it was a surprise when we entered in a small room without pools. And this is the real hammam, a Moroccan traditional purifican bath given in a warm and wet room. It consists of several baths and skin exfoliations and at the end, your skin is totally soft and renewed. A unique and wonderful experience, to be repeated from time to time.
Spa: Hammam and massage. We tried various hammams throughout our trip and this was definitely the best. A small facility but well thought out and executed.

Perfect spa experience. We did the East West package for couples. The staff in the spa are excellent and the whole thing was perfect. There is a very small changing room but we were able to use one of the bedrooms in the riad because we had booked dinner too.

Total Relaxation. What could be better than a luxurious neck and back massage. How about tranquil surroundings soft music and the best masseuse north Africa has to offer, well that's Maison Mk absolutely superb. A choice of 3 amazing oils and a beautiful spa room I was probably the most relaxed i'd been in years and the 15minute nap at the end was heaven.

Wonderful spa trip. I booked the spa as a New Year's Day treat for my partner and myself. We had a very lovely afternoon at the spa MK. We had both never had any traditional treatments before so I went for the east meets west package. The massage and the scrub were both very relaxing and thorough. We had cocktails on the delightful secluded terrace before and after the treatments. Would highly recommend spa MK, we were looked after with care and for the service and the venue it is very reasonably priced.

Perfect customer service. I had hammam and massage, both were special. Even thought the steam room was not as hot as at the Heritage Spa, the women made you feel relaxed and well taken care of. Had a mojito on the terrace after the session. Perfect! Could have wished the steam room was a bit more steamy... Prefer lying directly on the stone, not a mat.

Very nice. It's not actually that hard to find once you know you're way around the medina a bit. :-). The map on the website is excellent...and I really appreciated that!It's a nice spa catering to foreigners. You'll love it! I did the hammam and a massage. It was wonderful. The hammam cleaned off all the dead skin and the masseuse was lovely. And the massage was very, very relaxing.It is not a "real" Moroccan hammam. The room isn't so hot that you can barely breathe, the scrub down doesn't actually hurt. The people are lovely. It's just a very comfortable place.

A perfect end to the day. We took the package for couples followed by a gourmet meal. It was the perfect end to a day of exploration in Marrakech.The spa staff were courteous and efficient and the meal afterwards was very good.
Lovely Massage. The massage I had at Maison MK was really good. The spa facilities are small but the therapist was excellent.

Best of the Hammam Spas we did. And we did a lot. This was the best Hammam we had during our Marrakech trip. And we did all the ones recommended in the top 5 on the internet. Hammam was the most relaxed and comfortable one, and the venue is really nice. Staff very attentive and thoughtful. Whole experience was very good. We did the East West experience. If you want to do the evening dinner thing combined with the spa book well well in advance.....

you'll never want to leave. This spa truly is in the top five best luxury spas in marrakech. You are well looked after and the couples package for a hammam and massage each which is a beautiful and relaxing experience you will feel reborn after. It will be something you will always remember and is great value for money.

Impressed Sceptic. I am not really mad about spas but my wife is and so we went for the couples East/West treatment here and I must say I found the experience very relaxing and refreshing. As with the rest of the staff at MK the masseur and the lady in the hammam are wonderful and really know their stuff. The massage was probably the best of the few that I have had and whilst I have had saunas and steam baths before, I have never had a hammam and found it, including the exfoliation process very pleasant. The small spa area is great and really well thought out.

Perfect Pedicure. I had a pedicure at Spa Mk, which I really enjoyed and was relaxing. My toenails were filed and shaped immaculately and painted very professionally. On my previous trip to Spa MK in 2012 I had a Hamman which was a real treat to experience a Moroccan tradition. I can really reccomend Spa MK if you are looking for a relaxing professional spa treatment in Marrakech.
Very enjoyable experience. Having never had a massage before I was not entirely sure what to expect but I felt at ease and relaxed and would definitely repeat the experience at spa mk

A refreshing and relaxing start to our stay!. We arrived at MK from London early afternoon and what better way to start our holiday than with a hammam and massage. We immediately felt cleansed and refreshed - ready for the rigours of are lacing break.

An amazing experience. Whilst staying at Maison MK recently, my husband and I had the East West Combination at the Spa, a 90 minute combination of a luxury hammam and a relaxation massage. Well, what can I say...it was the most incredible experience, a first for us both and we came out after the hammam practically speechless having had no prior idea of what it would be like. Not only was it incredibly relaxing and in a lovely setting, we came out feeling cleaner and smoother than ever before, scrubbed like a baby by the wonderful hammamiste Fatiha. This was followed by the most relaxing massage I've ever had, with a lovely choice of oils, by another lovely lady, Samia. This experience is an absolute must, and great way of relaxing before an afternoons shopping in the souks. Not to be missed!

Gorgeous massage. My pregnant sister and I enjoyed Maison MK's spa when we stayed at the riad for five days in December. The massage we both agreed was one of the best we had. Unfortunately for my sister she couldn't safely enjoy the hammam due to her pregnancy but I thought it fantastic and like nothing I'd had before. The manicure as part of our pep-up treatment was less special so in future I'd properly opt for a hand massage or foot massage instead.

5 star spa. We stayed at the Maison MK and this is part of the riad (like the restaurant gastro mk). We both had the hamam & massage - what a way to spend 2 hours ! THe hamam scrubs off the old skin & magically replaces it with fresh, soft, new skin. Then the massage takes away tired old muscles and magically replaces them with fresh, soft, new muscles. Wonderful - we felt like new human beings after the treatment. Prices are very reasonable too !

hkim. spa was immaculate very cozy, Hammam was excellent!!!food was excellent and bar upstairs has great view definitely recommend spa and restaurant.had chance to quick look of their accommodation as well definitely love to stay next time.very convenient area as well.cheers

Amazing experience and incredibly relaxing. This absolutely made our trip.We had the East West package which was such a treat, really relaxing. The therapists were attentive, kind and professional.We left there feeling so relaxed and ready for the hustle and bustle of the busy City.This is an absolute MUST while you're visiting Marrakesh.

East West Package at Spa MK. We took advantage of the Spa at Maison MK and got the East West package where one person does a traditional massage while the other the hammam treatment and then you switch. The spa itself is really nicely decorated and peaceful. The massage was really nice but nothing compared to the hammam experience. This truly was a luxury to remember and highly recommended!
great spa. One of the city’s best hammams.We went for a massage and my wife did the hammam, we both loved it ,they will see us again.

great treatments. we were staying at maison mk & this is their in-house spa. We had the hammam and massage treatments. So complete & luxurious - we emerged from the hamam all bright and sparkly, and we emerged from the massage room so chilled we could have slept. One of us started with a massage, the other with the hamam & then we changed over - it wortked really well & meant that we didn't need to miss out on too much shopping time in the mad city.

Rather splendid spa!. My partner and I had the East/West spa experience - a massage followed by a hammam. The massage was great - relaxing and very effective at getting rid of the shopping stress. However, Hammam was the highlight - pampered, scrubbed, oiled, polished, rinsed and relaxed - a remarkable experience. Highly recommended when you are in Marrakech and in need of some TLC!

Intimate spa experience. I went in to Spa MK for the works - massage, mani and pedi - and came out feeling like a new woman! Very well trained massage, one of the best I've ever received. Genuine, personable and welcoming owner and staff, as well. Highly recommended.

Bliss. I had the Hammam, deep tissue massage, manicure and pedicure. All services were great! I live in France and I find these types of services are average and over priced. Spa MK was top notch. Its small, right off the central area of hotel but still very discreet. I was staying at the Riad, I scheduled it so I finished right when they served afternoon tea! added bonus!

real luxury. A friend and I had the east meets west treatments along with the delicious meal. This was a special treat for us as we were only in Marrakech for four days. The treatments were wonderful and the ladies who gave the treatments were very kind and calm, this was very nice as we had no idea what to expect from the hammam.. which we both loved and will always remember. After our treatments we had canapés on the rooftop overlooking Marrakech which was a special experience and we were able to talk to the owner who has worked and is working extremely hard to make spa MK perfect and I must say we could not fault it. Our delicious meal was super.. very imaginative and although I am not a 'foodie' as such could appreciate the originality, presentation and of course taste of this beautifully cooked meal.. the waiters were charming..as were all the staff we came across. The décor is outstanding .. I especially liked the concave ceiling (which is covered in gold leaf) with the attractive lamp hanging from it. All in all I am so glad I checked on tripadvisor before I left for Marrakech as this is such a beautiful place to find behind a simple door.
Relaxing. we both took a 1h massage and it was very relaxing. the combination between the perfect riad and the wonderful spa makes Maison MK one of the best places in Marrakech

Great place. We had the spa treatment starting at 5pm and finished it with drinks on the spectacular roof terrace and dinner later on in the restaurant. From start to finish the service was exemplary and the staff are a credit to the place. The property itself is fabulous and the food was the best we had in Marrakech; a gourmet experience. This place was highly recommended to us and we completely agree that it is a brilliant place.We will be back.

A different world. Walking into this place was as if you were walking into another whole world. My wife and I booked the evening pamper package, one person has a massage while the other has the hammam treatment then you swap over. The treatments last for 90 minutes and it was absolutely amazing. Both the ladies who carried out the treatments were great! We couldn't have wished for anything more. We were really well looked after from start to finish. Once the treatment was done we went to our 5 course taster meal. This was out of this world, a fantastic menu with some crazy ideas that really worked! MK is a beautiful riad, I would recommend taking a look for sure. The waiters who looked after us were so polite, not overly attentive and even gave us our own private dining room which made the evening so much more romantic for the both of us. I cannot thank them enough for this wonderful experience. I would definitely stay at MK if we ever visit Marrakech again.
Relaxing pedicure. I had the luxury pedicure whilst staying at maison mk, it was so relaxing and my feet felt wonderful afterwards. Wished I had booked a massage too.

Oasis in the madness. An incredible modern oasis in the madness of Marrakesh with hints to the history and culture of the old town. We went for the evening pamper session as a treat from my girlfriend on her birthday. The package included a fantastic hammam massage, a further massage and then a five course taster meal. Everything was perfect. The staff were attentive and friendly and the food was as good as any restaurant in London or New York. Highly recommended.

Amazing experience!. This was the first time I ever visited a hammam so I decided to choose a private one and I couldn't have made a better decision! We took the combo massage and hammam and I started with the hammam, the woman did an amazing job and I loved the whole experience! The massage after was a nice bonus although I was pretty relaxed after the hammam ;) if anyone is looking for an amazing time choose this one!
Lovely spa treatments. Lovely spa experience at this super riad - great massage, facial, and pedicure - all in lovely surroundings

A pampered spa experience. My husband and I got the East/West Hamman after we luckily ended up staying at Maison MK. We looked at other hammans but were not quite sure what we were going to get so when we ended up staying here we decided to splurge. The services were a little on the expensive side especially since they only lasted 45 minutes. The treatment rooms were small and intimate. I adored the hammam room and wished I could have one at my house! Roukia and Fatima were very attentive and warm and friendly. We loved the little touches and felt very well taken care of.

Best Ever. We spa'd our way around Marrakech this past week. We started with a hammam/massage package at Maison MK and nothing compared. The massage was amazing, one of the best I have ever had. The room is dark and beautiful and the masseuse was a pleasure. In between the massage and the hammam we had a little break with tea and fresh fruit. The hammam was amazing, one hour of being scrubbed, bathed, moisturised, etc. I have never had a better hammam experience. The hammam technician was a happy, smiley woman who definitely knew what she was doing. I wish we had gone back again before we left but will definitely be back.

Heaven with a 5 stars customer service. I bought a Pampering package with a friend, we had Hammam and massage treatments plus tasting dinner included. As soon as we arrived we were welcomed with mint tea and we relaxed on maroccan style sofa placed in the courtyard. They provide everything you need (rubs, slippers, hairdrier) and between the treatments you also have 15'min relax with fresh fruit and juice. AMAZING! The hammam experience is something beautiful, the Hammam lady is so professional and sweet, I enjoyed every minute in there! Afterward I had a relaxing massage with green tea argan oil, really nice. In total is one hour for 2 treatments plus 15' relaxing in between. The therapist both speaks English and they are so nice... After the SPA session we were offered a room upstairs in the Riad where to get changed for dinner (separate review for the SUPERB restaurant and food experience)...What else for an unforgettable evening in Marrakech??

Luxurious treat. Our weekend trip to Maison mk was one to escape the British weather and also to relax - and we did just that. I had a beautiful facial on our first day and my husband had what he has described as the best massage ever! Lovely staff and comfortable treatment rooms. On our second day we had booked the Afternoon Treat (East West hammam and massage combination) - one of you has the hammam treatment whilst your partner has a massage. After 45 mins we sat in a reception area in the middle of the two treatment rooms and had some pieces of freshly prepared fruit and a delicious fruit drink and then swapped treatments for another 45 minutes. The hammam was a fantastic new experience, both relaxing and invigorating and the massage was nice and firm. Afterwards we went up onto the terrace in our bath robes and sat in the late afternoon sun having English afternoon tea - which was all part of the Afternoon Treat - it was absolute bliss. Advisable to book well in advance.

Best hamam and massage so far. Entering the riad you find bright modern interior etrium, containing a small plunge pool with a resident large rubber duck. The treatment rooms are off this space. There is a small massage room and a separate hammam both of a size designed for one guest anf one massiuse. The staff are charming and talented. After a treatment you can head up to the roof and enjoy a glass of wine while soaking up the atmosphare of the bustling medina and a see of rooftops spread out below in all directions under the watchful presents of the majestic mosque nearby.

Unforgettable, luxurious treat. Top marks to this spa hotel. We had the east west treatment and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a luxurious hammam & massage experience. An oasis in the midst of Marrakech.

A luxury spa experience. I researched hammams in Marrakech long and hard, as many seemed to involve giggly indiscreet masseuses and public humiliation in a disposable thong. Spa MK offers a relaxing and luxurious experience. We had the East-West combination - my unsuspecting husband was lulled into a massage-induced stupor and was then sloshed awake next door by the hammamiste, whilst I made sure I had the hammam first and could then float away for the rest of the evening, oil-scented and relaxed. In this package the treatments are done completely privately; you can take your own undies or swimwear; and they provide robes, slippers, a hairdryer and snacks. There was plenty of giggling from the hammam room - inevitably having a bowl of warm water emptied over your head is funny, and the hammamiste is good-humoured and has a laugh with you. The masseuse is equally lovely - just the right amount of chat and engagement whilst remaining respectful. All in all, a very lovely experience.

The evening pampering package - wish we'd just done the restuarant. Not worth it for the spa. So, I was SO excited for this part of the trip given the rest of the reviews online about Maision MK. My husband and I booked the evening pampering package, which is 2600 dirhams for 2 people. To me, the spa was just a room to the side that they'd set up to make a bit of extra cash and not a focus what-so-ever of the experience. At one point during my hammam, I was so cold and kept telling the kind hammam lady "j'ai froid!!" because she was opening and closing the door so often and would just leave me alone for ages. We could have just done the (amazing) dinner at 650 dirhams a head (separate review) and saved ourselves the poor to average hammam and massage and just had a good dinner. I had several other hammams while in Marrakech and am a frequent visitor to spas, so I feel confident in my assessment that this is the least focus of this property.
amazing massage. the therapist was so professional & she left me feeling totally de-stressed and relaxed. The perfect preparation for a day out in the souks !

Incredible spa experience in heart of the Medina. I had the most incredible facial at Spa MK, the Oriental, delivered by the amazing Roukia. Can't recommend her highly enough. She also washed and blow dried my hair with amazing results. My partner had the East West treatment and emerged on cloud nine. Just book and find out for yourself....utterly fabulous.

Heaven. My friend and I booked the evening pamper package. From the moment we arrived we couldnt feel more looked after. As we arrived a little early we were offered mint tea and oranges while we waited and it gave us a chance to soak up the beautiful surroundings. The spa session was a hammam and massage, one of you has the hammam, the other the massage and then swap. The staff were lovely, very attentive and the massage was pure bliss. After you are given time to dress and get ready before going to the roof garden for drinks and canapes. The terrace gave excellent view all across the city at night. A fire was blazing to keep you warm and blankets were offered for all those feeling a little chilly. After choosing main course we were escorted back downstairs for a 5 course meal. The food was simply delicious and very well presented. This really was a holiday highlight and a definite must do for those who enjoy a pamper, great food and excellent service. I cannot reccomend enough.

Enjoyable hammam and spa experience. My husband and I booked the 'afternoon treat' package at Spa MK. The surroundings are wonderful, the hammam and spa room felt luxurious and relaxing and the therapists were very good. The roof terrace that we had afternoon tea on was lovely, with great views over Marrakech. The afternoon tea itself was OK but not amazing, I found the cakes a bit over-sweet and the sandwiches a little dry. The scones however were delicious. It's not cheap but I would recommend the spa for a real treat in Marrakech, but perhaps without the afternoon tea.

Christmas Bliss. The Spa was beautifully designed and I couldn't wait to have a treatment.There were many different treatments to choose from. I chose the 90 minute Top to Toe Massage (Signature treatment) on Christmas Day. The candles, the delicious fragrances and the amazing therapist ensured I was totally relaxed for the rest of our holiday.

The perfect hamam experience. Me and my friend Anastasia chose the east and west combination, which is a 45' massage and a 45' hamam. The stuff was really polite and friendly, they offered us mint tea before and fruit platter after.One of us was in the massage while the other was in the hamam, so neither of us had to wait!Massage was really relaxing and we enjoyed it, but we both agreed that the hamam was an awsome experience and we strongly recommended it to everyone!One of the highlights of our visit to Marrakesh!Don't miss it!!!

Spa Bliss!. My friend and I had a package that included a Hammam and massage for each of us. Every little touch has been thought of, from the ice cold bottles of water that we had in the middle of our treatments to the mint tea and beautifully presented fruit platter after. We both emerged from our treatments feeling thoroughly scrubbed with super soft skin and feeling very relaxed! I would highly recommend the Spa to anyone with a spare hour or two in Marrakech!

WHAT AN EXPERIENCE!!!! . My wife and I visited this spa yesterday and it was probably the highlight of our visit to Marrakech. Hanane and the whole team were amazing and the spa/hotel is out of this world! After our treatments we were taken to the roof terrace for a glass of wine, the view was one of the best in the city, cannot recommend highly enough! Thank you for an amazing experience and evening see you on our next visit! :-)

Truly Relaxing Spa Treatments. My husband and I both enjoyed hammans and massages. Both were thoroughly enjoyable, with staff who were both professional and caring. My husband was something of a novice when it comes to massages and he was very impressed. It was lovely to enjoy mint tea after our treatments whilst overlooking the indoor pool. We will certainly book more when we return!

Maison MK. I took my teange daughter and a couple of friend for a "pamper afternoon" to celebrate a couple of birthdays. Masion MK devised a lovely pacakage which lastest several hours and included afternoon tea on the rooftop - and amazing experience for us all. We shall be back!!!

Wonderful experience!. Had a great experience at Spa MK and had chance to overlook the lovely suite and terraces of the location. It is a must to visit this location if you are in Marrakech, it embodies the perfect spirit!Will definitely come back!

Sumptuous in-house hammam and massage. My wife and I had a spa treatment and rose petal bath during our stay at the riyad and both of as agree that the experience was excellent. A great range of treatments, excellent service (staff offered to come in on our day off because we were leaving the next day) and a fantastic locationA great place to relax and let the stresses of the day/journey melt away.

Fantastic massage and hammam at Maison MK. My wife and I had the combined massage and hammam while we were guests at the beautiful Maison MK. I am not really a "spa sort of bloke" but this experience was superb. The massage (my first), was a perfect antidote to the hussle and bustle of the Medina. Roukia was friendly, very professional and the whole experience was fabulous. The same goes for the hammam a great experience, professionally done. If you go as a couple, one does the massage while the other does the hammam then you swap over. You then sit, glowing and relaxed while you rehydrate with water and mint tea before hitting the souks with renewed energy - thoroughly recommend it.

Luxurious in-house hammam and massage. Maison mk, as well as offering luxurious riad accomodation and being the home of gastro mk, also has a private hammam and massage room. The treatments here are a fantastic way to relax and spoil yourself, just a step away from the crowded medina.

Perfect for pampering!. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit at Spa MK. We arrived early, escaping the hussle and bussle of the streets and relaxed on the rooftop terrace sunloungers before our treatments. The luxury hammam and massage is amazing and definitely worth trying if you're looking for a traditional Moroccon spa experience. Professional and luxurious, this spa is worth a visit!

the place for a massage in marrakech. If you want one place to go for a spa without breaking the bank on the five star hotel spas, go straight to Roukia, the highly skilled and experienced therapist at Spa MK. I tried massages in three more reasonably priced places in Marrakech, two of which had nice settings but were disappointing treatments by ladies without a lot of experience of what an international clientele expect, including the highly rated and otherwise lovely and gracious Heritage Spa. The difference at Spa MK is Roukia's magic hands. She has firm pressure and knows where the muscles are, a rare skill in Marrakech. She leaves you transformed. Her relaxing facials use all natural ingredients and include a massage during the mask. Highly recommended.

Fantastic day! Highly recommend this for a real Marrocan experience.. We just spent the day at MK maison , firstly doing the cookery course followed by the East West treatment at the spa. Everything was wonderful and the staff could not have been nicer. It is not the cheapest place in Marrarkech but you get quality and is good value for money. Thank you so much for adding such a great day to our Marrocan honeymoon!

A very relaxing experience!. This was the first time my husband and I have ever had a hamman and we can now thoroughly recommend it. The staff at the Maison MK spa were professional and friendly. One of us had a 45 minute massage whilst the other had the hamman and then we swapped over. It basically consists of having a lot of buckets of warm water chucked over you, then a scrub with black soap, an exfoliation with a mitt ,a mud mask, argan oil in your hair, and then more buckets of warm water. When you leave you feel totally relaxed and your skin and hair have never felt softer. The massage was also very good. A great thing to do after a morning spent walking round the souks.

Excellent Massage. I was staying at Maison MK so thought I would try a massage as I suffer with carries the woes of my life in my neck and shoulders. It was fantastic and I highly recommend it. It made my stay in Marrakech so much better as all my stresses were sent packing and I could really relax. I also then had a pedicure and choose vibrant orange nail polish, which went beautifully in Marrakech. If you want to really have a treat then I recommend a trip to the Maison MK spa.

super-relaxing. I wish i was back in the spa now, not typing this in rainy England. I had the hamam & massage - 90 minutes of pure bliss & relaxation. First was the hamam - scrubbed, coated, rubbed, softened, and washed with gallons of water - what an amzing treatment ! Then it was onto the massage. I was offered a choice of oils, and the room was so calming with its candlelight, chilled music, comfy bed, and amazing masseuse.As an alternative to tramping round the dusty souqs, its hard to beat this - definitely a super-relaxing way top spend a couple of hours.

Professional and relaxing. My friend and I booked ourselves into maison mk spa during our trip to marrakech. The experience was wonderful. We were greeted by two very professional and friendly men at reception. The therapist was very friendly and spoke English very well which instantly made us feel comfortable. The exfoliation and hammam was really good and the massage was very relaxing. They used argon oil in our hair and shampooed after. My hair was silky soft. I could also see a huge difference with the face mask they used which I was meaning to go back and purchase but did not get the chance. My friend also had a pedicure and was very pleased with the results. We were given refreshments of juice and Fruit and plenty of iced water to ensure we were hydrated after our hammam. We were also asked to choose which scent we would like them to use for the massage oils. The riyad was beautiful inside. I have had plenty of hammams and massages in many countries and I would say this was one of the best. Excellent value for money!

Great option for 1st time hamman experience. Beautiful atmosphere and professional staff. You get a great hamman experience with all the traditional spa amenities that make it good for people who may be wary about a 100% traditional Moroccan hamman. Have tea after your treatments in the garden area. The massage was relaxing but be sure to tell your therapist about specific areas to focus if you have them.

Lovely Spa!. My friends and I completed the Marrakech Marathon, so good Spa treatments were highly needed. We took massages and hammam, and both treatments were absolutely gorgeous. The 90 minute massage, was especially great. Treat yourselves to this lovely little spa!

Great hammam and amazing treatments!. A friend of mine and I had the most amazing hammam, manicures and pedicures - the staff were lovely and professional and we cannot wait to tell friends and family about it and to return sometime soon.

A truly beautiful retreat in the middle of madness. My husband and I visited Maison Mk for a Hammam, massage and then a 5 course meal. It was a truly wonderful experience. The Hammam and massage were excellent, we then had a room to relax and change in ready for our evening meal. We then had drinks, a hookah and canapés on the beautiful roof terrace. There was a sumptuous seating area and a fire pit to keep us warm. The restaurant area downstairs was really beautiful and food was of Michelin star standard.
Beautiful. The spa in our hotel ! Had a lovely hamam & massage - felt so well looked after & when the staff had finished, my skin was softer than a baby's. What an amazing way to spend 2 hours.

Perfection in a small package. My boyfriend and I had the chance to enjoy MK's spa as part of their Pamper Package - €220 for a massage, hamman and then a delicious dinner. The spa at MK is small but perfectly formed - we trudged in out of the rain and were met by Hanane, who graciously showed us around the riad and chatted to us while showing us the spa. It's very small but pretty and very very clean. Lovely dark and restful hamman room where I was scrubbed and splashed with great gusto by the lovely lady looking after me. I fell asleep when she left me in there for 5 minutes before scrubbing my hair and tipping more water over me - brilliant. Then out to the waiting room for a cool sorbet and a little rest before going into the pretty massage room for a superb massage that really made me forget all my aches and pains! Each treatment was 45 minutes and the 2 ladies who worked there were brilliant. Even my boyfriend agreed it was wonderful (and he's not a massage type of guy). Sure you can probably go to cheaper places but our whole MK experience was so fab, we didn't mind spending the money on such a grand time. Just what we both needed on our first day in Marrakech. Highly recommended.
Totally relaxing. We both enjoyed wonderful Hammans for the first time when we stayed at Maison MK. Such a relaxing experience we can't wait to return!

Peace from the outside world. The luxury Haman experience mixed relaxation with fun. The actual hamman ritual was great fun and wonderful to feel so clean afterwards. The massage was good and very relaxing and put me in good stead to then wander through the souks in a considerably more chilled out fashion,
My most favourite Hamman experience. We both enjoyed a brilliant Hamman and massage before dinner at Gastro MK when we stayed there at the end of November.

...a REAL treat in amazing Marrakech!. We visited Marrakech for the third time at the end of November and wanted to try something 'different'... so we reseached and booked ahead to enjoy a Massage and Hammam at MK Spa, the afternoon before our return to the UK. We weren't entirely sure what to expect, but the service that we received from the MK Spa team was exceptional, both throughout the booking process and from the moment we arrived at MK Spa.MK Spa is easy to find and is an absolute oasis of calm and tranquility inside. The team showed us around the Riad whilst we were waiting and we will certainly stay there in the future - it was very stylish, had a wonderful roof terrace and a clearly dedicated team of knowledgeable and pleasant staff.The treatment itself was an eye opener - but only in a good way! We left feeling refreshed, relaxed and very satisfied - the cost was entirely reasonable and we would definitely return again.Marrakech is a crazy city - but places like MK Spa enable you to appreciate the madness - we'd highly recommend a visit.

Great hammam experience. We reserved the hammam and massage for two. We did not know what to expect. The Maison MK is a showplace and the spa rooms were very nice. I had the massage first, and felt a little more exposed than I would during a massage in the US. It was nothing compared to the scrub down, where by the end I didn't care that I was basically standing naked with buckets of water being poured on my head. I have never had a treatment like it. My husband and I were very shiny at the end. We were treated to a tour of the Riad before we left. It's amazing. Next time I'd try to reserve the spa package that includes dinner.

Very special spa. We were lucky to find Spa MK was just a stone's throw away from where we were staying so we called in first to take a look. As soon as you step through the door you just know it's not going to disappoint! My friend and I chose the 'afternoon treat package' from the long list of fabulous sounding treatments on the menu. I've never had a hammam before but what an experience - it was amazing and I can't wait to try it again!! The afternoon tea was very traditionally English but taste was sublime and the pastries truly wonderful!We were so impressed we went back the next evening for the 5 course taster menu. The food was sensational and not that expensive. We also had the best wine of our stay! I would highly recommend this gem of a place - do not miss it if you're in Marrakesh!

Wonderful Evening @ MK!. We tried “evening pampering package”, which is 45 minutes Hammam + 45 minutes Massage + 5 course dinner (EUR 220 for 2 people, drinks not included – remember this price is NOT per person!). It was definitely inexpensive for the treatment, food and service we received.It is not easy to find MK, but there is a very detailed description how to get, so I strongly recommend to print out and take it with you (home --> information & downloads (on the bottom) --> PDF documents --> map & directions for maison mk, gastro mk & spa mk) . Anyway, if you still have difficulties, ask someone the direction of a shop called “kif kif” rather than MK.Basically, entrance is all the same for Riad, Spa and restaurant. But spa has its own area inside of Riad.Since the spa is small, only two people can enter at once. You have separate changing room and can leave your belongings inside.You do not need to bring anything with you (unless you need fresh underwear, make up, hair gel, hair brush, etc). Flip flops and bikini pants will be provided by spa.Both hammam and massage rooms are only for one person. It means one must start with hamann and the other with massage. In between you have short break with refreshment, then visa versa afterwards. Since I personally think hammam  massage order is better, it was pity. Massage was very fine and professional - I would have rather preferred little stronger, but my wife liked it very much. Before the massage you can choose which oil you would like her to use (there were four choices). Massage room had dark and relaxing atmosphere.In hammam they wash you three times (hope I am not mistaken). You will be really clean – it is good to wash out all the dust and sweat from Souk! If someone has dry skin, I rather recommend to start with hammam. Otherwise better to take skin cream, if you finish with hammam. Inside of the hammam is very hot, so you will be sweating a lot by the end. You will receive ice-cold mineral water afterwards to cool down – they really think a lot for you.Inside of the spa is very clean. The staff is very professional and the package price was more than fair. We enjoyed it very much and felt like a new born baby afterwards. I do not speak much French, but I did not feel any inconvenience. Although we were not the guest of Riad, we were treated so well both in spa and restaurant. Just please make sure to make reservation, so that you do not miss it!

Fabulous. We were staying at the riad and had the welcome package - massage and hamman. The massage was amazing, all done in candlelight, so especially relaxing. Hamman was great too, my hair and skin felt amazing afterwards - a lovely pampering treat

an initiation. I don't do spas ! That's what I said on my first day, but i needed a half leg massage after the plane journey. After that I was smitten. Half leg massages with mint shea butter after every shopping trip in the souks. A lovely manicure and finally i took the plunge on the last day and did the luxury hammam.I don't regret a thing. Thank you Maison MK for initiating me so gently and beautifully in the joys of spas.

Feel As Though You Are Having An In-Home Experience. The staff are professional; and the little hamman feels comfortable; quiet, seducing. My girlfriend and I had massages and hammam; had we not been so clean, we would have had another!
cool place. coolvery cooltop placetop peopletop stafftop foodhighly recommneded place to have a drink ;;dinner;;stay in their guest houseyours,olli

A must try when in Marrakech. We recently used Spa MK whilst staying at Maison MK. Their spa menu is very comprehensive with may options to choose from. Treatments can be booked in advance, this is advisable as they take bookings from non hotel residents. Treatments were fab. We have tried many spas around the world and both agree this was by far the best. The massages were available in either darkness or candle lit room which added to make it even more relaxing. Expect to pay here what you would pay in UK or possibly less but the standard was excellent. Be sure to try when in Marrakech.
Great , small. Smaller than I expected but great. I have had hamans in turkey and DUI but this was without a doubt the best ever, I felt like cleopatra. Great service.

Nice massage. Missed the Hammam.. The weather was especially hot when we stayed at Maison MK, and I am also pregnant, so my husband and I opted out of the Hammam option and went for a massage. It was nice to have a massage as an afternoon treat after walking around all morning. I have only had a massage in the U.S., so it was a bit different than what I was used to/expected. It seemed to be focused more on oil application than tissue massage, and I was also a bit more "exposed" than I am used to. :) But, that being said, it was still an enjoyable experience. Reading the reviews, it seems like the Hammam is more of their specialty. The Maison is beautiful, and I would imagine it to be a more hygenic/upscale environment than most spas in Marrakech.

Soooo chilled!!. Booked from UK and visited with my daughter. We booked the pamper package after reading other reviews on here. It was everything, and more than we expected. The staff were friendly and professional. We had a hamam and massage, I did one first and my daughter the other then we swapped over. The Riad was stunning and can appreciate exactly what the owners and staff are trying to achieve. I met the owner on a second visit to the Riad to purchase some gifts for friends back home and he was delightful and charming. Nothing is too much bother for these guys and they have thought of everything. I hope to go back soon and stay overnight with my husband... as this time he was unable to travel with us. I am hoping I can get him to use the spa facilities but if not he will certainly enjoy the food and ambience. This place is a must when you visit Marrakech. Thankyou once again to the owners and staff for a wonderful day. (see seperate review re Gastro MK.)

A little over priced and confusing. We had the luxury hamman and stayed for the evening meal. Overall I would say the Spa was above average. Service was excellent and the inside of the Spa itself is amazing to behold. They really did a great job redecorating / renovating (read the history of the place in the book while waiting).The dinner on the other hand was not good. Drinks and canapés were nice, up on top of the beautiful terrace bar. They came and took out dinner choices and we were settling in for a beautiful evening watching the sun set over Marrakesh, then confusingly we get moved downstairs to the back of the reception / spa in the dinning area. It just didn't make sense. The food itself was trying way to hard and even stranger had only the remotest connections to Moroccan cuisine. It didn't really help that I was violently ill the following day and missed most of the last day in Marrakesh....I can't say for definite this was from the fish I had but my partner had the lamb and was fine, having eaten exactly the same as me all day except that meal.Overall the spa is above average but let down by food that is trying way to hard (I had a meal 5 times better in the central square at a stall for less the 10% of the price 2 nights earlier) and slightly overpriced. Worth a visit for the spa though. I would have give the Spa a very good (although just about).
Totally amazing massage with exceptional attention to detail throughout the whole experience.. Best massages I have ever experienced. Rooms were beautiful and relaxing.

delightful and professional. What a delightful treat it was to use this chic little spa. We had the hamam massage package . Very professional. Nice touch to condition the hair, and an amazing beautiful fruit snack. Also very close to the main shopping areas of the souks and the square so worth a visit.
Loved the Hammam. A very different experience, quite sensual and luxurious, and very very soothing.
Spa MK. nice and cosy spa, clean and you get the best private hammam ever .keep up the good work .
Spa MK. Small although offers a good range of spa options with very friendly staff and the pedicure was fantastic - I am a convert!

A perfect evening. I booked an evening at Gastro MK as part of my wife's birthday and it was a beautiful experience, I requested a "nicer" table if possible. It was made an extra special evening as we were given a private room, which made the whole experience unforgettable! The service, the food and the setting from the first moment we arrived was sublime and so congratulations to the management and the team, they deserve every success! Thank you for a "do you remember" memory that we will tell and remember for a long time coming!

massaged to perfection, then fed !. See my Gastro Mk review for the other part of this experience. I had the pamper package & that means a hamam & massage, followed by dinner at Gastro MK (number 1 restaurant in Marrakech). The hamam & massage was sublime. 45 minutes of each & i felt so relaxed when I emerged. Candlelit, quiet, relaxed & attentive, the girls created a wonderful atmosphere. After the treatment it was time to shower & change for dinner and we spent the rest of the evening having a superb 5 course meal. A gerat way to spend nearly 6 hours !

A special experience. What a great experience while you are in Marrakech. The staff are so professional. This is luxury at its best. My husband and I had the hammam and the massage. We literally floated out of the spa when we were finished. It is right inside the riad so you don't have to leave the property to enjoy this experience. I highly recommend it. My husband loved it and he rarely agrees to do this kind of thing. He couldn't wait to go back.

everything was perfect. I have already gone on far too much about Maison Mk, but i love my spas & I had to write a few words about their spa because I saw that its open to non residents as well.I wanted to say thankyou to Loubna & Fatiha for my beautiful hamam & massage. It was a real experience - i have had many massages, but this was my first hamam, and it certainly won't be my last !I have never been looked after so well - i just surrendered myself to these two delightful ladies & everything was perfect. I emerged relaxed, soft, clean and half asleep. The most perfect feeling.

Relaxing manicure. Had a manicure during my stay at Maison MK, which was extremely relaxing. The time spent on my cuticles and nails was far beyond that I have ever received during manicures in the UK. My only criticism, if I had to make one, was that a little longer could have been spent on my hand/arm massage. This comment was passed on to the manager, so hopefully this will be taken into consideration in the future.

Perfect!!!. A wonderful haven, with wonderful staff - a must experience holiday treat!The Rhiad is extremely well refurbished and the spa facilities are top notch and I thought good value. There is also a beautiful roof terrace if you fancy a drink after.

A haven in the medina.... If you are looking for a way to take a step back from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh, look no further. This spa is as relaxing as it is luxurious. We had the couples massage and hammam and I couldn't recommend it more. An utterly gorgeous way to spend an afternoon.
Fabulous experience..could have spent the whole day in there.. Calm, quiet, private, beautiful, peaceful, pure relaxation

Fabulous experience. A fabulous oasis in the madness of Marrakech!! Wonderful Hammam and Massage. Greeted by Emily who was charming and friendly. Thought the price was very good for the level of service. It would cost a lot more in the UK.We also found the owners very helpful, sending us detailed location info. Highly recommend.
A wonderful spa. While staying at Maison MK, my husband and I both treated ourselves by visiting the spa and loved it. Wonderful treatments, very calm and relaxing. Worth a visit!

TOTAL RELAXATION. Definately worth a visit After the chaos of the souks and all the haggling, this spa was a great find We met Emily who had just started working there that day The hamman and massage were the best, staff were very good Ended our day with a mint tea on the terrace Bliss
Good spa, but not cheap. Really enjoyed visiting this spa, but it isn't cheap. The service is excellent and the experience of the Hammam in particular should be done by all who go to Marrakech.
Heavenly!. A terrific Hammam experience - the first of many I'm sure!
Relaxing!. The two ladies were really helpful and gave the most relaxing massage and hammam. You must try it!

Totally Chilled. I had the Hammam Scrub but lovely Fatiha followed by a relaxation massage by Hannan. The Scrub was comfortable and effective; I felt squeaky clean and brand new. The massage was heaven and I was soon sleeping like a baby. I didn't get that after massage aching feeling that you often get the next day and both ladies therapists listened to what I wanted out of the treatments. Being a bit of a spa junky; this place is definitely up there spa quality.

Too expensive. We went there and spent a few hours , the attendant barely spoke any english , bad communication therefore we ended up getting the opposite of what we asked for , oh well we were just dumb tourists...

2 Hours of pure bliss. Relaxation and hammam in the spa. Excellent and relaxtion massage followed by the unique experience of having my first hammam. Gallons of hot water being thrown over you and having your body scrubbed was fantastic. It is a must do thing for any visitor to Morocco

Bliss. Not usually a spa person but could not resist trying a hammam. I felt like a pampered child unable to wash myself. The differrent lotions and scrubs felt so invigorating. My skin felt like it could breath again, then to top this the relaxing oils and massage was just bliss.

stunning hamam & massage. We stayed at Maison MK and used the spa there. There are two massage girls and a hamam girl so we resisted for a few hours before trying out the hamam & massage treatment. Amazing - i am now addicted & want more, more, more !
Valentines. Both me and my wife tried the Hammam and massage treatments twice and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience.

Went for the gourmet diner. Don't arrive late, they like to serve you all at the same time which is fine, and given the quality of the food, an excellent idea. Also, if you are not staying, get very detailed directions, it's not easy to find!

Blissful escape for an afternoon and evening.. We spent the afternoon having a massage then hammam which was very relaxing- and left you feeling cleaner than ever. We then had some drinks on the beautiful roof terrace and stayed for the yummy 5 course meal. A lovely day!If you plan to treat yourself (quite expensive) while in Marrakesh, go to MK maison!
Being reborn. What a bliss, we came out rejuvenated. Complete relaxation

Small but perfectly formed. I experienced my very first hammam at Spa MK but it definitely wont be my last - i came out feeling a like a newborn baby, totally amazing. The massage was excellent too. A great little spa, at very reasonable price.
Magic Maison MK. Amazing spa and great place to stay, give it a go. Annabel and Paris

Pure divine relaxation!. After reading various reviews about the surrounding spas in Marrakech, I'm very glad I chose the spa at Maison MK. Although you are paying a lot more for a hammam, this certainly adds that extra sense of relaxation, knowing that your personals are in kept in safe surroundings, and that the levels of hygiene are top notch.I went for a popular combo of a luxury hammam and relaxing massage. The 'gommage' was sensational, being scrubbed with black soap, then having a rhasoul mud mask, then a sugar scrub, whilst your hair was having an Argan oil conditioning treatment. Buckets of perfectly hot water were poured onto you inside a perfectly steamed atmosphere. Other than having to turn your body over a couple of times, you didn't have to lift a finger!A quick shot of fruit juice and delicate slices of fruit.  If that wasn't enough, you have a 45 min relaxing massage. A candle scented and lit room, the massage was indeed relaxing, with the perfect ambience, almost sending me fall into a deep sleep.A brilliant hour and a half spent in luxurious surroundings for a reasonable price (especially compared to some other packages I'd seen elsewhere). Unfortunately, after all the treatment, you are then plummeted back into the noisy, crazy life that is Marrakech!

Pampered silly. We stayed at MaisonMK so felt like we had the spa just to ourselves and pampered ourselves silly in 3 days. A must is the hamam experience where you start in a steam room and are washed and scrubbed and polished and get an argan oil hair treatment, then massaged beautifully in the next room till you fall asleep - divine. Its good to do with a friend so you can share the experience ( and your reactions to the hamam- I won't spoil it by saying more!)Waxing was very efficient and thorough and professional. Same goes for the manicure and pedicure. The nail polish colours were very tempting (Essie !) but it was nice to see that there was no extra charge for a French manicure. So those were the necessary treatments for me but I would have happily had everything on the long menu if I had more time there.

Serious ChillOut. My visit to the Spa at Maison Mk was certainly equal to anything I've experienced in London. The hammam was wonderful ( I expected to be several pounds lighter after the vigorous exfoliation!) and the massage was excellent. Both the technicians were professional, expert and delightful.

Pure Bliss. My experience in the Spa MK was pure bliss. I was lucky enough to have been a guest at the Maison MK, but I would have ventured through the winding alleys of the medina simply for the spa itself! I enjoyed a 45 minute full body massage followed by a 45 minute himam treatment. The massage was very relaxing and the room was perfectly heated. 45 minutes didn't seem like nearly enough time, I could have laid there forever! Next was my himam treatment, a typical Moroccan washing. It was quite different from any spa treatment I have ever received before... and it was much better! For 45 minutes, I laid in a heated, stone room on a thin yoga-like mat as hot water was continuously poured over my body, followed by such treatments as a sugar exfoliation or an argan oil rub. My hair was washed and conditioned as well. It was arguably the most relaxing, refreshing, and enjoyable 45 minutes of my life! It was very reasonably priced, I paid only 60 euro for both treatments combined. In between, I was served freshly sliced oranges sprinkles with cinnamon. I highly recommend the spa services of Spa MK to anyone and everyone.

another part of the maison mk world that is beautiful. I had a hammam and massage at the spa while we were staying at Maison MK. It is like another world - dark, candle-lit, chilled, and very relaxing. I had 90 minutes of pure indulgence - wonderful.

lovely and very private. A Spa that does not look clinical or like a factory.A very private place, very luxurious without being over the top. Staff are so carring and welcoming and really take the time to treat you well. Amazing hammam massage. I felt so clean refreshed and even my tensions went away.I never though they would do.Loved the decor, the music, their fruit juice after treatment and the all the little attentio to detail. Thank you Spa MK!
Hammam. Please try the Hammam, we also had fabulous massages and pedicures
Fantastic massage. The massage was totally relaxing I would hily recommend.

Magic away from the madness of Marrakech!!!. I booked a visit to Spa MK from my home in the u.k,I had been to Marrakesh before but never experienced a Hammam.I arrived at Spa MK and was greeted warmly by staff and shown to a waiting area and given a drink of water whilst i waited. I had a massage first which was the best i'd ever recieved the therapist certainley has "Magic hands" The rose petals and candles under the bed were a lovely touch and i found it hard not to fall asleep!!!After a glass of fresh juice and fruit it was onto the Hammam.I was very nervous as i didnt know what to expect but the lady who did the treatment was very professional and put me at ease,I was scrubbed within an inch of my life and the clay body mask was divinei left with amazing soft glowing skin and a big smile on my face!The only thing that i thought would have been better was if the Hammam had taken place first then the massage,I went for my flight home straight afterwards and would have slept like a baby! All in all though i would reccommend spa MK for an escape from the heat & dirt of the wonderful city of Marrakech! We are thinking of returning in 2012 and staying at Riad MK and maybe indulging ourselves in some wonderful treatments!!!
Great Spa. Great Spa and we also stayed at the hotel as well..Brilliant place to visit and to stay.
Lovely. Myself and my boyfriend had the hammam and relaxing massage which we both throughly enjoyed, I have never felt so clean and now wish I'd bought some of the black olive soap.

what a way to spend a perfect afternoon. my partner and i went to this spa and we both had a hammam and a massage. So relaxing & so beautiful & we just had the most perfect afternoon. We both left with big grins on our faces and returned to our hotel where we fell asleep, perfectly relaxed. If you want a special treat, this ticked all the boxes for us.

twinkly beautiful. Booked a luxury hammam at this spa before we even left home so that i could prepare my skin and maximise the sunbathing. It was easy to find, but then they did send me directions by email. The spa is actually in the center of a really cool Riad (or town house i think it means), and its very twinkly beautiful. Small I have to say, but perfect. The spa girls were very pleasant, smiling eyes and my girl was very gentle with me. I went through one procedure after another, douche, wash, massage, exfoliate, scrub, wash again, mask, and lots of washing and I think another layer of beautifying and hair shampooing (which seemed to be optional).So all in all a thoroughly cleansing and relaxing experience. I have been to Marrakech 3 times already and had a hammam each time. This one tops the lot because of all the little details and the extra care taken. Back home, Christmas shopping, and it all seems so long ago & far away. I promised I would write a review, so now i can feel less guilty. I wish i could go back because I feel all grubby again.

Very Relaxing. We booked this treatment before our trip on email directly with the spa, the treatments where fantastic we left feeling very relaxed. The only thing I would say is if the spa could provide a plastic bag for your wet clothes after the treatments.

“An oasis from the bustling chaos of the Medina.”. On my recent trip to Marrakech, I had the MK signature massage, facial and reflexology.A must for those tired souls.....It was heaven.A darkened room... gently lit with candles, relaxing music..... which set the mood.A gentle deep cleansing scrub was applied to my face, followed by cleansers and moisturisers, all natural products. Perfect for those with sensitive skins. Foot reflexology followed by a full body massage which was the perfect tonic for a tired and overworked body. Certainly helped me to unwind and aided a good nights sleep. Bliss.

soooo relaxing. we were staying at riad Maison MK and this is the spa there. I promised I would write a review because it was so good. I had the hamam and massage combination. 45 minutes of cleaning & softening & coating & rubbing, followed by 45 minutes of heavenly massage by candlelight. Sadly i fell asleep during the massage so I missed some of it, but i think that shows how relaxing it was.

Hammam and Massage. I went with my mother to Marrakech and prior to travelling has booked a spa treatment at Maison MK. I did not see the Riad as we were taken through to wait for our treatments, the area for the treatments that I saw was very small, and not much room to get changed etc. However the staff were lovely and while we waited we were given some water to drink. The treatment was first class and I recommend everyone to try the Hammam, I could have lay there all day and been scrubbed and washed - very relaxing experience. After I had a full body massage which was a perfect way to finish off the treatment. In between the treatments we were also given some water and fruit - which was a nice touch whilst we sat in our robes. Overall a good experience and just what is needed to take a moment to relax in the hectic city of Marrakech.
Relax at MK. Just right for atmosphere, lovely friendly staff, came out feeling a new woman !

A hidden gem in Marrakech. My Partner and I ate at the restaurant at Maison MK and also used the spa. The restaurant was superb and far surpassed our expectations. It is a little difficult to find but worth the effort. The evning began with drinks on the terrace which has great views of the mosque. Dinner was then served in an intimate and romantic room. Everything from the bread through to the dessert was incredible, and by far the best food we had in Marrakech. The chef Omar also paid us a visit at the end of the meal which we thought was a nice touch. The spa was also fantastic, although it would have been nice if both myself and my Partner could have had treatments at the same time but as there was only one room this wasn't possible. Nevertheless the facial and massage we had were very relaxing and professional. Overall, highly recommended!

Tranquil spa. We booked the hammam and massage combination treatment at the start of our trip to Marrakech and my only regret is that we didn't book another one at the end!The package is a fantastic way to relax for 1.5 hours and leaves you feeling clean and de-stressed! Our therapists were super professional, yet smiley and friendly at all times.
small but very very good. who said that small cant be very good. a very nice treatment room, similar sized Hamam ands two very professional staff.

beautiful, perfect, special. I went to this spa for a hamam and massage. A beautiful experience - not just a hamam and massage, but so much more. From the moment I arrived, i was looked after like a princess. The ladies doing the treatments were so smiley, and professional, and calm.What a way to spend a morning. I left refreshed and ready to shop for more things i didn't really need.

A cute little Spa in a quirky hotel. Positives: Value for money was excellent compared to what we have paid in the past for similar treatmentsThe massage was excellent- very relaxingThe hamam was a unique experience- felt nice and clean afterwards and was given the scrubber that was used to use at home.Negatives: Compared to other Spas visited this was very small with only 2 treatment rooms and no relaxing waiting areaIn between the massage and the hamam you sat in the tiny Spa reception and it felt a bit awkwardThere wasn't much explanation as to what was going to happen in the 2 treatments.

A special little spa with a beautiful aura. 'maisonmk' has a small, discreet little spa that is really worth experiencing especially for the excellent Hammam. I didn't know what to expect other than quite a basic scrub and rub down. It turned out to be much more than that and more luxurious than I thought. There's quite a ritual involved. My skin was prepared really thoroughly before the scrub after which I was quite suprised to see how much dead skin came off! The clay mask after this was gorgeous as was the massage with the cedar oil & scrub. My skin felt beautifully smooth and moisturised afterwards. I felt comfortable with the therapist and it's clear that she is quite experienced doing the Hammam. My facial was equally memorable. The beautician had a lovely aura about her and made me feel so calm and relaxed. I received a wonderful massage not only on the face but on my feet whilst the mask was taking effect. This was a welcome surprise as I felt as if I had reflexology treatment included for free. She really had a special touch and was very professional and caring. They say 'Good things come in small packages' and I would certainly say that about the spa in maisonmk.

so good I fell asleep during the signature massage. Like most people - I spend 9-5 most of the year feeling constantly stressed. I'm terrible at relaxing.I have regular massages in London but the massage at Maison MK is the only one in the world that was so relaxing I actually fell asleep!Not too expensive, fantastically good natured and professional staff.All of our wedding guests at Maison MK got treatments and all were satisfied!

full of style and professionalism. We booked our spa treatments in advance in England - so first of all a nice stress-free booking. The Maison MK riad that the spa is in, is a real jewel, unlike anything else we have seen in Morocco and we have been 3 times now. The staff were really sweet and professional. We had a beautifully relaxing time having the 'top to toe' treatments (me a hamam and a massage and a facial - it normally comes with a manicure or pedicure, but i can't stand my feet being touched !). My girlfriend had the hamam and masage and manicure and pedicure and pronounced them 'wonderful'.All in all a real winner with the style, the unexpected refreshments, all the lovely touches, and the calm professional manner of the staff.

Such a Great Afternoon Well Spent. I very rarely like to indulge in these things however with some arm twisting from the missus I when along, and was very glad I did. It was AMAZING! Just what i needed after walking the street for a while. I felt rejuvenated and after one of there Maison MK hamman's, felt cleaner then I ever have EVER! it was great a must if you have time .

relaxed and professional. I came here to find some calm and quiet away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Its so tranquil here. They know what they are doinghere, and in comparison with London, it is a bargain. A hamam and a massage costs 60 euros and takes an hour and a half. You are scrubbed & polished, and cleaned & softened in the hamam - i loved it. Then into the candlelit massage room where I fell asleep half way through the treatment because it was so relaxing.Do come & spend an afternoon here - it sent me out like a new man into the mayhem of Marrakech.

superb !. What a beautiful spa & what a beautiful set of treatments. We both had the hammam & massage combinations which were extremely luxurious (and very good value at 60 euros). The spa is set in a riad which was also stunning.What an amazing way to spend a few hours of our holiday - it was my favourite thing that we did in Marrakech.

8/10. Me & mum had day in spa mk with cooking course followed by spa then gastro in evening.Overall g8 day. I Must say, mary, manager very helpful couldn't do more. Spa very peaceful. My signature massage wasn't the best I've ever had tbh and wasn't ideal having the masseurs phone vibrating in the middle then also answering on it twice during massage. Which was disappointing. My mum had hammam massage combo and enjoyed more than me it seemed. Cooking course enjoyed alot, Omar the head chef is a lovely person good English showed us around Market fruit meat n spices. We cooked bread, salads n Tagine and showed us start 2 finish vey easy n also provided recipes guide n spices 2 take home.After course, lunch on roof terrace by the food we prepared. Also good 2 see the local bakery just around the corner and would of never known about it!

What an experience!!. My girlfriend, now fiance, booked me in for a massage. I was adamant that was all I wanted to do while she went with a facial massage, hamman and henna. While I was finishing probably the most relaxing massage ever, she came into the room and declared that I had to have a hamman bath. Gents, let me tell you, it's one of the most indulging experiences you will have. I've never felt to clean or soft. All I could think of doing was just crawling back into the room and napping. I was so relaxed.

Lovely Experience but not quite 5 Stars. My wife and I had a Hamman and relaxation massage each at MK and both enjoyed the experience, neither having had a Hamman before. We were greeted by Mary, who manges the Riad and was very friendly and proved a charming host. Riads are small and as such the spa area was also of the diminutive variety but comfortable and relaxing. My massage was good although I would not rate it as one of the best I have had, that still goes to the various Banyan Tree spas that we have visited and who I our experience are unrivalled. My wife reported that she enjoyed her massage and she also had an additional 15 minute foot massage tacked onto the main relaxation massage and found that to be really good.The Hamman was certainly an experience and one which I would thoroughly recommend. You are literally scrubbed clean, all of you, including your hair! You come out feeling very fresh and envigorated although it is not something I would recommend if you have any sunburn! Do it at the beginning of your stay if this may be an issue. Things that let it down slightly are the shower room, which is tiny and did not have any towels in it (no one was there to askl for any so I had to dry myself on my robe. Not a big deal but would have been nice and perhaps they are usually there. It would also have been nicer to have a little more space to change in but again this is a Riad in the middle of the Medina so could perhaps be forgiven. I did feel that MK offer incredible value for money at €60 per person for a Hamman and massage and as such can thoroughly recommend the experience.

I hate to be the first person to write a bad review. My husband and i were very excited due to the rave reviews but honestly it wasnt all that. Yes the staff were friendly however they were also unprofessional.We chose the hamman and massage, in hamman i was left in there know one told me why lol it was odd also while i was supposed to be "relaxing" all i could here outside my room was what sounded like a party, lol the therapists were howling with laughter so i couldnt exactly relax. To top it all off the room where my husbands clothes were got locked and we were escorted to one of the rooms from the hotel which we thought was nice however know one came up to tell us the room had been unlocked. My husband had to come and get his clothes after 45 mins, we went to pay for our treatment and didnt complain remained calm they did apologise however you would think they would cut the cost of the treatment but no this didnt happen. They charged us full price and even expected a tip!!!!!! My husband had to ask for.his change back. All in all it spoilt our whole day not the best spa weve been to and wont be returning again im afraid. Oh and the snack of fruit we got in the middle of the treatment was a joke slices of apples so thin they could melt in your mouth lolbest of luck to them not our cup of tea really put a damper on our trip
Heaven. What a wonderful place to relax! Just gorgeous and the treatments were brilliant. Make sure you get a few spa sessions in here, you won't regret it!

Highly recommended!!. We visited (myself and my wife) Spa MK in august 2011. We booked from England by providing our credit card details and got instant confirmation. We both went for the Hamam and Massage package at 60 euros. We were received by friendly staff and our sessions started on time. The Spa itself is 5 star quality - very clean and relaxing atmosphere. We were made to feel comfortable and the session itself lasted for 1.5 hours. We will definitely be returning next time and even think of booking our accommodation there as well.

Small but absolutely perfectly formed!. Would thoroughly recommend a treatment here - I had an amazing treatment - the traditional gommage in the hammam, followed by a massage - both ladies are miracle workers - was such a relaxing treat. Everyone who visits Marrakesh should try a Hammam eperience and although the local hammam is probably quite an experience in itself, this was a far more relaxing and pampering treatment, yet gives you an authentic Moroccan expeerience, and in a beautifully designed, comfortable and fragrant environment! Spa MK have obviously gone to great lengths to emply experienced, qualified staff. Not only that but you couldn't meet more smiley, sweet people, who really genuinely want you enjoy the spa. Both the massage and Hammam are carried out in near darkness, which really added to the relaxation aspect - and I can't describe how wonderful the treatment room smells!! Although not a large spa, the Spa MK team have produced somewhere welcoming, friendly, intimate and somewhere I can't wait to go back to.
Heaven!. Spa MK was great! we were made to feel really welcome! the food was great and the massage and the hamam weer excellent! would def recommend spa mk if you are visiting Marrakech!

Relaxing time with great staffs. It was my great time at spa MK in my trip to Morocco. The spa was very clean with good fragrance, and staffs with great smiles welcomed me so it made me relax a lot. It is located near main square Fna. I'm very satisfied with the treatment, hamam and 30 min. massage. You should try hamam in your stay in Morroco, and I really recommend spa MK!

Perfect spa!!. it is perfect!! the service is amazing and i had the time of my life!! I did tip to toe and i can only tell you on that night i slept like a baby!!
its worth every penny!!
enjoy

Add this to your bucket list. Among the crowded streets of the medina, behind an ancient door sits a truly beautiful riad and home to the maison mk spa. This was the highlight of my trip to morocco. I had the tip to toe package and enjoyed every minute. The traditional hammam is an experience I'll never forget. I was a bit apprehensive at first, having to take my clothes off and be bathed by a stranger but the staff are professional and made me feel at ease. Unfortunately I did get a surprise at the end when I was charged 3.50 euro for a can of soft drink. I would do this again but I would just chose the massage and the hammam and bring my own drink :-)

BEST SPA EVER!. We contacted the spa via email and received a reply almost immediately. treatment was second to none! service was unvelieveable! the spa owners even came in and spoke to us to make sure everything was ok. They were so friendly and down to earth - they even showed us the hotel rooms including their personal room! we did not stay in the hotel during this trip but if we were to come back then this would definetly be the place to stay!

A must do if you visit Marrakech!. Myself and a friend visited MK Spa on our recent trip to Marrakech. From the first initial booking process the service we recieved was first class and very helpful. The staff at MK Spa were amazing and the treatments were really something special. We opted for the combination hammam and full body massage which were both very different but both equally enjoyable. The massage was probably the best I have ever had and the hammam left my skin so soft! The actual Riad itself was beautiful and very peaceful too. It was a perfect start to our trip and I really would highly reccomend it if your visiting Marrakech!

A refreshing escape from the heat of Marrakech. I had the best time at MK. From the small cobblestone streets to a massage and a Hammam. The staff was so friendly and the place is a wonderland as far as decor. I have been to traditional hammam's in Istanbul and this was similar and very different. More like a spa treatment. The price was fabulous. An afternoon well spent. Thank you MK!

Relaxing visit. My two friends and I enjoyed a fabulous day of pampering at the Maison MK in Marrakech. I highly recommend this place. We organised the whole experience before we left London and the staff were friendly and accomodating. The Beauticians were very professional and skilled. We coupled the spa experience with a 5 course dinner that was exceptionally well cooked. I will be returning there again with my friends and family.

what a massage !. I went to the spa at maison mk for a treat - a luxury massage. It was so professional & well organised from the booking process to the directions to the little guided tour of maison mk to the massage to the stunning fruit plate to the departure. A great massage - done by candlelight by a beautiful masseuse with magic hands. I promised to do my first Tripadvisor review so hopefully its going to work.Sally

wow - best spa I've had in a very long time, maybe best ever!. I was looking forward to some TLC when we got to Marrakech, and looking at Trip Advisor, Spa MK got great reviews. I made an appointment over email with a couple of days notice and headed in.I had the luxury hamman and MK signature massage - oh boy, so good!The hamman in the warm black room was divine, and the massage was bliss too. I woke myself up with a little snore while I was relaxing with the face masque on which is always a good sign! Both ladies who worked on me were highly professional and top notch.The maison is gorgeous too, we weren't staying there but it looked lovely.A pricey treat, but certainly worth it. I can highly recommend it for some bliss time!

this spa is incerdible. We were staying an a small, basic riad that was adequate for our needs, but we had read about the spa at maison mk and it sounded perfect for us. my partner and i each had the hamam and massage combination, 45 minutes of hamam and 45 minutes of massage for 60 euros. It was the best 90 minutes that we spent in Marrakech.The hamam was luxurious, candle lit, gentle yet firm, and our skin felt so soft afterwards. The massage was just a delight.
