Done in a dark room by candlelight it was soothing, totally relaxing and sadly i fell asleep and missed some of it.The girls were amazing and i wish i could have put them in my suitcase and taken them home, but the Easyjet excess baggage charges prevent that.

Perfectly pampered. This spa (even though it has to be small to fit into the beautiful surroundings of its central Marrakech riad) is perfect and includes a hammam as well as a great range of western treatments for all your pampering needs! I made the most of it and enjoyed the hammam, a relaxing massage and a facial. I felt beautifully looked after and they were particularly great at making the treatments bespoke to my pregnancy needs. At the end of each of the treatments I felt wonderfully relaxed.
Bliss... Definitely worth visiting while in Marrakech, perfect for relaxation after a shopping trip in the souks! The staff are incredible!

A real Treat. I would thoroughly recommend anything at Maison MK as we stayed there for 4 nights and sampled as much as possible. I would give the Spa a special mention, though, as we used it nearly every day. On the second day a scrub & a massage, on the third day a facial, on the fourth day a polish and a henna, and on the fifth day all ready to be sent home looking and feeling a million dollars.

Wonderful spa. We had a great massage and hammam - personal treatment with about 45 mins each, alternating with my partner. Beautiful surroundings, really authentic experience, relaxing and fun. Totally recommended.

Pretty Spa. As a group of girls going to Marrakesh for the first time we decided to do a bit of pre-planning and came across this pretty spa. In fact, its part of a very chic looking little boutique hotel called Maison MK. We ended up staying there which made using the spa very easy! We used it a lot and they were very flexible about when and where we could have our treatments. Without a doubt I would advise doing a hamam early on so that your skin is made ready for the sun. I'm not a facial person but my friend assures me it was luxurious. We had a lovely little henna done with our pedicure, an amazing rose oil bath, and one day after a lot of walking we had a special leg massage to relieve our tired legs and feet. We loved that so much that I think they will add this onto their menu!So many little touches that I couldn't mention everything but definitely recommend this place.

Blissful massage. I was recently a guest at Maison MK, and it was a total luxury to have the spa there. Sadly we didn't experience the hammam during our stay but we did book in for a relaxation massage and it was fantastic!The spa itself is lovely - the treatment was done in a beautiful candle-lit room, and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. The massage was total bliss, as was our whole stay at Maison MK, it's just a shame we didn't have time for more treatments while we were there.

Total Luxury and Relaxation. We were recently staying at the amazing Maison MK and were pleased that they have their own small but perfectly formed spa facilities.This is total luxury.... One room for the hamman, a great re-vitalising experience, followed by a massage room where the treatments are carried out in darkness, with candles and scents.Both treatments combined make you feel totally relaxed and chilled out and along with the fresh fruit and drinks, makes an excellent experience.Thoroughly recommended and a 'must do' whilst in Marrakech.M&M

a promise is a promise - perfect. See Hassna, i promised i would write a review after my perfect hammam & massage !I stayed at maison MK (see review of the hotel under maison MK) & they have a brilliant spa there. Very luxurious set-up & such total attention to detail. I was given my hammam 'kit' - a beautiful bag with all the bits and pieces. Flip flops (colour coordinated with maison mk, obviously), the potions & soaps for the hammam all wrapped beautifully, the maison mk logo'd mitten thing, a big fluffy robe, and rose petals. Suitably perpared I entered the hot hammam where i was washed, scrubbed, soaped, washed, sugared, washed, lotioned, washed (did I mention washed...?) and left feeling like a new born baby.A 5 minute pause with fresh juice & fruit & then straight into the most relaxing massage it is possible to imagine. Candle light, dark room, Hassna with the most perfect touch ever. Life should always be like this.

get into the MK spa... a nice retreat after a day in Marrakech. we spent a few well spent hours relaxing on the terrace, getting a nice massage followed by a hammam. Can't say I'd been bathed recently by another person.... should do that more often....especially if you're a bit of a control freak.. very kind, thoughtful, friendly and accomodating staff supported by upbeat, sensible oversight from management at the spa. The spa is immaculately clean and beautifully appointed and great value. We highly recommend travellers make a booking in advance and unwind early in your trip to Marrakech, it will help get you in the right frame of mind so that you can chill out on the terrraces and just slow things down..

pampering perfection. We first called the UK number for Maison MK and spoke with the owner about how we could use the spa at her hotel. We had several conversations in fact, which was really helpful as it helped us to get our bearings in Marrakech. And as a result we ended up visiting the spa twice! After the owner described her beautician as the waxing queen of the world and 'a giggling whirling dervish' I gave it a 'whirl' and can definitely attest to that!Two days later we returned to use the hamam (or is it a hammam?) - my friend had a hamam and I had a facial at the same time. The best facial I have had for a long time, and i am fussy! For the hamam I can definitely say that my friend was thoroughly scrubbed till she glowed like a baby. After a lovely refreshment of fruit and tea, we both left thoroughly cleansed and relaxed. Just a few steps outside the door of this lovely oasis, we entered into the hustle and bustle of the souks again for a very different experience!The only word of warning I would give is that you need to book in advance by email or by phone - i don't think you can just turn up. It is only a small spa, so you have to be clever about the treatments you have if there is more than one of you as there are just 2 treatment rooms. Although it is chic and beautiful and calming, and the girls are so gentle and friendly - we were so welcome and felt very special being there.Madeline

what a treat.... We were staying at one of the big hotels, but I came here for a massage and a hamam after reading about it on tripadvisor. Amazing massages and a fabulous hamam. I was left bright and alert from the hamam which was so luxurious, and was put to sleep by the candle lit massage ! And what a riad - Maison mk is drop dead gorgeous. Next time we are in Marrakech, and I hope its soon, this is more like the experience we want. The whole treatment was an experience from the moment we made the booking through to the moment we left.

best massage ever. we stayed at maison mk and i had a fabulous massage while i was there. done in the dark with beautiful smelling oils. it left me so relaxed that i went upstqirs and promptly fell asleep. back to uk in a few hours. cannot write more on this arabic keyboard with all the letters missing...

luxury boutique spa. Firstly a big thank you to tripadvisor for listing spa mk. I tried to write a review after my visit, but it wasn't listed yet. This secret little place, part of the beautiful maison mk riad / gastro mk restaurant has only recently opened its doors to external clients for the spa & i am so happy it has. I just rang on spec & they booked me in.It is, as my title says, a luxury boutique spa & my hubby & I visited for two of the hamam / massage combination treatments - what an experience. I started with the hamam and he started with the massage - and after the first 45 minutes, we both emerged. Me, scrubbed beautifully, honeyed, sugared, soaped, washed, and with the softest skin in the world. Him, half asleep & more relaxed than I have ever seen him before - he seemed to have lost the power of speech but mumbled that he had just received a 'glorious' massage.Then we swapped over & I certainly understood - it was a fabulous massage. Hasna, the masseuse, has a beautifful touch. From the moment she started, all was good in my world & she very cleverly tailored it to my needs as the massage progressed. The massage was in almost darkness - just a couple of candles & soothing music made it such a peaceful atmosphere.Great little touches like the fresh fruit salad at 'half-time', and fortunately I spied the Essie nail varnish on my way out so I treated myself to a quick 'emergency' manicure! Hope hubby didn't mind the extra wait - he certainly looked contented with the morning's activities.Can't wait to get back to Marrakech & to visit spa mk again.

Amazing spa clean very nice staff are friendly. This spa in the riad and is very clean comfortable and the treatments are amazing Sana who was our therapist is very professional and she spoke English very well the spa is very comfortable warm and we enjoyed out 2 hr spa treatment would definitely recommend this to all will be going back very soon

Moroccan oasis. Just had an amazing traditional hammam and massage with my partner. Couldnt think of a better way to eacape the mayhem of the surrounding medina. Would highly recommend this day spa to all couples visting Marrakech. Thankyou to all the staff!
Marrakech Ritual-what an experience. Went here for a Marrakech Ritual with a friend due to the good price. A completely unique experience of a hammam and massage and would definitely return!

Amazing!!. Went for a Marrakech Ritual as a couple and could not recommend this more to anyone! That staff were lovely and the traditional Moroccan Hammam experience left us both feeling really relaxed with super soft skin!!Definitely worth taking a couple of hours to visit here if your visiting Marrakech!!

Perfect end to a weekend away. Our Riad organised my boyfriend and myself to have treatments here. We got a couples package that was about 475dh each. They treated us wonderfully, and the facilities were clean and well kept. The scrub was quite severe but felt wonderful afterwards! Then we had a 1 hr full body massage, followed by a hot bath covered in rose petals. The whole experience made us feel special and very relaxed, a fantastic end to the weekend!
Relax and enjoy!. Had a very nice treatment, the Fez treatment of almost two hours. Massage was very good! Place is clean and proper and looks very nice! Staff friendly and helpfull!

Refreshing & Relaxing. Very fair price, we paid 450dh for 30 minutes of scrubbing/peeling and 1 hour of massage. Ended up staying for 3 hours in total.The staff is very friendly and cares about the well being of the customers.Hammam is an absolute must for Marrakesh!

Professional & relaxing. Got told about this place by our taxi driver who insisted we should go there. Down a few ally ways you wouldn't know it was tucked away.. It was beautiful. We booked a day in advance and paid a 200DH reservation. My friend & I had the "Marrakech experience" which was a hammam, black salt scrub, massage & facial. When we arrived we were shown to a changing room & locker where we left our bags and changed into robes. The women who did our hammam were professional & polite and I really enjoyed it there. 45mins was enough time as it got very hot, but with the oils and scrub it made me feel revitalised & my skin was left feeling fantastic!We then went for our massage which was a tad to gentle for me, but it was relaxing & the The staff were friendly, professional from the beginning & I would definitely recommend & go back again!

Ham am . This was a fantastic experience and a very enjoyable day. The girls were very professional and the building was spotless. You could be put off by the approach to place but it is easy to recommend this as a must do whilst in marrekesh. It was a quarter of the price of the hotel for exactly the same treatment and time. Lovely staff and would go again.

Great Hammam, not the massage. I really enjoyed the hammam which I haven't had before and was a great experience. My skin felt great after! I definitely recommend and the women was lovely.Although the massage itself was okay, the women were constantly talking at the beginning and when I looked up at one point she was on her phone!!

Good quality for price . The hammam was good, the girls seemed a little preoccupied though and not really interested. The massage was very good and relaxing. Overall it was a pleasant experience, good vibe and good price.

An amazing relaxed spa. After some time walking in the Atlas Mountains we decided we'd treat ourselves to a hamman and were recommended this one - having never had a massage before I was apprehensive - but needlessly - it was so discreet, relaxing and totally mind cleansing by professional staff - amazing and highly recommended
Not luxury at all. Came here for a hammam scrub. Hardly relaxing when you can hear people talking outside the steam room. They don't know what they're doing, my skin feels and looks the same. Avoid.

Value For Money!!. Me and my wife came across this Hammam because it was close to our hotel. For 900MAD (£60) we had 45min Hammam + one hour massage each separately because one of us had to look after our kids.The staff were really nice and friendly. The massage was so good that I fell asleep within 10 minutes. This same package was being sold at other Hammam for 600MAD (£40) per person. I will recommend this place any day.

A lovely time out experience. My husband and myself, like others had a couples package, with the hammam and a massage. The inside of the building is clean, and the main area is very peaceful and a nice setting to rest in afterwards. The treatments were delivered professionally, in a manner that was conducive to a relaxing atmosphere.It is good value. Perhaps a little more explanation would have helped,but it is less easy when trying to communicate in a different language to ones own.

Perfect. This place is a must, other spa's must be crazy to charge up to double. This place was immaculate and so beautiful inside. Make sure you follow the flower petals as we didn't noticed them until on the way out - due to having a lot of young young kids wanting to offer us directions in exchange for tips. We just thanked them and say not firmly and we found it with ease.

A lovely peaceful experience. We wanted to try a hammam but were not sure where to go, our driver recommended the 5 Elements & took us to view the Spa. The staff were very friendly & explained the treatments, we decided to go & booked for the following day. We booked as a couple for a hammam followed by a 1 hour massage. From our arrival to departure we were very well looked after, the hammam was relaxing and thorough followed by the most wonderful massage, we left floating on air. We were so impressed we booked for another treatment the next day!!
Super relaxing. Lovely Hamman and massage at this hidden away gem. Clean and good attention to detail with very helpful staff. Would definitely return.

Relaxing and clean. I was looking for a good Hammam recommendation but in the end we decided to go for the one that our Riad told us about around the corner. I took the 30 minute Hammam and 30 minute massage for about 30 Euros. As it was my first time I can´t compare it to anything else but it was really enjoyable. The massage was really good, I have seen other reviews that they are not very good at massages in other places but this was firm but relaxing.

most horrible experience in Marrakech. We had an appointment at 17:00 and when we arrived the women at the entrance was really rude and she postponed our appointment with 45 minutes without giving any reason so we had to wait. We asked for thee which we got 30 minutes after asking twice.Finally she asked us to prepare for the hammam. The whole atmosphere was really tense and the hammam was actually cold. After our hammam they moved us to the 'relaxing' area. It was extremely cold as well. Overall the hammam was not that good but the women at the entrance was the worst. We would not recommend going here.

5elements Marrakech. For a first experience of hammam in Marrakech this is excellent . Great value . We had the hammam gommage and massage package . Very courteous girls making sure we were well looked after and happy . This is tucked away in a somewhat grubby alley , but once inside very relaxing pretty little raid courtyard and welcoming . For 450 MAD each we had the best experience . Massage was excellent . We were there for nearly three hours . No rush nearly 2 hrs in total of treatment and then lovely relaxation area with the mint tea of - course . This was recommended by a local . We are glad we listened and did not go off to some of the more expensive spas / hammams of which there are many . The massage was wonderful . We felt great afterwards . This really was a good value good experience .

Amazing experience. My husband and I just had a couples hammam experience and just loved it.The guy at the reception desk was very helpful and friendly.The ladies who gave us the treatment were very patient and discreet as it was out first time. We felt amazing after the treatment and enjoyed the time in the relaxation room afterwards to relax. A must do!

experience you can't miss. just go there and let it go. What an experience! I went with my husband and 11y old daughter. We didn't have an appointment but could go straight to the hammam. We didn't have more time to do the rest of the treatments unfortunately.The two girls who help us, were very kind, we got showerd, brushed, soaped.... oooh that was really fantastic. It's like going to a sauna but with the attention of these two sweet persons... felt like being a baby again!! haahahaAt the end we could relax drinking a cup of maroccan tea. Very very nice experience!

'5 Star for 5 Elements'. We were recommended this place by the manager of our Riad. We booked in advance providing a few days lead time, quite possibly due to the fact that we wanted a group booking at the same time. What an absolute treat, we booked the Hammam and Massage treatment. After the initial greeting, we were guided to a changing room to robe up, then escorted to a hot room where we were bathed, soaped, showered, scrubbed. This was an experience like no other, truly authentic and the laugh we had was priceless. This alone would have been worth the price, we were then taken upstairs for our individual massages. A complete different setting and one of tranquillity and harmony. The best massage I have experienced to date, so not much more to add on that. After an active Hammam this is the perfect way to wind down and relax. Our only complaint was finding out about this place on our last day. Most definitely would have booked for all three days in Marrakech. Few tips would be to wear swimming trunks and avoid white boxer shorts…. Located in the Kasbah neighbourhood but an absolute sanctuary for relaxation.

Wonderful experience. I was directed here by the manager of the riad I stayed in. Didn't have an appointment but they could see me straight away for hammam, gommage and massage. Very clean, welcoming, friendly and very good value, about half what was being charged elsewhere. Another time I'd just have the hammam and gommage, and leave the massage for a separate time.

Great experience. Great place to discover relaxing experience in Marrakesh. The place was clean and warm enough in January. The staff was polite and professional. You should try the whole package which includes steam bath, savon noir and oil message.

Outstanding!!!. Best experience ever. Form start to finish. Great treatment, friendly welcoming staff. Did this treatment last year in a five star hotel in cornwall, won't bother again as no where will be as good as here. Felt amazing & so relaxed. Highly recommend!!!
Fantastic experience. They keep their promises, and the whole experience was nice!We had the fes package, and the hours masssage is recommended!

Nice hammam experience. We found this spa trough a flyer in our Riad. We went on the internet to check on the reviews before making our decision. After deciding to go there we called around noon for a booking at 6PM, for my husband and myself.we took the full ''Marrakech hammam", 45 mn hammam with 30mn massage. As soon as we arrived we were conducted to a changing room and were given 2 pairs of slippers and 2 bathrobes. Then we were taking to the hot room to be washed from head to toe, and rubbed with black soap, then sat there with the steam, you can feel all the dirt coming out leaving you dizzy in the end. But then you are dried out and taken to the massage room , it was so good that i fall asleep. I regretted not taking the full hour massage. After that you go to a nice chilling area with a cup of morroccon tea, and left to relax until you are ready to leave. The full experience was nice and the man at the reception desk was very concerned about our experience and wanted to know if we enjoyed it. I find that behavior very constructive. Overall i have a very good time.

Died and gone to heaven!. Wow! What a fantastic place! My partner and I went for a Hamman massage package! It lasted hour and a quarter. Absolutely fantastic, the girls are angels sent from god!!! Sorted all my tired aches out and started my day off great! Beautiful stunning palace inside and staff are brilliant. Shall visit again and again and again!!!!

Tranquil oasis. Spent a morning here with 4 friends. The treatments we had were good, i think having a party of five at once stretched them a bit, but it worked out ok. We had Hamman, body scrub, mud wrap and massages. A wonderful experience after days of hustle and bustle. The staff were very polite and friendly, the rooms lovely.The prices are also very reasonable. The only thing i will say is it is a little hard to find, but then it is Marrakech and most things are there!

Awesome service - take the time to find this place!. My sister and I were referred here from our riad. It was pretty difficult to find (not very good signs either) and a lot of locals didn't seem to know where it was either. BUT it was totally worth the time - the ladies who did our hammams were such sweethearts, were very genuine, and we had a fantastic experience here overall. Would recommend this place to anyone!

Best Spa in Marrakech. I was on holiday a few weeks ago in Marrakech and as I am an afficionado of wellness, I visited several spas during my stay. When walking into the spa, I was surprised by the brightness.I took a rituel Marrakech, and it was heaven. The scrub did me so good. After that my massage was given by a professional masseuse. The total atmosphere at spa 5 Eléments was great.Discretion, nice architecture and very good infrastructure. Definitely a place to go when wellness is your thing. Thanks. Tintin

Terrible 350 dirham massage (35 EUR) for 30 mins. Came as a couple at the last minute because the much more upmarket, classier les bains de marrakech around the corner couldnt fit us in. The taxi driver drove us here instead. They didnt have trouble charging us 1 hour price, for a 40 minute rub session they called a massage. We asked specifically for more pressure, both before and during the massage, but the girls were giggling THE WHOLE MASSAGE and didn't vary the pressure at all. The worst was - and I have never had this from any massage therapist in my whole life and I love massages - when the lady removed my WHOLE TOWEL so my entire front was exposed, and started massaging there?!! The room was extremely freezing I felt I could get sick after. The therapist took about 3 lots of 5-10 minute breaks. Very unprofessional, talked to each other and giggled disturbingly throughout the whole 40 mins. Finished early, didnt say anything just led us back downstairs. My partner was so upset over the experience because we wanted a relaxing experience to unwind from the stress of the souks, not freeze in our underwear whilst two girls giggled at us! Terrible experience and a complete ripoff AVOID!

A hammam and massage in the Kasbah - but nothing special. Our riad owner recommended and booked us for a hammam and massage. The 5 elements spa was difficult to find in the back street as not well signposted. Once inside the spa it was very tranquil - a riad courtyard setting with lots of side rooms. We changed into gowns and placed our clothes, keys etc into secure lockers. We were taken to the hammam room where we received our mud splashes. Very invigorating but remember to keep your eyes closed if you're wearing contact lenses.We were taken upstairs for the massage then bath. The stairs were difficult to negotiate with slippery feet in the plastic sandals they provided so be careful. Both the massage and bath were very good and relaxing. Great to experience as a couple - as we had done.The staff were attentive and gracious. At the end we were shown to a screened-off area off the courtyard near to the entranceway, where we could chill out in our gowns and warm towel wraps and contemplate. We had expected a herbal tea although we were given a bottle of water each. Then we were simply left. During this time there was a lot of activity outside the entrance some 10-15 metres away - men moving gas bottles, children drumming outside and mopeds screeching outside drifting fumes inside the doorway. It would help if they closed the door but it seems it is kept open so clients can find it.Basically we were not enamoured with the wind-down time and also had to find our own way out and reorientate ourselves to where the changing rooms are. They need to work on how these sessions are closed out as it left a negative impression although the main events were very good.

A fun and relaxing experience. I went to this spa with 4 of my girlfriends and we all loved it.The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to make us feel at ease and accommodate us.We were all given robes, towels, plastic slippers, paper panties and as much bottled water as we wanted.The Hot room was lovely with dim lighting and a lovely shower in the middle to wash before and between stages of the hammam treatment.The seats were extremely hot so you need to take an extra towel in with you to sit on.We all opted for the hour long massage after the heat and scrub which was very relaxing and the massage ladies were very good.After the treatment we lay on loungers and they brought us all mint tea, we stayed as long as we wanted and didn't feel at all rushed.All in all we had a very pleasant experience, I went back for a second one 2 days later !

Worst experience ever. As a special treat to myself on my last day in Marrakesh I decided to go to the spa for a hammam, massage and facial. the spa was recommended by the riad and guests that had been there for massages were happy so off I went. Unfortunatelly I decided to go for a massage untried by the others called thinness massage...I arrived and was given a locker containing a robe and plastic slippers, first impressions, the robe smelled of oils, so I wasn't sure it had been cleaned, I gave it the benefit of the doubt and was shown into a hammam only to be taken out again 10 seconds later to then wait and be shown into another hammam... Compared with a previous experience the whole thing was very quick, which is just as well as I was finding it too hot, and superficial, but ok. No towel given to dry yourself off, you are put back into the ( cloth) robe which you keep ( wet ) right until the end.I was then taken to the massage room and did not have the good sense to ask what the massage consisted of exactly ( I have had numerous different massages aimed at cellulite, drainage, circulation etc...so wasn't worried). Nothing was said either or asked.When I got in there was a used tissue on the massage bed which I found off putting to say the least, but again said nothing, the girl had a cold so probably forgot about it. she then started by on foot which was fine, and the calf which was firm but fine, unfortunately she then continued so hard up the first leg and the rest of the body it hurt like hell, and I have had 3 of my children with nothing at all and I would rather give birth than go through her massage again, it was excruciating, I told her it hurt, I flinched, I tried to move my limbs away because of the pain, I told her I had bad circulation and showed her a varicose vein in my arm, told her I had back and neck problems and to go easy, all to no avail, she kept saying it was normal (!!!). I did not get down and walk away thinking somehow I would feel wonderful once it stopped. But no, once over I was in a state of shock, my arms were shaking badly, and I was feeling like I had been mauled. I then was put back into the wet robe, taken to a day bed and given cold mint tea, and then taken to facial which was ok. i was so upset I decided to wait for the person who was coming for me outside in the street rather than sit there. I made it back to the riad, had a quick bite to eat and went straight to bed for the rest of the afternoon (4 hours) I felt so bad. Next morning I counted 12 bruises and still felt really bad in spite of taking a lot of arnica, pain killers and muscle relaxants. Two days later I still ache all over although the shaking has subsided. So all in all the treatments which were not the massage were just average, the hygiene and comfort just under average, the customer service inexistent as I told 4 different people I did not feel well and they just ignored me, and this particular massage only to be booked for your worst enemy !

There are better places close by. I have had Hamam in other places and was particularly looking forward to having one in Morocco. Unfortunately this wasn't the experience I was hoping for. The girl that took us to the Hamam was very young and giggled all the way through the session which wasn't very calming and also a little off putting as she giggled and scrubbed. She was quite fast and I didn't feel that the job was done particularly well compared to other hamams I have had.I was then taken for a massage and the girl that did my massage was very clearly in experienced. The massage was weak and I wasn't impressed. Having spoken to others I wish I had booked into Les Bains De Marrakech where their experience was much better and it is only up the road from the 5 Elements Spa. My recommendation would be to go somewhere else.

Pure heaven. Unforgettable experience!. My partner and I were coming back from the souk after a long day of wandering around in the criminal heat of Marrakech at the end of July. We were desperate to reach our hotel' swimming pool, when a boy stopped us in the street and showed us a leaflet from a nearby spa, which was offering a discount on treatment packs. On the paper, the price seemed excellent and they did have availability there and then, so we decided to have a look at the place. The spa is located in a beautiful riad, decorated in a very elegant way. The personnel was extremely friendly and welcoming, and showed us to some cozy changing rooms where we were assigned a locker each (with key). In each locker we found: 1 bathrobe, 2 hand towels, a pair of slippers and a pair of flip flops. We were taken to the hammam room, an amazing space with arched ceiling and stone walls. Here my partner and I received all the treatments at the same time, assisted by two Moroccan girls who performed on us the traditional washing (hammam) with black soap, the famous Arabic overall scrub and a body & face clay mask. We were in heaven!!!! You may wonder whether it may be awkward receiving all these treatments at the same time as your partner, in the same room, and with 2 girls washing both him and me. Well, it wasn't awkward AT ALL. These women were spa professionals and knew their stuff very well. My boyfriend and I actually found it very cool to be treated simultaneously as it allowed us to see in each other's eyes what we were feeling at all times! After this complete session in the hammam room, we were left to relax for a while, then we were led to the massage room, where again we received a simultaneous relaxing massage. In this room there were 2 massage beds + a male and a female massage specialists. My boyfriend received a massage from the guy, I was massaged by the woman. The massage was about 45 min long and involved the use of Argan oil, typical of Morocco, which after the scrub leaves your skin as soft as a baby's. Finally, before leaving, we were accompanied to a relaxation area with individual beds and cushions: we laid down there while sipping some complimentary mint hot tea. When we came out we felt and looked like completely new people!! I have never felt as good in my life, even after some expensive beauty treatments. And the price was one of the most amazing parts: the whole pack, which overall lasted 2 hours or so, was the equivalent of 25 euros per person!!! Please go and find this hidden gem on your next trip to Marrakech. (PS. I wish I had taken pictures but we were so relaxed when we came out that we completely forgot!)

Is this the same les bains?!?!. Well I am wondering if I went to the same one as the previous reviews as we did not have a amazing experience sadly It felt like a transaction rather than a nice treat and experienceThe hammam was 20 minutes lying waiting for it to start and then 5 minutes having something rubbed on and scrubbed off and told to showerThen we had a wrap which was nice but again it felt like the mud application was rushed The we had a massageThis was nice but not amazingThen we had to pay an d it was as though we were an inconvenience rather than a customer who'd just spent over 2000dhsAll in all it was really disappointing experience which is a real shame and surprise as we were recommended by three separate people to go to this place

Amazing experience. Had a couple's traditional Hammam & Massage with my wife.. was excellent!Great staff hospitality, authentic decoration and feel in the big Riad, relaxing experience overall.. and quite fairly priced for the service you get..Would highly recommend it..

Perfect traditional Spa/Hammam. My daughter and I had a Hammam at Les Bains de Marrakech which was amazing and incredibly relaxing. The place is so typically Morrocan too so if this is what you're looking for you won't be disappointed. This was our first Hammam so didn't really know what to expect if its yours too let me warn you they really scrub hard!!! Tip if you are a pale mortal like myself and have put fake tan on ready for your holiday this will all come off so remember to take some with you otherwise you will spend the rest of the holiday looking like a ghost!

beautiful large riad. The place is absolutely beautiful! It's located by the oldest gate to the medina, in the Kasbah quarter. It's hallways are expansive, rooms beautiful, hammam rooms are large with nice light. What threw me off was the staff (front desk hostesses) and the feeling that we were being rushed. They took us to dressing rooms, gave us robes and almost rolled their eyes when we asked for disposable underwear. After that it was mint tea time and introduction to their beautiful courtyard with inviting plunge pool. That part was rushed, maybe 5-10 minutes tops. Hammam (scrub time) was done poorly and superficially, with minimal use of products, and it did not include hair washing. Massage was wonderful tho, almost made up for the rest of the experience. Funny thing was, the entrance was grand and open and beautiful, but when it came to the exit time, they led us to the back door, that led to the back alley. I still giggle when i think about it. Kinda of a let down as the whole experience was.

Truly amazing. I've been there twice (5 years apart) and it's been, on both occasion, an amazing experience.From the people at the desk to the staff performing the treatments, everybody is welcoming and nice.The building (the relaxing rooms where you get some time to relax after the hammam or the massage) is very nicely decorated and calm. You can't imagine you're right next to the hustle of Marrakech' Medina.

Avoid for Hammam. Upon arrival we found that the reception staff were quite rude and we're talking amongst themselves. They seemed disinterested in our business. We originally wanted a Hammam and massage but changed our minds to only Hammam due to limited time - thankfully we did. Hammam. I was taken to the changing rooms and then to the stream room by a lady who told me she'll perform Hamman on me. I wasn't given a choice. My preference would have been a male. She hardly spoke a word of English. It would have been nice if someone would have told me what was happening next and for how long, but that wasn't to be. For around 550 dhs it's not worth it as I could count the number of times she used the hamman scrub. That particular experience felt rushed. To top it off I was left in the steam room for what would seem like a long time I'd say around 30mins without her telling me when she'll return. If that wasn't bad (but I'm not sure whether this is normal practice) the steam room floor started to bubble with steam blasting from the vent. I was totally shaken up by it as the temperature got really high in barely high. Now, I'm not someone who can't handled heat but this was like I was trapped on top of a kettle while it was boiling over. I didn't make a fuss about the whole experience to management as I had kids and wife waiting for me and we had a prior engagement. Sorry to say I definitely will not be returning.
Relaxing experience. Want to escape from the chaos of Marrakech and regenerate? Book some time in this spa and you will enjoy the hammam, the massages, relaxing mint tea.

Great experience but not 5 star. This was mine and my boyfriend's first hamman. The décor is lovely and the man at reception who greeted us was very welcoming. We were put in a two person room. It's extremely hot, we could have done with some water in the room as we were struggling by the end of the treatment. The ladies who washed us down were nice and but they spoke the whole time to one another which wasn't very relaxing and other than 'ok?' neither of them had a word of English. It's 45 minutes in total and I'd say just 10 of that is with the women in the room, the rest is just steaming but for less than €20 you can't complain. We did really enjoy it and felt baby smooth afterwards.

Luxury atmosphere but quite overated treatments and hospitality . Decor at the Les Bains de Marrakech is definitely worth visiting the place if you are looking for luxury atmosphere, unfortunately, the treatments and hospitality is not 'top notch' comparing to other 5-star spas in Marrakech we have been to.1. Hospitality. Greetings and farewells at the reception are dry. They reminded me of tired employees at Tesco. However, a guy who was bringing the tea was lovely. He made our experience a bit more special.2. Treatments. Well... We arrived, changed and went straight to hammam. We were left there alone for a long period of time listening to staff giggles and gossips next room. Ladies did scrub us for 5 min and then told us to go to the shower at the same time (one shower! Two people!) well, that was it. We expected luxurious hammam experience with scrub and body washMud-wrap: a walnut size ball of mud was spread all over my body. I could barely see it on my body let alone on my husband who is 6 ft tall.we're Covered in foil and blanket, and left for 40 minutes. We felt ourself like 'foiled' fish left in the oven. We uncovered ourselves in 15-20 minutes and waited to be collected.Massage: My husband felt relaxed after and was quite pleased. As for me, massage was ok. Unfortunately, masseuse kept burping, so it kinda kept me awake 3. Hospitality and staff. I believe hospitality and staff make whole experience either pleasant or not. First of all, clients visit spa to relax. We could barely relax due to staff talking. In acclaimed 5 star spas that would be unacceptable. Well, it did improve after we complained to a guy, who was probably a manager. He was nice. Secondly, clients expect being looked after. During hammam and mud wrap there was no one around. In general, my impression is that this place has become a 'spa factory'- lots of clients, there is no need to work hard on every client or train your staff accordingly.

Luxurious and a real treat!. This was the first hammam we visited and the most luxurious! Beautiful surroundings and very relaxing. It was a little less personal than the other hammam we visited and we were dying for water but couldn't find anyone to get some from but the hammam itself is very impressive and the massage was amazing!

Best Hammam Marrakech . Amazing hammam experience. Staff are very friendly and helpful, and all visitors get provided with a bathrobe and slippers. Our 2hrs was very relaxing and enjoyable and prices were reasonable. £30 for a 2hr massage. The place is a little difficult to find as its not in the centre but worth the trip. Make sure you don't just go to any place for a massage. There are places to avoid. Stick with Les Bains and you will be not be disappointed. My first visit here was in April 2010 and not looked back since.

Amazing Experience. I do not know the price as this was a gift from a Moroccan friend to try the Hamam.. At first I was a bit nervous but the staff were so friendly and welcoming. I automatically calmed down once it all started. The experience was one of a kind. My body and skin felt really good and I would definitely recommend to try this out at least once when u visit Morocco. A very clean place where its done for males and females, however I did not have anyone else around me during that 1 hour of the Moroccan bath.. They did serve biscuits and tea before leaving the place.

Expensive and Excellent. We went as a couple. This is more Arabian Nights for tourists than authentic, but was nonetheless an excellent experience. The quality is superb, both in terms of the environment and the service. Remember to take swimming kit. After changing, we spent a little time in a sunny and pretty courtyard with a pool, before being ushered into a private room in the hot, steamy hammam for a period, interspersed with soaping, scrubbing and coating with a thick, black soap (argan oil based). After showering this off, it was time for a rest and water/tea, followed by a massage. The whole experience was over two hours and well worth it for both of us.

Luxurious hammam in the heart of Morocco. We booked upon recommendation of a friend and were not disappointed. In fact, had we visited earlier during our stay in Marrakech, we would have gone back for additional services - Les Bains de Marrakech was a trip highlight! The stark contrast between the buzzing medina and immediate beauty and tranquility inside of the spa was incredible. The atmosphere was not only relaxing but outstandingly beautiful, and the service was excellent & attentive. I would recommend budgeting for an additional hour or two after your service to relax over tea and cookies, or to lay outside by the pool. This experience is an incredible value - five star luxury at near Moroccan prices - and books up quickly. So be sure to reserve your service(s) in advance.

Blissful. We came here on our last day before our flight after 5 full-on days of exploring, and it was exactly what we needed! On arrival we were greeted warmly and taken to our changing rooms, provided with dressing gowns and slippers and shown to a beautiful quiet outdoor pool where we hung out for an hour or so. We were then called for our treatment together - we chose the traditional hammam experience including body scrub and facial, and hour long massage. We were provided with water, mint tea and biscuits.

It was different. I have been to spa's in Bali, Thailand, USA , China, Turkey and Malaysia....this was just much different. All three people in our party agreed it was ok....but it would of been so much better if someone spoke English other than the receptionist. I think the fist part of washing your body just was a tad strange. No one spoke English it was rough exfoliating that just about took off my nipple. No on in our party liked this part!The soft massage was fine. It was a different experience, not sure that I would return to this particular spa. Maybe I am just too used to a nice relaxing spa with tranquil music. I was not ready to sit in a steam room setting for 40 minutes where the floor and walls are hot to the touch and you can't speak to anyone doing the service.
Amazing, wonderful and surprising!. My experience was delightful... I felt like a queen really. It was arrange by some friends and I had the most wonderful hamman.

If you're looking for luxury this is the place. . My sister and I decided to treat ourselves and go for a Hammam. We have both been to a local one before so we know there was going to be a big difference and there was. This was more like a spa day but we loved it. It was very relaxing and indulgent. I would recommend if you're looking for a relaxing luxury retreat. If is a traditional Hammam then you want then this isn't for you.

Style over substance. Guys, this ain't for you. Different story for ladies on the other hand. On a city break break with my sisters and parents we prioritised a visit to this highly recommended hammam. However, it's not a hammam in the traditional sense, it's more of a ladies spa. My "steam chamber" had no steam. My scrub was more of a gentle rub. My massage was sort of soft and laid back. I was actually bored through out. I feel better after a visit to the steam room at my local gym. The decor and smells are wonderful. The staff are lovely, but at the end of the day I wanted a Turkish bath style hammam to make me feel cleansed and refreshed. I felt worse on the way out than on the way in. On departure the receptionist asks if I enjoyed it... I said not really as there was no steam. She never bothered. She told the owner/manager (as did we), he too was not bothered. So, sadly, my intended highlight became my reluctant lowlight of a fantastic trip to a fantastic city where the locals, culture and food have blown me away!

Tourists dont be ripped off!!. I advise first timers to Hammams look for a traditional hammam instead, ...where you will get the REAL experience for a third of the price...dont be fooled by the pretty decor you see on the photos!we had a couples hammam and massage, the wash down was very quick and not attentive at all.the massage was the worst i have EVER had and i have had many around the world...my five year old could have done a better job.!! forget relaxing i was lying there feeling so frustrated wondering what the hell she was doing! and she was yawning her head off!The girl massaging my husband had a face like a camel! with bad attitutude! yes it had beautiful decor and calming music but that is all!!and to top that when we got home they had charged us 200d more!

Poor service. My riad kindly booked us a massage. However I forget to check what name it was booked under. I explained the situation and provided several possible name. Instead of helping, the receptionist was dismissive and failed to offer any sort of solution.

An incredibly indulgent 'time out' from the hustle and bustle. We were on a trip with 4 of us, female friends for a long weekend. We had found this place online and when we turned up we were blown away by the style and beautiful decor. The staff spoke very little english and we were unsure exactly what was in store.... but we had an amazing body scrub with the traditional black soap, Hammam and relaxing massage. It was all absolute bliss.... thoroughly recommended and good value too.

A rip off for tourists - very poor quality hammas. It may all look like a very nice spa but the service and quality of the Hamas was very poor, and we were left with the impression they are only after your money with no care about the quality of the service. The girls were very unfriendly and we left feeling we had been ripped off. If you want a nice western type spa surrounds then it's ok, but the quality of the Hamas is extremely poor. My advise is to go to Heritgae Spa which was fantastic.

Western Style Hammam. If you want to dip your toes in the water to a hammam and have a western style experience, this place is for you.The facilities are amazing, the experience is relaxing, the staff is lovely.The actual services are very western so don't expect a nice deep scrub or a deep massage here, use this as a warm up if you are uncomfortable with spa experiences. I prefer a real hammam, but it was a lovely facility.

Nice break from the Souks. We booked the standard Hammam and body scrub for 200 dhm which was quite good value. If I were going to book again I would go for something slightly more expensive. We were shown to the pool where we waited to go through and had some mint tea. We hadn't asked fora private room but ended up having one just for the 2 of us, we were shown to the shower and then to a sauna like room. The lady covered us in eucalyptus gel type stuff and left us for a little while, washed it off and then scrubbed us with black soap. We were then shown to another room where we could just lie down and relax until we wanted to leave. The lady didn't speak much english but it wasn't a problem- she was also not too hard with the scrubbing as i've heard a few horror stories, she asked us if it was okay. We were given the mits to take home with us which was a nice touch, and the mint tea was the nicest I had all holiday. I would have liked to have visited a public Hammam but my friend was slightly apprehensive, if you are looking for a luxury hammam this is lovely but I would definitely recommend paying slightly more rather than having the standard hammam. It was also VERY peaceful and we felt very tired and relaxed afterwards so it's a nice thing to do in the evenings- they said 5pm was their busiest time.

Absolutely relaxing. I was looking forward to a relaxing massage and I got an incredible day. From the moment you enter you feel inside Moroccan SPA heaven. Service is amazing, very accommodating and very professional. Atmosphere: 5Cleanliness: 4.5Service: 4PS: If u chose the Hamamm bath, ladies, you will have to take the top of your bathing suit off and will be massaged all over-By very professional ladies off course. Make sure then, you are with your significant other or with a group of friends whom you are very close to, otherwise you'll get acquainted in the most awkward way really fast.

Incredible spa experience!!. We were debating between here and La Mamounia or Royal Mansour and ultimately price won and we decided to try Les Bains. I could not have been more pleased with our visit here. From the moment we stepped foot in the door, it was an oasis from the chaos of the medina. The facilities were stunning and service top notch. 3 of us girls had a hamman together and then individual massages with a break for tea and a snack in between. My masseuse was incredible. I regularly get massages in the USA and she was one of the best I've ever had for sure. Definitely will return on the next visit and hopefully get a two hour massage this time... Thank you! :-)

to do when rest needed. Les Bains de Marrakech is absolutely wonderful, in fact it's one of the most relaxing and indulgent spas I have ever been to! Lie back and sip mint tea in the beautiful courtyard as exotic birds swoop above your head, before heading into a hammam for a invigorating full body scrub.

I loved the experience. Very nice and well organized place with great smell.. I tried the moroccon bath and I really loved it ... staff are very welcoming and friendly I do recommend the place so much

Pricey. I went for the classic hammam plus one hour massageThe experience is very nice but I have to say I have had better massages for less money.The atmosphere is posh...They don't make reservations unless you pay in advance They accept also credit card payments

Not worth it. Yes it's clean and well designed, but it should be at the price you have to pay (600 dirhams for a traditional hammam and massage).The staff were curt and we really didn't feel welcomed. It was nice to have the private hammam - but there was only one person to scrub the both of us down and it was a fast once over. We then had some mud quickly applied and that was it.The rest area was nice and the mint tea was ok. Finally the massage - pretty bad. We both had the 'drainage' which felt like an hour of stroking - hardly a massage. I asked for more pressure, which lasted a few minutes and then it went back to stroking. Pretty useless.We then went back to the changing room and you're then escorted out the back door via the payment area. I would have complained, but the woman was more interested in collecting the cash.It's nicely designed and it's clean, but you do feel like you are on a conveyor belt. It's touristy and a bit predictable.Wouldn't go back.

Hammam and wonderful massage from Les Bains de Marrakech. `My friend and I walked into Les Bains de Marrakech to make an appointment for a massage. The friendly receptionist gave us a list of services in French but we read English only. We waited for a few minutes for someone to bring us the English list of services. We decided on the traditional hammam and massage for $60.00 That included forty-five minutes body scrub and one hour of massage. Upon request, we put down a deposit and returned later for the services. (It is best to have an advance appointment.)When we returned, we sat in the waiting area until we were called. Shortly thereafter, a woman opened a door and invited us in. She presented to each one of us a heavy white robe and slippers. She lead us to the changing area. After we changed, we were lead to a room to relax before we get the scrub. Two women lead us into the scrubbing room that we both shared. We were instructed to take a cool shower before laying down on a bed. After they left the room, the hot steam came on. The same two women returned after the stream treatment and poured cool water over us. Mud was put on us and they left again. Shortly, they came back to the room and scrubbed us. The scrub was quick and somewhat harsh. It would be nice if they were a little more gentle with the scrub. Afterward, we were told to shower and relax in another room. Mint tea and water were offered to us. Two different women came and took us to different room for a massage. My massage therapist used the right pressure to massage. I felt like I was in paradise and could not get enough of it. I felt disappointed when the time was up. Afterward, we were directed to return to the room to relax again. Water, mint tea, and biscuits were served to us before we got dressed and to leave.This was my first hammam and my third massage in my life. I can not to compare the hammam experience, but the massage was the best I have ever had.
Awful reception. Really frosty receptionists. So put off by how rude and disinterested they were that we went somewhere else. It's v near the Bab Agnou.

Nice way to spend a morning. This is a lovely spa my second visit and hammans is very good. However don't book in the early slot it was the only one left and the spa was a little cold for me next time I will make sure I book a later one. The massage was excellent and it is a great way to unwind in a busy city.
Couples hammam and massage. Loely spa at the end of our trip. The whole experience was unhurried and luxurious. Highly recommended.

Hidden in a narrow street in the southern Medina. It was a real experience. We booked a half day treatment for couples with Hammam, massage and a bath of rose patels. The treatments were done in a very professional manner and we always felt good. The Spa/Hammam itself has a beautiful interior. The decoration is real Maroccan and authentic. We wanted to go again, but we didn't have the time anymore, because we stayed in Marrakech only for 3 days. Next time we'll come back! The price for the treatment was around 700-900 Dirham (I can't remember). We found the price fair for 4 hours of treatment!

Ive been spoilt. Had I had not visited another local spa a week before in Marrakech, I may have scored this a bit higher. A lovely setting, with beautiful rooms and architecture, but I agree a bit like being on a conveyor belt and definitely lacked a personal touch and warmth. Would go back but not my first choice.

So relaxing - a great experience . Went with a friend during a long weekend in Marrakesh. Had a dual spa where we were scrubbed within an inch of our lives. Truly amazing feeling, and to be honest from previous reviews I thought it would be much harsher!Not one for the prudish though as all is out bar knickers. The scrub was done in a steam room and then we loved to relaxing beds for some tea and to cool down. Following that we had a gorgeous rose petal bath, very relaxing and fragrant although probably was a bit too long in terms of heat!A real treat and a must do. Although part of me does wish I had done it the traditional way too so I could compare!

Nice but could be more personalised. Husband and I had joint hammam and relaxing massage. The spa house is clean and efficient and hallways and rooms are nicely decorated. Like other reviewers I did feel a bit like I was on a conveyer belt of treatments. The staff usher you around and although they're not unpleasant they don't have an aura of being warm or welcoming. Our relaxing massage was ok, but they could take tips from other styles of massage. For example when massaging the face then fingertip techniques work well rather than just sweeping hands over your face. But loved the scalp massage. Overall it was good but not outstanding.

A luxurious treat, from top to toe.. What an experience. From the minute we arrived, we were looked after wonderfully by the quiet & friendly staff. The decor is beautiful and the atmosphere peaceful & calming. The treatments were fantastic and we left feeling refreshed & relaxed!

Highly recommended. Very friendly staff and beautiful interior. The atmosphere is very peaceful and a perfect opposite to the noisy city. After Hammam you get to relax in a small room with nice music and tea, water and cookies. It was the best thing to do in Marrakesh!
You'll feel so peaceful and fresh afterwards :)

very professional staff. great experience. amwzing decorations. you will feel relaxed once you step in. the hammam experience really deserve it. soft oil massage was relaxing and nice. its 5 stars place. you wont regret it.

Impersonal & Rushed. Les Bains is quite possibly the most exquisite hammam spa I've seen in my five months in Morocco. The decor and design are simply stunning. Unfortunately beauty isn't everything and I've had much better hammam at incredibly less fancy spas. The staff were just friendly enough, but not as warm and welcoming as most Moroccans. I was rushed into the steam room, lathered up as my attendant said "face up" and "turn over" and then rushed out. I was left for 20 minutes to steam. The steam was nice. She came in once and asked me over and over "okay?" "okay"? She couldn't understand English or Spanish so I was completely unable to communicate with her. My bad for not speaking French, I know. When she returned she quickly exfoliated me and then rushed me over to the shower where I washed my own body and hair. I was rushed to the "relaxation" area and given nice tea and biscuits. My relaxation time was not rushed thankfully. Then I was herded out the backdoor to pay and be on my merry way. I know this place has rave reviews and it is certainly a beautiful spot, but for me it was completely impersonal and rushed and therefore not very relaxing. Perhaps they've gotten too big for their own good and forgotten that it's not just about packing the daily schedule to hit their financial quota but about offering a warm, welcoming and relaxing environment for spa goers.

Consider going to another salan. For 200 DH they ran me through like cattle. For 3 minutes they smeared the soap on and left me for 10 minutes. Not much steam in the room. When the woman came back she put COLD water on me. You better take your shower in 3 minutes as they are in a hurry. then no towel offered to put on my wet head to sit in a room that was not warm. Honestly, I didn't find anything about this visit that would make me go back. I have had much better hammans at less sophisticated places. The place looks good but please do more research for a different place to go to.

Mediocre -- would try others. Went with a group of girlfriends, as we love doing baths/spas when we travel (eg Istanbul, Budapest, Bali) -- this experience was only okay. Half had good bath experiences, half had decent massage, but not one had a good all-around experience. My massage was terrible -- no pressure, no change after I asked for more pressure a couple times, and way too much oil. The locker room is small and easily overrun with ~ 10 people in it. Compared with other experiences in Istanbul etc, where the two hours are filled with bath, scrub, shampoo, massage, this experience was a lot of sitting around. Probably could have cut the time in half. We had (a likely unique) bad experience at the end too. We asked the reception to ring two taxis for us but she wouldn't unless we gave her a number. We didn't have one as our riad, restaurants, etc had been doing it for us all week. So we had to wait at the entrance to the kasbah during rush hour trying to flag down two taxis which took about 45 minutes. At 60€ pp it was reasonable but we would definitely try another place next time.

Lovely Spa Day. The best way to end a great vacation by stopping here the day before leaving Morocco. I opted to do the traditional hamman with a massage and I was in heaven. After walking around Marrakech and Fes for 2 weeks, I desperately needed to relax. And relax I did. The spa is beautiful. Very clean and easy to find as it is right at the entrance to the Medina. The staff is lovely and the services are plentiful and reasonably priced. Afterwards, I felt totally refreshed. This is a must do when in Marrakech, just a fantastic experience.

True relaxation. In a city wish is as manic as Marrakech is, hiding away in this hammam for a few hours offers blessed tranquility. They have got the system down to a T here and it is a smoothly run operation. The hammam experience was very relaxing and the hour long massage that followed was sheer bliss. My only criticism is that it does feel a bit like you are on a conveyor belt in the way your are moved through the process like clockwork.That said, I left with silky smooth skin and feeling revived and ready to face the streets of Marrakech again,

Cold jacuzzi, locked in changing room. Perhaps because I was the last customer for the hammam, it was a bad experience. The jacuzzi was cold and unpleasant. The changing room door was spoilt and could not be opened. When I knocked and called, no one came and I was locked in and had to find a way to force it open. No one cared or apologised when I told them the door was spoilt. The hammam scrub was ok but felt rushed since they were closing. They said they open till 11pm on their website but they actually closed at 10pm. Will never visit again.

Still fantastic. I come to Marrakech about twice a year and always stop here for a couple of treatments. The treatments and the technicians are fantastic and you leave feeling brand new Andre revived. The only negative this time is that I didn't feel the reception was a friendly as they had been in the past. But genuinely still fantastic.

Stimulating and relaxing. Upon approaching the entrance, we could already get a feel for the luxurious surroundings inside. We reserved a couples session, each of us having a 1hr massage, which we had in our own room. Mine was a deep tissue massage and it was excellent. My foot had been aching from a fair amount of walking and it felt much better following the massage. My wife had a pregnancy massage, which was one of the reasons why we opted for this place over the other ones such as Heritage Spa & Mythic Oriental.The interior is all about the low soft lighting, Moroccan furnishings and dark colour tones.Highly recommended.

Amazing experience, service, ambience. This place is wonderful, and my only regret is that I only had time to visit once during my stay.You do normally need to book, at least one day ahead, but they speak good English, French, Arabic, etc. They are polite, but efficient, on the telephone.We paid a 600 dh (60 euros) plus a generous tip(they deserved it) for 45 minute Hammam plus 60 minute basic massage. Overall, the experience was amazing and at no point did I feel anything other than relaxed. Staff were always there to apply treatments, to direct, to assist, to bring complimentary tea and water.The place itself is beautiful, with wonderful Moroccan design, and I felt like wandering around with a camera (but was too chilled!)The hammamm was not too hot...They did add more steam at one stage, although I would have preferred it a little hotter. The soap and scrubs really exfoliated well, and they give you the glove to take away (which is reassuring too).The massage was genuinely relaxing, and very competently done.Since we went as a couple, both the hammamm and the massage were in private rooms for two people.There were also relaxation areas and a pool (albeit extremely cold!).If you are looking for a hammamm, massage, spa experience in Marrakech, then I would definitely suggest here.

Oase van rust. On our last day we visited this spa in the middle of the medina. It's like a litte relaxation heaven on earth. The ladies were very friendly and gentle with us. You have to try it!!!!. We didn't want to leave.

Fantastic. My husband and I love the place. It was fantastic. The building inside looks really nice, the staff is very polite and friendly. We stayed half a day with 3x 1h massages. Felt so good that we almost fell asleep. We will surely go there again!

Nice but could have been better.... I went with a group of 8 ladies, and they were able to accommodate us. It was a nice experience, but I felt they were very quick and lazy in the hammam. I was expecting to get SCRUBBED. However, it was just a light brushover, - something I could easily have done on my own. Also they used very little mud and it was basically just splashed on my body. I actually rubbed it around myself after they left. It seemed like we were just treated as some annoying tourists, and not a special customer. I am planning a group retreat next fall in Marrakech, and I will definitely choose a different Hammam for our group.
Wonderful . TO have a very important visit to this place Were you feel very surprised and have a good relax for some time. We enjoyed match and we love it so much thanks a lot.

Most relaxing 2 hours of our trip. Lovely setting and great staff. We opted for the traditional hamaam followed by a sports massage and a relaxing massage with oils. We emerged refreshed and rested. Very good value, with water, mint tea and sweet biscuits served during breaks in treatments. Would highly recommend.

Did not live up to expectations. We were executed about our Hamman Experience@1200 around £60 each we expected a fair bit of luxury and pampering. It was a bit like a conveyor belt experience, we shuffled from one section to the next , which not much chill out time in between and then shunted out(politely) once we had used up our allotted time. Staff friendly enough if a little abrupt, clean, nice place but could be a little more welcoming, warm and little less like a ham man factory..sorry had better, cheaper in Spain.

Very relaxing and enjoyable experience!. We thoroughly enjoyed our spa experience. The building is beautiful, the ambiance is soothing, the facilities are modern, clean and well organised and the staff well trained. My only comment for improvement would be the following: the staff spoke quite loudly among themselves in the corridors as we were trying to enjoy our treatments, which was a bit annoying.

Went above and beyond!. We had booked this spa through a tour operator but upon arriving, it turns out the spa has no connections to the tour operator! The guy that had picked us up followed us into the spa and said we came to the wrong one and tried to make us go to a different spa which didnt look well kept. As far as I was concerned, my voucher stated it was for Les Bains De Marrakech.As the man and the spa staff were trying to sort it all out, the spa offered us tea, water and biscuits whilst they tried to work out what happened. It turns out the tour operator had sent me vouchers for the wrong spa! The staff could tell that my friend and I really wanted to stay at Les Bains De Marrakech and not go to the alternative so worked it out that they would sort out the mess with the tour operators and we could stay at the spa.Having arrived at 11am, the spa didnt have space till 1pm but after reception spoke to the spa manager and staff, the staff were willing to take their lunches a little later so that we could start our spa at 12pm!We first went to the hammam where we were oiled up and left to steam for 10-15min. The lady then came back in and scrubbed us (really hard!) then put on a clay mask and again, left to steam. After the hammam, we then went to a resting area and had some tea. We then moved onto our massage and this was amazing! The staff did whisper to each other throughout but we didnt mind this as they were still giving us a really good massage! After this, we then went to another resting area before it was time to go!All in all, a fantastic experience and Id like to thank the receptionist who was on duty on the 8th Oct at 11am. Thank you so much!

Great experience. I have recently visited Les Bains de Marrackech with a girlfriend and we both had a really great experience. We had booked on line prior to our visit and although the day and time we had requested was not available, an alternative was offered. Payment via credit card on their web site (even if it was in French!) was easy to understand.Upon arriving at the spa we were booked in and shown to the changing room where a locker is given to each client. We spent a short while at the pool, very relaxing, and then went off for our first treatment in the Hammam - we had chosen two different treatments, both very relaxing although after 45 mins it was getting a little warm in the room!A rest between treatments and then we had our massages - again we had chosen different ones, really very good - I fell asleep it was so relaxing! Of the many massages I have experienced around the world, this masseuse certainly was very professional.Mint tea, water and some cookies served to us as we rested (once again!) in a heated room, a perfect way to end a really great experience.

Incredible value and a wonderful experience. I recently visited Les Bains de Marrakech with a large group of friends. In the lead up to the trip the staff were very helpful with the arrangements and pre payment and made the whole experience enjoyable and easy.The spa itself is absolutely stunning! The outside pool was wonderful, relaxation rooms were so comfy that we all fell asleep and the staff are great. We had the traditional combination deal thingy which was a 45 min hammam and scrub with black soap and mud followed by a 1 hour full body massage. The experience was brilliant and only cost us about £35 each for the whole thing. I would definitely go again and highly recommend this place!

stay away from the massage. I came here with a friend in August and we had booked the Marrakesh Ritual which was 45' of Hammam, 30' Mud Wrap plus a 1 hour massage. according to the website you could choose between relax and drainage. we booked on their website in advance and also paid in advance to guarantee the booking.after arrival and changing we were brought to the outside pool area to wait for our treatments. the pool was nice and the whole area quite clean and open.the hammam was great and the people were friendly (don't be shy).after that we were wrapped in our bathrobe and brought to a room with lounge chairs for the two of us to relax. we got a bottle of water as well as a glass of tea.after a while we were picked up and brought upstairs for our mud wrap.it wasn't a mud wrap as i expected. there was barely any mud and it was dabed very sparingly on to your body and then we were wrapped in foil with a towel over our eyes and lights almost completely off. it was very relaxing but we might as well have been wrapped in just the foil based on the amount of mud.after that we were once again in the poolarea and then brought to our massage.we were not asked about relax or drainage and i wasn't sure if they were just starting off slowly and then would be asking which I wanted.it never happend.the massage was extremely slow and it just consisted of rubbing our skin or just randomly resting and touching. there was no real technic and there was no hint of a professional masseus trying to release tension or work our muscles.there was an extreme amount of oil and the hair and face was also massaged! i was not happy about this as it doesn't say anything about a facial and the amount of oil only came out after washing my hair about 3 times.It was not relaxing at all and I just wanted it to end as it was absolutely useless. it was the kind of massage anybody can give a friend without any knowledge of how to massage.we felt that they were waiting for us to fall asleep so they didn't have to do much. both were yawning and resting their hands on us for several minutes.i would definitely not recommend the massages. one of the worst i've ever had.we complained afterwards and the receptionist told us I would be getting an e-mail, but I still haven't gotten anything after 3 weeks.other than massage i would recommend this place as it inexpensive and clean and the staff is friendly.

Unforgettable experience. We arrived in the afternoon, and I would recommend arriving an hour early so you can settle in, and use the pool facilities. Overall, the experience was really wonderful, although I had a few points for improvement:- I found the massage staff rude, during the massage, and when I had to undress, they were giggling, and then proceeded to cough and yawn over me several times during the massage (ew!)- the massage was very light, and although nice, I would expect a bit more- there was no communications during the whole things about what was going on, and as a customer, it is nice to know exactly what is going on!Overall though, the experience was lovely, the place was clean, and for a three hour experience, the price was very decent

FANTASTIC. My mother and I booked in for two hammams. We got there early, thus they asked us if we wanted to spend some time by their nice pool.After a while an extremely nice lady massaged us both and we really enjoyed our hammam. Later on, we were offered to rest at the spa and they offered us Moroccan tea and water. The price was really convenient and the spa extremely luxurious! Definitely coming back next time!
Beautiful spa. Stunning layout, beautiful interior and fantastic treatments. Very reasonable prices. We had two treatments each and stayed for 3 hours and loved every minute of it.

Best Spa in Marrakesh !!!!. Les Bains de Marrakech is located in the Kasbah district, just five minutes from the Koutoubia mosque.Just around the corner of Bab Agnaou. We were instructed to arrive half an hour before the appointment time.The staff are polite, well spoken and friendly. Once we had been welcomed, we were taken to the changing rooms to get ready. They provide everything – you only need to bring your swimwear. Once changed you may either relax beside the pool on sun loungers, take a quick dip in the pool or inside the waiting area. There are varieties of message treatments hammam available,Once you are done,you are served with a mint tea.I recommend it for it calmness and cleanness.
Great Massages!!!!!. Went there for our honeymoon and had a couples bath plus massages!!! Felt peaceful and calm!! Would definetely go back for more!!! Good value for treatments.

Good treatment, poor staff. I booked a hammam and a four hand massage at Les Bains. I had done a lot of research and this seemed like it was good value for money. The place is really nice and relaxing with a pool to sit around before your treatment. The Hammam and massage were excellent and we felt really relaxed after it. The only criticism i have of this place were the staff. The 2 ladies that did our treatment were fine. But the people who show you around seemed completely disinterested in us. They forgot about us after our treatment and we had to go and find someone to show us where to go next. We heard them all standing around chatting for about 20 minutes when we were meant to be relaxing after the treatment.

Excellent hammam. We visited Les Bains de Marrakech in part because of the option to have our treatments in the same room. Despite arriving an hour early (it was very hot outside!) we were allowed to come in and use the pool while waiting for our treatments. Yes the desk staff (as per other reviews) were a little surly, but on the whole we found the staff pleasant and all the treatments we had (hammam, oriental bath, massage) were professionally executed. The massage, as others have observed, could have been firmer, but it was thoroughly relaxing. I can imagine that if you don't speak French that things could be a little confusing here, but one poster's comment about not being allowed a shower before leaving is simply absurd: there are plenty of showers in the changing rooms. While not at the level of elite spas (I say this in comparison to a number I've visited around the world), Les Bains de Marrakech is a beautiful place and a real respite from the busy city outside.

Amazing experience. Amazing ambiance, stunning venue that isn't expected from the surroundings outside. Treatment were very good and relaxing. The only downside was the noise while we were in the steam rooms. The employees talk amongst themselves quite loudly. Also thought it was value for money, DHS750 per person for just over 2hrs. Stunning pool and chill area. Well worth a visit.

A relaxing oasis amid the bussle of the medina . When booking our hotel we decided to go for the full experience and have a Hamam and massage. Our hotel recommended and booked at the Les Bains de Marrakesh for us. Before our visit I was a little apprehensive as there are many places around that provide a Hamam and some of them looked really awful from the outside. However we were very pleasantly surprised. This spa is just inside one of the entrances to the medina and as you walk through the door you already feel cool and relaxed. The reception staff are very polite and efficient and let you know exactly what's going to happen. We had booked the 'Traditional' package, which includes a 45 min Hamam and an hours very relaxing massage. This costs 600 dh (approx £45). In between each stage you can relax by the pool, or in one of their many relaxation rooms. They then come and take you to the next part your treatment. I was a bit worried about doing this on my own, as I'd never had a Hamam, massage or even been to a spa!
