But they have couples rooms where you can have the Hamam, massage or such together if you wish. The do provide a robe and slippers to walk around in but women just need bikini bottoms for the treatments and men swim trunks/boxers or swim shorts. Also, as a nice extra, they keep you topped up with water, mint tea and local biscuits. All in all the price is mid range for top of range facilities. Throughly recommended.

Magical Place. We came here on our first day of our trip to have a hammam and massage and felt immediately relaxed from the moment we walked through the door. We relaxed by the pool for some time before we were called up for our hammam (a must do while in Morrocco!). Between our hammam and our massage we were served mint tea whilst we relaxed on loungers indoors. The massage lasted an hour but it felt like 2! It was out of this world and I kept nodding off. Afterwards we were given a chance to wake up with some more mint tea in the indoor courtyard. The interior design of this spa is beautiful. Will definitely be back!

AMAZING!!!. I checked different Hammams online and visited a few to check out prices...this is not the cheapest but it's a good value for what you get. We booked the appointment at midday. They asked us to get there by 11:30 so we did.We got there and they gave us our locker number and directed us to the changing rooms. They alsoGave us a bath robe and slippers and told us to chill around the pool until the time of the Hammam. We waited around the pool til what I think was midday sipping maroccan tea offered to us by a nice lady and then we were directed to the Hammam room. Unfortunately they don't offer paper underwear so women can either lie naked or wear their own knickers (or bikini bottoms) and men have to wear boxers or their own swim wear. No one told us to bring a spare pair so we only hoped that they would get dry by the time we left. The Hammam lasted 45 minutes and the Ladies were very nice and smiley. After the Hammam they asked us to take a shower and then we were directed to the relax room were we were offered tea and a bottle of water. We waited thereFor around 10 minutes and then we were brought to the massage room were they massaged the whole body for an hour. Tbh it wasn't the best massage of my life (I do massages at work so I was concentrating on her movements and the pressure) but my Boyfriend loved and fell asleep so I guess it was great. After the Massage we were directed again to the relax room were we were offered 2 biscuits each and tea again. The whole experience was amazing and for 600dhs (around £39) we couldn't ask for more. I recommend this place to everyone as the interiors are amazing and you feel like you are in an Alladin's movie.

Decor and Super Bath. Super bath in a great atmosphere. Great time, Great sensations.The bath is 80% of the experience, lets say massage not more then 20%.The great thing in fact is the atmosphere, the bath and the good time spent here.

Decor, service and hamman were amazing, not sure about the massage!. My sister and I visited here as we had heard it was the best in Marrakech. All of the staff were extremely friendly and spoke very good English. The decor and ambience is fantastic and I couldn't fault it. I would highly recommend the hammam (sitting in a sauna where you are basically exfoliated and cleansed until your skin is as soft as a baby!) but my sister and I both felt that the massage was not worth £30 more. The massage was very relaxing but was not the type we are used to. It felt more like you were being stroked with pressure rather than being kneaded into (if that makes sense!) but perhaps that's what a Moroccan massage is like. It was lovely to have mint tea and bottled water offered whilst we were waiting between the hammam and massage and after the massage. One thing we both noticed was that we frequently felt as though we were left to relax/wait around without being told what for or how long. I would definitely come back here again but only for the hammam, not the massage. TIP: do not wear new/expensive swimwear for the hammam as is might darken it (learning from experience!)

Second visit!. We'd been to Les Bains about 5 years ago and had the largest package on the menu, a 4 hr treatment which was nice even though they leave you soaking or relaxing a little too long.. This time we just had the hammam and gommage which again felt like we were left in hammam, a quick scrub and that was it! Place is beautiful but sure you'd get more moneys worth somewhere else! And by somewhere else I do NOT mean 5 sens de Marrakech, that is awful

So relaxing that I fell asleep. One of the highlights of my trip. Luxurious, incredibly tranquil and outstanding massage and hammam. I'd recommend getting the hammam and massage package which lasts a few hours with quite a while spent relaxing between sessions with mint tea. The place itself is stunning too and they let my partner and I do the hammam together which I'm told is quite rare.

Hammam at it's best!. I booked a 2 hours Hammam + relaxing massage for me and my friend as her birthday gift and we both were 100% happy when we left.The staff was great, very helpful, polite and knowledgeable.The buiding itself is gorgeous,clean and very relaxed.We left the building feeling energised and distressed.I'll definetly go back and i can strongly advise anyone togoand be pampered in this FAB place!!!

Awesome. I have travelled to Turkey and tunisia and have not had a better hammam and spa all my life. Wow what a place. Hidden in a 'gulli' in the heart of marrakesh this place has got to be the best ever. When you step inside it's like u would never expect it to be so posh, upper class... Unlike all the backstreet stuff going on... I went for a traditional massage costs around £40.00 for 3 hours of scrubbing rubbing massaging resting.. Unbelievable.. I came out of their with skin feeling live, fresh and felt so relaxed.. I wish I had done the spa twice during my 7 night if I had known how good this place was. No regrets, fantastic staff, beautifully dressed. 10/10

Perfect Antidote to Hectic Marrakech. Stepping in to Les Bains de Marrakech is like coming to an oasis in the desert.It is calm and beautiful and we were warmly welcomed.by the very polite staff.A few explanations would have been helpful-ie Relax here in the sun and we will see you in 10 minutes,or you will have 20 minutes in the sauna etc as we weren't sure what was happening at all times.That said,we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves,the exfoliation was quite gentle and the massage was better than I expected.We left feeling relaxed and very,very clean.

Luxurious hidden treasure in Marrakech!. I could not go without leaving a well deserved positive review! I have visited Les Bains de Marrakech last week. After hearing all the positive feedback from tourists as well as local people I had to experience thus luxurious authentic Moroccan Spa myself. The Spa is hidden in the Medina and you would never even think it would look this beautiful, luxurious and large inside. What a treat for the eye! The decor is exquisite and atmosphere very very relaxing.From the moment I entered the manager guided me through the entire process and handed me over to the extremely friendly and skilled staff. Although I wasnt really feeling well when I came to the Spa initially due to food illness, the staff really did everything to make sure I was ok and I felt better soon. Hammam, Massages and Facilities are excellent. I would most certainly recommend this Spa to anyone and in fact I cant really wait to go back and experience it again. The best Spa I have experienced so far! Salma

Terrible massage. Myself & my husband had a couples hammam & massage, we were greeted by surly staff from start to finish. This wouldn't have been too bad if the massage was good but it really was terrible. The therapist yawned & whispered to her colleague throughout, she applied no pressure & I couldn't call it a massage! I felt ripped off, the staff do not seem happy there & I would not recommend a massage there, what a let down!

Relaxing 3 hours in Marrakech. My wife and I did a hamman and a relaxing massage, which took about 3 hours. The hamman usually takes about 45min in a sauna (private for the couple), with skin treatments by the specialists. The place was clean and nice. Afterwards, we went for a couple relaxing massage (1 hour), which for me was the best part. following the massage we went to a resting room, and could calmly drink a fresh mint tea. The price was also OK (about £50 for we both. I think only the hamman was about £10 each).

A must in Marrakech. As soon as we walked in we felt relaxed. We were given bathrobes to wear and were given lots and lots of water and mint tea. We had a couple's hammam (good scrub down by a woman) and then a couple's massage. An excellent way to spend the morning or afternoon. We came here from a recommendation by a friend on her honeymoon.

An Oasis of a spa.. First experience of a Hammam and spa in Marrakesh. Have to book in advance of a few days as they seem to be busy. Lovely morrocan decor. Quiet and serene with mood lighting. Changing rooms are clean and luxurious. My wife and I had a massage. We love our massages and have travelled the world finding the best. Our gold standard are the very best in Bangkok. I thought my massage was very good as she worked my sore muscles (regular gym goer) well. Unfortunate my wife didn't find it as good as she was used to deeper kneading. Overall service and ambience was top class. Price very reasonable compared to the other posh Spa in Marrakesh. I don't think the others are much better overall. Would recommend it for first timers whom has never had a Spa/Hamman experience before in Marrakesh. I would go there again.
Absolutely loved this spa. Visited this spa for some much needed respite whilst in Marrakesh- absolutely beautiful, great value and well worth visiting.

Lovely staff make this experience. I've been to a few other similar venues, and this is my favourite. It's a beautiful building, but you are so very well looked after it makes a real difference.Bear in mind this is one of the few baths which allow for couples treatments.

Relaxing experience and well looked after. We turned up this morning, it's pretty easy to find, just off the main road - it looks like you're going out of the wall but it's a quick left and there's a sign :)Upon arrival everything was lovely, the building is very impressive and staff seemed really helpful. So many staff in there!! Changing facilities were great and the place smelled gorge. The only reason we have not given it a 5* is because we had booked the Marrakech experience (hamman, mud wrap and massage) the hamman was fine , it was 2 of us in there and we were left in the steam room for quite some time before and during the treatments, obviously your pours need to open so this is part of it, but it seemed forever and we thought they had forgotten about us as this was not explained. Then once taken up for the mud wrap we were slightly disappointed with experience as there were 2 girls and they had a small pot each of which they were smearing small parts of 'mud' over us to then wrap us up. What the girls did took 2 minutes and then they left us a long time to snooze etc and relax but not really worth the money that you pay when we could have done this to each other. Wasn't the kind of thick mud we were expecting.Massage was fab and we would do the whole experience again, recommend it if you're after a little tranquil get away but wouldn't say that you HAVE to do it or you will be missing out if you don't go. Of corse there are other treatments so this is just a review on what we paid €128 for 2 people. We were in there for 3.5 hours in total and would say the hands on therapies lasted around 1.5 hours including the hour massage .All in all it's a beautiful place

Great but read the small print . We went as part of a wedding group, fortunately it was just the women. You'll get to know each other VERY well. The hammam scrub is amazing on reflection but I lost any pre- wedding tan I'd cultured! The massage is so relaxing but some of us were paired up so no modesty is allowed. One of us was massaged by a male, so make sure if this isn't your thing. The surroundings of dim lighting and wonderful smells are very relaxing. The only negative was a fuss with the treatments. One of our party paid the equivalent of £20 more than most but seemed to have less treatment. When we queried it she'd supposedly been given a scrub with a more expensive oil! Felt a bit taken advantage of.... Check that you get what you booked for.

Incredible. We went for the hamman and massage. Just incredible. We had no idea what to expect and staff doing the treatments dont provide any info they just get to work! I felt like a new person after. Best spa experience ever. We were there for 3 hours and felt it was great value

Very relaxing. A few of us recently visited, and had the Hamman massage, scrub and draining massage!
Service was excellent - well looked after and massages were great!

They just want your money..Not a spa at all! Staff not trained for treatments!. We always check reviews before visiting places, but somehow we did not find this place on Tripadvisor until after the visit. Such a shame!!! We would have never gone there as reviews about bad staff are so true!This experience went really wrong.. As soon as I entered hammam room, the lady doused me with boiling water from a bucket which I first - did not expect as she did it from behind; and second – it was so hot it burnt my back! I reacted, but she did not…I kindly asked not to use that water on me again using gestures and a smile. She just put me onto the bed also smiling. Scrubbing was really painful – I told the lady that she was too harsh with the glove, but she said “hash, hash” and laughed with another lady who was doing the same on my husband. He suffered in silence, but I asked to stop. The clay was put onto us and ladies left the room..they started chatting outside our door and then it turned into yelling and fighting for about 5 minutes! What the hell??? The entered later laughing again. I was then asked to take the shower and guess what – here comes my second bucket! Onto my legs this time!!! Clearly the lady did not understand why I screamed first time and what I said to her, therefore I got the full “pleasure”… We then were given teas outside and asked to relax before the massage, but this was no way relaxing for us. I informed the lady who came to ask if everything was ok, about what happened, but she just went away. Massage was ok, but we both were in terrible form, therefore did not enjoy it.We probably should have learned some French before going in, but we thought the staff in a place charging €60 pp would know some basics in English such as “hot”, “no more”, “harsh”, “painful”, etc.. such a shame!When we were leaving the lady who knew that things went wrong was not there. Receptionist clearly wanted to get rid of us charging full price and saying “bye-bye” as soon as she got the money. Really bad!!

Relaxing time in sumptuous surroundings. I felt pampered throughout my one hour traditional hammam experience here. If you are self-conscious - never fear, you get a private steam room, shower, & relaxation room to yourself. In hindsight, I would have paid for a massage or a perfumed bath. This was the perfect treat after long day of sightseeing and shopping. I felt wonderfully clean and relaxed afterwards.Make sure to book at least a couple days in advance!

Wonderful place. I have been in this spa few years ago and of course came back as soon as I visited Marrakech two weeks ago.I was trying to book my massage via email and I was getting response quickly.Visit itself was wonderful experience ,had 1 hour relaxing massage and it was perfect.At the end they take you to beautiful room where you will be given mint tea and biscuit.However you cannot be there forever as they are very busy and people from next time slot are due to enter.Anyway,if you are fan of spa,this is the place you must visit while in Marrakech,however remember they are very busy and you need to book in advance to avoid disappointment .Will be back in Les Bains de Marrakech for sure.

Know what you're getting yourself into. I write this as an English female who has had a few British spa experiences but none in Morocco, but I feel that I would have wanted to know this info!We went for the traditional hamman experience followed by massages - I had a relaxing one and my husband had a "draining" one. Overall, this was a good experience and we felt that we had a relaxing time and that it was friendly, clean and good value for money, however, as a primarily tourist venue, we felt that they were a little liberal with the nudity!We were taken to our hamman first where my bikini top was taken off me. Then you go through the traditional hamman experience. They will touch your breasts and you won't really be able to hide anything!Then for the massage, they gave us some paper underwear (I think you would be spared this if you'd put a spare pair of your own in the pocket of your robe). My husband got some perfectly reasonable shorts, I got a skimpy paper thong...During the massage, they will pull down your pants to massage your bottom and again will massage your breasts. The massage rooms all come off a long corridor. Each room has a door (made of wood) and two windows with wooden shutters. We only realised halfway through the massage when we opened our eyes to turn over that whilst these had been closed to start with, they were all now wide open, onto the public corridor. Literally anyone, of either sex could have walked down the corridor, whilst we were lying there naked, but for a flimsy bit of paper!In addition, whilst the massage was nice, my husband felt his wasn't really "draining" and my massage therapist kept yawning and checking her phone during my massage. As I said at the beginning, this was an overall good experience and if you are used to getting naked and are very body confident then none of this will bother you and you'll have a good time. Equally, forewarned is forearmed and if you now know that you'll have to get really naked, maybe that will help you relax more too. I just got the feeling that they had the wrong idea about tourists and just because we feel ok about showing our legs and shoulders and being naked in front of our partners, it doesn't mean that we get naked in front of the world!

Perfect Bliss. We had booked for 2 couples at the same time starting 9.30 am. Ww had the Hammam for 45 minutes where you'd lie in this charming hot room and the ladies come in and pour warm water over you then put the steam on then they come back & scrub you down with mittens which you are given later as gifts. Then rub this sandy dark coloured cream all over you then you have more steam & at the end you have a shower using orange scented shower gel, you then rest before your massage which was one the best I have ever had, she managed to get rid of years of work related stress knots in my neck shoulders :) the facial & head massage was so gentle and my whole body felt relaxed & tingled at the end.The rooms are lush & clean the towels are luxurious and the scented rooms make the whole experience unforgeable. For £39 per person for 3 hours of perfect bliss I want to come back again and again.

A relaxing day. The place is really very nice and people here don't rush to push you outside, and this is a very good way to work. Me and my partner had treatments in couple: the hammam was nice also if is not so easy resist 45 minutes inside, we had an hard scrub (maybe a little bit more delicate and longer is better) and a nice rest after it. A refreshing mint tea was served, before we continued with the rose petals bath. No one will disturb you and you can close your eyes in the room decorated with candles. This was my favourite part. After another brief rest there was the massage. A little too soft according to my opinion, but not bad. I recommend to enjoy this place much more for the atmosphere that for the treatments.

Good experience, was expecting more from the hammam.. As the title says, the hammam ended up being a brief 5 minute steam inside of your own private room (with girlfriend). Other than that the massage was good, scrub is a little on the hardcore side, but I didn't mind that.Relaxation room and tea afterwards was a nice touch.

Room for improvement. Don't get me wrong: there's a lot to like about Les Bains de Marrakech. The Moroccan decor was beautiful, while the facilities were impeccably clean. I felt relaxed from start to finish.That said, there's definitely room for improvement. While I laid in the hammam for what felt like ages, the scrub itself was over in 60 seconds. By comparison, near-identical scrubs in Turkish hammams lasted for a good 5-10 minutes. The real disappointment, however, was the "massage". I felt like I was dipped in a vat of Argan oil and lightly patted for 60 minutes. Was it relaxing? Yes. Did my back feel better for it? No. For what it's worth, my friend reported a similar experience. [And she repeatedly asked for more pressure!]I don't know that I'd recommend Les Bains de Marrakech to other travellers, but it didn't leave a bad taste in my mouth. Just oil in my hair. [Pack shampoo. Lots of it.]

Pure relaxation!. We booked the basic Hammam package ~1.5 weeks in advance and everything worked out fine. Though massages might be a bit pricy, the value for money you get with the basic package is perfect! The interior is amazing - clean and really beautiful (gorgeous maroccan lights everywhere). I went there with my partner, so we really appreciated the couple hammam room - which is not a given in Marrakech.The staff was friendly and helpful.We spend about 2 hours at les bains and left perfectly relaxed and recharged.

Heaven!. I always dream of the time I spent almost an entire morning at this heavenly spa! The space is not only beautiful but the whole experience is one of the best. You feel they know their business and have thought of every single detail. The massage was to die for...I really wanna go back and experience it again. I did the bath soak at the end which I wouldn't do next time just cause felt a little dark and lonely...

Nice experience but too hurried. We were here for a couples hamman experience. The receptionist spoke English but she was a bit snobby with our checkins when we arrived. The ambience is nice. The hamman experience was too hurried and we were left in there for 30min before the scrub. The staff could not speak English and we were lost most of the time about what happens next or where to go. The French guy at the reception was nice and welcoming. Overall an interesting experience but we won't be back.

Well organised, priceworthy and beautiful . We went here with now expectations at all and ended up more than satisfied with our experience. The atmospher were calm, relaxing and most beautiful. The traditionell hamam with black soap included sauna with scrub. The straff were very effective and you kinda gotta feeling that you were in a hurry. But if you ignore the fact that they do this prosedure to around 100 persons per day it could be really nice. The massage was amazing! A holebody massage for almost an hour. The price for the hamam and the massage were 580 dh.

Oasis in a mire of a town. An absolute oasis of tranquility from the horrendous hassling and stench of a city called Marrakech (medina). Beautiful inside, mysterious enough to be intriguing, welcoming enough to be relaxing. A true 5* spa experience. Lacks old world charm it is more Moroccan modernity however that is welcome in a place like this.

Relaxing. We booked before we arrived in Marrakech as a last day relaxation treat. We got the ghassoul body mask with plants (170 DHS) which is very reasonable. The place is lovely and the changing rooms were fully equipped with lockers, showers towels etc. The hammam was an experience to say the least! I don't know what I was expecting but it was different. I did however feel relaxed afterwards and you can stay in the relaxation room as long as you want and they give you mint tea, water and biscuits. I think language was a barrier though because we asked for a little more steam and the whole room filled floor to ceiling and I had to go and open the door to let some steam out!!! Overall a good experience though!

Average. Last time we were in Marrakech we had a hamman and massage at Mystic oriental and it was wonderful. This place is a little cheaper but not by much.We took friends who have never been to Marrakech before and they enjoyed it, but I felt is was decidedly average. The staff were a little cold and not particularly friendly (in comparison to most Moroccans) and the building was nothing special.My massage was done by the one male who does massage and it was ok but nothing special. I know what it feels like to walk out of these places feeling magical and this wasn't it. And there were no aroma's at all. There are so many Hammans available and I wouldn't return to this one.

Very nice!. Had a 45 minute hammam with soaps, scrub etc followed by an hour's massage. The hammam felt a little hurried but probably more our fault than theirs as we got our timings muddled and arrived 15 minutes late. However the massage was the best I've every had - really deep and attentive. Beautiful and excellently equipped communal areas and plentiful complimentary refreshments made for a luxurious afternoon!
Very Plush. Came here for a spa and body scrub. Was very impressed with the professionalism. It was a truly a cathartic experience.

Very average - whats the hype about?. I visited this spa on my last trip to Marrakech in Dec 2014. I had read a lot of amazing reviews on this so my expectations were set very high only to be a little underwhelmed. i have been to many spas all over the world so i have much to compare it with. The spa itself is nice and has an authentic feel. I had a pedicure - which wasn't great. But after complaining about this for the next treatment they made sure the masseuse gave us our moneys worth. I had a full body massage and the masseuse was very thorough. The receptionist was very pleasant and accommodating.

amazing and professional service. The attention to detail throughout this experience made it truly wonderful. The right people speak to you and guide you where to go at the right time inviting you through the maze of tastefully decorated and well maintained rooms to your next treatment. We had a couples shared hammam which was quite unique and left our skin as fresh as it had ever been! My wife then went for facial while I had a massage. As if by magic as I appeared from my room so did she and we were led once again to another rest area and offered tea and pastries. The décor the ambience the products and the robes with sized slippers all contribute to a 5 star experience especially when you consider it cost around 50 GBP each for over 2 hours which my wife tells me a similar spa in London would be many times more

Great place, a must in Marakesh. We had 45 min hammam & traditional body scrub with black soap, kessa gloves in a private room and booked it the day before we went, but it's better to book a bit more in advance. The cost was 170 Dirhams which was great value. After the treatment, you can stay in the relaxation area for as long as you want where you are given mint tea and water. The Changing rooms are fully equipped too, electronic lockers, showers, shower gel provided too.

Relaxing afternoon and good value for money.... Were not regular Spa goers but this certainly fulfilled our expectations. We went for the half day traditional package which was around 40£, we were aware that for a Marrakech spa this was in the upper price bracket but coming from the UK this seems good value. Each step was hugely relaxing: we were never made to feel rushed and were really happy with the treatments.The staff were attentive and friendly.

scrub, sweat and relax. Hammam for beginners. Make sure to fix a visit some days ahead, this hammam is booked out quite often. No need to do more than "simple" hammam, for 170 Dirhams. All other treatments are available all over the world. if you've never been to a hammam before this is a perfect place. Very close to the tombeaux saades. Enter the Medina at Bab Agnaou (Gate Agnaou) and just turn right, there you are.

Overrated and overpriced. We chose one of the half-day packages and overall the experience was not great, especially the service delivery was far from perfect. The place is nice and clean however the staff is not really professional.In the package we had a massage and the execution was not professional. The staff seemed bored, one girl was constantly yawning while another one had a cold and kept coughing and sneezing. Also we had no indication of what was happening between the treatments and been waiting with a bottle of water while a mint tea would have been more than welcomed.For the price I would have expected a much better service and would not recommend the place.

Stunning. This place is pretty impressive. It's tucked away down a tiny street in the Kasbah, but when you get in there, it's like a maze of calmness! They're really fantastic in there. They even give you slippers in your correct shoe size. The interior decoration is beautiful and the treatments are intensely relaxing. We went on our first day and quickly made a booking for our last. I'd love to go there again.

Pretty but perfunctory . The hammam is such an important part of any trip to this part of the world but we were not quite confident enough to do exactly as the locals did and visit one of the more simple establishments. Retrospectively I think that was a mistake. The setting (just before the slave gate in the Kasbah) was easy to find and the interior darkly mystical with its chocolate drapes and intricate lanterns. The session started with us lying on covered slabs in a cave like room, which was filed with heady eucalyptus scented steam. When our pores were sufficiently open two women came in and proceeded to cover us in soap (special black soap that looks like treacle). It was very quick and casual and then we were left to steam again. A second visit allowed them to scrub the soap (and layer or two of dirt) off us. After this whirlwind affair we were left to steam again before being taken to sit and allow our heads to cool down. I was in Jordan a couple of years ago and the process was much less perfunctory and rather more comprehensive. I appreciate that we may be viewed as wealthy foreigners but I can help feeling that a hammam frequented by locals would have given appreciates better service for a fraction of the price - certainly a lesson to be learned about overcoming my squeamish ness of other people's dirt.

THE BUSINESS OWNERS NEED TO SUPERVISE MORE. I love a great spa experience and am willing to pay for it too. A moroccan spa experience at this price should be the best in the world ..unfortunately it is not and these are the reasons why .Staff ... seem to have developed a bit of an attitude , as in we are the best and the busiest so we don't need to try very hard , or even be friendly to you....... Bad public relations .Staff ...seem to think its ok to chitty chatty amongst themselves at every given opportunity ...hey ladies we DO NOT WANT TO LISTEN ABOUT YOUR PERSONAL PROBLEMS OR LIFE BEING DISCUSSED WITH OTHER SPA ATTENDANTS over my body .STAFF ... PLEASE , we have paid a lot of money for this treatment , because it is supposed to be the BEST SPA in town .... can you realise this ?. Now OWNERS , you have a captured audience here , we the traveller who wants to experience the real Morocco wants to indulge ourselves in a wonderful treatment ,we come to marrakech thinking we will get the best treatment here. but do we want to be attended by ladies who have little time for us and would rather gossip than work ? , or rather text message on their mobile phones at every opportunity ...NO ... its disgraceful . Spa attendants should be there for us , TOTALLY ... they should be welcoming and proficient , if you are dealing with undisciplined workers , sack them , or supervise them until they learn proper protocol. As a client of your spa I felt totally ripped off , simply because no one was interested in serving me properly , but you were all very interested in my money and a tip . I know the girls are local and Arab , so in their culture such a habit is not considered bad , but us westerners don't tolerate such things , not for the price you charge especially . If I had not have already paid up front I might have refused to pay ...although the treatment could not be considered bad ..( but also not the best ) .I am just not up for being treated as if a mobile phone and gossip with another staff member was more important than me. SORRY LES BAINS DE MARRAKECH ..I WILL TRY ANOTHER SPA NEXT TIME AND WONT BE BACK ...BECAUSE YOU OWNERS NEED TO TAKE CONTROL , NOT JUST KEEP YOUR HAND OUT FOR THE MONEY . It looks very much like you think you have it made and you don't need to try anymore ..........THINK OF TOMORROW you people , a bad word goes around faster than a good one.

Only place I wanted to tip in Marrakech but wasn't even asked!. This place was beyond amazing. It should be in the top ten places to visit in Marrakech. The prices are extremely reasonable considering the level of service and relaxation. My girlfriend and I enjoyed a Hammam, massage and bath and each one of them exceeded our expectations. We were treated to mint tea and cookies twice during our experience and at the end the price was exactly what was posted. No hidden fees and they didn't even ask for tips. I've never been to a massage or spa that didn't ask for a tip and of all places, I was certain that in Marrakech they would try to add a large tip to the final price. That was just the icing on the cake of an amazing experience. I would absolutely go again (and might go again before we leave town)! There are nice lockers and changing/shower rooms.

Sophisticated modern hamman.. Booked a traditional hamman and relaxing massage with my daughter during our trip to Marrakech. Modern hamman with a traditional twist. Beautifully decorated rooms, cosy steam rooms for two. Professional and well dressed staff. The black soap , scrub and steam were excellent and the hour massage was the best I've ever had. Beautifully clean towels and gowns and flip flops supplied. Good changing facilities and good showers.Would I recommend this hamman?? Yes, definately. It is for tourists but most enjoyable.

Burned skin after hot stone massage. This spa was highly recommended by the riad. The welcome, first of all, was a bit unfriendly. Fake smiles. We crossed several darks rooms (could almost see nothing). I had booked a hotstone massage for me and my friend. Although I had asked to put us together in one room, we were seperated. My massage was great. The one of my friend however was too hot. She complained about the stones and her back. When she turned her back to me I noticed big parts of the skin of her back were burned (2nd degree). When we mentioned this to one of the ladies they tried to relief her with a little bit of cream. That was all. No sorry, no reduction, no extra stuff. In my opinion this spa has become to popular. There will probably much better places in Marrakech. With people who actually like you to be their client.

Nobody answers the phone !. For two days I have been calling and once someone picked up, I was waiting and waiting and eventually the line dropped … and calling again and nobody answers … and the reservation through the web is terrible. So it might be worthwhile but the customer experience prior to the experience is terrible ! Result: they are fully booked and I can't go.

Lovely spa. We booked for a massage . This is a very popular and busy place . Booking essential . Lovely experience . Quite expensive . You will not be disappointed , but try a raid style hammam also as a good one will be better value than this .

Very good + excellent environment . This place is a proper spa, relaxing and fairly upmarket surrounding la with good spa treatments. Slight conveyor belt feeling with large numbers coming through but a big place well staffed.

Almost heaven. My husband and I had a couples massage and hammam,which was really lovely.The best part was the Massage,the therapists were really good.The hammam bit was a bit rushed but still very nice.Price "fantastic "A must for when in Marrakech.

Very beautiful but also quite rushed. We booked a couples steam, scrub, mask and massage, so we would be together. We were led to a really nice room for the steaming, the ladies were quite abrupt and brisk. After having the ghassoul mask applied, we were very hurriedly showered and rushed out of the room, we needed longer to get clean and I kept find areas of mask! From there, we had 10 mins relaxing on some loungers and mint tea was served which was way too sweet. Then we were taken for our massage which was nice. For me it was ok, for my partner it wasn't strong enough, but he should have asked for it to be firmer - it was just a rub in of the oil. After the massage we were taken to another relaxation area, I asked for water but this didn't arrive, so I had to go and find some. The places is a maze of corridors and it took some time to find someone to help. Maybe it was a language issue, and this place has the potential to be amazing, but they just need to be a little more communicative. It was a very nice treat though.
Relaxing. Lovely relaxing spot in the heart of the medina. Worth an hour or two at least. Came out feeling really clean and refreshed.

So dissapointed.. Booked this place as a surprise for my girlfriend. On arrival we were not made to feel very welcomed and we were not advised on what our treatments entailed, just led from room to room. We had completely different spa packages yet we shared the exact same treatments from start to finish.Masseuse was tired, yawning and laughing amongst each other. There was special experience to be had here, just a money farm. Hygeine was not high in this establishment either.Would never recommend.T & S

Interesting experience. I came her for a relaxing afternoon with my partner, I was having a Hammam and massage and he was having just a massage. We arrived early so we were shown to the pool area, sadly there was no sun here so it was cold. There was a language barrier so neither of us knew what was going on at any point, we were just shepherded into different rooms and left, at one point I was left in a room to relax with mint tea which was lovely but it was next to the staff break area - not so lovely. Both our massages were wonderful, my partner was left for ages with no idea what to do or where I was so got dressed and waited in reception for me, when my massage was over I was told that my husband was finished and I must leave. I guess that was more the language barrier rather than rudeness though. Otherwise a good afternoon, don't recommend walking straight into jeem el fna afterwards tho ;)

Day Trip. We went on a Day Trip, it's a very early start as we had to travel from Agadir. We left at 6:30 am, the coach was quite cold as the air con was on, but that I'm sure you could ask the driver to turn off. After a couple of hours we stopped at a fuel station, there you can eat, drink and use the loo. The prices are ok, no dearer than uk and the facilities are clean.There is a lot of walking when you get to Marrakech so wear comfy shoes and they also suggest that ladies have their shoulders and knees covered. You go to the Mosque, outside are public toilets, if you need to use them be prepared....the smell is awful, you hover over a hole in the floor, there are plastic footprints either side so you can perfect your aim! Lol. Take tissue with you, they charge for toilet roll. You visit the Souk, it's amazing but keep you wits about you, scooters drive at you, it's up to you to move! We were taken to Dar Essalam for lunch, this was very nice. You are given free time at the Souk for shopping then early evening meal before departing back to Agadir. There is so much to see, including Snake Charmers..it is a long day but well worth it.

First Hammam ever.. Beautiful building easy to find by The Saadian Tombs. We went for The Traditional One. Scrub, body mask and massage.We were there for over 2 hours and although there was a language barrier with the staff, we managed to understand each other! They were all very friendly and our masseurs were excellent with good pressure. The head massage was wonderful.

Beautiful hammam. Very clean and comfortable, couple rooms, great massage. The scrub could be better (it was quite short - we had a much better one in Istanbul) , but all in all it was a very nice experience. Very relaxing!

Seduced by decor - room for improvement. I chose to have an indulgent afternoon at Les Bains after glowing reviews in several well regarded luxury travel magazines. The interior is absolutely exquisite and luxurious. I had the "traditional face & body" package which consisted of hamman + scrub, 1 hr draining massage & 1 hr purifying facial. The steam room was small but lovely and intimate and the therapist was great. The massage was not bad (therapist had good technique but it felt like a skin polish even after having asked for firmer pressure). The facial consisted of about 10 different types of masks and scrubs (no steam or extraction). My skin felt great afterwards but it would've been nice to be told what was being done and what products were being used.Overall, for the amount they charged which is somewhere north of average but certainly not expensive, the experience was okay. The staff could do with some more training in service delivery (i could hear therapists chatting in a nearby staff area throughout my first treatment which was a mood killer). I was also left alone for about 15-20 minutes between treatments, not knowing what was going on and whether someone would come back to fetch me. After the treatments, i was pointed to the stairs and bid farewell with simply "bye bye" - the place was dark and massive, with a labyrinth of corridors. Massage therapists should also be taught as a rule of thumb to ask clients re pressure and general comfort level - they tend to forget when you are lying naked on a bed covered in oil with the aircon running, it can get rather cold (i had to ask for extra towels).Recommendation - it would've been nice to have a few more amenities in the bathroom for post treatment i.e. face/body moisturiser (what better way than to promote and flog their own products) and comb/brush for doing your hair. Tip - if travelling during summer months, take your bathers as there is a nice pool to lounge by.

Avoid! Go to Hammam de la Rose instead!. My wife and I decided to visit Les Bains in October 2014 based on positive reviews it received from TripAdvisor and other websites. We were fortunate enough to visit Hammam de la Rose two days before and it was truly excellent. For the same price, you will get a much better Hammam experience in a nice, modern setting with friendly and knowledgeable staff. The massage there was also very good and very firm (as requested). Les Bains by comparison was shockingly bad. The Hammam took place in a room that was not particularly atmospheric or comforting. And the massage was by far the worst massage that my wife and I have ever had. It was so bad that we actually laughed during our couples massage as it felt more like a moisturising session than a deep tissue massage. The masseuses chatted to each other during our massage which didn't help the mood. They also spent a good portion of the massage stroking our hair and patting our feet, whilst digging their uncut nails into our skin when attempting to massage our backs. My wife and I regularly have massages in London and whenever we go abroad, but this one was so bad that it has prompted me to write my first ever TripAdvisor review. Avoid at all costs, and put your money to work at Hammam de la Rose!

Very nice but not a proper massage. My husband booked in for a Hammam, body scrubs and I had a relaxing massage and he had a draining massage. The ladies in the Hammam part were a little abrupt and no explanation of what was going to happen. Still enjoyable. Plenty of rest periods between stations. Lots of mint tea and cold bottled water. We both found the massages to be 'nice' but not anywhere near what we were hoping for/expecting. More of a light rub with some oil. If you are hoping for an invigorating, deep tissue massage then maybe try elsewhere. Enjoyable day overall.

Beautiful spa but room for improvement. While I enjoyed the spa and massage I feel there is some room for improvement particularly with some of the staff. The receptionist is the first person you meet when you come into Le Bains de Marrakech and I felt she could have been a bit friendlier and more welcoming. Giving your clients a smile would be nice too. Also while we were relaxing in between treatments (scrub/steam) we could hear some of the attendants laughing and making a lot of noise outside in the corridor which spoilt the relaxing ambience. The massage was fantastic and I drifted off to sleep and felt very calm and relaxed at the end. On the whole it is a good place to go to escape the hustle and bustle of Marrakech for a few hours. The décor is amazing and most of the staff were very attentive but there are a couple that definitely need more training in customer care.

Expected a bit more for the price .. Pricey enough even by European standards. Not too difficult to find, a 10 min walk from Jam El Fna. Went for an hour massage and my wife had a pregnancy massage alongside me. My massage was nice, not amazing. The masseuse for my wife didn’t seem to realise she was pregnant (even though booked online in advance) until part way through and had her on her belly for a lot of the massage which is not advisable or comfortable. The facilities are excellent, lovely calm atmosphere. Nice to sit by the pool beforehand. I’d try somewhere else next time.

A little bit of Heaven!. Living in Marrakech, this is my regular hammam venue. There is a sense of calm here, from the moment that you walk through the door. The staff are friendly and attentive, the surroundings luxurious. The exterior pool is an added bonus and wonderful place to relax or swim for a while, ahead of your treatments.Compared to the UK or Europe, the cost of treatments in such luxurious surroundings are amazing value. The regular supplies of bottled water as well as mint tea and cakes are always very welcome.My only complaint is that the relaxation areas directly after the hammam itself are often a little noisy, and this can take away from the relaxing atmosphere and general experience. This is occasionally due to the staff chatting, but is mainly caused by the other clients who are excited after their treatment! Maybe a few polite signs asking you to be conscious of others when talking, may do the trick?All in all, this a wonderful hammam, which I highly recommend. I only wish that I could treat myself every week, rather than every month. If you are coming to Marrakech, do make time to visit les Bains and pamper yourself!

Fantastic Spa Treat. What can I say - a temple of relaxation. Went for the full spa treatment with sports massage. Lovely 1/4 hour relaxing by the outdoor pool with a mint tea, then steam room, wash by a gentle attendant, shower and possibly the most relaxing massage I've ever had. I was even pleasantly light headed at the end. Then another 1/4 hour chilling out with a mint tea before another shower and departure. I loved every minute of it.

Poor standards . I went here a few years ago and had a much more professional experience than I had today!The facilities are great, however the staff need training! The Client care is poor, and they are quite rude. I could hear them joking around in the spa corridors whilst having my Hammam, not at all relaxing. The Hammam was poorly performed and felt rushed. No refreshments were served prior to commencing my treatment or afterwards!I actually couldn't wait to get out of there.Won't be going back.
10/10!. Absolutely amazing! Cannot fault. My partner and I had a 45 minute hammam, scrub, mask, bath and massage and it was truly wonderful. Felt thoroughly looked after throughout.

a fantastic afternoon - a step into magic. We went as a family and had a wonderful afternoon. The staff were attentive and the experience amazing. The mud soak was a little hot but otherwise a pleasurable and very relaxing time. Every request for more water and mint tea was met with prompt service. The hardest part was stepping back out into the hot August afternoon to walk back to the Riad. Well worth every Dh. Note one comment that it was difficult to book ... not my experience at all ... the email response was prompt and my request for a change responded to.

Very fun different experience. .. Fun experience. We went in a group not knowing what to expect. The ambience is very nice. . We started with a scrub, sauna, mud bath. It was fun and reinvigorating. We liked the hammam it was different and worth while. The massage was ok, not very special compared to other massages I have had. Maybe I'm spoiled since we had great massages in other countries, but in general I would say it was average. . If you are going for a different experience you won't be disappointed..

If you have been put off by bad reviews - read this. Before I went I read some reviews and wondered if I should go. I spoke to a local person and was given some really important advice... Rasheed, a local, told us that Hamman's are for locals to undertake their "once a week" wash: Not for tourists; having said this, Les Bains is probably to posh for many locals. So we went. The staff are direct... They say "shower now"... "Turn over now"... Etc but are very professional and very good. The decor is amazing, the experience is fantastic, the massages magical, the atmosphere wonderful. If you like fake Irish bars... Don't go. If you want to experience different cultures, see traditions, feel what locals feel, then this is something you should not miss. No one should have given this less then four stars. We had a traditional hammam and 1hr argan oil massage for £42gbp. We were told by an Irish couple that they had a orange blossom bath which apparently was amazing.

A wonderful afternoon!. We had a wonderful afternoon here...getting out fo the heat and getting to really relax...out of the hubbub of Marrakech. Everyone took very good care of us and we truly enjoyed the experience...it was also great as my husband and I could enjoy this together...a great way to spend some time!

Treat yourself. If you stay for a few days in Marrakesh, treat yourself and book a "formule" treatment in Les Bains de Marrakesh. Hammam gommage, massage drainant and anti age facial. Worth every dirham and much cheaper and better than in the luxury hotels of the city.

A MUST when visiting Marrakech!. The spa is such a nice break from the overwhelming city! The building is beautiful and truly luxurious. The hammam and massage were excellent, and you get breaks for water/tea/cookies, etc. Highly recommend it!

Gorgeous. Absolutely gorgeous spa. My husband and I booked a traditional package including Hammam with black soap scrub and and ghassoul mask followed by an hour-long massage. We came early and were able to enjoy their nice pool for about 30 minutes before our treatment. The decor is beautiful, the services top-notch. All that for a fraction of the cost you'd pay in Europe or the US. Sure, you can go to cheaper, more "local" places (there are hundreds of Hammams in Marrakesh) but why not splurge if you can? This was just what the doctor ordered after a long, early flight to counter the jetlag.

A wonderful experience to share with your loved one!. My girlfriend booked the traditional package, which included a 45 minute hammam, followed by a one hour relaxing massage, for my birthday.At the beginning we were both slightly apprehensive as we were waiting by the swimming pool, but the staff there are very friendly and welcoming, and they showed us in the right direction. The hammam was such a wonderful experience- I cannot really describe it, and the massage was perfect, just what we needed! In between the hammam and the massage, we had some delicious mint tea. The decor inside was beautiful, and we did not need to wait very long at all.The price was a bargain in comparison to what you get!The whole experience was a once-in-a-lifetime, and we definitely recommend it.

Very relaxing time. My wife and I took a city break to Marrakech to take in some culture and sights. We decided to indulge in a spa afternoon and had a great time here. Plenty of mint tea and very peaceful. We went off-season so it wasn't busy at all, there were a handful of other people enjoying the services on offer. The scrub down with mud, the rose baths, the massage were all great. I miss it. Marrakech is a great destination and this spa is worth a visit.

Professional. My only issue with this spa was the difficulties in booking! I had to practically harass by email to confirm as communication would simply break down at essential parts which was very frustrating. I had started looking elsewhere when it finally all worked out.However upon arrival I was not disappointed. The decor etc was divine, it was clean, staff were professional. It was just a lovely ambience. My partner and I had a lovely relaxing break from the mania of the streets of Marrakech. We opted for the traditional hammam and massage. Although the hammam was maybe not our thing, it was no fault of the staff - it just felt to us a bit of an endurance test! We were gasping for water and praying to be let out by the end.The massage was relaxing, as described. I'd go back for sure.

Relaxing spa in the middle of busy Marrakech. Les Bains de Marrakech was calm and quiet from the minute we walked through the doors. It was a beautiful place, inside and out. We opted for 'the Traditional One' treatment, a 45 minute hammam and a one hour massage. It was mine and my partner's first hammam and massage and we definitely weren't disappointed! The staff, despite not speaking much English and us not speaking much French, were very friendly and helpful. The scrubs and oils smelled gorgeous and both parts of my treatment were so relaxing. The day before, we had spent hours on camels and in uncomfortable mini buses, causing aching backs, which our massages fixed no problem. My partner was so relaxed that he fell asleep during his massage! We were served delicious mint tea and biscuits between and after the treatments, which were a nice touch. Would definitely come back here again.

Outstanding relaxing place!!!. Have been here with another 3 girls friends for a full day hammam. It was an amazing relaxing experience. To start with you enter that lovely building & are greeted not only by the lovely staff but all your senses too...your eyes are delighted with a beautiful décor, then the lovely smells of incenses then your skin is welcomed by a fantastic pool where you sun bath, relax & swim. All gorgeous. After a good 30-40 min in the amazing pool you go to start the treatments. We were 4 girls & we had the treatments in pairs, which was very convenient so we could enjoy together.We started with the sauna, mask & salt scrub, which made us feel like in a princess steamed room with a marvellous marble décor. Then moved into a relaxing room for a good 15-20 minutes followed by a mint tea. After that went for the 1 hour massage full body which was amazing again...so relaxing. Then you move again into a relaxing room to then finalise with s rose petals covered bath which with all the incenses were just from another world.The staff will not rush you at all...its your day to relax & enjoy it.The only problem I had was to cope with the heat. I passed out after the bath but merely because I struggle to cope with the heat & all activities included heat at some sense.The city was very hot alone, the the sauna & the bath was just too much for me, but its a personal problem of low blood pressure so no fault for the Spa.When I passed out the staff were superb & super helpful. I had a doctor from the spa with me plus the Spa general manager to help me recover. They were just so helpful & attentive. A must go place!!!Just make sure you eat well (but not too much) before your full day of Spa.Loved it!!! We all 4 did!!!

disillusioned. On our arrival at the hamman we were first greeted by a very unfriendly girl at the desk who was not helpful at the slightest, probably a clear sign not to venture any further ! Anyhow we decided to pursue the idea, left a deposit and came back later at the scheduled time. Once shown in the baths there was very little guidance or explanation to how the spa functions. We were basically shuffled into a room lying there without knowing what was going to happen next. After a few minutes a lady came in and I must admit that she was the only person on the premises that at least made an effort to make us feel comfortable. Yet once again no explanation ! The massage was very average and I could tell that the girl who had attained had obviously very little experience. No towels provided for showering and at least a plastic bag could have been offered for the wet swimwear. Of course I understand that its is Ramadan and its probably difficult for the girls to work in such conditions. Makes me wonder whats really going on behind the scenes ! A big disappointed after having really looking forward to something unique !

The perfect hammam, you do need reservation!. I come here a couple of times each year, what a heaven for hammam lovers; gentle and professional staff, 1001 night interior, it is almost addictive! You will come out of Les Bains reborn...

Disappointing. Having visited this spa in 2012 we were really looking forward to an afternoon of pampering,sadly on this occasion we were really disappointed. The welcome was warm and friendly and the surroundings stunning but the staff doing the treatments seemed disinterested. After changing we were taken to the hamans ,cooled down with water and left, it was so hot they we had to open the door, 10 minutes later a lovely lady came in and used a scrub on my niece,another lady then came in a couple of minutes later and started my treatment, she finished mine long before my nieces , after a while this was rinsed off and the mask was slapped on ,hardy spread out and not covering the entire body, they were in and out of the room in a couple of minutes.it all felt very rushed. Once this treatment was finished we were led to a relaxing area where we were given mint tea and bottled water. This would have been lovely but the staff were standing close by talking in very loud voices...not very relaxing ! Our next treatment was the relaxing massage, the room we were taken into was very cold, and it took a while for the ladies to sort themselves out to start the treatment. I must admit the massage was lovely but spoilt buy the constant yawning that we both could hear. Once the massage was finished were were shown to another relaxing room, given tea and left on our own. After 30 minutes no one came in so we changed and left. In summary the decor is beautiful but the staff really let us down on this visit. We will defiantly return to Marrakech but not use this spa again and sadly would not recommend it.
stunning !. Wonderful place ! We had a 4 hands massage, honestly it was my best massage ever !A lovely staff and a very beautiful place ! Definitly the place to be in marrakech

fabulous spa. Serene, beautiful, unrushed hammam and a great place for being totally pampered. I wish we had found this sooner into our visit as we would have gone several times. My husband and I got treatment rooms together. Lots of how soapy water, a nice argan soap wash, (heated stone walls and floor). Lots of time to just unwind. Never hurry on to the next station. 3 hours of treatments (the works) and resting between and after. The massage was adequate. Not "trained/educated/certified" like they are in the US but not bad. Other than that we loved it.I am from the San Francisco Bay Area, where the same sort of thing would have been $350+ and would not have had the gommage available, which I loved (they give you your glove to take with you, nice since I forgot to buy one and ensures no multi-use).I have no idea what others had to complain about. Another reviewer mentioned the staff hardly spoke. I find a chatty staff a distraction when I am trying to relax. They guided by touch. Also this is a Muslim country and these women are working with nearly naked men that are not their husbands, which must be quite a challenge.Definitely worth the price and the time.

Totally overpriced, unless you like to pay for waiting. We had a hammam with body scrub and algae wrap with my friend. We were first ushered to a room and got a couple of buckets of warm water on us. Then we waited for 10-15 minutes, and finally two women came to hurriedly to apply what I might guess was the soap on us. They hardly said anything and then disappeared for another 10 minutes. Finally they came back to perform a 1 minute scrubbing, followed by very hastily applying on us what I might guess was the algae wrap. We ended up massaging the wrap on ourselves and on each other, as it felt like the ladies didn't really do a thorough job and they had again left us to wait.Overall the service received was far from our expectations: the hammam ladies seemed to be very dispassionate about their job and uninterested in their customers. Of the 45 minutes that the hammam experience was supposed to take, we spent 40 minutes waiting for something to happen. The worst rip off in Marrakech in my opinion, to be avoided.

Lovely afteroon, but maybe too expensive for what it was.. We booked ourselves for the Hammam, full body massage and facial, complete pamper, and it was lovely. The Riad it is set in is beautiful it has been decorated to a high standard. the staff were friendly and attentive. But we all felt that we had been to better Hammam, received better massages and facial for the price we paid. As an experience the full package, it was great, if you have more time, ask around and get some other recommendations.

grumpy staff, worst massage ever. We were really looking forward to this and had high hopes given the steep price tag for Marrakech. On arrival we were (not) greeted by some incredibly disinterested staff. This should have warned us. it didn't get any better. except for a lively and friendly person performing the hammam everyone working there was incredibly grumpy and unfriendly. The place is absolutely stunning and beautiful and I enjoyed the hammam but there were too many downsides for thos to make for a good experience. Noone explains anything to you. We weren't asked what massage we wanted and were told we'd be getting the relaxing one. Awful. My masseuses belly was constantly hitting my head for the first half and the only ppl relaxing seemed to have been the masseuses. Constant breaks in between discussions between my massuse and my husband's massuese. What was supposed to be a 1hr relaxing massage consisted barely of light stroking. No towels afterwards to have a shower following a very oily treatment. I really just wanted the whole thing to be over half way through. Spend your money somewhere else where you will be treated well and have a professional doing the massaging. We wish we did.

I love it!. My partner and I did the scrub followed by a massage. This hammam is beautiful, clean, and modern! The scrub was so much fun and a great experience. The massage was also very lovely and relaxing. I found the price point to also be very good value.I would highly recommend this hammam.

mixture of good and bad. This place is somewhat over-rated in my view. Four of us visited the spa. We all went for the traditional hammam-massage combo. There were two types of massage on offer - relaxing and circulation. Despite asking a number of times, the staff were unable to describe the difference between the two. Myself and my wife found the hammam element disappointing. There was one robust lady who oversaw the hammam for the two of us. She was in the room for no more than 5 minutes out of the 40 we spent in the treatment room, though this is fairly normal apparently. She mainly seemed to be in a rush to go outside the room, where she was having an animated chat with a colleague, which took away from the relaxing atmosphere in the room for us. Despite this, she fished quite aggressively for a tip at the end but I was not prepared to tip that type of service.Things improved quite a bit for us in terms of the relaxing message, which was just as described. We were very happy with our massages. That said, one of our friends in the other group was unhappy with the massage, having been left alone in the treatment room for almost 20 mins, which is slack when you pay for a one hour massage.The rooms and facilities here are very attractive but the service seems to be quite variable, which appears to be mainly down to the staff. I wouldn't discount this place but it may also be worth considering alternative options.

Highlight of our trip. After searching many reviews and site this hammam appeared a lot so we figured it was a safe bet. We were not disappointed! We opted for the basic hammam package as we were on a low budget trip but would definitely go back and try some the other treatments. We had not booked before arriving in marrakech but called up from our hotel and got a booking for 6pm that day.Right from the moment you walk off the street you are greeted with the overwhelming feeling of luxury as you walk through the beautiful entrance, and are shown to the equally nice changing rooms. We (my sister and I) were treated in a room with just the two of us by a lovely lady (maybe named Carolin?). Although she did not speak much English and us not much French we were able to communicate ok and it all added to the experience (we found it quite funny). We were washed, lathered and scrubbed before being shown to a private relaxation room where we were offered mint tea and traditional cakes. And we're even given the exfoliation glove used to take home (with the name of hammam on it)It was a great experience and we both thoroughly enjoyed it, even with the communication barriers. All we would recommend is to go before you get sunburnt!!

Good but .... Beautiful spa but does feel like a bit of a conveyer belt being shifted from one area to another-have been here a few times and treatments are always great.however communication could be better -would help if the procedures could be be explained instead of just being left wondering how long it takes.also-the pool.i wouldnt even have been aware there was one on the last visit if it hadnt been for the fact ive been before.we waited for 20 mins in reception for the appt-why not let clients sit outdoors for their treatment, as after you have it you cant use the pool or even sit at it at all.overall though gorgeous.

Poor service; too many people; lazy staff. Visited with my partner in May 2014. Did not enjoy the experience and would not return. The actual facilities are very nice but this place suffers from poor managment and lacklustre staff. Our experience here was akin to a Groupon experience, only without the discount. Pool area was so overfilled that my partner and I could not get loungers.Massages were shoddy at best. The two ladies in our couples room would talk and giggle amongst themselves and also dissapeared from the room for 5-10 minutes twice for no apparent reason. "Relaxation room" was filled with bees. Really just not worth it. Avoid.

Cheap luxury..it does exist!. When we looked at our credit card statements we couldn't believe it. Hammam, one hour massage, tea and little cakes. Brilliant value and so wonderful to be pampered ( we didn't even tie our own gown belts! ) Three grannies on a husband free escape couldn't ask for more. I really recommend this. ( our Riad booked it for us before we arrived, so no problems. )

Cannot fault it - was lovely!. We decided we wanted to experience a Moroccan hamman and came across Les Bains whilst searching the web.We decided to book online, which was hassle free.Our treatments were the hamman with black salt scrub and four hand massage, for three of us. We were shown to the outside pool to relax before our treatments and were surprised to find out that we were being treated together in our own private hamman.The staff were excellent, friendly and the atmosphere was relaxing and very Moroccan. We definitely recommend this place, next time we want to try more treatments.

Yes it's touristy. Visited with my husband and young adult son. As others have said the experience is a little touristy and you do have a bit of of feeling of being herded though. That being said, for less than one third the price we would pay at home it was a pleasant and at times hilarious experience. The spa it self is beautiful. The massages and treatments very good. The look on my sons face when a woman poured water down his shorts was worth every penny.

Luxurious, calm, intimate & sparkling clean. In spite of organizing a huge (and time consuming) party, I decided to do something different for my 40th birthday and headed to Marrakech... I went with a girlfriend of mine to "Les Bains" for wonderful moments of indulgence. I highly recommend this place which is known to be the best in the city. It is known to have hosted numerous French movie stars and artists. The ballet of hostesses guides you through this maze of beautiful corridors and veils hung to the ceiling. Your privacy is respected at all times and you never encounter any other clients except in the relaxing area... You are served chilled water, peppermint tea & patisseries throughout your stay. The General Manager, who personally greets you at the entrance, seems to be on duty 24/7, has an eye to the details and directs his staff to ensure your comfort. Treatments are perfectly executed and, despite the surrounding decor, end up to be much cheaper than in Europe. You definitely feel like royalty and you will keep wonderful recollections of this place for ever. Two last tips : make sure you book well in advance and if you wish to stay in a beautiful & comfortable riad literally next door, I recommend you stay at "Riad Awa", it's 4* and 20 meters away !

Get Some Pampered Relief. My bf and I had prepaid morning appts for traditional hammams and relaxing massages and we arrived right at the appt time, which wasn't a problem. Note that other than the receptionists, there is very little English spoken among the employees here, French was pretty much all we heard. At one point I'm pretty sure it was the owner himself who greeted us in English and gestured us to follow one of the girls towards the massage rooms upstairs.The bath was great, we were in a small stoned, cave-like steam room together but being someone not accustomed to steam rooms, I would recommend not eating very much beforehand otherwise you might feel sick like we did having just eaten breakfast. I thought the scrubbing was tolerable and the attendant asked if it was ok.I knew to expect being led from step-to-step and room-to-room and being left for awhile, and I thought it just added to the relaxed experience.The relaxing massages were exactly that, with sweeping and smoothing type movements. They were very thorough, and I almost fell asleep, so I'd consider that a successful relaxing massage.

Book ahead so as not to be disappointed.... I didn't get to have a massage because they were fully booked for 3 days. I did manage to get a hammam with my friend which was the best £12 spent in Marrakech. Very enjoyable 2 hours and i would definitely return with an advanced booking.

Paradise. The photo does not do the entrance to this blissful spa justice. My husband and I spent several relaxing hours here. On arrival you are provided with a secure locker and escorted to the outdoor pool and general relaxing space before being collected for your treatments.We booked online before travelling (& paid in advance), which made the expereince completely hassle free. We went for a hammam, body exfoliation, clay wrap, followed by a full body massage. All treatments were provided together, for example we had our own hammam, where the therapists came in to provide the treatments. After the hammam, we were led to an indoor relaxation room, provided with water and mint tea and time to chill before the massage.It would highly recommend this expereince, it is worth noting that the staff have limited English, (French is fluently spoken) , but this was no problem whatsoever. I will definitely return the next time I visit Marrakech.
feel like a queen. me and my friends spent one of afternoon here and we had no regrets. yes is maybe a bit more pricey but the service you receive and the quality of the products is just amazing!

amazing, the best massage ever!. Amazing interiors, very nice personnell, superb massage, really the best massage I ever had so far. It is expensive for Moroccan standards, but with 75 Euros you stay there more than 2 hours and really have a very very relaxing and pampering time!Super reccomended!
amazing!!!. One of the best in Marrakech!! Do not miss this authentic experience. Get a black soap hammam and 4 hands massage. Total heaven.

Lovely spa, lovely staff. Had a delightful experience at the spa, we had the package with two massages and a hammam. All of the staff were very professional and friendly and the massages were great. The facilities in general are very nice. It is a quite hard to find but is worth it when you do.

Love, love, love. Have visited les bains many times over many years and just love it. You feel as though you have been taken to another world and are totally indulged both physically and emotionally. I always feel sad to leave and totally exhausted...you float out on a cloud of calmness.

Beautiful and luxurious. My partner and I had a hammam together and then a massage on Friday 25th April. We arrived half an hour before and were led to our changing rooms which are large, clean and like those you would expect in a spa. There are lots of towels and showers with their shower gel in so you can wash down afterwards too. You are given a wristband to open your locker, I felt comfortable that my possessions were secure. Then we were left to sunbathe on sunloungers in a central courtyard around a little swimming pool which was bliss. The hammam itself is quite an experience, we had two women scrub us down, cover us in plant goo (which was a lot nicer than it sounds) and sluice us down with water. I have never been so clean or soft-skinned! Then we were allowed to relax on loungers (inside) with mint tea and water for a while, which was a nice touch. Then we had a massage in the same room which was wonderful. Not a hardcore sports massage, but incredibly relaxing. I thought the whole place was beautifully and luxuriously decorated and well laid-out - there are clearly a lot of people there at any one time but we never felt as if we had been forgotten or part of a conveyor belt. Lovely couple of hours!

Worth a visit after all the walking around. We passed on the more 'local' hamams to spend a bit more at Les Bains and were not disappointed. We signed up for a hamam and massage combo. The place is beautifully done up and run quite professionally. My wife and I had a hamam room where two ladies washed and scrubbed us. With breaks to let the soap, body wrap stuff sink in, this took about 45 minutes. Then we had a 15 min rest with tea and a biscuit before heading to individual massage rooms. The massage was very good and i really enjoyed it. They use argan oil which is made from a local fruit. Then we had a shower back in our respective changing areas. Tip - carry a bag for your wet things.
Probably highlight of our trip!. This is a must. We spent around £70 for a 3.5 hour luxury relaxing experience. I wish we had of tried lots if treatments. Make sure to book.

Luxury. A good compromise between a luxury spa and a public spa. From the moment you walk in there is a calm tranquil atmosphere. We had booked the traditional hammam, which included a steam , scrub and massage. It was a lovely experience. Yes the massage was not as hard or intense and perhaps some others. But I am not keen on deep massages where I feel like my bones are hurting. The massage was as described relaxing.The sauna and scrub was very good.The relaxation in between and at the end was lovely, water , mint tea and pastries.The hammam is clean and the changing rooms regularly cleaned , nice clean fluffy towels , hot water in showers , which were nice and powerful.I would recommend a visit for an indulgent and relaxing spa. The price is more than a public hammam , but worth it for a little bit of luxury, and cheaper than anything in the UK.

Opulent, decadent, self-indulgent!. I should start by saying that, whilst I do like hammans, I've never been that fussed about massages and have had very few in my life, although my wife has had loads. Without doubt the best pure hamman experience I have had was in a public bath in Istanbul. However, this was a close second and the whole experience was probably the most self-indulgent thing I have ever done. My wife and I were looked after together throughout our "traditionelle" package. We started with a rub down and then mud wrap in a lovely steam room, then washed off and into luxuriant robes for a lie down in a large quiet room with a mint tea. Then upstairs for a double massage. I have only ever come out of a massage feeling sore and bruised before. This was amazing - the masseuse seemed to have about eight hands and I finished up by falling asleep! Then back down to the closed "courtyard" of the house for more mint tea in opulent surroundings. We came out after 2 hours feeling wonderfully refreshed and all for approximately £45 per head.

Dropping into Heaven!. It was probably one of the best experiences I've ever had! So relaxing in our beautiful surrounding. I went on a girls holiday and it was the perfect place to go for full on pampering. we first had the ham man treatment, two at a time, and then full body massages. Came out feeling like bliss! will definitely be coming back to Marrakech just to visit Les Bains again!

Disappointing. I was under the impression this was going to be our best spa experience on our 11 day vacation with 12 of my friends. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed. This was the worst massage experience that I have ever had. The lady either fell asleep or thought I was asleep and stop massaging. There were large spans of time where she wasn't touching me at all. One time she stepped out the room. I would have to look up to get her attention and then she would return to the massage.I felt like she didn't want to be there or wasn't interested in me (the customer) have a decent massage.I wish I would have read the negative ratings in advance, I may have still booked my treatment but it now explains the rude response to my dissatisfaction, and I wouldn't have been taken back.
