As you will see on most negative rating they have responded as if it is the customers fault and something is wrong with the customer.I was very disappointed, since I had such high expectations for this spa and the massage.It was nice and clean but that was my only positive.

A little bit of luxury in Marrakech. I visited Les Bains de Marrakech with my wife. I have to say that I was in two minds after reading some of the reviews on trip advisor, but have to say it was absolutely fantastic.We had a hamman in a shared room, followed by the relaxing massage.I was a little nervous at first, having never experienced anything like this before and only being dressed in my skinny minnies! But after a short while I relaxed and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience.It was a bit weird being washed and rubbed down by someone else, but the ladies giving the treatments were completely professional and friendly throughout. They mostly however speak French so communication at times was sketchy (unlike the ladies on reception who spoke excellent English), however we managed with our schoolboy/girl French.It is true that this hamman is aimed at tourists and from what I understand not like a traditional hamman, but the idea of our visit was to enjoy our time together, not spend it in different parts of the building.We were both completely relaxed and glowing afterwards, which was a great end to our stay in Marrakech.If you want a touch of luxury at the end of you stay in Marrakech, book a visit here, I can heartily recommend it.

The ultimate Spa!. I have just returned from an amazing Hamman and massage with my partner. We knew that rain was forecast so we booked in for the afternoon and it didn't disappoint! We arrived to a friendly welcome and tea and then we were both put in a beautiful warm room for the Hamman - where we were scrubbed and masked before then having some more tea and downtime before a fabulous massage! I had read the reviews and had high expectations - it didn't disappoint! I love a spa day and this surpassed anything I have had before so don't leave town without a visit!

fantastic experience. as 2 woman enjoying a relaxing break we found this place perfect.true,we didnt have a clue what was going on half the time and being friends for 25 yrs and being topless together for the first time for 2 and a half hours we thought the experience was hilarious,which wasnt maybe the most relaxing ,but most fun !. we had the sauna type thing and the scrub which is scary as you think you will have no skin left.the comedy factor from laying there in the sauna with the mud pack on with the squelchy noises everytime you move is worth it.the second half which was the massage relaxed the laughter away.im not an experienced spa visitor but my friend was and she had been to some top places that werent as intimate with the massaging but were not such value for money as this one was.worth a visit.

What a treat. We went for the spa day, me and my partner, I didn't think it was expensive at all, where we live, London, just a massage is as expensive as the full experience.We started with a full body scrab and steam, followed by one hour body massage and a super romantic bath, with candle lights and rose petals. We were so pleased. In between treatment we were given tea, water and little sweet. the booking process wasn't so straight forward, they never replied to emails. Over all very happy with the atmosphere, the cost and the treatment. Will love to go again

Lovely spa. I visited this spa with friends and we had the hamman treatment which involved relaxing in a steam room and being washed with a special type of glove. I don't think I've ever felt so clean as afterwards! The building is beautifully decorated with Moroccan decor and everything is very clean. The treatment took place in a room for two people. They asked that we took our bikini tops off, but we kept the bottoms on! The only slightly strange thing was put in a really big shower together as it seemed a bit too close for comfort.After the treatment, you could relax in the spa with biscuits and Moroccan tea. We stayed for ages chatting away and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

You get what you pay for. We booked a day package with hammam, hot stone massage and a relaxation massage. The price was 970 dihram per person. I had read really good reviews about this place so was really expecting a lot, but we had already had some other spa treatments other places so I had a point of reference to spas in Marrakech. The hammam was pretty bad. You get scrubbed, they leave, you get rinsed and moisturised and they leave and each time (3 in total) the room gets hotter. By the last time we were begging for relief. After the hammam they sent us into a nice relaxation room where we got tea before heading into our hot stone massages. We were really happy with this one. Then we had a couples relaxation massage (even though we told them when we booked that we didn't want to be in the same room). My masseuse was yawning the entire time, every once in awhile the two masseuses were talking to each other kind of loudly and giggling. The massages were completely ok, but nothing special. The only one we were crazy about was the hot stone. I would definitely go back to Maison MK and get the hammam/massage package and pay 1400 dihram instead of paying less with one more treatment here. The location is beautiful, completely stunning and it would be much better with better quality massages and hammam.

Never had a massage like it - fab!!!. For the similar price of a standard 50 minute massage in the UK we spent about 4 hours relaxing. There were 4 of us, 2 couples, and we were split into couples and went in to get steamed and get the mud treatment. After that we had a one hour all over massage (and I mean all over, so no inhibitions... I kept my bikini bottoms on but that was it) and then a 25 minute soak in a really relaxing room. Effectivelt had a bath with rose petals but there were just 2 baths in the room and it was quite dark and very relaxing. Loved it. Nothing was a rush and nothing was too much trouble. We had the tonic day spa at 950DM. Please go! You deserve it and will never get anything near it in the UK!!

Fabulous. I was a little unsure about what to expect and very quickly loved every moment. Les Bains is a great escape from the dusty streets of Marrakech and the very many staff are all delightful. The hammam experience was quite something and thankfully I was with a couple of very close friends so we were happy to have our privacy. Felt wonderful after the hammam and then had a draining massage which was every bit as fabulous I could have wished. If you are considering going, though, it helps to know that you should bring either a spare bikini or set of lingerie to wear (it would really help if you had disposable pants so the black paste doesn't ruin any of your own) as you leave Les Bains. I liked that you don't carry any money so there is no expectation for tips at any time. Very relaxing and a lovely half day.
Relaxing treat!. My first time for an hammam.... My husband and I had a duo traditionnel and massage which was an experience not to be missed and Les Bains de Marrakech are especially lovely!

Quite Nice. Worth a trip here if you need to relax and get away from the constant shouts of "better than Sainsburys!"Have to say I have experienced some of the best spas/massages in the world in Thailand and this doesn't compare, the women doing the massage didn't really know what they were doing, but still left feeling relaxed and less stressed.We went for the The relaxing bath25 min Oriental bath with salt bath of bitter orange +1h relaxing body massage which was fine, there was a bit of a wait and sometimes we felt like we had been forgotten about but it was still a reasonably nice way to spend a couple of hours.

Beautiful experience, surely I'll be back.. Having read through the previous negative reviews I can't help but wonder where all this people have been, because surely wasn't the same establishment.Since you arrive, you receive an exquisite and warm welcome. The hamman, although is not the most rustic or traditional one, is superbly performed. The relaxing intervals are filled with a very chilling atmosphere, drinks and even local cakes. I found the staff very helpful and even though most of the masseur don't speak English ( If I want an English speaker one, I'll stay at home) are very professional and lively always trying to make you feel comfortable. In overall an amazing experience. I might even repeat before I leave.

It is ok - not authentic. Came here as it has been voted best Hammam. I thought it was ok; I wanted something more rustic, this is definately geared to tourists. I like the old style hammans. This certainly isnt that.They don't explain what will happen and you are left alone in rooms not knowing what is going on - they need to talk through the process with customers. I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking for a traditional style hammam.

Wonderful experience. I would agree with previous reviews that the service providers do not speak English and that they leave you in the room without instructions. Since I had read the reviews prior to going I knew what to expect. It was a wonderful experience, but wish I had done more services. I only did the hammam. Be prepared to be topless in the service room which was a private room for my friend and I. Would I go again? Absolutely and would do more services like massage and wrap.

Factory. Hammam factory for tourists. Very quick gommage. After that we had a massage. My masseuse listened to her own music with her in-ear phones, and just rubbed a bit. I've had better massages...And what a pity that i was'nt allowed to swim in the pool. Very nice decor though. Interesting that couples get their gommage treatment together.

5* Experience at fraction of UK cost. Read the rest of the reviews on TA for Les Bains de Marrakech - they are all true. I had my hammam and relaxing body massage 3 days ago and I am still floating. Too relaxed to leave a long review! Book in advance, take swimwear, don't have any concrete plans for the evening (you may want to just have dinner in your riad and sleep!) and obviously - ENJOY. I had an amazing time.

What an experience. Loved it!. On the recommendation of "Abdulah", our friendly Taxi driver, we booked a "Traditional" package (580 MAD each) for our last day before we travelled, so that we would be completely zenned out for the flight home. By gum, it worked.. We woke up once for a cup of tea, and then again when we landed at Stansted.This was my first ever experience of a Hamman, so I hadn't a clue what to expect. The other reviewers on here (Thanks all) had done such a good job though, that I thought it worth trying. It was something else. We got a really secure locker each for our stuff, a white towelling robe and some slippers in the correct size, before being shown into a lovely hot (marbled) bathroom with comfy benches on two sides. I've not been washed all over by someone else for forty five years, so it was a bit weird at first but once I relaxed, stopped giggling and just let it happen, all was well. The exfoliating scrub was great (they give you the glove as a gift when you leave) and the mud coating was a novel experience. After twenty minutes at regulo 4, we were showered and shown through to the massage room, where my partner and I were both given the "Relaxation" massage. Legs, arms, feet, back, chest, head and hands - they chased the tension out with oils and a level of skill that must come from years of training.Les Bains were really good to us both, and this was a most pleasant introduction into the art of Hamman.

Lovely place. 3 of us visited for the traditional hammam, which we had together (they don't leave much on ladies so don't be shy) and was great. A friend and I then had massages, after a nice rest. The massage was good, I kept my bikini bottoms on but my friend was told to remove and put paper undies on (which I thought was hilairious). Then through to another really nice room for a mint tea. The place is beautiful and I really recommend it, just lost marks on the undies...

Amazing! – Relaxing, Beautiful and a great Service.. If you have the luck to go to the Bains de Marrakech during your stay in Morocco do it! My girlfriend and I did the hammam and the duo massage and it was great. The service was amazing, really friendly and they made sure that we had everything we needed. As soon as you enter the establishment you find yourself in a different world, from the tea by the pool to the amazing massages and the relaxing rooms, the environment is amazing and you come out so fresh and relaxed.I highly recommend this establishment to everyone. Compared to many spas I have been too, they really provided a top notch service for a reasonable price and we cannot wait to go back there.

Very elegant but lacking in substance. These baths are very, very chic and stylish from the entrance onwards and I think this is what you pay for in the price....The decor of the baths is traditional dark polished plaster walls, silk drapes, beautiful tiles and hand made lanterns with relaxing music and slim, pretty Marrakechis to guide you around the seductively lit rabbit warren of the baths. This is a Marrakech hammam that is definitely catering to luxury European tastes.You will only need to bring your own bathing costume for treatments and everything is kept in an electronic safe locker for which you always have the key to around your wrist. You'll need to book a couple of days in advance, even in low season as it is extremely popular with European and American tourists.I had the traditional wash and scrub (with gommage) and a relaxing argan oil massage. Total time was for 1.5 hours and cost me about £60. "Bargain" you think......The hammam room itself was large enough for 3 to lie in their own area but unlike in a Turkish hammam, you lie on cushioned beds not on the marble itself, so the heat can't get to your muscles as it should which is a great shame. The washing and scrubbing was minimal with a quick 'wax on, wax off' style and nowhere near as thorough as those in Turkey, so the hammam part was a big disappointment for me.Just as the heat was nicely building up it was time to shower off and be taken to a rest room to relax on luxury couches sipping hot mint tea and bottles of water. This room was far to cool for me and we seemed to be there a bit too long before being led upstairs to the massage room.The massage I chose was 'relaxing' as having received 'relaxing' massages before in Turkey (only to be thoroughly worked over) I thought this would be more than enough for my tired, aching legs and shoulders. I soon wished I'd picked a deeper massage from the menu as this was far to mild and gentle and I needed something more intense for my aches and pains. My partner had a lymphatic draining massage and said it was the best he had ever had, so maybe he made a better choice than myself!At the end of the session we were led the another, larger relaxing area which is the courtyard in the centre of the baths, showing that this was once a large and plush Riad in the Kasbah area.More tea, water and little Morrocan biscuits are provided and once you have made your way back to the changing rooms to dress, you are shown to the exit lobby to settle your bill and maybe purchase some of the treatment products they use. I thought these were a little pricey and you can get much cheaper and equally excellent lotions and potions in the shops and markets in town.Leaving the baths you find yourself coming out of a plain back door into an alleyway, no graces or smart exit, but follow the path and you come back again to front entrance so you can find your bearings.Overall, Bains de Marrakech is a luxury pampering experience at article that would normally be much higher in Europe or the US, but if you want to experience a proper hammam scrub treatment and a good, quality massage I would try a more traditional hammam in Marrakech that the locals can recommend (or stick to the ones in Turkey). I have heard one called 'Ziani' in Marrakech about 5 minutes walk away just up from the Bahaii Palace is very well reviewed.......

Very relaxing. Very nice indeed. Good value for money and left feeling very chilled. The basic Hammam was well worth the time. The treatment itself lasted about an hour but you won't be rushed to leave afterwards. Enjoy!

Try the four hand massage. We were recommended this Hammam though our Riad owner afterwards said we could have gone somewhere just as good which wasn't overpriced. We booked in advance before our holiday and the process was very easy. The staff were professional though not particularly 'friendly'. The surroundings were very relaxing and beautiful. It would have been nice to have the process explained to you but I think the language barrier prevented this. My partner and I had opted for the hammam, scrub and black soap with four hand massage to follow. This was a totally relaxing and authentic experience. The scrub was invigorating and the four hand massage bliss. The only thing was we were abandoned in the relaxation room afterwards for an hour, no one came to collect us and we had no idea how to get back to the changing room. We got rather cold by the end of it and tried to find where to go, also they don't tell you that you aren't supposed to leave through the reception area. They also didn't tell you where the toilets were, there were none in the changing room.

Very disappointing. We attended the spa on the 18th December as we were interested in experiencing a special Hammam experience and a relaxing massage after a long day exploring.On arrival the staff weren't very friendly and we found the whole experience most of the staff were extremely unprofessional and constantly giggling and making jokes between them all.The Hammam was a waste of money and time with no explanation and no English spoken by the ladies who could barely communicate with us to explain what was happening. They weren't very tolerant either and it was basically two minutes of scrubbing and hot water thrown on you and the rest waiting in a room wondering when someone is going to come see you.The waiting time between all the services was very long with no explanation about what happens next.But the worst part of the whole experience was the massage treatment. The lady who was massaging was so disinterested to the point where at one stage I thought she had fallen asleep. she yawned about 50+ times and constantly sniffled and made funny noises in my face. The massage wasn't only the worst massage I have ever had in my life but made me feel extremely uncomfortable.At the payment desk I let the manager know about the experience and she didn't charge me for the massage only the hammam. But it was a long waste of our time and overpriced.It feels like a mass factory and the workers have little care or passion for what they do.I wouldn't recommend this experience to anyone. Not even If it was free.

Great hammam - beautiful spa. My friend and I had been in Marrakech for 4 days and on our last day wanted to have a relaxing hammam to complete our north African experience. Les bains de Marrakech had been recommended by friends and by our guide books so we thought we would give it a try. We realised it would not be as authentic as a more local hammam but as we were not sure about hammam etiquette we chose to go for somewhere were they were more used to tourists. We were not disappointed! As we only had one hour to spare we chose the hammam followed by a scrub and a mask. It was lovely - really relaxing and a beautiful environment. We had been told that it was very expensive which it was compared to the more local hammams - but very reasonable for UK standards. Would highly recommend.
Best hammam in the world?.. Possibly.. Very relaxing hammam, great massage and friendly staff. Highly recommended place to visit in Marrakech.

I only wish I spoke French....... I have never had a hamman before so needless to say I was a little ignorant on the process, however I can only say that the four and a half hours we spent at Les Bains De Marrakech were some of the best hours I've had this year!It was only ten minutes prior to our booking that I looked at the reviews on here and realised I would be topless for the entire session.... eek! Something that I quickly got used to but was a little embarrassed with at first!We booked the Relaxing Day Spa session (for 2 people) which included the traditional Hamman, A 25 minute bath filled with salt and bitter orange and a one hour massage (approx £65pp).The hamman itself was amazing! I wish I could speak a bit of French though as a warning I was about to get a face full of water would have been nice but I couldn't have enjoyed it more!After the most intense scrub I have ever received I now feel the softest I have ever felt and I am seriously considering a yearly visit....We went as a couple and there was only ever the two of us in the rooms and it was certainly relaxing. The bath was nice and so was the massage but it was the Hamman I would recommend!My only complaint would have to be the staff on the desk! They were quite rude and unapproachable the evening before when we went to book, and only started to be nice once we had given them a huge deposit.Also slightly disappointed that we weren't given access to the pool area, although it was locked off and empty out there so we wondered if it was a seasonal area? However it wouldn't put us off attending again, however next time maybe just for a hamman because that was the real experience!

" A very DISAPPOINTING experience to say the least ". We booked a hammam and massage for 4 of us in our group and chose Les Bains as it came very very highly recommended by our Riad owners. We had 2 elderly mums with us and for all of us it was a first time hamman experience so we weren't entirely sure of what to expect apart from what we had been told by our riad owners.There was no clear direction from the time we walked in, like a lot of the other reviewers state, you are led from room to room without any explanation of what it entails. But it wasn't that which was so disappointing for us, after the hamman, which was in a communal room, we were led to a room to relax and have a drink of water and mint tea before being taken to individual cubicles for our massage. During our hour long massage, all 4 of our therapists left the cubicles every 15 minutes and got together outside and we could hear them laughing and giggling away. Not being an expert on these treatments, what I do know is that while you are having a massage it has to be uninterrupted and flow smoothly for the duration. One of the therapists was soooo rude that she even asked one of our elderly mums who is in her mid sixties if she had a baby in her tummy..... that I think was completely out of order and not the behaviour that you would expect from the staff of such a professional and reputable place.Having told our riad owners about this awful experience, they got in touch with the management of Les Bains and it disgusts me to say that they've had no response of any sort even after a follow up call.So all in all, a very expensive treatment in a very hostile environment. Next time, sure to try one of the cheaper places..

bewildering but lovely!. We booked a hammam and massage for the afternoon of our last day in Marrakesh. It was certainly an experience... My boyfriend and I had the hammam together and did enjoy it though it is a bit weird having a stranger rub soap and mud on your boobs and pour water down your boyfriend's shorts while he is showering!! We were a bit disappointed that we didn't get more time to sit and steam in the hammam, it didn't feel like 45 minutes but then we were in there for 3 hours so it must have been... We both loved the gommage though, where they scrub you hard with an exfoliating glove and all your dead skin comes off in flakes! After the hammam I went for a massage which was very nice and relaxing, not a super deep tissue massage like I would prefer but the masseuse was very good. I has assumed that while I was having the massage my boyfriend would go and get showered and changed and be able to read his book while waiting for me so I was surprised to see him waiting for me in the relaxation room they led me to after the massage, still in his robe, where he'd been waiting for the whole hour! He did say it was a little bewildering how they just led him from room to room with no particular explanation of what was going on, and it is fair to say that we did do a fair bit of sitting around in our robes wondering what was going to happen next... However the decor and surroundings are beautiful and tastefully luxurious, there was always mint tea on hand and the staff were friendly enough. There was definitely the feeling of being part of just a long line of tourists they were processing that day, but I suppose that's to be expected. All in all it was a pleasant and relaxing experience.

Most relaxing 3 hours of my life. This place is simply wonderful! Be sure to opt for the Traditional Hammam followed by 1 hours massage. This was recommended to my friends and I by our Riad and boy, are we glad we booked!First things first, it's worth knowing that you have to do the Hammam topless. If you can be a little bit prudish (like myself) then it's definitely worth having this knowledge upfront - time to prepare yourself! I also read that if you wear a one piece then you have to remove the whole thing..! I was sure to pass this info onto the girls before our visit so we were all equipped with bikini's, protecting at least a little of our modesty..! When you arrive you're taken to the changing room and given a robe and slippers, you change into those and then go and relax by the pool until the girls operating the Hammam are ready for you. Once you're called for your hammam you're taken into a small stone room with heated floors and walls, this is where you have to remove your robe and bikini top, and you'll all be sat on beds facing each other while you're bathed in very warm water. Following that they lay you down and rub a moisturiser all over you - and believe me, they're not shy about it! It's most definitely a new experience..! Or was to me anyway. They'll leave you for a few minutes and when they come back you shower off the moisturiser and they'll rub a scrub into you which they then scrub off with an exfoliating mitt - again, bear in mind this is a very thorough scrub and may well be a new experience for you..! It gets rid of lots of dead skin though, and when they're done you shower again before being covered in mud. After this they leave you for much longer than previously and it does become a bit claustrophobic and steamy after a while, but fear not they come back eventually! You can then shower all the mud off, relish in your lovely new soft skin, re-robe yourself and head to the second holding room feeling slightly better acquainted with your pals (and the hammam girls for that matter..!). In the second holding room you can rehydrate with a bottle of water and relax while the massage girls prepare for you. After a while you'll be lead to your massage (these are carried out in separate rooms to your friends) where you can just completely unwind and enjoy a luscious hour of massage. Utter bliss!Following the massage you're taken back to a holding room to meet up with your pals once more, and it would seem that you can relax in here for as long as you'd like. Certainly no-one hurried us out anyway. They serve you mint tea and biscuits while you relax, or in my case try to become slightly less relaxed - I couldn't even string a sentence together I was so blissfully high!The experience is so worth the money, it offers a blissful 3 - 4 hours of calm in an otherwise hectic, bustling city. The only downside is heading back out to the craziness of Marrakech afterwards - it can be quite the shock to the system!

Luxury hammam in beautiful settings. The settings are wonderful, and from the moment you walk towards the spa you can see why they charge a premium price in comparison with the traditional hammams. We chose Les Bains de Marrakech as my boyfriend and I wanted to go to a hammam together, which isn't the norm in the traditional hammams for cultural reasons. Upon arriving, we were given the spa fluffy robes and taken to relax by the outdoor pool with min tea and water before our hammam and gommage session. The hammam and gommage session was an experience! My boyfriend and I weren't entirely sure what to expect, and at one point we were left in the hammam room alone together, not sure if we were meant to dive in and do the treatment ourselves. The ladies weren't very clear about what we should be doing or expect, so this was slightly confusing. The actual hammam and gossage though, was wonderful and we both came out feeling the cleanest we've ever been! A nice touch that you get to take away the exfoliating mitt when the session is over, to continue the tradition at home. Originally we hadn't booked for a massage, but we asked after our hammam and the staff were able to cater for us with just over an hour wait. We passed this time by the poolside once more (which is absolutely freezing, so this time is more often used purely for sunbathing it would seem!) with more mint tea. We had our hour-long massages in separate rooms, as they have male and female masseurs. Whilst it was a very relaxing, all-body massage, it didn't unfortunately get rid of the knots in my back as the masseuse didn't use a lot of pressure - if I went again I'd ask for a firmer massage up front. The whole experience cost us around £50 each, which considering the prices we would pay in the UK we felt to be very good value for money, for a relaxing day.

Excellent spa. Serene ambience which makes you relax the minute you step in. The hamam is wonderful - hot but not overpowering stuffy. We had a mud wrap followed by a scrub then an hour massage. Bliss, bliss, bliss. My skin did feel a lot smoother and would go back to Marrakech even just for a weekend of this!

What a treat!. I read a few reviews of the traditional Moroccan hammam and decided I would like to have the experience. Initially I wanted to visit the Les Bains de Marrakech with my partner though he was poorly, so I went solo.Got an excellent service and got scrubbed and massaged all over. An interesting experience, relaxing and luxurious. I was not sure what to expect inside, though it looked like they offer a lot of various services, have a pool outdoors area and I would have loved spending more time there.The only difficulty was that I do not speak French or Arabic and felt a bit stressed as I was not sure what to do and where to go. I always had a member of staff taking me from one place to another, so that was helpful.I would suggest reading up on the services, so that you can choose the best and use the spa for longer as it is so beautiful that spending a day there with a few treatments should be lush experience.

Genuine Morrocan luxury - fantastic value. Visited with my husband in september. Beautiful decor, attentive but not overbearing staff, expertly organised. We paid 58€ for a hammam and full body massage. Was excellent value. We spent 3 hrs there - felt like the best spa day I'd ever been to! Massage had together was wonderful. Lots of attention to detail in treatments and the venue. Would absolutely recommend it 100%. Felt like a real morrocan luxury experience at amazing price.

Massage was great. I was recommended two bains by my Riad, and in a decadent holiday mood I decided to try both! Les bains is obviously a professional establishment, it is very large and there has been a lot of attention to design from the way you move around the building, to the fittings. It truly is a beautiful spaceHowever I felt a little like a number, being herded in and out on a time schedule which given the size, probably is to be expected. The package was for 100 minutes or so but I was there for over 3 hours to stay in time with all the other guests. I had the draining scrub & massage, the scrub was underwhelming (rushed, left in the steam room too long) but the massage was excellent. If you are looking for a personal , more intimate experience one of the smaller hammams may be better for you but if you need a killer massage then this is the place to go.
PARADISE!!. Fabulous from start to finish, I was alone ain my thoughts and had enough Mint tea to sink a ship, the scrub was legendary and the Massage was fabulous, would go back in a heartbeat!

Its a place you want to come back to!. Its a great place, the atmosphere is great the service is good and yo can relax! if you do go make reservations for the hammam! its a great experience and the massages are great! but do book in advance if you are going on high season! we went once and returned for a second time during our vacations! we loved it!!!

Disappointing.... This place is beautifully designed, offers a wonderful plunge pool and plenty of nice touches like aromatherapy oil scented relaxation rooms, mint tea and tiny biscuits but this is not why you go to a hammam and this is where the problems start - after being put in the steam room we were left for 10 minutes (I went with my husband) then two silent and surly women came in threw water on us, slapped on some soap and then left again - this took all of 30 seconds. They returned after another ten minutes, threw more water, scrubbed us and left us again. A pattern was emerging...after another ten minutes the silent duo reappeared and did their thing with the buckets of water and slathered on some other stuff (we didn't care by this point) and yes, you guessed it, left us for ten minutes. Fed up, with stinging eyes, and no idea what the hell was going on we got up and left the room in search of towels and showers. The silent pair reappeared as if by magic and, hilariously, managed to speak for the first time to tell us their names; I can only imagine this was in the hope that we might lose our minds and want to tip them for their utterly disinterested ministrations...After 20 minutes in a pleasant relaxation room we were taken for our massage which was fine if you like being slathered in oil and stroked for an hour. This was not a massage - with no attention being paid to muscles, deep tissue or joints.This is such a shame - the place itself is beautiful, wonderfully atmospheric and with lots of tiny touches that should make it a truly memorable experience; alas the thing you go for - the hammam and massage, are disappointing in the extreme.

Luxurious relaxation. My husband and I booked a traditional Hammam, with an algae wrap followed by a one-hour massage for couples. After a short (albeit hot) walk from the square to Les Bains, we were overjoyed to enter the cool darkness of the spa. We were led to separate dressing rooms and given magnetic locker bracelets. After changing into our swimsuits, we were given thick terry robes and led to lounge chairs by the pool and given a bottle of nice, cold water. Heavenly. After a leisurely swim in the pool, we were asked to follow a woman to our Hammam. We were able to do the Hammam together. The room smelled wonderful and was deliciously steamy. Two girls came in to slather the savon noire on us and they told us to lay back and relax. The same two girls came back 10 minutes later to scrub us with the kessa gloves. (We were given these after the procedure was over.) After that, they applied the algae body mask and we relaxed some more. They poured buckets of warm water over us in between each soaping or scrubbing. When it was all over and we showered off, my skin felt like baby skin. It was wonderful. We were then taken to our duo massage room. It wasn't a deep tissue massage, but it was excellent. Just what we needed. After an hour of bliss, we were taken to a room with incredibly high ceilings and misters. We were given mint tea and cookies and did yet more relaxing. The facility is top-of-the-line. It's clean, beautifully done and the service is extraordinary. I know it's not the kind of Hammam the locals use on a regular basis but I didn't care. Superb experience. Do this. Double your pleasure; do it with your sweetheart!

Simply superb. From start to finish this is without doubt one of the best most proffesional spas we have ever visited. We opted for the Relax day spa treament. We arrived at 9.30am for drinks and relax in the courtyard. We were given fresh clean robes and flipflops. At around 10 am we were led into the steam room. In there we had eucalyptus oil rubbed into our bodies, full body scrub and clay mask. All interspersed between relaxation times. The whole process lasted about 45mins. Very nice. We were then led into another relaxation room where we had drinks. Next came a warm bath of salt and bitter orange. The bath was full of rose petals. This lasted about 30mins. Again relax back in the court yard with fresh orange juice to drink. Finally we went for a full relaxation body massage that lasted 1 hour. Once complete back to a different relaxation room that sprayed fine jets of cooling water. Biscuits and drinks. Wow! The place is fantastically decorated. Everything is kept totally fresh and clean. Really nothing negative to say. The cost was 850Dh per person about £70. Not a lot when you consider we came out at 2pm. Four and half hours! The other thing to note is all our treatments were done together so my wife and I could enjoy the whole experience together. Very nice.

Beyond Expectations!. I came here for the Relax package with 3 girlfriends on a weekend trip to Marrakech. I am fortunate enough to work with some of the best resorts and spas in the world so I didnt expect the spa to have the same standard that I am used to. I was beyond blown away by the experience, service was top notch, facilities were spotless and everything was just amazing. The services started with the 45 minute hammam and black soap scrub. If you have not experienced this before, it may come as a surprise as its a bit abrasive and you have to take your top off. The ladies use buckets of water to rinse you off (similar to what my mother would do with a garden hose when I was a child and played in the mud), followed by a mud wrap that soaks for a softer skin. Once the mud mask is rinsed off, it was time for the oriental bath which was upstairs, the building is huge! Walked into a room that was filled with romantic rose petals and candles and it smelled like heaven! It was the most romantic thing I have ever seen, too bad I was sharing this with a girlfriend instead of a boyfriend! Then on to the massage, also the best massage I have ever had. I loved everything about this everience and so did my friends. Although the package lists times like 45 minute hammam and 1 hour massage, I am pretty sure that all of the services run way longer so you definitely do not get shorted for your money. Although two of my traveling companions had never left the US before and were quite shocked that the services include all areas of the body (no modesty here, it is normal to get your chest and buttocks massaged) they loved it so much they both made another appointment for the next day before we left from our first experience. The staff was fantastic and I would be back in a heartbeat if I could!

A moment of pure pleasure!!. I cannot thank my friends enough for having recommended Les Bains de Marrakech!! I’m not usually a fan of hammams and massages (especially in foreign countries), but I went anyways because my friends assured me it was worth it. First of all, the place is sumptuous. It feels like you’re in a Moroccan riad! It’s clean and the decoration is immaculate.I was wonderfully welcomed and I started off with an hammam. Being rather shy, I loved the fact that the hammam cabins were private! After an exfoliating scrub and ghassoul mask, I felt totally purified, inside and out. Also, thank you to the masseuse who worked wonders! I even fell asleep during the massage.After that, I had delicious, home-made snacks and mint tea in a beautiful resting room. I also can’t not mention the pool and the fresh juice! I’m coming back to Marrakech in beginning October and I’ve already booked a few treatments! A few words of advice if you plan on going: Book in advance! They’re closed in August and they were already full for the month of September, so I had to change my dates.
Heaven. Hamman perfect, staff very nice and the treatment more than expected! The atmosphere great! Not to be missed

Nothing to do with real Moroccan hammam. I work in tourism in Marrakech and have heard from many colleagues that this hammam is the best in the city. My friends from abroad were also very happy with this experience. So I dedided to give it a try.The beginning was really good. Enchanting oriental atmosphere, sensual fragrances, impeccable cleanliness, smiling ladies in Moroccan garments welcoming you. I was taken to the changing rooms, given an electronic key, a bathrobe and slippers, and left there all by my own, without any explanations. I waited for the lady to come and tell me what to do, in the end I had to go and look for her myself and ask her a lot of questions. She promised to show me the swimming pool after I finish my shower, but I ended up wandering through the labyrinth corridors all by myself again. Swimming pool part was good. They graciously allowed my to stay there for 1,5 hr instead of 0,5, because I didn't know about the time change and came early. However, the roaring heavy traffic outside didn't match with the calm atmosphere of the hammam at all. When the time came, I was taken to the hammam itself, again without any explanation. Although they knew that I understand French and Arabic, it's just not their style of work - to communicate with the customer. I was starting to feel as a prisoner or victim that has to follow obediently the orders of the jail keeper.The hammam woman was not gentle with me at all. She quickly made me undress, unceremoniously taking away my stuff from me. Quickly did the savonage, during which she painfully scratched my skin with her nails. When she started gommage, I asked her to do it properly, like in a real Moroccan hammam, so that my old skin goes off. She gave a stupid answer: since you took shower, your skin is clean. As her quick light movements didn't give any effect, I asked her to do it slowly and with force. But she clearly had no idea or experience of how to do gommage. I was just waiting for this terrible experience to end. After that I asked her to let me do my henna body mask by myself (I agreed it with reception before). But she insisted on doing it for me (probably expected some tips??) I was about to start crying, as she covered with henna my nails (that gives them henna colour that stays for a few days, and professional hammam women always avoid it) and even my private parts!! (painful feeling!) Then she ordered me to go to shower where I found just shower gel (although I was told that they offer shampoo).She didn't leave me in peace even there, constantly asking behind the door: ca va? ca va? (which probably meant: hurry up, I have a line of clients after you! you will take your long shower at home!) As I went out, she already collected all my stuff and was holding it out to me. My wet swimming suit was unceremoniously put in the pocket of my bathrobe. I was convoyed to the last stage of conveyor: the resting room. Again, without explanations (is it only for women? how long can I stay). Beautiful design, comfortable beds, relaxing music, a cup of mint tea... Unfortunately, I didn't care about it anymore. I just wanted to get out. As I knew it was useless to wait for assistance or attention, I wandered through the labyrinth again, till I finally found a staff member who showed me the way out. It didn't feel like I had hammam at all. Where is that feeling of lightness, cleanliness and rebirth?? A girl at the exit (a different door from the entrance), after my remarks, confessed to me that Moroccans don't come to them to do hammam. And that a real hammam requires time and relaxation. It's a purely touristic place that can make happy only those who have no idea about the real Moroccan hammam.I went out sad and disappointed.... For sure, will never bring my tourists there!

A wasted opportunity. Les Bains de Marrakech was something of a disappointment. We booked for a traditional Hammam followed by a massage and this should have been a great experience. It wasn't.The set up and on line information do a great job of selling the place, but the actual experience was really disappointing. The receptionist was not particularly friendly or welcoming. Some of the staff just looked thoroughly miserable and the treatments themselves were a long way short of what we would expect for the cost.The Hammam itself was done in a perfunctory and half-hearted manner and the massage was really poor.I got the impression that the whole experience was geared towards getting as many tourists through the doors as possible and charging them over the top prices for low quality service. I left feeling disappointed and ripped off.If I was going to Marrakech again I would look to try one of the local Hammams rather than visiting here again.

Must go!. The photos on here really do not do this place justice, visit the website for a better look. It is a clean, relaxing, professional contemporary spa with a morrocan edge in the middle of hustle and bustle of the city, easy to find. The prices are reasonable and much cheaper than what you would pay in the UK. We went here on our last day in Marrakech, my mum had a 1hr massage which she could not fault at all, and I had a hammam and algae wrap. The relaxation areas before and after the treatments are beautiful, and the staff are very friendly and serve mint tea before your treatment and another mint tea and bottle of water afterwards. Reception staff speak good English. I would only say that if you wear contact lenses take them out before your hammam!! Make sure you wear a bikini too. The lockers were secure and dressing gowns and slippers provided. Make sure you buy some of the products afterwards too, they are lovely, and quite reasonable given the quality. You also need to book in advance!

ALL FUR......... This place has certainly been designed well and has a warm modern yet morrocan feel about it. The website is informative and engaging telling you about its owner and what they're trying to achieve.. All commendable and gets you believing into the concept before you get there. You are a informed customer therefore expectant. We booked a tradtional hamam as a couple which was supposed to last 45 mins. At the outset there seemed a dis interest.. Do they not need or want out custom? It seemed quite odd.. We were just left to our own devices chatting amongst ourselves for 15 mins.. Do we just wait here? A brief of what we were paying for and what was going to happen And the benefits of that would not have gone amiss.. This pattern was to follow throughout our time here. Lost in translation this was not.. There are without doubt plenty of able English speakers within the establishment.. That could take 5 mins and explain. Details and care that was absent throughout unfortunately.After a while we were taken to our changing rooms.. Exemplary they were.. Beautifully appointed and told to change to our smalls given a digital key on a wristband and told to leave all electrical devices in the locker. Once we were ready we were taken to the steam room told to relax then a couple of cups of water thrown on us. Ten mins later a woman came in and patted on some savon noir told us to lie on our back and went off. Fifteen minutes she returned and scrubbed each of us down with a mitt for less than a minute and ordered both of us to shower . As I came out she spent 30 seconds rubbing oil on me then we were left to relax. That was basically it! The 45 min experience! Steam room a bit savon noir and a bit of oil thrown in.. The experience was rushed and there seemed a total lack of empathy and care towards us and the experience we were supposed to have. Instead of if being something very personal it was very impersonal and we felt the person giving us the hamam was just going through the motions. For me it was like regressing back to being about 6 when your mother scrubs you down in the bath when you've been playing out too long . Throws a bucket of water on you and gets you out of the shower just as quick.. The feel was more of that than something luxurious that the surroundings thought it demanded.. I don't know maybe we didnt pay enough to warrant that service maybe you need to buy more than just the hamam.. If so why offer it?.. But a friend that used to work in no other than Giorgio Armani once told me the training they were given is to make the person who spends the least money more special or as special as the person who spends the most.. The reason he said .. Today he has bought a belt .. Tomorrow he will be back for a suit/ shirt / etc.. The thinking here was very short term.. And even though we are not going back with things like this news does travel fast..Having had a Turkish version of the hamam which we experienced on a recent visit to Turkey. This was refreshing stimulating and enjoyable everything the Le Bains wasn't. The settings, the decor and surroundings are exemplary but it felt all fur coat and no knickers. The ambience is and should be the added bonus.. The cherry on the cake. More attention communication and care needs to be taken. A more personalised and individual one to one attention approach where at least 15 to 20 mins is taken putting on the oil or whatever might make the difference. I could have been anywhere maybe my local leisure centre for all intents and purposes.. Wasn't much of a experience if the truth be told. I think saunas are widely available throughout most corners of the world including the uk which was what this was interspersed with some random woman chucking a few buckets of water at you every 20 mins.. Must have caught them on the off day.. Maybe....

Perfect break from pounding the streets. Our Riad ordered suggested this and it wasn’t too close – so we walked to the square and took a taxi here for 20 dh (about £1.50). We were advised it was close but that it made an easy journey.Fantastic and a great break after a long day walking the day before.We had the tonic treatment – I’d suggest you book for about 1:30 – we had 2:30 so missed the storks landing at Kosybar, but a must is to have the spa then walk across to Kosybar for a relaxing view as the storks roost along the place walls.Our Riad suggest the club sandwich for lunch - en route – at the hotel Les Jardins de la Koutoubia – which we didn’t have time for so did the following day. If you’ve had your fill of tagines then this is the place to go – great food and an nice pool to laze beside. Actually we loved Riad Meriem but if walking to the square doesn’t appeal then this place may be worth considering staying, if you like a premium European style hotel – but I’d highly recommend Riad Meriem and plan to go back there. If we do, I’d repeat the Les Bain de Marrakech too – whilst my guide books suggested hitting a traditional (public/local) hammam – I got my fix simply having street food in the square after a couple of margaritas in Kosybar and walking back along rue Riad Zitoun Kedim (up-cycle alley to you and me)A perfect day: in summary – day 2 (following a day of lots of walking around the souks)Arrive at hotel Les Jardins de la Koutoubia ca 11 after a troll throug hteh souks and watching the snake charmers in the squareNoon lunch at hotel Les Jardins de la Koutoubia – great club sandwich and cobb saladsTaxi from there to Bab Agnaou / Les Bains de Marrakech – maybe a stoll around the Kasbah (we have a coffee at a roof café opposite the mosque on the rue de la Kasbah and watched a few storksTonic spa treatment Les Bains de MarrakechLeave and stroll to Kosybar – margaritas and stork watchingAmble up rue Riad Zitoun Kedim (up-cycle alley to you and me)Street food at #1 to remove any guilt from the club sandwich / cobb salad earlierHEAVEN.PS – if you’ve buying real saffron (strands) don’t get taken to the nearest place and pay 100dh/gram – 40dh/gram will buy good stuff and 20dh/gram is the cheapest you’ll get.

Great experience. We went here last week for our one year anniversary based on the reviews on here. We had the formule day spa, which took a few hours. We had a really good time but a few things let it done for us. I emailed the company before asking if we need to undress at anytime during the spa they strongly said no. We started the treatments and before I knew she had ripped my costume down and was scrubbing me with another woman watching. Luckily I laughed it off as had an idea from reviews here that I would go topless but thought things would be explained before doing it. Then I needed to shower the clay off and again before I knew it she was rubbing me down very very quickly and at this point she had taken my bottoms off and rubbing my down everywhere!this I didn't like at all. We had an oriental bath which I recommend as it was pure luxury, it was very hot and at some points I had to sit on the edge of the bath but it was absolutely brilliant. The we would goth a room to wait for our next treatment which was nice . Our massage and facial was really good too, probably the best I've had. But the two massage therapists kept giggling and whispering to one another which made us feel uncomfortable. The tea and biscuits they bought round were lovely. The lady I had was called shama, she must have told us about thirty times. ( she was the the lady who gave us the shower) after our facial which was our last treatment, I asked if we could sit by the pool and have a look, I also said piscine aswell as swimming pool just so she understood us, she ignored us and took us to our changing rooms where before knew it we were outside. It is very rushed and it s like a maze in there but the decor is absolutely stunning, very relaxing bar the things I said I just wished we could of sat by the pool rather than being escorted out. We paid over £200for it too and it was a very special day,

Luxurious Afternoon. I booked the "traditional one", hammam and massage. The atmosphere was fantastic, a true respite from the bustle of Marrakech. The staff were kind and the experience was so relaxing. Yes, you're moved around the bulding without too much explaining, but I found the rest periods between treatments added to my relaxation. It was worth every penny, the relaxing massage was one of the best I've ever had. Be prepared, if you do the hammam, you will be scrubbed thouroughly.

Fantastic experience!. My girlfriend and I booked into Les Bains de Marrakech having read all the positive reviews on here, we were not dissappointed. We bath booked The Traditional One and mentioned we were a couple. The decor of the place was beautiful, and after a short wait in reception, we were escorted to the dressing rooms. You do seem to be passed from person to person here, as the other reviews have said, but if you expect it, then it is fine.We were then taken to an outside pool area and brought some lovely fruity drinks and left to bathe for a bit. Into our hammam it was very lovely, we were put in the same room and left to enjoy the experience for a while. Every now and again a women would come in to add to the treatment by adding oil, then a mud like substance, after, scrubbing it all off.Having been left to rest for a bit more in a lovely cool room, we went for a Relaxing massage (same room again). It was so soothing. Even though the massge was a bit gentle for my liking, my girlfriend loved it.Feeling fully pampered, we were lead to another room and served biscuits, water and tea. There was no hurry to leave, so we enjoyed the atmosphere for a while.The only con I can think of is the lack of English-speaking staff, even at a basic level. So prepare your French! Other than that, it was such a lovely experience, and superb value for the money. We were in there for 3.5 hours, and paid around £45 each. Even though there are cheaper places, very few offer this great quality and atmosphere. My advice, go early, enjoy the pool before your treatment!

What a luxurious experience!. My husband and I had 'the traditional one', which was a hammam and one hour massage. It was a sumptuous, relaxing environment and the staff were friendly and very accommodating! This was the best spa experience that we have ever had and we would highly recommend booking a visit if you are going to Marrakech!!

Overall very good. Visited here last week for 'the traditional one', hammam and massage. The experience didn't start well, our hotel had made the booking in their name which was fine, but the staff never bothered to ask ours. We were shown into the changing room but not told what to do next (whether to wait there or go somewhere else), someone did come to collect us. There was an odd system of being passed from one person to another, a man with a clipboard would appear and just hand us over to another person who would show us to the hammam or massage area and leave us with a therapist, we must have met 10 different (nameless) staff members. In the hammam itself we weren't sure what was happening but laughed our way through it. The massage was great and in the end I felt like we'd been there for hours and hours. Left relaxed and happy! Beautiful place, if not a little confusing!

Very pleasant expirience. My partner and I chose this hammam at the recommendations from TripAdvisor and also the rocommendation of our hotel. The entire expirience was very relaxing- wonderful carrot juice by the pool, plenty of time to lounge inbetween treatments and after and we never felt rushed. The facilities were very clean and the staff were friendly and accomodating. Our scrub is the only part of the expirience that seemed sub-par. My partner and I were in a room together but there seemed to be a lot of lag time where we felt like we were waiting around. They spa was not consistent about explaining what the different treatments involved.Other than this, I would highly recommend it! Also, very easy to find!

Poor massage. Les Bains de Marrakech is a relaxing and luxurious spa. However, it disappointed for an essential element: the treatment. I booked a drained massage, which on their website is described as detox, muscular and invigorating. I chose a male masseur. I expected a good, strong massage. The therapist was only gently stroking me, kept me in the air-conditioning with no towels and felt cold, plus he spent more than 10 minutes just touching (not massaging) my head. When I asked him if I could have a stronger massage, he refused and said firmly NO. I complained with the french man (acting as manager) and he just defended himself by saying that a draining massage is not strong. I was wrong and it didn't matter that I wasn't happy with my experience, or that they are misleading clients with their descriptions. I am disappointed with their customer service, especially considering how much they believe to be one of the best (if not best) spa in Marrakech. With the prices charged, they should listen to people rather than challenging them. It's a shame, as my previous visit was fulfilling. Be warned about the draining massage (or the male masseur who is there)!

Eh.... The hammam was fine. A lot of waiting between 'courses' and a fairly cursory scrub. If youre expecting a turkish type hammam with lots of bubbles and scribbing you wont find it here. Massage was fine but the maaseuse had the affect of an american teenager. Not deep tissue if that is what you want. Pool area is nice. Mens showers had no soap or cremes to bathe post oily massage.

Incredibly relaxing and very beautiful. I booked the Traditional One for myself and my girlfriend, consisting of a hamman followed by a one-hour massage. I cannot recommend this enough. Everything was perfect. We were moved to various chill out zones throughout the time we were there, at the perfect moment in every instance - not feeling rushed but before falling asleep! :) Orange juice, mint tea and bottled water was provided, too. Excellent and professional service. Such tranquility when surrounded by the heat and hustle and bustle of Marrakech, too!

Magical experience. We booked based on other reviews. What a fabulous experience. We had the traditional experience and loved every minute. English wasn't everyone's language, however we were gently guided to the right place at the right time. My husband loved it, and spas aren't always his thing. If you have the chance enjoy!

Amazing. Amazing Spa!!We turned up an hour early due and the spa were so accomodating, leading us to relax around the pool with a refreshing drink until our experience was ready to start.All I can say is you must go, stress is just wiped away and the drinks and the little snacks are a lovely touch, no sense of being rushed through and the feeling of all the time in the world.

Really enjoyed the spa. We went as a couple opted for the relax day spa (850 dhs each)and loved it. There was one hour of massage,45 mins of hammam and an oriental bath at the end !The one hour massage was great and our first hammam experience was good as well.Very clean and neat and tastefully decorated -the lighting and the soft music makes you feel like you are in paradise! After the spa you get to relax with some mint tea and sweets ! Water and tea is also provided after the hammam before you go for the massage.The staff are very friendly and although we didn't know the language it wasn't a problem at all -we were guided throughout. They have lockers to secure your items.To add to this,you also have the kasbah cafe around the corner which is brilliant of you want to have a meal overlooking the koutoubia .Will definitely come back.

tried it once. We are not spa people, but we tried a package of massage & hammam at this palce. Seemed like 95% of clients were ladies, and very few men. It is OK, nothing good nothing bad. It was quite expensive though - so had no appeal to do it again.

its good not v.good. i think you have to take the masage along with the hammam, otherwise its nothing special.we had a couple massage/hammam package. we recommend the draining massage. all in all a great place to experience the hammam at marrakech. very nicely decorated, efficient, they even gave a spot discount when booked 2 packages. worth asking for it. nice pastries. will go again if i am there at marrakech.

Nothing special. Was pretty disappointed by this place as I booked a hamman package for my girlfriend and I thinking it would be really nice. The place is pretty but to be fair all that happens is that you go in a dark room, have some buckets of water thrown over you, get rubbed a bit with an abrasive mitt, have oil put on you and then get told to shower it off.Once that's done they direct you to lie down and you get a plate of dry biscuits..... All quite random, was left thinking "is that it?"

A slice of heaven. I have been here many times and it is a slice of heaven I can not recommend this spa enough, I got lost the first time and lots of people will say they know where it is and take you to another spa, get the address and map it's not hard to find

Relaxing afternoon. We visited this lovely spa on our 3 day trip to marrakech in march 2013. It was the first. Time my friend had ever experienced a full body massage and the first time I had ever experienced a hammam. It was an experience to remember! The rooms were all beautiful and the massage amazing.

Heaven. I had the hammam and massage package and what a bargain. For around £40 I spent 2 1/2 hours at Les Bain Des Marrakech and left so relaxed I.The hammam is a great experience, and the whole setup is very clean and impressive. The massage was a bit too soft for my tastes, but then i fell asleep so it certainly was "relaxing" as described. Great tea and biscuits post treatment in the indoor courtyard. It's clear this place runs as a well oiled machine and they have quite a large number of people in the building at any one time. But it never feels cramped or busy.Having visited other hammams after this, I realise how great it is.

Wonderful. Our first Hammam as a couple. The experience was brilliant. We did not know what to expect but the helpful staff talked us through each wonderful relaxing stage. I could not believe that we had spent nearly three hours being cleansed, exfoliated and pampered. The hour long massage was divine. Will certainly go again when we revisit Marrakech.

les Bains de Marrakech. one of the most relaxing days i have had in years. My friend and i were gently led into a cloud of soft music, soft lighting, and smiling staff who soaped scrubbed and massaged away the cares (and grime) of daily life. my french i,m ashamed to say is poor at best but this did not present a problem, as we were escorted from room to room and treatment to treatment and at the end allowed to loiter and chill without any pressure to pay or leave

Has lost it's magic.. What a difference a year makes.... I gave Les Bains a rave review exactly a year ago. Sadly, my recent visit was a major disappointment. Last year, this place was paradise, this year I felt like I was being processed. I booked the same treatment as last year - Hamman, wrap and lymph drainage. It was amazing - last year. This year, I wasn't scrubbed properly, I wasn't packed properly and the Hamman experience which should have lasted an hour was over in 15 minutes. The massage was ok, but I felt like I was being short-changed the whole time. If the management are listening, please talk to your staff. Remind them that the customer is and always should be king, or queen, or princess.....

A wonderful four hours of relaxation and calm. My friend and I booked on line about three weeks before our holiday which was straight forward and at each stage we received a confirmation email. So we had our spa booked for mid way through our week in Marrakech.The cost each was 850 Dirham. For this we steamed first with various scrubs, then had a warm rose petal bath finishing with a massage. Starting at 10:40 and leaving the spa at 15:10.From the moment we entered everyone was pleasant and friendly. The lighting is subdued with relaxing ambient music playing at a low level. They have very good lockers so your belongings are safe and dry with the spa providing the footwear and dressing gowns for you to use. Between each treatment we were given water and freshly squeezed orange juice and then left to relax for a time on wonderful couches in small side rooms before moving on to our next treatment.I was so relaxed by the time our massage started I fell asleep on the table and (much to my friends amusement) started to snore.I am happy that what we paid was a very fair price for the treatment we received and you can put together your own day by the combination of various treatments you pick from the website.

A disappointing treat. Les Bains de Marrakech could be wonderful, but it isn't. The hamman looks sumptuous, but the personal touch is lacking. The changing room feels like it's in the middle of a corridor and despite one of my friends speaking fluent french, no one explained to us where the toilets were, where the towels and showers were and what to expect during our hamman and massage. The hamman treatment verged on unnerving with women entering and leaving our steam room with no explanation of what would follow. There were sharply delivered commands to 'turn over', 'sit up' and 'lie down' and we were left to steam without any idea of how long this would last or even what to do if we wanted to get out. For the massage we were offered either a relaxing or draining treatment. Although my french speaking friend asked specific questoins about the relative pressure applied in the different versions, she got no more information than they were different techniques. We decided on a draining massage and were all disappointed by the lack of pressure. We left feeling that the women working in the hamman were undervalued by the management who were running a spa sausage factory. Although this hamman was cheaper than other up market ones, I strongly advise you to look around for something else.

Beautiful hammam but bit of a conveyor belt. Lovely surroundings and the basic hammam experience with black soap scrub was good. However I did feel that it was a bit of a conveyor belt and, as one of the other reviewers says, that I was rushed out at the end. This is summarised by the sumptuous surroundings on entry, but the plain corridor and basic door leading to a side passage on exit. I would go back, but I'd also try some of the less 'hyped' hammams too.

Lovely surroundings but treatments could be better. I've just returned from Marrakech where I spent two of my five days at two very different hammams, one being the much rated 'Les Bains de Marrakech', the other was 'Medina Spa'. I am a massage therapist to trade so I was interested to discover the Marrakech approach. Les Bains de Marrakech is truly a beautiful place to spend an afternoon and the treatments were good- I had a 45min traditional Moroccan hammam followed by an hours relaxing massage. The treatments were good but are not worth the expense compared to the same set of treatments at the less luxurious/ much less expensive ( but still very clean & pretty )Medina Spa in the heart of the Souk. The difference being the quality of the massage experience and attitude of the hammam girls. It was made very obvious at the end of my massage at Les Bains that my time was up and I wouldn't consider it professional to be making the bed up for the next client while I was still in the room! Neither is it professional for another therapist to enter the room to whisper to her colleague mid massage. The hammam girls at Les Bains were less than gentle let's say and I was starting to become apprehensive each time they entered the room. Medina Spa had none of these shortcomings and the quality of the massage significantly better. Regardless that the Medina Spa was less than half the price of Les Bains, I would definitely choose it over Les Bains time after time.
Not as expected. Beautiful decor and elegant surroundings but the hamman we booked was rushed (about a minute of actual scrubbing for an hour in the place!) and very disappointing.

wonderful experience. This was a great experience - perhaps not for the shy!The staff greeting you are very helpful and explain the procedures, you are given a robe and shoes then taken to a room where you lay on days beds around a fountain and have a glass of mint tea. Then you are taken to a hamman, where, if you are not wearing bikini bottoms you are relieved of your swimsuit, washed down with lukewarm water then left to steam, you are then exfoliated and daubed (head to foot) in a clay mask, and again left to steam. After being washed off you rest, then you have a great massage and more mint tea. You leave feeling relaxed, clean and invigorated. It is wonderful.

Fantastic experience. We chose this Hammam based on its excellent reviews and were not disappointed. It is a traditional spa in a side street in the kasbah region of Marrakech. It smells and looks great and the staff are very friendly.We had the hammam and 1 hour full body massage, what a wonderful experience, the best massage I've ever had. It left us feeling so relaxed and clean.We would return to Marrakech just to come back here.

Simply Amazing. His is by far the best spa I have been to..!From our welcome to the moment we left, I can not for the life of me think of a single bad thing to say...!Plenty of complimentary drinks n delicacies are given to you after every so often. The massage was soooo relaxing, it put me to sleep! What a wonderful place with decor that is stunning, u will feel a million miles away from the hustle and bustle from outside the walls of the spa...! :)p.s, when given a choice of either the relaxing or draining massage...opt for the RELAXING one! You will not be disappointed! Enjoy!

Ooooh this is a must- go!!. The service at this stunning hammam is amazing. Somebody brings you to your locker where you can undress in peace, then the lady brings you to an amazingly beautiful relaxation area where the next lady immediately brings you some tea.... After your treatment another friendly face awaits you to escort you once again to another quiet and beautifully decorated room for another nap and another cup of tea... Everything good you will read about this hammam is true. It is definately worth your dirhams but i only wished that the scrubbing took just a little longer. But i am pretty sure that, had i asked, the lady would have continued but i was too relaxed to open my mouth....!

Wow a must go! Lose yourself in pure pleasure.. I was a bit nervous at first as I had read a few negative comments, I shouldn't have been! I can not compare this to other hamman's as this is my first but comparing this to other spas this would come out on top. I would even go as far to say this is a reason to come back to Marrakech. English speaking gentleman on reception who could not help us enough passing us on to our first Lady in the hamman who spoke very little English but this made the experience all the more enjoyable. Then straight on to the steaming, black soap, scrubbing (vigorously,) mud was then applied to face and body followed by a shower. Next passed to a room to relax. Then came the facial wow I lost count of the products used and time spent on my visage!!The final treatment was the massage don't expect a deep tissue sports massage as this is not the case but a soothing relaxing massage using the finest smelling oils, I think I fell a sleep a few times I just hope I didn't snore.After the massage we were then returned to a central room to relax. I think I sleeped again only to be woken by two song birds flying around the room, it really felt quite surreal!We then had some Moroccan tea and biscuits. We were also not rushed out of the central room but decided to go as we were unsure of the time spent only to be shocked to find out we had spent 4 to 5 hours in the Hamman (maybe I had snoozed more than I thought!)Treat yourself go for the package deal, you will not be disappointed! My only mistake was finding this at the end of my holiday as I would have gone twice!
Heaven. This place is like something from your dreams! Beautiful decor and stunning atmosphere. Treatments to die for and the prices are amazing!

Wow! Beautiful spa, heavenly experience. Amazing place, my husband and I had a traditional ham mam, body scrub and 1 hr massage. So relaxing with wonderful service and friendly staff. The spa is beautiful, a quiet haven with he best of everything around you. Great to have all the treatments in a private cabin with everything clearly explained to us. Fantastic experience, a must have on a trip to Marrakesh.

Total relaxation. This is a fantastic spa!The building is stunningly beautiful inside, certainly reflected by the photos on the website, and the emphasis is on stress-free relaxation.I had the hammam with scrub and a 1 hour massage, my wife had a facial and a massage. We were greeted with delicious mint tea, and enjoyed biscuits and more mint tea to finish whilst relaxing blissfully following our treatments.The flow of the spa is just right, with helpful and friendly staff escorting you between your various treatment rooms.Totally recommended.

One of the best experiences in Marrakech. We reserved a traditional hammam + scrub + 1h massage. The whole spa is amazingly large and beautiful. You could not imagine to find something like this in busy streets of Medina. The atmosphere there is very tranquil and relaxed. I was afraid how to find the place but it was surprisingly easy to find since there was a sign right when we came in from the gate to Medina.I would recommend this to anyone who is visiting Marrakech!

Fantastic Experience. A group of us visited this hammam and all had the "Traditional One Treatment " which was the hammam, mud scrub and an hour full body massage. The spa is gorgeous, very relaxing and totally exceeded our expectations. The treatment was excellent value for money and I would definately recommend a visit to this Spa/hammam.

Blissful spa - very relaxing!. My husband and I booked The Traditional one about a month in advance via email. It was all very easy to arrange and I paid a deposit via Paypal. The staff at Les Bains de Marrakech were pleasant and efficient. We opted to have a private hamman cabin so the two of us could go in together. Just wear bikini bottoms (and shorts for boys!) and they give you a bathrobe and flip flops to wear. You start off with the hamman (steam) - it smells lovely and is nice to have the privacy of the couples cabin. You then get covered in the famous black soap (that they sell on all the apothecary stalls around the city), you have a shower and then the therapists come in and scrub you with a mitt - just on the right side of painful! After this they apply a clay mask and you carry on steaming before a last shower - this part takes about 45 minutes. It was really nice and the eucalyptus scent was very relaxing and cleared our heads.We then relaxed in a lovely room festooned with rose petals before being served some mint tea.The massage was blissful and we were able to have this in the same room too. Lovely oils and a very good massage. Most relaxing after all the walking we had been doing around Marrakech. We then lay in the courtyard room (where there are birds tweeting around) and had some more tea and some Moroccan pastries. The changing facilities are very nice and they have security lockers to keep all your property safe. It's very nice indeed at Les Bains de Marrakech.There are probably cheaper places around town but I liked being able to book in advance and the fact that we could go in together. I don't think my husband would have enjoyed this sort of thing by himself. I would definitely recommend it. And it's in a nice part of town - near Bab Aganou (which is stunning) and the Saadian Tombs - which you should visit before the spa.

Below Par!. Went for a Hammam and one hour massage with my partner. Started with a 45 min hammam- very rushed- quick splash- lay there for 15 mins then a quick 2 min scrub- another splash and a quick polish. Felt like the staff were unhappy to be there The massage overall was ok, better than the hammam. However again the staff were unprofessional- yawning throughout the massage! No relaxing music just silence with a few yawns! I regret going here and spending a hefty amount of money. I was told after there is a place called Heritage Spa which is a lot better.

Very enjoyable. My wife and I went to the Bains de Marrakech for a hamman and massage. The facilities are beautiful, the staff is very professional and you come out of there totally relaxed and ready to make another appointment for the next day... As a matter of fact, my wife and did try to make another appointment (we enjoyed it so much) but they only recommend one hamman per week. If we ever go back to Marrakech, we will definitely be coming back to this place.
