Pure Indulgance. We had a couples Hamman and Massage called the 'Traditional one' and would highly recommend it.Beautiful interior, warm welcome and great treatments. Loose track of time relaxing in this fantastic place while you get scrubbed and massaged. A great way to relax away from the Souks! Only negative was that one of the masseuses was either constantly laughing or had a hacking cough... we couldn't decide which!

An oasis of pampering calm. I booked my boyfriend and I in for the Relaxing One - a traditional black soap scrub, herb mask and massage - for his birthday as a treat. The treatment was excellent, the venue is beautiful and tranquil, very clean and well maintained. The staff were well trained and friendly. We enjoyed it so much that we booked in for the next day as well, for the duo bath and massage, which was also excellent.I will definitely go back next time I.visit Marrakech!

Find calm in a hectic place. We went as 2 couples for a hammam followed by a massage. The staff were always smiling and friendly. We were offered a choice of male or female masseuse which I thought was good. The session began with a private sauna room per couple which we found uncomfortably hot. In our case the masseuse helpfully created a cool breeze for us.We were scrubbed front and back with some kind of salts, though it was much briefer than we all expected. Later was the black soap.The atmosphere from the decor to the lighting, water features and music were all soothing. In our private couples massage room, we were treated to a long session of a soothing massage. We all felt later that we would have appreciated a stronger massage.At various times we were offered mint tea, biscuits and bottled water. The whole experience was very welcomed after the sensory overload from the Medina.

Pleasant Experience. We found Les Bains de Marrakech easily in the Kasbah area of Marrakech. It is approximately a 10 - 15 minute walk from the main square or probably more of a 5 - 10 walk if you are familiar with the area and know the short cuts. (I'd recommend sticking in to the main roads that border the Palace).I had tried to book a treatment that morning via their website for a 4.30pm slot but I didn't receive confirmation by phone or email that the booking had been received. We took the risk and just turned up any way and they said they hadn't received the booking but they had a slot at 4.30pm and 5.3-pm available.I picked the treatment I wanted (A Hamman with body mask and 10 minute massage for 450DHs) and was led to a room to undress and put on a dressing gown and flip flops. They provide you with a locker key on a bracelet at Reception so you can lock your possessions away.I had come prepared by wearing my bikini bottoms and stripped down to just these and put the dressing gown on. I was the led to a dark hot room (more like a cave really) for the treatment. I would say if you are claustrophobic the room the treatment was in may be an issue for you but I found it okay. The women that did my treatment was pleasant and communicated with me using the odd word in English (I don't speak French) and a bit of hand gesturing.I enjoyed the treatment, when it was finished was taken to a shower to wash off the body mask and then led to an area to relax. This area was beautifully laid out and furnished (as all of the areas I passed through were). I was brought mint tea and some pastries whilst I was relaxing.I enjoyed the experience but have to say that as I did it on my own, I think I would have enjoyed it more if I had experienced it along side someone else (I couldn't persuade my partner to join me) Everyone else appeared to be in couples or with friends.If you are thinking about going I would say give it a go, relax in to it, don't worry too much about what is about to happen when / next (I am sure they won't forget about you) and I think you will enjoy it.

Good but it was supposed to be better. Tried the hammam and massage, overall it was good and recommended but i expected more/better for the price paid. The service was polite but felt a bit rushed and a bit like it was some sort of a synchronized assembly line, The massage was nothing special.When we were finished, there were no towels left, then there was no gel in the shower and finally had to ask for a hair dryer.A program for 1h30 took around one hour more due to some waiting between stages (although with nice ambient music, tea/water, etc), keep that in mind if you go.

Did it once and went back for a second treat!. What an absolute treat and a must do in Marrakech. Situated just inside the Medina walls at Bab Agneau all the hustle and bustle of the city is left on the doorstep and you are immersed in a scented reception where everything slows down to the pace of your heart beat, and that gets slower by the minute. We booked a traditional duo (hammam and relaxation massage) for four supposedly lasting two hours. Our session lasted three hours! The staff are superb and the ambience just truly relaxing. It was such a hit that we booked a second visit the next week. The second visit was just as good and paced the same. Individual girls differ in the application of the hammam and the massage but each was delightful, nothing at all to grumble about - not even the price (550 MAD each). I booked the first visit online from the UK and paid a deposit through Paypal. Just wish everyone else was so efficient.

Best spa in my life!. I'm always looking for new places to relax and get a massage. Les Bains de Marrakech wins on all the others. Til you come in, you'll be pampered and accompanied in every time. The staff is always smiling and very friendly. The Turkish bath is a great experience. Take your time to relax and enjoy the music in the background and the mint tea on one of the loungers. Try the massage, too. it's intense and vigorous. At the end you'll feel regenerated and happy. Les Bains de Marrakech is an experience not to be missed!

Spa heaven. I can fully recommend this spa. It was easy to find, I felt very at ease as a woman going on her own. It was very luxurious, treatments were great, especially recommend the hamman. All the staff were lovely.Better than any spa I've been to in uk & much better value!

Amazing Spa experience. This hammam is tucked away just inside the bab agneau gate. It is huge inside with many rooms on many floors. Had the couples private spa day, with hammam, argan oil, ghasoul mask. Then a bath in a huge double bath, followed by an hour long relaxing massage. Wow is all I can say. Top notch.

Brilliant, but needs some customer orientation!. We booked a couples' visit ahead of time, so apart from the changing rooms we were able to spend our time together. You turn up and wait for someone to take you to a changing room, then they come pick you back up. I thought we'd booked the black salt scrub and massage, instead we'd booked the one hour rose bath (in adjoining baths, in a candlelit rose-petal strewn room). Then we had a massage in the same room, beds next to each other and the massages were brilliant. At no point do the staff there actually tell you what's going on - we had no idea when to leave the bath, that we were supposed to ask for paper-based undergarments to change into for the massage (the masseuses we had didn't communicate well, and via sign language some embarrassing mistakes were made!) As others have said, when you're done they take you to a large space to lounge and recover, but they don't tell you that it's up to you then when you want to leave, they don't come back for you. And as others have said, when you shower (there were no towels for drying off) and pay, you then do get chucked out a strange side exit. It's as though you're a post-plastic surgery patient visiting the day after surgery and they don't want you to freak out prospective patients. Les Bains de Marrakech could be a top notch hamman, if only they communicated with people a bit better about what's happening!

Wonderful, relaxing afternoon!. We had a wonderful afternoon at this spa. The decor is stylish and relaxing. The treatments were professional with an unhurried manner. We started off with a 45 minute sauna and a black soap scrub. 25 minute soak in adjoining rose petal strewn hot tubs. 1 hour relaxing massages and a 1 hour facial. We had private relaxation rooms with comfortable loungers between treatments. Highly recommend this spa.

Very good experience.. Very good place. Looks incredibly stylish, very chilled atmosphere, dark, moody lighting, helpful staff shepherding you round. Bath was excellent and they certainly understand their customers with the setting. Massages are good with the hour passing far too quickly. Only issue was once you’re finished you pay at a counter and they push you out of a back entrance and you have no idea where you are. You wander around dirty back streets a bit to the way in, then wonder why the hell they don’t just let you out of their very nice entrance. Bad way to end a good experience.

Great Hammam Experience!. We chose the couples hammam experience. The black soap rub was authentic, and the massages were relaxing. The only complaints I would have is:1. No photos were allowed inside (we like to document the adventures we take)2. After the last treatment we were set in a room and 40 minutes later a staff member came in and asked if we'd finished our treatment...we said we had, and so then we were escorted back to our changing room. I'd have preferred to receive some type of orientation so I knew more what to expect, and then be able to make a decision to not waste 40+ minutes sitting in a room at then end.

An oasis of calm!. We had The Traditional One as a couple and overall we enjoyed it. The decor in this place is amazing and the massage was great, although our masseurs did whisper to each other regularly which was distracting. There is a lot of waiting around for the next thing to happen and as we don't speak french we didn't get any explanations. The hammam part of the experience involved a little water throwing, a little scrubbing and a lot of very hot steam. The steam became unbearable! Not the best I've ever expeerienced but a nice afternoon.

An unforgettable experience. We didn't book ourselves but arrived to a friendly reception area and didn't have to wait long to be taken through to the changing rooms. The decor is absolutely beautiful and you instantly feel relaxed before any treatments have begun. We were escorted in our robes to an outdoor pool area and were given fresh melon juice. The one negative was were were left here for a very long time (approx 35 mins) and we did get a little fed up. Eventually we had our hammam which was out of this world. The ladies really do "look after you". Following we were given mint tea and water and chilled for 10 mins before being taken for a massage - which was great. Afterwards we were taken to a chill out room and given more mint tea and biscuits. It's a shame but the place doesn't let you take pictures -so you have to take my word for how beautiful it is!Wouldn't hesitate to return and wish we had a hammam closer to home!

Asian spas are better. Les bains is supposed to be to the top spa/hammam in Marrakech. We visited in December 2012, the week after Christmas.I made a reservation two weeks in advance and paid a deposit by Paypal. I requested a 5pm slot for 2 people for an hour and a half. AFTER we paid, I was given a 5.30pm slot.We already had a dinner reservation at 8pm at La Mamounia, so I asked them to move our slot to any time earlier, but they refused, telling us they were extremely full that week.We arrived at 5pm on the day and were told to take a seat at the reception. We were one of several people waiting. We watched as several people walked in and received slots on the spot (so much for extremely full!!).We were still unsure on what the process was supposed to be and none of the staff bothered to explain anything to us. After about 20 minutes I got up to ask the reception what we were supposed to do and they told us "Just wait, your hostess will come get you"At about 5.40pm the hostess came to get us to lead us into the separate locker rooms. We were given robes to change into and led to our private hammam room. The hammam session we requested was for 1 hour. It was basically about 2 minutes of the attendant pouring hot water on us, followed by a 10 minute wait, then a 5 minute scrub, followed by application of a body mask, then another 15 minute wait, and then they let you take a shower.Again, the attendants and hostess did not bother to explain anything to us, so most of the time we were wondering what was supposed to happen. The hammam was not warm enough to qualify as a sauna, so felt more like a mildly warm waiting room for something to happen.After the shower we were led to a lounge and served tea. After about 15 minutes, I got up to check what was going on next, since we had booked a massage as well. The hostess told us to wait, and then 15 minutes later we were led out.To separate massage rooms, while we had requested a joint room. But we just did not have the energy to complain and request a joint room. The massage was with oil, and the masseuse did not respond to requests for more pressure. The massage was mediocre.Finally we were led out, and it was already 7.40pm, meaning we had to rush to shower and go to our dinner. Astoundingly, a large group of people had finished together, so both the dressing rooms were chockablock full. Literally, we had to fight our way to our lockers, and stand in line to get to the showers.The lockers here lock themselves shut as soon as the door is closed, and I found myself locked out as soon as I turned to get a towel, because sure enough with the number of people in the locker room, someone with the locker next to me closed my door, so that they could open their.A request to the staff to open the locker door went unheeded until we made a fuss and the manager came to open the door. We made it out the door at 8.30pm and had to call ahead to our restaurant to make sure they could still take us.All in all, not a great experience. The funny thing is, that very likely Les Bains is probably the best non-riad hammam in Morocco. They obviously put a lot of effort into the decor as opposed to the dank damp bathouses that you see when you pass on the street.Having said that, I think spas in Morocco in general have a great deal of catching up to do before they can approach the service level of spas in Asia. After having been to the Les Bains, I understand why the Angsana Riad in Marrakech chose to bring in staff from Thailand rather than train locally. The difference in service quality is vast, so it will be awhile before locally trained staff can approach global standards. The Asian standard is based on American service training, so they are much more systematic. First chat with the customer, explain in full what is going to happen and how long it is going to take. Next, never overbook the facilities. You're selling an experience, not trying to get maximum utilization of the facilities. If the experience is unsatisfactory, you destroy the brand image. And the brand image is what allows you to sell hot water and soap at 50 bucks an hour.

We died and went to heaven - for 4 hours. This was recommended by the manager of our Riad who 'phoned and booked. Being bit gosh and brit about these things I wasn't sure what to expect and was worried I might be covered in mud, thrashed with eucalyptus branches and offered an assisted shower. This place was wonderful. My wife and I had a sauna with some sort of rub down for an hour and a "relaxing" (as opposed to some other type) of massage. All of this was interspersed with time to relax, drink mint tea, sit by the pool etc. Really wonderful. It cost about £40 each - a snip for what we had, in my view. We had a rude awakening after the 4 hours were up and we went back down the unprepossessing alley back into the reality of the dusty, noisy, raucous city centre. We nearly turned and went back in. We'd certainly have gone again the next day had we not been flying home. Ho hum. Highly recommended.

Wonderful spa, excellent service. We had a reservation via internet. We arrived in time and we started the the program in time. The staff is very fiendly and principally are women. My wife and me had a reservation for a bath of 25 mintues and a realxing massage of 1 hour in a privat room, it means that you can be alone with your partner. The bath was wonderful, full of roses, oiles and just the good temperature. It was in fact 30 minutes and then we had a short rest with orange juice and some sweeties. Then we had the massage, very professional and reamarkable. It took 50-5 minutes, with several steps. Then we had again a short rest with orange juice and cookies. If you will have a massage with argain oil including your head (and hair) after wash your hair. I didn't do that, so my hair just became a bit "black and smokey", I think it was the argain. It is not the cheapest bath in Marrakech, but the the service and the venue worth the money that you pay. "A kind of must."

Wow. As a seasoned spa visitor in the UK I have to say i was blown away by this place. You can book private hammam which is obviously a different experience to the public ones (doesn't mean it's better but very different thing!) and it means you can go with your partner of opposite sex. The decor is what is so striking - Morrocan dark wood and lamps and beautiful marble tiles etc etc but with a real luxury calm feel. Most people doing treatments etc don't speak English but it didn't matter the message was clear 'relax' and just let us pamper you with all sorts. The receptionists speak all languages so can help you pick your package. GO!

Bliss and total relaxation. Went with a friend and had to book the day in advance. Very professional staff who spoke english on booking and just the 'hammam experience' cost only 150MAD, which was very reasonable consisering how much time we spent there (about 2 hours). We had no idea what to expect, but just went with the flow. Each time there was a 'break' someone came and served mint tea in very calm relaxing areas. First we were taken to the changing rooms and given plastic sandals and bath robe, then taken to a warm room and had water poured on us. We were then left to steam before the ladies came and soaped us. Again a relax before they came and opened new scrub mitten in front of us, and scrubbed us thoroughly. It wasn't hard or painful or uncomfortable, just delightful pampering. They then gave us lots of soap and shampoo for the shower, and argan oil afterwards. No rushing or hustling along. Just bliss and relaxation. If you want to try a hamam then I highly recommend this one. The hamam experience was billed as 45 minutes, but we were there over 2 hours! And we werent even able to buy the oil, so no hard sell here!

What an experience. My partner and I went together and didn't know what to expect. We were able to take our treatments together, well the hammam part, so we were in a room together. It was hilarious in a good way. I started with buckets of water being thrown over you :) then we were told to lie down and we were left to steam. Then two women came in and scrubbed us all over, pretty scary, but it did the job! I then had a sort of body mask and we had more time to steam. I also had a massage, which was one of the best in my life. It was so relaxing!Les Bains de Marrakech are well designed and you get given mint tea at various stages of the process. The only thing I would say is that you aren't really told what is happening or how long you could be waiting in different parts of the hammam, but if you don't mind this, and lets face it, you're on holiday so don't have to be in a rush, then it isn't too big a deal.

Lovely Spa - great hammam. A real treat for the end of our honeymoon. Apparently more expensive than others in Marrakech - without trying them difficult to judge value but at £40 each for nearly 3 hour treatment we thought very reasonable. Would recommend.

so much more than just a massage. We went as a family - 6 of us - 3 boys, parents and granny. We got lost and hot on our race to get there for our appointment but as soon as we arrived, we were made to feel welcome, made to relax and just zoned out of the hustle and bustle of the city. The 'hammam' experience was fantastic - the salt scrub - invigorating! The boys had the gentler black soap scrub and thought it was great. In between hammam and massage you're invited to lie down, drink tea and relax and not only are the staff helpful and friendly, but it's a really valuable cultural experience and a good contrast to the heat and frenetic activity outdoors. We were there for over 3 hours and came out feeling wonderful. Thank you for looking after us so well. Sarah

First time right!. Never did it before.Loved it and will probably never find it again as good as this was!Felt like a fairytale from the beginning till the end. Never felt cleaner, softer and more romantic!

Last day bliss. This place is tremendous! We had the hammam, rose bath and then massage. It was a special half day spa - I could not fault itHammam for two with lovelt black soap scrub &body mask, we then went in to our second room with two incredibly large bath tubs filled with rose petals from there to our individual massage rooms where tensions were whisked away. Refreshments were provided throughout all excellent quality
very good detente. i have got avery good time day going from hamam to massage , to manicure end othe service.in the mlddle of the medina ,it was really special

Amazing.. Superb place to spend a couple of hours after the day's travels. Attentive staff and an amazing experience, we will go every time we visit the City. Seems expensive but worth every penny and once you have been you will know why.

Chill time. Lots of options to choose from, go for the one hour massage at the very least - wonderful. No paper knickers here, so take a spare pair of your own. A little noisy in the outside pool area, you can hear the cars going by but I'm picky.

A must - do go. My wife & I visited the Spa last month & what an experience. We enjoyed it from start to finish, it is advisable to book before hand. Really felt refreshed afterwards, a wonderful way to spend an afternoon.

Welcome to the Spa factory. Well, as with so many things in Marrakech, this place was a little tricky to find. Let me help you! There is a lovely old and finely decorated arch nearby and to the right of it are two smaller archways. None of these are to be confused with the archway which leads into the city through the old external walls. To the immediate right of the right-hand archway of the set of two arches (I can't believe I'm having to type all this - and all without pay!) is a small alleyway leading to Les Bains. The entrance is attached to the inside of the city walls. Celebrate a little when you finally get there. One problem was my locker key not working. Interestingly you are told the locker number but it doesn't appear on the bracelet. You would think this was a good security measure but in fact locker key no.2 actually opened no. 6's locker. It only took me seconds to try 10 lockers. Ok - so keep your bracelet on you at all times (even during wet treatments) and don't take any valuables. The gommage I had was fine and the massage ok...it was a little too light for my tastes but this is generally the Moroccan style, which is far removed from the bone breaking Turkish massages or deep-tissue English style (sports) massage. One big plus was the fabulous opulent decor but one big minus was that I didn't feel any personal contact from the staff...I was herded around at the same time as other customers almost as though I was on a conveyor belt. The turnover here is quite big, however, and so it lacks that intimacy that can be found elsewhere.
Wow!. did the traditional hammam and massage fantastic! Try and book before you get there as it gets very booked up

Stunning relaxation and luxurious treatments. We visited Les Bains de Marrakech for a private hammam for myself and my boyfriend, having been recommended by our Riad. What a stunning experience! Whilst my boyfriend had researched what a hamman entailed, I went in not knowing what to expect at all. All I knew was to take a spare pair of knickers (ladies you don't need bikini's or swimsuits) and not to be shy. Thank goodness we booked a private hamman as I am not sure how the dynamics of a public hamman would work. The first half an hr consisted of a full body scrub and soap wash. The first drench of water over our heads from a bucket was possibly the funniest, but perhaps was what we needed to break the ice. Following the steam room, we had 10 mins or so to relax in robes on a lounger with a glass of mint tea and had a foot rub and face massage. Bliss!Then followed a one hr full body massage. Both myself and my boyfriend were in the same room and had a simultaneous massage which I have to say was possibly the best I have experienced ever (and I've had a lot of massages). The ladies were keen to please and often asked if the pressure was right and left for about 10mins afterwards for us to take in the relaxation. Overall, a truly sumptuous experience and worth every penny. Such good value for money considering the surroundings, attention to detail and outstanding service. Highly recommended!! Alicia and Paul, London UK

Luxurious and a must..when you visit Marrakech !!. This was my first trip to Marrakech and first experience at a hamman. This place was highly recommended by the owner/staff at the Riad. I was expecting it to be much like the spas in North America but WOW..was I surprised! Initially it felt a little weird... having someone exfoliate your skin but the staff was very professional and made me feel more comfortable. The "relaxing massage" was the best I've EVER had and a wonderful way to relax after a long trip. The ladies who escort you to the change room/lockers (to get you started )were not very friendly and didn't bring the correct size for slippers. But that was not a big deal. Overall this was a wonderful relaxing experience! I would highly recommend this Hamman to others and can't wait to go back!!

Great day, well worth a visit. 550 dirhams for a hammam, hour long massage, black soap and scrub and oil - maybe not a bargain for Morocco but a special day and well worth it. You can also swim in their pretty outdoor pool and lounge in the sun weather permitting.Our hammam was not that hot - we had a cubicle for two and it was very dark and warm but not very steamy. Our friends had one that very hot and very light. They must have knicked our power! between treatments you relax in a glorious range of quiet lounges and mint tea is served along with water. After your massage delicious little cakes are served with your tea.My massage was great - very thorough, very relaxing. Fairly confusing due to language barrier but a full hour and very relaxing. Word of warning - you'll have a head full of oil and if you have a fringe you'll look hilarious. So don't plan anything glam straight afterward.I'd go again like a shot. Very pretty surroundings, very nice staff.
Go on - spoil yourself!. A fabulous haven amongst the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. It took a little getting used to - being scrubbed down with a glove like a green scourer - but well worth it.

Couples treat. My husband and i had a lovey treatment in the hammam, full scub and massage. Then you are taken to relax with mint tea and pastries.A beautiful and luxurious experience. The fraction of what it would cost in Uk

Wonderful Spa. My husband and I both enjoyed a fabulous Hammam at this spa. We had the mud treatment in the sauna and then an hour massage. It was a great way to wind down our trip. There were 8 of us in total who participated and we all loved it. The place is amazing and the treatments were wonderful. I recommend to anyone in the area to take time to visit.
great experience. This spa was an awesome experience. The decor is beautiful and the patrons are delightful. The prices were reasonable and the treatments were delightful.
Great Hammam experience. I would definitely recommend this hammam - it was great! If you have not been to a Moroccan hammam, then I highly recommend trying it out - you won't be disappointed.

Can I please go back now?. We went to Les Bains de Marrakech per a recommendation from our hotel. It was absolutely incredible. We went with the least expensive hammam experience- full scrub down, massage and such, and did not think we were missing out on anything. The rub down was great (I still have and use my glove!), and the relaxation rooms between steps were wonderful. My massage was great (and not for the inhibited!) and super relaxing. I went with my husband and we were able to share a room. If I could do it again I would have spent all day there. They let you use the pool, order food from the hotel, and just veg. Oh man, I'm dreaming about one of those cuddly white robes right now...
Heaven in Marrakech. Everything laughed till I cried and then relaxed so I could'nt walk. Hamman massage and face mask my favourite. Mint tea fab

Unbeliveable. As massage virgin I was a little nervous about going to have the full body scrub and massage but it was amazing. It's worth going just to see the beautiful building and decor. We were treated like superstars from the moment we entered and the staff were incredibly attentive. We were a group of 8 and they accomodated us all together, provided tea and sweet treats after the treatement. It probably isn't the most authentic of baths (no Moroccan people) but i it's relaxation you want I couldn't recommend it more!

Well-priced luxury. Beautiful setting - dark with relaxing music, everything smelled beautiful, you are led through hallways in white robes by a well-coordinated team of women. Everything was perfect and I certainly didn't expect this kind of quality for the price. Highly recommended.

Heaven. This was a wonderful experience. So very relaxing and a great escape from the noisy, crowded streets of Marrakech. It began with a mud, body scrub in the sauna, followed by an incredible relaxing massage (so relaxing I dozed off twice), then I opted for a traditional facial treatment. It was brilliant. The sauna can be rather stifling when you first enter but if you ask them to leave a widow open whilst you adjust it is okay. The staff were wonderful and the whole setting is very relaxing, clean and inviting. They even serve you mint tea and little pastries. Reserve the whole afternoon as the pace is slow and relaxing. My session took about 4 hours. If you need to unwind and recharge your battery this is certainly the place to do it. I would strongly recommend this experience in Marrakech.

A sanctuary amongst the chaotic Medina. Perfect relaxation experience amongst the hustle and bustle of the Medina, what's not to like?Good value spa experience - we opted for the traditional spa experience for a couple at 1100 Dirhams (c£45 each), which includes a hamman (similar to a Turkish bath) and 1 hour massage (you can choose a relaxing massage or a lymphatic stimulation one instead).The staff were brilliant and attentive throughout, stopping calmly to gently guide in such a natural way even when they were doing something else. The setting was great, more recently decorated yet still in authentic Moroccan style with lots of dark wood arches etc.I wouldn't have changed anything about this experience to be honest - it was exactly what we wanted on what was otherwise quite a busy schedule in Marrakech. The only slightly tricky aspect was finding the spa itself but basically head towards the area between Kosybar (marked on the tourist map) and the tombs and it is in that area - we asked a couple of people for directions along the way and they were really helpful.Finally, book a couple of days in advance as it gets fully booked due to its popularity.
Fabulous. Just do it.. We couldn't have had a more sophisticated and relaxing time. The spa is beautiful and the staff and treatments are great.
Dave and carol. A little expensive but very professional and high quality. The massage however at 1 hour long was very good.

Beautiful spa....average massage. My partner & I chose the duo hamman & massage for 550 dh ($132), we felt comfortable with the ladies scrubbing us down, but often times wasn't sure where or what treatment was next since our French was limited. The massage was very average and I ask if she could go a little stronger....she mumbled relaxing massage! The tea/water/cookies after the massage were a nice touch but after our massage we were led to a larger room with lounge chairs with other people which kind of took away that special couple feeling.

Best spa experience i have had. Good value for money and stunning setting, very welcoming staff and relaxing beyond words. We went for a private bath followed by one hour massage and were then taken to a big room to relax with tea and marrocan pastries. Do book in advance though as it does get very busy !
Very nice. a very good value for money and staff very nice, make an appointment in advance as it gets very busy.
An amazing cultural and spa experience. I LOVED my two hours as this local spa...our hamamm treatment was amazing and the massage was to die for....I now need a constant supply of black soap!

Interesting experience - brusque Hammam, relaxing massage. We (2 female friends) booked for a Hammam and massage - we were ushered into a hot room for the Hammam where water was poured over us and we were left. Then we were told to remove our bikini tops and were brusquely scrubbed with salt (do NOT shave your legs first as it stings!!) then water was poured over us to remove the salt, we were wrapped in clay/algae and left again before being prodded into a shower together (at this point we were told remove our bikini bottoms as well) and a woman stuck her head round the curtain every few minutes to see how our naked communal shower was going... It was interesting to say the least! Then we were given dressing gowns and taken to a relaxation area for tea (only one cup allowed) before our massage. The massages were excellent although we were still completely naked except for a towel that was frequently moved. The experience of the Hammam was slightly spoiled as we could hear the therapists chattering a lot outside the room but the massage was really good. T
European Style Spa. Suggest you call in advance of your trip as they book up quickly. Excellent European/Moroccan spa treatments.

A wonderful retreat from the madness. After reading the reviews on here I thought I'd treat my husband and I to a hammam during our holiday to Marrakech. I made a reservation via the website a few days before leaving the UK and paid a deposit through PayPal. This process was very straight forward. As soon as we entered the reception area we felt relaxed (which was lovely after spending the morning in the souks)The ladies on reception spoke english and were very efficient. I felt nervous and excited at the same time as this was my first hammam experience (we booked the traditional hammam, gommage and 1hr relaxing massage) Once we had changed into the robes and slippers provided we were ushered through to the pool area and given some fruit juice. After about 20 mins we were taken through to the hammam were my husband and I were in a room together, even though I had not booked a private hammam we were the only two in there which was lovely!Then the fun began! The ladies who perform the hammam do not speak English but were really lovely and made you feel at ease, they really made the experience good fun even with the language barrier. I am THE most self conscious person and didn't feel comfortable removing my bikini top but this was not a problem. After we were steamed and scrubbed we were taken to room to relax with mint tea.The venue is amazing and it was a real treat to be pampered away from the madness of the medina.

Relaxing. Clean, relaxing and excellent massage. You have to make sure and say whcih kind of massage you want else you end up feeling fustrated as it just a gentle rub. Teh Hammam was ok but expected a bit more of a scrub. All in all a good expereince and would recommend
reflexology was amazing. had a reflexology in this beautiful place very clean and nicely decorated...........pleasant experience.

What an ending!. Went here on our last day and had 3 hours of bliss - the hamman and massage were SO good - floated out on a little cloud afterwards - a perfect way to end a trip to a very exciting city!!

Even better than last time. We enjoyed our visit in 2009 so much we decided to come back and we were glad we did. There have been some great improvements and the spa provides a lovely break from the busy souks. The staff are very friendly and always happy to help.

Well worth it. Very relaxing - a great way to pamper yourself! You don't feel rushed at all and there is plenty of time to relax between treatments. If you do decide to go, be sure to book at least a day or more in advance as it gets booked up quickly.

luxury. we booked in for a hamman and massage. We hadn't had this experience before so didn't know what to expect. As we only speak English it was alittle difficult to understand what to do (in terms of what to wear etc) but we still had a great experience. Take a comb with you - I came out of the massage looking like I had been electrocuted so just as well I had some hairties etc so I could leave looking ok!

my best day in marrakech. clean, nice staff, amazing massage and hammam. Prices are ok, 100€ for massage and hammam for 2, plus you can relax in the patio for 30 minutes. I also liked the interiors, quite stylish!

Bliss. We went for a hammam and an hour massage and it was an experience which no one should miss. Some of the ladies doing the treatments can not speak English so it is a matter of hand signals and one word commands. It was the first time we had had a hammam and really didnt know what to expect but enjoyed the time spent at the spa. There is plenty of time to relax and you are not rushed at all. We were there for 4 hours! It was very busy so you do have to book. The only thing that we didn't like was being exited out of the back door, it felt wrong!

4 hand massage: bliss. Hammam/massage is an experience not to miss when in Morocco. Les Bains de Marrakech offers a 4 hand massage that is exquisite, definitely worth indulging in.We started with a hammam and seaweed wrap, and the only downside of the experience is that our hammam room was close to a building works in process, and we could hear all the hammering, which frankly spoilt that part of the relaxation.The manager came to check on me when I commented on this with the staff, and assured that they couldn't do anything about it and that our massage would be far away from the building works.He showed concern, but we would have appreciated a gesture as part of the experience was clearly missed.Tea and biscuits were included, and aside from the hammering, it was a really lovely moment.

Bliss!. The traditional hammam was an amazing experience and the full body massage even better! The property is beautiful and the pool area was great to sunbathe in. The treatments are excellent value. I can't wait to return!

unique experience. If you like massage... you will perhaps think you had never experience massage before.. palce is beautiful, people are great. The only bad thing: too much succes here, so you need to book in advance !

Wow. Loved it ! , a little oasis away from the maddness of Marrakech.My wife and I had a couples hammam, wrap and 4 hand massage and it was the highlight of our holiday - I can't recommend this place highly enough. Relaxing, tranquil, peaceful.

overrated place and disappointing service!. It was supposed to be an ultimate relaxation session but unfortunately ended up being a huge let down.I've booked a deep tissue massage but the massage therapist was either very unexperienced or just lazy.I did try to suggest I wasn't happy but she wouldn't really listen.instead of leaving relaxed and rejuvenated I left upset.talking to the staff didn't help,they were literally not concerned in the least.the place itself is beautiful and has a great potential but I don't think I will be coming back...

Go for Hammam and Massages, but not pedicures. My fiance and I enjoyed the massages and hammam so much that we went back the very next day - however on the second visit, my fiance got the Moroccan massage (and loved it!), I had the pedicure and was very disappointed. Of the 45 minute session my feet were: in 1inch of room temperature water for 3 minutes, roughly scraped for 5 minutes, and then very poorly painted (one coat! Not even a clear top coat and all over the show) for 10 minutes and then I just sat there for the rest of the time. The color I picked was going on fast enough - so the girl insisted on a different color. It didn't appear that any of the instruments were sterilized and I'm pretty sure I was given water from the tap. It was at the very end of the day, so I'm sure the girl was just rushing it because she wanted to finish early. Saying ALL of that - if you don't care about pedicures - definitely go! The place was beautiful and the other treatments of very high quality.

Amazing. If you are planning a spa trip during your time in Marrakech you must come to this Spa! Situated in the south of the medina, Les Bains is easy to find and is stunning from the outset. Myself and my boyfriend booked in for the traditional hammam and full body massage for 550dhs each. Don't worry about booking before you come to the city, our riad booked the treatments for us. Both treatments were incredibly relaxing, although we didn't know what to expect with the hammam as the staff mainly speak in french. Between treatments the staff supply you with juice, mint tea and pastries, all delicious. We were thee for just over 3.5hrs and it was a delightful and peaceful break from the busyness of the main city. Plan your treatments mid-way through your stay if you can. Enjoy!

Hammam for a dream day. We took an afternoon off from the Medina caos to get our Hammam spa treatment. We chose the duo Hammam + Massage (in couple). The Hammam was great but a way too hot for my low blood pressure. I enjoyed it and found the lady very good during the black soap treatment, but my boyfriend had a faster and less effective work (I dunno if is a religious issue). Massage was amazing and soooo relaxing. We almost felt asleep. Between one treatment and the other you can chill and have a mint tea in special rooms. I have to say that was a wonderful afternoon.

you HAVE to do THIS!!!!. I did the works... a scrub, foot massage, rose petal bath, massage, facial... OMG i was in there for THREE HOURS, and came out feeling like a princess. This is traditional to have the bathing ceremonies... and i definitely felt like i had entered into another world and given myself the absolute privilege of being washed and treated. WOW!! A trip to Morocco is incomplete without this experience.

Amazing experience of utmost pampering!. We got the recommendation for this Hammam through our hotel Riad Libiti Bito (highly recommended).At first, the prices seems quite high for Morocco, but after nearly 4 hours of pampering you quickly realise that it is really worth it.The atmosphere is magical and very relaxed. It appears that they can only attend 5-6 couples at each time, so it never feels crowded.Arrive at least 30 minutes in advance to enjoy the little pool in the patio and receive a complimentary orange juice. All you need with you is a swimming costume- the towels, shoes and a bathrobe are provided.We selected the Duo Traditional Hammam and Massage priced at 550MAD. Firstly, you are lead to the private hammam room, where you get to relax, warm muscles and then two ladies come to apply soap and let you rest 5-10mins. Then they return to scrub you with loofa and apply a sort of gel. Again you rest 10 mins and then they return to put another product similar to peeling mud. After shower, they take you to rest and relax with a mint tea and water for cca 30 min before you are taken for your 1h long massage.The whole place is beautifully decorated, with lovely soft music and essential oil lamps. The staff, women only, are very pleasant and helpful but speak only basic English.I highly recommend this place as it gave us a wonderful few hours of relaxation in a bustling city.

My Spa Day in Marrakech. The massage was really, really good. The service staff was very efficient and attentive. However, the place was too dark to see and they added extra 3% when I used my credit card.

Loved it. A really great way to spend a few hours of rest and relaxation in Marrakech. Very indulgent and felt really clean, relaxed and refreshed afterwards. Make sure you have a big glass of water before you get there as I was thirsty in the hammam during the first element of my indulgence package.

Absolutely amazing experience, worth every dirham!. Difficult to be described, i would not like to spoil the surprising value you get for your money. I had the Hamam with black soap and herb wrap treatment and 1 hour of fantastic massage in a beautiful envirement, experience out of this world, all together this costed Euros 55. Probably the most memorable experience i ever had of this kind!

nice!!. Very relaxing place!! Great and relaxing spa in the heart of the medina. The spa was the perfect ! This was without question one of the best spas I have ever visited in terms of the quality of the treatments
Excellent massage. Beautiful and relaxing spa in the heart of the medina.After a night out partying, the spa was the perfect detox, hammam, relaxation then a massage!

Check your change but otherwise very romantic. Upon entering - Les Bains gives you a proper "wow" factor - it's actually very romantic....but we were on my hen party - even still we had an amazing time!We had the traditional face and body, the massages is ok - its more about the experience...the only problem was that the people there don't explain very much of what they're going to do to you....well - we didn't speak French - so that didn't help. But since it was our first time in a Hamman - we just went with it! I also had a pedicure at the end - the lady started to say something but realised I didn't speak French so didn't go any further. The reason for my review was the ending.....the bill! We'd already paid around £150 in deposit for the whole treatments for the 7 of us - so when the bill came, it was a bit of a shock - the receptionist when I queried it said "no it is right" so I then had to break it down for her! I was annoyed as they charged us 30dhs for the application of nail polish in the pedicure (that must have been what the lady was trying to tell me!) and I just said I want the whole bottle for that?? They also charged us for the black "exfoliating gloves" - which they HAD to use during the Hamman - when I said we don't want it - they said we had to purchase it....so beware of the "add ons" they don't tell you about - which still didn't explain why the total was about £100 more then what I had worked out.In the end - the receptionist saw my working outs and agreed I was right....no apologies though - it was enough to ruin my thoughts about the Hamman and wanted to warn others about it!!I don't think I would go again because of the wrong change experience - but if you do decide to go.....check your change!

Phenomenal luxury in the middle of the medina. There was NOTHING to dislike...it was paradise. My wife and I are building a new house and we definitely "stole" some ideas for our plans based on this beautiful location...and right near an awesome Riad, the Riad Nafis.

Fantastic Hammam. I visited Les Bains to avoid a hot July afternoon in Marrakech. I was transported to complete relaxation and tranquility. I had the full deal. Hammam, massage and facial - 4 hours of bliss. I supposed to have a milk bath but there was a little problem with the hot water. No dramas for me and they adjusted the bill accordingly. The facility is fantastic. Recommend arriving a little early and taking advantage of the onsite pool, the water is freezing and so refreshing after walking to the spa from the Riad. I was given some orange oil by the manager on my leaving the spa which was a nice touch. Fantastic spa.

Brilliant spa and a must in Marrakech. This was without question one of the best spas I have ever visited in terms of the quality of the treatments - the massage was amazing.The facilities are great with a lovely outdoor pool area and the spa is exceptionally good value.
Such value!. You must'nt be shy if going for the hammam. But it's a must have. Our bodies didn't smell for days ;)
Very Good treatments. My friends virtually took over the spa for an entire afternoon. Everyone found the treatments on a par with the best in Europe.

A real Morocco treat. An oasis in the heat of the city - first enjoy a glass of fresh orange juice by the pool and then sweat it out in the sauna area before the rest of the hammam treatment, involving black soap and lots of scrubbing, then relax in soft robes with mint tea. Everyday should include a visit here. Fairly priced (150d/person), lots of other treatments available, book in advance though.

Amazing Hammam!. Came here on a girls' trip and absolutely did not want to leave. Amazing service and treatments. The hammam is a must-do. Also got a mani/pedi and regular massage, which were both also heavenly. There are relaxation rooms with chaise lounges where you are served tea and bisquits and can nap between treatments. Such a beautiful spa. We loved it!

Great experience!. What a perfect place to experience a hammam and massage treatment for the first time. This place was recommended to us by our Riad owner plus I'd already found it on trip advisor.We were in there for 3 hours being washed, scrubbed, smothered in brown stuff, showered off and massaged!Before the massage we were taked to a chill out room where we had water and mint tea.The massage was amazing and lasted about 1 hour.Finally we were taken to another chill out area where we had more mint tea and some small biscuit/cakes.There was a pool which we could have used but we decided to head off back to our Riad.The cost for this experience was 550 dirham each which is about £40We would definitely recommend this to anyone!
any time to spare in Marrakesh this treat shouldn't be missed. I had 4 days on my own in Marrakesh and spent a few hours each day relaxing at this spa after visiting sites

I could spend there every weekend!. Professional staff, great treatment! Difficult to find:) It looks much better and more impressive inside than from outside. A really mystical place...full of charm. You can spend a few hours there and relax....hammam, peeling, sauna, massage..... peace and tranquility. Expensive for Morocco but OK when compared with European spa resorts.
les Bains de Marrakech. beautiful spa, very relaxing and good value. One of the best in Marrakech
Spa Retreat. We loved this place where we had the couples hammam and massage, was amazing and very friendly staff, can't recommend this experience highly enough
Excellent Treatments. More of a Europen Spa and a bit more pricey thn the local hammams, but the treatments are excellent.

good hammam in a convenient location. Service was good and attentive. The smells were divine even as you walk along their narrow walkways from one area to the next. They are busy hence we were not able to book a full hammam experience but just an hour and later a facial with argan oil. Both were very good. Once you get to the 'rest' areas and the outdoor courtyard (common area so you are all in your bathrobes, hanging out with your own group), everything melts away and it's pure relaxation. It's a good hammam with very reasonable prices. You must make a booking and sometimes they require that you make a deposit via Paypal to hold your booking when they are super busy. Booking via email is easy, just go to their website and follow instrucitions. In French and Arabic only. Hopefully English will be available soon.

amazing. Les Bains de Marrakech was an incredible experience, absolutely lovely i had a hammam and an hour relaxing message. the staff were incredibly polite the lady who did my hammam (jamila) lovely. My friend and I got drinks while we waited our message. Overall a fantastic place, people and experience a must do if you are in Morocco :)
Les Bains. Sheer heaven, they look after you so well, we were completely rubbed and scrubbed and pampered!

Good Service. Our booking someone did not get put into the system. They were very accomodating and found a slot for both my gf and I quickly and gave us a free oriental bath afterwards as an apology gesture! Lovely building to have your massage in
An Oasis in Marrakech. One of the best spas in Marrakech. It lived up to the reviews I had read and the staff were so nice and friendly. I will definitely be back.

Relaxing atmosphere. Les Bains de Marrakech was an incredible experience. The employees are very professional and polite, and the spa is one of the most beautiful buildings I've been to. My wife decided for a Hammam (Scrub-Massage-Steam treatment) and she loved the whole treatment. Since I don't like massages, I was invited to wait for her by the pool area. I was given a white robe, and while lounging there enjoying the beautiful surroundings, they brought me tea, water, and some cookies. This place is absolutely wonderful, and from my wife's experience in the hammam, she highly recommends anyone to get it.
great experience. this spa is great because it allows couples. It was a great experience.
Amazing Hammam. We had such a wonderful time at the spa and would definitely recommend this place! Lovely to spend a day here after 4 busy days in Marrakesh.

Very disappointing experience. I was recommended this hammam by our Riad. We kept this visit till the last day in order to completely relax and unwind before our return. How disappointing! 1.Staff welcomed us without smile,2. Hammam treatments which was supposed to be 45 min. Instead- shower, staff put oil in few seconds and left, they come back after few minutes-shower and after scrub maybe 2 minutes total- 1 on each side, then shower and mask. Total time in hammam maximum 25 minutes. 3. Massage was a joke- it was relaxing and clean setting, yet the massage was so soft that I was feeling bored not relaxed.I asked the lady to use more pressure and she did for few seconds then stopped, asked again, but after initial minute she come back to soft strokes. She massaged my head 3 times,each time so softly and weirdly pausing with her hands in my hair, maybe she thought I was sleeping...I thought she could spent more time on massaging my body than sitting and playing with my hair.4. Yes,it is beautiful place and you receive your tea and sweets, yet staff is not very attentive and friendly.I asked for comment form and left my observations, staff didn't even say goodbye. Overall I would not recommend further.Average experience.

Relaxation from start to finish. I booked this on the recommendation of the concierge at our hotel and wasn't disappointed. I booked a traditional Moroccan experience for MAD550 which was supposed to last for an hour and a half but it was nearly a 3 hr experience. On arrival you are shown to your locker where you can leave your clothes and belongings and you are given a robe and sets. As I was early I sat and relaxes by the pool. I had the hammam, followed by a black soap wash and then a scrub and then a body mask. This probably lasted 45 mins and was very relaxing. My massage was well over an hour and was divine. She even massaged my ears!!!! In between treatments I was taken to the relaxation rooms and given water and mint tea. My husband started to wait for me in reception but they gave him a robe and he sat and chilled out around the pool area. They even gave him drinks at no charge!! It's really easy to find. Our taxi driver dropped us right outside at the entrance of the kasbah. I wore bikini bottoms and a top and they do ask if you want to remove your top. I did and I didn't feel intimidated at all. A very good experience. Just wish I had time to go back!!!!

Hamman services at Les Bains. This was a great experience and one not to be missed! The quality of the spa (very clean), the gommage and massages were well done, and the leisurely pace of the services made this a memorable event. I can see doing this on a regular basis!!

a place must visit in marrakech. This was the best of all spa experiences that I had in Marroco, there is nothing better than Les Bains de Marrakech.I made reservation online, very easy.As soon as we entered we were surrounded by the dim lights and beautifull morrocan style.Staff is so amazing and very helpfull, guiding you through the corridors of this amazing place from one treatment to another.I had a hammam and 1 hour of relaxing massage - excellent.The spa, the ambience, atmosphere, mint tea during your 15 min relaxing break between one treatment to another.Ive only wish Ive booked more treatments and went only there.Make sure you make the reservation in advance, money well spent.

A Jem in Marrakeck. The service was excellent! The place was beautiful and the pricing was reasonable. I got a day package which included the Haman, massage and a 20 minute soak in lavender and roses! Amazing. FYI, I didn't know what to expect with the Haman but basically sat in a sauna for 45 mins and felt like i was going to pass out. I felt good after but I don't know if I enjoy that experience in general.

An Oasis of calm from the chaos of Marrakech!. Me and my Mum had a great time here on our recent trip. We both opted for the traditional Hammam with black soap scrub and then a relaxing massage. For our last day in Marrakech this couldn't have been a better way to relax and scrub the dust from the city off ourselves! The staff were friendly and helpful, the decor was beautiful and the whole place had a lovely chilled atmosphere. There were high standards of cleanliness and hygiene! Me and my Mum both agreed that the massage was the best we have ever had.It was also very reasonably priced - we were there for about 3 hours, were offered numerous drinks and snacks, were never rushed and paid about 45euros each. You would probably pay twice that in Europe or the UK. There may be cheaper in Marrakech but for quality we would definitely recommend Bains de Marrakech!Tip: Take conditioner as this isn't provided and a comb as you will need to wash your hair. Wear either a bikini or just underwear and be prepared to take your bikini top off as it is generally expected! It also helps if you speak some French as most of the therapists speak very little English!
European Type Spa. Very good treatments, but you should book in advance.

Relaxing Hamman. Had the traditional package - Hamman and massage. Arrived 1 hour early and had a relaxing time by the pool, then went for Hamman - very interesting experience - finished off with a relaxing massage. So Good...

Marrakech spa. Amazing place. They make you feel you are the only ones in the spa. I had a salt scrub & mud hammam then massage which was amazing. You feel very special.Seems pricey for Marrakech but so work it when you think about the products they use and the way they make you feel. So worth it and would cost a fortune in London. The smells and light make this place special, as well as the communication between the ladies that run the place.A bit of advice, get there early so you can make use of the pool first. We got there on time so was not able to use the pool after the treatment as we were oiled up.Enjoy.
Les Bains. We had the traditional Hamman - it was FANTASTIC - an experience worth trying even if it only just the once!
very dirty. I have been ther for a Hammam and massage and found the towels very dirty. A young lady asked me to change it but i refused and go .
Best spa experience of my life. It was the single best spa experience of my life. So relaxing.

A must if in Marrakesh for body therapy lovers.. I chose a 55 € formula with 1 hour scrubbing=gommage + 1 hour massage. Both were great. Clean, polite & sympathic. Excellent quality. Problems: no wifi in the lobby & hard to reach them by phone. Don't think twice. Go for it!
OK. Not too bad an experience, cannot just ask for a specific area to be massaged, it was whole body and no exceptions! the people were lovely though
an oasis of calm in bustling marrakech. a place to relax, unwind and let the serene staff take care of you

Nothing to shout about.... After some serious research decided to book our "special hammam experience". The place is well booked up and a slot was available only for 9 a.m. Ok. Arrived 20 min before, the place was closed, waited at a nearby cafe 10 min or so. Eventually went in, the receptionists are rather desinterested, after a few minutes were escorted to get changed and to put bathrobes on. Looks like all bathrobes are the same size, so if you are more then 12-14, you just look plain silly. I was really lookinf forward to a nice hammam, my friend and I were deposited on 2 matrasses in a dark room, they through some water over us and left us there! We did not know what was happening and for 15 min or so nothing was! Then 2 ladies came, slapped some soap on us and left us again. Returned after 10 min or so, gave us a 50 sec scrub (didnt overdo it) and told us to shower. The shower was tiny, situated behind rickety wooden door, the drainage was poor, my frien had to step in after me, not ideal! When I asked for hair conditioner, the woman looked at me as if I was asking for the moon. They we stayed in a rest room for 15 min or so, massive room with lots of people. Then off for the facial, it was quite good, but all exfoliation liquid, scrubs and oils ended up running down my neck and into my hair! At the end you come out of a different exit onto the side street and the receitionist is not in the slightly interested and speaks virtually no English. Just "pay and go" kinda attitude. After such a "special" experience ended up on the street with stuckup oily hair. I coud not wait to get to riad to clean up. What a joke! All in all, nothing special and extremely expensive. Staff totally disinterested. DONT BOTHER, GO ELSEWHERE!!!

Perfection. My partner and I went to Les Bains de Marrakech and it was superb. The service was immaculate and the bath and the message left me completely relaxed and rejuvinated. The bains itself is relatively easy to find, although some directions and a map may be necessary. The decoration is beautiful and the staff very attentive. I think this hammam is more expensive than most in Marrakech but it was beautiful, relaxing and excellent value for what you get compared with an European equivilent.
Oasis of relaxation. Booked a Relaxation treatment - Hammam and massage, was excellent, and enjoyed time in the pool afterwards.

Divine! A must-do. I indulged in a hamman and massage at Les Bains Des Marrakech and was truly divine. We spent the first part of the experience (being steamed, sloshed with water, rubbed with mint, more steaming, sloughed with a 'cheese-grater' and then dipped in mud) in a state of hysterical giggles, but then followed the best massage of my life. We emerged after 3 hours feeling relaxed, clean, dewy soft and desperately in need of some SPF15!
Amazing. I would definitely recommend spending time in this spa!!

Fabulous Day Spa. We spent a wonderful half a day at Les Bains De Marrakech, it is a very beautiful spa and so well run - you never felt rushed and it feels so private like you have the whole place to yourself, its a must do when you visit the city

Simply Perfect. I can't say enough. Amazing atmosphere quality. They have this business down pat. They cycle people through from waiting, to changing to lounging to the hammam to the massage and back to relaxing before heading out. Everything was prompt and top-notch.
Scrubbed Smooth. A visit to the hammam is a must when in Morocco and Les Bains de Marrakech is a luxey version, but still very reasonable. Go for a scrub and massage...your skin will feel like silk.
Very touristy and not too unique or comfortable. Took a long time, did not have a very real feel, we were ready to leave half way done.

Wonderful relaxation. Les Bains de Marrakech was a great experience and totally relaxing. We had the Hammam and it was a wonderful way to spend a couple of hours - it put me in the mood for a great night out.

Reasonably priced treatments in nice surroundings. Les Bains de Marakech is one of the cities most famous spas as such it gets very busy and you need to book in advanced. I visited with my boyfriend and we both had a massage treatment. When we arrived we were greeted by a security guard who walked us from the street to the reception where we checked in. We were then taken through to separate male and female changing rooms. You are given a bracelet which is the key to your locker, robes and flip flops are provided and the area where you change is clean and nicely kept. We were then led through to the outdoor pool where you can sit and have a drink and relax before your treatment. After about 15 minutes we were led up stairs to our treatment room where the massage was done. The massage was lovely and they used really nice oils. One thing that surprised me was that they put a lot of oil on my face and then massaged my face so be sure to remove your make up or tell them before hand that you don't want oil on your face. After the massage we were taken down to a relaxation room where were served mint tea and some pastries. I fell asleep and was awoken rather abruptly by a member of staff and told I needed to go to the changing room however they then realised it was full and tried to send me back into the room but we asked if we could sit by the pool. At first they refused but then allowed us. the water in the pool was freezing and there was also a funny smell to it but the sun loungers were very comfortable. Overall this is a lovely spa and the treatments are very reasonably priced compared to London however the staff do need to work on their manners as we found them to be rather irritable and surly. As the spa is so busy is does feel a bit like a production line of clients going through too. Be sure to book in advance of your trip if you want to visit and arrive early so you can enjoy the pool before your treatment.

Relaxing bliss on the last day of our trip. Booked via their website prior to our trip, you then pay a deposit via paypal to secure your booking - really glad we did as when we actually arrived people were being offered appointments in three days time. What a wonderful experience, so calming, tranquil, relaxing.... I could go on! We did it on our last day and travelled to the airport relaxed and fresh for our trip home. It is quite easy to find, just look out for the sign and the chap in uniform at the end of the alley. I guess it is a bit of a production line, but the staff take great care to avoid it feeling as such.We had the couples hammam and relaxing massage which was fantastic. The whole thing took about 3 hours, as you are asked to arrive 30 mins prior to your appointment so you can get changed into your robe and slippers and lounge by the pool with a fruit juice. Thereafter you are taken into the steam room which is quite hot - it is very dark in their with relaxing music & soft lighting - so much so that I had not fully adjusted to the light when the lady came in and chucked the first of many buckets of warm water over me, which came as a bit of a shock but left my husband shrieking with laughter until it was his turn. I have never been so relaxed - the clay mask and scrubbing left my skin glowing and smooth. The massage was wonderful too, just right and the oils smell amazing.Afterwards you are poured back into your robe and lounge in the covered courtyard with mint tea and yummy treats until you are ready to get dressed and leave with the mitt they scrubbed you with.A few tips...dark underwear/bikini/bathers are a must, robes & flip flops are provided, secure lockers are provided in the changing rooms free of charge, shower gel, shampoo, towels and a hair drier are available in the shower area, but not conditioner. Leave youself plenty of time as you will not want to rush this fabulous experience.

A must do because you're worth it. This was one of the best things we did in Marrakech, do not miss out on this it really is a must-do. A friend of mine recommended LBDM so we booked online before we flew out - this is really necessary since they book up very quickly. We booked a week in advance but think 2 weeks is better since we didn't get the slot we originally wanted.We went for the relaxing full day spa which is totally worth it. We started off relaxing by the pool with lovely fresh fruit juice, and were then taken to have the hammam (ladies you will be asked to go topless!). The english of the staff isn't great here but enough to get by (instructions like 'turn', 'shower', 'turn again'!) but everyone was really friendly and helpful. Ater the hammam we showered and were taken to a relaxing area where we were served mint tea and water. After some time we were taken to have our massages which were sublime! Truly relaxing and you just feel so light afterwards. After this (oh yes there's more!) we then had an oriental bath which was a lovely soak in water infused with oils and strewn with rose petals. Finally you are taken to relax again either by the pool or in a room and served mint tea, pastries and fresh fruit juice again, and are free to leave when you please. You need to allow plenty of time to fully enjoy the experience, we totally lost track of time and ended up spending four hours there! Mainly because we weren't sure what to do after we were taken for the last relaxing part and hung around until we thought we better leave! It was such a lovely experience and everything from the friendly and helpful staff, to the stunning decor, to the clean facilities and the atmosphere and vibe of the place that makes you feel like royalty is something that should not be missed when in Morocco. We had a free hammam at our hotel and it just didn't compare. Also, they give you the exfoliating mitt they scrub you down with which is a nice touch.We went as a couple but saw lots of groups too, and when booking it's worth stating you want your treatments together. Overall, simply wonderful!

luxurious. lovely luxurious space but I felt a bit 'processed'. The staff in the hammam were a bit severe and I would not have enjoyed it on my own - but shaing the experience with a friend made it amusing and relaxing.

Sublime Experience. If you find yourself in Marrakech, do NOT pass up the opportunity to experience a hammam at Les Bains de Marrakech. It is possible to book online and you should plan to reserve well in advance of your trip. The entire experience is totally satisfying. I had a full hammam and 10 minute 4 hand massage for 450MAD. Don't rush through this - allow plenty of time to relax and enjoy!

T & B. Loved our experience here, would have gone back the following day for another treatment had we had the time. Book in advance and take a magazine as there is always "relaxing" time by the pool before your hammam.

WONDERFUL. I will strongly recommend this wonderful hammam because I think is the best one in all Marrakech.You are really pampering there, the staff is friendly and professional. The local are well decorated in Moroccan design style and everything is very clean.The price is a bit higher compare other hamman but if you are looking for a VIP treatment, this is the right place!The only negative thing is that you have to book long time in advance in you will be sure to find a place.

Excellent Spa. A marvellous Spa off a dusty square on a par with any in a 5 star hotel. My boyfriend and I had a 'double' Hammam and massage that lasted a couple of hours. So invigorating, so relaxing, such value for money! Advise to book in advance.

Paradise and great escape. We booked the 3 hour treatment including a hamman, pedicure, massage .... and in hinsight should have gone for a full day. This place is heaven on earth and for European standards very reasonably priced! An oasis of calm, great treatments and great smells within the city centre
Les Bains de Marrakech. Book ahead or you will be disappointed! Lovely, exotic and calming. Very friendly staff.

A calm sanctuary. Beautiful quiet setting, and the staff were friendly and helpful. A very traditional spa, set just within the city walls with an intimate feeling. The cool rooms to relax in after you treatment were set off by the multi-coloured lanterns hanging everywhere. You do need to book well in advance however.

Pure Heaven. If you are ever in Marrakech you must have a massage at Les Bains. It was bliss!!! The place is stunning and furnished beautifully. As soon as you enter, the music and ambience starts to soothe you. The staff are amazing and truly professional. We had the full works, body scrub and full body massage. The massage was the best I have ever had and this is coming from a person who is not usually comfortable with having a massage. Afterwards we relaxed in a room where they bought us tea and little cakes. I only wish I could transport this place back to my home town as I would got there every week.
Best massage ever. A really excellent place - also easy to find. If you ask the taxi to drop you off at the nearby city gate, it is immediately on your right as you talk through the gate entrance
Heaven. What more can I say, restfull, invigorating and traditional
1001 night. We had a hamman massage treatment and had a wonderful time. Its truly an experience and worth the extra money. You will enjoy yourselfe.

Les Bains Massage. We were fortunate that the proprietor of the Riad we were staying at In Marrakech accompanied us to Les Bains. We would otherwise not have found it so easily!We had booked prior 5- for. 45 minute massage. It was truly a magical, exotic experience.Initially we were taken to a u dressing room with lockers to store your clothes and valuables. We changed into huge, absorbent robes before being led to the massage room. The massage was indulgent and all body over. I especially enjoyed the upper shoulder, neck and face massage. On cessation of the treatment, a towel covered your body, the light dimmed and you were left for 10 minutes to absorb the tranquillity of the surroundings! Later you were escorted to a Lou ge bed area and offered sweet mint tea and Moroccan biscuits. You could relax as long as you wishes before walking back to the change room, showering and changing back into street clothes.A truly indulgent and magical massage experience! Beautiful and exotic interior to the establishment. Highly recommended.

What a result!!. We quite literally stumbled upon this little gem and thank the lord we did. We thought it would be worth asking what time we could get an appointment for, lo and behold they said right now if you like, so we did.Very comfortable, very professional and extremely relaxing. Highly recommended to all, great value for money to boot!!

Luxurious relaxation and pampering. I got taken here as a birthday treat, and its one of the most beautiful spas I've ever been too. The decor and atmosphere was impeccable and as soon as we stepped in, I instantly felt relaxed. We had a private room and booked in for the soap scrubs and massages, both of which was excellent, my skin felt amazing for the next few days. All the luxurious little touches like the thick white robes, the getting to sit back and relax with mint tea and petit fours really made an experience to remember.

dream comes true. My girlfriend and I had a fantastic relaxing afternoon in this 5* hammam! Make sure you book in advance as they do not allow too many people in at the same time.. It is located a few minutes walk from the square, in a wondefully refurbished riad. We chose the "relaxing package" (scrab + roses bath + massage. higly recommended!). Service is exellent, atmosphere is quite and relaxing.. a dream in the middle of the chaotic Marrakesh!

Do not miss this. This was the best massage of my life, it cost a bit more than the other baths but was clean and worth every penny. absolutely brilliant. Around Morocco Travels was also fantastic for trips and tour guides!
Total relaxation. Sheer luxury, clean and beautifully appointed. The hamman and massage were wonderful. A perfect finale to our holiday.

Highly recommended. The owner / manager is wonderful and all over things which is brilliant! I loved my massage.... on the hammam be ready to be left in the room for periods (different that US spa treatments) and the baths are lovely, but you will want to request extra hot water.

Very relaxing. We had a hamman which was relaxing, but maybe could have been scrubbed a little more than we were. There was a lot of waiting around. I had the lymphatic drainage massage and my friend had a 4 hander which were both brilliant. Lots of time to relax after in different lounging areas. We were sitting around the pool in the courtyard waiting for our treatments, having a lit of a giggle as it was a girly trip and a chap on the top floor stuck his head out of a window and told us to be quite as people were having a massage. Bit of a party pooper as we were not that loud. Apart from that the spa was great.
Wonderful Treatments. The treatments are a bit pricey but really top quality.
good place. we had a maroccan hammam with a massage and was goodthe body scrub and clay mask was very nice

Absolute heaven. I'm going to go back to Marrakech fo a weekend purely to visit this place. It is absolutely fantastic. I didn't realise there was this kind of luxury in this world. We went for the hamman followed by a draining massage and a hot stone. The hot stone was a little pointless though - wish i'd gone for the hot towel massage- my mum said it was wonderful.You must must must visit this place. Yes it is a bit pricier than others but there is no way they could compare. The whole day cost me less than an hours cheap massage at home.

Excellent service. Excellent service and reasonable price. The place is not easy to find but managed to locate in the end. Friendly staff, clean place, very relaxing.I would be happy to recommend this place if you are looking for a traditional hammam.

Very good experience. Had hammam, scrub and massage here - the steam room was very hot and I was left there a bit too long. The staff have a tendency to wander off/leave the door open so you might not get the privacy you expect and be left hanging for a bit - though that was my experience, I would still recommend - a good experience and good value for money.

Lovely spa, great for escape from hectic city!. Had a traditional hammam here - steam room was extremely hot and exfoliation was VERY rough! Skin felt lovely afterwardsthough. Wished we had stayed longer and had a massage as place wasreally relaxing, including a little pool where you could lie andrelax.

A wonderful spa experience!. My husband and I booked in for joint hammams and a 1 hour massage in February (offered under the services menu as "The Traditional One". We both chose "relaxing" massage. *Tip to ladies (and gents) wear a dark colored bathing suit if possible.
