Especially if you choose an option with a plant masque - the plant goop is very dark colored and I'm not sure it'll ever rinse out completely from my suit!The hammam itself is gorgeous and decorated in traditional Moroccan style. The place is simply ENORMOUS with room after room! Like any spa, it is soflty lit, and smells AMAZING. My husband and I don't speak french very well, but luckily both ladies at the desk who helped with our reservation and check in spoke english.Upon arrival, we were taken to separate dressing rooms to change into our bathing suits and put our belongings in a locker. As other reviewers have mentioned, keep some dhs in your robe pocket as you will not be able to go back to get tips!After changing we were taken to a steam room of sorts, where I was instructed to take off my swim top. Being naked in the presence of strangers is NOT my thing (esp with the hubs in the room.......just weird for me!) so I insisted on keeping it on, which was met with confusion, but she eventually let me be. We were showered off under a shower in the room, and left to soak for about 10 minutes.10 minutes later, our attendant came back and slathered us in black soap. We were then left to bake another 10 minutes. Upon returning we were VIGOROUSLY scrubbed and watched the dead skin just melt away (yes, it's gross...but that's the whole point!). I'm actually glad I left the top ON otherwise she might have scrubbed my "chest" right off!!!After the scrub, we rinsed off the goo under the shower, and were covered with a plant masque ...(face too) and then left to soak for yet another 10 minutes, before a final shower off. I walked out of that hammam with my skin soft and glowing.As a bonus, they rinse and wrap up the mitten ("kessa" glove) that they use for the scrub down, for you to keep, which I have used in the shower at home MANY time since with great results!We were then directed to a waiting lounge of sorts, with lots of beds paired together, and separated by wooden screens. We lazed about for around 20 minutes, eating cookies and drinking bottled water and mint tea while we waited for our massage.Then we were collected by 2 masseuses and lead upstairs for the massage portion. We had booked in for a "relaxing" massage, versus a "draining" massage.The massage was THOROUGH. I literally don't think she missed an inch (yes ladies...this means FRONT too...the WHOLE front). My only complaint (my fault!) was that the "relaxing" massage was little more than a rub down. I would've loved a bit more firmness, but it WAS relaxing all the same. Just not my typical preference for massages, but for $60 for the whole she-bang...you can't really complain!After our massage, we were lead back down to the "lounge" area, more tea/water/cookies and were left on our own to lay around as long as we like. Once we decided to get up (before we fell asleep) we headed back to the dressing rooms and I enjoyed a final shower, in a beautiful private shower stall with glistening gold fixtures and an assortment of moroccan shampoos and body washes that all smelled divine!The "spa" is really top notch. It is spacious and beautifully decorated. We never felt rushed. The facility was spotless and the masseuses/spa ladies were very professional. It was an excellent value. The only thing I regret is the timing (we shouldve done this on the LAST day, instead of heading back for another day in the heat and dust of Marrakech!) and I do wish I had booked in for the "draining" massage instead, for something a bit firmer.I would highly recommend this spa!
A great SPA. Quite, good service. The massage very good. You can go walking from fnaa square.
CLASS. This was near our Riad in the Kasabh area of Marrakech,it is i think the best Hammam/Spa in town a touch of class.
It is amazing. Try a fabulous day at Les Bain de Marrakech I always go!
very good. the Bains de Marrakech very good place to relax after the tour of city.
Lovely European treatments. They were very accomodating to our group. We sort of took opver the spa for an entire afternoon.
Like Aladdin's Cave. Brilliant. Once in a life time spa!Spent half a day here and I could have spent a week
Amazing. What a treat........... Still dreaming about it........ Wish could have stay longer

Incredible Place!. This spa is like a Morrocan Tardis, the corridors and rooms just appear to go on for ever. Booking and checking in was simple and they accept credit cards which was a big bonus. We chose a Hammam with black soap scrub followed by a relaxing massage. After you get changed you are transported into another time and place. The soft music, low lighting and incredible steam rooms make you feel as if you have stepped back 400 years. From there we were taken on another journey, first a relaxing mint tea and water and then along and up to our massage room. A great way to unwind in this manic city, a real must!

Very authentic setting, absolutely professional. From reception, where they welcome you in a very friendly and professional manner, to the lady that accompanies you to the dressing rooms to the massage, everything runs smooth at Les Bains de Marrakech. A beautiful place, neatly organised with statt that speaks very good English and French. Absolutely to be recommended!

Bath excellent; massage overpriced. We stayed for the traditional program, which includes baths and massage. The bath is an incredibly stimulating experience, which allows you rest from the psycadelic city. The massage was fine, but we found it overpriced and you can get a similar massage in many other places.

Everything you want from a spa. Professional and friendly staff, beautiful surroundings and a first rate hamman and massage. It was the perfect way to spend my birthday and I would definitely recommend spending a few hours here when you are in Marrakech.

...And relax!!. The building itself is lovely, very clean and classy. You feel as soon as you walk through the door that you are going to have a lovely experience. My husband and I had both a traditional hamman and a relaxing massage. Felt very chilled after it (once you have gotten over the fact that you are topless for the hamaan!!!) and you are given the scrub mit to take home too as a gift. What a lovely experience in a lovely environment.
Where to take care of you. Typical and wonderfull place where to find peace and quiet and to enjoy the hamman and the massage

A Fantastic and Relaxing Experience. The traditional Hamman and scrub was a great deal and a fun and relaxing experience. The spa was very luxurious, extremely clean, the staff friendly and I only wish I had booked a massage too!
An oasis in Marrakech. Loved relaxing by the pool with a fresh stawberry juice. Then off for a Hammam and what heaven that was, and the perfect end was a relaxing massage. A must do in Marrakech.

Absolutely amazing - make sure you book!. Absolutely fantastic Hamman and massage with very friendly service. Professional, clean and with everything you need - including refreshing tea and water before, during and after. Recommend you do the hamman, scrub, mask and massage. You get a private hamman and massage room for two. Very good price for the service - several spas in europe could learn a thing or two! Tips:- bring conditioner, hair brush and deo - they have shampoo, shower gel and hair dryers. You won't need moisturiser! - bring a swimsuit - they have electronic lockers to leave your things - no need for flip flops , robe or towels - they provide everything

Wonderful setting, very relaxing. My boyfriend and I booked in for a Hamman and a massage on the last day of our trip (book in advance as they fill up) and what a wonderful experience it was. Relaxation in a steam room, then a traditional body scrub with black soap (vigourous) and more relaxation before a shower. Mint tea and morrocan pastries served in the relaxation room before being escorted to a room for a lovely relaxing massage. Would definitely recommend.
Hamman Heaven. Best massage ever, I enjoyed a very relaxing time here with te girls.
scrub. great hamam, had a traditional scrub with the lovely argan oil to finish. Skin felt great, good price and beautiful rooms. highly recommended.
GOOD AND CLEAN. Wonderful experience, would definitely revisit and recommend

value tranquility in dream like Moroccan surroundings. One of my workmates had been to Marrakech a few months ahead of me and suggested I get a Hammam at Les Bains. On my last day there I had been quad biking in the morning and was at loose ends for the afternoon. I felt I had seen most of what I had set out to see and remembered the tip about the Spa. I went to scout it out and found it just around the corner from the Sadian Tombs. They were kind enough to fit me in despite not having a reservation (top tip - make a reservation as this is a popular place and although it worked out for me I think it was only a bit of luck). I booked in for a standard Hammam and was shown into the changing rooms which were very smart. I was then robed up and shown to a courtyard plunge pool and sipped some tea listening to the singing birds. I was then taken to my Hammam room, and showered under some cold water. I was left to relax for 15min and then was soaped up and left again for another 15min. I was then rubbed with a mit like sandpaper and then showered off all my dead skin. I was then doused in oil and robed up again. I was shown into a very nice relaxation room and brough tea and bottled water. After about 30min of peaceful reflection I changed and paid. (150 dh has got to be the deal of the year for me) You get a lot for your money here! They show you out the back door so I had to weave my way back to the front door to collect my girlfriend who was waiting in the lobby. I was in trouble as she thought I had slipped out passed her and went out shopping (they kindly gave me a plastic bag for my wet swimsuit). All in all I really belive I couldn't have ended the trip in a better way and the setting and facilities are top notch. The cooridors are darkly lit with beautiful Moroccan lamps, at times you are greeted by the smell of incense, and the sounds of trickling water. A treat to the senses and I would without a doubt do it again. I did say as I was leaving, if I had done it on the first day I would have been tempted to do it every day of my visit.
WONDERFUL. I had a marvelous time at Les Bains de Marrakech and went there three times during my 10 day stay! Magical, beautiful, relaxing, exotic, and some of the best massages I've ever had.

Loved this spa. After reading various reviews about spas in Marrakesh, I'm very glad I chose les bains de Marrakesh. A must is the hamam experience where you start in a steam room and are washed and scrubbed and polished and get an argan oil hair treatment, then massaged beautifully in the next room . The massage was totally relaxing I would hily recommend.

Excellent Spa. This was my first time to a traditional HAMMAN, it was like being a 5 year old and being washed by an adult it was really cool though my skin felt like a new born baby at the end. I am not one for massages’ but it was great and I had lots of energy after... they give you tea, water and local cakes/sweet to eat as well... will do that again
Nice and relaxing experience!. I had my first hamam experience here. It has been very good and at a very convenient fare. Try it !
The Hammam. Great Hammam and massage, nice location and service

professional and hygienic. Clean, up market ,never rushed , i thought massage would go on and on ,all towels, lockers,robes provided, Menu of spa options, his and hers room .well presented staff good value ,water ,tea biscuits included.
Relaxing. Relaxing treatments in a beautiful riad. Good value for money when compared to spas in Europe.
Relaxing!. Great little find. They accomodated a group of 10 which was great for us.

A pampering, luxurious experience, at a very reasonable price.. I wanted to experience a hammam, but was a bit nervous about it, and came here on a friend's recommendation, bolstered by the comments on this site. It was awesome. Very comfortable for a novice like myself. People were lovely, the spa itself is beautiful beyond expectations. It was relaxing and so tranquil there, in rather marked contrast to the part of Marrakesh in which it is located. I had the hammam, scrub, clay mask and a one-hour massage, and enjoyed every minute. After changing (choice of wearing a bathing suit or underwear), I spent a few minutes in a lovely garden courtyard waiting for my treatment to begin. My private hammam cabin looked like an exotic cave with white chaises against the walls, and the lady who took care of me was very professional and lovely. I was comfortably warm, well scrubbed, very happy with that experience. The cool shower after to remove the clay mask felt good, and was followed by a rest on a chaise in an interior courtyard, complete with billowing curtains and black pierced lamps and sconces, and even a cup of mint tea. The massage was in a restful, elegant space, with just candlelight during the massage. Another rest in an interior courtyard with mint tea and cookies ended the experience. All for a price of an average massage in far less exotic surroundings back home. Happy camper.
luxury. Friendly staff, calm atmosphere, lovely setting and a great experience

Hamman and massage. Very relaxing, clean and peaceful. Maybe a little bit like an efficient Hamman production line - if felt a like numbers through the door mattered more than the actual people. Massage was fabulous.

Very relaxing. We had a traditional duo hamman. The staff made the whole experience seamless and we left feeling very ralaxed. More expensive than other spas in Marrakech, but very good value for money compared to the same experience in England.
Relaxing. We spent a wonderful afternoon at this place witch was recommended by a friend , it was not cheap but worth it !
Too good!. It was told us being the best hammam of Marrakech; very relaxing experience
Luxury relaxation. Fantastic setting and lovely staff - quality spa experience

Fantastic oasis of calm in the middle of a hetic city. The service was first class as soon as we walked through the door. Staff were very attentive. The hamman was private so my husband and I could enjoy the experience together. We didn't feel rushed. There was time to relax before and after the hamman. We choose to have massages and these were also done very professionally in the same room. Afterwards there was time to relax, drink mint tea and wish we were staying longer. Great value for money.

A great experience. we were delighted, my wife and I with the combination "ham am + massage"....so beautiful, very cosy...The people are very nice and smiling, they offer you the typical mint tea...nice.Open your eyes wides because it's a beautiful, kind of luxury building.The best regret is we didn't have time to make it twice (or more) during our stay in Marrakesh.I would do it everyday !
european vision of a hammam. european prices, very small steam room, good masseuses and a charming experience after all;if you want a more exclusive one go to the beldi country club spa, my favorite

High quality Hamam. The best spa in Marrakech. Due to cultural difference more comortable to female than male visitors, but you'll find that in every Hamam. Little rough round the edges, though vefry relaxing and enjoyable.

Pre-booked couples Spa. I give this place a hearty 5/5. We thoroughly enjoyed our hammam/massage treatments and found the staff very friendly and helpful, whilst the spa itself was idillicly peaceful and very tastefully decorated. Upon leaving les Bains the wind felt different on our skin and we spent the whole evening in a very relaxed state of mind. Outstanding.The place was sold out on the day so be sure to book in advance. You reserve online and within afew days you will be emailed regarding a paypal deposit. This proved to be no hassel at all and guarentees you this 5* treatment.
Excellent relaxing afternoon. Great surrondings........ came out felling 'floaty'
The best and reasonably priced. The best deal in town, but don't tell anyone as they are always booked as it is
European Spa Treatments. A bit pricey, but very good treatments. Be sure to book ahead as they always seem to be busy.

Well scrubbed. Had a brilliant silver anniversary at les bains. It was good being able to be with your partner for the wash and the massage. There are assistants around to guide you around the confusing warren of corridors. The look of the place is very good. The wash was done by two women, and was pretty vigorous. The steam we cooked in stayed just on the right side of bearable/unbearable. The massage was excellent, although I wouldn't have minded it a little firmer. (There was choice of draining or relexaing massage, and we chose draining. But it was still relaxing enough to send one of us to sleep!) Small cakes and tea were served.I found the changing rooms less plush than the rest of the place. There was nowhere to put my shampoo in the showers (and, after the head part of the full body massage, my hair was full of massage oil). And the lockers were simply too small and had no hangers, so coat, dress and all had to be bundled up and squeezed on top of boots and bag. (Presumably if you go in the summer, you'd have fewer clothes to cram in, but it would still be nice to be able to hang them.) Also, there were no toilets attached to the changing rooms; there were elsewhere along a corridor.I would love to go again!
A superb experience!. We had a couples treatment. The place is relaxing, staff were friendly, professional and very efficient. A fantastic experience and one I would definitely repeat again!
Best In Marrakech. Simply the best spa in marrakech, The price is not to bad compered to uk prices.
AMAZING. We had a couples treatment and LOVED it. So relaxing.
Great experience. Organized, timely and very good service. The massage was excellent. Good value.
bliss :-). Fantastic luxury, I recommend this hammam 100%. Good value for money and the draining massage was the best massage I have ever had in my life!

Highly highly recommended...great experience. I deliberated over which spa to go to for ages and eventually decided on this after the great reviews on here.I was not disappointed. My boyfriend and I had the hammam couples treatment. We thought about massages, but didn't want to spend a whole half a day at a spa as we had so many other things planned.The spa was great. We turned up and were lucky enough to get appointments straight away. We really enjoyed the whole experience. The changing rooms were lovely, the staff professional, and the treatment great.Afterwards you are allowed as much time as you like to relax, you are given cookies, bottled water and mint tea. I thought this was excellent value for money and if I had been there longer would have booked to go back.I often go to spas in the UK and felt this was a good experience of a Moroccan treatment with a western spa twist.
AMAZING SPA A HIGH RECOMMENDATION. It was amazing the staff were so welcoming and friendly and also the service was 5 star it was like a very expensive spa in london you have to go.

Pampering essential. This is a beautiful building, where you are pampered and treated with the most lovely products by skilful staff. Both before and after your treatment, you've given time to relax and sip excellent Moroccan tea in wonderful surroundings. The art of the lamp makers is on show - the beautiful patterns cast on the walls through the intricate lacework patterns is simply gorgeous. No matter what treatment you choose, you will LOVE it.

Great surroundings, good treatment but a bit impersonal.... I have mixed feelings regarding this place.The decor is beautiful in a pared down traditional Moroccan way, low lighting and beautiful scents.The hammam and gomage part of the treatment was very professional.The massage itself was 'ok' but the treatment rooms are very small a la sardine can and you can hear most of what is going on around you which does somewhat diminish the experience. I think the problem here is they are basically offering a pretty slick hammam experience for tourists in a busy part of town and it has a tinge of spa factory about it. You even go in the front door and come out the back door at the other end! Maybe they just need to ease back on the number of treatment rooms or get larger premises!Having said that at 1000DH for 2 people to have a hammam and one hour massage it isn't bad value compared to what one would pay back in blighty...

Totally amazing experience.... We went to the spa on a hen party with 3 other girls. Service was excellent. They were so friendly and helpful and couldnt do enough for us. We had the 1/2 day spa package which we booked in advance for a hammam, salt scrub, clay body wrap and 1 hour massage. AMAZING. They will ask you to go topless but it's up to you what you do. Great value for money and absolutely beautiful place. Well worth a visit,
Everything was perfect. Everything was perfect and the people very friendly
Great day of relaxing. Beautiful interior and professional spa. Hammam and massage were great. Well worth it. Value for money.

Dissappointing for the price. I went here with 4 other girlfriend and we had mixed feelings about it. My personal experience Positive points:-Beautiful decor-Delicious pastries they serve you before and after your treatmentsNegative points:The lady who did my nails didn't do a great job (not what you would expect for the price - European prices).The room was really cold where I got my facial done, as were the creams. Because I had just gotten my nails done I couldn't put my hands under the blankets. I didn't feel relaxed at all.The hot stone massage was welcome warmth after the previous treatment. The lady wasn't very friendly and I was more worried about being burnt by the stones (quite hot on sensitve areas such as soles of feet and inner thigh).I just didn't feel like I had a really nice "pamper" like I had hoped I was going to have, spending hours in the spa.I would look into going to a different spa the next time I go to Marrakech.

Moorish Fantasy. This is like some vision of an Arabian dream. Cool tiled corridors surround pools and fountains. Big timber doors with fine carved inlays. Lying on day beds being served with sweet tea by beautiful women with dark eyes.It was not cheap - but good experiences of this kind rarely are. A relaxing massage in a private room with decor inspired by harems. So different from the restful spas of Asia or the clinical environments of the west. This was pure Moroccan - but pure bliss.
best in the city. tried a few at this price range and found this one the best
intimate. a lovely little hammum, it was a perfect mix of luxury and personal touch, the staff are amazing and the massages are perfect and I am massage therapist myself..

Surprising experience!. My boyfriend and I went for a Hammam together, we had no problems booking on the day, staff were friendly and we got an appointment for two hours later that day. It wasn't very busy and they accepted our request to let us go in the pool even though it was cold and it was January. They brought us mint tea to warm up and then took us to a private room.We had friendly attendants but because nothing was explained it was a rather baffling experience. Including the moment when she removed the top of my swimming costume! Then we were left in the room, soaped up and I began to overheat. My boyfriend was fine. Then she returned with another attendant and I experienced a very vigorous and extensive body scrub while my boyfriend experienced a less invasive clean. We were showered off and oiled up and taken to relax in a cool room and brought more tea. As an experience I would advise those (who like me) are uncomfortable with nudity in front of strangers to be wary. However it did give me a good holiday story to tell my friends! Altogether though quite stressful and un-relaxing first spa treatment experience, though my boyfriend found it very relaxing.
review. We found it to be very clean , value for money. We really enjoyed this experience, and found it very relaxing would definately reccommend it and would go again

best way to end a holiday. The service was excellent and very welcoming. the treatments were very good and the overall experience was brilliant. I couldnt have wanted to end a holiday in any better way.

Escape the hustle and bussle. Based in an inconspicuous area in the old city, this Spa produces an immediate surprise as soon as you set foot in the building. For 550MAD which is £41 I had a traditional body scrub and massage. The staff at the Spa were extremely nice and helpful which immediately made you feel at ease. The interior is extremely modern, clean, whilst a feeling of relaxing. My girlfriend and I started with a sauna then a body scrub that removed a lot of skin then had a mud cream put on us, this lasts for about 45 minutes. We were then put in a room with some mint tea to relax before the massage. The massage lasted for about 1 hour 15 minutes and was very relaxing throughout, covering head to toe. I am not one for a spa experience but can say that this was extremely enjoyable and would highly recommend this place if you have a few hours spare.

Gorgeous oasis. The decor is beautiful, service great, all in all a delightful experience. Thoroughly relaxing and they didn't skimp on anything. Lots of bottled water, mint tea, cookies at the end. Fresh towels a-plenty, candles, fragrant flowers. I had a great firm massage after the hammam treatment - an extra 100dr but worth it.

Beautiful ambience, clean & relaxing.... After reading great reviews on TripAdvisor & a recommendation on a Fashion blog I follow, I decided to book a relaxing afternoon/evening at Les Bains de Marrakech.Since I was visiting with my partner, after reading the reviews & looking at the website, I decided to book us in for the couples 'Traditional duos', which consisted of the usual Hammam, Gommage, Scrub & Seaweed wrap, with an hour-long massage, which worked out just under £45 each.I pre-booked online, picked the package, date & time I wanted & received an e-mail (in French - EEP!) back with a different time in the subject line, so do take note of that when you book. I know enough French to know it was a Paypal payment of a 50% deposit... & there was a link to click, which took me to Paypal (also the French version, but after signing in all I had to do was keep clicking the next/confirm payment button).We walked to the spa from the main square & all we knew was to head towards the Kasba. I asked a traffic cop for directions en route & he confirmed that we just had to head through the Kasba & it would be the first Hammam we saw.When we entered the Kasba, we thought that the Spa couldn't possibly be nearby. The roads were dirty, smelly, litter was everywhere, the shops were dire, it was like we'd stepped back a few centuries. We carried on through the Kasba & as soon as we'd walked a couple of minutes & reached the other side, there was a sign for Les Bains de Marrakech, pointing down an alley. We followed the sign & were happily surprised to see a beautiful entrance with red carpet, rose petals etc. Once inside, the receptionist asked me whether we'd like relaxing massages or draining massages, then told us to take a seat. Before long, somebody came out of a curtained doorway & told us to come through. We were given a gown & sandals, led to a waiting area & shown lockers & told to change into underwear & the gown. I'd highly recommend a bikini instead of underwear, though (unless you're a man, of course).Somebody came to get us & led us to a waiting area - a room with 4 beds covered in white towels - and sat back to relax while they bought us Moroccan Mint Tea. Shortly after, we were led into a small dimly-lit room, with plastic-covered beds on opposite walls & were told to sit down on each bed, topless. I'm quite comfortable with my body, but thought the way she said it was a bit strange. However, I adopted a 'when in Rome' attitude & stripped off down to my bikini bottoms.Then, an older woman threw buckets of warm water on us, then we were left shut in the room without a word & steam started to generate. Not knowing what was going on, when she'd come back or what to expect next, was as funny as it was confusing. 5 minutes later, she came back in, covered us head-to-toe in a brown sticky goo, then left again. More steam, more baking. After around 10 minutes, I had to go & open the door to cool down. The woman arrived shortly after & scrubbed us head-to-toe with what felt like a scouring pad. More water splashes, then the seaweed wrap. Except that this was less of a 'wrap' as it was just smothering me in it. Again, she left & more steam flooded in.After another 10 minutes, I was starting to feel like a crackling pork roast & went to open the door again, except that it didn't cool me down much. Just outside the door was a shower, so I turned it on. The woman showed up again, led me back into the little room and threw some cold buckets of water over us. Then led us to the shower.I walked into the shower and no sooner had the water hit my face, when I felt someone pull my bikini bottoms down. I turned around & my partner was in hysterics, the woman even laughed at my knee-jerk reaction & I carried on 'in Rome'. After smothering me in shower gel, washing me ALL over & giving my armpits a tickle, she motioned me to put my bikini bottoms back on, then the robe, then the sandals. Then did the same for my partner.We were then led to another waiting room upstairs, with only 2 beds in it... & brought more Moroccan tea. After 5 minutes, we were led to separate rooms & the hour-long massage commenced.I was massaged from head-to-toe & everything in between, front & back, for an hour. The massage itself was pleasant, the ambience was peaceful & it was a nice touch that when I was face-down, instead of looking at a plain floor, there was a big bowl full of rose petals on it.The one complaint I had about my massage (which I've seen more than once on other TripAdvisor reviews) was that my masseuse was yawning & coughing every few minutes. Instead of relaxing, I was too busy thinking about the germs that were now flying around the room, & since the windows & doors were closed, I was paranoid about acquiring said cough.After an hour, I was left in the room for 5 minutes without a word, then the lights were turned on on Miss Cough-a-lot's return, indicating the end of the massage. She gave me a new robe, led me next door to find my other half, then we were led into a beautiful room with 8 beds in this time, 4 on each wall, facing each other, & a water feature in the centre of the room, filled with rose petals - truly beautiful! There were other couples sitting chatting, & then we were all bought more Moroccan tea & some cookies.We chose to leave shortly after, we were led back to the changing area & made our way out, feeling very relaxed. Paid the other 50% of the payment on my way out.One tip - because of the size of the spa, it's inconvenient to return to your locker at any stage. If you intend to give a tip (which you will), make sure you take it in the pocket of your robe.
very nice. Quite expensive, but it deserves it! Very nice the treatmets to do by couple

This is what I hope Heaven is like. This is what I hope Heaven is likeI spent the best 5 hours in my life in this amazing place, and we did not even realise that it had been that long.We went for the "Les Day spa" with the facial.I came in looking a tired and drab 33 and left looking and feeling like a energised 23 years young!!Most of the pictures here don't do the place justice. (it is really hard taking good photos as the light is difficult to recreate) Go to their website for a little better feel of the place. I really felt like a 1001 nights princess, being pampered for my birthday.The girls do chatter a bit.. But everything else really makes up for it.The treatments, the tea and biscuits, the atmosphere, I will go back again and again and again!

Just what we needed. booked 2 hour session of scrub and massage and were there for 3 hours with relaxing bits in between treatment with mint tea and tiny sweets. My husband and I had both treatments in the same room together, would highly recommend, although don't take your best costume as oils hard to get out.

Super relaxing treatment!. The gommage was really fantastic, my skin was so smooth afterwards - massage could have been firmer but my boyfriend loved his - afterwards we felt super relaxed, it was one of my favourite days/evenings of our stay.

Get naked and scrubbed. We did a couples package in Dec. 2011. Our feedback- ladies get naked, just go with it... they say to change into your bathing suit but I had mine on for about 2 minutes. We were scrubbed painfully, slipping off weird mats, then both of our massage therapists had colds and were sneezing and wiping their noses the entire time..it's a beautiful building, all tourists of course, and ok priced.

OHHHHHHH.............. Ok......this was not on my list of things to do in Marrakech, but after three hours of being washed, scrubbed, pulled and poked at and an hour of very strong hands teasing out strained and tight muscles, this was probably my favourite activity in Marrakech. I have never slept as soundly as I did that evening and my skin felt as it it was glowing for days. Well worth the gentle teasing to get me there and I look forward to doing it again.
Amazing. The cost of the treatment was exellent value for money. My friends and I were sooo relaxed when we left.

Impersonal, unattentive massage which left me like an oil slick. We decided to take a quick massage at Les Bains de Marrakech before our flight out of Morocco. Unfortunately, despite the treatment menu offering a large variety of massages, we were not asked about our preferences or requirements on arrival, and simply whisked into the experience like pieces of meat on a production line. I had showered prior to arriving and wanted to tell my masseuse not to put oil in my hair or on my face, because I had to catch a plane, but was not given any opportunity to speak to anybody about my requirements. The masseuses were lazy (they sat down for much of the massage, with their shoes off, and spent about 15 minutes of a 1 hour massage massaging my hair, which was not enjoyable), and used so much oil (baby oil or olive oil...something that didn't smell nice) that I felt like I was a piece of meat about to be grilled. When they massaged my face, oil went into my eyes, which wouldn't stop weeping the rest of the day. We were not given disposable underwear (as we were at Mythic Oriental Spa, a much nicer experience), so our own undergarments were covered with oil after the experience. I needed to shower again between the massage and my flight as I was dripping with oil, top to toe. The time spent on massaging the upper back and shoulders was quite enjoyable, but it was too small a portion of the massage and was overshadowed by the uncomfortable experience of being lathered in so much oil that it was nearly humiliating. If you want personalised, attentive service and an enjoyable massage with (a small amount of) scented oil, go to Mythic Oriental Spa instead.
Incredible experience. Fantastic atmoshpere, relaxing spa, very well organised!

Amazing!. This is something you cannot miss in Marrakesh. It is one of the most relaxing places I have been in my life. The hamman was great and the massage excellent. Staff are very professional and timely. I did not like the music though. I think they could play Moroccon music instead. I really think those kind of new age tracks they play are boring and repetitive. But this is not going to make your experience less enjoyable. Just don't pay attention to the music if it is the case.
Very Good.. the spa is more European than Moroccan and the price is high than the traditonal hammams. But good experience and they take credit cards
relaxation. fantastic spa - very relaxing, great way to start off or end a holiday
Great way to start a vacation!. My wife and I did the couples Hammam and Massage. It was invigorating and relaxing.

Total bliss!. Perhaps not authentic, and all the clients seemed to be European or American, but it's a gorgeous and very upmarket hammam/spa where my partner and I were able to enjoy a bath and scrub in the same room. And we left feeling shiny and new and far more relaxed than when we'd arrived. Highly recommended and not really very expensive for the fantastic service and ambience.

calm and luxurious experience. the experience was really nice. everything was calm there, the treatments i had were a body scrub, hammam and one hour relaxing massage. all were done with professionalism and within beautiful surroundings. the spa is a calm haven from the bustling city and was really good value for money compared to what you would pay in europe. i will definitely go back next time i am in marrakech.

Absolute treat to yourself. We loved the 1001 night environment and the way we had to go from treatment to rest areas with tea to another treatment. We had 2 treatments and felt totally spoiled and renewed after the 3 hours at les bains de Marrakech. The total experience can't be matched by MK spa,which is much smaller and not really a dedicated hammam; you can better go for dinner there!

an oasis. My daughter and I spent the morning at the spa. We had the 3 hours of treatments. We first both had the hamman scrub. A shock to the system to have water thrown at you! But a nice shock. we were scrubbed down with the black soap and after many rinses and soaping we felt like new. After this we both had a relaxing massage. Bliss. Then my daughter had the hot stone massage and I had a facial. I enjoyed it and found it relaxing though I think it was quite average as far as a facial goes.

If you like Spa's and Massages I am sure you will love it.. We booked into this place before arriving in Marrakech, we booked a scrub, body massage and then I had a facial and my husband had the hot stones. We were showed the changing rooms and then taken into a Steam type room, I was asked to remove my bikini top, which fine, but I don't overly like exposing my top half to people I don't know! However I went along with it, they then drenched us with buckets of warm water and left us in the room! They came back about 10 mins later and put a body scrub all over us, and went off again. They returned used a hammam scrub all over us, which was quite hard and went off again, then we had a mud scrub put all over us and we were left for about 20 mins, boiling hot! They then rinsed us down. I was glad to get out of there it was becoming to hot and we were left for so long, it didnt really do much for me. We were then moved to 2 seperate massage rooms, the massage was nice enough, they are quite gentle certainly not like the south east asians do it, but depends what you like. There was a lot of giggling going on at one point, and our ladies went out to see what the laughing was about, and promptly joined in laughing and whispering, it was clearly at someone which wasn't very professional. I then had the facial which was nice enough but again she kept leaving the room? My husband said his hot stones massage was the best bit. I liked it and it was nice and relaxing, but I don't love this sort of thing and probably wouldn't go back. We paid about £75 each.

Top-of-the-line indulgence. We knew we wanted to end our stay in Marrakech with a hammam, and this place was recommended to us by the owner of the riad where we stayed (Riad Eden, which was terrific, by the way).This place is definitely upscale, although still relatively inexpensive. The building is 8 years old (we asked), and is built beautifully, in the same style as the rest of old Marrakech. We were pampered from the start, and even allowed to have our hammam in the same room, which was great. Tea and a cookie during the interim... then a full-body, one-hour massage. At the end, another tea in a beautiful, giant room where we decompressed for 10 minutes.All in all, this was super relaxing, and well worth the cost. It wasn't a traditional hammam, but the service and the experience were exceptional.

Money well spent! Pure Luxury. My boyfriend and I booked the bath & full massage before we flew out - which I would recommend doing as when we went it was fully booked three days in advance and the phone was constantly ringing.The whole experience was amazing and very relaxing. The building itself was decorated and set out wonderfully so you really felt that you were transported into a moroccan paradise.The oriental bath was heavenly! Such a romantic thing to do as a couple, but would recommend to anybody. The full body massage, was again heavenly. 10/10!!

Over-priced, poor service. We were abandoned for a long time while waiting in a room. We were offered no tea or refreshments and almost left mid treatment. It is a clean place. Staff moderately helpful (except for our scrubber Jamila who was great). Impersonal conveyer-belt service. The manager apologised and offered discount but ended up being charged full price anyway. Will be in no hurry to go there again.

Perfect end to our trip. We scheduled this for the last day of our trip and were not dissapointed. It was the perfect place to relax and unwind before heading back to NYC. You feel like a new person when you emerge. Highly recommend visiting
Relaxing. This Spa was arund the corner from our Riad in the medina. Service was fantastic and the place smelled lovely. Defo value for money.

It was actually more like a spa than Hamman but is clean and beautiful. We just went to a local Hamman in Casablanca, so we know this Les Bains is more like a spa. But I really like how they have couple Hamman room and also couple massage room. It is definitely more private than local Hamman so for people who are less adventurous and just want to have a relaxing time, this place is just perfect. Scrub is nice as your skin feel so soft after that. After the entire treatment, you will be brought to a big room for resting with Moroccan tea. They also have a nice swimming pool outside I guess it would be very nice when weather is warm. So please bring swimming suits
very good value. fantastic and cheap, a very calm environment- wish i went every day
Amazing place, amazing service. The message and treatments are lovely, and so are the staff.
The best spa experience i have ever had.. Stunning place, fabulous service and the most relaxing massage i have ever had.

...like it!. Beautiful, peaceful place... with the best and most relaxing massage in Marrakech! Was surpriced over how many people were taken care of there at the same time... an assembly line feeling in the cooling off room, waiting for the treatment. Expensive.

Interesting experience! Recommended!. We (myself and boyfriend) booked "the traditional one" online before arriving, we used paypal for half the cost (about £40 each) and it all went through fine. When we arrived we were led to get changed into robes and then went to the Hamman... I wasnt sure what to wear, and was in a swimming costume. The woman took one look at me said "no no" and pulled it down! This sent me and bf into giggles and we were then led into the hammam room. It's somewhere between a sauna and a steam room. We sat on benches and then two women started chucking water over us. We were then covered in various ointments and muds and scrubbed (don't go with sunburn is my advice!!). It took around an hour for the whole experience as after each layer of stuff we were left to cook for around 15 mins. It was a strange experience as the women knew very little English (apart from "sit", "turn over", "yes", "no"), so we werent sure exactly what were were supposed to be doing!We then were showered off and went off for our hour long massages. These are ALL OVER BODY. I am fine with this but having spoken to a few other guests in our hotel they weren't sue if this would have been right for them, so just be aware. It was hugely relaxing and I left feeling very laid back. I'd highly recommend but go with an open mind!
Amazing relaxing experience!. Whatever you pick to get in the spa, every cent spent is worth it!The place is beautifull, peacefull.Relaxing massage is awesome!

Great hammam for those not quite ready for the real thing.... My partner and I visited Les Bains de Marrakech after 2 weeks of venturing around the mountains, desserts, and beaches of Morocco. We were ready for some relaxation and this place delivered. We'd heard all about the local authentic Moroccan hammams, but we weren't quite ready for that experience just yet so we decided to go with more of the "European Spa" experience. We did the couples hammam, oil scrub, and hour massage and it was exactly what we were looking for. The hammam was hot and relaxing, the oil scrub was cleansing and invigorating, and the massage was theraputic and calming. The atmosphere of the place was welcoming and warm and the staff was respectful and professional. Afterward, we got even got some mint tea and cookies. The overall experience was exactly what we wanted and to get anything close to this experience back home, we would pay twice as much if not more. If you are looking to relax in a spa type setting while in Marrakech, we would highly recommend Les Bains de Marrakech.

Wonderful. There are so many Hammams to choose from in Marrakech and we stumbled upon this one and we couldn't have stumbled better!! The first thing we noted was the value - it's only 150DH for a 45 mins traditional Hammam and scrub - cheaper than most places in the city and certainly cheaper than our Riad. This combined with the luxury of Les Bains made it a wonderful experience. You feel pampered from the moment you walk in - each room is decorated thoughtfully and beautifully - in the final area, you can relax after your Hammam with some mint tea looking out over the courtyard and pool - would certainly recommend this Hammam to anyone.
The best SPA ever!!!. They've got great systemm, atmospher, and they know what they do... the only challenge is every time you want to go you need to reserve ahead:(

baffling. Our riad booked us in to Les Bains with my direction of 'everything' which i had gathered from another guest was the full 3 hour experience including massage etc. However, when we got there we only had a 1/2 hour hammam booked and they had no slots for anything else so we decided that would be fine and we could just get more exploring time on our last day! We were both led to different changing rooms and shown a locker and a gown and left with no other directions. I didn't know what to wear so left bra and knickers on and went out in the robe. I was shown in to a dark room and asked to lie down on a table adjacent to my boyfriend. Hot water was poured over me a few times and then the asked me to take my bra off and rubbed some slimy soap all over me. Then, without a word, our two attendants got up and left! We lay there for about 10 minutes until we started to feel a bit chilly, then they came back and scrubbed us with loofahs until our skin felt like it was going to come off. We then got how water poured on us again and were led to a shower at the side of the room where it was indicated we were to rinse off. Once out of the shower we had oil poured in to our hands and told to rub it in all over which we did. Once our robes were back on, we were led to a room with massage beds through it and asked to lie down and we were brought mint tea which was lovely. That was the last we saw of anyone, and, about 20 minutes later, having become a bit bored of lying in our cold wet robes in a cold room, we called someone and asked what we should be doing and they said we could leave! All in all I found it to be an interesting experience, and am glad I know what happens in a hammam. Is this a first class establishment which looks after you and makes you feel comfortable? No! I think next time I'll go to a local one for a snip of the price and mingle with the locals!
amazing. book the traditional one 40 quid 3 hours of pure bliss
THE BEST IN TOWN. This is a must if going to marrakech just so charming the decor wonderful the best spa in town and only just round the corner from our Riad.

Hammam and Massage. It started off well, having booked it through the Riad we were staying in. On our arrival it all appeared calm and relaxed before the receptionist came into the waiting area and seemed to be having an argument with someone on the next level up who we couldn't see. We were then taken into the Hammam room which was lovely for the most part. Towards the end we were rubbed down with something or other and then just left while the 2 girls whispered away to each other which defeated the object of relaxing.We then were taken upstairs to the massage room which again, started off really nicely but at one point I opened my eyes and saw my partners masseuse looking at a text on her mobile phone. This happened twice which I thought was rather unprofessional. Pretty much throughout the massage the girls had a whispering conversation with each other.At the end of the massage they both left the room and we were left wondering what to do as they had not informed us that the massage was over and to take our time getting ready. We lay there for a while and then got up. The dressing gowns were the same ones as we had come from the Hammam with and were wet and cold which wasn't very pleasant.It was OK I guess but certainly not the best I've had.

Lovely - do go!. My boyfriend and I went for one of their spa days here last week. I struggled to choose a place for a hammam in Marrakech, and was quite confused by all of the reviews, but this place turned out to be lovely. We had a black soap scrub, hammam, oriental bath (best bit, I thought) and relaxing massage (best bit, my boyfriend thought!). The spa is beautiful and very relaxing, and we really enjoyed it. I'd go back.

Great Hammam, great value. My family traveled to Marrakech for three days in November and took the opportunity to book ourselves into treatments here.We booked a Hammam and 60 minute massage each.As a repeat traveler to Marrakech, I can say that this stacks up as great value and I highly recommend it.
Perfect Hamman SPA. As a couple this is a perfect place. The other ons do not accept couples in the SPA. Only seperat times. Man/ Women

Heaven in Marrakesh. We went here on the third day of Marrakesh chaos and it felt amazing getting pampered in such a beautiful and relaxing place. We booked the Traditional One (45min Hammam & black soap body scrub and ghassoul body mask +1h Relaxing massage). After the hammam we showered and stayed in a nice room to relax with mint tea and cool down after the sauna. We then had the most relaxing massage - I must have dosed off a dozen times. More tea and biscuits afterwards. The whole thing lasted about three hours and cost €50 each which I think was definitely worth it.Watch out for the motorbikes when you get out, it's easy to forget you're in Marrakesh while you're in there.

Good value, stylish interior. After much research on TA and elsewhere, I booked a traditional hammam/massage at Les Bains de Marrakech for my husband and me at the cost of 550 dirhams each. I emailed them with my preferred date/time and they emailed me back the next day to let me know that it was available. They requested upfront payment of 50% by Paypal with the rest payable after the treatment by credit card or local currency. We were also advised to bring a bathing suit.Les Bains was tucked behind the medina walls by the Bab Agnaou gate. The interior featured exquisite colorful tiles, glowing lanterns and wooden latticework.The hammam part began with us being placed in a small heated marble walled room where we rinsed off and then were scrubbed with black soap and painted with liquid clay. Then for 20 minutes we were left to rest in the steamy hot room. After rinsing the clay off, we were led to the relaxation room for 5-10 minutes and given mint tea.After tea, when we had full body massages which I enjoyed despite the pressure not being all that firm. My husband's masseuse fell asleep twice while massaging his head which he found annoying. Overall, I thought Les Bains was good value for money and would go back. Not sure about my husband though!
Amazing bath and hammam. Definitely do the bath with the rose petals. It's dreamy.
wish we'd done this on day one. Had the traditional Hammam - what a great way to relax. Will definitely be back and plan to do the complete spa day next time!

Heaven in the medina. This was a great way to experience a hammam as a couple--next time we'll join the locals for 10 dirhams now that we're "pro". The spa was calm and lovely and the treatment was out of this world. Top it off with a massage afterwards and you've found pure bliss! Afterwards we melted back to our riad.

Reeeeeelax. We loved our day or pampering and supreme relaxation - it was so professional, almost nothing was said the whole day but you were just moved from place to place to continue the whole day - we had the full tonic day with facial! it really was great my only complaint was that they do not provide you with enough liquids to drink - ask and I'm sure they would bring them but when it's so quiet you do feel a little bad for asking.

It's alright.. I went in November 2011, for the Traditional Body One package, which includes 45 mins of hammam and body scrub, an hour of hot stone massage and an hour of relaxing body massage. In actual, the whole thing took 4 hours to complete as there's waiting time in between sessions for mint tea. The best thing was the hot stone massage! It was heavenly. The hammam experience was a good one too. The worse is the body massage, which supposed to be relaxing. It's anything but! They used waaaay too much oil, halfway through the massage, I felt like a fish ready to be deep fried. The massage itself was not good, the lady was simply rubbing the oil around. During the body massage, the lady who was massaging my mum even sneezed on her face!!! They all should use face mask!!! The facilities was very nicely decorated, however they could have put more aromatherapy in the treatment rooms. So, the hot stone was good, the hammam was average and the body massage was horrible. Overall rating: Poor.

The perfect ending to our stay in Morocco. My friend and I had a hamam (scrub and mask included) and relaxing massage here in Les Bains de Marrakech on our last day before catching our plane.The service is great, the place is beautiful and relaxing, looks very professional and upscale. The treatments are great and the staff is well prepared.They really make an effort to make you feel comfortable and spoiled, tea and moroccan treats included.You have lockers and shower room, with shampoo and hair dryer.Totally recommended!
Good But Book In Advance. Treatments were good, but we did have difficulty in booking. Best to book before you arrive in Marrakech.

HEAVEN!!. Loved everything about this spa! Went with my boyfriend after a crazy week in this gorgeous city and it was AMAZING!! Full scrub down and mud bath in the hammam followed by an hour long massage togther. Pure bliss, defo book!

Good, but not worth the money. Located just inside the bab agnaou and clearly signposted. There may be some wait to use the change room as only one or couple at a time. Small pool for swimming prior, ingested, invigorating in November. Pleasant romantic /mood lighting.Gommage excellent, massage fairly good. Male and female masseurs available. Hot sauna. Main issue is towels on lounges are just refolded after a persons use, even if damp as person just out of pool or shower-i was surprised as thought you should either use your 'own' towel or a fresh towel should be replaced for the next person. Alsolots of waiting on lounges in rooms with others between treatments, would benefit from offering water or mint tea in between times if waiting/ relaxing/whatever. Mint tea and Moroccan biscuits at the end.

Perfect. Do not miss this one. Beatiful place. Very friendly staff ! You get a lot for your money ! Very clean, good treatments. The location is great. Easy to find. I cannot find anything wrong to say about this place. The prices are very good, you can enjoy a nice , quality hamman for a decent price. I tried sauna, oil bath , pedicure. evrything was perfect. The place is pefectly organised, and altough they are always fully booked, you never get the feeling the staff has to rush.
Heavenly. Loved the surroundings, the massage, and the mint tea.

Average Spa. My husband and I booked here for out hammam, parts of the spa were beautiful, the relaxation rooms, the entrance and the pool area.I found the main let down was the changing room. It was very tired, there we no towels in there so you had to dry yourself on your dressing gown! There was only 1 hairdryer and the only toileries provided were shampoo and showergel which were in congealed tatty plastic bottles.....The Hamman was fun and the massage much the same as at home. The service from the staff was good.Would try another spa next time
Hamman in an oasis. We as a couple had a hamman together. We were in the same room the whole time and it was very relaxing and a gr4eat experience

A well needed break from the outside world!. I booked the hammam and massage package for my fiance and I about 2 weeks ago. Even though we booked 1430 we were informed to arrive at 2 so We could spend half an hour by the pool first, but despite we got there at 1330 that never happened and we never saw the pool! We were taken straight through for the hammam. It was very nice though and different and our skin felt great after. They took us to a room with beds to relax and have a mint tea before the massage and again after the massage so We did not feel we were being rushed out. The staff do not really speak English and I agree it could feel a little like production line but overall it was a beautiful place and we passed 3 hours very nicely there. We would definitely come back if we were to return to Marrakech.
Utter luxury. If you want to feel like a millionaire for £50 then go here!
GREAT MASSAGE. A little like a production line people in and out .But the treatment i received by professional staff was perfect,very relaxed experience and well worth the money.

FANTASTIC. I would go back to Morocco just for the hammam and massage here. The place was huge! If it weren't for the people directing us to our rooms, we would have gotten lost. I really enjoyed the couple's hammam and massage. I felt at ease knowing that is was only my husband and I in the room. I loved it! Thank you for the excellent service!
Sheer Luxury. Absolutely fantastic, from start to finish. A must!!
Quality treatment in a magnificent environment. Not the cheapest, not where the average local will go, but such a truly beautiful environment, spotless, relaxing...

Good, but very hot Hammam. Beautiful spa, however I found the Hammam very stressful. The lady leaves you telling you she will be back in five mins, which is more like 10 mins and then leaves you the next time for 10 mins, which is more like 20 mins. By the time she came back, I was so hot, I felt I would pass out and was standing up very agitated. After this though, I had a relaxation massage which was fabulous. Word of warning, I kept my tankini bottoms on, but there is no part of you left untouched so not for anyone who is a bit shy!!

Wonderful beyond words. Our primary reason for choosing this hammam was their Duo treatments. On our first visit here we had the Traditional treatment with a relaxing massage – this turned out so amazing we immediately booked one more Duo treatment for the following Friday. This time we had the oriental bath and energizing hot towel massage. This place has a truly luxurious Arabian nights type of atmosphere, the interior and the quality of the treatments are outstanding. Book well in advance via their website, and arrive about 45 minutes before your appointment so you can take advantage of the lovely pool area in the courtyard. The building is like a big maze and the whole procedure might feel a bit confusing (what with moving from room to room), but the trick is just to wait for someone to pick you up at each "station".
Spa. Peaceful beautiful place , helpful staff, great hamman and the best massage ever!

An oasis.... of tranquility. You may initially think that the price per person is expensive but once you've experienced the treatments and overall ambience, it is well worth the money and you will not get anything better for that price. Myself and my partner booked a duo hammam and massage and although the website said it would be 1hr 45 mins in total, we came out 3 hours later, totally relaxed and rejuvinated! You didn't feel rushed, quite the opposite, there are pockets of relaxation time in-between treatments and the mood setting at the venue is second to none. Best spa treatment ever, we will definitely go back!
Hamman and massage. great place ,good prices,we had the Hamman black soap scrub and the full body massage and it came to just over £40,Great value and better than anything that i have had in the UK.

Amazing , peaceful retreat.. I visit here each time I come to Marrakesh. We have the hamman and an hour massage . Whole experience takes about 3 hours with lots of relaxing in quiet areas in between treatments sipping mint tea . Gets very busy so definitely prebook. Sometimes they have men massaging women so if you are not comfortable with this you should let them know.

Nice treatments, many guests. The treatments (hammam, body scrub and massage, facial) were professional. Pleasant atmosphere, but a bit like a production line. You came in one end, you left the other end.

very dissapointing avoid. My friends and I were looking forward to out time at Les Bains de Marrakesh. I had read the reviews and booked in advance. We had all opted for the traditional hamman and black soap scrub and I was looking forward to feeling squeaky clean as I have had such treatments in the past. We had booked in for 6 pm with a view to catching the last of the sunshine poolside.The facilities and the layout I can not fault the problems lay entirely in the service. The whole experience was extremely dissapointing beginning with a disinterested welcome, to not being offered drinks and being left to wait endlessley by the sunless pool area without any idea of what was happening. The main problem was in the actual treatment. We were taken to a private Hamman which was nice and left for 15 mins wondering what was going on. After complaining we were individually rubbed with oil wich took about 15 seconds. Then we were left again for a further ten minutes. When the "therapists" arrived with their gloves they simply went over each limb with 3 strokes of their glove taking a total of less than a minute per person. We were then instructed to shower and taken to yet another room to "chill". Where no refreshments were offered. All in all an awful lot of sitting around waiting and very little spa experience. I certainly didnt feel squeaky clean and felt like the staff were simply badly trained or lazy.

Very relaxing!. My husband & I visited the spa on our last day in Marrakech & had the 1hr 45min hammam with body scrub, face mask & body massage.The spa was very relaxing & had a great atmosphere. The body scrub was amazing & left our skin really smooth & the massage was fantastic with just the right amount of pressure.We would def come back here & reccommend to anyone. One thing however, if you are a woman & uncomfortable with having your top off & having people touch you (in the body scrub & massage), then maybe ask about keeping your top on before you start. It didn't bother me, but would def be a problem for some people I think.

This must be close to heaven. I’ve enjoyed many spas which includes some of the best in UK (Senspa and The Spa, Pennyhill) and I’d been to the spa at the La Mamounia Hotel a few days earlier and I can easily say that Les Bains de Marrakech is the best I’ve been to by far. The attention to detail is impeccable: moody, Moroccan lighting; stone carvings on walls of changing room; some of the most relaxing chill-out music; fine mist spray in final relaxing room to cool you down at the end of the treatments; amazing decor everywhere.You must try their 4 hand massage and rose covered bath – pure indulgence. Slight niggles which just made it short of perfection:1) pool is too small to swim and unheated, and as shaded a lot does not get heated by hot weather. I’d say its for show rather than use, which is shame as would have been nice to have swim between treatments. 2) Understandably not all staff speak English but I would have liked to have been able to communicate by massage preference ie. deep, before massage started, as tried to explain this a few times to no effect. Still v relaxing 4 hand massage though3) Mist spray in final relaxing room not switched on when we entered but only after further customers were shown into room4) Other than at beginning and end I felt I was having to ask for water/mint tea rather than staff being conscious to this. Hamman dehydrating and had to ask for a bottle of water to be fetched from downstairs before massage began. Would have been good to have water on hand in massage roomDespite these niggles, it was the best spa so far to date

A relaxing, serene and authentic Morrocan experience. We chose this Spa based on the TripAdvisor reviews and it didn't disappoint. Once you get in you are transported into another world where everything seems to slow down and become so much more peaceful than the manic outside! The Spa itself is clean, well run with friendly staff. We had the relaxing day spa experience as a couple and the hammam and massage part of this were fantastic, really worthwhile and we were together throughout. The bit in-between however, an oriental bath, wasn't all that and in hindsight I would have saved some money and gone for the hammam and massage separately.This is expensive but then all good spas are so it's worth the experience but I'd suggest doing your homework and knowing the treatments if you're going to go for a day experience so that you make the most of it. Overall, big thumbs up.

An Oasis of Serenity. I visited Les Bains de Marrakech with a group of friends at the end of a long weekend in Marrakech and we all thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The service was very efficient without being rushed, and the massage was one of the best that I've had. It was great to chill for 3 hours in this oasis of serenity in the midst of the chaos that is Marrakech.

Beautiful environment, great service. I went to Les Bains de Marrakech with my mother and reserved a package with hammam, exfoliation, massage and pedicure. The place is beautiful and we felt like cleopatra. The manager was super efficient in recommanding what we should do and making sure everything was going smoothly. Very nice, clean, locker/changing room where we were given confortable robes and sleepers. We then were taking around the pool for a little while, nice a quiet cookies and tea were served, and then to our treatment rooms. The Hammam was typical Morrocan, very clean. We were then taken to an other relaxing room before the massage with amazing decorations. Massage room was charming and massage quality pretty good.Overal great experience, close to the souk where we went walking right after

Very fancy and luxurious, but the service wasn't brilliant. We went for the "Relax Day Spa" at 800 dirham each: hammam, oriental bath and an hour's relaxing massage.The hammam would have seemed very good if we hadn't already been to a local/traditional/proper hammam the day before - the scrub down just wasn't as thorough. I enjoyed and my wife loved the double bath - she particularly loved the rose petals and now wants to bathe that way every day!The massage was excellent, we both lost track of time and were both thoroughly and completely relaxed afterwards - we were in a pleasantly dosy daze as we were led back to the enclosed central courtyard for a mint tea to finish off the afternoon.We enjoyed the experience but some of the service wasn't quite right - some of the staff were very pleasant but a couple of them were just there to work and missed the point that this was meant to be a fancy spa.

WOW. The only thing I can say is WOW! This place is truly amazing. I visited quiet a few SPAs around the world but this is just surreal! Perfect in every detail. We did a 3 hr package (hammam,scrub,cataplasm,massage and facial) and was great! Not only the treatment were very pleasant but the atmosphere and the care the put in the experience is great. When we checked in we were escorted to the changing room and than to the pool area , offered a mint tea and than gracefully brought to the hammam ( they are vey attentive and always check that everything is ok) from there we relaxed in beautiful room on soft and white crisp loungers with relaxing music and moroccan lanterns (amazing!). After our massage and facial we were escorted to the courtyard (that has been covered with drapes) to rest a little longer on the loungers , this time as well there was music, tea and little cookies. After few minutes they started to spray a rose/water mist in the air . It was a great morning and an experience that I would suggest to everybody! Les bains de Marrakech is truly amazing and as soon as you enter it transports you in a 1001 night dream!

Heaven!. I love going to spas and so whenever I go away I can't resist going for a couple of treatments.This is one of the most beautiful places I've been to and unbelievably reasonable as well.It's easy to go for the same treatments as I know what I like and so I decided to try a couple that were a bit different. I opted for the Tonic Spa which started with a Hamman, followed by an algae bath and then a hot towel massage.Firstly, if you are bashful then this isn't the place for you. Although they say to have swimming costumes with you from the moment I started the hamman I didn't wear it again for any of the other treatments.It was my first Hamman and something I'll have again when I return. I was literally scrubbed and cleaned and my skin felt amazing afterwards.The algae bath was one of the most beautiful rooms I've ever been into with rose petals and candles leading the way to the bath with was completely covered with more rose petals. It was pleasant but not something that I'd have again as I prefer treatments where people are doing things e.g. facials and massages.The hot towels massage was amazing. It was a standard massage but towards the end they put these steaming hot towels over your back and down your legs - they're so hot they feel as though they're going to burn you and when removed you can feel were they were - but it also feels amazing!Everyone is lovely there and in between treatments you get Moroccan tea and freshly squeezed orange juice - which is yummy.All I can say is.... go on, treat yourself!

Not everything I'd hoped for. I booked a couple's Traditional package which includes a 45 minute hammam and 60 minutes massage and saved this for our last day in Marrakesh as a final treat. We arrived a bit early because I'd read that you could spend a little time by their pool, and we wore our bathing suits for this and the hammam. The pool area was cozy with room for maybe 10 guests, but the water was quite cold and most of the area was shaded. At one point some young men in the pool were talking loudly and a manager came from inside to shush them, which I later found ironic. So the first part was ok, they gave us orange juice and we relaxed there for maybe 20 minutes before they led us to the hammam. Now this was not my first hammam, so I know how good the experience can be - or bad, in this case. My husband and I were shown into an attractive enough private room with heated surfaces and lay down on the waterproof cushions on two sides of the room. After we had warmed up a bit two female attendants rubbed the black soap on us and disappeared for a while, then came back, rinsed us off and applied the clay layer. Somewhere in this was an exfoliation, which I only remember because I have the glove - everything these two women did was perfunctory and I felt like they couldn't have cared less about us. In between their brief appearances I assume they joined the group of women we could hear gossiping in French somewhere nearby, which completely blew any chance of serenity we might have mustered in that room. In truth, even though I'm not sure we were there 45 minutes, we were ready to finish with the hammam. Next they brought us to a resting area, which yes, was beautiful and quiet and atmospheric with comfortable beds. A woman came by offering mint tea, but after filling our small cups she went off and never came back to ask if we wanted more. In the Banos Arabes throughout cities in Spain, there is usually a room with pots of tea where you can help yourself to as much as you'd like as you move between areas. Here, it would have been nice if she had just left the pot with us because we were both thirsty. The massage at the end was actually excellent and very relaxing - again in a private room, here lit by candles, with two different women, this time friendly, who seemed to care how we felt. This redeemed the experience to some extent but were I to return to Marrakesh I would pick a different hammam.

Beautiful spa!. This spa is situated near the Toombes about 20 min walk from the main square (Jemaa el Fna). It was recommended by our Riad owner and I'm not sure that we would have found it as quickly without his excellent directions and map. It is situated a little out of the way.The spa itself was spectacular and my partner and I were able to have our treatment together (a traditional Hammamm body scrub). Beware that there is no modesty in these types of places! Although I had my swimming costume on, the top half was duly removed! However, you are not made to feel uncomfortable. Excellent price considering the treatment 500 dirhams for both of us (approx £40). Would definitely recommend you give it a try. Be advised though that you may need to book ahead as it is quite popular and can get busy.
Very relaxing. We spent a very pleasant afternoon having a hamman and massage, Not cheap at €145 but worth it. Surroundings were clean and staff attentive and polite.

World away from the stress of the Medina. Perfect way to end our stay in Marrakech. Having been in the city and Essaouria for 7 days this was a great treat for our last day. The spa was an amazing experience and very reasonably priced for the treatment received, 550 DHS for 45 min Hamman and 1 hr Massage. I was aware of having to take off my bikini top which didn't phase me in the slightest. The hamman was great, a real feeling of having all the dust and dirt of the city washed and scrubbed away. The relaxing areas between the treatments are truly tranquil. Mint tea is served throughout our stay which we had become so fond of during our stay in Morocco!! The massage was fantastic, we choose the relaxing massage option. Although i have heard reviews stating it was hard to find we did not find it to be. We simply got a taxi to Bab Agnaou and the spa is sign posted clearly on the right hand side at the gate. We left feeling completely relaxed and revitalised. Highly recommend

Absolute bliss tucked away inside the medina. Visited in July 2011 with a friend, found the whole experience to be totally perfect and very relaxing. Started off in the steam room, getting sloshed with water every now and again followed by the scrub. Although they made us take our bikini tops off, which we were hoping to avoid, it really wasn't such a big deal in the end. It obviously makes it easier for them to do their job, and I figured if they're not bothered about it then I shouldn't be either. Although I have to admit I wasn't prepared for when, lying on my front, they yanked down my bikini bottoms and gave my bum a quick buffing! But it just made me laugh more than anything. Scrub was excellent, really felt as though they were getting all the grot out of my pores and very relaxing also. Was then taken to the relaxation area and given lovely sweet mint tea - yum. The rooms are beautiful, and I was starting to feel seriously chilled out at this point. A lady arrived to take me upstairs for my massage (I had the Traditional One, Hammam, Relxaing Full Body Massage and Oriental Facial Care for 950DH). Again I was asked to take my bikini top off, but obviously no-one else was in the room, so not a problem. The massage was wonderful - and definitely 'full body' - even the tips of my fingers and ears were done! The lady who did it was lovely, we even had a bit of a chat in French, but she didn't talk to me during the treatment so I could just lie there and relax. I was then escorted to the room where I had the facial - again very friendly staff, and the treatment was bliss. All the people who were working there were very attentive; before I left the room the lady double checked I had my key to my locker (I'd put a load of stuff in the pocket of my robe and for a minute or two couldn't find the key) and then took me down to the pool. The courtyard with the pool in is absolutely beautiful and very peaceful; you would never think the craziness of the medina is on the other side of the walls. We were given more mint tea and some lovely little pastries. The only downsides to the whole process were, firstly, the booking online - my friend paid the 50% and, although she was asked to pay 550 DH, the amount she paid in pounds sterling actually translated into 580DH... Although I think we did manage to get them to acknowledge this and reduce the balance we paid at the spa. At the time however, it was a bit confusing. The only other criticism I would make is that they don't seem to let you return to the changing rooms (and your locker) until you are leaving. So if, like me, you leave your sunglasses in your locker, you won't be able to go back after your treatments are finished to grab them for sunbathing. I think my friend did manage to sneak back in to get something, but I was ushered back out to the pool! These are only very minor points though - more just areas to be aware of than real criticisms. As for comments below about it feeling like a 'conveyor belt' - I wouldn't say that is the case at all. Yes, you are escorted on to your next treatment when they are ready for you, but it is extremely smooth and efficient - I'd feel more annoyed if I was left for hours between treatments wondering when I'd be going, so I'm not really sure what people who feel like its a conveyor belt are after? You have plenty of time to relax after treatments - you can stay there for as long as you want - so, in my opinion, the way they run the whole process is spot on. I would definitely go back next time I'm in Marrakech, without a doubt. Probably one of the best things I did whilst I was there, and excellent value for money. The equivalent of what I had would probably set you back at least £200 in the UK!

Amazing Spa. We had an amazing experience at this Spa. My boyfriend and I booked a traditional hamam and massage followed by a pedicure.The staff were attentive and the venue itself is extremely luxurious. The decor is beautiful.The Haman was brilliant.
