We felt revitalised. The massage was one of the best massages we have ever had.We were served mint tea and pastries throughout our treatment.

Overall pleasant experience with the exception of the hammam. On arrival at the spa we were told that they have not got our reservation (due to mistake of Riad) but they were able to fit the two of us in for both the hammam and the massage straight away which was great! We were first showed to the pool to relax before taken to the hammam. However the 45-min hammam turned out to only involve 3 mins of actual treatment time. Nothing was explained to us, we were put into a steam room and left there not really knowing what was meant to happen (as our first time). Then 15 mins later a lady came in to run soap on us and walked back out. Another 15 min went and 2 ladies came in to give us a 3 min body scrub, and then they disappeared again. Another 15 mins passed before someone came in and showed us to the shower! The scrub was pretty below par.Luckily, it all got better after this! We were showed to a lovely area to relax with mint tea after the hammam. The massage was good and the room was nice and very comfortable. After the massage, we were showed to another area to relax with mint tea and pastries before leaving. All in all it was a good experience but I probably wouldn't go for the hammam again, massage is nice though!

Excellent - an oasis in the middle of madness!. I booked this before leaving the UK and the process was simple and reliable. After emailing which treatments my friends and I wanted I received a paypal invoice for 50% deposit. I was emailed a receipt and confirmation of booking shortly after paying. The remainder was paid by credit card after treatments.It was a wonderful experience - starting with a cooling dip in the pool (in 100+ degree heat outside). The ladies who did the hammam were matter of fact and efficient - but that's half of the experience. The massage was lovely and relaxing. The only slight negative is that my friend had the 'draining massage' which seemed identical to the relaxing massage. We were in there for three hours or so and the time flew by.The spa itself is tucked away in the alleys at the other end of the main square so it took us a while to find it (including a run in with a local who decided to swear at us when we politely declined his help) but that's not the fault of the spa! In summary, I would definately recommend this. Without hesitation.

Divine Decadence in a spa treatment. This lovely oasis is on the edge of the medina in Marrakech. We walked in the door to soft sounds and a lovely afternoon. The have a lovely courtyard with a cool pool to soak in prior to the various scrubings and potions that make up the hamman. My treatment included being wrapped in plastic and my friends had clay and salt. Then after a thorough showering off we lounged a bit before the long and wonderful massage. All treatments were punctuated by the sweet mint tea and sesame cookies that are such a wonderful threat in this country.

amazing!. such a beautiful place and peaceful experience. the staff were really nice and the hammam we had was really good. the price of the treatment included a robe, relaxation before and after the treatment and mint tea and moroccan sweets. would definitely recommend!

Blissful. My husband and I went to Les Bains de Marrakech during our recent stay in Marrakech and had a wonderful time. The booking process is a little tortuous and I had to wait a week for a reply to an enquiry via the website but the receipt of the deposit was confirmed fairly quickly.You do feel really pampered here (albeit a bit like you're going along a conveyor belt as they move people around each stage of the hammam) and the endless tea as you move through each stage was very welcome. I would recommend that you come near the end of the day when you are all tired out from the souks and just chill out and relax.The hammam was much better than one we had the week before in Fes (although that was still very good) and involved quite a few stages of scrubbing and body masks etc. We had massages afterwards which were really relaxing.The staff are very attentive and when my husband accidentally left his watch in his bathrobe there were about 5 staff running around helping to relocate it!Well worth the money!

Lovely tourist experience - a one-off treat. I booked Les Bains de Marrakech as a treat for myself on the last day of our week in Marrakech. My husband didn't want to go but I was quite happy to go alone and I am glad I did.I opted for The Traditional One - which comprised the hammam, gommage and rhassoul mask followed by one hour of relaxing massage and then an hour's hot stone massage.I have had an aromatherapy massage once in the UK (it was a Christmas present) and I wasn't too taken with it. I found it too expensive for what it was. But for the same equivalent price at Les Bains I was getting the whole package. It seemed a pampering sensation too good to miss.The place itself is beautiful serene and induces an almost trance-like state of relaxation. The staff who greet and escort you to treatments are deferential to the point of coldness - you can't induce them to chat, even in French, and I did feel a little bit like a colonial master being waited on by servants. My hammam girl was lovely and friendly though and we chatted in a mixture of French and broken English interspersed by the very basic Arabic I had learnt on Youtube. I had intended and expected to go fully naked - however she made no attempt to remove my clothes so I kept my bikini bottoms on out of respect to her young sensibilities. My large, bare white backside is no joy to behold for the young and innocent!The savon noir was massaged into my skin and then showered off, followed by the scrub with the kessa mit. This was the only part that really disappointed me. At home I exfoliate twice a week with those rough scrubby gloves you can buy - and I am merciless on my rough spots. At Les Bains, no matter how many times I asked her to scrub harder, it still felt as though she were terrified to rub too hard in case she got in trouble for damaging the "rich white woman's" delicate skin. After the scrub she massaged rhassoul into my body and face and left me to relax a little longer. As others have said before, the hammam room never gets particularly hot - certainly it wasn't as hot as the temperature outside - and with the door to the room continually being opened and closed, you get blasts of air conditioned cold air regularly wafting in.After a relaxation period in a dimly lit area (where I may have fallen asleep!) I was taken upstairs for my massages. The relaxing argan oil massage was wonderful - not deep or rough but she worked out all the knots on my neck and shoulders and the head massage was bliss.The hot stone massage however, was a revelation! Before going, I had remarked to my husband "this is going to be a bit of a let down - when I have seen it on tv they just lie hot stones on you - how can that do anything?". I was so wrong. I won't go into detail because I don't want to spoil the surprise for anyone else but it is utterly delightful. If you suffer with joint pains and rheumatoid arthritis, like I do, this treatment will give you a pain relief that you never dreamt of. It was wonderful. I did nearly fall flat on my face going down the stairs afterwards though because I was so relaxed that my legs had turned to jelly! After mint tea and pastries and another restful lie down, it was time to leave. There was no rush but I was a little hurried because I was being picked up outside the spa and didn't want to keep my friends waiting.I entered the spa at 12pm and left at 4:15pm - although I could have stayed longer if I had wanted.All in all it was an amazing experience, my skin felt soft and smooth and was glowing from the rhassoul mask and the argan oil massages. I would definitely recommend the hot stone massage to everyone and would even consider going back there to have it again next time I am in Marrakech.The actual heat room, soaping and scrub was perhaps a little disappointing however. It definitely felt like a watered-down, pampering version for tourists rather than a way to actually get thoroughly clean. Next year when I visit Marrakech I will definitely be braving a locals hammam and experiencing the different rooms of varying temperatures plus a thouroughly skin-stripping scrub!Was it worth the money? Yes absolutely, especially compared to the cost of massages and spa days in the UK. Would I recommend it as a treat for yourself? Yes, it is a lovely little pamper session to relax you after the bustle of the medina. Is it in any way a representation of real hammam tradition? Not that I could see, no.Maybe I am just not cut out for a life of being waited on hand and foot and treated like a dleicate flower - who knows? I would say that if you do go you will enjoy yourself but if you don't go you aren't missing much that you can't get in any spa around the world.

Wonderful spa in heart of Marrakesh. I have previously visited seval other spas and would rate Les Bains as one of the best. My mother and I each had a hammam, body massage and facial which had all been enjoyable. During each treatment we had been taken into a different relaxing area for mint tea and snacks. I will definetly visit Les Bains on my next visit to Marrakesh.

Lovey little hidden Gem. Las Bains is a really lovely place. It is set out well and overall a very enjoyable experience. We were taken from reception to get changed into our swimming costumes - you don’t really need your bikini top as that is taken off you. We had a cabin for the three of us so if you are a little body conscious then you should request a Hammam on your own. When in the hamman we were scrubbed and then a mask applied on, once that was dry the ladies came in and washed you down. We booked a hamman with wrap and massage. It was very relaxing. You get Green tea and biscuits after on the sun loungers which is a perfect finish !In comparison to the other Hammans this is probably on the expensive side for the locals but pretty reasonable if you are a tourist. The only gripe I would have is that we felt like we were rushed from the changing rooms and also we didn’t feel the hammam got hot and steamy enough as the ladies came in very frequently to either scrub us or wash us down. My first Hamman experience and I would go back again. We also got the Hamamm gloves as keep sakes.

Highlight of our stay in Morocco. Les Bains de Marrakech is truly an oasis amid the chaos and commotion of Marrakesh. We booked the 'traditional' which was a private hammam (for 2), followed by a 1-hour couples massage. It was an excellent value at 550dhs - about $70 US dollars. We made our reservation online and paid a deposit via paypal with no problem. They were expecting us when we arrived a few minutes before our scheduled appointment. It was our first time in Marrekesh and as non-French speakers we found communication and directions to be very difficult overall. It took longer than we expected to find Les Baines, even though it was only a short (10 minute) walk from our riad in the Medina. It’s off the main street and not clearly marked…unless you are specifically looking for it. We walked past it several times until a police officer pointed us to the entrance. The nearby vendors will try to lure you into their shops as you enter and exit. Just be very polite, yet firm and they will eventually give up. We've been to many spas in the United States and we both found Les Bains de Marrakech to be more luxurious than most. The property and décor are beautiful and relaxing. The mint tea and almond cookies are delicious. The locker room facilities for men and women are similar to what you’d expect at a luxury resort spa. First-timers should be warned that there is very little modesty at this spa. Be prepared to be completely naked during the treatments. Of course in public areas you wear one of the spa’s white robes. I was initially wearing a swimsuit under my robe, which the attendant quickly removed (without my consent) during the hammam. They made my husband remove his swim trunks and gave him a very small pair of swim briefs (think: child’s Speedo) to wear. Thankfully, it was a private room and quite dark, but it was still unexpected and a bit shocking. Before the massage, I requested that she cover me in a towel for privacy - so only the area that she is currently working on is exposed. She complied (sort of), but I was still quite uncovered and during the massage. Also - no body areas are off limits. My husband and I were both rubbed in places that American spa massages don’t go. We'll admit - it was a great massage and it wasn’t inappropriate, it’s just that we are accustomed to more privacy. It was actually rather comical for both of us to face the fact that we are "uptight Americans" when it comes to nudity. I wish we’d known a little more in advance so we could have mentally prepared and been more comfortable during the wonderful treatments. Nonetheless - a wonderful experience.

suffering from being highly rated on tripadvisor. We had made a reservation based on the ratings on TripAdvisor, and timed it for the last day of our 3 wk trip. Given the raves about this place, I expected to be wowed. Instead, I found that the staff was distracted and my husband and I were put on the "treatment assembly line". We had a hammam scrub and massage. Very little was explained. The women who provided the treatments were professional but distracted, often gossiping between themselves instead of focusing on my husband and I. The place WAS beautiful however. I suspect we would have had a better experience if there had been half the number of bookings that day (which was probably the volume of business before they rose in the rankings.)

Luxury in the Medina. I booked the Toic Day Spa (half day) for my wife and I as a highlight of our trip for a wedding anniversary. All booked online, and a deposit made via paypal, no issues at all.The sorroundings are just wonderful, very relaxing and great attention to detail, both in the building, furnishings and the service. Having not experienced any of these treatments before, I was not sure if they lived up to "best in class" standards, but we enjoyed ourselves being pampered! The hammam scrubbing was not as rough as other reviews suggested! The Oriental bath was relaxing and very romantic. The only let down was the massage, which should have been a stimulating hot towels, however half way through it was evident the towels weren't coming out. This took the edge of the spa package as actually what we received was the Relax Day Spa, but it was too late to start again. Never the less, it was excellent and relaxing!Beware as the difference in the price is 100 DHs per person on these packages, and next time on balance would drop the bath for a different package. However, we didn't let this spoil an otherwise great spa day! When pointed out to the staff when paying, there was no issue in adjusting the total cost.I would return if in Marrakech again.

Luxurious experience in beautiful surroundings. This spa/hammam is extremely luxurious. The prices are definitely high compared to local hammams, but low compared to establishments of similar quality in cities like London, New York or Paris.There is a good range of treatments, which are very relaxing and professional. Lots of complimentary mint tea is served!Do be aware that if you have a hammam or massage you will do so completely naked. If you don't think you'll be able to be comfortable and relax don't waste your money. However you'll be suprised how easy it is to get used to it.

Beautiful and Relaxing. A fabulous way to spend a morning. The staff were friendly, helpful and extremely professional.The traditional hamman was lovely and the relaxing massage lived up to its name. We thought the whole experience was wonderful and good value for money, especially compared with UK prices.

A little oasis in the middle of Marrakech. We booked Les Bains de Marrakesh on the basis of reviews on tripadvisor and in our guide book and we didn't regret it! We booked a half day treatment including a hammam, hour long massage and rose petal baths. There were short breaks inbetween each treatment and once we had had all of our treatments we were seated in a large room in the middle and served mint tea and delicious biscuits. Well worth a visit, make sure you book in advance as getting a space was tricky and we had to go to pay a deposit before the day of our appointment to secure the booking. It is conveniently placed just around the corner from the Saadian tombs.

NOT QUITE 5 STAR. We found the place easy enough and had booked ahead which is a must.They mostly speak french which is fine but means communication is at a low which can mean you are a bit confused about the whole process.all staff are friendly...hamman was AMAZING ... great experience massage was very relaxing altho id say if you want a massage rather than someone gently rubbing and stroking you off to sleep then go for the harder massage option .. at one point she was stroking my hair like you would stroke a little kitten .. this lasted about 10 mins, my requests to increase pressure were ignored.. nice if you wanna nod off but not exactly what i was after... good to escape the constant harrassment of the streets.. zzzzzz

lived up to their reputation and then some!. what can i say about this place that no one has already said time and time again - they lived up to their reputation and then some!We have visited this place twice during our stay (it was that good) and each time it was like walking into a wonderland off tranquility.The staff are more then helpful and look after you and make you feel relaxed to a point you fall a sleep on the massage table (i did!).When you find this place and you walk up the entrance you get the feeling Medina is million miles away and you have walked into a new world. The sights the sounds of the busy city outside are forgotten as you are pampered to nth degree.

Indulgent and totally relaxing. Bit tricky to find but well worth it. We had the 'Traditional One' which was excellent value at 550dhs each. 45 min in a personal Hammam (for 2), followed by an hours relaxing massage (the best I've experienced anywhere in the world). Beautiful rooms and attentive staff.

Beautiful spa in Marrakech. Just returned from a weekend in Marrakech, part of which we spent in this spa. The facilities and surroundings are absolutely beautiful. Throughly enjoyed and would throughly recommend.

An exquisite place to relax and unwind. This place has the reputation of being one of the best hammams in Marrakech and it absolutely lives up to it. Tastefully decorated win soft and warm hues with Marrakechi lamps, fabrics and curtains, and smelling of soft oils and rose petals, it is a delight to your senses. And it is very reasonably priced for what it offers. I opted for the traditional experience of hammam and a relaxing massage. The staff was friendly and polite, though spoke very little English. The masseuse was professional and friendly. Though it is a busy place, I was never rushed through my experience. You need to book well in advance though.

Beautiful, Peaceful experience. I got a hot stone massage and it was equisite. The service was immaculate and I enjoyed every minute. Just what we needed before the flight back to London. I will go back

In the city of Spas, this may well be the best. A truly fantastic experience.You leave the hustle and bustle behind and have one of the most relaxing experiences known! We had the Hammam, rose baths and one hour massage package. This cost about £100pp, which is much cheaper than you'd get back in the UK at a similar establishment (albeit not as cheap as is available in Marrakech).It was thoroughly romantic and both of us commented on how good our skin felt afterwards.Good tip - go at the start of the holiday, or you'll find that all that tan you've worked hard for has gone.I'd recommend this to anyone, but must ask, why oh why do you go in through a gorgeous entrance, but you go out into a little side alley, completely lost and not sure of the way back to the main road? Why don't you just go back out the entrance - surely the faces of people looking so smooth and refreshed would be much better marketing?

Excellent - but a bit pricey and impersonal. Loved this place - absolute luxury! Relax in the tranquil environment away from the crazy souks and hustle and bustle.It is quite expensive though. We paid 950 dirhams each for a hammam, and two one hour treatments. At times, it also felt like we were on a tourist conveyor belt with different members of staff in and out of our room doing different bits of the treatment. I would have liked a more personal approach. I might be tempted to try a traditional non-tourist hammam next time just to compare the service. The hammam itself felt a little rushed and I felt as though the person doing the massage didn't really enjoy it so made my experience not a good. Despite this, I would recommend this place if you can't compromise on your western comforts/surroundings!

You will feel great. This was my first hammam so I didn't know what to expect but I was really impressed with the end result.Myself and my boyfriend booked in for the 45 minute hammam on our last day in Marrakesh, we shared a private steam room and got a good wash with black soap, scrubbed within an inch of our lives and then wrapped in ghassoul before being polished with the famous argan oil.Afterwards, wrapped in fluffy white bathrobes we were brought to a seductive relaxation room which is decked out with low white beds and muslin curtains and given mint tea and told to stay as long as we wanted.Afterwards, I felt amazing and my skin has never felt so good. So much so that before leaving Morocco I bought black soap, argan oil and a hammam mitt and I am determined to keep up the routine :)The facilities at Les Bains are great, beautiful changing rooms with showers and hairdryers, robes and flip flops are provided and the staff are lovely.A treatment like this would set you back in the UK but to my surprise is was only Dh250 per person.

No pain - no gain. My first trip to Marrakech, and also my first Hammam. I realize that this is an up-scale, and probably far off a typical Hammam, but it was just my kinda place.I went for a Hammam + Regular one hour massage package, and it was completely worth it. After undressing, and putting on a robe, I was guided into a dark, warm and moist room where I was commanded into the shower, and then told to lie down. First, a huge woman scrubbed my whole body. It was painful the entire time, and I had to bite my lip not to scream. Afterwards, I showered again, and then she rubbed mud all over me. I was then left to relax while my body was burning. When she came back, I showered and dried off. I was then guided into a room full of sofa beds, where I fell asleep for a while, before the masseuse came to get me. She gave me an hour of wonderful full-body massage.All in all, a great experience.

Great spa experience - good prices. This may be classed by the locals as a Tourist Spa but it is an excellent facility, in a super setting, and very reasonably priced (especially when compared to England at least). My wife and I booked a Duos experience comprising a Hammam, a detoxifying massage followed by a hot stones massage - all for approximately £60 each (the price you would pay for a massage alone in the UK). It did feel a bit like a production line at times, but this is more a reflection of their effeciency and quality of service. We never felt rushed and in fact were in the spa for over 4 hours. A great way to escape the chaos and madness of the Medina, easy to book in advance (essential) and overall an essential 'must-do' whem visiting Marrakech.

A rather unusual experience. I booked a couples trip to this spa based on comments already placed. Found the online booking and payment relatively easy and straightforward. Got the etiquette for the experience.I had spoken to someone who said that the Morrocans in the Hammam get in your personal space. Bearing this in mind and previous comments I was a wee bit prepared for what to expect.We got the Hammam with the body scrub and mud rub which were great. We were in a room with warm marble and this was relaxing. Afterwards we had to shower and the staff were not shy about opening the front and back of my swimming trunks to pour small buckets of hot water down to help you clean. My girlfriend had bikini bottoms on which they were quick to take off before there was any chance to say no. So all this was a bit of a culture shock but going by previous comments it would seem to be standard.We then got a very relaxing hour full body massage which was good.

Romantic beautiful place. Booked via the Internet for traditional Hammam and massage as a couple (treatments done together). Paid in advance by pay pal - it took a while to get a confirmation and there was a mix up with what day I had booked. However when we got there the staff went to a lot of trouble to get us in and were really helpful and friendly. Ended up being given a complimentary Rose petal bath whilst we waited. Everything was relaxing, the decor was beautiful and it was very romantic. Between treatments we had mint tea in the relaxation areas. All together a fantastic experience.
Loved it!. We were here in July and had an amazing day! The treatments were wonderful.... the ambiance perfect.

Relax inside this oasis whilst the City bustles outside. The spa is in Kasbah and very easy to find you can dropped off by taxi right outside.You are greeted at the outer door by a doorman, and once inside I made myself understood in my broken French.After a short wait I was taken into the changing rooms and given a robe and flip flops to wear.The spa itself is very similar to most spas in the world, tranquil vibe, dimly lit, and soothing music.But the treatments are out of this world, the Hammam was not as rough a 'pummeling' as I had expected from reading some of the reviews. Which I was very grateful for as I had had a big night out the previous evening !After the Hammam, I was taken to a chill out room and given mint tea, after which I had a massage.Overall a very pleasent experience, if you don't speak French you will have to make do with a combination of mime and body language as none of the staff (apart from the receptionist) spoke English.Am going back in January and will be trying out Palais Rhoul and Les Secrets to compare.
No feel. The place architecture is attractive but it seems to be on a production line. No feel, too touristic.

Fine if you simply wanted you're skin rubbed with oil .... I was so excited to finally get an appointment at Les Bains de Marrakech, and it is truly a beautiful facility, the people there are very nice, but a massage ... they simply have no concept that it is meant for your muscles, not just your skin. I entered the beautiful entrance, was escorted to a lovely changing room, and laid down with some very hot mint tea to await my escort to the hammam. Very hot, very private, very nice. After I was taken upstairs to the massage area and even though I'd requested a masseur (not a masseuse) I was told there was only one ... I only needed one ... oh, well ... the woman was pleasant, but short and of quite small stature so there was no pressure in the massage. I'd looked up "plus fort" hoping that would help ... it didn't. After a monotonous hour of rubbing oil into my skin I stood up and left. The other odd thing is that you do not exit where you enter ... was I at my psychiatrists? ... no, you get the back alley treatment upon your finish ... there are much better hamams ... none as lovely ... but many better ... personally I'll be returning to Mille et Une Nuit ... not as nice, but a real massage ... if you care!

Perfect end to a great holiday. I took advice from others on trip advisor and booked a double room online for the last day of our stay. And yes it did take a few days for them to get back but it was all fine and sorted when i arrived. The place is instantly relaxing and we chose to have the traditional hamman and massage. It was my first hamman and it was excellent and i'm definitely going on the look out for more.

Awesome Spa Exeprience. We are experiences spa goers and this was a real treat. Like an american 5 star spa - but with all the morroccan touches. We got the scrub and massage duo for 2 people. Both were well executed. In between we enjoyed the beautiful, elegant rooms and lounge chairs and mint tea. A great way to spend a couple hours and was good value for $70 usd each.

A Real Must!. My husband and I opted for the Traditional Hamman and were pampered from start to finish. I would recommend going the last day of a trip unlike us who went on a desert excursion the day after and got caught in a sandstorm, pity we couldn't go back to get the sand off!

Best massage in the world. I booked on a friend's recommendation and am so glad I did. Travelling with my mother, we needed a break from the bustle of Marrakech and this was the perfect place for it. We both had the traditional hammam & massage duo. To be honest, I've had far better hammams and I wouldn't go just for one of those. But it got us in the zone for the massage which was quite honestly the best we've both ever had. Trusly amazing. Les Bains de Marrakech is really professional place - pricier than some others but worth every penny. From relaxing by the pool through the treatments and onto the final lounge with a glass of mint tea, it was one of the highlights of our stay.
Great Experience!. Did the Hammam/Massage-Combo. Great value!
Wonderful. Whole family of mine tried les Bains today. World class service, with excellent professional touch. Very good smiley service. Thanks to all the staff.

A MUST DO after a few days in the bustle of Marrakech!!. My girlfriend and I treated ourselves to a day spa ("the traditional one") at les bains de marrakech on the final day of our 5 day spell in Marrakesh. It was truly brilliant experience! Nothing can quite prepare you for how exhausting it is wandering the labyrinth of Souks and alleys in the ancient city and spending a day here was the perfect way to end an absorbing, non-stop trip to Marrakesh. Clean, friendly and professional. We booked in advance via e-mail and paid half as a deposit. This was all very smooth.

Top place a must do!!!. Fab place, best advice i can give is to book online and pay 50 percent deposit via paypal, which prompts an e-mail response for a confirmed booking! They are difficult to get a response from using the phone or e-mail or website.Sadly no pics are allowed.

Wonderful spa experience. My wife and I took the traditional Hammam and massage package and can recommend the whole experience to anyone looking for a relaxing couple of hours away from the hustle bustle of Marrakech. We asked to have our treatments together when we booked and this was not a problem. The hour long massage was the best I have ever had, and incredible value for money.If booking online leave plenty of time for them to reply, they will do, just not very quickly.Turn up early for your treatment and you can cool off and relax by the nice pool.

Sooooooooo relaxing. My husband and I booked a couple's package here as part of our week's stay in Marrakech. This was a scrub, to be followed by a relaxing massage.The outside of the building is bland giving no indication of the luxury within. On arrival we were invited to change into swim suits and we lounged by the pool for a while before being called to our appointment. We were led through the labyrinth of gorgeously decorated rooms to a marble room with a wonderful scent in the air. We were told by the very brisk masseuse to shower and then we were left alone for several minutes! This was a bit unnerving to be honest as we didn't know if/when she was coming back! I think I would find it more relaxing a second time when I knew what to expect. However the masseuse did return, with another masseuse, and we were then both scrubbed to within an inch of our lives! We then had a mask put on and were again left for a while until told to shower.Following the scrub we were taken to one of the beautifully decorated relaxing areas and given mint tea before being taken upstairs to our massage which was OUT OF THIS WORLD. I have visited several spas in the Uk and had several massage treatments but this was by far the best. The masseuse was clearly an expert. We were then led back to the relaxation area and given pastries and mint tea to round off our lovely morning in Les Bains de Marrakech.

Ahhhh - heaven!. hat more could you want at the end of a hectic week in this crazy cityFrom the moment we walked into this beatifully designed spa we were treated so well. Me and my girlfriend had the Relaxing Day Spa (800dh or £62 each). This gives you a traditional Morrocan hammam to start, a relaxing oriental salt bath and the a full body massage to finish. We were together for all the treatments.The spa also has a pool and bar area for you to chillYou can bearly get a foot massage at your local salon for £62 in the UK so this is AMAZING value for money

Ultimate Luxury. Quite simply the best spa experience I have ever had - and the cheapest!I went for the traditional Hamam followed by the 4 hand massage. At the point where both my head and feet were being massaged simultaniously I truly thought I had died and gone to heaven :-)The Spa itself was beautiful and the service efficient and professional. Unusually for a spa I was really encouraged to use the facility and there was no pressure to leave after my treatment. Infact I could have stayed longer relaxing on the loungers or by the pool sipping mint tea. I highly reccomend a visit to Le Bain Marrakech as a very special experience and a wonderful way to treat yourself.

great way to relax from the madness outside.. Definitely recommend les bains de marrakech. I went there with my wife last week. We had the duos relaxing package.Arrive well before your appointment so you can make use of their lovely outdoor pool and loungers, and the orange juice.When you arrive you will be given a robe and slippers to wear. Just keep your swimwear on.When your time arrives you will both be taken to what is like a steam room where you lie down. Two ladies will come in and Scrub you down and then they wash you with black soap. You will then be left in their to baste!After a while they will return and shower you down. You are then taken to another room where you can relax with a mint tea.Then it is time for your massage. The hour Long relaxing massage is brilliant.You will float to the next room for more tea and pastries.You can then return to the pool area to chill.Cost is about 40 pounds each. Well worth it and a good way to escape the madness of the medina.
Heavenly. Absolutely wonderful - one of the highlights of our short trip to Marrakesh. We are tempted to return to Marrakesh just to come back here! Not for the inhibited though!!

What a place to while away the hours!. My wife and I indulged ourselves to the formule package at about £68 per person. For this we each had a traditional hammam followed by a 1 hour relaxing massage and then a 1 hour facial for her and a 1 hour hot stones massage for me. After the hammam, we were left for a while on a bed in one of the relaxing day rooms with hot sweet mint tea. Think Arabian Nights or Prince of Persia, for our younger readers. Willowy drapes, sumptuous furnishings, fine Berber rugs and delightful Morrocan lighting. We were returned after our massages for more mint tea. It was a lovely experience, although my wife (more of a expert on these matters) felt we were a little rushed, having had no consultation and no prior advice to come earlier to enjoy the lovely outdoor pool etc. Wherever we are on holiday, we always partake in a spa treatment or two and I would have to say that this is the most imprssive all round spa settings we have encountered.Our tip: Arrive much earlier than your scheduled time to give you the opportunity of relaxing by the pool and having a refreshing dip!Les Bains de Marrakesh is situated to the south of Jemma el Fna by the Bab Agnaou (Gate Agnaou), by the old city wall, close to the Bahia Palace and Saadian Tombs.Prior booking is a necessity.

Beautiful setting. We visited this Hammam after reading about it in the New York Times. The setting was incredible. To be in the center of crazy Marrakech and have something so tranquil is amazing.They had a lovely pool and delicious tea and cookies. Very attentive staff.With such a chill setting, it felt a little rushed when we actually got to the hammam. The attention to detail that was put into the space, didnt shine through in the treatment. Also, the massage, (and this maybe a Morocco thing) was good, not great. And when you see this place, you would expect everything to be amazing.The stomach pummeling isnt to nice, but cest la vie.I would go back here and would recommend to friends.

4 hands massage is excellent.. The entrance is hidden down a long, tired looking, narrow alleyway but beyind the doors lies pure paradise.We were offered mint tea and a refreshing swim in the outdoor pool before the treatment began.We went as a group of 4; myself, my 2 female parents and my auntie and we had the hammam, 4 hands massage, body scrub, black soap rub and the all over body mud mask.We had our own treatment room which was effectively a steamroom, with box seating and waterproof cushion beds along two walls, and a smaller room through a narrow archway with one high massage bed, where the excellent 4 hands massage took place.We were given flip-flops and robes to wear and were informed by email, before arrival, to wear a bikini or a swimsuit. We were given lockers to put our valubles into.We were led down the softly lit corridors past several treatment rooms and massage beds, the place is like a huge Labyrinth, but it is stunning with drapes and stained glass light shades casting colorful mosaic patterns onto the ceiling and walls.Once we got to our room we were met by 3 women who did our treatment. They whipped off our robes. The next thing I knew, a woman behind me was undoing my bikini top and she then proceeded to whip down my bikini bottoms. At the same time my family were being undressed too. I told her that I wanted to keep my bikini on, but in French she said that we had to be naked. Being 19 I felt slightly embarrased at being shoved into a room and stripped naked, but that's how they do it so you've got to go with the flow. Being with my family made it less embarrasing as we were all in the same position.For the body scrub they used black soap, (available to buy in Les Bains but is much cheaper in the Souks) and a tough, exfoliating hand mitt (which we were given to keep after the treatment, they never use the same mitt twice for hygiene reasons). The black soap was incredibly aromatic, smelt like eucalptus and made my skin feel incredibly soothed and silky soft. The scrubbing was very forceful; firm but not painful, and took off the whole top layer of skin.The 4 hands massage was fantastic, but oh my they aren't shy and will not hestitate to pull your legs apart and throw buckets of water here, there and everywhere. I felt violated at the start but as I relaxed it was possibly the best massages I've ever had, lasting what felt like about 20 mins. In such a relaxed state of mind, it is difficult to keep track of who's hand is who's, I've never had 2 people massage me at the same time. You feel so relaxed you just sink into the massage bed and you feel like you're floating on a fluffy cloud. It sure was an experience. I would have another 4 hands massage and I definately recommend it.The mud mask was applied once we were lying down, the mud was slightly gritty to cleanse the pores but a smoother mud was applied to our faces. All of this took place in the steamroom so it got incredibly hot but the mud drew out all of the impurities and I felt like a new born baby when I left, so relaxed and so pampered, like there wasn't a care in the world (apart from being naked infront of my parents, haha).Due to religious reasons, women and men are not allowed to have treatment together if it has not been arranged in advance. When I was there one couple had been split up from their partners during the treatment, becasue they didn't specify a joint treatment upon booking. Les Bains seemed very organised to the point at times it felt a bit regimented whilst moving between treatment rooms, I think they were careful not to let women and men pass eachother in the corridors.After the treatment we were directed to a long room, lined with memory foam louners, with thin, silk, drapes between each one which can be tied back. We were given more mint tea and also little Moroccan delights consisting of small cakes and biscuits. Lovely. Relaxing music with chimes and drums played and scented mists were sprayed into the air.Not allowed to take pictures inside, so you'll just have to go and see for yourself.Stepping back out into the loud, busy, hustle and bustle of the main street of Marrakech after visiting Les Bains was like going from one world to another in the space of 5 paces. Incredible.

Ethereal experience, not to be missed.. If there is one thing I am truly glad that I did in Marrakech it is this. Les Bains de Marrakech is hidden at the entrance to Kasbah in a slightly dingy road but don't let that discourage you. It is a magical and wonderful place to visit.To put it into context I asked how many people work there and they told me 50, at any one time, to serve 15 customers per hour. And you feel pampered for it, led from corridor to corridor from person to person, gently coaxed from the pool to the hammam, to the massage and to relax with a smattering of water, mint tea and pastries in the middle.I went for the traditional hammam with massage at 550dhm which was an experience lasting 2.5 hours that would have cost hundreds of pounds in London. Not that I have experienced anything like it in London, for that matter. Scrubbed from head to toe with a black soap mask. Revitalized and left feeling fresh after an awful trip into down the night before.If you're feeling unsure if you should go here - don't. Take a petit taxi to the front door and be ready for it.

Best massage and hammam (scrub) ever. You book via their website www.lesbainsdemarrakech.com, and then communicate via email with them. They are fairly prompt with email responses after the initial one, but took 5 days to respond to the initial internet booking (as you will see other comments mention). They request bookings to be secured via paypal deposit (in our case, 650 MD half of our total).It's in Bab Agnaou, south of Jemaa El Fna square, near the Kasbah Mosque. We ended up paying a kid to take us there, as google maps [BEWARE] has the location incorrect, and we spent a good hour looking 20 minutes walk north of it!!!No photography is allowed inside, which is a shame, but understandable. The place is very plush, with relaxation areas by the pool in outdoor courtyards, or inside where they spray fragrant water mist.To explain (as I didn't know how it worked, and they don't really explain), you go into separate male/female changing rooms, which have lockers for your personal items, changing into bathrobes provided. You need to wear either swimwear or underwear (and bring a change of underwear, dark coloured as they will get dirty with mud/oils).Some staff speak english, but likely the ones who treat you only speak french/morroccan. If you so wish, keep some money on you in your bath robes to tip the staff, as you won't find them again later. I had a duo hammam + massage the traditional one at 550 MD, whereas my wife had a facial and massage at 800 MD. We asked to have our massages together at the same time, but they were unable to accomodate. You will need to arrange this in advance as they don't think about these types of details.I had a burly woman who was very efficient and professional. My hammam was a sauna / scrub with loofah mitt / light body mask. I was scrubbed to within an inch of my life, and had layers of my skin lying on the bench when she was finshed. She wasn't shy to pull open the front and back of my boxers to pour water in to rinse me. My massage was amongst the best I've had worldwide, I like relaxing massages, and felt that I had a full hour rather than the usual rushed one.My wife said that hers tried to take her swimming bra top off, but didn't press when she refused. You are served tea after each treatment, and it's very relaxing. There are cheaper places for this kind of thing in Marrakech, but to be honest, it was fantastic and well worth it (especially when compared to UK prices).

out of this world!. my husband and i booked a relaxation duo hamman and massage.I did this by e-mail from their website. The reply was very quick within 24 hours, so I can only presume they have got their communication issues sorted out. The 2 hour experience was wonderful. A steamy, salt rub massage ending with a rose mud body mask. We did get the giggles when we first saw what each other looked like! The hour long full body massage that followed was delightful-the best massage I have ever had. There was plenty of time to relax in addition, on couches sipping tea.The environment was lovely,relaxing and calm just as a spa should be. I shall definately be going back-in fact it could be one of the main reasons for going back to Marrakech. note:one thing that did take a bit of getting used to was that I was naked and my husband kept his trunks on. However once I relaxed this did not matter.I would have this treatment again. my skin felt fabulous afterwards.

Total Bliss..... My boyfriend and I did a day spa at Les Bains and I can honestly say it was one of the best spa experiences ever. We had a couples spa so had all of our treatments together which was romantic and also funny at the same time. It's a place of luxury and we were so chilled out and tired by the end of the day as it was super relaxing. The green tea and sweets added to the total enjoyment of this experience. A traditional spa experience well worth the visit

You'll think you've died and gone to heaven!. I booked this after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and they were absolutely spot on. The booking process wasn't too bad and paying by Paypal very straightforward. I went with 5 girlfriends and we've all been to various spas but this was something special. We started the day relaxing by the small pool and then went for our hammam body scrub which includes getting sloshed with warm water! After some mint tea we had our massages which were just heavenly and then some more mint tea and biscuits - we were there about 3 hrs and floated out afterwards. Just a couple of things to be aware of, as previous reviewers have said, be prepared to strip off (they are very professional about it) and also get good directions or a guide to get you there, its not the easiest to find.

Bliss - pure indulgence. Four of us (2 couples) went here on 31st May 2010 for a relax day spa package. Yes, the booking process was a bit hit and miss, but after e-mailing a few times after my initial on-line booking (4 weeks before) I finally got a confirmation. You can pay via PayPal which is useful.I took my mother for a birthday surprise and it was heavenly. We had all treatments together in couples which was really nice. First an hour of hammam and scrubbing (I've never been so smooth!), then an hour floating in a bath of rose petals and orange oil, then an hour full body massage (even your ears and hair get massaged!). Every treatment was followed by a relax in a lovely chill out area with mint tea and biscuits for the last one. We were able to use the outdoor pool for 30 mins after too which topped it all off nicely.The staff were very professional. A well run establishement. Yes - be aware ladies that you will be asked to remove your top for the whole duration (you wear a robe in between treatments). My mother was asked to remove everything but didn't seem to mind!- maybe because her bikini bottoms were shorts, who knows! They are not shy about scrubbing you everywhere and rinsing you off in the shower afterwards!We all left there feeling wonderful and the boys also thoroughly enjoyed themselves, having never been to a spa before (and probably thinking it was a bit of a girly thing to do!). Book well in advance and enjoy! Our day spa cost 80 Euro each, which is what you would pay for a massage alone in the UK.

wonderful experience - a must do.. We were lucky because our Riad got us a last minute appointment at Les Bains. The whole experience took about 2 hours and it was pure luxury. My husband and I did the bath and massage. It started out with a wonderful exfoliation and mud wrap for about an hour and an hour massage. This is not a muscle or sports massage, it just pure relaxation. The exfoliation and mud, made your body feel clean and soft. It really was worth the time and the money and I would highly recommend it. PS. Both need to remember to bring bikini bottoms to wear in the baths!

Worst communication ever!. I can't judge the experience itself but I can tell you this spa has the worst communication ever!I have been trying to make an appointment for almost a month now and I have sent over 7 messages but the only thing I got back was: We will send you the details of your booking may 1st. But I never got anything. I've sent it to their direct email adress and I left messages on their website but no respond. Even when I said they could consider my reservation cancelled if they didn't respond,I got nothing.So now I booked at Les bains de Alhambra, and they confirmed instantly! Maybe Les bains de Marrakech can learn something from them!

mixture of traditional and modern luxury. be prepared as to what to expect, the hamman and gommage were quite rough, and certainly an experience. Women you will be naked, men keep on swimming costumes, had traditional duo with my husband hamman and scrubbing followed by wonderful hour long massage afterwards.

Decadence ~ Moroccan style. A great deal for a very luxurious and relaxing spa treatment in a beautiful setting. It's a little tough to find, down an alley near the city gate, close to Saadian Tombs, but well worth the search. Once inside, let yourself be pampered by hammam sauna and scrub, then a nice massage, followed by complimentary mint tea and Moroccan pastry. All that and it's very affordable too!

The most relaxing experience ever.... From the moment you enter you are impressed. The treatments were fabulous (hammam, bath, massage) and the staff wonderful - attentive, professional and very skilled. The masseurs deserve particular praise for a stunning 1 hour full body massage. Little touches are great - mint tea between each treatment, fresh orange juice mid way and two little plates of maroccan cookies. All the relaxation rooms are fantastic - we were in at least 5 different ones! The staff are friendly and helpful, making sure everything runs smoothly. We never felt rushed - ended up staying a total of 3.5 hours. You really are made to feel like royalty!The only criticism was the booking process - I'd actually given up on getting us a spot for a duo relax day spa (so not the cheapest of treatments, either!) I'd emailed twice 2.5 weeks before, no reply, no reply to my follow up enquiry. Two days before, I received a booking confirmation! It seemed to suggest from the email below that they'd replied 2 days after I'd sent original booking.. hmmm... I've had this a few times in Morocco now, where emails don't get through. Perhaps telephone if you haven't heard bacj as it's well worth doing. Overall, the best spa experience of my life.

Worth The Hassle of Making an Appointment. I decided to go to Les Bain de Marrakech based on the reviews here on trip advisor. I paid attention to the fact that I needed to make my appointment early so I tried to book 2 weeks in advance. That turned out to be a good thing since it took 2 weeks to get a responds for my appointment ! I really don't understand why it took so long. I e-mailed and called several times and got nothing. It was always call back or you should get an e-mail today and I wouldn't get an e-mail. So whoever is in charge of making appointments needs a fire lit under their behind ! This Spa is much to classy for such bad customer service before you even arrive.On a better note...as I said it was worth the hassle of the appointment. My husband and I have been to many spas and this one is right up there with the best. It's so beautiful inside and I found the staff to be very nice. I got `The Traditional One'. I loved the Hammam & traditional body scrub. Lots of people wrote about having an open mind which was a nice warning but I didn't feel uncomfortable at all. I guess for Americans ...women anyway we are used to being covered up top but as long as you know before you go....no biggie. Yes the woman helped my out of my top but she was really nice there was no snatching as others wrote. Yes they will move your swimsuit bottoms around but the purpose it to get you clean as much as possible. Remember this is a Muslim country and being clean is a part of their culture so they take it seriously and it's a little different but a neat experience.  My massage was just ok but the facial was the best I've ever received. The lady was very nice. I don't know what the products are they used but the were awesome. My face never felt so good. I was so disappointed that I couldn't buy them on the way out. The Spa owner was greeting people as we left and he said that they will soon start selling the products on the Internet. The Spa owner was very nice by the way. He was very gracious toward my husband and I and was greeting people in the hall to make sure that they were enjoying themselves. The one tip that I read here and will give a nod to is the fact that you should take your tip money with you and carry it in your rob. You will have a different person for each service so be prepared for that money wise. I don't think they are used to people doing this. The look on the lady's face who gave me the scrub down was priceless when I gave her a tip. It was greatly appreciated and the way that you move from one place to another there it would be hard to go back and find your person afterwards. The Spa is quite big and by the time you are done your person maybe in the middle of servicing another person. Overall, this was an awesome experience ! The prices are cheap for all that you get and the amount of time that you spend there which make it even more appealing. It is a beautiful place and the owner should be proud. I would say go for sure and enjoy !

Stunning. This spa is a gem hidden in marrakech. The interior is stunning with tradition moroccan decor. Me and my partner had a traditional relaxing bath followed by a relaxing 1hour massage. The couple baths are situated in private rooms with candles surrounding and rose petals everywhere. Inbetween treatments your are taken to private couple rooms are given tea's and pastries. Fresh warm gowns are given between treatments and the staff are attentive without you feeling harrased. The building is gorgeous you wont be dissapointed. I have been to many spa's and this one tops them all!

Relax, relax, relax!. It was hard to get an appointment through internet. But after 2 weeks I got an e-mail back and I got the reservation. Once we were there everything was just perfect. No rush, just relax. We had the Traditional Body package. And it was perfect.

Excellent!. My wife and I visited in February and tried out the 'Relaxation' couples package. We garee with the other positive reviews. Not really a true hammam experience but a wonderfully realxing way to spend an afternoon. We thought the place was beautiful, and the staff very professional. Would recommend booking in advance as it was ceratinly busy during our visit. Not the cheapest option, but a very memotrable experience.

Loved it!. I was a bit unsure about this place, I sent an email before getting to Marrakech but never got a reply. Once I got there I saw the hotel's spa was very poor and I figured I'd call Les Bains to book a treatment and oddly I found a spot on the same day, perhaps because it was just one person and I specifically asked for a male masseur.The hammam was good, the woman I was given wasn't really into it to be honest although she literally ripped my skin off, she looked on a rush and quite careless but when I visit countries like this I stop and think.. these people get so little money and have to work so much.. do I really wanna get all [-]?? NO! So I even tipped her.The massage was ok, nothing to write home about though, just a relaxing massage though I figured I'd have a stronger massage that is why I asked for a male masseur anyway.What makes this a great experience is really the ambiance, the decor, the mood, the music, the candles... it matches the Thai 5 star resorts' spas minus the subservience of the workers.I didn't really get any attitude from all the reception girls and hostesses and it's not because I speak French since I saw them being as nice to English speaking people.

One of the msot amazing experiences ever. I enjoy spa treatments whereever I travel and so, because of the reviews here, a visit to les bains was a must!!I went with a friend and we had the msot amazing time ver. We were so well looked after, staff were very friendly, the spa smelled jasmine and the music was well chosen. Our treatments: ghassoul body wrap and algae body wrap worked magic. They werefollowed by a draining body massage which relaxed me so much I didn't want to leave!This is a place I would recommend to anyone and I would certainly be going back :)

A pampering must in Marrakech. Highly recomended. We were in Marrakech last December (with friends) and July (with my boyfriend) and booked a Duo Hammam & Massage for couples... wonderful experience. It's a kind of precious mélange between traditional Moroccan hammam and SPA experience; last but not least, good level of service and the staff is friendly and very kind.

Beautiful setting with great facilities, didn't realise i was that dirty!. This place is very busy and booking is recommended.we had a hamman and traditional massage, both were very rough but very enjoyable and you dont realise how dirty you are!!the hamman is ideal and a great place to spend a couple of hours, the staff are very attentive and very accomodating and help make it a lovely couple of hours.

Relaxing end to a frenzies tour of Morocco!. My spouse and I booked the 'Relaxation' couples package for our last day in Marrakech and though we were able to get an appointment for a mere 4 days later, it's recommended that you book at least 2 weeks in advance so as not to be disappointed. We were asked to come a minimum of 20 minutes before our appointment time but told we could come in much earlier if we wanted to take advantage of their pool and other facilities. Had we not been strapped for time, we most certainly would have done so as the pool was lovely!FYI, This is not a traditional hammam but close in experience for the tourist who wants to be pampered. On second thought, pampered may not be the right word. This is definitely not for the modest individual as you will be scrubbed and washed in the same no-nonsense way your mother washed you when you were 5 years old!Here's what to expect:When we arrived, were were taken to separate change rooms, given white robes and slippers/flip-flops then instructed to enjoy the room as we would be collected in a few minutes.We were brought together, taken to the relaxation area and given hot mint tea to begin the relaxation process. We were then taken to our private hammam room where we disrobed (only our underpants remained), and lay on the white 'leather' and stone beds. We were doused with pails of water (an incredible feeling!) and left to steam for about 10 minutes to detoxify. The room became unbearable hot so I simply opened the door a crack. When the gal in charge of us returned and saw that the door had been opened a bit, she became deeply concerned about our comfort and kept checking that we were fine with the temperature. Once satisfied that we were ok, she applied the the black soap gommage (instructing us to roll over/sit up) then left us again to allow it to work its magic. Once again we were doused with pails of water, then the scrubbing began! She unwrapped a new 'loofa' glove for each of us, then proceeded to scrub (almost all) our nooks and crannies. She was not as 'familiar' with my spouse... his underwear were only slightly adjusted for the wash but don't be nervous or shy here... just enjoy it. It's done with professional detachment.. arms raised and lowered, ears scrubbed clean.Next came an herb body mask, more steaming, then another douse and shower (in the same room) to wash hair and rinse off any remaining soap.Once we were squeaky clean, we were assisted with our robes then led to a relaxation area where we lay on thick white terry covered lounge chairs and drank a refreshing combination of mint and cucumber juice.Soon we were collected again and taken to our massage room which was fragrant, candle lit and very romantic. An hour later, we were taken back to the relaxation room were we both agreed that our respective masseuses were the best we had ever had, and allowed to stay as long as we liked.This was one of the most memorable experiences I've ever had. My advice is too book this for the end of your trip and don't be shy or nervous. These women have seen countless naked bodies in all shapes and sizes. Remember that you're in Morocco and enjoy!

Good experience - but expensive.. I went to Les Bains de Marrakech due to recommendations from friends. I had a hamman and a massage. Overall, it was a lovely experience but I would say a bit overpriced. The place is stunning, but the services not amazing.I will start with the negative - my massage was not very good. Also unless you speak french you dont really get told what is going on. They take you from room to room (to wait, have tea or have your treatment) but they dont tell you how long for or what is happening next. My hamman was very nice but again overpriced for what is was. I was alone for most of the time waiting. As other reviewer's have mentioned she took my robe and yanked my bra off without asking. I didn't mind, but if you do - let them know.To summise - I would recommend having a hamman but maybe going to a more authentic one - this is more of a dayspa and I have had a lot better.

Don't miss this experience. My wife and I booked a hammam + massage. The place is very romantic with a great atmosphere – the scenario reminds a legendary Arabian night. The staff was very friendly and experienced. That is a wonderful place to relax (with comfortable rooms and you are served a delicious mint tea all the time) after the busy souks around Marrakech... you will fell rewarded after the experience. It is a “must do” in Morocco and one of the highlights of our trip. We would definitely book another session if we had time. Don’t miss it (and book in advance as they are always busy!!).

How relaxed ......................... ............. what a lovely morning we had at the les Bains. 2 friend & I had the duos hammam & a massage. we all 3 had the hammam in 1 cubicle, which was a good laugh ............ we wore bikins for the session [bottoms only] and the massge was lovely. compared to the UK the price was very good. we spent about £65 for the 2 hours but were there almost 3 hours.you are supplied with slippers [seem to be all one size] towels and bath robe. there are shampoo/body wash and hair dryers. lockers for your belongings. so you can get ready to hit the souks/shops etc afterwards if you want to get changed there. they accept creit cards - book and confirm by credit card but pay on departure.once you have located them behind the door is calm and tranquil, well appointed. between hamma and spa and after you have nice day bed areas when are served mint tea and left to relax. you are given bottled water in the hammam wish is cool and welcomed!the sea salt body scrub wsa great - i was scrubbed within an inch of my life but felt relaxed, very clean and skin soft as a babys bum afterwards!i would sugegst booking in advance so you can get the time slot you want.very enjoyable morning - would recommend to anyone who likes a little bit of pampering!

Not overly impressed, but good massage. My friend and I visited the spa on the last day we were in Morocco - we booked 48 hours ahead and I would reccomend you do the same, if not further in advance to make sure they have a space.The reception staff were very pleasant and we were led into a communal changing area.First thing to mention, if you're more than a size 16, tall, or have larger feet than a size 6, you'll find it hard to wear the robes or the sandals so it would be worth taking your own.We were led into a 'relaxation room' which was nice and clean, however there were still a few flies flying around.We were then asked to go to the Hammam and when we got there, the woman didn't say anything except beckon us to walk in - at which point she literally undid my friends bikini top and took it off! I was wearing a swimsuit and said 'no, no, no' and she wasn't pushy - but it's a good idea to be aware that they do expect you to be topless for the Hammam, for facials and for massages.The Hamman was an interesting experience - the women who did it reminded me of gym instructors, kind of barking orders - my skin felt amazing afterwads, but I would have liked to have been told what was going to happen next.The massage was amazing, the spa therapist was very talented and I felt thoroughly relaxed. However after that, I was led into a room for my facial and told to lie face down on the bed. 5 minutes pased... 10 minutes passed... 15 mintues passed and noone came in. So I put my robe back on and wandered into the hallway to find someone - turns out they had forgotten or just not realised, so if I hadn't of been proactive, I would have been sat in there for ages.A woman came in and performed my facial but it felt so rushed - not only that, a bright light was put on at times and other spa people were just walking into the room to wash things. I've been to a few Spas in other places and it's never been the case - it was very hard to relax, not knowing when this bright light would be put on, or when someone would walk into the room.My face felt lovely afterwards and none of the women were horrible, but my tips would be:#1 Bring your own robe or sandals if you are a curvy lady or don't have small feet#2 Be able to say politely 'no' when they try (and they will try) to pull off your swimming costume if you aren't happy being topless#3 Check when you are led into different rooms what is happening next I'm glad we went, however I'd not book a package next time, just a massage and would bring my own robe.

Wonderful for Couples. We were in Marrakech for our honeymoon in March and booked a Duo Hammam & Massage for the 2 of us. It was an absolutely wonderful experience.Was it a traditional Moroccan hammam? Not at all - this is a much more pampering experience, something we both felt was perfectly suited for a couple on a honeymoon. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We left feeling very refreshed.Highly recomended.

A must have in Marrakesh. this was a gift for my boyfriend...A whole afternoon in relax...this place is an authenthic gem. Clean, elegant, romantic...it's a perfect getaway...i strongly suggest the lit candles bath with rose petals, the black soap gommage and hammam and the massage... after each session of treatment they let you rest in beautiful rooms with faint light, curtains, candles. they bring you hot mint tea and you can just relax and enjoy the atmosphere..price is higher than average in Marrakesh but it worths definitely..i suggest you to reserve in advance...they are always fully booked

Amazing experience!. Went to the hammam with my sister, and not quite sure what to expect. First we were led into a little dark room by a young women, who told me to take my bikini top off. when I said no, she insisted, so off it came!! My sister was instructed to roll down her swimming costume and again had no say in the matter!The hammam itself was not as hot as we expected, it was more warm and damp, so we lay down and the lady poured warm water over us, and then left for 10 mins- very strange! then 2 girls came in a rubbed the black soup all over us both, and then left again for 10 mins. Finally another girl came in and rubbed us VERY hard all over with a thick loofah glove, my bikini bottoms were pulled down by her in order to do this so felt a bit intrusive but again had no say in the matter!!! but then we were instructed to shower, and then led in our robes into a very calm room where we were served mint tea and lay down for 20mins. We then had an amazing massage each, which lasted a full hour and massaged my toes all the way to my head and ears-- really very good and nice and firm which is what i like, and very oily too.Overall, it is NOT the same as a relaxing UK spa experience, but thats because youre in MOROCCO (duh) so dont expect it to be something that it isn't--- it is a traditional way of washing and getting yourself really clean!! but i definately recommend the masage after, which ended things nicely. Definately worth going for the experience, as long as you are not self consious about your body!!!

Great experince for the tourist. Please note that this is an experience and should not be taken too seriously has a place to get an authentic Hammam. Saying that I had an excellent expereince and felt super afterwards.I had never been to a spa before but I wanted to try a Hammam so dragged my g/f along. The advantage of this place is that there are private rooms for your Hammam and the two of you can have the experince togther as tradional hammams are single sex places. The actual building itself is beautiful inside. It really relaxes you from the moment you walk in. You walk in and they tell you exactly what to do and where to go. The girls that give the hammam are very professional and respectful. However I didnt feel they were very thorough and felt they were just going through the different stages rather than actually doing each stage really well.They do leave the door open sometimes and the place does lose some minor heat and you do get people pottering in and out. At the end they take you too a nice room and they give you some tea and just leave you in there. So I wasnt sure if that was the end of the process and what we should do next.When we booked we were unable to get the treatment we wanted. The mask wasnt very through as they left vast chuncks of my body uncovered and when she did the loofah- leaving even bigger parts unscrubbed.The main woman at the desk is a bit snotty and I felt she only wanted to sell us what she wanted rather than what we wanted. There was no problem with the credit card payment.Overall the building and the different stages leave you calm ,relaxed and feeling ultra clean. If you want the experience I would reccommend. If you want something more authentic and less polished I would defintley shop around.

Dreadful experience - don't bother with it try somewhere else. We booked our Hammam in advance having found this beautiful riad whilst walking around Marrakech. We noticed that it was really busy and felt we had to try it. What a terrible disappointment. The staff were unfriendly, did not explain what was going on and treated us as if we were on a production line. They provide nice slippers, great environment but dreadful service. We were shown into a small hammam which was fine but nothing was explained to us. We got very hot and eventually someone rurned up and gave me a quick all over soap. She didn't soap my husband and we assumed she would come back. He never did get any of the black soap. A quick abraisive scrub followed this and a further 10 minutes in the hammam to complete our experience. We were given mint tea and the opportunity to relax before we left (this was the best bit). My husband complained to the receptionist about the poor quality of service and that he had not been provided with any soap. It was quite clear she did not believe him and she tried to contact the person responsible for us. She could not find them (I can't understand why in such a small place). Eventually we were given a small refund but no appology. If I were you I would look for somewhere else for a Hammam. It is not good here and it is certainly not an authentic experience.

The best Hammam/Spa of Marrakech. My boyfriend and I went to les bains de Marrakech for his birthday and we had an amazing time. We booked a traditional face and body formula with a 45mn hammam and black soap body scrub and ghassoul body mask, 1h body massage and 1h oriental facial mask . We had a private hammam and body massage cabins. Between each treatments a lady was bringing us in a relaxation room where we were given some menthe tea. We arrived at 9.45 and left at 13.30 feeling zen and relaxed. I don’t really understand the negatives reviews as we had such an amazing time, the receptionists, hostesses, therapists were all really nice, polite and professional. The place is absolutely beautiful as you can expect and the treatment time was respected.

a great hammam. my boyfriend and i booked a stimulating duo hammam and massage. one of the reasons we booked this spa was so we could have our treatments together. neither of us have really been to a spa before and we weren't sure what to expect! the place itself is really beautiful and the staff were very professional and polite, not great english but i speak french so it was fine. you may feel a bit self conscious about just wearing bikini bottoms or knickers but they provide robes and slippers. the first part of our treatment was the hammam. it was VERY hot, almost too hot to put your feet on the floor but the mint mask helps cool your skin. our massage was fantastic and very thourough. it is expensive but as a one off it is worth it.

Glorious! Stunning! Amazing!!!. The owner of my Riad recommended and arranged my visit to Les Bains de Marrakech. This Hammam is usually booked up, so a reservation is highly recommended.This is the most beautiful place I have EVER seen. I don't usually go to spas, but I have seen the inside of one or two, and nothing compares to this. Just walking in the door, I was enveloped with the most glorious aromas imaginable, as well as breathtakingly beautiful surroundings.I had arranged a 3 hour treatment called the "Relax Day Spa" , which included a hammam scrub with black soap and body mask, a 25 minute soak in an "oriental bath", and a 1 hour massage.Here's what to expect. I was greeted at the front desk (the English is not very fluent), and then escorted to a dressing room. I was given a locker with a key that I could keep. I was told to strip down to my panties, and given a robe.The first stop was a lovely lounge area with relaxing day beds, beautiful lighting and soft music. Many people were drinking tea. This is a coed area. I didn't have time for tea because I was soon whisked off to my hammam scrub. If you haven't had one of these before, be warned, it's not a soft soothing experience. They literally scrub the skin off of you with a very abrasive mitt. I knew this and expected it, and actually liked it! But let me explain the entire process. I was taken to a steam room with about 4 beds, but I had the room to myself. I had my personal attendant. First I was left to soak up the steam for awhile. Then the woman came in and rubbed black soap all over me and I was left to relax again. If you don't like having your breasts touched, perhaps it's best to wear a bra, or a bikini top and bottom. The ladies will touch any part that is exposed.After awhile, the woman returned, and she started the scrubbing process. As I mentioned, I rather liked it, but it could come as a shock to anyone who hasn't had it before. Then you are allowed to take a shower and removed all the loose skin. After than, you are given a body and face mask and left to relax again. This is followed by a shower, in which the woman will help you, unless you tell her not to.I would suggest you carry tip money in the pocket of your robe (20 Durham's per person). I tipped at large at the end, but I felt kind of bad that I couldn't give the woman money right then. She did not ask for any or seem disappointed. I just wish I had thought ahead about it.The hammam scrub and steam is an exhilarating and exhausting procedure. I was then escorted by someone who seems to know my exact schedule, to an even more beautiful coed room with amazing lighting effects, soft music, and beautiful organza draperies. You can ask for tea or water. If you speak French, it is helpful. After awhile, I was retrieved by a woman who lead me to the most beautiful and luxurious sight I've ever seen. It was a private room covered in black tatelakt, floors, ceiling, walls, and tubs. There were two tubs side by side in the room in case you have a loved one with you, but since I was alone, just one was filled. The room took my breath away. It was dimly lit by candles. There were steps leading up to the tub and they were covered in candles and rose petals. The tub was filled with aromatic oils and millions of rose petals. It was glorious, and it was all for me!!!!I had a relaxing soak. I wanted to close my eyes, and enjoy it, but even more, I wanted to keep my eyes open and remember forever the beauty!!!After this, I was taken back to the first relaxing room again until it was time for my massage.I've never had a massage before, so I didn't know what to expect. This was more like a rubbing with oils, than a muscle massage, but it was good. It took place in a private room with soft music and candles and rose petals everywhere. The woman spent an hour, thoroughly rubbing oil into every part of my body. Once again, if there's a part you don't want touched, wear something over that area. The massage included my face and head.Once again, I wish I had tip money for the woman, but she didn't insinuate anything.After that, I was free to relax in the common room until I felt it was time to go.Payment was fast and easy and the whole thing only cost 800 Durham's (or $92.00). I defy you to find such royal treatment anywhere else in the world for that price.There is a general tip box into which you can place the tips if you so desire. No pressure.I can't recommend this place enough. It is worth a trip to Marrakesh in and of itself!

Don't believe all the criticism!. Having read many of the complaints on here, my girlfriend and I were a little bit hesitant to book, but took the plunge on the recommendation of two friends of ours who went there last year (and got engaged in the romantic duo bath too...!).We had an absolutely wonderful and relaxing day. That said, I can understand some of what people have said so far, so here are my tips to make your experience as good as ours was (it seems to be very important to know what you're in for before you go to avoid disappointment or misunderstandings!).1.
