If you can, get your Riad owner or hotel concierge to book. Paulo from our Riad (58 Blu) called a day ahead and they were more than happy to take a booking for us, from him. So we never experienced the forms, credit card booking problems etc. They may still exist, but if you book this way it is very easy.2. The ladies on reception must have moved on. Nothing was any trouble and they were very polite. They spoke very good English, though I will concede that it is probably easier once you are having your treatments if you do speak a little French - we conducted all of our dealings through my basic French and everything went smoothly.3. If two of you book they will put you through the treatments together, and will assume you are a couple - it seems that the "Duo" treatments are specifically meant for couples (though it doesn't specifically say so in their brochure). So don't go with your good mate unless you are missing the good old days of boarding school and like sharing cosy showers. If you do go as a "platonic twosome", just explain when you book and when you arrive - they will give you seperate rooms (we heard them offering this to others at reception).4. Don't expect a hard-going sports/Swedish massage - they don't do it here! We had the "tonifiant" massage with hot towels, which was plenty for us, though I can well imagine that the "relaxing" massage might be a bit lame.Overall, it was worth the money, very relaxing and we didn't feel rushed or herded through. Either things have improved markedly recently, or some who have gone there before us were just missing their Beverly Hills beauty salons and their private masseuses! If you want a nice relaxing day and a welcome break from the souks whilst in Marrakech, go here. If you want the height of luxury on Versace towels and all provided in your native language, wait till you're back home!

Great place to come to after a day in the souk!. This place is expensive. It caters only for tourists - and even after the exchange rate conversion, its definitley not a bargain. I'm sure there are cheaper places out there. Their booking system needs a revamp - you have to fill out a MS Word document with your credit card details, that they hold as security in case you cancel your booking without notice. There is a huge risk of this information being passed along without your knowledge, it is NOT a secure method! I sent my credit card details in a pdf form, with a clause saying that I only authorised them (and only them) to charge me if I dind't cancel my booking in time and was a no show - it seemed like a big hassle, and if they are really serious about doing business, they really should come up with something better! Having said that, we arrived - tired, stressed out from the harassment in the souqs and the chaotic traffic of Marrakesh - and this was the *best* experience we had in the city. For 2 blissful hours no one asked us for money or shouted at us or tried to scam us. Yes, we paid a fortune for it, but I still think it was worth it. We had the traditional black soap and scrub, sweating it out for 45 minutes in the hammam. They were quite careful and gentle with us, and one of the workers smiled constantly at us. After our soap and scrub we rinsed off, and then got dried off and were served mint tea while waiting for our massage. The main reason for coming here is that they allow mixed-gender baths and hammams - if you go to a traditional one, men and women are segregrated (naturally). We had requested the relaxing massage (there is also the option of a stimulating one, if you indicate you want it, when you book or when you get in at reception) and it was sheer bliss! The masseuse was very good, she seemed to know where not to exert force (I have a gummy toe) and where to be careful. I have had Malay, Thai and Turkish massages, and this one at Les Bains was the best so far. The receptionist was not overly friendly, but after all the "friendliness" we had endured all day, this was fine with us. She was professional, and there was no fuss about paying by credit card. Again, the prices are not cheap, and you can get cheaper elsewhere in Marrakesh (baths are aplenty!) but its a beautiful place, with candles and rose petals, metal cast ceilings and soft chiffon furnishings, so if you think its worth it, after the hustle and bustle, book something here. Just be careful how you send your card details over.

Hideous experience. I was at Les Bains de Marrakech today with my sister (I'm her brother). We're both in our 40s. We'd booked a hammam, gommage and massage. First, after changing into bathrobes, we were kept waiting for 30 minutes without any explanation. Then we were taken into a lukewarm hammam by a surly woman with offensive body odour. Twice during the hammam another employee came in to chat with the woman, and on both occasions she left the door wide open, causing a freezing draft to blast into the room. She seemed genuinely surprised when I asked her to close the door. When the hammam was over, she invited my sister to take a shower, and told me to get in with her. I said I'd wait, but she said, no, it's a large shower. When I exited the hammam to enter the shower, I saw it was actually a tiny shower and that there is no way I could enter without being wedged in with my sister. Utterly bizarre.We then waited for our massage in a room with 4 other people, before we were all herded upstairs. I asked for a male masseur, they have just one, he's the sole male employee in the place. I told him I wanted a strong, deep massage to work my muscles. He proceeded to apply copious amounts of oil and rub me like a dog. I stopped him and again explained what I wanted, even demonstrating by massaging him, but again he started to stroke me like a dog. It was just awful. I told him to stop, and he simply left the room. Then a girl came in and acted as if she was going to continue where he had left off. I told her no. Then a manager came in with the original guy, I explained the problem to her, that the masseur just didn't seem to understand the concept of a massage. By this time I was so far from being relaxed that I told them to forget it. Downstairs in the mens changing room as I was pulling up my trousers, still naked from the waist up, two girls came in without even knocking and asked me again to relate the problem. The whole experience was surreal. Awful, amateurish, complete rip off. Avoid.

My favorite part of the trip. Granted I was in Marrakech for work, but even if I had been vacationing, I would have still needed a spa getaway after being in the country for 2 weeks. My experience was heavenly. I disagree with the other postings about the rude staff and difficulty booking appointments. We booked the traditional hammam scrub along with 2 hours of massage, and wow was it worth it. Coming from Los Angeles I have never seen such cheap prices, but it was seriously the best spa experience I've ever had.

ABSOLUTELY AWFUL! AVOID. Very Rude & Arrogant lady at reception. Seemed too preoccupied to contend with lowly clients.My wife had a pedicure which lasted a fraction of the advertised time & was conducted in a dark room. A child of 6 would have made a better job! Her nails were a mess, & were not filled but crooked, & she even ended up with a lurid nail varnish on her actual toes! Really apalling.When I asked the manageress to examine my wife's feet in daylight, she was exceedingly arrogant & off-hand. It took me half an hour to extract a refund.It must also be pointed out that by local standards, this place is exceedingly overpriced, even for shoddy work that it palms off on unsuspecting tourists.The massage was slightly better, but still rather amateurish. Avoid this place... If you want to be nicely treated & spend a lot, go to la Sultana, or go somewhere cheaper & more genuine.These people are shysters & quite obviously only in it for the money... They lord it up over their staff (doubtless low paid), & customers alike (wholly overcharged). Avoid at all costs.

Awful - avoid. Our only truly poor experience in Marrakech. From the word go, far from receiving a 'warm welcome at the entrance of the medina' we were treated like a huge inconvience. Glaring, surly staff, the rudest people we met in the whole of Morocco, herded us round after making a huge fuss about whether or not they could take credit cards (yes, as it transpires). We were left hanging around for ages without knowing why the delay, then said they would only be able to offer a massage for one of us after all. If you enjoy being treated like cattlewhile being fleeced then this is the place for you. Alternatively, go to a real hammam for less than half the price.

Beautiful ambience but go somewhere cheaper and more authentic. On our recent honeymoon, my husband and I booked in for a hammam duo each (hammam and massage). I hadn't booked ahead as I had read some bad things on TripAdvisor about credit card security with bookings at Les Bains de Marrakech. The ambiance of this Hammam is certainly amazing. It is beautifully decorated and there's the most beautiful courtyard where you relax and take mint tea mid-treatment. Our visit had a number of glitches in it though: Firstly we were ushered into the wrong treatment room (embarrassment for the staff and the poor people whose hammam was interrupted). Then when we showered after our scrub treatment the staff had forgotten to give us towels to dry off with.We were left in the waiting room for so long (about half an hour) mid treatment that I wondered if we had been forgotten!The treatments themselves were ok, the hammam part was surprisingly hands off, (5 mins soaping, 5 mins scrubbing and 30 mins us lying there wondering what was going to happen next). The relaxing massage that I chose was nice but pretty superficial.Overall I was disappointed.My criticisms are:* It is comparatively very expensive.* It is so popular that you sort of get herded through with minimal personal attention. Next time I go back to Marrakech I will seek out somewhere cheaper (and there are dozens of hammams there) and more authentic, will a less commercial atmosphere and more attentive staff.

wonderful spa. located right in heart of the city, this is part of a beautiful riad,. booking was easy and straightforward. had quick responces.had to give credit card info but was very efficient.. warning though- its very popular so you should pre book before you go.. def. a place to go to indulge yourself.. the full package which last for around 3-4 hours i think is excellent value- around £85 for hour long massage/ hour facial/hamman/scrub and a luxury bath.. plus an abundance of mint tea thoughout.. the relaxing areas are glorious and my friends and i came away relaxed & pampered...we just didnt want it to end!

Save your money. My friend and I were really looking forward to having a relaxing spa experience here to top off the end of our trip. We tried to book a massage and scrub, but everything was booked except for the 45 minute scrub. In short, it was the most unrelaxing spa experience I've ever had - we were basically herded like cattle with 4 other women through the treatment (which consisted of 5 minutes of scrubbing and 20 minutes of laying in the steamroom). It was all very rushed and the "best" part was that when it was time to rinse off after our scrub my friend and I were shoved in together into a tiny shower room.

Does this place ever respond to emails?. Having read all the wonderful reviews on here about this spa, i really wanted to go when I take my visit to marrakesh in three weeks.I have now requested a booking 5 times via their website and emailed them twice directly over a period of two weeks. Not one person has acknowledged my email or sent me a booking form or told me if they have any availability.Despite all the rave reviews on here, i must say i am very disappointed in their professionalism and communication to potential clients. I will just take their lack of correspondance as a sign that they do not want my custom.

They give away credit card numbers!. I tried booking online and filled up the form on their web.2 weeks later... they send me an email asking to fill up another form (excel file) with our credit card number... I opened the file and I found ALL the details of a previous customer, name,credit card nr, exp date, security code,etc...I called them, to let them know.... they didn't seem to be worried at all...and to ask if I could give them our credit card details on the phone... they said no, they can't guarantee the apointment unless we send them that form by email or fax (which I don't have)... So there you go, they have lost a customer and many more in the future...

Fantastic - go!. Les Bains de Marrakech is absolutely wonderful, in fact it's one of the most relaxing and indulgent spas I have ever been to! Lie back and sip mint tea in the beautiful courtyard as exotic birds swoop above your head, before heading into a hammam for a invigorating full body scrub. It makes for a very memorable half day, and although by Moroccan standards it's not that cheap, it's well worth the £40 we spent for more than two hours of treatments. I'd whole heartedly recommend it!

Girls pamper and gossip. We were on a girls' road trip and chose a touristy hammam as only one of us had been scoured before! We had a private hammam room for the 3 of us and took turns to be scrubbed, splashed and covered in mud. It was great (though different from a Turkish hammam which is bubbles and cold water). A draining massage afterwards was delicious in a meat-pummelled kind of way and we were just left to have a snooze and sip mint too between and after. You could even take a book along and sit in the peace and tranquillity. Only negative comments were it was so hot you could not touch the marble walls and so crossing the floor was a toe hopping experience, and that there was a problem with the telephone line so our credit cards could not be processed, which meant an accompanied walk to the nearest cash machine 10 minutes away.

Wonderful. We visited Les Bains De Marrakech and chose one of the spa packages. We were there for 4 and a half hours. The whole experience was wonderful.We had a hammam, massage and oriental bath. Following each treatment we had a relax session with mint tea. After the experience I was incerdibly relaxed.The whole building is beautifully decorated with your comfort in mind. Book it!

Book it!!!. Searching on the internet for things to do in Marrakech I came accross Les Bains de Marrakech and wanted to book imeediately - even its website is fantastic.I booked through there website but was put off when I got an email asking me for my credit card deatils, inlcuding a photocopy of it and my passport. I wasn't really happy with this and queried it with the Spa but they said there was no other option.I left it a few weeks so that it was nearer the time of travel and then decided to send the details requested as I really wanted to go to the Spa.I sent the fax and then got email confirmation of my booking!We turned up at the Spa a few minutes from our booking and it was perfect from there on in!We booked the Kasbah Day Spa - 3hours of treatment for about £50! We had a Hammam, Massage and then dual bath - all of which I would highly recommend.I have been to a few different Spas and treatments in this country but I honestly think Les Bains is the best! Book it!!!

Luxury!. My husband and I booked a half-day spa package here and absolutely loved it! This was one of the most luxurious spas we have visited and seemed as though we had walked into some kind of scene from Arabian Nights - billowing swathes of fabric on the high, sunlight-flooded courtyard, intimate rooms with soft, beautiful cushions everywhere.Our package started with a hammam which was the best treatment of the lot - we left with skin feeling softer and cleaner than we've ever experienced. Next we were led to a room with 2 bathtubs filled with scented water and rose petals, but we probably would have preferred some other treatment to this as it seemed a little daft to pay that much money to sit in a bath for awhile. Finally, we had an hour long full body massage which was excellent - you pick the style of massage as well as the kind of scented oil. The whole lot cost something like £50 per person, which given that we were there for about 4 hours in total and drank our body weight in mint tea and bottled water, seemed like excellent value. A very professional place that is absolute luxury - highly recommended!

Awesome experience. This Hamman bath is a must experience. I like strong massages and Boo was from Thailand and provided one of the best massages ever! The scrub bath in steam was an excellent experience and then the massage was out of this world. I went back the next day for another massage!

Heavenly. I visited with 2 friends and went for the deluxe package incorporating the petal bath. It was all a wonderful treat and Khalidja who did the treatments was excellent throughout. After a stressful year I came out feeling SO relaxed and pampered. Every aspect- from the decor to the attentive staff, the tea, the treatments were all perfect. I can't wait to return. Thank you very much. Helen

Bliss!. Very well run place with professional people, relaxing surroundings and great massage. As a couple we were well catered for and after the hamam, wash and black soap scrub, you have time to relax again up on the roof before an hour long massage with a choice of oils you decide on before starting. The black shorts given to me or the thong for my wife were important to cover our modesty but won't have a permanent place in our wardrobe! The massage itself was the most comprehensive and enjoyable I've experienced. Definitely one to try.

A GREAT experience ;-). My partner and I researched a lot to find the perfect place for a Moroccan bath. I can't say weather we found it in Les Bains d'Orient, as we didn't have the pleasure to experience any other bath. However, our experience at Les Bains d'Orient was simply PERFECT. This bath is clean (a must for us) and the service is impeccable. Our package included scrubbing and massage and we truly enjoyed. The interior decor is new and very well done. The people working at Les Bains are very professional and knowledgeable. As a couple we felt really well taken care of and always comfortable. I strongly recommend to indulge in a beautiful experience in this design boutique Moroccan bath. Enjoy
Lovely. This is a lovely, clean place with very professional and discrete personnel. We really enjoyed it and will go back.

Amazing place! You will fell like walking on the clouds after this! 5 stars . Absolutly fantastic! I left the Spa like i was born again! Clean, elegant and relaxing athmosphere! Well worthed! One of the best places i have been in Marrakesh!

Exceptional attention to detail.. Marrakech can be hellish and stressful at times, this hamman provides the remedy for it. We had a decadent and relaxing experience where every detail, such as cooling drinks, was attended to. Khadifa and Majda responded to our every need and we left relaxed and refreshed, ready to return to the raucous Medina.

I'm booking again!!. The Morrocan massage was the most amazing experience I've had in the spa world, which I usually go very often... thank you for this relaxing experience with my husband in our honey moon! I'm booking again before departing!

Luxury spa treatment . Me and my sister booked a 45-min hammam treatment. Everything went very smooth from the reservation, to the reception at the venue to the actual treatment itself. As soon as you walk through the door, you are engulfed by luxury surroundings and calming scents. The treatment left us feeling totally relaxed and squeaky clean.

Fabulous Hammam!. Absolutely wonderful experience and worth every penny! The best spa experience I have ever had. We had the Rêves d'Orient package and it was so relaxing. Mojda and Loubma were excellent at the massage and Karima made us feel very welcome and comfortable. Definitely will recommend to everyone visiting Marrakech!
Nice Experience. The incredible Hamam . First visit to Marrakech and to a hammam. The service was it incredible! Clean! Professional! I would recommend this to anyone visiting!

An exceptional spa. This was our second visit here and we fell in love with it from the first time. It is so beautiful inside and the decor is pure elegance and class. The staff are friendly and make you feel so comfortable. My hubby and I went for the full package which was amazing. Pedicure, massage, hammam, bath in cleopatra milk and a head/face massage whilst we soaked in our ancient bath tubs. You feel like your in a whole new world just pure luxury. Hidden little building amongst the busy markets once you step in you forget everything around you.

Tranquil Spa with friendly staff and a welcoming departure from the bustle of Marrakech. In my month long stay to Marrakech, I visited about once a week. It was a highlight of my trip to Marrakech. The staff was incredibly warm, friendly and hospitable, making sure my friends and I were well taken care of. They would allow us to wait for each other to finish with our services and bring us mint tea/cookies and help us to wind down and relax. Once you walk into the spa, you feel like you are whisked away into a tranquil oasis in Marrakech, from the smell, lights and overall ambience. The waxing done at the spa is top notch and my hair did not grow back for quite awhile. The mani/pedi service is also top notch for the prep work done to nails, but the spa does have limited colors in polishes and no fans to dry your nails. The actual hamam packages and the transformation of the smoothness of your skin is incredible. I did the hamam about once a week and my skin still thanks me for it. Come with time on your hands, as there is no rush to leave and the staff is incredibly accommodating.

Gorgeous place-nightmare to find! . I loved the hammam, the massage, the experience and the professional attitude of the staff. BUT I took one star off because the location was so tricky to find. As 2 lone women, We ended up dumped by a taxi driver in the middle of nowhere and had to tackle a fairly threatening situation. Luckily we found another taxi who took us nearer the location (which couldn't be reached by road) and gave us directions for the last part of our journey which we had to make on foot. Of course this is not the fault of the hammam but I notice that others will (for a charge) have a member of staff/taxi meet you at the main square ahead of your appointment as they acknowledge how tricky it can be for a foreigner to find their way around. I would have really appreciated that or at least a warning about the lack of road access when I had called up to book. I would return, but only if I went with a known, trusted taxi driver.

Great hammam and massage in clean and tranquil spa. After much research we chose this place for hammam and massage. Of all the places I walked past and found online this had reasonable prices and looked clean and calm. My boyfriend and I thought the atmosphere was lovely, staff were great and the place has a great ambience. The massages were amazing! I would definitely return. Thank you!

Wonderful experience. During the last day of our trip to Marrakech, we booked a treatment package at this hamman. The entire treatment was incredibly pleasant and delightful being ourselves surrounded at all times by an extremely clean and nice atmosphere and wonderful essences. All the ladies who treated us were very kind and professional and the massage provided by Majda and Bouchra as absolutely delightful.

Very Relaxing. Had an amazing atmosphere with lovely staff, the interior is stunning and is beautifully decorated. It was a bit of tranquillity in the hecticness of the city. I went for the traditional hammam which was relaxing and invigorating.

Just perfect . Friendly, attentive staff and great treatments in a beautiful setting. I got the energy massage and my friends got the sublime hammam treatment. Top marks all round. Going to go back tomorrow!

If you love massages- go here.. A group of us were looking for a combo package for a hammam bath and massage.We were not disappointed. Although a couple of other friends had experienced a hammam bath (w/o massage) at another spa which seemed to include more (clay mask) than in our combo deal, the massage part of our experience more than made up for this. The place is very clean, friendly and calm. We were glad to get a 10% discount that comes with any two people booking the same combo treatment. We dropped in without booking ahead. The experience lasted 2 hours in total. Despite the spa due to close at 5.30pm, given the time we dropped in, the spa kindly extended their opening hours for us. We really appreciated this given it was our last chance to have the spa treatment before heading back home. I have to emphasise that the massage was to die for! I've had various in the past but this was second to none. The masseuse applied the perfect amount of pressure and attended to all over the body without missing a spot. Good price given the cost of massages at home too. Do it!

Best massage ever. I can't recommend this place enough! I have had a lot of massages in 5* hotels in London before but none of them compare to the services I received at the Les Bains, I will be returning very soon hopefully!

Heavenly Spa. I recently visited this place on 23rd May! I don't even know where to begin!! This place was heavenly, as soon as me and my mother walked in we were greeted and welcomed (I didn't catch her name, but I assume she was the manager). She was so polite and welcoming! I didn't book an appointment so we were told to wait 30minutes. I don't know how long we were waiting because it didn't feel that long. We were given robes and sat in a room which was just so beautiful! We were then given tea and biscuits, again by another lady who was soooooo friendly and polite. We were then taken in to start the hammam and were scrubbed by two women who I wish I got their names to recommend them! They were so good and so friendly! My skin felt like a baby's bottom! We were then dried and given the robes again to wear and wait in the room again, where we were given more tea and biscuits (different ones). We were then taken in to have a massage and I swear it was so relaxing that I fell asleep! Me and my mother felt like new women! The place was so clean, beautifully decorated and the staff are amazing! I would definitely recommend this place and would go back when I am in Marrakech again! I recommend booking an appointment just in case too! Thank you to the staff there for making it the best spa experience I've ever had!!!

So relaxing. Having been to a traditional street hammam before, I wanted to try a more luxurious experience.With my 22 year old daughter, we had the "traditional" hammam option. We were so well looked after and completely relaxed afterwards - needless to say we felt a stone lighter after being scrubbed! Relaxing on sun loungers with mint tea on the roof terrace was the perfect end to the treatment.

The best way to relax!. Wonderful experience in a beautiful setting. We had a two hour treatment, one hour of bathing-scrubbing etc and one hour of massage. The price is a little high but it is worth it because you feel like every spa should make you fell: trully relaxed and rejuvenated! The girls were great, very mindful of our relaxation and well-being. I highly recommend doing it with a friend or as a couple!

Amazing - 1st time. There was 5 of us and we all had different enjoyable experiences and all very enjoyable.We sat on the terraces in our gowns and slipps with tea. 3 of us had Hammam spa package, very nervous as was first time but so good. Body felt lovely and soft, clean and after massage just felt wonderful didnt want to walk out. My other two friends opted for head massage and full body massage and both very happy. Will try and find one here in London. Great place to go and would highly recommend this. The staff were really helpful and very good!!

An ok massage - slightly let down by the customer journey. We visited the spa for a massage as a way of relaxing and providing some respite from our day of haggling at the souks. We opted for the 1hr couples massage. The spa was empty and once changed, we were led to a room for mint tea. Typically, this is when the masseuse would explain the oils and asks for your preferences. Unfortunately, this didn't happen. We were quickly ushered into the massage room and it became apparent that there was some heavy building work going on directly on the other side of the wall. This ruined the initial 15 minutes of the massage, due to the persistent thudding. Eventually, one of the staff stopped, left the room, came back and suggested that we move rooms, which we readily accepted, although this should have happen far sooner, if not at the beginning. Instead of starting the massage again, it continued for the final 35 minutes in one of the ground floor rooms, which was a little disappointing as the disruption quite clearly affected the relaxation. Once finished, we changed and went to pay. Typically, this is where apologies might be offered, perhaps with a discount, which again, didn't happen. The massage itself was ok, although it did not relieve much tension as it was fairly light as there was no consultation.Compare this to our experience at the Heritage Spa around the corner (highly recommended) and Les Bains d'Orient certainly has some areas to work on.A little more focus on the customer experience next time please!

No faults. I came here with my husband, cousin and brother in law and us girls got a package whilst the guys got another package. We felt like princesses throughout the whole experience, all the girls are really friendly and welcoming. If we ever go back to Marrakech will definitely return again. Cannot find any faults

Scrubbed and oiled to within an inch of my life. This place is amazing, even from the moment you arrive outside and can smell the scented oils inside. I'd not visited a hammam before so was unsure of what exactly to expect but thought the service was excellent and felt like I'd had a really premium experience (as reflected in the price). Tip: not for shy types! Almost every bit of you is scrubbed and oiled and then massaged afterwards. The staff were fantastic and it was extremely clean inside. I had the couples hammam and then a 1 hour massage.

Clean, relaxed and professional.. My daughter and I had a package here. The price was more European than local, as in £50 per person, however, they washed us, they scrubbed us, they moisturised us, they massaged us, they bathed us in milk and rose petals, they painted my daughter's nails and provided henna tattoos. It was lovely. The rooms are modern and clean, the roof terrace was peaceful, mint tea and plenty cool water was provided along with sweet treats and the atmosphere was very relaxing. There are more women than men around but the services catered for both equally well. Take a book so that you can relax and enjoy the facilities between treatments. Really good but you must book a little in advance. I was able to do this by email about a week before our visit - good time to go is 4pm but don't be late.

Lovely Spa, really worth the money. Amazing kind personnel with a lot of knowledge, they speak almost perfect English which is nice. They were very friendly which made the experience even more lovely than it already was. Really worth the price you pay!

Excellent Hammam & Spa. Excellent hammam and very friendly staff. It is an amazing experience. I want to thank Khadijah and Mariam for their great hospitality. Ask for Lubna to have a great massage. If you are in Marrakech you have to visit the this spa.

excellent experience. It was a very excellent experience. Have to come here and take a luxury Hammam and Spa. Take recommendation from : Kadejah and Maruam.
I will come again and again . It is wooooooow.

Simply the best. I can't compare this to any other hammam/massage experiences in Marrakech as this was the only one that I tried but it would be hard to better the experience anywhere else. I'd had a jam-packed weekend and on the last day I went to one of the top rated spas to see if I could squeeze in a massage but they were fully booked, I'd done my "trip advisor" research at home and didn't have time to check out any more reviews so I took a gamble with Les Bains d'Orient, they were also fairly well booked up but managed to fit me in later in the afternooon. I had the gommage and massage - approx 1 hour 45 mins - it was a wonderful relaxing experience with a firm massage. The products used smelled gorgeous and there was a short break for mint tea on the roof terrace which was surrounded by green umbrella plants and was delightful. I felt totally pampered. You are given the option of whether to have your face scrubbed and whether to have your hair done, I went for both and didn't regret it. I was staying in a riad a few doors down the street so it was ideal for me to wander back and retain that relaxed feeling. When my hair dried it did have a slightly greasy/oily look about it so bear this in mind if you aren't lucky enough to have glossy hair and are planning to do anything special afterwards. There was a toilet and shower in the changing room so those who don't want to keep the oils on can wash them off before leaving, I waited a few hours and then shampooed my hair before flying home and if I'd planned things better I would have picked a time when I had absolutely nothing to do for hours afterwards. When I walked around the souks I had dozens of people offering me hammam experiences and thrusting leaflets at me so I had the impression that it would be easy to walk in off the street to any spa and get a treatment - how wrong I was. If you want to have a luxury experience at one of the best rated spas then my advice would be to try and book in advance.

Paradise . Best experience we could have wished for. We ran late for our reservation but the owner did her very best to let us enjoy the hammam anyway! The staff is super professional, the hammam and the scrub were very accurate, a beautiful ritual! I also had the massage, relaxing and deep. We finished wish the henné tattoo, just amazing! I suggest it to everyone looking for a unique experience!
The best massage i have ever had. Put simply. A beautiful, serene, calming experience. I will return. HPlus extra for tripadvisor who obviously do not appreciate succinct prose.

Relaxing experience. Given the rainy weather and the amount of walking we had done our Riad recommended Les Bains for a haman treatment. We spent a wonderful couple of hours having one of the packages including massages and left floating on air. This is definitely an establishment with high standards of cleanliness and service. It was my friends first experience of such treatments and she loved it. My only criticism is that the changing room was rather cramped when more than two were in there. Thank you for a wonderfully relaxing afternoon.

Amazing !!!. Wow what a fabulous experience at this wonderful place hidden in Medina. I booked the Les Bains d’Orient ceremonial as a birthday treat for my husband and was not disappointed. From the moment that we arrived ( late in our case ) it was truly wonderful . The staff were warm and friendly and very experienced in their field of work. We walked away floating on air.........Many many thanks
First trip to a hammam. Absolutely outstanding!First visit to Marrakech and to a hammam.The service was incredible!Clean! Professional!I would recommend this to anyone visiting!Very very nice!

Exceptionally good: superb experience; great value for money. Booked a combined Hamman and Massage Package yesterday. Arrived about 90 minutes early due to terrible rain storm. Wonderful staff accommodated us and made us feel most welcome. Wonderful 'couple' Hamman with loofa black soap scrub if you can stand it, or herb scrub if you can't. Followed by unquestionably the best (and unusual) Moroccan massage (again as a couple in the same room with two masseurs). This stylish place, set in a converted Riad offers fantastic, luxurious, relaxing experience. And a 10% discount for two off the Package price made the two hours there absolutely brilliant value at 1080MAD for two people. We are going again tomorrow!!

Amazing experience! These women leaving you feeling like jelly! :). Really great hammam with friendly and attentive staff, who know what they are doing. We booked the Reve d'Orient package, which included the black soap scrub and rhassoul clay and a massage that was very relaxing and added a facial which included extraction and hydration. My travel mate, a guy, also got the same and we both felt like jelly afterwards - we were glowing! Both of us purchased their amazing massage oil in the Fleur d' Orange scent. A really great way to spend 3 hours! We booked later in the day and then went out for dinner - took away all the stress of the medina madness!

Excellent. My best hamam and massage experience. We loved everything about it ! The ladies took very good care of us and made the best hamam ever! I highly recommend this place for everyone and i m definitely going back !

Best experience in Marrakech. This was the first spa we tried in Marrakech and we wished that we returned (and not tried something else the second time, see my other reviews).The place is new, it has a discount for couples, the prices are fair and the personnel is highly professional. Great relaxation time on the terrace between the hammam and the massage (amazing massage). Very nice relaxing music, very nice atmosphere, extremely clean. We loved it, highly recommend it.

Best spa experience ever!. Beautiful, Our best memory of Marrakech, Extremely professional and kind staff.... the place is beautiful in an old Riad.This was our first ever couple duet Hamman and oil massage experience which we shared a couple's room,i n which there were two tables and two ladies to scrub us down with hot water, various oils and soaps.We opted for the couple duet Hamman, an excellent scrub down then the Massage, which were very relaxing and calming.A well-being moment of more than 2 hours of pure relaxation I would recommend without hesitation!Everything around is very clean and we didn’t feel intimidated considering this was the first time we had ever done anything like this.The mint tea and a time to relax at the start and midway intervals was perfect for the mood.Highly recommended and an excellent value, and a wonderful break from the chaos of the town outside the doors.We even purchased oils which were bottled in the perfect 100ml so if you came with on board luggage easy to take back.Will take a lot to top this hammam experience!

Excellent hammam and massage. We had not been to a hammam before and now can't wait to have another!It was lovely that we could share the experience - many hammams do not allow couples of different sexes to be together.We came away feeling cleaner than ever before and on a relaxed cloud!Definitely have the reve d'orient package - don't miss out on a massage!The staff were friendly and professional so we felt totally looked after and cosseted.This is one of the reasons that makes us want to return to Marrakech.

Excellent Spa Day. I could not recommend this spa more highly. The setting was beautiful and the staff were very professional. I enjoy spa services, but cannot afford to go as often as I would like in the U.S. For less than $100 U.S., including tip, I was able to get a massage, Hammam, manicure, Cleopatra milk bath (with rose petals), and facial with scalp massage. My partner does not usually like spas, but appreciated his leg and foot massage so much that he got additional foot-rub services - still only brought our total cost to $140 U.S. including tip.The service included showers afterward for those that prefer, and also included disposable undergarments among the usual towels, slippers, and robes. The entire building was beautiful and the atmosphere was very serene. In between services we were able to relax on the rooftop terrace, drinking tea, and reclining in the sun or shade, as preferred. There were also indoor rooms for lounging in between services, if preferred.My services took considerably longer, but my partner was able to relax and lounge on the terrace until I was done, enjoying more tea and complimentary Wifi. At the end, we were able to pay with our Chase bank, American Visa card as promised - this is important to note, as many places advertise the ability to pay with Visa, but then are unable to process American cards.I would highly recommend this spa for any service - the cleanliness of the facilities, and professionalism of the staff, were unsurpassed by any of my experiences thus far.

First Spa experience . I can say that I had one of the most relaxing time in my life! Actually It was my first experience with Spas and i never expectel to be better than this one. Although I went on the morning of the day without a past reservation, they welcomed me and we set a time after 5 hours on the same day and I really appreciated this. When I came back they showed me my locker and stuff and I began with Moroccan Hammam, a very clean one. Then they took me to have a rest with the Moroccan tea and some sweet and they asked me if I want massage now or the jakozi so I let them decide for me and they picked massage first, and it was really a great choice. I started with the massage and it was realy very cosy and awesome! After that I had the jakozi and it was a great end of the day. I spent 2 hrs and half for 600 dirham. They offer me a free jakozi on the package. I really recommend this spa to everyone and I will go again and again everytime I will be in Morocco! Thank u Les Bains d'orient.

Put a smile on my face. I visited on 09/02/16 with my mum and had the 2 hour package (great value as we were there for 2 and a half hours) and for the price is amazing. It started with hamman followed by a rose petals milk bath, massage and manicure. We were provided with tea and water between teatments. By the end I was very relaxed and the girls took such good care of us making sure everything was to our liking. The centre itself is clean, with lockers, robes and towels provided and located a 10 minute walk from the main square. I would highly recommend as I cannot fault the experience.

Oasis for your mind and body . This spa is a gem tucked away in the backstreets of Marrakesh. Very polite and helpful staff. Clean, beautiful and tastefully done up interiors. This spa experience is what you need after a hectic day around the city.

The best massage I have ever had. We were two couples from Italy wanting to experience one of these renowned hamams in Marakech. By searching through Internet we came across this place, weI sensed very neat. But what we experienced would beat all our expctations. We had bookd a two hour package. The first hour was filled with a body pealing from top to toe. We had never thought we would carry so much dead skin with us around. This was done in the hamam. The second hour we were deliverd a message that made us feel every single muscle in our bodies. Not only the kindliness of the staff but also their application really was impressive. We even thought of coming to Marakech back again just for this place. What is more. The prices are more than affordable for european standards...Just around 65 euro for a full treatment as described above...
Incredible quality!. It is a must see experience! Quality, service, attitude, cleanliness... Being a spa locer, I can say - well done, ladies!

Amazing experience. This wonderful establishment offered my friend and myself a truly amazingly luxurious Pampering session never to be equalled. We opted for the mad780 offer and were left floating on clouds with the feeling. There are sooo many lovely treatment involved with this from the initial orange blossom oil, the body scrub, the relaxing massage, the mini facial, foot massage, head, neck shoulders, manicure and top take your breath away the Cleopatra s milk bath with rose petals.Truly breathtaking! We shall most def return.

The most relaxing spa day.... I found this little gem of a place hidden within the busy streets of Marrakech. It is well known that the medina is full of constant noise and excitement, however once you step into Les Bains D'Orient, it's as if you've transported to another place! My husband and I were warmly greeted with smiles and were immediately accommodated even though we were quite early. We were escorted to the rooftop terrace where we were served mint tea and cookies. My husband decided not to have any service done however he was very relaxed on the rooftop with his tea and sweets. I was then led to a beautiful changing room and given a plush robe and slippers to change into. The attendant sprinkled some lovely orange blossom water in my hand and massaged my feet all before the Hammam and massage started. Everything was perfect and I felt relaxed and comfortable from start to finish. It was my first Hammam experience and it will not be my last. The milk bath with rose petals, the manicure, the face massage, perfect!! I can go on but you catch my drift. I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends and will certainly return.The place is very easy to find as there are clear signs on door and wall of the building. Very clean and fragrant. Well dressed and well mannered attendants. The attendants speak more French than English however, we had no problems understanding each other! Just a wonderful first time experience worth every penny.

Steam, scrub, oil, massage and relaxation. A very warm welcome put us at ease. We took the package and they fitted us in at short notice. The staff were friendly and courteous. The place was clean and comfortably heated.The tea, after the scrub, was most welcome. The massage was superb, far better than we've had at home at a fraction of the price.

One of the best Spa's we've visited. Despite being fairly new, this Spa is fabulous. The owner provides a very warm welcome at the door and the staff are pleasant, courteous and provide wonderful massages. The hamman was lovely too. we finished off our treatments by relaxing on the roof terrace with some tea and cookies - sublime!

Relaxing, serious, lovely. There's many Spas and Hammams around. I wanted to book a massage on a very short notice. Because they were already full (and so where the other Hammams I tried) I agreed on having a later time. The staff was very helpful and I communication worked very well (through email, phone as well as facebook). I cannot complain about anything I've experienced. Everything, from the helpful staff, the relaxing atmosphere, the welcoming tea to the perfect relieving massage. This isn't one of those cheap back-alley spas they advertise about in the street. It was truly remarkable and can only be recommended.

Terrible massage. I was wondering whether or not to write about my experience as I had already made my opinion known to the manager but in the end, I thought I should. I was so excited to have a relaxing experience at this spa - especially after all the reviews and recommendations. They were also kind enough to acommodate me even though initially they were full - which I thought was a good sign. Things started off well with tea in relaxation room. Then came the massage (I had a Moroccan massage). I have had so many massages in my life in various countries but this was truly the worst one. It was the first time I had to walk out of one before it was finished - and I really have quietly sat through some mediocre massages in my time. The masseuse simply had no focus or technique and my back felt almost broken at the end of it (this was not due to excessive pressure but simply SUPER bad technique). Her head massage was so bad that my hair was like a crow's nest at the end. Needless to say, it was pretty traumatising and I had to ask her to stop. I really don't know know what to say as I have never had to complain about a massage before and the manager was very sweet about it but didn't offer any compensation/reduction in price - truth be said, I did not ask for anything as I just paid and left. This was something that other people asked me when they heard about my experience. I guess I was just traumatised as I have never had to complain about a massage before, to actually make a scene about payment. Maybe it was just a one off, maybe they were full and hired someone on the spot to accomodate me. Who knows. The good reviews show that they must be doing something right and maybe I was unlucky to get someone on a bad day. Regardless, I won't be going back during my next time in Marrakech.

Amazing Hammam, Wonderful Massage& Relaxing Jacuzzi. For my boyfriend's birthday we decided that we would go to a massage in Marrakech, and out of all the options I think we choose the best one. Definitely value for money. We booked a day before through email with Bouchra (one of the main hosts) and we did not wait long for her reply. The staff are more fluent in French than English but they tried their best to communicate with us and were always very nice and professional. As it was our first hammam experience we did not know what to expect but we really enjoyed it. The massage was deep and I think it released all of our tension. We left feeling invigorated and extremely satisfied with the experience. I will definitely recommend this Spa. And if we come back to Marrakesh it will be the first thing we book.

Stunning service. This for me, was an outstanding experience, The manageress Boushra, could not do enough for us. The spa is modern clean and a wonderful Morden Marrackech vibe, the therapists are very well trained and warm and friendly. They have a wonderful open air terrace where you have refreshing mint tea and water, but don't get me started on the milk and rose petal bath awesome, while the sun is setting, wonderful way to finish or start your holiday in Marrakech. They will be seeing me again. Well done you guys
mr. hellow good afternoon, i just want good traditonal marrakesh hammam:hammam and massage and also face massage thanks

Bliss in the middle of Marrackech!. From start to finish, this was the best spa experience! We came across this place quite by accident and booked online. We always had a quick response. We were advised to arrive 30 minutes before our appointment time and after being given some lush robes to change into were sent up to the beautiful terrace. The walls were built to a perfect height which meant you couldn't see any of the surrounding buildings - only glorious blue sky. We were way relaxed before our treatment even started. The facilities are EXCELLENT, modern, clean, extremely well thought out, pure luxury. Despite the fact they were fully booked, the way everything is organised, you feel as though you have the whole place to yourself. The hammam and massage were both absolutely amazing and staff couldn't do enough to make sure we were well looked after. Changing facilities and the gorgeous rain shower were also pristine. I wish I had discovered this place earlier as I certainly would have visited again. True value for money - I would highly recommend.
Slice of heaven. It is immaculate and the staff are wonderful. 5 of us had a hammam and massage and agree it was one of the best we've had, up there with the Therme Vals.

clean, relaxed athmosphere. As I only went for a Hammam (and alone) I was afraid that they might just quickly do me 'in between' and rush me out again.... But the opposite was true. They really took their time, and gave me a lovely relax-time afterwards, with a cup of tea and water on the roof top terrace.

Wonderful hamam, serenity in the Medina. This was our first experience of a hamam in Marrakesh and we only popped in because it was local to our Riad. However we can't imagine a more relaxing and recuperative place after a day about the busy Medina. A scrub in the hamam, foot massage on the open air roof terrace (obviously the warm weather and blue skies were luck rather than being part of the package but it made it special nonetbeless) and finally a bath in milk and rose water in copper baths all contributed to making it a rather an amazing experience.And of course, the staff were very friendly, too, making it the perfect experience.

Wonderful experience. This was our first hammam experience and we can't imagine a better one. We got the double package: hammam and massage and from the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were in heaven. The place, staff and service was top notch. We could not recommend it more highly!

Perfect Spa in Marrakech. The place opened a couple of months ago therefore their interior is very unique and modern.The staff are extremely friendly and this is one of the few spas that has couples packages including massages as not alot of spas around the area does couples massage. The jacuzzi is on the terrace which gives an amazing experience and the treatments were on point. They provide tea and water whilst you are waiting to be seen and there hospitality is amazing. If you do not book a session with them you will regret it:-)

Great hammam, wonderful experience!. Even though we actually planned on visiting another hammam, I'm glad we came across Les Bains d'Orient, since it was an absolutely wonderfun experience. The hammam is very nice, clean, modern (but still with a great hammam-atmosphere). The staff was wonderful as well. We went for the Reve d'Orient package, which started with dressing into a bathrobe in the dressing room (with lockers!). We also got disposable bikini's and slippers. We then got a nice cup of tea and after that, we were brought to the hammam, where we were washed, scrubbed and treated with a black soap and also rhassoul. The women were very friendly and professional. Then, we were brought to the rooftop terrace, to enjoy another cup of tea. After that, we received a (in our case toning) massage from two other female staff members. I would certainly recommend going to this hammam. It offers great value, the rates are very reasonable, and it was just a great feeling to find such a nice and clean place in the city, where we could really relax. It was my first time at a hammam, and if I'll ever go to Marrakech again, I will certainly visit Les Bains d'Orient another time!

The best massage ever . This place is AMAZING! My boyfriend and I chose the 40 mins hammam with 1 hr massage. Just so you know, when you book a spa package for two or more guests, you get an additional 10% off. Service is great and price is super reasonable. Comparable to spa prices in thailand. You enter from a small alley into an oasis where you first get changed, then drink some tea on their rooftop terrace. You then get scrubbed and steamed for 40 mins before enjoying another glass of tea in a lounge. The environment is so comfortable and the masseuse is so good!!! Definitely one of the best spas I've done leaving me flying. Would definitely be back!

Highly recommend this spa!!!. I had a package which included a hamam and deep massage. It was excellent value for money.The therapists were professional, attentive and very skilled. All therapists spoke English which was helpful to me personally.The hamam was spotlessly clean and a lovely experience (my first time). I wish I had stayed in Marrakech longer so that I could have returned for additional treatments.

Exceptional. I have been to Morocco a few times and this is by far the best Hammam experience I have ever had. We booked a two hour package and we were spoilt from the beginning to end. The hammam itself was amazing followed by the best massage. We then relaxed on the roof terrace and it was hard to believe that we were in the heart of the busy city. So tranquil. It really was a highlight of our trip and I will be back next time.

Lovely experience. We were staying in a Riad nearby and saw this while passing every day. We had originally booked in another spa but got conned there by our operator so we ended up trying this one. And what an experience it was!We were accommodated at very short notice and were given the time of our lives in the hammam and spa. So glad we ended up at this place even by chance.We had a 45 minute hammam and 1 hr massage package and it was worth every penny. Highly recommended!!!

off the scale. new spa with pristine facilities. The ladies worked extremely hard, we had a two hour package and even this went over slightly. The head rotation during the massage was wonderful. Could not fault and would revisit. Kind enough to meet us nearby , had we known the area it is quite easy to find

Best Thing I did In Morocco!. There is no better way to spend an afternoon than to go to Les Bains d'Orient! I did the 2 hour Reve d'Orient which included a 45 minute hammam and 60 minute massage. I've never done hammam before and wasn't sure what to expect, but the staff was informative and helpful all along the way. It was an AMAZING experience. The massage was hands-down the best massage of my life! I get massages frequently, and none of them have compared to this one. The staff and service is truly amazing! This is a new establishment, but if they keep offering amazing service like this, it will be around for a very, very long time. I cannot recommend Les Bains d'Orient enough. It was the highlight of my entire vacation!

Amazing . This place left me completely relaxed,on cloud 9. The staff were attentive and look after you completely . The hamman ladies were incredible. The owner was on hand to greet and over see everything. Ensuring your every need was met. Beautiful clean relaxing would highly recommend.

Amazing experience best place In Marrakech for sure. As everyone else I looked up on TA which spas are the ones to visit and noted the top 10.. I would like most- go to the number 1 spa but after some experience of trying out the number 1s and coming out disappointed I thought I would check others out. This particular spa stood out for me as everyone who had visited had given it excellent and also as it is relatively new you know that the service will be to impress. I wasn't wrong this place I have to say is just amazing... I Have been to many spas across the world and even in London but this (for the money I paid )was totally totally worth every single minute.The staff are lovely and genuinely want to make sure you have an experience to remember. Both my husband and I went for a package of 40 mins hamam and 1 hour massage.The lady who does the hamam is superwoman .. And just the sweetest person ever who made sure you were ok the whole time. The exfoliating is hard work But wow does my skin feel great, smooth and I think with all her scrubbing more toned! Once the hamam was over she gave me a hug and said so lovely to meet you.. Just too sweet and so genuine it made me smile.. The massage... Oh boy... These women are super women .. I'm feeling so relaxed now after the pochon massage I don't want to move! They are experts at this and really know how to massage every muscle in your body! Overall 5 out of 5 for this place and I don't give that to everyone as I'm quite fussy.. Try it..and be prepared to come out feeling a new person.. I'm coming back next year For sure

Best spa treatment experience to date. Having heard much about Moroccan hammers / spa experiences I was keen to try out a more luxurious experience than the more traditional / local one, and this one at Bains D'Orient didn't disappoint. The two hour session included a wonderful scrub / clay treatment, followed by a massage by Khadiya, who I think must have magic hands as the full body massage was simply divine - and I came away floating. Certainly the best spa / massage experience I have ever had!
Very relaxing experience. The owners of Riad Abaca Badra just next door recommended this place to us. The staff were very friendly and the prices were reasonable. We had a very good experience.

Wonderful spa and birthday treat!. We stumbled upon this place by accident and were overjoyed with the experience. Neither of us had been to a hammam before and we both found it wonderful and relaxing, the massage afterward was an added bonus. Staff were incredibly friendly and professional and the amenities were great - big shower, hairbrush, hairdryer, tea served, soft music and a rooftop terrace! I would definitely recommend this place to friends & family.

Extraordinarily relaxing, refreshing, and memorable in beautiful immaculate environment. This was our first haman experience and a wonderfully memorable one at that. From our very first email contact with the staff, they were clear and helpful in explaining the options and how to find them. They sent a staff person to meet us nearby at a well-known public landmark to guide us on a short two minute walk to the entrance. Highest standards, beautiful, serene environment, respectful, skillful staff. The scrubs were delicious. The massage among the best of many we have had. We went as a couple and enjoyed the experience together throughout with simultaneous baths and rubs. Would recommend without reservation.

Lovely hammam experience . Recommended by our Riad owner and we were not disappointed as we entered the lovely spa. Beautiful surroundings with great service and staff that put you at ease. A very interesting evening trying out the hammam with clay face mask and argan oil hair treatment. Would highly recommend this spa - 5*

Beautiful, amazing, relaxing. . This was our 3rd visit to Marrakech, so our 3rd Hammam in the city, and by far the best! We have 2 older teens so we split girls and boys. The Hammam was super, and the massage beyond relaxing. The building has been done to a very high standard, and is beautiful. The whole place smells amazing. It's a must visit place for us. When we are back in February we will be visiting again. A perfect start to a holiday.

Beautiful new spa in the heart of Medina. This is a new, beautiful spa in the heart of the Medina. The side alley way which leads to it is fairly uninspiring, but what awaits inside is quite different. It is very luxurious and services provided are of the great standard. I had a hammam and a massage package and both were very professional and unwinding. In between the treatments I received the tea and pastries. It's very clean and ladies working in there are very polite and caring, although didn't speak a lot of English, but it wasn't a problem.Highly recommended.
Definitely recommend!!!. I had a wonderful time at this spa. I felt on top of the world on the relaxed and beautiful balcony. The women working there treated me so well. Definitely worth every penny

A Fabulous Chic Spa just 10 minutes walk from the centre.. My wife and I wanted a Hamam in Marrakech, having enjoyed many over the years in Turkey. We had looked at a traditional Hamam but she found it dark. This was 2 minutes from our hotel and as soon as we walked in we knew we had to book. It was pristine, so clean and smelt wonderful and was clearly an oasis of tranquility for anyone venturing inside. The constant care and unfailing attention of everyone there would impress anyone at the best hotels but was an unexpected pleasure to find.The Hamam and massage was the best we have experienced.As an experience it was expensive, but we will return before we go back home, so it more than offered value for the price.

Wonderful experience.. We asked at our Riad for a hamaam recommendation and were guided towards Les Bains d'Orient.It was a litte tricky to find and down an unmarked back alley but not far from the centre of Marrakesh, and well worth the effort.We had a great welcome and were given towels and paper underwear to change into, and a lockable locker for our valuables.Then mint tea and a time to relax.This was our first wash down and oil massage experience and we shared a couple's room, in which there were two tables and two ladies to scrub us down with hot water and various oils and soaps.We also opted for a pedicure for one and a manicure for the other...all very professional, relaxing and satisfying. We only wish that we cold do this every week!Highly recommended and an excellent value, and a wonderful break from the chaos of the town outside the doors.
Calm in the middle of chaos!. Absolutely fantastic spa, we went back twice in less than a week! She did everything possible to make sure we were comfortable and looked after.

A perfect experience. Everything in this place is just perfect. Amazing atmosphere, extremely professional and kind staff. The place itself is so beautiful it'd be worth going there just to see it. And after you've got your treatment, any of them...you'll just want to get there again! This is THE place were to relax after walking around the colourful Medina. At the end of your visit you can spend your time lying on the wonderful terrace sipping a delicious tea.

Excellent massage and attention to detail in a lovely ambience,. This is a brand new facility, and like a Riad totally hidden from the outside but light and tastefully decorated on the inside. I went with my husband, although we had different treatments they massaged us in the same treatment room. Beforehand we were led to separate changing areas for men and women, with lockers, toilet and shower where we changed into bathrobes and slippers. Then we were led to another area with loungers where we were offered mint tea whilst our feet were wiped clean of the street dust and briefly massaged. A really thoughtful gesture. Then we were taken to the couples treatment room. I had a face, neck and head massage, my husband a leg and foot massage. Both were done very well on comfortable massage beds in a dimmed atmosphere with thankfully no massage music!After this we were taken to another recovery area on the roof we sat on sun loungers sipping more mint tea with biscuit. We could have used the jacuzzi for a few more dinars.They have a comprehensive menu of different treatments available as well as the traditional hammams with natural products. They also speak English and their website is available in English.Altogether excellent value for money. Going again later this week!

Fabulous. I would highly recommend Les Bains d'Orient. Beautiful decor, lovely staff and amazing treatments. My husband and I visited and had a traditional hamman followed by a Moroccan massage and it was amazing, the perfect respite after a few crazy days in Marrakech.

Great place to relax!. I came to Marrakech for a relaxing 5 day break, this spa was recommended to me on the first day and wow, it's fantastic!It's a discrete and professional service, excellent staff, great surroundings and amazing massages. I'm going again tomorrow, to round off a terrific Moroccan holiday.The prices are very reasonable and I'd pay two to three times the amount in London. Highly recommended :-)

Cleaing up in Marrakech. Visiting the Hammam here, hidden in the depths of the souk is an adventure. Twisting streets lead you to Le Bain Bleu, where we experienced the baths and a lovely (gentle) massage. If you're feeling rich (it is not cheap) and you don't mind not knowing what is going on (unless you speak French or Arabic), this is a great experience. About 60 pounds per person is pricey, but we both enjoyed ourselves. I would recommend it for those not on a budget.

needs of improvement. As a qualified swedish masseuse and having gone to many places before and having had many massages I don't think this place is the best for an amazing experience. The staff could do with showing more interest and explaining in advance what is going to happen. like they leave the room after the massage without saying anything, you are left there not knowing to expect. The bath after the hammam experience is far too cold, i know it's meant to be cooling but not shivering. no idea where the jaccuzi is and if it works...not even mentioned to us as it's optional i have no idea if it even exists. I ordered the tonic massage as I have many aches in my body and didn't want a relaxing massage...I was told it was more expensive because of the use of hot towels...these were not used, when i mentioned this to my masseur afterwards he just dismissed it as if this didn't exist...so why pay more for same treatment but just a bit more pressure. talking of which...i had to ask for more pressure, the masseur replied, i am applying the oil at the moment...it doesn't take so long to apply oil on someone's back. The masseur didn't massage me around my shoulder blades which is where i needed it the most. Also, before any treatment, the staff should ask if there are any contraindications, injuries and so on...nothing was done so. the massage to the face was poor and hardly no neck massage. The leg section was awesome. being French I would have hoped that communication would flow more but it didn't. There is a serious lack of motivation from the staff. Before the hammam traditional treatment, there is a plaque explaining the session but didn't hae time to read it...then the staff proceded on "giving me very simple orders" go on back, front,,,,and not much explained...like next we are going to do this and that. The worst part is that after the bath, you put on your robe which then gets wet, then you are taken to a room to relax with fans on...such a cold experience...i was freezing, then after your massage, you get to put on the same robe again which is wet through...new robes should be provided then as we were so cold. Tea is served but it would be nice to be able to help ourselves freely to more drinks. Drinking is so essential during massage treatments...this should be reminded to clients too! I won't go back again as I think the price is far too high for the experience offered. shame!

Nice Hannam treatment, very rough, not relaxing . My husband and I had 2 hour treatment, the lady on front desk was annoyed and rude if we asked a question, the girls in the treatment room were extremely rough and didn't even warn us before they poured hot water on our heads and were very rude , eg saying quick get up, instead of please turn around so I can do you back. It was not relaxing but quite stressful as we didn't know how long we were going to locked in the hot sauna before they would come back, massage was supposed to go for an hour in the package but only went for 45 min , we had to wait around for ages in between treatments and didn't know how long until they were back so it wasn't very relaxing. We asked for water after spending ages in the sauna, this seemed like a major inconvenience to them and they told us we would have to wait till they could get it , about 15 min later and we were so Thirsty after sauna. Having said that, the massage was awesome

Good hammam experience in Marrakech. My boyfriend and I went to Le Bain Bleu while staying in Marrakech. I was looking for somewhere which offered a proper hammam treatment but my boyfriend was somewhat nervous so we chose to come here as we could have our treatments together (although in the end he decided to have a simple 'Relaxing massage' and skip the hammam). The staff are very friendly and make sure you know what they are doing, without being overly chatty to stop you from being able to just relax and enjoy the experience. The hammam facility in the basement is lovely, with a number of treatment rooms and a plunge pool to use following the treatment. The younf woman who treated me was charming, and the whole experience was lovely - I felt invigorated and refreshed, but not scrubbed to within an inch of my life (which was my experience from a Turkish hammam a few years ago!).The massage rooms are on the ground floor, adjacent to a relaxation room, where my boyfriend rested while I had my hammam treatment. Our massages were done in the same room - his by a masseur and mine a masseuse. We both had 'Relaxing' massages - he said his was very nice, and he certianly had no difficulty falling asleep in the relaxation room afterwards. I wasn't so sold on my massage - the nicest thing about it was that it meant I had oils rubbed into my skin after my hammam. There was nothing wrong with the massage technique as far as it went - I regularly go for deep tissue massages at home so I suppose I'd thought this would be the same, but it was much lighter touch.All in all I'd happily recommend Le Bain Bleu for those people wanting to have a hammam but in a place which is more on the side of a spa than a public bath.

Wonderful. I bought a couples package for my partner for her birthday and we had a great time. The place was clean, staff friendly and refreshments were provided. Some English would have been appreciated as we wanted to ask questions around the massage...but overall had a great experience...also finding it was unique.

Terrifying experience....locked in reception by 2 security guards....disgraceful service. I have recently visited Le Bain Bleu and had the most awful and terrifying experience you could imagine.I booked in for a facial and a body massage. The 'facial' was a 45 minute treatment. For 40 minutes out of the 45 minutes I had 3 masks applied to my skin and left alone in a room. As a trained beauty therapist I do not recognize this as a 'facial' but would only describe it as product appliance!At the end of the treatment I told the so called therapist of the spa and the spa manager that I was not happy with the treatment or lack of it!!!The body massage however was excellent.At the reception I agreed to pay for the body massage but was certainly not paying for the 'product appliance treatment' as I booked in for a facial which involves a facial massage and a consultation prior to the treatment . Neither of these happened.I was told I had to pay and the owner of the Riad I was staying in should have advised me that this was the 'Morrocan way' of having a facial. what non-sense. Why would the owner of a Riad tell me what to expect in their spa facility. I then asked to speak to the Manager not the receptionist to discuss my complaint further and was told that they were 'busy' and could not meet me. I still refused payment until I could speak with someone who had the relevant customer service skills to deal with my complaint and said I was around the corner in the Riad when the Manager was not busy to meet me. The receptionist said I could not leave as this would cause a problem for him (apparently staff are sacked if they don't collect payment ) so the 2 security guards outside 'locked me in the reception' until I paidPOOR SERVICE, AGRESSION AND INTIMIDATION AT IT'S BEST. APPALLING AVOID this place. They need service training and should not have a trading license with these kind of tactics.
Spa . This was a very good spa with very good massage and bathing. The only minus was the information during the bathing. No one told us about time to wait during the bath producing.

Great value in this Hammam in the middle of the souk. Hammam in the centre of the souk. While you can't take a cab to the front door, you can get dropped off 7 minutes away and just follow the signs (after 15 turns and passing through narrow alleys, tunnels under buildings, you arrive to a simple, but beautiful hammam. We booked a couple of days ahead and had the basic service done: steam, black soap, scrub, cooling bath and 1h couple massage. Discreet and very nice service. Every stage uses different local products with amazing scents. You come out soft and relaxed. Reasonably priced. They take Visa. Don't forget to tip.

Ok - but.... The place itself is fantanstic, everything was great. Issue for me was the massage. The woman that gave me a massage kept speaking to the man massaging my husband which was rude and ruined the whole experience for me. I also asked several times to apply more pressure and she wouldn't, she wasn't the best masseuse I've ever encountered and would never want to get a massage from her.Also, I noticed that in general the staff were quite uninterested, which in experience comes from the lack of management supervision. Someone needs to talk to them about etiquette and tell them that a spa is not a place where one would expect the staff to be chatting amongst each other at every chance that they get (literally!).

Quiet setting, friendly service. We found this via recommendations. It was a walk from the main souk. We took the couple package. The ladies look gentle but are amazingly strong from the scrub, mask and wash down. I took the relaxing massage but it was hard, especially so after the Mount Toubkhal climb. Wished i had taken more than 60 minute massage though. The staff don't speak much English so it was a bit challenging to tell them what i really wanted.
Enjoy the classic marrocan bath. Go and be relax!They took the traditional bath and created a beautiful and relaxing place to enjoy and stop for a little bit the noise and quick tours in the country.

Great Massage. Recommended by my Riad ,chose 900 Dirham Package and although it was alittle bit more expensive than I would have chosen found it to be very clean ,and beautiful inside the gommage and scrub really cleaned my skin and rested after before Massage which let me cool down first ,nearly fell asleep...Asked for firm Massage and got it ,it really was a professional lady that gave the massage .I would return here again!

Great massages. I didn't enjoy the hammam that much (though I got rid of a ridiculous amount of dead skin in the process), but the massages were really worth returning for. They were so, so relaxing. After the massage the staff provides you with mint tea and some sort of Moroccan cookies.Most of the ladies performing the hammam and massages don't speak much English. Those who can communicate fluently in French will probably feel a bit more at home.

A nice, relaxing exoerienxe. Le Bain Bleu was a lovely spa that I stumbled across by accident and they were able to book me in for that afternoon. I found the treatments to be professional and relaxing and the staff were friendly. The staff did not all speak good English but we managed to communicate sufficiently. The prices are high but worth it for a nice tealxing experience

TERRIBLE END TO OUR TRIP. Prior to the long explanation of my low rating of this spa I will express that the masseuse was lovely but the massages were average. You can receive better massages in cheaper spas or similar priced spas such as Adam park spa hotel without the rudeness, poor customer service and cockroaches we experienced here!!!We arrived on our final day to receive the treatments which were supposed to be 1hr25, but took 2hr30m. We were left unattended for approx. 40mins in a bath of scented water (falsely advertised jacuzzi), which had cockroaches on the bath top! We were also offered tea from a tea tray that had ants on it! My friend & I booked Le Bain Bleu two days in advance for our last day. We were interested in a simple massage (approx.350DH), but enquired about the possibility of having a massage in the same room and were shown the price list (in French, which we do not speak). We were told the price for a double room massage and a chance to use the jacuzzi was 700 which we deemed as reasonable. The receptionist who spoke little/bad English neglected to inform us that the price was per person!Once we had our treatments on our last day we were shocked to find out that we had been incorrectly informed of the price!
