This was obviously a misunderstanding due to the language barrier but all the staff proceeded to insist that we were to blame and should have known better. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE.The receptionist who had told us the price two days before even tried to deny he had ever seen us!As it was our last day and we were flying out in the next few hours we were out of money, but allowed a member of staff to follow us with their card machine, to our hotel to try and use a card to pay. The card machine was faulty and could not process the payment. We then went to try atm points (we tried 3), but my card would not allow me to withdraw abroad. Out of options, we apologised profusely even though we were not to blame. And tried to explain that had he not misunderstood our price enquiry and not mistakenly told us it was 700 we would have paid it all in full! The staff member who followed us to the hotel created an embarrassing scene in our hotel and called the police to our horror. The police came and understood our point! Our regular cab driver and hotel staff testified to the police that we have paid for many services! We would have never booked treatments without enough money. The staff member from Le Bain bleu was relentless and aggressive! Even after the police officers disagreed with him, asked him to accept responsibility, asked him to take the 700 we had and leave us alone, he would not! He followed us yet again to the airport!!!! And I tried once again to withdraw money to no avail. We were only able to be free of this aggression and harassment once we entered the airport and he could not enter! We are sure he would have caused another scene and possibly result in us missing our plane. A spa with such aggressive & rude members of staff with poor customer service does not deserve to be visited. We are also convinced that the member of staff may have deliberately deceived us regarding the cost just to get more money, which we unfortunately did not have! He repeatedly denied ever meeting or discussing the price with us!! If you would like to visit a spa with similar prices with kind staff in a beautiful space please try farnachi spa in the medina or Adam park spa hotel.We explained that we would be writing trip advisor reviews and the arrogant staff member did not bat an eye lid as he replied that he would reply and contest everything we had to say! Le bain bleu honestly ruined our trip, please do read all the bad as well as good reviews before deciding to visit, now I can see that what was said in those bad reviews was what we experienced and more!

Beautiful non pretentious space. A wonderful bath house with friendly, genuine staff. I had an appointment for a traditional hammam and massage. My parents also had an appointment for massage. Staff welcomed us graciously--we were several minutes late since we got lost in the medina. The staircase down to the bath and pool was unique and had a quaint feeling. Everyone and everything was very professional. Both the hamman and massage was wonderful. Comparing to another massage I received at Le Bains de Marrakech, the one at Le Bain Bleu was much better.

Hamam Scrub a dubdub . We needed to experience the Moroccan hamam, with the thought of our last year's Turkish bath in Istanbul to compare. A not to miss in the to do list while in Marrakech. We loved the layout of le bain, the process and the after glow we saw and felt. This hamam was chosen while checking the Lonely planet for top hamam. Our group comprised of 9 ladies for the scrub; only 2 opted for the massage. Wonderful experience and comparison with Turkish bath will be unfair. These two are great experiences not to missed.

A relaing afternoon. We booked a hamam and massage treatment and were really satisfied. We were three People and had a hamam room for our own. The facilities are clean, the rooms have ambience and the fullbody massage was really Relaxing. The Spa can be easily found by a short walk of ten minutes from Djemma El Fna by Little signs put along the way. If you have time before the treatment, you can take a drink on the rooftop terrace of the Riad which belongs to the Spa!

Scrubbed and happy . It was a bit difficult to find the place initially- look for the small blue sign at the archway in the souk. In the evening, follow the lit path. Staff were very attentive - from reception to hammam ladies to the masseurs. One of the registration ladies saw that I didn't bring my swimwear, and might have to skip the jacuzzi. She dug up some disposable underwear to protect my modesty. So a tip - bring swimwear or just a spare set of undies. Women may go topless, but should wear undies. You start with a shower and soaping, before resting for 10 min for the skin to get warm. The subsequent scrubbing was less painful than I expected, and the hammam ladies were super friendly. If you are uncomfortable with the door left ajar, just ask them to close it. The warm stone bench and eucalyptus smell were just so comforting. The massage was gentle, yet it released all the tension in the body. Highly recommended.

Amazing!. Recommended by the Lonely Planet guidebook, 4 of us went to Le Bain Bleu on our second day in Marrakech. Our first hammam spa was an unforgettable experience in beautiful surroundings. Very peaceful and relaxing. Staff were friendly and nothing too much trouble. Would highly recommend.

Superb facilities. What an amazing experience from start to finish. The staff were amazing and the lack of English spoken was not a problem at all. First time we have experienced a hammam but certainly will not be the last. We will definitely visit le bain bleu again

Traditional Moroccan Hammam & Masage. What a wonderful first time experience of a traditional hammam & massage. The staff were very friendly and excellent at their jobs. The lack of english spoken made for some amusement to both us and the staff but did not in any way detract from the experience. The feeling of complete cleanliness and relaxation afterwards was amazing. Apparently this is one of the best known Spas in Marrakech and it is easy to see why. Definitely value for money and well worth a visit. If we had been staying longer we would certainly have tried one of the other treatments available as well.

Heaven!. Six of us went together as part of our 'me time' holiday away from our partners, children and dogs. We went into the hammam together and cast modesty and Britishness aside. We were washed and scrubbed and anointed with masks and washed again with scents including eucalyptus, rose, pine and (I think) verbena. Being a sucker for essential oils this was all heaven to me. The two ladies who were attending to us were friendly and talked just enough, for instance recognising that I wanted to know about the scents so therefore talking me through them. we went and relaxed in the jacuzzi, which was warm, rather than hot. After that we were escorted upstairs to our wordless and peaceful massage, which I found absolutely wonderful and curiously emotional. The it was just a time to relax and return slowly to reality with a glass of mint tea before we stepped out again into the souk. Heavenly.

Smooth and relaxed! . Arriving after a 5 hour flight, lots of stress at work and a long cold winter in Norway, four ladies was left in the able hands of the personnel at La Bain Blue. One hour later we came out of the hammam treatment with the softest skin and relaxed bodies! To be recommend for a wonderful start to your weekend retreat. We did massage the day after - also a good experience.

Tourist public hammam experience. Know what to expect , this is a tourist public hammam not a spa!easy to find and pretty much every Riad will recommend this place. Take your swimming costume, ladies preferably a bikini you will be topless for most of the treatment. I suggest the duo of the traditional hammam and massage experience. Treatments here are not relaxing; staff are incredibly loud, noisy and rushed but I guess this is somewhat authentic of the Moroccan hammam. If you are shy of nudity, this is not the place for you! Even though every room has a door, they are usually left wide open. You will have you breasts and butt exposed from time to time. After the 30 minute hammam you will be asked to put your bikini top on and have a 10 minute laze in the lukewarm jacuzzi with other guests. Then you will return to the "relaxation room" upstairs while staff hustle and bustle noisily to get the massage rooms ready. The one hour massage was okay, a lot of oiling and rubbing with an occasional massage technique. Throughout our experience staff were kind and friendly.Overall, a good tourist public hammam experience to be tried once.

Great start to the holiday. Read about this online and was not disappointed.Little sure what to expect when we booked a hammam and relaxing massage for my wife and I.Found it easily enough despite its location.Place was lovely inside and the hammam was an interesting experience after which we both felt clean and relaxed. After ten minutes in the jacuzzi and a rest upstairs we had an amazing massage. Brilliant !!!

What a treat. I heard about Le Bain Bleu from a friend and looked it up on the internet. Everything was just as good as promised. I had the traditional treatment with hammam and relaxation massage. I was so relaxed leaving the hammam I almost got lost on my way home, despite I chose Le Bain Bleu for its location on the route I walked to and from Jamaa el Fna several times a day.
An amazing visit. The one who want to try the morrocan bath should go there. They will shower and whash you, while you can relax in the sauna.
Great massage. They used high quality argan oil. I tried the back massage and it was very relaxing and comfortable!
Amazing spa in Marrakesh. Private, luxurious spa hidden in the medina. Very beautiful stone facilities, nice bathrobes, friendly staff. Great place to go if you really want to pamper yourself!

Hamman paradise. I have been here every year and it keeps getting better. Staff fantastic silent peaceful spa Hamman excellent especially the traditional one, the hot stone and hot towel massage perfect the facial was exceptional. Three treatments for under 70 sterling fantastuc value. Upstairs the restaurant does a fantasic fresh home made apple pie after a long day at the Spa its the perfect treat prior to heading back to the Souks

Hammam Heaven. It was totally serene, calming and amazing. A wonderful experience. I was scrubbed to within an inch of my life! Then smothered in oil and massaged till I was comatosed. It was really exceptional.

Lukewarm hammam and mediocre massage. The hammam was not hot enough and the door was left open most of the time whilst we were left naked so did not feel it was worth the price paid (600 dirhams for a hammam and massage). Massage was so so - could have used more pressure.
Traditional hammam. Very clean place, and professional staff. It gives you a nice break from the busyness and craziness of the city.

Wonderful Hammam and Massage. My husband and I are very spa picky and so chose to go for a private and slightly more upmarket Hammam. We thoroughly enjoyed out time at Le Bain Bleu. It was clean and tidy and our aids where very good at their jobs. Our massage was so relaxing and we would definitely recommend it! Worth the cost but beware ladies, tops do come off so don't be shy!!

Hamam and spa. The staff gave us a warm welcome - we, a family of two adults and two children - girls on eight and eleven, was given friendly and professional advice about treatments. Nice atmosphere and good hamam treatments. Le Bain Bleau is beautiful and stylishly decorated. Can be recommended.

Brilliant morning with the girls. Very beautiful spa with a calm environment and professional staff. Good price compared to other spas.Me and my girlfriends booked a traditional hamman and full body massage. They were very accommodating and managed to book 3 girls at last minute. Recommend going in the morning when it is less busy. Hamman involved being rubbed all over your body with creams and scrubs. Warning: You are expected to remove your bikini top and stay in just your underwear. The hamman felt a little rushed and they left you for 10-15 minutes at a time with treatment on your skin. The staff did not explain that they would leave you for periods of a time but there is a notice on the wall of the room explaining so. The hamman could be a little longer, however the full body scrub was very effective in removing all our dead skin! We were then allowed 15minutes in the Jacuzzi which was cold unfortunately so we did not stay in there for long! The full body massage afterwards was wonderful. The right amount of pressure was applied to all of my body from neck/shoulders all the way down to my feet and toes. We were allowed onto a relaxation bed afterwards with a bottle of water and Moroccan tea which was a nice touch- all included in the price.We were even allowed to take home our body scrub glove as a nice souvenier! Would definitely recommend!

First hammam experience!. Just back from le bain blue where I had a traditional hammam experience. The staff were so lovely and professional and we were able to communicate in basic English. I was shown to a changing room and given sandals, disposable underwear and a robe, and there were lockers for my things too. I was then taken down to the treatment area, in a room with a member of staff I was washed, had oil applied, exfoliated and a mask applied. This was all done whilst topless, not the norm for the Brits, but I just got on with it. My dignity was preserved and I had my robe when leaving the room. I choose not to use the jacuzzi although it looked lovely and instead was taken upstairs to another treatment room for a one hour massage. The lady giving the massage was excellent! I might even try to go back before the end of my trip :-) All this was booked for me by the lovely and helpful staff at the Riad Soundouss
Hammam. Absolutely brilliant experience! Wonderful location with very friendly stuff. Massage was perfect after a stressy day at the Medina!

Amazing, relaxing - a must!. We loved the experience at Le Bain Bleu. The staff were really nice and professional, and the massage was incredible. We had our hammam as a group of 4 friends which was a lot of fun too. A must do if you are visiting Marrakech and want a couple of hours of total relaxation.

Worth every Dirham!. At first, my friends and I were very skeptical of going to a hammam. We had no idea what to expect or if we would even like it. I can now honestly say it was amazing and I will definitely be back if I come to Marrakech again. We sent a message to the info email for the spa just the evening before for four appointments and they emailed us back within minutes confirming our reservation. They even provided a guide to take us from the main square to the spa. Definitely bring a bathing suit and small change to tip. And be sure to have some tea and lunch on the terrace of the riad attached to the spa. We had a truly wonderful experience at Le Bain Bleu and recommend it to everyone.

Didn't meet the expectations.... We visited les Baines blue because it looked nice on the pictures. But jacuzzi was cold. They rushed the hamam session and the scrub withî 30min and the massage was so so...rubbing some oil on your body for 500DH. Not satisfied at all...

Great scrub, average massage. We paid a higher than normal price for a Hammam here, so that we were able to enjoy the experience together as a couple. We really enjoyed the scrub and felt so clean afterwards and we bought the massage as a combined package. The massage was very average - more like someone rubbing oil on us, rather than an actual massage. I think, in future, we will try to experience the Hammam as the locals do - it's just that we wanted to try it together our first time. If you're looking to experience the hammam together as a couple, I would recommend doing the scrub, but the massage was not worth it at all.

Fantastic!!!!. I had my first (and horrible!) hamam experience in Istanbul in January and so I was very skeptical about going to the spa/hamam in Marrakech. I had a packed itinerary in Morocco so I just said to myself to give it a go. I realised I would need a massage before I head back home just to loosen up my muscles and ease my back pain from all the walking. I read review after review here on TA about the different hamams and found Le Bain Bleu. There were a few reviews that were off but then I trusted my gut and booked my massage and hamam therapy here anyway....and I am glad I did!Upon reviews here on TA, I followed suit that one must come in very early to avoid the crowds. I booked with Gemma for a hamam and sports massage at 10am however when I came, they didn't have my booking at all. Luckily, they still had one slot left. If this booking process had been taken cared off, I would've given them 5 stars! The ladies who took care of me were very professional and made sure I was getting the treatment up to standard. I was all alone in the hamam area which was blissful! The staff speak only a few words of English but were very helpful and kind. The lady who did my sports massage was THE best. I'm not your typical soft-massage lady so I found it fantastic that she was able to deliver the amount of pressure I want! Take your time relaxing after your treatments. I actually had a whole pot of moroccan tea! Haha! I am also naturally a curious person and looked behind the curtains and saw that there was a riad attached to the spa. I will definitely book my next stay in this riad as it is well-located and BEAUTIFUL inside! ps. if you're going to Istanbul and want to know which hamams to avoid, write me a message or see my reviews!

Hammam from Heaven. Had a great Hammam with a 'Traditional Beauty Express'. I had no idea what to expect, from here, or from the whole Hammam experience. It was a beautiful spa, with lovely people, and wonderfully liberating. felt very pampered and there was no one else there, so the whole thing was wonderfully relaxing. Some of the staff didn't know english, but that made the whole thing even more hilarious, and I felt perfectly at ease. Amazing, I would come again every time, and recommend it to everyone.

Would not recommend this place . Staff was fighting when we arrived and was very unfriendly and stressfull during our stay. The place was very noisy and we could not relax. Too bad, we hoped for a nice Marrocan hammam experience but it was far from nice.

Fantastic hammam and spa- probably the best massage I've had!. My boyfriend and I went here whilst in Marrakech and loved it. We were able to have the treatments together which isn't the case with all Hammams. We opted for the traditional hammam which included a scrub, body mask and massage. The whole thing lasted about 2.5 hrs and it was so relaxing. It was also probably the best massage I've ever had. I would definately recommend to anyone visiting Marrakech on the look out for some relaxation.

Wow so relaxing. Just what we needed and we were not disappointed. I chose the relaxation package, approx £68 but for 3 hrs of pure chill time it was worth every penny. Definitely recommend this hammam.

My first hammam...and the last I will have at bain bleu. After being shown in, I asked about the underwear, was told they will give me something to use after the hammam. Wore bra and panties as instructed on the wall. Bra removed after being totally soaked (so why was I told to wear it?). First rinse and oiling very quick, then was left on my own for so long I came out of my room to see what was going on. Scrubbing was alright, but she did not do all areas (and other areas too much). Again left for a long time, spent it stretching because not sure what else to do. Final wash also left out patches, and had to request enough rinses to actually get the soap out of my hair. Left in both jacuzzi and rest area with no indication of how long I should be there, when they would come get me or where I was supposed to go next. Skin feels very dry afterwards, not soft and glowing like some travel companions had after their experience at a different spa.

Very relaxing, highly recommended. A great retreat from the city. Staff were professional and attentive. We were a group of four and were all able to receive our treatments together. Massage was amazing. Received water and tea. Definitely worth a visit.

Relaxing after a busy day in Marrakech. The hammam bain bleu was very relaxing. First we had a hammam and after that a one hour massage. We really liked the hammam and the massage was absolutley amazing and very relaxing.The only thing I didn't like, was that the people working there were talking loudly to eachother during the hammam which was a bit disturbing. But they were very friendly and courteous.

Excellent hamman and massage. We had an excellent hamman and massage here last week. We pretty much had the whole place to ourselves as it was very quiet, There is a nice bar upstairs, and the spa is clean and feels quite luxurious. The hamman was good, it would have been good to have more explanation about the various different stages (perhaps not done due to the language barrier). The hour long massages afterwards were really good. Overall, the staff were friendly and professional and we managed to happily spend almost 3 hours in the spa, relaxing between and after the treatments. Would definitely recommend.

Felt 20 years younger!. Wow! In all of the hubbub of Morocco find tranquility! Tucked away in the Medina, Le Bain Bleu is a wonderful first experience of a hammam. Everything is provided, bathrobe, slippers and paper pants (you can take your own bikini/swimming trunks instead if your prefer). My husband and I booked a session together and after getting changed were shown into the room in the profile photograph. We were then treated to an hours worth of rubbing, scrubbing, oiling up, splashing and general bodily washing. I felt 20 years younger when it was finished and my skin was very clean! We were then led off to the bubble pool and given a bottle of water each to re hydrate. Finally we were led to the coming round area and lay on beds listening to soft music whilst drinking mint tea! There is a terrace restaurant available too - gin and tonic has never tasted so good! Would absolutely recommend this to everyone - its a massive contrast to the sounds and smells of Marrakesh.

relaxing. took 3 girlfriend's away on holiday and we ended up having a 3 hour session here, now some of us are fat others older etc. but the staff made us feel right at home, and were very welcoming. I will defiantly go again when I go back.

Walks the line between authentic hammam and luxury spa. We recommend this hammam for anyone new to the concept who wants to try it, but is perhaps nervous about the grit and grime of a traditional hammam. They have developed a space that is atmospheric and attractive, with the basement containing the hot rooms and plunge pool, while the ground floor has relaxation beds and the reception and changing facilities. We opted for a Traditional Hammam package which included a hammam body scrub with black soap, Ghassoul body mask, footbath, and massage with argan oil. For those used to Western European spas, this is not the same, so shed your expectations. You will be scrubbed vigorously and hot water poured over you to rinse off the various treatments, while you lie or sit in the hot steam room. You will feel as if you are being pushed around a bit, but you need to relax into this. The rooms can be noisy as a result of the nature of the process. We found it relaxing, but those used to quiet spas might find it not so much!Speaking French or Arabic would help you - our masseuse spoke no English - but is not essential in my view. We left feeling refreshed and very clean indeed. We would go again.

Go in the morning, you will be in paradise.. This is one of my first spa experiences, a good way to start! We were hesitating to go because of the mixed review here. But we are glad that we finally went IN THE MORNING, because it was empty (there were only two girls who went before us). The best thing about this place is their MASSAGE! We were treated like a king and queen. Hammam was so-so, don't expect too much.. It is not hot enough! Neither the Jacuzzi.. But it was still good!! The fact that there were not so many people there, it is a high plus point, no rush! The waiting room is one of the best part! It is so relaxing, just laying down in a nicely decorated room, with your mint tea and cake. We were super relaxed in the massage room. The product that they use is also great, the Argan oil, is not oily but sticky enough to be used for a massage. The masseur are very well experienced and did very well! The best part is that after the massage, the masseurs left us to relax for a bit. Overall it is a very nice experience!

Good place. Our Riad recommended this place and we really enjoyed the hamman and massage afterwards. We don't have anything to compare it to but felt overall that the experience was positive and very relaxing.

Not relaxing and not recommended. My friends and I spent a couple of hours in the spa having pre booked the traditional duo package. This was for the hammam, massage and to use the spa facilities at a cost of 600 mad.The whole experience was disappointing and not at all relaxing. There were so many people that we had to have our massage before the hammam as they had obviously overbooked. The spa itself was noisy and overcrowded and not particularly clean. We had to ask for water and were not offered refreshments at any time. The main areas had both men and women in attendance and it was quite noisy. We did not end up going in the jacuzzi as it was too busy and the staff were obviously wanting to get us out as soon as possible after the hammam.The staff do not speak English so it was difficult to know what was going on or what was happening next. The massage was not so bad although starting at the feet and ending with the face is not ideal. However the hammam was really, really dreadful. It was not pleasurable and felt like we were on a conveyer belt, being pushed and pulled about and at times it was verging on embarrassing. We all felt that the staff were just treating us as stupid tourists with no care or genuine level of service. Although we did not have any idea what to expect, this was not the experience we had anticipated having looked forward to a relaxing treat. None of our party are prudish however it was lucky that we all possess a sense of humour!I had a hammam at the Riad we were staying at a couple of days later which was totally different and an absolutely wonderful experience which made me understand what a traditional hammam should really be about.None of us would recommend Le Bain Bleu as a great experience. Do not go here.

Relaxing New Year's Day treat. The riad we were staying in recommended this spa and it was a good choice. I really enjoyed the experience of a haman and if possible have a massage after. I found this experience very relaxing.

Nice caos, great massage. I did an appointment recently with 2 friends of mine. The way to the spa was very special and beautiful. We booked two massages and a facial. But when we arrived we figured out the the level of English wasn't that good from anyone working in the spa. So by accident we ended up in the Hamam. Which was our first time so it took a while until we recognized the mistake. Unfortunately there were not enough employees to give two massages afterwards. It was really a little caos. Anyhow, the hot stone massage I received afterwards was amazing. The spa is clean and has a nice atmosphere. The employees are a bit noisy and the commandos a bit harsh. All together a special experience and fair prices (we did not have to pay for the Hamam treatment)

A wonderful relaxing afternoon!. My friend and I needed a relaxing spa day after a hectic weekend in Marrakech. We basically wandered around the city when no solid plan. The first Hammam spa we looked at was fully booked. Finally, after an hour, we stumbled upon Le Bain Bleu. My friend remembered it from some reviews she read and we were both a little skeptical but figured we'd try it anyway. We were both glad we did! Thankfully, they had open spots for us right there. We ordered a traditional Moroccan Hammam for only 200MAD (less than 20euro). This included a foot soak and a eucalyptus scrub. First we were brought into a changing room and given paper thongs, robes, slippers, and lockers for our things. We were to take off everything including our bras. Once we were changed we were brought into a private room with lounge chairs, a jacuzzi, and showers. We took off our robes and washed ourselves down. Then we were guided into an adjacent hot, stone room with stone benches. Some reviews include men being in the room with women and an uncomfortable atmosphere. I can assure you this was not the case. My friend and I, both women, were the only people in the stone room other than the female workers treating us. We each had our own girl working on us. First they threw warm water on us then washed our bodies everywhere. I mean EVERYWHERE. Thankfully, neither of us being awkward people were okay with this. However, some women might feel uncomfortable with this. After they left our feet to soak for about 10 minutes and left the room. When they arrived back they threw more water on us to take the soap off. They then scrub our bodies with some type of mitten. I have had body scrubs before at high end spas. This was by far the most effective scrub I have ever received. We were actually able to see all the dead skin that was scrubbed off, and I take very good care of my skin. They then washed us down again and we showered, washing our hair also.We were then brought to a cold jacuzzi which was a lot more refreshing than it sounds. We sat there for about 10 minutes just cooling off. We put our bathrobes back on and were led to a quite room with lounge chairs. A woman brought us water, delicious mint tea and biscotti buscuits. We were left to rest for as long as we wanted. All in all a wonderful and inexpensive experience for our first hammam and highly recommended!!

Wonderful 3 hour trip to relaxation bliss. Le Bain Bleu is a luxury and in so I felt I received above my expectations and good value for my money. The facility is very serene and well laid out. I felt very comfortable and no apprehension as this was my first hammam. I felt like a new me when all was said and done. The staff were always courteous and attentive. There is ample time to relax and let your cares melt away. I felt the facility was clean and kept up. The massage was wonderful and the staff very attentive. I would definitely go for a return visit. For my first hammam experience, I feel like labeling this establishment as catering to 'tourists' not a bad label in fact I am glad it was more un-traditional.

Worth every cent for visitors to Marrakech. My hubbie and I decided we couldn't have a trip to morocco without experiencing a Hammam. While some people on tripadvisor have complained this place caters to tourists I don't see this as a bad thing - after all we are tourists. We opted for the full experience of the hammam, massage, facial and pedicure. The entire experience was wonderful. We are treated well, privacy was respected (I was covered with a towel since other visitors were in the jacuzzi). The whole experience lasted about 4 hours. I did see the areas cleaned for other patrons. While everything wasn't scrubbed to creation with bleach like you'd find in the western countries, it was definitely adequate and I felt comfortable being there.

Lukewarm experience catering to touristss. Let me begin with a statement that I am not a hammam novice and have prior experience. I traveled to Morocco with my sister and wanted her to experience the same traditional bath and ritual I fell in love with. We choose this place since it received high recommendations from Lonely Travel guide book.The place is nice but being associated with hotel it caters to its guests which means that you will encounter presence of men which is not acceptable in traditional hammam. I am not a prude but 6 noisy Dutch men in jacuzzi bath playing bowling with water bottles who wandered into our hammam room where we are basically naked is hardly relaxing experience. The whole hammam procedure consisted of 40 minutes of being laying on marble slab and 4 minutes of scrubbing rinsing included. Don't get me wrong, place is nice but it is far from traditional hammam where I was scrubbed to no end by 2 women, rinsed, bathed, my hair was washed, all in absolutely quiet and calm atmosphere. If you are looking for something more traditional, I am afraid this is not a place.

Relax. It was difficult to find this place. While you are in Marrakesh you need to visit hammam as this town has great traditions. We received an advise for 3 places and choose this as at the end of the day we were tired and were close to this place. I liked the service, design of the place and I did not expect traditional European approach for spa as you can find in this region only old traditions. Relax, enjoy and keep smiling. They served us with the bottle of water and I liked it a lot. It could be nice to have a cup of herbal tea at the end of the hammam.

An amazing 'first-timers' hammam visit.. My partner and I knew we had to visit hammam while we were in Marrakech. This hammam was right next to our riad so we did some research online and went over to reserve a spot for the next day.This hammam is untraditional in the sense that he and I could both partake in the experience together. While we spoke English, the hammam staff, who spoke French and Arabic did their best to communicate with us. We were treated very well here, and the 'Traditional' service along with a massage was amazing. I would recommend it to anyone who is going to a hammam for the first time. Very relaxing and very Spa-like. Be sure to bring extra cash for your massage and your hammam attendant. They deserve it!

Grand Bleu Relax - superb relaxation. Whilst my fiance went on a day's cookery course in Le Riad Monceau, I went for a hamman at Le Bain Bleu. I was very pleased to have chosen this private hamman, which we had researched before travelling and had our Riad book for me. I chose to have the full Grand Bleu Relax, which comprised a scrub, relaxing bath, jacuzzi, full body massage, full facial and finished off with a pedicure. This took 4 hours and I was treated with full respect throughout, by a different professional for each treatment. My skin was noticeably smoother and my face looked radiant. I would recommend this personal treat to anyone visiting Marrakech with time away from the hustle of the souks.

Warning Travelers. **Warning Travelers**Here is what you, the Traveler, need to know about Le Bain Bleu. This spa is disrespectful, unprofessional, and unhygienic and not the place you want to go to experience a real Moroccan hamam. My husband has worked in research and development for the Spa industry for 10 years and in the massage field for 20 years providing education, instruction and providing services for professional sport teams. Thus you can trust, regardless of any reply from this “spa”, that this is not a case of a finicky or temperamental tourist who didn’t like their massage and service but a precise and accurate account of what you will be confronting if you go to this unprofessional, unhygienic and seriously disrespectful attempt at creating a spa experience for tourists in Marrakech.Here are the highlights, 1. Dirty Sandals, black with grime2. The hamam was lukewarm.3. The bowls that they used to wash the feet were obviously not cleaned as they soaked our feet in them, splashed the bench where we were laying down and just put them back in the corner.4. The pillows to rest your head were reused for several patronsAll of this increases the chance for cross infection.5. The services provided in the hamam would last a total of 2-3 minutes before the women left. It was hurried, not relaxing, and was definitely under par for any spa.No direction or communication of what to expect or do, if you have never experienced a Traditional Moroccan HamamNo indication that I, who obviously showed up with no bathing suit and was told that they would have something for me to wear at the Spa, would only be provided a paper g-string and had to wear a lace see through bra which was removed during the treatment numerous times during the hamam and the JacuzziLeaving the hamam door open while other patrons/men showered and leaving me exposed to men while we were escorted to the Jacuzzi pool, regardless of the fact that my husband demanded they give me a pair of the men’s shorts and his numerous requests that they cover me up. He had to stand in front of me and shield me from view in the shower and sit in front of me in the Jacuzzi to give me some dignity more than once as the women who provided services made no attempt to help.I was told to walk topless to the Jacuzzi while another other couple in the pool uncomfortably looked away but were also showing more respect for me than the spa staff could muster as I was obviously in a very uncomfortable and DISRESPECTFUL SITUATION. The oil massage started at the feet and ended up finishing with a generous lathering of the oil from the feet and body all over our faces and hair. In massage 101 they teach never to massage from the feet up because it leaves the client irritated and unable to relax as it pushes all the energy up to the head.Regardless of the numerous attempts to indicate to cover me up during the massage we were put in the same room and as my husband insisted my chest be covered with a towel as there was a man in the room massaging him, the hand towel was laid on top exposing the side of my chest. My husband opened his eyes during the massage and saw his therapist staring at me. In Arabic/Muslim countries if you don’t already know ---- something as small as “side” exposure is a sign that you are a loose woman and should be treated and thought of as such. Many would venture to say, “you should have just left rather than subject yourself to this type of treatment”, and like we have all probably experienced at one or more times in our lives, OF COURSE we should have!In retrospect, I would have done it a heartbeat but we didn’t. At the time we were both shocked and confused about what a traditional hamam entailed “in Morocco.” In the United States and any other country where my husband has worked or where we traveled, it is totally different in that it is professional, sanitary and dignified for exactly the same price! Even putting aside the entire experience of the emotional trauma and internal triggers of disrespect and disregard for the privacy of my body and the lack of dignity offered to me as a client in their spa, the most infuriating part was that Morocco being a Muslim country, more than any place in the world adheres to keeping men and women separate. It is a HUGE issue to disrespect a man by disrespecting his wife, and if a Moroccan, Muslim or Islamic man [apparently foreigners at this spa are treated with less respect than a dog at the groomer] had someone touch and rub their feet and then touch their face and head with the same oil, and in addition, treat their wife the way I was treated, he would “take action” and have the support of everyone around him. Bottom line, don’t be fooled by their claims, by the generic upscale spa like façade that makes them look professional. You can take your chances and hope for a good massage saying, “those people reviewing just didn’t have a good experience” but don’t forget that if you end up being treated as we were, it leaves a deeper wound than just inexperienced staff or bad luck of the draw.Also, if you read other reviews, other women have been treated disrespectfully such as being left completely nude with no indication that she might be exposed to male patrons, not to mention numerous people who contracted infections from this spa.Our Riad felt so bad and embarrassed about what happened, indicating that this was an contemptible way to treat guests in Morocco, that they refunded the money we paid for the service and said they would take it upon themselves to get the money back from the spa, communicating their atrocious behavior and treatment of guests they sent to their spa. We have recently found out up to present day the spa manager has refused to work with or compromise with the Riad. We as travelers need to stick together to keep our comments accurate and detailed to influence change or facilitate enough loss of business to stop this kind of behavior toward the travelers who bring the money and support into their economy. Trip Advisor gives us a forum to do this and it is important we ensure other travelers can count on our comments so they don’t suffer the same indignities, misfortune and mistakes we endure and make it so that in the long run we can all experience the excitement, fun, beauty, pleasure and wonder travel can truly provide.

Great escape- don't miss this opportunity. Le Bain Bleu was recommended to us by the staff at Riad Magellan when we inquired about going to a hammam this was an excellent and comfortable blend of traditional and pampering not to be missed. Although not much of how the 2 hours we spent a the hammam was explained to us it didn't matter because each experience was lovelier than the next.First we went downstairs and had a private hammam room ( just the 2 of us) the hot marble felt great on our achy bodies after the bustle of the medina and if you got too hot there was a shower to cool down. The only complaint was that there was a loud group out in the common area that continued to ignore the shhhs being sent their way.After the ladies came in and rubbed us down with the special black soap and hand mits they sent us out to what looked like a hot tub in the common area. Honestly, the last thing I wanted to do was get into hot water, Surprise! It was actually a perfectly temperature cool bath! After we relaxed and cooled down we went upstairs for a completely relaxing massage. We fell asleep at the end!Then we were brought out to lounge chairs to relax with mint tea and cookies.What a great experience not to be missed.

Express hammam and massage. My husband and I had the 30 min express hammam and 30 min express massage at Le Bain Bleu. A friend recommended it as the best part of her trip to Marrakech - so good she went twice during her stay! It took us nearly an hour to find the spa but once we finally arrived, we found it well worth the hassle. We were very impressed with the spa facilities, it smelled so lovely! Our hammam seemed less than relaxing but extremely efficient. The lady vigorously rubbing me was professional but also had a very grandmotherly quality that made me smile. She was determined to get me sparking clean! The massage that we booked afterward, on the other hand, was very, very relaxing. It was the BEST 30 min massage I have ever had. THE. BEST. I still can't believe it was only 30 min because it was transcendent! Good pressure, attentive to all areas including scalp, hands, fingers, even toes! I left this spa feeling like a new woman. And for all those complaining about "European" prices....stop looking to exploit businesses in so-called developing countries; it's disgusting. There was nothing overpriced about this establishment. They made sure to include the special touches you would find in the best spas like plush robes and slippers, a bottle of water, time to relax between treatments in a mineral hot tub, etc. We truly received 4-5 star treatment in this spa and still paid 50% less than an average spa in London. I thought it was well priced and excellent value for money; I would gladly recommend Le Bain Bleu to anyone!

Carwash experience. After so much personal attention during the days in Marrakech I compare this hammam / massage experience with a carwash, with hardly any interactions with the 3 ladies who touched my body for washing, scrubbing and massage. The atmosphere is very nice and all is clean. They have an excellent process in place to services many visitors in a set period of time, they even don't forget to give you a bottle of water while resting or nice cup of tea afterwards. It would however be so much nicer if you would not feel a number, but a person, feeling vulnerable while naked. I have hardly seen a smile on the face of the ladies who I met and missed the personal touch, like a normal welcoming hello while meeting new staff. The hammam / massage package has Wester European prices, well overpriced if you ask me,
Luxury. This was the perfect bit of R+R us girls needed on our girls weekend in Marrakech. We had a hammam and massage treatment. The spa is beautifully decorated and very relaxing.

A relaxing experience. We wanted a hammam; Le Bain Bleu was a good choice. We considered another spa that was closer to our riad, but couldn't get in. Le Bain Bleu had openings, so we went. Staff were kind and respectful; the experience was great. If traveling to a country where hammams are available, set you inhibitions aside and go! Le Bain Bleu is clearly tourist-focused and more of a spa than a traditional hammam, as is the cost. Enjoy a massage after the hammam and then find a place to relax for a couple of hours afterwards. Not confident that our tip actually made it to those who assisted us; am guessing it was pocketed by the woman who took us to pay the bill, which is done in the hotel next door. Place can be hard to find.

Excellent massage, average hammam.. Went on recommendation of our riad. The spa is quite difficult to find, so what should be a relaxing experience means that you arrive in a state of anxiety. You are not made to feel particularly welcome on arrival and are left on your own quite a lot. The staff doing the Hammam and one or two of the masseuse looked like they would rather be somewhere else. The masseuse I had was excellent however, but I can't say that it was an overall enjoyable experience - the massage being by far the better part of the package. This is such a shame, the spa looked like it had undergone an expensive refurb. A little tweaking would vastly improve the atmosphere in the spa - namely customer service and overall attitude of the majority of the staff.
Very nice!. I just went there for waxing and even in that situation I was relaxed. The stuff was very professional and friendly and the place very relaxing, I strongly recommend it.
Wonderful little gem. I went to a few hammams in Marakesh and this was the best. Beautiful space, excellent staff all and all a great experience

Up market hammam. I went with my husband and we shared the room, it was recommend by the owner of Raid Bibtia were we stayed and less than 5 mins away. It is very busy and very tourists' I saw only travellers there & credit cards taken is goodA beautiful place with layout well thought out and very clean. You are giving a locker, robe & shoes. Sadly it was the only one I visited during my stay it that wonderful country, so I can not compare.The scrub & mud was good but too short ..... but the 1hr massage was 5 stars, and I have had a lot of massages, really every country I like to try their spa's etc.  Will I go back ????

Relaxing spa. Visit the spa in December. We had a good experience in the Hamman with a superb scrub. Afterwards we had a very relaxing massage, a cup of tea. Good service and friendly staff.I will be back.

A quality Hamann and massage experience. My wife and I went to this place on the recommendation of the owner of the Riad Sacr where we were staying. Only 5 minutes away from us, and 5 minutes from main square. We were very pleased with the welcome, the experience and the overall decor quality. we booked only the day before, and could only get a 10:00 time but we saw that as a good thing. Busy = popular = good. We had the two hours for 600 Dirhams (about £45) for the one hour hamman+mud scrub + jacuzzi, then one hour massage. Great staff, very clean and you can pay by credit card. I would definitely go back and recommend this place to others.

Fantastic first hammam experience. Went to this place after reading the good reviews online and wasn't disappointed. Turned up without a booking which wasn't a problem, and had my very first hammam experience! Two hours for £45 - one hour hammam and jacuzzi, one hour massage. Great facilities and staff, very professional and clean - would definitely go back and recommend this place to others!

If you love service with a smile this is not the right place....... Booked a couples hammam and massage here. Average place but everything felt a bit rushed. The ladies in the hammam did not smile once and it felt like they would rather be so where else. Wanted some advice on massage but we're told that on this day they only offered one kind of massage

couples hammam and massage.. My partner and I booked a couples hammam and massage based upon a recommendation in the Sunday Telegraph on the day we travelled to Marrakech. We miraculously found the place early and asked if we could bring forward our treatments. The Girl on reception said it would be ok but we did feel that we were a bit compromised because of this. There didn't seem to be a great deal of organisation and we were left on our own for quite a lot of the time. We and another couple felt that the hammam side of the package was very brief and we didn't get the hands~on experience we had looked forward to. I had to ask for water after the hammam having expected it would be offered to us. However I did thoroughly enjoy the massage and drifted off nicely. We were asked if everything was ok and they did give us a full hour for the massage part of the treatment. Once the massage was over we were led to the relaxation area and brought mint tea and biscuits and after that somewhat forgotten. The other couple and us both had to l return to the reception areas to ask for towels to shower . All in all It was a very expensive bill and the service didn't justify the cost.

Bad manicure. The place is lovely however if you're going to have a manicure (because the weather can do a number on your hands), skip this place. The room for this is barely used, on the roof wi AC off and not decorated like the rest of the spa (read not at all). The material used is somewhat rickety and the nail polish is dated thus doesn't apply nicely. Basically, as soon as I got out, I stopped by a pharmacy to get remover and some fresh polish to reapply myself.

Absolute heaven in Marrakech!. I've been to a fair few spas, and this is one of the best. Not cheap, but a wonderful experience! My friend and I went for the relaxation option at 850 dihrams, and it was magnificent. First we steamed gently for a while, and scrubbed ourselves with black soap. then we had a lovely foot bath, and were smeared with some mud, then left to wallow. After that a bracing scrub with sweet smelling salts envigorated us, followed by soothing oils. I felt very relaxed, and enjoyed the face mask as well. After this we showered and were taken to a bracingly cool jacuzzi! Then came the most amazing massage of my life - and I've had a few! It must have lasted over an hour! Staff were friendly and helpful - we spoke in French, as their English is limited. I recommend this place wholeheartedly - can't wait to go back!

An enjoyable experience, and excellent massage.. It wast first experience of Hammam, but not of a massage. You wouldn't find this place by accident, but once there it's very relaxing. Starting with a shower, steam room and then the Hammam - it was a little like being scrubbed with sandpaper, but certainly opened out the pores. Short time to relax before being covered in mud-mask (or similar, my French doesn't go that far!) and left for a while in the steam room. Then a shower and off for the massage which I must say was very good - interesting that's wife was asked to go naked but not me? All in all very good experience , but a few more smiles from the staff would help - a comment not confined to this place at all!

Average hammam. We have been here twice once only hammam and once only massage during our stay here in Marrakech.The hammam was ok, however we stayed too long in the hot room and my blood pressure was too low so I had to quit during some time. Then the washing and scrub ritual was good, the lady was nice. The feet bath was good & refreshig however the basin was by far too small (for feet over 38).I would rather expect some water/ more tea & cookies during and after the spa treatment. Jacuzzi poor & not similar to a whirlpool, not hot enough.Very nice decoration & clean hammam. However it is a little bit overpriced for the service!Massage was good. 1h massage and they did exactely 60 minutes!Ladies at reception kind of rude!

'average spa'. My husband surprised me to have a spa in Le Bain Bleu. The place is just 5 minutes walk away from the Riad where we stayed. It was decorated very well and being in a Muslim country you have to comply with their rules. My husband booked the treatment, but nobody told us to bring swimming outfit. When we arrived there, since we are not prepared we decided to have a relaxing massage instead. The massage was great only I was feeling uncomfortably to be exposed unnecessarily. While the therapist is massaging my legs my upper part of the body is exposed (not happy about it). Although I tried to cover myself the therapist took no noticed of it. I was expecting them to be more conservative regarding this. One policy in massage is that 'expose only the part of the body that you need to'.Overall the massage was soothing, relaxing and the environment was decorated very well. Again quite pricy in compared to the standard .

Between a good spa and a public hamam. We stayed at Riad l'Orangeraie (which we loved), and this was just steps away, so it was a great choice for us. We got the 60 minute express scrub and massage combo (about $25 each) because we went at 4pm and they close at 5. I wanted a separate experience from my husband, but we did end up in the Jacuzzi and the end relaxation area at the same time. They scrubbed off tons of dead skin, so it was nice. The massage was relaxing; I liked it, but some might find it too light. After we got to the relaxation area at the end, I read the (only, i think) sign that said women should wear bikinis. Ooooops. I lived in Japan for five years, so I didn't think anything of walking naked around the spa. Oh, well. If they cared, they didn't show it. Staff spoke French with some limited English, so it was enough for us to get by. We could have gone to a more luxurious spa, but really you can get that anywhere. The public ones would've freaked out my husband, so this was a good compromise.

BEYOND PERFECT !!!!!!! EXCELLENT EXCELLENT. This was my second visit it two years, how can it possibly get better, it did it was fantastic, the robes we were given were lovely, our one hour massage was relaxing in lovely therapy room , the facial was invigorating and excellent and lasted an hour and the paraffin foot soak was Devine. The staff are polite, gentle and knowledgeable, the food I.e tangine and slalad was perfect as was our waiter who was fast and efficient, the treatments are so cheap compaired to the uk, I would recommend everyone to try this wonderful spa. The decor is fantastic, the art work / photographs on the walls are lovely and this truly is a spa that should not be missed, thought and care has gone into le bain blue and I can't rave about it quiet enough, I will return again and again, the staff are better than five star hotel staff in the uk. This is a must if you go to Marrakech ,

HORRIBLE HAMMAM. Don't go here. I had a manicure and a pedicure and I have an athlete's foot now and warts on my hands.. Disgusting. They rubbed my hands with aceton? HONESTLY. Not to mention the rough cuticle removal and ugliest nails I've ever seen after. And then, my boyfriend, got a 'massage for 45 min', they made it last an hour and rated him for that, no refunds, no nothing. Only a big fake smile from the -bleep- working there. Goodbye €90,-. You better spend your money in a real hammam where the Moroccans go or a hotel spa. Not some stupid touristy trappy spa like this. So. I've said it.

Good experience. My husband and I had a basic traditional hamman an massage experience, we were both done together, massage was good, however they could be slightly friendlier and more accommodating during the experience.
I would recommend that they have and offer water due to hydration rather than to purchase.
Follow the sign just keep going right to the end......of the alleyway

Good hammam experience. We had the basic scrubbing and soaping treatment, and since it was a private booking my husband and I were in the same treatment room. A little weird being topless in front of strangers, but hey you just go with it. We spoke French with the attendants, unsure if they speak English as well. Overall it was a nice spa experience for a reasonable price.

Worth a visit if you can overlook the flaws. A reasonable quality spa, quite tastefully decorated and very clean. Their herbal baths and scrubs were really good (can't get anything like them at home) but massages were limp and not very skilful. Service is patchy - some staff were rude when we wanted to change treatments. The place is hidden in winding backstreets - yes, carry on walking past the smelly rubbish dump!

Incredible Hammam. So relaxing, and they take private bookings which means your male and female party won't have to split up...which also means that you'll find yourself sat opposite your male and female mates in just your pants.We booked in for the traditional hammam and 1 hour massage, was an absolute treat

A deserved guide book favorite, but hard to find.. Lonely Planet big it up, and rightly so. We did the couples thing for 600 dh and after some serious subterranean scrubbing, soaping and scraping had the massage. Nice setting with relaxed, pleasant, capable staff. A great time out from child care and the Medina.

A whole new world. We travelled as two relatively young girls (17 and 20), so we went for this Hammam as it wasn't public, and yet wasn't too expensive. It's well hidden down a little alley behind the souqs, but is a completely different experience to the streets of Marrakech. We dropped in the day before and booked a slot for a 45 minute body scrub and a half hour massage, totalling 350 dirham each (£26). You'll be asked to leave a 100 dirham deposit in case you don't turn up, but you'll get that back when you pay.When we arrived the next day, we were half an hour early, and they threw in a free pore mask for us both. If you are shy, be aware that you will be asked to remove the top of your bikini. However, if you're uncomfortable with this then I'm more than sure you won't be forced (the staff are female, so don't worry too much). Despite only booking a half-hour massage each, we were treated to a full hour of full body massage. The treatment is fantastic, nothing like anything you'll ever experience in England. Don't miss out on a hammam treatment in Marrakech; it'd be a mistake.After the treatment, we were taken to a room of loungers and given a bottle of water and a glass of Moroccan mint tea (gorgeous stuff) and left to wind down for 20 minutes or so. We weren't sure on the etiquette, but discovered that you leave at your own will, they don't come and ask you to leave. Overall, this spa is a wonderful one; the perfect balance between public and expensive spas in Marrakech.

nice hammam in the heart of Medina. we wanted to test an hammam in Marrakech, and chose this one as to be a good option between local vs fancy ones.Treatment was good, skin completely regenerated after the scrub!!! also good the tea and relax after hammam.

Pure heaven. On our last day, we spent a few hours relaxing at Le Bain Bleu. You can hardly believe such a tranquil place exists amongst all the hub hub of the city. The tropical smells on entering immediately make you feel relaxed. Everywhere was spotless, the staff are very professional. If you are a bit shy, then be warned that the hamman is mixed. The massage was lovely and the whole experience was memorable for all the right reasons. Equally not an expensive few hours given the cost of a massage in most UK spas.

Outstanding pampering in the secret Hammam. Ok it's not really a secret as it's listed as one of the best private Hammam's in the Lonely Planet guide, but it feel like it as you follow the labyrinthine narrow streets of the medina to find it.This was a bit of a special treat for our 10th wedding anniversary trip to Marrakech.We had a couples Gommage (body scrub) and 30 minute massage in this tranquil space. We were really pleased that the staff offered us a 30 min massage rather than the advertised hour long one as our budget wouldn't stretch that far.I've never felt so relaxed or clean.The only downside was some of the relaxing music played whilst we were pampered. There was definately a bit of Greensleeves and also Air on a G string (which will always be the Hamlet Cigar advert for me). Didn't put me off though.

Gorgeous. A truly wonderful spa giving my girlfriend and I the best treatments we've ever had. It's very nice that couples can have their hammans together so as to share the experience. After cooling off in a lovely plunge pool we then had a fantastic massage followed by mint tea in the relaxation room. Part of the charm are the winding derbs that lead to the spa- it feels like a real secret garden. It is very reasonably priced and I would definitely recommend it to couples and single travellers.

Fantastic modern hammam. Fantastic experience. Staff very friendly, and communicated well despite limited English (ours and theirs)... Smile goes a long way. Massage was great, mint tea nice and scrub in hammam thorough. We loved it. Hard to find find if it's your first day in Marrakech, for us it was day six and a doddle. For 10 dirham you'll always find a local to take you the last few yards if needed! Lonely planet top choice for a reason.
Nice and Cosy. This was our second spa experience in Marrakech, and it was great. Nice interior, friendly staff and very good massage. i haven't felt so clean in years....Well worth a visit.

Nice facility. Poor service.. I had a bad experience at Le Bain Bleu. From the start, the staff rushed us about, killing the tranquility of what appears to be a well-designed little facility. I went there with my sister. We’re American, and while not puritans, we didn’t want to receive our treatments together. The treatments are topless. And a brother and sister being topless together is not customary in our country. We both explained this to the staff. Initially, they told us it wasn’t possible. Then they agreed. I was asked to wait about 10 minutes longer than my sister, who was escorted in for her treatment. When my sister removed her top in the little subterranean steam room, she again asked the woman if I would be going to a different room, she was told yes. About 10 minutes later I was escorted into my sister’s room where she was receiving her topless treatment. She scrambled to grab her top. I averted my eyes, equally startled since we had made clear to the staff we were not a romantic couple but rather siblings. Both of us are from the West Coast of the states. So nudity is not a big deal. But what made it, at least for me, so egregious was how the staff handled the situation. First, they let it happen. In a Muslim country, if a client requests they don’t want to see their sister topless, I would think this would be honored. Second, they did nothing to resolve it or even bother to apologize once it happened. Instead they just insisted we share the same room. When, out of principal, I politely refused to share the room, they just ended my sister’s treatment early and ushered her out of the steam room and into the shower. They never apologized or made any indication they believed they had erred.The facilities do seem nice here, and for that I gave it two stars. But the level of service was far too low to recommend this establishment to others. Also, it is worth noting that the services are co-ed. For Europeans, this is probably not a big deal. But the American women who were receiving services seemed startled to see me, a man, escorted into the same small rooms where they were being ushered around topless. I only mention it so people, who are looking to be pampered and relax, do not find themselves in a situation that makes them uncomfortable.

nice, but more spa than hamman. Located down a lane way that you might otherwise overlook, we had reserved the "duo traditionelle" before leaving home so that we could experience a Moroccan Hamman together as a couple. Le Bain Bleu was very quick to respond to emails and the staff were able to deal with us (via email) in English or French. The treatments themselves- sauna, scrub and massage- were really good, however, it was very similar to any modern European spa, and not as authentic as you may see other places. It must be noted that most 'real' hammans will not allow a couple to be together, so it's a trade off. The scrub does use Moroccan black soap and you are offered mint tea in the relaxation room after your treatment but we had hoped for some more elements to mark it as 'Moroccan'. That said the staff were nice and the facilities are modern, clean and quite luxurious and the treatments are well priced when compared with European equivalents.Note: we brought just ourselves and our swimming costumes, we weren't given towels personally but there were some in the changing rooms and we were provided with robes and flip flops.

Secret little haven in the centre of the city!. My boyfriend and I came here on a second day in Marrakech after a recommendation from our riad. It's very hidden away down the windy streets but their map is good. Just follow it with confidence. When we arrived (we hadn't booked) they said they had space in 30 minutes and they took us up to the terrace for mint tea and biscuits while we waited. We opted for the Traditional Duo for 550 each and we had all the treatments together. They lead you into a changing room to get changed into paper pants (or you can bring your own spare pair!) there's a locker each so you can lock your valuables away. After a shower you lie on a hot marble shelf in a warm room until they come in and soap you down. After the soap comes the scrubbing, which feels great and it's very satisfying to see so much dead skin coming off! After the scrubbing they wipe thin mud over you and leave you a bit longer. The mud smells amazing. When they come back and rinse it off the cool water feels fantastic. You can have a shower and wash your hair before going upstairs to a lovely relaxation room for more mint tea and biscuits. Then comes the massage. Now, having had a variety of massages I can be quite hard to please. However this massage was perfect! Great pressure and did all the bits sometimes missed - hands, feet and head. After lying in the dark for about 10 minutes we came out to get dressed. Although the treatment lasted 1hr 45mins we were shocked to find out we'd been in there for 3 hours! Amazing. All in all a super-relaxing experience. Definitely recommend!

Terrible! Wrong image of Moroccan hammam. At first, the hammam we wanted to try was full during our stay. The Riad we stayed recommended Les Bains Bleu which was a terrible wrong choice. The walk to the hammam was very interesting we felt like acting in the movie - this part was fun. I experience local hammam before as well as the hammam in five-star hotel in Morocco. So I know what the great hammam is. we went there with a friend who came to visit me in Morocco. We were in separate treatment rooms. We had a shower and waited in the separate steam room (no steam, wrong temparature, like you sitting in a wet bathroom) for 20 minutes no one came to us. I had to come out of the room to ask for someone and this also happened to my friend in another room. after waiting and waiting the therapist came to give the 2-min exfoliation.. (in normal hammam this would take at least 20 minutes. the idea of scrubing the the clean your skin..with this 2 min treatment is a waste of time and ruin all true experience. They were overbooked. we had to wait for another 20 minutes to get to the massage session. Massage was ok however the therapist left the door ajar which is so disturbing due to the noises from the outside. I cannot recommend this place to anyone...

Not worth the effort. Impossible to find ! Not particularly cheap or traditional. My wife and I were not impressed. it is the first time i have had such an experience and it is not worth repeating. The hot room was not that hot, and I wasn't sure whether to wear my shorts or a towel - poor service - eventually she went and got me some paper boxers. Then some other women came and sat by the pool, the small pool.! I thought it was all a bit weird and I can see why she wanted paid before the treatment. She wanted cash but eventually I paid electronically on the hotel machine next door. The massage was ok. The next day was the start of a religious holiday so maybe they just wanted out of the place - who knows? I am sure there is a much better alternative.

Luxury!. Great place, well hidden but definitely worth the effort to find - and no one else there so definitely felt special.Hammam experience really relaxing and cleansing, nicely timed too and with perfectly timed soak in the plunge pool after. Followed by fantastic couples massage and then mint tea on a lounger until ready to leave. Feel a million miles from the souks, we went to Cafe Arabe first to wind down so we were really ready to relax!This defintely felt like a luxury experience, top marks!

Very relaxing and lovely spa - shame about the farting masseuse!. My boyfriend and I had a traditional duo hammam at this spa. It is quite difficult to find, but once you are inside it is very tranquil. They rub you up and leave you to soak in a steam room for quite a while then scrub you ferociously with a mit, before covering you in Argan oil. Your skin is left incredibly clean and soft. After some more time spent lying around in the buff we were taken into the massage room which (having never had a massage before) was relaxing - apart from the fact the masseuse who was massaging my boyfriend farted quite loudly and could not stop giggling thougout almost the entire duration of the massage. I found this incredibly unprofessional (albeit slightly amusing) and it ruined the experience for us, not least for the fact that through her uncontrollable laughing my boyfriend only ended up getting half a massage. The girls there don't speak any English, so you need to know the basics in French or Arabic. It was pretty expensive too.

Great experience with style, with one of the best massages we have ever had. Well hidden at the end of small street (you better ask someone to show you), there is a real treasure of Marrakech's Medina. One of the best, if not The best hammam and massage I have ever had. Decoration combines traditional decor, with hammam underground, with some newness and modernity (eg. nice and interesting photos).What is beauty, it's spacious enough, still they limit a lot number of people inside, so you have nice Impression of privacy. But for the same reason it is absolutely necessary to book in advance. We had private hammam with my wife, hammam very clean, well kept. The 2 ladies knowing what they were doing. But this was nothing compared to what was waiting us just after. First they had no problem to change men as masseur who was prepared for me for women masseuseSecond both me and my wife were discussing whether it was The best massage or "only" one of the bests, knowing that massage is something we are allowing ourselves at any possible occasion all around the world. So, at the and I would really recommend this spa, it's not the cheapest but it's worth every dirham.

Great experience with sweet staff and nice surroundings. My husband and I booked in for a traditional hammam and ghasoul wrap. Although we had not specifically booked for a duo treatment we were treated in the same room which was nice; and the therapist for my husband was female so no awkwardness for me there. I hadn't had a hammam before (or even a massage back home) so I don't have much to compare it to, but for me as a novice it was a great experience. The stone in the hammam was really warm and it was a very comfortable place to relax. The scrub itself was thorough without being uncomfortable - the therapists are skillfull and automatically adjust the pressure based on the customer (my husband said he was srcubbed much more). My therapist was also very careful of my sun burnt bits. We did not feel rushed at any point and while the booking is for 45 minutes, with relaxation time etc we we're there for over an hour. The spa provide lockers and a hairdryer and brush in the female changing room, which is very welcome. We felt it was good value at 250 Dhm each.
centrally located, accessible nice surroundings, great experience. very central, although tricky to findclean and lovely surroundings hammam was a must have experience

Nothing so special!. Nothing so special as read on internet. It is really difficult to find it and the prices are high as another luxury hamman visited some days before, but it has nothing to do!We had to wait around one hour between the hamman and massage because they have not enough space and staff. The relax area is always crowed and some time you have to wait standing.They not accept credit card

Best hammam in town. Most tourists don't know about this hammam and we only found out, because someone's mum at our riad goes there. We had a very good hammam treatment and massage. The decoration is nice, traditional Moroccan and the service very good. We paid 1,100 Dhiram for the two of us and consider it money well spent for 1 hour and 45mins of pampering.

Bleu Heaven. The Le Bain Bleu Spa was one of the highlights of a visit to the Old town of Marrakech.Wind your way through the souk and down a narrow twisty alley,and eventuallyy you find the Oasis that is the Bain Bleu. Take a good map as it is a bit of a dead end.Take a spare pair of pants as you get the full Hamman with eucalyptus oil,warm tiles and mud,then an hour of full soothing massage. We giggled like children after the first bowl of warm water was poured over us!The whole experience was blissful,though a little French will help. As with the whole city, 'fronglaise' can get confusing.I was impressed with the time taken,the attention from the staff and the overall wonderful hamman. Really good value at about £45 for two hours. Very nice.

Very good hammam experience. Starting with the good things: the spa is beautifully decorated in a way that feels like an excellent combintation of genuinely moroccan style and tourists' expectations. The staff is very good at their job and both the hammam treatment and massage were excellent. The hole experience was very relaxing.Based on the comparisons we made with other spas it also seemed to be good value for money.The slightly less good things: Except for the receptionist we met no staff that spoke any English and my limited French made it a bit tricky. The staff could use knowing a few key words in English and/or learn to better communicate with foreigners without repeating the same word in French over and over again. This communication difficulty also made it hard to know what to expect and what to do. (I.e. relax and rest or get dressed and leave the room etc.) When we were there they also had some issues with some showers that were temporarily out of order, but that is easy enough to fix.

Poor Management Makes for Disappointing Experience. We were due to stay in Marrakech for a week and being Spa junkies spent ages hunting through review sites and websites to work out where to go in advance.Le Bain Bleu caught our eye - it had only recently opened and it's design looked a little more contemporary than others, plus the treatment list and prices seemed good and placed it alongside the other mid-Market Hamman's in the area.What the website fails to explain is the Hamman's is tacked onto a Raid as an additional money making stream... And it quickly became obvious that the owners had little experience in running a Spa.We booked a bath and massage package at 600 Dirhams.When we arrived our baths obviously hadn't been run so they sent us for a massage first without explaining the situation. The massage room was cold (we were later told they had a power cut but just in some rooms?!). I was never introduced to my masseuse who came in late with a cold and a dripping nose, whilst my girlfriend's ignored her request to focus on a particular area of her back that was stiff and continued to ignore her when she asked for a pillow to support her head.After being gruffly informed that the massage was over we were taken to the baths. These have been built far too long so you keep slipping down them and the bulbs in them were broken so when they 'dimmed' the lighting by turning the other lights off we were left in complete darkness, having to get out of the baths and ask them to turn the lights back on.The baths were hot, although different temperatures. That I expected, but not that we would be left without any water to hydrate. Eventually - feeling dizzy - we had to again get out of the baths (we now sat across their widths to stop us slipping down them) to leave the room and ask for a drink (initially we were told 'just last out for 10 minutes more' but bottles were eventually produced)Finally we were taken to the relaxation area which was right in the corridor between the treatment rooms so we were constantly disturbed by guests and staff coming and going.Whilst there was nothing horrendously wrong with the session everything had obviously been ill considered from the design of the spaces to the service. It appear the management had been on a token spa visit and then tried to replicate the experience without any consideration to the logistics or details.We spoke to the manager (owner?) afterwards. Whilst her co-manager texted on her blackberry next to us she rather arrogantly dismissed our disappointment. After much protesting she did eventually offer us a Hamman free of charge, but it was obvious that the service levels would not have improved in the interim and we really didn't want to go thorough the same thing again so we declined.Instead we visited Les Bains de Marrakech the next day and it was soooo good we rebooked for the following day too. They are a great example of how the extra 5% makes all the difference to the experience.

fantastic! blend of western and moroccan spa culture. I loved my visit here! It's difficult to find but well worth it! I did the hamman/gommage for 150 dirham and it was great! I especially liked that it's more private than the traditional Moroccan hamman and MUCH CLEANER! This place was very clean, and there was a locker to put your purse and wallet! My skin was baby soft at the end. When you are done with your treatment, you take a shower and wash your hair. Then you can drink tea and eat cookies.
