They also let you keep your glove, which is nice. As an FYI, they give change in euros, not dirham. I believe a Spanish woman runs the place. It has a very European feel to it.I was wary of getting coming here, but it was really great!

I don't recommend this spa!. HI All,I went to this spa, for a massage, hammam and scrub: this was the worst spa experience I ever had!The place is ok, but the hamam is not a proper hamam, as it is about 30degrees only! I have asked if the temperature would be increased, but actually no! As this was the room, where the scrub was being done...So, it is worth mentionning that I left the place with a very bad skin: it wasas if I didnt have any spa treatment! I would not recommend to anyone to go there... There are much better spa places in Marrakech!

They kicked us out 10 minutes after the massage. The building is nice. The pool is actually in a different part of the Riad and does not seem to be part of the Spa experience unfortunately.My massage was mediocre, my colleague was happy with his. I had asked for deep tissue on my legs only and basically receive a full body touchy feely 'relax' massage.We then had tea in the 'chill-out' area but one of the owners came and told us we had 10 minutes to get dressed and leave. Since the Spa is attached to the Riad (which has a full time receptionist) there was no excuse like 'we're' closing.We got much better treatment the next day elsewhere.Skip it.

Yum!. If you are in Marrakech, the Hammam is not to be missed! I just went because my wife wanted to go. Going to a spa is not something that would ever cross my mind. I usually find it to be a waste of money. It is rare to find a decent masseuse or masseur in these venues. So, I was very pleasantly surprised when the masseur at Le Bain Bleu put his hands on me. I could immediately tell that this guy knew what he was doing. I feel qualified to critique him, as I know a little about the human body. I have studied yoga for the past ten years and have taught it for the last two, I have studied massage therapy and am currently in medical school. So, I can tell if the person working on me is just doing a set a moves he was taught, or if he really knows his anatomy and how to use it. This guy was the real McCoy.But, Le Bain Bleu is not just a massage. It is a whole experience. The place is decorated beautifully, and set me at ease right away. My wife and I did a couples thing. First we were led down to the bathing room where we were laid down in a steamy room while a woman poured hot water over us then rubbed us down with that Moroccan Ghassoul soap. They keep you in your skivies, or a speedo if you choose, so you are not totally nude, so bring some dry underwear to put in the locker and wear home. After we were soaped up we were left to just relax and marinate in the low light and steam. Ahhhhh. Then she came back , rinsed off the soap of and covered us in black mud and left us to marinate again. Ahhhhhh. It was beautiful. Finally she came in, took a scrubbing glove out of a sealed wrap, one for each of us, which she gave to us afterward (no re-used gloves here) and scrubbed us down one by one. And I mean scrubbed, neck to feet, back of knees, butt, everything not covered. I was amazed at how much dead skin came off.Then an argan oil massage and some reflexology followed. And as I said before, it was done well. I was quite impressed, but that melted away into pure relaxation and bliss after a few minutes. We had been running hard the week or so previous to this in other adventures, so our muscles were in need of some TLC. And they got it. The massage lasted about 90 minutes, then they finished us off with about thirty minutes of reflexology, which I had seen on the menu and had requested. Finally, we were led to a pair of lounge chairs in our cozy robes and served some of that delicious Moroccan mint tea. and again we were left to just enjoy and relax. The staff was in no hurry to hustle us along. My wife and I just eased back and enjoyed the tea.Overall we were there about four hours. For hours of bliss. And for the two of us it cost about €175.00 ($270.00US) that is including a nice tip. There are lots of hammams in Marrakech, many for the locals are less expensive. But, I did not go to any of those and do not know what they are like. What I do know is that Le Bain Bleu hit the spot! My wife has brought me to some nice spas and massages over the years and she always asks me if I enjoyed it afterwards. I always tell her yes (which is wise when she is spending $400 bucks for a two hour couples massage as a gift for us), and it usually is "nice." But, I never had the desire to go back to these places again. I actually want to go back to Le Bain Bleu. I highly recommend it.

Thoroughly relaxing experience. It's quite tricky to find but totally worth the effort. We spent about an hour wandering around the souks lookkg for it an had all but given up hope when we asked a friendly looking lady in a ship of she knew the street. All I'll say is that you should follow sign for Dar cherifa cafe and then keep going down a dark underpass to find this spa at the very end of the derb. We had the traditional duo hammam with massage which was wonderful and exactly what we needed after the crude shock of the medina on our first day. I had booked online in advance and I would advise this to avoid disappointment.
lush. wow, what an experience, an oasis of calm and peace....i had the traditional hammam, well worth the money. if id had more time i would certainly have gone back for more treatments.

Hidden away New Hamman. Based purely on the one review on tripadvisor, I visited Le Bain Bleu last week.I had the 250 Dirham "Special Hamman". It was wonderful. A tradional hamman using savon noir, rubbed down and scrubbed ( gommage) by the hamman attendant ( a very nice young lady) using a kessa glove, followed by an application of rhassoul( clay) before rinsing off. Mint tea was then served in a relaxtion room.As previously stated Le Bain Bleu is tucked away. Head to the Moussine Mosque, take the derb signposted for Dar Cherifa and just keep going. It looks like a dead end but continue on. You will reach a T junc, bear right and the Hamman is on the left. It would benefit greatly if it had a sign outside and one at the top of the derb.Highly recommended. Check out their website.

If you want to do one thing to make your stay memorable, this is it.. We just discovered a great new spa in Marrakech - in Mouassine near Dar Cherifa. It's called Le Bain Bleu. It has just been finished and so new it doesn't even have a sign up yet. I heard about it through a friend.It is beautifully decorated with several hammams, a dipping pool for cooling down after your hammam, massage rooms and a lovely relaxation room. What a great experience--you leave feeling clean, bright and energized. The personnel were very friendly and truly made us feel welcome and special. The place has a lovely tranquil atmosphere – unlike the busyness of other spas. I'm so glad I didn't miss out on this. I've made a vow to go there every time I go to Marrakech. If you want to do one thing to make your stay memorable, this is it.

Excellent hamman. This was a 2-hour pampering session! We loved every minute. The ladies who took care of us were gentle and professional. I got layers of Sahara sand off after a week in the desert. I suggest the full package of steam, scrub, massage, and the mud wrap. After that treatment, I felt wonderful. The owner explained the services quite well, and even recommended an excellent spot to eat lunch en plein air. For less than $40, I was pampered like a queen.

Just 'WOW'!!. Not usually being a great lover of massage; I was not prepared to be blown away. For the very reasonable price of D270 (about £25), we were treated to the most amazing massage, sauna & hair wash. I can honestly say, I have never felt so good & totally relaxed afterwards. The products used smell absolutely divine and the staff there are friendly and welcoming. I would highly recommend this place and cannot wait to visit again!

Low price, great quality, fantastic owner. I had idea what a Hammam was before my trip to Marrakech and did not plan on getting one until I got covered with dust on an excursion just outside of the city. Hammam Ziani is just a short walk from the Jemaa el Fna, and was absolutely one of my favorite experiences during my short stay in the city/country. The experience was fantastic and was about 45 minutes - even if you are unlikely to visit a spa or get a massage (like me) it was a great way to see a new aspect of the culture here in Morocco. The owner is also fantastic, and is great to talk to if you are from the United States - he is originally from Morocco, but spent significant time in the States and is especially friendly and sociable to travelers. He gave us a great deal, great service, and was more than happy to answer any questions about the rest of our trip. There are probably higher quality, longer Hammams, but if you want a cheaper, quicker and still great alternative, come here!

A gem of a place!. Came here with my parents this morning after returning from a 3-day trip to Merzouga. We were thoroughly excited about a massage for our aching bodies and this place didn't disappoint! We arrived at Hammam Ziani after reading positive reviews about an authentic and inexpensive experience which it certainly was. We were greeted by the owner who showed us around and made us feel very welcome and we left feeling completely relaxed and restored. We hope to return once again before we fly back home!

Low quality for the price . I visited the hammam with my partner: the whole place looks a bit run down, first the toilet door felt off its frame, there were no towels, we paid for 60" massage and only got maybe 25". The massagers didn't speak English and only pointed "out" with the finger once they finished. The massage was intense. Afterwards, we were left alone in the locker room with no towels to dry our hair. We were supposed to do it with the bath suits. As we insisted, we got a little tea. Wouldn't go there again.

The Real Mcoy. Whenever we visit Marrakech we always visit Hammam Ziana. This time we visited twice, once at the beginning of the holiday and then at the end. When we arrive the owner Damane Ziani welcomed us, we paid 250 dirham each (£20) for a homage (scrub) and massage. We were each given a basket with bath robe and towel in and were taken into a small candle lit room for mint tea. Five minutes later I was taken to an anti room with lockers for my belongings (men and women go to separate areas) where I undressed and were given disposable knickers to hide my modesty. There could be other women in the Hammam at the same time so don't be shy. The ladies don't speak very good English but their gestures are adequate to understand. I was led into a room with marble type beds where I was washed with black soap and rinsed, then into the steam room for about fifteen minutes. Then back to the first room where I was scrubbed vigorously from head to foot, the amount of dead skin that comes off is unbelievable, washed again then taken to the massage room. I borrowed a towel from my hotel to put on the bed as they have plastic coverings and can be a bit slippery. Oil was applied and then I had the best massage ever including a head massage. Next I was led back to the first room where I was washed with a soapy scrunchy had my hair washed and conditioned and rinsed again. The women then helped me on with the bathrobe and wrapped the towel around my head and led me back to the anti room where I dressed. When we arrived the owner had said "no tipping" and there are signs all over, but the ladies do gesture for money and say "sh" not to tell the boss, but I gave my lady a tip as I thought she deserved it.We both felt clean, refreshed and relaxed and our skin was really soft and glowing. I would definitely recommend Hammam Ziani. Give it a go.Can't wait to return next year.Ps Damane has two beautiful little dogs called Rex and Rosie and a shop next door that sells natural oils and soap.
Best Hammam Ever. My girlfriend and I sent to the Hammam and got a student discount! So only 200Dh each. The experience is lovely and awesome. Will defenitely return !

wonderfull massages from the professional women who works here.. Because my profession is giving traditional Indian massages, I was very critical. The silence during massages, the respectful touch and the nice smelling oil gives a very good and purifing experience. Shukran and Thanks

Was oke. Nice people. We did take the treatment with the package. The scrub and massage was Okay. But the package was not worth it..deffenitily not like the picture they show you at the reception. They Use very little amount of mud. So take the treatment without. The one for 270dh. The loungne was Nice.

Body went through car wash...... . Interesting experience.... Never had a hammam before. Went with my husband and teenagers. We all did 270 dirham package. We paid and was suppose to get change back but didn't. It was only 20 so didn't say anything. Got tea first. Daughter and I went in. They asked us to undress in front of them. They gave us thong underwear to wear only. We put belongings in locker. The key goes on your wrist. Then they left us in steam bath for half hour. Then they rubbed oil and gave bucket bath. Then you lie down and they scrubbed u down. Feels like soft sandpaper. Then bucket bath. Then go to another room for oil massage. Then back to bucket bath. Then you lie down and they soap you down. Then final bucket bath. Then they give you bathrobe and you go change. Ladies bring hair tie. You will have to go back hotel to wash your oily hair. The only difference for my husband and son was that they showered on their own and the attendant wrapped the loin cloth on them. It does say no tips. They do ask. Didn't give anything. Glad we tried it at a reasonable price.

Authentic but impersonal . My husband and I booked an evening hammam session during our honeymoon and we chose Hammam Ziani for the reported authenticity - it being the only 'moroccan' Hammam and unlike a western spa. We were happy that they also provided men for men masseuses and women for women. Once I went into the women's section, they gave me a cloth to wrap around my chest and disposable underwear. However, perhaps due to a lack of English speakers that work at the Hammam, it seemed like they were not respectful or receptive to my own shyness about being without clothing. In previous spa experiences, there seems to be a bit more privacy, at least whereby the masseuse and yourself are in a room separate to other clients. I found it uneasy that there were 4 other customers getting the Hammam treatment at the same time in the same room.The steam room was nice and hot, and the scrub part was also nice with excellent exfoliation. Again, I think the communication skills were the biggest point to fix here - the people who work there are really lovely and sweet and well meaning, but a bit more basic English training would be so helpful! After the scrub was the massage, which was a good massage but from a personal perspective, being alone in that room and not knowing anyone or their language made me unable to fully experience the calm and comfort of the Hammam, and this could perhaps be rectified with a more personal treatment - or introduction of names from masseuses. All in all, I think if you're a shy person like me, then maybe opt for a more western style private Hammam - this one was authentic, but hygiene could be improved as there was lots of hair everywhere and the turnover between clients was too fast to clean massage beds etc. My husband had a good time as he was the only person being treated in the men's section, and had more of an individualised approach. Again hygiene was a slight issue, and this can be easily rectified if the Hammam take on fewer clients at one time and take more time to clean between them! All in all, thanks for our first Hammam experience, but not as spectacular as we were expecting.

Hammam is a must, a unique experience!. Hammam was a therapeutic experience which you have to try if you go to Marrakesh! I went for the all singing all dancing experience for 350 dirham and I was there for 4 hours!First you start in the steam room and although not as hot as the traditional Hammam's in Marrakesh, is not over bearing. Then you go into another room where the woman will scrub all the dead skin off all over your body, even if you exfoliate, it's shocking how much comes off! Then you're washed and given a full body massage. Then washed again and then another steam but with seaweed wrap. Then washed lol I've never felt so clean. My skin felt incredible after! I literally felt stronger.Ziani is lovely and very welcoming. One thing I would say, is there are signs not to tip yet I was still asked to tip.

Great experience and reasonable price!. It was a good experience - a mix between a traditional hammam and a more touristy spa -, a reasonable price and the owner was welcoming. The only confusing thing was that there were signs everywhere saying that no tipping was allowed, but the masseuse still asked for tips.

Great Massage with a smile. I actually met Ziani as I was walking down the street past the Hammam. I was lost and he helped me find my way back to my Riad by sending one of his staff with me to guide me home. Having lived overseas, he speaks English and will be able to give you advice on where to go to. I went to go into the Hammam, but Ziani sent me off to a museum first, as he said it would be better to see the museum, then have my steam room experience, scrub and massage. Thanks to Khadija for a fabulous massage and many thanks to Ziani for all his help. Highly recommend for a great Hammam experience in Marrakech.

Good Massage. Having experienced loads of Hammams in Marrakech, thought we will give 'Ziani' a try . The massage was fantastic but the steam room even though I said I would like it hot, it wasn't. Also there was no door to the steam room, so it made it difficult to keep the room hot. Like other Hammams where you have a small sink to soak yourself, this didn't !!

Brilliant service. We visited this hamam today, we were after the traditional hamam experience rather than the usual onez, the staff are friendly, although they don't all speak English but still ensure to provide good service with a smile. The scrub was fantastic, the massage was excellent from end to finish brilliant experience. We had 13 & 12 year old boys with us who also enjoyed the experience. We are not just relaxed but also left with soft and smooth skin. The owner of this place speaks very good English, is extremely polite and helpful. We will be returning before we go back home. We are still on our holiday, I wanted to give a review while we were here to make sure it's done. Highly recommend.

A unique experience. I wasn't sure what to expect coming here. In the end I found myself clean as I have ever been and pretty darn relaxed. It is also relatively cheap for everything it includes. I would give a full 5 rating, but the staff is pretty pushy on tips even though there are signs on no tipping.

Fantastic!!!. Friendly staff with a warm and welcoming invite to a world of peace and serenity. They train their staff for up to four years and the experience is passed through you to feel.It lasts about 2hrs and you could never put into words how relaxing or invigorating it is. My fiencee came out feeling refreshed and uplifted.You really could fall asleep as you are taken into a world of pleasure.This hammam has been visited by many stars and recommended by both famous stars and public alike.I would highly recommend this hamm am especially on your first day to rid the dead skin and invigorate the body.

Good experience, though be aware in the evening in ramadan. We went in the evening to this beautiful and clean hammam with a bit of bartering on the door and decided to go for the gommage hammam without the massage as we had just been on a trek up to the summit of Mt Toubkal and wanted a good clean!My boyfriend had a great experience firstly being steamed, then showered, then scrubbed and pulled and stretched, showered, then soaped down kind of massaged and then steam room and showered again. He came out relaxed, happy and very clean.I however was firstly in the steam room and then scrubbed with a traditional mit and soap and then brought back to the steam room however the steam never came on so I lay for about 25 minutes in a mildly steamy room waiting to be collected. When i finally was I was quickly soaped off (the soap smelt amazing) and then left to get changed. Although I had definitely been scrubbed I was disappointed with my experience, especially compared to my boyfriend so we decided to go back the next day. When we explained the situation the man on the front desk was very understanding and explained that the staff were often exhausted by the end of the day during ramadan and he apologised a lot, offering another hammam which I turned down so then gave us a hammam mit and the best soap they had. Overall this was a good experience and I would recommend this place, but maybe be aware that your treatment may be rushed at the end of the day during ramadan.

A bit disappointed. Went for a massage before flying back to UK the next day. Was expecting to have a best relaxation but was little disappointed. Basically you would get a lengthy wash with assistance and massage (not so proper massage) even unexperienced ones could do it better. So you would get a basket that has towel/robe if you were lucky, small piece of cloth/apron to wrap around your lower body so you would not be completely naked throughout the process and a pair of slippers. You would then be taken to the shower and then they would put on a mud all over your body. You would then be asked to go to steam room for at least 15 minutes. Tip not to touch your eyes as it really stings. Then you would be taken for another shower. Then you would be asked to lay on those slippery covered mat massage table. Then you would be applied with oil and you would be scrubbed to almost having your skin peeled off. It was hard. Then another shower and then they would give you a massage that wasn't the best. At one point I thought I wouldn't be able to walk after as he kept on massaging my Achilles Tendon and it did hurt. That was the longest 30 minutes of my life. Then final shower and off you go. Though it was clearly posted everywhere not to tip but the masseure would still begged for it. You get a mint tea after that physical torture. It was just good to try but if I had gotten what I was told then I wasn't probably writing an average review. It was way too pricey for a lengthy wash.

An interesting experience of traditional culture. Don't expect a luxury spa therapy here! Basically you are coming for a thorough cleanse but they also offer dry massage if you prefer.You enjoy a traditional mint tea after which you go to the changing rooms and lockers. You are provided with sandals and a small apron or towel. You shower first. Then a good coating of essential oils is applied and you start with a spell in the steam room followed by another shower. Your masseuse then gives you a really good oiling which helps remove the grime and dead skin. You are then scrubbed down, as hard or soft as you like!! Another shower and then a lengthy massage, finally a really good soapy wash and final shower.Although you are advised not to tip your guy does expect something as is usual throughout Morocco for any service. You can then relax with another tea before perhaps going for a walk and hearty meal!!Its an interesting experience but just a little pricey. Perhaps other hammams are cheaper so it might be worth shopping around!

Don't Miss This Spa!. Hammam Ziani was the prefect place for my daughter and I to relax after tromping through the souks all day. The owner is from San Francisco, and was delighted to talk with Americans. Everything was great, although the massage could have been deeper. The soups and oils are lovely, and the whole experience provided a necessary respite for this weary traveller.

Great experience. I visited recently based on the T.A. reviews and was very happy with the experience. I'm a man, so this was the male experience:* Arrived and had price options explained to me. There are no baths, just the steam and massages. I chose the full package because it was only about $40 USD for 90 minutes.* Men massage the male customers. Women massage the female customers.* Changed clothes in a locker room. They gave me a towel/cloth to wrap around my waist so I wasn't naked at any time with the masseur or in the steam room. * Masseur washed me down with some soap and I led me to the steam room with the soap still on for about 10 minutes (hint, don't touch your eyes because the soap stings)* Masseur collected me from steam room, I rinsed off in shower, laid on table, got an incredible exfoliation for about 15-20 mins. They really scrub you with a loofah. Hard.* Next received a great massage. Like the best in my life. I was covered in some oil or soap that made it very slippery. The guy was great. I would guess this was about 30 mins* Then i got a mud cleansing. That could have been skipped but added another 20 mins to my experience. Rubbed some mud on me. Covered me in a plastic sheet to bake for 10 mins. * Masseur took me to the showers to rinse off. He scrubbed off the mud and oils.* Masseur hit me up for a tip at the end even those signs say no tips. I gave him the equivalent of about 5 USD.At no point wer my butt or other unmentionable areas touched. It was a very appropriate experience for shy Americans!Overall fantastic!

Just GREAT ! Great value, great hamman, great massage. I chose to visit here based on reviews on here and decided this would be the one for me ... additionally it was just around the corner from my Riad so saved getting lost ! I chose the popular 270 dirham package. I went mid morning and the place was pretty quiet. I got the customary tea and bottle of water and my bag with robe etc in it. As I didnt fancy the disposable knickers I wore my bikini bottoms and they were fine with that, although they did give me what is commonly known as a "wedgy" when doing their scrub lolYes it takes us uptight Brits out of our comfort zone - it's get your kit off and get oin with it. No need for embarrassment, this is just a job t them that they do every day and your body is not sexualised. I seen a lady here saying she felt uncomfortable because one of the hammam ladies undid her bra for her ... she was probably trying to be helpful and also wanting to get on with her job. it's US that are uptight about it, it's natural to them. Anyway, i digress.Into the steam room - wasnt too steamy but you can have it turned up no problem. out of there and into the "bath", washed with "black soap" (feels like silk on your skin), then given the exfoliation rub and boy do they do it well. Lots of dead skin off. it's not like a Turkish hamman where you are drowned in soapy bubbles, it's very different. Next - off to the massage room where I had the best massage of my life. I was oiled up and the lady's fingers got into, and inbetween, every muscle and boy did it feel good! Every part of my body was massaged, even my ears. Yes they do get close to the groin area but stop short of it and never once did I feel uncomfortable, worried or unsafe. You lie on a table that is covered in an oilcloth type cover that is slathered in oil ...it's slippy so sometimes you feel the need to hang on to the edges.After that back to the bath area to be washed down again and hair washed. Then back to the changing room, get dressed then off to the waiting room to have more tea if you wish.I wasnt aske donce for tips, although my masseus kept hanging around when I was getting dressed and smiling at me so I guess she was wanting something, however a big crowd of women had just come in so she was then busy with themMy whole experioence lasted almost two hoursI can safely say it was the best 270 dirhams I spent in MarrakechI'm going back to Marrakech in two weeks time and this place will be my first stopdo it ...throw away any inhibitions and just go for it ... you'll love itI loved this place and felt like annew person when I was

Not exactly what we expected.... I knew this wasn't a top, top spa and was definitely lower priced than other options I explored but it was significantly grimier than we expected. My daughter and I both have long thick hair and without combs or conditioner - we left with hair a tangled mess. The steam room felt a bit skivvy - agree with another reviewer that the thin mats seemed to never have been cleaned. None of the women working there spoke much english so I was glad to have some ability to communicate in French. The oddest part is that the place is plastered with signs forbidding tipping in 4 languages but at the end, the massage women begged for tips and signaled that we keep our lips sealed about it. Very strange...

Spa. A wonderful spa experience near the market, it was the perfect end to a busy day. We took the 270dh offer and we had the steam room, scrub, massage and a bath. The ladies were very professional and I felt I was in good hands, It was well organised and you only had to bring new clean clothing with you as they provided you with a bath robe, towel and disposable pants. The scrub was fantastic, the amount of the dead skin cells that came off was just shocking, my whole body felt so smooth afterwards and I was really impressed. They massage was very relaxing and they did your whole body.if you want to treat yourself and feel fantastic then I would recommend this.

So relaxing!. The Spa staff in our hotel weren't very welcoming so we decided to venture out to this place recommended by my sister and we are so glad we did! She had been 3 times and said all 3 times she had nothing but positive experiences. We went as a group of 4 and we were treated like royalty from the moment we got in. We were sat down, given Moroccan tea and a bottle of water each & then were told in detail about the packages they had to offer. It's strictly segregated for men & women which we were very pleased with. We put our stuff away in the lockers and taken to sauna/steam room. The ladies were so jolly and we had loads of giggles with them. They aren't very fluent in English but we managed just fine. We paid 330 dirhams (roughly £23.50) for 30min sauna/steam, hammam scrub, 45min almond oil massage, mud wrap and bath. It was a very relaxing 2hr session. The scrub and massage were AMAZING. The women work really hard and give 110%. Overall it was a bargain and we all loved it and would definitely go again. Our hotel spa charged 350 dirhams just for a 30 min massage. What a rip off! This place is value for money, I highly recommend it! P.S - we were not hassled for tips at all. We paid up front and got great service.

Good enough for Al Pacino... good enough for me. Stumbled across this hammam whilst walking around with my 12 year old son. Door staff and owner were so friendly and allowed us a look around and sip moroccon tea before deciding if we wanted any treatment. As it was fairly quiet in the morning the owner said he will allow my son to come with me, which was fantastic as I felt more comfortable he wasn't alone! The steam room was awesome with the most steam I've ever experienced and the scrub was unbelievable, I don't think I will ever feel this smooth again.. the massage was undoubtedly the best I've ever had!! For 270 mad for me and 150 mad for my son it was the absolute bargain of my holiday, I would have easily paid more! So glad I found this place and would definitely return here again and again! Very clean and authentic hammam.. not to be missed on your marrakech holiday!

Relaxing oasis in the noisy old town.. Great treatment - steam room, peeling and a massage for a very good price and in an traditional interior. My friends and myself were very satisfied about the level of service. It was a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh.

Good but could be better. . Going this place right on doorstep to palace when I visited. Hammam was good and massage was decent for the price. Didn't like that massage etc was in clear view of everyone else using the place, and plastic massage bed not the best. Masseur was good and did feel good after massage. When left I was stopped by a man in the street (didn't recognise him) telling me he was the masseur and he was looking for a tip. Quite happy to tip these guys normally but to be chased down the street is not really a good advert for the place. Would have probably returned otherwise.

Fine experience for what it is. The light music and pleasant smells were a nice start, and the price is right at 270 durham a person. I've been to hamam before and I expected not to be wearing clothes, but it was a bit unnerving to have one of the female staff unhook my bra FOR me as I got undressed. I brushed it off. They give you a disposable thong to "cover up" - which I really wasn't sure if they were new or just washed and put back into a plastic bag. It was massive and didn't fit, which is slightly uncomfortable if you expected to be a tad covered; really it was for show. The steam room was fine, but the small pads to sit on looked like they hadn't been washed in ages and with the tiny thong, I was especially glad to be scrubbed down after. The woman who walked me through was pleasant, though a bit invasive, rubbing all the way up the crotch (though she did stop when asked, good). I hadn't expected having a naked massage lying a foot away from another client and her friend as they were also being massaged. The staff were chatting and giggling to each other the whole time and I also had to firmly tell the practitioner to stop massaging my breasts. The rest of the massage was fine, and I enjoyed the wash down/shampoo after. It just wasn't as relaxing as anticipated.

Break from the hustle and bustle of medina. Came across this with my husband as we were walking from Bahia Palace. Very welcoming from the outset, we were both welcomed in to the seating area, given green tea, had a tour of the hammam by the main man himself Ziani. He offered us choice of treatments all reasonably priced. We were so pleased with how we were treated that we came back the following day as promised and had our hammam treatment. My husband had a 90 minute hammam and I had the hour long. Im pregnant so had my treatment in a room without any steam. Overall, this hammam was the best we'd both been to and we will definitely come again. Reasonably priced and not forced into anything.

A wonderful experience despite the request for tips. I expect the owner knows his staff are asking for tips, so I suggest he put an secure/optional tip box at the desk. That out of the way the hammam steam scrub and oily massage, reflexology and head massage shampoo, lying on plastic sheet on couch. For 270 dirhams it was excellent value. (You can look around before you choose to participate). Notice at the desk and in changing room "no Tips" and on booking you are reminded it is inclusive. However you are in Morrocco. You will never get a massage like this again!! Presuming they are all excellent practitioners. The owner is very friendly and helpful and has lovely wee dogs. Everything is supplied inc disposal bikini bottoms. Go with a friend if you are a bit wary of being half starkers in the steam. Or feel a bit vulnerable. Women and gents separate. Also if you do not want to tip............be tough. However, remember how much it costs for just a back massage in UK and nothing like this.

Wonderful experience . I went to hamman Ziani in May 2016 and was one of my wonderful experiences ever... We had a complete spa treatment and after that I felt like I just reborn again really recommend it guys from Angola

Best massages ever!. That was my second time to gonfor a Hammam in Morocco, and Hammam Ziani was a great choice after a long day of sightseeing under the heat. The guy at the door who seems to be the owner is very polite and welcoming. When you get there they offer you a free tour of the Hammam and some Moroccan tea to give you sometime to decide whether you want to go for it or not.The Hammam is neat and clean, smelling so good, and their staff is really nice. They were so happy that I am Egyptian and wanted to give me the best massages. Khadija who massaged me was beyond perfect, she tackled every single muscle and bone that was aching. It's GREAT value for money, as you do hammam, scrubbing and massages for 270 MAD.I highly recommend this place specially a massages session with Khadija.

Relaxing time out from the busy city!. We went to Hammam Ziani on recommendation from our Riad, and we were not disappointed! We received a warm welcome and a tour of the Hammam, before discussing the packages over mint tea and delicious chocolates. We went for the 270 dirham per person package - which included use of the hammam/steam room, a traditional scrub and an oil massage.It's a traditional hammam so men and women go separately, but there is also a cabin for private couples massages if you prefer.I was taken into the ladies dressing room, where I was given disposable underwear, slippers and a robe to put on, before being lead through to the sauna. Glass windows allow shafts of coloured light in, creating a magical misty atmosphere. After about 10-15minutes a lady came and collected me, taking me through to a room with beds in, where she washed me down before giving me my scrub. I particularly enjoyed the foot scrub - so she did it twice! Then I was lead through to the massage room - half an hour of pure bliss. I almost fell asleep! After this it was back to the previous room for another wash down (and they even shampooed my hair!). Then tea and more biscuits in the relaxation room. I left the hammam feeling relaxed and my skin has never been softer.

Good Hammam to share with friends.. Two couples traveling together, we decided to go to this Hammam at the end of the day. Got a good scrub and massage for a decent price. We choose not to go to one of the public hammams as we all wanted to go at the same time, and most have women's hours and men's hours later. It was all good, locked lockers, towels, robes provided. Wish they didn't have plastic on the massage or scrubbing tables. My only real complaint.

Relaxing place. During our tour in Marrakech we spent an afternoon there. After a day tour in the city it is a good place to relax. The place is nice clean and friendly. The staff is very polite and professional. They give you a good service and after one hour and twenty minutes of treatment you come out very relaxed ready to face the rest of the day.Highly recommend.

Good for body, and maybe even the soul. What a wonderful couple of hours being pampered, scrubbed, soaped up, massaged and washed! The hammer was clean and crowded with Moroccan men, so I knew it was authentic. I felt so good after my experience, I went back three days later and had a second round of it! Different masseur, same wonderful experience. If you are considering a hammer experience, I recommend this establishment. Lockers are secure, staff friendly and lots of the "black" soap you seen being sold! Clean up you act and go there!

Lucky for some. Neither of us had ever been to a Hammam before so had nothing to judge against other than reading reviews. I would have given it a 5 as the steam, followed by scrub, massage and then wash were fantastic. The masseuse was excellent and worked wonders on me. However my husband seemed to spend a lot of time in a shower, his scrub and massage were minimal and after being repeatedly asked for a tip he was out and done in less than an hour. It seems it's the luck of the draw as to whether your experience is good or not.

If its good enough for Orlando Bloom... Awesome couple of hours at Zianis, we wanted an authentic hammam and we definitely found it. I think it was about 350 dirhams for a steam, black soap scrub, 35min massage and a clay wrap. Was also given tea and water (even got given fruit as we hadnt eaten). Ziani was kind and patient as we decided what we wanted.Orlando bloom and other celebs have visited here too!
Nice experience. . The staff is friendly and the interior of the Hammam is authentic.So many hammams are fake (built into apartments) but not this one.

Possibly very authentic?. This is a good place to go if you're looking for an "authentic" experience ie it's a bit tatty, you get a good scrub down, you may feel a little out of your comfort zone. However note you will be asked for a tip, you might have to ask them to turn up the steam, and we didn't see any locals there...the photo is from the relaxation mint tea room at the end (nicest and smartest room we saw)

Good value: affordable for service. Paid 270dh for the standard spa package. Comes with spa bag (robe, slippers, paper underwear) and services. Lasts around 90mins. You get undressed and put belongings in a locker. Lady leads you into a steam room where you relax for ~5-10mins. Then you get a full body ”black soap " & exfoliating scrub down. After is a ~45min oil massage, followed by a shower/shampoo. The sign says that staff are not allowed to ask for tip but she quietly asked for money afterwards (as soon as I gave her 20dh two other women asked for money as well... It was awkward). Overall it was a good price but the staff felt somewhat unprofessional at times. Might be different if you go in a group.

authentic Hammam. loved my out of the box visit here. a traditional Hammam experience to take british/irish well out of comfort zone while immersing them in high quality relaxation and pampering. communication was a struggle but after i had been stripped doused in water, steam, basted and massaged, i really didt care. Felt like a princess. if you haven't had a hammam try here, they don't exploit or target tourists, The locals are there too. The massage is great quality. the concierge at the door is English speaking Value is excellent . i got package 270 dirham, approx 25 pounds for 2,5 hours of spoiling

An experience one shouldn´t miss. There are many offers for hamams all over Marrkesch. We went here, since our host from the riad recommended this place. And he did right. From my perspective for a treatment of roughly 60 minutes it´s very well priced and they give the full program: steam bath with this special dark soap, washing, scrubbing and massage (30 minutes). It´s a very nice experience, do it!!

Traditional hammam experience. Had my first hammam experience here. Known to be the 'tourist friendly' traditional hammam. Price is reasonable for 270 dirham. Was told by the riad owner that I was staying that if you go to a more traditional ones ensure you know the whole ritual of hammam like the locals do. If not ziani fits it all in providing cloth, towel & robes with the masseur guiding you through the process. Facilities were reasonable for the price you pay as you can see the price difference in the other private hammams.

Only ok, not the best . We were recommended this hammam , the facilities are not as good as ones that I have been to in Turkey but OK. Although it says not to tip I was asked by my masseur for a tip.The male changing facilities are right next to the entrance.Would I recommend this....probably not.

Excellent value.. I went to this hammam twice. It was easy to find by Marrakesh standards, prices were reasonable, and the service was great. I was so relaxed afterwards. They have a hair dryer too which was helpful. It's not a fancy hamman, but it is nice and clean.

Best Hamman and very clean. Me and my wife visited this on our last day in Marrakech and we were very very impressed. Well worth the money. We paid 270 dirhams each and it was worth the money. Very professional and the bath and the massage was excellent. Could not fault one bit. They do both men and women. When we arrived we were welcomed. Sat in a beautiful lounge and given mint tea. Then we were both taken to the hammam men and women separately. When I left this place all I wanted to do is just sleep that is how good it was. They have a very strict policy of no tipping but I wanted to empty my wallet to the guy who did the bath and massage that is how good I felt. I would recommend anyone to try this and they won't be disappointed. Thanks to the staff. Will visit again when I come back to Marrakech. Thanks guys.

Excellent relaxing and stimulating massage. This was lovely. They provide everything you need, so if you are a 1st time hammer like I was, it takes all the worry away.The receptionist is a polyglot. If as he says his other languages are as good as his French and English, no one should run into problems here.Although men and women are separated, it's open to both, all day, every day.You are taken through each stage, (mainly using sign language in my case as the masseur didn't speak much French).The scrub and massage were VERY firm, but I think that's the deal with a hammam.I would have gone a second time if I thought my skin could have coped with that much exfoliation!

Nurturing, Relaxation and peaceful pampering. Recommend this hamame. Also visited a public hamame as we were looking for some local culture . We were taken to another place by our taxi ( as is often done in Marrakech! - everyone knows the best place for tourists- they charged more so we stuck to our plan and are so pleased we did). Men and women use different areas. We went in the morning. It was quite and there was no one but my sister and myself (and the lady staff) in the place. We went for the full package at 350 dirhams and were delighted. Lovely women ( didn't speak English but we could communicate well enough) -doing our hamame and great massage. Also had a mud wrap,and steam room treatment that was bliss. The place is so relaxing. We were in there a couple of hours at least. A real highlight of our trip to Marrakech. Would love to go again and would definitely go back to Hamame Ziani at the earliest opportunately .highly recommend it.

Video surveillance in the locker rooms. To start with the worst part of the Ziani experience: After a horrible 2 hours in Hammam Ziani, we went to a shop right next to Ziani Hammam (same building as Hammam Ziani, sells towels, body lotions, oil etc.) what we saw there in the shopping area was unbelievable!!! There was a screen with live video surveillance from the locker rooms in Ziani Hammam. We could see naked customers in the locker room!! Anyone who goes to that store can see this screens and see the customers in the changing rooms!!! Something like that should be forbidden!!! Ziani experience: My friend and I were looking for a relaxing massage and therefore stopped at Hammam Ziani. They explained that they offer a 1h20min Hammam experience for 27 Euros. Since we only wanted to have a massage, we asked if it was possible to skip the Hammam and just get a massage. It was possible so we booked 2 massages for 15 minutes later. When we came back we had to wait in the waiting area. Nobody told us how long we have to wait, so after 10 minutes we asked them. After 10 more minutes we could go to the locker rooms. After that a woman brought us and two other girls to the steam bath. We were surprised that we would go to the steam bath given the fact that we booked a massage and not a Hammam. The steam bath was really grubby. We had to sit on uncleaned plastic mats without a towel or something... After another 5 minutes we asked why we are here since we actually booked a massage. The women were very surprised when we told them that we had only booked a massage, so they send us back to the steam bath. After a couple of minutes they brought us to a room with 5 massage tables. It was so cold that both of us were freezing. The tables we covered with white plastic, they were still oily and there was still hair on the plastic from the previous customer. They asked us to lay down. We both found it really grose but since we were there for a massage... we did it. The massage itself was ok. Not very good, but ok. BUT... it was sooo cold and it was so loud! There were always people in the room, new customers coming and going, different staff coming and going, i had several people touching my legs because they passed by my table. It was absurd. After the massage, they washed us with an old sponge (they even put it in our faces!!). Then we got some old and wet towels to dry ourselfs!!! After 2 hours we left the Hammam and the only thing we wanted was a hot shower!!

Good traditional Hammam. Had the extended package which was steam, body scrub and then longer massage with oils. The place is very clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful. It's not a spa experience, that's not a criticism, just so you are aware that it's a traditional Hammam where you are steamed, scrubbed and massaged firmly. You leave feeling revitalised and fresh. It is excellent value, similar places seem to be charging almost double the amount.

Beware . It's our first time to visit Casablanca and we would like to try the Hammam and the receptionist of the hotel where we stay in recommend this. Prices was affordable and very good relaxing massage. But BEWARE of the lady who keep your personal belongings to the locker because she will steal some of your money that you will not notice. Before we went down to hammam, i counted my money and when we finish i count again 200dirhams was missing from my wallet. We ask the reception guy if there were a cctv inside but unfortunately there was nothing. So it was my bad luck.Note: Just BEWARE and dont bring all your cash if you want to keep it in their lockers.
first time experience of a Hamman. Very relaxing and authentic experience. Not rushed as went in the early part of the day, well worth the 270 D
Naomi. I had an amazing experience! The staff were so friendly and put you completely at ease. The massage was lovely and I feel great now! Thank you :)

Great massage. I went in on my own as my kids and partner couldn't be bothered I think they where more shy.The place is traditional hammam not a 5 star place but nice enough, I got steam first scrubbed washed with really hot water then a half hour deep tissue massage which I throughly enjoyed so much that I went back next day for a full body 1 hour massage felt great when I came out all clean and pampered price was decent as well.
Relaxing. Had a vey relaxing massage to sooth my tired walking muscles. Lovely atmosphere and very friendly and welcoming staff. Reasonable prices too.

Grateful. I didn't didn't have enough time to visit the hammam unfortunately but the owner was so kind to me. After a 3-day headache I was desperate for a pharmacy and they were all closed on the Sunday. The owner first tried to help me find one that was open but they were all too far away. So he brought me one of his own with some water and Sat with me while I drank it. I tried to give him some money for it but he refused to accept it. Thank you so much, it got rid of my headache meaning I could enjoy the rest of my holiday in Morroco. So grateful and I definitely will be coming back when I'm next in Marrakech

amazing experience!. Very welcoming, we were offered mint tea in a lovely lounge area while waited to be seen. Very different from typically English massage, but felt so good afterwards. Highly recommend it!

A great place to try a more traditional Hammam. We went for the Hammam Ziani originally as we wanted to try a more rustic hammam, but not too basic. The Ziani offers something inbetween the public & private hammam's and was well worth the visit. Everyone was very welcoming, always offered tea and we loved the whole experience. The owner is very helpful, and suggested a place for lunch that was excellent & even organised our taxi back to the hotel. Would recommend!

A Wonderful Hammam Experience - But Not Worth The Dirham.. Overall, my time at the Hammam was okay. It was what I had expected (the cleanliness, the staff, the package and the treatments).However, I have a few qualms about the place:1. My sister later informed me that only two options were available in French and English - the 270 DH treatment, and the ‘full’ package at something around 350 DH (which includes a seaweed wrap). However, options in Arabic showed one treatment that costs 120 DH. Now, I knew the star-studded clientele was a mere marketing ploy, which was not the primary reason we chose this hammam; however, after finding out the price differences, I feel as though we may have unknowingly paid for a marketing stunt we did not want to be part of.2. The constant loud chatter by the Moroccan women. Not as peaceful as I'd like. 3. As we retreated to the tea area by the reception, the owner came in to give orders to a Moroccan woman known as ‘Nina’. It was in Arabic so I could not understand a word, however, to a non-Arabic guest, it came across as loud, crass, and frankly, embarrassing. It was not the ‘relaxation area’ they claim it to be, with the owner constantly calling (read: shouting) for ‘Nina’ from the door of the hammam to one of the back rooms.These are my only qualms for Hammam Ziani. It is definitely a ‘mid-range’ hammam; it was not public yet the women were not clad in an all-white attire. However, 270 DH is a little steep to pay for the experience - it is definitely catered for tourists and Western pockets.

Authentic hamam expierence. Great hamam with an relaxing atmosphere an awesome owner. Very authentic with good massage. I can recommend it to all of you guys that are looking for a REAL Moroccan hamam experience.

Bad service. We had paid for the full package which should have included the scrub, massage, soap. But when I went in, they forgot the massage. And I didn't realise that until I was sent out saying everything was done. I then asked the manager, and he said he will refund the price for the massage or that I could buy some product from his shop. He then went in and checked with his staff, and told me that I could get the massage done. So I got the massage done. But in the end, it was frustrating, as I had to get dressed to come outside, and then get changed again to go back in for the massage, and get dressed again after everything. It delayed me a lot (and I was there with my 2 year old and wanted to get back to the hotel soon). Surprising how they just forgot that I had paid for a full package and were not even apologetic!

Good authentic hammam. As a regular traveller to Morocco I have been to a number of hammams, ranging from 5* spas to real local ones. Hammam Ziani was a good entry point to an authentic hammam, without the crowds of local women chatting away as they scrub themselves. The masseuse was a genius, saying I must have a bad headache (I did!) because I was holding a lot of tension in my neck, and within minutes she had worked it out. It is not a luxury spa experience, and you might not want to look too closely at the surroundings, but all in all it's a good experience and well worth going. On a side note, I did have some sort of reaction to the clay mud mask, but I do have sensitive skin, so I put that down to my own fault not theirs.

Dirty, filthy place and PUBIC HAIR everywhere, we were given USED DIRTY GOWNS! Avoid!. I felt compelled to write a review today as we booked our flights to Marrakech again (2nd holiday to Morocco! 1st was in July 2015) and the only place I can think I'll avoid in Marrakech is THIS FILTHY, DIRTY PLACE! THIS IS NOT A HAMMAM! It's a disgusting building full of dirt and all things gross, like pubic hair and dirt! My sincere apologies to all people reading this, I do not usually use caps when writing, indeed it's seen as shouting! I do feel like shouting right now!Right, cut a long story short, on our second evening in Marrakech, we went here after seeing it's ranked no.9 in the Spa's and Wellbeing section!I made an awful decision going there and the fact that I still remember the awful time and the horrid filth I saw in Hammam Zaini, months on, is proof enough that it affected me in a very bad way.Paid for a 1hr40minute package, got a 1hr10min (if that) of nothing, almost nothing. My brother paid extra for a more luxurious scrub, and longer massage - he was out, sitting in the waiting room, before My mother and I were changed and out!The nicest bot of this hammam is the communal waiting room. Once inside the hammam, you will find it's dirty, smelly. They rush you through the whole hammam, not even rubbing the black gommage stuff on you, they make you do it yourself, then ask you to go sit in a hot room, as I sat, there was brown gross stuff on the benches, looked to right and left and there was PUBIC HAIR lots of it! That hot room hadn't been cleaned for at least a month at least!They leave you in there ages, then bring you out, tell you to splash yourself with water, tell you to lay down on a plastic table covered with a plastic dinner table cover - this has been previously used and they tell you, get on it without cleaning it or anything!The woman then and gave me a 10 minute massage! when my package clearly stated 25 minutes, then demanded tips...right by the sign it says no tips!Please save your money, avoid this! I am going to be in Marrakech next month, I am going to try Hammam De La Rose this time and I'll report back.If anyone reading this wants to advise me on a good hammam to go to, please message me. I'd appreciate that.

A total and disgusting rip off!. I think this is my first negative review anywhere.What we were told would happen on the street before we we went in was nothing like what we experienced:- An hour an a half of hammam, gommage and massage lasted a whirlwind 35 minutes and we were dressed and in the street again.- The kit we were given had a new exfoliating scrubbing glove in - that we never saw. I realised too late and had already been covered in other people's dead skin - yuck!- The place looks lovely from outside and even going in. But the massage tables are slimed up plastic covered in other people's hair and dead skin.- The gommage was super fast and done to get us out ASAP, and the massage was on yet another dirty and slimy plastic massage table.It is way too over priced and I feel robbed of an amazing Moroccan hammam experience. I would highly urge everyone to keep walking and find a nicer more authentic and hygienic hammam.Do not be fooled by how friendly people are before you go in. I'm sure they are lovely people, but the whole thing is designed to get as many foreigners in and out as possible. Relaxing? The total opposite!

Good value and pleasant experience. I visited this Hamman after reading through other reviews on here. I wanted to avoid the hotel hamman experience and go for something a little closer to reality. Overall it was lovely, I don't speak French but the ladies get around this by using hand gestures. If you are expecting pink fluffy towels and spa music you are in the wrong place but that's not what its all about, if you want to relax in the steam room and follow that with a scrub, massage and wash down then that's what you get. I would definitely go again. In short, ladies and gents are separated, yes you walk around topless in your disposable pants, yes the ladies to take you by the arm to lead but not in an unpleasant manner. Yes the massage tables are covered in plastic but just relax and go with the experience. The ladies are lovely, it wasn't overly rough at all and I came out smiling

Relaxing times. I visited the hammam twice during my stay in Marrakech as had a cold and was tired and found the steamy and relaxing environment really therapeutic. The staff were very friendly and it was a clean and pleasant environment and good value for money. I would visit again and recommend it to friends.

Walk on by. Do not stop.. We visited this place before committing to a service. On the morning we stopped, the owner was present. Very friendly man who told us he was born in Casablanca but grew up in San Franciso. He spoke several languages very well including English. He took the time to tour us through the hamman and explained the service to us. We had our 2 children ages 8&11 with us and we wanted to find a hamman that would be suitable for all. We were impressed with the cleanliness of the facility and the time he took to talk us through the experience. We even enjoyed some tea and he gave us some suggestions on what we should see and do in Marrakech. Based on this, we decided to come back the next day for the service. Big mistake! We arrived and the owner was not present however they welcomed us in. Children were supposed to be half price (clearly marked on the price sheet) but they charged us 200dh instead of 175dh. No explanation and our fault for not questioning. As we were 2 males and 2 females we were separated and each taken to our own sections. At check in we were given baskets containing robes, disposable underwear, new gloves(for the scrubbing). Once in the change room, the attendant helped us to disrobe (very awkward for a Westerner but we assumed this is just how it goes). No robe and nothing for our chests. The owner had told us clearly that we would be given cloths to cover our breasts. We were taken into a shower room and were doused with hot water than told to lie on the ceramic tables where they covered us with the "black soap". There was very little product on us and then we were told to go into the sauna. It was just me and my daughter as the spa was empty. The sauna was warm at best and the steam only hit our faces so we were actually feeling cold. They left us there for quite a long time. So long that we actually called out to see if they had forgotten us. They came back and said 2 minutes. It was another 10 before they returned. We were taken back to the ceramic table and the scrubbing began. I noticed that the glove used was not the same one as was in my basket (different color) and I quickly figured out it was not a new glove, but a used one they pulled from a bucket. Gross! We were scrubbed down and they chatted very loudly the entire time so it was not relaxing. They then took us into the massage room which contained 4 tables covered with cracked plastic. They were dirty, covered in hair and skin. When they realized we noticed, they quickly rinsed them off. We were covered in thick oil and then we had to hang onto the table sides as we both felt we would slide off otherwise. Not relaxing at all! Once the massage was done we were taken again to the ceramic tables to be rinsed off. At this point they washed our hair and then used a very stiff brush to get out the tangles. The brush came out of the same bucket as the scrubbing gloves. They then told us we were finished and she wrapped me In a robe. I put my hands in the pocket and found a used Kleenex. Again, disgusting. Once we were dressed, there was no one anywhere so we went into the tea room to find the rest of our family. No one ever came back so we poured our own tea which was cold. My husband and son were both asked for tips and there are sign everywhere clearly stating " no tips". Obviously we did not tip. This was a horrible experience, dirty and impersonal. Do yourself a favour and pay the extra money to go to a proper hamman. As a side note, my daughter had a reaction to the soap (was very itchy during the sauna) and my face broke out after all the heavy oil that was used.

WOW... What a massage!. The massage therapists are trained in Casablanca and know their job!I had a highly trained lady named Habbibi who was the Best... She would be the reason why I would come back to Marrakech, for me the massage was therapy to relieve my neck pain.The Hamman is clean, the experience is wonderful, the people are friendly.. I wouldn't dream of going anywhere else when in Marrakech.

You MUST go! . I've been to Marrakech lots & have had a hammam every time, with varying prices and quality. So Ziani isn't all rose petals & women in white coats (which i hate) but it isn't at tourist prices either. My friend and I had the 350 MD package and I can safely say it was brilliant and worth every penny. The ladies were lovely, smiley, friendly and made you feel so at ease. They didn't bat an eyelid at my extensive tattoo collection. My friend is very body shy, at 47 this was her first massage & she loved it! We both came out feeling shiny & new. Even my husband commented how soft my skin was when I arrived home 2 days later. My masseuse was tenacious at getting the knots out of my shoulders, it was a strong massage and left me feeling 10ft tall. I cannot wait to go back for my next visit and will try to squeeze 2 hammams in, it really was that good And I agree with the other reviewer, the no tipping policy made a refreshing change. Thanks girls, see you next year!

1st time in a Hammam. An unusual experience, in comparison to some other places the cost was low, just under £20 for the scrub and the massage lasting 1 hour 20 mins in total. Personally I didn't like having another man massage me, the massage was thorough but I would just prefer to be massaged by a female. The premises were pretty clean, I'd describe it as a compromise between a traditional Hammam and a proper Western style Spa. Would I do it again? NO. Am I glad to have tried the experience? YES.

excellent experience, friendly staff,. i was in marrakesh with some friends to play golf and afterwards we wanted to wind down and relax, i was told by locals to go to hammam ziani, glad i did, i loved the scrub and mud wrap, my friends were equally pleased too. included in the package was the steam room, body scrub (30min), hot oil massage (1.30min) fresh juice afterwards and a relaxing room experience afterwards all for £25 i thought they did a brilliant job, would definitely visit again and highly recomend to anyone visiting marrakesh.PS: we were told by the owner that tip was included in the price and we do not need to tip the attandatnts, but after 2hours of intense relaxation coupled with the customer service we all tipped the massuses... (they are poor guys who work long hours for a fixed wage, so don't forget to tip them)good luck.bazlondon

Interesting experience. Is it bad that I gave this review only 4 stars? No, because I wasn't expecting to give it more than 2 or 3. I have nothing to compare this experience to, I only went because I was told that it was the ultimate Moroccan experience. I paid 350 for the entire package (I believe there's a student discount too). This included getting a shower, being put in the sauna for a long time (the sides weren't too hot but the middle section was), getting scrubbed (it was quite gross to look at all the dead skin afterwards), being massaged (mine was quite rough and made my body snap a few times, but everyone else thought it was could've been rougher. I don't know if I got a rough massage or if it was rougher than than the others - this could be replaced by seaweed therapy), getting a clay treatment, and tea at the end!I thought the experience might be weird and awkward but sometimes I'd look at the lady in the eyes to see if she thought it was weird and awkward and she would often just flash me a bright, motherly smile which made me feel better about the whole experience.This hammam is right next to Palais Bahia (kind of sandwiched between both the square and the Palace) and would recommend it as a convenient and nice spot. I was told that it wasn't an authentic experience since the "real" experience would all happen in one room and they'd lay me down on the floor for a cheaper price, but I thought it was a good introduction to whole "having someone wash you" and "spending 3 hours naked with other girls". The awesome:-There are signs everywhere saying that "Tips are prohibited" which is nice considering that everyone else in Marrakesh will ask you for one. -There's a hair dryer (included) and argan oil cream that you can use afterwards (also included). The bad:-I'm not sure the ladies there speak French. This experience might be a little harder for those who don't speak French (you'll have to do a lot of guessing with their gestures and body language).-The whole experience was 3.5 hours long. My friend and I had someone almost alert the police that we went missing because we didn't think this would take more than 2 hours.

An enjoyable visit. Excellent massage, felt comfortable throughout though expected the steam room to be hotter. Very reasonable price. A nice welcome with rose petal tea. Do visit their shop next door.

What a bargain!!!. This isn't the most plush Hammam in Marrekech, but if you don't need all of the glitz this place is great! The steam was perfect and I was scrubbed vigorously before a good massage.I went early and was the only one there and so the steam wasn't running continuously and I heard outside noise.All in all its about 1/2 price than others and from my point of view a bargain.

Serious run, relaxing experience. Friendly staff, profesional massage and wery relaxing and nice spending time there. Went there two times during our stay. Don't have to bring black soap or rubbing gloves, everything is included in the price.

Unfortunately a below average experience. I visited this hamaam because it was mentioned in a guide book. The 'manager' gave a good sell. Seperate for men and women. Description of the 2 packages.I went with two other people. The steam room wasn't hot enough. You had to sit higher up to benefit from the steam which still meant my face was steamed and not the rest of my body. The steam room was also very dark.My massage was very gentle. Granted I could have asked for more effort. My two companions had a better massage.The scrub which I thought would be more aggressive was again very weak so I don't imagine would have taken any substantial skin off. I think it really depends on who you get.During the massage the workers were a bit chatty, but when one of my companions joked that she wanted to sleep, the workers quitetened down.Considering we were semi naked having these treatments, I was horrified to see and hear a man walking back and forth outside the massage room. This was very disappointing considering we were told it was separate for ladies and men.There was no one available to complain to at the end so I cut my losses and left.If you want a cheap and cheerful experience without the luxury experience then this is the place for you.
Great Hamman. The Hamman was super clean. We elected for an hour massage after our steam. It was a great massage. Also it is a set price with no tipping. Would highly recommend this Hamman

Really nice visit. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit, it was very clean and welcoming. We were shown around the hammam when we got there, and then the man on reception (who could speak perfect English, and had the cutest dogs! He even went and got his new puppies so we could have a cuddle with them!) explained the 2 packages we could have. We went for the hammam and half hour massage, which took about an hour and a half or there abouts, and cost us about £18. You could have a longer experience for a little bit more, which included a wrap/body mask and a longer massage. We waited in a room where we had mint tea before being sent through to the changing rooms, where we were handed flip flops and a TINY paper thong. I am a size 20 and they fit me, they are stretchy so if you are slightly bigger, don't worry! We then had loads of water thrown over us and then shown the steam room, then more water and a scrub, then another go in the steam room, then an amazing massage, possibly the hardest one I have ever had, but it was so good! Then we had a hair wash and laid on a concrete bed and had yet more water poured over us to get rid of the oil from the massage. The ladies that worked in there were very sweet and guided you from place to place, and had a laugh with us too! It was definitely an experience, and you must do it when you are in Marrakech!
good place. It is not so extensive as some hammams. It only has one steam room. But overall the massage and treatment is good. You can also have women and men at the same time BUT not mixed

Lovely experience. I did my research before visiting this hammam and I'm glad I did. I did not want the feeling of being in a "posh spa" because I could have that here in the uk any time I want . I didn't want the stress of going to a traditional locals hammam which would require me to take my own hammam kit and where I would feel so inconspicuous that it would not be relaxing at all. So Hammam Ziani makes a perfect middle ground. I loved the massage and body scrub . Trotting around with just paper pants on was a little out of my comfort zone but in an odd way quite liberating !!!! I was not asked for a tip and for that reason I did give one .

Worth a splash!. I read some of the reviews before visiting Hammam Ziani, but no matter all the detailed descriptions the treatment my friend and I had there came as a big surprise and is definitely a memorable one. We showed up around 8 pm knowing that they are open till 10 pm and asked for the package that includes mud wrap and lasts 2 hours. First we were escorted to the ladies' changing room and given slippers, thongs and a dressing gown to put on. When we were ready were led a room where we got splashed by buckets of warm water and then to the steam room where we had to wait a while. It was a bit noise due to the steam machine hidden somewhere near to it and the temperature was just okay, not really warm though. We were asked to return to the room for a very thorough scrub then splashed again and directed to the massage room where we received a top of our heads to the end of our toes oil massage that was very strong. Then we had to return to the steam room and lay down to have our bodies covered in mud then wrapped in foil. The steam came on again as it was turned off when no one was in and we were waiting in our mummy wrap. In the end we got thoroughly washed and soaped and splashed and could leave feeling completely refreshed.I only recommend this experience to those who like firm massage, who are not shy and happy with women staff touching them almost everywhere (both the wash and the massage is front and back) and don't mind indelicate treatment.

Pure relaxation. We went to the hammam after a 3 day mountain trek. We had previously dropped by and been shown around by the owner and liked his approach. There are separate areas for men and women. Lockers are provided. Treatments were fantastic, scrubs, steam, massage etc. My only criticism is that the female masseurs only spoke French which left me feeling a little unsure what was going to happen next (especially being almost naked!). Apparently this wasn't an issue on the male side, although my husband was asked for a tip despite signs saying "no tipping". Left feeling very relaxed and rejuvenated.

Okay, not so special. I went with my girlfriend (of course men and woman are separated at the Hammam). We took the 270 MAD package for 1:20h. First there was a cup of tea, after I had to take off my clothes of and a man tied a small scarf around my waist. The Hammam started with a steam room (with not so much steam), after I got my personal guy putting soap on me ans scrubbing me. Finally there is a full body massage which was good. The beds where not so comfortable (plastic, quite hard) without privacy (3 beds in a cramped room with other people) and the masseuses talking with each other. You see signs with 'no tips' everywhere, but still I got asked for it multiple times afterwards. The whole experience took about 1 hour. I have been to a Hammam in Turkey 1 time before, so maybe I don't have good comparison or this is the more traditional one. However I think I won't go again.Some positive points: my girlfriend quite enjoyed it (more privacy, no asking for tips, nicer massage) and you get all stuff provided. The price is reasonable.

Left glowing.. Traditional Hammam , our first time and it was absolutely fabulous! Friendly and really helpful. Why go somewhere else and pay more? I'd highly recommend this to anyone except if you're really uncomfortable showing your body wearing just paper pants.

Refreshing . This is not a spa treatment! You will be scrubbed, rubbed and left feeling brand new.The massage and scrubbing are not gentle however that is what the hammam is about! The owner was very nice I was feeling dizzy and he brought me water and asked a host to watch me as I would be in the steam room.I recommend this hammam , everything is very upfront and efficient. If you dobt know the process do ask for a breakdown where you pay. Staff English is non existent (french is perfect) but really what do you expect the women to say to you whilst your nearly nude and they are scrubbing off your dead skin? Yes they do hold you by your arm, I think it's done so you don't slip whilst walking and go onto the right place for the right treatment. The women mean you no harm, everything that they can do for you to make your time pleasant they do, from attempting to put slippers on your feet, helping put your items in a locker to wrapping your towel around you when you finish.I enjoyed my massage, it was rough but relaxing, it didn't remind me of a swedish or a sports massage. They rub everything and if you do not want something done just gesture and then add 'no'. I had a great time as did my mum we left glowing.Yes in the changing area it says no tips, I think it's written as some tourists where frustrated with being asked. You can say NO but I am sure if you know what service to expect and base it on the service you receive and how refreshed you'll feel you will want to. The ladies aren't expecting anything big if you go with expecting to tip 20dh and very rough but loving treatment the experience will very pleasant and unlike the horror stories of the lower stared reviews.Enjoy your hammam experience!

amazing. I recommend visiting here, although initially I was shy of being almost naked I just reminded myself that they have seen so many people naked the girls don't care! You start by relaxing with tea, then a lady takes you to get changed into a disposable thong they give you. She then leads you to get washed down and then puts you into a sauna. After the sauna you get scrubbed down to get rid of the dead skin, real good scrub! Then you have a massage and after, another wash down. They also washed my hair and platted it for me. The girls doing all this speak no English but you don't need it any way and the man who is at the entrance speaks great English and explained everything in detail. Highly recommended!

Leave your pride at the door and enjoy the relaxing facilities . Although some people have posted negative reviews my experience of the hammam was great. On arrival the friendly multilingual staff explain the facilities and cost which is good value for facilities like this aimed at giving tourists an authentic experience. The facilities are separate for men and women. After changing into small garments (paper pants for ladies and what can only be described as a very small sarong for men) you are lead through to the hammam. After time relaxing in the steam you are scrubbed, washed, massaged and washed again with great efficiency while still being looked after and allowed time to relax.
