I agree that the concrete slabs in the steam room and massage room could use a bit of padding, but that couldn't take away from the experience. Highly recommended! One caveat...look up the address ahead of time and have a cab take you there. The medina is VERY difficult to navigate on your own.

Finally a moment of relaxation after the fuss of the medina!. Ofcourse we wanted to visit an hammam and we found this one via Tripadvisor.It was an excellent experience with very dedicated people, who could leave you in peace; something that we didn't encounter so far in the city itself.A special word of thanks to the owner, who spoke very well English and had a handfull of very good advices for us about restaurants and places of interest.Thank you very much and good luck with your excellent enterprise!James Tyndall, from Maastricht.

Very nice hammam. Great hammam. The prices may be higher than a community hammam but then it is catered to tourists. The owner is an extremely nice guy that has given us somerestaurants and places to go that were just outstanding. He was almost our personal tour guide. The hammam itself is beautifully decorated. However the steam room and massage rooms could use some work.In general; a very nice and worthwhile place to visit for any tourist thay wants a hammam experience.

Great experience for men too!. I went to a few (every day that we were there) Hammams in Marrakesh and I found that this one was the best value for money. I enjoyed this experience the most. Yes it might seem to be a bit dated but they are reasonably priced. Men cater for men and woman for woman. The men that did my message and gommage was really good. I would go there every day if I could. You are first taken in for a shower then you are asked to sit in the dome steam room. No one else really bother you in the steam room and there are buckets of water if you want to cool down-I guess its help yourself, I didn't use it. You are then asked to go through to another room within the hammam to get a gommage (Scrub), after the gommage you are directed to the showers again where after its a message on the same bed you were scrubbed. Finally you are soaped down and asked to take one last shower.

Excellent place to relax and get the dirt off you. I love this place.It has its home in a XIV century building so you soak in some of the atmosphere as well.I regularly visit when i arrive in Marrakech to get rid of the tiredness of the trip and set me in the mood to relax.then i go again before leaving the city to take off all the dirt accumulated running the souqs and medina.win/win :-)

Not what I expected - at all... Hmmm..I got to be honest having read the reviews myself before going to Ziani I was expecting better…It wasn’t terrible, but it just wasn’t what I was expecting I guess. In brief, my boyfriend went one way I went the other (separate sex hammam) I joined a group of 6 French women. There were only 3 women working so there was A LOT of time waiting in the steam room with absolutely no explanation as to what to expect next which was a little unnerving. The ‘wash’ took literally seconds then you’re back in the steam room. Then someone comes in, takes you by the hand and lies you on a concrete slab for a scub with the same mit that has just been used on the other ladies…. It’s vigorous, as expected it an exfoliating rub down, but I was just so uncomfortable on a rock hard table.Then.. back in the steam room. Meanwhile, I may add that there is constant shouting and chatting between the workers which again wasn’t what I imagined, as I thought it was supposed to be a relaxing experience – far from it. The best bit – the oil massage, more of a rub than a muscular massage but it was nice. As you are not told what you’re doing next I was standing around butt naked waiting to be told where to go next... The steam room. So I decided to take a shower and wash out the oil from my hair, although the showers don’t work so I had to wash my hair using a bucket. The towels and robes are old, like really old so I personally didn’t feel the place as particularly clean. My boyfriend had a different ordeal, it sounded better than what I had, but equally said It was something he’d choose not to do again. However, having said that we have spoken to people who have enjoyed a hammam in various places around Marrakech, so I’m sure it can be a very enjoyable experience, but I won’t be going back to Ziani again.However, I could have visited on a day where they were short staffed, therefore it would explain the long periods of waiting round and having a rushed wash, scrub and massage, but personally I wasn’t impressed with the service.

Straightfoward local hammam experience. We were looking for a local hammam experience without too much hassle and this spa delivered it. While more expensive than a true local hammam - 270 dh for a bath, rub down and massage - they were well-used to foreigners and provided everything we needed. The spa is clean and efficient and the staff were friendly to me and my two young daughters who were very excited by the whole experience. I suspect there are better hammams, and probably lots worse.

such a good experience. this was the first time we visited a hamman. the ziani is somewhere in between the very high luxury end and the traditional moroccon hammam perfect for us as it turned out.on arrival you are seated on soft low slung cushioned benches served traditional mint tea. we then had small introduction in english. there are different packages available, the more expensive were 350 dh, so roughly £25. we were told it was an all inclusive price, so tipping wasn’t necessary, we did however each give the person who looked after us 20dh, i feel it’s fair it is a service industry and expected. the reason we picked the ziani was for it’s steam room which i prefer rather than the usual sauna. i didn’t notice the length of our stay, i only know we had a fabulously relaxing time.the moroccon part of the treatment is called tqsal, whereby you get rubbed down with a large rough glove, i kept my eyes shut through most of it, but when i dared look i saw in tiny black (bobbles like on a wool jumper) coming off my skin. never realised i was that filthy, appearantly it has an exfoliating effect and should not be done too often, but is certainly not harmful. you get washed and soaped, a wonderful experience i felt like a kid again, then rinsed off via buckets of water and a sponge, scrubbed if i remember and then placed in the steam room, after that it’s the massage.bring conditioner if you have dyed hair like me and a spare pair of knickers, they do provide some but i understand that they are not that great.a couple of minor issues - i would have liked the massage to concentrate on some of my problem areas, like neck and shoulders, also the masseuse had a habit of using very light quick strokes. when i tried explaining that i was ticklish and would have preferred a slower and deeper treatment she didn’t understand. the mats we were placed on during our massage were plastic and so didn’t let the skin breathe, would have preferred a more natural surface.overall it was truly amazing and i would not have missed it for the world, the place is comfortable feeling and is clean, the introduction was exactly right as we were a little nervous and didn’t know what to expect.

Excellent Massage - Great Experience. this was a traditional place and a great experience. It's not polished and ritzy, it is moroccan!! Not for the shy person as they do give you a full body massage, but they are extremely professional. Cheap and fun and you feel like you have actually had a massage - it was great!!

Definitely an experience to try!. We stumbled across this place in the heart of Marrakesh and I'm so glad we did because it was a fab experience. We were talked through the options by the owner (Ziani) with a mint tea in hand and shown around the place before we decided to go for it. We were scrubbed down, relaxed in the sauna, washed again, had a massage, washed again, and then relaxed in a lovely room with mint tea again! Fab experience :)We also wanted to say a MASSIVE thanks to the owner...it was our first time in Morocco and he went out of his way to help us out. In addition to the Hammam experience, he arranged transport for us and places to stay! Thank you VERY VERY much :)

Amazing. Exactly, what you need mid-holiday. I loved this place. I really enjoy massages and spas anyway and this was a great way to relax and cool off after a long day walking in he heat and dust.Men and women go in separate sections but do be warned, if you are body shy, you do get naked but for a thong and move from room to room as such and the ladies (or men depending on which you are) do wasjph you and give full body massage bu it is lovely and oesn't feel awkward at all.The treatments are delightful and there's a really lovely relaxation room with mint tea for afterwards. It took me 40 minutes to be able to stand up and leave, I was so relaxed.The desk staff speak English and treatment lists are in English. The masseuses speak enough English to tell you what to do and where to go.Only downside is that the team room is beautiful but not massively hot.

Good Hammam.Great Experience.. Went here last week..it was only a 5 minute walk from my riad.I was given a guided tour, was happy with what I saw and booked for later that day.I went for the 270 Dirham package.It was worth every dirham.I had a sauna, was exfoliated, massaged hard ( my choice) for 30 minutes, and washed and scrubbed. Relaxed afterwards with some Mint Tea. I have to agree with other reviewers.I visited Le Bain Bleu later in the same week.It was good but I enjoyed my experience here better. Give it a try.

Cool experience but not long enough. My friend and I just went to the hammam and had the full package-steam, massage,scrub and drink. It was supposed to be a 1.5 hour experience but it was less than that. The lady who showed me thru wasnt at all aware of closing the curtains as i got changed and My experience in the steam room was really short. Other than that, it was fab. My lady was sweet and spoke only a couple of words of French, but she didn't stop smiling the whole time. She asked for a tip at the end and was happy with what I gave her. That was NOT the experience of my friend however! He went to the men's section and was told that his tip wasn't sufficient! His massueur said he should give more and was really inappropriate and rained the experience for us both. In summary my lady was lovely, his man was vile!

Very enjoyable. Although this hammam does not have the decor and smart ambience of other spas like les Bain de Marrakech I must say I enjoyed my time here more than all the others. And at half the price !. I went with a group of friends , the girls had female masseuse , and the guys had male masseurs.It gets very busy , so try and get there before the masses . Try and keep some cash to tip the masseur , he will drop hints , but not pushy , and you will have to go back into the steam room to actually give him the money discreetly . Worth every dirham !.

Great Experience. I thought that I wanted to have a local hammam experience – I suspect that I wouldn’t have really enjoyed a truly local experience. Our riad hosts (at Riad Dar Dialkoum) guided me to Hammam Ziani and I’m really glad they did. The experience was probably somewhere between the truly local hammam (communal wash place) and a western spa – more at the spa end, but not ‘slick’. In any event I thought it was a perfect compromise – fantastic black soap up, followed by steaming in the steam room, then an amazing oil massage – not too hard, not too soft - loofah down, wash down (the soap smelled like Perkins Paste! please take this as a positive comment, it smelled lovely), a couple of showers; all in a friendly, clean establishment. The masseur did ask me to go and get him a tip and give it to him in the massage room – he must have had to share if it was handed over in other parts of the establishment or something along those lines; but I was happy to tip him and I did as asked. I gave him 50 Dirhams (~5 Euros) and he seemed happy. I had the seaweed wrap add on and all up it cost D350 (or around 35 Euros). If I get back to Marrakesh I will head straight to Ziani on day 1 – unwind quickly into the holiday - I will skip the seaweed (save D100) but I will make sure I get back for a second visit on my last day.

Brilliant traditional hammam. I have been to this hammam before and it is still excellent. My friend and I had the full package at 270 dirhams, which is well worth every penny. The massage with Argan oil is just brilliant, the scrub with black soap invigorating and one leaves feeling extremely clean, but tired from all that steam, scrubbing and massaging. Why can't we have one of these in the UK?

fantastic experience. Having only ever been to a massage in a beauty parlour at home , i was not sure what to expect.So my friend and i went along and this experience turned out to be the best experience we have had in ages .Although the oil massage was extremely relaxing , every other part of the treatment was so funny, i haven't laughed that much in ages.My skin had never felt so clean and fresh .All the staff were great, although we couldn't understand them it was just their smiley faces and helpfulness.Dont go if your shy as you have to strip off and sit in a paper thong(which i managed to put on back to front to start with).I would never go to another posh spa if we had these in England.If you visit Marrakech you cant come home without a visit to Zianni.enjoy

"Relaxing but fun experience". Had a fantastic time here; we chose this hammam because we didnt want to go to a 5 star tourist hammam/spa, we wanted an authentic experience and we were not disappointed. I really dont think I have laughed so much for a long time. We were basically scrubbed and massaged for hours by women who didnt speak a word ofEnglish but made us feel very welcome. It is not for the faint hearted though; we stripped off and wore a skimpy pair of paper pants whilst the women who worked there rubbed us in soap, scrubbed us, washed our hair and threw buckets of water all over us. Because we were laughing, they tickled our feet to make us laugh even more. My friend who had just been massaged with argan oil was slipping all over the marble table whilst I was having my hair washed and buckets of water thrown over me. A very relaxing but fun afternoon. However, we did look a state walking back to our riad as we didnt prepare and take conditioner for our hair!!Highly recommended.

very relaxing. This Hammam is situated just down from Palais Bahia, our receptionist phoned and got a deal for us. As you enter they invite you for a tea, which was a bit rushed as the ladies were ready for us. Then you change which they give you a paper thong. Then it's into the hammam (vapor)room where they give you soap to put on all over and then you sit for about 20min, then the ladies wash you over and then you lay on the marble table as they exfoliate your whole body and then to be rinsed off, which makes you feel incredibly cleansed. Then if you choose(highly recommended) to the massage room a half hour whole body massage, then showered and ready for the day.

Not on par with others. We chose this hamman due to the positive review in the Top 10 guide, dissapointing in reality. The staff were welcoming but the hamman itself was a little seedy with very unwelcoming showers. The body scrub was a new experience and the Massage not bad if you like to slide all over the couch. The therapist made it very clear he expect a tip at the end!

I felt like a little kid again!. We were finding it hard to decide on a hammam, so we jumped online and found great reviews of this one. And we weren't disappointed. The whole experience was loads of fun. Despite not speaking any English, the ladies were all really cute and friendly, leading us through the slippery maze of walkways and into the steam room. My friend and I had the giggles, as the whole things just seems hilarious. Is definitely no place to be shy! They give you little disposable knickers and that's it! We sat in the steam room and gossiped for about half an hour, sopaing ourselves up and getting ready for the experience. Beware - the floors are super slippery so don't rush around! let the ladies lead you! i wouldn't have minded a bit of a harder scrub, but i guess they are used to wimpy tourists haha. The massage was delightful, and i felt like a little kid as the lady poured soapy suds over my hair at the end. A good idea might be to take some conditioner with you as they don't offer it, and my hair was like a bird's nest!Highly recommended, it's a real treat. Also, i'd recommend going at the start of your trip so that you're skin is scrubbed and clean and ready for the sun to do it's work!

The most amazing experience- highly entertaining and relaxing. I went here with 6 girlfriends. The whole experience was made by us all being able to be treated at the same time. All treatments happen in steam rooms so it's hard to see around you. Massages followed and mud body mask. The whole thing took about 2 hours finishing with mint tea in a nice lounge. For £25 we all thought it was a bargain. We had visited newer hammams but they looked like the spas in the uk. This was the real deal. Don't go here if you are prudish, shy or of a nervous disposition!! Do go if you want to experience a true Moroccan Hammam. We all loved it and would go again.

service, authenticity and fair prices all in one. If you are accustomed to Moroccan hammam treatments, then you will appreciate this. If you are a 5-star traveller and find it difficult to adapt to the places that you visit, stick to your hotel. If you want a proper hammam treatment, and like cleanliness and authenticity, then make your way here. If you know the procedure, then you will not expect a "steam room" experience, this IS a Moroccan Hammam... leave it to them and keep your expectations in your hotel room. One thing.... you will leave feeling squeaky clean and relaxed. Take your swimming costume (spare trunks/bikini bottom) along and just go with the flow. Procedure: steam, Moroccan soap, "gommage"/scrub (very thorough), optional massage (highly recommended) shower and change. give yourself 90 mins. No matter how many showers you take or scrubs you have after this.... nothing will compare to how clean you feel after a hammam.

Entered a sceptical tourist, departed feeling like a King!. Having been ripped-off left, right & centre in Marrakech I rather sceptically entered Hammam Ziani but was immediately put at ease by the welcoming receptionist who clearly explained the tariffs and options, then after making my selection he talked me through the process of what to expect.The hammam was fantastic and the massage perhaps the best massage I've ever had! After everything was over and I was back in my clothes, I was taken to their chill-out lounge and given the typical mint-green tea which properly finished off the experience well.The only possible downer was the lack of information over tipping policy. I'm familiar with it being said to tip the masseuse something at the end and I'd readily decided to tip 50DH, but the masseuse very forwardly asked for something 'hush hush' to be handed over outside. I left 20DH at reception for him!

Pampering in a tradtional Hammam. I love Hammams. The wonderful feeling of relaxation, soft skin and absolute cleanliness one has after the steam, gommage and massage cannot be beaten. I was delighted to be invited in to take a look around as I strolled past the Hammam Ziani from my nearby Riad.The interior is pure delight. Traditional, beautiful and inviting. Add to that the warmth of the welcome from Ziani and his lovely staff and I doubt if you could better this. Certainly, it is well known in Marrakech and is favoured by local people as well as visitors.For 270 MDM (around £25) you enjoy 90 minutes of indulgence in surroundings that are a pure delight. This is the total price for steam, gommage and the wonderful massage. Everything is provided, so you need only walk in and allow yourself to be pampered at a far lower price that your Hotel will charge.Take a taxi to the Parking le Prefecture, right opposite. Every taxi driver knows Hammam Ziani. And then ENJOY!

a true real experience. Hammam Ziani is a really true traditional hammam and offer to visitors a great experience for a correct amount of money. if i may suggest : go early afternoon when the place isn t too busy
Overpriced steam room and not vet hot. 80 dirhams for a semi warm steam room. Dreadful, better value in UK. Didn't go for massage.

Best price for tourist-friendly service. Visiting a Hammam for the first time can be a bit scary, and those that tout themselves as ‘tourist friendly’ usually ask tourist prices too. Not the case for Hammam Ziani. The service was so good, and so cheap, that we visited twice. Once for just the basic steam, scrub and shower, and the second time for the massage too (around £15 for this - great value). Staff were friendly (it doesn’t matter that they don’t speak English, they show you what to do without it), the place was clean, and the hammam itself relaxing and excellent value. Us girls weren’t asked to tip at all, and in fact would have liked to have done, but my husband was asked for one – out of sight of the CCTV camera, so clearly staff have been told not to ask for tips. If you’ve never been to a Hammam, visit this one. If you have visited a tourist-friendly one before and been disappointed (as we were in Turkey), you won’t be here.

autentic, good, middelpriced. Very nice expirence, 270 MAD for the big tour. black soap wash, scrub down, masage, white soap wash and toweldry by the morrocan ladys. went twice. First time exelent, 2 time the woman was in a bit of a rush : (But I recomend this place. And would go next time.remember to bring tips for your marrocoan lady. 20-40 MAD.

Not worth the money. I have chosen this hammam because of the good reviews here, but deeply regret that went there: walls are white like in hospital, light is too bring-couldn't relax, steam room is cold, shower was dirty and rusty, massage table wasn't cleaned after previous client, massage ladies don't speak English. Would never go there again.

Great experience - got to do it.. I agree with most of the reviews here that it is quite an authentic experience - although a bit on the more expensive side - but much cheaper than if you were to go to the Hilton.They offer several packages but it is structured such that you have not much choice but to choose the basic package at 270 Dirhams. This gives you a steam bath, a scrub, a massage and a cup of that obligatory mint tea afterwards. There is a locker for you to keep all your valuables - but i would not suggest that you bring too much precious stuff with you as the locker does not look too strong for the determined thief.For those who find the steam bath too cold, just inform the attendant who will turn up the heat. Trust me, it does get extremely hot once they turn it on. As for the scrub, for those not used to it, it is strange but you will be surprised at how much dirt they can get off you.The massage is more like "Thai" massage than aromatherapy massage so be prepared to be pressed and turned, rather than "stroked".The whole experience lasted about one and a half hours to 2 hrs. As usual, you are expected to tip.I only give 4 stars instead of 5 for these reasons:1. Price is way too expensive in Marrakesh. The local hammam is only about 10-20% of the price.2. Locker is not strong enough3. Pressured to give a tip at the end of service.

Fairly authentic hammam experience, good massage. Hammam Ziani offers various packages. I had the basic hammam and massage which cost 270 Dirhams. They give you a basket with all the neccessary lotions etc and you change into a wrap which stays on throughout (men). Your attendant then takes you to the steam room where you wash with black olive soap and then are taken to a table for the gommage. Rough gloves and more soap get you really clean. After a shower you have a massage. Very good full body massage then another shower and out to get dressed. The whole experience lasted about one and a half hours. You are expected to tip the guy who performs the treatment. Give whatever you think appropriate. When you are dressed you are served mint tea in a small lounge. All in all a very satisfying experience.

Good experience - somewhere between traditional and touristy. Whilst others may prefer the posh spa surroundings of other Moroccan hamans for my mind this is much better - a perfect balance between traditional and touristy.Agree with many of the previous statements - nice and clean, and very welcoming. We had a tour first and then went back later in the day to have our treatment.Once you get used to the paper knickers and trying not to be self conscious - a bitish thing I think !!! - then it was fantastic - the scrubbing in particular was very good as was the massage. Partner also enjoyed his and we met up after for mint tea in the relaxing area. Right near the palace so easyish to find (well as easy as anything is in Marrakech!!!)As previous people have said a tip is expected although I didnt feel pressured - tipped about £2.50 which I dont think was bad at all.If I got back whic I hope to do would def go back to Hamman Ziani

A pleasure for all the senses!. I can't begin to describe how wonderful an experience I had at the Hamman Ziani in Marakech.The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming to my friend and I. We visited first and were shown around the spa so we could see how it all worked and what would happen and then the various packages were explained to us. We bought the deluxe package for 350 dirhams (about £44), which meant we didn't have to book in, just turn up when we wanted and included the steam, gommage (the scrubbing), 30 min full body massage with scented argon oil, 30 min seaweed wrap and almond full body and hair wash.It was a luxuriant experience, though the girls who provided our treatments spoke limited English and us limited French we were able to communicate and have a nice conversation. The architecture of the hamman itself was beautiful, with lots of white tiles, arched ceilings and grey and white marble tables and sinks that were intricately carved.A pair of bikini knickers (brand new), a key locker, slip on flip flops and a terry cloth robe were provided as part of the package and at no time did you feel hurried. I have very long hair and one of the ladies also took the time to brush it for me after the session had ended, which was an additional luxury that I enjoyed.Tipping is expected and other reviewers have complained about this. However, tipping in Morroco is an expected part of the culture, but you shouldn't be expected to tip until you are dressed and able to access your locker. We gave a 50 dirham tip (about £6) between the two of us as we had two ladies working on us constantly for 1.5 hrs and an attendant who helped us in the changing rooms.After the session we spent 15 minutes in the chill out room and had a complementary mint tea (the morrocan drink of choice) and listened to some lovely ambient music.All the products used on us were available to buy in their boutique, but it must be noted that prices here are much higher than the pharmacies in the Kasbah and Souk, but we were not pressured to buy anything, which was nice.I would be very tempted to go back to Marrakech for a weekend just to experience this Hamman again. It was a great experience and a wonderful way for my friend and I to round off our holiday in Marrakech on our last day.

Good facilities with staff that get on with the job. Having been to a number of hammams in the Middle East, this would have to be one of the nicer places. It was clean and although a few other people there we didnt actually see them. The hamman is divided into 2 sections, 1 with the steam room and a separate room where staff can clean and massage you with 2 beds there. Although there were a few others while we were there we didnt see them and it was not crowded. The staff did a good job, cleaning and massaging us. They have a lovely area to relax and have some tea in after the whole experience.Oh also the entrance price is negotiable. We managed to get it nearly at half price for the 3 of us. The extra bag, soap, towel etc that you can buy from them isnt really worth it.

Nothing extravagant, but decent hammam experience. I've had better, I've had worse. If you want a luxurious experience, expect to have to dish out the cash at an upscale spa. But if you want a basic hammam experience that you can trust to be clean and legit, Ziani is for you.

better than the 5 star places for many reasons.... If you haven't had an authentic hammam, you may be impressed by the beautifully decorated, expensive production-line set-ups around Marrakech. If you want "the job done" this is the place.Once we found the hammam in a lane ( near a historic palace) we were shown a menu of treatments. We chose the hamman option with an argan oil body massage.We were prepared with our "swim wear" with us- you will be only wearing the bottom half. We were led to the ladies section, given a set of towelling robes, slippers and a locker with a key. Then we entered a dome shaped traditional steam room.The room was steamy and since we picked 2pm (early by local standards) we had the place to ourselves. It was a great experience, especially the way the shafts of light streaked through the steam ( the dome shaped room had small holes in it, and the sunlight pierced through- we were in another era. The scrub was great, the massage was amazing, they even washed my hair for me afterwards, i've never had such a good head massage. The staff we very welcoming and friendly. Tipping is standard in Marrakech, we were not pressured. In fact after the treatment, we went looking for the ladies to give them a token of appreciation. Its clean, prices are good ( we paid 270 Dh for our treatment), we emailed in advance, but they replied and stated we could walk in anytime, as is the custom in a Morrocan Hammam. Afterwards we sat and had a refreshing mint tea in the salon. I like the authenticity, although it isn't one of the "public" hammams where one would take their own soap, towel, bucket etc. its adequate for me. I shall be returning and have recommended Hammam Ziani to everyone i've met. ( i've had about 8 hammam treatments in the past)They speak enough English to communicate, the prices are fair, the treatments are thorough, and they do a good job. thanks to trip advisor, it was because of a previous review that i chose to visit.

Very good and simple introduction to the hammam world. This was our first time in a hammam, for both men and women, even if we are very frequent sauna goers. For a trial we chose the basic package, which includes scrubbing, but not massage, for 80 dirhams, plus 20 for a towel (total about 9-10€, for one hour). Anyway, scrubbing felt like a massage, the hot room was good and clean, there were enough assistants there to guide and treat us, there was a decent changing room and a nice relaxing (tea) room for after-bath. There are probably many more luxurious hammams around, but this was a very good introduction to all of us. Everybody felt very happy, and ready for a good dinner, afterwards. This contrasted greatly with the experience we had in a terrible "hammam" a few days later in Essaouira (for a higher price).

terrible experience. on my last night in marrakech i went to hamman ziani...since i read good reviews here. maybe it was due to my late evening appointment (at 7pm), but the whole experience was all wrong. i get massages at least once a month in nyc and this was my third hamman experience in morocco....my first was at 1001 nights hamman in marrakech (which was very good and recommended by my hotel for 330 dirham), the second was a traditional hamman in essaoria which was good too(where i paid a guy 150 dirham for a scrub and massage).first, as previous reviewers have mentioned....the steam room is luke warm at best (i don't like overly hot steam rooms, but this was ridiculous) also, i had to lather myself with some sticky paste...this was done for me at the other two places. after five minutes..yes, five minutes, ALI called me from the steam room and had me lay down on a slippery, cold, wet table....where he lathered me some more and dumped water on me...shortly after, i took a shower.then i laid down on the same uncomfortable table (there are 3 tables in each cold room) and he began putting oil on me and "massaging" me. 15 minutes into i had to ask if this was the massage, because he was just rubbing/feeling my muscles....not massaging them. i asked him to do it harder...which didn't help. after 45 more minutes of this (i had paid for 25 extra minutes of massage)...it was over.i reluctantly gave a 20 dirham tip...which he didn't like, but i was really unhappy with the whole experience. afterwards, while having mint tea, i asked another patron about his experience and he said the same thing about the massage not being strong enough.i would have to say that i wouldn't go back again, it just wasn't worth it.so a recap of my issues:1. lukewarm steam room2. uncomfortable tables for massage3. massage room is same as shower room and is cold and shared with 2 other people getting massages4. massage was a light muscle rub, not a massage5. at no point throughout the process are you giving a robe or towel to dry off until the end...i would have liked to have dried myself completely before the massage

Authentic experience. Ziani is a good compromise between an authentic hammam experience and a tourist aimed spa. Forget about luxury (at least on the male side) this place has nothing to do with Les Bains de Marrakech for example.. but it's also much cheaper too. There's no private cabins for massage, the massage beds are covered with waxed sheets so you get all foamed and oiled up and then they just wash it off and ready for the next...As for being cold, not really. The hammam was hot enough to steam cook me! I had a great scrub and many great massages! ADIL (young short guy) makes awesome strong massages, HAFID and RACHID make great massages too but more relaxing type.

Average. Being in Marrakesh, we wanted to experience one of its main attractions, a hammam. And we chose Hammam Ziani. The package cost 270 dirham - for the hammam, a scrub (gommage) and 30 minute massage which includes use of a towel and robe. The place itself is dimly lit and whilst not dirty, its not the cleanest. It was a bit dark and dingy for my liking.All in all, quite expensive for a rather mediocre experience.

Enjoyable and a little bizarre!. I researched thoroughly before embarking on the hammam experince, so that I would be prepared for what was to come, having never even been to a spa before. I was not let down by my experience at Ziani. The guy on the reception talks you through the options ( I went for the full package) and although the women inside don't speak much English or French, they are pretty patient and point you where you need to go, so it's best to just go with it. You get handed a basket with a robe etc in it, get changed into your paper knickers and make your way to the first area where you hang up your robe. The staff can tell what package you're on by the colour of your flip flops and the basket you're given to take with you (not sure why, maybe in case you want to use your own shampoo etc). Oh and yes, I would slip some money for tips into the pocket of your robe when you're getting changed so that you have that with you at the end. You then go and sit in the steam room for a while till a lady summons you to be soaped down and splashed clean, Then you sit some more, till another lady comes in and you are massaged, scrubbed and slathered in mud and plastic sheeting to within an inch of your life! The whole experience is quite odd but the women are friendly and have seen it all before. At the end you can shower and wash your hair (although I'm not sure if there's a hairdryer) and get helped back into your robe. Generally, the lady that massages you is the one who gets tipped and she'll be with you for most of the process. The place does smell a bit odd, but not dirty, just don't expect the kind of shiny clinical feel of a comparable Western institution. I enjoyed it and was clean and soft at the end of it all, glad I did it.

All round great experience. I went to Marrakesh with 2 girl friends of mine so we were up for some pampering. We had been to another hammam at the beginning of our stay and thought it was an alright experience but we were pleasantly surprised when we knew we were on to a winner at Hammam Ziani. The 1 and a half hour procedure started with some blacksoap and water in a beautiful steam room with marble stools and basins, followed by a thorough scrub in another room and finished with a thorough massage by really cheerful and friendly ladies who knew what they were doing.

not really. this is soley a westerner oriented hammam. bring your own towel and avoid being charged for this. the steam room was luke warm and just felt nasty. the dude that exfoliated and massaged me needed to buy deodorant but was friendly enough so the pong was tolerable. i think the feelings of feeling dirty from some reviewers comes from the strange smelling soap and oil they use. but i agree the premises just isnt pristine. the dude asked me for a tip as soon as i was off the table. for the 200 dirhams i would say an average experience. i am however giving it a 'terrible' rating as i believe it is cheeky to underpower a steam room (local hammams charge local moroccans 10 dirhams) and i just get fed up with being asked for tips. and yes the dudes do tend to push you through the various areas. so i am sure you will find better hammams.

Ladies, make sure you have the money to tip. First of all, I have to say that the Gents section at Hammam Ziani is very good. I completely enjoyed the service. Staff are professional and friendly. HOWEVER, my wife had a very horrible experience at the Ladies section and WAS NOT ALLOWED TO LEAVE.The Incident:Right after finishing her hammam and massage (when she was still in her undies), my wife immediately was asked for tips. It is quite hilarious indeed. Under which body part can you hide the money when doing hammam?Actually, my wife and I have no objection to tip, providing that (i) circumstances allow (ii) this is discretionary. Unfortunately, both were negative in this incident. (i) Apart from the fact that there is nowhere to hide any money during hamman, my wife has actually given all her belongings to me when she was enjoying the pampering due to security concerns.(ii) After knowing that my wife has no money on her, the staff immediately showed an unfriendly face and attitude towards her. She was detained in the property until I arrived and gave her money to set her free.This is simply horrible. My wife almost burst into tears when she saw me. So, ladies, make sure you bring enough money with you to tip, apart from the fact that the service has already been paid for upfront.

Hammam Ziani in Marrakech. I have just had my first Hammam experience at the Hammam Ziani in Marrakech (there is another one in Casablanca). I have been having massages all over the world and can honestly say this is one of the best I've tried. But please be aware that an Hammam is no SPA. It is more 'violent' . The purpose is not to have a 'out of body' experience, but to get you reallllly clean! Bad:- The price on their website is not correct at all. 270dh for steam room+soaping+massage+shower+scrubbing OR seaweedtherapy.- you are not told what is going to happen and you can end up waiting more than you expected in the steam room.- it is clean but by no standards what you'd expect of a SPA. you could tell all the material, although cleaned, has been used several times.-the ladies are waiting for your tip in the end.Good:-the massage is fabulous, more of a violent that relaxed type-the ladies are very nice,polite and make you feel comfortable-it all lasts 1.30h which is the reasonable time for it.-it is very central.-the price is extremely reasonable.If in Marrakech do give it a try!

first time ok, second time v. good. I read great reviews of Hammam Ziani and decided to visit it on a trip to Marrakech. I went in the afternoon, and found the place pretty crowded. The people who work there (after they had taken my money) had little time for me. I was left in the steam room for a long time and then given a quick massage and scrub.The scrub was great, but for that price, I would have liked to be treated less as a problem and more as a valued customer.Worse, 2 young women tourists decided to walk in with 4 wailing children. An experience that should have been relaxing, ended up being just the opposite!!Anyway, I had a few hours to kill on my last day in Marrakech and decided to try a Hammam again. The Ziani was the most conveniently located- so I went back- but with extreme misgivings. I told the owner about my awful experience the last time and he assured me that this time would be different. He instructed one of the attendants to look after me- and gosh, did she! I was given fantastic treatment, a lovely scrub and massage and a great sauna soak.In the end, I came away with good feelings about Ziani- but if you want to be treated well there- you will need to be a bit assertive.Otherwise, thanks to some good reviews here, they get a lot of tourist traffic and may be slacking just a bit.Go there for the convenient location, good facilities and treatment that can be very good- if you push for it..

worst experience of my life. I have been to many hammams and this was by far the worst I have ever experienced. Everything was extremely dirty and unhygienic. The towels were not washed and there were hairs and dirt everywhere. I did not get scrubbed properly and i was left in the steam room for 45 minutes without any steam.I would recommend the Hivernage hammam. This was exceptional and everything was great. The massage was amazing and I felt very clean and refreshed.

Its so good.... I chose the Hammam Ziani because I didn't want a very expensive upmarket 'feminine' place with rose petals and the like, but neither did I want a public steam room. Having read previous reviews off the internet, i reckoned that this place was just about right- and it was , for what I wanted. I took th 280 dirhams menu- and it was everything i wanted. When you go in they allocate someone to you who looks after you for the duration of your stay. My man was 'abdullah'. First he shows you to the changing room where you swap your clothes for a sarong like wrap. Clothes are put into a locker and you keep the key. First a shower and a soap rub, then on into a very steamy steam room for about 15 minutes. on emerging from the dteam room another quick shower and then onto a 'table'. There were four tables in the room and other people were being treated at the same time, but by different attendants. I have been to a hammam in Turkey once. There the job was done on the floor of the large baths area, this place is a bit more upmarket than that. No sloshing of water buckets - however much fun that is. The room is tiled and there is a coloured glass window. First round is a good scrub with a sort of loofah mitt. All over, but carefully just avoiding the most intimate parts. Abdullah showed me just how much skin came off me. A lot! Then a shower , and on to the massage. It was quite strong. With oils rubbed in to all over. A few stretches and pressure applications nearly made my eyes water!! Then some warm soap and a hair and body wash, and another shower to get it all cleaned off. You come out feeling so fresh and clean. All the spare skin is sloughed off, and knots and hairs straightened. Really an exceptional experience. Reborn is what people say. However I recognise its not for everyone. My wife didn't fancy it, nor the other couple we travelled with. Its not for someone with (say) a bad back unless the masseur is extra careful - or people who are overly embarrassed about another person being that personal about cleaning them almost all over. However, cosidering the whole experience, I enjoyed it and look forward to going again to a hammam sometime.Just to mention, it took me ages to find the place, maps of marrakesh are not good. However , in fact it is only about five minutes off the main square. Just a few doors along, there is a shop selling soaps, oils and ungents. Run by a man called Zac. Its a good place to buy things to take home to use as next best thing to having this kind of scrub at a hammam. Ask the man on the ticket desk where Zac' s place is!

Fun for the price. My partner and I went here to kill two hours after checking out of the hotel and before our transfer to the airport. It was great fun.We arrived at 1pm and bought the full experience for MAD 350 (about £20).First, we got changed into these skirt things you have to wear. Then a shower and steam for 20 minutes.Then we had a salt scrub (it takes the skin off if you're not careful), oil massage, seaweed wrap, soaping and shower again followed by mint tea. It all lasted about 90 minutes.Being honest, the massage wasn't the most sensational I've ever experienced but for the price you cannot complain and the place is clean and seems to target tourists.I'd go back.

Certainly different !. Despite having been to the far east and had massages there and at home, this was nothing like anything I've experienced. The whole experience was much more clinical. You very much felt that the purpose was to get you clean, rather than the 'Spa' experience which always feels a little more intimate and designed to relax. Not that that was a bad thing. Both my sister and I came out feeling great and would definately do it again. We had the package at 350 DH / £24ish, included gommage (scrub), massage (and yes, they massage ALL of you, from head to toes), seaweed wrap ( watch out for the cold marble slab underneath you and hot slop on top - weird) and drink (aka mint tea!). She has skin that can react to creams and I have pressure urticaria, but whatever they used didn't cause any reactions much to our surprise.Good way to spend a couple of hours out of the chaos of the medina. Never been to any other Hammam so can't tell you if good value for money, but the package worked well for a novice, and compared to rip off England seemed good to me !

Traditional Hammam. Traditional Hammam in Marrakech - Hammam ZianiLocal Traditional Hammam, English spoken, and English price/description lists on front reception counter...Very friendly..ladies and gents separate..No mixed as this is a traditional local hammam. Can wear Bikini, or one piece swimsuit but most ladies wear just their pants!My husband & I went to this local hammam as we thought that was more authentic, and had been highly recommended by other guests staying at our Riad.We were told to go about 2 pm, as it gets busy about 4-4.30pm with the locals. We went to the Hammam Ziani, we did not need to take towels etc only thing to take for the ladies was a spare pair of pants! and spare pair of undies for the men unless you go naked.Our experience was fantastic, lasted 1hour 45 mins, but my husbands lasted 2 hours! We had traditional steam room, then soaped down, splashed with very warm water, then steam again, then another soap down, then another splash down, then exfoliation (Wonderful) they even pumice your feet!, then soap down, then full massage with oil, then soap down and hair washed...you are given a basket with all clean products, wrap etc which only you use.Came out feeling exceptionally clean and soft. It cost us about 18.00 ..really good value and I wish we had had it at the start of our holiday then we could have had another minus the exfoliation just before we went home!The ladies in there do not speak English but its not necessary, as they simply lead you where they want you. There were other tourists in there but it was not busy, my husband did not want to come out after his session...he enjoyed it so much!

Great Value Hammam near Palace. Hamman Ziani is just down the road from Palais Bahia. It is a traditional style Hamman catering for tourists. 80Dh for Hammam, Steam, Gommage and Soaping - compared to 150 Dh at our hotel spa.I took a 280 Dh package including massage and algie wrap - excellent value and eveything was first class. It seemed to cure my aches and pains and a week later they still haven't returned. This impecably clean Hamman has different sections for Mena and Women and is open from 8.00 - 22.00. I strongly recommend it.14 Rue Riad Zitoune jdid. Phone 062 71 55 71

Well worth a visit . Went today to Isis spa. Stripped down to underwear and given a robe. Fati scrubbed and washed me in the hamman which feels great. Then had a half hour ( should have had an hour) massage by luna which was wonderful. Then laid in a room with meditation music and had some tea. Very relaxing. Just what you need after a few days walking round Marrakech but it is hard to find. Well worth 300d. Would recommend.

Mr. Just been to isis spa and hamman. Fati scrubbed and washed me clean then had a half hour massage (should have had an hour) by Luna which was wonderful. Then a lay down in another room with meditation music playing and a glass of tea. Just what u need after a few days of walking around Marrakech. Well worth 300dirams. Would recommend.

Great, clean and attentive staff! . My mother and me went to the isis spa and experienced a very nice treatment: hammam and massage (package traditional ritual for 300 dirhams).We had the staff's full attention for about 1h20 and Fatima (hammam), karima & loubna (massage) treated us with great care (gentle and still strong)The only minor thing is that the hammam (steaming area) only consists of one room. Apart from that it's a very clean and lovely and airy place and we would definitely recommend it!
Super amazing spa. I visited here 2days ago at that time a felt like heaven i bet isis spa is the best in marrakech then kali is the best therapist I wanna go this spa again

Wonderful hamman experience. My friend and I visited this spa (both our first ever hamman) and had an absolutely wonderful experience. For 400dhm each we both had the traditional ritual with an hours massage and left completely relaxed! Fatima gave us a great hamman and then two lovely ladies then gave us great massages. Highly recommend!! Neither the map on the website or google maps take you to the correct location so leave some extra time to find it (it's absolutely worth the hunt!)

Just do it! . What an amazing experience. I was fearing it would be like Turkish baths which I was not impressed with. But I was pleasantly surprised. Fatima was amazing and washed every nook and dusty cranny after being in Morocco for over 2 weeks and then Loubina (?) did my massage. I went somewhere out of this world. I did a this with a friend. It was great! Leave your inhibitions at the door and enjoy!!

Serene environment for a relaxing experience . This was my first time at a hamman and it was quite an amazing experience. This is a modern hammam in one of the many lanes of the Medina. It is clean, hygienic and serene. I did the hammam and the massage. This is a great combination and Sanaa and Karima did a wonderful job. I was very relaxed after the experience that I did not wish to leave. They are in no hurry and you can take your time relaxing after the massage. I paid 400Mad for a 1.45hours experience.

refreshing and cleansing. Never done this before but it was fantastic. Felt great the next day as well - skin freshly cleansed. Well worth the 300 derhams which included the 30 massage afterwards. Fatima was excellent, despite the language barrier.

Plan this for the end of your vacation. First of all and very important as someone stated before, bring an extra pair of underwear unless you like feeling it soaking under your pants. My wife and I planned this visit to the spa even before going to Marrakesh. Thos placr is in a secluded street just steps away from the main square at Jmaa el Fna. Once there you are requested to strip your clothes down to the underwear and given robes for the rest of the experience. First you will be greeted by the always smiling Fatima, a lovely lady the will scrub your body from head to toes with black soap and then cover you with mud called ghassoul, and then, you will be scrubbed again by Fatima (make sure you ask for her). Then you will be taken to another room where lovely Karima and Lubna will pamper you with a body massage (we also asked for a facial treatment also performed by them), let me tell you that you and your spouse will be taken to a peaceful paradise of relaxation! after one hour you then will be taken to a small room for you to relax and drink a cup of tea for a few minutes. I cannot stress enough what a great experience this was! Again, do not forget to ask for Fatima, Lubna and Karima!!
Isis spa. Was an amazing experience. The body scrub leaves you refreshed and if you go ask for Kera she does an amazing massge
Refreshing and relaxing. Fatima and Fati gave us a traditional hannmam wash and body scrub followed with mud and massage skin felt fab when we left

Hammam was unforgettable, Massage left me confused.. My husband and I booked the couple's hammam and massage on September 13, 2016, our last day in Marrakech. This place is hard to find so we scouted it the day before, make sure you give yourself enough time to look for it.The hammam was such an amazing experience. The girls upstairs were very thorough and professional. You don't know how much dirt you have on your body until you've had a proper hammam experience. These girls scrubbed the heck out of us and our skin had never felt so good. It was truly an unforgettable experience, it had me researching hammams in NYC.Now to the massage...We walked in the couple's massage room and I smiled at my masseuse, she barely made eye contact and gave me a smirk (weird, I know). The massage started out ok then it became apparent that she was not in the mood to give a massage. lol Now I know how my dog feels when I'm doing something else while I'm halfheartedly petting him. 1/3 of the time, she actually exerted some pressure while massaging me. The next third, she was barely doing anything. She was kind of playing with my hair at one point with one hand. ( I think she was on her phone with the other hand) Then the last third, guess what, she just disappeared. lol She walked out of the room and didn't come back for 5 minutes. I thought the massage was over so I started to get up and saw that my husband was still getting massaged so I laid back down. She finally came back and massaged my legs for a minute then stopped. I laid there for 10 minutes (not exaggerating), 10 MINUTES!, without any clue what was going on since nothing at all was happening. I finally got up because I didn't know what else to do, my husband was still getting his massage and my masseuse was behind my massage bed on her phone. I asked "Are we finished?" and she scowled at me, I asked her again and she said loudly "OK". I felt bad that my husband had to end his massage but I was so confused, I had no idea what was happening! I think maybe since she was about 4 months pregnant, she was hormonal. It's either that or she REALLY, REALLY hates giving massages! Anyway, the massage ruined it for me. I give the hammam 5 stars. I would definitely come back here for that and we highly recommend it. Bring an extra pair of underwear because you have to wear one during the hammam. My husband gives his masseuse 5 stars, I will give mine zero stars. I've been getting massages once a month for 15 years now and I can honestly say that it was the worst massage I've ever had. If you're getting a massage, make sure it's not with the angry pregnant lady. She'll give you the stink eye. ;-)

Best scrub and massage!. Fátima Zara was great at her massage, helped me relax and she was very gentle with my hair and earing gs during the head massage. The hamam was great too, the ladies really looked after us and made it a fun experience.Thoroughly recommend the place.

Excellent Spa and staff. The spa was excellent, the service was brilliant and the staff were all great. Might be worth plotting the location on your phone to find as its down a small side street on the Derb Dabachi road. I walked by it a few times!
Couple Spa. Gorgeous spa with lovely staff. Had a couples hammam which was great value and a peaceful break from the wonderful chaos of the Marrakech medina!

Fantastic hammam & spa experience!. Me and my partner went to ISIS spa for a couples hammam and massage - for a very reasonable 580 dirhams (for 1 hour 15 mins but we were actually there nearly 2 and a half hours). The spa staff were amazing - the receptionist was so helpful, and the hammam-lady was brilliant. We were both taken to the roof to a steam room where we were washed and scrubbed - we've literally never been cleaner. This was followed by a half hour massage downstairs that was extremely relaxing! Before going to Marrakech I was struggling to find a nice spa that we could go to together that wasn't really expensive - and would highly recommend ISIS to anyone looking for a similar experience :) We weren't rushed at all and you have a few minutes in a lovely chill out room with mint tea before you head back out into the town.Also I stupidly left my necklace in the pocket of my robe but when I called the next day they had found it and kept it safe for me to collect!

Wonderful Spa! . This spa was hard to find - but worth it. Lovely hamman experience and massage at this place. Very beautiful, clean and relaxing. We had a couples package for 780 DH that lasted 1 hr, 45 minutes. Loved it - they even ended it with mint tea! Trip Advisor has the location slightly off - so walk around the area a bit and look for the signs. Also, ignore the people that tell you 'there is nothing down there' even though the signs clearly point the way. It's worth the wandering to find!

Great spa!!!. Difficult to get to. Follow the signs. Trip advisor tag is not accurate but gets you close. Walk towards the tannery and turn right when you see the spa sign. Great hamman! Massage was great as well with a proper massage table. The best way to end the vacation!Highly recommended!!!

Very satisfied. I have visited the spa with my wife for the hammam + 1 hour massage couple's package (780 mad). My wife said it was one of the best experiences of her life.How it was: after undressing to our underwear, my wife without bra for the exfoliation, we were taken to a room where two friendly women, Fati and Samir (from what I understood), showered us with warm water, soaped, rinsed, before the exfoliation. It was rough and hurted a little, but it was OK in the end. They then covered our bodies with some beauty cream, and we waited for a while before being rinsed and lead to the massage room. Now I must stop to say my skin was never so great as after this treatment. My wife loved the way my skin got.I thought the massage was good, my wife said it was one of the best of her life. We were always in the same room, and after comparing our experiences, I concluded we got exactly the same treatment, we just differed in our perception.After the massage we were lead to a room to relax and have some tea, and after that dressed our clothes, paid and went away pretty relaxed and satisfied.They provide everything, I would just recommend a change of underwear if you don't want to go away with wet undies or going commando.

Hammam and massage. We had a couples hammam and massage which was a very good experience and excellent value at 780 MAD for two people. The staff are very professional and very competent. In particular our masseuses - Karima and Noura.

A must do massage and more. This was my last activity on my holiday to Marrakesh this year. The medina in Marrakesh is crowded noisy and often overwhelming; this is the perfect antidote. As soon as you cross the door you feel at peace in the relaxing decor. I had 3 treatments, a steam room bath, a massage and the best pedicure I have ever had. feet in great condition weeks afterwards and all using traditional techniques. I left revived and refreshed. My only regret I did go at the beginning of my holiday, so I could ahve gone back again. Staff are lovely. Highly recommend.

Excellent spa with great value . My boyfriend and I went to Isis spa for the couples hammam and massage. I was a bit worried about the hammam, mostly the vigorous scrubbing, since I had never experienced that before. The staff was very helpful and listened to my request of "pas la visage si vous plait". My boyfriend loved the hammam and enjoyed being scrubbed and then doused in water. It was a very fun experience! Then came the massage. The women who massaged us (Fatim and Fatima.. I'm so sorry if I'm getting your names wrong!) were excellent! They were very thorough and the massage had great pressure. Overall we thought this was a wonderful experience and a great value!

Slice of serenity in chaotic Marrakech . 22 year old Australian female, solo traveller. I received the "traditional ritual" package for 400 dirham. It included steam room, soap, scrub with exfoliating glove, mud scrub and 1 hour massage. When you step in you are greeted by friendly staff and delicious smells of incense. You are taken to a room to get changed into a robe and slippers and this is where you store your belongings in a locker. Then you have your treatment. All services were excellent, especially the massage. Afterwards, you are taken to a lovely relaxing room with sofa lounges where you can recline with some mint tea. There is no rush in this room, you are allowed to take your time to relax. Just a wonderful experience overall, highly recommend. I have had cheaper hammam and believe that this was worth the extra money.

Relaxing retreat. My boyfriend and I had the couples Hammam and Massage. It was a fantastic experience. We were looked after from the moment we stepped inside to the moment we left. If you go I'd recommend asking for Fati and Karima both ladies did an amazing job. Its very reasonably priced.

Bliss!. We decided before we went to marrakech that this was the place to go and I'm soooo glad we did, whilst trying to find the building we were told by a man that is was closed. But i had previously looked up opening times and decided to go look for myself. It was open so booked in for an hour later. We went for the couples hammam, it's very calm and quiet in there away from all the manic streets outside. We got changed into our bathrobes and got led upstairs to the steam room where we were washed(including my hair & braided) and clay masks applied then scrubbed down and washed off. Then led back downstairs to have a hour long massage. I've never had one with so much attention ( she even did my fingers, toes and eyelids) was heaven. After we went left in a room to chill out with mint tea. I can honestly say I've not been that calm and relaxed in a long time. Definitely recommend u do this! X

Spa. ISIS spa derb debachi marakech medinathe worse experience ever!They don't understand a word of English. I decided to go for the hammam and the full body and facial massage, manicure and pedicure.The hammam is hot and abrasive which is fine   and expected it to be and the lady was very friendly but we couldn't understand each other at all. I asked to be washed up a little sooner than than expected time as heat was too uncomfortable.Then it started with the facial and the body massage which was nothing more than a soak in oils and the girl was inexperienced and just gave a little rub all over the body and the face with Argan Oil.Next was the pedicure which started of with removing my nail Polish and she asked if I wanted the nails clipped I agreed but stopped her after the first nail as she started to cut them round and chopped a chunk of the corner so asked her if she could keep it straight and just file them instead. She takes a lame used buffer from her raggard bag to smooth out my nails from the top which she did one and gave up and didn't bother with the second foot. Her filer to smooth the nails was too lame to hold the movement which she struggled with through out.She didn't have a proper loafer to take the dead skin off the feet, at this point I lost interest and was deeply disappointed and wanted to arrange my lift to get back to the Riad I asked for wifi access they refused to provide wifi password for whatever reason. I continued to watch the girl struggling with her poor quality materials to carry out the rest of the treatment. She was rough with the cuticles and cut the firsr one too close which exposed the redness front of the cuticle I asked her not to cut the cuticles and just pushed them back.This was the cherry on the cake when she dug out an old bottle of clear nail Polish which was too dry and hardly any left in the bottle, I watched her put the lumps on to my nails and finished off by taking me down stairs to the rest room on my way down the stairs I slipped off the slippery rug on the tiles the man who manages the place giggled immaturely.This was a complete waste of time, a day before leaving Morocco. As I sit here writing this review with lumpy clear nail polish on my hands and regretting the time I wasted this morning which was supposed to be relaxing. Unfortunately the place is hidden away in very rough part of medina with inexperienced staff and above all they have poor quality beauty materials at their disposal through.

Lovely Spa tucked away . I visited Isis Spa with my husband, we felt very welcomed by the staff and the Spa treatments are very reasonable. We went back quite a few times because we loved it there & we received a Spa gift from the staff.

Tucked away escape. Tucked away at the end of an alley filled with turns and notches in the bowels of a congested, bustling souk is Isis Spa, a lovely, quiet escape from the city beyond. The service was incredible and the spa was very well-kept and clean. Also, it felt safe and not once did I doubt my safety being there. My friend and I booked a double massage for an affordable price and we had an hour escape in a shared room. My massage was so relaxing that I fell asleep and did not even realize I had been tired or had fallen asleep until the end when she woke me up. Afterward, we were led downstairs to a quiet room and served Berber Tea until we were ready to get dressed again. Overall, a very good experience with excellent service.
Fantastic! . We had the couples hamman and massage. Excellent. You will love it! Beautiful inside, professional staff, a haven of peace right in the city. We would go back anyday

Great hammam. We did a couples package after our hotel recommended this place. Looked into some others but in the end I'm so glad we went here. The staff was so nice especially because my boyfriend was not an experienced hammamer. The place was beautiful wonderful treatments and massage. They even had a place to just relax afterwards before going back out to the busy square. Definitely worth it!
hammam and massage. Had a great Hammam and massage, From a full body rub down in the hammam and an hour full body massage at a great price all staff are professional enjoyed my visit.

Palace in the middle of a busy medina . We had a wonderful experience from the beginning to end. We received a couples massage and hammam treatment. Everyone was polite, professional and paid attention to all the small details making it our favorite part of the week.

Great place to relax and recharge on hot summer day. Amazing massage and hammam baths. Booked a couple session and would highly recommend. Masseuse are very professional and the hamam was very clean and well maintained
Good and Cheap. Certainly not the best spa in Marrakech, but if you're wanting to save a bit of money this is excellent value for money.

Experience. It was quite an experience to get thrown directly in to a wash, hard scrub and hammam. Then on to a good massage and end with some tea. We did the couple combo package (one of the cheapest) but we really felt it was worth it. Never had so smooth skin before.

Very relaxing. I got the Relaxing Egyptian Oriental combo for 300 dirham. It included a 45 minute relaxing massage and 30 minutes in the jacuzzi. The staff was super friendly, and the massage was great. Afterwards, I was treated to tea and go to lounge in a calm room with my friend post treatment. The spa was beautiful and in a central location.

Great value Hammam. Had a splendid session at this tucked away Hammam following a recommendation from our Riad owner Michael. This was a couples treatment unlike many Hammams which are ladies or men only.We were thoroughly rubbed scrubbed and cleansed in our first hot room with lashings of cooling water to refresh our tired western bones. Then we moved to the massage room with two excellent masseuse ladies Noura and Loubna. A fantastic 90 minute experience for about £20 each!

FEELING FABULOUS. What a BRILLIANT place. They made us feel very comfortable. My sister and I booked in for the duo massage which meant we were both looked after at the same time. The hamman (bath) was simply wonderful and the massage was really fulfilling. The place was clean and very friendly. The decor was stunning. We have booked to go back to the same Riad we stayed in (Riad Dar Najat) and have already asked them to schedule us for another hammam with Isis Spa. There are many places that try and offer you a cheap hammam - my advice is - go to this spa. We were made to feel dignified throughout the whole time there Hope this helps you to decide.

Amazing hammam, amazing massage, just amazing . Me and my husband booked the couples hammam and massage and it was excellent. It was so relaxing my favourite was the hammam id never had one before and although I had sun burn it left me feeling lovely. Just a point to note if you've never had a hammam like I hadn't the lady that carries out the hammam which is a mixture of tipping buckets of cold water on you and rubbing a black soap bar on your skin, then she vigorously rubs you with a mit to get the dead skin off which if you've got sensitive skin it might be abit of a shock to the system. Also she asks you to remove your bikini top which I didn't mind but some ladies may be abit more self conscious so it's just a warning for you so you know what to expect, I'm sure if you requested to leave it on that would be fine too. The massage part was great too very professional the staff made you feel very welcome. We are English speaking but staff had no problem communicating with us. It's all thanks to trip advisor reviews how we ended up trying the Isis Spa and we are so glad that we did. Do not leave Marrakech without visiting this place! Don't be tempted by cheaper places as this place is well worth the money!

Amazing and Relaxing experience. My husband and I had a wonderful experience. We bought the couples package. We had such a pleasant and relaxing experience. The staff is super friendly and make you feel comfortable. My skin and body felt so good afterwards. All the stress and pains went away. I like how in the end they leave you alone in this room all lit up with candles and relaxing music and they bring you tea. Please come to this spa, you will not be disappointed!

Lovely space for authentic Hammam . Lovely setting. Attentive staff. Fantastic Hammam experience on two occasions followed by soft relaxing massage which I felt was appropriate following Hammam. I prefer a stronger Thai massage normally but it would have been out of place following the serenity of the Hammam experience. Make it a place to enjoy.

Refreshing and relaxing spa experience.. We booked a hammam and massage package with my friend here. The hammam was black soap scrubbing and clay body mask. I found that part a bit rough but Im not sure if it was supposed to be like that as it was my first experience. The full body massage with argan oil was beautiful and very relaxing. After the massage we could relax with some mint tea in a nice room. Interior is nice and relaxing and staff is very friendly. You need to book a day in advance ad they are busy. It is slightly more expensive then other hammams in the souk but it is eort spending a bit of extra to feel more comfortable and relaxed. Highly recommended.

Splendid, relaxing and worth the money. We had a couples hammam with black soap scrub and clay wrap and Argan oil massage for 580dhs for both of us. We were in the same room the whole time which was good. The hammam made us feel totally clean and refreshed (just don't get sunburn before you go). The massage was really relaxing and it all came with a nice glass of Moroccan tea. The only minor downside was the hammam ladies chatted a bit too much. But definitely worth going and remember you need to book ahead we went in in the morning and were booked in for 2pm. Also map on here is wrong.

Go if you like being ripped off!. After a lot of research and reading the reviews, I booked a couples hamman and massage with the spa. The location was hard to find however the atmosphere in the lounge of the spa was wonderful. It made me look forward to the experience even more. However everything went downhill from here. The hamman experience was not enjoyable. The two ladies were chatting the whole duration which was not relaxing at all for us. After a very short scrub, we just sat around waiting/"resting" for 15 minutes. 4 of us (my bf and I plus the two ladies working) sat around awkwardly "relaxing". The massage did not get much better. If you like soft/no pressure rub, this is the place for you. It honestly felt like someone just rubbing my body up and down. The massage also had 15 minutes of just "relaxing" laying around (with the 2 masseuse hiding in the corner chatting!). Our experience ended 20 minutes earlier than we paid for (we were told once again to relax in yet another room).I was very unhappy with the overall service and complained. I was met with a very condescending attitude from them. The manager was no longer there (the only professional one we met during our experience!). From what I saw, it is much better when he was there. We went a bit later and the employees were definitely "slacking" off!

Heaven on earth. Impromptu Birthday Present from my husband and my what a surprise! Isis spa is tucked away behind one of Marrakech's busy streets. As soon as you walk in you are transported to another world. The place is beautiful and you would never expect it. We went for the couple's hammam and massage and were treated like royalty. Everything from start to finish was perfect. Our only limitation was the language barrier to profusely say our thanks. Will definitely be returning before the end of the trip. Highly recommended at very reasonable prices.

Heavenly!. We were a large group including several children aged 6-14. After reading reviews prior to our visit we booked this spa as it seemed the most family friendly. We were not disappointed! The staff were all lovely- friendly, cheerful, competent and smiling throughout. The children were made to feel especially welcomed and the treatments adapted to suit them. The setting was very relaxing and pretty. Just one note for anyone planning to visit- they do not accept cards, just cash, so plan ahead!

Great value for money. Just what I needed after a week in the mountains.. I went for the 45min Hammam with black soap and massage. I'm not a regular user of spas but for the price, I thought the service was excellent and I found the experience invigorating and relaxing.

All style, no substance, not relaxing. As there were so many spas in Marrakech that offer hammam massages, my sister and I booked at this spa based on the 'excellent' reviews on tripadvisor.We had booked the 'Care Relaxation Ritual' package (Hammam + scrub with honey almond and raised oil + clay wrap pink + Jacuzzi +45min massage + facial good mine honey) lasting 2h30mins at 450dhs each as a special March promotion, and we were very disappointed that it was anything but relaxing. I'm not a spa type of person, so I'm not very difficult to please, but I was not impressed at all with this service, and my sister was very much looking forward to this as we had hiked to Ourika Valley the day before. Positives: Lovely looking spa and open spaced; lovely receptionistNegatives: One poor woman on her own completing the hammam scrub for me and my sister, with a loud tap running in the background, so not relaxing.The 45min massage for actually like 5mins in total and more of a gentle rub down, and when I asked for more pressure it was just slightly more; during the facial there was no massage, just slapping on whatever product they put on, and left us for long periods in-between at which time the two masseuses were talking away with each other - so couldn't relax. I think it's pot-luck which masseuse you get, because my sister said her's was quite good, but obvious really short.The owner was rude and non-apologetic when we tried to explain that we didn't have the 45min massage. So we asked for a discount - she was only going to give 90dhs off each, considering that their cheapest massage for 2ppl is 580dhs for 60mins, we felt that was not acceptable. So after a bit of slightly heated discussion we had agreed on 300dhs each. Final thoughts: The venue was lovely enough, but think the staffing level, skills and their attitudes need to be improved. However, other patrons around us seemed to be happy, so I'm not sure if were we just unlucky!

A very relaxing spa. I was at the Isis spa with a friend of mine. It was a very nice and relaxing atmosphere, a very good quality /price spa, and very kind staff. It is a must while you are in a trip in Marrakesh. Enjoy!

Hammam and Massage. It was a nice escape from otherwise busy Marrakech streets. The place is beautiful and tranquil and the massage was very good. I liked the hammam overall but the lady kept opening the door and since it was February outside it got a bit breezy and cold. She also didn't feel very welcoming but the rest of the staff were very polite and pleasant. The massage was amazing! Didn't want for it to finish..

relaxing and warming. I was recommended Isis spa by my mother who had been there previously, it was a hard find, through the market but, once you opened the door it was tranquil and beautiful! Everyone one where was so welcoming an happy! The massages were amazing and thorough, and I was very relaxed and pampered!
Highly recommend!

Good value for money. Isis spa was recommended to us by our Riad owner, the hamman was great. The ladies scrubbing us down were lovely. My boyfriend's masseuse was great, and he thoroughly enjoyed it. However my masseuse was terrible. I asked her to be gentle but neither she or the other masseuse understood and she kept increasing pressure until I screamed. She later just sat there during the last few minutes waiting for the other one to finish. It was a nice place overall, I happened to get unlucky.

AMAZING!!! The best massage experience ever. Hard to find, the the door is opened to display the most tranquil calming experience whilst the hustle and bustle still continues behind the closed door.
