Welcomed with peppermint tea then led to a changing room with robes and slippers. Every inch of your body is soaped, rinsed and exfoliated by wonderful women who spend the whole day in the heat of the room. We had an amazing massage in a dual room, the young girl massaging us, climbed into the bed at certain points to ensure a thorough massage. Amazing experience, cost us approx £30 each for 1hr 45 mins of bliss. We felt invigorated, cleansed, refreshed and beyond being relaxed and chilled out. Quite difficult to find but a retreat awaits you! Will be returning before we leave!

Ok. Spa is lovely. Hard to find. The man at the reception is very friendly. However the massage was ok. My partner really enjoyed it but the pressure wasn't right for me even though I had asked for hard pressure. Also could be because the lady I had had just finished a session with someone else. Be prepared to go topless. Google map address is wrong.

One of the Best Massages of My Life. Went in on the recommendation of our Riad owner, the google map directions were wrong, luckily had the direction from our Riad to get to the place. As soon as we entered, we knew we were in a professional, high quality spa. The ambiance & the decor gave the place a beautifully calming look. Even though the place has 10 rooms, 5 for hamman & 5 for massages, they were all occupied. So we reserved ourselves a suitable slot and came back later for the treatment.We went for the Traditional Ritual, 1 hr 45 minutes package. After storing our belongings in the locker room, we went for the hour long Hamman. It was a combination of steam and body scrub. The room was hot & humid, there seemed to be some heating underneath the sitting/bed. Soap,Body Packs,Face Packs, Shampoo were applied at intervals during the treatment. In between the scrubs we were just left to lay in the room, initially the heat was a bliss but after 15 minutes the room use to become unbearable due to the steam, then the next round of scrubbing & bathing use to start, making it bearable again. It was a unique cleansing experience. After Hamman we went for the message, it was among the best i have ever had. The pressure applied was perfect. Afterwards we were lead to another room to lay in & let the argon oil be soaked in. For 400 dirham for a 1 hr 45 minutes package, felt the place to be cheap as the standards maintained are of the highest quality.

If you are in Marrakech and fancy truly relaxing, enjoyable experience - this is the place!. We were advised to visit Isis Spa for a traditional hammam. This started with buckets of hot water being poured over us and was followed by a full body scrub. We were then covered in some sort of clay pack that refrshed the skin - I have never felt so clean! As if this part of the experience was relaxing enough, it was followed up with a superb massage. The hammam last 2 hours and was a truly relaxing experience - very much needed after the Madina of Marrakech!The Isis Spa is a bit difficult to fine, but very much worth the adventure!

Family of 4 totally relaxed. We scheduled this on the advice of our airbnb host and it was a fabulous experience. My children wanted to come back every day if possible. We scheduled the hammam and 1 hour massage. The whole family did the hammam together and the attendants were responsive to our needs for different water temperatures. After we finished our scrub we were led into two treatment rooms, one where my daughter and I were massaged and one where my son and husband were massaged. The masseurs were great about making sure that I could talk to my daughter whenever we wanted to and kept the massage appropriate to her age (9) and mine (older than 9). After our experience we were all led to a relaxation room that was warm and quiet. We enjoyed mint tea and an additional time relaxing. After we went back to our airbnb and then went out for part of the day. For the first time in my memory, my children put themselves to bed that night because they were so relaxed. It was the best experience for all of us.

Perfect way to relax. Once you've experienced Marrakech, you'll want something to relax you. We were recommended Isis Spa, which was an excellent choice. We went for the couples Hammam and Massage deal at about £20 per head. It lasted almost 2 hours and consisted of a hammam sauna, with scrub, clay pack etc, massage, tea, then a chill out room. Fantastic value and worthwhile to de-stress.

Perfect for Couples. Visited the Spa January 2016.I was very thorough in my research of which Hammam to visit as I had read that one of the must do things in Marrakech is experience one. I was looking for something within a reasonable budget for couples that was as well rated as possible. So I booked the eternal love care pacakage (890 dH).It was a bit tricky to find it, but if you ask some of the more casual disinterested shop keepers they let you know which way to continue.The Spa is beautiful but as we were late we changed our package to one that wasn't as long (790 dH = 1 hr. and 45 min.). We could've had the massage all day, once I asked the lady to be slightly more firm it was exactly the right pressure.The staff were all smiles, very polite and welcoming, and gave us as much time as we wanted.Post hammam and massage we were to able to hang out and drink some tea, and no exaggeration the tea was some of the best I've ever had.AMAZING value. Very neat, clean, and tasteful. Super soothing.Bring an extra pair of underwear, only thing I missed.Do visit!

Relaxing afternoon. Isis was recommended by the owner of the Riad I was staying in for being good value and nearby. Good value it was! 300 Dirham for a hammam style scrub down and massage. Which, when compared to other private facilities, is excellent! Very clean facilities with a nice ambience. Down a quite alley way.

Money well spent. Walked in with no appointment... Met by a lovely man who booked us in right away..... Hammam was very good.... Massage was relaxing..... Spent two hours there and would happily return there....

Pampered to high heaven. What a wonderful little gem between all the hustle of the square. It is quite tricky to find. You would never guess that it's down a small alley. Going on what we read before coming to Marrakech we decided not to listen to the corner shop man telling us where the spa was located. We did end up listening to him after taking a few wrong turns, ended up buying some sweets from him later and thanking him for the direction. The spa was lovely, be prepared to know your company very well with whom you go with. Ladies are expected to be topless. After the initial embarrassed moments you get over it and enjoy the hammam scrub down. Seeing how much dirt and dead skin comes off you is nauseating, however the feeling after is lovely silky smooth skin. You get to keep the exfoliation mitt they use for you. The massage was amazing, I asked for it to be firm and my gosh firm it was. Felt so good and relaxing as we went walking in the Imlil Valleys yesterday so a great treatment to have for aching calves. Thanks for a wonderfully relaxed afternoon!

Very professional. I visited this place on my 2nd day in Marrakech and booked a Hammam/Massage for next day. The place is not hard to find; just watch out for the signs. When you set foot in this place, you forget the hustle and bustle outside. It is extremely clean and steaming with aroma. You start in the waiting room until your appointment, tea served. Then you get taken to the changing room where you put away your stuff in a locker. You have to wear shorts (for men) and get their robe and plastic sandals. You get taken upstairs to a room where the hammam takes place. The lovely ladies wash you down, apply some stuff and wash you down. The they scrub you down and wash and so on, it went on for about an hour. Eventually you dry with their towels and put the robe back on. Then you get taken to the warm-ish massage room when you lie face down and listen to the music. The lady starts to massage you oils starting with you feet and working her way up, right up to the face and forehead. But most of the massage is directed at the back. She correctly identified that I had a tired back (since I work in a constant sitting job). The massage went on for about an hour after which I was taken to another cooler room where I was wrapped in a blanket and given tea. I rested there for an enternity and nearly fell asleep. Then got called to get changed. There was no compulsion to give a tip but I wanted to show my appreciation for the ladies upstairs; they had a little tip box.It was wonderfully relaxing experience in a truly prefessional environment. I have only 2 minor criticisms; they start the massage with the feet (with bare hands, I presume) and work up to the face. Now I thats not hygienic; I wouldnt want anything transferring from my feet to the face. Secondly the sheets on the massage table have a hole through which you breath when lying face down. The hole area of the sheets smelled rather tired and unpleasing. My suggestion is that they should use rubber gloves when massaging the feet and also have a disposal paper napkin to rest the face on.Other than that, this is a wonderful spa and I thoroughly enjoyed the treatment here. I will definitely be booking into this place the next time I am in Marrakech.

Good after stress but hammam not hot enough . After three stressful and tiring days walking and discovering Marrakech this was very good. But considering the SPA side this is not good enough. Lady who gave the massage is not strong enough and once she finished I immediately got cold. Hammam does not deserve its name since the room was cold plus the lady would constantly open the door to talk to her colleagues, it just did not help to keep a better temperature. Everybody was nice though.

Lovely spa didn't want to leave!!!. Went for the couples massage as it was our birthday and it was amazing! Would deffo recommend, just behind the Medina. Didn't want to leave we were so relaxed and fell asleep at various points. Very reasonably priced also!

Just Do It! Dont think just go!. Me and my 4 good friends were very reluctant based in the fact it seemed that it was in hidden alley ways...it was but the moment you step in is the same moment you are overwhelmed by its design. I believe the gentleman's name was Khalid and he took care of me and my mates who had never been to a hammam before. Lets just say we will always go back here. For the price of 400dhs for the ritual wellbeing package... its worth 800dhs. The entire staff were amazing, friendly and had a good sense of humour. Definitely going back even though it was a struggle to leave as we felt so relaxed.

Really great staff. Relaxed with no rush.. Just finished ~3 hours at Isis Spa on a cold day. Every single staff member that I interacted with (5 different folks) was so warm and pleasant. The hammam scrub down and rinse was excellent and relaxing. The room wasn't very steamy, but warm enough. After that I was led to the jacuzzi - but it wasn't nearly warm enough for my tastes, so we skipped on ahead to the facial and massage. The facial was long and luxurious and the products smelled great. The massage was thorough, but quite gentle. My fault for not asking for more pressure. After that I went back to the jacuzzi (which the host had worked hard to make hotter). It had increased in temp from 28 to 32. This was better, but I am used to piping hot jacuzzis and therefore this still felt quite tepid. Lastly, I was guided to the relaxation room and covered in 2 blankets and given some tea. It was quite cozy and I would've stayed longer, but we were on the 3rd or 4th round of the same CD playing over and over again and I couldn't handle it. For the record, the piano songs are: Crazy (Patsy Cline), Bridge Over Troubled Water, Yesterday, ???, Come Away With Me (Nora Jones), Unchained Melody, and Everything I Do - I Do It For You (Richard Marx). I would definitely go again! The PRICE was insanely good. I was not at all pressured for a tip, but I left one because they definitely deserved it! Recap of the things that could improve: music, jacuzzi temp, massage pressure.THANKS, Isis! :)

Best Hammam in Marrakesh . My partner and I went on our last day in Marrakesh in order to pamper ourselves before our flight. Boy did this place pamper. We were given our own posh robes and taken to the Hammam room where we were thoroughly scrubbed down and massaged by two of the friendliest women. We were then taken to the massage room where we were treated to the best full body massage that I've ever experienced. We got the traditional ritual package at only 300 dirhams. Well worth the money!

My first full Hammam. Had my first Hammam treatment here and founder it a wonderful experience. Excellent service by all involved in the treatment. Slightly hard to find but worth the search. Looked at a room for the future and they look good. In a very quiet and peaceful alley.

A special experience. Me and 2 friends had hammam and 1 60minutes massage. It was really original and someway unexpected, I thank Samira for her treatment and for beeing so kind. At the end my friend tried to sink in the central fountain withount success.

Great scrub, massage OK. We went here because the had a couples package for a good price. 580 MAD for scrub and 30 min massage. The place is clean and staff are nice. Bring a bathing suit. Women must be topless. Men: wear something that can expose most of your legs for the scrub and massage. The scrub was interesting, it's like rough sand paper and it hurt at times (but my bf said it did not hurt him) but the amount of dead skin that comes off is incredible. And our skin was so soft afterwards! The ladies doing the scrub were very nice, we speak French so I'm not sure of their English skills. I give the massage a 6 out of 10. Typical for touristy spas, i didn't expect more. It was relaxing, though, and we got to relax with mint tea after.

More than just a pampering!. Everyone loves to be pampered but this is next level. We were made very welcome straight from the start. The scent and music as you enter creates such a relaxing ambiance. Would recommend to anyone going to Marrakech. We felt like King and Queen from start to finish. Thank you again Isis Spa.
Very nice hamam in the middle of the medina.. This is a really nice hamam with very nice rooms, and staff. It is 50m from the main street but so much nicer.

Delightful. I have to admit to being a little apprehensive being led down various dark and narrow passageways to the ISIS Haman and Spa Centre. Our fears were totally unfounded. Entering the calm of the building an English speaking man discussed out options and the fees. All very soft sell. We opted for the full Haman wash and body scrub for an hour followed by an hours massage in a double room so we could mutter sighs of enjoyment to each other throughout. For those new to this experience we had to keep our pants on and rather wished we had brought swimming gear with us as we walked back to our Riad pantless! Ladies wear nothing up top for the duration. The body stub with an abrasive flannel really does seem to remove a layer of dead skin, then Argan Oil is gentle massaged into the 'new' skin. Delightful. A must on any visit to Marrakech.

CHEAP, VALUABLE, WORTHY. Isis spa was not in pool position on tripadvisor, but it was strongly suggested by the young man who took care of us at our Riad. He said the price is fair, the service valuable and the people warm and full of values (meaning they don't cheat on tourists, but they sell the real product, using the real oils and beneficial essences). 39 euro for 45 min Hammam and one hour massage and it felt great! Two very nice girls assisted us during the hammam with delicacy and respect. Then my friend and I were accompanied in the treatment room where two therapists gave us a massage for one hour. To improve: explain what you are doing before doing it (it is interesting and guest is curious to know), cleanless. Such a great experience, such great and professional people! A must during your stay in Marrakech!

Lovely place, great experience. We booked “Couple’s care” at the unfortunately named Isis spa for 580 dirhams. The interior of the spa is so lovely and clean. After getting changed, we were led up to the steam room where we were basically washed, scrubbed and moisturised! The ladies were very good and our skin was so soft after. We were then led to a lovely, quiet, candlelit massage room. The massage was so relaxing. Afterwards we were taken to another candlelit room to drink a tea and relax until we felt ready to leave. It was a wonderful experience and we felt great afterwards.

Relaxing ish. It took a little time to find, but when we did find it the staff were very friendly and the place looked clean. The treatment rooms for the traditional baths were clean and the ladies doing the scrubbing were good if not a little too forceful at times. It didn't help that we spoke no arabic and they didn't understand any english... But with a little wriggling they soon realised some of the scrubbing was too intense!Anyhow's, went for the massage afterwards which was good, but not great... An small point was the music they played in the background was on repeat and became annoying!But overall given cost (approx £65) for two massages for two people it was worth it!

Fantastic Way to Spend a Few Hours Relaxing!. We visited the Isis Spa for a couples Hammam and Massage when visiting Marrakech for our honeymoon. The entire experience was fantastic from start to finish.As with most Riad style buildings, it's easy to forget about the hustle and bustle outside as soon as you step in the door.As mentioned below, it'd be worth knowing what a hammam entails if you're shy, or travelling with someone who isn't your partner!The only point I'm marking down for is that it was difficult to confirm our booking over email. Initial contact was immediate, but I didn't get a response after this, and needed to get our Riad to call on the morning to confirm. Once the call was made however, everything went perfectly!

Pure relaxation! . Had the most amazing experience. I booked in for the traditional ritual as it was promotion in September. I was treated to a hamman and a one hour massage. It was just what I needed. The women who looked after me were great (be prepared for limited English) and provided a very relaxing experience. Highly recommend it

Good value for money . Great spa very good value for money We had the scrub and a oil massage for 1hr 45mins come to 75euros for both of us.Left feeling clean and loose.Oil massage was perfect very deep and hard

Hammam. Well worth the money...got the hammam package with the massage ...opted for the slightly more vigorous one to stretch the joints and it was amazing! Aziza worked her magic and three hours later I stepped out feeling relaxed with the aches and pains of the day gone ....

Great spa. We had a great time at this spa, we got the hammam plus one hour massage for my boyfriend and I as well as my parents and they were very accommodating about us wanting separate hammams for the two couples. My boyfriend and I had done a hammam in Fes a few months earlier and we enjoyed this experience much more- the atmosphere and the service was wonderful (and the price is hard to beat). It might be confusing to find since Google maps shows an incorrect location, but we just called ahead and had someone meet us at the cafe de France- much easier than wandering around the souks! Definitely recommend and will return if/when I come back to Marrakech!
Good priced spa. We visited Isis twice during our stay in Marrakech and enjoyed the experience. The hamman was interesting and the massages excellent.

Family Hamman, Nicely Done, Nicely Priced. This Hamman was recommended to us by our guide. It was a first for us all. And what an experience it was!! We all thoroughly enjoyed it and actually relaxed as a family, especially when outside the doors is so hectic.This Spa is well worth the money.The staff were lovely and made you feel at ease.And a lovely glass of mint tea for us all in the relaxation room after was a nice finishing touch

Great Experience. This was my first hammam experience so I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. It was recommended by our riad and I think we pain 40euros each for the hammam and an hour long massage. They provide lockers for your belongings. The hammam is on the roof, and it was an odd but not unpleasant experience. The oddness is in being mostly naked with your travel partner while both of you are oiled down, and scrubbed while being doused with buckets of water. I literally have never been cleaner! The massage was decent. A pretty nice end to our afternoon!

Best way to end a hot day. We visited this spa with no prior boking (family of 4) at 5pm and they were happy to accomodate us. The girls all lovely washing us and the massage was great afterwards and ever so relaxing. the price very reasonable considering other places were charging twice as much. We had a hammam experience, mud facial and body scrub, 1hr massage and jacuzzi time for 350 DIRHAM per person. The only downside was that it was difficult to locate the spa. However even though it looks very old/traditional building from outside, inside is a whole new world. Definitely bisit this place when in Marakech

Good experience, easy on the wallet. We decided to have the couples package with typical Hamman cleaning and massage. We had no idea what to expect and i will say the first part of the visit surprised us but we truly enjoyed the experience. You are first cleansed with buckets of water and scrubs/mud rubbed in to your entire body. You are scrubbed pretty hard to get all the dead skin off and rinsed again. You are nude except for underwear so know that going in and you'll be ok. Then we received a 45 minute massage which offset the harshness of the cleaning process. There were candles lit, music playing and it was very relaxing. Price is very reasonable.Its very hard to find this spa as there is no sign out front and its down an alley with a few twists and turns so get good directions or have someone from the spa meet you on the main path maybe to make it easier. Its beautiful inside and was a nice escape from the hustle and bustle.We had to go straight to the airport after so I'd recommend giving yourself some time before the next activity to go back and rinse oils off/reapply makeup/hair fix.

Perfect balance of quality and price. lovely spa day, great price. As much as i wanted to brave the local spas, my man and i wanted to do it together (uncommon of course for morocco). Isis offered a couple's package for about $25 a person. We got lovely clean robes, a private room for washing down (this part is surprisingly unsexy with lots of water, steam, and scrubbing --- however, I literally went grey with dead skin after all our travels, so I was extremely happy to be sloughed off and buffed up with vigor). I brought my own conditioner because my hair is thick and curly and they only offer basic shampoo (there is an option to not get your hair wet but it would be difficult I think). Then we were taken to a private room for a 45 minute massage. The massage was gentle but pleasant with nice oils. Then we were taken to a resting room with comfy chairs to stretch out in (still in our robes). The staff literally tuck you in with a nice blanket, and bring you a cup of mint tea. It was dark and quiet. We nearly fell asleep, and no staff bothered us to move along. Thus, it was perfect for the price. We tipped into a communal jar, though personally I hope the girls who have to sit in the steam room (SO hot) get most of it because they're literally wet and hot all day long. I would have tipped them directly but, of course, I was in my robe and not my clothes. Side note - they provide a locker with a key to leave your bags in. 2nd side note - was a bit difficult to find. I called ahead and a staff member met us outside the Cafe de France and walked us the rest of the way.

Amazing!! Best spa I've ever been to!!. Amazing price for an amazing treatment. The staff where all lovely and for less than £30 I recieved a scrub,facial, wash, massage and jacuzzi and I loved it. It quite enjoyed myself and would recommend it to everyone who's visiting Marrakech.

Heaven!. We went for the couples hammam and massage on out last day in Marrakech; it was well worth the wait after traipsing round the hot dusty city for days. After changing into dressing gowns on arrival we were shown to a steam room where a lovely lady gave us a thorough scrubbing, clean down and rinse off before we then went for an amazing hour long massage. I felt I could almost fly afterwards, well worth a visit!

A very relaxing massage at a fraction of the price. I had an hammam followed by a massage, together with my fiancé. It lasted for about 2.5 hours and we paid less than £30 each. We were very pleased and certainly would highly recommend it!

Allot of hype & lovely surroundings for average experience. We visited this spa/hammam in early march as a couple package deal...My wife has been to several spa's, for me it was a first... Overall we thought it an average experience,though relaxing.... Allot of hype & lovely surroundings/decor but the staff seemed flustered or tired...We had been a couple of days before to check the place out & price's,and were very impressed by the welcome and price's layout etc, on returning for our treatment/spa weather it was busy or not the staff appeared rushed/confused/tired, when we and another couple turned up at similar time... We were in the waiting area with other couple for at least 10min before being ushered into the changing room's and then taken upstairs to the deck and told to wait... Shortly after we were taken into the steam rm and 3 ladies/spa staff appeared flustered and confused as they got organised... then the hamman/body scrub started with my wife & i being attended by an old woman & young lady that appeared to be doing 2 rms at once, i gather the other couple were in steam rm opposite. 3 girls/staff to 2 couples... Although the scrub/steam rm was nice one only imagines if it was busier how the staff would manage... We got a good 40-min steam & scrub and the last 15 min the staff were just sitting in rm with us chatting amongst themselves.... a bit disappointing..On the positive; the massage downstairs was great, i nearly fell asleep... The 2 girls that looked after my wife and i were great...Then we were moved to another rm with 4 beds and candles and were told nothing...Apparently this was the chill out rm... but with 4 men & 2 woman with 4 beds was more uncomfortable than chill out... (my wife explained this is the norm in spa's to have a chill rm after your massage)... Overall for 780dhs i expected a little more service/staff organisation, average experience...

Great Relaxing experience.. After careful consideration we decided on Isis Spa as we felt we wanted a couples experience that we both could enjoy and that would not break the Bank and I am happy to say this is what we got.We were quite lucky that the Spa was only a 10minute walk from our Riad, we went along the day before our treatment, just to suss the place out and know exactly where we were going.We chose the couples treatment at 780 DH which meant we could have an hour long massage, we both loved the massage, it was heaven! The hamman was an experience in itself, my husband almost passed out with the heat!We were washed, scrubbed and had a body mask treatment before being rinsed off and taking down for our massage, afterwards we were taken to a room to relax and given a refreshing tea and as much time as we needed to waken up!The staff are all lovely and a credit to the spa, well worth the money and highly recommended.

Excellent service very relaxing. Very good value for money. I recommend wearing a bikini /shorts for the hammam. We had a hammam then a massage. Good combination. After the massage you are put in a bed in a separate room to sleep and given tea. Excellent

The best Hamam experience!. The place is beautiful, the staff really nice and friendly and the hamam + the massage was AMAZING!!! I would absolutely recommend it if you're in Marrakech. It's totally worth it!!!!

Very relaxing, very Morrocan. My friends and I each had a 'traditional package' which included a 30 minute hamman and a 30 minute full body massage. I highly reccomend! I left the spa very relaxed. The spa is very clean and all staff were friendly and helpful. A hamman is definitely something to experience - you have to throw all british morals aside and be prepared for lots of nudity... but you settle into it and end up enjoying!

Fantastic Experience. Fantastic Hammam experience. We went as a couple and didn't know what to expect. We really enjoyed the Hammam and my skin felt so amazing afterwards. The massage was fantastic I have never felt so relaxed. My partner has never been near a spa let alone had a face mask on before and he loved it!!!Great price and a lovely way to spend some time in a very busy place.

Very relaxing, ideal for couple wanting treatment together. Great hammam and scrub, massage so relaxing.lovely atmosphere to relax in with mint tea post massage. Only knocked a star off as would have liked to shower afterwards (were covered in argan oil for our flight home!).

Bit of a hit and miss. After a long consideration we (me and my girlfriend) decided to go to Isis Spa. We were looking for a nice and not too expensive couples package, so we decided to choose "Care Eternal Love" package that had a special price of 850 dhs for 2 persons. All in all, it was a pleasant spa experience, even though it could have been better. PROS:- Friendly and helping staff.- Tranquil and clean spa, tucked away from all the hustle and bustle on a small side street. The atmosphere inside the spa was really nice. - Very nice massage (third and last treatment). I felt like I had a proper massage and I wasn't just being patted.- Good scrub by the "hammam girls". SO-SO:- The place is a bit hard to find but so is almost everything else in Marrakech. - The hammam (first treatment) is interesting if you haven't experienced it before. The girls who scrubbed us were friendly and attentive and we were able to stay together in the same room, which was nice. We were thoroughly cleaned and scrubbed and it felt great. But it still wasn't quite the real thing and we left the room feeling like we've had a good but a bit ordinary spa treatment. It just doesn't give you the real hammam feeling. - After the hammam we had to move two floors lower to the jacuzzi room. During that time we were cooled down a bit because the outside temperature wasn't that high. And because the spa itself was cool in late February, we would have expected the jacuzzi water to be a few degrees warmer.CONS:- The massage room wasn't as warm as it should have been. The temperature was almost ok for me but my girlfriend said it was too chilly to enjoy the treatment. - After the massage we had to put on our robes, which had already become damp after the hammam and jacuzzi (although they tried to dry/warm them up on a heater) and we were guided to a "relaxation room". The room itself was chilly and having the damp robe on didn't make me feel much relaxed after a nice massage, so we decided to drink our warm tea and leave. TIPS:- If you are looking for a real hammam experience, you shouldn't be going to a spa. If you want a few treatments and a bit of pampering, then Isis Spa is a good choice. - Try to go there when it's warmer outside or ask the staff to turn up the heat in the treatment rooms, so you wouldn't have to think about being chilly.

Nice hammam & Spa. If you are interested in a hammam & spa experience, would recommend this spa. Not too far from the main square, though can be a bit tricky to locate. Look out for the sign board in the main street-Derb Dabachi. Once inside it is a whole different world- clean and pleasant ambiance.

Relaxing experience . Isis was recommended to us by our riad and we're glad it was! We got the couples deal for 780d and it was well worth it for the hour long massage alone. The black body soap/scrub was perfect before hand as your skin feels soft and clean before your massage.

One of the best moments in Marrakech. I had read from the reviews of the Riad where we stayed that there was a fantastic hammam that accommodated couples at the same time - Traditional hammams separate sexes - and once there just had to try it. The hammam (spa) is really modern and clean, surprisingly very calm considering the madness of the souks outside. We chose the steam bath that consists of a wash, clay/mud rubbed all over our bodies and a full body exfoliation followed by an hour massage. Absolutely wonderful!The girls looking after us were very professional and lovely. My body afterwards hadn't felt that soft in ages and the experience is totally and utterly relaxing. Husband and I felt asleep during the massage. To keep the price down book it yourself. Riads take a percentage and we ended up paying an extra 200 MAD . It was worthy though.

ISIS. This spa was recommended by my riad. I went for a preview and booked my first ever Hamman experience. I returned half an hour later and had my 2 hours of pampering.Not being an officianardo of Spa treatments, all I can say is that every appeared very clean and professional and very reasonably priced compared to what you would pay in London. Anyway I came out feeling very relaxed indeed.

Gorgeous Spa!. Went here for my partners birthday treat on Saturday 13th Dec 2014. Had a couples spa costing 580MAD for two people. Got a taxi from our Riad at the other side of the medina, he dropped us as close as we could get then we spent 15 mins trying to find it. In the end we knocked on the door of a riad asked for directions and they sent someone to show us. Its in a maze so get someone to meet you from the spa at the square, as it literally 5 mins away. We were greeted and shown to the changing room where lockers, robes and slippers were provided. Had full traditional hammam which was an experience but absolutely perfect. following that we had full body massages. The room was a little cold but hot towels were used to cover us. This was so relaxing and one of the best massages I've had. After the massage you are put in another room to relax some more in a snug blanket on a lounger with tea! We only left when we realised we would soon be asleep! We were walked back to the square by an employee. Highly recommend this place!

Fabulous hammam serenity in the midst of the madness. We were staying at Riad les nuits de Marrakesh who recommended this Hammam and after hearing from other guests how good it was we asked our hosts to book. Not only did they book but they took us there. I doubt many people would venture in without a recommendation its off the rue darb Dabachi down a few undesirable looking alleys but off course as soon as you step through the door you enter a different world. Away from the dust grime and chaos of outside into a beautifully renovated riad of serenity.We booked the couples hammam and massage. Staff were welcoming and gracious. We were led into a changing room where we put on our swimwear and we were given clean white robes and warm white towels and footwear.After being lead to a room on the roof terrace we did as we were asked while two young girls soaped scrubbed and rinsed us.Unfortunately it got too hot for my husband and when he was asked to sit up he passed out briefly but all he needed was cooling down which we did and he was fine. The girls were very friendly and professional.We were then led downstairs for a massage which was excellent, normally you have the ticklish feet...but not here she knew the pressure points very well.Very relaxing and again very professional. We ended in the relaxation room with a glass off mint tea.Loved every minute of it. My skin feels really soft, my husband enjoyed it. Not normally his thing. They do lots of other treatments and had i got time i would be returning.Would highly recommend. And sorry girls if my husband passing out panicked you.

Great Value For Money!!. We booked the couples care package for 580 Dirhams which was well worth it. The staff at the front desk were very attentive and polite. The hammam staff lacked some focus although the massage was amazingggggg!! We are going to go back to get a massage before we leave Marrakech!!

So good we went twice. Booked a couples session in advance advertised at 2 hr 15 m which actually took close on 5 hours - superb. very traditional, very relaxing,The masseurs, shower girls were very friendly and attentive.We immediately booked again for a different set of treatments for three days later. The spa has a couples policy so you're never apart.As for the price it's fantastic - half of what our Marrakech hotel wanted to charge. Relatively easy to find too despite it being in the souks.

Lovely relaxing afternoon hidden gem.. We booked Isis spa after our Riad host found it online. He rung up and booked it for the following day.We have just arrived back. We had the 45 minute Hamman followed by a 30 minute massage for 580dh for a couple. We thoroughly enjoyed. First we had the Hamman, which was great felt very clean afterwards. Then the massage which was lovely. Finally you have tea in the chill out room.It was very clean, and they supply a robe and slippers. It was great value for money, with other spas charging twice the price. I wore a one piece costume which I wouldn't recommend as it is easier with two pieces. My boyfriend just brought swim shorts which was fine.We have booked to go again before we go home. Would definitely recommend trying here.

The best spa in Marrakech. Despite the traditional hammams where men and women are separated, Isis Spa allowed us to experience traditional spa treatments together. From the second we stepped into the spa, we felt transported. Beauty surrounded us in sights and senses. The spa treatments included a luxurious exfoliation and scrub down with a body masque. We also received an indulgent shampoo treatment. Afterwards, we were taken to a quiet, dark room where the lovely masseurs massaged oils into our freshly scrubbed skin. We left feeling indulgently pampered and the most relaxed we've been in years! The staff were kind and helpful and everything about our time at Isis Spa was brilliant.

Very relaxing. Me and my boyfriend were recommended this hammam by our riad and they were amazing. The treatments were not expensive and they were clean. We had a hammam and an hour long massage. The staff were very professional and made sure we never got cold while moving from one room to another. Our robes and towels were hot and clean when we got them. My skin never felt softer after the hammam and the massage put us in such a relaxed, sleepy state. After the massage we were placed in a room with beds and a heater. They gave us tea and didn't rush us to leave. We really enjoyed it.

Wonderful Treatments But....... The treatments were absolutely lovely.Had a hammam and an hour massage. Very therapeutic and relaxing.Beautiful surroundings, Prices were good and their email correspondence was good. Unfortunately we got no way near white robes.They were damp and dirty and the footwear was wet and not sized.The location is nightmare to get to l; very hard to find.

Great massage. My husband and I had a hammam. I didn't know quite what to expect - but my skin felt so smooth after. The massage we had was great. Have the whole hour - it is worth it. I think the price was good here as cheaper than others I searched on internet. The place was clean and the staff professional.

A little gem tucked away near the main square. We found this place by pure luck while we were losing ourselves in the chaos that is the souq! We walked in from craziness to pure blissful relaxation. This spa is only just a few turns away from the main square but once inside you feel like you are a million miles away. The price was fantastic. It was a proper spa experience over three floors. We had a hamman and massage for 580dh for two. Which when you compare to other spas (900dh) of this standard it was an amazing price. Left us feeling completely relaxed and ready to face Marrakech again!

Best Massage I've Ever Had. ......and I've had a few!! I stayed at Rian Granvilier around the corner and during the booking of various other things they recommended this place. They later also stated that the owner of their Riad visits ISIS on every one of their visits from France. We travelled as 2 couples.The recommendation was enough to sell me so I booked 2 x couples hammam/massage at 580 dirhams per couple online, from home in English with no problems. I tend to book this wherever I go and for me, the highlight is the hammam and the massage is always a nice finishing touch. mainly because I hate my feet being touched and have the pain threshold of a small child.Not here. Admittedly I've had better hammams, most noticably in Athens but I have never had a massage quite like this one. No problem with feet or anywhere.Now I woke up that morning at 0230 for an early flight from UK and landed around 1100. The hammam was booked for 1400 so I really needed it and I am mindful that an average massage would probably seem good in the circumstances but all 4 of us, obviously with 4 different masseuses each felt the same. I had in my reasonably competent French worked out how to say to the girl that without comparison it was the best I'd had only to mumble incoherently when the time came such was my dopey relaxed state! They offer Moroccan mint tea as the perfect end to a relaxing few hours. Naturally after such an experience all 4 of us returned at the end of our stay. The wives had chocolate hammam body wraps and pedicures, us gents had a 4 hand massage with 2 girls each that I have never experience but was again absolutely wonderful.Morocco is hot, dusty and grubby. You walk everywhere and if you go anywhere near a quad bike or a camel you need a massage. I doubt there are many like this in Marrakech. Spotless, tranquil, friendly and clearly are experts. Perfect.

great massage. Beautiful setting, modern decoration, a hidden gem in the medina. Wonderful hammam. Massage was very professional, effective and very relaxing at the same time.Friendly and helpful staff.

Splendid. Beautiful place, friendly, clean and central position. We have been very good there.The hammam has a typical moroccon-style Service and you can have a Great emotiinal experience. We higly revcomend it. Paola e Aurora

Good way to lose your hammam virginity. This spa was recommended to me by the hosts of our Riad which was located a few minutes away. I opted to have the full hammam and 1/2 hr massage. The spa itself was nice and clean and overall was a good way to experience my first hammam (i.e versus in a public hammam). I was a little nervous about getting my kit off for the experience and went in with my bikini on but the lady who performed my black salt scrub didn't give me the opportunity to be either shy or nervous and she was so matter of fact in the way she gestured to me to remove my bikini top that I instantly forgot my shyness. The massage wasn't like a remedial style massage but more of a relaxing carress style. If I were going again I would probably skip the massage and opt for a facial instead.

Perfect afternoon of pampering after a morning of quad biking. We booked an afternoon Hamman session on our first day in marakesh. Isis Spa is gorgeous... It themed black cream and a vibrant red. In the middle of the spa is a plunge pool with white, pink and red fresh petals...it is beautiful and very clean.The spa staff were polite and talked us through the various spa treatments available . We chose the Hammam treatment that included the facial at about €40... It was well worth it. There were 4 of us and we were given 3 women to scrub us with the black soap, give us facial,bathe us in the steam room, wash our hair... We had a mud bath... It was all a very enjoyable experience we felt so clean and relaxed after an morning quad biking.The Hammam was followed by an hour full body massage... I think we all fell asleep!!!!when we did wake up the treatment was finished off with some fresh mint tea and loads of pictures of the spa and the spa staff
Fantastic. We visited the spa on june 2014 and the experience was fantastic. The staff were lovely, especially Simo and Samira.

Soooooooooo relaxing. The Riad my partner and I were staying at recommended ISIS and I am glad we took the advice. The place looked fantastic when we walked in, very clean and the front house staff were great, also spoke very good English. The treatment we had was a hamann and massage which both parts were approximately 45 minutes. At all times the both of us were together in the same room, to start we went to a stone heated room where we were washed down, scrubbed with a mit, exfoliated and hair washed (we were just in bikini and boxers). We were then transferred to a massage room were we both had massages which were fantastic, my partner almost fell asleep she was so relaxed. This was the perfect end to our trip.

Worth a visit after a few days in the souks. We visited the spa on our 4th day in Marrakech and it was exactly what we needed. The staff were lovely and facilities were clean and comfortable. The location is a little out of the way, off a side street and round two corners, but once you are there, the energy of the street just dies away. The prices were reasonable (even when we were travelling on the cheap) and if you play your cards right, you may get the entire building to yourselves.

A chance for the whole family to have a Hammam experience together. Staff were friendly and the massage was lovely but the really unique thing about this place is the option for a family to have a steam, scrub etc all in one room, rather than being segregated.

Wonderfully relaxing massage. We went to Isis spa on the last day of our holiday, and it was the perfect way to escape from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech before our flight. We had the honey, almond and rose body scrub, and the four hand massage which was fabulous. Would recommend!

Amazing place great value. Me and my girlfriend went here one afternoon on our marrakesh trip the staff were extremely friendly , was great value and the treatments were best we have ever had. Try the couples hamman and massage AMAZING

So relaxing. After the hustle and bustle of the streets of Marrakech, the Isis Spa is a welcome change. Reasonable priced treatments (recommend an hour massage - amazing) were exactly what was needed after a couple of days of exploring the city. Staff were lovely, the surroundings are beautiful and the whole experience was stress free, comfortable and relaxing. The spa is easy to find too from the square - it is signposted from the main road so don't worry when you end up in a small street and then alleyway - it is there!

Wow! A real treat..... Our first Hammam ever, my husband and I went along not really knowing what to expect.... I won't spoil it for you but it was a great experience. We paid extra to have a 1 hour body massage & practically floated out of the place feeling refreshed and pampered. The staff were really friendly & was really good value for money ( approx 480 MAD for both of us) it's a wonderful break from shopping/walking/sightseeing. Ps. Take swimwear! You have a locker & key for your belongings.

fantastic spa! great value for money!. Let me just say, for all the treatments we received ( myself and my partner) we would need to pay a little fortune back home! It is definitely great value for money!We were greeted by a lovely young gentleman and when he was greeting me by name ( yes, I know he got it through staff member of Riad we were staying at) but he just made me feel so special and welcomed. Staff were very nice and even though the girls didn't speak any English they put a lot of effort into having a conversation with me. I am a very chatty person so I probably made them feel very uncomfortable? And I managed to fall asleep twice during my massage.What was really special to me was when one of the young girls took her time and patience to undo my really long plait and washed my hair with care! Also according to my watch treatment took much longer than it meant to be and no one seem to be stressed about it or rushing as out of the room for next people booked. It is essential to experience hammam while you in Marrakesh and let me just tell you: go for ISIS! It is worth it!

Not worth it - rude staff. We went to this spa recently after our riad staff booked us in. Something that I know they did as we were present at the time. We wanted 3 chocolate wraps and one massage. When we got to the spa however we were "greeted" by the owner I assume, a grumpy sour faced woman who immediately told us to shut up because we were not whispering as we came in - fine, but at least put a warning sign up or at the very least ask guests kindly with a smile, don't just bark at them as soon as they walk through the open door. This woman then informed us that we had booked 3 massages. No we had not. Cue small argument. She told us we couldn't have what we "claimed" to have booked as the spa and hammam was full. I think we must have been the only people there aside from one couple who I saw leave the massage room later. Instead she insisted the only treatment available was of course, the most expensive one. We couldn't have this because we had all just come with enough money for out treatment and a tip. Finally we found a half hour massage that we could have for the same price as the wrap. But to me, it was pretty obvious this woman was just trying it on which, along with her rudeness really wound me up. Not exactly how you want to feel in a place of relaxation. After telling us to be quiet she then proceeded to chatter loudly herself for several minutes on the telephone. My friend thought her massage was incredible. I found it irritating and like a gentle caress personally. Wouldn't recommend. If nothing else because of the owners attitude.

Das ist kein richtiger Hammam. I cannot recommend this Hammam / Spa. It doesn't really have a Hammam. The room they say should be a Hammam is just a room with a shower and very uncomfortable chairs. You cannot really relax because the water tap is broken, so it makes noise the whole time and you cannot really lay because there is not enough space for laying (just sitting). The girls that are supposed to wash you (like in a real Hammam) are talking the whole time and give you the shampoo, etc and you have to wash yourself. I have been in other Hammams in Marrakesh before and they cost the same but were much better on the service.The quality in this Hammam is very bad. Price is too expensive for this kind of bad service. I don't recommend it at all!

So good, I fell asleep.......twice!!!. We discussed a Hammam with our host Simone (see Dar Bamileke review) after breakfast today and he said that he'd been here yesterday. He even escorted my wife and I there.We opted for the traditional Hammam with an hour massage for 400dh (traditional Hammam with half hour massage is 300dh).I don't want to spoil the experience, but needless to say I fell asleep twice, once during the massage and afterwards in the chillout room.

Great spa great prices. Went here twice a the massage was so amazing, the morrocan relaxing massage left me feeling soo mellow and relaxed it was unreal!! Loved it, highly recommend the massage as its top!!

Lovely Experience. We went based on advice from our Riad and were not disappointed. Friendly greeting with tea and time to look through our options with no pressure. We were allowed to look at the massage room and hammam before we chose our treatment. We opted for the couples Hammam and massage. The Hammam experience while not entirely authentic was great. The massage was fantastic in a lovely air conditioned room and the ladies giving the massage were very proficient. Well worth the money.

Quality top. I was there for almost 3 hours. It was a great experience. I had hammam, with individual treatment. I felt like a king. The massage was ok, but nothing more. The facial treatment hurted me, but the result was better than what I had before in my life.

very nice but !. The spa is very nice, exceeded our expectations as we were a bit sceptical, but the welcome and change over went well. The massage itself was very nice and perfect as part of the last night relaxation at Marrakech. However, two flaws were that the ladies that were carrying out the couples massages kept talking through out the massage so we weren't quite able to dose off and fully 100% relax, also the AC kept being switched on and off so kept going from hot to cold repeatedly. Had these two not happened, the rating would have defintely been a five as it was a very nice relaxing experience.

A relaxing experience.. It was my first time in a hammam and I found it very relaxing. I was greeted by friendly staff who explained the treatments and prices available. I was shown to a changing room with secure lockers where I could store my clothes and valuables. The hammam was situated on the roof and was very thorough. Afterwards I went for a massage. To finish I was taken to a dark room and served with tea. I was so relaxed that I lost all track of time. The staff were very friendly. My skin was smoother and glowing when I came out. I found it a very enjoyable experience and would definitely go back again.

Decent value, not the best experience I've had. I had never done a hammam treatment before, so I don't have a ton of context, but the place seemed fine, and it was substantially cheaper than other places we looked into. I went with a friend who had done it before, and we kept looking at each other confused during the scrub part of it; it just seemed a little haphazard. I also wasn't thrilled with the fact that I was just lying on these surfaces that really can't be cleaned in between customers (though I don't know if this is abnormal; from what I've heard, it's similar to other places like Korean or Turkish baths). The massage part of it was great. Overall, I thought it was worth the $40 USD that I paid, but I don't know if I would go back.

Enjoyable Hammam and massage. The perfect retreat from a Marrakech downpour. Having never been for a Hammam or a massage it was a rare treat and a novel experience. The spa is well signposted and easy to find and the welcome was excellent. We found the spa to be clean and elegant with an attentive team. We did not know what to expect from the Hammam and each part was a pleasant surprise. We chose the couple's package with 1hour massage and it was well worth it. I am not sure my skin has ever felt better.
disapointing. it was not clean at all and the massage totally overrated. instead of a massage I've got a smooth caress.

Loved it!!. What a fabulous spa, and quiet and peaceful oasis and yet right in the heart of the Medina. Wonderful staff, had lots of laughters with friends during our steam and scrub then enjoyed a peaceful massage, just the tickets after shopping in the souks and recovering from a late night with too many drinks the night before, perfect!!
Relax close to the plaza. Nice break from the chaos of the central plaza. Recommend the bath and massage. Unique experience. Very nice staff and clean.

hideous hammam followed by good massage. Riad staff showed this spa's flyer and booking through them would save me a lot of time and trouble, so I decided to go for it. We went for the couple package for 500dh/€50. It's a very reasonable price, but you get what you pay for. The hammam session was, honestly, so bad that I had to laugh every time the girls asked me 'good hammam?', not knowing if I should be honest or polite. Everything was so rushed, without a second to relax. My partner and I felt like dogs being washed. As soon as we got in the hammam room, the ladies applied savon noir and clay mask. This took literally 5 seconds. After a minute, they started scrubbing me, fast. Obviously my skin wasn't ready for that (- usually you should sit in the steam for at least 10 mins to soften the skin before you scrub). Therefore it was painful, and wasn't very successful. I could tell they just wanted to get each dog done as fast as possible. You pay 50DH at a local hammam and a big mama would give you a far better gommage, with care. Or even at home by yourself! I had been looking forward to the nice, fresh feel after a professional gommage, the feel when you have removed all the dead skin cells. So this was a huge disappointment.Moved to the massage room which was much cooler than the hammam, where we were left naked and half wet. I was freezing until they brought a towel to cover us. The background music was not my taste, not very relaxing.The massage was good. There were some moves that I really enjoyed, although I still hadn't recovered from the horrible hammam experience. I would have enjoyed it more if that didn't happen.Since we weren't provided with towels other than bathrobes, I was mentally preparing myself to go out with my hair wet. But when I asked, the team was happy to bring me to the hair-dressing room and kindly dried my hair. I thought it was very nice of them, and I left the spa happily.Overall, I guess it was ok for the price we paid. I liked the team, their smile and service. If only they took twice more time for the hammam session, this would have been a great experience.

A couples massage. Located right next to the bustling courtyard of the Jemma El Fnaa and the market place.There is quite a large variety of pampering treatments available.We had reasonable, one hour massage and staff are friendly.Prices are moderate, but still a little more expensive due to its tourist location.

Good for couples. I'm not so into spas but my girlfriend loves them so she convinced me to go. It was good for us as we got the couples deal. We were given a full body scrub and massage. We also got to stay together for the whole time which made me feel more comfortable. The massage was very good and I actually felt really good after it.

Excellent spa experience. This was our first time to experience a Moroccon hammam. It's not such a luxury and fancy place, but the quality of hammam body scrub and the massage is very good. Actually I went there again one day after and had one of the best massages. Highly recommended. Its next to the police station on Djamaa el-Fna. Make sure to reserve in advance so that there is sufficient time for the Hammam. Recommended Asma, Kawtar and Sittam. The french owner is very friendly
Very nice and professional people. Excellent experience overall. Small spa but the professionalism and enthusiasm of the people make it a great experience.
A wonderful experience.. It has been a really wonderful experience. A day of pure relax. Competent and solar staff. Clean and friendly place.
A dream come true!. Beautiful experience, with good facilities, great ambiance!Rayah and Hanah were a beautiful staff and the manager was very friendly.I hope to go back there, great services.

Small hammam but good experience . We were recommended this Hammam through our Riad as we didn't have time to look around. We were able to have the hammam booked out for us in the morning so there was nobody else there which was good because the hammam is too small for lots of people. We managed to get a good deal for use of the hammam, body scrub and a full body massage. Someone picked us up from the Riad and took us there on foot through the souks as it is based 10 mins away just off the Jemaa Al-Fna square. Upon first impression it doesn't look great as there is work going on outside but inside was decorated fine. There aren't a lot of photos of the place which we tried to research but inside they have gone for a dark, dimly lit atmosphere. Not quite sure why it is so dark as it was a hard to see to begin with! We were given robes and slippers to change into and then taken to the hammam. It is small compared to other hammams I've been to. There is a large slab in the middle where you lie down to have your scrub and then there is a small seating area but you wouldn't get more than 4 people in there without it getting too cramped. It took a while to steam up as we were first in. Our body scrub was very good, the lady who did it was thorough and scrubbed us top to toe! She even lathered us up and shampooed our hair, our skin felt great! The full body massage was also really good. We were in a room with two beds so we got massaged at the same time. We had been to Ourika valley the day before and were in pain from walking uphill. The two young girls doing the massages were thorough and also gave us deep tissue massages as requested. She even got up onto the bed and pulled me this way and that to properly stretch me! I've had massages before and would say that this was a really good one. Overall, I would recommend this spa if you would prefer a quieter spa experience and not looking for somewhere too fancy or luxurious. It does the job as the staff are good at what they do. We weren't expecting much to be honest when we saw the place but actually were pleasantly surprised and pleased too. The only issue is that they speak little English but we managed to get by and explain what we needed to.

We're coming back next month !. We are frequently travelling for business and we are going once or twice a month in this city. We tried many spa and it really is the best for performance and prices. The team is great and very competent. Thank you again!
Nice surprise. I visited this Spa with 3 friends and we all thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hammam and massage left us all feeling relaxed and pampered. Thank you Ladies!

Worth trying. This wasn't my best spa experience, but there is nothing bad to say. Girls (staff), if you are reading this, I want to thank you for your kindliness. You are very great and I felt myself very good after visiting.

If it's peace and tranquility you're looking for..... Don't go to Amouna Spa. We'll break this review down simply. Went there for a spa session with my partner. The staff did not have one word of English between them, which was unhelpful but not the main problem.Went in at 2PM to book a 40 minute massage, 30 min hammam and body scrub for 5PM. Arrived at 5PM to discover that there were around 10 men in the queue, who of course went in ahead of us, which meant that we waited until 5:40PM for our session.Our 40 min massage lasted for 20 minutes, of average quality. After another 40 min wait to get into the actual hammam (hot bath room), we decided to give up and ask to leave, paying only 300 of the 500 Dirhams of the price. The rude receptionist insisted that our massage lasted 30 minutes, even though we said it lasted 20 or even less. We were offered an extra 30 min free massage but because the quality of the massage was so poor the first time we declined. We agreed that 400 Dirhams would cover the costs including the hammam which we desperately needed to wash all of the oil off our bodies. She agreed and dismissively told us to hurry up into the hammam as there were other people waiting.Wanted a relaxing spa experience and came out even more agitated and restless than we were going in. Don't know if everyone who has gone here/will go here will receive the same treatment but we think it's best that one doesn't risk it.

Excellent hamman. This was a 2-hour pampering session! We loved every minute. The ladies who took care of us were gentle and professional. I got layers of Sahara sand off after a week in the desert. I suggest the full package of steam, scrub, massage, and the mud wrap. After that treatment, I felt wonderful. The owner explained the services quite well, and even recommended an excellent spot to eat lunch en plein air. For less than $40, I was pampered like a queen.

Just 'WOW'!!. Not usually being a great lover of massage; I was not prepared to be blown away. For the very reasonable price of D270 (about £25), we were treated to the most amazing massage, sauna & hair wash. I can honestly say, I have never felt so good & totally relaxed afterwards. The products used smell absolutely divine and the staff there are friendly and welcoming. I would highly recommend this place and cannot wait to visit again!

Low price, great quality, fantastic owner. I had idea what a Hammam was before my trip to Marrakech and did not plan on getting one until I got covered with dust on an excursion just outside of the city. Hammam Ziani is just a short walk from the Jemaa el Fna, and was absolutely one of my favorite experiences during my short stay in the city/country. The experience was fantastic and was about 45 minutes - even if you are unlikely to visit a spa or get a massage (like me) it was a great way to see a new aspect of the culture here in Morocco. The owner is also fantastic, and is great to talk to if you are from the United States - he is originally from Morocco, but spent significant time in the States and is especially friendly and sociable to travelers. He gave us a great deal, great service, and was more than happy to answer any questions about the rest of our trip. There are probably higher quality, longer Hammams, but if you want a cheaper, quicker and still great alternative, come here!

A gem of a place!. Came here with my parents this morning after returning from a 3-day trip to Merzouga. We were thoroughly excited about a massage for our aching bodies and this place didn't disappoint! We arrived at Hammam Ziani after reading positive reviews about an authentic and inexpensive experience which it certainly was. We were greeted by the owner who showed us around and made us feel very welcome and we left feeling completely relaxed and restored. We hope to return once again before we fly back home!

Low quality for the price . I visited the hammam with my partner: the whole place looks a bit run down, first the toilet door felt off its frame, there were no towels, we paid for 60" massage and only got maybe 25". The massagers didn't speak English and only pointed "out" with the finger once they finished. The massage was intense. Afterwards, we were left alone in the locker room with no towels to dry our hair. We were supposed to do it with the bath suits. As we insisted, we got a little tea. Wouldn't go there again.

The Real Mcoy. Whenever we visit Marrakech we always visit Hammam Ziana. This time we visited twice, once at the beginning of the holiday and then at the end. When we arrive the owner Damane Ziani welcomed us, we paid 250 dirham each (£20) for a homage (scrub) and massage. We were each given a basket with bath robe and towel in and were taken into a small candle lit room for mint tea. Five minutes later I was taken to an anti room with lockers for my belongings (men and women go to separate areas) where I undressed and were given disposable knickers to hide my modesty. There could be other women in the Hammam at the same time so don't be shy. The ladies don't speak very good English but their gestures are adequate to understand. I was led into a room with marble type beds where I was washed with black soap and rinsed, then into the steam room for about fifteen minutes. Then back to the first room where I was scrubbed vigorously from head to foot, the amount of dead skin that comes off is unbelievable, washed again then taken to the massage room. I borrowed a towel from my hotel to put on the bed as they have plastic coverings and can be a bit slippery. Oil was applied and then I had the best massage ever including a head massage. Next I was led back to the first room where I was washed with a soapy scrunchy had my hair washed and conditioned and rinsed again. The women then helped me on with the bathrobe and wrapped the towel around my head and led me back to the anti room where I dressed. When we arrived the owner had said "no tipping" and there are signs all over, but the ladies do gesture for money and say "sh" not to tell the boss, but I gave my lady a tip as I thought she deserved it.We both felt clean, refreshed and relaxed and our skin was really soft and glowing. I would definitely recommend Hammam Ziani. Give it a go.Can't wait to return next year.Ps Damane has two beautiful little dogs called Rex and Rosie and a shop next door that sells natural oils and soap.
Best Hammam Ever. My girlfriend and I sent to the Hammam and got a student discount! So only 200Dh each. The experience is lovely and awesome. Will defenitely return !

wonderfull massages from the professional women who works here.. Because my profession is giving traditional Indian massages, I was very critical. The silence during massages, the respectful touch and the nice smelling oil gives a very good and purifing experience. Shukran and Thanks

Was oke. Nice people. We did take the treatment with the package. The scrub and massage was Okay. But the package was not worth it..deffenitily not like the picture they show you at the reception. They Use very little amount of mud. So take the treatment without. The one for 270dh. The loungne was Nice.

Body went through car wash...... . Interesting experience.... Never had a hammam before. Went with my husband and teenagers. We all did 270 dirham package. We paid and was suppose to get change back but didn't. It was only 20 so didn't say anything. Got tea first. Daughter and I went in. They asked us to undress in front of them. They gave us thong underwear to wear only. We put belongings in locker. The key goes on your wrist. Then they left us in steam bath for half hour. Then they rubbed oil and gave bucket bath. Then you lie down and they scrubbed u down. Feels like soft sandpaper. Then bucket bath. Then go to another room for oil massage. Then back to bucket bath. Then you lie down and they soap you down. Then final bucket bath. Then they give you bathrobe and you go change. Ladies bring hair tie. You will have to go back hotel to wash your oily hair. The only difference for my husband and son was that they showered on their own and the attendant wrapped the loin cloth on them. It does say no tips. They do ask. Didn't give anything. Glad we tried it at a reasonable price.

Authentic but impersonal . My husband and I booked an evening hammam session during our honeymoon and we chose Hammam Ziani for the reported authenticity - it being the only 'moroccan' Hammam and unlike a western spa. We were happy that they also provided men for men masseuses and women for women. Once I went into the women's section, they gave me a cloth to wrap around my chest and disposable underwear. However, perhaps due to a lack of English speakers that work at the Hammam, it seemed like they were not respectful or receptive to my own shyness about being without clothing. In previous spa experiences, there seems to be a bit more privacy, at least whereby the masseuse and yourself are in a room separate to other clients. I found it uneasy that there were 4 other customers getting the Hammam treatment at the same time in the same room.The steam room was nice and hot, and the scrub part was also nice with excellent exfoliation. Again, I think the communication skills were the biggest point to fix here - the people who work there are really lovely and sweet and well meaning, but a bit more basic English training would be so helpful! After the scrub was the massage, which was a good massage but from a personal perspective, being alone in that room and not knowing anyone or their language made me unable to fully experience the calm and comfort of the Hammam, and this could perhaps be rectified with a more personal treatment - or introduction of names from masseuses. All in all, I think if you're a shy person like me, then maybe opt for a more western style private Hammam - this one was authentic, but hygiene could be improved as there was lots of hair everywhere and the turnover between clients was too fast to clean massage beds etc. My husband had a good time as he was the only person being treated in the men's section, and had more of an individualised approach. Again hygiene was a slight issue, and this can be easily rectified if the Hammam take on fewer clients at one time and take more time to clean between them! All in all, thanks for our first Hammam experience, but not as spectacular as we were expecting.

Hammam is a must, a unique experience!. Hammam was a therapeutic experience which you have to try if you go to Marrakesh! I went for the all singing all dancing experience for 350 dirham and I was there for 4 hours!First you start in the steam room and although not as hot as the traditional Hammam's in Marrakesh, is not over bearing. Then you go into another room where the woman will scrub all the dead skin off all over your body, even if you exfoliate, it's shocking how much comes off! Then you're washed and given a full body massage. Then washed again and then another steam but with seaweed wrap. Then washed lol I've never felt so clean. My skin felt incredible after! I literally felt stronger.Ziani is lovely and very welcoming. One thing I would say, is there are signs not to tip yet I was still asked to tip.

Great experience and reasonable price!. It was a good experience - a mix between a traditional hammam and a more touristy spa -, a reasonable price and the owner was welcoming. The only confusing thing was that there were signs everywhere saying that no tipping was allowed, but the masseuse still asked for tips.

Great Massage with a smile. I actually met Ziani as I was walking down the street past the Hammam. I was lost and he helped me find my way back to my Riad by sending one of his staff with me to guide me home. Having lived overseas, he speaks English and will be able to give you advice on where to go to. I went to go into the Hammam, but Ziani sent me off to a museum first, as he said it would be better to see the museum, then have my steam room experience, scrub and massage. Thanks to Khadija for a fabulous massage and many thanks to Ziani for all his help. Highly recommend for a great Hammam experience in Marrakech.

Good Massage. Having experienced loads of Hammams in Marrakech, thought we will give 'Ziani' a try . The massage was fantastic but the steam room even though I said I would like it hot, it wasn't. Also there was no door to the steam room, so it made it difficult to keep the room hot. Like other Hammams where you have a small sink to soak yourself, this didn't !!

Brilliant service. We visited this hamam today, we were after the traditional hamam experience rather than the usual onez, the staff are friendly, although they don't all speak English but still ensure to provide good service with a smile. The scrub was fantastic, the massage was excellent from end to finish brilliant experience. We had 13 & 12 year old boys with us who also enjoyed the experience. We are not just relaxed but also left with soft and smooth skin. The owner of this place speaks very good English, is extremely polite and helpful. We will be returning before we go back home. We are still on our holiday, I wanted to give a review while we were here to make sure it's done. Highly recommend.

A unique experience. I wasn't sure what to expect coming here. In the end I found myself clean as I have ever been and pretty darn relaxed. It is also relatively cheap for everything it includes. I would give a full 5 rating, but the staff is pretty pushy on tips even though there are signs on no tipping.

Fantastic!!!. Friendly staff with a warm and welcoming invite to a world of peace and serenity. They train their staff for up to four years and the experience is passed through you to feel.It lasts about 2hrs and you could never put into words how relaxing or invigorating it is. My fiencee came out feeling refreshed and uplifted.You really could fall asleep as you are taken into a world of pleasure.This hammam has been visited by many stars and recommended by both famous stars and public alike.I would highly recommend this hamm am especially on your first day to rid the dead skin and invigorate the body.

Good experience, though be aware in the evening in ramadan. We went in the evening to this beautiful and clean hammam with a bit of bartering on the door and decided to go for the gommage hammam without the massage as we had just been on a trek up to the summit of Mt Toubkal and wanted a good clean!My boyfriend had a great experience firstly being steamed, then showered, then scrubbed and pulled and stretched, showered, then soaped down kind of massaged and then steam room and showered again. He came out relaxed, happy and very clean.I however was firstly in the steam room and then scrubbed with a traditional mit and soap and then brought back to the steam room however the steam never came on so I lay for about 25 minutes in a mildly steamy room waiting to be collected. When i finally was I was quickly soaped off (the soap smelt amazing) and then left to get changed. Although I had definitely been scrubbed I was disappointed with my experience, especially compared to my boyfriend so we decided to go back the next day. When we explained the situation the man on the front desk was very understanding and explained that the staff were often exhausted by the end of the day during ramadan and he apologised a lot, offering another hammam which I turned down so then gave us a hammam mit and the best soap they had. Overall this was a good experience and I would recommend this place, but maybe be aware that your treatment may be rushed at the end of the day during ramadan.

A bit disappointed. Went for a massage before flying back to UK the next day. Was expecting to have a best relaxation but was little disappointed. Basically you would get a lengthy wash with assistance and massage (not so proper massage) even unexperienced ones could do it better. So you would get a basket that has towel/robe if you were lucky, small piece of cloth/apron to wrap around your lower body so you would not be completely naked throughout the process and a pair of slippers. You would then be taken to the shower and then they would put on a mud all over your body. You would then be asked to go to steam room for at least 15 minutes. Tip not to touch your eyes as it really stings. Then you would be taken for another shower. Then you would be asked to lay on those slippery covered mat massage table. Then you would be applied with oil and you would be scrubbed to almost having your skin peeled off. It was hard. Then another shower and then they would give you a massage that wasn't the best. At one point I thought I wouldn't be able to walk after as he kept on massaging my Achilles Tendon and it did hurt. That was the longest 30 minutes of my life. Then final shower and off you go. Though it was clearly posted everywhere not to tip but the masseure would still begged for it. You get a mint tea after that physical torture. It was just good to try but if I had gotten what I was told then I wasn't probably writing an average review. It was way too pricey for a lengthy wash.

An interesting experience of traditional culture. Don't expect a luxury spa therapy here! Basically you are coming for a thorough cleanse but they also offer dry massage if you prefer.You enjoy a traditional mint tea after which you go to the changing rooms and lockers.
