You should take a quick shower to clean up a bit and go to the steam room, it could have been a bit hotter but it was perfectly ok. The black olive oil soap is given upon your entrance to the steam room (take a generous amount) and you can soap yourself or wait for someone to do it for you. Once you are done there, it is scrubbing time, and IT IS AWESOME, they will remove all the impurities and dark thoughts you carry with you. You need to turn and rinse every now and then... the people speak French and basic English but its simple enough, they will point and tell... its a no brainer. Then they will massage you with oils, and pretty strongly too, which is something I really appreciate. The place is not private and you might have a few of your fellow travelers getting massages next to you, but that does not bother me. Besides, this IS NOT A FANCY SPA, it is more similar to traditional hammams. That is it, the whole thing might take a bit over one hour, you might get a longer massage expecting a tip (I will address this in the next parragraph).The place has signs everywhere about the NO TIPPING policy. But regardless you will be asked for tips a couple of times, I have no problem with this if i got a great service, which I did, so I sneaked back in to give the guy a couple EUR. But this is entirely up to you, you will not be harassed or anything. You can now get out and get a tea while you wait for the rest of the people with you. My girl was in fact waiting for me already while sipping some more tea, she had a similarly great experience, it seems that the only thing that really differed was that she got panties and i got a loincloth. We were really happy and will come back for sure.

A good experience. Lovely hammam we found by accident one afternoon. We talked to the owner and came back the next day. We took a taxi as we would never have found it again! It was actually in my guide book as a 'top ten' - but i didn't think i would be brave enough to try a hammam. The owner answered my questions and was helpful. Look out for his 4 cute dogs!I went for the full package: steam, wash, scrub, massage. Paid 240dh.....partner speaks arabic so i can see i got a cheaper deal than others lol.The place is clean and the tea/relaxation area is really atmospheric :)

No Tips. I enjoyed my visit to this traditional hammam.... Quite hard to find .... Best to get a petit taxi ..... There are two levels of service .. Normal is 270 dirham's ...about£18 .... No tips are allowed which is good as you do not have people chasing or harassing you for tips and everything is provided, robe,sandals,soaps,oils .... I took swimming shorts ...... The entire experience took about an hour and was very refreshing ..... Pls contact me if you have any queries as I found it difficult to find out from a european's point of view what is involved.

Felt great, and ready for my long trip home. I was not sure if I was going to do this. I have never liked massage, and after a pretty poor experience 20 years ago in Lebanon (felt like the girl was stroking me only), I have never seen the point.But oh, how wrong I was!After asking a few time for directions, I finally found it. It was only a short walk from Jemaa El Fna. The receptionist made me feel welcome, and the masseur was a very strong woman! She apparently was the boss of the other ladies, and scrubbed, washed and kneeded like a heroine! She was also a very nice lady, and totally professional. I did not feel that the hammam was particularly dirty, as others have mentioned.The details have been given by other reviewers, but I payed 270 dhirams may -15 for the basic package (about 1h 20min, without mud wrapping). You do not have to bring anything. The whole ordeal was finished with a nice mint tea, before heading as a new person to the airport.

a very good afternoon. the masseur even boys than women are very very good, and they do their work with heart!!!the owner is full of respect toward tourists and his staff, and this give a very good atmosphere where everybody can relax well and good! good relation price and quality of service.Tips are not requested, but if you want to live 10/20 diram to the masseur, they will be happy to accept it!

dirty. dirty shower,, sticky stuff on the wall, really dirty doors and floor, good exfoliating,, the worse massage ever if i van call it massage,, it was just smearing oil on my body.. guys talking a yelling , loud, not nice,,,

Lovely hammam but abrupt manager. My wife visited this hammam, and found the service to be excellent. However, the manager was quite abrupt and forceful which left a bad taste. We're not sure if he even realises it, and of course we didn't mention anything about it at the time. There are some dogs sleeping near the entrance and they are very cute. All in all, worth the price.

a tranquil retreat from the madness of Marrakech. a perfect place to unwind and experience a fantastic hammam.after the mad shopping of Marrakech to enter Hammam Ziani is a delight to savour.Tranquil and relaxing the staff make you feel as special as a princess whilst you enjoy their magic treatments,

Wow, wow & wow!. Myself and my husband treated ourselves this afternoon to a Hammam and massage. Men and women have separate areas but we both had the same great experience! For the equivalent of about €27 each we got the scrubbing of a lifetime and a lovely relaxing massage. While the massage was lovely and very relaxing I can't imagine that they'd had much professional training however you could tell they've been doing this for some time!Overall, a great experience and I would definitely do it again!Advice for first timers - have no expectations and keep an open mind.

Leaves you feeling wonderful. fancy a scrub, steam, massage and wrap in seaweed? my skin felt great for days afterwards and and my daughter and I agreed it was the highlight of our three day trip to Marrakech.

Wonderful escape!. Its always a pleasure on our trips to visit Hammam Ziani with the groups to enjoy a steam, scrub, Argan oil massage and Rassoul mud wrap. You leave feeling super relaxed, cleansed and refreshed. One of the best experiences in Marrakech! Thank you.

Great start to the day. Me and my friend decided to go to Marrakeh to celebrate our birthdays. Before setting of we knew that we wanted to go and visit a local spa. When we arrived in the morning we where greated with traditional tea whilst deciding as to what treatments we wanted. After the treatment we left happy, relaxed and ready for another day. Highly recommend this place.
Special atmosphere, beautiful setting.. Special place with cheerful staff and thorough scrubbing. The place to visit if you want something more traditional than a hotel spa.

it was my first public hammam. and it turned out to be very good. i chose the option that allows for a 30 minute massage and i thought that was a great price considering i got scubbed and massaged at the same time.

Excellent experience, great price. I've never felt so refreshed and clean! I chose the 27 dirham option (I asked for a student discount, so I only paid 20 dirham), which included the steam room, a massage, and scrub. I left feeling awesome! I definitely recommend this place. It's a great break from the crowded, dirty streets.
As far as hammam's go, this one is really good. Welcoming, beautiful waiting area, great tea, loved the steam sauna, good massage, fabulous almond wash!

Ziani Hammam in Marrakech. Ziani Hammam in Marrakech is the place to go if you want to experience the traditional Hammam. We loved everything about it! They offered mint tea at the beginning, then brought nice baskets with towels and flip flops. They have special lockers for clothes and bags, you don't have to worry about that. After the steaming, we had a good exfoliating with black soap and a special glove,...and the piece de resistance... the massage with argan oil. It was awesome! Those ladies know what they're doing! We felt like floating when we came out of there! It's the real stuff! We didn't get that in a spa of a 5stars hotel.
Good experience. Good to experience moroccon bath in Marrakech. Just walk in and you will get the treatment. Water is so slow and hard to get a proper shower. Overall just ok.

Very Nice!. We would advise this hammam to everyone. The people are very friendly, the massage was great and the scrub was not as bad (by far) as you would maybe think after reading the other reviews ;)We had massage, scrub, black soap and steam sauna for just 250 dirham (something like 24 euro). There are lockers to stall your bag and it was clean in the hammam.In short: perfect!

A good cleansing of the madness..!!. We decided to have the 350 Dh treatment (��23).... A great way to escape the madness and be steamed, washed, scrubbed and massaged for a couple of hours. A traditional hammam (not a touristy spa)

Good clean fun.. My friend and I spent five days in Marrakech and our visit to this perfect little bath house was a sure highlight. We're not big spenders and had been put off by some of the high end spas in the city catering chiefly for tourists, but were convinced we'd feel like wallies rocking up to a local hammam and not knowing our ar**s from our elbows (so to speak!). Easy to find right by the Bahia Palace, Hammam Ziani provides the perfect in-between solution. We went for the 350 dh option, including a steam room session, scrub, argan oil massage (1 hr for my friend, 30 mins for me + a mud wrap) and a good wash. The ladies giving us our treatments were wonderful and made us feel like we were in safe hands. Being lead by the hand from room to room, lubed up on argan oil, naked save a pair of tiny paper pants and slopping about in ill-fitting plastic sandals has never been more fun. After we'd dressed and finished giggling about how nice it had all been (I hadn't been washed like that since I was about three) we were shown to a sumptuous sitting area where fresh mint tea awaited us. A seriously nice treat. The most money we'd spend in all our five days in Marrekech, but worth every dirham. (oh and apparently a good scrub, and Hammam Ziani certainly gives you that, means more chances of getting a better tan afterwards - bonus!)

Amazing Authentic Relaxing Hammam. This place is a dream! A must for anyone wanting a truly, authentic relaxing experience. The staff were really welcoming and showed us round beforehand so we really knew what we were getting. The Hammam is set up separately for men and women, and the package we got included an amazing Hammam and massage. They also have a "no tip" rule which meant there was no hassling at the end, so we both left feeling ridiculously relaxed! Cant recommend this place enough, especially as its such good value

Cleanest I have ever been!. I went here after another spa had no record of my booking and weren't very helpful. Glad I ended up here. The girls didn't speak English but that didn't cause any problem and actually added to the experience. There were English speakers available to explain the two pakages they offer. 350 dirham fot the steam, scrub and massage and a mud wrap (or you could have a longer massage). 270 without the wrap.The girl was pleasant and attentive. Lovely massage and I genuinely have never felt as clean as when I left! Not as luxurious as some spas available but definitely excellent value for money.

Great!. My hubby and I enjoyed the experience! .. after a few days in town -inside La Medina- and others at the desert! the sauna, massage and relaxation were just great! .. a friendly place too. Try it!

Hammam. Had a great afternoon at the Hammam really worth the money we had the full package which was a sauna, massage and relaxation it was so nice, girls and boys seperate and you only wear a small pair of knickers (girls), it was such a good massage would highly recommend.Lockers for your goods, all really good, the boys enjoyed it too.

little haven. We had done the ''sights'' , had seen review for this hammam in a guide book so thought we would give it a go. The day we went it was quiet only myself and my husband there but the staff said it gets busy in the warmer months with tourists. all your stuff goes in your locker with a key you wear on your wrist, unlike some hammams where the bags are left with staff. I had sauna, scrub then a half hour massage then body mud mask for another half hour followed by a hairwash for 350 dirums. Hubby declined the mud mask had extra half hour massage. same price as mine.Female staff for the women male staff for the men. All the staff were lovely and then complementary mint tea and chill out before hitting the souks. Definately has to be done
Nice. Superb Hammam. If you are in Marrakesh, take the trip, its an old Hammam (200+years). I've been to Hammams in different countries , but this is the best so far
Delightful experience. Such a beautiful and relaxing experience,best thing you can do in Marakech,I was just amazed at the ease that Zaini puts all of his guest in.Would recommend and will be back.

Amazing!!!. This is probably the first place I have visited in morroco to make me feel at home, having spent two days with my two friends in marrakech the owner Ziani was a fresh friendly face who made us all welcome with a glass of morrocan mint tea. The price of the full hammam was 270DH which is a very reasonable price considering it last for 1h15! Some of the tourist hammams offer around 650DH for 50mins!.As a darkskinned women I am more than used to the stares and glares but the ladies here were wonderful and gave us the best treatments and massage. The owner went to the extra mile of helping us discover more of the old town on map and explained everything from how to haggle for a camel and also were to go out at night (something our hotel lacked in). Afte our hammams there was a pleasant mint tea awaiting us. The owner and the overall hammam is definately a must we left grinning from ear to ear and thats definately more than expected. Thank you mr ziani we will be sure to come back next time we visit!

Just THE Best and SO reasonable. Set between the Bahir and the Badi palaces (not quire sure I've spelled those correctly) we found the Ziani by accident and was that our lucky day. We checked the hammam out before going to the Bahir palace and went to it between palaces. We had previously declined going to another hammam (advertised as reasonably priced by some Trip Advisors please note) because with a massage it would have cost us nearly `1000 dirhams. The Ziani, on the other hand only cost us 270 dirhams with a massage (January) and when I say massage, the one I had by Karim was the best massage I had ever had. I went with a girl friend and we both enjoyed the experience so much so if you are looking for somewhere clean, authentic, very reasonably priced and with lovely friendly staff do get yourself to the Ziani.
A Marrakech must do. A wonderful relaxing experience in a delightful setting. Excellent staff. A haven of calm in the this beautiful but busy city.
Excellent service . Amazing service good prices and attention to details.....loved the experience I will definitely recommend a super session I would love to go back again....

Okay Hammam, but awkward clash with masseurs due to no tip rule. The experience of this Hammam was not as bad as I feared. Since you go in naked and have other people to wash and scrub you, this could have been uncomfortable, but in fact it was rather nice. The scrub and massage in itself was comfortable (and you got super silky smooth afterwords) but I had a minor clash with the masseurs after they were done. The hammam had a 'no tip policy' but the three ladies that worked there actually begged me to tip them. I didn't really know what to do, and it made me quite uncomfortable. I also froze a bit in there all the way through.

Better than expected. I visited Hammam Ziani with two friends after failing to get a walk-in appointment at the other more luxurious places in town (Le Bain Blue etc). They fitted us in right away, explained the different options available, and although clearly geared towards tourists it felt fairly authentic to us. The sexes are segregated here, unlike at the more exclusive westerns spas in town, and the scrub I received was one of the best ever. I wasn't asked for a tip by my masseur either, who was really friendly and explained what to do next etc. So for anyone wanting to experience an authentic Moroccan hammam without going fully native, and if you are prepared for it to not be the same as the service you will get in a western spa, then this is a good place for you. I would definitely visit again.

Better than other Marrakech hammams, but needs to improve for the price. I went as a treat at the end of a 2-week backpacking trip. Overall it was worth it, but it could have been better considering the price.Visit: you can take a quick free tour and see into the change room and treatment rooms to get an idea of the warmth & steam. Front desk gentleman during the day was amazingly kind & pleasant. When I went in the evening a different gentleman was not at all polite & simply asked me to pay immediately and then sent me in with a staff member. As a paying customer, that was not appreciated.Pros : Better than most of the other Hammams off the side streets. Others from my Riad went to one suggested by the riad for 200 dirhams, but they were massaged in a cold room and only had a hot shower. Sort of defeats the purpose of the hammam/steam! At least Ziani is warm.Cons: Steam room for relaxing should be hotter. It was warm, but not hot. The service really depends on the attendant you're paired with. My actual treatments were shorter than they should have been. My scrub was only a few minutes at most & not as thorough as it should have been. My massage was rough, not thorough, and definitely not 30 minutes;10-15 minutes maximum. So that was too bad. Another gentleman with another attendant had the same package as me but received a longer more thorough treatment.270 dirhams for basic package (scrub, "30" minutes massage, steam, hot showers, body oil). No restricted men vs. Women hours as they're completely separate. Don't need to bring your own undergarments to this hammam as you're given a loin cloth and slippers. Tip:I was given the dark gel to rub into my feet in the hammam. Seriously don't get this anywhere near your eyes OR touch above your neck after. I ran my fingers through my hair and some residue must have leaked onto my face as I sweat : serious stinging.Note: the business posts clearly that tipping is forbidden. I was still repeatedly asked for a tip by my masseuse but i chose to respect the owners' wishesOverall: while it could be better, Ziani is a better option than some of the other spa hammams for 200 dirhams. But, improvement needs to be made to match their claims of being great

Very disappointing...go elsewhere. My family and I visited this hamman after reading a favorable review in a leading travel book. While the women enjoyed their experience, the three men in our group had an awful experience. As others have mentioned, the waiting area is nice, clean and relaxing. However, the men's area is worn, dirty and downright scary. We were supposed to have a hamman and a massage. The hamman consisted of a short steam room visit followed by a series of "treatments" and seven showers (we spent more time in the shower than we did getting treatments or a massage). As for the massage, it was the absolute worse massage I have ever received. It was more of a light rub than a massage...and it lasted 10 minutes rather than the promised 30 minute massage After we were done, the guy assigned to me put his hand out looking for a tip despite signs throughout the facility saying "No tipping". After refusing his gesture, I quickly made my way to the small and dirty changing room. I saw the same guy poking his head in three times looking to see if I was still there so he could hit me up for a tip. It was a very weird experience and I could not waIt to leave. So, while the ladies in our group had a rather nice time, I can't recommend this hamman given what transpired during my recent visit.

First class service. My wife wanted to visit a Hammam while in Morocco and this Hammam was recommended by our hotel (I believe a very good choice)Very inviting no hard sell (other business's in the medina could possibility learn something here) - felt comfortable from the second we walked through the door.I waited for the duration of my wife's treatment (approx 2 hours) - given tea at regular intervals and English language mags to read - thanks to the staff for making the wait a pleasant and restful experience! My wife was looked after by a young lady called Zainab who provided a great and professional service throughout!!!First class service all the way, many thanks!!!

It's not what it is promising to be. Friendly staff by comming in. You get a quick but full tour of the Hammam before you decide on what you want. They carry two packages: a hammam experience and an extra experience, that basically gives you 30 minutes extra massage or a clay treatment.We choose the extra experience and paid the 350 dirham for it. The hammam provides you with towels, slippers and a wrap around your waist. So you don't have to bring anything yourself.You start with a cup of Moroccan tea in a waiting area. They pick you up and help you undress and do the waistwrap. Guided to the steam area. First a shower. One out of thee showers broken. Doors made out of old windows with plastic. The hammam is rather cold and that takes away part of the comfort.The guy that was appointed to me to do the treatment didn't speak any English so it was hard to communicate.After a few minutes he picked me up in the steam area for a rubbing. Than back into the shower. He started the massage. But it was anyting but that. Not worthy being called a massage. The clay treatment means a few lines of clay on your body, aprox 30 minutes wrapped under a plasic sheet and they poor hot water over you from time to time.Back into the shower to get the clay off, being washed with soap, and shower again. And that was it. And than the begging began: give me money sir. You bring money? You give to me. There are signs all over "No tipping" but the staff doesn't care.In the end we got an extra cup of tea. When the owner asked how it was and I responded that is was merely okay, he said "good" and walked away. That was it. We both had a simmular experience. So go here for the experience. Not for a good massage nor a proper clay treatment.

Pas mal. This was quite a decent Hammam experience - the massage was good, but as others have said below, it was not warm enough in the massage area or in the steam room - it should be very hot - that's the point!! I'm not sure if this may just be a result of it cold at night in December and this being a traditionally-constructed Hammam.

brilliant. very good service, good prices and brilliant overall. Mr Zianni was very helpful and the massages are very good. Only bad thing is the masseuses ask for a tip (I would've thought they receive enough wage).

Hammam Ziani. I enjoyed Hammam Ziani with two girlfriends. We were welcomed with a mint tea, shown to a room where the three of us were rubbed with oil, then taken to a steam room where we enjoyed again just the three of us. After some time we were taken back to the other room where we had a body scrub and massage. I even had my hair washed with lovely smelling Almond shampoo. I like that our experience was private and not shared with a group of people in the steam room or other treatment room. The facility is older but very clean. It has it charms and the service was well worth the money spent. Only 27 euro.

Quite a mess. Cold and quite a scam.. the masseurs were constantly begging for a tip. None of them are real masseurs.. they just soap you.. not much privacy here 4 rows of massage beds next to eachother and the masseurs scream constantly to eachother. Don't go...

Mixed experience. This is a little bit more rough and ready than some of the hammans but that was the appeal. It's not a local place but some of the other places feel like you could be back home which seems to defeat the point a little to me.Anyway, my experience was excellent and for the money, i have no complaints. My girlfriend really liked hers but for the same treatment, hers was finished 30 minutes before mine and at the end, the lady treating her was very persistent in asking for a tip. When she said she didnt have any money, the lady said "you must have something". Now, that's pretty standard in Morocco BUT the hamann has signs everywhere saying "no tipping allowed" so we hadnt taken any extra money with us. The while situation made my gf feel quite uncomfortable. I get the feeling the woman was pretty desperate and we didnt want to say anything and get her in trouble.

Very Relazing - Very Enjoyable. A little out of the realm of what an American might consider a spa but a massively amazing experience for a pittance by US standards. No mingling of sexes as there are two distinctly separate sides for men and women, some with children in tow. The heat,steam, scrub, invigorating massage and mysterious substance body wrap all made for a taxi ride back to the hotel and to bed. Warning: this is an afternoon/evening adventure with no big plans for the evening as you will be flat out but gloriously exhausted! Plan ahead and negotiate price up front as this could be a long taxi ride from your hotel. The facility is somewhat on the worn side but fastidiously clean and very good with great service,

Mixed bag. . My wife had a great Hallam. Scrub massage soap etc. About 1hr 20 ish270 dh half price of many othersShe was well looked afterOwner was friendly and non pushy.My experience was ok. I was a bit cold and damp for mine. I should have asked for it to be steamier... But I shouldn't have had to ask..I was very wary and didn't think. However in light of this the owner knocked off 70dh.So my wife had a 4 star experience.Me a 3. Nice almond soap.My Massage could have been firmer...by a lot. Scrubbing and soaping was good.The ladies seemed to have much better handle on things.But all in all cost compensated for the bit so polished experience.

Dissapointed. We chose this Hammam, because it was right around the corner of our Riad. A nice guy showed us around the Hammam and explained us the different packages. We decided to take the Package 2, which included the Entry+TopMassage+Seaweedtherapy/Special back +Bathrobe+Toiletbag for 350 dh, altogether 2 hours.Men and women were seperated. There were lockers available in the changing rooms.After undressing, a woman took my hand and ushered me into the steam bath, where 4 other women were already sitting. You couldn't see anything, because the room was full of steam. While I was sitting there, new women were lead in and others were picked up. It seemed to be very busy. I waited approximately for half an hour until a woman, who just spoke french, came to pick me up. She took my hand and brought me into a room where 4 other massagebeds stood. She scubbed me with the the typical Hammam massage glove, washed off the skin with soap and rinsed me with water. It took 5 minutes, if not less. Then I was put back in the steam bath. It was even more crowded now, we had to squeeze together. After another half an hour I was taked out again, now into the massageroom. The massage, which was included contained a 5 minutes "massage" where argan oil was just rubbed in a little. Afterwards I was taken back into the steam bath, where they put a seaweedpaste on me and wraped me in a transparentfoil. Now I had to lay on the hard stonebench for approximately 40 minutes! Then someone brought me into the bathingroom again. Put soap on me and rinsed me with water. Then I had to go get changed. Then we could take a tea.Altogether: I spent most of the time waiting in the steambath, everything else was just done really quick. It felt like being on the assembly line! Neither the massage, nor the bath really convinced me.I would not recommend this place!
Cold. i came here 4 years ago... When it was good fun. Now it's dilapidated, cold and not enjoyable... Tho the women who do the scrub and massage are lovely and jolly.

Wow. I visited the hammam with 2 friends . We were greeted politely, no hassle, and given an explanation of costs. Mint tea to begin with and then off for my first hammam experience. Since all 3 of us were attended to simultaneously a great time was had by all with much laughter , ooohing and aaahing. It was a fantastic experience and exceptional value for money. Very hands on , much more so than in the UK but not at all intimidating.Would highly recommend
Amazing scrub. The manager was very helpful and the general information he gave us was handy . We had an amazing time in the SPA, we were scrubbed,bath and lastly we were mud wrapped.A house of care.

thouroughly enjoyable and so relaxing. A lovely experience! Was shown around hammam before commiting, looked clean comfortable so my daughter and i came back the next day to experience it before catching plane back to uk. WONDERFUL experience! As stated before it was a relaxing series of nicely warm washes and body scrubs each followed by a 10 to 15 minutes in steam room. Massage was wonderful and lasted the stated 35 minutes which makes you feel sooo relaxed . The staff were very friendly and after feeling totally refreshed we relaxed in the parlor/tea room for lovely mint tea . Overall it lasted 1hr 40 for my 370 diram xperience and 2 hrs for my daughter who had the mud wrap extra. Definately to be recommended and i will be returning on my next trip

Smiles and tea and chill in the hammam. This was the first hammam I have ever experienced - I was persuaded inside by my friends and a little nervous at first, but the staff were wonderfully warm and friendly and settled me down with a glass of mint tea. I opened my pores first in a room thick with misty steam, then had body wash and scrub, hair wash with a wonderful almond shampoo, and finally the luxurious full body massage which seemed to go on for ever - with liberal applications of argan oil. Afterwards I felt a new woman! My skin so smooth! Would definitely go back

This is IT !. I would like to think of myself as 'an amateur' of the Hammam & Massage experience having enjoyed innumerable sessions over the last 30 years or so. Over several visits to Marrakech during the past 5 years I have tried countless locations to find a true Marrakchi experience. Well, this is IT! For the boys, if you like soft towels, a dark room and a pretty girl for your massage, do not come here, you will hate it. (I cannot speak for how the ladies are treated as this is a seperate area at Ziani). However, if you are looking to enter a world with a large dose of the real Hammam culture, are not shy of your body and are OK laying on a marble slab next to a complete stranger enjoying the same experience, then you should come here. You are met by a very pleasant multi lingual guy at reception, which you must pay up front. Don't worry, you will not be disappointed. You are then stripped naked, given a peice of blue cotton to cover your essentials and pulled directly into the steam & massage area. A quick shower, you are then soaped fully (and perhaps intimately for some people) and led into a very authentic domed steam room with only natural light through small glazed holes around the dome. A very pleasant experience.Followed by copious amounts of showers, soapings, scrubbings and a massage of between 30-60 minutes by a mostly naked bloke (except for his own white cotton loin cloth) with hands like shovels - it is just great! For the Rolls Royce version it is a very modest 350Dhs, some 3 times cheaper than any hotel spa, for a standard treatment it's 270Dhs. I left the Ziani feeling squeaky clean, relaxed and ready for the day. I will definitely be returning. Do not get tempted by sellers in the street pulling you elsewhere or taxi drivers who want to take you to the Kasbah for the more 'fashionable bains' - Like Bains de Marrakech or Bains d'Alhambra. You will get a private room for the massage and a pretty girl at these places but you will pay a lot more and you will miss the excellent ambiance and experience of Ziani. See you soon guys!!

Not as authentic as I had hoped, but still great. I visited this hammam looking for a really authentic experience, but of course so does everyone else, so it's all tourists, but... it's a really great once you're in. The staff are lovely, the man I had gave a great massage, and was so friendly and smiley, even with the language barrier. I'd recommend this to tourist who want a really hammam with the comforts a more touristy hammam can offer.

A pleasant experience for a lower priced hammam. This was my first hammam experience. I looked at others highly rated on trip advisor but they were very expensive. I chose this one due to the cheaper prices and relatively good reviews.We got a hammam (steam room, wash, scrub, rinse) and full body massage for 270MAD.On arriving we were served mint tea, then changed into disposable pants, and went into the steam room. We were after a few minutes lead into another room, and were washed with black soap, scrubbed (within an inch of our lives!) and rinsed off. Then went in for the massage which was lovely - very relaxing. After the massage we were brought back to the wash room and were once again washed down and rinsed off. They also shampooed our hair.Not a 'high end' place, but cheaper than a lot of the other tourist aimed hammams, and a pleasant experience.

Fantastic hammam. This hammam was fantastic - authentic and not too touristy. Great massage, great gommage and the sea-weed/mud wrap was exceptional. Very attentive staff. I had such a great experience, I went back a second time. I will definitely return on my next trip to Marrakech.

Total relaxation and comfort. I visited Ziani looking for a traditional Hammam; the kind I would struggle to find in Europe. Upon arrival, the manager immediately took care of me, served me a mint tea and explained the treatment options. Excellent and thorough massage and deep scrub. Prices are fantastic, 1/4 what you'd pay in the UK. Highly recommended.

Relaxing but ..... We have been to a couple other hammams and found them enjoyable. Who doesn't like a good scrub-down with a rough brush, good soap, a wrap and a massage? If you want a cheap local hammam this isn't it, a bit over priced. Over produced. And for the middle aged guy to steamy to see over the rim of my glasses :) to get around. A traditional hammam is the way to go. Ask the person who runs your Riad or Hotel where the locals go.

Very nice. It's not cheap - 270 dirhams - but you get a good scrub by some very sweet ladies, a wonderful oil massage and to finish it, they wash you with foam. I came out very relaxed and happy. Don't miss the lounge at the entrance, it's very nice.

Average Hammam. Little disappointed. After reading hundreds of excellent reviews on this Hammam we decided to give it a go.The atmosphere at Ziani is definitely very relaxing. People smile at you and you feel at peace (especially in comparison to the chaotic rhythms of the Medina itself).As per the treatment - I was expecting much more!! I decided to go for the full massage package (steam room with soaping, scrubbing, 1/2 hour massage + extra 1/2 hour for 70 dirhams more). I was escorted in the massage/shower/steam area by a smiley guy who didn't speak a word of English. He made me shower first (in a really grimy and shabby box) then he took me to the steam room. The room was cold - the steam came on only after 5 good minutes. Just 5 minutes later (not enough to get proper warm) he came to pick me up for the soaping, scrubbing, oiling treatment. These didn't last more than 10 minutes in total. Then he started the massage; Pleasant but nothing more than a gentle stroke who anyone could perform. No longer than 30 minutes (I paid for a full hour massage) and he told me to shower again and go back to the changing room. On my way out he asked me for tip (even though everywhere in the hammam is written NO TIPS! in all languages) which I obviously gave him as after a few hours in Marrakech you understand there is no other choice but to tip everyone if you don't won't to be pestered.The Hammam finishes with a refreshing cup of mint tea in the main lounge. Again, nice but no wows here! Overall just an average experience. Tired facility, pleasant but not professional workers, a bit dirty. Not sure I would recommend it, especially the full hour massage.

Great Moroccan Baths. This is a great place to go for a communal hammam experience for tourists. Its fun, relaxing, and the staff is friendly. The massage was great. Get the scrub and massage package. Lockers, locks, and disposable panties are provided. Only cash is accepted. There's a wash room, steam room, scrub and massage area. Be careful with the marble floor and tables when wet. Take some time afterword to relax in the lounge. If the owner's around, he'll recommend some nearby sites, such as a historical museum a few step away. I'll go back next time I'm in Marrakesh.

The icing on the cake in Marrakech. On my last day in Morocco, after a great two-week tour, I decided I wanted to get a massage since I had a free day in Marrakech. My tour leader and my riad desk clerk set me up with the Hamman Ziani. I was used to American massages, but I didn't know what to expect in a Moroccan hammam. It turned out to be a very enjoyable experience, exceeding my expectations. After directing me to a shower and a 5-minute steam room stay, a young man treated me to a very sensual massage. He had me lie down on a table that was covered with an oil cloth and used a liberal amount of body oil on me. Afterward he soaped me up to get as much of the oil off as possible and directed me back to the shower to complete the process. It was one of the best massages I've ever had and made me wish I could have one like it in the U.S. It truly was the icing on the cake. I would go back in a heartbeat if I ever return to Morocco (which is a wonderful country to visit if you've never been there).

First Time...Will do Again!. I was vacationing in Morocco with friends (September, 2014) and we spent our last two days in Marrakech. One of our friends had experienced a hammam previously, two of us had not. We were a bit anxious about going, but our previously experienced friend urged us to partake. When in Morocco, do as the Moroccans do! Our tour guide (Khalid) suggested this hammam to us and we were not disappointed. The whole experience was quite unnerving for me initially but once the whole process began I relaxed and enjoyed the experience. I've never felt so clean or pampered, all of the women who take care of us were remarkable...the one who gave me a massage was great! I would definitely do it again...it was very reasonably priced...a similar treatment here in the states would have easily been $200+.

Fantastic experience at a reasonable price. I can't think of a better way to relax after a day's shopping and sight-seeing. Anyone who is disappointed with this fantastic place should go on to sample either a ridiculously expensive massage in a boutique hotel or the extremely basic facilities in a traditional public hammam. This place strikes a wonderful balance; the building has traditional features but the massage is not the tradiitonal rough manipulation but rather a firm but relaxing massage as good as any I have had anywhere. I went three times during the week, it was so reasonably priced!; all three therapists I encountered were well trained and accomplished. On my final visit I was joined by a friend and his 14 year-old nephew while our two female companions headed into their section. We emerged buffed and glowing and all agreed that we had been treated to a memorably enjoyable experience. Thank you Hammam Ziani!

A different and affordable experience. It is a nice experience, of course don't think this is a 5 stars spa. It is relatively clean and organized. Prices are ok. It has a nice waiting lounge where you can drink tea and listen to music. Then you will be given towels and someone will take you to the steam bath, then a session of massages. The massages are not excellent but they are ok (not professional). If you are in Marrakesh, experience this.To improve: The quality of the massage. However, these guys get paid nothing for massaging all day long, I understand that they get tired.

Invigorating !. First experience of a hammam ever , for myself and my daughter , staff couldn't speak English but it wasn't a problem , they were lovely , friendly welcoming owner , and we met the little dogs Linda and Emily . Left feeling invigorated , skins never felt so smooth , reasonable price , and though there's no tipping signs everywhere I slipped the girls a few dirhams for the good service we'd received , would definitely go again

Typical Marrakech. On our dayli way home we found Hammam Ziani. Because of the two little dogs emelie and linda I take a look inside, and the owner of this hammam is a very kind guy. He gives us a map an wrote down everything we should see on our journey. In this hammam are separate rooms for men and woman. The ladies made a good job. The Massage was very nice. For 270 MDH you get everything you need. This hammam is not 5* but it's typical Marrakech and everbody should visit. Greetings from the Girls from Berlin.

Most amazing experience ever!. We were just there last night, it was the best hammam experience ever. This was not our first we have experienced turkisk hammam were it was coed. This one is for both sexes .....however you are seperated. Ziani the owner greeted us with a friendly smile and a warm welcome as though we were old friends. The girls were wonderful to us giving us the most amazing massage. Meena was so sweet treating us like her sisters. Because it was late, ziani saw to it we had a cab back to to our hotel without getting ripped off....as it was late evening. This was a true hamm experience. You won't be sorry. God bless Ziani and his wonderful staff for their surpurb services.

BEST experience!. As we walk back to the Jemma El Fna Square from the Bahia Palace, we spotted this Hammam place. A gentleman standing outside trying to convince the customer to come and experience the Hammam! He was not pushy at all when we said we will be back since we didn't have enough cash with us. Instead, he told us to just check out the place and see if we wanted to come back! We did see the inside and we decided to come back the next day as promised, but the guy who showed us inside was not on duty at that time. For once in my life , I felt like a royalty; a very nice and sweet lady always smiling gave me a complete bath scrubbing my whole body and whole bodyassace with oil and the sauna room was really awesome! I really liked the different small holes with different colors reflecting on you! I meant to give a good tip to the lady when I walked in the front desk to ask to give the tip to the lady, the owner said "NO TIP" because they get at least 65% of the fee you paid! The owner, Ziani said the best thing I can give is to write the review instead! But I'm willing to write the review anyway! Thanks for the wonderful service at Hammam Ziani! I shall be back again for another royalty experience :)

Not impressed !. It's a Hammam ! The price is ok , 270 dirham per person. You get a steam first, a quick wash and a massage. The water was on a stand still inside the showers and I was thinking how much dead skin from other was under my feet. At the change rooms there are signs saying " NO TIPS", but as soon as they finish with you , the guys don't leave you alone until you give them a tip.

Great experience and value for money. Followed reviews on trip advisor and some from people we had met and I am very glad I did. Never had hamman before and the ladies put me at ease , yes it is a very strange experience to be almost naked but when in Rome, I just decided not to worry, relax and go with the flow, wish I spoke better French, the guy at the front desk kept my husband entertained as he decided it was not for him!!! Lovely and best value of the holiday, not too touristy with a traditional feel the guy in out riad said price was very good.

Bliss.. So relaxing. Visited Hamnan Ziani today and we were delighted with the service. After reading many great reviews we chose to visit Ziana even though our Riad manager had advised else where which seemed quite expensive. So glad we chose to ignore his recommendation. All the staff were great, my lady I believe her name was Zeenab was wonderful, extremely professional prob the best massage I've ever had. We would definitely recommend. The owner, an English speaking morrocan was very helpful too with helping us with a taxi fare seemed extremely genuine. Great price 270 drm .A*****

Wonderful experience. My 14 year old daughter and visited Hammam Ziani a week ago on a Sunday morning. It was our first visit to a hammam. We were shown around and told the price of 270 dirhams each. We had mint tea first then we were shown to the changing room and given disposable pants to wear and given a lockable locker for our belongings. We were washed, then sat in the steam room, then scrubbed, massaged then washed again by 2 Moroccan ladies. They didn't speak any English and we don't speak any French or Arabic but this wasn't a problem. Both ladies were lovely and the one who dealt with my daughter was so kind and took really good care of her, giving her hugs and kisses before we left. It was an extremely relaxing experience which we both thoroughly enjoyed. I would highly recommend Hammam Zianni and would definitely return.

Very relaxing :). Me and my husband went to this hammam last week Monday. We went to the Atlas Mountains so thought we could do with a hammam in the evening! Owner is very welcoming. We had been given a tour a few days before and decided to give it a try.Price was very good and we loved the sauna, scrub, massage. Mint tea is a nice touch.Only negative was we both got asked for a tip even though there are signs saying 'no tips' and owner specifically said not to tip. Just a pointer, take some clean underwear to wear after! We forgot and after having a nice scrub its not nice getting into the same underwear again!!

Excellent. Me and my husband visited today it cost £270 dh for wash steam room scrub and seaweed. The best hamman by far ive had many in greece turkey and morroco. They have a strict no tipping policy although I was still asked and they said shh although I policy said no. Well recommended by far. The owner is great and speaks fluent english and is is more than happy to help with any directions or advice you may need

Good hammam. The price of this hammam is very good according to others and the service is great..Instead is recommend to take your own bikini top with you, because they will give you a kind of slip, but afterwards everything is topless (what I personally did not really appreciate..)

Could have been amazing but.... My wife and I stopped in and chatted with the owner for a bit and he was very nice and the place was beautiful. We both decided on the "standard" package which was 270DH (~ 33.75USD). A bit high for a hammam but this is a "Luxury" place, so hey, why not. Plus, the owner pointed out that they have an explicit no tipping policy as they factor it all in to the price, a policy confirmed by the presence of signs posted almost everywhere in 4 different languages stating "No Tipping", a bit odd for Morocco but ok, great!Dropped some things off at the Road and came back for hammam. Upon return, the owner was out but that was fine. I paid for us both, 600DH, got back 50DH and was told they had to go make change and would give me the other 10DH when I got out, no worries. The Hammam itself was amazing, really really great. Awesome steam room, 3 rounds of black soap scrub/exfoliate/massage with cool shower in between. Absolutely incredible for 1.25hrs, I felt great!Upon leaving but before getting dressed, when were both in nothing but barely a half towel, however, my guy stopped me and whispered "mister, may I have a little tip for me?" All of a sudden what was an amazing experience got really uncomfortable. I looked at him confused and slowly shook my head and pointed to the signs and said "I can't, there's signs everywhere." He whispered "yes I know but please just a little." And I still shook my head no pointing to the signs. That's a -1 right there. Then he held a finger to his lips and whispered "ok but shhhh, please not tell I ask for tip". Super awkward. That's another -1.Got dressed, went out and had some tea while waiting for my wife. Upon leaving I didn't even ask for my remaining 10DH. I feel like the whole situation wouldn't have even happened if the boss was there. A brief chat with my wife afterwards confirmed a similar experience, albeit not so aggressive and secretive.Overall it was an amazing experience that was really soured in the end. I have no problem tipping and its generally the Moroccan way to tip for everything, but this place is very explicit about not doing so, especially since I was asked to keep it quiet that he even asked.

Great! . We asked for a quick tour first and liked what we saw. Had a lovely scrub, steam, mud wrap and massage here. Well looked after and yes ladies do wear disposable knickers but who wants to get mud or oil over their own clothes? Some of the reviewers on here seemed to think it would be like Champneys and were disappointed but the oils and massages are just as good and less than half the price. Unlike other reviewers, I saw the holdall again at the end and got to wear my robe whilst I did my makeup and sorted my hair out. We both came out feeling refreshed and very very clean. They gave us lovely mint tea to hydrate us and we played with their very cute dogs who were delighted to see us! If only there were more Hamman like this in the UK. Overall very good!

sucio / sucia / ruido. first time in Marrakech went to bahya palace met some one who gave me the address i visited it looks nice from outside i bought my ticket i went in i was shocked with cold sunna and stinky shower was cold too the water was blocked the table of scrab was full of oil that stops the scarab to come out the glove was been used many times that is dangerous it can transfer illness then massage comes beginning was ok the massage but some one keeps open the-door and shouts at the stuff i did not understand what he was saying but i got the clue that he was asking my masseur to hurry up it;finished and my man asked me for tips âind extra money it was no good,bad experience i took a taxi in-front of the hamam the taxi driver asked me about it i told him the hamam was not good and worthy for the money he told me about another hamam hilton that was super nice,same price but good service went there on my last night never come back there first time and last time

The perfect Hamman experience!. First time to Marrakech and my first experience of a Hamman. Me and my good friend were suggested by our hotel reception to attend here, which we did. Of course, we're glad we did too. For our first hands on experience, I can say it was worth the money. Felt totally relaxed and my skin was soft like a baby bottom, literally:-).Management ensured we were well looked after and spoke english, unlike his employees. However it didn't matter, as everyone was very polite and seemed hard working. Would recommend this place to anyone, especially with the fact that we went back for another Hamman before we left Marrakech.

Tourist Hamam. Warm welcome by English speaking front of house.I paid 270 Dirham for my experience.I was taken to a changing room which was very near the reception desk and put my belongings in a very rickety locker.Based on a previous T.A. I made sure that I only took enough money for my immediate needs.I was lead to the steam room where the mud was applied and left to steam.I think I was left in the steam for about approx 10 mins,I think if you could speak French then you might be able to stay in longer,which would have been better.I was given a massage which was enjoyable,but it was very 'lightly done' I think I was lucky as it was not to busy,as it is quite a small place.When I was getting changed I was not harassed for a tip,but I think this was due to how busy it was.This was not the same experience I had in Instanbul,but it was definitely more than satisfactory.

Money stolen. We were with a group of 11 people in the hammam, 2 men and 9 women, it was a nice experienece, but afterwards we went out eating and while paying the bill all the women missed half of their money, in total 300 euros, we are afraid one of the people working there has a masterkey of the lockers and got into the lockers! It was late already and we left the day after early so not worth to go to the police! But be warned, dont leave money in these lockers!

Wonderful experience. I took my 3 children aged 12, 11 and 9. The youngest is a boy and he was allowed to be with us girls. I went because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and was not dissappointed. My boy did not want to take his clothes off but Razlan (not sure about the spelling) was great with him. He eventually ageed to go in with his swimming trunks on and had so much fun he was asking afterwards, when we could go again. Razlan amused him with water fights and let him help with my massage as well as massaging him. The environment is warm and steamy and totally relaxing (even with my son there). The staff were lovely. My two girls had never had a massage before and were awed by the whole process, and being treated to such a great experience. All the children loved the steam room. Being oiled, soaped and washed down was also wonderful. My hair was washed too, which I rather liked. This is a genuinely worthwhile activity whilst in Marrakech.. You will enjoy it at the time and feel great afterwards.

Traditional Hammam for Tourists. Definitely worth a visit during your stay in Marrakesh. Prices are listed on their website. I called to make a reservation for 2pm on a Monday, but it wasn't busy. Please note that only male masseuses are available on the male side of the hammam.

Relaxing. I was in \Marrakech for a few days and wanted to experience a Hammam. Zani is situated in the Medina, the Hammam is good, I took the 270 drm package that included a massage for 1 hour. It was excellent. They give you a towellling robe,towel, wrap and and a private locker for your clothes and possessions. Well worth the visit and if I am back in Marrakech I would be happy to re-visit Zani Hammam.

Really good. We really wanted to experience a hammam in Marrakech and quickly realised how much they vary. Some just don't feel right and others are tourist rip offs. We found 2 which were both brilliant in different ways. This is a proper hammam. Women and men are seperate. I had a shower, was oiled up and sat in the steam room. Then it was onto the table for a massage. After the heat of Marrakech I came out feeling so refreshed. I thoroughly recommend this place. I notice that other reviews have mentioned the 'no tips' sign and also stated that their masseur asked for one. You're in Marrakech - everyone wants your money! Just tell them you've seen the sign. They can't pressure you too much as you're only wearing a towel.

Definitely go here.... My wife and I were looking for a genuine hammam experience, after having a great one in our hotel (kenzi farah)...I researched lots if them and settled for Ziani...which I'm pleased about...We asked our taxi driver to take us here, and he tried to talk us out of it, and recommend a better one, as apparently Ziani didn't offer massages!We insisted that we knew what we were doing and didn't want to go anywhere else but here...he reluctantly agreed.As you enter, we were greeted by an enthusiastic guy, who showed us how the experience would map out, I was shown the men's area and my wife had a lady showing her the female area.I paid 700dhm for both of us and the experience began.I was given a sarong, and walked through to the sauna...left for a few minutes until a guy came in and started putting black gel soap on me...all the guys spoke good English, he did this and then I was left for about 10 mins...then taken to a marble block and scrubbed...soooooo good...all the dead skin...so much even thought I'd had a scrub the day before!Then a shower and massage...I could have had a seaweed wrap, but opted for an extended massage.Great experience...once it was all over I showered and went back out for nice mint tea...and relaxing.My wife had the same experience although she opted for the seaweed wrap...and apparently the women are given small disposable underwear.I have to admit, this was great...a really good experience in a hammam that must be only a couple of decades old...However..the massage, although good, did not surpass the amazing one I had at the hotel.Definitely go here as top of the list of hammam to visit...

Traditional Experience. We went to the Hammam Ziani following a trip to the desert. What an experience! I've used spas in the UK and been to Turkish baths but nothing prepared me for this. Total relaxation.Steam room, followed by a scrub (to get that desert sand out of every pore!), then a wash, then a mud wrap back in the steam room, followed by another wash. It was incredible. I felt absolutely brilliant.

Good experience. After reading the review I thought I will give it a go. It was a good experience and for the price I think it is worth it. There was a bad a bad odour in the massage and shower are May be it was just that day I'm not sure. I was told no tips but the masseuse did ask for a tip and feeling sorry for him did give something for his effort as I felt this probably make a large part of their salary. I would recommend it as an experience once because of the price to try a hammam out and then it would be individual choice after that.

Very good first time hamam experience!. Hamam Ziani was the first hamam I experienced, ever. I went to a handful during my time in Morocco and I think this was the best place to start. In my opinion, it was geared toward tourists but at a very reasonable in price. 270 Diram for a steam, massage, and scrub. The whole thing was about 1.5 hours. I love spas, spa treatments, massages, scrubs etc. and like a good deal. This was good and a good deal. You start with a lady who takes you to a locker room. I was wary of leaving my things in the locker, but they gave me the key to carry around with me and I just went with the flow of things. There are lots of detailed reviews about what exactly happens - but essentially a very warm and welcoming lady will take you from station to station, and you will be met by another lady who will tell you to sit, stand, lay down, turn over, etc while they work their magic. While I like the whole thing, the scrub really stands out. I mean they scrub you, every bit of you, and remove the top layer of skin. The scrub was actually more gentle here than at more traditional local hamams and still made me out-of-this world soft and smooth. Pros:1. Warm, welcoming staff. I was as comfortable as possible, being led around to the stations, having buckets of water poured on me, or being told to climb onto a big, slippery massage table in front of several other ladies - and with not much on!2. Great scrub without being too harsh or being to tentative. Perfect for your first hamam experience. Love that squeaky clean feeling.3. Very relaxing lounge, with good attention to detail. Hot tea, lotions, and a hair dryer were available at the end. I have long hair, and really appreciated the hair dryer. 4. Felt pampered - so much that I went back for another round just before we left Marrakesh5. Everybody has the same covering, provided by the hammam. (in more traditional ones you go with your own undergarments, which can be awkward if you are not prepared!)Cons:1. Men have a very different experience - less relaxing, and much more awkward. My BF got hit on (he didn't think it was as funny as I did!) but his massage guy told him he was "very sexy" and "I like you" over and over. 2. The men's tipping situation is a bit much - on my side, the lady was more discrete. But on the men's side, they sat there with their hand out and asked "tip...? tip....?!"If not for the men's section, I would give it 5 stars. Tips:1. I didn't think the additional seaweed wrap did much for me; not worth it. I would rather come back and do the normal package twice for a bit more.2. Make a late evening appointment - less crowded and you will probably be tired from exploring all day. 3. Don't eat just before you go; give yourself at least an hour or so to digest since you will be laying on your stomach, and flipping over several times.4. Be prepared for the lack of covering - on yourself and everybody else5. The front desk guy speaks English, but many of the ladies don't. Just follow them, the answers to whatever questions you have will be obvious soon enough.

Hammam Ziani Marrakech. very nice hammam experience. completely as described in other positive reviews. Women felt they were even more pampered than men. not hard to find , pleasant ten minute walk through souk from jama el fna in direction of palace

Definitely worth a visit... I have been travelling through maroc for nearly 3 months now & visited local hammams, I arrived in marrakech to meet a friend & we decided to visit a more traditional hammam over the many european 'spa' hammams... it was fab, authentic products used and an absolute bargain... full exfoliation, eucalyptus steam,massage,soap wash & hair wash... slippers, sarong etc all supplied. .at NO point were we asked for a tip... we were offerred water & fruit prior to our hammam (no extra charges). The women were friendly, the service excellent. I would recommend here..traditional hammam but a huge step up from the local village ones.... we thoroughly enjoyed our time here...

Family hamman including children. First day in Marrakech, us and our three boys Inigo 11, otto 8 and Ruben 2. Boys were quite stressed by craziness of the square and motorbikes driving through the narrow streets of the souk. Bring on Ziani and his team at Ziani Hamman. Arrived inside to a sweet cup of mint tea! Lush red velvet sofas and fossils in the walls. My wife went off for a quite relaxing hamman. My three boys and I went into the men's Hamman. Great fun as four men guided us through steam room, lit with blue and yellow light beams through the domed roof. Then a body scrub to scrape away the dirt from our journey. Slowly the stress of arrival was massaged away, whilst one of the guys entertained my two year old with water play, and gentle massage. Ending with an almond wash. Inigo chilled out completely and the souk and busy streets no longer worried him. Otto however laughed the whole way through, didn't realise how ticklish he was! Thanks for looking after us, all the best Jonathan (by the way only 270 dirhams each, Ruben was free!)

Don't waste your time and dirhams. I've been to this hammam before, last year in fact. The standards have dropped to a degree that the only function in this establishment is for the employees to demand a tip for poor service. The management states no tips, but that goes over the head of the employees. I guess you get what you pay for. If the management had better quality staff, one would not feel offended by requests to be tipped. Try somewhere else, I did.

Not one for the prudes. I would recommend a hammam from this place. They had a lovely waiting room with plenty of moroccan tea to relax you whilst you wait before being taken to the baths. The normal deal is 270 dirhams which pays for scrubbing, a massage, robes, disposable underwear and such. For 350 dirhams you got to be slathered in seaweed mix and wrapped up in plastic (quite unnerving when I first saw someone lying like that - looked a bit like a body bag...) We opted for the more expensive option, how often do you get to do a moroccan hammam?I have to say. They give you sarongs to put on to cover your modesty but this is removed pretty much as soon as you go into the baths so don't get too attached to it. Throughout the experience I may as well have been totally naked which, normally around my best friend and around total strangers I would not be okay with, for some reason in this setting I felt pretty comfortable.The overall experience felt like I was assaulted by large women who I couldn't understand, scrubbed raw, oiled up, slathered in some dark stuff and then wrapped up in plastic to steam. Generally quite confusing but it was great, I felt so relaxed after and my skin was so smooooooth.Definitely not for the faint-hearted but worth a go if you want a good hammam experience!

Good, clean fun!!. Having done some prior research before our trip we thought that Hammam Ziani sounded like a good bet. We didn't want a luxurious experience in a Riad but wanted something more traditional without being too basic and I think that is pretty much what we got. I don't want to spoil the fun by detailing exactly what happens step by step but it was a fabulous and funny experience that myself and my 3 friends thoroughly enjoyed and one I would highly recommend.

Great find. Came across this Hammam whilst sightseeing. Have wanted to have a go at this for a few years now and it was a great experience.Friendly introduction with a tour of the Hammam and free Berber tea prior to us making up our minds. I'm male and the females do have a slightly different experience (so I'm told by the wife!) but just as good.You are allocated a member of staff who makes sure you cover all of the steps so don't worry about not knowing what to do. Hang your modesty up at the door. They do not recommend using bathing trunks as the oils stain these and they provide you with a sarong to cover your bits. You were also allocated a locker for your possessions which was fine. The whole experience lasted just short of 2 hours. Initially you have a shower, followed by a steam (sitting higher gives more heat and they did ask whether I wanted it cool or hot and more steam was added) with an initial soaping, the steam room was an old domed building with covered holes in the ceiling to let light in, seemed quite authentic. I would have preferred longer in the steam room but I guess they need to get people through the lengthy process.I then took a further shower before the "black soap" and baby mitt were used to get rid of surface grime and muck. This is like being scrubbed with a light scouring pad! but it does ensure that you are thoroughly clean.Then follows another shower before your top to toe (literally) massage, they don't miss anything. I've had a couple of massages before which haven't done much for me really but this was the first time I've had a male masseur and there is definitely a difference, much better from a personal perspective, really got into the muscles.After the lengthy massage there is a further soaping down with what smelled like almond oils and plenty of foam, prior to a final shower.Like others, although I was told that there was no tipping I was asked, and the chap did stand just outside the changing room whilst I rummaged around trying to find change which was a little awkward.The next day we were walking past the Hammam again, and when we said that we had been in the day before we were offered to go in for free Berber tea again, which I thought was very excellent customer service.Overall a really good experience, and I would use them again, but not perfect.

we took advice from another TAdvisor reviewer. and had a great experience at this hammam, one of many vying for tourist patronage. We do not have a comparison, but Zania was indeed clean, reasonably-priced and inclusive (they provide everything, including disposable underwear, and there are no additional charges), and the staff were competent and attentive. We'd heard from some who had patronized other hammams that the traditional scrub could be quite vigorous, that the steam could be too warm, etc., so we asked many questions of the owner (excellent English) before we committed. It was a worthwhile two hours of relaxation and a refreshing cultural experience. The Hammam Zania is just off the Place des Ferblantiers, but is not difficult to find from most points in the medina. We would definitely visit again.

Totally rejuvenating!. Oh my gosh - quite simply the most amazing experience you will have had! This is absolutely authentic as it gets. The locals come here so if you're after spa-type music tinkling gently in the background and rose petals strewn about the place, this won't be for you! The place is clean and functional - it won't win any prizes for a spa-like ambience (have a Hammam in your hotel if this is what you're after). Yep - you'll need to leave your modesty at the door (as well as your clothes - you are given a pair of very small disposable knickers! Be reassured male and females are separated) but these ladies have seen one, so they've seen them all. The staff are thorough with all the treatments (soap,exfoliation,buffing, washing) and as for the massage...it is 40 minutes or so of utter bliss. The only regret I have about the whole thing is that I had to go out for a special dinner that night - I felt I wanted to go back tot he hotel, wrap up in a robe and slippers and generally just chill out. It's a unique experience for sure!

Buffed as a new penny . I share Rich R's view, the experience of the girls in our group differed distinctly from us men. The steam room never quite was hot enough, there were three beds in each massage bay meaning you must negotiate your way around the other clients and masseuses as you take the frequent trips to the showers. On the cool side which isn't great when you're trying to relax and a bit dark & steamy, but not in a comforting way. For most of the time the music wasn't playing so the only sounds were shuffling bodies, scrubbing, muffled Arabic voices and the sounds from the street outside. The scrubbing and massage cover a full 98% of the body, so this is no place to be if you're prudish. On the plus side, the whole place is clean, the showers are past their prime but they work perfectly well and the front of house staff we very welcoming and helpful. There are secure lockers for which you keep the key. In the moments when you feel comfortable enough to relax the scrub and massage are good and "thorough", but don't expect a comparable level of relaxation that you might experience from a spa massage. The "no tips" policy displayed on numerous signs did not prevent my masseuse from inviting me to compliment on the experience in the corridor and hassling me "for a small chip" on the way out, then hanging around the entrance to the changing area whilst I opened my locker for money. Awkward!!

Relaxing hammam. Be warned - this is not something to d if you are prudish!I was on a short break to Marrakech with 2 of my friends. One of them had found out about this through Trip Advisor and it sounded like what we wanted. We didn't fancy braving the public hammams and even though our hotel had a Clarins Spa in it - we wanted to try something authentic. Make sure you plan your route before leaving your hotel as you will be hassled if it looks like you are lost. We stopped once to consult our map and "the most trustworthy guy in Marrakech" told us that it was shut. We decided that we would carry on and another shop keeper directed further down the road to it. It's opposite a car park which is a good marker to keep an eye out for! The owner speaks good English and lets you have a little look around before you make a decision. This was a Christmas treat from one of my friends so I'm not sure on price but we went for the scrub and wrap. They give you a bag which has a sarong and disposable knickers and you can lock your belongings away - some of the lockers have seen better days so we all put our stuff in one locker in the end. You walk through the door and the steam hits you - your sarong is whipped away and you are basically naked so make sure you are with good friends! In the womens' section you are guided about by big motherly-type ladies who direct you about - they are not phased by anything! You get washed, steamed, scrubbed, massaged, wrapped, and washed again. The steam room (and also where you lay in your wrap) is a beautiful domed room. We went on a Monday around 12pm - it wasn't busy but as I was laying in my wrap a group of ladies did have to step around me to sit on the seats - however I think it was more awkward for them clambering over me with disposable knickers on!! The final wash and shampoo could have been a bit longer - however its with Argon oil (I think that's right!) which leaves you feeling super soft for the rest of the day. My hair was silky smooth as well which I didn't expect.Overall this place is a good place for tourists to visit to get a lovely relaxing experience - I would recommend it!

What an experience!. My partner and I heard about this hammam from a local person when we got to chatting. I had my first Hamman and totally enjoyed it, the massage was WOW!I had looked at other places that were a bit "iffy" that actually cost more! This place was clean and well run! Jean Luc runs a "tight ship" ... Just try it.I went the next day for a second time, before leaving Marrakech.

Spotless relaxing hammam. Looking for a spa in Marrakech look this one up. It is a short walk from the main square. The staff are all friendly and the clean environment means you can just relax and unwind in this traditional way. The scrub, massage and steam will leave you feeling relaxed, clean and revitalised. NOTE - there is no tipping here. The price you are given is the price you pay and given how reasonable it is it is excellent value and well worth a trip. GETTING THERE? From the Café Paris on the main square. Take the road at the side of this café and keep walking straight. You will meet a slight junction carry straight on. It is 6 - 10 mins on the left hand side.

Nice place. At Hammam Ziani, the service was very good and attentive, the treatment was so relaxing after a walking day in the souk !!!All in all it was a pleasant experience for a very good price.Definitively to be recommended.

A very good value. It was my first hammam experience, and I really enjoyed it. I did the 270 dh package that included the scrub down and massage. They were quite busy when I got there, but I only had to wait a few minutes and I didn't feel rushed through any step of it, which was nice. It lasted the full 1 hour and 20 minutes as I was told it would. The massage was amazing, though the shampooing could have been a little more extensive because it was just a quick wash through. The scrub down was great - I've never felt cleaner! They had a hair drier that I used afterwords. My belongings were locking in an individual locker and I had the key around my wrist the whole time, so I wasn't worried about anything being taken. I'd say this is a great option for someone wanting to try out a hammam but not yet ready to brave a public one on their own.

1st Visit to a Hammam. This being our first time in Morocco we chose this Hammam as it appeared quite traditional. The price quoted on the website was 120dm but appartnely this is the "Casablanca" price and we were charged 200dm. The staff were friendly & courteous. We were made to feel comfortable. I arrived with some trepidation - the thought of parading around in paper knickers (I had read the previous reviews) was not paticularly appealing. I was immediately put at ease and did not feel nearly as uncomfortable as I had thought I would - this was largely due to the genuine nature of the staff. My advice is "give it a go" It was pleasantly relaxing and a lovely experience.My husband also enjoyed the experience (male & female treatments are done separately). There is a strict no tipping policy.

Hammam Zianni. Fabulous place to get a decent massage ( Arabica was excellent) and gommage steam wash etc.Having tried local Hammam and then western spa style Hamman I would recommend this as the best and the prices are very good. A 270dr will get you cleanse and hour long massage and 380 will get you massage, gommage (scrub) steam, mud wrap and massage. Very friendly and excellent first toe dip into Moroccan Hammams.

From a man's perspective - it was ok but far from paradise.... Let's say I think the woman get a far better deal than the men regarding facilities. After attending the Hammam myself I can confirm a number of the comments from other reviewers.Let me say first of all though that the guy who took care of me in the Hammam with the scrub and massage was great. If it wasn't for him the experience may have been very different. However......Steam room was steamy however felt quite cold, and don't let them take you out from it after only a minute, give yourself a good 8-10 minutes.Showers were in same room as the people getting massaged, quite a distraction.Showers started with a dribble and didn't get much better, didn't even get hotter than luke warm.Woman get beautifully doused in warm water from their masseuse, men just take a shower.If it's busy you could have 3 other people getting massaged in the same room with you. There are two rooms close to each other so total of 8 people. There isn't even enough room to walk around the massage tables like this so it would get quite cosy and I would say, far from relaxing.The room for the massage and scrub is right next to the steam room and as a result these rooms are very humid and steamy too, and just a little cold as well.Oh, and one last thing, changing facilities were a bit uncomfortable. There was an enclave with lockers and a bench. Not so bad, however if you were stood in the wrong place then I'm sure that people at reception would see you. And when I was finished there was a very dodgy guy just sitting at the entrance monitoring things....a little weird and uncomfortable. In total, if you go knowing all this and not expecting more I'm sure you will enjoy, after all the place seemed clean enough and the masseuse seemed to know what they were doing. If you expect better then walk on by.....

Great place, ask for tagine place! . Well run place. Real massage none of that fluffy stuff! Like the no tips policy.Ask the owner about the tagine place down the road. It's next to le tajinia. No frills, tiny room, one tiny bench to sit on, no starters, no drinks, just bread and tagines which are cooking in front of the bench. Best tagines in the area at 25dh each! It's where the workers pass by and eat. Not suited for all!

So relaxing! You will feel scrubbed clean and refreshed. I ve been here before and it was just as lovely. I wanted my 2 boys to experience a true Moroccan hammam. Men and women are separate which was important for us. The surroundings are lovely. It's a little hard to find but easier if you go through the jama al fana way in between the cafe France and another restaurant just keep walking through the alley. It's near the Bahia palace . Very calm atmosphere and - strangely- old Indian song instrumentals which I knew all the words to! They take their time and the whole experience takes around 1 and 1/2 hours- well worth around £20 each. Would definitely recommend
