Best experience ever!. This was my first time in a proper Hammam and I was not quite sure what to expect. But after reading reviews and the wish to have a full Moroccan experience I thought I should go.We choose the Special, which included everything even a tea. It was the most relaxing experience I had in any spa experience so far.The ladies take their time and you get a good scrub and massage. Everyone was very friendly and you felt save and welcomed.I wish this was around the corner I would go every week.Prices are also the best I found in Marrakech.Thank you for this experience.

The perfect balance of public hamman and spa. Hamman Ziani is exactly what we thought it was and it gets an excellent rating because of that. It's not an upscale luxury spa, but you know that because of the prices, there are no illusions about this. It's also not a public hamman, but you know this too because of how it's advertised. This is exactly why we chose it! We wanted the 'public experience' but not the awkwardness of 'are we doing it right?', 'can we sit there?', which can take away from enjoying it and we didn't want to go to a spa, we can do that anywhere. It seemed like it would be the perfect balance and it was.We went mid-morning and there were only a handful of other women, my boyfriend was only with one other man on his side. You get soaped up, rinsed off and sit in the steam room (could have been a little hotter), then scrubbed, massaged (this was really fantastic, she was strong and it was like a deep tissue massage) and I opted for the clay wrap (covered in clay and wrapped in plastic in the steam room for about 20 mins, then shampooed. There were two locals there bathing, the women who worked there were friendly, they even sang a little bit, held my hand everywhere I went so I didn't slip and made it a great experience. My boyfriend had a nice experience too, although he was asked for a tip, even though it clearly says not to give tips. This and the steam room could have been hotter are my only complaints. The guy who runs it is very nice and genuine and told us about some places to go afterward, very helpful.

Enjoyable experience, reasonably priced. After being rinsed down I was left in the steam room to relax, then into another room for the scrub and rinse, the third room for massage, then back to the scrub room to be washed including hairwash. As we entered, another customer leaving, asked me how much I had paid - when I told her we paid the advertised price, she commented that we could have bargained the price down (didn't occur to me as it was a set pricelist, however I was happy with the amount we paid as it was a fraction of the cost of any similar treatment at home).The ladies' side is traditional, with attoendants pouring water over you but my son reported that on the men's side, you just get under a shower - the men's side also has just the two treatment rooms, one for steam and the other for the scrub the massage and the shower. It was a relaxing experience, and we came out feeling squeaky clean.As commented by another reviewer previously, we were also handed baskets with fluffy towels and robes etc as we entered the hammam and these were whisked away quite quickly, not to be seen again. However we were provided with a dry robe and towel at the appropriate time and the attendants have all the products they need on hand. I am not particularly bothered whether the contents of the basket are themselves actually used, but feel it is an unnecessary step to provide customers with a basket if it is only for show. Once you hit the changing rooms you are given some disposable undies, plastic sandals and a cotton wrap that you only wear for the few steps walk into the steam room. You put your clothes in a locker, and the key on elastic band stays on your wrist throughout. The wrap is taken away within 2 minutes of you putting it on, and the rest of the visit takes place wearing the paper pants and the sandals. Be careful as the floors are very slippery, At times you are sloshing through an inch or two of water in the plastic sandals they provide for you to wear, but the attendants keep a firm grip on you as you're escorted from room to room. There are male attendants for men, and women attendants for women. There is a small lounge area to rest after your treatment and mint tea is available there - I noticed a hairdryer and mirror there too in case you don't want to walk back to your Riad with wet hair as we did, but these would have been better placed in the changing rooms.An enjoyable experience.

Highly overrated hammam. We made a reservation and still had to wait for half an hour. When we got in it was too crowded and we had to wait for one hour more in the sauna. Then this group of people were going for their turn. It was not relaxing although the ladies did their best with the massage. The deskman only apologised and left. Not recommendable to visit for a quiet and relaxing hammam.

Nice experience. This was a lovley experience. All other reviews are spot on. The girl I had was wonderful at my treatment and Zianni was also very nice. Only one thing. We were each given a basket with what looked to be a nice fresh (dry) robe and towel. After I changed I never actually saw this basket of things again. I was handed a fairly damp scruffy robe and towel at the end and the basket with the rolled up fresh looking items was no where to be seen. I just wonder if it went back to the front display and I was given some not as nice looking.... It just made me think if the baskets at the front were just for show and then taken away to be replaced by the 'not so nice' robe and towel???? I did see anothe comment that might suggest a similar experience. It was nice that tips were included but my friend was actually asked for a tip on the mens side, but since he knew it was meant to be included he refused..... Still ...I would go back and perhaps make sure the basket of dry and clean towel and robe was available at the end.

Second visit - just as good!. My second trip to this hammam. This time I was with my 12 yr old daughter. She was understandably a little apprehensive about the semi-nudity, but this did not last long. The women treating us were so friendly and put her at ease. The hammam was very busy during this visit, so the pace of treatments was a little slower than previous visits, yet we never felt like we were left alone for too long. Nor were we rushed through any treatments. Definitely a fab place to relax and be pampered. Only thing that was lacking this time was mint tea at the end or someone available to ask for some. We just ended up sort of leaving!!! However, looking forward to my next visit in Feb 2014.

I love it here, you'll float out.. It's so good, I've been back.This is more of a authentic hamman compared to the many supposedly luxury spas and hammans in Marrakech.The owner speaks many different languages and is more than happy for you to have a look around without any pressure to purchase treatments.If you're uncomfortable with semi nudity in front of strangers, this isn't the place for you as all treatments take place in communal areas (separate areas for ladies and men)You'll be provided with everything you need, paper pants (I take my own bikini bottoms) sandals, modesty wrap (it's not on for long) towels, bath robes and lockers.Unlike other hammans, you'll be charged a price that includes tips for the staff, so you'll not be pressured into tipping (which can sometimes spoil the experience, especially if you're unsure how much to tip)The staff here couldn't be sweeter. The take great efforts to make sure you're comfortable, and genuinely look after you rather than some of the fake efforts I've experienced In the so called luxury spas as it's aimed at generating tips.Packages include, black soap wash, steam, scrub, massage and mud wraps. The top package includes all of the treatments and takes about 1 hour and 45 minutes all for 3500 dirhams which is exceptional value.You'll be given time to relax after your treatment with some mint tea, hair dyers are available too.You'll leave relaxed and scrubbed within an inch if your life.One of my favourite places in Marrakech, don't miss it.Make sure you take time to pet the owners cute dogs, Linda and Emily. Linda loves the attention.

Nice experience . Good massage, not as strong as some, but felt good. I left feeling very clean and refreshed. Hammam experience in general is probably not for the faint of heart, or the overly modest, but as long as you know what you're in for, it is wonderful.

great place definitely worth a visit. Relaxing treatment in the steam room, amazing massage that seemed to last forever. A must if you are visiting marakesh. The manager is the most helpful guy, advising where to go and how to get there. Very genuine. Would recommend to anyone wanting to unwind for a couple of hours. Very reasonable price. We chose the top package which included a seaweed body treatment. Worth every penny.
Great Value. After reading reviews on here decided to try. Great value compared to many other hammans. Lovely wash and massage. Definitely not for the prudish! !!

Great value, great experience. This is our first visit the Morocco and Marrakech. Before visiting the city, we had decided we wanted to do the Hammam Spa experience, but had read a few reviews of people having poor experiences, for one reason or another. We'd read about Hammam Ziana, and tried finding it, as per the location shown on this Tripadvisor app....NOTE: the location on the app is not correct by a long way! We had to do a google map search in the end.....after a "friendly local" who could see we were lost, offered to show us as he was going that way. He didn't, he lead us in a block then asked for money. Lesson learnt! However, once we'd found it, it was so worth the effort. We found it clean, welcoming and no pressure at all to book a treatment. The owner is more than pleased to just show you around and leave you in the relaxation room with a cup of tea. We decided to book the top package, which was 350 Dirhams each. We both found the treatments excellent, relaxing and outstanding value for money. Thank you so much.

Great experience but a bit awkward at times. This was a great Hammam and I would go there again. I had the 'super package' for 350MAD . On the super package you get the wash, the steam, the massage and the mudwrap and you definitely come out feeling super clean and chilled. It is incredible good value - under half the price of the spa in my Marrakesh hotel and probably a third of the UK price for the spa equivalent here. That said it is a hammam not a spa, you do need to be comfortable with public near nudity (gender separated but still public). The changing area is private and there is a secure locker to leave your things. You are given a pair of 'micro knickers' to wear, some plastic shoes and a wrap to walk into the hammam itself but once you are in there the wrap is taken away and as both the hammam ladies were busy I was left standing there a while feeling a little self conscious before my lady came to take me for my wash. Once you get started it is better and after the wash you are led to the steam room and left to relax for a while before the scrub. As others have said, the scrub is amazing and scary how much skin comes away! I had the same lady for all my treatments and she was very good, I have a shoulder injury which I explained to her about (in French, I don't think she spoke English, although I didn't try) and she was very careful to make sure that she didn't do anything to hurt it. the massage was excellent and helped ease out my aches and pains from the Camel ride a couple of days earlier, the warp was also good although getting up on to a marble slab covered with plastic when you have just had an oily massage is definitely tricky!I would definitely go back and would recommend Hammam Ziani but there were a couple of things that have stopped me giving this 5 stars. The first is that we popped by the previous day to make sure we knew where it was and decided we might as well book for the next day as we didn't have time to go ahead right then. The man on the desk (not Ziani) asked for a 100MAD deposit which I thought was unjustified as we were booking for a quiet time (early afternoon) and most people just turn up, also we weren't asking them to reserve anything for us - I've never been asked for a deposit for a beauty type service before and I thought it was a bit off.The other disappointment was that I was expecting the full Turkish bath type arrangement, with a series of 3 interconnecting dry hot rooms as well as a steam room, Hammam Ziani doesn't have any dry hot rooms, just the steam room.In summary though, great experience, good value for money compared with the Spa equivalent and a must do, especially if you have been foolish enough to go on a Camel ride :-)

Wish this hammam was available in the UK. Great visit to hammam ziani, the owner spent a few years in the US so appreciates great customer service (and speaks English!), great value for money, the ladies (and gents) in the hammam might not speak english but deliver a great scrub and massage. Recommended if you want to experience the closest possible experience (as a westerner) to the real thing without being Marrakchi.

Zaini hammam - Not good!. My experience was not good! i tried Zaini last week when i was in Marrakech for a few days. I wanted to try somewhere different as i have been to several Hammam's in Marrakech and i had read a couple of good reviews. I went late morning and was surprised to find the steam room was cold. They turned it on for me but it never got warm enough. For me one of the best bits of a hammam is the buckets of hot water thrown over you to rinse you after washing. At Zaini you go into a shower where the water drips out! it was very disappointing, it was no different to having a normal shower! Suffice to say I wont be going back unless they improve their operation.

Best thing in marrakech. Everyday I sit at home in London wishing Hammam Ziani was nearby to me. I would have done it everyday if I had the time. Fantastic experience (350dh for massage,hammam,seaweed wrap and mint tea). Both the owner and moroccan ladies were warm and inviting. I'm normally self conscious, but I forgot any issues I had as it was a beautiful experience. Thank you, and I'll be back

Beauitful experience . I visted ziani hammam in november as a solo female. I opted for the 350dh hammam. It involved the soap, steam room, massage and sea weed wrap. I was given disposable knickers, a sarong and robe. You are topless but you soon relax. The hammam its self is spotlessly clean, the ladies really put you at ease. I left after my mint tea feeling so calm! I will be going back in december when i return to marrakech! Beautiful experience!

Fantastic! Very hard to find!!!. I have been to a few hammams on my travels and Hammam Ziani is one of the best. I read an article about how amazing it was and was excited to try it out for myself. It exceeded my expectations by far and loved the experience. The owner is very welcoming and even provides a tour of the hamman, but the best part is he doesn't make you feel obliged to pay for a massage after it. Be aware it is very hard to find!!! Tripadvisor directions are wrong and led us to a different place, which is not even a hammam but a spa. Also as Hammam Ziani don't pay commission to the local Moroccans like other establishments they will be less willing to show you where it is. It is on Rue Riad Zitoun el Jdid and keep walking until you come to a car park. It is directly opposite it with the doorway right on the main road. I had the full package and the extra price was well worth it, getting extra time in the hammam and an hour long massage, absolute bliss. Couldn't recommend it enough!

An absolute must!. We visited marrakech in October and had a really great time. We had read reviews about Hammam ziani so had planned to go there. I must say that all the positive reviews are absolutely true. The hammam itself is large but pretty basic not exactly a sight for soar eyes. However the treatment is five star. We had the full works and it cost half of what it cost us at our hotel. The ladies fully dedicate their time and effort in making sure you have a good experience and the massage is out of this world. We came out feeling completely relaxed and pampered.

Wow!!!!. We were not recommended this hammam but decided to pop in whilst walking by one morning. The owner was really friendly and welcoming and offered us tea even though we were just looking around. We decided to return the following day and opted for the full scrub, massage and mud wrap.....we were not disappointed. The massage was amazing and we came out feeling super pampered and relaxed. A must for anybody visiting Marrakech.

Amazing Experience. Thanks Ziani. I visited Morocco in September 2013 and one of the must have experiences I was told was to have a hammam. I was spoilt for choice. However on taking a walk in the Medina, I passed by Hammam Ziani. The owner Ziani was by the doorway welcoming clients and he talked me through the experience. He also gave tips about Morocco on a whole even offering us the local tea even though we were not having a hammam at that precise time. I told him that I would be back and I am so glad that I kept my word, it was a fantastic experience and I have been recommending this place ever since. On entry, you get offered some local tea and then I was taken to the female section of the hammam. I took the super package which included the hammam and mud bath. I was first rubbed down in oil and taken to the steam room, then got scrubbed, massaged and after rubbed with mud and wrapped swaddle- like for some time so that it could all be soaked in. After I was bathed and got my hair shampooed. The staff were wonderful and treated everyone really well. The most amazing part of the experience was the full body massage as my limbs felt like jelly after. I was soooo chilled and relaxed.The overall time was probably an hour and a half and it was so relaxing it seemed longer. I left there feeling as if I were floating and my mind and body were totally relaxed.I will definitely go there again and am not tempted to try anywhere else after this amazing experience. They have repeat customers also as another European tourist told me that this was her third time there. Apparently, everytime she travels to morocco she goes there....and I thought to myself..yep that will be me :-)

Great experience. My husband and I went here on a midweek afternoon - it was quiet (only two other people there) and the service was brilliant. The ladies who run the women's side are definitely a couple of hard workers! The full package was a wonderful experience - i have seldom felt so thoroughly clean and relaxed - and I was only sorry we didn't have time to go back.

Serenity and bliss. I visited the hammam Ziani with 2 two girlfriends and our husbands and we loved it. I felt so clean and refreshed afterwards, the perfect antidote to the frenetic bustle and grime of the Marrakech streets. The owner, Ziani was most helpful in explaining the routine and also, afterwards, where we could go to buy products or enjoy great Moroccan cuisine. There was no pressure to buy and tips included in the price, so no pressure there either. We got the 350dh full package and it was worth every cent. The ladies on staff were good at their job and kind. You can tell they really care about giving you a memorable experience and they are not rough. The scrub was good, the massage was exactly the right pressure and the clay wrap was so Devine I nearly fell asleep. I have been to a public Hannam while in Morocco and that is a totally different experience. This is luxury. I also visited hammam Ziani in Casablanca and while it was a great experience too, I liked the Marrakech spa better. Mr Ziani provides attention to detail and service that makes this a must-visit destination when in Marrakech.

Heavenly!. We visited the Hammam Ziani in Friday as its supposed to be quieter and we had the place pretty much to ourselves. My two girlfriends and I were steamed, scrubbed, massaged and washed in a wonderful zombie like state. The super package is worth every penny. I highly recommend this place to anyone. The only thing I'd do different is book in later in the day after trekking around the souks - rather than visit first thing like we did. I'd go again tomorrow if I hadn't gotten sunburnt! :)

Good if you like a bit of pampering. My girlfriend and I decided on this after the reviews here.We were under no false illusions with what the decor or standard may be like. A lot of people on here seemed to be expecting a high end western spa for some unknown reason...The guy on the desk was a little pushy with the packages, we were sure we didn't want the scrub (my girlfriend was worried about the harshness) just the massage etc. We were led to through the various stages, where to undress, where to store our clothes etc.The steam room/sauna was fine, quite warm near the top and not so at the bottom if its not your thing you can sit low. The massage guy was very nice and the massage was nice, not too firm as to be painful. You then get a scrub afterwards which was nice. I'd probably recommend this as being more rewarding after a day of walking around then early like we did it. Still nice though.The massage went for quite a while, definitely more than the 30 mins we paid for. After which I was shown where to get dressed etc. I was NOT asked for a tip or even alluded to one at any stage by any staff member and neither was my girlfriend.Overall I'd recommend it, none of our stuff went missing as I've heard with other hammams, no bill variations and the people were nice. The place is super wet and slippery so make sure you wear the shoes they give you and take your time moving from room to room. I think the place was pretty clean, with all the water/soap/oil/steam you're hard pressed to see more than a few feet in front so people claiming it to be dirty must have better eyes than me.I'd agree if you're not comfortable with nudity/personal space it might not be for you. While during our session you weren't nude at all, just a towel/apron thing they do get quite close to certain areas during the massage which can feel a little weird! (Guys do guys, women do women) so guys, don't think you're getting a girl like Thailand/Bali etc. There was nothing dodgy though, everything above board etc so I had no problem with it and if you read up on Hammams you should already know this, might catch walk-in tourists off guard though.Overall, great way to spend an hour or more, whichever suits!

Best hammam in Marrakech . This has to be the best. Having tried lots while here and disappointed with so many other. Traditional male only hammam fantastic steam room under a dome. Well work making the effort for

Two times a charm. My trip to Marrakech was for my honeymoon. I originally planned to come here with my husband as I am an avid fan of hammams, especially if nude, as I have been raised going to Korean bath houses since I was a child. After reading reviews of pretty much being nude and having the best massages, I had to give it a go. The bonus is that Hammam Ziani is very easy to find as it is on the same street as the Palace Bahia, which was a bonus as it was not far from our riad. We first arrived on Saturday 21 Sept before 8pm. It was relatively quiet. We were greet warmly and immeditately given a tour despite saying it's ok we want to go in for sure. They were persistent so we don't get disappointed. My husband LOVED it. He had ZAGHIB (a slim man with glasses) and said despite it being powerful, he felt so relaxed and as if all his muscles and joints from our first two days of intense trips were all set in the right place again. Apparently, the men's section was virtually empty. I was led to the female room and it was pretty busy. If I recall they have 5 or 6 massage tables and three tables for scrubbing and bathing. I was bathed quickly and led to the hammam where one woman was. At first it was wonderful until nearly 25min later I am still there in the cold, with no steam, and clearly forgotten. Later I am fetched and scrubbed, but it was so gentle and with the steam long gone, my skin was not easily shedding. Next was the massage, which was very disappointing. Everything was on a set time and there was no focus on my aching feet or back. The back massage was painful and just that. After it finished, I was in more pain than when I came in. At the end, I was so disappointed and terrfied my husband had the same experience. I was wrong, thank goodness!What made it better is the willingness of the manager to get me to come back as my husband wanted to. I said I would go elsewhere while he went to Ziani. Instead, I was convinced to come back as I was told that I would be given a 30min massage for free. We missed our appointment on the following Monday due to a terrible day trip, but they easily re-scheduled us for our last day before our flight. I was given a great price to make up for the disappointment and my husband again was happy. He opted both times for the 350 Dirhams package. Our second time he has HASSAN. He said he was not powerful like Zaghib but was so detailed. He spent time on each aching point that my husband again was in heaven. What was consistent is the fact that both of his guys were very attentive and knew exactly where to massage more. It was busy again on the women's side, but this time it was better! ADIJA (sp?) is a young, round woman who bathed me properly making sure I was clean and lathered up before leading me to the hammam. I was given time in the hammam in the glorious steam. Adija came to get me and when she scrubbed. WOW! It was a massage and scrub in one. I would say she would be the female version of Zaghib with power. Literally my back that was hurting cracked when she scrubbed me and I felt so relieved! Plus the fact I was there for a second time and a lot of skin was scrubbed off means my first time was a waste. Afterwards, I was escorted by FATIMA, an older lady, who is supposed to be one of the best. She is the female version of Hassan. My hour massage with her was very relaxing. Maybe I could have done with more power, but with the amount of stress I face, I'd be in pain from all the reflexology. Instead, Fatima was so attentive and got so deep in my tissues that I felt relaxed. I wasn't cracked into place but I was massaged enough to feel relaxed, which is a difficult thing to do. Overall, I'd go to Ziani again. On our last day, we met Ziani. He lived in San Francisco for some time. I am from LA so that was a conversation starter. The best part though is when I told him of the night before and how I bonded with two of his dogs. When I mentioned them by name, his smile lit up and he asked me if I'd like to see puppies! YES! He truly loves his dogs. We were led to the back where I was immediately tackled by his friendly dogs and the cutest puppies ever. Marrakech is beautiful but I think Ziani's dogs made my trip because the puppies were too cute. My husband, who has allergies, even admitted that the puppies warmed his heart. Wonderful service from management. If you choose to go, for women request Fatima (if your muscles need relaxing) or Adija (if you really want to be cracked into place). For men, request Zaghib (like Adija) or Hassan (like Fatima).In all honesty for 350 Dirhams (£26) is a wonderful price. You are given a bathrobe and necessary items. Also it comes with hammam, scrubbing, 30min massage, 30min seasweed wrap, and washing. Instead of the seaweed wrap you can opt to extend your massage to a full hour.
Wonderful!. Very nice hammam, went there for the second time in a year. The man working there is very helpful and kind. The massage was great!!!!!! I really recommend this place!

Felt like I had died and gone to Heaven. Stumbled across this hammam with my 2 young adult daughters. Decided to experience it and wow - it was probably the best thing we did during our long weekend in lovely Marrakech. The owner is charming, very helpful and speaks fluent English. The experience was superb. We had the full treatment consisting of wash, scrub, steam and massage and it was nice for the 3 of us to have at the same time. It really was a superb experience - felt like I had died and gone to heaven. A really good value experience - 270 drms (about £20) each. Worth every penny. Don't be tempted by the 'spas' that you see around - this is a genuine hamman which is better.

Left me feeling zingy all over. As a 'Hammam virgin', I didn't really know what to expect, but this was a fun and worthwhile experience. Blokes strip off completely, apart from a little wrap around skirt thing, so be warned - you should not be squeamish about being near-on naked. First of all, one of the attendants washes you down with some black soap, and then you go into the sauna for 10-15 minutes. Afterwards, you are taken to have a quick shower, and then the treatment begins! You lie down on a table where you are scrubbed to within an inch of your life (gommage), with barely a square inch being left unscrubbed (again, having any hang-ups about getting up close and personal will seriously interfere with the experience!). After a complete layer of skin has been shred, another shower follows, followed by a massage. The package costs 270 dh (about £30), and ends with a glass of mint tea in a peaceful sitting area, which is good as I could hardly stand afterwards, and slept for 3 hrs when I got back to my hotel! I would definitely go back again if I visited Marrekech

Mixed feelings, not sure if it was really clean. The package takes an hour and a half, and is what most people do. It's sort of a public hamman, but lots of tourists go. I didn't think it looked so clean. From the filthy rug at the entrance, to the shower doors, walking in pools of water, a bit crowded, etc. No private rooms here, all community rooms. I didn't like that the massage guys were all talking and shouting with each other while people were getting massages. No quiet peaceful music, just a lot of talking. Kind of annoying. When you walk to/from the showers, you literally have to bump into someone's feet getting massaged. Not spacious at all. The scrubbing and massage were quite good, I suppose the price is reasonable, but I prefer something more luxurious, more like a spa rather than a public hamman.

Pampering at its best!. Read reviews about hammam Ziani most seemed very positive so decided to check it out. First time I have ever used a hammam. Ziani very welcoming and homely, guided us into his darkened fragrant abode with promises of mint tea which he did deliver. We were made to feel very relaxed, no pressure at all, we just soaked up the wonderful sensory pleasure of the lounge area and given our slippers, towels and robes and locker keys. Ziani's dogs are sweet and I am not a dog person but they took to me instantly. We settled on the full package costing 350 dirhams. His staff do not speak English and my French was gcse level 30 odd years ago! But we managed as best as we could. There was not one inch of me that was not scrubbed, I laid back and just thought of England. After a while you do relax and just slip into the warm velvety folds of bliss. I think I actually may have regressed to my childhood as the ladies do everything for you, they even guide you onto the rooms to stop you shooting out of the door from all the oil and mud on you. All my british prudishness went out the window and you find yourself in a state of euphoria as all control is taken away from you, just enjoy the moment. The massage with argan oil was incredible, I did think they may have been pressing too hard at one point as I could hear things cracking, however pain I had been suffering in my back and neck was relieved immediately.the massage they do seems to be a mixture of shiatsu, reflexology and general massage, the smells are wonderful. Be prepared to be massaged front and back, you can cover some modesty with a pair of paper knickers, little did I care, I enjoyed the whole experience especially the hair washing, head massage and being scrubbed with almond soap. We relaxed after this awesome session with more mint tea and chatting to the owner.he does not encourage tipping...but do what your heart tells you if you feel it is right. These women have magic fingers and can caress your cares away. I would go back again, there are probably more spa like ones, but for those on a budget price was pretty good and ziani makes that experience even more special with his warm welcome. This hammam comes highly recommended!

A nice experience. This was my first time in an Hammam but I can say that Ziani Hammam is a very nice place. Inside there are kind ladies that provide to give you all the stuffs you need (flip flop, slip and towel) and they take care of you for about one hour and half. I spent 200 dhiram for scrub, massage, turkish bath and body and hair wash. Before leave the hammam they offer some mint tea in a pretty room. Advised!!

relaxing day. I was directed by my tour guide to this hamam and was a bit sceptical but once our group was inside the perception changed. we were taken to a lounge with big comfortable sofas and offered Moroccan tea and cold water as it was 45-50c outside. we were well looked after and didn't have to take anything with us, not even a towel and soap. the sauna and massages were very good as we had the superior package and included everything in the hamams offering. After our session the ladies were not 100% happy with the massage so the owner offered a free same session the next day.The next day we also took the kids(8 of them) and they all enjoyed it also. the owner of the business was very welcoming and entertained the kids while we were waiting for the ladies which took them nearly a hour longer than us.All in all a good experience and worth the money.

Good massage but could be cleaner. We were staying in a Riad minutes away from this Hammam and went there this week. We (me and two other men - they have a separate women's section) took the 270 Dirham package (about £22) for which you get soaped and sit in the steam room for about 10 mins; then scrubbed down hard followed by a nice long massage and a wash down. in between each stage, you need to shower in a cubicle. If you have never been to one before, a visit to a hammam in marrakech is a must. The massage we got was very good but: (a) the boys doing it asked for a tip even though there are notices against tipping - they are mostly young students; (b) the place is not the cleanest and showers not the best; (c) they loofah they used for the scrub came out of a new sealed pack but I do wish they used several of them - one second he was scrubbing my heels and toes and the next he was on my face and shoulder with the same loofah - and the loofah does touch your nether areas as well. Ziani, the owner, is a good salesman and you can negotiate if you a group. Also, two of his dogs keep you entertained (although, not in the massage, shower area!). Do go to this place if you are on a budget as there aren't many that give you this quality of massage. But if you are looking for a calm, serene surrounding with nice clean, white interiors and marble all around - this is definitely not the place. The soap they use has an earthy smell that is not to everyone's taste (after smelling me when I came out, my wife changed her mind of trying it!). Most other places that are cleaner, better would cost 400+ DHS. Be prepared to get butt naked - I saw some men wearing their pants (that's underwear in British English!) but we chose not to and it was fine...

I felt cleaner and pretty :). I read about this Hammam place on Tripadvisor and wikitravel before I went to Marrakech. I wasn’t too sure if the place would be good as the entrance seemed a little dingy. But as you step inside it is a hug sitting area behind with is a bigger bathing area. There are separate section for men and Women. The hammam takes around 90 minutes. They provide you with towels and robes with some moisturizers for after the hammam. They ladies are very polite and friendly, since this was my first experience I was feeling a bit weird but she made me feel very comfortable and at ease. They start off with the cleansing process and use some kind of mud paste to scrub your body. Once done they take you to the steam room, then they give you a nice and very relaxing hot oil body massage (which I wished lasted forever!) and then there is shampoo it get rid of all the oil. The experience was worth the price. After the Hammam you are served hot lemon and mint tea to complete the relaxing process . Would suggest don’t go there after a heavy meal like what one of my friends did 

As long as you're happy being naked it is wonderful!. Our riad recommended this place and it was a really nice mix of luxury but not too touristy. We had the cheaper package which was about 270 dirham and included hammam, scrub, massage. I felt utterly wonderful and like jelly afterwards which was such a nice change as we'd spent days wondering around the busy and sometimes a little bit hectic souks. The women who did me and my friend didn't speak any English but this wasn't a problem at all, as they know the basics ('turn over') so if you essentially let them turn and flip you around then language thing isn't a problem. I would describe this place as rustic. If you're looking for 5 star tourist luxury this isn't it, but you can get those in London, you come here for something that feels a bit more authentic and is pretty good value too. On a slightly odd note - their mint tea was the nicest I tasted in Marrakech! I haven't had this style of treatment before, so the fairly sudden change from fully clothed to being almost completely naked, wandering between rooms and being rubbed from toes to earlobes was a bit of a shock to me at first, hence be prepared to be naked, but also be prepared to have a lovely relaxing time.

A good experience. This was our first time in a hammam, the staff did a good job, cleaning and massaging us.They have a lovely area to relax and have some tea in after the whole experience.Highly recommended, it's a real treat.

Best Massage. I had never been to a hammam, and once I got over how different it was from American massages and spas, I had a good time! Excellent massage for a wonderful price. Would definitely recommend Ziani's to everyone! He is quite nice too! He saw us on the street the next day and invited us in again for tea.

Wonderful place.. After reading lots of reviews of hammams in Marrakech we decided Hammam Zani was the one for us. A bit more luxurious than the local places but much better value than some of the higher end places. We went for the biggest package and i went for the mad pack and my husband went for the extra massage time. The price was 350 dirham each. I'd suggest go early in the day, we were the first in there and so it was just us in both the male and female areas for a long time. It isn't for the body shy. I was in just some small paper knickers and my husband in a little towel. You keep slipping the shoes they give you on and off. You need them as it can get very slippy. I had an amazing soaping, steam, scrub, massage, mud pack and then wash off. The amount of dead skin that came off was amazing. Afterwards we both felt amazing and would love to return. The owner is very nice and keen for people not to tip.
Felt like a baby!. Scrubbed, Sauna'd, Steamed, Massaged, Oiled, Hair washed. Indulged ourselves with the luxury treatment, the works! A great treat!

Where traditional hamam meets high end spa... My husband and I visited one morning during our trip in Marrakech and had the full package for approximately £35 each, consisting of a soaping, steaming, scrubbing, massage and seaweed wrap. They have separate sections for men ad women and we both found the staff professional and thorough. The establishment was clean and well organised with complimentary mint tea served at the beginning and end of the package. We met the owner who was very friendly, he also gave us some advise about where to eat and what to see durin our stay. Thanks Zianni! Will definitly be back!!

Massage your cares away. Ziani is an amazing place to experience a truly authentic Marrakech hammam. The washing and scrubbing are cleansing and the massage is superb, firm and relaxing. Your cares just melt away. I would have no hesitation to recommend a visit and the cost resonable to boot.

Hidden luxury. This what exactly what we needed after strolling around. The staff were very welcoming and friendly even though some did not speak english. The treatments were amazing they left us feeling so good and we were definitely taken care of as we were given special green teas.

Blissful hammam experience. My friend and I flew home this Thursday, 23rd May, having decided that a pre-flight visit to a hammam would be a jolly way to wind up our wonderful holiday. We settled for Hammam Ziani and were not disappointed. We did not want the usual spa experience with its inflated prices and sometimes snooty therapists and this traditional hammam was a world away from that. We rather tentatively stepped into the small entrance where we were immediately made to feel welcome by the manager - there was no hard sell, just an explanation of what treatments were available. We discussed them with him over a glass of mint tea and settled for the very reasonably priced two hour deluxe package. We were then collected by our respective therapists, charming and caring women who took us to change and showed us where we could lock away our belongings. We were then given some outrageously small g-strings to wear, much to our amusement. There followed two hours of steaming, scrubbing, massaging with oils and hair washing before we were wrapped in towelling robes and given a towel to dry our hair. This was followed by relaxation in the traditional sitting room, where we sipped our mint tea before leaving with a spring in our step and a great sense of wellbeing.A word or two of caution:1. Although there is a 'no tipping' sign up, a woman who appeared to be in charge came and asked for a tip at the end of the session 'for the girls.' I had no objection to tipping my therapist - she worked incredibly hard on my behalf, but I was concerned that she may not have got a share of the money I handed over.2. Beware of the wet and slippery marble floors. Never move away from the massage tables without immediately putting your hammam shoes back on - these are provided.

Definitely worth the money. I went to hammam Ziani last week. My friends and I were invited to look around before we booked. I opted for the basic 25 euro treatment, body scrub and 40 minute massage, I couldn't fault the treatment I received. Came out feeling refreshed and relaxed. The ladies were polite and the massage was one of the best I've had! There are no posh treatment rooms but it's clean.

Great Location, Excellent Staff, Reasonable Price. I am a student and cannot recommend this hammam more. Before my hammam experience, I went in to request more information. The owner was more than accomodating and even recommended a fantastic place for my friends and I to enjoy lunch before the hammam. He was invested in helping us have the best time in Marrakech. This hammam is clean, has a great staff, and is worth every cent. The process is extensive, relaxing, and you leave feeling incredible. I enjoyed the hammam experience and the tea following the hour or so long hammam session. Please pick this hammam - it is great way to wrap up a day of site seeing and leaves you relaxed and rejuvenated.

Good overall. Some problems, but handled very well.. We went as a couple and had different experiences. My treatment was good: there may be nicer boutique spas, but it was definitely good value.My fiance's treatment wasn't quite the same. First, it was about twenty minutes short of the length that we were told it was going to be; the masseuse skipped his back almost completely. Futhermore, although there are signs everywhere saying that tipping is not permitted, the man who attended him in the hammam demanded a tip at the end. He gave him all the change he had (about 10% of the total, still a reasonable amount, and he wasn't going to give him one hundred dirham), but the attendant insisted it wasn't enough and asked for more. However, when my fiance mentioned the problems to the owner, the owner was very apologetic. He asked my fiance to point out the attendant, then offered a free hour massage or a significant portion of the price back. The service wasn't flawless, but as a business they handled it about as well as you can if your employee acts inappropriately.

one more reason to go to Marrakech. first visit to Marrakesh and i got addicted to this hamam which is clean thorough all the staff are trained and know how to give a massage a definite reason to return to Marrakesh

A blissful escape in the heart of Marrakech. I have been many times to Hammam Ziani, every treatment has been wonderful, the staff are helpful, the therapists well trained and all give excellent massage treatments, the Hammam is one reason why I return to Marrakech time and time again!

relaxed package after a shooping tour. we found this hammam during a shopping tour in the souks and decide to book one of the packages. For 27€ you will get the steam bath, scrubbing and the massage, towles and bathrope are included as well. It was a nice experience and we got more energy to continue our shopping tour.

Great experience.. Myself & 2 friends opted for the super package at this hammam. I have tried 2 other hammam/spas in the same area as ziani. One was very contemporary and for me too clinical. The other was similar in style to Ziani, but lacked the friendlieness and very low hassle factor of Ziani. This hammam was brilliant. The treatment itself is as has been described on TA. Every bit of it was wonderful and eased our aching muscles as we had been in the mountains for a few days. We all left feeling refreshed (& exhausted at the same time). The women who did the treatments were fantastic. They guided us carefully through all the different treatments / rooms, etc. Due to the nature of a hammam every surface is wet & slippy. One major advantage of Ziani is that all the treatments are on one level.(at least they are in the female side - do not know about the male side?) In other spas I have been to in Morocco, treatment rooms have been on many levels, making the dangerous slippy floors, even more so. The owner and staff are all very welcoming & made us feel very pampered in Marrakech. Will definitely go again when next in Marrakech.

Great Experience. We wanted to try a hammam that wasn't like a spa you would find in England or a posh hotel. We also weren't quite brave enough to go for a "local's" hammam. Hammam Ziani turned out to be exactly what we wanted.We were greeted by the owner at the entrance who was very nice, welcoming and spoke good English. We were then showed around by one of the ladies. After that we were served tea and left alone to relax and decide what treatment, if any, we would like. We just decided on a massage as we were a bit short on time.The traditional décor and general feel of the whole place made it seem quite authentic to us.My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We were looked after very well and received fantastic treatments.

Scrubbed to death - in a good way!. Great hamman experience. My friend and I went for the 'super package' which included a steam, scrub, massage and seaweed wrap.The only downside was having to wear the minuscule thong they provided!! A definite must in Marrakech.

Highlight of Trip. This is something everyone should do while in Marrakesh. I will try to add some different perspectives to the other reviews posted. First of all this is the only Hammam I have been in so I don't know how the others are. There are lots of "guides" trying to drag you into every Hammam to get their cut so beware of where you are dragged. One of the great things about this place is the owner who gave us great restaurant recommendations and a list of things to do in Casablanca which was our next stop. The second best was that everything was provided and our cloths and possessions were locked up and reasonably safe. The "sell" was very friendly... We were allowed to leave and have lunch before coming back for our treatment. The experience was unique. A mix of steam, scrub, massage, mud pack, and stretching for 350 durams for the deluxe package for 2 hours. A woman on out tour went to a fancy hotel for 1200 durams for 1 hour. This is a lot more authentic.  There was a big sign in the men's area that said tipping is not allowed and i was told that the house splits the take with the workers. MY massage person asked for a tip which was awkward although everyone in Morocco will ask for a tip.

Thoroughly fun experience... I had booked this before we left UK. We got a taxi because we were not quite sure where it was but having roamed the area it is best described as about a minute from the Bahia Palace entrance toward the soukhs, right hand side opposite the car park. We were met with tea and the ladies went off one way and the men the other. Lockers for all possessions with key you keep, stripped off completely but then given a wrap around cloth that covers the bits.Oiled, steamed, scrubbed, massaged and soaped over the next one and a half hours. It was a hoot and very cleansing, muscles were found i forgot that i had. Worth the 270DH cost per person in my opinion. Owner very pleasant, lots of info, good english. We all tipped 50DH, not due to any pressure but because the work involved deserved it. I would recommend the local feel of this experience against a spa. This is between the basic hammam and the hotel spa and fits well with Marrakesh itself, everything is provided inclusive of the price.

Great experience.. This is nothing like the Hammams in some of the 5star hotels around the world but just as good. Modesty goes out of the window when only wearing paper pants! We opted for the super package at 350 dirhams and were washed, brushed, steamed, masaged, slathered in clay and wrapped in plastic before emerging with silky soft skin. Yes they do reuse clothrs between customers which is not that hygenic but this is to be expected here in Morocco.Would recommend this to all. Separate areas for men and women so ideal for all. Owner Ziani made us feel very welcome.

January 2013. We visited Hammam Ziani in Jan 2013. I had read reviews on trip advisor before going to Marrakech, and had a few on a shortlist. Hammam Ziani was incredibly easy to find, very friendly English speaking receptionist who invited us in for a mint tea, we were shown around the hammam, given a price list and the procedure was explained to us. We weren't hassled, were left alone to talk and make up our minds. Went back the next day to book - were recommended a time so the 4 of us could go together. Treatments were very good, very thorough (very different experience to an English spa!) - don't expect to cover up! Brilliant massage. We sat down afterwards and were given mint tea and pastries - really great service. We paid 270 dirhams (about £22 at our exchange rate) - more than you would pay in a 'local' hammam, but having spoken to others who went to their corner hammam (where you need to bring own shampoo, bath mat, sponges, buckets etc) our experience sounded so much better, and it was a beautiful setting. As we were passing the next day we were invited in again for another mint tea !! Can't fault the friendliness or service received at all - highly recommended - we would visit again!

Not the best not the worse. We visited Ziani in January 013, based on recommendation from trip adviser, to be fair the review was mixed, and we had open mind when we visited. We paid 350 Dirham which is approx 35€ for that was the price of steam room, wash & scrub! Message and mud mask. We were told that if we wish we can have 1hour message instead of the mud mask; this appealed to us. However the guy who did the deal with us did not tell his staff in the Hammam the change in the program, so we still had to have the 30 min message and the mud mask. It was pointed out by another reviewer that they use the same Lipha/ kiess for scrub from one person to another. And I agree that is the case, I wish I had purchased one from the market they are less than £1 each and taken it with me. Also they don't have good hair shampoo and conditioner etc so take these with you. I was also not that keen on the towel and the bath gown I was given, for some reason I did not feel it was all that clean ( only my feeling mind) so my advise take these things with you and get a price reduction for them. If you negotiated any deal make sure the person who made the. Deal with you pass that information to the staff concerned.Over all it really was not that bad, and I have not caught any thing nasty, so don't be too alarmed, but it is good to know what you are getting and to be happy with it from the start.I have been to Hammam in Kuala Lumpur ( Moroccan Hammam! In KL) and that was far superia and better value than this Hammam in Marakech, the same in Turkey; all in all this was a slight disappointment for me. I will try some where else next time.

a must do when in marrakech. although i am informed about hammam treatments, i have never tried it before. the thought of being scrubbed, bathed, oiled and kneaded sounded a bit too rough, but being a fan of spa treatments i had to experience it at least once.i am glad i went to hammam ziani for my first ever treatment. the receptionist spoke fluent english and clearly explained the options and prices. my friend and i chose the treatment package with 1 hour massage instead of mudpack for 350 dirhams. if i remember it right, the treatment lasted 2 hours, maybe less... because the hammam style of rejuvenation is unique, i cannot compare it with massage treatments i've experienced in thailand and bali. all i know is that i felt renewed after, with my skin very supple and smooth :-)hammam ziani's staff are very professional and courteous and their interior is beautifully relaxing.my suggestion is to contact them for their business hours and come around ten in the morning when the masseurs are not yet tired. it can get crowded on late afternoons/early evenings so better to call first before going. 20 minute stroll from jemaa el fna :-)5 minutes by foot from palais bahia

Best Marrakech memory!. I had read about the hammam experience before heading to Morocco and really wanted to experience it. After a couple of others in our group found the Ziani Hammam, I made it a point to get there on my last full day in Morocco. As others have mentioned, the owner speaks excellent English and was extremely helpful. Be aware that part of the hammam experience is "exfoliation" so expect to be scrubbed within an inch of your life! And also be aware that, for women at least, the "attire" is (ahem) a tiny mesh G-string!I had "the works" so I spent an hour and a half being rinsed, steamed, scrubbed, massaged, wrapped in plastic and steamed again, and then a final wash including a shampoo. And this cost about $35 U.S.! They use soap and shampoo containing argan oil, which is great. I agree that the concrete slabs in the steam room and massage room could use a bit of padding, but that couldn't take away from the experience. Highly recommended! One caveat...look up the address ahead of time and have a cab take you there. The medina is VERY difficult to navigate on your own.

Finally a moment of relaxation after the fuss of the medina!. Ofcourse we wanted to visit an hammam and we found this one via Tripadvisor.It was an excellent experience with very dedicated people, who could leave you in peace; something that we didn't encounter so far in the city itself.A special word of thanks to the owner, who spoke very well English and had a handfull of very good advices for us about restaurants and places of interest.Thank you very much and good luck with your excellent enterprise!James Tyndall, from Maastricht.

Very nice hammam. Great hammam. The prices may be higher than a community hammam but then it is catered to tourists. The owner is an extremely nice guy that has given us somerestaurants and places to go that were just outstanding. He was almost our personal tour guide. The hammam itself is beautifully decorated. However the steam room and massage rooms could use some work.In general; a very nice and worthwhile place to visit for any tourist thay wants a hammam experience.

Great experience for men too!. I went to a few (every day that we were there) Hammams in Marrakesh and I found that this one was the best value for money. I enjoyed this experience the most. Yes it might seem to be a bit dated but they are reasonably priced. Men cater for men and woman for woman. The men that did my message and gommage was really good. I would go there every day if I could. You are first taken in for a shower then you are asked to sit in the dome steam room. No one else really bother you in the steam room and there are buckets of water if you want to cool down-I guess its help yourself, I didn't use it. You are then asked to go through to another room within the hammam to get a gommage (Scrub), after the gommage you are directed to the showers again where after its a message on the same bed you were scrubbed. Finally you are soaped down and asked to take one last shower.

Excellent place to relax and get the dirt off you. I love this place.It has its home in a XIV century building so you soak in some of the atmosphere as well.I regularly visit when i arrive in Marrakech to get rid of the tiredness of the trip and set me in the mood to relax.then i go again before leaving the city to take off all the dirt accumulated running the souqs and medina.win/win :-)

Not what I expected - at all... Hmmm..I got to be honest having read the reviews myself before going to Ziani I was expecting better…It wasn’t terrible, but it just wasn’t what I was expecting I guess. In brief, my boyfriend went one way I went the other (separate sex hammam) I joined a group of 6 French women. There were only 3 women working so there was A LOT of time waiting in the steam room with absolutely no explanation as to what to expect next which was a little unnerving. The ‘wash’ took literally seconds then you’re back in the steam room. Then someone comes in, takes you by the hand and lies you on a concrete slab for a scub with the same mit that has just been used on the other ladies…. It’s vigorous, as expected it an exfoliating rub down, but I was just so uncomfortable on a rock hard table.Then.. back in the steam room. Meanwhile, I may add that there is constant shouting and chatting between the workers which again wasn’t what I imagined, as I thought it was supposed to be a relaxing experience – far from it. The best bit – the oil massage, more of a rub than a muscular massage but it was nice. As you are not told what you’re doing next I was standing around butt naked waiting to be told where to go next... The steam room. So I decided to take a shower and wash out the oil from my hair, although the showers don’t work so I had to wash my hair using a bucket. The towels and robes are old, like really old so I personally didn’t feel the place as particularly clean. My boyfriend had a different ordeal, it sounded better than what I had, but equally said It was something he’d choose not to do again. However, having said that we have spoken to people who have enjoyed a hammam in various places around Marrakech, so I’m sure it can be a very enjoyable experience, but I won’t be going back to Ziani again.However, I could have visited on a day where they were short staffed, therefore it would explain the long periods of waiting round and having a rushed wash, scrub and massage, but personally I wasn’t impressed with the service.

Straightfoward local hammam experience. We were looking for a local hammam experience without too much hassle and this spa delivered it. While more expensive than a true local hammam - 270 dh for a bath, rub down and massage - they were well-used to foreigners and provided everything we needed. The spa is clean and efficient and the staff were friendly to me and my two young daughters who were very excited by the whole experience. I suspect there are better hammams, and probably lots worse.

such a good experience. this was the first time we visited a hamman. the ziani is somewhere in between the very high luxury end and the traditional moroccon hammam perfect for us as it turned out.on arrival you are seated on soft low slung cushioned benches served traditional mint tea. we then had small introduction in english. there are different packages available, the more expensive were 350 dh, so roughly £25. we were told it was an all inclusive price, so tipping wasn’t necessary, we did however each give the person who looked after us 20dh, i feel it’s fair it is a service industry and expected. the reason we picked the ziani was for it’s steam room which i prefer rather than the usual sauna. i didn’t notice the length of our stay, i only know we had a fabulously relaxing time.the moroccon part of the treatment is called tqsal, whereby you get rubbed down with a large rough glove, i kept my eyes shut through most of it, but when i dared look i saw in tiny black (bobbles like on a wool jumper) coming off my skin. never realised i was that filthy, appearantly it has an exfoliating effect and should not be done too often, but is certainly not harmful. you get washed and soaped, a wonderful experience i felt like a kid again, then rinsed off via buckets of water and a sponge, scrubbed if i remember and then placed in the steam room, after that it’s the massage.bring conditioner if you have dyed hair like me and a spare pair of knickers, they do provide some but i understand that they are not that great.a couple of minor issues - i would have liked the massage to concentrate on some of my problem areas, like neck and shoulders, also the masseuse had a habit of using very light quick strokes. when i tried explaining that i was ticklish and would have preferred a slower and deeper treatment she didn’t understand. the mats we were placed on during our massage were plastic and so didn’t let the skin breathe, would have preferred a more natural surface.overall it was truly amazing and i would not have missed it for the world, the place is comfortable feeling and is clean, the introduction was exactly right as we were a little nervous and didn’t know what to expect.

Excellent Massage - Great Experience. this was a traditional place and a great experience. It's not polished and ritzy, it is moroccan!! Not for the shy person as they do give you a full body massage, but they are extremely professional. Cheap and fun and you feel like you have actually had a massage - it was great!!

Definitely an experience to try!. We stumbled across this place in the heart of Marrakesh and I'm so glad we did because it was a fab experience. We were talked through the options by the owner (Ziani) with a mint tea in hand and shown around the place before we decided to go for it. We were scrubbed down, relaxed in the sauna, washed again, had a massage, washed again, and then relaxed in a lovely room with mint tea again! Fab experience :)We also wanted to say a MASSIVE thanks to the owner...it was our first time in Morocco and he went out of his way to help us out. In addition to the Hammam experience, he arranged transport for us and places to stay! Thank you VERY VERY much :)

Amazing. Exactly, what you need mid-holiday. I loved this place. I really enjoy massages and spas anyway and this was a great way to relax and cool off after a long day walking in he heat and dust.Men and women go in separate sections but do be warned, if you are body shy, you do get naked but for a thong and move from room to room as such and the ladies (or men depending on which you are) do wasjph you and give full body massage bu it is lovely and oesn't feel awkward at all.The treatments are delightful and there's a really lovely relaxation room with mint tea for afterwards. It took me 40 minutes to be able to stand up and leave, I was so relaxed.The desk staff speak English and treatment lists are in English. The masseuses speak enough English to tell you what to do and where to go.Only downside is that the team room is beautiful but not massively hot.

Good Hammam.Great Experience.. Went here last week..it was only a 5 minute walk from my riad.I was given a guided tour, was happy with what I saw and booked for later that day.I went for the 270 Dirham package.It was worth every dirham.I had a sauna, was exfoliated, massaged hard ( my choice) for 30 minutes, and washed and scrubbed. Relaxed afterwards with some Mint Tea. I have to agree with other reviewers.I visited Le Bain Bleu later in the same week.It was good but I enjoyed my experience here better. Give it a try.

Cool experience but not long enough. My friend and I just went to the hammam and had the full package-steam, massage,scrub and drink. It was supposed to be a 1.5 hour experience but it was less than that. The lady who showed me thru wasnt at all aware of closing the curtains as i got changed and My experience in the steam room was really short. Other than that, it was fab. My lady was sweet and spoke only a couple of words of French, but she didn't stop smiling the whole time. She asked for a tip at the end and was happy with what I gave her. That was NOT the experience of my friend however! He went to the men's section and was told that his tip wasn't sufficient! His massueur said he should give more and was really inappropriate and rained the experience for us both. In summary my lady was lovely, his man was vile!

Very enjoyable. Although this hammam does not have the decor and smart ambience of other spas like les Bain de Marrakech I must say I enjoyed my time here more than all the others. And at half the price !. I went with a group of friends , the girls had female masseuse , and the guys had male masseurs.It gets very busy , so try and get there before the masses . Try and keep some cash to tip the masseur , he will drop hints , but not pushy , and you will have to go back into the steam room to actually give him the money discreetly . Worth every dirham !.

Great Experience. I thought that I wanted to have a local hammam experience – I suspect that I wouldn’t have really enjoyed a truly local experience. Our riad hosts (at Riad Dar Dialkoum) guided me to Hammam Ziani and I’m really glad they did. The experience was probably somewhere between the truly local hammam (communal wash place) and a western spa – more at the spa end, but not ‘slick’. In any event I thought it was a perfect compromise – fantastic black soap up, followed by steaming in the steam room, then an amazing oil massage – not too hard, not too soft - loofah down, wash down (the soap smelled like Perkins Paste! please take this as a positive comment, it smelled lovely), a couple of showers; all in a friendly, clean establishment. The masseur did ask me to go and get him a tip and give it to him in the massage room – he must have had to share if it was handed over in other parts of the establishment or something along those lines; but I was happy to tip him and I did as asked. I gave him 50 Dirhams (~5 Euros) and he seemed happy. I had the seaweed wrap add on and all up it cost D350 (or around 35 Euros). If I get back to Marrakesh I will head straight to Ziani on day 1 – unwind quickly into the holiday - I will skip the seaweed (save D100) but I will make sure I get back for a second visit on my last day.

Brilliant traditional hammam. I have been to this hammam before and it is still excellent. My friend and I had the full package at 270 dirhams, which is well worth every penny. The massage with Argan oil is just brilliant, the scrub with black soap invigorating and one leaves feeling extremely clean, but tired from all that steam, scrubbing and massaging. Why can't we have one of these in the UK?

fantastic experience. Having only ever been to a massage in a beauty parlour at home , i was not sure what to expect.So my friend and i went along and this experience turned out to be the best experience we have had in ages .Although the oil massage was extremely relaxing , every other part of the treatment was so funny, i haven't laughed that much in ages.My skin had never felt so clean and fresh .All the staff were great, although we couldn't understand them it was just their smiley faces and helpfulness.Dont go if your shy as you have to strip off and sit in a paper thong(which i managed to put on back to front to start with).I would never go to another posh spa if we had these in England.If you visit Marrakech you cant come home without a visit to Zianni.enjoy

"Relaxing but fun experience". Had a fantastic time here; we chose this hammam because we didnt want to go to a 5 star tourist hammam/spa, we wanted an authentic experience and we were not disappointed. I really dont think I have laughed so much for a long time. We were basically scrubbed and massaged for hours by women who didnt speak a word ofEnglish but made us feel very welcome. It is not for the faint hearted though; we stripped off and wore a skimpy pair of paper pants whilst the women who worked there rubbed us in soap, scrubbed us, washed our hair and threw buckets of water all over us. Because we were laughing, they tickled our feet to make us laugh even more. My friend who had just been massaged with argan oil was slipping all over the marble table whilst I was having my hair washed and buckets of water thrown over me. A very relaxing but fun afternoon. However, we did look a state walking back to our riad as we didnt prepare and take conditioner for our hair!!Highly recommended.

very relaxing. This Hammam is situated just down from Palais Bahia, our receptionist phoned and got a deal for us. As you enter they invite you for a tea, which was a bit rushed as the ladies were ready for us. Then you change which they give you a paper thong. Then it's into the hammam (vapor)room where they give you soap to put on all over and then you sit for about 20min, then the ladies wash you over and then you lay on the marble table as they exfoliate your whole body and then to be rinsed off, which makes you feel incredibly cleansed. Then if you choose(highly recommended) to the massage room a half hour whole body massage, then showered and ready for the day.

Not on par with others. We chose this hamman due to the positive review in the Top 10 guide, dissapointing in reality. The staff were welcoming but the hamman itself was a little seedy with very unwelcoming showers. The body scrub was a new experience and the Massage not bad if you like to slide all over the couch. The therapist made it very clear he expect a tip at the end!

I felt like a little kid again!. We were finding it hard to decide on a hammam, so we jumped online and found great reviews of this one. And we weren't disappointed. The whole experience was loads of fun. Despite not speaking any English, the ladies were all really cute and friendly, leading us through the slippery maze of walkways and into the steam room. My friend and I had the giggles, as the whole things just seems hilarious. Is definitely no place to be shy! They give you little disposable knickers and that's it! We sat in the steam room and gossiped for about half an hour, sopaing ourselves up and getting ready for the experience. Beware - the floors are super slippery so don't rush around! let the ladies lead you! i wouldn't have minded a bit of a harder scrub, but i guess they are used to wimpy tourists haha. The massage was delightful, and i felt like a little kid as the lady poured soapy suds over my hair at the end. A good idea might be to take some conditioner with you as they don't offer it, and my hair was like a bird's nest!Highly recommended, it's a real treat. Also, i'd recommend going at the start of your trip so that you're skin is scrubbed and clean and ready for the sun to do it's work!

The most amazing experience- highly entertaining and relaxing. I went here with 6 girlfriends. The whole experience was made by us all being able to be treated at the same time. All treatments happen in steam rooms so it's hard to see around you. Massages followed and mud body mask. The whole thing took about 2 hours finishing with mint tea in a nice lounge. For £25 we all thought it was a bargain. We had visited newer hammams but they looked like the spas in the uk. This was the real deal. Don't go here if you are prudish, shy or of a nervous disposition!! Do go if you want to experience a true Moroccan Hammam. We all loved it and would go again.

service, authenticity and fair prices all in one. If you are accustomed to Moroccan hammam treatments, then you will appreciate this. If you are a 5-star traveller and find it difficult to adapt to the places that you visit, stick to your hotel. If you want a proper hammam treatment, and like cleanliness and authenticity, then make your way here. If you know the procedure, then you will not expect a "steam room" experience, this IS a Moroccan Hammam... leave it to them and keep your expectations in your hotel room. One thing.... you will leave feeling squeaky clean and relaxed. Take your swimming costume (spare trunks/bikini bottom) along and just go with the flow. Procedure: steam, Moroccan soap, "gommage"/scrub (very thorough), optional massage (highly recommended) shower and change. give yourself 90 mins. No matter how many showers you take or scrubs you have after this.... nothing will compare to how clean you feel after a hammam.

Entered a sceptical tourist, departed feeling like a King!. Having been ripped-off left, right & centre in Marrakech I rather sceptically entered Hammam Ziani but was immediately put at ease by the welcoming receptionist who clearly explained the tariffs and options, then after making my selection he talked me through the process of what to expect.The hammam was fantastic and the massage perhaps the best massage I've ever had! After everything was over and I was back in my clothes, I was taken to their chill-out lounge and given the typical mint-green tea which properly finished off the experience well.The only possible downer was the lack of information over tipping policy. I'm familiar with it being said to tip the masseuse something at the end and I'd readily decided to tip 50DH, but the masseuse very forwardly asked for something 'hush hush' to be handed over outside. I left 20DH at reception for him!

Pampering in a tradtional Hammam. I love Hammams. The wonderful feeling of relaxation, soft skin and absolute cleanliness one has after the steam, gommage and massage cannot be beaten. I was delighted to be invited in to take a look around as I strolled past the Hammam Ziani from my nearby Riad.The interior is pure delight. Traditional, beautiful and inviting. Add to that the warmth of the welcome from Ziani and his lovely staff and I doubt if you could better this. Certainly, it is well known in Marrakech and is favoured by local people as well as visitors.For 270 MDM (around £25) you enjoy 90 minutes of indulgence in surroundings that are a pure delight. This is the total price for steam, gommage and the wonderful massage. Everything is provided, so you need only walk in and allow yourself to be pampered at a far lower price that your Hotel will charge.Take a taxi to the Parking le Prefecture, right opposite. Every taxi driver knows Hammam Ziani. And then ENJOY!

a true real experience. Hammam Ziani is a really true traditional hammam and offer to visitors a great experience for a correct amount of money. if i may suggest : go early afternoon when the place isn t too busy
Overpriced steam room and not vet hot. 80 dirhams for a semi warm steam room. Dreadful, better value in UK. Didn't go for massage.

Best price for tourist-friendly service. Visiting a Hammam for the first time can be a bit scary, and those that tout themselves as ‘tourist friendly’ usually ask tourist prices too. Not the case for Hammam Ziani. The service was so good, and so cheap, that we visited twice. Once for just the basic steam, scrub and shower, and the second time for the massage too (around £15 for this - great value). Staff were friendly (it doesn’t matter that they don’t speak English, they show you what to do without it), the place was clean, and the hammam itself relaxing and excellent value. Us girls weren’t asked to tip at all, and in fact would have liked to have done, but my husband was asked for one – out of sight of the CCTV camera, so clearly staff have been told not to ask for tips. If you’ve never been to a Hammam, visit this one. If you have visited a tourist-friendly one before and been disappointed (as we were in Turkey), you won’t be here.

autentic, good, middelpriced. Very nice expirence, 270 MAD for the big tour. black soap wash, scrub down, masage, white soap wash and toweldry by the morrocan ladys. went twice. First time exelent, 2 time the woman was in a bit of a rush : (But I recomend this place. And would go next time.remember to bring tips for your marrocoan lady. 20-40 MAD.

Not worth the money. I have chosen this hammam because of the good reviews here, but deeply regret that went there: walls are white like in hospital, light is too bring-couldn't relax, steam room is cold, shower was dirty and rusty, massage table wasn't cleaned after previous client, massage ladies don't speak English. Would never go there again.

Great experience - got to do it.. I agree with most of the reviews here that it is quite an authentic experience - although a bit on the more expensive side - but much cheaper than if you were to go to the Hilton.They offer several packages but it is structured such that you have not much choice but to choose the basic package at 270 Dirhams. This gives you a steam bath, a scrub, a massage and a cup of that obligatory mint tea afterwards. There is a locker for you to keep all your valuables - but i would not suggest that you bring too much precious stuff with you as the locker does not look too strong for the determined thief.For those who find the steam bath too cold, just inform the attendant who will turn up the heat. Trust me, it does get extremely hot once they turn it on. As for the scrub, for those not used to it, it is strange but you will be surprised at how much dirt they can get off you.The massage is more like "Thai" massage than aromatherapy massage so be prepared to be pressed and turned, rather than "stroked".The whole experience lasted about one and a half hours to 2 hrs. As usual, you are expected to tip.I only give 4 stars instead of 5 for these reasons:1. Price is way too expensive in Marrakesh. The local hammam is only about 10-20% of the price.2. Locker is not strong enough3. Pressured to give a tip at the end of service.

Fairly authentic hammam experience, good massage. Hammam Ziani offers various packages. I had the basic hammam and massage which cost 270 Dirhams. They give you a basket with all the neccessary lotions etc and you change into a wrap which stays on throughout (men).
