Your attendant then takes you to the steam room where you wash with black olive soap and then are taken to a table for the gommage. Rough gloves and more soap get you really clean. After a shower you have a massage. Very good full body massage then another shower and out to get dressed. The whole experience lasted about one and a half hours. You are expected to tip the guy who performs the treatment. Give whatever you think appropriate. When you are dressed you are served mint tea in a small lounge. All in all a very satisfying experience.

Good experience - somewhere between traditional and touristy. Whilst others may prefer the posh spa surroundings of other Moroccan hamans for my mind this is much better - a perfect balance between traditional and touristy.Agree with many of the previous statements - nice and clean, and very welcoming. We had a tour first and then went back later in the day to have our treatment.Once you get used to the paper knickers and trying not to be self conscious - a bitish thing I think !!! - then it was fantastic - the scrubbing in particular was very good as was the massage. Partner also enjoyed his and we met up after for mint tea in the relaxing area. Right near the palace so easyish to find (well as easy as anything is in Marrakech!!!)As previous people have said a tip is expected although I didnt feel pressured - tipped about £2.50 which I dont think was bad at all.If I got back whic I hope to do would def go back to Hamman Ziani

A pleasure for all the senses!. I can't begin to describe how wonderful an experience I had at the Hamman Ziani in Marakech.The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming to my friend and I. We visited first and were shown around the spa so we could see how it all worked and what would happen and then the various packages were explained to us. We bought the deluxe package for 350 dirhams (about £44), which meant we didn't have to book in, just turn up when we wanted and included the steam, gommage (the scrubbing), 30 min full body massage with scented argon oil, 30 min seaweed wrap and almond full body and hair wash.It was a luxuriant experience, though the girls who provided our treatments spoke limited English and us limited French we were able to communicate and have a nice conversation. The architecture of the hamman itself was beautiful, with lots of white tiles, arched ceilings and grey and white marble tables and sinks that were intricately carved.A pair of bikini knickers (brand new), a key locker, slip on flip flops and a terry cloth robe were provided as part of the package and at no time did you feel hurried. I have very long hair and one of the ladies also took the time to brush it for me after the session had ended, which was an additional luxury that I enjoyed.Tipping is expected and other reviewers have complained about this. However, tipping in Morroco is an expected part of the culture, but you shouldn't be expected to tip until you are dressed and able to access your locker. We gave a 50 dirham tip (about £6) between the two of us as we had two ladies working on us constantly for 1.5 hrs and an attendant who helped us in the changing rooms.After the session we spent 15 minutes in the chill out room and had a complementary mint tea (the morrocan drink of choice) and listened to some lovely ambient music.All the products used on us were available to buy in their boutique, but it must be noted that prices here are much higher than the pharmacies in the Kasbah and Souk, but we were not pressured to buy anything, which was nice.I would be very tempted to go back to Marrakech for a weekend just to experience this Hamman again. It was a great experience and a wonderful way for my friend and I to round off our holiday in Marrakech on our last day.

Good facilities with staff that get on with the job. Having been to a number of hammams in the Middle East, this would have to be one of the nicer places. It was clean and although a few other people there we didnt actually see them. The hamman is divided into 2 sections, 1 with the steam room and a separate room where staff can clean and massage you with 2 beds there. Although there were a few others while we were there we didnt see them and it was not crowded. The staff did a good job, cleaning and massaging us. They have a lovely area to relax and have some tea in after the whole experience.Oh also the entrance price is negotiable. We managed to get it nearly at half price for the 3 of us. The extra bag, soap, towel etc that you can buy from them isnt really worth it.

Nothing extravagant, but decent hammam experience. I've had better, I've had worse. If you want a luxurious experience, expect to have to dish out the cash at an upscale spa. But if you want a basic hammam experience that you can trust to be clean and legit, Ziani is for you.

better than the 5 star places for many reasons.... If you haven't had an authentic hammam, you may be impressed by the beautifully decorated, expensive production-line set-ups around Marrakech. If you want "the job done" this is the place.Once we found the hammam in a lane ( near a historic palace) we were shown a menu of treatments. We chose the hamman option with an argan oil body massage.We were prepared with our "swim wear" with us- you will be only wearing the bottom half. We were led to the ladies section, given a set of towelling robes, slippers and a locker with a key. Then we entered a dome shaped traditional steam room.The room was steamy and since we picked 2pm (early by local standards) we had the place to ourselves. It was a great experience, especially the way the shafts of light streaked through the steam ( the dome shaped room had small holes in it, and the sunlight pierced through- we were in another era. The scrub was great, the massage was amazing, they even washed my hair for me afterwards, i've never had such a good head massage. The staff we very welcoming and friendly. Tipping is standard in Marrakech, we were not pressured. In fact after the treatment, we went looking for the ladies to give them a token of appreciation. Its clean, prices are good ( we paid 270 Dh for our treatment), we emailed in advance, but they replied and stated we could walk in anytime, as is the custom in a Morrocan Hammam. Afterwards we sat and had a refreshing mint tea in the salon. I like the authenticity, although it isn't one of the "public" hammams where one would take their own soap, towel, bucket etc. its adequate for me. I shall be returning and have recommended Hammam Ziani to everyone i've met. ( i've had about 8 hammam treatments in the past)They speak enough English to communicate, the prices are fair, the treatments are thorough, and they do a good job. thanks to trip advisor, it was because of a previous review that i chose to visit.

Very good and simple introduction to the hammam world. This was our first time in a hammam, for both men and women, even if we are very frequent sauna goers. For a trial we chose the basic package, which includes scrubbing, but not massage, for 80 dirhams, plus 20 for a towel (total about 9-10€, for one hour). Anyway, scrubbing felt like a massage, the hot room was good and clean, there were enough assistants there to guide and treat us, there was a decent changing room and a nice relaxing (tea) room for after-bath. There are probably many more luxurious hammams around, but this was a very good introduction to all of us. Everybody felt very happy, and ready for a good dinner, afterwards. This contrasted greatly with the experience we had in a terrible "hammam" a few days later in Essaouira (for a higher price).

terrible experience. on my last night in marrakech i went to hamman ziani...since i read good reviews here. maybe it was due to my late evening appointment (at 7pm), but the whole experience was all wrong. i get massages at least once a month in nyc and this was my third hamman experience in morocco....my first was at 1001 nights hamman in marrakech (which was very good and recommended by my hotel for 330 dirham), the second was a traditional hamman in essaoria which was good too(where i paid a guy 150 dirham for a scrub and massage).first, as previous reviewers have mentioned....the steam room is luke warm at best (i don't like overly hot steam rooms, but this was ridiculous) also, i had to lather myself with some sticky paste...this was done for me at the other two places. after five minutes..yes, five minutes, ALI called me from the steam room and had me lay down on a slippery, cold, wet table....where he lathered me some more and dumped water on me...shortly after, i took a shower.then i laid down on the same uncomfortable table (there are 3 tables in each cold room) and he began putting oil on me and "massaging" me. 15 minutes into i had to ask if this was the massage, because he was just rubbing/feeling my muscles....not massaging them. i asked him to do it harder...which didn't help. after 45 more minutes of this (i had paid for 25 extra minutes of massage)...it was over.i reluctantly gave a 20 dirham tip...which he didn't like, but i was really unhappy with the whole experience. afterwards, while having mint tea, i asked another patron about his experience and he said the same thing about the massage not being strong enough.i would have to say that i wouldn't go back again, it just wasn't worth it.so a recap of my issues:1. lukewarm steam room2. uncomfortable tables for massage3. massage room is same as shower room and is cold and shared with 2 other people getting massages4. massage was a light muscle rub, not a massage5. at no point throughout the process are you giving a robe or towel to dry off until the end...i would have liked to have dried myself completely before the massage

Authentic experience. Ziani is a good compromise between an authentic hammam experience and a tourist aimed spa. Forget about luxury (at least on the male side) this place has nothing to do with Les Bains de Marrakech for example.. but it's also much cheaper too. There's no private cabins for massage, the massage beds are covered with waxed sheets so you get all foamed and oiled up and then they just wash it off and ready for the next...As for being cold, not really. The hammam was hot enough to steam cook me! I had a great scrub and many great massages! ADIL (young short guy) makes awesome strong massages, HAFID and RACHID make great massages too but more relaxing type.

Average. Being in Marrakesh, we wanted to experience one of its main attractions, a hammam. And we chose Hammam Ziani. The package cost 270 dirham - for the hammam, a scrub (gommage) and 30 minute massage which includes use of a towel and robe. The place itself is dimly lit and whilst not dirty, its not the cleanest. It was a bit dark and dingy for my liking.All in all, quite expensive for a rather mediocre experience.

Enjoyable and a little bizarre!. I researched thoroughly before embarking on the hammam experince, so that I would be prepared for what was to come, having never even been to a spa before. I was not let down by my experience at Ziani. The guy on the reception talks you through the options ( I went for the full package) and although the women inside don't speak much English or French, they are pretty patient and point you where you need to go, so it's best to just go with it. You get handed a basket with a robe etc in it, get changed into your paper knickers and make your way to the first area where you hang up your robe. The staff can tell what package you're on by the colour of your flip flops and the basket you're given to take with you (not sure why, maybe in case you want to use your own shampoo etc). Oh and yes, I would slip some money for tips into the pocket of your robe when you're getting changed so that you have that with you at the end. You then go and sit in the steam room for a while till a lady summons you to be soaped down and splashed clean, Then you sit some more, till another lady comes in and you are massaged, scrubbed and slathered in mud and plastic sheeting to within an inch of your life! The whole experience is quite odd but the women are friendly and have seen it all before. At the end you can shower and wash your hair (although I'm not sure if there's a hairdryer) and get helped back into your robe. Generally, the lady that massages you is the one who gets tipped and she'll be with you for most of the process. The place does smell a bit odd, but not dirty, just don't expect the kind of shiny clinical feel of a comparable Western institution. I enjoyed it and was clean and soft at the end of it all, glad I did it.

All round great experience. I went to Marrakesh with 2 girl friends of mine so we were up for some pampering. We had been to another hammam at the beginning of our stay and thought it was an alright experience but we were pleasantly surprised when we knew we were on to a winner at Hammam Ziani. The 1 and a half hour procedure started with some blacksoap and water in a beautiful steam room with marble stools and basins, followed by a thorough scrub in another room and finished with a thorough massage by really cheerful and friendly ladies who knew what they were doing.

not really. this is soley a westerner oriented hammam. bring your own towel and avoid being charged for this. the steam room was luke warm and just felt nasty. the dude that exfoliated and massaged me needed to buy deodorant but was friendly enough so the pong was tolerable. i think the feelings of feeling dirty from some reviewers comes from the strange smelling soap and oil they use. but i agree the premises just isnt pristine. the dude asked me for a tip as soon as i was off the table. for the 200 dirhams i would say an average experience. i am however giving it a 'terrible' rating as i believe it is cheeky to underpower a steam room (local hammams charge local moroccans 10 dirhams) and i just get fed up with being asked for tips. and yes the dudes do tend to push you through the various areas. so i am sure you will find better hammams.

Ladies, make sure you have the money to tip. First of all, I have to say that the Gents section at Hammam Ziani is very good. I completely enjoyed the service. Staff are professional and friendly. HOWEVER, my wife had a very horrible experience at the Ladies section and WAS NOT ALLOWED TO LEAVE.The Incident:Right after finishing her hammam and massage (when she was still in her undies), my wife immediately was asked for tips. It is quite hilarious indeed. Under which body part can you hide the money when doing hammam?Actually, my wife and I have no objection to tip, providing that (i) circumstances allow (ii) this is discretionary. Unfortunately, both were negative in this incident. (i) Apart from the fact that there is nowhere to hide any money during hamman, my wife has actually given all her belongings to me when she was enjoying the pampering due to security concerns.(ii) After knowing that my wife has no money on her, the staff immediately showed an unfriendly face and attitude towards her. She was detained in the property until I arrived and gave her money to set her free.This is simply horrible. My wife almost burst into tears when she saw me. So, ladies, make sure you bring enough money with you to tip, apart from the fact that the service has already been paid for upfront.

Hammam Ziani in Marrakech. I have just had my first Hammam experience at the Hammam Ziani in Marrakech (there is another one in Casablanca). I have been having massages all over the world and can honestly say this is one of the best I've tried. But please be aware that an Hammam is no SPA. It is more 'violent' . The purpose is not to have a 'out of body' experience, but to get you reallllly clean! Bad:- The price on their website is not correct at all. 270dh for steam room+soaping+massage+shower+scrubbing OR seaweedtherapy.- you are not told what is going to happen and you can end up waiting more than you expected in the steam room.- it is clean but by no standards what you'd expect of a SPA. you could tell all the material, although cleaned, has been used several times.-the ladies are waiting for your tip in the end.Good:-the massage is fabulous, more of a violent that relaxed type-the ladies are very nice,polite and make you feel comfortable-it all lasts 1.30h which is the reasonable time for it.-it is very central.-the price is extremely reasonable.If in Marrakech do give it a try!

first time ok, second time v. good. I read great reviews of Hammam Ziani and decided to visit it on a trip to Marrakech. I went in the afternoon, and found the place pretty crowded. The people who work there (after they had taken my money) had little time for me. I was left in the steam room for a long time and then given a quick massage and scrub.The scrub was great, but for that price, I would have liked to be treated less as a problem and more as a valued customer.Worse, 2 young women tourists decided to walk in with 4 wailing children. An experience that should have been relaxing, ended up being just the opposite!!Anyway, I had a few hours to kill on my last day in Marrakech and decided to try a Hammam again. The Ziani was the most conveniently located- so I went back- but with extreme misgivings. I told the owner about my awful experience the last time and he assured me that this time would be different. He instructed one of the attendants to look after me- and gosh, did she! I was given fantastic treatment, a lovely scrub and massage and a great sauna soak.In the end, I came away with good feelings about Ziani- but if you want to be treated well there- you will need to be a bit assertive.Otherwise, thanks to some good reviews here, they get a lot of tourist traffic and may be slacking just a bit.Go there for the convenient location, good facilities and treatment that can be very good- if you push for it..

worst experience of my life. I have been to many hammams and this was by far the worst I have ever experienced. Everything was extremely dirty and unhygienic. The towels were not washed and there were hairs and dirt everywhere. I did not get scrubbed properly and i was left in the steam room for 45 minutes without any steam.I would recommend the Hivernage hammam. This was exceptional and everything was great. The massage was amazing and I felt very clean and refreshed.

Its so good.... I chose the Hammam Ziani because I didn't want a very expensive upmarket 'feminine' place with rose petals and the like, but neither did I want a public steam room. Having read previous reviews off the internet, i reckoned that this place was just about right- and it was , for what I wanted. I took th 280 dirhams menu- and it was everything i wanted. When you go in they allocate someone to you who looks after you for the duration of your stay. My man was 'abdullah'. First he shows you to the changing room where you swap your clothes for a sarong like wrap. Clothes are put into a locker and you keep the key. First a shower and a soap rub, then on into a very steamy steam room for about 15 minutes. on emerging from the dteam room another quick shower and then onto a 'table'. There were four tables in the room and other people were being treated at the same time, but by different attendants. I have been to a hammam in Turkey once. There the job was done on the floor of the large baths area, this place is a bit more upmarket than that. No sloshing of water buckets - however much fun that is. The room is tiled and there is a coloured glass window. First round is a good scrub with a sort of loofah mitt. All over, but carefully just avoiding the most intimate parts. Abdullah showed me just how much skin came off me. A lot! Then a shower , and on to the massage. It was quite strong. With oils rubbed in to all over. A few stretches and pressure applications nearly made my eyes water!! Then some warm soap and a hair and body wash, and another shower to get it all cleaned off. You come out feeling so fresh and clean. All the spare skin is sloughed off, and knots and hairs straightened. Really an exceptional experience. Reborn is what people say. However I recognise its not for everyone. My wife didn't fancy it, nor the other couple we travelled with. Its not for someone with (say) a bad back unless the masseur is extra careful - or people who are overly embarrassed about another person being that personal about cleaning them almost all over. However, cosidering the whole experience, I enjoyed it and look forward to going again to a hammam sometime.Just to mention, it took me ages to find the place, maps of marrakesh are not good. However , in fact it is only about five minutes off the main square. Just a few doors along, there is a shop selling soaps, oils and ungents. Run by a man called Zac. Its a good place to buy things to take home to use as next best thing to having this kind of scrub at a hammam. Ask the man on the ticket desk where Zac' s place is!

Fun for the price. My partner and I went here to kill two hours after checking out of the hotel and before our transfer to the airport. It was great fun.We arrived at 1pm and bought the full experience for MAD 350 (about £20).First, we got changed into these skirt things you have to wear. Then a shower and steam for 20 minutes.Then we had a salt scrub (it takes the skin off if you're not careful), oil massage, seaweed wrap, soaping and shower again followed by mint tea. It all lasted about 90 minutes.Being honest, the massage wasn't the most sensational I've ever experienced but for the price you cannot complain and the place is clean and seems to target tourists.I'd go back.

Certainly different !. Despite having been to the far east and had massages there and at home, this was nothing like anything I've experienced. The whole experience was much more clinical. You very much felt that the purpose was to get you clean, rather than the 'Spa' experience which always feels a little more intimate and designed to relax. Not that that was a bad thing. Both my sister and I came out feeling great and would definately do it again. We had the package at 350 DH / £24ish, included gommage (scrub), massage (and yes, they massage ALL of you, from head to toes), seaweed wrap ( watch out for the cold marble slab underneath you and hot slop on top - weird) and drink (aka mint tea!). She has skin that can react to creams and I have pressure urticaria, but whatever they used didn't cause any reactions much to our surprise.Good way to spend a couple of hours out of the chaos of the medina. Never been to any other Hammam so can't tell you if good value for money, but the package worked well for a novice, and compared to rip off England seemed good to me !

Traditional Hammam. Traditional Hammam in Marrakech - Hammam ZianiLocal Traditional Hammam, English spoken, and English price/description lists on front reception counter...Very friendly..ladies and gents separate..No mixed as this is a traditional local hammam. Can wear Bikini, or one piece swimsuit but most ladies wear just their pants!My husband & I went to this local hammam as we thought that was more authentic, and had been highly recommended by other guests staying at our Riad.We were told to go about 2 pm, as it gets busy about 4-4.30pm with the locals. We went to the Hammam Ziani, we did not need to take towels etc only thing to take for the ladies was a spare pair of pants! and spare pair of undies for the men unless you go naked.Our experience was fantastic, lasted 1hour 45 mins, but my husbands lasted 2 hours! We had traditional steam room, then soaped down, splashed with very warm water, then steam again, then another soap down, then another splash down, then exfoliation (Wonderful) they even pumice your feet!, then soap down, then full massage with oil, then soap down and hair washed...you are given a basket with all clean products, wrap etc which only you use.Came out feeling exceptionally clean and soft. It cost us about 18.00 ..really good value and I wish we had had it at the start of our holiday then we could have had another minus the exfoliation just before we went home!The ladies in there do not speak English but its not necessary, as they simply lead you where they want you. There were other tourists in there but it was not busy, my husband did not want to come out after his session...he enjoyed it so much!

Great Value Hammam near Palace. Hamman Ziani is just down the road from Palais Bahia. It is a traditional style Hamman catering for tourists. 80Dh for Hammam, Steam, Gommage and Soaping - compared to 150 Dh at our hotel spa.I took a 280 Dh package including massage and algie wrap - excellent value and eveything was first class. It seemed to cure my aches and pains and a week later they still haven't returned. This impecably clean Hamman has different sections for Mena and Women and is open from 8.00 - 22.00. I strongly recommend it.14 Rue Riad Zitoune jdid. Phone 062 71 55 71
Perfect . Thank you soo much to leila and her staff for a wonderful experience. Clean friendly relaxed environment. Was just perfect
Great Hammam service. I was book an appointment to Medina Hammam in the internet, Leila was so kind and helpfull. We went to the duos hammam and massage, which was so good. Thanks

Ultimate relaxing in a very busy city. Very friendly and skilled people, only good intentions and fair prices. We paid €55 for the 1h15 hammam package for two and were very pleased with it, we even gave a €5 tip.It's really the thing you need after walking through the busy streets of Marrakech.There are lockers for your valuable things and a bathrobe and towels are provided as well. We came in just after noon and could still easily make a reservation for the evening.

Ultimate Relaxation in a Busy City. I was genuinely stressed while trying to decide which spa to go to in Marrakech. Having gone to the Medina Spa, I was 100% satisfied I made the right choice. Medina Spa is run by very friendly staff who know their stuff.My group of three tried to book the "Rituel Marocain" for 150dh but were told this was only available in the morning. Instead we went for the massage duo with an extra person. It meant we payed 280dh each instead. It was worth every extra dirham though.First we received our treatments in the steam room. I'm normally fine with heat but even I found the heat a bit much after a while. A glass of water and some fresh air and I was good to keep going. Upstairs we had our massages, which were top quality, and then finished it off with some lovely tea in our bath robes.This is probably the one attraction above all I'd recommend visiting in Marrakech.

Pure Bliss in Marrakech. We chose the couples package which began with a warm welcome. The Hammam was spacious with a fabulous power shower. The Hammam therapist spoke English, she was kind and sweet natured. Followed by a superb one hour massage, by someone who clearly enjoys the art of massage, she had a wonderful, pure energy and healing hands. After our treatments we were wrapped up and given time for total relaxation. The staff were all attentive and focused. We left Medina Spa feeling relaxed and refreshed. Highly recommended.

Awful Experience! Waste of time and money!. The Spa that our riad usually recommends was closed and so the owner made my husband and myself an appointment at the Medina Spa. It was our first Moroccan scrub so we didn't know what to expect. The sauna was not clean and the scrub part was sloppy (under 2 minutes), leaving half of our skin unscrubbed. The mud application was watered down and again, applied very sloppy and only to part of our skin. Each were washed off by someone throwing buckets of water on us (which was almost comical.) So then the massage...We proceed upstairs with our two massage therapists and had high hopes. This was worse than the scrub- the girls did not stop talking (in French)! The massage was more of a rub for me and my husband said his was not even that. They eventually stopped massaging and just sat there! We tried to tell the receptionist on the way out and the discomfort even got worse (our riad called later). We were so sorry that we didn't go to one of the two top rated spas on Trip Advisor. Pay more and go elsewhere!

Excellent service, great value for money. What a fantastic morning spent at this spa.Myself and my partner had the Supreme Beauty package which consisted of a hammam, massage and facial.It was wonderful, staff are very friendly and attentive. The massage was so relaxing my other half fell asleep!! Would recommend this spa to anyone. Great price, great central location. My skin felt amazing when I left. We attended on the first day of our holiday.

Not recommended . The staff was extremely friendly, however the bathing place didn't look very hygienic . The massage room was cold, (air-conditioning blowing the cold air directly on the massage table).The massage itself was very mild and facial not done properly, the extraction was done in a very poorly lightened room...the prices are ok, however would worth paying a bit more and get a nice, relaxing experience ...also bring your own water, you will need it.
Hammam spa. The staff was kind and professional. The place is clean and prices affordable. I would love to go back! Don't look any further this is the best value for your money.

Excellent value for money . My husband and I booked a one hour and 45 minute hammam/ massage for 750 dhirams (for both of us)- we certainly were not disappointed. The service was excellent as we were met with smiling faces, we were provided with clean towels and robes and both thoroughly enjoyed the hammam bath and massage. We were given tea twice and were provided with a locker to keep our possessions. Considering our hotel Spa was charging almost three times as much for the same service, the treck in to the market Square and obscure location was definitely worth it.

OK, but careless. We went there for a couple treatment of hammam and massage and it was rather ok, considering the price for both was DH750 (for 2 hours). The hammam was done rather carelessly, with some mud and oil here and there, although the communication and the lady were pleasant... The massage was very mild. The staff respected the peace:) However were yawning:)))

Fabulous Experience. We went to this hammam because it was close to where we were staying, and I read that it was more authentic than the ones for tourists. That said, we were greeted by staff with excellent English, did not need anything other than either a bikini for women or swim trunks for men. Bathrobes, towels, slippers were all provided, and they were clean and comfortable. If you forget your bathing suit, you can just wear your underwear and bring a dry pair to change into afterwards. The scrubbing women invited my niece and me to take off our tops, which we did. (Although we had asked if they could take all three of us at the same time, we did not realize my niece's boyfriend would be shown into the same room. With all the water, he had to keep his eyes closed most of the time anyway, and why look at me --62 -- when my niece -- 24--, his girlfriend, was there.) We chose to just have the gommage -- the traditional exfoliating scrub with a variety of soaps. Massages are available as well as other services, but we wanted something uniquely Moroccan. The whole experience was just scrumptious. It's been about ten days since, and my feet are still totally smooth. After we dressed -- woozily -- they served an herbal tea, which was delightful. The place isn't terribly easy to find, but it's also not that hard. From Jemaa head up towards the Cafe de France and continue past it up that long arm of the Jemaa. Take the next major right turn, Rue des Banques. There's a right turn about 20 feet before the street ends at the point where Rue (or Derb) Kennaria becomes Rue (or Derb) Riad Zitoun el Jdid. There was no name on this little street, but it's Derb Zaari. On the righthand side near the end of it, you will find Medina Spa. There could be a wait if you just show up. We booked ahead by asking our hotelier to call them, and went right in. None of us can remember what we paid anymore, although we think it was either 150 or 200 dh, which is $15-20. We were there for about an hour.

Relaxation. It was our first time in a Moroccan Spa so we did not have anything to compare it with. A lot of cleaning and then a massage, all for MAD520 in 2hrs 15mins per person. At some point after the massage we were left in the lounge not sure what was next and were forgotten for a while, apparently waiting for a hot drink. My hair was completely wet and tangled, I didn't have a comb or a hairdryer to have it sorted.

Totally relaxed - clean as a new pin. The Haman was recommended by our Riad and is located near the main square at the end of a small alley. There are a lot of spas in that area and some look a lot more professional than others.We were welcomed by the staff and shown to a nice reception area and then to the changing rooms.We had bought a couples package so were both led to the hot room for the first part of the experience, this involves a good dousing with warm water, soaping and relaxing in the heat followed by a thorough scrub down and further cleansing. after this onto the massage, a truly relaxing experience, this is followed by relaxation in the lounge with a hot drink by which time you are floating on air.Both thoroughly enjoyed it and given more time in the city would have made a repeat visit.

Amazing. The staff was very professional, this was our very first time experiencing a traditional Moroccan spa and was very surprised. I walked out feeling like a new person, I will definitely recommended this spa.

You get what you pay for.... We booked a couples hammam and massage. The women did not speak good English and we weren't given disposable underwear until the poor hammam woman disrobed my husband. I was disrobed and told to sit on the hammam "pad" naked, until the underwear arrived. The hammam itself was nice. We got a good scrub but I was worried about the cleanliness. I saw two dime sized spots of mold on the pads and we were given wet, squelchy shoes to wear. It looked like they just rinsed off the pads with no real disinfecting. Also, the hammam portion didn't involve a soak in warm water so keep that in mind. After the hammam, we were wrapped in our robes and taken upstairs in our now REALLY wet shoes to the massage room. The man at the front desk wondered why my husband didn't have a towel for his hair and promised to bring one to him but never did. The massage itself was relaxing although the room was a bit noisy as you could hear some street sounds from outside. We also were given the massage in our wet disposable underwear, which was uncomfortable. After our nice warm massage we were wrapped in our wet, COLD robes, given back our squelchy shoes (now slippery with massage oil) and sat down outside with a thin blanket and barely warm tea. I chugged mine and ran downstairs to get dressed and warm. Overall, it was a nice experience but the cold, wet robes, and nasty shoes really made my rating go down. So much could have been improved if they charged a little more and made sure after your hammam you were kept warm and dry. I will not return to this place.

Great Experience for first time at spa. Myself and my partner booked in for one of the double treatments - hamman and body massage. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and it was a massage quite unlike any I've ever had!My partner enjoyed it which was great as it was his first time getting a massage.Great way to relax after a busy day at the medina

Not great, just OK.. I wouldn't give this place more than three stars because the steam area was pathetic. I was scrubbed down which was OK, then rinsed got robed and was taken to massage room. The towels looked dirty in there and the room was cold, the masseuse was good and gave a good massage however, this was my second visit to a hamam, the first was to 1001 nights which I thought was much better. I was charged 300dhm for 1hr 15 mins at Medina so not bad. I was charged a little more at 1001 nights but think their facilities were much better.

Worst massage we ever had. Facility semi clean/very unorganized, unprofessional and unexperienced masseuses!We got there 15 mins before our appointment time, we were welcomed and asked to change in a locker room...we waited in there as we had no clue what to do. I actually opened the door and asked as to what's next, the guy replied "oh when you guys are done , come out here...in the lobby ...well really my wife isn't comfortable walking around in the lobby with a robe on but still! Anyways went to the hammam the girl ran in front of us and washed the place in 2 secs and said ok ready! one poor girl was working on both of us, didn't speak good English, kept leaving during the process...one time she was gone for over 15 mins that I had to leave and ask what are we supposed to do? The answer was oh just wait she will be back! She actually didn't do a bad job at all otherwise...then we were guided to go upstairs, through the cold lobby again and walk by the main entrance, again very unprofessional....worst massages we have ever had in our lives. It was more like rubbing some kind of not so good smelling oil on our bodies!We get massages on regular massages so maybe we are spoiled and expected more but this was not a massage. They were talking to each other during the massage, not relaxing, one of them left half way somewhere and came back and did some weird massage movements that has no medical explanation...I'm in the medial field and i know what needs to be done! Then at the end we were laying on the table for 5 mins with nothing getting done, I raised my head up to find both of them sitting down. I asked if we were done? She said just lay down and relax, running the clock... oh well the massage is supposed to be for an hour but you are sitting down...we both said we are really good and decided to leave.Save your money and pay a little more and get something really worth it. We did one that was double the price and actually loved it and regret not going back to the first place. But live and learn.Our appointment was at 7 pm , maybe they had a long day and tired but still not an excuse

Soothing treatment. The spa offers excellent treatments and packages with great value for money. The hamam treatments as well as the massages are professional and soothing. Only the massage couch does not offer an ergonomic headrest when lying on the belly.

Lovely relaxing. Afternoon. Thoroughly enjoyed the couples treatment in this lovely Spa - we laughed with the staff as between us in English French & Arabic we chatted & they tried to teach us some more Arabic as they scrubbed & polished & rinsed us off - followed by a relaxing massage

Very good price-quality relationship. We chose the Esprit zen duo Marrakech which is about 55 EUR for two people for 1 hour and 15 minutes. The hammam (black soap and scrub) was very good as was the 30 minute massage afterwards. The spa is very good value for money and the staff were friendly. We enjoyed the experience and would return.One important piece of advice: we were trying to find the spa and were accosted by a man who pretended to work for Medina Spa and who guided us, rather forcefully, to the spa and the waiting room. After a few minutes, and noticing that another group of three persons in the waiting area also seemed a bit confused, I went back outside to check the number of the door of the building we had been led to (there was no real name displayed anywhere, probably deliberately) and realised it did not correspond to the address I had for Medina Spa. I then walked out of the door and back into the alley and (despite insistent shouts of "my friend, my friend, where are you going" from the same guy) found the correct spa at the end of the alley. We then left the first place and went to the real Medina spa. The other spa is located just before Medina spa (which is right at the end of the alley, on the right, when coming from the place Jemaa Fna, talking the Rue Des Banques), which is confusing at the best of times and obviously this person was taking advantage of that. Be warned, this type of deliberate deception seems to, unfortunately, be quite common in Marrakech.

This Place is Good. Not having had a Hammam before (massage) my wife an I booked in here for an early evening appointment. Friendly staff greeted us and we were given a locker to deposit our clothes, given a bathrobe and directed to the massage room. Some hammams provide paper underwear but this one didn't. We disrobed and showered, oiled and subsequently massaged by a lady who used a hand glove and black soap.I was really surprised at the amount of dirt which came off me during the scrub which was done over all of the body. This despite showering every day etc. Grossant oil was applied (a combination of seven oils) and after a final shower we left for the next stage.Upstairs we were given a half hour massage, the masseuse using Argon oil. It was a very relaxing experience which left you feeling very clean and warm. Finally, we were given a time to relax further with a drink of mint tea before dressing and departing. We both slept very well that night ! It was a great experience and the staff were very professional. Well worth a visit.

Really nice. I came here for My first ever hammam, so I don't really have anything to compare to. I had The hammam+scrub+30min massage, was met by really Nice and attentive Staff and had a really cozy time all in all! The scrub could maybe have been a bit More intense,but The nice staff (Naima &Rislane) made me oversee such small details. Skin feels super smooth now, but My hair was left poorly washed which is less nice.. Also surprisingly the prices on their website are apparently not updated, so upon arrival they first showed me the new prices(70drhm more). I would definitely come here again!

Wonderful hammam and massage. I had the hammam and massage package. It was excellent value and very invigorating.Having had a Berber Massage, I made sure I requested a firm massage. We also agreed on a firm scrub. The scrub did not really compare to the absolute grating I received at the public hammam I went to in Assilah, but I felt very smooth after. The massage was very good- not just an oily rub!The spa is located at the end of an alley, so it can be a little unpleasant if you are alone at night. It is a real oasis from the noise and chaos of the rest of the Marrakech medina.

Great value and great service. Firstly, when you try to find this place beware of scouts near the main road who will try to fool you by saying this spa is closed or doesn't exist etc. IGNORE them. The spa is down the end of quite a small and quiet street so do not get sucked in by the scouts as sincere as they may seem. We took advantage of the valentine's offer and booked in for a 2h15 session for 400dhs pp. The treatment was fantastic. So relaxing, especially after a long day of navigating the hustle and bustle of the souks nearby. I must have fallen asleep at least 3 times and almost forgot my own name! Such was the level of comfort and relaxation! The experience was made even better by the warmth and friendliness of the the staff, in particular Khalid who was responsible for our reservation. A real highlight of our stay in Marrakesh and one I would most definitely repeat. Thank you Medina Spa! Just a small tip, I would recommend taking an extra pair of underwear if you do not fancy going commando.

Good experience. The hammam was good. I really enjoyed the scrub. They really should warn guests about the scalding hot walls and floor. I'm taking away a star for the massage. It was more of an oil rub rather than a massage. Also, my husband asked if we could pay by card and the receptionist said he'd try. But when we finished he just flat out refused to take card. I understand there are fees and such but if you're not going to take it, just say so at the beginning instead of putting us in a awkward and unpleasant situation at the end of the treatment.

Best value for money.. We had a simple package. 45 hamam and scrub 30 minutes of massage, mint tea, for 550 Dhm for a couple. We had our young daughter also with us for 300 dhm and we had the treatments all together. Ideal for a family.They kept the schedule as expected so the experience overall was about 1hr, 45 minutes. No rush at all. Towels, robes were clean, all people extremely friendly. I have to comment that the massage was very good (I have a lot of experience) and was easily adapted to my needs (I like more the strong revitilizing one, than the soft relaxing...).Take an extra underware with you if you do not wish the one they provide you. You will jit be fully naked during the treatmants.It is a rather small, clean, cozy and friendly place with very good service. Do not expect marble baths, rose petals everywhere, pools etc. You get what you pay. A revitilizing experience near the hectic Jemaa. We booked it again for the last day before we leave as we do not want to experiment and we were 100% satisfied.

Good Place to escape the hustle and bustle of the souks.... We had a very nice and relaxing time there... paid 75€ for two people... nice hamam with different treatments .. afterwards One hour Basic massage... our bodies felt very good after the treatments... good choice if you will spend the money...
Great hamman and massage. We enjoyed the couples hamman and massage deal. Very relaxing, friendly staff and ideally located.Perfect after a busy couple of days exploring the Medina.

Loved it!. My mom and I are Tunisian so we are used to the hammam/spa oriental experience. Despite that, we loved medina spa because it was a traditional morrocan ritual. The team there was very professionnal and welcoming. The prices are also very good! I recommend it.

the opposite of relaxing. We have been to lots of spas and hammans around the world and this is the first one we ever left in the middle of a treatment. The young woman (just one for the two of us) in the hamman seemed confused - inattentive, inexperienced or disengaged, or a combination of the three. To be fair, the manager was very gracious and did not charge us, which was helpful. Judging from the other positive reviews, we might have caught it on an off day, but it was very off, indeed. Can't recommend it and wouldn't go back.

Could not fault the staff. We booked the night before (though I'm not sure we needed to) and the owner was really accommodating. Was gentle and not pushy in any way. The hammam was a great experience and really good value for money.

A feeling of wellbeing. Our second day in Marrakesh and we booked a Zen Duo scrub and massage. This was unbelievably relaxing and we felt really pampered. We'd recommend it, though it's hard to find down a narrow alleyway off the square
Highly recommend.. Lovely experience, welcoming friendly staff, great value for money, located in the heart of the Medina, relaxing and fab massage.

A luxurious and lavish experience. After much searching for a good hammam in Marrakech, we stumbled upon Medina Spa listed in tripadivor's top hammams. We were welcomed by a genuinely affable staff and delicious mint tea. We had found a discount to one of the spa packages on the website. It was only supposed to be available through online booking, but the receptionist gave us the discount in person. We partook in a traditional hammam with scrub, body mask, hair mask, and sauna. It was truly lavish to be bathed and scrubbed. We then had an hour massage, one of which was a new form called the 'California Massage' which included deeper pressure and was wonderful. The staff spoke mostly french and arabic, but they had enough english to make themselves understood and the receptionist was fluent. Everyone was accommodating, hospitable, and it was one of the few relaxing experiences we had in Marrakech. On our way out, we couldn't help remarking on how soft our skin and hair was and how supple our muscles had become, what can we say, a true luxury. Also, they provided slippers, towels, robes, and lockers.

Wonderful!. Medina spa was an excellent experience. The staff were extremely hospitable, friendly and total pros at what they do! The rates here are extremely competitive as well. We will definitely be back next time we're here!

Great Service. Good Prices. Clean. Tidy and Very Welcoming.. As a lone female attending a hammam it is always nerve wracking when you first go in but I was made very welcome and comfortable for the short wait until I was show to the dressing room. The Robes were clean and the shoes provided were comfy and clean. I was attended by one young woman who did not have much spoken English but was able to find gentle ways to move me here and there to follow the hammam process. Whilst I was uncertain about what happening, which oils and soaps were being used etc I was washed and scrubbed and then washed and rubbed into a relaxed state over a period of about 45 minutes. There is a lot of lying down, turning over and then getting up again, but she was a great assistant with calm direction and it felt like a patient and relaxed event. It was hot going at times but there was plenty of cool water on hand to splash my face, and when the lady realised I was overheating a quick word out the door and the steam was reduced in my spa room. On exit a sit down in the cool reception hall gazing up to the airy terraces of massage rooms above and a sip of the traditional mint tea... before dressing and exiting once again into the centre of the hustle bustle of Jma el Fna.Excellent location in the centre of town. A quiet back street just off the square makes it handy but also secluded from the main thoroughfare. Staff were helpful, discreet. Showed massive gratitude for the tip I gave but sought none at any stage in the process. Clean. Tidy. And at the special offer prices listed online for September not too expensive for a small treat. I would recommend for single females visiting the city. Not awkward or imposing here at all.

Great value for money. Visited with 7 friends and booked through Click Excursions. For approx. £28 we received the Hammam and a full body massage - incredibly good value for money bearing in mind in the UK we pay up to £70 for a massage!!!Altogether it was an amazing experience and something very fun to do with friends! The staff were very friendly and accommodating and made us feel very comfortable.

Recommendable!. As Korean, we've chosed the normal massage because we know how hamman is. Haha. Like every buliding does, this building wasn't look okay and was difficult to find it haha. so lady from the shop came to 'cafe France' to take us and we finally found it. The guy at the reception speaks english very well and the facility was quite nice and clean. For me, how it is clean is important! well the ladies who did massage for us are very lovely and kind. Price is quite reasonable I guess. And if you want, it's better to make a reservation in advance.

Have the honey! . Me and my boyfriend visited the Medina Spa and we had one of the packages with the honey scrub and massage. Highly recommended! My skin has never felt better..it was so soft! The treatments lasted a good amount of time, it wasn't rushed in the slightest. The staff were all very friendly and happy. The mint tea after was so scrumptious! We felt very relaxed leaving there. Oh and another good thing, it is very reasonably priced. Give it a go :)

Great in parts but bruised rib and burnt ankle not so good. We searched for a decent spa on line and Medina had good marks. There was an on-line discount price for two (750DH for full Hamman and massage (1 hour). The Hamman (wash and scrub) was great and we got thoroughly cleansed and scrubbed. However, the foot level vents pushing out really hot steam were a health and safety disaster. I accidentally caught the vent with my heel and was promptly scalded. This developed into a full scale blister the following day. The massage was not bad. Although I did ask for a strong massage (the lady masseuse was gently tinkering about with my legs) I did not expect what felt like a chiropodist crack on my spine and ribs halfway through. This caused actual real pain and bruised my ribs. My wife's masseuse had rough hands which caused friction during the massage. A bit of a shame as we were up for a great relaxation and deep massage and cleanse. We did get pretty relaxed but with a heel blister and bruised rib, and roughed up skin we can't really recommend this.
Relaxing . Very nice and relaxing. Me and my girlfriend had a couples experience with Hammam and massage. Was reasonably priced and was a perfect treat!

So refreshing!. My friend and I booked our Ultimate Beauty Package online. It was so affordable and the service was top notch. It was nice to have a relaxing day getting pampered. The Hammam was defiantly and experience, but we had fun. I recommend everyone do this, especially if you're traveling as part of a couple. I've never had my skin feel so soft!

Lovely experience & not expensive. My 17yr old daughter and I visited here today as we were really interested to try a Hammam experience. We had looked on TA at loads of different ones but the top scorers were also rather expensive. The owner of our Riad suggested this one as it was only a short distance away and luckily some other guests we met at breakfast had been and said it was good. There are a few bad reviews of this place and I admit I was expecting to be disappointed but it was unfounded. There are young men who hang around at the top of the lane who will tell you it's closed or not very good but ignore them.We were shown to a changing room with a locker when we arrived and given slippers and dressing gowns to put on. We both kept our pants on as we weren't offered paper ones. I'm not that fussed about nudity but my daughter was a bit self conscious so the knickers stayed on! Having read other reviews it recommends checking online for special offers which we did and got an oriental relaxing treatment together for 250 dhs each. We asked our Riad owner to book it for us and there was no problem at the spa as some other visitors have experienced. We were both shocked at how much dead skin is scrubbed off but it looks and feels amazing afterwards. My daughter and myself both enjoyed this Spa very much and we did as much giggling as relaxing - particularly during the foot scrub. The massage was excellent - I've had lots of massages and this one was done very well with the perfect amount of pressure. Overall I would definitely recommend this place as a great value, clean and professional spa. If you want rose petals and 5 star luxury then maybe you'll be disappointed here but for a pretty cheap and relaxing couple of hours in very nice surroundings then this is a good option. One last thing, we didn't tip. Not because it wasn't worth it but because the owner of our Riad said it's not expected (some hammams forbid it) and also if you do tip then 20/50 dhs is fine. If I went again I would keep a couple of 20's in my gown pocket to tip the Hammam girl and masseuse separately. They disappear afterwards and I'm always dubious about tips going to the intended staff if you give them to someone else.

Couples massage was perfect. We spent the afternoon in the spa on my boyfriend's birthday. We had a couples hammam and massage. We were showered, scrubbed, steamed, covered in honey and then massaged for about an hour, full body. It was fantastic. My skin felt amazing afterwards and it was the best massage either of us have ever had. Book through the website as the place was busy.

Very good value. My friend and I spent a very relaxing afternoon here. The staff were attentive and friendly and the spa itself clean and tidy. I had a lovely steam, facial and massage and enjoyed every moment. Would recommend this as a mid range option. Check the website as we took advantage of an offer that was only advertised online.

Good pampering after visiting the souks. If you have been roaming around Marrakech exploring all the things it could offer, a good way to end this is to get hammam and massage at Medina Spa. Beware on your way there because some guys would entice you not to proceed and offer you cheaper price. I enjoyed the hammam and the massage. I felt a million bucks after. The hammam wash truly exfoliated my skin. The massage was very relaxing. I loved the way the masseuse massaged my face.

Not the best massage, her phone was more important. Last week I booked a massage at Medina Spa. Staff was friendly and the place seemed clean. But is was by far not the best massage I ever had. Half of the time the masseuse was texting or I don't know what she was doing with her mobile phone?! In my opinion it's quite inappropriate for the staff to keep their mobile phones (with camera function??) in their hands when a naked guest is laying on their massage table. But ethics aside, if at least the massage was of a great quality I wouldn't even mind that so much. But no, I was by far not the best massage I ever had. The moments she used her both hands were relaxing. But I didn't feel better than I did before the massage. She finalized the massage with a head massage with her oily hands, so I walked out of the hammam with terribly dirty greasy hair. The hammam treatments might be fine (didn't try it), but I would definitely not recommend this hammam for a massage.

Disaster. I booked by email only to arrive and find the place looking a bit of a mess! I was told they had no booking for me and even if they had it couldn't go ahead. I'm not sure if there had been a flood or something similar. The fact they had no record of my booking anyway was disappointing. No apology or interest.

Very relaxing hammam. I had found and pre-booked a Hammam at Medina Spa, but when i arrived the lady had no record of my booking. She apologised and offered me a Hammam and messge for €30 (normally €40). I was scrubbed, washed, scrubbed and washed again then lay in the steam for about 15 minutes. I then went upstairs where i recived a full body message which lasted about 30 minutes. To finsh I sat on a pile of soft cushions with a glass of mint tea until I decided tha it was time to leave.Highly recommended.

Very good hammam. We wanted to do a hammam as a couple and there was a special offer here for 650 dirham for both of us. We found this on the hammam website, the woman in charge initially pretended not to know about this. Like every thing in Morocco be very clear what you are asking for and what you will be paying. We got undressed ( just wore pants) and were taken into a steam room. We were washed and soaped, had the soles of our feet scrubbed, and left to sweat. After about 15 mins we were rinsed and scrubbed very vigorously. We were then covered in a clay like substance and left again. The young woman dealing with me was more thorough than the one washing my husband. After being rinsed again we went for the massage. The building is an old one, with very steep stairs to the massage rooms, so difficult if you have limited mobility( and wearing hammam shoes!) The two masseurs were very good, and thorough, but there was a lot of whispering between them at times, and the young woman who was massaging my husband had a very loud persistent sniff; both things did distract from a relaxing atmosphere at times.We were there for just over two hours, and I can recommend the experience.

Nice spa, friendly staff, good value for money, easy to get to. The people who work there did everything to make us feel comfortable and the massages were very good. We were so pleased after the first visit that we returned three times. I liked the fact that they listened to our requirements and succeeded in making our experience relaxing and enjoyable. The prices are lower than other top spas (duo massage is good value) and the proximity to the main square is a great advantage. (When facing café de France, take the road to the left (rue des banques) and take the first lane on the right - don't be put off by the lane, once inside the spa, it's lovely!)

A great spa in the heart of the Medina. This spa rivalled any I've been to in Ireland with excellent staff and beautiful surroudings. I chose the delices d'orient which was exellent value for 400dh. I came out into the streets of the Medina relaxed and revived.

After a day in the Souks. After a day wandering the labyrinth of the souks it was great to find a spa near to the main square and the riad I was staying in. A really relaxing time and very well looked after by polite and friendly staff. This is going to be a must after every biking trip from now on.

Surprising! Friendly staff, great value and great location. This is just off the main square, very nice inside, friendly staff. My friends and I had the 2 hr package which actually lasted longer. We had the hamman, gommage, facial and full body massage- be aware they really mean FULL body so be sure to tell them if you are body concious! However we really enjoyed it and it was excellent value and very relaxing! Would highly recommend a visit.

Fun spa. My girlfriend and I wanted a hammam spa. Looked at the local ones and the more expensive hotel ones- Medina spa offered something in between.It was great- good hammam body scrub followed by massage and tea. To find it make sure you use the spa's website map and not trip advisors.

Hammam and massage. To end our trip to Marrakesh with a relaxed hammam we found our way to the medina spa. We took the esprit zen duo Marrakesh for 750dam. The hammam was not the best I have ever had, the girls were busy talking to eachother and we could not understand the language and I think they were gossiping and giggling about us. The Washing and scrubbing was shortly done and not very accurate. The massage we got later was more than perfect and did make it to a pleasant experience. But the hammam was below average. Normally I am used to be washed and scrubbed untill I wonder if there will be any skin left when I am done but now my skin was barely pink. But the price of 750dam is a resonable price for 2 persons. And the atmosphere is very well to relax and enjoy.

Great value!. Discovered this place by having a flyer thrust into my hand. I was a little dubious at first, but it was a lovely little spa. Not luxurious but had an authentic local feel. I had one of their packages that were great value. Hammam scrub, facial and massage. I was scrubbed clean and then a blissful couple of hours of pampering. Only thing was that they didn't speak English, but then who wants to talk - I was so relaxed I fell asleep.

Massage!. My 9 y.o. son and I went to this spa in medina today. We were just looking for some hammam in medina and ended up in there. We purchased a package for two, including hammam, scrabbling etc and massage. I have to say the massage was the best I ever had (and I had it in many places and countries). The lady therapist was very knowledgeable of what she was doing and it was divine! However, the hammam itself didn't make any sense. If felt a little uncomfortable when, after scrubbing, the two attendants applied a tiny amount of mask on our bodies and just turned over and started talking to each other paying little attention to us. Eventually and after wandering what's going on for a while we left the hammam early for a massage which, as I said, was grand and worth visiting overall. The building and decor is fascinating and the hammam is located on a narrow street off the main square which added the value to our experience.

Relaxation at it's best. Place suggested and arranged by Riad. There are numerous about so wanted to make sure we sent to a nice professional one. Had the full Esprit zen duo Marrakech (for two) which lasted 1:45 and only cost 750dhrs for 2. (£54) Worth every minute and every penny. Came out feeling relaxed, cleansed and ready to do battle in the Souks all over again.

Blissful. We did a 2 person package while staying in a nearby Riad and it was wonderful. After scrub and masque felt like a layer of grime had been removed and following the 30 min massage felt fantastic. Also, thought that for what we paid the two person package was well worth the money. Confirmed for me that Hammans are the best.

Great find. This was booked by our Riad (Chamali) and was struggling to find a Hammam that would take me, my two grown up sons and girlfriend - a lot are single sex. This was great as we could all keep our swimsuits and enjoy the experience together. Wont spoil what happens if you have never had a Hammam - but worth a visit - lovely place - nice staff and felt fantastic afterwards. We did a traditional Hammam (45 mins) followed by 1 hour massage - bliss.

The best massage I've ever had in my life.... Today was our first full day in Marrakech and number one on our to do list was to go to a hammam. We thought about the public ones but as two girls in our early 20s on our first trip were too nervous of the unknown so went for medina after looking in lonely planet and the website. We were so happy with our choice!!We decided to treat ourselves and went for a duo package "Zen duo Marrakech" which was brilliant. We were scrubbed and soaped several times over in the steam room downstairs, allowed to relax, supplied with tea a couple of times when we relaxed on the sofa upstairs. Then we had a brilliant full body massage - possibly our best ever!The ladies were all lovely and friendly, we left feeling completely relaxed. Towels, robes and shoes were provided so we just took bikini bottoms! Very tempted to return before the end of our holiday!

Excellent massage. I am used to have professional massage at home, and usually try anywhere I go, mainly in Asia. I am quite picky about many aspects of the massage, the service, ambience, and hygiene. The masseuse was excellent. Not just her technique, but her discretion and kindness. Ambience was average. I was expecting a room with wonderful smells, good oil, etc, which did not happen. Service was below average (they only have small size robes and I was not offered a shower or the use of toilet after the massage, so I left all oily). Hygiene was fine, of what I could see. The price is not cheaper than I would pay in Europe for an average place. Overall, for the living cost in Marrakech, the cost is too high.But after 3 days of non stop walking, I gladly paid the price for a good massage, even if not the best place. But I think Marrakech if great for other things, not massage. It cannot beat Indonesia or Thailand.

Highly recommended!. Our riad recommended this place (and actually helped book reservations) after we discovered the spa we were looking into was booked. Luckily, they had a newer spa (Medina Spa) with availability two hours later.Very tastefully done. The hamman was quite an experience. You're in a room where a woman literally scrubs you pretty forcefully, thus removing your dead skin and leaving you feeling like a newborn baby. Some may not be so comfortable here because others may be in the same room but the good thing is you're supposed to keep your underwear on (for those, like me, who are more prudish).After an hour, we had our massages. Mine was just ok. Poor girl must have been tired because she had no strength in her fingers. Left somewhat unimpressed (although the others in my party enjoyed their massages).One downside was that their credit card machine was broken and so they only accepted cash. Wish they could have told us in advance, so we wouldn't have wasted half an hour getting cash from an ATM.Minutes from Jemaa el Fna

A must on every holiday. My partner and I just wanted to experience a gommage but the Hammans the locals use are separate for men and women so decided to try this on the recommendation from a guide book. We new from the map roughly where we were going and found it fairly easily. The building inside was stunning and an oasis of calm after being at the square. We were greeted at the reception and shown a menu of the services offered in various languages and there was no hard sell to have anything more. than we wanted. From here we lead to a small changing room with lockers to change into bathrobes. When changed we were taken into the steam room for our gommage. We both quickly adjusted to the heat and were washed and scrubbed from top to toe. Afterwards we were lead back to the seating area for a cup of mint tea and then time to change and go back to the real world. The whole time we were there we never felt rushed and the staff were very helpful and friendly. IF you have the time I would recommend having a gommage and would definitely return here.

mixed feelings. This SPA has been recommended to me by a friend. When I went there I was stunned with the beautiful decor and very nice reception service that greeted me with some mint tea and sweets. I had a wellness package that included traditional hammam, massage and facial and it was amazing! I felt wonderful and very relaxed. So I went again as the prices are really cheap compare to other hammams and spas I have been to in and around Marrakech. And to my disappointment I must have got the worst therapist who works there. She was not a good masseur at all and she answered her mobile while doing my massage. Very unprofessional. So I would say that a visit at Medina Spa can be an extremely pleasurable or extremely disappointing experience, all depends on the therapist you will get.

Amazing . I requested a room for both of us me and my wife we had 1h30m a massage with hot oil and hot herbal. We enjoyed the massage. Prices kind of middle.
I recommend to visit baan thai massage.
Good luck for you all.

The BEST Thai massage!!!. A Thai massage is kinda like someone doing a yoga class on you and they hit every pressure point and stretch you every which way. It is done on the floor and you keep your clothes on ( at this place, they give you a comfy outfit to put on). I never thought I would find a Thai massage in Marrakech, but this place came highly recommended and it did deliver. The hamam is very nice and I would recommend getting the traditional hamam services and following it with the Thai massage or any other kind of massage you want...they have several choices. After my treatments, I was fortunate to met the owner, Remy, who explained how he runs the place and the in depth process he goes through to hire his staff. He has put is heart and soul into his establishment and it shows in every detail! A must do while in Marrakech. Your body and mind will thank you!
Spa Day. Excellent Hammam and Massage. We also did pedicure and the staff were highly trained and professional.

Very good thai massages. Went there for a Thai massage and it was up to my expectations... made by thai therapeutThey do also hama and scrubbing by morrow an business.It is a rather good money for value. The minimum price for a thai massage is 500dirham for an hour (40 pounds) up to 570 dirhamWill certainly go back
Perfect hammam and massage . I recommend to try it. Nice stuff and services, u can choose any massage that u like ,thanks thanks thanks thanks ,......
Fantastic owner. Had a small issue with my massage and the French owner stepped in and solved the problem immediately. This type of customer service is rare in the Middle East.

Nice hammam though much shorter than promised. 2 of us signed up for the 1 hour hammam experience.It was supposed to last for one hour though ended up being a 35 minute hammam that too combined for the both of us. It just felt completely rushed. Place was nice otherwise. Wouldn't go back

The Moroccan Hammam was great - the rest forget it. Have booked 3 treatments (Hammam, Massage, Facial) at Baan Thai. The 2nd time we went to this place ...Hammam - great treatment ... however somehow steam bath too small for twoMassage - was OK - nothing exciting Facial - forget it - they do not even have the basics about how a facial should beOverall we shall not go back to this place, which in comparison to few other great places, is rather on the expensive side.
excellent. Nice place to go for great thai massage and super reflexologie plantaire. so if you want a great treatment dont miss baan thai

Amazing massage, best ever. I took my cousin there as part of her birthday and I can tell you this is by far the best massage we have ever had!! I don't think words can express how amazing it was. Defo recommended!!

Thai Heaven in the heart of Marrakesh. Excellent place , If you visit Marrakesh you have to go to this place after a long walk shopping in Gueliz or Sahat el Fna ,easy to find (in Guéliz Avenue Med V) in the same building as Charlot coffee House(any local can guide you to this place).The masseuses are so friendly and professional. They make you feel very comfortable and welcomed(communication in English). The massage rooms are private and you feel like you are in the heart of Thailand with all these decorations and music.

Fantastic massage. In fact, one of the very best massages I've ever received - from a thai woman just new to Marrakech. Excellent facilities. They will likely try to upsell you, and it isn't inexpensive for sure. But overall very worth it - I will be back.

Great, authentic Thai massage. In my opinion, Thai massages are the best in the world - and this was a great spot to experience a traditional Thai massage in Marrakech. My masseuse was Thai and ran through many of the same stretches and pressure points that I have experienced in Thailand. Yes, the price is more than you would typically pay for a massage elsewhere in Marrakech (or Thailand), but totally worth it for an hour of expert care.The location can be difficult to spot on your first visit - enter at the Residents Les Jasmins office building and take the lift to level four. Turn right and you'll see signage for Baan Thai's door.

Worth the money. I was put off by the prices but went because of the TA reviews. It was a good decision.It was spotless professional and a great Hamman/Massage.You can pay half the price at other spas, I cannot comment on the others but this was well worth £50. 2 hours of pampering. Came out polished and needing a sleep.

Loved the hammam. I have been visiting the Baan Thai institute for quiet a few times now over the last two years.Frankly , the hammam was the best i had so far in Morocco.It is a small space and not the traditional deco you expect , unlike other touristic places, the black sleek surface was just perfect and the place feels cozy and upon request , i had loads of steam , so it was fantastic.As for the massages, i often have the traditional Thai massage , the therapists are all friendly and professional and the massages are good.The only point they should look at is the isolation , sound proofing, since sometimes you can hear people walking outside the treatment room or the reception phone/doorbell ringing.

Amazing massage!. I have had many massages in many styles and I must say that On's massage topped the list. She doesn't speak English, but it didn't matter since she is a truly intuitive massage therapist. Although she is quite small, she is incredibly strong and gets out every last knot in your back and neck. The institute itself is lovely and serene. We had a hammam/massage package but the hammam was nothing special. The steam room was not warm enough and the hammam scrub didn't use black soap (the package was from Carrefour!) or good implements. The hammam part was rather awkward, but we had a lovely spot to relax post hammam and had mint tea while we waited for the massage part. Unlike many spas/hammams in Marrakech, couples are allowed to be together during the hammam and massage which made for a nicer experience. This was truly a treat and worth doing!

BEST HAMMAN in Marrakech!! Average Thai Massage. This is one of the most amazing Hamman/massage type experiences ever. Forget all the other places in Marrakech and head here for the BEST experience ever! It is intimate, relaxing, very thorough, and at no point did I feel uncomfortable despite being virtually naked. Ask for Fatima (I think that was her name) She is pretty amazing and made me feel comfortable and SO relaxed after! Completely skilled and professional ! I booked to have a Thai massage after. I would suggest to avoid this. Stick to the Hamman. It is completely amazing enough to make you fully relaxed. I have had many many Thai massages and have been to Thailand numerous times. This is no way lives up to the Thai massages that are for one tenth of the price. They did not seem to know the pressure points as well nor applied the pressure in the right way. My friend was also disappointed with the Thai massage but very very happy with the Hamman.Forget all the rest, book your hamman here. It is the best and super clean too!

Truly Outstanding Massage. Having read the reviews during 2013 we booked a Hamman & Massage.This was our first Hamman & will not be our last, it was firm but once you got used to the pressure used it was an experience not to be missed. This was carried out in a professional way but virtually no part of either of our bodies were spared. My Wife was given a micro thong for the Hamman & I was given a waterproof covering that looked more like a see though Shower Cap. This seemed quite strange but once we got past the intial embarrassing part it was well worth it.This followed by a short relaxing break during which we were given a refreshing drink.Our one & a half hour Thai Massage with oil was carried out in the same room which I found a lttle too hot but was about the right temporature for my Wife.We both had a Medium to Firm Massage & both Thai Ladies ensured that they unlocked any tension we may have had, it was certainly firm bordering on brutal at times but we both felt much better once they had finished. They both concentrated on areas that needed extra pressure but i dont think we needed to tell them where as she found the areas on my back & shoulders that needed the extra attention.As stated in a previous review we were once again given the skimpiest of clothing to wear, my wife yet again had the tiniest thong imagionable & I was given underwear with slightly more material but it was never going to cover what it was suposed to cover which I am sure probably cheared up the masseuse. It was advertised as a full body massage & both of us felt that this was as close to a full body massage as you could get whilst still being professional. As you can imagine the clothing given actually seemed pointless but the towels did cover our modesty for some of the time. This did not put us off having a second masage at the Baan Thai & we both had another hour & a half massage without the Hamman but on this occasion we had the medium massage which was out of this world & left us totally relaxed. We will definately go back to the Baan Thai when we return to Marrakech in the future. Colin & Nicola.West Sussex.

Excellent. We were only in Marrakech for 3 days and had various treatments at 3 different places whilst we were there. This was definitely the best. I had the Hammam, followed by the massage and it was great - the masseuse really knew what she was doing and managed to unlock all my tension without hurting me ( which was not the case everywhere!!). Ladies, be prepared for the Hammam - they really do wash everywhere, which, as a Brit, was a little disconcerting!! She was also VERY harsh with the loofah, having said that I came out with skin like a new born and feeling better than I had in months.
