My husband had a massage and said it was the best he has ever had ( including across Asia, the Carribean and in the UK). Good value I thought - around £100 for 2 of us. We will be back!
great facial. during our visit in Marrakech I had a facial at this place. very nice ambiente, friendly service and a great facial. very good value for the money.

Thai massage and hammam - brilliant. Finding this place was difficult for all of 5 minutes, having been let down by the location services on trip advisor. Putting that aside, the hamam was brilliant the thai massage was very energising. Left feeling light on my feet

peaceful and welcoming retreat. I was warmly welcomed and had reservation confirmed as soon as I arrived. The Spa smells of heavenly Lemongrass and instantly puts you at ease. My shoes were changed and I was taken to a room with comfortable recliners with pillows and blankets for my pedicure and manicure. The therapist was efficient and did a beautiful job. After pedicure was dry I was taken to the therapy room for my one hour Thai and Oil Massage. The Thai therapist did an amazing job. The massage was as I had experienced in Thailand. Therapy rooms are comfortable and warm. All staff members that I encountered were friendly and welcoming. I am very much looking forward to returning.

Massage was excellent, hammam was average. The quality of the full body massage at Baan Thai Institute exceeds that of Heritage spa (rated 'Excellent' on Tripadvisor) and Mythic Oriental Spa.The quality of the hammam, however, was mediocre at best, and the 'relaxing area' was rather noisy.

Impeccable!. The Receptionist was cheerful and welcoming. Spa very clean and perfectly maintained. My wife and I were very impressed by the wonderfully professional massage applied by our respective Thai therapists. In short the massage was excellent and is well worth a 5***** status. One slight observation... the management should consider making hot towels available for the therapists. That will allow them to rub the body (wipe-out the oils) after the massage. If they have that in place already, then it was not done neither for my wife nor for me.

Good Massage. Very good massage and in a clean and relaxing environment. They give you a really tiny jock-strap thingy to wear during the massage. As a well endowed male, It was way too small for me, so everything was showing but I was ok with that :)

Extremely relaxing space in a beautiful appartment. Made an appointment via phone. Went for the Marrakech-Bangkok package and is was top class!The day after I tried the traditional Thai massage and this was really amazing.If ever I come back to Marrakech I will definitely visit the Baan Thai Institut again!!

Amazing Hammam experience. One thing you need to experience in Morocco is Hammam! I absolutely love spas and massages so I was very excited about this new experience. However, my friends kept discouradging me by showing me reviews about Hamman treatments that involved being washed with boiling water and touched in private areas (which does sound a bit scary I must admit). But I just knew these reviews must be over exaggerated so I decided to give it a try anyways.I was suggested a Spa nearby our Riad - the Farnatchi Spa. Its a nice looking spa with a typical Maroccan design (which I fancy very much). The reception lady was nice and welcoming, spoke very good English and put a lot of effort into making me feel comfortable. Then the 'lady' that was doing the Hammam came and took me to the sauna area. The Hammam tretament was very discrete. I didnt experience any awkward touching, rubbing or scratching. Since the Hammam treatment is usually followed by a massage, I had to wait around 10 minutes until the 'lady' prepared the massage room. That wasnt a problem either. I was chating with the reception lady while drinking a cup of verbena tea in a beautiful welcoming hall, which you can see on the picture. Then I had an hour long relaxing massage. I trully recommend the Farnatchi Spa. It was so relaxing! The only reason I am not giving them the highest rating is that I found it a bit too pricy.

A nice spa in the chaos of the medina. This is a new spa which we were told opened a few months ago. It does look just like the pictures. The massage was OK for me nothing special but nice and professional. My friend found her massage good. They ask you fill in a form beforehand and then you are taken to a room which has an ensuite shower. So you you have the option to shower after your treatment. The spa does not have a pool or relaxation area. If you are looking for a spa with a pool then i would recommend to look for one outside of the medina. The prices are the same as what you would find in a European country.

Lazy masseuse ruined the experience!. My husband and I stayed in Marrakech for 3 nights and went to Fernatchi Spa on August 31st. I'm quite disappointed that we did not get the wonderful experience everyone else wrote on TripAdvisor.. When we walked inside the spa, 2 ladies eventually showed up to greet us. Neither spoke English; quite hard to communicate. We told them we'd like to get a massage, they told us to sit down and wait; one lady left through one door I'm assuming to get the rooms ready. We waited in awkward silence for at least 10 minutes; the lady who stayed behind didn't speak a word of English nor offer us a drop of water.Now to the massages, we were led through one of the doors leading upstairs, my husband through one room and I next door. This is where it started to get bad. Unfortunately I got the "new" lady. I kept emphasizing I like hard pressure and we were paying extra for deep tissue massages. She was basically rubbing oil on my body and when I asked her to put more pressure, she would sigh and say "more? More?!" She also yawned about 10 times during the first 40 minutes. Then all of a sudden, she told me to relax and left the room. I thought maybe she was getting hot towels or hot stones or.. something. I was left alone for 5 MINUTES. I only know because I got up to check the time. I was fed up at this point, I opened the door and she was sitting right by the room and jumped up when I came out. I asked what the heck is going on and she hurried back in the room and kept telling me to relax and lay back down. Then she started wiping the oil off with a dried towel. Finished. I got up and was obviously pissed. She asked me if I was ok and I said no I'm not. I paid for a 60 minute deep tissue massage and you basically did 40 minutes then left for 5 minutes. She started to freak out and offered me to lay back down for 15 more minute massage. At this point I had enough and I'm not sure how 15 minutes of her terrible massage would make the situation better. After a few minutes of going back and forth, I asked her to please leave the room so I can get dressed.  Let me just say I've gotten massages from Thailand, Cancun, Dominica Republic, multiple places in NY and VA in the States. I've never had a masseuse leave towards the end of the massage and tell me to "relax" and just lay there. Ridiculous. The only reasons I'm giving them 2 stars is because apparently my husband had a wonderful massage and the spa is beautiful inside and high technology (built in sound system and thermostat in each room) They did end up giving a 30% credit towards our bill but i would NOT recommend this place for getting massages. You never know if you might end up getting the masseuse I got.

A beautiful setting and wonderful spa. During my stay in Marrakesh I opted to spend an afternoon at this spa. The staff were delightful and professional and the experience could not have been better. I wish I would have had time for a traditional hammam, I would have come back for more!

Amazing experience. It is my wife and my first time in Morocco and after many days of exploring, a few days of hectic traffic, heat and fumes, we entered the Farnatchi Spa curious and excited for our first hammam. And we were blown away. Gracious, friendly, just enough explaining but also letting us enjoy the experience. We feel simply amazing, completely refreshed and cleansed. We both highly recommend and wish we were staying another day as we would be right back for more!

A beautiful oasis. As regular visitors to the beautiful Riad Farnatchi, we were so happy about the opening of the spa. In keeping with the serene and elegant taste and style of the Riad, the spa is exquisite and immaculate, from the shining black and white mosaic floor, to the intricately carved woodwork and plasterwork in keeping with traditional Moroccan workmanship, to the beautiful marble of the hammam. The treatment rooms are inviting, well-soundproofed (for uninterrupted peace!), and have as high quality and as comfortable massage tables as I have ever encountered. Perhaps the best aspect, though, is the warmth and professionalism of Saida and her excellent team. Their massages and hammams were as wonderful as I have had anywhere in the world - and my wife and I have been fortunate enough to stay at a large number of the world's finest hotels. So a resounding vote of approval - and thanks! - for an absolute gem of a spa, an oasis in fact.

A hidden gem in the old town - A Must Visit!. I went to Farnatchi Spa on my last day in Marrakech and it was the perfect ending to a great trip. I was warmly greeted by the manager and was shown into the beautifully decorated spa. I was offered a glass of fresh mint tea whilst I looked through the menu of treatments and decided on their Tonic Massage which they tailored to 90 minutes for me. The massage was amazing, my whole body felt totally tension free. Th massage rooms have ensuite showers which mean that you can shower and change in your own time, maximising the relaxed feeling from the massage.

The best!. During our very first trip to Morocco, we stayed at the Riad Farnatchi in Marrakech. The Farnatchi Spa was conveniently located with an entrace right from the Riad, we couldn't have been luckier. After an interesting few days getting used to Marrakech, we decided to take an afternoon and visit the spa for the hammam and a massage. Upon entering the Farnatchi Spa, we were taken aback by how clean and luxurious the environment was and how friendly the host was. I highly recommend the Royal Hammam treatment as that experience blew us away. The massage therapists were highly skilled and professional. I would highly recommend Farnatchi Spa and will definitely return should we travel again to Marrakech

Oasis in The Medina. Farnatchi Spa is a true oasis in the Medina! The staff are so welcoming and with the beautiful mint tea on arrival it feels like the hustle and bustle of the medina is literally a world away. My back massage was amazing and the perfect way to end the day and so relaxing - didn't want to leave. Will definitely be back - such a find in Marrakech!

What a find. As I was wandering the medina, Farnatchi caught my eye because it was so crisp and clean from the outside compared to its neighbors. I walked in and immediately felt like I was in an oasis. The owner took the time to explain the Moroccan tradition of the hammam and answered my general questions about Marrakesh that I had accumulated. I'm not a spa guy, but I would highly recommend Farnatchi to anyone.

A wonderful spa treat on our final day!!. We had a lovely spa day with both of us enjoying a Royal Hammam and Relaxing full Body massage. Saida was a fantastic host, very welcoming, kind and also informative. She is a complete credit to Farnatchi Spa and Marrakech. We thank you ever so much for taking care of us during our last day. Highly recommend!!

Perfect. I went to Farnatchi spa to escape the hassle and bustle and have an afternoon of relaxing treatments and was stunned by just how good all their treatments were and how reasonably priced it was! I had a Royal Hammam followed by the Ila vital wellbeing treatment which were both sublime. This is a must visit for anyone wanting great spa treatments in Marrakech.

Wonderful Spa in Marrakech . My mother and I spent 5 days in Marrakech. To relax from the crazy shopping mode, we set out to try a Hamam à la marocaine! As I was browsing in this app, I found a lot Hamams or Spa's. I just couldn't decide. So by fortunate chance we Stumbled in to Farnatchi spa! And boy was that a lucky strike. So this is a review to assure you all that we ( my mother and I ) recommend it strongly and if you ever are indecisive just choose Farnatchi Spa.The hostesses and personnel was very cordial, polite trustworthy and very kind. The atmosphere was beautiful and relaxing. A mixture of traditional architecture and modern facilities. And may I add, very, very clean. My mother and I chose Royal Hamam treatment and a simpler version of it, and when we left the spa we felt clean into our bone and soul.I would personally like to send my thanks to; Fatima (who scrubbed us so well and made us feel so comfortable in her presence), to Najla (for being a wonderful hostess and receiving us so well) and specially to Saida ( for hostessing us when we stumbled in, took our booking and gave us wonderful tips about Marrakech).For us, it was a heavenly hour we spent there, and worth every penny!

Best Spa! . This is a stunning Spa in the heart of Marrakech! Clean, bright, great vale and wonderfully run by the expert team of therapists and the very kind and enthusiastic manager! I hope very much to return again soon.

The most relaxing facial! . I had a fantastic Ila facial at Farnatchi Spa today. The service was impeccable and the facial itself was relaxing and left my skin feeling amazing! Highly recommend this wonderful Spa, a little oasis away from the bustle.

Best Spa in Marrakech. I have visited a couple of the Marrakech Spa's on a few different visits and am stunned by how much better this experience was than my previous ones. Farnatchi Spa is light, elegantly designed with traditional and modern twists. The Spa was immaculately clean and the welcome was second to non. I went for one of their Ila treatments, the Vital wellbeing and a Royal Hammam and came out feeling like a new person. I will no longer be looking for other spas on future visits to Marrakech as I would only end up being disappointed.

Back again!. My 2nd visit to this incredible spa was every bit as good as the first. I sadly didn't have time for a hammam or massage but needed an emergency manicure and polish. They kindly fitted me in and 2 weeks later my nails still look as good as new!

Superb Spa, Excellent Facilities, A Truly Relaxing Experience.. My wife and I took and mid season short break from work to have a quick week of rest and relaxation. We popped in initially just to enquire about the facilities and wow, what a place. A beautifully fitted out traditional building, light, airy and very welcoming. We were shown the tariff of treatments available (very extensive) and all very reasonably priced. No high pressure selling techniques just the offer of a mint tea or fruit juice while we browsed. We both booked a Hammam, a traditional steam bath and scrub similar to a Turkish bath. I opted for the back massage and Karen opted for the full body massage. My back massage must have been good as I fell asleep at the end! Feeling fully rejuvenated it was an experience well worth the money and I would definitely recommend a visit if you're looking for a completely relaxing experience. Karen certainly enjoyed it and booked a facial for the following day. It was whilst waiting for her I was shown around the Riad Farnatchi, I'll review that separately so as not to ramble on too much. But if you're visiting Marrakesh, put Farnatchi Spa on your "to do" list.

Tranquility and in the heart of the medina. My boyfriend and I visited Farnatchi spa with two friends during our trip to Marrakesh this May. We all opted for a Royal Hammam which was an hour's treatment and included a full body scrub using the traditional black soap with lovely eucalyptus oils, a body mask and finished off with a super massage. I had previously had a hammam at Les Bains de Marrakesh on a different trip but the three others in our party had never experienced it before. From the moment we arrived we were looked after and put at ease. I found the staff to be so much friendlier and more professional here and they all speak good English and are able to explain the treatments to you - which was very helpful for my friends who had no idea what a hammam involved. My boyfriend and I were in one Hammam and our two friends in another. It was an incredible experience and every effort was made to ensure we were looked after and felt comfortable. The spa itself was really clean and beautifully styled - I loved the way it has been designed and renovated with such authenticity whilst at the same time seeming modern and simple and CLEAN. The tranquility of the spa is miraculous as you are right in the heart of the medina. I would love to visit Farnatchi again and might try a massage next time. Apparently they have one of the best trained masseurs in Marrakesh!

Heavenly Oasis. We loved here it so much that we visited twice during our trip! I had Ahmed for my massage and it was the best I have ever head, I love his spiritual touch and I can understand why he has clients fly in from all over the world just to see him. I also had a traditional hamam and this too was lovely, the therapist was caring and gentle and I felt relaxed throughout. The spa is obviously beautiful and they use the organic handmade Ila Spa products which are fabulous.

Stunning and authentic luxury Spa. Visited the Farnatchi Spa when staying at the Riad of the same name and it was an absolute delight, a peaceful haven with wonderful staff, our Hammam more than lived up to expectations with calming lotions and potions and a wonderful atmosphere, couldn't recommend it more highly to anyone in need of some downtime from the outside hustle and bustle, they've truly created a wonderfully authentic experience

Pure luxury. I went with two girlfriends on a weekend away and the spa was just the ticket. I've been to a few spas in Marrakech but none rival the service and feel of farnatchi. The spa its self is a serene escape from the hustle of the streets outside and the treatments are so considered and good it's hard to fault them. I was 5 months pregnant and was treated with such care and attention. My massage was one of the best I've ever had and my massuse was very spiritual which really added to the experience for me. Loved it. Will be back. Every weekend of the funds allow!

relaxed, professional and thoroughly enjoyed by both of us. This is a truly stunning Spa and it became one of the highlights of our trip! We had a wonderful Hammam (Hammam Royal) followed by genuinely one of the best massages I have ever had. We went for the Ila treatments and although slightly more expensive they really were superb and I would whole heartedly recommend trying them, they were so good my girlfriend actually bought some of the products to take home with her. The staff are extremely welcoming and very professional. This really is a must do thing if you are in Marrakech!

lovely relaxing oasis. Newly opened, impeccably designed spa. We had the whole package - Hammam, gommage, massage and our attendant Fatima was lovely. I really enjoyed it. We were offered tea at the start and end and were very well looked after.The Manager also gave us a tour of the Riad and it looks like an amazing place to stay.

Visit to the Farnatchi Spa - Hamman and Back Massage. The Farnatchi is Spa is deeply stylish and contemporary haven from the excitement of the souk and sightseeing in wonderful Marrakech. I visited at the start of my week's holiday and the service from the sympathetic and professional staff was exemplary. I imagined that the purpose of the hamman is to relax, be diverted, and to cleanse, and the massage to aliviate aches and pains - and at the Farnatchi my expectations were exceeded. The tranquility achieved in the marble hamman was just what I needed and I had been nervous in advance. In addition the staff gave me excellent recommendations on restaurants and shops, which greatly enhanced my stay. If I could stay at the Farnatchi Riad one day, I would be very happy. VC

Idyllic. WOW - just WOWI have been waiting for this spa to open since my last trip staying at Riad Farnatchi when it was still being built.I knew from the quality of the Riad that the spa would be just as good. And it didn't disappoint!The interior design is exceptional - they have created a really chic environment which is very tranquil and zen. Its a great example of modern paired back Moroccan design.My friends and I started with the hammam experience which was amazing. The lady doing the treatment was so lovely and we came out with the softest skin.I also had a relaxing facial which was great - I felt like a new woman after only a couple of hours in the spa!I couldn't recommend a trip to this spa enough - its very central offering wonderful treatments in a beautiful setting. Will be returning again this year without a doubt!

Awesome Spa visit. My friend and I (both 23) discovered the Spa accidently in the old town. We just came back from a hammam in les bains de marrakech and were quite dissapointed with their treatment, so we decided to take a chance with this new Spa. We were welcomed very warmly and served tea on the terrace upstairs while waiting for the rooms to get ready for our massages. The staff is very friendly and attentive, the rooms are very clean, bright and newly renovated and the massage was super relaxing!

World Class Spa in the Medina. Could not have been more pleased with my service at Farnatchi Spa. We checked in to the adjacent Riad Farnatchi and they mentioned the new spa. I called to book my mother and myself treatments and they were able to accommodate us within one hour. Saaida, the spa manager then came to our suite to confirm our appointments. When it was time for the service, a spa representative met us (in our bath robes!) on the roof of the riad and we walked to the spa. The facility is gorgeous, just like the riad. Very elegantly designed without being ostentatious. I had the massage with warm oils and herbs. My mother had the Royal Hammam. The staff was well trained and professional. Cannot wait until my next trip to Marrakech- I will definitely return!

Best spa in Marrakech. I've been going to the Farnatchi Hotel for years and love it. Recently visited and took a trip to their new spa and it is amazing - the same extremely high standards one can expect of this very established hotel. Beautiful therapy rooms and experienced masseuses in tranquil setting. A distinct step up from Les Baines de Marrakech which we had visited previously.

Zen-like experience in the old medina of Marrakech. As a resident of Marrakech I am always searching for new experiences and in particular, the traditional ritual of a Moroccan hammam. I spotted a sign for a new spa in my neighbourhood as I was on my way to the souks, and out of curiosity, I walked through the discreet doorway signed Farnatchi Spa and arrived into a naturally lit reception area where already my senses were awakened. Subtle scents, gentle and appropriate music and I was greeted by professional and friendly staff. Sometimes spas can be a bit intimidating for first-timers, particularly those who are visiting solo, but this was certainly not. I immediately booked a treatment then and there. After a particularly hectic week, I chose a 1-hour oriental facial designed to hydrate the skin, and was escorted into a moodily-lit, traditional-style treatment room where I experienced the most soothing and gentle facial I could have wished for. I was so taken with the spa that I booked in for a hammam a few days later and that was an equally cleansing, nourishing and pampering hour in an otherwise busy day. I look forward to the opening of their spa lunch spot on their cleverly-designed sun terrace which I believe is imminent. Go to TripAdvisor | Privacy Policy | Co

Stunning!. Pampering at its best. Ahmed was a fantastic masseur. The best I have ever had. So much so I returned for another massage the following day and can't recommend him more highly. All the other staff I met were professional and welcoming and I never wanted to leave!

An amazing experience. You can't leave Marrakech without experiencing a massage and farnatchi spa outdid the ones I've had in Latin America and the Far East. A truly authentic and surprisingly sensual experience.

The best spa in Marrakech. I visited this stunning spa in the heart of the medina perfectly situated between the Maison de photographie and the Koranic school for an incredible ila facial and ila massage. The beautiful black and white zelige sets off the handmade carpets and cleverly crafted plasterwork throughout. I was most impressed by the light and airy feel to the place and the traditional 1920 photo enlarged on the spa room wall. The massage and facial were out of this world with a wonderful scent that lasted the rest of the day. I didn't have time but the spa menu on the roof terrace looked incredible and I will most certainly be returning to sample that and perhaps a hammam next time.

THE MOST AMAZING SPA YOU CAN VISIT. It was the most fantastic experience, wonderfully friendly staff, on arrival, as well as throughout my treatment. The reception area is so tastefully decorated, local rugs, beautiful hand carved plaster work, couldn't have been more charming. The hammam was just out of this world, honestly the best I have had. I would recommend a visit to Farnatchi Spa as an absolute must, even if you are not staying at Riad Farnatchi (which by the way is also a must).

Amazing. We had a package with the cooking class and this was the perfect finish to our day. We had body a foot massage when we got there and had a couples massage. Loved my massage here! Thank you to all the lovely staff here!

Great first hammam visit. We were booked this place by our Riad manager and were totally happy with the recommendation, especially as it was around the corner from our Riad. The Spa itself is found in the backstreets within the medina - another 'hidden oasis' which you would not believe is behind the little wooden door. A lovely place to relax and be attended on by very professional staff - the hammam experience of being soaped and scrubbed down was quite fun - especially if you are sharing it with someone else! Then the medium massage that I had was 'just right'. They manage you along the process gently with glasses of water and peppermint tea at the end - the whole experience was about 2 hours for us - we had the Signature Treatment I think - about 750DHM each. Worth it!

Hidden Jewel. We were searching for a hammam that could take a same day appointment. They were able take us, and the service was impeccable!!. I had the Mythic Signature package, which included a hammam scrub and a 1.25 hr massage. The mint tea and quiet time was amazing. We were there for about three hours. The property is gorgeous! Very clean, and the people are soooooo nice.

Awesome experience!!!. My masseuse did a fantastic job! The experience was great from the hammam to the signature massage. I am very pleased with the amount of professionalism and attention offered during my visit. I'll definitely make another appointment on my next visit to Marrakesh.

Welcoming & calming! . We had a beautiful couples massage here this afternoon and recommend anyone wanting a massage in the old city to try here. It's about £38 for a full body, you receive tea & biscuits on the rooftop after you just float off the beautiful room you we're massaged in. The girls are friendly and good therapists. Don't be put off finding it it's a magical doorway to bliss.

the perfect match magic & relaxation. i highly recommend this place, if you are looking for a mix between tradition & best in class relaxation techniques, here you will be served. Lalla Saloua & lalla Fatima big thank you.

Amazing oasis of calm. My wife and I visited this spa within the Medina, the entrance is a little off putting, walking past derlict buildings down a side street with in a discreet door that is slightly off putting.The inside is a completely serene and peaceful, with a little pool and lovely decor.We had a mythic lovers package that consisted of a wash and soap scrub, a bath and massage for each. We added facial and jacuzzi to this as well.The treatments were brilliant and the staff were thorough in their work and lovely to talk to. They always ensured we had drinks and we were wanting for nothing.There was also a rooftop terrace which was nice to sit in the warmth following the treatments and also were the jacuzzi was.Could not ask for anything else from the spa.We booked solely through them and via email added the extras and had no problems.
Super. Beautiful riad with amazing staff..it's Really a Great place to stay ..One of the best riad in Marrakesh
the best place for relaxation. thank you for all your services, the team are all nice and understanding.thank u MYTHIC OTIENTAL SPA

An absolute must do!. Beautiful spa day, delivered by a group of respectful staff that treated us like kings and queens. We did have difficulty finding the spa, however arranged to be collected from our riad at no extra charge. Amazing experience, don't bother looking at any other spa other than this one, you won't be disappointed! Massive thank you to all the staff!

Hammam and massage. The hammam was very business-like and she scrubbed the entire body very briskly! You aren't entirely naked- they give you a tiny strong underwear thing.
The massage was nice and the extra money for the Argan oil was worth it- now, the next day my skin is definitely softer.
11 Out Of 10 ��. My first ever hammam experience and it blew my expectations out of the water! The ladies are amazing and super respectful. Definitely worth a visit.

Awesome..... Lovely inexpensive and refreshing Spa. Was easy to find in the Souk area and the treatments are fast and flowing... would definitely recommend the Spa and also they take a nice photo of you at the end and emial to you to keep sake of your visit.

Great spa day! Amazing hospitality! . Great way to recover after an overnight to Zagora. The spa was extremely clean, comfortable, and professional. The ladies were very friendly and the Hammam experience was amazing. My skin has never felt so soft!

Review given for masage only. Spa lovely, as was the hamman. Ayurvedic massage not recommended. Interpretation of an Ayurvedic massage by the therapist at this spa was unlike any I have ever received before - and not in a good way!

Very professional & a great value!. My husband and I had the Mythic Lovers package. We loved it and we thought it was an excellent value for money. The ladies work very hard, they looked after us so well. Their website is really good with all of the treatments listed, and it was easy to book via email. I got a response within 15min. Impressive! I highly recommend this spa. The massage especially, was incredible!

Loved it! . We went for the couple package. It was about 60 euro each. The steam room was pretty small compared to the Turkish bath we had before but the scrubbing was so much better. We never thought we had that much dead skin. The massage was great. I loved it. Service was OK.

Great way to end the day. After walking the streets of Marraketch a great way to recharge. So peaceful relaxing. A good scrub with black soap, and relaxing massage after. Relax on the roof terrace with tea after. Worth the money.

Charming. I booked this for my girlfriends birthday as we have never really tried a Spa day before.We paid for the Mythic Relax which was the massage and the facial as a package.When looking for the venue, keep an eye for the signs, then walk down the alleyways and search for a black door with the sign "Mythic Oriental Spa". A local kindly directed us to the venue as we clearly looked lost! hahaFrom the moment we entered the building, you walk into an Oasis. You can hear birds chirping and flying around (1-2 from what we could see). It's a welcome breather from the hectic Marrakech that we have grown to know over the course of 3-4 days.You are given a choice of drinks for a start and once you are ready, the staff take you to the changing room to change into their provided underwear. I was fine with my disposable boxers but the girlfriend did not feel hers was adequate so asked if she could stay in her swimwear, which the staff kindly reassured her was ok.The facial was first and as it was the first time for me, I found it a little weird at first having someone cream, scrub and squeeze my blackheads (I'm a male) but eventually got into it as I relaxed throughout the treatment. The girlfriend found the facial fantastic and this was long overdue as she has been so busy with work and life etc.Then came the massage, my girlfriend opted for the relaxing massage, I went for the strong massage. My masseuse was very firm and really hit the right spots, she really went into my knots in my back and applied the right amount of pressure on the legs. Please be warned, I am used to strong massages as I do a lot of sports/gym work, so I have it regularly and I am used to this pressure!The girlfriend loved her relaxing massage as it was something she was looking forward to all morning. Overall, we spent 3 hours there and the staff ensured we felt as relaxed and comfortable as possible.I would recommend this for anyone who would like to de-stress after a long hard day of exploring the busier side of the Medina and wants to relax in a little paradise that is on the outskirts of the medina.

Oasis of tranquility amidst the hustle of Marrakech. Definitely would recommend this spa to everyone that visits Marrakech. It was authentic but 5* at the same time! Very clean & professional! My husband & I went for the classic package & it was stunning! It's pretty hard to find though - get a good map before you head :-) enjoy!

Amazing experience. The whole experience from start to finish was amazing, far better than we had expected. The staff are very friendly and make you feel welcome the moment you arrive. The whole experience was unhurried starting with the foot massage, then a wonderful bath, the hammam and then a one hour massage. My daughter and I were unsure about having the hammam but were so pleased that we did because it is an experience not to be missed and we felt the cleanest that we had ever been.If you are in Marrakech I would strongly recommend that you visit as I'm sure you won't be disappointed. It was a highlight of our holiday.

Peaceful osasis in the heart of Marrakech. Our riad owner recommended this place, and let me say; we weren't dissatisfied! Everything is really nice and private, and you really feel like a God. Even the email with the photos which we received some months after our trip was a nice gesture. They know what they are doing, and have everything under control, so you can just relax :-)

Best massage and hammam ever!. I visited the spa with a friend during a recent stay in Marrakech, and left a much happier person. The staff were amazing, the hammam was divine and the massage (I say this as a massage addict) was without exaggeration the best I've ever had. My friend said the exact same. What a magical experience. We will definitely be back!
Best Massage I have ever got . Staff are very professional and very friendly .. I got Moroccan bath together with full body massage .. It's an experience that I will never forget

The best yet. Don't leave Marrakech without visiting this Spa, amazing, relaxing treatments, especially the oriental baths so beautiful. Cant recommend this spa enough. Definitely will go back and will visit early evening to see the spa when its lit.Thank you especially to the lovely ladies who work there your'e all fantastic.

Simply the best spa in town ! . Had a fabulous afternoon here pampered by the full team of friendly welcoming and obliging girls of the spa ! Tucked away behind the bustle of Larrousse this oasis of tranquility cannot be beaten ! For 3 and a half hours ( session was described as 2 hrs ) the attention to care and dedication to total relaxation were utmost in all the spas staff from the moment of stepping across the doorway . Nothing rushed and complete pampering followed with refreshing cool drinks , juices and snacks with a surprising birthday cake and rendition of happy birthday by all the ladies in both Morrocan and English !! The Hammam experience in the steam rooms with eucalyptus is one you will never forget !! You will understand this more once you have experienced it ! Relaxing baths with mineral salts follow and tranquil music in darkened candle lit rooms full of incense and warmth . The hour long full body massage will put you into a state of total relaxation and it is difficult not to simply fall into a deep state of sleep ! Refreshing mint tea and a time to regather ones thoughts are all that is required before then leaving this little gem of a piece of paradise and renter the bustle of the medina just a foot outside the door ! Amazing and unforgettable , thank - you !

Relaxing Spa Experience!!. This spa is a wonderful relaxing way to escape the hustle and bustle of the medina for a while! The staff are friendly and attentive, and the Hamman & massage are fantastic!My husband and I had the Mythic Classic package (750d/about £50 each) It consisted of an invigorating traditional hamman with black soap scrub, followed by a relaxing, luxurious 1 hour massage. We have never been so clean in our whole lives! We left feeling totally rejeuvenated! If you're in Marrakech and have a couple of hours to spare...Go here!!

Fantastic experience. After our cooking course at faim d'epices, we were brought to the Mythic Oriental Spa. It was a wonderful setting, the staff were friendly and professional and the experience was very enjoyable and relaxing.

A Spa as in Thousand and One Nights. The spa is hidden in a fully refurbished Riad in the city centre with a water basin in the courtyard. The treatment included hot bathes, foot massage, a traditional hammam session and a full body massage. Especially after the massage, it felt like a rebirth ! The personnel was very kind and professional. Try it and you will always want to come back !

Relax and de-stress. My wife and I had the most relaxing couple of hours in the Mystic Oriental Spa. The explanation by Zineb of the menu was done in a completely unhurried way and then the experience was choreographed perfectly from the greeting area - across the bridge to the changing room, into the hamam and then up the stairs to the massage room where my wife an i relaxed in the waiting area in the room and then both to the massage tables. She fell asleep after on the table due to the soft music. I really liked my masseuse - Souad - highly recommended. We met the owner Florent on the way out - he is a perfect gentleman - excusing himself for his poor English which was actually much better than my french. I will definitely recommend the place to others as a way to relax and de-stress in Marrakech
A nice Spa experience!. We had a wonderful time at this spa:) The staff is very helpful and kind. If you want a relaxing time book Mythic Oriental Spa!

Lovely relaxing retreat. After seeing lots of good reviews on trip adviser we decided to book a full works massage.
It was lovely. The staff are very friendly and one of the best mint tea and biscuits I've had!
If we were to come back to Marrakech would def come back here.
Relaxation. Amazing and stunning place, where the staff is very friendly and so welcoming. We had the best massage on the world and can't wait for the next holiday for s treat.

OMG!!!. After a long travel day we booked Mythic Oriental Spa and it was awesome!!!This is the real deal.....my wife and I had an amazing time we didnt want to leave!Its a bit tricky to find it..at least for those who have been in Marrakech for 2 hrs!!! but it is so worth it...everything was outstanding!! Please dont leave Marrakech without going to this place!!

Hammam Heaven. An outstanding Hammam, offering excellent treatments at a very reasonable prices. Located on the edge of the Souk and within easy walking distance from a range of Ryads, the Mythic Oriental is a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of Souk shopping. The staff are extremely attentive and welcoming, ensuring you enjoy a relaxing and carefree visit. The wash room is small but functional, the real gem are the treatment rooms, offering single and couple experiences. Do not be fouled by the rather shambolic surrounding area, once inside you will be well looked after by a very professional and engaging staff. Will definitely return.

Wonderful Hammamexperience!. My wife and I had a wonderful time at the Mythic Oriental spa. For starters don't be deceived by the walk up to this place or the entrance. Its an oasis iniside!. We booked a private Hammam and massage and were welcomed with a drink. Our therapist (Sofia) who did the Hammam for us was simply amazing and we had a wonderful exfoliation. After relaxing in the steam room for a while, we were then led to a beautiful and spacious massage room where the massage therapists made sure that all our travel aches and pains were melted away in an hour. Fully rejuvenated and feeling younger we came out of the massage and had some yummy moroccan cakes and Mint tea. It was one of the best Hammam and spa experiences we have had. Thank you Zineb and team for welcoming us and making our visit memorable!

Wonderful experience and service! . We decided to drop in without an appointment, but we were greeted with open arms and a warm hospitality! We received traditional Moroccan tea while we decided on the treatment. I decided to go for a massage, while my wife chose the pedicure and epilation. I have to underline the warmth and comfort offered by the personnel. They behaved in a very professional manner and both treatments were flawless! We highly recommend this place as I doubt you'll ever find a place where you will get the same service, hospitality, treatment and welcoming as you get from the girls at this place! We will surely be back upon our next visit to Marrakech! Top notch!

Luxurious Relaxation. This spa is very welcoming, relaxing and worth the time away. You are welcomed with a cool drink and pampered by attentive staff. The scrub bath and massage package is a 'must try'. Don't be deceived by its location, its a beautiful, quiet, oasis in the middle of the city. I even got additional attention as the 'bride to be' with a dance and song, lol. If you are a bride to be, you are encouraged to rub your luck on the single girls around you. Don't leave Marrakech without some downtime here.

Is paradise don´t be scared by the surroundings. The place is amazing even if the neighbourhood is a little far away, and you may have the feeling that you are going to be kidnap entering the building, one you get there it feels like paradise. the scrub is a great experience and the massage great !! I want to go back to Marrakesh just for that. The girls are super kind, they went to pick us up at the main street, really patient and attentive. Just be attentif with the neighbourhood, we took a cab in the middle of the street there and when we made it to the hotel, the taxi driver tried to sell us drugs, try to call your own cab.

Good massage but unprofessional staff. My partner and I came here after attending a cookery course. Overall the 2hr was good. we had a hamman followed by an hour long massage for which we could choose our own scent which was a lovely idea. Before the hamman we were given a complimentary 'foot massage' - this had the potential to be a lovely start but instead the therapist spent it shouting to her colleague down the corridor so was not relaxing! The hamman was good, but again unprofessional because our lady forgot to apply the black soap scrub so after drying off we then had to de-robe and get back in. We didn't mind at the time but in hindsight it was disappointing considering the expensive price tag. The massage was lovely, my partner and I had it in the same room and they were very thorough. But again there were a couple of things that were unprofessional. Firstly my masseuse yawned the whole way through very close to my face! The second was that for quite long periods of time I was massaged with just one hand, and I later overhead an argument where a client claimed that the masseuse was on her phone whilst giving a massage! Overall the spa was lovely, a very relaxing haven within Marrakech but clearly a lack of professionalism at times.

Haven in Marrakech . The spa was a little haven after a hectic day in Marrakech exploring and shopping. It's a little hidden away and doesn't look like there will be such an amazing space behind the entrance. It's well worth the visit to be pampered.
Excellent scrub and massage in this spa.. Professional treatment with very nice staff! For sure when I am in Marrakech again I would like to visit this spa again. With our regards to ms. Zineb

Fantastic massage. So much more than I hope. Pay for the full package with traditional Hamman and 1h15 massage 850 DH. It was worthy, very nice staff, wonderful masseuse. Perfect end of day and holidays. Recommend to everyone. It's not easy to find. You see a sign on the main road pointing to a small street. Just follow the street to the end. Be aware of very small kids asking for money. On the away out they become a little ruff. But I get no problemsPerfect spa. Most likely to came back

Awesome experience!. I booked the Mythic Lovers for my husband as a surprise for his 40th Birthday. The place was hard to find but once inside it is a haven of calm and opulence. The whole experience was a pleasure, from picking our fragrances to a good scrub and a relaxing soak. Then came the hour long massage which was out of this world. To end the experience the staff serenaded my husband with 'Happy Birthday' and pulled out a surprise cake! This was a very nice and totally unexpected touch. Thank you to all who made our experience so memorable.

Amazing!!! . Me and my girlfriend come here for her 30th birthday and we had an amazing time. We had the Mythic lovers treatment..... 2 and a half hour's of sheer bliss!Staff was fantastic, the spa was beautiful, and they even come out singing happy birthday to my girlfriend with a surprise birthday cake..... Amazing!!! Would 100% recommend coming here.Thanks Mythic Oriental.

Visit here. I went here with my partner after a day of cooking and it was just what the Dr ordered. Very relaxing and thorough.Loved the whole hammam experience.Book this place it's got lovely settings and very relaxing atmosphere with very attentive staff.Will be going back!

amazing experience. I booked the Mythic Lovers package as a surprise for my husband's birthday. Very easily booked via email before our trip. This was such a lovely experience and well worth the money. The hamman, exfoliation, spa baths and massage were all fantastic. All of the staff were very attentive, and surprised him with a lovely surprise of a birthday cake, which they all presented and sang "happy birthday" also in their local tradition. Thank you to all the staff at Mythic Oriental Spa, we had a truly amazing and memorable time with you. Pam & Steve

Wonderful!. We came here with a group of 6 without a reservation on a friday night. The staff squeezed us in and even stayed late. They were nothing but friendly and accommodating.The atmosphere is beautiful and relaxing, a real Moroccan riad vibe with luxurious couchea and drapes overlooking a courtyard. You are served tea and the traditional fresh orange juice (which is incredible) if you have a bath. Multiple people in our group agreed it was the best massage they had ever received. The oriental bath was extremely relaxing and a fun experience. The hammam was a little small compared to some, but definitely a cultural experience. If you've never given it a try, definitely go for it. I know our friends will always remember their first traditional hammam experience. Very affordable, totally relaxing, definitely would recommend.

Most amazing experience at your spa 💜. Last month I and my wife visited this amazing spa (Mythic oriental spa) we enjoyed a real relax, they made us feel like prince and princess. thank you for the high customer service exeprience, the staff were smiling at all times , helpfull and they made sure we had everything we needed. We will definitely come back next year..Thank you for giving us a lovely memories..Ziad & Rita Alameddine

A pleasurable experience. Ok the place was fantastic, the staff and the experience. However it wasn't a place you could spend all day, It lacked a chill-out area and sauna. Plus a juice bar or alternative refreshments to water and tea would have been nice. But without being over critical the treatments I had were very very good. The Hamam and Moroccan scrub was an experience, and the massage was just what the doctor ordered.

A spa experience to write home about. As you might know from some of my other reviews, a great spa and massage treatment is important to me.We went here on the recommendation of our Riad Clementine, and we're not disappointed.The whole experience was wonderful, from the welcome tea, choosing the oil for the massage and the foot rub, to the olive oil soap, body scrub and fantastic massage.This was a wonderful couple of hours spent in a very special space. What's more, this place is tucked down a back alley, and we walked past the door, down to a dead end, scratching our heads to the bemusement of the locals! As is so often the case in Marrakesh, this place looked like nothing from the outside, but step inside and it's like a geode, all rough on the outside and full of beautiful calming colours and crystals in the inside!!Highly recommended.

Highly Recommended. This place is awesome. You will have some trouble finding its location by yourself but the receptionist was kind enough to come and get us. As for any country, I highly recommend purchasing a data plan ahead of time so you will have google maps and ability to send text and make calls. On to the experience, I can only say it was one of the best memories of Morocco. I don't want to give you spoilers but you will relax, feel clean, and enjoy some delicious tea. There is an old-style hamam where they scrub you down. The massage is so relaxing that I fell asleep right away and the whole place is very magical.

A Beautiful Staff a nice place. It's the second time to Visit Marrakech City for my wife and I, but it is the first time to see paradis Spa at Marrakech. it's Mythic oriental Spa, is the best one in the area Riad Laarous, So we had advise From Simo that is work at Marrakech Palacio de las especias hotel for visit this beautiful place. we had a very nice Mythic Signature Packages...it is unforgetable experienceThe staff are brilliant super friendly special the beautiful girl ZINAB, worth every dirham don't leave Marrakech without visiting Mythic oriental Spa.thank you Miss Zinab for to care to my wife and me and thank you Simo for your advice;)

Comme ci, comme ca. We booked out trip to Mythic Oriental Spa with a package deal via Faim D'Epice cooking class, which I highly recommend. The spa, on the other hand, was a little underwhelming. The treatments weren't bad, but they weren't great either. Costing roughly the same as a mid-range spa in NYC, I expected better service. For example, during our hour long couples message, my right foot received an inordinate amount of focus with a lot of mumbled chatter between the two masseuses. Afterwards, I found out my wife's left foot received the same level of treatment... I guess there was some juicy gossip that day. Whatever the cause, it was not the most professional experience. When we leaving, they clearly had a working credit card machine, but told us they only accepted cash.

Great value for money!. Excellent value for money and great service - really great find!Make sure you know how to get there - the signs are VERY limited and yes...it is in a secluded allyway. Would recommend going whilst it's still light so you can find your way easily

Excellent spa treatment and staff!. This spa was recommended to us by a friend and it did not disappoint. Everything was fantastic from the staff to the quality of the treatment. My pregnant wife and I had the couples treatment, and we both thought it was just excellent value and service. We would definitely recommend!

Good. Been there for Hammam plus 1 hour of full massage plus 1 hour of pedicure.The Hammam was a bit simple,even the room it's a bit small,but the lady did the scrub well.The massage was really good, I asked for strong massage and one of the lady did it really well. Don't know the name of the lady but I would like to say thanks to her!But other ladies might be less strong than her so you must be lucky and find her for the best result.Pedicure was good,the same lady of the massage treat my feet in a perfect way.We booked this place because you can find a good package including a cooking class in a farm outside the city plus Hammam and massage(1080 dirham per person).I recommend this package.

Pampering myself in Marrakech. Mythic Oriental Spa was recommended by the riad I was staying at and I have to say that the treatment I received there was among the best I've had! The staff are all very welcoming and professional and the spa itself is decorated and furnished in the most exquisite of tastes! From the moment I arrived, I felt I was taken into the competent hands of everyone there and gracefully led from one area/service to another, each time being offered something to drink and a place to rest. Even my bathrobe and slippers were the right size for me! I'm small and usually disappear in the standard-size robes most spas provide. To say attention is paid to every detail is an understatement. Would definitely recommend Mythic Spa to anyone wanting a rejuvinating respite from the exciting, yet sometimes, exhausting, hustle and bustle of beautiful Marrakech.

Pampering to perfection!. I booked the Mythic Lovers package for my partner as a birthday treat and we were not disappointed!! The spa would have been impossible to locate without our very helpful Taxi driver who liaised with the Spa staff on the telephone and they came out to meet us. We were also over 30 minutes late but the staff were still as pleasant as ever!Stepping inside was like stepping into another world, so serene and relaxing compared the the hustle & bustle just outside!We were given paper underwear, comfy robes & flip-flops and were provided with secure lockers for our belongings. The underwear for women is literally like one strip of tracing paper so if you're at all 'shy' with the partner you're attending with then bear this in mind - you are practically naked the whole time!The baths and scrub was something neither of us ahd experienced before so we enjoyed the suspense of what was going to happen next and had a little giggle at being washed like a baby - and our full body massages were out of this world.... it literally was pampering to perfection!! I very much doubt i could find anywhere in the UK to rival the experience & for what we paid too.Overall we were there for nearly 3 hours and being pampered every second!The staff even gave my partner a gift for his birthday too which was very sweet of them!We had such a wonderful experience and would definitely go back if we visit Marrakech again!

AMAZING EXPERIENCE. I visited the Mythic Oriental Spa in July 2015 with my partner we had the Mythic Lovers for 2.This experience was the highlight of my trip to Marrakech I was totally blown away. The scenery, the smell and the decoration was all perfect. The staff are all so very friendly & they are all amazing at what they do. The mythic lovers treatment is a MUST if your a couple of just 2 friends.Totally worth the price! Not to be missed if your looking for a spa in Marrakech!It was difficult to find, but one of the girls that work at the spa was kind enough to meet us at our taxi & guide us to the spa.

Fab oasis . My husband and I visited this week, quite tricky to find but worth it. Felt special from minute we arrived to our departure. I booked the Mythic Lovers package as a treat on our day off from golf. Worth every penny. Staff very professional and efficient, would recommend and hope to visit if we're lucky enough to return To Marrakech.

A relaxing spa visit. We went to this spa after a cooking class at faim d'epices. The combination was good value, and also very relaxing after a hot afternoon. It was not crowded with customers when we were there, and staff treated us attentively. During the 1 hr massage, my boyfriend and I both asked to be massaged harder, but the staff were responsive. Thanks for a great time!

Very nice, relaxing time. Very nice massage, relaxing place, atmosphere and stuff. Hammam could be more tender, sometimes it was very painful for me. A shame, that we ware waiting ~2 hours for our turn.If I would just judge quality of the massage - excellent. I can reccoment it, especially with cooking classes.

If you can find it, you will not regret a visit here! Like stepping into a different world!. We booked a visit here whilst staying in Marrakech and were daft enough to try to get here on foot. Thankfully the riad we were staying in had free wifi and we had managed to glean just enough information from other traveller's visits to manage to find it!Tucked away down a labyrinth of narrow alleys, just outside the famous souks is a slighlty ornate door with a small placard that gives the first hint that the place you are visiting is very different from it's surroundings.You are welcomed by a very friendly host and as soon as the door closes behind you the noise, the smells and the dust of the streets of Marrakech are gone and replaced by a still, sweet smelling paradise! I won't give too much of the experience away but you are guided professionally and quietly around this hidden oasis and treated to some of the most relaxing and indulgent spa treatments you can imagine. The paper underwear you are given does little to hide your modesty so bear that in mind if you are of a shy or nervous disposition but the staff do do a wonderful job of putting you at ease. It's difficult to say how long the experience lasted as time seems to just melt away whilst you are here. I have only ever been to one such spa in my life and frankly I wouldn't want to try anywhere else for fear of it not living up to the standard of this visit. My better half does have more experience of spa days and tells me this was by far and away the best she had ever visited. I would highly recommend a visit here for anyone visiting Marrakech. Everything about it was superb. The adventure of finding it, the miraculous transition from the dust and bustle of the streets to this hidden oasis of calm, the lavish treatment whilst you are there... all if it was fantastic!

Fabulous!. A really helpful taxi driver helped us find this spa as it's tucked away in a back street , we would never have found it on our own! Once inside the door it's absolutely fabulous,very quiet and peaceful with beautiful decor. The staff were extremely friendly and professional. We had the Mythic Signature package starting with a lovely foot massage,a fantastic hamman and ended with the best ever massage.If you need a break from the noise and bustle while in Marrakech we highly recommend a visit to the Mythic Oriental Spa❤️❤️❤️

Hidden Gem. Once we found the place, it was like stepping into another world. Instantly relaxing and seriously pampering. All the staff were absolutely lovely, and great at their jobs. Would definitely recommend to get away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech!

Wonderful spa experience . I have learnt in Marrakech never to judge a book by its cover. This place was in a dusty street that didn't look much from the outside. Inside though - wow! Beautiful decor and wonderfully welcoming staff. Also one of the best massages I have ever had. wonderful!

Paradise in Marrakech!. We arrived at the spa and couldn't believe what we found behind the dusty street door, a beautiful riad with friendly and welcoming staff. My boyfriend and I had the Mythic Lovers package which included a private hammam for us both, a Moroccan black soap exfoliation, a private bath and a one hour massage. It says two hours on the menu but actually we were there for three and a half. Between the treatments we received foot massages, tea, orange juice and water and we were left on the roof terrace to relax at the end, a very relaxing experience and definitely one I would recommend for friends and couples that want to share the experience together.

Delightful hammam experience. We were booked into the hammam by our Riad, and we loved it. It was a great experience that felt quite authentic. I have never had a hammam before and it was quite the experience.

A very good experience in Marrakech. There are just good points:- The spa is indicated on the main street of la medina Avenue Lakza, so you can find it easily- Staff is really nice, they leave you the time you want in the terrace and after your treatment. They offer you traditional Moroccan pastries and tea at the end. When you leave, they offer you to take a picture of the patio and send it to you.- You can come at any time before your treatment; you can wait in the sunny terrace where they propose you a traditional mint tea or orange juice.- The treatments list is extensive - The mythic signature massage and Mythic signature face treatment are really nice, they take great care of you.- Decoration inside is nice, typically Moroccan and soothing.

Perfect and tranquil end to fun filed day. My afternoon at the Mythic Oriental was part of a day package following a cooking class at Faim d epices .Located in one of the side streets of bustling Medina upon opening the door it's like Alddins Cave . You are greets but tranquility and relaxing aromas which automatically sends you into relaxation mode . All staff members were at hand to ensure I was comfortable and relaxed , providing water, tea and pastries throughout . Following a disturbing and stressful morning in the medina this experience helped me unwind and relive my anxiety . The scrub , bath and massage expire nice was delightful. At the end the staff helped me get a taxi and ensured I was safe back at my Riad. I highly recommend

Once in a lifetime treat.... Last night I went to the most amazing spa treatment. It was brilliant and so relaxing. The spa was beautifully presented - so hard to believe that just 100 feet away is all that crazyness of the market area. If you are looking for a real treat - I would do this.
Home on a cloud. Totally unexpected opened up the door to paradise. The prizes were quite high. But then we just enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere and wonderful treatment and rode home on a cloud.

Lovely spa. My friend and I had a private hammam experience, with a traditional scrub and then a 1 hour full body massage (the mythic spa package). Considering how reasonable the price was (750dh), it was amazing.The spa had a very exclusive feel, and we were waited on hand and foot. We were treated like princesses, and it was 3 hours of pure relaxation and being pampered.Be prepared to have an unusual once in a lifetime experience, but come out feeling sparkling clean and completely relaxed. The traditional scrub is unlike anything you would get in England, but was definitely worth doing if you are in Marrakech.The facilities were great, and the staff were very welcoming and friendly. This is an experience I would definitely recommend to anyone coming to Marrakech.(Be warned, you are almost completely naked in front of the person you came with and the staff for the whole time!!)

We booked this, as a package with L'atelier Faim d'Espices.. Not sure if we would have ever found this place, without being led in with our driver! Beautiful inside, cannot believe how nice it is inside, compared to the building outside.Massage was better than the usual UK standards, but wasn't the best we've had. The Hammam & black soap scrub was good, really enjoyed that, you can go as a couple for both Hammam & massage, if requested. The choice of oils, for your massage was really nice.Really nice experience, combined with the cooking class package.

Wonderful Experience. My wife and I had the "Signature Massage" together at Mythic Oriental, and it was really exceptional. Enjoyable and relaxing, with tea offered at several stages between the events -- a foot massage, soaking in a warm tub, being scrubbed in the hammam, and finally a long and lovely full body massage. The building itself is spectacular -- a renovated riad.We would return to Marrakesh just to visit Mythic Oriental Spa again!

OK but expensive. This is a very good looking spa and has a lovely ambience. It is however a bit like being on a conveyor belt. with lots of being moved around to different areas of the spa. The massage was reasonable but not exceptional. I got the treatments at a discount as part of a cookery package. Their regular prices are very steep and if I had of paid full price I think I would have felt that I had not received value for money. As other reviewers have mentioned there is a lot of waiting around & I would liked to have had some sort of steam room to relax in and enjoy. It was an ok experience but I will look at visiting a different spa when I return to Marrakech.

Highly recommended!. Visited the Mythic Oriental Spa in Feb 2015 for a massage and hammam with my girlfriend. The staff were very friendly and the treatments were amazing.A little expensive but you get what you pay for!

Lovely Hammam and massage. Definitely recommended. Only gripes were changing facilities average and shower had no hot water.Staff excellent and the treatments were great. We had a couples hammam and massage. Would definitely return and expect we were unlucky with the hot water.

rejuvenating and wonderful. When walking inside the riad, the atmosphere was peaceful and calm, as well as a beautiful setting. It was very clean and welcoming. After tea and changing our clothes, we started with a short foot massage, then we went into the aromatic steam room. The hammam table was a little small and narrow, but manageable. The staff member did a great job with the exfoliation, followed by a room with candles, low lights, and quiet music for the wonderful and relaxing massage. At every rest point or transition room, there was a table with seats, drinks, and at the end, some sweets. This place would be difficult to find on your own; a taxi dropped us nearby and a staff member met us to walk in. When we left, we had a hard time getting a taxi, and it turned out he got lost and couldn't find our hotel. 45 minutes later and after several stops to ask for directions, we arrived. This isn't directly the problem of the spa, but the neighborhood was a concern.

Paradise is hidden behind a small door.... I was in Marrakech for Valentine's weekend and was lucky enough to stumble into Mythic Oriental, hidden away on a small alley! My boyfriend and I booked a couple treatment with private hammam and massage and it was absolutely perfect! The staff are extremely professional and nice, the facilities clean and with that nice exotic atmosphere everyone looks for when travelling abroad!After walking around the busy streets of Marrakech it feels like stepping into a different planet of calm and beautiful colors and perfumes and mint tea and cookies.....I'll definitely go back!
Brilliant. Spent half a day here, I was one of 8 girls booked in for a hammam and the signature massage and it was amazing!Very professional, clean and relaxing.

A relaxing oriental massage. We had a great relaxing massage in a very nice oriental atmosphere and decoration.We enjoyed the atmosphere very much as well as the different scents of massage oils offered.It was hard a little bit to reach the place there but in general it is worth going there.

Amazing- I think best spa experience ever!. My friend and I decided to go to this spa as she's been there few years ago. It's truly stunning, intimate and very relaxing. Hammam was professional and massage amazing. Recommended! Will be back next time when in Marrakesh

Lovely experience, beautiful spa.. After walking round various streets we finally managed to locate this spa down an unexpected street. We hadn't made an appointment but they were able to offer us one for 20 minutes time. During this wait they brought us green tea and there were various books to have a look through. My boyfriend didn't want to have a treatment so waited whilst I had mine. The hammam was amazing and felt like it gave a really deep cleanse. This was followed by a whole body massage in a lovely tranquil room. Felt very relaxed afterwards and really enjoyed this experience. Would definitely recommend!

Great experience to do in Marrakech!. We had a fantastic experience at Mythic Oriental Spa.Great service, ambience and facilities. I booked the Mythic Signature package (hammam + massage) with my husband and a friend. My husband and I did the hammam together, our friend did it before us on her own.We enjoyed the treatments and I would highly recommend this spa if you want to try a Moroccan hammam.

Amazing best spa in marrakesh . Nightmare to get to- got a little harassed by some locals on the way but once inside the spa is amazing! Staff were really accommodating, the spa it's self is amazing. We got a back massages each and it was incredible. Highly recommend!

what a treat and escape from the busy streets. We went last week,the spa is difficult to find but well worth it .A beautiful tranquil spa , we had the full hamman experience and body massage.The girls were friendly and really looked after us,plentiful ,teas and pastries and relaxation.The hamman was amazing, black soap scrub, wash and steam then followed by the great massage,Really recommend this spa, there are lots of hamman around but this was a real spa and well worth the experience.Don't miss it.

The best spa experience you can have!. I visited the spa during my stay in October.I had two treatments both were exceptional - the staff were so obliging and took great care over making sure I was happy- had water, felt relaxed and so on.The experience ended with mint tea and sweets on the roof terrace - again the staff were working hard to ensure the experience was brilliant and it certainly was.This is without a doubt the best Spa I have ever visited and the decor and atmosphere only added to the whole experience.We'll worth a visit.

Super tour, Lunch and fabulously sensual massage!. The Spa had a special offer for November which combined a tour of the major sites and souks with a guide, lunch at the the Ben Yousseff restaurant and a superb hammam and 1 hour massage all for the bargain price of 1200 dirham. The spa was the highlight, it was out of this world, we came out feeling sooooo relaxed. The women there are very skilled and very professional. The day started at 8.30 and we didn't leave til after 5pm. Would definitely recommend and so worth the money!

AMAZING!!. Here is why I so HIGHLY recommend the place...- we got a little lost, called the place and the young girl who we assumed managed the place ever so kindly came and found us and walked us safely over to the place.- a family of 4 picking different treatments were all synced up so that we finished at the same time.- what we all picked to be 2 hour treatments max ended up being over 4 hours which was a lovely surprise! Making the money value to be above and beyond. - ALL STAFF WERE LOVELY AND TRULY SWEET GIRLS.- Treatments... Devine! Loved every second. Felt so relaxed and pain free, which is a rare occasion for me.
Do it. If you don't do a Hammam in Morocco you are mad. We went here after a recommendation from our Rhiad. It was lovely, very relaxing and my skin felt amazing afterwards.

Just try and enjoy. Beautiful experience. Do not spend lots of words to describe this place as it's simply beautiful and a perfect mix of local traditions, relaxing environment, high competence.Anyone who tries an experience to this place will be 100% happy with no regrets. You feel yourself totally regenerated and relaxed after 2 hours hammam+massage.If you never tried this activity I strongly suggest to start with the very classical formula (45 min hammam + 1 hour massage which you can choose as soft, medium or strong depending on your preference).Absolutely recommended, you can't miss it!!

Made me feel like a queen!. Many spas give you a nice welcome and try to pamper you, but there's something about the staff here that makes you feel like they LOVE to treat you like you are the most important person in the world! From the moment we walked through the door to the welcome cold drink, to the choosing of the fragrance for massage oil, to the foot wash and massage, to our services (hammam and massage) to the after service mint tea and cookies, I felt completely pampered by staff who were gracious and warm. Loved it!
thoroughly enjoyable!. I had a hammam and massage package, the whole thing was amazing, I enjoyed every second! The staff were wonderful and the spa itself is so so beautiful!

Heaven!!!. Our visit to this spa (as part of a special package with Faim d'Spice cooking school) was probably the highlight of our whole Moroccan adventure. Absolutely loved every second of it, fantastic service, attentive staff and excellent treatments in a stunning and tranquil setting. I would definitely recommend a few hours here to anyone staying in Marrakesh. And it's especially enjoyable to share the experience with a partner as the spa's facilities cater well for couples. A really memorable experience!!!!

Amazing... This was just a really great experience from start to finish it, and the girls really made you feel like you were the only customers they've had or were ever going to have. Hamam was great (not that I've got anything to compare it to but we both really enjoyed it), and the massages amazing. And tea and biscuits were served to us both before and after the whole thing, and we just kept getting told to take our time with everything. Also, they took photos of us afterwards and emailed it to us later as a little souvenir, which was a really nice touch. Overall, highly recommend.Ps we did it as part of a package with a cooking course through Faim Epices, and I'd really recommend that too, both as a deal and separately.

Amazing!. Upon arriving in Marrakech for the first time you can be forgiven for feeling a little apprehensive, you may decide like us to relax first day at your riad too scared to venture out! On your second day you decide to walk outside into the chaos that is the medina, go for a stroll around the souk fearing for your life as motorbike after motorbike zooms past you occasionally brushing your arm. You return to your riad feeling a little stressed you eat a comforting kofte tajine and fall asleep.It was at this point on our third day we first visited this wonderful hammam and spa, it's difficult to find in amongst the riad Laarous square but worth the effort. We found a small sign on a wall pointing down a little alleyway, by now getting used to the chaotic streets we strolled down to find a discreet wooden door with the name 'mythic oriental spa', again feeling a little apprehensive we knocked three times...A lovely young lady with a huge smile on her face greeted us and welcomed us inside to a beautiful 3 story building very similar to our luxurious riad. We were offered a drink - gratis which in itself is something not often seen in Marrakech. Another lady greeted us again with an English menu of treatments - my partner had already exclaimed "were having the full package no matter the cost" No doubt the first two days had taken their toll on her :) The full package included a hammam, black soap exfoliation, covering us in mud, a salt bath and a full body massage totalling 1450dhs per person. No need to bring any clothes here as they provide temporary underwear and bath robes - the women's underwear I found quite funny on my partner but I won't spoil it and I am a big kid, the men's though we're just some basic black boxer shorts which are thrown away afterwards.At the beginning you are given some water to drink with slices of orange in whilst they offer you six different items to smell, you then choose your favourite for your massage oil and we also got to choose our favourite bath salts.Rather than talk you through the rest of the experience I will just tell you it is amazing way better than any spas my partner has been to in the UK - this is my first spa. Your skin will feel better than it ever has I was blown away!Once your treatments are over you are taken to the roof terrace for a Moroccan tea and some sweet pastries its sublime!When we went downstairs and got dressed we were taken to the till to pay and without bartering at all we were charged 900dhs each a lovely surprise, we gave a generous tip and left feeling ready to take on the medina and anything it could throw at us! Today is our last day and to finish the trip off we visited again and we thoroughly enjoyed it just as much! Marrakech is a city full of chaos and beauty, do not miss out on this thoroughly relaxing and enjoyable treat!

Perfect end to a day. The madness of Marrakech can be quite overwhelming, but an afternoon spent at Mythic Oriental Spa is the perfect remedy. It's amazing how the noise vanishes the moment you walk through their doors. Ornately decorated and extremely peaceful. My wife and I spent our afternoon here as part of a package deal with Faim d'Epices cooking class and were treated to a wonderful hammam and lengthy massage. Just allow yourself to enjoy the experience, paper underwear and all.

Great massage but poor hamam. Very difficult to find. Lovely welcome. Had wonderful Hamam at Riad Idra for the last 2 years but this one seemed very poor in comparison using the same mit on both of us and body plus face without being changed (this was not the case at the previous hamam we had elsewhere). However, I have to say the massage was incredible and one of the best I've had and went away very relaxed - in a taxi.

Sanity amidst the madness!. Having not visited a spa together before, my husband and I visited this spa last week and not only did we love it, but were sorry we hadn't done so before! The staff are attentive and very skilled, they served us drinks throughout our 3 hour stay and we felt very well pampered. We hadn't booked or brought anything with us but it wasn't a problem, we were fitted in straight away, and everything we needed was provided. We chose the Mythic Lovers package (allow 3 hours not 2) and enjoyed it very much. After a lovely hammam, oriental bath and the best massage I've ever had we were treated to tea and Moroccan pastries on the terrace.If you don't do anything else whilst in Marrakech, treat yourself to a visit to the Mythic Oriental Spa, it's near the Riad Larousse.

Wonderful experience from start to finish. My wife and I have been to spas all over the world and I have to put Mythic Oriental Spa near the top of the list in terms of best overall experience.
