The spa itself is a bit tricky to find but Zineb (the person who booked our appointment via email) met us at our drop off and made sure we arrived safely and without distraction. Once inside, my wife and I enjoyed a package that included a private Hammam, full body exfoliation and deep tissue massage. Each phase of the experience transitioned perfectly with the establishment as a whole and team members being first rate! I will not hesitate to book again the next time we are in Morocco.

Wonderful and relaxing experience. Me and my boyfriend visited Mythic Oriental Spa in 2012, we chose a hammam massage and enjoyed every stage of this relaxing experience. The spa is difficult to find but I suppose this is the case for a lot of things in the center of Marrakesh, we were greeted and ushered to change, had a foot massage and full body scrub and hammam, then a full body massage followed by a delicious tea on the top floor, the building is beautiful and everyone is very welcoming.I would love to go back and recommend 100%

Don't be shy!!. Our first hammam what an experience!Step 1 - change and laughStep 2 - choose your oilStep 3- sweat and laugh some moreStep 4 - be scrubbed and laugh even moreStep 5 - rinse, dry, change your undies, laugh even louderStep 6 - enter massage roomStep 7 - calm, tranquil setting, enjoy - no laughing for 1 hourStep 8 - leave totally relaxed after fantastic experience.

At the beginning I felt like leaving! The bad comments I read here were also actually true!. They serve you the first tea break that lasted literally 5 SECONDS! Then they take you to clean your feet with some warm towels, I wish there would have been some massage involved in it, but it was sooo quick, until here it felt like you were in a MASSAGE FACTORY, and it is truth, it felt like they were in a rush to finish the session. Then came the Hamman, we booked a “deal” of 1800 DIRHAMS for a couple, where it said that the Hamman lasted 30 minutes and it had to be per person, but the Hamman lady was, again, so in a rush that it must had lasted 15 minutes each, if so.. it was a very good hamman though, she did good pressure just wish it would have lasted what I paid for! Then it came the massage which was the bit that kind of save the feeling of being MUGGED WITH AN OVERPRICED PACKAGE, as the massage was actually good, a bit more pressure would have been nice, especially when we told the nice girl in the reception that we wanted the hard massage, but it was nice and relaxing, so we left like eemm ok it was not that bad.. but that is not the feeling you want to leave with for that much money paid! Especially when there are other better places for less than that. Would I go back? Maybe for the massage if the price goes down.
JUST GREAT. Difficult to find but they collected me from my Riad and brought me back. Just bliss in a European take on a Moroccan Hamas. Throughly recommended and wish i could go back.

Oasis in Marrakesh. We spent 3 hours in the spa. First a private hammam - meaning as couple in the same room - not men and women seperated. We had a 1 hour hammam treatment - I dont want to tell the details here, because I think you should enjoy and not know all the details. This was followed by a 1 hour full body massage...then some mint tea and sweets, relaxing on a balcony in a riad. You can just go there as you are. Towels, disposable underwear, changing rooms, lockers, bath rope etc all provided. My advice for girls (hair): after the hamman and massage my hair was all messed up. There is a shower, but no shampoo/ conditioner/ comb and no hairdryer. Before you go anywhere else after the spa you might consider going back to your hotel to have a shower, wash your hair and dry it. Before leaving you can fill in a form rating the service. They are asking for your email....well, you might not want spam mails, but they are so lovely to take pictures of you and will send them to you via mail.

Pampering experience. A wonderful hammam and massage. Was a wonderful experience. Beautiful spa, friendly welcome and professional. Very difficult to find so arrange to be dropped off and collected by a taxi. Will definitely be returning and recommend it to anyone visiting Marrakech.
An enchanting experience. We stumbled across this hammam and we were very glad that we found it. We were treated very well and had a wonderful relaxing experience.

Great massage, lovely service. We were very glad that one of the ladies came to meet us from our taxi or we would never have found it! We booked also as part of a package with faim d'espice cookery school which gave a good discount. Really friendly staff, a warm welcome and mint tea, nice choosing your massage fragrance. The hamman / steam room could be better - more like swimming pool changing rooms and rather cramped but the treatment was good. Massage was really good.

A SPECIAL TREAT. Paradise - beautiful, calm and tranquil setting, attentive and experienced staff, several hours spent being totally pampered.....
We enjoyed the experience so much that we returned for a second visit on Christmas day.
A fabulous treatment which we reluctantly left, feeling squeaky clean and completely relaxed.
We will certainly return to Mythic on our next visit to Marrakesh.
Thank you

How to find it. As other contributors have said, it is not easy to find. In my experience it was impossible to find without having to pay 'guides', plus the usual bartering. Hence you are even more stressed before you enter. Your taxi driver will drop you off in what I would describe as a large and very busy square.To confirm that you are in the right place, look for the lone tall palm tree. If you cant see it, you are in the wrong place.Once you see the palm tree, look for the shop 'Pharmacie Populaire.With the Pharmacie directly behind you, walk opposite and away from it. Keep walking until you see a small sign at about two metres high up on a left wall facing you 'Rue El Gza'This proves you are going in the right direction. Keep walking straight ahead.After about 150 metres you will see a sign also about 2 metres high up on the wall which says Mythic Oriental Spa, with an arrow pointing to the right. As of Christmas 2013 this is the only sign.Follow the sign to the right for about 100 metres and you will see a door in a wall to you right.You have arrived.Did I enjoy it? Yes. My Christmas present to me. Thank you to me.There are other reviews on here which explain the process of what will happen. I found them to be correct and very useful.

Excellent massage and surroundings, hammam could be better. We visited as part of a package deal with the faim d'epices cookery course (highly recommend). Warmly welcomed with drinks and a smile, gorgeous surroundings. Foot massage was lovely. Enjoyed selecting the oils for the massage, Hammam however, was a bit of a let down. Lady was unsmiling and looked quite miserable, making it a tad uncomfortable to be honest, and it was over very very quickly. In contrast the massage was one of the best i've had, lasted the full hour, felt like more. We were then invited to have mint tea and biscuits up on the roof terrace, which was a lovely end to the day. All in all well worth the money especially with the package deal. Would recommend.

Excellent and good value. Booked the 2 person hamman and massage. Both were very good. Only slight gripe was that we were left in the warm bath rather to long. It fast became a cold bath so we put our robes on and found a member of staff who looked after us. We prefer our massages to be firm and they were. The white disposable knickers were obligatory which was a pity as they were rather uncomfortable and covered nothing.

Good . The charming beauty of the old unsuspecting building that houses this hammam does not make up for the place's lack of finesse.It borders on being a high-end spa (impressive decor and premium prices) and a local hammam (overall attitude and approach) but fails to follow through on either promise. Two things that really stood out to me were that a) the therapists were giving one another a manicure in the central courtyard in front of guests and b) my masseuse's nails were so long they were scratching me during my massage!That being said, the ladies showed true Moroccan hospitality and were very pleasant throughout. I went to this spa based on the recommendation of our ryad manager (Paulo of Ryad Anjar) and do not intend to go again.

Great spa. We visited the spa after the cooking course at Faim d'espices. It was very professional and the therapists were well trained. My husband declared it the best massage he's ever had. The Hammam experience before the massage was wonderful. ( it was our first time experiencing this)

Buddied up with their cookery class - marvellous!. We visited here after a day at Faim d'Epices as part of their deal. A perfect end to a lovely day doing home cooked food then a nice and tranquil Hamman and massage, This was a brilliant deal that seemed quite expensive when sat at home planning our holiday. On returning home after our full day out that ended here we realise it was a marvellous day out- brilliant value for money and so relaxing. I would recommend this highly. If you buddy it up with the cookery class you get a great full day out - the ultimate in relaxation. We had Hammans elsewhere but nothing quite as relaxing and tranquil as this. They take their time here which is just what you want for a little escape from the chaos that is the centre of Marrakech. Thanks. xx

A bit hit and miss. We opted for a package, black soap, scrub and massage.I've been to a few hammans so knew what to expect, but no one asked if we'd done this type of thing before or offered to explain what was going to happen. This would be helpful to people if it was there first experience of a hamman.The bad bits:I didn't feel the personal service I'd expect. It was very much like being part of a production line with the aim to get you in and out.This isn't an authentic hamman, it's been designed specifically for western tourists, which is fine if this is what you are looking for.The steam room where you are washed and scrubbed was a bit tatty and no where near hot enough (steamy for my liking)The pressure to fill a customer satisfaction form was irritating. I appreciate they're useful to them, but I haven't paid a fair bit of money for an experience to be told to fill one out- no thanks, I'm not on a school tripsWe visited towards the end of the day and asked if they could organise a taxi. This seemed like a huge inconvenience to the receptionist who told us they were closing. In the end she agreed to walk us to an area where we could get a taxi, but begrudgingly.The good bits:The massage was excellent. The masseurs are clearly well trained in anatomy and the pressure was perfect for me. The masseurs were happy to take direction if required(softer, harder ect) I would have liked to have tipped my masseur, but as we were rushed out I didn't have the opportunity.Would I recommend this place or go back again? No, the overall experience wasn't that great, there's much better hammans in Marrakech

Nice experience. We were a family of five adults who spent two hours in the spa. The overall rating is very good to excellent, especially the massage. The staff is attentive and professional with a special plus for a forthcoming and service-minded manager. The only downside is that the private hammam is small in size.

Perfect spa experience. My girlfriend and I booked a couples spa session, and we were not disappointed. Entering through the front door of the spa from the nondescript, narrow back alley it is located on is an astounding experience. The moment you enter you are hit by silence and a sense of calm tranquility.The ladies at the spa were very attentive before our session began, and provided us with refreshments. They were also very discreet and professional, and did not make us feel uncomfortable at any point. The hammam was incredibly cleansing with Moroccan black soap, exfoliation and a mud wrap, and after the relaxing bath that followed (with freshly squeezed orange juice) we both felt the cleanest we had ever been. We then experienced an hour of an enjoyable and relaxing massage each, followed by small edible refreshments and mint tea. My massage was perfect, but my girlfriend found hers a bit rough on parts of her back - something I'm sure you could ask to be gentler when there.I cannot recommend this strongly enough, and both my girlfriend and I consider this to have been the highlight of our trip to Marrakech. If I could rate it higher than 5 stars, I would. At only ~£60 per person, you'd be crazy not to make this a part of your holiday, and if we ever go to Marrakech again then we'll certainly be booking another round!

Could do with more information. I booked a treatment at the spa as part of a combined package deal with Faim d'Epices. The building is hidden in a narrow street and you only find one sign on the main road but no further help from there. I arrived a bit early for my appointment. They offered me mint tea and told me to relax and then we will start the treatment. This was my first hammam experience, but the ladies were not particularly helpful. They speak limited english and could not explain the process properly. In case you intend to visit, here is a short guide what to expect: after arriving you will be seated in the lounge and have tea. Then you will go and change, they give you single use underwear so don't worry about bringing your own swimsuit. You will have a gown and slippers. After this you will be offered some water and they will ask you to choose a scent for the massage oil. First they will take you for the hammam. It will start with a very short foot massage then you will be taken into a room. You will sit / lie on a stone bench while they wash you with warm water. They apply the black soap and will leave you in the room for about 5 minutes. After this they wash the soap off and they will scrub / exfoliate your skin with a special glove which feels like having your skin sandpapered. It is very refreshing and invigorating though. After rinsing all the soap off you will be offered a towel and pair of dry underwear. You will wait in the main patio for the message. The message lasts about an hour and when they finish they will leave you alone in the room to relax for about 10-15 minutes. You will be offered tea and some sweets. You then go and change and the treatment is finished. Altogether I had a good experience, however more information would be helpful for those who have never visited a hammam or had their body scrubbed before. The offer together with the cooking class is a very good value for money and very refreshing after a long day.

Incredible Spa & Hammam!. Such a beautiful and luxurious spa/hammam which offered private treatments for couples. We booked a hammam and cooking class package with Faim d'Epices, and it was the highlight of our time in Morocco. The spa was really clean and professional, with incredible atmosphere. We had a relaxing hour long massage and hammam bath, loved it!

Inky blue sky with twinkling stars - the ultimate rooftop ending. Had a lovely evening here relaxing as part of the combined cooking/spa package. We were taken to the riad (Mythic Oriental Spa) as part of the package although I could imagine it would be hard to find if you set off alone. What a fascinating, beautiful setting inside Mythic Oriental Spa. We were greeted warmly and offered welcoming, cleansing drinks - changed into robes etc and provided with large secure lockers for our clothes and valuables. This was an interesting and funny experience: if you get the black soap in your eye do not try to wash it out with the water as it may be salty; full body frontal washing and massage (unlike in UK) and one member of our party had the shock of her life as this was her first ever massage. Please note though that all very discrete and a great way to bond with family and friends. The rose petals laid out on the massage beds was a nice touch. Mythic Oriental Spa had a nice ambience but the ultimate "to cap it off" experience was the rooftop which would not have been out of place in a Vogue fashion shoot or hip hop video - an inky blue sky with twinkling stars. Relaxing, refreshing and rejuvenating - yes it was pricy but the drinks and nibbles on the roof top were out of this world. A fabulous ending to a wonderful day. A cab to our hotel would have been 100 dirham from the spa but the lady gave us directions from Mythic Oriental Spa to the main square - basically left, left, left and we got a cab from there - the driver wanted to charge 200 dirham but settled for 30 dirham when we advised him we were not first timers (although we were)! Mythic Oriental Spa also sold some lovely expensive t-shirts which I was nearly tempted to buy. A photo at the end of the experience was taken and posted to us a memory - a nice touch.

Impeccable service/beautiful setting. Our riad owner organised a trip to this beautiful spa for us. We got to embrace the Moroccan culture by having a hammam, then a bath and then a massage for a great relaxing break from the hectic city. The tranquil spa is beautifully decorated and the staff were extremely professional and helpful. I would definitely recommend this lovely spa.

Bad memory which I never want to have. My wife and I had spa at Mythic Oriental on 26 Oct 2013. This was my first spa so I did not really realize what should I did in each stage. Therefore, I might ask some silly questions or raise some silly requests during the spa. At the end of the spa, I suddenly heard that the staff were talking some gossips in English in the pantry and the gossips were about my silly questions and silly requests. At that time, they did not know I was just standing near the door entrance of the pantry. In their conversation, they found that my questions and requests brought them much trouble. Of course, this kind of gossip disappointed and hurted me a lot as I was just innocent of each step in spa. My first spa gave me a very bad memory which I never want to have.

Amazing. Would go back in a heartbeat. This was the best massage I have ever had. A lovely touch was after the massage you had plenty of time to relax on the table. No rushing. Taken to the rooftop for tea was an added bonus. Just book. You won't be disappointed. Make sure you leave some extra time to find it. We were 20 minutes late. :(

Hidden luxury. The spa is hidden down another small alley with only one sign to direct you where to go, but if you can find it then this is a real hidden gem. Moderately priced, the treatments are excellent and the full body massage was amazing.

Lovely relaxation. My friend and I booked the couple package and overall it was a pleasant experience. While the end massage was superb we felt that the first part of the hammam treatment was somewhat rushed. Perhaps we expected a bit more given all previous reviews. Nonetheless, all the staff were amazing, very friendly and professional and it was a good relaxing way to end the hot Marrakech day.

Relaxing haven. The spa was an amazing place, hidden away in Marrkech's Medina, but well worth the trouble finding it. If you decide to visit - get a taxi! We decided the walk would do us good before the Hamman and massage, but it was a nightmare to find. There are no street signs in Marrakech, lots of tiny alleyways which do not seem to relate to the map we had! We would, however, not have missed the experience for the world. My husband and I had the couples ritual which lasted about 2.5 hours. Starting with the black soap wash followed by a body scrub and a type of mud mask (?). We were then taken to a room with two bathtubs and we then had a long soak in a candle lit room. Following this, we were taken to another room for our couples massage. All through the experience, the staff were very professional and made sure we had plenty of water, juice and mint tea to drink.

A Happy Ending. We booked this Spa Treatment as part of our cooking package and after a full day over a hot stove ;) ;) it was the perfect way to end the day. Let me just say this, I absolutely love the Marrakech concept that wealth is not publicly displayed but enjoyed inside. Going through the Medina is very interesting but when you go through the door of the Mythic Oriental Spa, you enter into a whole new world. Wow!! we were totally taken by surprise. The decor was amazing, each room was better than the other and everything was extremely clean and well kept, true luxury. Since, I was with my boyfriend we did every treatment as a couple, We started with a refreshment, orange juice for him and mint tea for me. We were then escorted to the changing room and then to pick out our desired scents. Treatment started in the steam room which included being washed by a women. Lets me say this, Hammam is an experience, from the black soup wash and the full body scrub was not only excellent and the ladies are very professional and make you feel totally at ease. After a cool drink we went upstairs into another beautifully decorated room for our massage. Minutes into it, I could hear my boyfriend snoring and I was on my way to join him. I'm not sure how long we slept but we both felt very relaxed and refreshed when we woke up. From that room we continued up to the top balcony in our robes and slippers, where we joined the rest of our friends. We sat there for a few, enjoyed more drinks, the cool evening breeze and the sunset. What away to end a full day. It's a total experience, from the treatments to the lovely staff. The ladies are just that, ladies. They are extremely professional and very nice. We tipped and thanked them all and we did leave without buying soaps and oils. We all agreed that we wish we had more time in Marrakech so we come back and try other treatments. This is a must try and a definite place to revisit on my trip back. That you Ladies great job and keep it up.

Perfect birthday treat after a trek through the mountains!. My boyfriend and I loved the throne room reception that we given whilst sipping cool orange water and deciding upon the scent we wanted for our massage. We had no idea what a Hammam was or what to expect so it was an eye opening experience for both us when we were visited in the steam room by a lady offering to wash us! After recovering from the initial surprise, the wash with black soap and scrub with the Hammam mitt was a refreshing and enjoyable experience. We fully appreciated this even after we had dried off and got changed into our spa robes and fresh spa underwear. The assortment of refreshments offered at every pause between treatments was also a nice touch and our massages were very relaxing. We both felt suitably pampered after the whole experience and slept well in our beds that evening.The slight difficulty we had was that the place was a little hard to find on foot. We attribute this mainly to the fact that the street names in Marrakech are not posted on the streets!! I’d recommend stopping to ask for directions in shops, or get a taxi.

The highlight of our trip to Marrakech. No words can do justice to our time at the Mythic Oriental.Do not be deceived by the location, on entrance I can assure you this spa, based in a riad, is pure luxury.My partner and I arrived 45mins early for our booking of the Grand Couples Ritual package and were treated to a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. From there we were taken to a dressing room where we changed into the disposal underwear provided by the spa.From there, we were led to a room where we could choose what scents and oils we wanted to be used for a massage while sipping on our lovely orange juice!We were then led to a room where we were given a very relaxing foot massage. Following this, we experienced the hammam! My partner and I were both scrubbed down with black soap and then washed with bucket fulls of water/. We then went to another room for our 20min slimming wrap which also helps the skin and pores.After being washed down again, we were taken to a very warm jacuzzi where we were presented with more orange juice. The service could not be faulted, this is exactly what we needed after our hammam.We were then taken to a room upstairs where we had our massages in a room together. Pure relaxation!An hour later, we were led to the roof terrace where we were treated to mint tea and some Morrocan cakes.All in, a wonderful experience and would definitely come back to Marrakech just to go back to Mythic Oriental.

Amazing high quality spa experience that was worth every penny!. I visited Mythic Oriental Spa with 2 friends and we had a wonderful time. We were given a tour of the facilities and then went on to make an appointment. The staff were all very pleasant and made us feel relaxed and welcome. Every part of the spa experience was executed well and I would most certainly visit again. Thanks you to Zineb especially who made helped make our tau in Marrakech more brilliant!

A little Gem!. We booked this spa as part of a 'special' deal with the very good L'atelier Faim d'Epices cookery school. After cooking we turned up to the the Spa and we were taken a back by how nice the place was. Going down the small alley ways we certainly weren't expecting to see such a well decorated place. The ladies there were very friendly(spoke English which helped). We were offered drinks. We were only waiting 15 minutes when we experienced the Hammam followed by a full body massage. Both of which were great. Then we were walked onto the rooftop where we could relax until we were ready to leave.An amazing experience had from start to finish. I would reccommend to all if you want to relax amongst all the hustle and bustle off Marrakesh.

Superb luxury and attentiveness - also perfect for couples!. We visited here as part of a package with cookery school faim d'epices, which was equally awesome. This Hammam is incredibly luxurious, amazing personal service from the moment you step into the beautiful Riad. The massage was divine, and a bonus for couples is that you get your treatments together in the same room, unlike many other Hammams which separate the sexes.The experience went beyond our expectations and was faultless from start to finish. Will definitely book a return visit when next in Marrakech.

Wonderful experience!. We have booked the spa treatment at Mythic Oriental Spa together with the cooking course at Faim d’Épices and we were thrilled by the whole package!After the cooking course at Faim d’Épices we were brought to the Mythic Oriental Spa and warmly welcomed with a drink of our choice. As we were a group of 11 people, we had to divide into 3 groups. One group could start immediately with the whole treatment and the rest had to wait for a while. This was not a problem as we could spend the waiting time on the fantastic rooftop terrace with its relaxing ambiance and enjoyed ourselves in the whirlpool where time passed really fast. Soon, we could start with our first hamam experience that we enjoyed to the full. After the foot cleanse, we were washed in the steam bath and scrubbed. The highlight of the whole treatment was the extraordinary one hour massage after which we all felt very relaxed.

Amazing place to calm down. We booked the Spa as an arrangement with the cookery course Faim d'Epices. It was a wonderful experience. We enjoyed the Hamam and the Massage very much. We also had the possibilty to enjoy the Whirpool on the roof top, which was amazing and very relaxing. From the outside the Spa does not look that special, but from the inside it is just beautiful, a perfect place to relax a little bit after exhausting days in Marrakech. Also the staff is very friendly. I would totally recommend it, it is definitely worth the money.

An excellent way to unwind. Myself and my partner booked the cookery and spa package with Faim D Espice. After a morning of cooking it was lovely to arrive at the spa and walk from the bustling street into a tranquil oasis. Warm and welcoming staff made us feel at home as soon as we arrived with a welcome drink. We were then shown to the changing room where we got into our robs and our paper pants ready for our spa treatments. We were then escorted to another room for a glass of water and to chose our massage oil. We then went off for a foot cleanse, steam and scrub down (which was an amazing experience and one I had been unnecessarily nervous about), we then came out and were given more water before being taken into the massage room where we were both given very different massages. I had a relaxing and partner had a deep tissue massage. Then off to the roof top terrace for mint tea and selection of sweets. The staff there are really friendly and good at their jobs. An excellent way to relax. Would definitely go there again and highly recommend!

combined cookery and spa package. Four of us booked the cookery and spa package with Faim D Espice. Nice relaxing sit on the rooftop then off for foot cleanse, steam and scrub down, then the best massage ever. The staff there are really friendly and good at their jobs. Lovely décor. Would definitely go there again.

Fantastic spa experience. We done the couples spa package combined with the Faim DEspice cookery course - really great experience and great value as a package. My wife and I were dropped of here by the cookery course owner and given refreshments before changing for a foot massage and then a hammam together. Washed down by a very friendly and polite girl before chilling out with more refreshments before a massage together. Excellent massages together by 2 very professional masseurs in a delightful room with soft lighting and calming music. Up to he rooftop chill out area for mint tea, Moroccan pastries and watch the sun go down - great evening

Relaxing end to our best day in Marrakech. Earlier in the day my girlfriend and I attended a fantastic cookery course with the affable and slightly eccentric Michel at Faim d'Epices and decided to opt for the full day package which concluded with a hammam and massage at Mythic Oriental Spa. On arrival we were greeted by smiley faces and mint tea and shown to some comfy sofas for a few minutes so we could take in our surroundings and wind down from the chaos that is Marrakech. When we were ready we were taken to a private room where we were given a foot massage, next came the hammam, which if truth be told was slightly disappointing, the room was small, cramped and a little uncomfortable and our 'scrub and wash' lasted no more than a 5-10 minutes each. Once we dried off we were taken for our massage, which in my opinion was the real highlight. An hour later I floated from the treatment room to another comfy sofa for another cup of well received mint tea. Before leaving we posed for some photos with the staff which were emailed to us on our return. I would certainly recommend this spa; it is good value for money, the staff are very friendly, attentive and good at what they do, the property (riad) is beautifully maintained, the mint tea is very tasty and we both left feeling very calm and rejuvenated before re-entering mayhem outside.

Mythic Oriental is a diamond in the rough!. My partner and I had a joint couple treatment and loved it. The staff were fantastic (they definitely went out of their way for us) the place was beautiful (the pictures don't do it justice) the treatments were such a resenoable price and it was just a great tranquil environment in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. I would recommend Mythic Oriental to everyone!

Wow ! This is amazing.. Four of us went to this spa as part of a package after attending a cookery course at L'atelier Faim d'Epices. We were welcomed with mint tea and one couple were taken off quite quickly to start their hammam. I was in the second couple - we were taken to the roof top terrace with another drink, where we waited for about 20 - 30 mins to be collected for our turn- take a book with you to read and see it as part of the relaxation rather than seeing it as waiting for something to happen. Then we started our hammam. we were provided with paper undies to protect our modesty. Then we had our feet washed and our bodies washed with black argan soap- lovely - BUT don't touch your eyes - it stings if you get it in your eyes. We were then scrubbed with a glove and washed down - which included a small bucket of water being poured over you - its better than it sounds. very invigorating. Then we had a massage- out of this world- in a darkened room with soft music and lovely oils. I had a gentle massage ( by request ) and my husband had a stronger massage. we were served mint tea at the end too. The staff were calm, professional and polite and we felt very comfortable there. I would highly recommend this spa for a calm, relaxing experience.

Amazing end to an Amazing day!. We booked our couple's Hamman via the internet---quick and accomadating replies from the lovely Zainib.We arrived dusty and sweaty after a wonderful trip with Marrakech City Tours to the Atlas Mountains. Walking in to this beautiful spa was like Heaven! The building was calm, beautiful, quiet and tastefully furnished. From the word 'Go' we were treated like royalty. First of all we had the traditional Mint tea welcome, a God Send! Then we were shown to the changing rooms---if the gown doesn't fit then ask for a bigger one---we did, nothing was too much trouble!We selected our scents and then embarked on 3 wonderful hours of treatments and pampering. I am disabled and the care and kindness that I was shown will stay with me for ever! The 'girls' were all lovely, charming and very able at their chosen tasks. I felt safe and totally 'normal', it was just divine. Finally my birthday cake appeared! Wonderful. Many thanks for such memories.

An enjoyable hammam & spa experience. My husband and I booked this Spa as part of a package deal with a cooking academy called l'atelier Faim d'Epices. We were almost immediately taken into the room for welcome tea and to select the scents for the massage (Patchouli was our favourite!). The girls at the spa were really nice and friendly. Khaula (pronouced how-la) and Omaima (pronounced Oh-myee-ma) deserve a special mention. Khaula gave us the hammam bath while Omaima was husband's massuese. The massage was very relaxing and Omaima went the extra mile when my husband mentioned about a nagging pain in his leg. We really enjoyed our time at the spa and if we had time on our side, I would have liked to go back for a foot massage with Omaima. Hopefully next time :)

Nice but.... We booked this spa as part of a 'special' deal with the very good L'atelier Faim d'Epices cookery school. Having had a nice day cooking we were looking forward to a relaxing evening. It started so well - sat down in a nice (if very hot) reception. We didn't even mind being asked to wait 15 minutes. However 45 minutes later and still nobody even bothering to even talk to us, we got a bit anxious and asked how long - eventually we were told 'maybe another 15-20 minutes' by the young and definitely un-apologetic manager....Basically we could see that they had overbooked with people - presumably coming in on spec - whereas as part of the deal with the cookery school we were probably lower margin business.Anyhow we decided not to wait and walked out. The place looked OK but needs to sort out its booking system and service, given the prices it charges.....at no time did we feel that anybody really cared that we were being kept waiting. I think the cookery school needs to find a more reliable partner!

Great finish to a great day. We found out about this spa as part of a package that was put together with a cooking school called l'atelier Faim d'Epices. We had had a great day there then were brought right to the spa (good thing...we would never have have found it on our own). It was like an oasis in the middle of the Medina desert! We were greeted with tea (of course), asked to choose what type of scented oil we liked and given robes to change into before we went into the warm room for the black soap and hot water splooshing. Nice to be able to go as a couple. We were left to warm through after the first dunking and then given another rinse before we went into the hammam scrub room. The girl was working hard! You could see little balls of dead skin rolling off! We went back to the warm room for another rinse then off the the massage room. From what I saw on other reviews, it seems like some people come more for a quick treatment than a relaxing time. This is not the place to get that. Enjoy the laid back pace. It is a spa!The massage was fabulous. My wife got the relaxing massage, without asking for it, and I got the real work down massage....without asking for it. Just what each of us like. Again it was nice to be in the same room while this was being done.Afterward, we were given time to relax in a quiet room with some tea or water, whatever we preferred. Nobody rushing you out to make from for the next customer, just a really peaceful time. We ended up buying some of the oils that were used on us to take home. Pretty hard to recreate the whole experience but we'll get part way there!Overall, a great experience in a welcoming atmosphere at a reasonable price. We loved it.

cannot believe the raving reviews. This experience was not worth the money. We indulged and ordered the couples spa ritual where you sit in bath water for thirty minutes, then you get a hammam "scrub" which lasted about 2 minutes (weve been to way better ones in Morocco where the girls actually remove the dead skin in a 20-30 min session, this was nothing compared to it..and at half the price) a body wrap, then a "massage" where they just rub your body. The atmosphere is very nice but if you want an actual spa experience where you feel re-energized and refreshed afterwards (and that something was actually changed) then this is not it. Its gimmicky and touristy.

Hidden but special treasure. Wonderful expert couples spa treatment undertaken with professionalism and courtesy, talented masseur released a frozen shoulder and having massaged away most of the pain made an aromatic wrap to go on the shoulder after. I hadn't really mentioned it but she found the problem in seconds. I've had spa all over the world and the actual treatment rates very highly. The only slight negative was the sound of children playing from nearby. I expect spas charging 120 £ for a treatment to be an oasis of calm! Fix this and it's 100%.

Do not listen to bad reviews!. This place is a gem! It was quiet difficult to find (this is my only negative thing I have to say) but totally worth it! (We had to pay a local to show us where it was). We had no idea what to expect and what exactly we got from a hamen massage, as no one has written here exactly what happens i will go through it.On arrival we were warmly welcomed and shown where to get changed into dressing gowns and shoes (everything was very clean which was a really big thing we were worrying about). We were then shown to a little private section where we enjoyed orange enthused water. Then we picked the sented oil we wanted for our massage.After this we were taken through and given a foot massage with a warm towel which was Devine. Then shown into a sort of steam room where they rub you down with a sort of oil and then bath u then leave u to sort of soak in the oil after about 10-15mins they come and wash it off(myself and my girlfriend were feeling quiet awkward about being topless but they made us feel so comfortable). After this they took as through to a room where they did a sort of exfoliation with rough glove with black sand and oil, which was so nice and you could see all the dead skin they got off your body which was excellent. You then go back to the 'steam room' and are bathed again and asked to wash ur hair.Then comes the massage. We entered the room and they put on some relaxing Moroccon music and lit candles. The lights were then turned off so the room was lit just by candles (obviously not pitch black) and we got on the tables (we had out massage together). We were feeling again quiet awkward about being basically naked, but the staff made us feel so comfortable by covering the areas they weren't massaging with a towel.The massage was amazing! And when they say full body massage they mean it! We had every finger, every toe massaged! Even our heads and faces. People have written that it wasn't hard enough but I felt the pressure was just fine! And I'm sure u could specify if I had wanted it Harder.After the massage we had tea and busicuites on the roof terrace. People have also comment about the time factor but I feel they just don't want to rush you which I pressure to have then someone pushing u out the door. Also another comment about the price, I was very happy with the 750 dh (around £65-£70) as you are more or less having three treatment! There are places that charge less but you are defiantly getting a great service and I can assure everything is very clean which a lot of other places we looked at weren't. I highly recommend this place! 10 stars!!!!

Fantastic end to a morrocan holiday. I went here on Valentine's day with my husband for a couple's package and really enjoyed it. My husband was a bit apprehensive as he never did anything like this before but he also enjoyed the experience. The massage was fantastic and the mint tea and pastries on the roof terrace at the end topped it off nicely. Overall a very romantic day and one I wont forget.

Hmmm.... maybe try somewhere else. I was less impressed with this spa than others on Trip advisor. On the positive the building and rooms are beautiful and everyone was pleasant. On the negative side, of the 2.5 hours we were at the place (after the wonderful cooking school), I seemed to spend much of my time waiting with the obligatory mint tea in front of me , and I got really bored. The actual massage was probably at most an hour, and not very effective . Perhaps I am just more used to massages where you feel they are trying to unknot tight muscles, rather than just waving their hands over you. The bath was a do it yourself job, where you sat on stone benches and poured water over you, and the scrub seemed to last about 10 min max . I suspect there is better value in Marrakech .

Far from the best. We found Mythical Oriental on Tripadvisor and it was a letdown. It is a lot smaller than other spas, not as cosy, the hammam was not even body temperature, and the ensuing bath was better taken at home. I have had better treatments in ordinary spas in Sweden, France and Spain. Even if the staff ceased chattering after we told them so, they could still be heard through closed doors. There are far better choices in Marrakech, and cheaper - we had one the next day.

Amazing. I ended my holiday to Marrakech with a full body massage at the Mythic Oriental Spa. This was total relaxation! I left there feeling like this was the highlight of my trip! I would highly recommend a visit here for pampering, relaxation, and all round well being. Well worth a visit. Staff are very friendly and professional. The spa is a welcome, beautiful, warm and peaceful retreat. Book now, you will love it!!!

Absolutely Beautiful!. This place is gorgeous! We came here for a hamam and a massage and they were both very good. The massage, however, is worth a BIG mention! Being a masseur myself it's rare I get to enjoy these kinds of treatments and the young lady who did mine was incredible. totally relaxing and wonderful. Go!

Fantastic hidden spa!. Great spa and great service! I went in a group for my Auntie's birthday and we all had the Hammam plus massage, which was incredibly relaxing. The owner's parents were visiting and I spoke to them in French - very lovely! They also organised a birthday cake for my Auntie with all the staff coming out to sing Happy Birthday. Very accommodating and above all, a really relaxing day! I will definitely visit this spa again!

Perfect spa in medina!. A hidden treasure in the heart of Medina! We had an awesome experience from start to finish! The staff were very accommodating & provided excellent service. Would go back & this place is highly recommended!

Experience a little Moroccan magic. We can only add our voice to the chorus of approval for this gem of a hammam in the heart of Marrakech. The local children clearly are used to tourists making their way to the spa as they called out the number of the house as we approached in case we were not sure which door to knock. The welcome was warm and friendly and with a quick explanation of what to expect, we got started. Refreshments first and a chance to choose which scent for massage and bath, then a lovely foot massage to start the ritual. Washed with savon noir, steamed, scrubbed till pink and tingly then wrapped for the rassoul, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Became so relaxed, even dozed off a couple of times as the relaxing experience took effect. The massage was sublime and we were treated to refreshing tea and pastries as a final treat at the end of a wonderful experience. Would I recommend Mythic Oriental Spa? In a heartbeat. Very reasonable compared to London prices and delivered with warmth and care by the lovely staff. Hubby had never tried anything like this before, so he was well impressed. I've done a fair few spas and Mythic Oriental is way up there with the very best in my opinion. Felt so much better for the experience. Highly Recommended!

Couples Package. After a full day at Faim d'Epices, we were shuttled to Mythic Oriental Spa and this definitely ended the day on a perfect note. Aside from being blown away by the decor, friendly staff, and elegance of the spa, the services were fantastic. You are provided with everything you need and are relaxed throughout. Our session included a selection of scented oils for the massage and bath salts. We were then lead to a room contaning two bathtubs where we soaked for 30 minutes in relaxation. Afterwards we had a cleansing, scrub, hamman, wrap and finally the massage. At the end we were served mint tea and then finished. Absolutely amazing experience and would love to go back.

Hamman experience. Wife visited this spa - this is what she said; I chose Mythic Oriental Spa following reading the positive reviews on trip advisor. This was the first time I had been to a spa in Marrakech, but had previous experience of others in Thailand, Vietnam and the UK of course. It was a bit of a risk as, rather than go with my husband, I took my 66 year old mom instead, leaving my husband to look after our two children (by the way, I don't think there would be anywhere for someone to sit and wait for you if they were not also having a spa session). We didn't know what to expect at the spa other than what I had read on trip advisor. I had pre-booked in the UK via email, and had received a prompt response in English and confirmation of our booking. The spa would have been difficult to find on our own, but we were guided by a teenage Boy (followed by his friends, obviously checking we were going to hand out money). For those yet to visit, from the square, where you get dropped off by a taxi, take the alley off which has a no entry sign for cars, walk slightly up hill, within just a few minutes, you will see a small general " shop" on your left, and opposite a turning to the right, the wall has a bold sign pointing the way to the spa; follow the alleyway down and round to the left, then right, the only route you can take if I remember correctly, the spa is on the corner before the alleyway turns again sharply to the left. As the other reviews say, don't let the alleyways and outside worry you, once you get into the spa, it is a different world! The girls were lovely, and spoke enough English to make it easy. We really enjoyed the experience - once I got over sitting next to my mom in nothing but a paper triangle thong! Not an experience to go through if you are at all body conscious! Not that the girls take the slightest bit of notice. You may well end up with wet hair (you can wash your hair if you need, but don't think there is an opportunity or facility to dry it), also, if you are like me and can't face the world without your lippy, take everything you need with you. Overall, I would certainly go again. Can't say how this compares to any other spa in Marrakesh, but certainly was as good as others I have been to.

WOW! I want to go back!. I think I have never received such a great service in a spa like here! You are pampered the whole time and the whole staff are so friendly. On top of this they provide you with everything you need: bathrobe, slippers, towel, one-time underwear, shoer gel, shampoo....First you get some water with lemon, then you are washed with black soap and you receive a body scrub. After a shower you get your wonderful relaxing massage and at the end a nice mint tea with pastries. If you wish to do so youhave the possibility to buy some of the spa products. Simply amazing!
Excellent Massage. Located somewhere in the middle of the medina. We liked the massage very much. Timing and quietness of the staff can be improved.

Simply amazing time. Don't let the narrow roads, or the lack of decor at the front door fool you. The moment you walk in the door till the minute you leave, you'll truly understand the meaning of being pampered. My wife and I had a couples hamman and massage. Having never had a hamman before, really had no idea what to expect. Was initially a bit surprised to have someone put soap on me, and really had no idea what savon noir is. Once it was explained what was going on, and the process behind it, I wish i could have had one every day. The massage itself was more than spectacular. I wish the spas where I live had this level of skills and service. Our massage was 60min. My only recommendation is to get a massage for as long as you can find time for. 60min is just too short for such a wonderful massage.

Utterly indulgent relaxation. You'll probably struggle to find this place, but it's worth seeking out. Ask a local for directions for a few dirham - we were heading completely the wrong way until we did this!We opted for the Couples Evening Retreat, around 3 hours for about £60 each. You can actually have it any time of the day - we changed the time of ours due to approaching thunderstorms!The spa is in a riad, and the way they structure their bookings makes it feel as tho you have the whole place to yourselves. It's very peaceful.I won't spoil it by going into details of the treatments, but suffice to say the quality of the surroundings, the products usednand the treatments was excellent. We were so relaxed afterwards it felt like such a treat. The whole experience was fabulous.

Nice spa. We did the 2 hours couples treatment, it was nice and relaxing and the staff was attentive. Only drawbacks were the massage tables weren't very comfortable and there's an extra fee if you want to use the hot tub.

Simply bliss. My partner and I booked the couple package and was not disappointed. What is billed as a 2 1/2 hour package was actually 3 1/2 hours. We was impressed with the decor, cleanliness and service. You have you very own little area so are not passing others on stairways and changing rooms and from the moment you arrive feel like you are the only ones in the place. Spa's back in the U.K could learn from here. 1 thing to be wary of thou is the 'helpful' man who will walk you there from the square nearby. He will take you straight there but he may not be happy with the 10dh you give him. He is harmless though.

Little haven in a bustling city. The staff were very friendly and helpful, on our arrival they were very understanding with a small issue we had. My partner and I went here in September 2012 and had the couples evening treatment, which included arrival drinks, foot massage, oriental spa, hamman, full body wrap and exfoliation, massage and moroccan tea to finish, You feel as if you are the only people there as the staff very cleverly move you around the spa. A very nice and relaxing thing to do in contrast to the hot and sweaty city. Highly recommend.

Bliss. We went to Marrakech beginning of this year and whenever i think back, the first thing i see is Mythic Spa! Thats why i had to write a review :) It is an amazing experience!! The treatments are devine and the decor of the riad makes you feel like you are in an arabic fairytale. The products feel great, mild on the skin and smell delicious. The owners are a young lovely couple, they're very friendly and happy to help with any questions you have. We wanted to buy some specific moroccan jars and they brought us to a great shop on their scooters! If you're in Marrakech, Mythic Spa is a must! You definitely won't be disappointed!!!!

The most amazing spa. I went to this spa along with my husband as part of the cooking & spa package offered by Faime de'pices - we were taken to the spa by the driver after the cooking course and it is in what basically looks like a back street off the souk, so very pleased someone was taking us! After knocking on a very inconspicuous door, we entered the most amazing spa. It's so sumptuous and luxurious, the girls look after you extremely well and you feel well and truly pamperred. The only thing to note is that you should be comfortable with a bit of nudity if you're going to this spa! Particularly the women. We were both given disposable underwear to wear, my husband was given boxer shorts which were fine, and I was given a disposable thong, which covered virtually nothing! You don't see anyone else, apart from the women who work at the spa and do your treatments, but it's still something which I'm sure could make someone feel uncomfortable. I'd read a couple of the reviews which mention this before going so I was prepared and to be honest you just need to relax and go with it. The treatments were fab, and the massage in particular was amazing. Highly recommended!

Absolutely Wonderful. One of the wonders of Marrakesh is that you have no idea from the outside little streets of the Medina what you can find inside. We made an appointment at Mythic Oriental Spa by email from the USA as they came so highly recommended by other customers. We thought that pampering in some Oriental Spa should be an experience to try. Oh my were we right. The taxi dropped us as close as he could and then we walked a little narrow street until their discreet door. We rang the door bell and once a very nice lady opened we were in pure heaven for 2.5 hours. Our treatment for two was for 90 minutes but they allowed us so much time to rest and savor tea and pastries between each session that it lasted a lot longer. The decor is simply sumptuous, every detail is thought of. My eyes were in awe and I asked to meet the French owner to ask him where he purchased some of the decoration. Florent was very nice and gave me some addresses. His staff, all women, were very good masseuses and so genuinely nice that we will remember them forever. You "must" make it part of your Marrakech's experiences. The best spa experience we ever had.

Fantastic treatments, beautiful place and great staff. My boyfriend and I chose the Mythic Oriental Spa based on trip advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. I have been to spas in the UK and the experience at Mythical Spa was exceptional. We choose the VIP couples experience which we found very enjoyable and was just as described in the other reviews. The building is hard to find, you have to walk down a dodgy alley way but once you are there the building is beautifully decorated and the staff were all welcoming.

One word only.... Heaven!. My partner and I booked the couples VIP package and we really were treated like VIPs from the moment we arrived. We were offered refreshments on arrival and given a selection of scented oils to chose from for our massages. We were then taken through to another area for a foot massage before be taken through to the hamman. After the hamman we were given time to bathe in a gorgeous room with lovely deep baths and relaxing music and more refreshments. Following this, we went to another area for our full body massage and then shown to another part of the Riad for mint tea and traditional sweet treats. What really stands out about this spa is the time you are given in each of the areas to relax. Some places feel rushed but here it feels like you are the only people in the spa that day and you are given so much time to enjoy the treatments for a truly relaxing experience. You are able to buy all the products used in the spa and these are perfect for gifts or to treat yourself and they are excellent value.The staff were incredible, very discrete but at the same time very attentive and every part of the experience was excellent - I cannot find even the tiniest fault with my experience here and would highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to be pampered and treated like a prince/princess. A perfect way to relax and escape the wonderful madness of Marrakesh!!

We were undecided!. With so much to see and do in Marrakech we were undecided on our booked visit but we are so pleased with did this. We booked the Evening Couples Ritual Spa but actually couldnt book in the evening so plunged for 3pm which gave us the evening to explore further in Marrakech. From the moment we arrived this is a professional outfit. The girls were helpful, professional and very relaxing to be around. We were shown to a Private Hannam and then wraped in mud, bathed in rose petals and then the most amazing body massage in a twin massage suite. My husband thought it was fantastic and he doesnt do this kind of thing regularly so a real treat and we are so pleased we did this. The Riad Spa is also beautifully decorated. A well run and well organised spa visit. Thank you Ladies.

Amazing Hammam. This was our first Hammam experience and it was just perfect. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. They made sure to accommodate our every need (including my sensitive skin!) and we were even treated to some cakes and lovely mint tea once our massage was over. I would definitely recommend to anyone travelling in Marrakech!

Great couple's treatment. My partner wanted to relax and have a spa day whilst we were in Marrakech for a few days, and decided, thanks to tripadvisor to give Mythic Oriental Spa a go; at first, whilst i was apprehensive being my first spa trip, i soon got into the swing of things.We opted for the 900dirham (if i remember rightly) couples treatment. What a treatment it was.Firstly, finding the place is a little hard [big thanks to googlemaps!] but well worth it. The atmosphere is incredible. You can so easily forget where you are. It's wonderful. Staff are friendly and attentive, it's clean, it's tidy, it's authentic. It's relaxing.The different rooms for the shower scrubs, hammams, mani/pedicures, massages, teas etc were all differently colour co-ordinated, and you seamlessly move through the premises and i was gobsmacked by every second. DEFINITE RECOMMENDATION; great value for money, so glad we found it!

Ok, but nothing wow. After reading all the reviews I am not sure if I went to the same place. We book a VIP package after reading the excellent reviews. The place itself is beautiful. The treatments were TOO long, the first time they left us for what they said was gonna be 20 min, but after half an hour "marinating" wrapped in a plastic bag we had to go and look for one of the girls! You can hear them talking and giggling all the time, a real turn off when you are looking to relax.The massage and treatments were ok, but nothing "wow".The odors are the big problem here, the towels smell bad; the girls, and this is difficult to say... have very bad armpit smell, and after one of the treatments they came back smelling like garlic and onion after they probably had their lunch... not exaclty what you are looking for during a massage....Very disappointed of the whole experience.

Wonderfully relaxing. We visited the spa as a package with the cooking class (see other review) and it was a wonderful experience! We had a traditional Moroccan haman which consisted of a foot rub, black soap sauna, salt scrub and then a massage.I will warn you that you are practically naked the whole time - you wear these paper knickers which are pretty useless and have a robe for public areas. You do get used to them getting up close and personal very quickly. My boyfriend didn't enjoy it as much as I did but he said the massage was very relaxing. Be warned - it is incredibly difficult to find!! We were very lucky and our driver from the cooking class dropped us straight there because we would not be able to find it otherwise! We also booked a taxi to take us back to the hotel as we were outside of marrake
good hammam. If you are looking for a good Hammam , try this placethey provide every things and you will get your baby skin back

A little piece of calm inside the walls of the Medina. We visited the spa after some recommendations from our Riad owner, it was just rounded corner which was a bonus! On entering the spa we were reseed by the ladies and shown in to a room to change. I know that other people have mentioned the paper knickers (thongs I'm afraid!) they don't leave much to th imagination,however the women are so discreet I didn't feel uncomfortable once.My partner and I opted for a hamman and then a massage,both were out of this world. The massage was unbelievable, it as so relaxing that I had to fight to stay awake as I didn't want to miss a minute of it. The ladies let you take your time in the spa, we didn't feel under pressure to complete the treatments, we were probably in the spa for close to three hours. We both left feeling amazing. There are so man amazing sights to see in Marrakech, however if you do have time you must visit a hamman and if you can find this spa this is most definitely where you should head!
Relaxing and renewing experience. Beautiful facility and great service. Staff were pleasant and anxious to make the experience match your expectations. Highly recommended.

Best massage ever.. On a recent holiday to Marrakech, my boyfriend and myself went for the Vip package at this spa. We both read the reviews and thought this sounded amazing, The reviews did state that us girls had to wear a disposable thong, which didnt really bother me until I saw it. It was a bit on the large side for me which meant it showed everything esp when wet. I also felt a bit uncomfortable when walking into one room to another with just this thong on. A towel wouldve been greatly appericated at this time. The room in which we had the Hamman wasnt very big but the treatments were good. Though I was asked at one point to wash my hair, which I really didnt see the point to this as I was then walking around with wet hair for the rest of the time, again maybe a towel to wrap my hair in wouldve helped. We was then asked to relax in a bath which to me was very cold so we ended up getting out ourselves but i guess with it being very hot at this time of year, this could be very welcoming for some people. My boyfriend really enjoyed the Hamman and im glad he did as it was his birthday, but I can honestly say it wouldve been better if I wore my bikini, I wouldnt have been so worried about trying to cover myself up and worrying about what was on show, and im sure I wouldve enjoyed this experience much more if I did wear it. It really did spoil this for me and I knew I spoilt it for my boyfriend. Im sure you can insist on wearing a bikini if you feel the same way as I did though the thong was ok when I had the massage, which I have to say, was the main reason I rated this experience excellent. Me and my boyfriend both thought it was the best massage we have ever had and we would def recommend going here just for that. It certainly relaxed me after the Hamman. I really dont want to put people off about the Hamman because I had one a couple of days before at our hotel (with my bikini on) and it was lovely. Maybe the thong wouldnt put many people off, but I def think it should be your personal choice to what you would like to wear. They say this package takes 2 and a half hours but we were there for 3 and a half so its def worth doing, they really do look after you here. Also sitting upstairs on the terrace afterward was a great way to end the whole experience.

Relaxing. It was very nice and peaceful after a day cooking Moroccan food. The music was nice and the surrounding was beautiful. It definitely looks divine, The girls attending you are a bit shy or at least they seemed to me but all in all it was a great experience

Awesome Hamman - Amazing Massage. We took the 'couples VIP' package. Everything is amazing and great apart from the 'main' room for the Hamman that is cramped and not very intimate as there is simply not enough room. Other Hammans we have had have had a main large room to allow you to lie down and be 'scubbed' and cleaned. My partner said they left us too long in a 'cold bath' but I was happy - total time was 3.5 hours even though they quote 2.5 hours as the time for the treatments. The girl's pants seem a bit pointless and could cause un-neccessary embarrasement as they are so small and see-through when wet.
time of my life. I had a great massage to dream about , will definately go back all the way to Marrakeck just for this !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Great Day for Couples. We did a couples spa here are really enjoyed our day. The treatment consisted of a steam, ex-foliation, clay wrap, bath, massage and tea and lasted for over 3 hours. It was nice to do as a couple because you do get to spend a good amount of the time together.Best Points:1) Value - The price you pay for the number / quality of the treatments you get is very competitive.2) Service - All of the people working there are polite, friendly and helped us enjoy our time.3) The Massage - The massage was great and done in an air-conditioned and very relaxing room.Areas for Improvement:1) Explanation of the Day: It would have been nice to have the various activities explained in a bit more detail up front. That way we could have made some minor adjustments to timings for some of the activities (time in the bath was probably too long)Top Tips:1) Location: The spa is a bit difficult to find, make sure you have 20 Dhirams on you to ask someone to guide you there if you can't find it on your own. There are a few winding streets that you have to navigate.2) Wrap Beds: For the clay wrap we were put in different rooms one which had a massage table/bed, the other which is more like a tiled ledge. They put down towels etc on the tiled ledge, but make sure the person who is less concerned about a soft bed goes in that room.

Fabulous. What can I add that has not already been said about this place. It is just heavenly. We went as part of the cooking class / spa deal which made it really good value. When you enter from the street it is like going into another world. Gone is the noise and franticity of the city and instead it is quiet and serene. I was a little nervous as I had never done anything like this before but we were looked after from the moment we went in, to the moment we left. I cannot recommend this highly enough. It fully deserves its trip advisor accolades.

Fantastic Spa experience. My husband and I came here for a hammam followed by a massage and I couldn't rate this place highly enough. The girls are so friendly and lovely and make you feel very welcome and relaxed. The hammam was amazing - you feel so incredibly clean after! Which is perfect after walking around such a hot, busy city all day!!The massage was lovely, we were both done in the same room which was special.The building is out of this world, all finishings were expensive and well done - making this a top class spa experience!My only criticism is how HARD this place is to find!! It took us no less than 45 minutes - they should put more signposts out leading you the way. Luckily we eventually found someone who knew where it was and took us to the door - otherwise we'd never have got there.That said, it was well worth the trek :-)

Amazing experience. A fantastic experience. We were booked for a two hour ritual and think we got over three. Very good massage and treatments. It isnt easy to find and they dont take credit cards but they warned us in advance so we had cash!

Beautiful Building. The spa is in the most beautiful Riad and the treatments were lovely- however i found the girls slightly unproffesional at times (giggling to each other through the massages etc). However dont let this put you off going- the whole experience is extremely relaxing and very morrocan!

So relaxing, well worth it!. We went to the Mythic Oriental Spa on a recommendation and it was amazing. We went for the grand evening ritual for couples, which I would also recommend for others. It may be difficult to find but our taxi driver knew the area. You should ring up a few days before to book; we went at 5pm and it lasts around 3 hours which was just right. Definite must do if you are in Marrakech.

Hard to find but well worth it!!!. Having seen the reviews here on trip advisor, my husband and I decided to book up for the grande evening ritual for couples. It did not dissapoint! Although there was some complication down to the booking (they put us in on the wrong day) they remained professional and still made sure we recived 5* treatment. We left feeling soft, smooth, relaxed and refreshed!
Great massage!. I enrolled in a morrocan cooking course with Faim d'Epices and they had a promotion in combination with this spa.Both were memorable
the best way to end your holiday!. a little tricky to find (like everything in Marrakech) but this was amazing. I would come back to Morocco just to go here again!

Very Relaxing!!!. Me and my boyfriend went here on our last day in Marrakech, which was a perfect way to finish the holiday and wind down from the hustle-bustle of the super busy medina!We opted for the Hamman, exfoliation and massage which was 750Dh each, which in relation to everything else in Marrakech was expensive, but 100% worth it :).You get robes to wear with disposable underware (which are quite revieling) and disposable boxers for the men. There is no disposable bikini top, so I wore my own, but soon took it off as I felt comfortable with the staff. The staff look pristine and smart and are very proffesional. Firstly your given mineral water with orange slices before being taken to a relaxing room where your feet and legs are massaged and cleansed (with is very very relaxing!! - im normally ticklish aswell!).Then your taken in a sort-of steam room. A lady comes in and washes your body with the traditional black soap and throws a bucket of warm water over you! Very exhilerating!!! You then get layed on a tiled slab and thoroughly exfoliated!! (including bum cheeks and boobs!!) This felt lovely! You then return to the steam room where the lady throws a bucket of hot water over you to rinse of and then you wash your hair and are left for the heat of the room to cleanse your skin. We were then both taken upstairs to a beautiful room which we could both have a massage in. We chose our oil, and the massage was superb!!! Very thorough, again, bums and boobs included!Once this was done, we were taken to a terrace and served mini cakes and mint tea! Delightful!The place was decorated so beautifully, and the experience couldn't have been better!My boyfriend would never normally enjoy this sort of thing, but he really managed to relax and enjoy the experience too!Would deffinately recommend!

Perfect. Not one flaw - a beautiful and elegant spa, exceptionally well run by Florent and his team.A big thank you to the girls who carried out our treatments - they were friendly, yet professional. I can not recommend this spa highly enough.

Great service, great value. My wife and I had a hammam and massage package as part of a larger package with the Faim d'epices cooking school. It was our first hammam experience, so we didn't know what to expect, but we enjoyed every minute of it.The spa building itself and all of the rooms were beautiful. The service was excellent from start to finish. Everything about our visit was exceeded our expectations and was better than most spa experiences I've had in Canada and the United States. The value was incredible as we would have paid at least twice as much for the same treatment back home.Unfortunately we visited towards the end of our stay in Marrakech. If possible, I definitely would have booked another visit. Our hammam and massage was a highlight of our time in Marrakech.

Paradise.... My wife Claudia and I were in Morocco as part our 15 year anniversary. We bumped into a guide from Maroc Excursions Day Trip who recommended Mythic Oriental Spa. We absolutely loved the 2 1/2 hours of pampering and caring service. Would recommended it any time!!!Claudia and Willie(2 argies living in the UK for 15 years)

Heaven. If you want to feel like you've been scrubbed, washed and massaged like never before, then come here. It really was one of the most pleasurable experiences ever and I highly recommend it - we felt like new people when we emerged. Mmmm.

Luxury Spa in Marrakesh. We were truely surprised!Excellent customer service, super clean. The staff paid great attention to us, they were warm, friendly.If you are looking to be spoilt, look no further.
Fantastic, authentic spa experience. Just go and try it!! you won't regret it. My daughter and I had a fantastic three hours being totally pampered.
Fabulous. Wonderful hammam and amazing massage. Beautiful house and superb way to relax.

Relaxing, Friendly and possibly the best Spa I have visited. I could not fault Rihab and the ladies who made our spa experience relaxing and memorable. We went as a party of ladies on a hen do and came out totally relaxed and feeling beautiful. Well worth a visit!

Must Visit !!!. As every one mentioned Its wonderful experience , Nice Girls, good ambiance, and of course amazing hospitality. I would definitely recommend this place for relaxation and stress relief. It would be good if we are given a choice to select the female massagure, however all of them looks professionals.

So Relaxing!!. We went to Mythic Day Spa as part of a package with Faim d'Epices Cooking School (highly recommended - see separate review). We loved our time at the day spa and the package represented great value for money. I was so relaxed after the massage that I didn't want to leave :)
Wonderful Hammam. Wonderful staff, beautiful surroundings and excellent service

Very relaxing. This is a lovely spa, very relaxing and the treatments are great. We had the couples twilight package and like others, managed to spend 5 hours here. There was waiting and some noise but it didn't spoil what was a lovely relaxing treat. The massage was fantastic and the smells tickled the senses.

Fantastic. As everyone else has said, this place is great. But I'd like to direct my review to all those men who are either too macho to go to a spa, or they don't understand the process and are hesitant to find out. Now if you're in the group that doesn't like the idea of having beautiful, young Morrocan girls rubbing oil on your body, you can quit reading now. Otherwise, listen up.I did the visit with my wife as part of the package deal with Faim d'Epices. We were greeted at the door by the hostess, who is absolutely perfect for the job. She speaks excellent English and makes you feel special from the start.Step one is the locker room. You are issued a bathrobe and disposable underwear. Since the staff is all female, and they aren't really interested in seeing more of you than necessary, the men's underwear is about like boxer shorts and a dark color. The women's version is about like a thong (no top) and is white, so it becomes transparent when it gets wet. I'm not sure why they even bother with it.Then you go to the Queen's Boudoir. Here you choose between three flavors of oil that they will use for the massage. I'm not really up on the various scents and couldn't much tell one from the other, but my wife liked having a choice. Next up is the foot washing and massage. You put each foot up in a young lady's lap and she washes it and gives it a massage. My feet are normally very ticklish, but they know what they're doing and it didn't tickle a bit.Next you're led to the hammam. This is like a small steam room, but not as hot as a typical steam room. Here a lady takes a bucket of water and washes you down with what they call black soap. I don't know where it got this name, as it wasn't black. I think it had olive oil in it. Anyway, she gives you a good washing and rinsing and you're ready for the next step.This is the exfoliation step. What this means is that you lie on a table and a lady puts on a mitten that must by covered with tacks and rubs you all over with it. When she finishes with you, you shouldn't need to scratch for a month. There were little bits of loose skin all over me. Then it's back to the hammam where you wash off again to get rid of all that skin that used to be attached to your body. Then you rest there a while and work up a bit of a sweat. Next you're led to a small room where you're given a towel to dry off and a dry set of underwear before it's off to the massage room. There I believe you're given a cup of tea before they start the massage.The massage therapists really know what they're doing. I don't know how it turns out that the most beautiful ladies in Morocco turn out to be employees at the same place. And how do they just happen to be massage therapists? But it's obvious that they aren't just here for their looks. They are professionals and I felt great during and after the massage. The final step is the tea room, where you relax and have another cup of tea. We weren't sure whether we were supposed to stay until they came back for us or just come out when we were ready. So we stayed a pretty long time, and even though we were the last customers of the evening, they never rushed us and we came out when we decided they weren't coming for us.After that it's back to the locker room to get dressed and try to figure out why they don't have one of these at home. So quit worrying about this being something that real men don't do. Make your wife promise not to tell the guys, so they won't give you the business when you get home. Or better yet, tell them to get to Marrakech and try it for themselves.
Lovely. Great way to spend an afternoon with the girls, the staff are lovely. Although feel free to contact them directly if you get lost rather than asking a local.

Moroccan Angels!. We picked this spa to visit from the reviews here on tripadvisor, and were definitely not disappointed.On our first day in Marrakech, we ventured into the city to book appointments in the spa's we had pre-chosen which was quite hard work, as the taxi driver did not know how to get us to the spa we had chosen even though we had the name, address and had it marked on our map! He passed us on to a street cleaner who showed us round to the spa door, who we paid for the privilege.
