Apparently it was not enough to just pay the one guy, he wanted us to pay all his friends as well and it all got a little scary until the lovely receptionist from the Mythical Spa came out and saved us!We were taken into the lovely inside courtyard and offered a drink (well needed and they refused payment for it), while we looked at the brochure and chose our treatments. We booked in for the 'Mythic Spa Ritual' a 3hour experience for 1350dh for on our last day of our break. They did not want a deposit leaving but did say they it was cash only as they do not yet have a credit card machine.On the last day of our break, we packed, left the hotel, got in a taxi and went through the same ritual of the taxi driver not knowing where this address is and driving a really long way round (after the first day's taxi we found it much easier just to walk everywhere with our map, but we had luggage...). The taxi had to ask directions from someone on the street, let us out, then directed us into the souks and charged us the equivalent of fifteen quid for it! We knew it wasn't in the souks so headed in the other direction, couldn't work out where we were on the map and..........the next thing the lovely receptionist comes flying by on a scooter! Recognising us she escorted us to the spa door, (see, Moroccan angels!)The spa itself was amazing, so relaxing. We were the only two people there, and had a therapist each. We had a quick foot massage followed by a hamman. Me and my friend were together in the hamman, then into separate treatment rooms for our scrub, then back to the hamman, then into our separate rooms for our wrap. After being washed off (and cooling down!) we were upstairs into a candlelit treatment room for a full face massage and a full body massage, bliss!We then had mint tea while having a hand massage and manicure. My nails are in pretty rubbish condition and my therapist was a real perfectionist with them, they've been in much better condition since I came home!We found that the therapists struck the right balance between friendly, chatty and interactive while having treatments like the manicure but didn't hear a peep from them while doing the massage. Perfect!There is a clean shower, changing area and toilet and also secure lockers.The lovely receptionist then ordered us a private taxi (posh minibus) to the airport with price agreed (less than a tenner!). Perfect way to round off the holiday.Definitely take the time to find this place, it's well worth it. I know it's first on my list of things to do when I go back!

Extraordinary Experience!. From beginning to end the entire experience was one of being pampered to death by an extraordinary doting and caring staff. My wife and I had the complete treatment of bath, scrub and massage together in a quiet, serene and beautiful surrounding. So happy we came here instead of Les Bains De Marrakech. This was a non-rushed relaxing experience where we were allowed to relax and linger with mint tea and Moroccan pastries after our treatments. They intentionally schedule treatments so you have the facility to yourself, for a singular experience that is uninterrupted by the arrival or departure of other clientel. We can't recommend this Hamman highly enough!

Great spa, very relaxed. We went to this spa after seeing how popular it has become on this site. We were very lucky to be staying in a wonderful Riad (not listed on this site to review but called Riad Les Trois Mages), which turned out by chance to be less than a 2 minute walk from the Spa. The ladies in the spa were so welcoming, friendly and accommodating. We asked for the evening spa package for couples which is meant to last 2.5hrs but we were there for almost 3.5! Which was wonderful but ran a little into dinner plans! It worked out to be the equivalent of approximately £60 each but for what you get it was well worth it. The only criticism is that there was a lot of waiting around, which, if you are tired and stressed out from shopping all day would be nothing to find fault with. You really will be treated like royalty and it is certainly a wonderful experience especially if you don't have long in Marrakech and want to experience a great hamman without shopping around.

A decadent ritual to relaxation. My review is long overdue since I visited this Spa in mid-March after several days traveling thru the Atlas Mountains, obscure villages, and the desert. It was a much needed 'cleansing, relaxation' ritual that I longed for after arriving in Marrakech. The atmosphere of this spa is so exotic and sensual compared to the spas I've been to in resorts/hotels in N. America. The ladies who took turns with the baths, exfoliations, massages - were all professionals and very attentive to my personal preferences, including choosing the oils and music accompanying my massage. I was never rushed thru the rituals - I could have stayed longer than the 2 hours I was there and felt that they would not have minded. It was a wonderful, decadent and even indulgent experience - I came out of that beautiful place feeling light, relaxed, and ready to take on the rest of Morocco. I highly recommend this place for its great atmosphere and service - and yes, it may be hard to locate but some places are worth getting lost for...

The Oasis of Marrakech! That good!. There's a reason why Trip Advisor listed this as one of the top activities for a 3 day Marrakech trip – they are absolutely AMAZING.I went with my girlfriend and it was great to get away from the chaotic Marrkech streets – really hating the street hustlers.The pictures on their website and across the internet are bang on. Staff are incredibly friendly and courteous. I wasn't thinking that it would be professional but it really felt like an all star treatment straight from the movies.We had the Grand Couple treatment that was supposed to be 2.5 hours but somehow we spent 4 hours!!! Yes, 4 hours of treatment and it never felt that the staff was rushing the treatments or pushing us out of the spa.I can't think of any negatives besides it was difficult to find but that was the same for ever other place in Marrakech. Prices are reasonable given how much we pay in the UK and US. Definitely recommend and if I ever go back to Marrakech I would for sure go back.If you do go, leave a fat tip because they really do deserve it.

fabulous staff. I booked for the couple ritual spa and my husband was taken poorly half way through the 3 hour booking. The staff were incredibly kind and concerned and i would have no hesitation in recommending the spa to anyone. The treatments that we had were wonderful.
BEST spa i've experienced!. Stunning spa, great service. Wish i could go back every month!

Where Marrakech ends and Paradise begins.... Mythic Oriental Spa is an unforgettable experience in the city of all senses Marrakech.My partner and I had the Grand evening ritual for couples which was like a long journey through the heavens.Everything from the professional treatments and massages to the beautiful surroundings and riad to the finest mint tea and biscuits is first class. Exotic scents, subtle lighting of candles and lanterns and pleasant music add more drama and enchantment.The director of this parad(is)e is a young and lovely lady: Rihab. She is very accurate and speaks French and English, but most important - she is always smiling and thus predisposes her guests/customers to relax.Highly recommended.

Heaven..... This spa was amazing, we booked the grand evening ritual for couples which was unreal. From the minute we stepped through the door we were treated like royalty. Everything think was perfect and came out relaxed and fresh. Rihab the girl who looked after us was the perfect host and managed the spa great. The girls who done the treatments and massage were also good. Would highly recommend it.

...a moment away from the rush of the Medina. You might, at one point, want to escape from the impressions/noises/millions of peoples of the Medina and then looking for a place to relax, a simple moment of privacy. We went there for my birthday - for a special treat. We had booked a 2.5h treatment with private Hamman, bath, massage. I believe we ended up spending 5h there and not regretting a single moment. The moment we entered, we were received from the 6 cheerful girls working there and treated like kings. We felt never rushed and sometimes wondered, if we were now left for 20min or 40min chilling in the bath...at the end, we were brougth to the Terrasse upstairs, chilling in the April Sun...when suddenly all the girls came upstairs to sing a "happy birthday" song for me and bringing a delicious cake. We were told that we should feel like home and that we can stay as long as we want...The Treatments were hihgly professional, the massage was superbe, the place wonderfully decorated and very clean. Clearly, it is not a bargain and you might find similiar things for less money - but hey, we believe it was 100% worth the spend! Going there, you know what you will get. And yes, we went also to a public Hamman [men & women separated] for 5-20D - but frankly, you cannot compare the two experiences...Tip: I dont know why, but Google Maps on my Iphone always directed me to a wrong place in the Medina when i typed in the exact address. Suggest you type in "Rue el Gza" or just go to the "College Mohamed V" and get picked up there.

The perfect way to relax in Marrakech. I read the reviews on trip advisor and was not disappointed. From the moment we entered the lovely facility until we were gently guided out the door, the experience was perfect. The hammam was wonderful, the gommage envigorating, and the massage very good. The relaxation afterwards was superb. We never felt rushed at all. We spent 2 1/2 hours at the spa. We'd highly recommend it.

Good but not the best in Marrakesh. We had a good hammam treatment and massage at Mythic Oriental spa. The decoration is nice and modern and the service very good. However, if you take the price into account, we paid 1500 Dhiram for the two of us, we had a session at another spa that was just as good, but cheaper (Le Bain Bleu, which is also in the old part of town).
Very relaxing. We did this combined with the cookery school at Faim d'Epices and it was a lovely relaxing way to finish the day. Having never had a hamman before this was quite an experience!

Very good - one minor niggle. My partner and I booked this as part of the L'atelier Faim d'Epices package. We both had a very enjoyable experience and the service was first rate. Our package included the steam bath, wash with Moroccan brown soap, and a massage; all excellent.The one niggle - and not not enough to reduce the star rating - was the disposable paper underwear provided. Us blokes get a pair of shorts, which were fine, but women get a kind of thong, basically a g-cloth (no pun intended) with string attached. My partner found this uncomfortable and a tad embarrasing, particularly when the first pair broke and had to be knotted by me! You might consider taking your own underwear or bikini bottom.Nevertheless, this was avery good experience with an excellent massage!

Marrakech Hen Do. Wonderful and authentic experience at the Mythic Oriental Spa - we all went for the hammam an massage, which was lovely. Service was excellent, and the spa itself is very serene. Overall very good value as well. Only downside is that it is pretty difficult to find, so would make sure you get good directions from the spa first. The manager was so helpful to us when we called to say we were lost, and sent a member of the spa to find us! And also arranged a return taxi for us back to our riad. Highly recommended.

Excellent hammam experience for couples/friends. Me and my partner went to the Mythic Oriental Spa as part of the deal they offer with the cooking class of L'atelier Faim d'Epices. We found it to be a good and enjoyable deal. We weren't able to do both activities on the same day as the cooking class was already booked of our preferred date but were nevertheless still able to use the deal and do the two activities on two separate days. Nice customer service there!The spa is great, we had a friendly welcome. There are lockers for your clothing and bags, and flip flops, a bathing gown, as well as disposable underwear are provided. This was our first time to any kind of spa so we had our swim wear with us as we didn't know what to expect. We preferred using our swim wear as the disposable underwear didn't fit that well (it was way too big for me - we had a laugh in the dressing rooms), but after the cleaning part you will have to take off your wet bikini bottom (or disposable underwear) anyway and you will be asked to put on a new dry disposable one before going to the massage room. So much for our preference for our own swimwear and we thus got over the fact that the disposable underwear wasn't exactly our size and continued the treatment with our new pair of 'hot knickers' - all part of the experience, er!? ;)The washing and scrubbing was nice and relaxing. I never went to a hammam before and the washing room wasn't super steamy (not sure if it is supposed to be?) but I thought it was fine (it was warm and pleasant enough).I was relieved to find out that it was just going to be me and my partner as I was afraid we would be separated at first, so I was happy that we could go through the treatment together. Just the scrubbing part was separate but that doesn't take too long anyway. The massage was the highlight for us both I think, very relaxing and calming. We got a mint tea afterwards, and we were told that we could relax a bit more on the roof terrace without a time limit. This I particularly liked about the place; we didn't feel rushed through the treatment at all. In fact, we were expecting to be in there for 1,5 hours, but in the end we were there for over an hour longer that that (including the shower and dressing time after the treatment). I read in other reviews that some people got a bit bothered by the chatting noises of their staff, so I paid extra attention to this during our time there, but thankfully I didn't hear much (if any noises) at all. + Beautiful hammam+ The private hammam deal is great for couples/friends+ Very friendly service: good welcome and we weren't rushed through the treatments+ Good scrub and very relaxing massage+ Get ready for sexy disposable knickers! ;)- Tricky to find; make sure you print the map of their website. We went there by cab but the cab can't drop you off in front of the place since it's in an alley so a map is useful.

One word! AMAZING!. I went to Marrakech for 3 nights with my partner for her birthday. I took her to the Mythic Oriental Spa where we had the Grand Evening Couples Ritual. It was simply amazing. I recieved so much information through the lovely lady who was in charge called Rihab through regular emails. She and her staff literally treat you like royalty. It all started off by walking in the middle of a wonderful traditional riad. We were served mint tea and pastries and taken to a room to change. My partner and I were taken to a room which chairs that looked like thrones. We were given hot water with lemon in it and were told to pick 2 products, 1 for the hammam and 1 for the bath. After that we were taken in a room and given a foot treatment which was great. We were then taken to the hammam where the 1st product was applied and then washed off in the traditional fashion many times. We were then taken to get a hot clay wrap which was different and had to lay there and relax for 20 minutes with relaxing lighting and music to sooth us. We were then taken back to the hammam to wash it off. After that we were taken to a room with 2 baths with our chosen product in it, candles, roses and romantic relaxing music playing. We lay there for 20 minutes sipping local fresh orange juice which was superb. After that we dried off and were taken upstairs where we had a 40 minutes massage. The girls do an amazing job from head to toe leaving you feeling like a new person. After that we were taken to a private room where we were served mint tea and pastries for a 2nd time. We were then taken to the rooftop, where we sat under a canope with a great view. The staff then came out, with a local lady and they all started singing happy birthday to my partner. They presented her with an amzing cake at no additional charge which made the day perfect. The whole experience was worth it at £70 per person and me and my partner will one day return to this wonderful little gem among the hustle and bustle of marrakech.

Superb!. Everything is implemented to awaken your senses in a space where the master word is refinement.If Marrakesh has great charm, to offer an enchanting holiday this spa will remain the best way to find the promises and the many temptations that emanate from the Eastern spirit of this part of the world

Pure heaven - a wonderful treat for mother' day!!!. Nine of us visited the spa on mothers day and not one of us could fault the place.......from the moment we entered to the moment we left!!!!............Rihab and her staff were wonderful really made us comfortable....................The whole experience was to die for.................we had the hamman, scrub and hour and half massage and topped off with pure relaxation on the terrace with tea and pastries....................Would def be visiting Mythic Oriental on our next visit - its like a different world!!!!

Great experience, not quite perfect. The building, decor etc is stunning here, really set the mood for our early evening hamaam after our day of cooking and eating with Faim d'Epices. Michel brought us right into the spa so we had no problems finding it and when we were leaving after the staff did theire best to direct us back to somewhere from where we could find our way home.We were probably a bit naive and under-prepared for this, not knowing that we couldn't wear our bikinis like we had done for a similar activity in Granada, Spain, but thankfully we're good friends so we got past any awkwardness from the near-nakedness. However, as pointed out by another reviewer, the staff were young girls and were VERY giggly. Which I'm sure had nothing to do with us but nonetheless didn't help create a relaxing atmosphere. Again as pointed out by another reviewer, my friends exfoliating scrub was great, mine not so much. But by the time I got upstaits for the massage I didn't care cause it was wonderful and after almost falling asleep, we were taken for some mint tea and it was made clear to us that they were in no rush for us to leave.All in all a good evening well spent, just maybe a little more professionalism would have made us feel more comfortable and relaxed.

It was a poor massage! far too short. The place is nice, clean and relaxing. The body scrub was good by someone who put some effort in. However, the massage was disappointing and the masseuse looked good but her massage techniques were poor. It also only lasted 15 to 20 minutes of a one and half hour package. Most of the time was spent waiting around and given tea! nice experience but not what i paid for. I think there are better places.

Beautful hidden paradise. What an amazing spa this is! My partner is an exprerienced beauty therapist and was amazed and delighted with the service and experience of this amazing place. You actually can't believe this place from where the entrance is. Down a couple of narrow dingy alleways there's a pretty small door and in you step to the most incredible setting. Newly built by a young couple everything is spotlessly clean and beautiful. We arrived at the spa without a reservation as we went when browsing spa's on our mobiles while having lunch. Luckily this didn't matter as they slotted us in. We had the couples treatment which if your going with a partner is a 100% must. You change into robes and slippers and they also supply underwear for men and women. We got one of there best packages and spent the next 4 and a half hours in total ectasy. The Hammam experience was incredible and the girls that work there take such good care and attention to you. We had the full body and facial massage which was so good I fell asleep and woke up feeling amazing. My partner came out wishing she could have the experience every day as did I. Even though they over ran the treatment we had they in no way rushed or made any effort to change the experince. Just be sure to take cash as they didn't have a card machine. A truly wonderful spa ran by the kindest and lovely people. A real treat in marrakech!
An excellent and relaxing experience!. We had a body scrub, hammam and massage and thoroughly enjoyed our trip here. It was worth every penny!

A taste of heaven. From the moment we stepped in through the magical door every moment was an epitomy of relaxation!Beautifully decorated riad with perfect attention to detail made for the most amazing spa afternoon we had ever experienced. Rihab, the lovely owner of the spa ensured absolute privacy for us 5 girls, we each had the hammam and massage package which was simply amazing from start to finish and then served wonderful moroccan tea and biscuits on the roof terrace while you soak up some sun.A must visit in Marrakech and well worth the search through the windy roads of the medina!Highly reccomend!

A Drop Of Heaven. This was a special birthday trip and the visit to Mythic Oriental Spa was a gorgeous afternoon! It was an interesting and relaxing experience with lots of laughter from us along the way too! We arrived a little early so sat on the roof terrace enjoying mint tea in the sunshine. We had booked the Grand Evening Couples Ritual which included soaping and steaming, exfoliation, a wrap, steam and shower, gorgeous side by side baths with orange juice to drink, with the lights turned down and serene music playing - it was heaven... then we had a massage which was a little firmer than I'd have liked, but still very relaxing. Pastries and mint tea were served afterwards... heaven.... Definitely go here if you're thinking of having a luxury hammam!

A private oasis of calm and tranquility. Hidden away from the hustle and bustle outside, a wonderful experience shared as a couple away from everyone else. Highly recommend the combined offer with Faim D'Epices for a wonderful day in Marrakech.

Excellent. We loved our time at the Spa. Rihab was very gracious and we were treated like royalty. The treatments made our skin incredibly soft afterwards. It was a real treat and one of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech. The place isn't difficult to find if you remember it is first left after Ryad Larousse and around the corner at no. 7 (there's a sign on the door).

The most amazing spa. We booked for the 4.5 hour couples package and ended up staying over 6 hours. The treatments from start to finish were amazing and we were treated like royalty. The price is really good for what you get and I would recommend this lovely haven to everyone.

Beautiful Spa but could be improved. My boyfriend and I did a couples evening ritual (in the afternoon), and we were at the spa for almost 4 hours.  The Good: The spa was beautiful. Rooms were very nicely decorated, music was good, place was very clean. The massage was excellent, although I felt that it was a bit short. The oils smell great, and not too much oil was used on the body. The staff were very friendly too. The not so good: I felt the foot massage at the beginning was a bit too gentle (could be a personal preference). Throughout the hammam, the bath, the foot massage, we could also hear the staff chatting and laughing away, walking in and out of the rooms, closing doors; it really killed the whole relaxing experience for me.My scrub was also a let down, although my boyfriend got a very good scrub. For some strange reason his scrub took twice as long as mine. He probably got a better person to do his scrub than I did. =(

Perfect ending of the day!. Wonderful environment with charming and extremely professional staff. My wife and I combined this visit together with our cookery class at Faim D'Epices. What a great combination - do it!

One of the highlights of Marrakech. We went to the spa as part of the package with Le faim d'epices.The whole experience of the hammam and massage was very good and relaxing. The staff were helpful, explaining the whole process, and also accommodating as one member of our group wanted to do the hammam on her own.My only criticism was that whilst waiting in the steam room you can overhear the staff chatting, laughing and talking on the phone. The walls weren't soundproof. This is a minor criticism but it would have been more relaxing if they kept their voices down. However apart from that they were very professional.I thoroughly recommend the cookery class and hammam package as it was a very reasonable package.

Lovely interior, pleasant therapists, very relaxing. They had made a slight [--] up with our booking ( we went as part of the package with the Cookery Course at www.faimdepices.com)- but it was sorted out for us.There is a definite 'Wow' factor when you walk through the big black door off a quiet street, through a velvet curtain into the main riad. The interior was beautiful - and the rooms that the Hamman and Massage were done in were to a very high standard.There are so many people offering Hamman and Massage - but I am definitely glad we chose this one.I have no shame - so had my treatments in the paper thongs they give you ( they also give you lovely clean white robes to wear whilst walking from one place to the other) but if you are more reserved, you may want to take bikini bottoms and 2 spare pair of pants.Lovely time was had!
Beautiful. Beautiful spa and surroundings. Great massage, but partner did not enjoy hamman particularly. I have a few previously and this is the best yet!

Awesome spa. Went here with my wife, and I'm not really into the whole massage spa idea, but it was wonderfully relaxing. Had a really nice couples massage which lasted about 2.5 hours followed by mint tea and pastries which were also very nice. The cost was extremely low, and the staff did a great job.

Best spa experience i've ever had. I took my mum to Marrakech for a few days and she had seen the Mythic spa on Trip Advisor and was determined to find it ... after 2 days of looking and asking ... no luck, so i emailed them. Rhiab got back to me straight away and booked us in for the next day and gave us excellent directions (it is sooo very difficult to find) When we arrived we were pampered to within an inch of our lives, 3 hours worth of treatments (Couples experience) which, as a spa junkie i can confirm was close to the best 3 hours of my life. The massage was especially fantastic. The staff were lovely, attentive but allowed you to relax. We spent the next few hours in the sun on the roof terrace with peppermint tea which just topped off the day. We were well looked after and if i could do it once a week ... i would. Ladies especially, i highly recommend you visit this spa, it will make your trip and send you home with a smile and your shoulders will be about 3 inches lower! Thank you ladies for providing us with an truly unforgettable experience!

Be Pampered and Treated like Royalty in Marrakech. The Mythic Oriental Spa is a beautiful spa with traditional Moroccan décor combined with first class western-style service. This is not a traditional Hamman with impersonal service; it is a very high quality spa with international style service.We had a special Grand Couples Ritual that lasted over 3 hours and cost 900 Diram (£70) each. This included and quick foot massage, Hamman, exfoliation, hot clay wrap and the massage to finish it off. To start you are taken to a nice and cosy seating area while they prepare your treatments. Here you can look at the treatments menu and decide what you want. Then you go into the private changing area which includes toilet, shower, lockers, hair dryer, sink with mirrors and individual changing cubicles. In my locker were disposable boxers, a nice robe and slippers. Everything was very private and very clean. Once changed, we were then escorted to an even nicer seating area and served water with orange. Here we were given the choice of oils to use for our various treatments.The treatments themselves are very nice and the treatment rooms even nicer. I was scrubbed, rubbed, soaked, rinsed, steamed, bathed in various kinds of ways before my relaxing massage.The final massage was in a beautifully decorated couples room with 2 massage tables and lovely his and hers thrones to sit on afterwards.After drinking our mint tea and eating our little pastries we were allowed to relax before getting changed.I would definitely recommend the Mythic Oriental Spa above the more traditional Hammans – you will be pampered and treated like royalty in beautiful surroundings.

A wonderfully refreshing experience!. Having read good reviews of this spa on Trip Advisor we were very much looking forward to a few hours of pampering whilst in Marrakech. We had some trouble locating the Spa but a quick e mail to the lovely Rihab (the Manager?) resulted in more precise directions. She even offered to come up to the main street (Riad Larousse) to find us! Quick tip .. on the Riad Larousse (the road) there is a Riad Larousse (a Riad) opposite the Riad there is a sign on the wall directing you to the Mythic Oriental Spa. Follow the alleyway for a few minutes and you will reach a large wooden door on the right. Anyway, the spa was everything we had hoped for. The building has been beautifully refurbished and is truly luxurious. The staff were very friendly and professional and the treatment (we had the 'Grand Evening Ritual' at midday) was sublime. The prices, although not cheap, are reasonable for the experience. Many thanks also to Rihab (the manager?) for rushing to the spa early the next morning to allow us to collect a bag we had left behind! Great experience - do go!
Loved it. Must go and you feel like royal pampered from head to toe.
wonderfull experience. The silence, the smell of jasmine in the spa makes you feel relaxed.

Lovely spa. We chose this spa because I preferred the treatments and liked the look of the place, as well as being able to book the 'Grand evening rituals' for couples. the booking process was through email, so simple and no deposit required.It's quite hard to find, but once you step into the Spa, its a lovely building, and the rooms are very nicely decorated. The owner of the spa was friendly and showed us where to get changed etc. The ladies who would be looking after us during the treatments were a bit giggly whilst showing us the oils that we could choose, but we put it down to them just being friendly! First we were taken into a room to have black soap put all over us, then its washed off, then we had the exfoliating scrub with a glove, which makes your skin lovely and smooth, then off to have a skin mask with morrocan mud, then thats washed off and you have a bath with whatever bath product you choose. The room has two baths so you get one each which was good. Lastly we had a massage, and after that mint tea with morrocan pastries. This spa is a bit more pricey that some others I looked at, but if you want to feel pampered and if you're a couple who wish to be together during the treatments, this is the one to go for. Just as a mention, I emailed the manager after the appointment as I think the mud wasn't suited to my skin and my husband's massage wasnt as relaxing as he hoped, and she did get back to me.

Very nice but it could be better. I booked this spa as a combo offer with a Moroccan cooking class (which was excellent) and we were dropped here for our Spa and Message. Pros:Without a doubt an excellent messageGood value if you get a combo deal with cooking class (DH 750 normal, DH 540 in combination with cooking class - total cost of class and spa combo DH 1080) Don't bring anything. Everything, including disposable shorts are included.The aromatic massage oils were really nice and my skin smelled and felt really good for at least 2 days.Cons:The place looked great, but I didn't like some fake electric candles. The checking in time took very longI had to put the black soap and steam in one room, then I had to change to another room for the scrub, then I had to be back to the same room for rinse and wash. I think the whole thing had be done in the same place.
Superb Hideaway. Pretty much my perfect idea of pampering - it may be hidden down a Moroccan back alley, but the staff, treatments and interior are superb.

Professional brilliant. Althought not easy to find - I booked this for my wifes birthday. A beautiful place with great ambiance. Staff were friendly and professional. We left feeling relaxed and chilled out.
Expensive but worth the cost.

Beautiful spa with lots of potential.. Gorgeous space - visually pleasing and extremely nice staff. This being a new spa I believe they have yet to reach their full potential... the staff was gaining their stride. I believe within the year this will be an extremely popular spa in the old city.

The ultimate relaxation. My boyfriend and I visited the spa on his birthday as a special treat.We opted for the 1hour 30 mins traditional massage - and it was the highlight of the holiday.Treated to a warm foot massage, steam room, drenched with warm water, scrubbed down in individual rooms, back to the steam room before heading upstairs to a tranquil and beautifully decorated room for a 45 minute massage. The day ended with mint tea on the terrace.The staff went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and enjoying our day. Highly recommended (if you can find it tucked away down the little streets that is...)

From A Spa Junkie - Definitely Go. As the title indicates, I am a bit of a self-proclaimed spa junkie. First, I'd like to say that I have visited spas of all shapes, sizes and swankiness and this experience was up there with the best of them. I scheduled 1 hour massages for a group of colleagues after being worked to death at a conference. They were able to accommodate all nine of us with less than 24 hours notice. The facility is classic Moroccan, tucked incognito into a corner of the Medina in Marrakech. Very clean, cozy, and comfortable, I could have moved right in. There are also plenty of places to sit and sip orange water or sweet tea. The staff was amazingly welcoming and the treatments got two thumbs up from everyone in my group. One note of warning, if you are modest or body shy, let them know.

Couples Spa. As soon as we arrived at the Spa we were met with a warm welcome and the atmosphere was calm and tranquil. We were given a locker so we could change and store our belongings and then sat down in a quiet area with a glass of water and were surrounded by samples of the oils and creams. We then chose which oils we wanted in our bath and for the massage. We were thoroughly pampered with a foot massage, hamman, wrap, bath and full body massage. The treatments were carried out very professionally and we were in a private area for each of the treatments. All areas were immaculate and clean. Afterwards we had some mint tea and relaxed. There was no pressure in how long we stayed there - a truly wonderful experience.

Best spa experience. The spa itself is in a 'riad' style building but has been immaculately designed in a modern moroccan style with every attention to detail. The treatments were as good as any I have had anywhere in the world and the whole afternoon was magical. My husband and I left in a totally different headspace.

Relaxing experience with friendly and welcoming service. The Mythic Oriental Spa welcomed us on our first morning in Marrakesh after a long morning of travel and a very early start. It was a pleasure from start to finish - the staff made us feel welcome and comfortable, explaining exactly what needed to be done for each part of our hammam-massage dual treatment. While the receptionist had mistakenly forgotten to reserve our hammam, she quickly remedied this while we enjoyed some mineral water and tea. The hammam was a great experience, and the massage was extremely relaxing. We had another massage at Les Bains de Marrakesh, and the one at Mythic Oriental Spa was much much better - they used scented oils (and not too much oil), and the masseurs were very attentive and worked hard. The setting is lovely, and sitting on the sun on the rooftop terrace afterwards, feeling sleepy and relaxed, was the perfect way to top off an enjoyable morning. I would definitely recommend Mythic Oriental to all visitors of Marrakesh!

Dont miss this it is a must.. We did this spa in conjunction with the Faim d Epices and had a great day. The staff is very professional, decoration of the spa is fabulous, Immaculate surroundings and opulent. The hammam and massage treatments were fantastic. We ended up going back 3 times over our week in Marrakech it was so wonderful. Highly recommended

pure relax. We arrive at Mythic Oriental Spa after the cooking classes and it was a great idea!Fantastic place, very well renovated. The owner came after the treatment to be sure that we were OK and she helped us with booking the train trip for the next day.

Overindulgence - best spa experience, hands down!. From the initial email query to service charge, Rihab was very polite and professional. Always eager to please and exceptionally accommodating, this was a sign of the experience to come.Once we found the spa, Rihab and her team made us feel exceptionally welcome and offered a package which provided better value for money. We opted for the Marrakech Oriental Experience, which went for 6 hours.All services exceeded expectations and were performed very thoroughly. We left the spa feeling exceptionally relaxed and satisfied.As we were keen to leave the spa in search of dinner, Rihab offered for us to return the following day to enjoy use of their jacuzzi, which comes as part of the service.If there is one thing you do while in Maraakech, ensure you make time for this gem. Jus be sure to have Rihad explain the location to your taxi driver!We'll definitely be back on our next trip to Marrakech.

beautiful place. i was surprise when i saw the spa inside with a wonderful decoration and the Cleanliness. The service was exellent even the treatment was well done, with the 2 girls don't miss anything out .''Rihab '' the owner was coming when we finish our treatment to be sure if everything was good. She was so nice with us ,thank you girls for the wonderful moment . not to be missed if you visit marrakech

Clean spa with excellent staff in a beautiful riad. Once we found our way through the confusing streets in the area (watch out for "guides" who will try to get money out of you - figure out exactly where you're going in advance), we were amazed to enter this beautiful riad, which we found out had recently gone through a lengthy - and worthwhile - remodel. The space was calming, with lots of light, pretty Moroccan furnishings and clean massage/hammam areas. The staff was great as well and made sure to coordinate the treatments of my two friends and I so we could enjoy the day together. We were there for 5 (!) hours and got the "couples package" (think we paid 600 dirhams each), which included a quick foot massage to start, then hammam (black soap rinse, exfoliation, mud mask, etc), a bath and a full-body massage. Afterward, they served us tea and Moroccan cookies on the rooftop terrace, and we didn't feel pushed to leave so we hung out for a good while. All in all: A much-recommended experience and a lovely way to get away from the shopping and busy streets!

paradise in the midst of chaos. After a day cooking, this was the perfect way to unwind and relax. As we had to wait for our treatment, we had a relaxing jacuzzi on the roof top terrace. Then we were washed, rinsed, scrubbed, rinsed and had a soothing oil massage. Afterwards we were given tea and cakes and told we could stay and relax for as long as we wanted. The staff were all lovely and made us feel very welcome and our whole visit was very unhurried. Great value in conjunction with cooking at faim des espices.

Very relaxing. Absolutely loved the treats and tea on the top of the building looking over Marrakesh at sunset and listening to the call to prayer! Felt like we were in a scene from a movie. The staff were great, very friendly. I thought it had a hugely relaxing atmosphere and felt very at ease there. Loved the Decor too! We did the deal with the cookery class, it was our favourite day of the trip!

Beautiful spa, perfect pampering for couples. We had the most wonderful day here during our honeymoon. We booked the 4.5 hour package as honeymoon treat and ended up spending 6 amazing hours there being completely pampered and with every bit of us scrubbed & massaged. It is a perfect place for couple as we had the place to ourselves and had all of our treatments in a double suite. We were looked after beautifully. Highly recommended!
Very Relaxing. This is the perfect retreat after a hectic day in the Medina - the staff are lovely and the massage was heavenly.
First class customer service. What an outstanding customer service, no wonder the place is fully booked up for days.

Great spa!. This spa opened 5 months ago so everything is fresh and new. We decided to go to this spa after reading reviews on tripadvisor and chose it over Les bains which had been recommended to me. So glad we went with this especially as the reviews were so much better!The treatment we chose was the couples evening ritual (which we did in the day). This consisted of a hammam, exfoliating, a wrap, oriental bath and a massage. This package was amazing, felt like a million dollars afterwards. The staff were lovely and we were looked after throughout. If you go to Marrakech and want to escape the hustle and bustle than this is the place to go... a true gem! You won't be disappointed.

Very relaxing start to our trip. The facility is clean and very cool decor/layout once you get inside. My husband and I had the Grand evening ritual for couples. My only two complaints are:-the "oriental bath" portion of the ritual was too long and the bath water was barely luke warm. -the spa itself is very tricky to findEverything else was wonderful.

Great atmosphere, overall good experience. The treatment we had was great and very relaxing. Rihad and her husband are extremely nice and attentive. The only negative is that the first appointment for them in the day was late and thus it shifted everything forward. This resulted in our appointment running 45 minutes later (we had to wait this time in the beginning). It would have been nice to have been better informed about this when we checked in so that we were not waiting in our robes for a long time. We would have been happy to come back at a later time. The spa needs to find a better way to deal with late customers without interfering with other customers schedule.

The best experience ever. Rihab and her team make you feel so welcome and like royalty treating you as if you are their only client.My husband and I have never experienced anything like this ever.Her team are amazing too .The whole atmosphere starts as you enter the spa through the little wooden door to the most amazing beautiful decor and furnishings.This is a must if you visit Marrekesh

So good we went back the next day!. We went to mythic oriental as part of a package with the cooking class and it was lovely. Beautiful place and very relaxing atmosphere. We enjoyed it so much we promptly arranged to go back and try something different the next day, which was equally fabulous. Staff all polite and friendly, especially Rihab. Many thanks!
relaxing and refreshing. An oasis in a dusty city. we booked a package together with L'atelier Faim d'Epices and it was good value.

a magical place behind narnias door...not to be missed. I visited as a combined day with Faime d,epices cookery school.We were led round little narrow streets and ended up at a discreet wooden door with smallest of signs, when the door opened it was like stepping inside narnia..such thought and beauty has gone into this spa making it magical for visitors..it is a feast for the eyes,beautiful seating areas,luxury fabrics,just total opulence in every room.I was nervous as had visions of being pulled around,limbs cracked etc but afte speaking to the lovely owner and explaining my skin bruises easily she made sure staff were aware and only used gentle pressure.The staff are very professional and very respectful,after changing into robe was led to a private sumptuous room and brought orange water to drink,then it was off to be washed with the black soap and a steam for five minutes followed by rinsing then scrubbed all over before going back to steam room to wash again.Then it was into the dimly lit massage room with soft oriental music playing to be massaged all over with my chosen oil -patchoulyBy the time i was done my skin was so soft and i smelt wonderful. I waw the last guest there but still they brought me mint tea and pastries and said relax as long as.After 4 hrs at the spa and being there alone i wasn,t looking forward to finding my way to hotel in dark but the owner and staff were great,the girls were going my way so asked if i,d like to use their cab with them,they even paid refusing my offer.The experience and smells in the spa were amazing,i can,t recommend this place highly enough . I can,t wait to use the patchouly body cream in its luxury pot when i get home,the smell will be a lovely reminder of the beautiful spa and it was a perfect treat after the cooking which is also a "must do".The owners and staff at both places were delightul and fun with very warm welcomes and should be very proud of what they have achieved here.Thank you i will be coming back with visitors for you. Vanessa

not trained masseuses. The spa is beautifully decorated but the service was below par to say the least. The masseuses are obviously lacking in professional training. Their constant chattering and giggling outside the treatment rooms certainly did not lend to the ambiance. My shoe would give me a better foot rub.

Beautiful spa - Really good value!. My husband and I went for the Grand Couples Ritual. Be forewarned the Spa is not particularly easy to find. We were luckily staying fairly close by and happened to see the sign pointing down the road or else I think we would have really battled! The spa is spectacular - each treatment room has been well thought out and fitted out beautifully. The decor is dramatic and romantic ,the integrated sound system in each room adds that extra dimension of luxury and sets the mood perfectly. Staff were very professional and friendly. considering how much this would set us back here in London, we were very glad to pay the 900 dirhams each for an amazing experience. Definately reccomend it.

A hidden gem!. Hidden down a dark smelly alley this spa is out of this world! Nicer and smarter than any spa I have been to in the UK. We had the hamman massage which is an experience in itself - give it a go!

Pure Heaven or even better. My wife and I visited the Mythic Oriental Spa at the start of our 10 day holiday after reading reviews on Trip Advisor before leaving and thought we might give it a try. We were unsure of what to expect but were overwhelmingly suprised as soon as the owner opened the doors and we walked inside. The architecture and the detail to furnishing and finish of the building is superb. The calming atmosphere that comes not just from the surroundings you are in but also from all the staff that work there is unbelievable until you experience it for yourself.We chose the VIP treatment for couples and it was worth every Dirham and more. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. We were washed, relaxed and massaged and received refreshments too. In fact we both loved it so much that we went back again the day before we left and it was every bit as good as the first time we visited.Visiting this spa has left us feeling rejuvenated and totally relaxed and was a perfect pinnacle to a lovely holiday. Would we go back again?? Oh YES!! Would we reccomend to others....It is a must if you visit Marrakech.

#1 Spa.. coming from a Spa Snob. The Mythic Spa is a must do when you go to Marrakech. It's the best spa that I have ever been to and surpasses the Ritz Carlton Spa, Elizabeth Arden Red Door, etc. and you paying half the price. It's beautifully decorated, the staff is so warm and welcoming and you have the traditional Moroccan treatments that afterwards make you refreshed and years younger. I was shocked to find out that this spa was only 4 months old and the staff worked so seamlessly you would think they have been doing this for many years. I even recommend my friends coming to Marrakech just to go to this spa. Book an afternoon of treatments and you will not be disappointed.

Absolutely Amazing!. So so so good. Everything was amazing!!! Would go back in an instant. We came here as part of the partnership between here an Faim d'Epices, which is also very good. Check them both out!
Fabulously Relaxing. Probably expensive for Marakech but you get what you pay for. Everything was designed to make you feel relaxed and pampered. Spend the money it is worth every cent.

wonderful experience. after a long way of traveling, we advise you that to book a chance with Mythic Oriental Spa, they will treat you as a king, me and my family so glad to made that experience hammam and exfoliation with morrocan black soap and body massage it was exellent; we had nothing to complain about, we promise to come back again next year for my birthday. highly recommend this spa, it's a very clean place and a friendly staff wonderful treatments with lovely products.it was very relaxing time with a nice oriental music, its hard to get up and get dressed to leave we feel like we staying there all day it was a lovely experience.
Total luxury. We combined this with a cookery experience it was amazing well recommended

Relaxed and Pampered. Walked in feeling frazzled after a day of exploring the souks and left feeling completely chilled out. Booked a Grand Evening Ritual for couples as an anniversary treat. Staff were welcoming and friendly and the surroundings scrumptious! Felt like royalty as we were led to a boudoir where we were treated to a refreshing drink as the treatments were explained. Starting with a mini foot massage,we were washed,scrubbed followed with a natural clay body wrap and left to relax before we had another wash and then a relaxing soak in bath salts followed by a top to toe massage! It was all finished off with mint tea and pastries as we were left to relax for as long as we liked. The ambiance created was very relaxing and the spa was one of my highlights on this trip, would definitely come back if I visit Marrakech again.
Pure Relaxation. Wonderful and relaxing experience worth every single penny (cent, dihram or zloty!) and cheap compared to European prices.

Amazing experience. Expensive for Marrakech but worth it!. My girlfriend and I had the Grand Evening Ritual for Couples here at a cost of 900 Dh (about £75). This was 2.5 hours and involved a foot massage, hammam (wash, exfoliation scrub, mud body wrap, hair wash, aromatic bath) and full-body and facial massage, followed by mint tea.Girls be prepared: you will be at very least topless (I think the paper thong - boxers for men - is optional) but the only people who see you are your partner and 2-3 staff.The staff were friendly. It was romantic and pure relaxation.
Very relaxing. the staff was incredibly accommodating and professional. a great end to a day of cooking!
Heaven. Enjoy the chamam, the massage and the roof top. Before you go take exact directions.

Great Value for Money for the best spa day you'll ever have!!. My boyfriend decided to treat me for my birthday whilst we were out in Marrakech. He had booked me in a full days worth of treatment at the Mythic Oriental spa.We were dropped off by a taxi and to save us walking through the busy Medina the owner of the spa came to meet us from our taxi who was a very positive, warming nice lady. I went with one of the girls I was on holiday with and our boyfriends had escorted us to the spa. Whilst we got ready in our bath robes the boys were treated to mint tea.We were spoilt rotten at the spa, it started off with a foot rub and then proceeded onto a steam (with some sort of clay rubbed on us not sure what it was). We were then washed in the shower, exfoliated, washed and steamed again, had a hamman wrap, we then soaked in the bath with roses, then we had a facial, a full body massage. To top all of that off we had a manicure and pedicure to finish off. We were meant to go to the roof terrace for a jaccuzzi but becuase we had just had our nails painted we didn't want to ruin them.When we had finished with all of our treatments the boys were waiting upstairs with a birthday cake that the spa had organised.They really went all out and spoilt me rotten. If I go back to Marrakech I will definately return here as it was ag reat value for money you would pay triple even quadruple for that type of treatment in England.

Good but some reservations. Went here with my hubby for the hamman and massage.He has never experienced a massage before and was a little apprehensive, made worse by the giggling of the two girls who did our massages!The place is beautiful. The welcome, setting, the girl who did our 'washing' and the roof terrace were all of a very good standard and this place could have been an amazing experience.We have fed back our comments by email so hopefully the giggling will have stopped, if so, go and enjoy!
Perfect start to our break. This was the perfect way to start our Marrakesh break. The staff, surroundings and treatment were first class. we will be back.

An oasis in a busy neighborhood. I love going to spas in the different cities I go to so I just had to try this one after reading the reviews. It was difficult getting a weekend appointment which excited me even more! Rihab, the receptionist/owner, was very accommodating though, and responded promptly to my e-mails. I understood our tour guide's hesitation and warnings (about getting lost, being possibly harrased by men) when I got to the area but I still think he was just being cautious. (I had no bad experiences during this 1-week visit to Marrakech).Once you get in, though, it seems you are transported to an entirely different world. The silence, lighting, and luxurious curtains and fabrics instantly put you at ease. But I think there was nothing extraordinary about the massage technique itself except for the really liberal use of the oils. I suspect though, that the language barrier contributed to this feeling, as I couldn't entirely relax and had to keep guessing what was going to happen next each time the therapist left the room. Or because I have a regular masseuse back home who knows which parts needs massaging. Maybe if I wasn't rushing, and had an entire afternoon to savor the surroundings I would have enjoyed it more.

Bliss...... We visited here as part of the combined Faim d'Epices / Mythic Oriental Spa package and as part of a 60th birthday treat for my mum. It was definately the best day of our trip to Marrakech and would see this as a must do......We arrived at about 5.30 and didn't leaves until 8.30 and it was amazing, an experience that i don' t think i'll ever forget in the hamman.....The foot rubs, body scrubs full massage followed by the tea and cake afterwards, it was absolute bliss.......

a peaceful haven of bliss. Looking for a 'couples' hammam experience while in Marrakech, we researched Tripadvisor, and quickly discovered Mythic Oriental Spa, as one of the top listed hammam's in Marrakech. And, on top of that, there was a combo offer if combined with the cooking class at Faim d'Epices, which we also wanted to do... so we decided to go for it. But rhather than do the cooking and spa on the same day, we asked Michel (Faim d'Epices) and Florent ( Mythic Oriental Spa) if we could do the Spa the day after. No problem whatsoever for both gentleman, who both duly respond to their email requests in a very timely, professional and welcoming way.So having done the Cooking class the day before, which was amazing, we set out to find the Mythic Oriental Spa the following evening. It has to be said, be sure to have clear taxi instructions, as it is in the Medina, but a bit removed from the touristical center. All in all we had a bit of a hectic survival journey to get there, as our first taxi driver had the wrong address and dropped us somewhere totally not near yet.. long story short, we arrived, way too late and totally frazzled... but...then a world of bliss opened for us!Florent and his lovely wife were very welcoming and immediately eased our minds... we were swooped through a lovely passage way into the changing area, and then beckoned into the courtyard, over the water, into a beautifully welcoming reception area, where we were seated on trone's like a couple of pasha's. We felt right at home! We chose our aromotherapy scents, and were led into the hammam. All is just wonderful, everything very new, very stylish, the staff just lovely... and eventually a wind down with mibt tea and cookies on the roof top terrace.. Heaven!We wish Florent and his wife lots of success with their beautiful little venture!

This spa is absolutly T O P!!!! (and they use real good products!!!!). Spa & massages are part of my (stressfull) life. With an average of 30 massages a year, worldwide done, i discovered here my FIRST spa where they understand the full 200% the meaning of ZEN and relaxing! As of the moment you step in you get REAL value for your money. I first went to test because another hamman gave me poor resultat for my money, despite of the promesses. I went back for the full treatment programm what s a must-have-done event if you stay in Marrakech. The great, devoted staff was about 5 hours busy with us. I felt asleep differrent times during the treatments and HAD to relax after to wake up. I had that night a great sleep ...I ve visited in Belgian and worldwide different spa from small till would-be-top or fancy, but this is the F I R S T who has it all. Compare this SPA to a TOP 3 Michelin *** restaurant, or in car terms with a Mercedes S. Dare to search it, because Marrakech IS safe. And if you dont like to walk take for 20 or 30 dirham un petit taxi. Step into the Mytic world, close your eyes and let them bring you into heaven! Enjoy your treatment with their very good, natural products (what s also very important).

Great way to end a busy day.. We booked this as part of deal with L'atelier Farm d'Epics experience, and it was a great way to end the day. To get to the spa you have to walk down a little alleyway where you are greeted by children who want to shake your hand, but as soon as you step through the door it's like you've entered heaven. Inside this beautiful raid they have created a peaceful haven, where the stress of modern life just disappear. The staff were great and for the main you wouldnt know they were there as they were very peaceful in their approach. Nothing was rushed and you really felt you had time to relax and appreciate all of the experience. As part of the deal we had a private room for our massage, it beautifully decorated and very relaxing. The massage was good, however I've experience better - that is more personal preference. I would definitely recommend a visit, they have a great selection of treatments. It was a great way to end the day.

A-M-A-ZING !!!. We visited here on the final day of our trip as part of the combined Faim d'Epices / Mythic Oriental Spa package. First of all, get directions!! We loved the whole scene of tiny streets, hussle and bustle, people everywhere and bikes zipping all around, but without some guidance from Michel (from Faim d'Epices we would have got totally lost!!).But once you are there, this place is something special, and we were made to feel like a King and Queen for the full 2-3 hour duration! Starting with a refreshing drink and introduction / selection of massage oils, and then off for a quick change into some curious underwear before heading to start the Hammam. I won't spoil the experience, but without doubt it was the best way to end our trip in Morrocco. From start to end we loved this experience! It seemed so strange going from this quiet, peacful location out into the madness of Marrakech, but that's the beauty of it!In comparison with the UK, the price is really good value when you realise how much attention you get! A definite MUST!!

5* experience Beats every other spa I've been to! Do not miss it!. We booked the Faim D'épices cooking class & Oriental spa together before we travelled to Morocco & it was the best day's experience!You will not believe your eyes as your led to the door of this spa! Right in the middle of the busy dusty market, noise & people all around, you walk through the door &........ silence!It is so beautiful, tranquil, & exciting all rolled into one. I went with my mum & our treatments were done dual from the foot massages, scrubs & finally the massage, the girls who were providing the treatments were sweet & funny & had us giggling!after all your treatments you are led upstairs to the roof terrace for mint tea & little sweet pastries, we sat there as the light started to fade in our fluffy bathrobes looking out at a beautiful night sky, this is truly a place worth visiting!!

Loved it. We visited the Mythic Oriental Spa as part of the package offered in conjunction with L´atelier Faim D´Epices and it was just the perfect way to end the day. Luxury surroundings coupled with very attentive staff, the hammam was certainly an experience! It was the first time I´d been to a spa with my husband and it felt like we owned the place and they really wanted us to have a special time to treasure. Can´t recommend it highly enough.

A superb experience - pampering and exotic surroundings rolled into one. My teenage son and I had a sublime time at this converted Riad. I am not surprised it took two and a half years to complete - the attention to detail is exquisite. Situated in the middle of the Medina, you have no idea what lays beyond the very small wooden door set in a wall that looks hundred of years old. Talk about a Tardis moment! Once inside you enter another world. One of tranquility, gorgeous fabrics and hedonism. I was reminded of the Fry's Turkish Delight ad (for those of you who are old enough to remember!) We stayed there ages with absolutely no pressure to leave (despite it being an hour beyond the official closing time.) The products used are very high quality and our skin really did feel like the proverbial 'baby's bottom'. The owner is utterly charming and she and her team have dedicated themselves to ensuring the client has the best experience possible. Go and get yourself pampered!
A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. Beautfully decorated, you're made to feel really special, I wish we had more time to have stayed longer and made more use of their faciliites!

Amazing haven away from the craziness!!. We visited the spa as part of the cookery day package. We had a couples hammam and massage. It was very relaxing and a great experience for me and my fiance. We thoroughly recommend the spa as a professional and peaceful place to be. We enjoyed a break from trying to avoid mopeds through the alleys of Marrakech old town!

Relaxing evening. Went to the spa as part of the cooking and spa package, which worked really well. Amazingly relaxing place. Being washed by someone else was slightly odd but the massage was good. Very clean. Friendly staff, nothing is too much trouble and you can stay as long as you like afterwards and sunbath and relax on the roof terrace.

Manicure, pedicure. Brilliant, good value and friendly and professional.
This is the 2nd spa building, next to the toilets, down stairs.

Perfect end to the day!. We attended the Spa in the late afternoon, as part of the double deal with the Faim d'Epices cooking experience. These two experiences really do go together. The Spa is a absolute haven of peace and relaxation within the medina in Marrakesh. It is a fabulous venue, which you enter through what what appears to be a non - descript back door in the medina! The staff are welcoming, gentle and make you feel entirely at ease. The place is extremely clean. My wife was somewhat reticent about strangers washing / massaging her body - but I can report that she loved it! We opted for the couples experience which meant we received our individual pampering, together throughout the Spa. The end of the experience, sitting and relaxing on the roof of the building (in seclusion) with a hot mint tea was brilliant. As it was dark when we finished it was particulary romantic on the roof sipping our tea and listening to the calls to prayer across the medina! This was a brilliant, relaxing experience which we would recommend to anyone visiting Marrakesh.
An oasis - relaxation guaranteed. We experienced the MOS after our Moroccan cooking with Faim d'espices. The perfect end to the day. The spa is incredible and I wish I could have spent the day there!

Bliss. We visited Mythic Oriental Spa for a couples massage, and truly this was luxury and pampering to the extreme. The Spa itself is gorgeous, bright, spacious and so clean. The staff were so professional, wonderfully friendly and so good at their jobs. The entire experience from the Orange water to the massage to the mint tea and bisquits afterwards is BLISS, that is really and truly the only word I could find for it. BLISS. And for all you guys out there that are not crazy about accompanying your wives. GO for it! My husband went begrudgingly as he thought massages for kind of girly, by the time he was done, we was asking me if we could book a massage for everyday we were in Marrakech. BLISS!

Fantastic experience. Although it was only open since a few months, and although it is not easy to find (we got friendly service of a Marrakech person to show us the way) this was unforgettable. We took the hamman, gom with black soap and 45 min of massage and we were both (was in duo) very satisfied. Very nice environment, very experienced massage ladies and a very friendly service. You should do this !!!
fantastic experience. Royal treatment!. We booked a couples evening special. € 90 pp. For sure worth the money! Me and my wife were pampered tot the extreme. Really really great!

Fabulous experience - go to be spoilt in luxurious and relaxed surroundings. We booked this as part of a deal with Faim d'Epices. Neither can be faulted and for a little over 1000 Dhirams we were out from 9.30am to 7.30pm with cooking, fun, spices overload followed by a traditional hammam in what can only be described as heavenly surroundings. The whole day was relaxed and the hammam, if you haven;t had one before, involves a good soak and scrub down followed by a divine massage. Mint tea and Moroccan biscuits served up on the roof terrance at sunset. No rush to leave.As always this Riad was hidden down a maze of alleyways and its door only hints at what lies behind....A taxi was even arranged (in a luxurious Mercedes for a little more than the standard taxi) for us. Neither experience to be missed.

Wonderful experience. Fantastic pampering experience.
Went and had body scrub and massage with my partner. Girls that did it were excellent.
Beautiful surroundings and very special. If you want a massage - do not go anywhere else - its perfect. Lovely scents in the air.
We will be back!

Top Quality Spa. Very enjoyable experience from the outset. Its certainly a large part of magic of Marrakech that a place such as this can exist in dusty side street in the Medina. The spa is set within a beautifully and newly refurbished Riad. The style is contemporary and very chic with clever design and perfect lighting and oriental touches. The spa was absolutely spotless throughout. My partner and I opted for a combination Hamman exfoliation and massage as a final day treat on our break in Marrakech. The two girls who undertook the treatments were highly professional and the pace was perfect as we were led between each treatment to a lovely rest area. Afterwards were left to relax on the roof terrace for as long as wanted.It was also nice to meet the owners who have gone to an enormous amount of effort to provide an unforgettable experience. The spa also has its own extensive range of exquisitely packaged spa products. Highly recommended experience.

Cleanliness is next to Godliness!!!. I booked a hammam at the Mythic Oriental Spa, for myself and my husband, via a package that was being offered in combination with cooking classes at Faim d'Epices. What a way to complete a perfect day!!! Cooking, fun, a fantastic meal, and then the most relaxing hammam I've had yet! If you don't know what a hammam is, you're in for a treat. You will be so scrubbed, washed and clean that you squeak. Add to that the massage that you get....well, my husband kept me awake because of his snoring thru it! With the hammams that I've experienced around the world, I'm exceptionally picky that not only to I come out feeling clean, but I insist on impeccably clean facilities and the Mythic Oriental is the cleanest I've ever seen! You definitely get MORE than your money's worth at this hammam and you will come away feeling refreshed! I can't recommend it highly enough!

Mythic Oriental Spa - peace and tranquility in the Marrakech medina.. My friends and I visited Mythic Oriental Spa on August 15, 2011. I learned about Mythic Oriental Spa through the cooking school, Faim d'Epices. I had partipated in the cooking class earlier in the day at Faim d'Epices, and signed up for a special cooking class/spa promotion that was being offered. My friends did not attend the cooking workshop, but met me at the spa afterwards. We all agreed - it was an amazing spa experience! We all elected the traditional hammam/exfoliation/massage package. The facilities are gorgeous, clean, well-maintained and extremely serene. The staff were all very warm and friendly and made us feel at home at all times. The mint tea and pastries we were offered while there were amazing. The products used are incredible, and you have the opportunity to purchase some of them at the end. We left the spa feeling refreshed and renewed. In all, an amazing experience and a must-do while in Marrakech!

One of the best spas I have been too. We went to the spa as part of the Faim D'Epices cooking class (class in the morning and spa in the afternoon) The spa was very new (open 2 months) it was beautifully designed and Florent and his wife were incredibly nice. Florent's wife spoke perfect English and we were offered drinks, and then waited for our treatments. I had a hamman and a massage. I was taken to a lovely steam room, washed and scrubbed with black soap, and then taken to another room where I was scrubbed down with an exfoliation glove. After that I was given a drink and taken to another lovely room where I had a massage. My wife had a massage and a pedicure and she said it was great. We have been to many spas but this was probably one of the best in terms of décor and service. It didn’t beat my massage at the Grove, but was close! Check out the rosewater and argon oil too available for purchase. The reason there are not many reviews is due to the fact it is new but after trying to book for the next day we found out it was very popular already! Not to be missed!

Fabulous fabulous. My boyfriend and I went here on a joint offer with L'atelier Faim d'Epices (in the morning). It was a great combo for a full day outside of the busy souks - check it out!The girls in the spa were really lovely and we were treated like royalty but also had a good laugh (especially as we were spa novices and kept getting lost and not knowing what to do haha oh the giggles!)The lady who owned the place with her husband (sorry I can't remember names!) was so kind and welcoming; they've created a gorgeous spa. We had the Hammam and hour body massage and the girls don't miss anything out - I've never felt so chilled.A tip for people going, they provide disposable pants for men and women - don't worry blokes, they are full boxers! And there are ample sized secure lockers in the changing area for your bits and bobs.Really recommend this, either on it's own or as a package if you can get it!

Luxury. This experience was luxurious from start to finish... Very good value, friendly staff, snacks and drinks throughout, beautiful setting, amazing massage. If I ever need a relaxing holiday this will be my first choice and I will be recommending this to anyone coming to Marrakech.

Perfection - beautifully relaxing.. The only reason this spa lacks reviews is because of its age. Its new. Because of that, everything is still immaculate, clean, fresh and the staff enthusiastic. We had a beautiful afternoon here. Regularly given snacks and drinks. The hammam and massage we had were exquisite, lengthy and good value. We were never rushed and always treated professionally.The spa only employs females, and couples can have their treatments done together, in the same room.

Beautiful and relaxing. Warm, professional staff made my visit to the spa a highlight of my time in Marrakech. After spending a couple of days in the hustle and bustle of the souks I had a much needed massage which left me walking on air. A place of calm in the busy medina. I will definately be coming back again on my next visit to Marrakech.

It's the small things that matter the most. Having just returned from a week at the Pullman I wanted to share my experience.I had high hopes for this trip with my young family and some of the reviews that I read were very good.The plus points.The hotel is clean and the staff are amazing be it in the main restaurant, terrace bar area or the Pull boys (pool boys as they have a play with their name). The customer service team especially Yasmin was amazing and I will elaborate on this later.The restaurant is large and there are a lot of choices even for vegetarians which can be difficult.The facilities are good and cater for all whether it's a family or a couple.The not so good points and this is where the need to Pull their weight (pun intended).The staff although are great at times there are not enough to manage all the guests.At times when I called reception no one would answer the phone and also when I requested something it took 3 days of asking. I requested additional hangers on day 1 and they finally were delivered on day 3. The waiters around the pool area are not enough and if you sit at the far end of the pool you will not get served. Another guest informed me that he had to tip one if them and he came over regularly. This should not be the case. If you are at the Adult Zen pool you have to pay for your drinks as this bar is not part of the all inclusive which is annoying so to get the AI benefits you have to walk to the main pool.My wife and her cousin went for a spa treatment and this turned out to be not the gentle relaxing experience that they were hoping for. When Olga the Spa manager was told of this she became very aggressive and defensive and not customer friendly. She really needs to be sent on a training course. We refused to pay for the treatments.I would not class this hire as 5 star but at most 4 or a high 3.With the issues that we had I would like to thank Yasmin for all her help and support to make sure our trip with all the various issues was enjoyable. In addition in the restaurant Mariam, Mohamed were great and the following Pull Boys Yousef, Younes and Yassine were great.In life it's the small things which make a big difference and unfortunately Pullman Marrakech you failed in these.

best hotel experience. went there for my wifes birthday. Badr and his team were very very helpful. The service was spot on. Thanks and we will surely visit again. Only constructive criticism is that the breakfast could have been a little better.

Day pass for whole family - SUCH a retreat when staying in the medina. We found that the medina was not going to work for us every day of our 8 day trip to Marrakech with our 3 daughters aged 6,4 and 2. It is too crazy and hectic. So on the 3rd day we googled hotel swimming pools that non-guests could use (27 degrees in December, oh yeah!) and found this place. For £26 quid you get a very decent buffet breakfast, lunch, unlimited drinks, snacks, use of pool and facilities AND the most incredible hotel kids club we have ever seen. Donkeys, peacocks, goats and cows. Trampolines, go-carts, Wendy houses, arts and crafts and heaps more and a team of incredibly enthused and gifted 'carers.' Special shout out to Selwa, who also worked on the front desk, but for 2 of our 3 days looked after our 2 year old solely. The baby doesn't often bond easily but by lunch time of the first day she was running off and not looking back. Selwa looked after her so so well. It was the best decision to go there and we'd highly highly recommend it if you need a bit of r&r away from the hustle. Such a special team. Every single member of staff was friendly and attentive and helpful, and seemed to be very happy to work there. Sana in the restaurant also was incredibly sweet, remembering our names and returning lost property to us by the pool.

Great Experience. We have just returned home after a six night stay in Marrakech and i am so happy we managed to find this hotel. It was so relaxing with very friendly and attentive staff. We made the most of the free hotel shuttle into the city which is a great service. It was peaceful at night time and the pool was amazing.

Fantastic time. First visit with family and we will be back. Initially worried after reading reviews from british guests but shouldn't have as we had a fabulous break. Staff were very courteous and attentive . The tennis coach Adleb was very patient and very good. Hasnaa,Olga and Larbi were extremely helpful and fonts of knowledge. The bar man Jawad made great cocktails and the General Manager was also visible around the hotel daily. We never ventured outside of the hotel but used the facilities which include kayaking,tennis,table tennis and football. Also worth mentioning the Kids Club looked excellent.

Extraordinary Hasnaa!!!!!!. Hasnaa is a true asset to the company!!! She makes every day a day to remember. The aqua zumba in the morning is amazing!!! She is very social and super helpful to everybody!!! She helps out where ever she can and always with a smile, always working very hard. For me, she is THE reason to come back to the hotel because she makes us feel welcome and at home.The hotel is wonderful, the room, the food, the people who make the food are amazing!!! Never eaten so good!!! But this would not mean so much without the helpful and caring hand of Hasnaa. Thank you Hasnaa for being hier for us and making our trip fantastic!!!!!

Fantastic!!!!!!. First visit was in June this year, now again with my husband for our 5th wedding anniversary. Staf still knew who I was... And for our anniversary they gave us a special welcome in our room!!!! So romantic and kind of them!!!! They made a heart of rose petals and roses on the bed and bathroom....They made the second visit as perfect as the first!!!! Still great food, and super service!!!!
