Always with a smile and always willing to help you!!!! Had a massage and this was realy amazing... Totally relaxing... They know what they are doing!!!Looking forward to our third trip...

Fabulous time!!!!!. We went for 5 days and we had a wonderful time!!! The service was excellent!!! They were very kind and always willing to help.It was also very clean in the hotel and in the rooms rooms. Also the swimming pool was excellent... Mounier and Simo made sure that we were served and safe at the swimming pool. Chairs, parasol, I mean..., such a service....The activities arranged by the staff were super!!!! I learnd how to dance the salsa, I had a belly dance lesson... Every morgen aqua jim, and they even played ping pong with me... :-). The two ladies who made my holiday so magical were: Hashna and Nadia. Every morning with a smile and always by everybodies side to help out.What was also very good was the service at the bar in the evening. They kept me company during the few hours that I was alone... After the bar there was a sort of guessing game going on, with music, super organised by Youssef.I was horribly burned in my face and needed a doctor, Hashna and Nadia took turns to stay with me because I was alone at that time. They didn't leave me alone at all. The hotel did everything in there power to help me during this painfull time!!!My husband and I are going in september for our late honeymoon (only 5 years to late, but... :-) ). I can't imagine a better place to go to and selebrate our marriage because I feel very welcom and at home there...So Hashna, Tania, Youssef, Mounier , Simo and all the other staf, thank you very much!!!!! I hope to see you all again in september... Bye bye, untill september!!!!Wendy.

Amazing. This hotel is fabulous, the food is spectacular, not a fish & chip in sight, very traditional dishes all delicious. If you have a sweet tooth the desserts are to die for, they taste as good as they look ! Clean, friendly great pool & the shuttle bus to & from the centre is a great bonus.It's about 15 min drive out of town ideal location as Marrakech centre is a little hectic & crazy but brilliant all at the same time ! Going back to hotel after shopping is just perfect way to chill.Markets or Souks as locally know are brilliant maze of local products, leather handbags galore ladies ! Top tip ...choose carefully lots of different quality of leather haggle haggle haggle ! Also smell the leather, one bag once I was home smells disgusting, like an animal, sorry but true. All gets very confusing when your there in the busyness of buying !Have fun.

Relaxing out of town complex. After arriving around 2100 direct from the airport , our taxi pulled up to a fantastically lit entrance, we were soon checked in and then offered to go in the golf buggy to our room, room was lovely very modern and large, being that the hotel was quiet I would of expected the service to be spot on but this was the only disappointment, extremely slow service ordering drinks this was felt mostly at the bar inside but then even continued when we sat around the pool soaking up the sun, we made most of the free transport to the centre which run every hour or so and then got a taxi back which was around 80 - 150 dirhams. Facilities on site were great , breakfast included hot/cold items , would recommend hotel but they just need to get the service right as other accor hotels have just got the edge

5* but not as we know it. Fabulous hotel in lush green well-kept surroundings. Facilities adequately 5*, reasonable selection for breakfast, lunch and dinner. If you're expecting 5* service then think again! It just doesn't happen there. The spa and gym doesn't open until 10am - if you're lucky. If you're just as lucky there might be someone at the spa reception - but don't expect a welcome or any interest - in fact it looked like we were interrupting what should have been a lazy day slouching on the reception sofa for the receptionist - she wasn't happy. Then we found the Jacuzzi - don't expect to be shown around. We were the only people in the spa apart from the receptionist and 2 other female masseuse - we walked in on them - one lying on one of the sofa's in a waiting area the other slouching over a treatment table - after a hard day's work? I fear not - this was at 10:30am. We were then told we could not use the Jacuzzi as we had to make a reservation - a reservation? We were the only people there! We also later found out that you have to pay to use the Jacuzzi! Spa advertised as 24hrs - open from 10am until 11pm – work that one out.If you want anything don't expect to be served - you have to go and get it yourself or go and ask someone. No one to greet us at the front door on arrival - the only one of the 5* hotels on the way including 4*s where this happened. We asked for a map of the enormous grounds at reception as the hotel advertises a jogging route - nice? Forget it - no map and no idea what jogging route we were on about.All inclusive? Expect to be tagged with an immovable plastic “bracelet” - shame they couldn't just give you an ID card. Coke Zero in a can - expect to pay - out of a bottle - part of all inclusive! Another nice touch is the opportunity of dinner in the Moroccan restaurant for those on all inclusive. What they don't tell you is the dinner is a limited version of the buffet restaurant - you don't get the choice of their full menu, although this is not advertised - we only found out by watching the only other table, which was sat on the opposite side of the restaurant, given their book of a full menu! If you’re all inclusive, you will be made to feel as an unwanted guest as you’re not paying the full menu prices. As all inclusive, you can only get a bottle of water at the pool bar or at the buffet restaurant, although all bars and restaurants serve the same bottled water, they will not serve you whilst you're wearing your tag!Great pool, you won't want to get out once you're in. If you're not fussed about which bed you have, fine. If you're choosy then it's a 6am start to beat the French! Giant umbrellas opened and closed by the pool attendant, when it's time to leave your umbrella will be closed unless you specifically ask. If you're looking for great service, fantastic facilities and a good standard of cleanliness then this is not the resort for you. We stayed for a week and there were only 2 staff that gave a decent level of service - Soufiane on reception (although there are no details shared or welcome pack to tell you about your stay) and Hassan in the buffet restaurant. Look out for the barman in the black shirt in Le Bar Ambiance (we didn’t catch his name) can only be described as plain rude and extremely unhelpful. Our placemats were stained and unclean and the floor was rarely swept in the restaurant, we dropped some biscuit at dinner and it was still there the following breakfast, the staff would wipe any crumbs onto the floor with their hands and then reset the table, mostly with clean cutlery and glasses. The restaurant staff offer a miserable welcome, tea and coffee are only served when you chase, sometimes you just have to get it yourself and then it might be cold.It is very clear that the lack of care, etc., comes from the hotel management and spreads down to the rest of the staff. We made a complaint to the reception staff, the general manager was so concerned he sent his Quality Manager rather than himself. We were told that a contributory factor to the awful service was because we stayed during Ramadan, although this wasn’t an excuse.The hotel and grounds are beautiful, but it is such a shame because the whole experience was ruined by the rude attitude and lack of service from the staff.

Fantastic. The hotel has quite a wow factor. The gardens and pool area are beautiful and very well maintained. The meals we had were all buffet style with a great selection and great quality, although not cheap. The staff and service are truly excellent, there were lots of staff around and were all very happy to help.

not bad but few things to improve. we stayed in this hotel for 10 nights in the end of March. The hotel itself is very nice, very large areas and good comfy rooms with comfy bed. They also have a great kids room with many activities. The food in the main dining is good, though the breakfast selection is rather small especially if you stay for a long time. The staff in the F&B and some in the FO are not polite and sometimes even arrogant. most dont speak english and sometimes hard to explain what we want from them. i think the main dining room is understaffed as u cant even catch them to pour u a cup of coffee. Also, a big note to the HK department: please install a rubber wheels on the housekeeping trolleys, otherwise it sounds like we live next to the railway.

Excellent Spa. I'm just here to thank the staff of the SPA and specially the manager of the Spa who gave me and my family the very tender welcome and the very respect care, also thanks for the kids club who took a good care of our kids during our absence. really all Spa in morocco must be the same because before we got too bad treatment and a foolish people who tried just to steal us. Thanks

Quite an experience!. 1st time ever to have a hammam and wow! The experience is great and the hammam took care of me and pampering was amazing. It is a fabulous Moroccan experience not to be missed! The location is very close to the Saabien Tombs within the Medina. Mint tea is also provided.

Amazing experience.. I have been here before and each time it never fails to make me feel relaxed. I had the experience Hammam....the staff are lovely. The atmosphere is tranquil and the massages are great. Definitely worth a visit.

Rushed experience . We went for a hammam and massage and the whole experience would have been nice if it wasn't for the noise, the entire time people were laughing and talking.. We had 1 minute of foot massage and 1 for facial, the hammam felt really rushed and the girl doing it was really fast.. Maybe 10 minutes out of 1 hour .. The place looks amazing wish the staff was better, such a pity

Go here whilst in Marrakech. . My boyfriend and I went and had a joint hamman together followed by a massage in separate rooms. The decor is lovely. The staff are experienced, friendly and attentive. It's very reasonably priced. The hamman was great. We had one the previous week and it wasn't half as good as this. The lady was really thorough and hard working. The scrub was vigorous but not painful. Little touches like bottles of ice cold water, fresh mint tea between treatments with s lovely foot massage really made it special. My boyfriend and I have massages regularly but these were the best we'd ever had and we had different therapists. I'd highly recommend this place.

A great way to escape the chaos and heat. We were overwhelmed by the number of Hammams available and the varying reviews. L'Alhambra was recommended by a local businessman we met on the train. The place is well signed from the main street. We visited in person and made our booking. We had the two hour Introductory Hammam which included a Hammam, 30min bath and 1 hour massage as a couple. We were greeted and efficiently conveyed through the process, handed from each therapist to the next. It was a lovely experience and we were happy with the service.

Don't waste your money here. -We paid for 1 hour massage, starting at 7 pm. -After about half an hour, they left the room without saying anything. We waited for 5 minutes and decided to go look for them. They just pointed to another room with loungers where they gave us a quick 3 minute feet massage. Then left again without saying anything. After waiting 5 minutes - during which we could hear lots of noise behind heavy velvet curtains that kept moving - we asked what was happening and they said it was finished. -I reminded them that we had 1 hour massage and they said that it had indeed been an hour. We figured time had gone very fast. -They didn't point us to the showers or anywhere, so we asked where we could shower and they pointed in one direction without even offering towels. The shower was tiny and very uncomfortable, so we just removed the oil as best as we could, got our stuff and left. -Once we had left and checked the time, we realized it was just a few minutes past 8 pm. We should still have been on the massage table practically until that point! They just tricked us into paying more and giving us half of what we paid for.-We could have come back and demand a redo, but the facilities are smelly and not nice (I have no idea what reviewers who say this is luxurious are talking about). -Also, I could feel the nails of the person who did my massage, not scratching but very uncomfortable. My husband said he could feel the belly of the person who did the massage directly on him a few times during the massage. Overall, the massages were not good, doubt these people have any real training to know what they're doing.-Needless to say, NEVER coming back to this place.

Amazing,wonderful hammam and massage.. It was our first experience with hammam. It is a very interesting process. The massage after the hammam was really very relaxing. You will leave with oil on your body (and hair) so prepare to wear clothes that you can easily wash after this experience.Take the package that has massage. It is definitely money's worth.Make sure you don't take the last appointment. You will feel rushed.

Full body scrub and massage. Excellent -this was the best spa treatment I have ever had. Absolutely amazing.. The staff were all very attentive and their goal was to please. we were scrubbed, pummeledwashed and then massaged for a good two hours. this was pure quality.

First ever massage, lovely experience. This place will be difficult to find but well worth it. Our driver took us there, there was some confusion between the driver and the reception but it got sorted out ok and our experience began. Hamman and scrub followed by facial massage then full body massage. It was delightful and I think I went to sleep during the scalp massage. Lovely, I would definitely do this again

In days of stress . I just picture myself here and just imagine I'm going through the whole circuit again. I could only speak based on my experience, and the gommage, massage and relaxation were truly exceptional. I'm coming back in my next visit for sure! Oh, and it is quite affordable for what you get!

It Could be A Wonderful Experience. I actually went twice, the first time it was amazing. The best hammer and a spectacular massage. The second time was only so so and my pedicure wasn't worth the time or the money. It's hit or miss.
We had a hamamm and massage.. Enjoyed the full experience. Very relaxing massage. The hamamm was very stimulating and the sauna was great.

Not as portrayed in photos. Busy place. Hammam experience was more traumatic than relaxing. Everything is very rushed through. Massages were of average quality. For the price you pay, it is OK. Location is near Kasbah and easy to find.

relaxing and luxurious experience . Visited this Hammam on recommendation from le Meridian concierge. We went as a couple and the experience was amazing! They first led us to a small changing room with lockers where we changed into robes and then were led into a warm room with slab marble walls and benches and a tai head shower in the center. Here they scrubbed each of us with the black soap and then used the loofa glove to scrub the whole body. Then we rinsed under the rain head and had some buckets of warm water splashed on us. They leave you in the room for about 10 minutes following to relax in the warm and humid room. Following this you visit a relaxation room in your robes while they put lotion on and massage your feet. Then cold compresses on the eyes and forehead while you drink the hot mint tea. From here we were brought to a room for a couples side by side massage and following that we were treated to warm baths in huge soap stone tubs by candlelight with rose petals everywhere. While in the baths next to one another, they came in and performed facial and head massages with lotions. After a 1/2 soak in this warm room, we put our robes back on and were sat in the relaxation room one last time where we were given cold bottled water. An amazing treat for the senses over a period of two hours for about $80us - One tip bring bikini bottoms as you need to keep them on at all times.

A very nice experience situated just off the Rue de la Kasbah. A very friendly and welcoming receptionist helps you sort through the menu to decide on your treatments, and I was fortunate enough to get a walk-in treatment. I found the other staff to be not quite so smiley but they did perform their work efficiently. I had a lovely one hour massage followed by a wonderful oil bath, ten minute head massage and free foot massage. Overall, a very nice and pampering experience.

An enjoyable experience. I booked a Discovery hammam for me and my daughter via our Riad. This involved a rub down with soap, a scrub, and a massage. We found the hammam itself hilarious, with buckets of water being chucked over us. It's true that the staff struggle to communicate but if I knew more French I am sure that wouldn't have been the case. We were left for quite a long time in the sauna part, and my daughter became a bit uncomfortable. Fortunately before we fainted, we were moved to the resting area. We were given a brief foot and face massage before we moved upstairs to the massage itself.The oil used was argan oil, which is actually unscented, so I wasn't surprised. I found the massage very good, and as strong as I requested. My only complaint would be that the masseuses did whisper to each other a lot at the start, which meant they weren't concentrating so much on the massages. However the rest of the massage was great.I thought 450dh pp perfectly reasonable for this lovely experience, and would recommend it for part of your Marrakech holiday. One word of warning ladies - unless told otherwise, your upper body will be scrubbed and rubbed. And I mean all of your upper body! :)
A great place to relax. A well-organised establishment with very nice and professional personnel. They used some natural products like 'savon noir'.
Very nice Hammam. We visited this Hammam without having booked, and evenso they were very friendly, and made it possible to take us in. The Hammam was very nice and relaxing.

nothing extraordinary. We (couple) had a standard hamman, an hour massage, bath (the one with rose petals). Pluses:- nice 'Moroccan' look & feel- girls at the reception speak perfect English- good quality of cosmetics - massage (light rubbing rather then pressure one)minus:- expensive- rushed (felt little bit like on a 'factory line')- bathHamman:Lady who was putting the soap on us wasn't very communicative. She left us without a world and we stayed in the sauna for 15min without knowing what will happen next ans when. Later two other ladies came who gave us a proper scrub (if you want a gentle one you need to tell them first). Later we showered and were moved to the waiting areas for 10min and offered a tea. Bath:Then we went to the bath. 2 baths next to each other, rose petals everywhere - very romantic :) Which surprised me there were no oils or very little in the bath. I was expecting fusion of fragrance and smells but nothing like that. I was literally bath with water with petals. Water was very hot (I mean easily over 40C hot) and the room got very streamy very quickly and I simply couldn't breath. 15min in a lady came who gave us short head and face massage with oils which was very nice but didn't enjoy it that much struggling to breath in a very steamy room in hot bath. I had to get out to ask for water in the end.. My husband stayed bit longer so I guess it's a personal predisposition. After the bath we were taken to for the MassageWhich was the best part of the spa. Ladies were very diligent and didn't leave a part of my ski (ok maybe some;) which wasn't massaged with a thick oil. Again though no fragrance! No smell at all. After the massage we've been rushed to the changing room.All in all I was most disappointed int the bath. Why not put really nice smelly oils? Why not make it more entertaining and less hot? I might add that the bath is more expensive then the massage! All in all - not great value for money especially that we negotiated the prices down anyway.
Overpriced. I had a complete experience and paid 55 euros. I believe it is quite expense for what I get. It wasn't bad, but personally I believe is not a good value.

My awful experience. I just went yesterday and had a full day booked of hammam, facial, massage, manicure and pedicure. My experience up till the manicure was amazing! But when it came to my nails, I just asked the woman for a specific shape to my nails and I rested in my seat while she started. I only became aware when she clipped away at a finger and it hurt so much that I realized she had clipped my nails and ripped off the edges till my flesh was exposed. I pointed it out and at that point I was so upset. Instead of apologizing, she rudely said she did her job and I didn't understand. I asked for the manager who very rudely in Arabic told me they were experts and I had no right to complain. The ordeal was awful and I ended up in tears and was made to pay for that service and received very rude remarks. I paid 1350 MAD to be treated badly. I highly discourage anyone from going and being Egyptian, this is a shame. I posted pictures with my blue nails before and then after. It isn't easy to see but more than a bad job and burning skin on my fingers, the treatment was awful.

Good affordable option for couples. We decided on Les Bains de l'Alhambra after comparing options where they accommodate for couples spa-style hammam together instead of the traditional baths where men and women have separate hours. The bath takes place in a separate marble room lit with candles, where the masseur applies traditional savon noir with eucalyptus and does the scrubbing to get rid of old skin. We paid for a clay body and face mask that added 50 dirhams to the price. We were offered mint tea and a short foot massage while relaxing after. Overall we found it to be a very relaxing experience and good value for money.

Fun Time. I took my daughter here for her fist hamman experience. They were nice and friendly and she thought it was different. Moroccan hamman is a bit different from the Turkish I am accustomed. This is hamman has small rooms that fit 2 or 3 people. My daughter and I were together. In Morocco they put this thick black paste on you and then scrub you. The room is a beautiful marble room. After the hamman you are escorted to a resting room where they give you some tea, a foot massage and a face massage. It was very affordable and nice. Highly recommended.

Reasonabley priced Hammam. I previously visited this Spa five years ago, it is about £10.00 for a Hammam.They are very sympathetic to your requests, I asked for my Henna Tattoo not to be scrubbed, and a friend of mine asked for a softer Massage.All in all a nice experience but I think next time I will go for a more authentic Hammam.

Go on - spoil yourself!. No trip to Marrakesh would be complete without a good scrub down in a Hamman. Totally relaxing and feeling spoilt and pampered....great for sorting out the aching feet, legs and hips caused by several days of walking around the town. Recommended

Super family experience. Just back from "an amazing experience" according to my 14 year old daughter. Despite us turning up on the door we were fitted in at short notice. The receptionist spoke excellent English explaining all the options to us. We went for the Hammam Experience with Massage. The team were very supportive of the the fact that we were a father daughter combo with us able to do the Hammam experience together before going into private rooms for the massage. The Hammam was really good, especially the scrub although I would have liked steam within the warm room. We loved the pampering between Hammam and massage. We opted for the traditional "Morrocan" massage which was medium pressure and very relaxing. Floated back to our riad nearby. Two very happy customers.

Good massage at reasonable price. I visited this Hammam and Spa on the recommendation of the owner of my Riad. The Spa was quite busy with many rooms. I only opted for a massage and was ushered into a locker room where I changed into a robe and put my belongings in a lockable storage. The massage was quite good although I have had better. After I ushered into a room to relax, where I was given mint tea and a separate foot massage. After about 20min I was taken back to the locker room to change. The price was about 350Dh which was reasonable value for the experience.
Lovely, relaxing time. . A touch of luxury amid the hustle of the souks. The massage was great -and not a bad price either! Thanks for a lovely evening
Good Hammam (for tourist). This is a good Hammam, for tourist. It's a bit cheaper than the others, and the quality is good. we had Hammam/scrub and massage, which was good.

Relaxing Experience. This is the first spa related activity I've ever done so am by no means an expert, but found this very relaxing even just for the basic 150DHS package. A good scrub and relaxing foot massage! I forgot to ask if they had hot pools, as that would have been a welcome addition - you may wish to enquire if you visit.

Nice visit to a hammam for reasonable price. I booked this through my riad and it was a really nice experience. The hammam was only a few minutes from riad so that was a bonus for me as I wanted somewhere I could easily nip back to hotel from. The massage was amazing, it was a full hour and full body - totally relaxing. I would definitely recommend a treatment with a massage! The hammam was good, a little underwhelming, although I didn't know what to expect. It felt a bit rushed - I changed into bikini then went into a hot-ish room (it's not sauna temperatures) where the lady showered me and the rubbed the clay on. She literally spent 2 mins on the clay but they leave it in there so I put some more on while I waited. She then left for 10mins and then another lady came back to do the scrub and shower. It did feel a bit rushed in the hammam and the ladies didn't explain what was happening. I was fine with it but can feel a little confusing! Everything was really nice - mint tea, robes, friendly staff, an extra foot massage and relaxed atmosphere. At 450DH it wasn't too pricey for nearly two hours there but probably wouldn't pay more. It wasn't overwhelming but a nice thing to do while in Marrakech.I'd recommend going in earlier in the day before it gets busy!

Relaxing. Me and my boyfriend went there after some exhausting trip do the desert. We chose the hammam + relaxing massage (450dirhams).Firstly, we changed clothes (just underwear, no top bikini or bra for women, and a robe that they provide), then moved to the relaxing area for tea. Afterwards somebody called us for the hammam (it was our first hammam) - they took our robes, we showered, they put the soap on our body, then you wait for a while. Then, scrub as, front and back, very hard, bit it feels great! It's like every dead skin is getting off your body. Then shampoo, shower, and relaxing for 15 minutes (like sauna, but less hot I would say). Shower again and back for relaxing, small time for tea, and some iced stones on your face. Very very small foot massage. And afterwards, up to the body massage. That was amazing! I would just enjoy it a bit harder, but that's personal taste, the massage was great! Well received, well taken care of, free tea, and friendly staff. Would go back!

Hammam was rushed. Massage was great. . The massage was probably the best massage I've ever had. It was incredibly thorough and relaxing, and the lady was lovely. However, the hammam prior to that was quite disappointing. I think that because we were a group of 3, they rushed the process. We felt we weren't in the steam for long enough and felt as though we didnt get scrubbed properly, it probably took less than a minute for each of us. Also, while we were left to relax, the women would come in and out, leaving the door open which allowed a lot of cold air to come in. Although this was disappointing, the face mask and the relaxing foot massage while we drank a glass of mint tea, and then the full body massage, did make up for it.
A very relaxing visit. Was recommended to us by our Riad, and was really worth a visit. We went as a group of friends and had both a lot of fun and a very relaxing visit.

Hammam in Marrakech. My boyfriend and I visited Les Bains de L'alhambra for a hammam. It included black eucaliptus soap bath, scrub, and foot massage. They served mint tea as well. The place seemed quite clean -even if dark. Staff were quite loud for a place of relax, which got a bit annoying.Overall a relaxing experience.

A clean good scrub!. The Riad we stayed in had technical issues with their hamam, so we were recommended this Les Bains. My friends and I were first time hamam goers, but we did do our homework beforehand. I would advise everyone to do some homework, so you know what you're in for. We opted for the Hamam, with clay body mask and foot soak. Couldn't fault their service at all, we walked out feeling clean and refreshed! FYI - They did tell us to take the top part of our bikinis off. Bottom intact though!

thourough scrubb exelent massage. we visited this hamam during our 4 trip in marocco. my friend and i have had several hamam treatments in our own country as well as abroad and we think this is one of the best! clean friendly staff very good scrubb and an exellent massage.beutifull uilding also. maybe they could try te tell a litle bit about the treatmment taht your going to get, but hey some surprises make the travel worth wile!

Disappointing!. My husband and I were away for the weekend - our first time away on our own since having children so we thought we'd treat ourselves to some pampering. Our Riad owner recommended this place so we were happy to try out her recommendation. As others have stated, we were handed grey (previously white) robes and slippers to match! We were then shown in to a small room to await our hammam. Not knowing what to expect I was a little uneasy and the woman assigned to us did little to put me at my ease. After declining to take my tankini top off she literally shoved her hand down my top rubbing the soap over my front - awarding me no dignity at all! She then left us for approx 15 minutes which was far from relaxing. On her return she scrubbed us down with a sandpaper mitt - I'm not convinced the mitt was clean. After having buckets of water thrown over us we were ushered in to the chill out area. The women constantly disturb the peace in the chill out area as they fetch drinks from the fridge - why they can't keep them somewhere else I don't know. The massage itself wasn't too bad although I did find my back massage was actually quite painful so I was relieved when she moved elsewhere. I wasn't allowed to keep my top on for this, I guess understandably but I have to say I felt a tad uncomfortable when she was massaging my front as she was a little heavy handed! Personally I wouldn't recommend this place at all and I wish we'd spent a little more time reading the reviews. However I would recommend experiencing a hammam but don't expect to leave with any dignity!

Amazing Massage. We didn't want to go all the way to Morocco and not experience a spa, so on the recommendation of our Riad (Riad Romance) myself and my daughter were booked in for a one hour massage. The whole experience was wonderful. We had the massage together in the same room and the ladies were amazing and listened to what we asked for. The massage did indeed last 1 hour and beautiful soothing music wafted through the air by the end of the massage my daughter woke me up and told me that I had been snoring....that's how good it was!!The ladies then left us in the room for about 10 minutes, we weren't sure what was going on so we put our robes back on and got ready to go and get dressed, but no... they ushered us into a beautiful room with about 8 relaxing loungers, they sat us down and then bought us some delicious mint tea. That was amazing but it didn't stop there, after the tea another young lady came into the room and then procceded to massage our feet with warm scented oils. It was bliss. I would recommend the massage experience at Les Bains de l'Alhambra. It was fantastic.

Ultimate Relaxation. We booked an early slot of 9am and arrived before the crowds. Great hammam, relaxing and long foot massage and we didn't feel rushed at all. The staff were friendly and the decor is beautiful. Recommend taking a bikini, moisturiser and conditioner though for afterwards.

Disappointing . Visited this spa as a group of 7 ladies on recommendation from our Riad during a 3 night break in Marrakech. We arrived 30 minutes early thinking we might be able to relax & chill first but were told to come back at our allocated time. Fair enough. On returning I realised that they wouldn't have the space to put us anywhere. As a group of 7 we'd pre booked various different packages from their Duo Hammam & Massage selection. We were all ushered into two very small & cramped changing rooms to get changed into our bikini bottoms & robes - please note ladies, no tops allowed) - then taken to the mixed sex 'relaxation' area for mint tea. Then shortly after all ushered into the hammam steam room. Tops off sitting there with some people I hardly knew (it was a hen-break) was initially a bit uncomfortable but decided to just go with it and treat it as a laugh. However, this part of the experience felt like a bit of a production line, each of us having black soap slapped on, almost dragged under the shower to wash it off, told to put feet in mushy petal bath, face & body scrubbed with loofah mits, clay mask being put on face & body VERY sparingly (my legs had the tiniest amount put on them and it felt like the dregs from the pot, plus I'd thought that the clay mask was going to be part of the massage), lastly showered again before being given anybody's robes back (I had the bikini top of somebody else's in the pocket) and all between the door being repeatedly opened periodically for the two staff to come in and out whilst we're all sitting there semi-naked!! Hardly relaxing. Anyways, we then went back to the relaxation area for something cold on our face and a two minute foot rub. Could have really done with a bottle of water to cool down from the steam room but they don't sell any. 20 minutes or so later two of us were taken upstairs for our massage. The bed towels were wet (from the previous person?) and the head hole uncomfortable. The massage was good but the language barrier meant I couldn't explain to be gentle around my lower spine (I have a disc problem) so at times it was uncomfortable. I also felt there was a lack of discreetness when asked to turn on to back for front massage. Also was expecting to be asked if I wanted the relaxing/toning/draining massage as per the description but that didn't happen. Not sure if our visit was the advertised 1hr 45mins in total but it certainly didn't feel like a relaxing spa afternoon that I was hoping for. Also the head of our party ended up having a row with reception as we all were being charged the same (550 dirhams) even though we had prebooked 3 different packages at 450, 500 & 550 dirhams). Sadly, I think I've been spoilt by massages I've had in the UK & the Turkish hammam I've had previously as this was overall quite a disappointing experience and I wouldn't go back there or recommend it.

Not great - all a bit rushed and impersonal. We went here recently ( my husband and I) after a recommendation. It seems really nice when you walk in, however we felt the whole experience was rushed, impersonal and not great quality. The hammam scrub was minimal and quick, and then we were whisked off to a room for a mint tea. I thoguht we might have time to relax here especially as someone put a wrap on our face, however we were there for about 2 mins - not even enough time to drink our small cup of mint tea! We were then whisked upstairs for a massage, although this was more like a body rub, as it was very tame. I got the impression that the masseurs were bored, and weren't really bothered about giving us a good massage. The whole experience was advertised to be 1 hr and 45 mins but we were in and out within 1 hr and 15 mins. An expensive and not great experience..

Great hamman and massage. I had never had a hamman before, so wasn't entirely sure what to expect. Mine started at 5.00 in the evening, so if there was a conveyor belt of people it had died down when we (six of us) arrived. The towels were dry on the beds, but there were certainly people moving in and out of the relaxing area all the time. The ladies in charge of the hamman part really do scrub and it was a bit disconcerting having my swimming costume pulled right down, particularly as I was also with my son and son-in-law. However, it was very hot and clean and I really did feel like every impurity had left my body. The massage upstairs was very good and peaceful and professional and a good hour too. I would have gone again if I had time, but next time will come in an old bra, or bikini (not such a good look for someone of my age).

Tourist conveyor belt. Having been here before I can say it's gone rapidly downhill.. It must be gerting it's customers from holiday packages. It's the only place in Morocco where you are told off for arriving late when on time and ordered to get changed into robe (grey and dingy ) then kept waiting around for 15 minutes. Rushed up and downstairs by staff. Lukewarm bath, which my friend was convinced was previously used (slimey at the bottom). Given "Moroccan " massage.. Which appears to be just hard random rubbing ... Spent couple of minutes on one side then 10 minutes on the other and vice versa.. Utterly random technique.Pointless to point out the language communication barrier.. But unless you have excellent French or Arabic be prepared for zero corrections to the massage (I mention this because when you complain ..the receptionist will point out its all your fault for not correcting the girl during the treatments !!!) And any germophobes out there's? Towels used in communal areas are never changed whilst i was. waiting between treatments (20 minutes ) staff just tided towels and put them back damp Same with tea staff just collected glass refilled them with tea and gave them to next customer.At the end forced to wait for 15. Minutes until locker room was free to get my clothes approximately 10 other new clients entered and disrobed while existing customers just made to wait to "escape" hardly relaxing ...Oh and unbelievably there is only one toilet for the entire facility ...be prepared to queue..:-(

Great first Hamman and massage! . This was the first time my boyfriend and I had tried a Hamman and massage so we had no idea what to expect! We paid 500 Dh each for the combined Hamman and full body massage which seemed really good value for money. To start the Hamman was great the lady told us what to do and was very friendly and we felt thoroughly clean after this. We then had a relax and mint tea before going upstairs for the massage. Throughout the whole thing my boyfriend and I were together which made for a better experience. The massage was amazing not a muscle left untouched! Be aware that when they say full body massage they mean front too (ladies no tops!) but it was all very relaxing and calm. We left feeling very refreshed and calm ready to face the bustle of Marrakech renewed. This was a great overall experience and I would definitely recommend it to anyone coming to Marrakech!

The massage was excellent, but the hammam treatment was just OK. My friend and I went to this spa recommended by the riad where we stayed in Marrakech. We chosed duo hammam and massage 1h45. The reception welcomed us and confirmed the treatment we wanted and then took us to the changing area. Inside the locker there is a bathrobe and slippers. We changed by keeping the underwear on as they do not provide disposal underwear.I chosed the package duo argile (body scrub, argil body wrap, footbath and massage). The body scrub of savon noir... Well i got impression that she has been tired may be or I do not feel that she likes what she is doing..., From a very quick application of the product until 5 minutes of very light skin rubbing. After that she applied the argile body wrap fastly and provide the foot bath inside the hammam and let us in the hammam for at least 20 minutes with that cold foot bath (I would prefer to have longer time in the body scrub). so the hammam experience was not really impressive except just waiting for so long inside the hammam until they took us to relaxation area providing mint tea And face compress, waiting for the massage therapist to be ready.Massage experience was the opposite of hammam experience..... It was excellent.... I asked for tonique massage and the therapist did really good massage and she put more focus on releasing the tension on my back with deep consistant pressure. The feet, head And the face massage was also very relaxing. Overall, The massage was tonic and at the same time very relaxing. Khadijah, my therapist was highly skilled and professional therapist. I have tried many massages in Bali, Thailand and India, but the massage at Alhamra was one of the best massages I ever had. I wish the body scrub and wrap was as good as the massage. Overall, all the staffs is very polite and very professional and the treatments are good value for money.Oh ya... Bring your second underwear if you do not want to go home with wet underwear.

Great Value Spa, Great Coupley Experience. Was a bit weary as there is a big warning message on TripAdvisor that the place is under investigation for fake reviews but I think it was really good experience and great value for money.We had the Duo Bath and Massage experience which worked out to 550 DHM each. It comprised of a (very) hot bath soak with Oranges, Bath Salts and Argan Oil where we had head and face massages. This was followed by a 1 hour full body massage which was so good that I nodded off for a while. Finally we had a foot massage which I wasn't expecting to be included in the package which was very nice.The is a very small piece of criticism that I would give. It would have been nice if there was some advice given when I booked as to what to wear and what to expect. To that effect, I think the below tips are useful, if you are doing the same experience:* Bring some spare dry underwear, or bring along and slip into swimming shorts/costume before you go for the treatments* I'm sure my wife would agree; Ladies, please leave inhibitions at home. you will be seen almost completely naked by your partner and the masseuse in the treatment rooms. Also, a full body massage means chest as well.It seemed quiet when we visited so didn't feel as rushed as some people say in their reviews. Would definitely and probably visit again if we travel to Marrakech again.

Wonderfully relaxing - great value. We went for a hamam and massage combo and it was wonderful. It started with the hamam which was a steam, intense scrub and then a nice petal foot bath. This was followed by a foot massage, mint tea and cold face flannel. Next was the massage, which was really good and lasted ages. The place is clean, slippers and robes are provided, the staff are attentive and nice and you can go in as a couple. All in all it was a wonderfully relaxing experience to escape the craziness of outside. Remember to bring swim stuff to change into, otherwise you'll have very wet underwear!

Duo Hammam massage. +:-clean-polite-nice overall atmosphere -slippers and bathrobes provided and clean-:-no refreshment except mint tea but no time to drink it-massage was more back rub than proper massage-no breaks between hammam and massage and after the massage straight to the changing room:a bit abrupt-bad reaction of my face skin due to the oil

2.5hrs of luxury, excellent value. I went for a package (£60) comprising hamman (scrubbed to an inch of my life:-)), foot massage, 1hr full body massage, followed by a divine soak in their rose petal laden bathes which included a facial & massage - this was heaven. I found the staff to be great, though you were sort of moved from one person to the next - though in my case this was done seamlessly. It's relatively easy to find being near the La Sultana restaurant just off the main street near the tombs & Bahia Palace, Kasbar Street. Would definitely return. You just need to remember your swimsuit - they then provide you with a bathrobe and slippers during your stay. There is also a small shower in the changing rooms along with a locker for your clothes.

Relaxing. Went for the hamam and massage. Didn't know what i was gettinng myself in for and my underwear got soaked in the hamam. Massage lovely and relaxing. Would go again (although maybe just the massage next time!).

Hammam and Massage, Perfect during a holiday. Found this place quite randomly while visiting the Tombs Saadiens, The place was clean,professional and delivered on the expectations. The experience was not hurried or harassed. Totally recommend/

Enchanting....... Having just spent a week in Morocco it was a very welcome treat to enjoy such a wonderful, calming, relaxing experience as we had at the Les Bains de l'Alhambra - staff were amazing and added to the whole experience. Very good value for money and a memory that will last always.We stumbled upon it by complete chance but should you wish to seek it out, and i suggest you do, find the Kasbah cafe and you will soon be guided to there :)

Ultimate relaxation. Booked in for a hammam and tonique massage for our first full day in Marrakech - under the recommendation from our Riad (Amin). The hammam is certainly an experience to try as you are scrubbed and showered down with "Le savon noir" black sofa and exfoliating scrub. You are left to relax in the warming room - like a sauna- for periods before they enter back in to wash off the soap and wah your feet in rose petal water. You are then taken to a separate room to relax further, where you are given a foot and face massage and mint tea! Before you then head up for the massage in an upstairs room - having been my first ever massage it has certainly set the bar high!! Nothing but relaxing and left Les Bains de l'Alhambra feeling great. Tried to book in again for our last day before flying home, but was fully booked so recommend to book in advance to avoid disappointment.

Very professional - and not too expensive. It's hard to find some place to trust after a few days in Marrakech, but we did well to get to Les Bains de L'Alhambra. Very professional women, speaking very softly - just entering the place is already part of the experience. We had 1h massages at the cost of around 30 euros each, and it was one of the best in my life. Highly recommended!

Amazing experience.. After reading some of the reviews, i was very hesitant but decided to try it anyways. My experience with this Hammam was incredible. The scrub and steam was refreshing followed by an amazing massage.....no one asked me for a tip even though i generously offered one for the great service. I would highly recommend this location for anyone travelling in Marrakech who wanted the "true authentic Hammam" experience.

Wonderful Experience, Very Relaxing. After a long and tiring day exploring the Souk, this is just what we needed to unwind. We were greeted by warm and friendly staff and this was the case for the entire experience. We went during the evening when it was pretty busy so had to wait for long periods between treatments, this however did not take anything away from the experience as we were quite happy to relax on the lounge sipping mint tea. Neither my friend nor myself had been to an hammam before so we were not prepared for the most vigorous scrub of our lives, there was a point when I had a little peek to ensure that my skin was still intact. Joke, it was rough but done with care. The smoothness of my skin afterwards made every moment of the scrub worth it. The foot massage was really good, but could have been longer. Good value for money and I would certainly go back.

Very relaxing environment. My husband and I came here on the recommendation of a friend. After the hustle and bustle of the past few days of travel we needed this! The massages were amazing, I almost fell asleep and my husband didn't want to leave. For the price it was more than worth it, I slept better that night than I had in weeks! If I ever return to Marrakech again (I hope I do!) I will definitely go back here for another massage and this time also get the foot massage - didn't have time this trip.

Lovely relaxation in a soothing environment. We went here (three women) on the recommendation of our Riad's owners and we're not disappointed. The girls were experienced and the massage a lovely way to soothe aching muscles from a busy few days. Lovely and reasonable. 450 Dirham each for 2 hours (about £40). Worth every penny for the massage which was thorough. Lovely fragrant place. Although watching my mate have a bucket of water thrown at her was worth £39 of the £40 spent.

Very Relaxing. I came here for some R&R (rest and relaxation) and specifically wanted to try the massage because everyone seems to recommend it. I definitely got the massage I wanted, which is saying a lot because I'm very picky with massages. I enjoyed it that much that I decided to purchase an extra session just for my feet. That foot massage was awesome!

Massage ok but the rest? Dont bother.. Went there today. Pretty disappointed - I had never had a hammam before but even I knew that this 'hammam' was a waste of time. Led into a room to get changed and then directed into a dark shower room with rubber mats. Washed by attendant for all of 2 mins and then she walked out. Waited and waited. Room was warm but not steamy or anything. Had to stick my head out the door just to get attention of attendant! What the?.... Then almost on request I was given the Gommage for about 4 minutes. She then walked out again and returned with the mud mask. Applied. Told to put feet in rose water bath. Hmmmm I wander how many other feet had been in it already? Left alone again. Then attendant comes back about 10 mins later and washes my face and hair with shampoo. No conditioner or anything so of course it gets super tangled. Great. Hammam may be 45 mins but really its just an expensive couple of showers and an exfoliation with a mit. Right. Total time of hammam was really about 10 mins with the rest of the time waiting for the next bit. I was then led into a room with sofa beds. Start getting a foot rub and something cooling on my face - but sure enough just as it starts to improve im whipped upstairs for the massage. Good massage - relaxing - not strong at all. That was the best part about it all. Hammam aspect was a waste of time - wished id saved my money and just had a massage. Shame because its nearly the same price as much more upmarket places. Ah well next time.
Scrubbed within an inch!!!. A lovely relaxing hammam, went with my husband and felt really relaxed and rejuvenated afterwards, the foot massage was divine!! definately recommend wish i had two now!!!

go for the massage skip the rest. like other reviewers, we also went on the recommendation of our riad and at first were shocked by the awfulness of the place - put into a room shared by both genders on wet (i.e. not changed between guests) towels/sheets to lie down in very heavy robes (with underpants/knickers on)then into a bathing area that was also obviously not cleaned (my friend found a used bandaid in her foot-soaking water - ewwww) on squishy cushions (again not changed between guests) - 2 attendants came in and very lackadaisically splashed and soaped us, then upturned buckets over our heads - i guess that was the hammam! (note that i've been spoiled by Turkish baths in Istanbul, where you get personalized service by very sweet attendants)back to the wet beds to lie around for a while and at some point an attendant rubbed our feet for less than 1 minute - 2 little girls came in wearing towels around their waists (no idea where their parents were) and 2 men came in and were put on beds very close to them!finally came the good part of a full body massage by a very competent professional masseuse and then baths in rosewater with nice scalp massages - so it ended well, but honestly out of about 1 2/3 hours, only the last 1/2 hour was at all pleasantwe told all this to the cashier and she seemed genuinely interested in our comments so maybe there will be some improvements - but meanwhile, only go for the massage and forget the rest!

Disappointing. We went to this place on the recommendation of our Riad. I have to say, I was disappointed. We signed up for a hammam and massage for 1 hour 45 minutes. The hammam, body scraping part was supposed to be 45 minutes, but was actually less than 5. The women doing it, seemed bored and uninterested. They did a quick 3 minutes then left us lying there for over 40 minutes. Honestly, I could have been lying by the side of the pool in our hotel- for free. I asked if they could do a bit more, which they did, this time quite hard, and they then threw hot water at me which they knew would sting.Then I had a 'massage' which was very weak. It was more like being rubbed with oil, rather than massaged. I politely asked if she could do it harder, twice, but she didn't respond.The changing room was cramped and uncomfortable. The shower was pathetic behind a plastic curtain.I actually left without paying the full amount, I was so disappointed. Of course they were annoyed and said they would ring our Riad, which they did- and had the nerve to ask the Riad to pay the difference! I suspect the Riad was getting a kick back for recommending them- so when the Riad owner told me this I told her not to pay it and they shouldn't be treating her recommendations this way.After this, I am now sceptical about taking a recommendation for anything from the Riad...as I suspect they have relationships with various companies and only recommend places which they get kick backs from.Marrakesh was disappointing in general, I had been there before twice and enjoyed it, but this time I found the constant haggling over prices and the rip off sellers in the souks exhausting. The taxi drivers were so difficult we decided to walk whenever we could. They attempted to charge us 5 times the going rate. The best way to deal with them is to ignore their price fixing suggestions, just get in, then hand them 10 DH when you get out. Never agree a rate, as it will always be way more than is fair.On top,of this, the men were gawping at my teenage daughter in her shorts. It was most uncomfortable, and I feel that the locals actually have no respect for tourists. They only tolerate us to get out money. There are lots of other warm countries to visit, and this one is dirty, unbelievably smelly and quite disgusting. I'm sorry to say, I've gone off Marrakesh and won't be returning.

Great experiance. This is a Ham-mam and Spa , but not like any you would have experienced in the UK .I would recommend it and it is worth every penny for the full body Massage.It is very traditional and run totally by women. The atmosphere is a bit confusing because not much English is spoken but the staff try to instruct you by pointing and smiling a lot.The mix of water bath and Red velvet curtains was a bit off putting but it felt very realistic in a Marrakesh type of way !

Impressive Service. I have to say I was quite reluctant to visit Les Bains de l'Alhambra after some of the reviews on here, however, I have to say I was very impressed by the service I received. It's placed in a very convenient location and is readily accessible; that was a relief, especially given the hustle and bustle of life in Marrakech. After we entered, we were warmly greeted and this hospitality was extended through the entire visit. The place is also very clean indeed, which is exactly what you want when spending time at a place such as this. The massage in particular was the one thing that stood out, although all the services I experienced were top notch overall. I'd definitely recommend Les Bains de l'Alhambra for anyone visiting Marrakech and I'll certainly be back in the not too distant future.

disapointing. Two years ago I went to this place with my partner & it was a wonderful experience!Now they all require retraining!Whilst one of us was getting a massage the therapist was yarning & sniffing!Charming!Also, were rushed out once our massages & baths were finished.We weren't given time to relax on the recliners, drink tea or water!Unfortunately has turned into get em in & get em out place...not recommended!!

Quite good but a bit of a conveyor belt. It was like going to a drive thru hammam but a nice foot massage . Also we got in trouble because we took too long getting changed and we were not meant to use the shower

Not started we'll but ended up great!. Me and my friend were recommend by our riad to go to this hammam and upon arrival we were shocked at how busy it was and the experience didn't start well. We got changed and told to sit down on wet sun beds and relax but behind the curtains there was the staff laughing,chatting away and it was anything but relaxing. We were going to walk out but decided to stay. As we had our treatment the girls working there kept laughing and talking lto each other in Arabic with no interest of what they were doing. I had been to hammam before in marrakech and new this was not right. We complained and the end to the hammam and they apologised and advised they would speak to their boss to let them know. We also spoke to the riad who was very surprised of our feedback and called the owner himself to complain and we were offered to go back the next day for a complementary massage. Now this was a whole different experience! It was perfect! The massage was great and they were friendly and we truly relaxed! I would recommend this hammam but I would suggest to go during the day as in the evening it can get quite busy.

Worst massage ever!. So me and my wife decided to go to this spa because it was recommended by our hotel manager (maybe because they have some sort of business deal in place). We were going to go to heritage spa before the recommendation and I wish I had now. Anyway, when we arrived I asked what the moroccan massage was like and the woman at front desk said it was a little rough but good for your muscles, this sounded like it was exactly what I needed so I went with it and my wife got a pregnancy massage, both 1 hour treatments. So we changed into the robes that were given which look like they never get washed. They started the massage and it was very very weak, I thought maybe they get into it after a while and start applying some pressure. So 30 minutes passed by and the ladies left the room for 10 minutes. Me and the wife were confused and thought it can't be finished can it? So they came back after 10 minutes and told us that the massage was over!! We were shocked!! They then took us into another room where we had tea and were given a 5 minute foot massage, they kept us in that room for about 20 minutes.At this point I realised this is what they meant by 1 hour.When we were done the woman at front desk asked how it was and I told her it was a weak massage and nothing like described. She said I should have told the masseuse to apply more pressure, I told her I thought it was going to be rough by what she said so I didn't think there was any need and plus the massage didn't last long. Anyway we left and it was a waste of 350 dirhams each! I wouldn't recommend going here even if it is recommended by someone as they are probably going to get a cut. I left feeling the same as when I went in with my aches and pains.....worst massage ever!!

A great place to experience a true hamman scrub. Great service and an indulgent combination of treatments! As recommended and booked for us by our Riad, we headed down for a hamman and massage duo. We changed in one of two small changing rooms then were sat in a hamman wet room, where a surprisingly strong lady doused us with hot water and covered us in black eucalyptus soap. Th scrubbing that ensued was vigorous and on the border of pain but our skin afterwards was smooth and ready for a Morrocco massage. Lovely touches of foot rub, hot stone face massage, and sweet mint tea in the waiting room between treatments. Only complaint would be a very noisy tour group in there at the same time as us - slightly spoilt the tranquil setting. But would highly recommend. Good value for money.

Relaxing hannam - don't forget your bikini bottoms. This hannam is just off the main street by the Saadien tombs, just past the Kasbah cafe.It has a lovely low lit feeling to the entrance, the eucalyptus smell hits you even in reception. We had to book a few days in advance to get a good spot for a couples hannam.I advise taking bikini bikini bottoms or shorts for men. Otherwise it's like 1980s sports classes with no kit and you find yourself in your underwear in the hannam.The black eucalyptis soap is lovely. The salt scrub was great and left skin silky soft. The foot massage was a bit average.
Great but rushy. We had a great time, good massage, the only thing was that we where rushed around, and the staff where stressed out. It was really nice.

Lovely massage. We could not get into our planned spa and the hotel booked this one last minute. It is a bit hard to find as you go off the main street and around a few corners but the locals were really nice in helping us get there. There was never any pressure to take my bikinis off as I had read so many other places do and the massage was absolute heaven. The hamman was a bit of a let down but I had never had one and I think I imagined it would be more scrubbing than it was and that the room would be nicer. It would have been nice to have the option of showering at the end. Overall we enjoyed to experience, it was a solid 7/10 and I would go again if the opportunity arose.

a conveyor belt hamman for tourists - not great. i booked a hamman and manicure - hamman wasn't exactly authentic and i felt rushed in and out - production line - bathrobes old.- place wasn't that clean.Manicure was done in the reception area with a curtain pulled for privacy not ideal and very dark. Manicurist also didn't put base or top coat. Lots of gossiping and giggling from girls on reception.I wasn't that impressed at all and would urge travellers to go elsewhere.

Relaxing. I booked this via the Ryad where I was staying. I was told they could do a package for 450 dirham which I took up. I arrived at the time given, I was warmly greeted and taken through to a change area where I was instructed to place all my clothes into a locker and keep the key. I kept just bikini bottoms on as instructed. I went straight through to a steam room where I had water poured over me without any warning or description! I then was rubbed with an oil and left in the room. The lady was explaining what she was doing but each time she left I had no idea how long it would be! I enjoyed the scrub and felt a lot better afterwards. I then went into a room with a series a loungers where I was told to relax. I was given mint tea and a foot massage that was very good. Once the five french laughing girls (other clients) had left this room I was able to relax. A short time later I was taken upstairs for my massage, I was asked if I wanted soft or medium pressure. I went for medium and was pleased with the quality of the service. The lady enquired during the massage if it was ok. I then went downstairs where I was able to take a shower and get changed. A very enjoyable 2 hour experience that left me relaxed and clean, well worth it.

Lovely Experience. As a qualified Therapist, I tend to be extreamly critical of any form of salon or spa. My boyfriend and I visited Les Bains de L'Alhambra after our resort spa was fully booked and on the recommendation from our hotel.It was a delightful experience and relaxing. My massage was basic and I have had better, but for the general authentic experience I would recommend anyone to visit. Foot massage was excellent!!

Lacks grace!. It was not where the map says it is! But we found it. As we speak French it could have been easier for them to explain the process. But no-one did. And although the steam was ok, the whole hamman experience was just that. A process. Massage better and relaxing but I agree that there should be a) a shower for afterwards - just had your hair washed, then oils all over it for the massage... B) BEWARE. We booked a £350 each treatment and were charged £900. What a whopping tip. As I'd asked our hotel to book and my husband paid, we were unaware of the cheekiness until that evening. It was quite good, but I'd like to award it 2.5 really. Have had much better.

Lovely hammam & massage. My husband and I initially wanted to go to Les Bains de Marrakech but it was fully booked and we opt for Les Bains de L'Alhambra. This was our only hammam/massage in Marrakech so we cannot compare it to any other. However, we found the spa to be a nice experience and we have recommended the place to others. The setting is nice and clean.You will be rushed in the locker area where you will be offered a robe to change into and then you put your belongings in the locker and keep the key. You are then moved to another area with long chairs to relax on and offered mint tea but before we got round to drink it we were asked to go to the hammam area. Nice, dark and relaxing. We felt the hammam was a bit rushed. Water was poured on us the black soap rubbed on us quickly and we were left to lie down for 10 mins. The girls returned and exfoliated our body with the gloves. That felt a bit rushed too but we felt very clean afterwards. Then again we moved back to rest on the long chairs for a few minutes and showed upstairs where we had the massage in the same room. My masseuse was good but hubby felt his did not put much pressure at all.The staff were lovely girls but the place is very busy and does not feel like a spa experience as such but very 'touristy and commercialised'. Nevertheless, we still enjoy the couple of hours we spent there and overall was a nice experience.

Relaxing hammam - perfect end to Moroccan holiday. My sister and I had our first hammam experience here so have no basis for comparison. But we loved it! Excellent way to end our Moroccan holiday. Good value for money. Staff were polite and made you feel special. Foot massage and Moroccan mint tea after was a nice touch!

MUST DO @ Marrakech. I have been here several times and it's always TOP!!
Hammam + massage is the ultimate combination to escape the busy hectic Marrakech.
Lovely and friendly staff! Beautiful and relaxing environment!!
Certainly a MUST DO whenever you are in Marrakech.

Pedicure and massage. The pedicure was standard, but seeing as I'm used to the Asian run powerhouse nail salons in australia I guess it was good (I'm used to the full on foot bubbles spa and big massage chair). This lady was more thorough and didn't rush but there was no top coat!!!! The massage itself was pretty good, the masseuse didn't speak English but understood the word stronger so once more pressure was put on it was good. Be aware ladies that your boobs are included! A bit odd but I was taken a bit by surprise.Overall the service is quite impersonal, I felt like I was being cattle herded around and none of the girls were that friendly, nor unfriendly, just doing their job at the minimum standard. The price was great, 350 dirhams for 1 hour massage but I will try another place next time. For the budget conscious this place I think was the cheapest around without compromising cleanliness.

Super relaxing. We booked the package of a hammam followed by a one hour massage. It is certainly a bonding experience to be in a room with 7 of your friends for the hammam, but it was excellent fun! The hammam itself was great, they really do scrub you down and you feel very clean afterwards. We then had a foot massage which was great, followed by a 1 hour full body massage. When they say full body, they mean it! It was one of the best massages I've had, and everyone else felt the same way about theirs. The staff were incredibly friendly, particularly the girl that I booked the appointment with. It was a lovely way to end our last day in Marrakech.

Beautiful relaxing spa, great value. We went as a mixed group of 8 and booked the hammam, foot massage and full body massage. The hammam was hilariously chaotic - they stuck all 8 of us is one room - with the two staff clearly bemused (and amused) at the clueless foreigners, but it lost none of the effect of being scrubbed from head to toe. Both the massages were absolutely superb and very professional. For the full body, people were taken to individual or dual massage rooms, and everyone came out thoroughly cleaned and relaxed. Worth noting that this place offers excellent value for money, having everything you'd expect from an experience twice the price.

Absolutely excellent. I visited the spa during my holiday in Morocco and it was so good the first time that I went back for more! The first visit I had the hammam, full body massage and the Moroccan bath (as a package), and then on my return visit I had the facial and a pedicure.Both times I was given a robe and slippers to wear and made to feel totally relaxed and pampered. All the girls were lovely and the surroundings are wonderful - everything is calm and peaceful and quiet and dark. The spa itself is traditionally Moroccan, rose petals are sprinkled everywhere and there is the beautiful smell of Eucalyptus. Not only were the treatments themselves amazing but the added extras really added to the whole experience; the foot massage after the facial, the sweet mint tea, the bottle of water I was given during the hammam.It helps to know a little French as this is the language used to communicate, my French is very very basic but I didn't find it a problem. I booked in person and through the owner of the riad where we stayed - this might be a good option if you can. I would undoubtably visit again and the fact that it's incredibly good value (as a UK visitor) is an added bonus!

Very good. The experience of being naked in front of strangers was soften by the fact that it was my family I was with and it was a dark and relaxing atmosphere. Staff were very helpful and welcoming, though language was. Barrier!My mom who had mobility challenges,was gallantly swept off her feet by the security man to and from her massage! She liked that! Massage was gentle, I wished it was firmer, but still it was such. Heavenly experience, I slept like a baby!
nice hammam+spa. We tried the Duo hammam with gommage+massage, very good value for money and good service. Relaxing and charming environment.

Relaxing massage. Went for a couples massage and it was very relaxing. The room was very calming and quiet. I did have to tell the lady to use more pressure but overall it was a good experience.I did find it very hard to find but the receptionist was pleasant. But the language gap was a slight problem .

Great experience. Just returned from a couples massage at "Les Bains de l'Alhambra". Through my riad I was recommended this place. I booked myself a four hands massage, and my girlfriend a relaxing massage.After that I can't go back to just a normal massage four hands all the way.The play looked clean and pleasant and we were shown to the room with two benches so we could have the massage together.Highly recommend.

overpriced & unsatisfying. First impressions where poor-The receptionist was somewhat short and unhelpful. The atmosphere was good, tucked away from the busy street it delivered on relaxation. Having had a fair few massages, this was one of the worst I have ever had. I could barely feel the massage & proceeded to wait to be asked if the pressure was ok, when I felt I had waited long enough, although embarrased I felt I had to ask the masseuse to increase the pressure a bit seeing as the price was so high for the massage. The air conditioning was also broken in the room, which left a rather irritating clicking noise throughout.

Very interesting to try!. As our Riad owner (Riad Cherrata) recomended we booked a Traditional Hammam in the spa. Was a great treat after busy day in marrakesh. cost 200 dirhams per person,but worth a price.

Great spa, good value.. The owner of our Riad recommended we come here as she visits for a treat with her daughters. My fiance and I had the Moroccan Due (Hammam Duo and Massage), which was a traditional hammam (wash and scrub) followed by an hour long full body Moroccan massage. The massage was very relaxing and at the end your hair and body smell amazing! (Ladies, a warning: the full body massage means full body!!) We thought we would be separated like in traditional hammams, but were in the same room for both the hammam and the massage, which was much better. The treatments were brilliant with a cup of mint tea in between and were excellent value for money. Overall, we would absolutely recommend this Spa for anyone looking for a relaxing treat during their stay in Marrakech.

You have experience a hammam in Morocco. My teens were a little leery of a hammam treatment, but this very nice spa has rooms big enough for five people. We wore bathing suits, which was perhaps not the norm, but works for a family. The attendants slosh you with water and then rub you with soap. You steam in the hot room, which opens your pores (they give you water bottles), then they come back and scrub you with a rough mitt to get off the dead skin. They also shampoo your hair and massage your feet after a rose water soak. We followed the hammam with massages, which were Swedish and very relaxing.

Avoid this place. Even though I went there because it was recommended by friends, I've had a bad experienced. I took a package of orange bath + relaxing massage, and it turned out that the massage was the worst ever. Painful, hard, half of my body was not even touched, and the girl who did this poor job, spent most of her time on my feet and my face !!! Until the end I thaught it would go from hard to soft but it didn'twhatever, it can happen to have a bad masseuse, it doesn't mean the place is bad so, tottaly stressed after this "formula" I told the owner and instead of reimbursing me the package or offering me another massage, he didn't even split in half the price and gave my 20 euros back, telling me that if I wanted another replacement massage I would have to pay for it !!!!!So, to avoid such a problem for you, professional masseuse and fair treatments I advise you to go to another place like "Les bains de Marrakech" which has a much better reputation

Nice massage, but needed a shower afterwards. This is the hammam your hotel recommends when Les Bains de Marrakech is full. The 500DH program is nice incl. massage and body scrub. But this hammam has no pool and we really missed a proper shower afterwards to clean off grease and clay. There is a single shower in the locker room, but I prefered the shower in our hotel.

Fun girly splurge. My female friend and I had our riad book an appointment with this luxury hammam (definitely not the type of place locals go to) the night before. We had an appointment for 14h and it turned out to be the best time because we pretty much had the place to ourselves and the ambiance was very calm and peaceful. Tons of tourists came in later in the afternoon after a day of visiting. So it's better to schedule your appointment earlier in the day. Staff is very nice, the ladies speak excellent French. The place smells of lovely, healthy eucalyptus.I had the hammam + massage package with my friend. We were washed and scrubbed from head to toe by a staff member. Our hair was washed but with the oil from the massage later on it turned out to be for naught. Bring a bathing suit bottom. You will have buckets of water dumped on you. In the actual hammam (not too steamy, thank goodness), also enjoyed a foot soak in rose petal water and a foot massage. Afterwards, we went to another room where we had a quick mint tea, another foot massage, and some sort of cooling treatment on our faces (I think they just applied ice?). Afterwards I had my relaxation massage in another room, which was wonderful.Overall, excellent service. Nearly 2 hours of pampering for 500 MAD (=50 EUR). I could never afford such a thing here in France. Definitely one of the highlights of my visit.

Lovely if not a little different. The hammam was beautifully decorated. The changing room is not very large so be prepared to wear easy clothing to change in and out of. Make sure you wear bikini bottoms or a spare pair of underwear as you will get wet! The staff do not speak English very well at all so we were just led around without understanding of knowing what was happening. We went into the sauna first were buckets of water were literally thrown on us, then left for an undetermined amount of time. After that we were scrubbed till there was no skin left on our bodies, it was quite painful but also quite nice. Then left again for another undetermined amount of time. After that we had more water thrown on us. Then we went to the massage portion of our day which was lovely but modesty is not an issue! While the experience was quite different and a bit shocking at times it was lovely and kind of fun to experience something out of the ordinary spa.

What a Birthday Treat...... This was organise by my wife for a birthday surprise - truly memorable.We did this on our first day (which I would reccomend).We were having the Duo Hammam and Massage 450dhs 1hour 45minsThe first part of the treatment was a traditional HammamLed into a marble clad room that is heated, you are washed with warm water, then rubbed all over with traditional black soap and eucalyptus, they then scrub you within an inch of your life to remove dead skin cells, then you steam for a while with your feet in cool water and rose petals, hair washed and a foot massage later, we were let through to another area where we had cool facial and foot and calf massage.we were then taken through into the massage room and had an hour long massage, this was fantastic.The Hammam itself is very traditional, softly lit with excellent staff, would love to go back here when we return to Morrocco.

Traditional Hammam relaxation in the buzzing Kasbah. Visited this hammam for the duo hammam and full body massage - a total of 1 hour 45 mins and this includes a foot massage and cold stone facial costing 450 moroccan dirhams. Well worth the money.I went alone and was treated very well by the staff and was made to feel welcome.
