They spoke french, arabic and english and other languages im sure at request.The initial reception is very dark but this is not only tradional but it adds to the relaxing ambience which is nice.Mint tea and cold bottled water was avaliable as often as wanted and the staff were always around to assist you.It was quite busy but I didnt feel rushed and they gave plenty of time for each client. Belongings are safely stored in a locker and clean slippers and robes are given.Overall a lovely experience. Shukran

A haven in the Kasbah. We tried from the "duo hammam and massage" menu:" Moroccan duo", classic hammam with traditional black soap eucalyptus and there after 1 hour massage. What a feeling!!! Your skin is so smooth after and you feel like a new person.Try it!!!

Never been so relaxed in my life. My wife and I went here on the morning of our last day in marrakech, what an excellent way to unwind from the madness. It was the first time i had done anything like this, but felt very at ease and the staff were brilliant. We had a 45 minute hamman, which consisted of a body scrub, black soap, face mask, time in the steam room and finally a foot massage. We then had an hour of massage. This cost 500 dirnham each. I would recommend this to any bloke who might be feeling uncertain about going with his wife or girlfriend.

Seems like a spa factory for tourists. Accompanied a friend that wanted a package deal and settled on a manicure while I waited. The chair was in the waiting room which is less than uncomfortable, there is a constant stream of tourists coming in with the gentlemen that hustled them there. The staff are fake friendly, gossiping at every free minute and generally unprofessional. My manicurist clearly has no training. She hurt me several times, tried to dip my hand in cold water, cut my cuticle way to low and had to be told to put on a top coat and to top it all off the manicure cost 50dh more than my amazing manicure at Bollywood nails.

Traditional Hammam. A must visit for anyone who would like to experience the Traditional Hammam, rose petal bath and the relaxation the l'Alhambra has to offer. This was reccomended by the staff at our Riad and we enjoyed every minute although you were unsure what was coming next....

Highly recommended!. My husband, our two teenage daughters and myself had 2 hours of real pleasure at Les Bains de l'Alhambra. It was really just wonderful and we would visit them again without hestitation. It was no problem that my husband and I took hammam and massage together. One very important thing - remember to bring new underwear/bra! You have these on during your hammam - to bad if you didn't bring an extra..

Relaxation. Professional, clean, relaxing environment, received THE BEST hammam and massage experience here. Men and women can be in the Hammam together if requested as a "Duo experience" which is hard to find in Marrakech. Wonderful experience, a must do!

A memorable Moroccan spa experience. This spa was recommended by the Riad we were staying in (Riad Les Trois Palmiers) as one of the best in Marrakech. As Morocco is Muslim, it was hard to find a place that could cater for men and women together. Les Bains de l'Alhambra can provide this service at request, it was another reason to book!The Spa is located near the Saadiene Tombs in an old building. It's small, neat and clean, very warm and comforting, where the staff look after you every step of the way. We were greeted at reception and taken to a room where we changed into bathrobes and slippers which were supplied. We went for Pack 3 which included a hammam, clay wrapping, foot bath, foot massage, rose petal bath with salts and aromatherapy oils, a head massage and a full body massage (that alone was one hour). The length of the whole pack was about three hours.It was a great spa experience, therapeutic, relaxing and a moment of calmness. Nothing like we have ever had before. My boyfriend and I left feeling recharged and uplifted.As advice, take a towel, soap and shampoo! This is my only negative piece of feedback about the place, there were no towels (we had to use the bathrobes to dry ourselves) or soap in the shower room at the end of the experience to get all the oil off. I would definitely go back there and try other treatments, if I ever were to go back to Marrakech. If only we could have this in the UK (and at the same price)!

Lacking spa basics: no towels provided!. The treatments - hammam scrub, ghassoul, massage, and pedicure/manucure are all very good, however no towels are provided, neither are hair brushes or hair dryers, so make sure you are not booking right before a fancy lunch! The hammam is not a steam room, just a tiled room with heated benches but no incoming steam from vents. And as other reviews mentionned, the foot bath in the hammam is probably used for several guests.

A nice experience amid the busy Kasbah district. On the last the of our stay, my friend and I wanted to visit a hammam. We first went to Les Bains de Marrakesh, but didn't have a reservation and they were completely booked for the day.Then someone pointed us at Les Bains de l'Alhambra which was located around the corner. The prices were the same and the staff spoke English and was friendly.

Bad experience. I booked a hammam & massage at 5 but passed by two hours before to see whether I could anticipate it. They had availability on the spot, so I decided to stay. Big mistake. I was searching for my wallet and they urged me to hurry up. Not really the right thing to do in such a place....I was accompanied to the changing room, which is dirty and shabby. Then I was moved to another room, while the hammam got ready. The hammam did not look very clean and it's not steamy enough. There was noise outside in the corridor and I could not feel relaxed. Moreover, as the lady did not draw the scrubbing glove from a brand new bag in front of me as it is commonly done in other similar places, I have doubts it was new.After that I passed in the same large room as before for a very brief foot massage and then got accompanied in another room for the massage, which was too light. I got then accompanied again in the large room for a moment and then it was over, shorter than planned.I have enjoyed lots of massages in my life and I must say this one was one of the worst experiences I have ever had so far. I am sure there are much better options in Marrakech, avoid this place!

Peaceful and relaxing. Wonderful hammam with a kind attendant who realised that this was our first time and took the trouble to put us both at ease. It was nice to be able to do as a couple. We both had the clay body wrap and my skin is still feeling lovely and soft 5 days later.

scrubbed up well. Enjoyed a steam, scrub and massage here with my husband. Friendly efficient staff and a good overall experience. Massage wasn/t deep as some may want but it was very relaxing and pleasant, Would recommend

The ultimate spa experience. I'd recommend the duo de hammam and massage. This consists of a 45 min turkish bath with black soap, scrub down and foot soak in a bucket filled with rose petals. You'll then receive a foot massage while enjoying some mint tea before a 1 hour full body massage. Friendly staff and a must to relax after shopping in the souks

Good spa, nice environment, good to just relax. The spa is not too hard to find. The interior is nice and quite relaxing - the staff are friendly enough. The massage treatment is ok, not one that you would go to if you wanted more than a rub down and nice mint tea.

Great interior design, poor massage. The thoughtfullness that went into designing the place seems a bit of a waste, given the quality of the massage. The initial piece - the feet massage was ok, but the hour long one was dissapointing. My wife and i both asked for a hard version of the Moroccoan massage and were asked to reconfirm this upon entering the room. What followed was more of a superficial rubing of oil on our bodies, no strength nor precision of movement. My wife also mentioned her masseuse was writting text messages on her mobile while doing the massage with one hand...nothing to add, really, after this.

The experience of a lifetime!. Having dated my Moroccan boyfriend for almost two years now, I've heard nothing but wonders about Moroccan hammams; and I knew I had to try it while I visited this beautiful country. The first time we went we made a short-notice appointment for a 2.25 hour hamman treatment that included a massage. It was the best experience ever! BUT I did feel that they rushed me through it since they wanted to close on time and go home. I almost wish they had told me to come back the next day instead of rushing me. The second time we went we decided to get a couple's foot massage. This time they took their sweet time and did it right. The rooms are wonderfully decorated and maintained, the staff is very nice and professional. I would definitely recommend it.

Fun and relaxing experience. My sister and I arranged to have a hammam on our first afternoon in Marrakech and what an experience it was. We were shown to the changing room (we were told to just remain in our underwear although I wore a costume) and given a robe and slippers after a short while we were shown to the steam room, were we sat for a few minutes before two ladies came in and proceeded to rub us down with the black soap and then exfoliate us. It was quite rough at times but it was such a giggle as they do really get up close and personal. We were then showered off and shown into a relaxation room were we were given a relaxing foot massage with delicious mint tea. We then proceeded upstairs for our hour long body and head massage, which was wonderful. We left feeling like new women and felt the whole experience was great value for money. Highly recommended.
Relaxing. A wonderful place to visit for a cleansing hammam followed by a relaxing massage. Lovely surroundings and wonderful staff
an excellent afternoon. visited as part of a family day and had the full worksthe children loved the experincevery relaxing and excellent value
Great hammam! Great deal!. This place is perfect - beautifully done, great staff, delicious tea. We had a wonderful hammam and massage. Plus, the whole thing was reasonably priced.

Best massage ever!. Took my mom here while on a short break in Marrakesh. It was her first spa visit ever and I fear it was a mistake. She will be hard pressed to match it!! We had a hamman and then a massage. Hamman was a little rough for me, but my skin still feels wonderful afterwards. My mom didn't find it sore at all. The massage after was amazing. You definitely a bit more exposed than in the UK, but not once did I feel awkward. Would highly recommend!
Very nice hammam. Nice and clean hammam in front of saadin tumbs recommended by the riad, nice package of hammam, scrubing and massage.
Great experience. Recommended by the riad, clean, good value for money, nice staff. Would recommend to take the package, hammam, scrubing, massage.
Nice Hammam. Recommended by the riad, nice place just in front of Saadin Tumbs, very good value for money.

Heavenly massages. One of the best hammam experiences we have ever had especially at what is an extremely reasonable price! The massages are excellent and all the staff were lovely! Make sure to bring a spare pair of underwear as yours will be soaked by the end.
Beautiful relaxation. Beautiful, efficient, relaxing and courteous. Also incredibly good value for money - went twice!

A good place.. We had a real good time in here, doing Hammam, massages, and more for my girlfriend (you know ho they are).With the only, little bad point, is the time we spent here...over 4 hours, this was a LITTLE too long.But, except that, we arranged a good time, the girls are nice and smiley, they don't speak english, but it doesn't matter.If you should go there, just take their hammam and massage package....
Two Hours of Bliss. We scheduled a Duo Hammam & Massage Number 3. Excellent service and well done scrub. The massage will very professional and one of the best that I've had while on vacation.

Awesome!. We went there as a group of 9 women and absolutely loved it! We were nicely welcomed, the only negative note was that 2 of us had to be taken care of in a separate room while the other 7 enjoyed the hammam together. Not a big deal really but it would have been nice to know that up front.We had the hammam, then a one hour massage which was one of the best I ever had. I recommend the 'duo marocain'. The ambiance was relaxing, the staff very friendly, the place as you would expect a spa to be, it felt like being in another world. I feel relax just thinking about it. Go there if you can, and then walk back to the plazza with a smile on your face...

Good value for money. It was a very nice experienve at the bains de l'alhambra but a couple of things could be improved however. It is decorated very nicely and welcoming. They told us to get changed i.e. Get undressed but unfortunately we didn't know that our underwear would get completely wet, otherwise we would have brought some spares. Since it was our first hammam a few explainatory words would have been nice since the first things the a bit unhappy looking hammam girls did was pourring water over our head - quite wet welcome. It would have been nice to know what to expect. Other than that, it was great experience. The relaxing room was set very nicely and you never had the feeling that you were only part of masses of people getting squeezed through. The oil massage was just fantastic, absolutely value for money!

Blissful. This was blissful, I went as part of a group of six friends. We had a warm welcome on arrival, the steam/wash was fun but very relaxed, the girls that we had were lovely and my sister (whose birthday it was) was sung to. The cooling off treatment before our massage was heavenly, the massage was sooo relaxing. I love these sort of body treatments and have been to quite a few spas in my time but this was an extraordinary experience and great value, highly recommended.

Completely blissful. I went here with five girlfriends because we couldn't get a booking at Bains de Marrakech that I've visited on a previous trip. I loved it there but in my opinion Bains de l'Alhambra has the edge. No, the riad isn't as big or beautiful but it is the staff at Bains de l'Alhambra who make it a magical experience. They are truly caring. It was my birthday and they sang for me, giggled with all my friends and paid real attention to every detail. The massages are amazing. Most of my friends are busy working mothers and left say that for once they felt as if someone else had really looked after them - they loved it! Great value for money and I'd say a Marrakech must-do if you want to have a hammam and massage.

the best. very good quality treatments, we spent 3 hours having massages, facials, reflexology head massages etc, my husband could not speak and said he had never been so relaxed in his life, definately a 'must do' in Marrakesch, not far from a large artisan centre, so shop, and flop for a few hours

Beautiful and relaxing experience, luxury pampering. We went as a treat for my wife's birthday. Very pleasantly surprised! Lovely decor and ambience. We went for the full Alhambra experience, hammam, bath and massage. Unusually for Arab countries, we stayed together and were treated together at every stage, which was nice. Three hours well spent, left feeling like a million dollars!

Bliss those hammams and massages. You just have to do at least one hammam and massage session when in Marrakech. Although there are tons of places to go I would not go to a place that hands out flyers on the street. Also a price lower than 400Dh for a whole session is not advisable. This place is in the Kasbah area off the main street. It may feel a bit intimidating to walk into an alleyway and ending up at a black closed door while locals gather around. But hey, that is a western eye. As soon as you are inside it smells and looks good. At first you have to get used to the dimmed lights. We booked a couples treatment; so everything is done at the same time. First we had a wash and scrub (the hammam), followed by a foot massage and then an hour long massage. Ah, how nice and how good! You feel totally relaxed. One thing to bear in mind; when you go into the hammam you are asked to leave on your underwear. Because you are showered and scrubbed this gets wet. So, take a dry pair of knickers with you.

A relaxing treat amongst the madness ! ... I came here with my sister and a friend on New Years Eve for a morning of relaxation and pampering after the madness and craziness of the souks. We asked our Riad host, Yassine, to book us into Les Bains du Marrakech but they were fully booked all weekend so we came here purely by chance. Even though they had space for 3 of us to have two treatments each they were still very busy, as were most Spas by the sounds of it. We arrived, after walking up a side street and were led to the front door by a 'doorman' and shown inside. The friendly receptionist greeted us and knew immediately we had come from Riad Papillon. She went through the treatments with us to make sure we were getting what we wanted, took our payments and were then led off to a changing room. The Spa is very dark but also very pretty with rose petals and twinkly lights and soft music which created a nice calming atmosphere. I had a full facial which included a lovely foot and half a leg , hand and arm massage which I wasn't expecting but was all very nice. The therapist was very good and I felt very relaxed afterwards. This was followed by a manicure with hot wax. My sister also had a manicure and we were seated together near the reception area with a voile pulled across for privacy, which was quite nice as we could talk to each other while having our treatment. I had a French Manicure which I was very pleased with, although we did think it strange that they didn't put a base coat or a top coat on. Overall we were very pleased, found it cheaper that other Spas in the area and would return again without hesitation.

Relaxing. A quite and relaxing rest in Marrakesh, Les Bains de l'Alhambra scrub and rub and oil you up. The massage is nothing to write home about but it's a nice way to spend a morning. And their rare, helpful signage is very appreciated.
Good Massage. Relaxing massage, nice atmosphere, although a bit pricey.

Beutiful...but touristic. Beautiful hamam with really good massage, but unfortunately it did feel very genuine. would still recommend it as a nice way spending an afternoon, sipping mint tea, chilling and relaxing. But if it tastes it also costs!!!

Was okay but could have been better. Firstly our taxi there was late. 45mins later we arrived and I apologised right away. We were greeted with a cold and annoyed receptionist.After we were left to change into robes (room wasn't all that) and led to the hammam.The lady there was great and had a great treatment. Although other reviews were right when they say things have probably been used before. 1. Bowl of water for rose petal foot spa and the glove they scrub you withThen led to relaxation room for mint. Very nice although again the ice used is probably used on all as it's on a special deviseWe then went on for whole body massage which was lovely n peaceful but wasn't a proper massage. More a rub oil into the skin which was nice enough.After which we were left to go down n get changed. Sorry but this was not good. Shower was broken and a small liquid soap dispencer was meant to wash all the oil out, which it didn't. It was a corner cubicle with shower curtain n nothing much else. Ended with dissapointment.After that we waited for our taxi but as the place was shutting they asked us to wait outside.... Seriously? And so our 2 hour relaxation was a rushed 1.20 I guess as we had cone late (not our fault) and we left feeling a bit miffedGood enough but customer service front house is a bit to be desired
Good value, thorough hammam and great massage. Really good, nice staff, excellent massage and fun hammam

Very enjoyable family experience. Delighted with the service today and an excellent Hamman, lots of fun and laughter for the family.
Followed by a thoroughly relaxing massage by an attentive young lady, very good.
Why not 5 stars then ? I suppose we felt a little bit processed however that's a minor point.
Recommended
Brilliant relaxing afternoon. Well worth a visit to escape the heat of Marrakech. The best massage I've ever had.

Lovely experience. My boyfriend and I went there for a haman and massage. We had our treatments together which was lovely - were really pleased with our treatments. I thought the place was beautiful and was lit with candals and rose petals - very beautiful. Between our haman and massage we were taken to a chill out area to relax and have mint tea, which was lovely. My only negative comment would be that once our massage was finished we were just shown to the changing area to change and leave. It would have been much nicer to be shown back to the chill out area to relax for say 10 - 15 mins on the beds before we had to change and leave. Overall very enjoyable.

what a disappointment and a tourist trap. Having visited Marrakech a few times previously, I was aware that some establishments overcharge and under-treat. I have been to various spas and have had different experiences. I went with a cousin and decided that we would pamper ourselves, we booked an appointment via email.On arrival it was looking as if things were going to plan, we had a "bath" treatment and a full body massage and pedicure booked. Quite expensive, but we were prepared to pay for the experience. The bath was great, then we were ushered into a treatment room where both of us had a massage simultaneously, except the therapists were talking and laughing the whole way through. Not only that, every time they were making a point/expressing themselves they would lift a hand, so it affected the massage. I tried to explain to them in English that we hadn't com eto listen to them, as it was far from relaxing. When we asked them to press more firmly, they just carried on as before. It was a waste of time I couldn't wait for it to be over. after about 40 mins, i asked the therapist to stop tallking, but they just mimed instead as we could feel the change in pressure ( sign-language) from the so -called massage. As we left the treatment room they asked us not to tell reception.. what? that they had ruined our experience???!!!When we finished ( the pedicure was rubbish too, they just filed our nails and painted them) the receptionist asked us what we thought, so we told them the truth. They called the therapists, spoke to them in Arabic, then insisted that we pay for half an hour of massage. We said that it was unsatisfactory and that we would have left if we knew we could. The manager was unhelpful and unprofessional. Instead she broke the cost of the treatments down into individual prices ( which is more expensive) and demanded that we pay for the two parts we had. She didn't even aplogise or attempt to negotiate an alternative treatment, customer service is not the focus... just harvesting the money from the tourists. If you want the personal touch, don't bother, as the "relaxation room" is like a dormitory/production line, where people wait in towelling robes (about 10 beds in a row) wondering when it is their turn. Unless you are fluent in Spanish/French, go somewhere else... Hammam Ziani.. better, cheaper, more authentic, a third of the price. ( maybe not decorated as splendidly... that didn't make up for the poor quality treatment).

Fantastic Hamam and Spa in Marrakech. This is a fantastic place to chill, relax and take care of yourself while in Marrakech. We were a bit scared when we saw some stuff written on Tripadvisor about this place, but this hammam is TRULY AMAZING. I'm probably one the more sensitive person ever and I'm even allergic to shower water in Europe and the US and to pretty much every perfume and I can tell you that I DIDN'T have any rash after the hammam but the contrary! My skin was softer and cleaner than it ever been and I felt relaxed and wonderful. We had the Moroccan Duo and the 1hour massage was a blast!GO ENJOY THIS WONDERFUL PLACE, you won't be disappointed!

Great place, if you want to break out in an unsightly rash.... Looks can be deceiving. Though the spa at first glance looks very well taken care of and clean, nothing could be further from the truth. I had a full hammam, bath and massage, and while all felt wonderful while we were having the treatments, the aftermath was horrid. That evening, my face began to itch. By the next morning, I had broken out in a hideous rash everywhere that the hammam woman had scrubbed me down with what I can only imagine was a bacteria-riddled loofah. Two weeks later, when my skin finally returned to normal, I found myself wishing I'd spent a few extra dirham and gone to Les Bains de Marrakech....

fantastico. Fab Spa in an excellent possition.We all had full body massage because we didnt have enough time for the Hamman.My recomendation:book early and give yourself a few hours there!Very professional and lovely setting.I heavily recomended.You can find cheaper spas in Marrakesh but you get what you pay for.

A fun and surprising experience. Recommended by our riad and a fun, unusual experience! The spa is very dark with velvet drapes. Not too hard to locate as near the tombs. 3 of us (2 girls, 1 guy) booked and they asked if we wanted separate hammans – we opted to go together and had 2 ladies scrubbing us in the hamman. Funniest part was when they threw buckets of hot water over us – we weren’t expecting that! A foot massage and rose petal foot soak ended the hamman and then we went through to the rest area where we had another foot massage, face massage with ice and a glass of mint tea. We all then had separate massages with oils – mine was firm and relaxing. Overall a very good experience for a very reasonable price.

Good hammam - fair reviews. I planned and booked a duo hammam and massage for my boyfriend as asurprise.  I did the research before arriving in Marrakech and receivedsome helpful feedback from the Riad we stayed in.When we arrived at Les Bains de l'Alhambra, I thought the welcome couldhave been somewhat more friendly and the process should have been explainedto us.  The foot massage was just a 5 minute rub, and the lady did both ofus consecutively, as opposed, to two people working on us at the sametime.Our feet weren't soaked beforehand, and the lady did not wash her hands inbetween doing us both.  This didn't bother me too much because it was myboyfriend and I went first!  We then went for our scrub and clay wrap (thehammam part of the experience). Again, there was only one lady (a differentone) working on us together, but it worked quite well on this occasion.She was very friendly, but I did feel as though we were on a conveyor beltbeing 'processed' at each stage.The final stage was the massage, which was very good and done by twodifferent ladies simultaneously.  My boyfriend v much enjoyed his massageand thought the pressure used was more than enough!  Once I relaxed theexperience was v much enjoyable and for 450DHS pp it is v affordable.Most importantly, this place was clean! The only downside is that the staff could have been more attentive to individual needs rather than 'process'everybody.Remember to take spare underwear with you!

Good enough; could be better. We had a list of recommended spas before we hit Marrakesh. Since maps and street names are as useful as a boat in the desert, we failed to locate almost any of them, especially the ones hidden in the Medina among the labyrinth of souks. L'Alhambra is relatively simple to find, there are obvious signs on the main street from the Saadian Tombs in the Kasbah area, on the right hand side when walking southwards.Good English-speaking receptionist that took us through an online presentation. Since there was an in-house hammam at our riad, we just went for a 1-hour Moroccan Massage for the pair of us. 350dh each, totally off-limits to locals but still reasonable for Westerners.Our masseurs were young and polite, had a few minutes of quiet chatter and giggle between themselves at the beginning of the massage. I thought it was an okay massage, though we would prefer more pressure as opposed to a gentle rub of oils.The relaxing area was beautiful, we were served mint tea and a further 10min foot massage before we took our time to get dressed. The experience took 1.5hr altogether. I don't have another Moroccan spa to compare this to; I enjoyed it, didn't fall in love with it.http://londonwingz.blogspot.com/2011/05/charming-mess-in-marrakesh.html

Not the best, but good hammam for the money. It's not the fanciest place and it could use a good cleaning, but the staff were friendly and very attentive and for 150 dirhams (hammam with gommage) it's good enough. If you want super clean and fancy then go to Sofitel and pay 3 times as much. We found this place, because les bains de Marrakech was completely booked for the time we were in Marrakech and this place was right around the corner.

A non pretentious sanctuary hidden with quality staff & personal service.. I booked a his & hers Hamman with the body scrub & the clay body wrap. The place is simple but the lady who attended to us namely Amina had a fabulous cheerful smile & an amazing Level of energy. For me Great service is all about the person & she had such a great way about her it was simply fantastic. We then had a foot massage by another great therapist with magic hands! Overall I would definitely go back again for a slice of pure bliss & heaven.

Disappointing - but still nice - make sure you get what you pay for!. My riad booked the 'Duo Clay' for me and once I had found the location, entered the very dark spa which was beautifuly scented and very calm. I then had the hammam which was wonderfully exhilarating, followed by a relaxing massage. It was a nice experience - a calm oasis in the centre of a mad city - but disappointing on a couple of fronts - firstly I booked (and paid for) the Duo Clay, but never actaully received the clay wrap ( I only realised this later when my husband asked me whether I had enjoyed it!) and secondly because I felt a little bit like a piece of cattle being herded from one thing to the next - it would have been nice if someone at the beginning had explained what would happen at each point during my spa experience so I knew what to expect rather than just leaving me alone in the room or in the waiting area for 5-10 mins at a time (this happenned 5 times), without explaining why. On the whole it was nice, but next time I would try somewhere else. This was not a cheap experience and I believe there is better value and better service to be had elsewhere in Marrakech.

Relaxing decadence. At affordable prices.. We went to Les Bains after not being able to book at Les Secrets.It was a very reasonably priced and a fantastic sensory experience. The hammam, black soap and scrub was 200dh for 45mins and also included a Rose petal foot soak, plus clay mask. I went w my friend and we had a private room, which was heated and one washer lady. After we'd finished, we were taken out to day lounges and served mint tea and given a further foot massage. A western take on the hammam experience at non-western prices. Bliss. And highly recommended.

return to other worlds, other epochs. It is incredible what a few hours left in hands of exotic and autochthonous masajistan can do in the persons.It is a marvel this hamman, in Marrakesh's full heart, the atmosphere from after entering, the music, the exquisite treatment, they do that it is a place for, without place to doubt, to repeat in my near trip to this city.The best the tubs of petals.Albert

Perfect. We had excellent and efficient communication with these chaps before we went so i was already impressed. The taxi driver couldn't find it first time round but when we arrived it was wonderful. Through a tiny Indiana Jones type door into a magical relaxing spa. We had been for the marathon and were thoroughly spoilt, we went for the all singing and dancing at 400 Dirhams and i thought it was excellent value for money, it took around 2 hours in total.

Touristy.. A bit pointless... If you want to experience a real hammam, this is definitely NOT the place. It's a kind of cosy and pretty SPA, where both men and women are allowed in together, which is very unusual for Marrakech. In fact this is a business for tourists only.. And you can also tell from the prices which are prohibitive for the locals. The hammam room is very tiny and the packages are organized in slots of 2 hours for each appointment.. After that, you are invited to pay and you get thrown out. In terms of quality of massages, out of the 7 of us who had one there, 3 had a good experience and 4 didn't enjoy it much. My massage was nothing special; also my masseuse was very young and kept using her left hand to send text messages from her mobile, while massaging my back with her other hand (!!??!!). I really wasn't very impressed & I wouldn't recommend this place.

paradise experience !. I should start this review from admitting that I am a spa addict. I go at least once a week for a massage or some face treatment in one of many London spas and beauty salons. And I would compare this place to the best places I have been to in London. Even thought it's in Kasbah which is not the most popular part of the city, this place is worth a visit. My hotel was in Hivernage and the cab costed only 30 dhs (2.35 pound) . It doesn't look luxury from outside but just wait until you enter it. The whole place is beautifully decorated, the relaxing area is amazing. I had a hammam, massage and a bath and then pedicure and manicure and I was very happy with all the treatments. I loved the massage, it was on a heated bed, took I think more than an hour and all my muscles felt really relaxed after it. I will definitely go there again when I'm visiting Marrakech next time.

Nice enough without being anything special. Like most things in Marrakesh, this place took a bit of finding. Down the back, around past the local eateries and follow the alley would be about as useful as the map on their website! I can't help either as I've just tried to find it on Google Maps and drawn a blank. I think we followed Rue de La Kasbah south from the Saadian Tombs end and saw some signs on the right hand side of the street.We had the Hammam and Massage Duo as a couple (450DH each) and whilst it was a pleasant enough experience, neither of us would go back. My partner has had plenty of massages and been to day spas and the like but it was my first time so we had different expectations. The place seemed small and a little like a production line without being unpleasant. The staff were unfailingly polite and professional during the two hours we were inside the establishment.The gommage was 'interesting' in the same way that being set on fire might be interesting the first time. I am now of the firm belief that the body already has a well developed method for shedding itself of dead skin cells and needs absolutely no hurrying along through use of a mitten seemingly made of sandpaper. The cool bottle of water provided whilst in the warm and humid gommage room was an excellent touch. We then had a small cup of sweet mint tea whilst relaxing on a chair for about 5 minutes and a bit of a token foot massage.The final piece was an hour long massage. As this was new to me I guess it was OK. It was much gentler than expected and seemed to involve spreading oil over most of my body without targetting any muscle groups. The massage table was heated which was pleasant and the rubbing was soothing enough.Overall however, I'd much rather spend the same amount of money for 18 holes of golf. It would last twice as long and the walk would be just as relaxing.

Definetely not worth the money. We were looking for a Hamman experience and ended up in this Spa. The road to this Hamman and the doorman should have gave us the warning but anyway, we entered. The website tour presentation by the receptionist and the flyer looked beautifull so we booked the Hamman and one hour massage. The hygine was low, as we were lying in the relax room on towels that were wet, from the clients just before us. Also in the washing/scrubbing area you were supposed to put your feet in a bucket of water with rose leaves in there. It was around 7 in the evening, the water was icecold, and there were no rose leaves on the floor. This could only mean that they never changed the water and that X number of people before me sat on that same bench with their feet in that same water/bucket. When we were directed to the relaxing room again, we sat down and a hostess took an icecube out of the fridge to cool the face. When she finished cooling my face with that icecube, she opened the freezer again and putted it back, meaning..... (think about the bucket). The average age of the people that work there is 23 years so you hear them giggling all the time, like a schoolclass.. No suprise, the massage was an absolute dissapointment, very friendly girl (but everybody is friendly in Marrakesh) but it was not a massage, it was like putting oil on your skin and softly rubbing it in.... We paid 45 euro (which is a lot of money there) and I really felt scammed... If you would like to go to Spa, dont go to this one.

Excellent massages and beautifully decorated building. My partner and I had the Hammam and Massage duo (1hr45mins and 450 dirhams) which was excellent. We had reserved in advance as we were only in Marrakech for a few days and didn't want to have to organise anything when there. The reservation process was straightforward and the staff reply quickly and politely to all enquiries (unlike Les Bains de Marrakech who ignored my online reservation and two e-mails for over a week!). We enjoyed the (vigorous and invigorating!) hammam treatment, the beautiful tranquil relaxation area and the complimentary mint tea. The foot massage and face treatment we received while in the relaxation room were nice extras and the 1 hour massage was the best we'd ever had. The staff were all very attentive, friendly and professional. Highly recommended.

Oasis of tranqulity in the heart of the Kasbah. We had a hammam and massage package that lasted close to 2hrs, was utterly fantastic and worth every penny of the 40 Euro (or so) Staff were polite and courteous and since my wife is pregnant they were very attentive. This is a cheaper and easier to book alternative to Les Bains de Marrakesh but I reallly couldn't imagine it gets much better than this and my wife and I were very impressed withe both the hammam and massage. Considering how hectic the Soukhs and Kasbah are in Marrakech this was a perfect antidote.Highly recommended.

wonderful respite from the craziness of Marrakech!!!. having enjoyed a hammam last year in Essaouira, my girlfriend and I booked up at Les Bains which was recommended by our Riad. We could not have spent a better couple of hours - pure pampering and relaxation!!! The spa itself is divine - very stylishly decorated, very cool and very luxurious. Upon arrival we were given a locker and a place to change into our robes and slippers then escorted to a relaxation area where we reclined for 5 minutes before being called for our hamman. This was a very very enjoyable and fun filled session with the two young girls who worked there - they were so friendly and happy in their work and took great delight in our squeals of surprise with the vigourous scrubbing, buckets of water over our heads and the toe pulling!!! ( watch out for that one!!! - bit of a shocker but afterwards - oh my goodness, the feeling!!!) We left the hammam feeling cleaner and softer than ever before.We were then taken back to the relaxation area and given some mint tea and then a foot massage. After 10 minutes we were taken upstairs to the treatment rooms. We had both booked a 1 hour moroccan full body massage which was absolutely divine - one of the best massages I have ever had.I cannot recommend Les Bains de L'alhambra highly enough. In fact, in the heat, dust and sweat of Marrakech, I would say a visit here in an absolute must!!!!

Perfect ending for your holidays in Marrakech. After 7 days spent in Morocco walking a lot, riding on camels, spending hours in a bus, trekking in mountains... Les Bains de l'Alhambra was definitely the best choice to end our holidays. We had an appointment by the end of the day (6pm) but our bus driver extended our day trip without notice, so we were 30minutes late. We asked the receptionist if it was still possible to get the hammam/ oriental bath package and she said we had to wait a bit so they could prepare everything. They were so kind to us, offered mint tea while we waited and treated us the best way possible. The hammam lady was really funny even though we didn't speak a lot of french to her. Even though we were late, we didn't feel rushed and the hammam felt so good too!Oh and that head massage during the oriental bath did miracles!They are all very polite and friendly people, constantly making sure everything is fine.
Horrendous and dirty. Do not go here, it was the worst experience of our trip to Marrakech. Dirty place and aggressive treatment - not relaxing at all. Disgusting.
Wonderful experience!. A great selection of treatments at reasonable prices. The massage was among the best I've ever had!

Wonderful Experience. we arrived an hour and half early for our appointment after walking all day. we were recieved pleasantly and courteously by all staff who could not do enough to help us. we had booked a package that lasted approx 2 and a quarter hours (we were there 3 and a half) and this wasnt because we were left waiting. we thoroughly enjoyed every part of the spa experience from the hammam to the rose petal bath and the full body massage with hot stones. all in all it was one of the best experiences of Marrakech and i woud recommend it to anyone.

Wow! . This was my first time at a hammam and will not be my last. From the moment you step in you are taken amazing care of. Greeted with tea and water, then a run down of treatment and oil/scrub selection. The hammam was a great experience and skin has never felt this good. Massage was text book techniques. Professional and friendly staff. You will definitely not regret a visit!

Must Do!. If you are in Marrakech, please try the Hammam because it is really something unique. They did the Hammam for me and my girlfriend simultaneously which made it safe and nice experience for us. Very professional place with lovely staff!

Nice afternoon at the spa. First of all, the owner of the spa - Antonia - was AMAZING. We LOVED her. She was so attentive and hospitable during our visit to the spa. Antonia is very organized, and runs a tight ship at the spa - and I mean this in the very best way. We were offered mint water and mint tea both before and after our spa treatments, which was great...also unlimited delicious cookies while we waited for our massages after our hammam! :) We were able to choose from a whole bunch of massage oils for our massage, and were even sent home with soaps in the same scents we had chosen (a nice surprise!). The hammam was great...it was kinda nice to see all the gross, dead skin coming off you, leaving you baby soft afterwards ;) We were sent home with the exfoliating gloves that were used on us too..nice to know that fresh gloves are used on every person :)The massage was great...very relaxing, and the pressure was good The only con was that the ladies who scrubbed us down in the hammam, were rough when spraying us off, shooting the powerful water stream into my eyes. Although the roughness seems to be all part of the experience, it would be nice to have a little more gentleness / TLC Overall we had a lovely experience at this spa, and would recommend it to any of our friends and family!

Best experience. It was my second visit to Heritage Spa. Pure bliss. The experience starts with warm welcoming with a glass of tea and water in the small and beautiful reception area where I choose my oil and soap for hammam while nice lady explains the treatments I am going to have. They provide everything you need from the bathrobes to disposable underwear. Lady in hammam was nice and comforting. I even did not feel language barrier, the communication was easy and pleasant. After hammam I was accompanied to massage. The massage was just what I need. It seemed that the lady knew exactly what I need. I was so much relaxed and almost got asleep during massage. I highly recommend this place for the quality treatments and service they provide.

Overall good, with some issues. I came here with my friend to have a hammam and hot stone massage.We enjoyed the experience overall - the spa is lovely and smells great, and the women working there were very helpful.The hammam is a very bizarre experience but the ladies were very patient even with me giggling like a child! It leaves you feeling very fresh and clean and was very relaxing overall.Our issues were:- A man from the next door flat came in shouting about the noise from the spa during our massage which was very offputting! - We were initially asked what oil we would like for our massage but they then chose to use verbena (my least favourite) without telling us until I inquired after- We were almost overcharged - fortunately we had checked online before and knew it should be cheaper and queried it- The hot stones initially were too hot (sounds ridiculous, but one felt like it was scalding me) but improved

Luxury relaxation . This hammam is located in one of the cozy areas. We went for the Romance session for couples. It was 2,5 hours of luxery wellnes and relaxation. The only bad thing to mention, is when we had the facial session, where we ralxed for some time, the ladies kept talking, even if quiet. It was annoying. Beside that, they get our very best recommendations.

Pleasure day. We hardly recomend this place for your "pleasure day" ! I was there with my boyfriend and we had the "Romance" couple hammam and massage! All the stuff are smily, so nice and professional! To chose your fragrance of massage oil,and to taste the tea there, will make a difference for your relaxing time! Sure we will come back! :))))

First spa experience... . ... So maybe we're a little uneducated, but after days in Marrakesh we needed to relax, and this was perfect. We made a slight mistake on what we booked, but they made space for us where they could and we got the massages we wanted. Aside from a bit of a rookie error on our part involving argan oil and our eyes, the whole thing was very relaxing and left our skin feeling very smooth and new. The ladies who carried out our Hammam detox were lovely and made my girlfriend feel very comfortable, even when she was wearing the ridiculously small disposable pants and nothing else. Advise would be to leave make up and inhibitions at home.

Superb experience!. We had a brilliant Hammas treatment here as a couple. The environment is beautiful and peaceful, with stunning Medina architecture and decor. I was 6 months pregnant when we visited but the staff were able to confidently make adjustments and recommendations by using different oils and keeping the massage rooms cooler. Staff were so attentive and friendly.It felt like a real luxury!

Excellent experience!. We had a lovely afternoon here (two ladies). We had a traditional hammam, massage, and pedicures. Everything was fantastic, and we had a very enjoyable afternoon. All the women there were excellent, the envirmonment was relaxing, very clean. Very enjoyable experience. Thank you!
Great experience. The hamman and the massage were excellent. The place is clean and well decorated. The staff is very professional and friendly. It is highly recommended.

Outstanding Experience! . Having read some reviews, I was a bit sceptical about Heritage Spa. I wanted a more traditional hammam, while my girlfriend was looking for a more luxurious experience.To put it simply - I was wrong. Granted, I have not been to any other hammam but everything about Heritage Spa was just outstanding.Both the two ladies who conducted the hammam itself, as well as the two who gave us our massages were very friendly, professional and a bit of a laugh, which we enjoyed! We were asked how we liked our massage, and we got exactly what we asked for; it was amazing! The facilities are top class, the lady who was at reception was excellent and the tea between the hammam and massage was a very nice touch.Overall, I couldn't recommend Heritage Spa highly enough!

Amazing experience. Really enjoyed our time here. Very relaxing and very well spent money. I would go back every day!We started with the hammam that was very nice, took a break with tea and fresh water and went to have a beautiful massage. It was sad to go back to the chaotic streets after that.

The best massage and spa experience . Wow! I have been to many spa and hammam but this has been my best experience!!! I came with my husband and it was his first hammam experience and he enjoyed it!!!The oils smell wonderful, the tea and biscuits are delicious and its just a perfect way to relax from the chaos of the streets.My face has never felt so soft!!!We went for the package heritage romance and for £60 for two people- money well spent!I am so relaxed right now I do not want to move!!!

1001 Nights wonderful Spa. we have visited some Hammam, this is with one of the best. A great feel-good oasis away from the Medina. The service is excellent and we felt well cared for. It smells like a thousand scents and the atmosphere is like a thousand and eight. We had Hammam Oasis Detox for 650 Dh and were totally happy and satisfied.This Spa is highly recommended
Relaxing with the girls. What an experience... Totally scrubbed and massaged.... Wonderful staff and wanted to take them home to keep me in top condition...

Professional and Brilliant!. My wife and I cancelled our appointment with another spa to visit heritage spa and we were not disappointed. The staff is extremely professional and they do their absolute best in making their clients as comfortable as possible.Highly recommended.

great experience!. I loved this spa and their hammam package. The staff is absolutely wonderful, friendly and warm. The facilities are tucked away in side streets of medina, but it's easy to find. As with any other beautiful home in Marrakech, it winds up and up, it's clean, and smells absolutely wonderful. They provided us with mint tea and cookies, clean robes and slippers, as well as disposable underwear. Their products smell amazing and feel great! My skin was glowing head to toe! I went with couple of my girlfriends and we had a blast! We tried several other spas, including La Mamounia and Les Bains de Marrakech, and this was by far our favorite!

Hamman and massage . Today we went to the spa. Welcomed into comfy area when we discussed what time of massage we wanted. Firm medium or soft. Also what type of oils we would like. We were then taken to a wet room and laid on a hot slab and rubbed with black soap and warm water. We then had to lay and wait which seemed forever as it was so hot. They then came and rinsed us off with cold water. Very refreshing. Then came the scrubbing which was vigorous but not painful. I could not believe the amount of dead skin coming off !! Next was a mud mask applied to the whole body. You then laid there again for some time which again was hot ! Afterwards you were thoroughly rinsed off. Next came a wonderful shampoo and head massage. Wonderful. Once rinsed off you went all wrapped in a robe to a waiting area where you had mint tea and biscuits. Next our massage. I opted for a medium pressure. All over. Very professional. My partner and I were together the whole time apart from our massages. We were offered a shower but we preferred to leave our oils on. Easy to find if you follow guidance. Allow plenty of time. Very reasonable too.

4 handed massages . After a week in the Atlas mountains a good massage was needed. This Spa did not fail it was wonderful and my first 4 handed massage ever was fantastic! My wife did the hamman and was not disappointed. Loved it

Yes but no to the massage....... This was my first experience at a hamman. I had a deep wash/cleanse followed by a massage. All modesty must be done away with here as the cleansing process, which lasts about 30 minutes, is undertaken while wearing a one-size-fits-all very brief pair of disposable knickers. Once in my knickers, I was taken through to a small tiled steam room where I was instructed to lie on a wet marble slab. The attendant soaped, exfoliated (this is the part where all the dead skin cells are sloughed off with a rubber glove) and covered me with mud in succession. This was alternated with rinses between applications and time for soaking. The attendants were extremely efficient. No mucking around here and no time to dwell on the insufficiency of my itsy bitsy pair of knickers as the attendant prodded and pushed my body around the wet slippery slab. It was a bit like being a wet fish at an auction to be honest. The rubber glove bit felt really nice and with all this black stuff peeling off my body, if nothing else, it gave me confidence that at least I was going to stride out of there nothing less than clean. I followed this with a one hour full body massage. I have had lots of massages in my time and unfortunately, I didn't really like this one. Not completely sure why. Maybe wasn't much more than a body rub with oil. The other thing about the massage was that when it was over, I was given my robe back to go and get back into clothes despite being covered in oil. I felt uncomfortable getting back into my clothes with that much oil on me. A shower or at least a towel to wipe it off would have been good. I ended up using my robe as a towel. All in all, I loved the wash/cleanse in the steam room. Would return for this but not the massage.

Excellent !!!. Went to Heritage spa for Hamam and Massage. It was a great experience starting with the location in the bylanes of marrakech, the old house and its traditional interiors, a very welcoming manager to the actual hamam and massage done by professionals. It was one of the best massages I have had. deserves the certificate of excellence

Blissful experience. A treat on the last day of the holidays, I was your typical awkward first-time hammam visitor but was made to feel very welcome. Everything was explained first, and the hammam, massage and facial were wonderful. If it wasn't so far away I'd be a very regular visitor! ;)

Amazing experience!! Fantastic... 5*. I'm not a massage kind of person but I must say that I feel very relaxed and indulged with my visit to the Heritage Spa. The service was excellent and well worth it. I think the price is very reasonable for what you experience. I would definitely recommend this Spa to have a massage.

Hamman and massage. Well what can we say, fantastic, relaxing, treated like royalty, felt we was only ones in the Spa. Truly a wonderful spa where Antonia and her staff work to make your visit exquisite. Mint tea and water on arrival, private room to get changed in, relaxing area after hamman tea and cookies served, massage well I think best we have ever had. We even had a gentleman come to our Riad to collect us as we didn't want to get lost! Then Antonia took us back on her way home!! Such lovely ladies, atmosphere, quietness, truly a spa worth visiting thank you ladies for making our visit so special xx

Wonderful Spa. It was my second visit to this spa. I did hammam and relaxing massage. . Firstly, i did hammam and after massage and i would say that everybody who comes there should try massage after hammam - it`s an unforgettable expirience. Masseuse`s hands were very gentle so a felt incredibly relaxed. So if you are in Marrakech and want go to spa eou should try Herritage Spa

Lovely lovely spa! :). This spa is so lovely! During our recent one week stay in Marrakesh, I treated my husband to the romance package (hamman, massage, facial) on his 40th birthday and it was the most incredible experience! I've had a lot of massages in my life and I can honestly say that this was the best one I've ever had and the facial was simply divine! The service was amazing, all the ladies were really nice and totally professional at all times. The lady on reception was so kind to us and even treated us to some complimentary soaps, scrubs and massage oils as a gift! After a week of exploring the hustle and bustle of the Medina, we both left the spa feeling totally brand new. We've been back in the UK for almost two weeks and our skin still looks and feels amazing! 100% recommended to anyone!! Thank you so much ladies :)
Most relaxing place in Marrakech. Perfect hammam, perfect massage, perfect ladies, very professional. I felt totally relaxed afterwards. Customer service is perfect!! Try it out!!

A luxurious treat!. If you're in Marrakech and looking to pamper yourself, this is the place to go. The staff are extremely welcoming and speak very good English. They explain the treatments so you know exactly what you are getting. I would recommend the Hammam and massage package, it's unbelievable! You feel so relaxed and blissed out throughout the whole thing.
Mo and Sharmin . Excellent service.... Massage is quality! Facial for the Mrs was class!Very relaxing. Hammam was excellent!! Definitely recommend :)

Amazing experience! . Can't recommend this place enough. Personal and professional the whole time. Went for the couples romance package with my partner, and even though he is not one to normally enough spa treatments, he was overwhelmed at how much he enjoyed it. That is five stars in itself. This place is pure luxury, and the women who run the place are fantastic. Don't look elsewhere, it's the best spa in Marrakech for a reason.

Wonderful Experience. This is our first Hammam experience, and it was a great one. We did both Hammam and massage. Our skin and hair became so smooth after the Hammam, and we felt so refreshing after the massage. The place is not big but well organised and decorated. The staffs are very professional and nice.Highly recommend this for anyone who comes to Marrakesh.

Relaxing massage but not deep enough . I enjoyed my massage and the whole experience at Heritage. Staff were friendly and I felt very comfortable. I got tea and time to relax after and given a soap gift.I have a troublesome neck and after a week of sleeping on rock hard Moroccan beds I was in need of some healing. The massage was relaxing and enjoyable but nothing like a amazing massages i get at home in Sydney that really release built up muscle tension and relieve headaches etc.The work on my legs was great though!

A lovely experience with bad after effects.. Overall, my wife and I had an enjoyable experience. We both opted for a traditional hammam. The women were very hospitable, and the atmosphere was relaxing. However, the following morning we both woke up with a rash. It is unlikely that my wife and I have both suffered a skin allergy/irritation to the products, therefore our only assumption can be that the spa is not properly cleaned. If it wasn't for the after effect, we would have highly recommended.

Exceptional Service!!!. The staff at this spa are incredibly professional and attentive, never letting your tea get cold, keeping your hydrated with mint water, and checking in to make sure the treatments and products are satisfactory. While my partner was getting a facial, they provided an additional foot massage just so I didn't have to wait too long. Such thoughtful details are what make this place exceptional!

Beautiful spa with great service. This was the first time we went to a hamam. Very friendly staff who explained well what we would experience. Due to a small miscommunication we needed to wait a little, but gof offered another treatment for free as a compensation. Super nice. Beautiful and luxurious, good location in the Medina of Marrakech

Amazing - first Hammam. Me and friend had an incredible time at this spa. Found the location by googling Hammams while in Tangier. Easy to see why this particular spa is often rated #1! Owner and staff spoke English and clearly laid out options. We selected Hammam and massage. Incredibly relaxing and the staff was super friendly. The overall experience was a first for me but I def plan on returning! This is a top notch location in Marrakech and a must visit if you are looking for a spa. You won't be disappointed.

Great time and lovely spa. We had a great time at this spa. We were treated really well and despite booking a 1hr45 treatment we were looked after for 3.5 hours. Staff were so friendly and the treatments were great. A wonderful last day in Marrakech, would recommend and would go again.
Romantic & relaxing. We went with my girlfriend and could not be more satisfied. The staff speak english and are very professional. The bet way to relax after the souks!!
Expensive but well worth it!. Had a relaxing couple of hours here and enjoyed the experience of a Moroccan hammam. Beautiful setting and lovely staff

Very nice . Me and my girlfriend had a wonderful relaxing time here, they were all so friendly and wonderful people, their prices were very reasonable, plus they gave us extras on the house 😊
If you want a spa then go to this one

Beautiful Spa Will Definitely Return. I booked this spa as a treat for our anniversary. We went for the hamman and massage package. The spa was beautifully decorated. The staff were very friendly and helpful and tailored the treatments to our preference. The treatments themselves were amazing and the overall experience was very relaxing and comfortable. There was a mint tea break between the hamman and massage which was a very nice touch. I've previously had a hamman treatment in London and it was nothing compared to Heritage Spa! I will definitely be returning on our next visit to Marrakesh!

Soooo relaxing!. Me and my husband had booked our sessions one day before (although I am pretty sure you can also go without making an appointment). We had the hammam + 1 hour massage and we were both offered for free facial treatment. All the women working there were super friendly and nice and made us feel very comfortable.On our way out we where also offered as a gift two amazing soaps. It was a lovely experience, a great way to relax and get away for a few hours from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh.

Scrubbed to an inch of our lives.... On the last day of our week trip to Marrakesh we decide to relax and get 'clean'....really 'clean'. Our Riad recommended Heritage Spa for various reasons, client reviews, Trip Adviser ratings etc - and I can say all are correct - top place. We chose the Romantic Package which was a 2 and 1/2 hour experience of both the Hammam Spa and Massage. The Hammam was awesome - we were washed, soaped, left to sweat and then scrubbed/washed to an inch of our lives! What followed was an amazing massage - although we were taken off into separate rooms for this - not too sure where the 'romance' element is there! All good value for 170eur...and we got some complimentary soaps as a reminder of our visit.

Heaven in a place called Marrakesh: un-be-lieva-bly good. After finding the place - which took us a while as getting lost in a Souk seems to come natural to us - we were amazed by the stunning interior. That looked very promising. The friendly receptionist made sure we were comfortable and explained all options in a very clear and precise manner.Up we went for the massage (we skipped the hammam because of some patches of burned skin due to the blazing sun a few days earlier) and enjoyed what can easily be described as one of the best massages we have ever had. For both me and my partner to acknowledge this is like finding needles in haystacks as we are incredibly critical being two certified masseurs ourselves.Heritage Spa hit a full homerun. The additional facial massage was also first class. We can not recommend this place more than we just did!

Massage mediocre, didn't get my hours. I should say from the outset that my rating is for the massage, which is what I was here for only. The ambience is great, if that's what you're looking for. But after days of walking, I needed a real massage. Theres nothing more frustrating than being rubbed up and down, without any therapeutic pressure on areas that are dying for it. I had asked for extra hard massage, but got low to medium at best. Also, I got the one hour body massage, plus a half hour foot massage. I was out within 1 hour 20 minutes, and I had been left alone for at least 20 minutes - in the middle and in the end. Long enough at the end that I exited myself and asked if I was finished. This place is just to feel pampered and smell nice. But not worth it if you need a real massage. Especially if you regularly get massages at home.

Hammam. I was recommended to go to this spa by the riad I was staying at. It was literally a two minute walk away which was great when you feel all relaxed after.The lady at reception (I didn't catch her name) was really attentive and helpful. This place was beautiful set out with a traditional Moroccan theme.On arrival we were greeted and promptly taken to a cute seating area to relax and look at all the available oils for our massage and the scrubs for the hammam. We were offered mineral water and Moroccan tea.We were then taken up the the next floor to get changed into the disposable underwear and robes and slippers. The only bit I didn't like was the disposable underwear didn't leave much to the imagination but this is my personal preference and to be fair it is standard practice in all spas. Men however were given disposable shorts.Next was the hammam. We taken into a room and asked to lay down. First we were washed and then covered with a scrub, then left to relax for a few mins then it was time for the scrubbing, it's amazing to think how much dead skin you have on yourself lol.After that was washing, a hair wash and bit of a head massage then a clay mask was applied to the body and we were left to relax again before a final wash. All the ladies were fully professional even though it was a bit embarrassing for me but that's just me.After the hammam we were taken to a seating/relaxing area and greeted warmly by a lady who brought us mineral water and Moroccan tea as well as a few Moroccan sweets. At this point I felt so relaxed and clean I could have just slept.I also opted for a massage after which was great. It was an all round good experience.

Great pit stop for some TLC!. A highly professional top quality spa offering traditional hammam. We had the heritage romance package - his'n'hers steam soap scrub and clay, then massage. It was fantastic! Complete rookies to the process we were convinced by the glowing reviews online and we were not disappointed. We came out feeling rejuvenated, refreshed and skin as new! A must if you're in town.

Excellent traditional hammas. Oh hat a wonderful experience. My skin was cleansed and refreshed like nothing lose I have experienced. The ladies at Heritage spa were just so lovely and friendly. They explained the whole hammas treatment process, and went to great lengths to make sure we had the best experience, choosing the type of oils for the massage, and even gave us some lovely soap to take home. It was all very relaxing and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. It was a bit tricky to find, but well worth it when we arrived, lovely tea and relaxation. Thank you!

Excellent Hammam!. I loved where this Spa is located. Lovely friendly staff, the hammam was FAB! I returned the following day for a foot massage and back massage but there were just OK! We were given a voucher for the Lattitude restaurant, which came in handy!

Exceptional experience in the heart of the Medina. My partner and I wanted to try a traditional hammam in Marrakech. I know that there are probably more traditional public hammam spas out there but this one was perfect. My partner and I opted for the heritage romance couples package and it lasted three hours with a hammam and a massage each plus a facial for my partner and a foot massage for me. Value for money is an understatement and the staff were all very friendly and hospitable. I can see why so many people recommend this place!

Professional and friendly. My fiancé and I wanted to experience a hammam, however knew there were no traditional unisex hammams. We both got the oasis detox - hammam and massage. The service was very professional and friendly. I did some research and learned their are supposed to be a number of different heated rooms, so I was a bit disappointed when we stayed in the same room for the entire 45 mins. I expected a relaxing spa like experience, but the application felt a bit rushed and the wash down a bit violent. The room was a bit small for 2 people and a bit noisy, but the mint tea and snack before and after the hammam was a nice touch. Our skin felt silky soft afterward. My massage was fabulous, however my fiancé said his left a lot to be desired. All in all it was a nice treat after we walked around the souk all day, but the price was a bit expensive for what it was.

Hamman and massage - a must try experience in the Medina. My partner and I visited the spa looking for an authentic Hamman - and we got it!We opted for the romance package, a 2hr 30m extravaganza of heat, water, oil, rubbing, scrubbing and relaxing. After a consultation on the oils and scrubs to be used, we were led to the changing rooms to start the experience. Now do not be fooled, the Hammam is not the relaxing part. For those who haven't had one, every intimate inch of you is washed and firmly scrubbed, whilst you are blasted with water an a hot sticky room. The amount of dirt that is removed by the course scrubbing mits is pretty scary ( we've committed to having one a week from now on!). From then, it was on to the massage. Whilst it was incredibly relaxing, it could have been a lot firmer (for both of us) and more focused on relieving individual areas of tension. Either way, it was relaxing and both the pedicure and foot massages were well executed. The facilities were clean and rooms were comfortable and calming. We paid around 1800 MAD for the treatments, which was reasonable - certainly compared to western standards.We would certainly recommend as a way to escape the hectic madness of the Medina for a few hours!

Best Massage Ever. Great massage, lovely comfy surroundings hidden away in the middle of the medina.the staff were great, very helpful and friendly , most importantly our experience was not rushed, nice tea and biscuits halfway through between our 2 experiences :)

Professional and friendly hammam.. I booked two oasis detox hammam and massages for myself and my girlfriend for her birthday.We were not disappointed with our first hammam experience!!They were friendly helping us pick our oils and different soaps.The hammam room was the perfect temperature and beautifully decorated :) After the hammam we had tea and a pastry and cool minty water. The massage was nice but short.We forgot to tip - sorry !! But we had a great time all in all - highly recommended!

Could have done a better facial myself. My partner and I decided to get facials done after a long and hot day walking along the dusty streets of Marrakech. The call to the spa was promising, as the lady spoke English and offered the first available time slot. We arrived 20 min before our allotted time of 7pm, as the website recommended arriving 15min prior. The lady explained that we would start at 7pm, and when we tried to inform her which facial we wanted from the menu, she just said something about it being about the type of skin we had. But the only assessment was what we thought our skin type was. So we had no choice of the type of treatment we wanted. We sat at the waiting area for another 20min until 7.10 or so. A guy came in and placed 3 cups of mint water, and 3 mint teas on the table with some cookies. Nice hospitality, but we didn't know if it was for the both of us or the group of 10 who were before us. So we hesitantly sipped the water and waited. I was asked if I wanted to get changed into their robes, but was then told that it was not their usual practice. After being ushered into the room, we were told to take off our tops. The therapist proceeded to slather different types of creams on my face. Cotton pads full of icy liquid were placed on my face, and the water kept dribbling into my ears. She tried to use tissue paper to pad my forehead to abort the liquid, which continued to dribble into my ears. Continuous pulls of tissue from the box right next to my left ear ensued for the next 45 min. I have fallen asleep during facials back home before, even during extractions. There were no extractions of course, just putting on a lot of different mystery creams. The clincher was when the therapist sealed my nostrils when placing the cream/mask! I could not breathe, and indicated so. She used a stick to scoop the mask, pushing it into both nostrils in the process. At the end, she slathered a thick cream onto my lips, which I wondered what it was. She then asked how the treatment was. And proceeded to PRY open my eyelids because I didn't open them. I had thought the treatment was still ongoing as my face was coated with oil and lips full of cream! My partner said his was average and he was not suffocated by cream, which is why I am giving it a 2-rating rather than a 1.
The best spa!. The best spa in Marrakesh. I visited with my girlfriend, the hammam room was just amazing and the staff very kind! We also took a massage, highly recommended!

Amazing spa, good value for money. My friend and I had the romance package and it was amazing! It was about £60 and we had a Hammam, full body massage and I had a facial, my friend had a foot massage. Beautiful spa and lovely staff, will be coming back!

Great Hammam experience - will definitely be back!. My husband and I chose the romance package for 2. I made a reservation in advance because we only got 2 free days in Marrakech. There were a few signs directing us to the place so it was not that hard to find considering we are in the medina with lots of narrow roads. The reception lady spoke good English and got us checked us right away. Wonderful staff making sure we have the full Hammam experience. My skin was nice and soft for days after the treatment!

Romance package for 2. Wow wow wow!We had to book a few days in advance as we wanted a package that involves many staff over 2.5 hours All the staff were very lovely, warm and courteous from start to finish.We had never had a hammam before and felt very well looked after.The hammam left us feeling cleaner than ever.The massages felt like they went on forever which was nice as I often find they feel like they are over too soon.My facial was long and luxurious and my husband had a very nice foot massage. It was very nice to have tea and biscuits inbetween too.Best money spent on this holiday and we will definitely book here again if we come back.

Amazing experience, didn't want to leave.. Our experience was great! Had to book in advance as it was full the first time we popped in. We got the hammam and massage pack - 650 dirham on the menu - ended up paying only 550 each. The staff was extremely nice and diligent, made us feel comfortable. The place is extremely clean. After the thorough scrum and oil massage, we didn't feel like putting our clothes back on and leaving. Definitely recommend if you have some money to spare.

Hammam to die for. This is the best spa I have ever visited in any country. The treatments are superb and the staff very well trained in their individual specialities and this probably makes a difference. Once a again I was greeted with mint tea in a little room with sofas for relaxing on before being taken to the changing room and then to the Hammam . Following that you are given a short while to,relax before your next treatment if you are having one and you are served with mint tea and little treats. Treatment rooms are quiet with relaxing traditional music and nothing is rushed and the rooms are not cluttered with lotions and potions as the girls prepare for each client by gathering together only what they need for each individual. Can't wait to go back

Brilliant!!. Both me and my husband enjoyed our treatments..the staff were absolutely lovely and they took there time with us rather than rushing..we got to choose our own oils and stuff from there selection which was fun..the massage was so relaxing and they made sure they got every bit..the hamman was lovely and the staff were funny and very sociable which is always good..never felt so relaxed and clean!and to top it off we got a discount voucher to a fancy restaurant AND got 2 free gorgeous smelling soaps..defiantly will be going again!!

Relaxed and Intimate - a great experience. Once we found the spa (there are no signs at the Dar El Bacha) we were warmly greeted and led to a charming little waiting cove to smell and choose the various oils and soaps to be used during our treatments while having a mint tea. I went with two other women, and we all had the Hammam Beldi Detox treatment, which included the scrub - very thoroughly done I should note, you watched as one full pound of dead skin was removed from your body - and a body and face mask. After, we chose from different scented oils to moisturize with, while being served little pastries and pots of tea on a terrace lounge area, also with very charming traditional decor. This spa feels more personal than Les Bains de Marrakech for example, and it is definitely a place I will be returning to. Go there to get really clean!

2nd visit - still superb!. This spa is a small section of Heaven on earth. Takes some finding - IMPROVE YOUR STREET SIGNS FROM DAR EL BACHA PLEASE! - but once off the dusty streets and into paradise, the hectic walk is forgotten.The hammam is a wonderfully thorough cleansing, the relaxation after is so calming, and followed by one of the finest massages and facials I have ever had. Throughout this , every member of staff is a delight: informative, patient, no rushing. You feel like Royalty. You cannot visit Marrakech without going here. The End.

Amazing spa experience - not for the faint hearted!. We were recommended this spa by our Riad and we weren't disappointed. We were made to feel very welcome by the hostess and had time to sit and relax, drink Moroccan tea and choose which products were would like the girls to use. The hamam is certainly an experience! Our skin was glowing and smooth in time for the hour long massage that followed. I can honestly say the it was the best massage I have had, and I felt absolutely relaxed afterwards. A couple of weeks down the line and our skin is still feelings the benefits!Some caveats for anyone considering booking a spa during your stay in Marrakech.1) This is not an experience for the body conscious! You are basically wearing nothing but a pair of paper pants and nothing much is left to the imagination.
