You might want to do some 'maintenance' before braving it - and I wouldn't recommend going with anyone that you don't want to see all of!2) Don't put the body oil on your face - specifically near your eyes. I I learned this the hard way!3) The best time for this experience is either at the end of the day or on a day when you are planning to chill out. Allow plenty of time to really soak up the benefits.

Modern, traditional and excellent all round. We both enjoyed the Couples package for 2-1/2 hours. The Spa was attractively traditional, but very clean and modern at the same time. Ladies were great and the management very efficient and thoughtful. I would go again, once my skin grows back.
Fabulous!. The gommage was lovely and I felt like I'd been scrubbed cleaner than I've every been before! The massage by Zahira (I hope I've got her name correct) was just super-relaxing.
Wonderful spa!. What a great place to have a massage. The riad is a wonderful experience. Massage and hamam is fantastic! They treat you with gentle and good service.

The most relaxing experience. I searched for a while before choosing Heritage and I am so glad I went with them! As soon as you walk in you are instantly relaxed and the staff are beyond professional and generous. I was seated in a waiting area where they brought me tea, I then got to choose my scrub for my hammam and oil for my massage. I had chosen to do the Destination Marrakesh package which was a 45 minute authentic hammam and 1 hour full body massage. I found Heritage's prices very reasonable. I was then led upstairs to change and put on a robe. I wasn't sure what to expect with the hammam but I am so glad I did it. They provide you with plenty of water and make sure to check in if you are too hot. I forget the name of the woman who did mine but she was lovely and I thoroughly enjoyed the scrub. From there my robe was back on and I was lead to another waiting area where I sat to wait for my massage. Here they brought me more tea, mint water and some Moroccan biscuits. I was in heaven. The atmosphere is so relaxing. My massage was great, but perhaps not hard enough. That was not a problem though, i still loved it. I left smelling amazing. If you go to Morocco getting treatments here is a must!

Delightful traditional hamman in the heart of Marrakesh- a must have experience!!. This was a highlight of my trip! I booked in advance as this is a popular spa! I went for the package deal which includes 45min hamman, 1 hour full body massage and 45min facial. The price is incredible only £68- in UK I would be paying over £280 for the same treatments! Upon arrival I was greeted with warmth, a smile with tea and cakes. The decor is very traditional which I loved. It was so clean and warm- lovely setting for a relaxing day.The Hamman scrub was great. The ladies who did it were so lovely and made me feel really comfortable. They made my skin feel brand new- I recommend doing it at the start of your trip so it doesn't get rid of your tan. I went with my friend and they managed to do it in the same room which was nice as we shared the experience together.Between the hamman and the massage you have more tea and cakes and a little rest in a room filled with pillows - it was very cosy :)The full body massage was wonderful! One of the best massages I've ever had in my life!! The only thing I would say is the room could have been a little warmer.The facial was great, my skin was in pristine condition when I left. I would recommend this spa to anyone going to Marrakesh!We also got 15% off at Latitude restaurant. We went for dinner (they don't do lunch) and it was such a wonderful experience. We ate outside and it was the best meal we had!!The spa staff were all so nice- friendly, warm and welcoming as well as very experienced and good at what they do!Thank you Heritage Spa for the unforgettable experience!!!!!!!!!

My first 4 hand massage!. My husband and I visited the spa for a joint hammam and I also indulged in a 4 hand massage. The spa is clean and safe, and the reception staff speak perfect English. We booked by email the day before for 4pm, but when we arrived they were confused and said that they were expecting us at 5pm. Nevertheless they took us straight in to get working on us. The hammam was just how I'd expected it- thorough scrubbing top to toe and a soothing mud mask afterwards. My husband doesn't like any sort of pampering so he tolerated most of it for my sake but did say he would go again. The 4 hand massage- omg!! Just wow! Ive had countless massages all over the world- Thailand, Bali, Malaysia, Dubai, India, etc and so I just thought I would indulge in one with 2 ladies working on me. They were so synchronised in the way they worked it felt as though it was just one person. I have never felt so relaxed in my life. It's a shame I don't remember their names :-(It was the little things that made this spa great- being given different options for the massage oils and hammam scrubs, being handed a small bottle of water whilst in the hammam as the steam can get a bit too much, the mint tea and pastries after the hammam, the full size boxer shorts for men and the shower caps for women, the complimentary Sens de Marrakech soap after our treatment etc. I purchased 7 bottles of their argan oil as it is by Le Sens de Marrakech- one of the purest argan oils you can purchase. It was 50 dirhams for 50ml, and when in the UK I have to import this brand from France which costs €42 plus postage for 100ml, so it was a real bargain!! Hadija at the front desk was so lovely- really genuinely nice! The only negative thing I can think of is that the time spent with the mud mask on in the hammam was quite a while and it was very hot. I enjoy things like steam rooms but as mentioned my husband does not and so he was keen to get a move on when I was happy relaxing! Also the same with the mint tea- he drank his quickly and then just wanted to get dressed but as the changing rooms were busy he had so sit and wait for a while. I was more than happy to enjoy the tranquility but if you're anything like my husband you might find it a bit too relaxed!I would 100% recommend this spa. Thank you ladies xx

Relaxing hammam and massage. We had just arrived in Marrakech from NYC and within 5 hours of landing we were at Heritage Spa. What a great way to get over our jet lag. My friend and I each had a classic hammam experience, followed by massages. The staff was professional and helpful; the spa itself was relaxing and I loved all the lounge areas and the mint tea at every turn. A lovely place - I will be back when I return to Marrakech in a few weeks!!!

Lovely experience . Went today and it was a lovely experience very authentic and enjoyable! The staff were great and made me and my friend feel very relaxed! We were offered some lovely tea and offered to choose our oils and products! The Hamman was great and the women made us feel at ease and were very thorough! The massage was lovely very relaxing and probably up there with one of the best I have ever had! I had my first ever facial with them too which I enjoyed but wasn't something I would ever be really bothered about doing again! All in all a wonderful experience!!

Fierce hammam, good massage, divine facial!. After a lot of research and asking around I went for this hammam/spa because I wanted something Maroccon, yet with some western kind of spa treatment. The spa is located in a house on a side street, with a nice vintage Maroccon vibe to it. I found a package combo I liked: The Heritage Beauty including the hammam, a massage and a facial. Every trip I go on, I do some kind of spa treatment because I enjoy them, I need them and it is always fun to combine a local treatment with some kind of "normal" spa treatment. The hammam lady was fierce, she scrubbed so much skin off my body I was in awe (I do scrubs myself and I had had one a few days before) that I had any left when she was done. (You get your used scrub glove as a present, but I did not want it...), 45 minutes later I had some mint tea while waiting for my massage, which was fine, done in a dark room with light music playing. I told the lady I wanted more pressure which I got. Lastly the facial, which was divine. I'm used to the therapists telling you with a light touch or voice when something ends or starts, but the communication was kept to a low. They kind of turned on/off the lights and went out and I thought OK are we done now? But all the staff were sweet and professional and I would recommend this spa, because it was clean, had nice professional staff and it was just a great experience which left me smiling.

Left a new person. We went there with my girlfriend and chose the romantic pack which included hammam, relaxating massage and foot massage. It was a great and relaxating experience and after the almost three-hour session left a new person.Highly recommended!

Best experience in all of Marrakech . My riad owner recommended this place and I'm so thankful he did. I went for a hammam and facial and could not have been happier. First of all the place is perfectly clean.. That's a top priority for me and it exceeded my standards. The hammam was the best I had in all of Morocco. The woman was so incredibly thorough, professional and accommodating. I have a very large scar on my leg and she took special care to treat it and not apply too much pressure while scrubbing. The facial was also amazing. Better than most I've had in the USA. I literally walked out of there glowing. Most relaxing day of my life.

An amazing find to relax and rejuvenate. I had read some reviews about his and not all were great but I had a great experience at this spa. We went for the Hammam, Peeling, Body Massage and Facial and we were so welcome from the second we walked in. We were a party of four and all of us thoroughly enjoyed the treatments.

Silky Smooth. This was my first time at a spa and it was worth every penny. My gf and I went for the 'Heritage Beauty' package at 950Dhs per person which included a wash/ exfoliating scrub followed by a body massage and facial. It was so relaxing I ended up losing an hour after falling asleep mid treatment! The staff were lovely and very professional and I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting a relaxing afternoon after wandering the souks all morning.

Amazing service and experience. We actually ended up going here twice during our week stay, well worth it. Service was excellent, prices reasonable and an authentic experience. Something that had put us off before was the netted thong that we were given at our hotel spa last time. The heritage spa provide a boxer short version, much better and much more dignified.We will back.

The best massage I have ever had!. Went in the morning to try to make a booking. Managed but only just. It was pretty booked up already. I would advise booking at least the day before. You could get lucky like we did though. We had the heritage beauty package which consisted of a hamman, full body massage and facial lasting 2½ hours for 950Dhs. The hamman was hot! The massage was better than any I have had in the UK and was from top to toe. The facial I think was good but I must admit I fell asleep. Would definitely recommend. The disposable underwear was lacking somewhat though. Pretty much just a see-through thong! Nothing left to the imagination.

An authentic experience. I'm not an authority on hammans (have only been once before while travelling in Istanbul) however I really enjoyed the hammam treatment and following pedicure, we had booked at the Heritage Spa. It lies in a small ally in the Medina, and is decorated in traditional Morrocan style with mosaics, marble and dark wood.The friendly staff 'ordered' us around on their hot marble slabs, and we were soaped in and scrubbed from head to foot, and afterwards we clean and smooth as newborns. A great experience.

My first Hamam. This is truly a wonderful experience, from the minute you walk through the unassuming door, you feel that you have been transported to a different era. The Hamam was excellent and you feel like a king. Amina who did my Hamam was very professional and hard working, inspire of the heat on the Hamam. Next I had the best massage of my life courtesy of Hanan, who has been doing this for 12 years. The experience shows in every facet of this spa. I highly recommend this place and would go again next time. Mr. Ali

amazing. we went to heritage spa in the afternoon after a long day of walking around all the city. had a package of hamam and massage and it was the best experience ever. we felt like newborn after the nearly 2 hour treatment. we all did the hamam the first time and it's been very intense but also a great experience. the massage was just fab and very very relaxing. definitely going to do it again.

Relaxing!. We booked the romantic package. First we had hamam together, sitting i a warm moist room, being scrubbed very hard, given a mudmask over the body. The staff was very professional and did a great job. After that we had a massage at separate rooms. The massage was very relaxing but not very deep. Then ending with a facial for me and a foot massage for him. All in all a superb experience, but as others reviewers have stated a bit hurried at times. I also got a rash after the hard scrubbing, but my skin is rather sensitive.

Beautiful spa, lovely people. We did the Heritage Romance package for couples and it was amazing from start to finish. Such great value for a very relaxing and refreshing 2 and a half hours.The staff were all so lovely and friendly, and really looked after us as we were quite shaken and distraught from stuff that had happened to us the day before.Would really recommend Heritage and I'd definitely go back if I'm in Marrakech again.

Unforgetable experience. We were 3 friends looking for total relaxation and we really enjoyed this priceless moment. What a warm welcome, friendly staff, clean places, very professional, we still feel the benefits of the treatments 1 week later... we will not hesitate to go back next time we will be in Marrakesh... we highly recommend this great value for money spa...

Fantastic!. My friend and I went to Heritage Spa for a hammam and massage package. It cost 650 drs, and was worth every penny. From the warm and friendly greeting, to the hammam girls, who gave us the best scrub of our lives, and to the lovely relaxing relaxing massage, the experience could not have been any better. I would highly recommend it!

Perfect spa!. We booked the Romance package for 2 which cost around £60 each. It was meant to last for 2.5 hours but we were there for almost 3.5 hours as another couple were running late. The manager was lovely and offered us a free foot massage as we waited. We started with the Hammam with a scrub and clay mask; then had a foot massage each and a body massage with our chosen oils and finally a facial too. We left feeling completely and utterly relaxed and thoroughly pampered! Would definitely come back.

The Best Massage Ever!. We picked Heritage Spa for our hammam and massage due to the good reviews on here and were so glad we did! The staff were really friendly and helpful and spoke great English so for first time Hammam-ers like ourselves we felt in safe hands. The experience of a hammem is a brilliant one, so if you are even considering it then give it a go and do so at Heritage Spa! I have never felt so clean and it was a great way to end our holiday. The massage was the best myself or my husband have ever had and the gifts and discount they offer for a meal at Latitude 31 (also well worth a visit) was a nice touch. Book in advance, a day or so should be enough. We found the spa easy to find and would recommend it to anyone. We went for the hammam and massage combo which at 650 dir was really reasonably priced, we were there 2 hours and had tea served and a nice relax afterwards.

Relaxing and peaceful experience. Wonderful experience from start to finish. Lovely, friendly and highly attentive staff. The hammam was a great experience and the massage was wonderful
Would definitely recommend.

Bit of luxury tucked away. The other reviews here are great - and this is just my experience. It is tucked away and can be hard to find, but we were staying locally and popped in to make our appointment in person so had found it a couple of days before. It is very professionally run and you are treated very well - as others have said "mint tea" upon arrival and taken to a little area where you can choose your oils and lotions. Not alot of time was given for you to make your decision (I also noticed this at the end when I was waiting for my husband and saw two other couples also brought in, given refreshments but then "rushed" to choose their oils). We were then taken upstairs and shown the changing area and lockers. We had booked the "romantic package" of hamman, massage, one facial and one foot treatmmen. I assumed the massage would be done together in the same room (as I have experienced in other locations around the world). Unfortunately the treatments were not explained to us before and I didn't want to go into the hamman as I suffer from asthma and couldn't breathe properly when they opened the door. So my husband went in and I was taken for my massage. Subsequently I finished an hour earlier than my husband, but I was shown back to the changing room and then taken back to the lounge area where I was given mint tea, water and biscuits (which was lovely). Personally I didn't enjoy my massage and was very disappinted with the foot treatment as I thought I'd get a proper pedicure with removal of hard skin, nails polished etc - and this didn't happen. My husband enjoyed the hamman best, however he has had a rash all over his chest and back since then so he's obviously had a reaction to the treatment. So in summary, it's a relaxing spa where you are treated well, but I would suggest checking what you are booking and what will happen during each treatment so you are prepared in advance.

Wonderful experience, best hamman & massage ever. This Spa was recommended to us by a local girl working at the hotel we were staying. It was excellent, quite hard to find but we dived in a hotel and asked for directions. Very professional, speaks English - you must reserve ahead. We had a couple traditional Hamman & massage. It took about 2 hours. Hot marble steam, hose down, body scrub, more steam, wash, local mud (rissoul?) covering and final hose down. Then we relaxed for about 20 mins wrapped in robes and drank mint tea & nibbled sesame/peanut biscuits & drank water. Then with the oil of your choice a blissful 1 hr massage. Felt very relaxed all day & slept very well. Still feeling the effects a couple of days later.

Hammah . Very nice Spa , myself and my teenager daughter first time having a hammah and we like it . Staff is very professional and they very welcoming , it's clean and the ladies are fabulous with a smile on the face . Thanks for treating so well.

Great private hamman experience. We were recommended this spa by our riad and it was excellent. We had the traditional hamman followed by a massage and it was a truly relaxing experience. The hamman and body scrub is nothing like I've ever experienced but skin felt so soft and clean afterwards. Massage was relaxing. You will be well looked after here and will leave feeling refreshed and relaxed.

Small, private and great service!. If you want all the original spa treatments, like hamman, massage or the like - this is the place to go!The staff there are really skilled and the treatments are the best I have ever (yes, ever!) had in my life!Dont miss this little heaven of true self-pampering :-)

Relaxing visit. Excellent service from the moment we arrived. Greeted with mint tea and taken to a seating area to choose our massage oil and soap, good variety to suit all tastes. Very professional staff, they gave us a soap when leaving to remember our visit and a discount voucher for a local restaurant. Spoke perfect English.

Wonderful . This is in an amazing location and not being attached to a hotel it offers something more unique and is based in what I believe to be an old riad. Staff are very friendly and lovely mint tea is served while you are changing. Myself and my friend had a massage each, wonderful experience and highly recommended. The price is not even half of what you would pay in London for a massage and the complimentary soap when leaving was lovely. Also after day of dodging mopeds and being hassled in the street at every souk - it's s very welcome change of scene. Just one thing to note...they ask if there are any areas you don't want massaged...my female friend got a shock when her breasts were massaged! To be fair she hadn't said she didn't want them - just not a usual technique in the West!

A definite must do in Marrakech. A lovely spa providing hammam and massage. Very relaxing in lovely surroundings, very stylish with friendly staff. Mint tea and nibbles! Very good value and we were given free supplies of soap and aromatic oils to take away.Booking is essential

Just lovely. I do not really like spas but went with my wife. The place is small but lovely. Service is amazing... definitely one of the best. I just had a joint hamman with my wife. She then had other treatments that she loved, while I waited with my book. The staff were very friendly and looked after me with tea and treats while I was waiting. They gave us discounts for no apparent reason! My wife loved it so much that she booked to go again.

Underwhelming and disappointing experience.. Having read all the reviews, my wife and I opted for the one hour massarge and facial experience. The facial was ok, but nothing special and the massarge was extremely underwhelming.I've had massarges from Thailand, turkey and Malaysia and compared to this, this place was very disappointing. There was little technique and and undue amount of time was spent massaging the feet. I did however tell the masseuse what to do and she did change track. I am completely preplexed by all the reviews - as it was not luxurious or even good as what other people are saying. I voiced my view to the the receptionist who, Just kept saying thank you (not sure she understood). We did received a small bottle of Argon oil, two soap bars and 100d off. I wouldn't recommend for the price or quality. You should go else where.

Pure bliss!. My husband and I visited this spa as a birthday treat and had the Destination Marrakech package. It was easy to find and from the moment we arrived we felt relaxed. We enjoyed sharing the Hannam experience together in a couples spa, and were given the scrub down of our lives! We then enjoyed a cup of tea and biscuits. The massage afterwards was excellent, with very good pressure and lovely oils. When we left we were given aromatherapy soaps as gifts which was a nice touch and throughout the staff were friendly and helpful. We thought the price was very reasonable too fir the amour of attention and level of service we received. Would highly recommend.
Sheer bliss :) . After all the exciting hustle and bustle In Marrakech this spa was a fantastic relaxing sanctuary. Not to be missed. Had the Hammam and massage package. Simply wonderful.
Worth every penny. My boyfriend and I had a hammam and massage.It was lovely.The staff were really friendly and we felt completely relaxed.Highly recommended.

Value for money. Having been to other Hammams on the top 5 tripadvisor list I wanted to go to compare. Heritage Spa was a lovely experience more so by the staff than the decor. I wouldn't say it is luxury but is need of a but of upkeep. I had the Heritage Romance package with my husband. The package was well worth the money and time spent and it seemed to fly past. The staff were wonderful from the start to finish. With the facials a lot of work goes into it so that is particularly good value however a lot of contact is made on the eyes which made it a bit uncomfortable and left with a scratch under my eye which was quite sore which I was told was the soap but it wasn't.

The best SPA I've ever tried!. WOW! It was excellent. I've tried relaxing full body massage, feet massage, facial mask with argan oil and ghassoul, and hand and feet treatments. Everything was up to top level. I recommend this SPA if you really want to go to the paradise on earth.

BEST SPA EVER . We felt like Scheherazade in her beautiful palace ! We were treated like princesses by the amazing staff. Thank you so much to Antonina for making my sister's birthday so special. We even went back before leaving. Thanks again for everything !

We left here walking on air!. This is a great experience and I highly recommend it. We had a couple's message- in a private area which was absolutely heavenly. Very relaxing and neither myself or my husband found ourselves in the slightest bit uncomfortable. We followed this with a massage. Just over 2 hours later we came out feelings pound lighter and with super smooth skin. The staff are all wonderful!
mr. hellow good afternoon, i want hammam and massage good hammam traditonal marroco hammam and massage marrakech

Relaxing spa day. My parents and I went through the Hammam and massage treatments and the whole experience was delightful. I would recommend budgeting 2h30 for the whole time with a little bit of time to find the place (don't judge a spa by it's alleyway!)The women were all very sweet and professional and made us feel special.

A Relaxing time before flight home. I chose this as a treat before my flight back home. I had the Destination Marrakech massage/wash for 650 Dinah. I was told that it would take around 2 hours, in fact it lasted nearly 3 hours. The place is in the Old Midena so give your selve time to find it. It is a good idea to book before you go as it is a popular massage parlour.

Fabulous Massage in Morocco!. This was such a relaxing experience, that I was a whole different person afterward, from when I had walked in. After our massages, my husband and I were offered cookies, and mint tea, and the owner sat and talked with us about our experiences in Marrakesh. It was the kind of setting in which I would like to have stayed all day - so comforting and peaceful. The only thing is that this spa is tucked away in an alley, and can be a little hard to find. My husband and I were late to our appointments, but no one at the spa made us feel bad at all, which I really appreciated because I felt so bad about being late. If you book an appt online or through your riad, as we did, do your homework well in advance so you don't get lost like we did!

Memorable Spa Experience!. My husband booked us the "romance" package at Heritage Spa the day before and luckily we were able to get an appointment, the only one available. We wanted to experience hammam but together and also relax as we neared the end of our vacation in Morocco. The romance package consisted of: hammam, massages and a facial for me and a foot massage for him, plus a tea/relaxation break after hammam. We arrived 15 mins prior to our appointment and were brought to a waiting area where we had tea and also chose an oil and soap for the massage and hammam. We were then directed to a changing room where we were given disposable underwear which were big on both of us, robes and slippers, and then began our treatments. My husband and I were overall pleased with our experience and are glad we opted for hammam here. While we understand it is not exactly true to a traditional hammam we got the idea of what it may be like - and we did not realize how dirty we were! The staff was friendly and gave us some gifts to take with us which was wonderful - a soap and also a scrubbing glove. We are happy we went to Heritage and wouldn't hesitate to go again!

Nice and hot hammam. The person performing the cleansing process was quite brusque and gave short commands (turn, sit, lie down...) - no smiles, not as friendly and sweet as the person I met on my previous visit. But that did not ruin the experience. The other people at the hammam were very forthcoming. And I got a good scrub...

Unique and soothing experience...... My cousin and I chose the Beauty Package to help us celebrate our 65th birthdays. We were frazzled from a whirlwind 2 weeks tour of Morocco and just needed to relax, and slow down. We were still sore from a camel ride, and chilled from sleeping in Saharan tents. After the mystery built by following a stranger down narrow alleys, we knocked on a carved door, and entered a wonderful world of beauty and pleasure.The rooms are small and authentic in this antique riad. The staff is professional. We began with a hammam for just the two of us, slathered and resting on heated stone, then scubbed and washed,we relaxed. We were then given thick robes and tea. On to our massages, where she had the hot stone and I had the hot herbal followed by facials. All excellent.Then another rest and tea with cookies.This was perfect. If I lived closer I would be there weekly. This is a very worthwhile way to spend several hours and about $100. So reasonably priced! My skin still feels wonderful.

Memorable day of luxury and relaxation. My wife, mother and son partook of the Oasis detox hammam and massage treatments. All had excellent things to say about the experience. Very polite, friendly and attentive staff. Would highly recommend the experience for anyone needed to de-stress.

Hammam Spa. An oasis of paradise. Pure heaven. All the staff are so sweet and lovely. A and D who did the bath were lovely, sweet and kind. The massage was "out of this world". The whole experience was one of pure magic. I wish I was coming again next weekend, perhaps I will. Adorable.

Good hammam, but very average massage & facial. We booked the Romance package which is for couples to go through their hammam and massage together, followed by foot massage for one and facial for the other; very untraditional but we felt like spending to spoil ourselves. I booked via email many weeks prior and paid a €50 deposit and had over 10 email exchanges with them asking questions. They were very efficient and always responded quickly. However despite emailing them again just 2 days prior to our booking, they were very surprised to see us at their door when we arrived and they didn't seem to be expecting us at all. I had to tell them repeatedly what I booked and who I was. I also had to tell them I had paid a deposit and how much it was!Once we were settled in the waiting room with tea (we arrived a bit early), someone came and explained the process and showed us the oils etc and wrote down which oils we chose and what type of massage we wanted and any injuries that would affect the massage. It all seemed quite efficient however, when it came time for the massage, it was obvious that none of this information was passed on because we were both asked the same questions again with the exception of what injuries as that didn't seem important now! The hammam was great. We were in together, being soaked and scrubbed and washed down. Loved every minute. The women doing our hammam were really great and worked hard for their money and we tipped them generously (well I hope the tip made it back to them). After the hammam we sat and were given tea and cookies by a man who clearly and openly made fun of me when I answered his French with 'sorry only English'. He continued to make fun of this in a very condescending way despite me being nothing but polite and humble and my usual smiling self. From here we were directed downstairs for our massage and we were put in separate rooms. I would have liked to stay together as I thought was the plan for this package. The girl who directed us to the massage rooms had no idea what package or massage we were there for and she actually asked me if I was having the 'four hands massage'..... this was disappointing and I had to wonder if she was supposed to get the other couple who were waiting in the salon with us.Once in, she asked me what oil and what type of massage I like, despite having given this information earlier. And despite opting for the very firm, very strong massage, she gave me a mostly very soft massage. My spouse had exactly the same experience according to him. After the massage my spouse had to walk back upstairs for his foot massage, which he said was average but better than the body massage. He said he would have much preferred to stay where he was for the foot massage, being rather sleepy from the massage already. I stayed where I was for my facial, which took I think nearly an hour because I'm pretty sure i was forgotten for about 30 minutes. There was one part of the facial process where I was left for far too long and I actually spent a good part of it wondering if I should get up and look for the girl! After she came back, the rest of the facial went smoothly and was quite nice but far too long.I was then directed upstairs to meet my spouse who'd been waiting for some time for me (with tea). As soon as I met him, we were directed to get changed and leave. No chance for me to sit awhile and wake up which was what I really needed.We also both found that having to wear cold, wet slippers and a damp to wet robe around the building, upstairs and downstairs, was annoying and cold and therefore hard to relax and took away from the experience a great deal. The lack of communication about our package between staff was disappointing and annoying. We visit spas quite a bit all over the world and we know not to expect a therapeutic type massage from a day spa, but the experience we paid highly for here at the Heritage Spa was just plain average and not worth it.Even paying the balance was interesting as the same man who had served our tea and who I felt was totally condescending toward me, stood over the girl at the counter with pretty obvious distaste toward us and such a bad vibe that frankly i couldn't wait to get out the door. Overall, this is a very expensive package for a pretty average experience. I would recommend the hammam only. The hamman is the only reason I have given a 3 star rating. If we didn't have the hammam my rating would be less.

Incredibly relaxing. My partner and I booked the Romance Package while we were in Marrakech. We were given the choice of fragrant oils for our massage and the Hammam afterwards was invigorating. I've never been more relaxed in my life! Highly recommended, a fantastic treat for a very reasonable price.

Incredible . Do it. Was probably the most relaxed State I have ever achieved. Ever.Romance package was stunning value. £55 (per person) for hour long hammam (lay on a hot marble slab, divine in itself, and be slathered in soap, showered, scrubbed, showered, mudpack, showered, the best hair wash ever, showered) and then back into your fluffy robe. Quick mint tea then both whisked into massage room for the greatest massage of my life and I've had a fair few. Then end with either a facial or foot massage. Let the boy have the facial and so she offered me a pedi instead of the foot massage, as per the deal. Was such a lovely experience from start to finish, all for the price of a facial in london!One thing to note: the quoted timeFor the romance package is 2.5 hours. By time you have arrived, had a glass of mint tea, chosen your oils, then glasses of mint tea given between each pamper session, it's closer to a 3.5 hour experience. Pure bliss!A delish Falafel and harrisa sandwich in the henna cafe just 1 min walk away was the perfect way to finish.

Relaxing treat. We went here because of the trip advisor reviews. We had the heritage romance for 2 this was 2.5 hours of luxury. We had to book two days in advance and then we only had two choices due to this place being so popular. We arrived and was served mint water and asked to chose the oil we wanted to massaged with. We then changed into paper knickers and was led to a hot room where we laid down and was scrubbed and covered in black soap. It was amazing after being scrubbed a few times we were give drinks a relaxed before being led to the massage. I had a full body and a facial my husband had foot massage and a full body. We were give a soap and the scrub mitt as a gift. It was a lovely way to relax I would recommend this place it's beautiful.

Massage. Well located but very grubby. The robes and towels are recycled rather than washed each time which isn't very nice. The massage was ok but it was quite clear that the masseuse was offering what she termed as a massage complet. That's Moroccan for sex which wasn't what I wanted.

Only go for the Hammam.. My wife and I booked a Hamman plus massage package. It costs 650 dirhams per pax and the total duration was approximately 1 hour and 45 mins. The spa comes highly rated, as you can tell from the reviews online and the expectations were high. Perhaps that's why I only rate it 3 stars. The Hammam was good and the amount of dead skin that is rubbed out is alarming. You do feel great after the Hammam and the lady holds you and guides you out as you can get a little light headed (in a good way!). The Moroccans do it once a week or fortnight and it is integral to their culture. After the good scrubbing session, we were still in our wet underpants and hair and directed to the massage bed. The massage was average at best. The ones we get in Bali, Bangkok etc are way better and it does not appear that the massage is any different from the ones we get anywhere in the world (unlike the Hammam). I'm not saying it's bad, it's just not great, not by a country mile. So we look at the price, it's considered steep in Moroccan terms. you are looking at approximately £45. I'm just not sure it's worth it. There again, the Hammam was a great experience, but I'm sure you can ask your Riad manager to introduce you to one that is just as good without paying #1 tripadvisor price.

Fun experience . My husband and I got the couples romance package (hammam, massage, foot treatment/facial). The hammam was amazing! The massage was pretty good. My husband got the "foot treatment", which he found to be more like a weak foot rub to kill time while I was getting a facial, which was a series of a few face masks. I was left for what seemed like quite long in between each mask, so by the end of it I was ready to wrap up. I feel that the facial could have been half the time. The facilities are clean and the staff are professional and personable. Our skin feels amazing!

Scrubbed within an inch of our lives!. Went with my boyfriend for the hammam + massage. Managed to book in the morning for an appointment that afternoon. Excellent location down a quiet sidestreet. Staff greeting us were very friendly. We given tea and allowed to smell and select our black soaps and massage oils. The place was very clean with fresh towels and clean, white robes and slippers. Paper pants were provided (very stylish black boxers for him and highwaisted thong for me--think 1980s). The two ladies doing the hammam were very friendly and smiled and laughed with us as we attempted to relax whilst being soaped, scrubbed enthusiastically and covered in clay ALL over. After more tea, then a massage. I asked for med-firm pressure which was perfect. Overall a unique experience and a relaxing afternoon. We were given a scented soap of our choice each to take home which was a nice touch. Hammam and massage took approximately 2 hours--a nice break from the hubbub of activity in Marrakech. Would recommend.

Amazing!. We went back in September 2014 and again in June 2015...we went back twice in June 2015 as it was sooooo good and it was our honeymoon so we were treating ourselves :-)In September 2014 as a couple we had the hammam and then a full body massage, both were amazing!In June 2015 I was pregnant so my husband had the hammam and I had a manicure the first time and a facial the second time then we both had full body massages again!Each time, the staff were extremely professional and friendly, all treatments offered great value for money and all in all we can't wait to go back!ps. we had a third couples massage in the week we were in Marrakech at the 'Hammam de la Rose' - it was awful compared to the Heritage Spa!

Great experience. Me and my girlfriend went for a hamman and 1,5 hour massage. We never had he hamman experience before so we have no clue if this was good or not, but the massage was amazing. Finally a place which is not " finger pushing" you, but doing real massaging. I have a quiet a lot experience on massage and I kind of feel that this was my best massage experience in my life.. We will go back on Monday just before we leave Marocco..Thank you !
Very relaxing. Relaxing experience at Heritage, my girlfriend and I went for a hammam, massage and facial combination, good value for money. Perfect for couples.

Very relaxing! . I went for a Haman scrub and massage here. My boyfriend didn't want to come so I went alone and I'm so pleased I did- it was amazing! Despite being down an obscure back alley, inside it was beautiful and very relaxing. Everything was very clean and all the staff were extremely friendly. There was lots of tea and you got to choose which scrub and massage oil you wanted. By the end of the two hour session I felt totally relaxed and pampered - would definitely recommend! Very good value for money.

Romantic and amazing!. Me and my husband have just back into our hotel after having the most amazing 3 hours at this spa. Do not be put off by the fact that it's in back alley ways. The staff were the most friendliest people we ever met. They took care of our needs especially me as I'm pregnant 2 months, I had no problems with the ladies and me and my husband were spoiled by fresh mint tea. We both just talked had a laugh and throughly enjoyed our time. We took out the romantic package for couple, I want to do back already!

Terrible experience. Was my second visit to this spa. For the first one I didn't put any comment on TA as the experience was alright but not amazing in comparison with the many other Spa I tried in Marrakech and I didn't really want to bother writing a "normal" comment.But for that one I had to write something as what I experienced was far under the standards of any spa I tried in Marrakech(and I am a local so I really know what I am talking about here). Basically, the only positive things about this experience is the friendliness of the staff and I am talking here about the scrub and massage ladies. What I really was annoyed about is the non professionalism of the Owner of the property. Basically when we arrived we sat at the reception to have a cup of tea and I received a call from the nanny of my 3 years old kind that I needed to take (we never know what can happen with kids!), I exchanged few words with her until the owner came and told me to shut up because some people were having massage not far form the reception area.. My friend and I were literally shocked with his attitude, I didn't even had to chance to finish my call and just hang out on the nanny as I was scared he will kick me out from the spa ! This really has put me in a very bad mood to start what should be a relaxing experience. Anyway, after that we went to get changed in a "dirty" changing room that was to us more like a furniture storage. Sleepers provided were dirty (even wet!), not the right size I preferred to walk without...

Total Relaxation!!!!!!!!!!. Found this spa on Trip Advisor and couldn't have been happier we booked it! Had the couple romance package which included the hamman scrub, a massage and a facial each. It was the most relaxing three hours ever!It was literally down a dirt track so glad the taxi driver delivered us to the door (on foot!)Highly recommended!!!

Romantic day of Treatments. This little hidden gem is amazing! The building had lots of character and is a lot bigger than it looks. I did have a ittle trouble finding it as it is down a random street and Marrakech dont really do road names.My partner and I had the romance package and everything really was amazing. The hammam was a nice surprise and the massage was long and relaxing. The therapist were professional and caring.I thoroughly enjoyed my treatments and thought it was good value for money. You wouldn't be able to get that amount of treatments in the UK for the amount I paid and I have had worse therapists in the UK too!I FULLY recommend this spa and chose this one over the Mythic Orient. The Mythic Orient were a lot more expensive and were charging me a ridiculous amount to use their Jacuzzi. I was very happy with my choice.

Hidden down the backstreets.... You will find this beauty!As we walked down the dirt path, we started to doubt the many reviews. Maybe we had got the wrong heritage Spa? The path that leads to this haven would have you thinking your about to get mobbed not scrubbed!As soon as the door opened the smell of the spa hit us, and we were grateful we'd pre booked our 1pm Romance package.We were shown through and served mint tea and water, and given the scrub and oils to choose from. Our package started with a Hammam detox.Now none of the reviews had prepared us for the process, we knew we'd be steamed like a mussel and cleaned within in an inch of our lives.....but I (lady) did not realise I'd have to be so naked! The tiny disposable thongs were pointless, and if you are a little self conscious like me then you will struggle.The ladies were amused by my shyness and continued to hose every, and I mean every, part of my body. Whilst my partner lay uncomfortably close, taking great pleasure in my awkwardness.After our hour (?) Hammam we were taken to a lounge for more tea and biscuits. We then had the best massage, followed by a facial for my man (he's very metro!) and a foot massage for me.The Ukrainian receptionist was lovely and gave us two soaps as a gift and a discount for a local restaurant.We loved this place, and we'd advise you pre book as it seemed busy. The ladies were friendly and professional and you feel like you've almost stepped back in time with the tradition of the decor. This place was amazing, go and relax!

Refreshed, relaxed, felt amazing!. My friend and I decided to go for a hammam and facial at this spa as our riad was just around the corner. It was so calm and peaceful on the inside and the staff were great. The hammam was wonderful we felt so thoroughly cleaned with the black soap with eucalyptus and the clay mask, our skin is now so incredibly soft. Afterwards we sat in a room for some refreshments tea, water and biscuits and then we had the most amazing facial; washed, cleansed, exfoliated, rehydrated and massaged faces, neck and chest area. The products used smelt amazing. We felt so clean and relaxed it was a wonderful experience to end our trip. Thank you Heritage Spa!

Highly rated!. I am so happy that I visited this Spa for 2 hours of relaxation and tranquillity. It was total bliss from the moment that I arrived. The Spa collected me from my hotel which was located in Palmeraie free of charge which was great. The staff are very attentive from the moment of arrival. I have visited many spas in numerous countries however this was by far the best authentic spa which I have attended. We was given mint tea and water through out my visit and some lovely mini biscuits. I was fully scrubbed from head to toe they even washed my hair however do bring hair products as they did not have moisturiser etc. Before departure I was given a beautiful fragranced soap as a gift. They went on to recommend a beautiful restaurant for lunch it was like they wanted to ensure we had an amazing experience at the spa and our ongoing travels. Please continue to shine as you truly deserve your #1 spot!

Luxurious escape from the medina madness. I had a wonderful experience at the Herritage spa. I had a detox Hamam and it was excellent. Beautifully scented natural products and lovely rooms and amenities. Suitable for singles or couples. Look forward to returning when I come back to Marrakech!!

Amazing experience for a couple. Book in advance as they are very busy & closed Wednesday When booking ask for taxi transfer, as they offer a free service.(Our Driver Karim was very friendly)Located in small building, down an alleyway, we booked for a couples package (romance duo)Hamman, massage, facial/foot massage.Treatment: AMAZING! Tried and tested a few and this beats them all. Very authentic and definitely got our monies worth compared to our hotel spa. They were also accommodating if you don't want just a foot massage.Staff: very friendly, Speak French and little English but always smiling and courteous.The receptionist was well spoken and happy to answer any questionsOverall: definitely worth a tripadvisor award, Very good experience and would definitely recommend to other and visit again.

Great experience. How I wish there was a spa like this at home!!! Such a beautiful place!!! We were worried about finding it after reading some of the reviews - but it was well sign posted & we had no problem. We had the romance package for two - not for the modest - but it was great to be able to share the experience together. I have never felt so clean!! We would both recommend & would have expected to pay far more for this in the UK!!!

Leaves you feeling very clean and relaxed. The Hamman followed by a massage is highly recommended. My partner and I had the Heritage Romance package for two. This included a very thorough harman scrub and clean, followed by a relaxing full body massage and a foot massage. This whole experience was brilliant, very smoothly done in a great relaxing atmosphere. There is a break in the middle for mint tea and snacks to stop you getting dehydrated. All the stuff were lovely and brought you water/met any of your requirements. I would definitely recommend going here for an authentic and delightful experience that will leave you very very relaxed!

Perfect introduction to hamman. My partner and I booked a couples pack, very last minute, which wasn't a problem at all, the website has fantastic YouTube guides to direct you to the location from two separate land marks, very easy to find.The girls all so friendly and caring, attention to detail in every element. The experience felt very authentic in regards to the processes and elements, probably the ideal was to have your first Hamman, as opposed to going to a local hamman, where you need to bring all your own products (oils, scrubs ect)Having a tea break between each component to the services really helps you to feel relaxed and welcome. The ambient room upstairs is perfect after the hamman.I was given a scrub mitt to take with me (which I'll use after seeing the amount of dead skin that came off my body) and two soaps scented the same as our massage oils, the owner even gave us a voucher to the restaurant Latitude31 (we are going tonight) Perfect Moroccan spa day

Feeling AbFab!. We were staying at a Riad around the corner and decided to book a Hamman session and a massage at the Heritage Spa. We were warmly greeted on our arrival and shown to a seating area in which we were served Mint Tea and water and asked to pick the scrubs and oils we wanted. We were then shown the changing facility (lockers are provided for your bags and clothes) in which we were given paper underwear, robes and slippers. The ladies who worked there certainly worked their wonders, they scrubbed and washed us squeaky clean - I've never seen so much dead skin removed!!!! Once completed we were shown to a room to relax in and served Mint Tea and pastries. I was then taken to my massage which was fantastic and certainly relaxing.We both came out feeling like new people and certainly felt extremely relaxed after a few hectic days in the city. Worth every penny and I certainly recommend this lovely place to anyone thinking about booking! Thank you to the staff for our wonderful experience :)

New experience, glad I visited.. The ally leading to Heritage Spa currently has maintenance going on outside - we literally had to balance across planks of wood to get to the entrance (for which we then received 10% discount for the inconvenience however I don't think my online prepayment was taken into account so I think I over paid by £9 anyway - too late for me to rectify now unfortunately!). Inside was beautiful decorated, we were taken care of by all of the staff and received excellent service. If you're shy perhaps don't have the hammam as you do bare all - but these ladies do this day in and day out so I wasn't bothered even though I was a little shocked at first, just go with the flow! The massage was very thorough, all in all we were there around 3hrs and had mint tea and biscuits between the hammam and massage. In the UK I reckon you'd quite easily pay double for this, but then I think UK spas are overly expensive anyway.

3.5 out of 5 - beautiful place and need attention to details. Not easy to find but was worth it as we saw some non touristy parts. They fit us in and also gave us a good deal for both pedicure and manicure. They served us mint tea and cold water which was refreshing.The room was extremely hot and the girls kept the small fan on themselves. Mrs was not happy with the nail varnish work as they started chipping not long after and I believe they could have got rid of more dead skin on my feet including the dry skin around my dead blisters.

WOW...Doesn't Get Better Than This...ANYWHERE. Me and my partner joined Ali and the wonderful therapists at Heritage Spa for their Heritage Experience package. We were absolutely blown away by the level of service from start to finish (and the 15% discount at Latitude 31 meant their generosity and service extended through dinner!) This was without a doubt the best spa experience I have ever had, and that is not a small measure for me, I've spent thousands in a single day at fancy spas around the world, nothing comes close to the few hundred dollars I spent for 4 HOURS+ of absolute excellence here. The ambience is excellent, TONS of beautiful features and details everywhere. We were picked up and guided to the spa from across the Medina for free which is really hard to find anything in Marrakech for free! Upon arrival we were greeted by Ali and sat down with tea to personally discuss every little bit of what we expected from each portion of the package. This was absolutely custom tailored for us, and the VALUE IS UNBELIEVABLE. We thoroughly enjoyed the Hamam, massages, snacks, scrubs, pedicure etc. (And we are both bodyworkers ourselves with thousands of hours of training and experience so we know what good therapy looks/feels like!) There are plenty of Hammams in Marrakech that offer a third of the time/treatments and expect 1000 MAD more for their packages. I scoured every hammam and personally I think this is the best value in Marrakech, and as I said previously, quite possibly the BEST VALUE SPA EXPERIENCE TO BE FOUND ANYWHERE!Thank You Ali,I'll be back in 4 days for more!

Bliss. As a couple we opted for the romance package and we were not disappointed. As my wife was pregnant Antonina (manager) created a bespoke package for her where she had a carina Paris pedicure rather than a hamam scrub. We both had our massage together and I asked for my massage to be hard as I feel that soft massages don't do much for me. I saw the masseuse and though oh great here comes another soft massage... How wrong i was. My shoulders back and calves all had many nots in them and this lady removed them that were supported my loud groans. My wife thought I was being beaten/burned/both. At the end I felt like a new man. Will most definitely be coming here again as I feel insanely relaxed and ready to take on the world again.

Great experience . We had the romance treatment and it was very cool. The beginning of the treatment was a little fast and harsh. But after that it was highly enjoyable. Hamam, soaps, scrubs, massages... All great. The facial treatment wasn't quite my thing, it would be cool if the girls could chose between facial treatment and foot massage too. My partner said his massage was great, the foot massage could have been better. In the end you get a soap and the scrub gloves to rake home. All in all a worth whole thing!

My spa experience in Marrakesh.. This was my first time to experience Hamman in the most authentic country.Started with hot steam bath to oil massage, the therapists did a good job and we felt comfortable after the treatment. The music was good, not too loud and tea was just tasty.

Decent hamman but really poor massages. I was really looking forward to visiting the SPA as part of my holiday to Marrakesh and really needed a good massage to unwind. We did quite a bit of research and chose the heritage spa based on location and the packages they offered. We went for the 1h45m hamman and massage package. The service was welcoming from the front desk, but after that, there wasnt really any welcoming customer service. The hamman was good and thorough but the massage must have been one of the best massages I have ever had. We were warned that the strength would be poor due to it being ramadan, but I did not expect how poor it could be. Might as well have not had it at all. It was more stroking than massage. The head massage was just stroking of the hair. It just felt like they were not putting any effort into it at all which frustrated me. When my friend had her foot massage (possibly same lady) she had her eyes covered and had thought the masseur had fallen asleep! It is cheaper than the UK but still pricey so really do expect better service than what we received. Also, our massages were noway near 1 hour long which was what we were expecting. I would choose somewhere else for sure next time.

A little oasis in the heart of Marrakesh . A group of us went here today for a traditional hammam and massage experience. Despite having to strip down to basically nothing (in privacy) in the company of our group, we were made to feel comfortable and safe and were very well looked after by the more than capable ladies working at the spa. We started with a hot steam type room to warm our bodies and sweat out the toxins, then two lovely ladies proceeded to wash, oil and scrub the 3 of us individually until our skin was smooth and soft. We also got a clay body masque and hair wash and rinse then we were ushered into a lovely sitting room for tea and water to relax in dressing gowns before our massages. We were able to choose our massage oils from 6 aromatic options, and our scrub from 2 options. We could also choose the strength of the massage. Despite the confrontation of having to be nearly naked in front of the ladies working there and our group of friends we were with, the whole experience was lovely and I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great way to spend a few hours out of the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. The place itself was beautiful, had a lovely smell and relaxing vibe. Thank you as well for the complimentary soaps following our visit.

Wonderful. Coming back from a trek in the Atlas mountains, i highly recommend this place - we were warmly welcomed, looked after, proposed some tea and water... The hammam was just divine - it's a bit more expensive than elsewhere but it's definitely worth it!!!

Amazing. Simply put - the MOST relaxing and unhurried massage that I've EVER had.Me and my partner went for the Heritage Romance package (for couples). Not cheap, but an unbelievable hamman and massage which took 2 hours and 45 minutes! At 1,700 dirham - it was fantastic value and would have no hesitation is going again when we next visit this amazing place. On top of that, we were given a discount card for their restaurant (which is also fantastic and which we've reviewed) - Latitude. Wonderful staff, very pleasant surrounds - not too tough to find. Give yourself a treat and get down there!

Expensive disappointment!!!. We were looking forward to this place after reading the positive reviews on TA. I went with my partner who had a hammam and massage while I had a massage and pedicure. We had been to the other highly rated hammam (Rosa bon heure) a few days earlier and so had experience of a Moroccan hammam. After our greeting the experience at Heritage rapidly declined. The staff were curt and not at all friendly or attentive. This did not feel like a quality establishment despite the hefty charge. My boyfriend wasn't offered any showering facility after his massage and travelled home oily, which is unpleasant in the heat. The massage was also less complete than at Rosa bon Heure. This place really doesn't deserve the rating it holds. Take my advice and go to Rosa bon Heure. You'll have a much better experience for less money. Cannot recommend at all.

Perfect place to relax. We booked in advance due to a recommendation and we were not disappointed. We were welcomed by the owner who escorted us to a beautiful area where tea and water were served. She explained how the experience would work and left us to pick our scrubs and oils.We had booked the hamman and massage package and they were both brilliant and very good value for money.If you are a bit shy then maybe avoid the hamman but it was an awesome experience and I felt very smooth afterwards.In between treatments we were served more tea and nibbles.The massage was lovely but with it being Ramadan it was quite soft, perfect if you like relaxing massages.All the girls were sweet and attentive and the nice touch at the end was that you could pick a spa soap to take home with you.If you are visiting Marrakech and wish to take a couple of hours out for some 'chillax' time then look no further than the Heritage Spa.

Romantic Package. We had a romantic package consisting of a full Hammam, full body massage and then either a foot massage or a full facial, we were there for 3hrs and the staff were fantastic, offering water, mint tea and little biscuit things between treatments, if you would like a relaxing session after a hot day, definitely worth a visit!

Superb in every way from start to finish, head to toe.... Can't say enough about what an enjoyable hammam, scrub, massage, relaxation, etc. this was: simply an excellent quality spa experience (up there or beyond the best of Turkey,Thailand, Indonesia and the rest of Marrakesh, etc). The only challenge was finding the place- you must give the taxi driver the phone number, and he will call and get directions to take you as close as he can, and then it;s but a few minute walk. Follow the signs. Lovely structure, professional treatments, nice touches all around. Worth every dirham (only a third to half of what it would cost in the US or Europe)
A new experience. We had never had a Hammam before and would not want to spoil the experience for other newbies but go, be in each moment and enjoy.......highly recommended.

Beautiful, heavenly place. Pure bliss!. My partner and I booked the Heritage romance package for two people which included a hammam, full body massage, foot massage for him and facial for me. Everything about this place was wonderful. The place itself is clean and beautifully decorated , the people were wonderful, courteous and friendly and the treatments were first class.We were seated in a cosy and beautifully decorated waiting area and asked to smell various oils and decide which one we wanted for our massage. We were also asked to do the same for the cleansing soaps for the first part of the hammam. We started off with the hammam which was far superior to any other hammam I've had. The ladies were professional and with a sense of humour! It was all done very thoroughly and not in a half hearted manner as I've experienced in the past at other places. I really felt squeaky clean afterwards!After the hammam we sat for 10 minutes or so in a chill out area and were served mint tea, mint water and biscuits. Again this area was beautifully decorated and was truly relaxing.Next we had a massage in two rooms with an interconnecting door which could be open or closed as you wished. I'd asked for a strong massage and I can honestly say that it was the best massage I've ever had. The woman's hands were like silk! she was obviously very experienced. Everything about it was perfect, the pressure, the temperature in the room, the length of the massage and the general ambience. Finally I had my facial which was also very good and thorough. I'm not always a great fan of facials as I often think that they can either be too hurried or you're waiting around too long in between applications. Again, all the products were applied with care and skill. It really was worth every penny and a wonderful indulgence from start to finish. It was 2 and a half hours of pure bliss. You even get a discount if you then book a meal at Latitude31 which I can also highly recommend.

Hammond. I wanted to try a different sap from the wonderful La Maison Arabe. Great Hammond here. The facial is a bunch of masques, no extractions but I am sure my skin welcomed it. The pedicure is nothing like the US and I would skip that. The spa has lots of staris so be prepared to climb!

Heaven on earth. This place is amazing! Beautiful decor, friendly staff, delicious mint tea and cookies and most importantly super relaxing hammam and massage. We chose a couple treatment and had both hammam and massage done together. Some reviewers said the massage is not strong enough and that they had better in Asia, I totally disagree, I opted for a relaxing version (you could also choose a stronger stimulating massage) and the pressure was just right. I've been to various massages in Thailand, UK and Poland and have to say this was by far the most relaxing and pleasant massage I ever had. I would totally recommend this SPA, it might be a little pricey compared to other SPAs in Marrakech but it's worth every penny. An unforgettable experience.

A treat. This is one of the more expensive hammams in Marrakech but it is a beautiful indulgence. I chose it because I have had mediocre experiences at cheaper hammams and I wanted a good massage, not just have some oil slapped on and rubbed in. Here, you come out at the end fresh and scrubbed and feeling wonderful.

A little piece of luxury. I would really recommend this fantastic spa. The hammam was an absolute treat and great value for money.
The service was A* - we were endlessly supplied with mint teas and sweet cakes.
Thank you so much. I hope to return one day :)

A perfect end to a busy day. After being kindly welcomed by Antoinella (sp?), we sat down for a tea and she explained exactly how the Hamman worked. We were able to stay together as a couple through the treatment which was great, and the two ladies that performed our Hamman scrub were kind and made us feel comfortable. After a long, hectic day in the Souks, this is exactly what we needed. A wonderful, authentic experience.

Great! High value for money!. Very relaxing - we had a very late booking request and could find a spot for the 2 of us- staff is great and very nice - we spent 3 wonderful hours there and our skin thanked us!

So relaxed. Wow what an amazing experience this place was. Me and my partner came for a couples Hammam and massage, we had both never had one before and at first was strange but was so relaxing, the service and the way we were treated was like royals. I've never felt so pampered and looked after even with just the smallest things made a big difference. Would highly recommend as a must do in Marrakech, my skin has never felt so softThe best spa place to go

Great Spa and pleasant surroundings. Very Helpful owner, nothing was too much trouble. Massage was professional and great value for moneyCheck with Owner for discount when you visit Latitude 31 restaurant...Great food and service

Excellent place for a complete treatment. My daughter & I visited together for this amazing spa experience. We naively took costumes which we realised were way off te mark when we were issued with a paper thong each. You need to know your Hammam partner very well & beware of surprises. The rub down includes your ears & navel & more. The massage & face treatments were heavenly. My skin felt rejuvenated plus my mind & body totally relaxed when we left 2-3 hours later.Water, tea & delicious little biscuits were provided. Highly recommended.

Luxurious treat. Managed to drag my 'manly' husband here for a couples hammam and massage. This spa was on our Riad's recommended list (Riad Chayma) and was fairly easy to find after being given directions. English speaking manager was very pleasant and accommodating.Were greeted with a mint tea, whilst we chose our fragrances and asked what type of massage we needed as opposed to picking something off the 'menu'. We were both taken to the private changing room, where there were decent locker facilities and given robes etc. Hammam itself was an interesting experience, which everybody should try at least once!! Nervous husband seemed relieved we were together for this experience, he started to relax towards the end. Never have we felt so clean after being washed and scrubbed at least four times!! Hammam ladies always checking we were ok. Nice relaxing post hamman break with tea/water and biscuits before being led (separately) into our respective massage rooms for an hour of complete bliss. We were then left to chill out for a few minutes before rejoining each other to get dressed. We were given a choice of complimentary soaps and a restaurant voucher (10% off). All in all a great experience that even my husband appreciated. We would go back to Heritage Spa.

A real luxury hidden in Marrakech. We visited Heritage Spa last Sunday following a recommendation from a friend in London. I prebooked a hammam and massage for my partner and I and paid a small deposit in advance. We used google maps to find the place which was pretty straight forward. There are small signs for the Spa as you get closer so you know you're going the right way.As soon as we arrived you were made to feel special - the host was very friendly and welcoming and took us to a beautiful seating area to discuss what was going to happen and to check we were happy with everything. We also chose how strong we wanted our massage to be and were then lead into the changing room (only used by one couple at a time) and given our pants and robes to change into. The two ladies who did our hammam were so lovely and friendly - we got to choose our scrub and they gave us some to take away. They were very thorough and my skin has felt wonderful for days following their hard work!Following the hammam we took mint tea and snacks in another seating area and relaxed for a few minutes before being lead downstairs for our massage. We had our massages in adjoining rooms and chose our oils following suggestions from the therapists. The massage itself was really thorough and relaxing - I opted for medium strength one and my partner requested firm, although not a lot of force was really used. The decor is traditional yet modern, all very clean and relaxing. Staff at our Riad also recommended the place and said it offers reasonable prices compared to many of the upmarket spas in the medina. As you leave you are given a 10% discount voucher for a restaurant in Marrakech - we didn't use this as it seems quite far in the wrong direction for us, but might be worth it if you are staying in the area for longer.Highly recommend to others - a fab experience.

Perfect find!. Quite difficult to find bearing in mind that most of the streets in the Souqs area don't have names written on the buildings and maps. Based in a very quiet area this facility offers all sorts of treatments for your needs and you won't leave dissapointed . I have had a Karite hydrante facial and a manicure. Both for 850 MDH which in conversion comes to £60 for 2 hrs relaxation time. There was a very friendly English speaking girl from Lithuania, extremely helpful too. I will definitely recommend this spa as it was a fantastic experience for me! At the reception we have also received a 15% off voucher to one of the best restaurants in that area called Latitude31.

Fantastic . We were recommended by the owner of Riad D'Ari. We we certainly not disappointed. Opted for the couples hammam and massage. Black soap, mud cleansing and scrubbed to heaven and back before an amazing massage. The staff are so friendly and professional. We will certainly be coming back again. Worth every Dirham

A hidden gem of the medina. I enjoyed a top-notch massage and spa experience here, and would return on my next trip. Staff were friendly, accomodating and the prices were very reasonable. They even gifted me a free soap on my departure. very thoughtful. highly recommend.

Luxury hammam. This hammam and massage experience was excellent. The space is clean and beautifully designed. The staff is wonderful and attentive. They take care of the details and the experience is worth the price. Only thing I would say- don't expect a very strong massage. The hammam scrub makes up for it, though!

Amazing. My husband and I opted for the couples massage and it was wonderful. Although it's my first hamam and I was a bit uncomfortable the staff put me at ease. Everything was so well planned. I can't emphasise enough how much I loved it.

Bad massage. The hammam experience was nice however the poorly executed massage ruined the experience. The hostess rolled her eyes when we arrived 30 min prior to our appointment but eventually we got nice tea and marockan cookies while we got to smell and choose which products we wanted in our treatment. The hostess wrote down what kind of massage we requested before we went in for the scrub. After the scrub we hade some more tea before the massage. Here again I ephasized that I like deep pressure but the massage therapist only did a light pressure efflaurage. Very disapointing.

Luxury, so relaxing, a must do!. Luxury. Myself and my boyfriend opted for a hamman and massage, which worked out at around £90 for the both of us, and it was worth every penny! You would not get this quality for the price in the UK. We were totally pampered. Amazing from start to finish and a lovely way to end the holiday. I would certainly go back!

A truly wonderful experience. What a wonderful and sumptuous experience. My daughter and I went for the full works! This Hammam is so classy. Having been to one before this just doesn't compare. It's pure luxury. One is pampered from start to finish and all the ladies are absolutely charming. A must visit when coming to Marrakech. Also the mint tea and local biscuits are a fab addition.

Perfect from start to finish - Strongly recommend. When we entered, we were graciously welcomed by a lovely lady at the front of house. She brought us to a waiting area, gave us mint tea and invited us to choose the products we'd like to use for our treatments - we opted for a hammam and massage.It's probably important to mention was that we met a couple there who was back for a second time because they had enjoyed their first massage so much!Each member of staff that looked after us was wonderfully kind. The treatments were thorough and absolutely no corners were cut as is often the case in other spas that I have been to where regulations aren't necessarily as strict as back home!! We were provided with teas, waters and pastries a few times throughout at no extra cost. Nobody nudged us to tip either, which led us to tip more than we usually would! Very professional service which was quite welcome in a place like Marrakech!The experience was superb from start to finish and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone (with high standards!) who wanted a little break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Excellent hammam, worth every penny!. This spa is so classy! It's not very big but very cosy and authentically Moroccan. My husband and I had a 45 minute hammam. First we were given mint tea while the lady explained what was going to happen, then we were shown to a changing room where we put on comedy paper pants (don't bother taking swimming costumes or towels), robes and slippers. We had a locker each so our bits were safe.We were then shown to a little warm room with two marble benches, and were pampered (by two lovely professional ladies) with soaps, scrub, oils and skin mud masks, before being rinsed off and left to relax!I've never felt so clean, I was glowing!! I've never been to a hammam before so I can't compare it with any other, but my goodness go! I even got a lovely complimentary soap at the end. Wonderful.

Magical experience . I booked the heritage romance package for my partner and myself and was amazed by what a delightful experience we had. The ladies who carried out our hammam treatment were amazing - I couldn't believe how pampered we were! We then proceeded to a relaxation room for tea, water and treats. After that, we were led to have our massage. Neither of us could believe how long the sublime massage lasted! The facial was magnificent too. I can honestly say this is the most relaxing experience I have ever had and my partner concurs with that. Too top it off we were given a choice of soaps to take away and our exfoliating gloves too. Words cannot describe this place!

Excellent is an understatement of this spa!. Since I travel to Asia often and am able to visit luxury spas there at a very little price, I was skeptical of the prices of this spa. Since it was my mum's birthday I decided to go for the Heritage Experience package and I was not disappointed- hands down the best spa I have ever been too!We were welcomed by a lovely lady who offered us tea, Morroccon snacks and some mineral water with mint. Every single part of the package was perfect- they were not stingy on the oils or the time they spent on everything. It has been 5 days since I went to the spa and my skin still feels lusciously soft.The oils/ products used are absolutely fab and they even give you a complementary soup when you leave! In between each parts we were offered water, tea and refreshments. This place was one of the highlights of our trip and would recommend it as a must do to anyone even thinking of going to a spa- completely worth the cost!Heaven!

Never felt so relaxed. I booked myself and my boyfriend in for the Heritage Romance package as a treat for the last day of our trip, having read the excellent reviews here. From the moment we entered the spa, the pace of everything seemed to slow right down. We were greeted warmly and were sat down with mint tea and talked through our treatments. Then, once we had changed, we were led up to the top floor for the hammam. The therapists were very professional and friendly and after this we sat on some cushions for more tea, water and biscuits. After about 10 mins, we were led to our separate massage rooms which were dimly lit and quiet. The massage was better than I have experienced at high end spas in the UK and I actually fell asleep! We both left feeling extremely relaxed and content and I would happily recommend this spa to anyone visiting Marrakech.

Great ambiance, vey attentive and relaxing treatment. Our third trip to Marrakech, but our first time visiting Heritage Spar, quite difficult to locate being down a very narrow alley (aren't they all narrow in Marrakech) but the treatment was really good and left us very relaxed.

the best hammam in marrakech.
