What to say but perfection , every single step in the hammam is divine , the hammam , the massage , the welcoming , everything is perfect , i love hammams in morocco, and I ve been all over , but this is my favorite place , why? because it's a top of the line authentic moroccan hammam ritual, the products ( black soap and massage oil wich you choose among different fragance ) are the best .A so special and charming place.I enjoyed my time in heritage spa.

Pure Bliss!. Run and owned by Antonia, a lovely Ukrainian, Heritage Spa is a sleek affair. Booked directly with them. Perfect communication in English. She played perfect host and she kindly guided us through the services on offer to choose the oils and fragrances for the scrubs and massages we had (hammam is a must!). Its sister restaurant Latitude 31 (run by her husband Ali) is worth a visit and they are currently offering discounts if you visit both places.

A delightful treat for the body and soul. This isn't the least expensive way to enjoy a Moroccan hammam but it is luxurious and you will feel pampered when you are finished. The spa is in the Medina, tucked away in a narrow alley. Inside, there is a small alcove where you sip tea and choose the essential oil fragrance you want for oil and soap. Then you are whisked upstairs to change into disposable underpants and a robe. The steam room has heated marble slabs and can hold up to three people. My slab was a bit short for me (I'm six feet tall and longer if I stretch out.) If you are two in a steam room, one slab is long enough for two people, so for a couple with a tall man (or woman) one slab will be long enough. After a suitable steaming under an application of Moroccan black soap, you get exfoliated with a glove by the attendant, then rinsed off. You get to take the (wet) glove home with you in a plastic bag as a souvenir. Yes, it is amazing how the exfoliation removes rolls of dead skin cells. It's effective. After the traditional hammam, you relax in a room decorated like a Berber tent and have water and some sweetmeats (handmade chocolates.) Then off to a massage. My massage was one of the best I'd ever had. The music was familiar, too--some of the same relaxation music I use at home to de-stress. The only quibble was that my five minutes of relaxation after the massage in the darkened room seemed too short--they were busy. And that is a warning; a couple who stopped by the front desk was turned away for not having a reservation. So you should make a reservation. I enjoyed it, felt entirely renewed and relaxed.The spa presents you with a parting gift of Moroccan-made soap to remember them by--that was a nice touch. I wish I could go to the hammam every week. It was a lovely experience and I can recommend the Heritage.

Excellent experience of hammam & massage. My husband and I visited the Spa last month and chose their 'Heritage Romance' package which included a joint private hammam, full body massage and choice of a facial or feet massage. The private hammam was fun experience but be prepared to be scrubbed down well! The massage and facial was also lovely and the rooms are warm, comfortable and relaxing. We really enjoyed our experience here and the service from the receptionist was amazing!

One thing you should do in Marrakech. Our receptionist recommended this spa and arranged appointments and someone to collect us which was a great help. Two hours later we left feeling lighter, healthier and the most we have felt relaxed in a very long time. So wonderful I returned the following day for a foot massage and facial both which were amazing,.

A real must & the best in town !. We wanted to experience a true Moroccan Hammam and after reading the reviews I chose Heritage Spa and was not dissapointed. Although sceptical of such excellent reviews I can only say that it is an exceptionnal and authentic hamman & spa where they search for excellence and are highly professional. The staff is discreet and welcoming, the hygene immpecable and the little attentions dellightful. It may be a wee bit more expensive than what are considered other top end spas but after trying the others there is no comparison. Both my husband and teenage daughter absolutely loved it. Note that it is in the medina and not very easy to find so recommend that you look at the short video on how to get there.

Beautiful relaxing spa!. Our first time in Marrakech led us to the Heritage spa after being recommended by a client of mine, I work at a spa here in the states so I took the recommendation wisely. We booked the Romance package (hammam, massage, facial, foot massage) and because the alleyways were a bit confusing we arrived 30 min late, at my spa we would have turned a guest away but the manager greeted us and sat us down for tea without a single fuss of us being late! The manager explained the services to us, asked us all the proper spa questions (allergies, skin types) and then we were whisked away to the hammam to start our services. The entire time we were there we were pampered and taken care of. The products they use and the women who work there were the absolute most talented and professional I've ever encountered in a spa setting. Heritage spa will be the top and only reason I will ever visit marrakech again, can not recommend it enough!

Very welcoming and professional. Heritage Spa lived up to its reputation as number 1 Marrakech Spa on Trip Advisor! I was very pleased with all the advanced communication I had with Antonia at the Spa. She was able to address my questions and needs in a very professional and prompt manner and that continued at the spa itself. Being a man alone, I was a bit comceremd about the stress on couples and wondered about privacy. My fears were unfounded and I was given my treatments in completely private quarters. The treatments themselves were superb and the extras (teas, water, cakes, soap) all contributed to a delightful time. If I am ever back in Marrakech I will certainly return to Heritage Spa for treatments.

Great Morrocan Hammam experience. Amazing spa tucked away in the maze of the Souk in Marrakech.Very attentive, english speaking staff. Great range of services and products. Loved what they did to the old Riad and how they transformed the place into a Hammam. Definitely worth a visit whilst in Marrakech.

A wonderful experience. Myself and partner had the couples hamman and massage and facial. We had a warm welcome from all the staff. I had a little turn in the hamman as I think I was in there too long but the ladies were very kind and new exactly what to do with me. I'd say it could be an idea for the ladies to pop in more often to check on you as it was very hot. The massage was very nice although could of been harder as requested. The facial was nice and relaxing. The spa is beautiful and we really felt looked after. Great value for money. I'd definitely recommend.

First class treatments. A little off the beaten track, but great reception from staff for my first Hammam, was looked after very well and made to feel at ease.Really good massage just as you like it and lovely facial. Would not hesitate to use Heritage spa again on my next visit

Spa...ccati di relax . We booked a 2hr experience for couples. All provided by the spa, just get ready to choose the right soap and oil for the massage. The hammam was a private room for 2 and started with the scrub to end with the special clay for the body. A break with tea, water and sweets and is time for massage. It takes place in individual rooms upon your special request... A final present ends this unforgettable experience.

One of the best out there... For the price!. This is definitely one of the best spas out there (for the price) which makes it well worth a visit when in Marrakech. We did this as a couple.You'd pay at least 4 times as much in London for the hammam and full body massage treatment we had. The hammam is extremely thorough and the full body massage is of a good standard (from someone who is used to having deep tissue sports massage / physio regularly, I should know). The advice regarding oils is good and the soap handed to us on leaving the venue is a great touch.The spa is extremely well organised. It is well signposted along some of the narrow streets in the north of the Medina.

Fantastic!!. Great place, lovely traditional spa really nicely set up. Clear instructions on arrival on what to expect. The staff are brilliant super friendly worth every dirham don't leave Marrakech without visiting heritage spa.

An awesome experience for a couple!. At my request for a hammam (Turkish bath) recommendation, the manager of our Riad (Dixneuf la Ksour) suggested that my husband and I try the Heritage Spa, which accommodates couples. We had the “Destination Marrakech” combination (650 dh each), with a traditional scrubbing and massage. The massage by Sara was utterly relaxing and restorative.Among the many things I liked about this experience, the manager did a great job of explaining what we were about to experience---this was great as my husband had not previously been in a hamman. And while you opt for a package of treatments, it is further personalized (without extra charge) to your desires: you can choose among many scents, and also the type of massage---whether you want it to be relaxing or more therapeutic. I can't wait for another trip to Marrakech to experience this again! I cannot recommend highly enough.

Didn't want to leave.... Before arriving in Marrakech, we had said the one thing that we wanted to treat ourselves to was a luxurious Hammam and massage. After searching online, Heritage Spa appeared to be the obvious choice and it didn't let us down.We went for the Destination Marrakech package which included a couples hammam followed by full body massages for the both of us. Once we arrived we were given some mint tea and asked to choose our massage oils and hammam body mask. We both opted for the traditional eucalyptus and moroccan clay glassoul for the hammam. After changing into fluffy dressing gowns, we then went into our hammam rooms where we were soaped, scrubbed, masked and washed. Lovely experience (although be prepared for a very thorough scrub!) and shocking how much we both needed to exfoliate! Feeling the cleanest we had done in a long time, we were then given our dressing gowns and slippers and taken to a room full of relaxing cushions where we were provided with more tea and some sweet treats on.Soon we were taken for our massages. The masseuses have a heavenly touch and we both agreed that this was the best massage that we have ever had. Afterwards, extremely relaxed, we were taken to a lovely bed-like seating area and given more tea and treats.Heritage is a little spot of paradise within the hectic medina. The staff are friendly, discreet and it was so peaceful that we didn't want to leave to catch our flight. We were given our hammam scrubbing gloves and a special soap to take home which was a nice gesture. We highly recommend a visit to heritage spa, it is worth every penny/dirham.

Great value for money!. What a fantastic way to spend Christmas day!My friend and I booked the Heritage Experience and spent a good 5 hours cocooned in this tardis-like sanctuary in the medina. Much like finding anywhere specific in the medina, we had to weave our way around a few back streets first, but once we stepped through the entrance it was as if we were somewhere entirely different and the same all at once. The spa was very traditional looking but you felt familiar with it immediately.The host was brilliant - welcoming, confident and friendly. The facilities were clean and very presentable.The hammam and massages were amazing! I could barely open my eyes after 3 hours!Drinks and treats were tasty!My manicure was perfect too.I would recommend a trip to a spa to anyone visiting Marrakech, as I think it is definitely required after a few days bustling around the medina, but I would highly recommend this particular spa.We left feeling reborn.Great value for money!

Perfect End To The Holiday. After a week long road/kasbah/camping trip we really needed a bit of pampering. Heritage spa was an amazing experience. As a hamman virgin I was amazed at the process and how well organised and professional everything was done. From our initial visit to the spa to book (the lady who greeted us was so friendly and informative and guided us through every treatment). The two amena's were lovely who carried out the hamman. We had hamman, massage, facial and pedicure. Between each treatment we were given water, mint tea and chocolates. The massage was done quietly and to the desired pressure with no fuss and beautiful oils. My pedicure was the best I have ever had and I now feel like I am walking on little cushions they are so soft.Thank you so much for a wonderful experience and also for the recommendation for lunch at Latitude31. You were right, we were hungry and it was the perfect place to relax and the food was fabulous. I would highly recommend this spa.

Fluffy white robes and traditional slippers.... As a pair of hammam virgins, we had little idea of what to expect from Heritage.The problem we now have is will anywhere else live up to this!Frankly, it was amazing.We were treated like VIPs from the moment we entered (we didn't even have to knock, the door opened as we arrived)I had encountered the proprietor a couple of days earlier at the hammam's sister restaurant, Latitude 31.He remembered our meeting and showed Darlingka and I to a comfortable seating area where we were furnished with tea. He discussed our booking with us and suggested a more suitable, surprisingly cheaper, package. The hammam option arranged, we opted for Beldi Detox, we were invited to choose our preferred massage oils from a wide and sumptuous range.We were given a clear and concise explanation of what we should expect and the protocol involved in the hammam and then led to the changing area.Fluffy white robes and traditional slippers donned, we made our way to the double salon where Amena and Raja treated us to a thoroughly refreshing and stimulating experience. My skin has never felt so alive!I have often found massages in the past to be robotic and formulaic, delivered by a masseuse with half an eye on the clock. On this occasion, they were sheer bliss. Our masseuse took great care to ensure that each part of each of us received the same acute attention to detail.We repaired to a lavish lounge feeling revived and invigorated where we drank sweet mint tea and savoured Moroccan patisserie.The pedicures were thorough and precise. My feet enjoyed exactly the treat they deserved having been dragged through souks, waterfalls, mountain passes and windswept beaches these last few days.Little did they know, they had one more big treat coming their way...As Darlingka sat back for a magnificent manicure, the feet and I were led away for the most sensational foot massage. If my feet could speak, they would be thanking the rest of me for the remainder of our natural lives.All told, we spent the best part of 4 hours treating ourselves for a miserly sum equating to a little more than £100.I cannot rate Heritage highly enough. We all deserve a little pampering from time to time, I recommend you do it here.

Amazing..... It was our first Hammam experience and it was just wonderful. The place is relay professional and caters to your need . we had taken a couple package witch had a 45 mints scrub bath 1 hr massage and a 45 mints facial. we had a fantastic time. and was worth the money we had spend.we will recommend this place to any first timer. don't worry about the pricing, it is reasonable. don't worry about staff waiting for tips ( you wont find any).Just go and enjoy the hospitality..... they will advice and lead you through the whole process.the owner lady was really hospitable and knows customer service and delivers what she had promised you. All the best for this wonderful place.

Amazing experience. The route to this amazing place tucked away in a bustling corner of Marrakech, was well signed from dar el bacha, and what a wonderful welcome when we got there. The decor is lovely and such a surprise when you step in from the busy streets. We had a our first ever hammam followed by a lovely relaxing massage, and the whole experience flowed smoothly and professionally. What a lovely experience and all at a very reasonable price.

Unbelievable. This was a surprise anniversary gift. Our first, but definitely not our last hammam experience. We didn't know what to expect.... I thought it would be out of my comfort zone but every minute was perfect. The staff are discreet professional and kind. We couldn't have enjoyed it any more. We will definitely visit again.

Splendid. Arrived with friends not knowing what to expect, was immediately excited by the atmosphere created within. Have been to a few hammam places and this was one of the best. Great service and an ambience to go with. After speaking to management I can only see the place improving. An oasis in the hustle and bustle of the busy and narrow streets.
Amazing. This was the best spa experience we have ever had. Lovely place, very Moroccan and sumptuous. You will really feel spoiled. We had the full treatment for two and it was awesome.
Exfoliated to within an inch of my life. Best spa experience I've ever had- hammam, massage & pedicure. Really great service, totally reasonable price.

Love at first sight. We had never had a Hammam bath before and we will definitely do it again. We did the detox program, 45 to 60 mins of washing black soap applications mud and scrub.The final treatments was the classic mint tea and local pastries in a relaxing Moroccan room.Staff is very nice and make you very welcome. They provide everything from disposable underwear to slippers, from dressing gown to water. Just worry to relax only and enjoy massages and scrub.Payable with cards. Recommended.

Average spa, good vfm, nothing fancy. We went for a hammam/massage combination and got just that. The staff was nice but not very communicative, cleanliness is ok but not perfect. Not so nice: hammam staff scrubbing you (if you are two) were talking and giggling in arabic during the treatment. On the other hand, we felt like the whole staff was making us feel like we were the only guests.

Nice hamam. I would go here to get a nice hamam experience, skip the massage. The owner gave me a reduction since I wasn't satisfied. But I would rather pay full price for a professional treatment. Very nice tea and cakes. Friendly service.

A very memorable experience. I wish I could do this at home every week. Gracious, pampering people. I am cleaner than I have ever been. The hostess ( owner?) was fabulous. Thought about this for the entire trip. Go. It was perfect after a day of flying to ready myself for my travels.

Poor Service, Over-priced. There were a number of things wrong with my visit - the massage room was cold, the masseuse was inexperienced, my massage was interrupted for a chat with a fellow staff member while I was topless on the table and it was over much before the hour was up. Would not recommend. Had a much better experience at Les Bains.

Must-have. Went here with hubby for my birthday treat, we had the romance package comprising hamman, full body msssage, facial & foot massage. Both of us were flagging when we arrived, left there completely rejuvenated with an enormous sense of well-being. The hamman made it for us, the staff are so lovely, the venue is spotless, tranquil and very calming. Thoroughly recommend this place a thousand times over. You MUST go if you're in the area

Pricey. Aims to be grand in terms of website and prices, and delivers fairly well but certainly not luxurious. To put it into context - its a bit like getting a treatment at a virgin active gym. 600d or so for 45 mins of hammam treatment - about the price you would expect to pay in europe, economies considered this isnt right.

Relaxing and refreshing. My boyfriend and I had a Hammam and massage. The hammam was a great experience and the massage was sooo relaxing. Expertly done, soothing music, and a wonderful ambience. It was very relaxing and cleansing, and felt so far away from the hustle and bustle just outside in the city. The staff were competent and friendly and treated us with respect and care. We never felt rushed even though they were clearly very busy. The tea and pastries between treatments was a nice touch that extended the Moroccan feel and experience. We would definitely recommend visiting Heritage Spa as a must do on your holiday to Marrakech.

Lovely spa. We enjoyed our spa experience overall. We went for the romance package as we wanted to have some time away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. We also wanted to stay together for our treatments. I have been to a public hammam a few years ago so knew what to expect. The hammam was very authentic compared to the public hammam, except I don't think they were as thorough with the scrubbing. I felt like they did miss bits. My partner found the scrubbing a bit too intense and his skin was very sore afterwards. It may be worth letting the ladies know if you have sensitive skin - my partner doesn't have sensitive skin but he doesn't often use harsh scrub treatments. The massages were good but nothing special. We really enjoyed being able to choose the oils they use and the mint tea and treats between treatments. Overall I would return but I think some improvements could be made as although the price is very reasonable by western standards it is very expensive for morocco.

Consistently great. I have been to Heritage Spa several times over the past 6 weeks and it is consistently excellent. I have been to many spas in Marrakech over several years, but this is the top. I have had massages and a facial and all were excellently done by top notch people. The owners are both lovely and attentive. The space is beautifully done and extremely clean. Very friendly and efficient welcome. I can't say enough. Well done!

A must for any visitor to Marrakech. My wife and I went for a traditional Hammam and massage. The hammam was a fantastic and unique experience that everyone should discover. I can truly understand why this is a once a week activity in Morocco!Great staff, relaxing atmosphere and phenomenal hammam and massage! Go!

Amazing Experience. This was my first hammam and it was wonderful beyond belief and it will not be my last. The luxurious Heritage Spa was welcoming and the environment calm and beautiful. The relaxing massage was perfection and preceded by wonderful tea and little Moroccan pastries. You may need to book in advance as this is a very popular place.

Great experience. My husband and I booked a romance package and it was lovely. It was the first time we had visited a hammam and we would certainly recommend it. We felt that the package was good value - we were there for almost 3 hours on a rainy day so it worked out well.

Best Hammam in Morroco. We visited the spa after seeing it was rated #1 on here and it definitely lives up to the hype.The manager and staff are warm, welcoming and professional and both me and my boyfriend had wonderful Hammams (45mins- 290dh each).Couples can have their treatments in the same room, which is great and the little touches like mint teas, soaps and mitts makes this place stand out from the others.I'll definitely be returning next time I'm in Marrakech.
Heavenly after a week of hiking. Loved the experience. The hammam scrub was invigorating, followed by a very good massage. The ladies are very polite and the setting helps you melt away.

Very relaxing massage - great customer service. Came here twice with my girlfriend during our holiday in Marrakech - first time for a 45min hamman (290 dirhams - approx £20), and secondly for a 1hr massage (450 dirhams - approx £30). Chose Heritage Spa due to its popularity on Tripadvisor.It was the first time we had had a hamman so didn't know what to expect. Booked it the same morning with a 200 dirham deposit, and came back 15mins before the start time (highly recommended to give enough time to get changed & lock possessions away etc beforehand). We were greeted and taken to the changing room where the lockers are and given robes, slippers & hilarious underwear to change into before heading to the hamman steam room. The hamman itself was good and the 2 ladies that scrubbed us were light-hearted and made us feel at ease. Not particularly relaxing, but was glad me & my partner were put together in the same steam room otherwise the 15-20min period where the staff leave you for the treatments to 'soak in' would've been very boring & agitated. After we were washed down we were shown to a lovely room full of cushions and romantic decor to have a delicious mint tea and selection of chocolates. My girlfriend was also given a token gift of soap on departure.The hamman was not really our thing but we were so impressed with the service that we decided to go back at the end of our holiday for a massage. This time we booked the night before with a deposit of 100 dirhams (strangely less than last time even though the treatments were more expensive). We were greeted by a very welcoming French lady who was great in ensuring we were relaxed and got the perfect massage we wanted. After a welcome mint tea and treats she asked us to choose what scent of oil & what pressure we each wanted for our massages. We were taken to separate rooms but can tell you I've never felt so relaxed in my life - amazing massage. I asked for a particularly strong massage and the masseuse did just that, giving a perfect balance of firm pressure and sensuality without me being uncomfortable or tensed up at all. The smell of the Rose and Sandal oil was great too. After the massage the French lady was very attentive to asking how the the massages went & gave us 2 complimentary soaps on departure.Overall a great massage experience, lovely facilities & décor, good customer service and well worth the money!

A truly lovely hammam and spa!. I have been to Heritage Spa several times now and have to rave about the experience!The owners are super responsive when organizing your appointment. I brought 2 groups here and they were able to accommodate both with ease and confidence. The setting is very European Spa, high quality services, attendants, and the experience overall was truly zen-like in the middle of the bustling medina.We enjoyed the Heritage Beauty packages. I booked an extra service for myself before I left Marrakech. LOVE IT HERE!!
You have to try this!!. No words to explain this place... amazing!!! Will come back for sure! I'm not used to have spas while traveling... now I think different about this experiences!! Thank you.

Definitely worth a visit!. We visited the Heritage Spa as part of our trip to Marrakech based on the recommendations on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed!Great Hammam and Massage and the service was excellent with everything being explained in detail before we began. It was a pleasant oasis of calm away from the crazy bustle of the rest of Marrakech. We can recommend jumping in a taxi afterwards for lunch at the colonial Grand Café de la Poste as the treatments worked up an appetite.

Bliss . My other half and I visited the spa early this week and had booked the romantic package. The package consisted of two Hammam, two massages, a facial and foot massage. We changed the package to two facials instead of the foot massage and the spa were so helpful and happy to change it. The hammam was an unusual experience but thoroughly enjoyed it. The massage and facial was even better!! Massage wise one of the best I've had! My partner ended up having a foot massage as they forgot we had asked to change the package to two facials but we didn't mind and they discounted the cost accordingly. Lovely spa and would certainly go back. The only criticism was that there was another couple having the same package done at the same time and we were asked our preferences at the same time in the same room. This would have been much better if this would have been done separately.

Birthday bliss. Visited the heritage spa on my birthday and had the most wonderful experience. As I was with my boyfriend (who had never been to any kind of spa before) we went all out and chose the Heritage Romance package so that we could have a variety of treatments together. After taking mint tea in a lovely relaxing nook, we were led upstairs to a private changing area where we changed into robes and slippers and put out belongings in a locker. Then to the hammam where we had a vigorous savon noire scrub down and body mask in a hot chamber. Came out as smooth as babies!Next we were given time to cool down in another relaxation area with more mint tea and treats, before heading for the most divine full body massage. This was followed with a foot massage for my partner and a fantastic facial for me. I absolutely loved the whole experience. The staff were fantastic and the environment was lovely. We were made to feel so comfortable and relaxed throughout - particularly my partner who was a little nervous of what might be involved. We both had a lovely experience and can wholeheartedly recommend Heritage Spa. Thank you for making my birthday so very special.

Relaxing spa with amazing ambience. I have now visited the Heritage Spa on both my last trip to Marrakech and this one and have not been disappointed. The owners welcome you with tea and seat you in comfortable room and then come to discuss your treatment and help you to choose the oils that will be used for you. The staff speak some English and French so it is easy to communicate. The rooms are so relaxing and between treatments you have more herb tea and small cakes. I have hammams, massage and facials and always leave feeling relaxed and my skin feels rejuvenated. Have booked a facial for today before my return home tomorrow. This place will be booked again on my next visit to Marrakech without a doubt.

Amazing. My wife and I had our first Hammam experience in Heritage spa. And we must say that this is probably the best in town.
The staff is very polite and friendly. We stayed there for almost two hours and it was the best two hours of our stay in Marrakech.
Keep it up ;)

Lovely spa, very relaxing and luxurious. My husband and I visited this spa for the Romance package which included a traditional hammam experience, a full body massage each and then a facial for me and a pedicure for him. It was a wonderful place, not the easiest to find - but that seems to be true of everywhere in Marrakech - it's just part of the experience. The surroundings were beautiful and the staff were especially lovely. We were really spoiled while here and the whole experience was fantastic. I would happily go back and have the treatment every week! My skin in particular felt amazing after the hammam and I relaxed so much after the massage I fell asleep for a few minutes. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend the spa.

Absolutely Wonderful Hammam and massage....!!. I had an amazing Hammam experience ....I felt like all my worries were literally lifted off my shoulders ....that sense of relief....and I had a FOUR HAND massage for the very first time and it was absolutely exquisite .....like synchronised swimming on your body......the therapists actually massaged together in time with the music....fantastic....I would highly recommend this spa.....very sweet attentive staff....made you feel very welcome....never felt rushed in between treatments....a must in Marrakech.....I would fly in just to come back to this spa....!

Very friendly and comfotable. One of the best massages and spa experience I've had. Highly recommend it. Everyone was very kind and friendly from the staff to manager. They took the trouble to explain the process and made you feel very wecome and comfortable.

Fantastic Hammam and Massage. Very professional and friendly staff who explained the whole process when we arrived. The hammam was a great experience and my skin felt incredible afterwards. The massage was the best I have ever had - would definatley recommend!

Wonderful experience. I visited Marrakesh for a long weekend in August with a group of girl friends and wanted to experience the traditional hammam body scrub. Our hotel recommend the Heritage spa and it did not disappoint. The owner was exceptionally friendly and knowledgeable and made us feel entirely relaxed from the moment we walked in. The women who was you spoke limited English but were lovely and put you at ease with their giggles when you slipped about naked on the wet tiles! Although you could definitely have the experience cheaper in Marrakesh, we felt totally pampered and had the added touches of testing the oils, chocolates after the scrub and a free bar of soap at the end! Would definitely recommend.

Would go again and again. It was one of the best hammam and massage experience I ever had. Staff is very professional and friendly. Owner/manager was very brilliant in explaining the products and experience we were about to have. I felt completely relaxed and clean from top to bottom. Definitely recommend this spa.
Hem-am-azing. Wonderful staff made what could be a daunting experience amazing. A totally relaxing and unique experience. My skin has never felt so good. I'll be returning to Marrakech just for this!

Hammam Spa Sensation!. An amazing first Hammam experience. Hospitable, professional friendly staff and a lovely authentic atmosphere. Before our treatment started, the owner diligently explained the process of the Hammam as we selected our oil of choice and the desired pressure for our massage afterwards. As four girls together experiencing our first Hammam, we felt comfortable and very well looked after. After the Hammam, we had a small break for mint tea and a yummy Moroccan sweet treat, before heading off for the massage, which was divine. A Marrakech must visit.

Great first time Hammam experience!. There are many, many places in Marrakech that offer Hammam / spa services so choosing just one is a challenge! Ironically we came across the Heritage Spa whilst trying to find another spa that we had booked in advance (which we never found!). Luckily for us they had availability for that same day so we booked the traditional Hammam for two, 290dirhams each. This was much more reasonable than the spa we had actually booked so we were pretty pleased as not only had we managed to find a spa, with same day availability, but saved a few dirhams in the process! The lady on the front desk was very friendly and welcoming, explaining the process to us in advance over mint tea and letting us choose what type of soap we preferred. Robes and slippers were provided along with the obligatory paper underwear and there were lockers with keys for our belongings. My husband and I were pleased that we were able to experience the Hammam together in a room for two (some places separate men and women and we had read about others where you were in a room with other people). The ladies that gave us the Hammam scrub were lovely, very friendly, didn't speak much English but a few words (turn over, sit up!) were all they needed. Bottles of mineral water were provided too. The service was fab, the products smelt gorgeous and we felt very clean and refreshed afterwards! To top it off more mint tea and some Moroccan pastries to finish. The lady on reception even gave us a gift of some soap scrub at the end. Great experience and good value for money compared to some of the other higher end spa's.

Perfect!. What an amazing experience! The service was impeccable and the massage was one of the best i've had (i'm quite hard to please!).
I would recommend this spa for anyone wanting an authentic, luxurious hammam/spa experience!

Most definitely recommend to all!. After researching a number of reviews on different spas around the area I was staying in during my week in Marrakech, I decided to go with Heritage Spa, it was down the road from the riad I was staying at so that was a bonus. I booked the Heritage experience for both my sister and myself and I cannot recommend it enough.The entire experience lasted around 6 hours, we went at 10am and left the spa around 4pm feeling completely refreshed. It was my birthday so I chose to be pampered and the staff at the spa were brilliant. We started with a hammam, full body massage, pedicure, facial and then another fully body massage with herbs. The staff are very hospitable and kind, I never felt rushed and really were treated like queens from the minute we entered the doors to when we left. There is lots of mint tea and relaxing breaks between treatments so it was all done in a very relaxing manner.Ali was very kind to offer my sister and me a gift voucher for a free massage on the day we were flying back to the UK as a gift for my birthday, which was very sweet.I had Amelia/Amelle for my massages and she is a true gem, a very sweet girl who made sure I was comfortable throughout the day. I would definitely recommend others to come here and if I was to ever go back to Marrakech, I would be coming back here.

Wonderful hammam!. We visited the Heritage Hammam last week. I would just like to thank the staff here for making this a really wonderful experience. I go to the hammam regularly in London and therefore am well versed to the experience and so I was expecting this to be a authentic experience which it certainly was. We had the hammam exclusive package which in total lasted about 4 hours and included in addition to the hammam, a massage and a facial. The hammam itself was excellent and left my skin feeling clean and soft. The therapist rubbed argan oil on my feet and hands to soften them after the scrub down which was a nice added extra as most treatments don’t include this. The products used were also of a high quality. The Moroccan pastries and the mint tea served after the treatment were a real treat and just what we needed along with cold mint water. The massage was also really relaxing - the use of pressure was just right. The facial was good too. Overall a great find… if you are a looking for a hammam which is cosy with great treatments this is definitely the one. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us and were friendly and helpful. However, this place is a little difficult to find so I would suggest that you arrange to reach there by taxi. We asked the same taxi guy to pick us up- if you take his number, one of the staff at the hammam will call him and arrange this for you.

The 5-star experience. I am a regular customer and whenever I am in Marrakech I make I sure I visit!I came with my mum (birthday) and aunt who experienced Heritage Spa for the first time and loved it. I was in Marrakech for a friends wedding and told lots of friends who also visited and loved it.We each had the hamman, full body massage, facial and pedicure - all worth it.The owners and staff are extremely welcoming, pleasant and friendly. All facilities are clean and to an excellent standard.They offer extensive treatments and packages - all reasonably priced.If you are in Marrakech, it is a must and perfect to relax and be pampered.

An absolute must! WOW. My wife and I went just before our flight back to the UK, and Wow. We would go back to morocco just to go back to this little piece of heaven.We had a massage and facial and it simply was the best we have ever had. Don't be put off trying to find this place - once you do, you leave the hustle behind and drop into bliss.Without doubt - our best experience in Morocco. You must visit.

Small piece of heavan. This is the perfect retreat in the craziness of marrakech.We got slightly lost along the way and were then guided by a local (most are very friendly!). We tipped the guy and the spa took the tip of our bill!The massage itself was really good and myself and my partner were placed in the same room which was a really nice touch.Very reasonably priced versus the hotels and a much more 'Moroccan' experience.

Much-needed peace in hectic Marrakech. Two friends and I treated ourselves to the Destination Marrakech hamman and massage package on a hot afternoon. We were welcomed with mint tea and water to refresh before our treatments began. The owner/manager also explained our treatments quite thoroughly and allowed us to choose our massage oil scents. Both treatments were done with the utmost care and professionalism. I was particularly impressed by the masseuse who attended to all the tension in my back. We felt incredibly relaxed following the treatments and didn't want to leave the serenity of the spa. Highly recommend to all looking for a little relaxation in Marrakech.

Total Heaven. We were absolutely amazed when we walked into the spa, with over 6 ladies there just to greet us, the manager ushered us into a private booth where he talked through our Hammam. We then were taken upstairs to undress and robe up, and we were directed to another lounge/bed area where we relaxed for a while and drank mint tea and mint water (complimentary). 2 of us went in on of the Hammam rooms and the other of our party went in another due to the size of the rooms. The treatment itself was AMAZING, I have never been scrubbed so much in my life, it was really revitalising, and they take care of you by keeping you hydrated in the steam room with complimentary bottles of water.I left the spa feeling, refreshed, healthy, and I had the softest skin. Was an incredible price for the service we received and would go back in a heartbeat!5*************

5-star service . This is definitely one of the best spas in Morocco. Very clean, offers customized service, friendly and very helpful owner. Strongly recommend a visit to try out the tradition hammam.
Best experience so far!. Great experience and service, clean and professional! owner was super friendly and helpful, he even drove us to our next stop! Highly recommended!!

Amazing time at heritage!!. We just came back from a 2 hours and a half treatment at the heritage. We saw the reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to check it out. My partner and I went there the day before to see the menu and book it. The owner offered us tea and water while he was explaining the different packages. We booked a couples package for the next day. It consisted of an hour hammam treatment where my partner and I stayed together. During that time, the ladies put soap and other products on you, you decide which scent you want beforehand, in intervals of 10 minutes more or less. During that time, you can ask for complementary water since the temperature is high. After that, we were brought to a different room where we were offered tea and pastries. We could relax, cool down and have nice music in the background. Really a nice touch! Then we went for an hour massage. At this time my partner and I were separated. The massage was amazing. The package included also a facial and feet massage. After those 2, we were done and changed back to our clothes. At the exit, we were also offered 2 soaps, one for me and one for my partner.It was a great day, 2 and a half hour for 1700 Dirham total for 2 people is a really good price. The atmosphere is really good and the people professional and gentle. You can pay by credit card which allows you not to carry a lot of cash (pay by credit card in Marrakech is a plus, it's not given).We definitely recommend it! !!!

Memorable hamman experience. Soon after arriving in Marrakech, a friend and I went to Heritage Spa for a hamman and massage. Greeted by the owner, a charming and empathetic gentleman who talked us through the experience and what to expect before we chose the oils we preferred. The hamman ladies were kind and gentle and the scrub left our skin soft and glowing. I slept through much of the massage as it was so incredibly relaxing. I cannot recommend Heritage highly enough. A fantastic Spa experience in a natural and rustic Riad. Very clean, extremely good value for money and well worth a visit.

5* treatment!. Booked an oasis treatment (hamman scrub and 1hr massage)! for less than 60 pounds. I arrived early and they gave me a complimentary foot massage while I was waiting. It was so nice and I was given tea, water and snacks while waiting for my massage. After my treatment, I also got a complimentary bar of soap. It was such a nice experience after having a tiring day wandering around the Medina in roasting hot weather.

Fantaaastic!. Great intimate spa in Marrakech! Hammam is great and very clean! The massage is so relaxing with authentic music and oils you pick out yourself :) don't miss out on this - although the price is a little heavy compared to other places, but then you can be sure that the place is clean and the massage-girls has certificate:)

Traditional hammam . Although not what we expected, this was a great experience after a mountain hike. Welcomed with mint tea, we chose our soap then were led to change and into a couples room that was a cross between a sauna and steam room. First stage is a wash with black soap, second stage is a vigorous exfoliation then third is a mud rub - all with time to lie back in between. We finished with tea and pastries. Very relaxing and our host was brilliant. Just missed 5*s due to one quite surly therapist but others were all smiles

Awesome!. This weekend I've been to Heritage Spa. . We were in this spa last year and I confirm you that this year it was even better that last time. We started with hammam. It was wonderful experience. After hammam my skin was a skin of a newborn child. Then we were invited to massage. It was the best massage I have ever had. Masseuse really hit the spot. After massage I had facial care. It was wonderful. I truly recommend you to visit this spa if you are in Marrakech

Perfect... We visited on I believe 17th June and what a truly wonderful experience. The host was wonderfully welcoming and made us feel incredibly special, the ladies who carried out our treatments seemed happy and content. The staff are a credit to the owner and seem looked after. Thank you Ladies. We had Hammam, massage, facial and pedicure. All perfect and worth every penny.

Absolutely recommend!. My boyfriend and I chose this spa after reading reviews here on tripadvisor and it did not disappoint. It was difficult to find down a small alley but the staff were very welcoming and made us feel completely relaxed. We went for the "couples" treatment which included a hammam, full body massage and facial/pedicure. It worked out around £70 per person but I think it was good value for what was included. All staff were friendly and constantly made sure we were enjoying our experience. They gave us a free bar of soap and exfoliator to take away which was a nice little touch. It was a perfect way to relax after exploring the city and I would thoroughly recommend this spa!

Search this place out for complete pampering!. Everything you read in the reviews are correct. We had three hours of bliss in this spa. It was spotless and the attention to detail nothing was overlooked. We are going back for a top up just before we fly home.

Lovely little place. This was the spa that I took my sister and her friends too whilst we were out in Marrakech - they reserved the whole place for us whilst we had our treatments there - which made us feel really special and relaxed.The treatments themself were lovely - the oil selection was great.One of our party was pregnant and couldn't handle the heat and they re-worked a new treatment for her so she could still feel spoilt.Its not a sleek spa - its cosy and traditional and intimate - very cute place

Wonderful, Relaxing Hammam with Great Value!. Went for an exfoliating hammam and massage and it was absolutely fantastic! Mohamed came and met my sister and I up at our Riad a few minutes away (on foot) and guided us to the spa. We were ushered into a waiting room where we had a few minutes to decide which oils we wanted used during our massage and also drank some tea. When we were ready, we were guided into the changing room and then got out exfoliating rubs. Afterwards, we had a few minutes to drink tea and relax before our messages. The whole experience was well worth the great value! People were extremely nice.

Definitely worth a visit!. My boyfriend and I visited the heritage spa at the end of April 2014 and had a brilliant time. We ended up arriving a bit early and as such had to wait for until our booked time, however to stop us getting bored we were given a free foot massage which was very relaxing. The hammam itself was very relaxing and felt very thorough, we were both thoroughally scrubbed until our skin felt soft and new. The staff were very professional and at no point did we feel embaressed or awkward despite being almost naked during the treatments. After the Hammam we were led into a roof top tent where we were given tea and water and another foot massage. All in all it was an excellent experience, the spa is very clean and the staff are professional and welcoming, we'd definitely book again.

Amazing experience. Our experience at Heritage spa was fantastic, we paid for the dual hammam and massage treatment said to last 1hr45mins but we were at the spa for over 2 and a half hours. The experience was lovely and really put me at ease - not knowing what to expect. My partner and I had dual treatment rooms for both the massage and hammam which was a lovely touch and it is a very luxurious place to be. before the treatments we were offered tea and discussed what we wanted to get out of the treatments and chose our products, we then had the hammam and after this had another cup of tea and a glass of minted water with sweets before going for our massage. following our massage we were given time to recover before dressing etc, and as we left we were both given an argan oil soap to take home included in the price. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!

Relaxing, care free experience. My fiancee and I opted to go for separate treatments- I had the hammam and he had the massage. Customer service was excellent and very attentive. The hammam was a totally unique experience, very relaxing and my skin felt incredible afterwards. There was no rush, staff really took their time with you. I did not get the impression they were trying to get me in and out quickly as I have experienced with many other salons and spas. I enjoyed relaxing afterwards in the lounge and had some yummy tea and snacks. Definitely would reccommend this to others; in my opinion, the best activity we did in Marrakech!

Simply amazing. We booked for couples treatment which included traditional hamman, massage, facial and foot massage, they allowed us to change the foot massage to a pedicure when we arrived.Bee warned the traditional hamman involves being practically naked in a steam room, then being vigorously scrubbed and slathered in clay! The hamman treatment was a great experienced and was followed by a relaxing massage and facial for me and massage and pedicure for my partner.The staff were very professional and welcoming.

An oasis of tranquility. I've just returned from a few days in Marrakech and have to say that the highlight of the break was my visit to the Heritage Spa. My visit was arranged through the Riad in which I stayed. The spa is in the Old Town and is reached on foot through a series of alleys, but don't let that put you off (its part of the adventure). Stepping through the front door is like entering an oasis of tranquility. The staff are all friendly and professional and their hospitality is warm and welcoming.I indulged in the Destination Marrakech package, which involved a thorough cleansing by the ladies in the authentic hammam followed by the most relaxing massage I think I've ever had. The relaxation rooms are straight out of the pages of The Arabian Nights. Here mint tea and smiles abound. Just relax and enjoy.No visit to this hot, bustling city would be complete without a visit to Heritage Spa. Go on, treat yourself.

A unique Moroccan eperience. We visited Heritage Spa after a fun day attending cooking school. We were greeted and ushered into a little room and given tea during our wait for our "Destination Marrakech" hammam and massage. I had injured my heel and leg prior to our trip so having to walk up a flight of steep steps to the changing room was a bit challenging. Once we were outfitted in our disposable underwear and robes we climbed another flight of stairs up to our hammam room which was extremely hot and steamy. I was not prepared for the intense heat and was somewhat overwhelmed by the hot tiles and room temperature but our hammam attendants were very attentive and helpful at helping me cool down. We were scrubbed and sprayed all over and both my husband and I felt fresh and ready for more mint tea before we headed downstairs for our massages. I enjoyed my massage but I don't think my Therapist was as experienced as others I have found in the US, Thailand, an on cruise ships. We enjoyed our time at Heritage Spa and would recommend it to others but only if you do not have difficulty with stairs or can tolerate high heat and humidity.

Very professional. Lovely massage, although more relaxing than deep intense (to be fair, exactly as explained). The owner / manager was extremely professional, courteous and keen to please, as were all staff.

Magnificent Moroccan Massage. We had such a good experience with the Heritage Spa. Tucked away in an obscure street it was like an oasis from the hectic pace of Marrakech. We didn't know what to expect but were delighted with the traditional scrub down and relaxation rooms. The massage was really good; the atmosphere and the ladies were fantastic. I highly recommend this Moroccan experience.

Amazing experience. I would definitely recommend this Spa for a Hammam. It's a place of peace and tranquility. They are very welcoming and The ladies are very professional. We had a basic hammam and felt really relaxed at the end. The basic price was around £30 which was definitely worth it

Hammam + footmassage. We were greeted by a very friendly woman who explained our program to us, brought us a cup of tea and showed us the facilities.The hammamexperience for me was good but the women giving it were -in my opinion- not that accommodating. I could never understand what they were saying (it was my first hammam experience) and i felt like everything was rushed (people coming after us?)... All in all, a nice experience but next time i'll try somewhere different.The footmassage was not good. The 2 girls performing it (i travelled with a friend) were constantly talking to each other and it bothered me. If she could talk and massage well at the same time it would perhaps be a bit more positive but i could massage my feet better myself....I told her that she could massage harder but then she talked more with her friend... A disappointment and waste of my money.

A very special experience. Heritage Spa has transformed the traditional hammam into a luxuriously sensual experience.Definitely recommend that you get the hammam followed by the massage. One of the best spa experiences I have ever had.

A piece of heaven!. I went there with my fiancé and we loved it! Absolutely flawless service, we were so revived and happy after our treatments there :) We went for the Heritage Romance package, including a hammam, massages, a facial and a foot massage - very recommended! Of course you need to be relaxed and just enjoy the ride! Highly recommended to take your traditional Moroccan hammam here! It was really one of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech ;)
Very nice . Very nice, not wow but very nice. Had the simple package but would have loved just little bit more pampering

Excellent Hammam. All I can say is WAW, the idea of a husband and wife doing the job as partner is amazing as it is hard work, This hamam gave me and my wife the best relaxing time we needed and we didnt have to find it as we were picked up by the owner from our hotel and welcome d by the husband at the spaIn the hamam the two ladies were great and worked very hard and after we had the best massage of all time.If you visit marrackech and want a real massage with services in style then this is the place

Good but not the best. A bit difficult to find, this traditional spa is relaxing. You wait with a tea near a fireplace while choosing the oïl you will use for your massage. There is a changing room with lockers. They lend you paper underwear and bathrobes.The hammam was disappointing. The water kept going from freezing to very hot. So not comfortable. The women were laughing and speaking arab, so it made me uncomfortable also, since we are completely naked in the hammam. The waiting room between treatments was a bit bare, but they offered us water, tea and pastries, which was nice. The massage was perfect. If you have one experience of a hammam to savour, go to the Hammam La Rose nearby. It's way better.

Amazing...a must do, segregation aswell. First time me and my wife when to a hammam...we did the hammam and massage. Overall it was a relaxing experience just like to add especially due to me and my wife being devout muslims they kept it segregated at all times and catered to our needs which made us feel very comfortable. A big thank you

Complete Bliss!. I went here on recommendation from a Moroccan friend. It was my first Hammam and an incredibly blissful experience. The prices are really good value, the staff are lovely and the treatments amazing. I had a hammam followed by the spices massage. They give you tea before and during the treatments, the facilities are really clean, very traditional and the focus is on making you relax and it was just the de-stressing that I needed!
Pleasant couple of hours. Lovely spa, nice hamman treatment.The massage was lovely, really relaxing.Not the cheapest place in Marrakech and not the easiest place to find!

Highly recommend. Wonderful experience at heritage spa. Peaceful, indulgent hammam shared with my husband followed by hour long massage. Heaven! The fact Im 5 months pregnant was no problem and the women acted with special care and attention. Beautiful setting, great products. Ukrainian owner very lovely and professional, works hard! For a taste of heaven and escape the madness, go.

Excellent Hammam and Massage. We visited this spa after having a very average experience elsewhere......what a difference! Fabulous rooms and ambience; very professional and efficient staff throughout. The hammam was great, and the massage subliminal! We booked the couple package and it was more expensive compared to others in the city but totally worth it. Go ahead and treat yourself to the hammam and massage - you won't regret it!

Pleasant. Decided to treat my wife to a spa visit during our 4 day stay in Marakech as we had experienced massages from everywhere between Bali and Brighton!After a glass of mint tea we were taken up some narrow stairs to a changing room where we were given a locker for our clothes and belongings, a bath robe and slippers and some paper underwear!First off we were put into the "Scrub Room" very hot stone tables to lay on whilst being scrubbed all over with a scouring pad glove, I watched as a layer of skin was removed all over, was this pleasure or torture! A layer of mud was then plastered over us as we were left to bake on the hit slabs! Once this was washed off, we were taken to a tented roof area for more mint tea and a chocolate, the ladies who scrubbed us were very good, all part of the Hamas experience. We were then led into the massage room, mood lighting, warm and the soothing music soon relaxed you whilst the massage was given. This was extremely well done, the oil was chosen by us from a selection of six which were offered to us at the start of the visit and the girls doing the massage were given instructions as to our preferences - hard or gentle - as you desired!The whole experience took 2 1/2 hours, and cost 1,300 DH for the two of us. A day later and even after 2 showers, I still feel relaxed and my skin is still smooth and silky and slightly oily, well worth the money - and the torture!We were guided there by the staff from the Riad and found our own way back, it's not that difficult to find as there are signs all around the area but you need to watch how you get there if you want to find your own way back as the streets are a labyrinth and it's easy to go round in circles or in a direction you don't want to go in!A very enjoyable experience and as good as any Balinese Spa massage. My wife was given a bar of soap as we left and we were given the "Scouring Glove" so we can torture each other when we get home!

Not so impressed. Other ratings I read on this place were positive, but I was not impressed. The man who was running the show was very distracted, did not clarify some details to us, and made the overall experience less pleasant. The women who did services for the traditional hammam experience were nice and skilled. I would not go back to this place.

Perfect start to our holiday! . We had the romance package- it was brilliant!! The staff made us feel like royalty. If you want to get a tan during your holiday, Definitely have a hammam at the start as it will scrub off any existing tan.
Relaxing. its not so cheap but thats not why we went, most of the rviews are good and so is this one... Try it - you wont regret it

Wonderful. Had the hamman and massage, for 2. It was wonderfully relaxing and while not cheap, 1300Dh, was worth every penny; and seemed about par for the course for the hamman we saw advertising.The owner spoke excellent English, and he and all the staff were friendly and welcoming.Give it a go.

Lived up to all the reviews. I spent 3 wonderful hours there today having read the reviews. Don't be put off, all the best places in the Medina seem to be down alleys you wouldn't normally visit!Basically all the reviews are right - serenity, relaxation and I floated back to my hotel after the hammam and then THE best massage I've ever had. Bliss.

Amazing treatments and the staff is super nice!. Me and my mother tried the hammam and the stress-relief massage package. The prices is quite reasonable (for Norwegians). We came about 40 minutes before the treatment, because we couldn't find a place to eat lunch (it's not a lot of stores around and the spa is quite difficult to find) and so the manager recommended that we sit down and he would send out someone to get lunch for us. The hammam experience wasn't really my thing (a little awkward being washed by someone else, but my mother liked it very much), but the ladies were very professional and very nice! The massage on the other hand was heaven! I think I fell asleep a few times, because it was so nice. They definitely know what they're doing. During the treatments we were served water, snacks and tea. We also got to keep the scrub-glove from the hammam if we want to exfoliate at home. When we were finished the manager told us the lunch was a gift from him and we got souvenir soap. Luxury!! Thumbs up!

Absolutely magnificent service. We decided to follow all the reviews on TripAdvisor regarding this place and try this place out for our Hammam experience in Morocco. The place is very tricky to find unless you have a detailed map or a local to guide you (who will most likely try to rip you off for showing you the way, so be weary). If you can find your way to Ben Youssef mosque try to get to the market street and keep an eye out for somewhat elusive signage. Once there, it feels like you are in a different world. We had a thorough introduction into the different oils, muds and tinctures that were supposed to deliver a heavenly experience and they did not disappoint. For £39 for a full body scrub, Hammam and massage experience, including relaxation with tea and sweets this is a generally good price to go by. The service is excellent, the staff know their art and even when they don't speak English at all, make you feel extremely comfortable and welcome.

Wonderful hammam and massage. I booked a couples hammam and massage for my husband and I. I wasn't entirely sure my husband would enjoy it but he loved it. It was a truly relaxing experience. I would thoroughly recommend.

You must go here while in Marrakech!. Greatest spa experience of my life-5 stars all around. Visited with 4 other girl friends and all had hamam and massages after a desert trek. No issue with scheduling 5 people at once and we were immediately greeted with tea and snacks. Classy, beautiful, relaxing, clean, and exceptionally well priced. I would have paid double the rate!
Relaxing. Wow what a lovely time spent at the Spa. My husband and I went for the Hamam for a couple called "the lovers" We have never felt so clean, relaxed and spoilt. Would highly recommend.

Very nice first experience at a hammam. Having heard a lot about the hammam experience in Marrakech, my wife and I were keen to try one. We were recommended this one by the Riad we were staying at and it did not disappoint. The staff were courteous and professional and the hammam as such was a relaxing experience that left us both feeling very clean and with smooth skin. There was a very nice room to relax in afterwards that was a nice touch. Finally we were given some soaps to take home as well. All together an excellent experience.

Amazing! . What an amazing experience. I went to this spa with my partner and mother in law. It was the best part of the holiday. We chose the sea salt hamman and massage. Both were brilliant. The atmosphere was lovely, you were made to feel so relaxed and at ease. I was even given soap with the scent that I used for my massage at the end! Well worth the money we paid for it and would recommend to anyone.

5 star experience!. My husband and I treated ourselves to a hammam & massage experience at the fabulous Heritage Spa at the end our stay in Marrakech. What a fantastic experience! The service was first class & it was by far the best massage we've ever had....and we've had a few over the years! The treatments were great value - you'd pay at least double in the UK & the masseurs were very professional. I'd thoroughly recommend Heritage Spa to anyone looking for the ultimate spa experience.

Haven of peace. We booked this spa after reading on tripadvisor that it is the number 1 ranking spa here. We did not regret it. There were 9 of us in total, and we had planned it well ahead of our visit. The manager who I was emailing was very helpful and we worked out a plan of everyones treatments so as to not waste time on the day. The spa itself is very clean and you feel relaxed a soon as you enter...away from the hustle and bustle of the main street. Would have been a little tricky to find but the staff sent a member of staff to escort us on his scooter alongside the taxi so he could walk us to it when we got there (cars cannot drive into the little street it is actually accessed from). We did the romance package and the process was explained to us while we sipped on mint tea and picked our massage oil. The Hammam was great...never felt so clean in my life! The rest room where you are again offered a mint tea and chocolates was a nice surprise. We were then taken for massages/facials/treatments - all of which were relaxing. We were even given a complimentary hammam glove and soap to take home with us! By the time we were done we all felt fabulously looked after! If you are after a spa to spend time at during your visit, I totally recommend this one!

superb. my husband and I had a Hamman followed by massage at this spa on December 31st. I have to say it was a most wonderful way to purify and prepare for the new year. The hamman changed our whole concept of what bathing means and I probably left half a pound of old skin behind. Every detail was attended to, the service was stellar, I was in heaven from beginning to end, and as an added nice touch we both were gifted souvenir soaps in the same scent we had picked for our massage oil. This was the most amazing experience I had in Morocco. Period.
Excellent. Great service, beautifully decorated, and great therapies! Highly recommended when in Marrakesh. Good location as well.

Amazing Hamman Experience - You are spoiled there!. Hi everybody, we just visited the spa 3 days ago and loved the experience. We had booked a romance package and loved the Hamman and massage. Everything is very clean, staff is extremely friendly and you have a feeling you are in the different world - especially when they got you the little chocolate and mint tea during your break :-) You will be spoiled!

Wonderful!. Very friendly staff, we went to many spas but none could compare to the experience here. I wrote this review months after I visited. Usually don't write reviews but it was an experience I'll never forget. My girlfriend approves too and she's difficult to please; yeah I said it!!! It gets a 5 from me especially because of the value. Great service at a very reasonable price. Not too hard to find but if it's the first day of your holiday, circle the block and look out for the pic I've attached Enjoy!

Wonderfull experience.. I came to this spa because it had the best reviews on tripadvisor and I can say that all that is said about this Hammam is true. We booked Hammam and massage for two. After an explanatory session with a mint tee we were shown the changing rooms with lockers. Then we started the hammam session on the roof of the riad. Me and my partner shared the small and hot hammam room together. Two women did the treatment with oils, essence and mud. You feel very good after it. After a good resting pause in a tent in the roof with mint tea and a small sweet bite we did the massage session. Me and my partner took the relaxing massage with some pressure. We both thought that the ladies that did the massage were very professional. We were deeply relaxed after this. The room where the massage is done is warm, dimmed and relaxing music is being played. After the massage the ladies let us rest (sleep) for some time. All in all it was a very nice experience: the riad, the decoration, the music, the staff, the massage ladies and the manager. I highly recommend this place.PS: It seems the location is difficult to find. We used the location hinted by Google Maps and it was straight forward. Several panels guide you the last meters from the main road to the spa.

Amazing experience!. The number of excellent reviews say it all, and I can't thank the TripAdvisor community enough for such a fab recommendation! My wife and I had opted for the Romantica package and thoroughly enjoyed our experience! The service was courteous and efficient, everything was explained well and the hammam/massage transported us to a different world altogether! Worth every penny, and couldn't recommend this any higher!Yes, this place is indeed very tricky to find and we struggled too! It's just a 5 min walk from Bab Doukkala, it's signposted but still not easy to get to. Read the directions carefully and follow! Ask around but very likely that you'll get hassled by little kids wanting to lead you to the spa!

Heaven!. We went to heritage spa with our two teenagers. We all enjoyed it and felt blissfully clean and relaxed after the wonderful Hammam. The staff are very courteous and nice. The environment very calm and decorated so nicely. Attention to details everywhere like the heater in the dressing room. Can't recommend enough.

Great service, but difficult to find. We found this place with GPS as it's otherwise a bit difficult to locate. The staff were friendly, and you are given choices of fragrances etc. in English before the treatments begin. This was my first hammam experience and it was positive, with the scrub followed by sweets and mint tea, then a massage before getting dressed again. Always difficult to know how much to tip and who gets the tip. Our group ranged from 50 to 120 Dhr.
Superb. Had the "Heritage Romance" package, and we both loved it. Can highly recommend at package deal with both hemmam bath and massage.

Awesome. A true sanctuary amongst the mayhem of Marrakech. A definite must to scrub off all the dirt of the city and give your mind a rest from the contrast horns and buzzing scooter engines. The spa is tranquil and calm. The staff are attentive but not overbearing. The hammam experience is not for prudes but well worth the experience. The massage which follows is sublime and relaxing. All in all the ambience is truly wonderful and combined with the endless supply of mint tea, water and sweet treats, why would you ever want to leave! Some of our group went back twice in 4 days. I would definitely repeat the experience!

Highlight of our holiday - hammam & massage. We had a hammam and massage. This was a fantastic experience, highlight of our holiday in morocco. You do have to strip down to just paper pants, so I advise you go with someone you are comfortable with as you will be the same sauna room to have the hammam.Receptionist is lovely and explains the whole process, you are provided with heated bath robes, paper underwear and Moroccan tea. We paid 24 euro each and were there for approx. 2.5 - 3 hours. Definitely worth every penny. Best to have one in the afternoon, to relax after a day shopping in the souks!!

Very good expeirence. Another Hammam nearby, which didn't have any openings left for the day, recommended Heritage. It was my second hammam in Marrakech, so I have a comparison. Great service, nice atmosphere, and overall a great experience. The only con I can think of is a hard to find location - you have to take couple side streets to get there, but visible and clear signs will help you. On the way back they actually sent a person that took the luggage and showed the way. Strongly recommend!
Commitment to excellence. The highlight of our trip. Had the heritage spa package. From the tea to the music to the robes was wonderful real attention to detail. Did not want the massage to stop.

Excellent!. We had a traditional hammam with black soap and it was the best part of our trip. The skin feels completely different! We both strongly recommend this experience towards the end of your trip. After long excursions and camel ridding, this is a perfect way to relax and get ready for going home.

Wonderful experience. We booked in as a couple for the Romance option which included the Hamman and then a long full body massage. We found the settings very beautiful, lovely and traditional with a peaceful vibe. We arrived early and sat drinking tea and waiting until the Hamman was free. As soon as it was we were shown to the dressing room where they had lockers for your things and then to the Hamman itself. Both my partner and I found it a very pleasant experience, the Hamman was lovely and hot, just right in fact and the treatments and scrubs were done well. The ladies were kind, offering us water, checking we were ok, that nothing was too hard, too hot etc. Fantastic. We then went to relax for a while together with some mint tea which was nice and gave us a bit of together time. We were then shown to the massage room, we had a double room not like the reviewer below but in all reality when you are having your massage you don't talk to your partner anyway, infact we were both totally in a world of our own anyway - the massage was great! The ladies were really well trained, I had a more relaxing massage and my partner a more rigourous sports massage as we were asked what we wanted. We both loved the experience and came out feeling amazing, super relaxed, very very clean from the Hamman and super soft! Absolutely recommend. Staff were exceptionally kind, helpful and attentive.

Not so romantic. We booked this spa ( special romantic package), as being nr 1 from tripadvisor. It started ok with the hamman, although this was not so spectacular as I expected; no steam, hot ok, but nothing compared to things done before at home. The next part was the massages and other treatments, to my surprise, my husband and I were led to different rooms for the rest of the afternoon (2h)... Goodbye romance!

Oasis in Marrakesh. I've booked this spa treatment before we arrived in Marrakesh and although the process was slightly challenging due to the deposit requirement it was well worth the effort . The Heritage Spa was not easy to find but once we did arrive the staff was very welcoming. If you're not familiar with the area you should definitely hire a guide. We purchased the couples treatment which included a scrub, a massage, and a facial. This was a fantastic value and better than anything else we found in Marrakesh. I get a massage twice a month so I thought that the massage was just average but good for a spa. We had to add a facial because you only get one with the couples package that we purchased, but both facials were excellent.The famous scrub was what we were looking forward to, however, I was disappointed. You are taken into a room with a slab of warm stone, in this case it was as a couple, and you're wearing only a disposable thong. We were both in the room relaxing comfortably awaiting the staff member to begin the scrub service. It was a female technician for both of us and the experience was different depending on sex. My female companion enjoyed the scrub and thought it was thorough and invigorating. I was disappointed in my scrub because the female attendant seemed to be shy to get into all of the areas of the body (i.e. nether region and buttocks) and so that diminished the value and therefore the effect of the scrub for me.I don't believe that the female staff person was holding back, I think she was just young/shy to perform this on a man. I think that the service may be catered more towards women so I would suggest this: either hire male staff members that can perform the scrub or instruct the female staff members to make sure that they provide equal treatment for both men and women.The experience with the scrub notwithstanding, my companion and I both enjoyed our treatments at the Heritage Spa. We were treated to a gift at the end of our session and the entire experience was very comfortable. We would both go back to the Heritage Spa if our travels take us to Marrakesh once again.

A very strange experience. First the good things. We were six women, well traveled, in town for a weekend. We scheduled three treatments each. The Hamman Scrub was well done. The rooms were hot, but comfortable. The women were well trained. I completely enjoyed the experience. The hot stone massage (and other various massages received) were set in luxurious rooms with lovely low lighting and pleasant music. The masseuse was young and seemed adequately trained. She worked hard.Now for the strange parts:The reception room was a makeshift room on the roof. The rugs for sitting on the floor were well worn. Our manicures/pedicures were done ON the massage tables. The pedicures required you to lie on your back and get your foot into a bucket of hot water. This was uncomfortable and awkward. The manicures were poorly done. Our cuticles were cut so short they hurt and bled. We each came to the conclusion that the girls were under-trained. I felt if they do not have room for a proper manicure/pedicure station, they should not offer the treatment.Climbing to the reception room I had to step over someone's legs. He was in a treatment room so small that his feet hung out of the curtain providing his privacy.Finally, during our stay, a woman (not from our group) passed out in the Hamman.
