She was carried by her wrists and ankles ACROSS the Spa absolutely naked and placed indecorously on the rugs of the reception room. No effort was made to provide for her modesty.In review, the Hamman is too small for the number of treatments they offer. The staff was not professionally trained. Parts of the Hamman are in need of remodeling/redecorating.I wish this place well, but it was not what we expected.

Heritage spa - amazing. We read about this spa on trip adviser and were a bit dubious as to how good it could really be.Having visited spas around the world like the Maldives and Mauritius and thinking they were outstanding. I can honestly say that that the experience at the Heritage Spa was one of the best I have had.As soon as you walk in you are made to feel welcome with Moroccan whiskey, then you are talked through your treatment and what you wish to experience from it ie, feeling refreshed or relaxed.The Hamman is a unique experience and not for the shy for but after it your skin feels amazingly soft and the massage afterwards was one of the best I have ever had.I would not hesitate to recommend the Heritage Spa to anyone. Great value for money and the very best way to kick start your holiday .We will definitely return

Top Spa indeed. I had this week 3 treatments at Heritage Spa and I would come back again for a fourth one, but I am leaving tomorrow, unfortunately. I wish I could have a place like this in my home country, but there isn´t. I really can recommend this spa to everybody who is visiting Marrakech and who wants to gain a Hammam experience. I felt very well taken care of - the owner, Ali, was personally taking care of me in a very generous way - as well as he takes care of other clients - the massage was excellent - the girls seem to be well traineId. Also the applied products seem to be of excellent quality. Reading some of the previous comments, I would like to add, that Heritage Spa is a well known place and often fully booked, but it was never disturbing to me. I had a 10 min. break to wait for the next treatment and during this time I was offered a free 10 min foot massage - tea, mint water, biscuits - Nothing was missing ! So, that is why I am rating this Spa with "Excellent".

Great hamman!. We visited this spa two days ago for our hamman (best to book before you go as we did!) and it's hidden away which makes it more interesting so check your map (we didn't have a problem).We just had a hamman for the first time and we really enjoyed it - everyone in the spa, particularly the manager, were so kind and polite. I would really appreciate going as it's so relaxing and you really get your money's worth!

Good treatment, but not 'affordable luxury'. I agree with the previous review. My partner and had the 'romance package' which included a hamman, a massage and a facial for me a foot rub for my partner. The treatments were fine, apart from the foot massage, which my partner said was very poor. Bear in mind that he works in the fitness/spa industry. We were interrupted several times during the hamman and the ladies that were taking Care of us kept talking during the treatment, which is quite annoying.My biggest disappointement were the facilities. Absolutely not luxurious at all, especially the covered terrace where we had our break in between treatments, which looked quite poky and messy with a bar surrounded by stuff that should not be there.I am not sure it is worth the oney we paid for it.

Aims to be excellent but too busy to deliver. Both my partner and I had a hammam followed by massage (my partner) and facial (myself) and expected a wonderfully relaxing experience based on the reviews and the reward of excellence by trip adviser which is proudly displayed on every wall in the hammam. Although reasonably satisfied with the treatments, the whole experience left us feeling a bit let down. The hammam is clearly very busy and possibly for that reason the predominant feeling is of being 'processed' rather than taken care of. There seems to be confusion over who is looking after whom, long waiting times in-between stages (2 hour treatment took 3 hours in total), even the staff get confused who they were treating, as was the case in our hammam. The selection of massage oils that was offered was never acknowledged and implemented into the treatment. In the case of my facial a skin assessment was  not done even though i was told it would follow after the hammam and before the facial. Overall a very average experience even though the individual staff was lovely and professional, which is a pity. This hammam is clearly a victim of it's own success and being too busy is not able to deliver the excellence it's capable of.

Great Spa with Accomodating Host. I organized my wedding in Marrakesh and booked a day at Heritage Spa for the women in my family to get a taste of the Moroccan hamman and other spa activities.The spa itself was great - it is a little oasis of calm serenity in the middle of the busy old city, tucked into a traditional house with layers of rooms and staircases, and tradititional decorations with a modern touch.The spa services were fantastic - the modern hammam and the massage were great, and the staff was exceedingly professional.In addition, the owner, Ali, was the most helpful man I've met in Marrakesh. He helped me organize the spa day, he accomodated all sorts of special requests, and he was so professional and honest and streightforward. It was really refershing. I absolutely recommend this spa - it is one of the highlights of Marrakesh.

Excellent. Whenever I visit Marrakech I like to have a Hammam and a massage and have used another spa before or had someone come to the Riad. However this spa was recommended to me by the new manager of the Riad I stay at and I ended up paying two visits it was so good. My first visit was for the Heritage Beaute including hammam, massage and facial and was blissful. The owner has a chat first just to check what you have booked for and asks you to choose your massage oil whilst you sip tea and minted water. After changing you are taken to the roof area where the hammams are and treated to a full exfoliation and body wash with black soap and local clay all carried out in a heated room and this is followed by more tea and petits fours whilst you await your next treatment. The masseuse was excellent and for all her small size she had some strength in those hands as well as gentleness and after one hour I was feeling markedly less tense. She followed this by a wonderful facial to finish. I left after 3 hours of relaxation with gifts of shampoo, an exfoliation mitt and I bought a supply of black soap. Two days later I returned for a further massage on a troublesome neck and shoulder and was please that I had been given the same girl for this. Ali and his wife run a superb place and it is one I shall certainly visit again on my next trip.

Heaven!. Went with a group of female friends for our first ever hammam experience. We were made to feel so welcome and relaxed even before we had picked our treatments. The riad is stunning, in smell and decor! The whole hammam experience was amazing, never felt so clean. Following with a massage is a must! I don't have anything to compare this to as far as spas in Marrakesh go, but compared to my experience of spas this was by far the most amazing experience and something I would do again! I highly recommend a visit to Herritage Spa, I've never felt so relaxed.

Fantastic, professional, relaxing. My friends and I went to this spa yesterday. Unfortunately some local boys pointed it out when we were looking for it and then got nasty outside demanding money. The owner was a bit of a hero from the off as he hurried us inside and told the boys to leave us alone! Inside the spa was lovely - staff were warm and professional - as myself and my friend had to wait for our hammam initially the owner have us free foot massages and mint tea and cakes while we waited! The lady doing the massage was fantastic! We were then led through for the hammam - an interesting experience!! I loved it! The whole experience was great - when we left the owner even arranged for an escort to take us to our taxi in case the local boys were waiting outside! I would highly recommend this place. All the staff were so kind and professional and nothing was too much trouble.
GREAT. It is a wonderful place to go to, you are being spoiled by the minute you get in but everything is also very professional. When I go back to Marakesh I will for sure go back there as well!

The best spa treatment ever!. The whole experience at the Heritage spa is first class from start to finish. I went with a group of friends and we chose the Heritage Beaute treatment.When you arrive you are given mint tea and water and asked to select the oil for your massage. You are then escorted to a room with lockers to change into your paper knickers and dressing gown. First you are taken to the hammam where you are washed, scrubbed and exfoliated then left in what looks like mud for a while. They even wash your hair.After your hammam you are given more mint tea and petit fours before being taken through for your relaxing oil massage and facial.The treatment we booked was for 2 1/2 hours, although with the time inbetween it took 3 1/2 hours (so make sure you aren't rushing anywhere afterwards).This is by far the most relaxing spa treatment I have ever had. The staff are really lovely and friendly. I would definitely recommend it! Exceptional.

The ultimate relax. This was my first Moroccan spa experience so I wasn't entirely sure what to expect. Heritage Spa was recommended by a friend. I booked a Hammam and a massage and oh my goodness this has to have been the most relaxing experience I have had in 10 years. The service from beginning to end was amazing. The staff were lovely. Highly recommended for anyone who has any stress in their lives.

The perfect birthday!. My wife and i visited Heritage Spa for her 30th birthday, choosing this over Les Bains because of the overwhelming reviews on here. We were not diappointed! Located on an unsuspecting street, it's an aladdins cave of beautiful relaxing rooms from the moment you step in. You feel it retains the genuine traditional feel of a riad vs the more common characterless hotel spas. We had a couples Hammam and full body masaage - first time for a Hammam, and something we will be repeating! Never felt sosoclean! Nothing is rushed, you feel the staff want you to enjoy the experience, rather than churn through bookings. Friendly and professional, and the massage was perfect, an ideal relief from the chaos outside the doors. Could not recommend Heritage Spa enough!

a happy starting. This was my first experience in a hammam...if this place has such a good rate in Tripadivisor, there must be a valid reason. I booked the couple package and overall it was a very nice experience. All the staff were amazing, friendly and professional and it was a good relaxing way to end our first Marrakech day.Don't miss the chance to spend some relaxing hours here, if you visit Marrakech.

Wonderful. Can't think of a better way to relax and forget about the stresses of the working world. Enjoy! Apparently I need to write 100 characters for this review to be published. Unfortunately, I did have enough time to write a short letter, so had to take more time to ensure it meets the criteria (apologies, Mr Twain).

Excellent day, very relaxing!. We had an excellent day at the Heritage spa. We dropped in the day before we wanted to go and sat with the very helpful manager to understand all the packages available. We were given mint tea and much of his time which we really appreciated.The next day we went in and had all the treatments explained to us so we knew what to expect of the traditional Hammam treatment. They perform this treatment in private rooms for couples which is great.We also had a facial and foot treatment both of which were very well done.Highly recommended.

Aaaaah-mazing. Honestly one of the most amazing massages I've ever gotten. So relaxing, especially after a long, hot day sight seeing. I had went to for the traditional hammam first, which was quite an interesting experience, but felt so good. After enjoying that treatment I was led to a room for some tea, water and sweets and even got a little head massage. From there I was led down to a hot stone massage. All the services were delightful, the staff was charming, the place was very clean. They also helped me to get to and from my riad which I appreciated greatly. I would highly recommend a visit to Heritage Spa while in Marrakech.
Ultimate relaxation. I had a very good experience after all the long walks in the souks. This was the ultimate relaxation, including the service which was brilliant.

Soooooo relaxed. There it's no wonder this is number one on the list of things to do. We had very welcoming service, relaxing treatments, very decent prices and an amazing time. From the hospitality, professional service, bottles of water, mint tea, small snacks, robes, conversation, free soaps to take home and that soft relaxed feeling that lasted days who can complain. Loved it!

We loved this!. We really enjoyed our experience of having a full Hamamm at Heritage Spa. The owners were extremely helpful sending a man to collect us from our Riad and walk us back aswell. We enjoyed our first treatment so much we went back for massages! The mint tea and biscuits were great and its fab we got to keep our scrub pads aswell. We felt this place was a good standard and good value for money too.

Pure Bliss!!. Heritage spa was just around the corner from our riad and so seemed the perfect place to try our first hamman.. the only downside was that we didn't find it sooner!! Everything about it was perfect. We were greeted with mint tea and never felt in any rush, in fact we spent 2 hours at the spa for our 45 minute hamman!! Marrakech is an amazing place but it is pretty full on and a visit to Heritage spa is the best way to relax.

Did the job.... We booked at the Heritage for a hamman and massage for myself and my daughter. Anotonina is a true professional and looked after us well, as did the ladies in the hamman.As a therapist, I know a good massage from a bad one, and this young lady was meticulous and gladly addressed the areas I wanted her to. BUT I wasn't happy with a man being around the spa and definitely not happy with him towel drying my hair whilst I sat about in a robe. Call me prudish but I would have liked this to have been done by a woman. My daughter did point out he was there for security reasons as men too are clients but I still think his services should be carefully evaluated and if nothing, I should have been given a choice.MInt tea and cakes - lovelyAnd the giving of free soap bars, a lovely touch.Recommend it highly.....

A Must Do. My wife and I had a Destination Marrakech package at HeritageIt was a wonderful experience and the Hamman made you oh so clean!!It was all very professionally handled and it was our first experience with a Hamman. After cookies and mint tea we both enjoyed a separate but very relaxing massageAll in all, not to be missed if you are in Marrakech

Never felt so clean. We booked our hammam the same day and we got an opening. The owner Ali, let a driver pick us up from our hotel to the spa. Reception and hospitality was top notch when we arrived. We were then told about the hammam and its benefits with brief history and then my friend and I went in for our hammam. It felts amazing being scrubbed all over and getting all the nasty dead skin cells off. We then had our massage with great music and ambience and lots of delicious tea and cookies in-between. The owner then let the driver take us into town to do some errands and then brought us back to the hotel. Only downside about this place is that the products for sale there are more than double the price so get the names and buy them elsewhere.

Wonderful way to spend my 21st!. A friend and me booked the traditional hammam treatment for my 21st birthday at the beginning of September. We were greeted by the owner of the Heritage Spa, who told us all about how the hammam works and has been used in Morocco. He was terribly apologetic that we were running 10 minutes late for our treatment, and after explaining that I was in Marrakech celebrating my 21st he offered my friend and me a complimentary foot massage following the hammam! The hammam itself was incredible and was followed by Moroccan sweets and, of course, mint tea! We didn't need to lift a finger whilst we were there, as we had our dressing gowns tied for us and our hair dried and everything! I've never felt so soft and clean in my life!We chose this spa because it was rated no.1 on Trip Advisor, and I definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to experience a hamman in total luxury and bliss! It's also pleasantly located in a quieter part of the old city.

Absolute bliss. Plus a paper man-thong.. As two students we splashed out on this after reading other reviews and it was a great idea. We got the Destination Marrakech package - billed as 1h 45mins but we were in there 3 hours because they really do spoil you. In between the hammam and massage treatments we were left in a cosy nook with biscuits, cool water and mint tea. The hammam was done together and they made my boyfriend as comfortable as he could be with nothing but a bit of paper covering his modesty.. The massages were then done individually, and were absolute bliss. They check that the pressure is ok for you at the start and you choose your massage oil, lovely. Highly recommend it - might be a bit more expensive but it is completely worth it, and definitely less than you'd pay in England. Also they accept PayPal which was useful for us.

Spa. U must visit the spa it was just round the corner from our riad so finding it was easy this is an amazing place behind the front door the staff are very good and polite. Ali took time to explain the treatments in very relaxed atmosphere we had a hamman massage facial it took 3 hours ish it was heavenly this place is lovely its the most relaxed spa we have ever been to excellent.the value for money is second to none thanks

I felt good. A few days ago, a young man who seems to be there Commercial " I think" visited us in our Riad and suggested that we try the HERITAGE Spa , i had some doubt about first but he convinced me in his way and the reviews here made me more comfortable , I had a Hammame and it was so good i never felt more clean and the ladies there were polite and the explications was helpful i will try it again and again & recommend it to my friends.

I never use the word perfect, but this is the first time: PERFECT. We made a reservation for an hammam and a Harme du Sultan massage.Everything, but just everything is perfect: the greeting, the treat, the massage,...You have to do this when you are in Marrakech.My wife has been suffering in the back, but now she walks two weeks painless.A kind and excellent team !

Very relaxed!. Today I had a Hammam at the Heritage Spa. It was nice and relaxing and the women were very friendly! Tomorrow back for a massage! Go here when you're in Marrakech to calm down from the chaos on the street.

Heavenly.... We went to HERITAGE spa yesterday. We had the full hammam package together... we arrived at the spa and they fitted us in straight away. After having a mini consultation with Ali where we were given a detailed description of what was about to happen. We picked the oils we wanted used on us, we specified the pressure of our massages at this point too while enjoying mint tea. we were taken into a small changing room where we were given gown and slippers... and paper pants! After we has changed we were led upstairs to a sauna type room where we were truely washed and scrubbed. The ladies washed our hair too and gave us bottles of water. Then after about 45 minutes we sat in a relaxation room for about ten minutes. We were given mint tea again with biscuits while we waited to be called for our massages. The massages were absolutely just what we needed after a horrendous day being led around souks and tanneries. Its such a shame we cant afford to have this done everyday :) would recommend to anyone visiting marrakech. Thank you to Ali and all the girls for making our visit so special x

A truly blissful experience. I booked a hammam and massage package for my sister's birthday. The spa is very well signposted from around the back of the Bab Dokala mosque (where you can be dropped by taxi). It is a small spa run by a French husband and wife team. The manager was very friendly and welcoming, and recommended that we change from the hot stone massage we had booked to a normal massage due to the heat outside. This meant we ended up paying less, so it was nice of her to recommend the switch. The hammam was very thorough - I have never felt so clean! - and the ladies doing it taught us lots about the role of hammams in their culture without intruding on our relaxing time. We were given mint tea and snacks between our treatment in a very comfortable chill out room. The massage was one of the best I have ever had; they really listened to exactly what I wanted and delivered it. Upon leaving, the manager gave my sister a birthday present of a bottle of orange blossom massage oil. The whole experience (1 hour 45 minutes) cost about the same as you'd pay for a 30 minute massage in London.

Very good .. But. Overall it's one of the best spa's in Marrakech and the morrocan hammam with massage is really excellent i have two points that i'd mention:1) There Spa is very hot and you need to work on the A/C efficiency.2) There is no parking nearby Heritage spa so you need to stop about 250 meter and walk in order to get the spa.Overall i love it and this is the second time for me.

Good...but. Myself and my husband booked into the romance package. The place was good but not excellent. We were shown into a chill area to make our oil selections and have a mint tea nice touch however I didn't think the area was that nice and the shawl we were sitting on looked grubby. After this we were shown upstairs to the hammam were we had basically two women one really young give us our scrub and wash etc chilled for 5 mins then onto another chill area afain just an outdide area tented and it was boiling hot in there, we again had tea and water cookies again. This part was okay but not the best and I tell you why later! Then onto the massage we were split up at this point and showed to a nice room and had the body massages and facial. This I would say was the best part if the whole experience nice music playing and dimmed lights very good indeed and massage was great! Now the reason why I can't give more than 3 stars is because we were staying at the la maison arabe like 2 mins away and had a hammam and body mask there and it was amazing! The spa and hammam area was just gorgeous and we could not believe how nice the spa and their hammam was it was much more relaxing. At the heritage we felt like we were at a cattle market shifted from one area to the next or on a production line. The la maison arabe hammam was much bigger for 2 people and was proper steam getting pumped in there it was do much better than heritage. Also the spa area was so nicer if was pure luxury in comparison. The last reason no 3 stars is I did not like the owner constantly being about and at the end u are gave a small gift of soap very nice but then the male owner said I have another gift for you I wax then took to a little area where they sell products like oil etc he pointed to z bigger soap for me to take it just felt like I was being shown to this area to buy something I picked up the same soap as already given but slighty bigger one and we then left. It was not a bad experience but now we tried the la maison I would go there 100% before the heritage.

Well worth the price!. A very professional place with really good customer care. I suspect a bit more than you would pay for some of the other Spas, but well worth the (slightly) extra cost. I would recommend wholeheartedly!

Highly recommended. A wonderful experience right from the moment you walk through door. We were to made to feel very welcome and everything explained to us to help us understand all the options available. Ive been to a few day spa type places around the world this has to be one of the best overall experiences. Whilst I had a chosen a stronger massage and it would have been nice to have a bit more pressure, the massage was still truly relaxing and maybe it was for the best as it was one hour of pure bliss and relaxation. You are made to feel special here and I cannot not speak highly enough of the Heritage Spa.

A wonderful spa. Having just arrived in Marrakech, we wandered by accident to the door of this spa while looking for a Riad to stay in and the owner, Ali, was helpfulness personified when he took considerable time and trouble to offer us several choices which he Google'd up for us. His TA certificate of excellence was proudly displayed on the wall and we made a mental note to return for a hammam if our two-day schedule allowed. We went to the nearby Riad he suggested as best for us and it was a good choice.We returned the day after to escape the intense Marrakech heat and take in a hammam with massage. It is a wonderful, compact spa where Ali's staff take their work seriously under his knowledgeable direction. He is an expert in his field. It's a quite different experience to a regular public hammam (a good deal dearer too) as he focuses the emphasis on a luxurious dream rather than a simple back scrub and wash. Its a real ladies pamper venue. You were constantly being offered cold water or Moroccan tea to refresh and revive you as you progressed through the hammam and massage pathway. His market is spa rather than public bath and he serves it well. More like Wilmslow than Morocco, our treatment took almost three hours but the price matched it. The massage was the high spot which was an almost magical sensory journey.You must try it if you are in Marrakech.

I cannot rate this spa highly enough, it is brilliant.. This was our first trip to Morocco and finding this place was like a hidden gem. The owner was incredibly hospitable, picking us up directly from the hotel, and both he and his wife were welcoming and put us at ease.We went for the massage and then the traditional hamam experience, which I strongly recommend you do not leave Morocco without trying. The lady who did the massage had amazing hands - it felt like floating on air. The hamam itself was incredibly professional and well done, and designed to put you at ease - at no point did you feel self conscious or worry about anything. Constant refreshments were provided while waiting by a very friendly gentleman, who even taught us a little arabic, which was nice.I must also recommend you try the facial and manicure treatments, they went above and beyond anything I had hoped for or expected. The manicure in particular was one of the best I have experienced anywhere in the world. In short - do not leave Marrakesh without trying this place, you'd be a fool to miss it.

Brilliant. I booked the Romance package online, I just had to pay a deposit using PayPal which was very easy. The owner is lovely and speaks very good English.it is easy to find, we took a taxi. We had tea and then the hamman, more tea and biscuits and then the most wonderful and skillfull massage using all natural oils . I Also had a facial which was so relaxing. , I did not want it to end. We were there about 4 hours and it was well worth the money. Good start to the holiday getting rid of old skin! Fantastic, beautiful place.

Beautiful Spa!. Our trip was my 40th Birthday treat and we researched the Spa's available picking Heritage due to the wonderful reviews. We booked a package of treatments, the Heritage Beaute, at Dh950 (approx £75) for a Hamman, Massage and Facial lasting 2.5 hours. I completed this online before I left for Marrakech paying a deposit of €50 through paypal. You can get cheaper in Marrakech but in my view the experience here was well worth the price. I will point out that the one negative review I see on her was written shortly after the Spa opened 17 months ago. All new businesses have teething problems so don't let that one put you off focus on the new reviews!We decided to walk there, I am sorry I can not remember which of the old city gates we entered but it was basically a straight line in from there and sign posted so very easy to locate.We arrived an hour early, having given ourselves plenty of time to find the place not sure if we were able to wait but were welcomed in. We went into a quiet seating area for mint tea and water whilst we completed a form to assist in deciding which facial to have and testing the oils for our massage. We were then taken through to a changing area, where we were given paper pants (not big pants more thongs!) robes, slippers and a locker with key into which we could safely store our things. We were taken up to the roof to a sauna, lovely warm stone where we were washed then soaped and left to relax for a while, then the ladies came back in and commenced the Haman which included washing our hair, it's amazing seeing how much dead skin comes off! Then we were covered in a sort of clay and left to relax again before being washed down my skin felt the best it's ever felt! We were put back into our robes and given a towel for our hair and taken through to the relaxation area for more mint tea, water and biscuits. The man in here was lovely he dried our hair, a lovely head rub and held the fan higher to cool us. After a little while we went to our own treatment rooms for our massages and facials. The massage was incredible a proper tips of your toes to the top of your head massage! I drifted off a number of times! At one point my beautician was on the bed to provide more downward pressure on my back massage absolutely fantastic!Then she moved onto my facial which was the longest facial I have ever had! I chose a facial that reduces fine lines and wrinkles. I think I was washed and oiled about 3 times! The Haman did not touch the face but she seemed to use some milder sort of mitt on my face. Then the massage on the face oh my how wonderful! Your ears are massaged even your eyeballs! I felt her doing lymphatic drainage where they massage puffiness out of your face my eyes were quite bad before I went in. Then there was a seaweed mask that feels really thick and creamy then sets and peels off. Well I have to tell you i've never had a facial like this before it was INCREDIBLE! My skin felt so beautiful and silky, my eyes were no longer puffy and it did reduce fine lines around my eyes. I wish I could have that facial again over here!!After this we came back down to get changed then were invited back into the relaxation area at the bottom for more mint tea and water and to pay. We were here for 3.5 hours in total bliss!!The lady who owns the Spa with her husband was lovely and gave me some black soap for my birthday! We both had a haman mitt each to take away too! Then she phoned our Riad so that Sanna could organise our taxi to collect us then the lovely man from the roof took us to the collection point and waited with us until he arrived! Amazing service from start to finish!Thank you to the Heritage Spa for an amazing afternoon I won't be forgetting in a hurry I will be sure to recommend anyone visit you when in Marrakech!

Great experience!. Had a couple treatment at heritage, which was 1600 dirham , included hammam and massage. For him there was foot massage to finish with and for me there was a facial treatment. They use delicious smelling oils and are friendly, polite and professional. It gives the Marrocan atmosphere however with the western comfort ! Great experience overall !

One of my favorite places. Ever.. I've been to quite a lot of spas, from the Thalassotherapy in Brittany to several fancy places in Vietnam and Thailand. But the Heritage spa is BY FAR my best experience. First the place itself is very tastefully decorated, which is far from usual is spas, often quite kitschy. The staff is very kind, discrete and professional. The lady I had for my massage and face treatment was a real fairy, knowing exactly what I needed. And the products used are amazing. Sure it's not cheap. But that's because nothing there is cheap: from the service to the atmosphere, it is completely worth your money.

Wonderful , good price and well worth a visit. After reading the great reviews on this spa,we booked online a few weeks before our visit to Marrakech , we paid a small deposit in euros via PayPal ..so easy!! As the spa is a good 20 minute walk from the medina we decided to take a taxi ,the driver dropped us at the end of the road and gave us directions ,we found it quite easily with some help from the locals. The spa was beautifully decorated,very cool and calming,we were offered drinks while our treatments were explained.we opted for the Destination Marrakech which includes a hammans and massage. Both of these were truly fantastic, so relaxing and well worth the cost,we felt pampered and well cared for. The staff were fantastic ,really friendly and professional.i highly recommend the Heritage Spa and can't wait return next year!

Pamper yourself, Hammam-style. We booked a couple's package for the afternoon of our arrival, hoping to work out some of the kinks of air travel, and were tremendously impressed with the quality of service at Heritage. They spent real time at the outset explaining options in order to ensure that the experience was customized appropriately to our preferences. From the Hammam treatment to the massage to the hospitality in between services, we were very impressed. The building itself is beautiful, in a historic area within the medina. While it is a bit of a labyrinth, as prior reviewers warned, we found that a Heritage employee was waiting for us where the cabs drop people off. That prevented any possibility of getting lost or being hassled by touts--and that high level of attentiveness to detail followed through the entire experience. I would be there every week if I lived in Marrakech!

Absolutely amazing!!. We saw a few spas before going for heritage spa.The spa is beautifuly designed and feels very moroccon. We went to look at the soa first and went ahead and booked the treatments for towards the end of the trip .On the day we were given refreshments and a introduction of treatments by the owner.The staff were all lovely and so polite. We chose a package deal in which we got a hamam which I definitely recommend - makes your skin feel extremely clean and soft. a massage and a facial. All the treatments were realy nice and we felt completely relaxed and refreshed I was also pleasantly suprised by the owner and staff with a beautiful chocolate cake on my birthday :))) which made my day! cant wait to revisit.

Highlight of Marrakech. Thoroughly enjoyed our couples spa afternoon at Heritage Spa. Located in a quiet residential neighborhood with narrow streets, we were taken aback by the world class service and amenities offered here.The owner, Ali, and his wife (a Moroccan and European expat) were kind, welcoming and sat with us for 15-20 minutes to discuss our treatments over mint tea, cucumber water and biscuits before heading to our couples hammam black soap bath.Even though it was 100+ degrees outside, the hammam itself was surprisingly comfortable - outside of the nudity. The therapist was sweet and kind and soon inhibitions washed away like all the dead skin we'd been toting around.After, we were lead to a breezy cabana area where we were served more tea, cucumber water and cookies. About 20 minutes later, the massage therapists showed up and brought us to the first floor and into beautifully lit rooms with ubiquitous spa music. I'll cut to the chase here. I'm not a fan of massages because I've never really gotten one I loved. I loved this one. In fact, it may just be the best massage I've gotten in my life. We both fell asleep and woke up an hour later in a haze of relaxation.

Heritage Romance. We've been to several spas before but had never experienced a Hammam. Our visit began with refreshments and an explanation by the owner of what was in store for us. We were given a variety of oils to choose from for our massage and also the type of massage we would like.If you've never experienced a Hammam before, I highly recommend it. This was probably the best part of the whole package. The women who looked after us were really friendly and made us feel very comfortable. We both really loved the body scrubs.The massage and facial I had afterwards almost sent me to sleep, it was so good. My skin really has never felt better. Overall, for two and a half hours of bliss it was well worth the money. The parting gift was a nice added touch and we will definitely be back again soon.

Fantastic Spa. My partner and I love spas and often visit spas and spa hotels in the uk. So we knew we'd go to a hammam in morocco. We read the reviews on Tripadvisor and chose the Heritage Spa. We are so happy we did. Everything about this place is wonderful. We had quite a stressful journey with a taxi driver dropping us off at the opposite side of the city nowhere near the spa and then being threatened by a horrible guy. When we arrived at the spa I was really stressed and in tears but the owner totally put us at ease and even gave us a complimentary treatment before our package to help ease us in to the day. All of the staff are lovely and treat you really well. We had the oasis package with a hammam followed by a massage. This was fab and really relaxing. our skin felt really soft afterwards.It was so good that we went back a second time during our stay when I had a facial and my other half another massage. Again this was lovely and a really relaxing end to the holiday.If you're in Marrakech you must visit this place. A tip to get there as it's a bit out of the way- ask your taxi driver to drop you outside the Dar Moha restaurant and you will pick up signs - it's a couple of minutes walk.

you can't leave Marrakech without a visit.. My partner and I got a hammam and massage package for my partner's 35th bday. We spent 2 sublime hours at this oasis in the medina. It was an experience I will never forget. The owner was such a lovely person he even got my partner a gift for his birthday and took the time to make recommendations for places to go for dinner. You guys deserve all the success you have You have certainly earned it.

Highlight of our trip. If you're interested in a Hammam experience but are a little unsure DO NOT HESITATE! This was by far and away the highlight of our visit. My husband was in Marrakech for work in late June 2013 and I joined him at the end of two weeks, by which time he was completely exhausted. He only had one day to "do" the city before we flew out, so I made sure to book him into the Heritage Spa after having read about it on TripAdvisor. First of all, it IS a little tricky to find, but have your cab call the Spa (everyone has cellphones) in order to get the exact directions. It's about a three minute walk from where the cab drops you off -- keep your eyes open for the small signs pointing the way. Once we arrived, we were directed into a charming little room, given mint tea and mineral water, while we waited to discuss our selections with the owner. He was extremely informative, and steered us towards the traditional package with a steam, green soap scrub and herbal masque, followed by a massage. There is a place to lock up your clothing and valuables (my husband was worried about this -- he needn't have been!) and you're given paper underpants, a plush robe and slippers. The steam lasted about 20 minutes and took place in an old-world-looking tile-lined room with a domed ceiling. By the time we were completely relaxed, we were scrubbed within an inch of our lives -- very tingly and clean feeling, which was a pleasure after the dust and sand of the souks! Then the herbal masque, which again was extremely relaxing. Then off to another room to rehydrate with mint tea, mineral water and some delish Moroccan cookies! Then on to our massage -- I chose bitter orange scented oil, my husband something more masculine but I can't remember what. The massage lasted for an hour and was blissful.A couple of words of advice: try to do this at the END of your holiday -- it's perfect before having to deal with the hassle of plane travel. There are a number of stairs so if you're disabled, you may wish to check if there is a lift -- I didn't bother since neither of us needed it, but you might want to confirm. Also, book ahead! I called and put down a deposit by PayPal (20 Euros) which was very simple to do since there's free Wifi in all kinds of places around Marrakech. If your hotel/riad doesn't have Wifi, go to the Cyberpark or simply visit a hotel lobby which does offer this. And although my masseuse spoke some English my husband's did not, so it might be helpful to know a few phases, like turn over ("tourner"), too hard ("trop dur"), not hard enough ("pas assez dur"), lower ("plus bas"), higher ("plus haut") and that's wonderful ("c'est merveilleux") -- I guarantee you'll need the last one for sure!If we ever find ourselves back in Marrakech, we'll be going back here for sure. Just wonderful, and worth every dirham. Tip well; it's very inexpensive for what you're getting!

Perfect. We booked Traditional Hammam via email. When we arrived the boys from the street lead us to the Spa building, which is in the side road tucked in nicely in an oriental manner.The whole experience was fantastic. Waiting rooms, hall, everything is clean and nicely organised. Clean towels and dressing gowns as well as slippers are provided. before and after the treatment we were given refreshing drinks and tea.It cost us 250 Dh each and it did worth the money. Spa offers various other treatments and massages.Highly recommended.

Heritage spa. This is an excellent place to visit when in Marrakech. The manager was very helpful in explaining your spa options and the staff made us feel welcome right away. It was really hot in the country when we went and we were given water and mint tea at several intervals!! It was well worth the money as the staff were very good at taking those aches and pains away!!!

Amazing- a paradise of relaxation in the bustling medina. My friend and I have just returned from an afternoon at the Heritage Spa and we are both delighed. The staff are very friendly, professional and made us feel like we were the most important customers ever, with our relaxation and comfort being focused on at every stage. The moment you enter this spa, you are greeted with mint tea and mint cool water, you are talked through the treatments available and exactly what they involve. Our consultant spoke excellent English and we decided to go for the oasis combo of a hammam and massage. I cannot more highly recommend this spa and our choices! The hammam cleansed us of all the sweat and pollution of a week in the sun and souks, followed by the most magnificent massage I have ever had. The staff are all very skilled and clearly love what they do. As a spa devotee, I must say that this was a fantastic experience.

A great, relaxing afternoon. My partner and I spent a relaxing afternoon here. We opted for the "Heritage Romance" package, which includes 2 x hammam, 2 x massage, 1 x facial and 1 x leg massage. When we arrived, we were given some lovely mint tea to relax us before being whisked upstairs to have the hammam. We were in the same room, which meant we could chat during the treatment. Afterwards, we were given more tea with some lovely biscuits this time. Finally, we were taken to separate rooms for our massages. It was a real oasis from the hustle and bustle of the souks, and my favourite afternoon of the holiday. The proprietor and the staff were really friendly, which contributed greatly to the relaxing atmosphere.
Good spa. Had a great spa experience here, well worth the price! The manager was helpful and spoke good English.

Bliss..... The Heritage Spa will remain a highlight of my time in Marrakech. Finding the Spa was easy as it is well signposted (and the taxi drops you off nearby). Everything was very well organised and explained thoroughly so you know exactly what is going to happen. The facilities are clean and spotless and the staff are polite and friendly. The Hammam was certainly an experience and if I was to do this again, it would be alone (i.e. not with my teenage daughter!) Best massage I have every had. Many thanks.Highly recommended.

Choose this Hammam. Tricky to get to as is everything in Marrakech, but they do have it well signed when you are close to it.Three of us (one couple, one woman) chose the destination marrakech. I cant explain how wonderful it was. The hostess was very friendly, explained the process and allowed us to choose our massage oil. We were taken to the hammam, my Hamman was done by Malika(??) who was professional and friendly. My sister told me her attendent was also great.Only complaint here was that my short boyfriend was given the 'long' area to lie down and both my head and feet were against the very hot wall which was quite uncomfortable. Not sure if it would have been the same for him but as it was a bday prezzie I didnt complain and make him swap haha.Then you are taken in your robe for mint tea and biscuit to relax before the fantastic massage. Ask for a very hard massage if you are fine with 'regular' western or thai massages as the Moroccan massage technique is quite light.Practically fell asleep at the end of the massage i was so relaxed. All three of us sat in the quiet room post treatments absolutely blissed out. Fantastic afternoon.Clean, friendly and great value for money. Give it a go!
Best experience ever. Excellent!we highly recommend it!!very friendly and professional personnel!they explained everything thoroughly so we could get exactly what we wanted! We ll definitely go back!

A must do on any Marrakech trip. We knew a spa trip was obligatory on our Marrakech trip, and chose this one due to its good reviews on trip advisor. and thank you everyone who recommended it, because you were right! great treatments from very sweet staff, and a relaxing and pampering atmosphere that couldn't have been better. we had a combined deal of hammam and massage, which I would definitely recommend. Nice touch being able to chose the oils yourself.the spa is run by an amazing lady who looked after us really well - even dealing with a boy who was hassling us as we arrived, and taking us through the back streets to a taxi who she bartered with on our behalf as we left. That step further is always appreciated! It is not the easiest place to find, but definitely worth the effort.

Out of this world!. We recently visited the Heritage Spa after it was recommended to us by Maria at the Riad Mur Akush. It was a great recommendation and we had the most wonderful hammam and massage experience here. From the moment you step through the door you are in great hands. The staff are all great, the care and attention to detail was second to none. Our visit here was a real highlight of our trip!

There Ain't No Spa Like A Marrakech Spa. If you're on holiday, why wouldn't you go to a spa? And if you're looking for THE BEST service in Marrakech, Heritage is an excellently run ship that goes out of its way to keep you relaxed. And there's mint tea at every turn (plus, delicious biscotti)!Myself and my partner went for the Destination Marrakech package, which includes a hammam rub down and an hour massage. Try to opt for the hammam experience (a Moroccan tradition), as it's certainly worth parading around in disposable underwear to receive this treatment; you leave utterly glowing. And when in Rome...At roughly £45, it's excellent value for money. I'm just sorry that I left red hair dye on their immaculate white towels. Sorry about that, Heritage Spa!

They really go above and beyond for you!. i was looking forward to going to a spa in Morocco because i had heard it was a must do. I found this spa as a recommendation by a friend, and made a reservation the same day. The spa is hidden in the middle of medina, however once a cab takes you to the outside of medina, it is a one minute walk, they send out an escort to bring you to their spa and from the moment you walk in the tiny door they treat you like a QUEEN /KING. I do not want to spoil the surprise for you, but i am a spa goer, and what you MUST HAVE is the HAMAM. It really is an incredible experience, everything else was extra, but you must have a massage with hamam and believe me it will be the best experience of your life. THey are extremely professional and attentive, and you really will feel like royalty.I went with my two friends and they tried everything possible to keep us together. Just go here, believe me, and after you have your treatment, i will assure you that you will run to trip advisor to leave a review for them. They deserve it!ELENA :)

A little taste of heaven. The Heritage Spa will remain a highlight of my time in Marrakech. I first read about it on Tripadvisor and was positive about visiting the spa based on the other reviews. As my wife is a practicing Muslim we requested, prior to our visit, for no men to be present whilst we were utilizing the Spa's services. We received a speedy response and our request was accommodated for. This place already won points before I even visited them!Finding the Spa was slightly difficult but once we got there it was worth very minute. The receptionist was very friendly and attended to our needs. We were provided with sweets and delicious tea which relaxed us when we got to the Spa and the same was provided in between the pampering services. Me and my wife opted to use the Romantic package, which may seem dear in price but is alot better then the other Spas available in Marrakech. The package was phenomenal. The facilities were clean and spotless. The beds were comfortable and the Hammam was an experience on its own. I felt revitalized and relaxed after the package had come to an end and I highly recommend this place to anyone that visits Marrakech. Words cannot even begin to describe how great this place is and the only down point was that we had to leave. My visit to this Spa alone was worth the trip to Marrakech. *Please note, the photos I have attached do not justice to this wonderful place as it does really look better when visiting in person.

Bliss - Marrakech style. We saw a spa experience as something of a must for our trip to Marrakech. It was high on our list of things to do and hence didn't mind spending a little extra for something special. Heritage Spa really delivered on our expectations. My wife and I had a Romance package together (1600 dhs) and we were utterly pampered from start to finish. Time was taken to choose and explain the treatments - particularly so given my wife's pregnancy and then the hammam, massage and treatments were spot on. The mint tea and pastries in between were the icing on the cake. If I were to be picky I'd say there is a little bit of background noise during the treatments due to the spa being a typically compact building within the old medina but that didn't spoil the overall experience. Highly recommended for a couple looking for a touch of self indulgent luxury.

Profesionnal and clean. We have high standard when it comes to cleanliness and massage therapist. This place was recommended by our Riad and we were not disappointed. We could have our own private hammam (with my husband) and had a very caring lady for our scrub and wash. The massage was also lovely and adapted to our different needs. Very professional staff, clean environment, worth to pay the extra.

Just what we wanted!. A warm welcome that put us at ease immediately. Everything is designed for our well-being. The decoration of the massage room is magical. A pure moment of relaxation at fair prices compared to the quality of products and service.I recommend without hesitation!

A pampered princess. That's how I felt during my time at Heritage Spa. I opted for the complete experience, which lasted over four hours. It was divine. The staff was very professional and discreet. The tea, refreshing mint and orange water, and pastries were delicious. Just go and enjoy being pampered. After 8 days of zig zagging through the souks and doing day trips in and out of the city, this half day timeout was just what the doctored ordered. I hope that the spas in Fes will be able to hit the mark.

A wonderful, relaxing experience. We booked the Destination Marrakech combination, which included a hammam treatment and massage. From start to finish the experience was wonderful. When booking, they'll tell you where to have the taxi drop you off (if you're coming by taxi) and it's a short walk from there with just one turn. We were welcomed by the receptionist who took us inside, told us what to expect, asked us to choose the massage oil and what our massage preferences were. Then we were taken to the hammam room where we received scrubs and had our hair washed. After that, we relaxed in a quiet area and were served mint tea and cookies. The experience concluded with an excellent and thorough massage. This place is phenomenal. Highly recommended!

divine spa. whats not to like about sipping mint tea, and eating Morrocan pastries whilst having your feet massaged by a man in a fez? Great experience, lovely hamman and excellent massage. Good attention to detail and a great experience.

Massage yes, hammam so-so. I went here with friends. Great atmosphere. You're greeted with a mint tea and order your treatment. As usual, you're given the embarrassing paper pants to wear (why do we never remember to bring a swim suit?). For me, the hammam treatment was less satisfying, as most of the time we were left alone to 'relax.' I'd recommend an actual hammam, like the ones that may still be touristy but have segregated sections for men and women and the treatment is more vigorous. It will be more like the traditional Moroccan experience. The massage was great. With the lights low and the mystical music, I was next to asleep. In between the treatments, we sat in a tented area on the roof and had mint tea and cookies. Great touch. So, nice place, but if you want a true-ish hammam experience, try elsewhere. If you want a good massage, come here.

Great hammam and massage experience. We decided to book a couples hammam and massage treatment based on the great trip advisor reviews... and we are so glad we booked with this spa. We actually booked at the last minute... And managed to get a booking... however I would recommend booking as much in advance as you can to guarantee your booking. We got a taxi to the Medina and as soon as we got out we were surrounded by local lads offering to guide us to the spa. Thankfully Hassan who works for the spa was waiting by the road and got us to the spa without all the hassle. It is signposted but it is located further in, in a narrow lane. Once inside we were greeted by a lady who spoke very good English. We were taken to a room where we were given details of the treatments on offer and picked the oils we wanted for our massage. We were offered mint tea and also a cold mint and orange drink which were really refreshing. We were then taken to a changing room and given robes and slippers as well as disposable underwear to change into. We were then taken to the couples hammam where we were scrubbed head to toe and had a body masque. After this Hassan offered us tea and biscuits and gave us a lovely head massage while we cooled down. Finally we were taken to our massage rooms and given the most relaxing massage. This was one of the best parts of our trip to Marrakesh... and we definitely recommend Heritage Spa for a relaxing treat!

If you're in Marrakech, make this a priority!. My husband and I spent a few days in Marrakech recently as part of our honeymoon. I had read the great reviews of Heritage Spa and booked a hammam and massage for both of us. Leading up to our arrival in Marrakech, Antonina was very prompt in answering my many questions via e-mail and the Paypal option for reserving our appointment was very handy. Prior to our appointment, my husband and I had spent a week walking around Europe and many hours in airports and on airplanes - we were really looking forward to our spa experience. Upon arrival, the manager was very lovely and inviting (and spoke great English). We were treated to delicious mint tea, refreshing water and snacks while we got to choose our massage oils. The spa itself is stunningly beautiful. Everything smells amazing and there is soothing music playing in every corner. The manager explained the hammam and massage process in detail and escorted us to the room where we changed into the disposable undergarments. We then relaxed for a few minutes in comfy robes before we were escorted to our hammam, where we we both exfoiliated from head to toe (even behind the ears!) with lovely soaps and oils and after having our hair washed, we were left to relax with a body masque treatment. I have to admit, as this was our first hammam experience, my husband and I were feeling a bit anxious and modest...but the staff were very respectful and made us feel very comfortable and relaxed. It was pure, luxurious bliss.Following the hammam, we were treated to a head massage and more delicious refreshments. After some more relax time, we were escorted to the massage rooms, were we received relaxation massages with our chosen massage oils. I can say with confidence that this was the best massage I have every had. I was sad when it came to an end!As a helpful note, though there is clear signage for the Heritage Spa, we did have someone (unaffiliated with the spa) offer to escort us to the spa when he saw us looking around the area. Though we declined his offer, he instead walked us to the spa door and then demanded money (30 dirhams). It was quite uncomfortable. Thankfully, the spa manager asked him to leave once we entered the spa. So unless you are truly lost (which should not happen), be sure to avoid these individuals :)I can't recommend this spa experience enough. Probably a good thing that I live in another country as I would be wanting to go to this place every day. Treat yourself and enjoy!

Am amazing place that delivers what it promises. My friend and I had climbed mount Toubkal and the day after we checked ourselves into the heritage spa. Our legs were stiff and we were weary but this place really did the trick. A very efficient and knowledgable greeting in fabulous surroundings. We asked for a strong massage in our legs but the proprietor did explained up front that they could not offer a deep tissue massage but that we would have our treatment tailored to meet our needs. The hammam was great. Marina who looked after us was very attentive and the hot room was delightful. After having our skin scrubbed and softened Hassan gave us tea and biscuits and then proceeded to give us a wonderful head and foot massage before being taken down for our full body massage. This place was quite simply fantastic. There is nothing that I could complain about. If you are looking for true relaxation then this is the place for you.

A lavish experience. Beautiful newly rest orated but with real Moroccan flavourFirst I was served mint tea and water in a small sitting room where the owner explained treatments, philosophy and products used in the hammam. Then I experienced a very pleasant exfoliation in the hammam with argan soap and mask.Last I had a rest in a nice room with carpets and low seats where again they offered me tea and delicate nut biscuits.Very clean !

Luxurious hammam experience. Travelling as a couple, we thought it would be more fun to opt for a luxurious hammam experience rather than trying a local hammam where males and females are kept apart.Although tucked away in the Medina, the spa is well signposted when you get within a few minute walk away, and shouldn't be a problem to navigate to.We both opted for an Oasis Detox (1hr 45 mins, 650 Dh per person), a combined traditional hammam (scrub) and massage package. As expected we were able to enjoy every part of the experience together, except the massage - absolutely fine as not only is that a personal experience anyway, but so relaxing that I wouldn't have batted an eyelid if Queen Elizabeth was getting a back rub next to me wearing her own disposable thong-style pants (provided to all guests to change into)! Overall we were at the Spa for around 2.25 hours, service was impeccable throughout the visit, and were never rushed.I'm not sure a Hammam is really 'my thing' (as you should expect, it's quite vigarous), but I'm pleased to have had the experience in lovely surroundings, and absolutely loved the massage. My partner is the Spa veteran, and thought it one of the best she'd had - high praise indeed! :-) We both felt very relaxed, clean, and refreshed afterwards - a perfect accompaniment to offset the hustle of Marrakesh.

Bliss, pure bliss!. We were looking for a couples package, to share our first hammam experience and decided on Heritage Spa purely on the tripadvisor community ratings - we can not thank you all enough, it was the highlight of our trip! Hamid our riad manager who swiftly arranged the booking gave us good directions and we took a relaxed stroll there after breakfast. On arrival in this stunning building we were greeted and seated in a plush alcove by a most pleasant young lady, who helped us decide exactly which treatments we desired, offered us a first timers discount and talked us through the entire process in perfect english. We were shown to our changing room, where fluffy robes, slippers, disposable thongs and a safe for our valuables awaited us. We were then introduced to the lovely Amina who ensured that she turned us out to be the cleanest, shiniest people in Marrakech (I wanted to bring her home)! Then we were lead to the Bedouin tent on the roof terrace for minted water, pastries and a relaxing cool off period. This was followed by a most blissful hour long massage. I was surprised that my partner did not fall asleep, however, he said that it would have been sacrilege to miss even a brief moment of this. The entire experience was seamless and wonderful in beautiful surroundings, ending with hugs, lots of smiles and we were given a gift to take away! AMAZING - PURE BLISS!It's a shame that this spa does not have a branch in my hometown! On our return to the riad Hamid asked us how we were, we answered in unison - clean!I would not only recommend it, if I could, I would buy it.

wonderful spa. Of the most beautiful places that I have visited with my life a beautiful experience and I would recommend everyone to visit the place more than wonderful atmosphere and the reception is very creativity and professionalism and a reasonable price compared to others

A heavenly oasis. Went with my girlfriends and relied on trip advisors; was rated #1 and did not fail us at all!!! This establishment has truly earned its ranks. Because the medina can be confusing, a staff met us at a central location and walked us to the spa. We were warmly greeted. Ali took his time to explain all the packages and because we couldn't make up our minds actually chose one for us and charged us at a cheaper price. And what a great recommendation. The hamman experience is AWESOME, every inch of your skin is literally scrubbed. The massage is individualized to your likes. Even the snacks are to die for.On your visit to Morocco, must carve out some time for the hamman at the HERITAGE SPA. YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED.

A Very Nice Surprise In the Medina.. We went to this SPA following the trip advisors hints, we are quite usual to come in Marrakech as some friends of us have a house here, so we decided to try a new spa and we arrived at the Heritage spa. Once you get in the SPA you start to feel in a different world, the caos of the medina disappears and your mind starts to relax in a beautiful charateristic riad which has been totally adapted for being a perfect Spa.We had a couple Detox Hamman with Gommage made with the Argan soap and that was really great, we tried at least 30 hamman and gommages during our several journies in marrakech and this has to be put in the top 5 of our experiences.The place is quite easy to find and it is well marked with several signals on the road to the spa.I truly recommend this spa and prices are also quite fair, you will not want to go away.***IF THIS REVIEW WAS HELP FULL PLEASE PUT AN "i like" ****Thank you
Worth it?. Really REALLY relaxing! But didn't fit into our Lonely Planet low costs path we tried to follow. Western Europe rates. Hammam was SUPER! Massage regular, so next time just the hammam.

A must for any visit to Marrakech!. We seeked out the location the day before our appointment so that we wouldn't have to worry about finding it on the day. We found one of the signage boards and was looking lost when a young chap (presumably employed by the spa) kindly showed us the way. We were given a tour of the spa and booked an appointment for the following day. I was also assured that we would only have lady therapists.My husband and I booked the Destination Marrakech package and it was 2 1/2 hours of complete and utter bliss. The package included a traditional hammam and a one hour massage. When we arrived, we were asked to choose the oil we wanted to use for our massage and if we had any "problem areas" for the massage. We were able to have our hammams in the same room (just the two of us). The lady that looked after us (Marika) was delightful and through my broken French and her broken English we managed to communicate and have little jokes too. She was extremely professional and thorough. We were given plenty of time between each process to relax and let the soap/mud/heat do their jobs.After the hammam, we were given tea and biscuits and just chill.For our massages, we had rooms next to each other. It didn't really matter as we weren't going to do much talking anyway! I think the DH fell asleep and actually snored (how embarassing!!)! That was how relaxed he was and he did ask for a relaxing massage! I had asked for a firm massage to get rid of some the kinks in the muscles and she did exactly that. I was totally relaxed but the muscles did get a work out too.We both agreed that it is worth visiting Marrakech just to come to Heritage Spa.

Amazing Experience....2 1/2 hours of sheer pampering!. My partner and I booked the Romance Package. The riad isn't difficult to find as it is well signposted. It is a very beautiful riad tucked away inside the medina. On arrival we chose our oils and then the pampering began. We had a hamman/full body massage/facial with seaweed peel off masque/foot massage. It was a totally amazing and relaxing experience and I would recommend Heritage Spa to anyone travelling to Marrakech. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The patchouli and orange blossom perfumes of the soaps they gave to us when we left still fills our bathroom and reminds us of our fabulous day of pampering. Excellent value. Around 160 euros for 2 adults.

This is a lovely Hammam. Let's start with the location. Heritage spa is nestled within Medina. It's not the easiest place to fine, but once you are close, there are signs available to see and guide you. I used the Tripadvisor City App, it worked beautifully.Once inside (look out for the door number to help you locate the actual door - number 40), it is simply beautiful. Looks and feels authentic. The actual Hammam that we had was brilliant, the massage offered is customised by area of focus, which oil you want, whether you like a hard massage or a relaxing massage. Very very good.

Relaxing and good treatment. This experience was amazing. We had a destination Marrakech program that includes an hammam and 1 hour massage. It was all very good and relaxing. The girls were very professional and the atmosphere was brilliant.

Amazing. Myself and 3 friends visited this place only yesterday. We booked a hammam and massage each, what i loved about the place was the service was amazing! We were asked what massages we would like, what oils we would like, what areas to concentrate on etc. The hammam was a great experience and we even kept the mitt they used to scrub us down. The place is clean, traditional, calming and very relaxing. I urge everyone to visit this great place.

The real deal!. My partner and i went to the spa during our trip to marrakech. It was very close to our Riad (mur akush) so we popped in one morning to get information and make a booking for later that afternoon. we chose a hammam and massage package and it was the most amazing experience.the Hammam rooms suitable for two people so my partner and I were able to be together, the ladies were professional, friendly and very respectful. We have been to hammams in London and enjoyed the experience but it was never anything like what we experienced at Heritage Spa. The treatment didn't feel rushed, we were given plenty of time to relax. after the hammam we were taken to a relaxation room for tea and homemade marrocan biscuits. We were then given a selection of oils to smell to choose which one we would like used for our massage.the massage was out of this world, again in a room with two massage beds allowing my partner and i complete privacy. i am sure these ladies do a lot of massages in a day but it felt like it was the only one they had done that day, taking their time...If we had had the time we would have returned a second time to heritage spa... it was so special and delightful.

Wonderful!. I've been to Morocco in many years and I usually use the local hammams when I was in Morroco because I thought the luxury hammams for tourists would not provide an authentic hammam expedience. But after reading the reviews on TA and checking their web site, I decided to give it a try.Well, it was fantastic! I booked for a hammam and massage package and really enjoyed the experience. The place was beautiful and all staff were polite and attentive. It was so nice, I went back again after my trip from Merzouga. Highly recommended to everyone.

Great treat amongst madness!. I really enjoyed the whole experience. We opted for a Hammam and full body massage package and it was an excellent choice. Coming directly after a return from riding camels in the desert this was very well received.I cannot profess to be an expert in Spa treatments but what stood out to me was that it was a seamless experience. The different aspects were joined up with things like Moroccan tea and biscuits whilst sitting on floor cushions as you dried off from your Hammam. It was also excellent value. The only tiny negative I would say is that the changing area is only able to be used by one person or couple at a time. If there are a lot of bookings then it is pretty rushed to get out - this is ok for men but I would advise women to not expect time to dry hair and put on a full face of make up.All in all though I immediately wanted to book myself in for another one but sadly did not have enough time left!

Very relaxing. We booked the Heritage Romance package, which includes Hammam, massage and facial/head and foot massage. It was a really relaxing experience. I wasn't sure what to expect as I hadn't had a Hammam before but came out feeling wonderfully clean and my skin really soft.The staff are very attentive. When you first arrive you are asked what oil you would like for the massage and there are about 6 scents to choose from. After the Hammam you are given mint tea and petit fours before going in for your oil massage and facial. The whole treatment took about 2 1/2 hour and cost around £150 for two, which is excellent value!

Relaxation at its best. Yesterday after a shopping day in the souk we were looking forward to our appointment to the spa. At least I was it was my husband's first time. We had a lovely afternoon being washed, scrubbed and a full body massage and foot massage. Really worth the trouble to find.

great experience. The spa was very nice, exceeded my expectations. as a Moroccan man, i didn't expect that! that was very Good, decor was nice, thanks Majda very much, all staff was nice this day too.

Nice. My girlfriend and I took the romance package. The hammam was nice although the scrub was pretty rough. The oil massage was fine My girlfriend asked for a hard massage and got a normal one. Her facial was nice. My head and foot massage was not that special. The host of the spa was very friendly. The ambiance was quite relaxing. The five stars on Tripadvisor are a bit overrated. The price is also pretty high. We payed 1600 dirham for the package (just under ?150). I rate it 4 out of 5.

Relax relax relax. The journey to the hamman is the beginning of the experience. Walking through the busy streets packed with people, traversing down a couple of alleyways wondering whether you are going in the right direction, the kids playing footie in the street. Knocking on the door and admission to an oasis of tranquility. Reassuringly professional. Kind. Caring.We both loved it. A great start to our holiday.

Brilliant way to spend 2 hours, refreshing and relaxing. This place is really tucked away but well worth finding, had a hammam treatment and a massage. It was wonderful and the staff were really professional although the disposable undies didn't leave much to the imagination. It was a great way to unwind and i left feeling refreshed and really chilled, i used the vervain argan oil which was refreshing and after the hammam and massage my skin felt great for at least a week. Great find

peace. This place is for the healing of the spirit. take a deep breath and let the women scrub you down and clean you up. have tea while you wait for your masseuse to rub you (don't except a deep tissue massage).Tasteful, professional, clean and comforting.

Definetley worth the trip!. I went to Heritage Spa with a friend on a short break to Marrakech, it was absolutley wonderful. We were treated so well by the owner who was incredibly welcoming and friendly, and who came to see us following our treatment to find out how it was. We had a hamman which was great, really refreshing. As a whole the spa was very clean and decorated beautifully. I would absolutley reccomend a trip to Heritage Spa!
We loved it!. Once you find it you'll love it. All friendly, professional and luxury treatments. Don't have any reservations about booking a visit you'll have no regrets, it's a real treat.

Best massage ever. My wife and I went for the wonderful couples package. First a haman where you are soaped and scrubbed. Then a break for tea. A wonderful massage in adjoining room then my wife had a pedicure and I had a foot massage. Superbly relaxing. We both thought it was our best massage ever - which is quite amazing given that my wife is a professionally trained masseur.

Absolutely amazing spa experience cannot recommend enough!. You must do this the wonderful team and services made this the most perfect spa day. We had a hammam which was lovely although very very hot! We them had a mint tea and delicious biscuits before our pampering massage.I know there are traditional local hammam's but we enjoyed this as we could have it as a couple and every step was explained in English for us which really was a invaluable!  It was a lovely great and I recommend you splurge on this and save elsewhere!

'oh so nice'. We went after reading all the positive reviews on tripadvisor and with no regrets cos we had a fab experience. We had the hamman followed by the full body massage and we left feeling clean and relax and worth every penny. Now after a week, my skin still feel silky smooth. We would definitely visit this hamman again if we ever visit Marrakech again.

A good experience for our little family. We made our reservations only a Day in advance during highseason. The owner himself appologized for not being able to offer any massage, only a good scrub with blacksoap. But that scrub was on the otherhand really good! Our daughter, 2years old, were offered a free mini hammam on the house as a bonus. Being pregnant was not a problem, the treatment was adjusted to fit me. Highly recomendable!

Lovely treatments.. We had the haman and massage and now feel sqeaky clean! The haman was great and the lady even cleans behind your ears! We got a foot massage for free which was very nice of them then we had a massage which was really relaxing and just as good as ones I have had in the UK. Overall a great experience and I think we shall be going back for more!

Must go to. We recently went to the Heritage Spa in Marrakech and had the best hamman and massage. We were treated like queens and had the most wonderful time. All the little touches make this a special place. Really good value and such a great experience- highly recommend. X
Treat yourself. This is the most amazing Hammam. Fabulous atmosphere and decor. Treatment wonderful, the best massage ever. Made to feel very special.
Outstanding. Fantastically relaxing. Great price for what we received(romance package). Staff very professional and friendly. Would definately recommend a visit!!!

Excellent Spa. Great spa. Lovely relaxing atmosphere, beautiful products (argan oil, shea butter) and very welcoming owner who spoke excellent french and english. All staff made us feel very welcome and were attentive and helpful. We all had full body massages which were super relaxing, and mint tea before and after. Very highly recommended.

Pure luxury. Very nice atmosphere, a luxurious mix between modern and traditional morrocan style. Very friendly service and personnel. I had the Oasis Detox and felt totally pampered from the beginning to the end.

Recommend. Friendly and welcoming spa. Owner was very accommodating and friendly and couldn't do more to make us feel welcome and relaxed. Staff were great too at giving us our treatments. Venue was ideal and it was great to lounge in the roof top tent sipping teas after our treatment.
If I'm back in Marrakech I'll be visiting Heritage spa again.

2 hours of heaven. My wife used this place and they were really accomadating as she was 7 months pregnant. They advised her on what oils she can use for her massage and facial. Setting was beautiful. Although the 2 treatments my wife had done wer not part of a package they charged me a package price saving me about 300 dirhams so i spent it on the products they had for sale instead and more.It is a must to visit this spa and you will not be disappointed. Hard to find though... however if you ring the owner she will meet you at a more suitable location near the spa. If you asked to be dropped off by Bab Doudkala Mosque there are signs and directions that show you the way there.
Nice. Perfect welcoming, amazing service. Took a package for 650dhm, very soothing. The atmosphere is perfectly balanced and quiet. People are very kind

Pure bliss. I'd booked our spa package for our December trip to Marrakech back in July. It seemed like a long wait, but it was certainly worth it. After two days traipsing around the souks we were ready for a full-on pamper session and we were not disappointed. You enter a haven of peace and tranquility.
