The owners and staff were an absolute delight, our hamman, massage and facial treatments were blissful and genuinely one of the best massages I've had anywhere in the world. In addition our spa experience, which lasted over three hours was excellent value. Book your treatment now and enjoy!

Pure bliss. Visited the Heritage Spa while holidaying in Morocco for a 1 hour massage. I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone looking for a spa experience in Marrakech. The service was fantastic, attentive and personable. The spa itself is peaceful and quiet inside. The welcoming drink and cool shower before our treatment were just what we needed on arrival. The treatment was heaven, so relaxing. I could feel the stress melting away. We were really impressed with the value too.

This experience is a must. In my opinion, this spa is a must when visiting Marrakesh. It was my first time trying a hammam and I loved every second of it. I don’t think I ever felt this clean in my life!!! (Which is important after driving around the country for 9 days and riding camels). The massage was great too – I actually fell asleep which is not easily accomplishable. The owners are a very friendly couple who are generously striving to provide the highest level of service, and it shows. I probably drank a bucket of their mint tea too One of the highlights of my Morocco trip and I sure hope I get to experience it again.
Fantastic. This is a lovely experience. You should choose the option for couples which is not at all corny and really very very relaxing. It is well worth the money. Thoroughly recommended.

The most pleasurable experience in Marrakech. We went to Heritage Spa with my husband hoping to find some peaceful and relaxing oasis in hectic city of Marrakech. Our experience was ideal from the very beginning. The whole visit was feast for our senses, from very cosy oriental interior to delicious morrocan tea nad cookies served in the relax-break between treatments. The massage itself was marvellous, one of the best I've ever had. I took the relaxing one with scented oil. It was all I needed after exausting trekking in Atlas in the previous days of our trip. I count the visit in the spa as one of our most pleasurable experiences in Morrocco.I'm very happy that we chose Heritage Spa and would definitely visit it again if we ever find ourselves in Marrakech in the future.

Extreme cool hammam spa :). It was my first time in hammam. I brought there my wife, because she had always wanted to try this kind of spa. In the same time, I was just waiting for her in 'relax room' and was reading a book. Then, owner of the spa come to relax room, and started a conversation. He asked me if I like hammam etc. I confessed I had never tried this kind of relax, and that it probably was better for my wife than for me. He gave me the offer: "try my service. I honestly say that this spa is the best in town, and you will be surprised by the quality of services". And he was right really cool experience. My wife was happy because of good quality of massage, and I was happy because I experienced something new. And the price was good.

Simply stunning. This was my first ever Spa and my girlfriends umpteenth! What an amazing experience. We went with the Romantic Couples experience and were treated like Royalty. They managed to fit us in on the same day after being told at another spa that we were too late as it was fully booked. They will come out to the main street if you struggle to find them but it is actually extremely well signposted. Upon entering its like entering another world. The tranquil and calm escape was surreal. We had a Hamman which consists of being scrubbed (whilst wearing paper disposable pants!) like my mother used to do to me when I was a wee small boy! We then relaxed amongst cushions with mint tea and biscuits and soothing music. From here we then had a relaxing massage (you can opt for a stimulating one if you prefer) which was very very good.We cant rate this company highly enough and thoroughly recommend them.Many thanksRob & Karen

Traditionally accurate and exceptional attention to detail and service. Really enjoyed this experience. My wife and I got the couples package: body wash and scrubs, 1 hour massages, then she got a facial and I got a feet massage. Blissfully perfect spa unlike anything we have ever done before. Wish they'd open one in Philly! I can't comment enough on their professional approach to making sure we enjoyed our visit. If there is a better hammam in Marrakech I would be very surprised...

exteptionelle. me and my girlfriend went there for an evening of pampering and spent two and a half hours doing exactly so!we were welcomed with a tea and a smile had a 45minute hammam session and an hour of massage plus some tea and refreshments time under a tent in the terrace with our robes and slippers.there were many different treatments and combos to choose from plus we got to choose the oils we wanted to be used in our massage treatments.the staff also-mainly consisting of women as the owner and the guy that served us on the terrace were the only men around-were very proffesional at what they were doing and made us have the most relaxing evening we had in marrakech.prices are quite high for locals but i would say medium for westerners.

An afternoon of pure peace, relax and romance!. The Hermitage Spa is a blissful place to visit after coping with the Medina for two days.The staff was extremely nice and efficient from start to end. Even when I made the booking I got an instant reply and no deposit or credit card details were asked.They were expecting us and we had a wonderful spa romance with hamman, massage and facial for 2 all amazing!Prices are great and the place is a gem.They made us feel like Queen and King for a day.Well worth a visit when you feel you want to run away from the constant hustle.

Freedom from the hustle and bustle. This beautiful hammam hidden away is definately to be recommended. A most relaxing experience after the hustle and bustle of the streets. So tranquil, unrushed and entirely relaxing atmosphere. The staff are very polite and put you at ease (especially if you are a little uneasy on showing maybe more flesh than usual) and very professional. Certainly one to be highly recommended.

Absolute bliss.. There are no words to describe ho incredible this place in! We became aware of it via some research on TA and so glad that we did! On arrival in Marrakech, we emailed the Spa to check availability. We decided to go for the Heritage Romance package. The replies were prompt and courteous and even helped us with directions to the spa. On arrival, the riad took our breath away. Absolutely beautifully maintained and typically Moroccan . The owner met us with a warm welcome and discussed what would happen. Having a sensitive hip area due to surgery, I was a bit apprehensive with regards to being scrubbed and massaged there, however I needn't have worried. Before I could mention it, the owner asked if we had any sensitive areas and indeed if there were any particular areas that needed extra work during the massage. We were then able to choose our own massage oils and I could decide on a prescription facial to suit my skins needs.We then changed into the disposable underwear and the fun began. It started with the hammam which was simply incredible. As a frequent wearer of fake tan, it was hilarious to see the colour that was scrubbed off me. Every inch, top to toe was cleaned and I also had my hair washed. Afterwards, we were dressed in fluffy robes and hair wrapped in towels and left in a relaxing sitting area with mint tea and some Moroccan biscuits.After a short while, we were taken down for our massage. This was quite simply the best massage I've ever experienced, not at all rushed as if usually the case. The girl, I think her name was Fatima, checked the pressure was ok and thereafter worked her magic. It was total bliss. I could have lay there forever. After my massage, I had a facial which was incredible too. The whole experience was just so relaxing and I left feeling refreshed and squeaky clean. The staff were so attentive and polite from start to finish. It is an expense but its well worth every penny. I would go to Heritage Spa every day if I could!

Relaxation Heaven. We paid 1600 dirhams (total) for a 2.5hr experience which included a full body scrub followed by a full body relaxing massage and finished off with a foot massage for me and facial for my partner. The spa is a short taxi ride away from Jemma El Fna (5 mins 20 dirhams). We were welcomed by the manageress and shown into a relaxation room where the treatments were explained and were able to select our chosen oil for the massage. We were then taken into another room where we changed into a pair of paper pants (boxer style for the guys, thong for the girls) and given dressing gowns and slippers. Next it was into the stone slabs where we were washed, scrubbed and polished. It's amazing the dead skin which actually comes off you!! On completion of that we were shown into a side room where we were given mint tea and 10 mins to relax. We were then walked into our seperate massage rooms where we given the best massage we have both had in a long time. Soothing music, dimmed lights and professional staff made the massage so much more enjoyable. 1600 dirhams for both may seem a bit expensive but for a treat it was more than worth it. If your in Marrakech and thinking about a spa treatment don't miss this place....you won't be disappointed!!

Hammam was enchanting cultural experience. As an American, I've had quite a bit of massage experience and was curious enough about the hammam to forget my modesty for an hour and give it a try. The spa itself is charming and the service attentive. The manager checked in often to see if everything was meeting expectations. It was, as one reviewer commented, fun to chose my own massage oil fragrance. The bath experience exceeded my expectations in that I have very sensitive, psoriatic skin. I was afraid of so much abrasion but it seems to have actually improved my skin. The 45-minutes sweating on the marble slab was too long for me so I hollered and someone came immediately to finish the procedure.Apparently they are not trained in deep- tissue massage but the manager asked the masseusse to increase the pressure and she did a very good job.Given spas are ranked high on the list of things to do in Marrakech, Heritage Spa was an excellent place to go. Being located in the medina made it even more special.

I got a great servicing...... ...at Heritage Spa. The gommage was professionally and comprehensively executed by a polite, smiling lady (I hesitate to call her a professional scrubber). After this I got very hot drinking the mint tea which is provided in-between treatments and was carelessly flashing my bits when the charming owner walked in and started chatting away to me in excellent English. My next treatment was a lovely facial (although I'm not sure you can get much shine on an old boot) followed by a foot treatment. This was simply divine, with a lovely massage of my tired pins. I didn't meet any other clients during the 2 hours or so I was there and got the impression that this discretion was deliberate Heritage Spa policy...although I was also left wondering if it was because of my old fashioned methods of cooling off.........

Heritage Romance for two. We booked this in for the last afternoon in Marrakech as a special treat. They were very helpful and came to find us on the main road as we weren't entirely sure where they were. We had the Hertitage Romance for couples. After changing into the rather dodgy disposable underwear we had a hamman. This was an odd experience but very enjoyable. I can't remember being washed so thoroughly by anyone other than my mother when I was a small child. Even being scrubbed behind the ears!After some tea and yummy biscuits we had massages and facials. It was so relaxing that I fell asleep only to be woken by the sound of my own snoring. Opps!Definitely, worth doing a fantastic experience and way to spend our last afternoon in Marrakech.

Wow!. Saw this on TA, turned up and hadn't booked, staff were brilliant, offered refreshments while we waited for our 3hr (ish) couples treatment, was absolutely amazing, would not hesitate to return!

A hidden paradise. We booked a Heritage Romance spa package and it was the most amazing experience. Easy to find, the owner and his wife were very welcoming and attentive staff. The mint tea was the best we have had in Marrakech so far and the biscuits were yummy. The total experience was relaxing from choosing the essential oils we preferred to lying in the hammam and being scrubbed, cleaned and buffed - I never realised I was so dirty!! We both had full body massages that were sensational, we both agreed the head and face massage was almost hypnotic as we fell asleep. I highly recommend that you try Heritage Spa it is more than worth the cost and the hospitality is exceptional. You even get an aromatherapy homemade soap to take away. Enjoy!

Perfect.. Firstly its worth pointing out this is a hard one to find but its definitely worth it! Once you do find it you are welcomed and taken through to discuss your treatments and you even get to pick out your oils! The manager spoke great English (my french is terrible so this helped), she explained the procedure. My boyfriend and i went for a couples packages at around 650 dirhams each. Firstly we were lead to the changing rooms where we had to put on the smallest and least attractive pair of paper pants ive seen.. his were funnier.. and a lovely warm fluffy robe and slippers. Then we were taken to the hammam (like sauna but marble instead of wood) where we laid down and were scrubbed head to toe with black soap (all of the dirt that comes off you is amazing - apparently a good idea to do when you first arrive for a improved tan! we waited til we got back from our Sahara camping trip so were even filthier than normal!). Then we were left for 10 mins or so then wash down and hair washed.. i did feel like a child at this point.. mum scrubbing my hair and getting all the grit out from behind my ears.. After the big clean we were taken to a relaxation room and given mint tea to sip on for a bout 15 mins before we were taken for our hour long all over body massage. I really enjoyed this and certainly helped the bad back i had from camping but i will say i don't feel the massaging of the breasts was necessary.. im a brit, we dont like things like that! But it happened and i survived and the rest was amazing.You even get a little bag of smelly dried flowers for your underwear draw at home.. Would definitely go back there again.. You can get the same treatment elsewhere for maybe half but this was well worth the extra £20.

Most relaxing and nurturing experience. Beautiful place, great atmosphere and service. I felt like a princess, nothing we asked for was impossible. The owner was very helpful and the treatments divine. We spent a couple of hours in a different, magical world and felt so relaxed afterwards, I would always do it again!
Great Spa. During our stay in Marrakech for 05 days, We had a great Spa with Heritage Spa. Good massage and hamam.
Tranquility away from the Medina. Amazing Spa treatment. Hamman was great and massage was so calming. Manager was very very helpful regarding our stay and where to eat etc.

Excellent. Hamman, massage and facial were excellent. My husband had hamman, massage and pedicure and neither of us can agree with previous criticism of massage. Quality of products, professionalism of staff and overall effects of treatments were fantastic. Highly recommended and would definitelyfrequent the place as often as possible!

I felt like a Moroccan princess. We booked the duo hammam and Massage. I was totally relaxed me felt like a Moroccan Princess. Also to ambiance is really nice and the staff is very kind and speak good English.

Ok, but not excellent. Nice atmosphere but poor massage. I was expecting more after reading great reviews. My partner got a better massage so it may depends on who takes you. Pauses between treatments too long. Times of relaxation too long. I won't repeat.

A beautiful way to relax. I've just come back from a hammam treatment with my husband at Heritage Spa. We were not sure what to expect, as our only previous hammam experience was in Turkey. The hammam here was a small heated room, designed for one or two. We were soaped, left to relax, scrubbed with a glove, washed, polished with black soap, shampooed and rinsed. Shiny clean bliss! The soaping and scrub were as good as any massage. Afterwards, we were served mint tea and water in a sitting area while we relaxed.This was actually my second time at Heritage Spa, after an excellent pedicure a couple of days ago.Definitely somewhere I'd recommend to any one wanting a bit of pampering.

AWESOME AND NOT TO BE MISSED. This spa is tucked away at the end of a maze of alleys and is an experience not to be missed. From the moment you duck through the door you enter a what can only be described as heaven. My wife and I chose the 'Marrakesh experience' which cost 1200 Dirhams (£88) in total and took three hours! It starts with Moroccan tea and deciding which oils to have with the massage, this isn't rushed and sets the scene for the rest of the visit. It's then off for a Hammam (together), for those that arn't sure what this is, it's laying on a heated slab in a hot room. You then get 'soaped up' with black (olive) soap, then exfoliated, then smeared in volcanic mud and finally washed off. The entire experience if fantastic. It's then off to relax and then down through the building for an hour long massage. It is truly awesome and every minute draws you into the ambiance of the Heritage. I have to say, I was only going to have the massage, but so glad my wife talked me into the full monty, to miss it would have been to miss what was one, if not THE, highlight of my trip to Marrakesh. A couple of tips if you do go - Ask the Taxi driver to take you to the Dar Moha restaurant (which you should also try) and get a boy to walk you to the Hertiage (just give him 10 Dirhams, he'll roll his eyes and ask for more, but just smile and pat him on the back, it's just their way). Really don't miss this place . . . you won't forget it, it's a 6 star experience.

A must do. We arrived a bit early having been slightly 'souked' on the way! As in we had help we had not planned for, bought boots we might have waited another day for and got lost going the scenic route. All good and part of the pact tourists make with Marrakech and such a good place to be rescued from by the Heritage Spa. We immediately got enveloped in a private peace of warmth, fragrant smells and mint tea. It felt like we were the only people there and my daughter and I both had one of the best experiences of our lives, a traditional hamman and massage, literally waited on hand and foot. It’s so worth the almost European prices for a several hours of bliss.

Lovely Spa. Our Riad recommended this Spa and booked it for us. The staff to me and my husband to a private place to relax. We had a sea salt hammam. My skin was so soft after and my hair was incredible. We then had an hour massage each. The total was about 110 euros for everything. Such a great price. We were super happy with the service.

Pure Luxury !. My husband and went to marrakech for our wedding anniversary beginning September for 4 days. We wanted to have a spa experience and originally choose to book the oriental spa but when we arrived in Marrakech and tried to book through a tour operator there the spa was closed that weekend and were told that the Heritage was available. I had heard that this spa was also good so i booked the Heritage Romance treatment for 2 people (it cost about £90-this was after speaking to a lady called Antoinne there and getting a discount).We walked through back streets and arrived at a big grand door.Antoinne greeted us , the place was beautiful.We received water with an orange slice in it and then some mint tea - it was so refreshing.Antoinne was so professional and extremely polite.She explained the whole experience to us and we chose the oils we wanted for our massage( this included a hammam each a full body massage for an hour each and then a facial for me and a foot massage for my husband)which compared to london prices was a bargin.In between the hammam and massage we received rose tea - there was a choice of different flavours - and some morrocan sweets. At the end of the treatments we had a rest on the lovely comfortable beds and had more refreshments. The whole experience was amazing i loved it and felt very pampered.Antoinne couldn't do enough for us . I would definately recommend this place if your looking for luxury and some romantic time with your partner.

Exceptional experience. I was reluctant to go any spa - it's not my thing - but my wife convinced me and I'm glad she did. The entire experience was incredible.The space is a wonderful and peaceful contrast from the chaos that is Marrakech. We had a couples package, which included a hamman, massage and facial for my wife. I haven't been so relaxed in months. The management and staff are incredible and the entire process was seamless. It was expensive for Marrakech but we felt the experience was worth it.

What a start to our Honeymoon. After the chaos and craziness on the streets of Marrakech, Heritage Spa really is a sanctuary and an oasis of calm. Our package included a Hammam which was a real experience and we really did feel expunged afterwards. The massage then plunged us into a real state of relaxation. Thank you.

Amazing!. My husband and I spent 5 days in Marrakech last week and it was amazing. We had a hammam and massage at La Maison Arabe and were hugely impressed, as we'd enjoyed our experience so much we decided to do it again and visited Heritage Spa before going to the airport for our flight home. From start to finish the staff were friendly whilst being professional too. We were provided with lots of information about the options available, oils etc. We then dressed in our paper knickers (the image of my husband in his will stay with me forever and make me giggle every time). We started with the hammam which was fantastic and then some chill out time with a mint tea (he had Jasmine), it was soooo relaxing. We then went off for the massage, I'm not much good at relaxing and switching off but my massage was so good I was drifting away. Unlike an earlier reviewer who felt the masseurs were not well trained I would totally disagree (and yes, I have had quite a few massages over the years), it was quite perfect. If I lived in Marrakech I'd be there every week without fail, it was superb from start to finish and I was floating for days afterwards :-)

Wonderful Experience, Great Management. I was the US Ambassador to Morocco for 5 years and got to know the country very well. Last week I was back in Marrakech for business, and had a chance to wander around without bodyguards or a driver. As I meandered through the medina, I saw the attractive signs for the Heritage Spa and decided to investigate. Once I stepped through the door I was greeted very professionally by the owners and offered some tea and a chance to review the many treatments. I chose a simpe massage using light oils and was given an excellent relaxing massage by Fatima. The entry and rooms were impeccably clean and they did an amazing job transforming this authentic old riad into a unique and charming spa. Highly recommended.

Best hammam ever!. Travelled to Marrakech for 2 nights decided to visit a spa and through trip advisor reviews chose heritage spa .Tried a hamman with my husband and it was excellent . The staff were all incredibly friendly and very welcoming.Many thanks to you all for a wonderful experience.

Relaxing. My friend and I decided to spend our last afternoon in Marrakech by heading off to one of the many Hammams that were near where we were staying. Our riad recommended Heritage Spa and we booked the spa package for 2, I also opted for a back waxThe spa is off a busy alley near many shops but once you step inside it is peaceful and dimly lit. It was also air conditioned (well it felt cool) which was great after walking in 40 degree heat.We were greeted by the friendly receptionist who explained what would happen and then guided us to our changing room. We were given dressing gowns and slippers and some paper underwear. For women you are just given knickers and for men its pretty much the same. They do not leave much to the imagination and I was very cautious about staying modest.I was guided upstairs for a wax while my friend was taken to a relaxation room. The wax was fine, if a little painful (I am a bit of a wimp) Once the wax was over I was reunited with my friend where we received mint tea and foot and leg massage and a mini face rub. We relaxed for about 10 minutes and then went to have our scrub. We entered into a steam room and were told to lay down. We were both scrubbed head to toe and then showered off.After this we went our separate ways and both received massages. I cant speak for my friend but mine was amazing. I have a problematic shoulder and the masseuse sorted it right out.All in all it was a lovely afternoon and well worth the money. It was 450DH for the massage and 200DH for the wax

Beautiful Experience. My fiance and I went for the romantic spa package - hammam, gommage, massages and then a facial for the ladies and foot massage for the gentlemen. The whole experience was wonderful - beautiful surroundings, lovely tea and very relaxing massages. I absolutely loved the facial, though my fiance finished a little earlier than me and was a little bored by the end. Other than that, it was a lovely and indulgent time!

Excellent ham man. Travelled to Marrakech for 3 nights decided to visit a spa and through trip advisors reviews chose heritage spa . Never tried a ham man before I had one along with a massage it was excellent . The staff were all incredibly friendly and very welcoming . I have been very fortunate to have Ivisited lots of spas and this definitely was as good as any . Many thanks to you all for a wonderful experience.

Divided experience. We decided to have a full pampering time and pick one of the spa ritual over 2 days. It included traditional hammam, 2 massages, a facial and a pedicure.The spa is beautiful and it was minutes away from our riad, the owner welcomed us and sat us own to explain the treatments.On the first day we had the traditional hamman and it was FAntastic, our kids also had the hammam experience , it was free of charge for them and we really appreciate the detail. We were quite disappointed by the 1 st massage, one of them was relaxing with pressure it was ok but my husband wanted a deep tissue and it was nothing like a deep tissue.On day 2 our hopes were up because we said we were not fully satisfied but unfortunately the massages were not better, the facial was ok, nothing special and the pedicure was very basic.Overall i wish we had only booked the hammam . We passed our comments on to the owners who totally understood us and gave us a small gift;, i think the therapists are missing some training and if you are used to have good massages dont do it here you will be disappointed.I will repeat that the spa is beautiful, the staff is lovely and the hammam was great.

lovely spa. We were well taken care of by the proprietor and enjoyed ourselves immensely. We selected a traditional hammam experience and felt pampered throughout the treatment. A lovely spa and well worth a visit.

relaxing & luxurious. We had seen this spa reviewed on trip advisor so when te hotel recommended it too we decided to go for it.Owned by a husband and wife team who were so friendly and helpful explaining everything before we started. we booked the Romance couples package which included hammam, scrub, 1 hr massage and then facial for me and foot massage for my husband.Whole appt took 3 and a half hrs and was sheer bliss,excellent value at under £100 for both for everything.The Spa was much more sophisticated than we expected and we were given fluffy bathrobes,slippers and paper underwear which was more than adequate (see other reviews of spas) we chose our own blend of essential oils for the massage which was heavenly.I would definitely recommend this spa and would come back again. Don't be nervous about trying it as they look after you and it's not rough & ready like some of the cheaper ones. They even gave us a lift back to the main square when we finished as we would have got lost otherwise so they are lovely. Go!!

An absolute treat. We went for the 'Destination Marrakech' package after reading reviews and were not disappointed! It could not have come at a better time and we felt 110% relaxed. Fantastic, friendly staff who explained everything. Skin felt brand new and got a 20% surprise discount at the end! Massage was amazing and it is well worth the price we paid alone. As other reviewers said, spent a good 3 hours there so an excellent way to spend an afternoon before heading out to dinner in one of the many beautiful restaurants.

Amazing!. Hidden treasure in the backroads of Marrakech. Service and facilities were astoundingly good. Lives up to its reputation that took us there in the first place! I'm not one for Spas really but this worth a try at least once.

An oasis in the Medina.... Even though we were running late for our appointment heritage spa were still very accommodating and we managed to get all the treatments we had booked in for. We decided to go all out and have the Heritage experience which consisted of the hammam with body mask, massage, facial and pedicure. They provided us with robes and disposable underwear as the hammam is very much a full body experience! We were brought to relaxation areas in between treatments and served mint tea and water, the manager stopped by in between our treatments to see how we were doing and explaining about the various treatments. We Just felt thoroughly cleansed from top to toe and extremely relaxed! It does help to have a bit of basic French with the girls who provide the treatments. I couldn't say anything negative about the service or treatments. The only thing that I didn't appreciate was being caught off guard as soon as I came out of the hammam by the girl who treated us asking me for a tip when I had only just come out of the hammam even though i had every intention of leaving a tip once we had completed everything. I don't like it when a tip is asked for, it should be the clients choice. Other than that we did all have a great experience and I would return whenever I go back to Marrakech.

A perfect relaxing escape in a crazy city. We went there without a booking and the lady at the front of house was very welcoming. She let us sit down and gave us some drinks before even going into which spa treatment we would like.we chose one of the house specials 'oasis' treatments and we weren't disappointed. From start to finish we were pampered and treated extremely well. All the staff seemed very professional and friendly although being English there was a bit of a language barrier with some of the French speaking staff but this didn't cause any problems. Between the hammam, scrub and hour long relaxIng massage, we were treated to some excellent tasting Morrocon tea (nicer than we have got in the cafes by far) and biscuits. All in all it was an excellent, relaxing experience. I did this with my girlfriend and we had the whole spa to ourselves (I think this is standard in that when you book a treatment you get the whole spa to yourselves for the duration of the treatment but It's worth checking as I dont know if we were just lucky)All in all this spa is a relaxing gem in one of the craziest citys I have been too. Highly recommended

Wonderful Experience. My girlfriend and I decided on the Heritage Spa after seeing glowing reviews here on TripAdvisor. We could not have been more pleased. From the service to the setting, Heritage Spa really made a wonderful impression. We opted for the hammam/massage package and it was totally worth every dirham. The owner guided us through the entire process (which was a bit intimidating for the uninitiated) and was attentive and helpful during our entire stay. I cannot say enough good things about this spa.

Excellent experience!. My husband and I went to this spa after reading all the great reviews. Everything from the location to the attention was truly an experience in Marrakech. It was fairly easy to find thanks to all the signs leading up to the spa. When we went in, we received immediate attention and were handed a pamphlet with all the different packages offered. We chose to do the hamman and the relax massage treatment. It was perfect because we were not separated at any time. After being in the sun all day it was a huge relief to get all our dead skin scrubbed off. Days later and my skin still feels smooth. Sitting in a tented room drinking Moroccan tea and cold water was very refreshing. Amongst all the relaxation, one of the highlights was the demonstration on how to make the tea we were drinking. We even got to take home some sage and mint for free. I highly recommend this spa to couples and those who wish to get a culture experience and relax for a bit.

Our oasis in Marrakesh. We found in Heritage Spa our refuge for pleasant relaxing. The owner welcomed us in a very special way; he tried to understand our needs and proposed the best options for us. Besides, it was great to have him explaining to us the functions of each treatment. The place is amazing and we only have to thank them for the kindness of their hospitality. We went to make one single hammam and 4-hand-massage, but in the end we returned again for a 2nd hammam. We had a blast!

Excellent Choice. After contemplating much on which spa to go, I finally decided to follow my feelings and went to the Heritage Spa I was picked up at my hotel by the owner as I learned that he had to open at 930am for my request. I was so embarrassed but the very charming owner Ali is so hospitable and so kind. Forget about the old surroundings on your way to the spa. The most important thing is the excellent service and the clean treatment, massage and hammam spaces they have. It was so relaxing and my masseuse was so professional and caring. I had a small chat with the owner afterwards over some excellent mint tea and moroccan biscuits. The place reflects the good heart of the owner and his passion for excellent client satisfaction. I will definitely go back. I highly recommend this place as a must visit when you are in Marrakech. I paid about 290MAD for my authentic hammam experience and bought a moisturising cream for 250MAD. Dont forget to tip your masseuse as they really do a good job. Till my next visit...

Excellent hammam, great value and great host!. See title! Advise that you go the combined hammam and massage and take lots of time for breaks and tea (this is encouraged by the host as well!).The host did a great job in explaining the experience up front and advising which oils and treatment you should choose (make sure to ask as the masseurs only speak french!). Also make sure to engage with the host and ask about Moroccan history and life.Best thing is to visit the hammam in advance to get the explanation before booking a time - means that all you have to do is arrive and enjoy!

Very Relaxing, great deal. After a day visit to the atlas mountains my wife and I decided to give ourselves a treat and spend the afternoon relaxing in the spa.When the taxi dropped us off in the neighbourhood we thought it would be hard to find but thanks to the clear signs on the streets we made it there without a hitch. Once there we were pointed to a waiting room and offered tea. We chose the hammam + massage combo and were given a choice of scented oils for the massage. It was nice to get a treatment room for the both of us and sice It was our first hammam treatment (mud rub) we had a few laughs. The experience of getting washed down takes you back to your baby years!! After chilling for a few minutes in what looked like a "jaima" bedouin tent sipping tea and chatting with the manager were taken to the massage room, also acommodating both of us.They turned the lights down and played some relaxing music (a bit loud for my wifes taste) then we both had our hour long massages. Heaven.On our departure we each got a nice scented sachet for our drawers.The staff was very friendly and the manager made sure we were well taken care of throughout our visit. The price was very good, we both got our treatments for the price of a 30 minute massage at our hotel, we were there for almost two hours.

Heritage Spa - pure bliss!. My experience at this spa was magical, right from the minute go, the owners are great, very accomadating and attentative. The atmosphere is lovely, tranquil and peaceful where you can relax for as long as you like.The staff were very good and did the job very well.I was very grateful that i received a free foot massage as a birthday gift, and the tea and cakes were ymmy.Heritage Spa is def worth a visit!
Heritage Spa Marrakech. Superb client clare and simpathy. Superb massage. Good hanan although more space would be appreciated.

Nice place to relax. This Spa is such a nice place to relax. After a nice hammam, you relax in a cosy room with a nice cup of russian tea and delicious cakes ! This rias has been adviced by the owner of Riad Asrari, and it was a really good idea. The owner of this Spa is very nice and she was really taking care of our needs.

a hidden gem. host/manager antonina's hospitality was superb! i was worried about going alone but from picking me up from the main road, tailoring the massage to my preference to keeping me company during the breaks while i was enjoying my tea and biscuits, she made me feel right at home! (loved the biscuits btw as they weren't too sweet, unlike most u get in marrakech)did the hammam and massage package! had a fantastic relaxing experience!a hidden gem in the medina worth finding!

Spa experience. Amazing spa experience!. A must do in Marrakech!. Staff are friendly, making me and the girls feel very comfortable. The treatments made me feel fantastic afterwards. I would reccomend the hammam and the facials as I feel I looked radiant afterwards :) It was a great finish to a busy day touring the city. I loved the decor of the whole place. I will definitely come again to this spa in my next trip.

Review of a three day vacation in this amazing spa. It was so amizing ! This three day break with my daily routine permitted me to recharge my batteries in oerder to be ready for a new year of hard work. I am an unconditional of the spa and compared to all the spa where I went, it was for sure the best one. Service was excellent, the place is just beautiful, and we found all the rustic atmosphere of the red city. I advise all poeple who are looking for a moment of peace, relaxation and enjoyment to do not hesitate to choose this location. I hope I will take another break within this year to go and relax again, far from the stress of the work and the noise maked by the children !
Spa with the Girls. Had a fab time, service was excellent. Am sure we will all be visiting this spa. Owners were so helpful and the girls were so friendly. I miss it already :(

great experience. Situated down a back alley is a small door to this hidden oasis. The service was excellent with friendly attentive staff in luxurious surroundings. We were relaxed from the moment we walked in great value for money, don't miss out!

Beautiful place!. I went here with my daughter during our trip to Marrakech. We had read a lot of good things about this spa, but basically felt pretty let down afterwards. The place in itself is gorgeous, and the lady who has the place is very friendly and proffessional. e had choosen the signature teatment, and were shown to a small lounge for tea and explanations first. We then went for our hamman expereince - whci hwas the best part of the treatment. The young lady doing this was amazing; enthusiastic, proffessionel and extremely pleasant. We were then shown to another lounge for tea and water before our massage. The massage was a deception. Two young girls who had no idea what they did massages us, they were chatting away in arabic, they were on their cell phonesand my daughter told me it was really annoying to feel how the masseuse had placed her cellhone between my daughters feet to be able to look at it and respond to incoming messages. My daughter obviously felt the frquency of these text messages as the phone vibrated between her feet! I thought this was extremeley unproffessional. Very disappointing.

Lovely place, but massage a let down. On arrival we thought the spa looked very promising, we were shown to a lovely waiting area where we were given mint tea and cookies, whilst talked through our choices. After this we were shown to a small changing room, with nice lockers, robes and slippers. We were provided with disposable underwear. We were then taken for our massage, I chose the massage musculaire toubkal, "expressly for very sporty people" which was not as expected. Instead of getting into any muscles, it consisted of a strange rubbing process which was almost painful in the excessive friction and the little use of oil. It was a shame, as we had both really been looking forward to our massages, yet following mine, i was in pain for the next few days. On leaving we were asked to give a tripadvisor review, something which i felt really lowered the tone of the place, suggesting that all is important is the ubiquitous rating.
Fabulous. Very attentive staff, excellent treatments and gorgeous surroundings. They even met us at a nearby hotel to guide us to the front door.

Sublime .... My friend and I booked for the Destination Marrakesh treatment at the Heritage Spa and I can honestly say I have never experienced a spa treatment like it. Absolutely superb.We started with the Hamman which entailed a (lovely) member of staff soaping, exfoliating, rinsing and moisturising us - a wonderful experience that could have been embarrassing but was in fact just so relaxing and wonderful.Then into a little lounge for mint tea and a 'chill' (if we could in Marrakesh in June), before we went for a hours amazing full body massage. The quality of the massage was incredible - I felt like i was floating.Soft lighting, lovely traditional low music, air conditioned rooms all add to the experience.This type of treatment, and this quality, would be twice the price in the UK. If you are lucky enough to be going to Marrakesh, you just have to go here. It is truely out of this world.Each and every member of staff is to be congratulated for their professionalism and friendliness, but particular mention must go to Fatima who performed my actual massage - unforgetable.
fab hidden gem. i had a nice hamman treatment here in morocco,i had a great treatment and a nice relaxing time afterwards with a choice of scrummy teas!!! look forward to returning!!!
Great spa, beautiful surroundings.. Amazing treatments. Take a taxi, it is sign posted. The hamman is on the roof, the massages are fantastic.

Super Tranquil, Super Accommodating. Three of us booked in for 'destination marrakech' package the night before.The place was a little hidden but well signed from the streets. We were greeted and given options for different styles of massages - stimulating or relaxing and a choice of argan oils. They supplied - disposable underwear, robes, slippers and your belongings could go in a locker.I was absolutely gutted having injured my foot the day before, thinking i could not do the hammam. However after indicating my foot could not touch water they improvised with a shower cap and tape and water proofed my injury. The hammam lady was an absolute sweetheart making sure im comfortable and being aware of my injury.The masseuse was sooooo kind and accommodating aiding me down the stairs.I could not fault the hospitality of this establishment and the hammam was a breath of fresh air for my skin after sweating in the midst of the dusty vibrant city. The massage was extremely relaxing and tranquil with calming music in the background - the masseuse asked if the pressure was ok too. Whole experience took a little more than 3 hours, so don't go there if you're in a rush! I learnt during my visit that they opened in Dec 2011 and transformed it from a normal house so their facilities and furnishings were all pretty new and really clean.One word of warning though - the masseuse used alot of oil in my hair for head massage so I left with a clean but super greasy hair.I would suggest a dressing table with hair dryers for ladies who wish to put their face back on and fix themselves before embracing marrakech again.

Perfectly Peaceful & Authentic. What an oasis in the city! It was easy to find, with good signage. Our massages were wonderful and the staff was so attentive and friendly. The riad is beautifully and authentically refurbished, with a welcoming atmosphere. My only complaint is that they gave us the tour after our massages and if we'd seen all they offer, we'd have planned for more time there. The website doesn't do it justice. If you are in Marrakech, this spa is a must!

Nice, relaxing and very professional. I'm from Thailand and a big fan of Thai massage, the massage I got from here is not second to that at all. The girl who gave me a massage was Fatima I think her name was. She was very professional, polite and has magic hands. This is a five stars spa. I love it....

Nirvana - pure bliss. This Spa is AMAZING!!First of all, when you step into the spa you feel like you are in some kind of nirvana. The spa has been decorated beautifully and you are well looked after by the staff as soon as you enter.My partner and I turned up at about 4pm without an appointment but the staff were very accomodating and looked after us very well. On arrival you get robes, slippers, a drink of tea or water (if you want) and disposable underwear. You also get to store your things in a secure locker.The spa is slightly tucked away from the main areas but this is part of what makes it so special. When you knock on the little door in an little alleyway, you do not expect to enter such a wonderful place!I had the 'Destination Marrakech' treatment package and both the hammam and massage were heavenly. The room where I had my hammam was spotlessly clean and made of some form of marble or stone so it felt really luxurious. The smell of the massage oil was heavenly and the pressure was just right.The spa is beautifully clean and comfortable. One of the best I have been to in the world.

A real piece of calm, in an otherwise crazy city. This is a really small boutique spa, not glitzy by comparison, but super friendly, very attentive, and great value. The owners and the team could not do more for you, and my wife and I left throughly relaxed and ready for the stresses and strains of Marrakech, would whole heartedly recommend an afternoon here, enjoy

Excelllent. The place is not easy to find but it worth it!!!Immediate and welcoming reception, the beauty of the place and extreme cleanliness reassured us that we have made the right choice.We had Heritage Signature Pack. Before the treatment we were asked about our preferences in massage and were given explanations about our treatments.We have started with the hammam. It was a real treat!!! Tons of dead skin was scrubbed off. After we were offered tea and cookies in the berber tent (which is by the way with air conditioner-real relief from the heat of Marrakech). Our relaxing massages hit the spot and facial aromatherapy was out of the world.We have spent there almost 3 hours for the affordable prices and exceptional service.We recommend this Spa as a MUST to be visited in Marrakech

Wonderful spa. I wanted to congratulate this team for their professional treatments as well as the beauty of the spa and also he affordable prices they are applying in comparison to other spas in the medina. We went there with my wife and friends and we booked the heritage beauty treatments which was really unique and also a very original experience. The hammam with Argan oil is unique and the massage very professional. The original experience was the facial care with saffron and essential oils : unexpected. We came back the day after with friends : the same quality. If you are looking for a nique experience don't hesitate.

Wonderful. I have visited so many spa but this one is very unique. The place is very calm a road in a small street in the medina. The location is not far from dar el bacha 5 min of walk. It is decorated with prestigious paintings from all over the world giving you the impression to be in a museum. The girls are also very professional and seem to be trained on a regular basis. I was there with my wife and had oasis detox pack hamam and massage. It was top notch. I was also surprised by the prices that are not high in comparison to other spa in the Medna. Don't hesitate to visit it. It is a wonderful spa.

Convenient and relaxing!. Located 2 doors down from our riad the spa was an unexpected treat! The staff was so friendly and accomodating, my last minute appointment was welcome. The spa was everything you would expect and more.

First rate service and atmosphere for a little less money. Everything about this place was lovely, from the minute we walked in until we we left. We felt completely taken care of from the fluffy robes and slippers to the professional and courteous service and the best part was that it was a good twenty euro cheaper than the five star competition. I highly recommend this place. We did the hour and a half package and were there over two hours as they took their time with every step and made it a really special occasion.

Unique. I have vivited a lot of spa but HHeritage spa is a unique place. Richely decorated and very professional team. Antonina, the owner is managing this spa in a very professional manner and adviced us on what type of treatment to have.We had Heritage beauty pack and what an experience with all this natura lproduct. You feel yourself after that with a very smooth skin. I recommend this spa for the affordable prices for the treatments and the beauty of the place.

Worth a visit. In a shadowy, narrow and isolated alleway (don't be afraid, the owner herself will guide you to your destination), in the heart of the kasbah, this tiny, cute spa will grant you a warm welcome and an intense bit of traditional hamman. You'll rest in a silence nest just a shot from the traffic. We'll come back. We sipped mariage freres tea, eating yummy traditional biscuits!
nice experience. we had a hamman and massage 2 hours. very relaxed and enjoyed experience. very hard to find but they sent staff to find us which was nice.

WONDERFUL TREATMENTS. We went to HERITAGE SPA with 10 other friends and it was a wonderful experience. Treatments were wonderful, Hammam and massage as i have never done before. The welcome of the owner and the place were also unique. I have visited some spa in Marrakech but this one is really. They have managed the treatments for both of us in a professional manner even we were 11 persons.They have also offered tea and nice cakes. We came back the day after to do face care (only ladies). I recommend to visit.

Faultless. I really can't fault our experience at the Heritage Spa. We spent the most wonderful 3 hours here, having the 'Destination Marrakech' treatment, which was a traditional hammam / gommage scrub followed by a 1hr massage. It worked out at £38 each. The spa is probably quite hard to find but we were fortunate enough to be staying in the same locality and had walked past. The building is absolutely beautiful, spotlessly clean and lovely attention to detail with taps, lighting etc. We were directed to a changing room to undress and put on disposable knickers and a fluffy white robe. Once undressed, we went upstairs to the steam room and lay down for a short while. The next hour was spent being showered in warm water, washed in the traditional black soap, scrubbed to within an inch of our lives and then we had a hair wash and scalp massage. I can't really describe how amazing this was. We the sat in a small tented area drinking mint tea and just feeling blissed out! We then went down to have a 1 hour massage (both myself and my friend were treated at the same time), and the spa manager took the time to enquire what type of massage we preferred. This is a one-of-a-kind experience and I'm sad that we couldn't go back the next day and do it all again. I highly recommend this spa-- you get a feel for the traditional hammam experience but in a luxurious environment.
Excellent Spa. Very relaxing, clean, professional. Highly recommend.

Great massage in a beautiful setting. Although somewhat difficult to find, we followed Tripadvisor's recommendation and booked a 1-hour massage at Heritage Spa. A warm welcome, complimentary tea in a "tent" on the roof and a high-quality massage proved us right. This is indeed a beautiful place to visit, and the products used are of very high quality. Definitely to be recommended!

Total relaxation to unwind after the bustle of the souks. We had a Hammam and gommage scrub with a Moroccan massage. The spa was down some narrow streets but as well signed as anything in the Medina. The solid door opened into a classic Moroccan interior and they provided towel robes and disposable underwear. The hammam steam room was very hot , with a very vigorous scrum that removed large quantities of grime accumulated in London and Marrakech. After a relaxing mint tea we then had a totally relaxing massage. It was the perfect way to totally unwind after the buzz of the Souks and sightseeing.
Great Spa. Not the easiest to find - great service and a nice place to hang out after your hammam / massage.

Wonderful relaxing treat in hectic Marrakesh. The Heritage is located in a calm side-road north-east of the main souk and within the medina. It may be easier to find it coming off avenue Mohammed V than through the tiny souk roads. And once you find it you will discover a very pleasant and relaxing treat in the middle of this busy city.Antonina the owner-manager is very accomodating and helps to find the right service out of the extensive spa-hammam-massage menu. We chose a combi-package with hammam/gommage followed by a full body massage.The hammam is nicely outfitted, comfortable and very clean. After this first session we were served tea in the berber-tent style relaxing area before being guided to the massage. The latter is performed in an attractive and well equipped and nicely smelling room.The massage ladies are very friendly locals who know their profession very well.The pricing may be high for local salaries, but is definitely correct for international standards - we paid 490 Dh per person for almost two hours of very enjoyable spa experience.We would go back definitely.

Everything We Were Looking For. Everything about our experience with Heritage Spa was top notch. I found it very easy to book an appointment via email with Antonina. My husband and I had the traditional hammam and massage offering. I thought that we'd be separated but actually were able to share the experience. The facilities were new, clean and luxurious with a traditional Moroccan flair. The ladies who provided our services were pleasant and professional. We also thought they provided a good value. We would (and did) recommend Heritage Spa to other travelers.

a place to recommand. i have been there for the second time as i am doing business with morocco. A friend told me about this place and really it is wonderful. they have understood what is the meaning of providing good service to clients. It is not rxpe,sive in compariosn to other spa with the same or even lower quality and i am again satified by the hammam and massage.the fact to be in medina is a good experience even i am staying in hotel because it is really a break in the day.don't hesitate.

Fantastic Experience. As a first timer, was suitably impressed with the treatments provided along with the friendly welcome and relaxed, unrushed atmosphere. The Hammam and gommage was excellent, the massage was truly sublime. A place to return to ? Definately is. Many, many thanks to Antonina and the girls

Wonderful Hamam & Massage. Hamam and massage were excellent, the atmosphere relaxing. A charming little oasis in Marrakech. Prices are not cheap but reasonable. The Hamam room could be a little bit bigger, especially when there are two people in it. I will return definitly! Thank you so much for an enjoyable stay at the Spa it was worth every MAD.

wonderful spa. i was very surprised when i enterd this spa inside the medina. Extremely nicely decorated and clean, it was my 3rd experience with hammam. We had hammam and massage and face care with argan and saffron which was an unbelieavable experience we will necer forgot. Antonina, the ukrainian spa manager is extremely professional and was controlling everything into detail.I strongly recommend this spa: WONDERFUL

wonderful massage and face care. We have been in HERITAGE SPA after a long walk in the medina. What a surprise when we entred the place and guided by the team. I have visited some other places in the city but this one is a very good value for the money. Try the hammam with argan soap and drink the famous KUSMI TEA or MARIAGES FRERES for free where as you have to pay (if you foud them) for at least 10 USD. They are proposing several packs. We came back with friends the day after and were also friendly welcomed. Best SPA. John

Excellent !! very relaxing. Very close to our Riad , very welcoming staff. Did not feel like you were in the middle of Marrakech very relaxing would recommend for a lovely hamman and massage a wonderful experience.

Excellent Experience.. This spa was very close to our Riad, and for those who enjoy a little luxury, this is the place to be.Have all the stresses of Marrakech washed away, in your 2 hour visit.Great for couples who expect perfection.
Absolute value for money.... wonderful place indeed with great staff.hope to return ..

Beautiful Spa, very relaxing. The spa is beautiful, well maintained and hygenic. We were in a rush as we were fitting the Hammam and massage in before our flight back to the UK, despite this the staff did everything they could to make sure we were relaxed and that we made it out on time to make it to the airport. The Hammam was excellent, really professional and we both came out feeling amazing. The massage was also good, but we had to cut it slightly short to make it out on time. Great place to experience this.

Peaceful Spa in Marrakech. After a busy morning wondering around the souks, my husband and I went to Heritage Spa for a full afternoon of pampering! From the moment we entered the Riad we had a great welcome from the manager Antonina. The Hammam and massages were simply divine! This is a secret jem and definitely worth the trip!
Great. Very nice experience in a very professional environment. I must add that the different massages and the hammam were out of this world!!

Wonderful!. We visited the Heritage spa with 2 couples. We chose one of the combination packs offered by the spa which included one hour massage and half an hour hammam. This was perfect, the massage was very nice and relaxing and the hammam was very nice as well.
A perfect opportunity to relax after a chaotic day in the beatuiful Marrakech.

a wonderful relaxing experience. My husband, in an attempt to steer us away from the Souks, decided to treat my two girls and I to an afternoon of pampering. Despite being a little young (9 & 10) the staff welcomed them warmly, recommended suitable treatments( hamman and a manicure) which they loved . My all body massage was truly worth the money and certainly hit the spot. We all came feeling truly relaxed and ready for more action.The spa is set in a beautiful Riad which has been recently renovated and is a wonderful, calm setting for an afternoon of pampering.
